Reviews.Title: “WONT BE BACK !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bob F
Reviews.Content: After a long and frustrating drive last night, we arrived at Aria at 8pm and tried to use valet. It was very busy and very confusing so we pulled up in front of what looked like the main entrance and a man in a blue uniform with a black hat and beard yelled " YO !!!! YOU CAN'T LEAVE THAT THERE, WHAT ARE YOU NUTS ????? " We asked where we were supposed to go for valet and he walked away. We finally found the self park ramp, hauled all our luggage to the front desk, and waited what seemed like forever to check in. Why this hotel allows their employees to treat a guest this way is beyond me but I know We'll be staying elsewhere on our next trip to Vegas. Room is so so, service is just plain awful !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best bed on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: 2pretty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I average a trip to vegas once a year. Each year we try something new. To be totally honest, I couldn't find a flaw. Location is great, staff seemed very friendly and helpful. Casino floor as well as all the the property was busy but you did not get the crowded feel. The room was slightly small but the view was great! And the bed, the best I have slept on while on vacation. We did not experience noise from anyother guests and the whole place seemed very clean. Great experience and we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great option on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: canman66
Reviews.Content: I visit Vegas a couple of times a year. Used to stay at Planet Hollywood, but I'm tired of being charged the single supplement. So this was my first stay at Aria. It's a great hotel - clean, modern, great amenities. Kudos on the bed choice. It is excellent. One of the best I've ever slept on. But - be warned - if you like a firm mattress, this is not the property for you. The electronic in-room amenity controls are a nice option, but certainly no reason to choose this hotel over another. The casino is nice, but it lacks personality. A bit too antiseptic for my taste. Staff on property were excellent. Someone is training these people really well. All in all, an enjoyable visit. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, modern, good pool area, good location.”
Reviews.Author: AllanG
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas quite a few times and have stayed at quite a few different hotels. I liked the Aria and would stay here again. The room, although not being a "WOW" when you entered was a good size and had modern controls. You could operate pretty much everything with a remote controller. The King beds are very comfortable. I think they only have king rooms so you may want to check if you wanted 2 beds in your room. It's "Green" certified so the shower pressure is a bit lower than I'd like but not as bad as others. Outside of the room the hotel is very nice. I ate at the Blossom restaurant which I thought was excellent, and Happy Hour (3-6 PM) at the Skybox near the poker and sports rooms was a great deal for drinks and snacks. BTW, it's a very good poker room. Like everything in Vegas, it's a fair walk to get to places although you're next door to high end shopping at the City Centre. Overall I'd give it an 8.5 out of 10. Not the best in Vegas but good value for a high end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Debra O
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in March 2012. The room was not very clean as we found a gaterade bottle behind the door along with dust bunnies and what looked like cigarette ashes all around the toilet. Also make sure if you stay here that you wear your walking shoes because it was a major walk from your room to anywhere on the strip or to your car. The automatic curtains and sheers did not open properly. Also when we checked in we were pressured into upgrading for an extra $100.00 per night, but did not. Although the hotel does look impressive upon first appearance, we definately would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and modern”
Reviews.Author: 5reided
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a huge, beautiful, modern, clean, eco-friendly, and inclusive resort that served as our home base during our trip to the Las Vegas strip. Even after we checked out to stay at another Las Vegas hotel, we returned to the Aria. Our room was very clean and comfortable, and the lighting/climate/curtain/media touchpad controls worked and were fun to use. Pros: *Touchpad control of curtains, lights, television, thermostat, "Do not disturb" light, etc. *Free wi-fi throughout the property *Tram to Bellagio, Monte Carlo, and surrounding places *Modern architecture *Jean Philippe Patisserie at entrance to elevators Cons: *Technology can confuse older guests *Considerable walk to elevators from parking garage

Reviews.Title: “32nd Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: prf9
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Aria.wife and I chose Aria for stay to celebrate our 32nd wedding anniversary. Whoever trained the Aria staff deserves the highest recognition. Upon check- in we were greeted with "Happy Anniversary" we had reserved a regular suite and were upgraded to a corner Sky Suite overlooking the strip. Room was totally high tech operated by remote controll. 900+ sq feet of bliss. Everything from heated toilet seats to remote controlled drapes. Bedding is some of the best we've experienced and it can be ordered from A store in the resort named Elements. While all this was great, we were so impressed how great and friendly the staff were. One other perk staying at Aria is being in City Center. Within walking distance is world class shopping inside Crystals a high end shopping Mecca housing stores such as Tiffanys, Jimmy Choo, Harry Winston and on and on. Dining was good. Good Chinese, Italian and Breakfast. Save your money and splurge you'll be glad you did. After all you can't take it with you.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: jennifer h
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - 4000+ rooms. Hotel front desk gets very busy - the service is compensated. Felt like I was being rushed and just another reservation. Long walk to elevators from check-in/taxi stand. Room was nice - standard room. Would prefer an all-suite hotel (Palazzo). Aria is nice for the price - and has a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Aria - Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lisjoseph
Reviews.Content: Been to Vegas quite a few times - I think everytime I've come - I"ve stayed at the Wynn Hotel which is fabulous....this time - I stayed at Aria...fairly new hotel/casino/resort...its massive with a convention center, shops and everything you need right on property. I stayed in a king sized room which was fairly spacious...best part was that it had 2 seperate closests - which is great since I was traveling with my husband. The rooms were very clean and everything was automated - including the clsoing of the blinds. My room had an amazing view of the city....another plus is being a few minutes away from the airport. The pool area was great as well - Liquid is a special area that pretty much is a day-time club..they check ID's and all before coming in...bags too...techno music at 11AM. I could have done without that part. But the food was amazing and I enjoyed the cabanas. I still have a few more days here so will update at the end of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Service - Definite will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: SduNyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria for 2 days only, I wished I could stay longer. I got a nice corner suit with a good rate. It's beautiful. Nice view at night. Service was excellent. This was the fourth time I've been to Vegas. It's the best hotel that I ever stayed. I would suggest you to sign up their email promotion. That's how I got the promotion rate when I booked my hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Ellegance”
Reviews.Author: Averke
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with no complaints. Very contemporary without losing the glitz and glam. We even had a medical emergency and the hotels staff, ambulance & fire dept were amazing! Excellent service, will definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, stupid resort fee, long walks.”
Reviews.Author: Asten77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aria within a month of it opening, and I've been back about 4-5 times. The hotel is gorgeous. The casino has a very pleasant vibe to it, with a pleasant smell piped in. Rooms are also very nice, with lights, tv, temp, curtains all tied to the TV and a touchscreen controller. Positives: Comfy beds and pillows, great rooms. Attractive, classy looking casino. Shared food court with Monte Carlo has cheap fast food. Negatives: The elevators are in the middle of this very, very large hotel. We got a room near the end of one of the wings. It's a ridiculously long walk. The free tram to Bellagio is nice, but again, be prepared for a long walk to get to it. The Monte Carlo stop is reasonable, but the Crystals/Aria stop makes you walk through the entire mall to get to the casino. Resort fee: They didn't charge this for the first year or more, and now they do. It's ridiculous. Either put it in the room price or make it optional. Drink service in the casino is spotty I like staying at Aria, but don't forget to add $25 a night to the quoted room price to compare against Caesar's/Harrah's properties, which don't charge a mandatory fee.

Reviews.Title: “abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvWOW”
Reviews.Author: plasticbag19
Reviews.Content: New hotel part of the Billagio group. And you can tell, as the rooms are amazing!! you can tell America has an obesity issue as a 2 bedroom room is for 2 people! beds are huge. the views of the strip are great. we stayed for 3 days, but we wish we stayed longer. Technology in the room does take getting used to, but do not be put of by this, or you'd certainly miss out. One health & safety concern is that the power sockets are level with the bathroom sink and you dont wana get electrocuted... Food in general was good, but one day service was really poor and the waitress put our order through 30mins after she took it, then the food took another half and hour to make, and then 15mins longer to deilver.(if you have read my other reviews, you8'd know food is VERY important) We complained and didnt have to pay.. Gym (another important thing) was really good and the staff were really helpful. A great few days, saw some amazing places, and had an absolute fantastic tiem See you soon Vegas, see you soon Aria

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: st3phen
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Las Vegas and after pulling into the valet bay we were instantly wowed with our first sight of the Aria and its' wall of water. The staff at check in were very courteous and efficient and the lobby area was so impressive with superb modern architecture throughout. We were equally impressed with the room and all the mod cons, my husband and son setting up the timer to open curtains on a morning. The bathroom was awesome loved the shower area and the sunken bath. The pool area was a delight as too the buffet. Overall was a wonderful stay at the Aria which was within easy walking distance to the strip whether you cut through the beautiful crystal shopping mall or walked direct. The Aria was very fresh and beautifully designed and after checking out the other amazing hotels/casinos on the strip we were still so pleased that we had chose the Aria. Wow what a wonderful experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay and we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: travelingcouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at Aria and the stay was excellent. We would holy recommend it. We booked the stay through Hotwire.com for $80/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great for relaxing”
Reviews.Author: discriminating7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a suite on the 19th floor. The views were amazing. The suite was beautifully decorated and the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. We even bought the pillows at the Elements shop downstairs. We also used the gym and it had a good selection of gym equipment. Wish we could have stayed longer. We will definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “"Resort, Aim, Shop!"”
Reviews.Author: Kalandozopap
Reviews.Content: We payed several casual visits to Aria and surrounding attractions (shopping) since its opening. Recently we decided to stay at the resort and get acquainted with what it offers. The check-in was fast, but checkout had a line and a twenty five minute wait. The rooms were nice but the design of the room did not reflect the luxurious lobby, casino and other internal venues (restaurants and shops). Complimentary internet (with good speed) was a welcome difference versus other properties on the strip. The bathroom was nice also, with the double sink and the usual items, but the counter-top lacked space. The buffet (we ate dinner) offered a very good selection of food and the service was excellent. There is a good mix of table games and machines for those who enjoy gaming. There are choices for plunging into the night life and you can also enjoy a superb show - “Viva Elvis” by Cirque Du Soleil. The shopping in this complex is absolutely unparalleled. Our overall experience at this resort-casino was good and we may return again in the future,

Reviews.Title: “flashy, no substance, awful service”
Reviews.Author: letsgoMacLean
Reviews.Content: They tried hard to make this hotel cool, with all of the interesting design and electronic rooms. But it's all form over function, and it is really frustrating to stay at this hotel. Here are a few of my issues: 1. Navigating the hallways is impossible. One bank of elevators serves 10 or so floors, so if you want to go to a room that isn't in your bank of elevators, you have to take your bank all the way to either the casino or the promenade to get on another bank, and then go back up to the floor you want to go to. Additionally, there are several different pathways once you get off the elevator and you have to read a sign like five different times to figure out which way your room is. 2. Figuring out how to turn the lights on in the rooms is also impossible. It is not as easy as hitting a light switch. There is a NON-WIRELESS, awkward room control monitor that is not very touch responsive, and also is not synced with the buttons on the walls - so if you make a decision on the wall, and then change it on the monitor, stuff gets all messed up. 3. The shampoo and conditioner SUCK. The WORST shampoo and conditioner I have ever used. On Friday night when I went out it looked like i hadn't even washed my hair. I bought new shampoo for Saturday and it looked fabulous, so it wasn't the water - it was the shampoo that Aria provides. 4. Everyone I dealt with in the check in lines was an a-hole. They were impatient and judgey, and not helpful. My friend made the reservation and put down the deposit, and I checked in before him, then asked them to refund the deposit to HIS credit card, and they refunded it to MY card - which I figured out after i returned home. The cleaning service was amazing. Really, really amazing. I am never impressed with maid service. But it was awesome here. The pools are nice, except we kept getting free invitation/VIP passes to go to Liquid FROM ARIA POOL STAFF, and then we tried to go and they told us that the cover was $50 and the passes were no good unless signed by the bouncer in line. A $50 cover for a pool party is beyond ridiculous. Also if you want food you have to get up and go to the cafe to order it - waitresses will you bring you beer and a caesar wrap (literally, that is the only food on their menu) but if you want food you have to walk all the way over to the cafe. A beer costs $15 and a club sandwich was $16. Not cheap. And the hotel adds a $25 resort fee for internet to your room charge, and some other fees, so its way more expensive than advertised. None of us were happy with Aria. We've stayed at the Trump, the Mirage, MGM Grand, and they were all better - or at least more comfortable - than the Aria. It was really nice that there were no kids at the Aria, so that was one plus.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: susan h
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few nights at the Aria Resort and Casino. Beautiful place. The room was very comfortable, enjoyed it very much. Loved the Thai restaurant, great food.

Reviews.Title: “Strip Favorite!”
Reviews.Author: elcope
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from our annual March Madness stay in Vegas. We've been doing this trip for years - but this is the 3rd year we've stayed at Aria (and 5th time we've stayed there since they opened in 12/2009). Love, love, love, this hotel and for a number of reasons: first off, unlike every other hotel in Sin City, this one doesn't smell like smoke in the casino, thanks to the fact they pump lavender and vanilla through the ventilation system. The rooms are beautiful - everything is electronic and operated through a small digital screen next to the bed: lights, temperature, tv, music, window sheers, etc. Plus, when you turn the TV or radio on for the first time, the room remembers your likes and automatically turns them on when you enter the room again. And let me tell you about the bed - I know, when you're in Vegas, you barely spend time in your room...but the beds at Aria are heaven! Stearns & Foster mattresses in every room, make coming to bed at 6am, literally, a dream! Fabulous restaurants, from Michael Mina's American Fish and Jean George's Steakhouse, to Julian Serrano (one of my personal favorites - tapas!) and Todd English's P.U.B. The pool is pretty fantastic, too, although I haven't had a chance to check out the spa! Net/net, my husband I and go to Vegas 3-4 times per year - and have been for the past 13 years...we have our favorites when it comes to hotels and restaurants, and Aria is definitely one of them!

Reviews.Title: “Fancy, vast, perfumed”
Reviews.Author: mollingaround
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria for 6 days in the first week of March. Stayed in a king room on the 22nd floor. First trip to Vegas and the US. Wonderful city, very friendly vibe, heaps of fun. Hotel was well-located, in walking distance of most places, and there's lots to do in the hotel if you don't get out much. There's a variety of places to eat and drink, and a 24 hour shop that sells souvenirs, consumables and booze. Perfect. Check in was average, had to wait 2 hours for our rooms after a long-haul flight from Australia, which was sub-optimal, but not totally unexpected in such an enormous hotel. We were travelling in a family group (3 ppl, 3 rooms) and we'd requested our rooms close or adjoining. Had to haggle a little to get 2 adjoining rooms, with one of our party ending up about 2 min walk away which wasn't ideal, but hey, nobody died. A number of reviewers on this site complain about the distance between the lifts and their rooms, and it's true, it was a bit of a walk, but nothing too devastating. If you are sensitive in the respiratory system, this may not be a great place to stay. The weird perfume that's pumped in the casino to cover the smoke is pervasive, and it was always a relief to get outside in the fresh air. The Elvis show was fun, and the theatre was awesome - I'm not a fan of Cirque du Soleil, but this was good - probably because of Elvis. We also hired a car from the Avis in the hotel, and this was really handy - super convenient, and the pick up and return was painless. The electronics in the room were fun, especially the curtains. Housekeeping didn't show up every day, which doesn't bother me, but could bother others. All in all, a very nice hotel, but I probably wouldn't stay here again because the air quality is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Five star disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Vicki F
Reviews.Content: Our first time in a five star hotel, totally dissappointed. Staff not very friendly, just businesslike. Casino, lobby nice, clean, but no personality. In the room, desk, ok but not large enough to work on. Electrical outlets are there but are dark colored and not very visible at first sight, which we needed to plug in cell phones and laptop. The curtains and sheers are controlled by push button on the wall switch and also are controlled by using the televisions remote and all lights are controlled the same way. Bathroom has glass doors to shower and commode area. Be careful not to run into them in dark. They must be closed at all times. NO EXHAUST FAN OR HEAT IN BATHROOM. TOILET PAPER CHEAP. TOWELS ARE VERY HARD. SHOWER AND TUBS VERY SLIPPERY. THIN WALLS, YOU CAN HEAR DOORS SLAM AND CLOCK ALARMS NEXT DOOR GO OFF. HEARD MANY SIRENS GO BY DURING ALL HOURS. THE COSMOPOLITAIN (NEXT DOOR) HAS A OUTDOOR POOL AND PARTY AREA WHICH WAS ONLY QUIET ON SUNDAY NIGHT WHEN IT WAS CLOSED. THE BOOM, BOOM OF DRUMS AND MUSIC AND DJ'S HEARD TILL 3 A.M. AIR CONDITIONER READ COOL BUT NEVER FELT COOL ENOUGH IN ROOM. WE WERE ON 31ST FLOOR OF OUR SECTION CLOSEST TO STRIP. IT WAS THE SHORTEST TOWER. HOTEL IS FAR FROM STRIP FOR WALKING.

Reviews.Title: “lavish accommodations”
Reviews.Author: HappyHamptons
Reviews.Content: The contemporary architecture of the ARIA tower is complemented by the resort's lavish accommodations. Guestroom corridors streaming with natural light open to areas of enclosed glass, delivering spectacular city or mountain views. Within ARIA's 4,004 guestrooms, including 568 suites, panoramic floor-to-ceiling windows offer magnificent views of Las Vegas' striking skyline. ARIA's tower is uniquely designed to deliver corner-window views from every guestroom. --- Billy Amato - NYC

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance”
Reviews.Author: Tom N
Reviews.Content: The Aria follows the example of the Wynn and lacks an identifiable theme (in contrast to properties like Paris or the Bellagio). The decor is attractive, modern and somewhat of an Asia influence but nothing memorable. The hotel/casino sits more or less in the center of MGM's city center project, which makes it feel like your entering thorough a canyon of glass. There is a spectacular curved waterfall extending from the main entrance to the north valet, but there is so much distracting architecture that I didn't even notice it on arrival. The rooms are relatively new so not much wear and tear visible. Lights, curtains, heat/A-C are all controlled by the TV remote or an ipad like device on the night stand. Even the tech adept will find it a bit of a challenge to figure all this out. We had a corner suite, which was nice but nothing to write home about. This is probably the best layout of any casino on the strip. Very intuitive and easy to find your way around. Though we didn't use the pool, it looked very nice and was conveniently located just off the elevators on the second level. The high end restaurants and theater are also on the second level, which means that you don't need to wander through the casino to get to them. A tram, just above the second level, takes you to the Bellagio and an internal walkway gets you to the Monte Carlo. The staff, other than the rather harried players club personnel, were attentive and helpful. Overall, a very good if undistinguished, experience.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: gordon fan
Reviews.Content: So, this was my first time to Vegas, holy cow....what a place the Aria is!! I traveled with my husband, mother, and brother. My brother was the only one who had been there previously and I was happy that we were with someone who had been there before, it made things much easier. The limo driver that picked us up at the airport was super nice and helpful as were the bellmen. When we arrived our rooms weren't ready (it was 11:00am) however, the front desk stored our luggage while we headed to the buffet. My hubby and I are not fans of the buffet but this was no typical casino buffet!! The food was delicious and fresh and plentiful!! Once we walked around a bit after lunch we checked on our rooms but only one room was ready; the one for my hubby and I. Not too much of an issue since we booked a one bedroom suite with a connecting room for my mom and brother. Holy smoke.....the suite was unbelievable!!! A huge living area with a couch and 2 chairs, a table and chairs, refridgerator, humongous tv with a universal remote that was for the tv, curtains, and lights! It was wild!! Our bedroom was huge, huge bed but it was a little high for my liking. Our bathroom was awesome!! 2 person jacuzzi, huge walk in shower, his and hers sinks with a flat screen tv on the his side. And my husband's favorite..the "fanny" washer and heated toliet seat!! Oh boy did he love that thing. Then after being there over and hour, we discovered another 1/2 bath in the front of the room near the front door...who knew?? Needless to say, a few negative areas....my mother and brother's room was not available until well after 5:00pm which could have been an issue had we not had our suite available next door. And not for nothing but we were traveling with my 80 year old mom which we had mentioned during the check in. The walk from the elevator was far, not bothersome for me but I can see where that can be an issue for some people. The beds were really high! It was a major issue with my mom which after much back and forth with the front desk nothing was done to help her! We were better off walking to Walgreens to purchase a stool, they should really keep those around for future use. Our view of the strip was awesome but our window was filthy! On our last day there, our flight was pretty early so we got up early to get breakfast but nothing opened until 7:00am which I thought was strange. That was not at all convenient for us. Last but not least, I was quite shocked how expensive soda and water was there in the bar and grill and gift shop. I guess being that it's the adult Disney that I shouldn't be surprised but you are definitely better off heading to Walgreens to pick up soda and water for your room. As a side note, Vegas and the aria are great! Go see "O" and go have lunch at Cabo wabo, what a blast!! I thought the Aria was centrally located and in walking distance from everything on the strip. Unfortunately, it was way too cold for the pool so I cannot comment on that. Despite the negatives, I loved this place and would stay again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Spa & Casino”
Reviews.Author: Manuel V
Reviews.Content: From the time I made the reservation for me and my wife I knew that I was dealing with friendly & professional staff. My reservation was for a regular room for two nights, I mention the reason for the stay was to celebrate our 50th year anniversary. We were pleasantly surprised when we were upgraded to a Sky Suite at no additional cost. The hotel is a state of the art with the latest in electronics. Dinning, Shopping and Entertainment, outstanding. The Sky Suites have private elevators and 24 hr lounge with all the services and drinks and snacks etc. For the Viva Elvis Show they set us in ..the VIP area. A great experience. Thank you all Aria personnel.

Reviews.Title: “The "innovative" experience”
Reviews.Author: ManitouJeanie
Reviews.Content: Okay, there's a lot of hype about the new hotels in the City Center in Las Vegas. We all know each hotel tries to differentiate itself from the others on "the strip". The Aria has decided to appeal to the young, hip, business traveler. It is very modern and it's decor has an Asian influence. I do admit that the Aria is new, and clean and rather beautiful. But, I am comparing it to some of my other favorites in Las Vegas, and it doesn't measure up. It's a nice hotel but "it isn't the Bellagio or Mirage or the Wynn". The "innovative" rooms that they boast of are more trouble than they are helpful. I am computer savvy, but it took way too long to figure out the system to even turn the lights on. In the meantime, I had the curtains opening and closing at odd times! (When did I become "an old fart"???) We never did get the clock to the correct time. However, we really, really liked the heated toilet seat! (We stayed in their smallest suite called a "corner suite", so I don't know if the deluxe rooms had this feature.) BTW, the corner suite was about a city block walk from the elevator. (Good exercise if you go to the buffet, which was very good.) The casino was okay - not great. We had some problems with the folks at the players club acting what I call "snooty" when we had some questions about our players card and then later with comps for our bill. (We were NEVER treated like that at the Mirage.) Overall, our encounters with the staff were courteous, and we appreciated the assistance of one of the supervisors when our players card wouldn't work. The food options at the hotel, even by Vegas standards, seemed expensive. The Viva Elvis show (at this venue) was outstanding! I had been to a Cirque du Soleil show several years ago that wasn't that impressive so I was hesitant about this one. I was very pleasantly surprised. The pool: I am not really a pool person, but I got rather spoiled at the Mirage pool. So, on our final day I did walk around the Aria pool to at least see it. It seemed very nice with lots of palm trees and a variety of pools and restaurant bars etc. (Compare to the bland concrete at the Paris and Venetian.) It looks like it would be a good experience. Overall, the Aria could have been a "4 rating", but I rate the Aria a "3" because of their "attitude". On my future trips to Las Vegas I will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel with the best beds!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aria for 4 nights in March, it was our first visit to Las Vegas and we were not disappointed. The initial welcome was friendly and check in was quick. Our room was on the 4th floor and not far from the lift. We had heard of long walks to the rooms, so we were lucky. The room was very nice, spacious and clean. Electric curtains, great fun! But the bed was the most sumptuous ever and we really didn't want to leave it. Fabulous pillows, deep soft mattress topper, wonderful duvet, could not be faulted. The hotel is very large but the atmosphere is great. Having looked at other hotels along the strip, the Aria has the most contemporary feel and the slot machines are well spread out. And yes there are so many slots, and tables, but that is what it's all about. The buffet breakfast was delicious and so much choice, eggs benedict, fabulous. There are lots of variety in the bars and restaurants to suit all tastes. The pool area was lovely and waitress service for drinks. Sadly the Liquid was not open, but looked very nice. The Elvis Cirque du soleil show was also not open and it would have been nice to know before we went. But we went to the Cirque Du Soleil at Fantasy Island and that was excellent. However, there is lots to see and do at the Aria and we would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Bed and Fun on Property Win over Any Problems”
Reviews.Author: Amber R
Reviews.Content: Aria was a real treat to stay in; it's a refreshing smoke-free environment, the bed alone was the best I've ever slept in, and the bedside-gadget controlled temp/t.v./drapes were a nice touch overlooking the strip. I don't think my husband was ever completely happy with the temp, because he'd set it at 65 at night and awake with it still over. My biggest problem was the consistency with what is written and voiced. For instance, since you pay for the gym it'll be good to know that it closes at 7? Or was that 8pm? Depends who you ask at the front desk. There's great new equipment and variety in the gym despite the mix-up! Also, I love the 24 hr Cafe Vetro, (so it says upstairs in your hotel guide),...although when you open the menu BOOK, (honestly love the variety), it has specific hours too. My best advice is if you intend to visit someplace on the property, (even the pool), ask about hours. By the way the pool was refreshing and scenic. On Friday & Sunday nights there is a talented guitarist/pianist/vocalist near the casino elevators that's worth a drink and listen. He's completely captivating over the expensive slot machines, (which boast normal penny/nickel/quarter/dollar increments but then have much higher minimums when you look at the buttons), but with a central location it's easy to travel to another casino for your slot needs. Perhaps I had too high expectation for water pressure on the shower/spa duo, but despite the shortcomings the truth is: Was it clean/luxurious feel where I want to drop my head every night? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel and will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: TW501
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptionally clean and well run, and staff are courtious and helpful. I especially liked the pool and spa area.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: hvtrillo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property 3 times now, most recently March 2012. It is top-notch, but pricey. Cafe Vetro is very nice for breakfast ,as we like a sit-down and be served breakfast. The pools are lovely and there is enough shade for all who want it, but I would like to see food served around the pool and better drink service. Skybox Sports Bar and Grill is a fast-food outlet right next to the Sprots Book, and we split a fantastic cobb salad from there for lunch. Jean Georges Steakhouse is pricey, but they split our steak in a wonderful presentation and it was cooked perfectly. The rooms are spotless and everyone who works there is friendly. One thing I dislike is that they allow customers in their huge check-in area to just line up behind separate lines, when having one or two major lines to feed the many check-in stations would be more efficient. There was a man standing there with a clipboard to answer questions who could very easily manage the lines so people wouldn't have to wait while their line was slower than others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, but restaurants are not on up to par”
Reviews.Author: jbr23
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Aria. Great place, new, clean, modern etc. We ate at the Sirio restaurant are were quite disappointed --- with both the service and food. My veal chop stuffed with swiss chard was excessively salty. I could not eat the entree. We ordered a salad and asked to have it split between my wife and I. The waiter placed the entire salad in the middle of the table and while he saw me dividing the salad asked if I wanted pepper. "Well, yes I do but can you wait until I finish dividing the salad?" ( I thought he would have done this for us.) Overall the place was OK and the waiter kindly did not charge us for my entree. I did tip as if the bill included my meal not to penalize the waiter. The waiter indicated the veal chop was new on the menu and the chef was still experimenting with the dish. Great now he tells me, after I order and try the dish. I spoke to the concierge the next day and explained the situation. She indicated the GM would contact me to discuss the matter. In a service oriented business such as the hospitality industry communication is key. I still have not heard from the GM nor do I expect a call. As a shareholder of MGM this is unacceptable. When you say you are going to call, you call. Ironically on Sunday evening at the Wynn, we were eating at the Stratta when Steven Wynn walks in and speaks to us. Sell MGM and buy Wynn and stay there next year!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: live4thebeach072
Reviews.Content: I had heard so much about the Aria Hotel that we were excited to stay there this time. The location is perfect - especially if you are shopper - great shopping right next to it if you are into high end brands. It's close to the Cosmopolitan, which is also great. I also really liked the TRAM that transports you all the way to the Bellagio. Great Plus as the trip is always so busy, there really is no point to taking a cab. The service was good too. Even though we had a blast, I doubt we'll stay there again. The rooms were disappointing in that they aren't very well designed, and the colours are dull. We didn't watch TV (of course, we are in Vegas) but it was not possible to watch TV from the bed, I found this as a design mistake! (or is it on purpose, who knows) The couch table, chair...all very uncomfortable. A long hallway was just a waste of space. Nice bathroom, but no counter space whatsoever! We were in a corner suite with a view of the strip, which was ok. The view from Mandalay Bay is a lot better! The whole room was high tech which was nice, but I didn't care much about how overcomplicated they made it. The bed, pillows and linens were top notch, I have to say, so that's a big plus. But I think in Vegas, pretty much every hotel is like that. One night we got a table at Gold Lounge. Great service! I loved it because it's a smaller type lounge. However, the music was sooo bad! They really need to hire a good DJ. The music was just horrible. Cannot even compare to some of the well know clubs in Vegas, but it has potential to be an amazing spot - hire a great DJ! Personally, our room a the Wynn & Encore was a million times better. However, they are bit far from everything and there isn't much to do there, but I must say, I really love the decor and rooms! I hear Bellagio has spent a lot of money renovating the rooms now with a modern look. So next time, we will probably check that out. I didn't like the Bellagio before...it was getting old and smelly, but now, it might be a different story. I am giving it a 4 star because of its location. But if I had to rate the rooms, I would rate them as a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: L_R32
Reviews.Content: I know this review may be late,but better late than never!!! I stayed here for Halloween 2011, and I must say I should have checked out after 5 hours of being there and went over the Vdara. I always love the Vdara. Its comfortable, spacious, apartment styled desgin. The check in for the Aria was about 30 minutes long and the host were really rude. When we got to our room the black out drapes did not keep the room from shining light in the room. And next to the bed they have a hand held touch screen remote that controls the whole room, which the light is brighter than the light you turn on in the room. I had to put the pillow on top of the remote just so that I could get some sleep. The bathroom was ok. except the tub and shower were both in the same area such as like a combination but when you opened the shower door there was the shower and if you walk in the tub was just right there. Like how do you take a bath while someone is taking a shower. Water being splassed all in your face. Maybe some take turns well i just did not get it. Overall the only thing good about this hotel is the food places especailly Japanese Blossom and the night clubs. other than that i will never spend my money on this hotel again!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, pretty posh!”
Reviews.Author: mozart8181
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a very modern hotel in the City Center. The beds are extremely comfortable and the staff is very courteous. You can take a tram over to the Bellagio, Vdara and Monte Carlo from the Aria for free, it takes only a few minutes. If you're looking for a less expensive place to eat, tram it over to the food court at the Monte Carlo. Take a look at the world-famous fountains at the Bellagio, then go back to Aria and eat dinner at Lemongrass, the best Thai food ever!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience !”
Reviews.Author: psychodoc
Reviews.Content: Have to say that me and my friends had a great experience at this hotel during our Vegas vacation ... Great locations, good options of restaurants and bars/lounges , a big non smoky casino and an amazing buffet option too. The front desk was also very helpful and got us rooms with connecting doors ... Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Aria”
Reviews.Author: topgal
Reviews.Content: Beautiful newer hotel in Las Vegas. Spacious bedrooms with top of the line gadgets and electronics..for example, all lights, drapes,tv, etc are remote controlled. The noise level in the lobby and casino is not deafening and it smells fresh. The restaurant options were good and the buffet wonderful. Great coffee, pastry and sweets available. It is walking distance to many other hotels. Nice casino area. Looked like wonderful pool area but it was too cold for us to use.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SWCSydney
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault the hotel. The rooms are large, clean and well laid out. The bathroom is large and very usable. Really like the shower and bath how it’s in the same 'room'. There are some great restaurant options. I didn’t gamble so cannot comment on this part. Check in/out was fast and efficient. It's very well located on the strip pretty well half way. The WiFi was incredibly fast and was included! Overall very happy and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vegas Resort!”
Reviews.Author: MSM93
Reviews.Content: I agree with the reviewer who said that Aria trumps the Bellagio. I have stayed at both and will definitely go back to Aria. The hotel is beautiful, the staff is courteous and helpful, and the pool is wonderful. The rooms are a bit smaller than the Bellagio or the Wynn, but the incredibly comfortable bed and technology make up for it. The room is operated by a control panel that sits by the bed and would make even the biggest gadget geek happy. We splurged on a cabana for one day of our visit and it was a blast. There are several pools, two of which are adult (or big kid) only. Poolside service is great (although not cheap ... but neither is any other Vegas hotel). Try the Pink Cadillac Margarita! YUM!! And you can't beat the location! I highly recommend Aria!

Reviews.Title: “I think my expectations were too high...”
Reviews.Author: dexter619
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 5th wedding anniversary. We had decided to stay here months before after being very impressed by the food and the sports book on our last visit to Las Vegas. I think that my expectations were too high because I got disappointed about some things. First of all the hotel is gorgeous, so let's get that out of the way. Nice and modern, decorated stylishly and simply. However, two mishaps occurred that I believe should have gone smoothly for the type of hotel Aria is and for the cost ($275 a night). Firstly, I made arrangements prior to arriving to have some anniversary treats delivered to our room the day that we checked in through the concierge. When I called down to the concierge after settling into our room, I was on hold for about 10 minutes before someone answered. Then the attendant that I spoke to seemed not to know what was going on. I explained that I pre-paid and had arrangements for champagne, strawberries and rose petals and she acted like she couldn't find my reservation/itinerary. She put me back on hold for several minutes and then I was finally able to confirm. Later on, I received a call from another person at the concierge department requesting my credit card info again. They claimed that they didn't have the last 4 digits of my credit card. By then, my dealings with the concierge department were annoying, at best. Anyway, after all that, they did deliver the items and also made a heart shape on the bed with the rose petals, which was nice. The transaction, however, was far from flawless. Another issue that annoyed me was that our TV malfunctioned about 3 times. The first time, we called a technician who arrived promptly. The 2nd and 3rd times, my husband observed what the technician did to fix the issue and did it himself (I think it was a series of steps to reset the TV). Everything else was good. I went to the salon for a manicure and pedicure and they were able to take me for a last minute appointment early in the morning. The buffet was delicious and so was the food at the sports bar. The sports book is a little small for big events (we were there to bet on the NCAA college basketball tournament) and it was quite crowded, but we expected that. I like that the City Center (of which the Aria is a part of) is right in the middle of the strip. A small note regarding the crowd and the atmosphere: the Aria is a little pretentious for my taste. The crowd is mostly made up of stuck up yuppies who want to show off their money. It is not very diverse at all. I didn't feel very comfortable or think that others were very approachable. I like to have a good time and laugh with fellow travelers. I didn't feel like I could do that at Aria. The relaxed and fun vibe at Planet Hollywood or MGM is more my speed. In conclusion, I think that I put the Aria on a pedestal and was a little disappointed, especially in the concierge experience. I doubt we'll stay at Aria again.

Reviews.Title: “Belated Honeymoon in the beautiful ARIA”
Reviews.Author: Jessica C
Reviews.Content: Aria was a beautiful hotel!!! My husband and I renewed our vows and finally got the honeymoon after 8 years of marriage, so we splurged and paid a little more than your average resort on the strip to stay at the Aria (which we got for a good deal on Allegiant's website). I do have a couple of comments on different areas of the hotel that seem to be frequent issues on here. Staff: I've read a lot of comments about staff attitude issues, etc. on here and I have to say that we had ZERO problems. The staff were all friendly, from concierge to the front desk, the bellman, and even the folks assisting guests where the shuttles arrive at. Everyone was professional, courteous, and very willing to assist us with our stay. Room: We reserved a king bed deluxe room for our stay and upon arrival were told that the only king bed room had a shower only and not the shower-tub combo I was looking forward to. When I let the desk clerk know that I still wanted a tub, she put us on the 53rd floor in a room with two queens, promising to have them find a nice room for us the next day with a king AND the shower-tub combo. We called our first afternoon there and after complaining a little bit about the room we were in (the technology did not greet me or anything when we walked in!), the clerk put us on the 20th floor with a Strip view. LOVED IT! I enjoyed everything about that room and did not mind the darkness as we tend to use only ambient lighting in our own home and it keeps it a bit darker. The towels were plush, the view was impeccible, and the furnishings and decor were lovely. I was looking forward to the comfy bed, but I really didn't find it all that great. It wasn't bad, but I think that the bed had seen a lot of use and the mattress seemed kind of firm for my liking. That's okay, though, because I've stayed in a lot of cheap motels and this was delightful compared to them. Housekeeping: Often I've read that houskeeping has been sub-par during peoples trips to this hote; however, our housekeeping was wonderful. We would turn the light over to "SERVICE" and by the time we reached our room again for either the night or to change or take a break, our room was spotless. The only bad thing I didn't like at all was that the last day we were there the housekeeping had thrown away my boot cup from Fremont, which I was going to give someone who wanted it. Spa: Oh...my. Wonderful! I loved the Spa!!! My massage therapist, Sheila, was very nice and quickly made me feel comfortable as this was the first massage I ever had. The ambiance was relaxing throughout the spa and the hosts were very accomadating. Food: We at at Cafe Vetro the first night we stayed at the Aria and the food was unimpressive as well as the high price. $60 for two people? Yikes! Guess we weren't in Kansas anymore! My husband and I also at at the buffett a couple of times and really enjoyed the good food selection as well as the omelett station they had set up for breakfast and then again for Friday brunch. We had eaten at the Mirage buffet while in Vegas and Aria was hands down so much better than the Cravings Buffet at Mirage! Last note about food was we had room service and I thought that the price was comparable to the room service I had at Luxor during my previous stay in Vegas; and by that I was presently surprised and the food was awesome as well! So...one last thing. I've heard people complain about all the walking that there is to do at Aria due to its immense size. To that I have to say: it's VEGAS! If you come to Vegas and don't expect to do a ton of walking (even though it wasn't fun to have to trek through Crystals from the Strip just to get to the hotel!), then this is NOT the city for you. Vegas is all about walking everywhere so I guess it didn't bother me that we had to hoof it quite a bit around the place. Overall, I think we stay there again sometime if we got a good deal again. However, this trip was much more of a "splurge", and I'd rather stay somewhere right ON the Strip, so next time my hubby and I travel to Vegas we'll probably stay somewhere a little cheaper and that is more accessible to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: julze15
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel. From the moment we stepped into the hotel the staff was excellent. Always smiling always there to help. I even got a birthday card & gift left in the hotel room for my 40th. There was a vanilla aroma that you can smell all around the ground floor. It is a stunning highly finished hotel. The pool area is stunning 3 hot tubs & a couple of pools we were lucky enough to visit it on a couple of occasions. The rooms were on the small side but they had everything we needed the technology was a hit with my fella opening & closing curtains, temperture & lights all dealt with at a push of a button via the tv or remote control. it was so quite in our room the bed was so comfortable best night sleep we have had in years.Oh & the location is spot on. Right in the center. We will defo be returning. 9.5 out of 10 xx 5 nights stay 12th- 16th March 2012 the we moved to the Pallazo

Reviews.Title: “Aria”
Reviews.Author: rebecca s
Reviews.Content: Sirio Ristorante An outstanding dining experience with a beautiful menu with classical dishes to suit all tastes. The rooms were spacious and of perfectly high standards with a beautiful view and perfectly located in the centre of the strip. The spa was outstanding for last minute relaxation befor our wedding. We were recommended this by Jimmy Vegas Weddings and we were more than pleased with the commitment and level of standards they delivered to us.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: FoodAddictPEI
Reviews.Content: Since we were in Vegas for several nights, I decided to try both Aria and Bellagio and Aria is the clear winner. I was initially a bit disappointed by the room size at Aria, but the convenience of the technology won me over. It is so nice to be able to adjust the temperature or lighting without getting out of bed. The room control tablet is very intuitive and easy to use. The beds are a bit soft for my taste both others will love them. The water pressure in the shower was great and the rooms were really quiet. I wish there was a coffee maker in the room but most Vegas hotels don't have them. The pool area looked very nice but the weather was a bit too cold during our visit to try it out. GREAT STAFF - I generally don't comment on hotel staff since I'm a fairly low-maintenance traveller and don't demand alot of staff, but the Aria staff were spectacular! Every employee from the front desk, bellman, maids and waiters seemed genuinely happy to have us staying at their hotel and willing to do anything to help. LOCATION - Great location. It is only a few steps from Aria to the free tram which takes you to Bellagio (the centre of the Vegas universe) in a matter of minutes. FOOD - The Aria buffet is one of the best in Vegas (and I've eaten at many of them). In addition to the great food, it is one of the few with natural daylight and the waiters are very attentive. We loved the buffet so much the last time we were in Vegas that we decided to stay at the hotel this time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Flannypants09
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Aria is awesome. The staff is perfect, the room is outstanding(technology, and the most comfortable bed known to mankind). I am sold on Aria and they have my business for life.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with an exception or two”
Reviews.Author: bbaxter44
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay but you need to know a couple of things. We stayed two nights and had to call to have our room made up. An isolated experience? Nope, miraculously we ran into some friends that were staying there as well. They told us that their room wasn't made up at all. Excellent location, interesting decor but probably more to suit European tastes. The vanilla scent permeating the hotel may affect your allergies but I liked it. They have some beautiful outdoor swimming pools but they close at 5:00pm, that includes the expanded hot tube pools as well. Here in the desert this time of year, 5:00pm is the warmest part of the day. An interesting place that I highly recommend, don't expect 5 star accommodations. It is more along the lines of a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Aria Las Vegas March 2012”
Reviews.Author: texaslucky55
Reviews.Content: Wow !! this place is is fantastic.Rooms are beautiful and everyone we encountered was very friendly and service was great. Restaurants are expensive so we ate elsewhere,except for the gourmet buffet which was $38.95 per person, included a whole lobster for every 2 persons. Unlimited house red or white wine included also. It was good but not great. Security was very good. you have show a room key to get to the elevators. We went to a friends room one night and didn't completely close the door to the room and when we left there were two security guards outside of the room, they said they noticed the door open and just wanted to make sure nobody left the room without closing the door. Casino has a vanilla scent they use that you notice at first,but after a few minutes you don't notice. Did not have that smokey smell that a lot of casinos have. There is a food court you can walk to between Aria and Monte Carlo that has McDonald's,Sbarro, a Mexican place, Starbucks, Subway that's where we ate breakfast most days. If you are staying there and valet park you can call and they will have your car waiting for you when you get there, Table game minimum bets were pretty high. blackjack was 10-15 minimum with most $25 minimum. Overall we enjoyed our stay probably better than any other strip casino we've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “The Service is Impeccable but it has some flaws”
Reviews.Author: nomoretrainsinnv
Reviews.Content: Spent the entire week in Las Vegas at the Aria. Went mainly for the Elvis Presley show which was fantastic. Also took in the Terry Fator show (ventriloquism) and this show was funny and kept us laughing thruout the show. All in all the two shows were well worth the price and you should not hestitate in going. So back to the Aria. The place is huge so plan on doing a lot of walking. The many dinner places and casino make it an adventure. Cafe Vettro was one of our favorites for breakfast and lunch. American Fish is right on and well worth the money. Taste and presentation are tops for this place. Like I said prepare to spend. For example since our "deluxe room" didnt have a coffee pot a large pot of coffee, one banana, two english muffins and the morning paper was $40. A little steep in anyones mind. We were sold on the idea of a "deluxe room with two corners". The first corner was the street facing window and the second corner was 18 inches of glass. Yeah right! Next toiletries. A place like Aria one would imagine items from France, Great Britain or the United States not "Made in China". Cheap and shows no class! Finally the telephone system in the room. We heard from a variety of employees that the phone system has multiple issues and has been a source of problems. There was a scheduled power interuption for our room that effectively "locked". This means we had to call the front desk, asst. hotel manager and housekeeping with our cell phones coming in through the main switchboard for such things as room service. This went on for 24 hours. After the front desk and the asst. hotel manager not answering their phone we finally got someone in housekeeping to get us out of "phone system jail" When we complained at checkout they deducted two days worth of resort fees. The Aria is nice but we wont make a return trip. Oh one more thing. We had to constant call the front desk to have the mini-bar restocked.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PVTraveler01
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel.... New, well maintained ....room furnishings and bath are outstanding; lighting in the rooms fair at best Location great...restaurant options superb.. Blossom restaurant in particular outstanding .... Housekeeping an desk staff very friendly and service oriented. Lots of hi tech gadgetry in the rooms ..... A touch pad control panel by the bed .. Several control switches around the room ..... However the human engineering is not good ... Stuff is very non- intuitive ..eg trying to lower the volume on the in room music soundscape ... also all controls exhibit about 5+ sec plus latency -- very frustrating . Telephones went out one afternoon --- for some time......... only 2 electrical outlets available in room( I called the guest services desk as I couldn't believe it but yes only 2 and neither anywhere near the bedside tables---on the exact opposite wall at the desk) Open and closing drapes controls tough to find ... Couldn't simply pull them open or shut! Wifi spotty .. Had trouble connecting one day from my room.... Friend on other end of floor said only could connect if stood by window -- nowhere else in room. Other days worked fine.. In summary..... Looks like they poured too much money into hardware and way too little into people to make it work for the customer -- in total. Even though I personally am pretty tech savvy ( I'm an engineer as well ). I would have strongly preferred less of this tech .

Reviews.Title: “BUYER BEWARE!!!!! Especially if Privacy is important to you!”
Reviews.Author: DrewCrew_515
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review with this: I have been in the Casino Industry for nearly 13 years, traveling to some of the best Casinos (Public and Tribal) throughout the United States. On an average I frequent Las Vegas about 3-4 times a year for business and usually spend a week there every winter for Global Gaming Expo (G2E). This was my first visit to Las Vegas for pleasure and no business. As previously mentioned I frequent Las Vegas quite a bit, staying at many of the properties, I now prefer to stay a block off the strip at a non-gaming hotel, but the hotel was chosen by the couple we went with as it was her Birthday and their Anniversary or else Aria would not have been my top choice. If you are looking for a STRIP VIEW, this is not the hotel for you! The hotel is quite a ways away from the strip, so if you are looking for that experience, stay somewhere like Bellagio, Paris, Planet Hollywood etc…. My room view consisted of an A/C unit on the top of the roof. Since we were approximately 10-15 floors from the rest of our party and didn't even ride up in the same group of elevators we asked to be moved closer to them, our request was NEVER met. The first time we were told that our request was in the computer and check back the next day. After checking back the next day, our request was NOT found, so we requested it again. We were informed that someone would contact us to inform us if our request could be met, NOPE! Never Heard from them. READ THIS: We are normally easy people to accommodate and usually never request our room to be serviced we had illuminated the privacy button on our room before leaving each day. On Saturday morning, while leaving the room for brunch we made sure our privacy button was on, as we did not need service and since the rooms DO NOT HAVE SAFES, I HAD LEFT A LARGE SUM OF MONEY OUT. Upon our return that evening, my wife and I noticed that our room had been somewhat serviced and our privacy light was no longer illuminated. We had new towels hung up; our bed was halfway made, etc…. At first glance it did not look like anything was missing but it was still disturbing, but I was reluctant to say anything. The next morning we had a voice message on our phone, left at approximately 1:00 PM, about an hour after we had left, informing us “that since our Privacy Light was on, our room WOULD NOT BE SERVICED AND IF WE NEEDED ANYTHING, PLEASE CONTACT HOUSEKEEPING.” With that message I filed an incident report with the Security Department on Sunday, March 4, 2012. I was informed that the incident would be investigated and I would at least be informed when my room was accessed and who accessed my room within 7 days. I JUST LEFT A MESSAGE WITH RISK MANAGEMENT on March 22, 2012 as I have NOT HEARD from anyone! ( I will try and attach a picture of my incident report) Last but not least, the restaurant service is terribly slow, even for Las Vegas and the drink prices are outrageous. On a brighter side, the valet is easily accessible and the staff is great! The Hotel Lobby smells absolutely HEAVENLY, and the Gaming Floor layout is easy to navigate. The electronics that control the room are cool and the bath is nice. Some rooms they are located in the shower, so if you are looking for a nice romantic bubble bath with the infinity feel its cool.

Reviews.Title: “Aria Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: AllenWilson15
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at several "Strip" hotels, we found Aria to be excellent and the location at "City Center" puts you in the center or walking distance from many other newer hotels/casinos. Nice rooms, good service. Taxi to Fremont Street (Old Las Vegas Strip) was $50, you could rent an Avis in the garage for $100/day and parking is free at most casinos/resorts. Since we had the car, we took a short day trip to Red Rock Canyon, a national park half an hour out of Las Vegas City Center.and recommend it should you begin to feel too jaded. Beautiful rock formations and an excellent visitor's center. Plenty of hiking trails should you care to but not necessary to enjoy the 13 mile scenick loop through the park.

Reviews.Title: “Don't want to stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: RDumkaCEO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the epitome of class while still being priced within reach. Gorgeous rooms and views make it pointless to want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: runninginearth
Reviews.Content: stayed one week last December, very nice modem hotel, clean in room. We checked in one room first night, but waked up in the early morning by smoking smell, smoke from washroom, looked like someone in next room was smoking, ventilation system linked in these rooms. I had to ask reception to switch a nonsmoking room. Overall experience is good.

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT EXPERIENCE AT ARIA”
Reviews.Author: JOSEPH B
Reviews.Content: The property was beautiful and the service and hospitality were great. I will definitely make another trip here Thank you for the warm welcome and hospitality Cordially Joseph Booker M.D.

Reviews.Title: “Aria Resort/Casino exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: MontereyDave01
Reviews.Content: We've been wanting to try the Aria at City Center, so when we received a great offer in the mail, we made reservations. The people at the 800 number were quick and well-informed about our offer. In less than 10 minutes, we reserved a room, selected the night and performance time of the Elvis Cirque de Soleil show, made reservations for a limo pickup at the airport and received a confirmation email. If you go to Las Vegas often, it's smart to join your favorite hotel's afffinity program. As we played in the casino, we earned points through the MGM Resorts program and that translated into instant comps for us. The limo reservation was a bit indulgent, but it's not as expensive as one would think ($77) and there's no standing in a long line for a taxi, instead we were greeted at the baggage claim by our driver and went directly to the waiting car. During our ride to the Aria, we asked the driver about the hotel to find out what other people had to say about it. His friendliness was very helpful in navigating what was for us, a new hotel experience. Upon arrival, one is immediately struck by the immense size and very modern architecture of this hotel. Once inside the lobby, before we could even get oriented, several hotel employees greeted us and asked if we needed any assistance. In a matter of moments, we were directed to the "invited guests" counter and began our check-in. We were greeted like long-lost relatives and the front desk friendliness was refreshing! We asked for a room closer to the elevators with a great view (tips we found on Trip Advisor.) Our check-in clerk, Leah, was so friendly and helpful, we were compelled to mention her name here. Leah reminded us not to touch anything in the fridge, because if things are just touched or lifted up, that becomes an instant room charge. The hotel is immense, huge, large and vast! After check-in we wanted to see our room and unpack. Again, multiple employees asked if we needed help or directions, as we were guided to our specific elevator area. Note: Various floors are grouped together, for quicker elevator service. For example, if you are on the 34th floor, don't get into the elevators marked for floors 19-30. The room was very nice and everything seemed brand new. We learned how to use the much talked-about electronic control pad and were able to open the drapes, adjust the room temperature, turn on lights and select TV channels effortlessly. We pressed a few incorrect icons, as we were learning how to use the system, but overall, there was NO problem. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was well stocked with all necessary ammenities and the bath/tub enclosure was fun! One can take a bath while the other one showers, all within the same glass enclosure. Our only problem with the room was the lack, I mean almost complete lack of water pressure in both sinks. This was never fixed during our stay, even though we reported it 2x. The casino is large and there's the much talked about, scent of vanilla wafting in the air. We were not overpowered or bothered by it, in fact we liked it. In some way, the vanilla seemed to warm-up some of the coldness of the modern architecture. The selection of very modern slots is quite large and at many of the slots, one can select not only the game they want to play, but the denomination as well. This save your feet, because it cuts down on some of the walking! There's a lot of walking in this hotel - everything is on a large scale, so wear comfortable shoes - your feet will thank you. Be warned, like all Strip casinos, this one is just as tight as the rest of them. There is very little "slot action," no mid-level "hits" and after 4 days on the casino floor, we can say we NEVER heard a single jackpot bell ring, nor did we ever see a single "hand-pay." By the end of our trip, we had given up all hope of winning anything. We discovered the fixed rail tram to the elegant Bellagio and spent time there enjoying the casino and garden. There's a large, gleaming-new shopping mall at Aria, named Crystal. It's worth a walk-through, the shops are all high-end and very expensive. Most all of the shops were empty and the mall was rather quiet. The Elvis show by Cirque de Soleil was awesum. The theater is large, the seats are comfortable and the show was full of energy. This is the largest Cirque cast in Las Vegas and even Elvis haters will find something to enjoy about it. Don't miss it! For quick dining, consider The Jean Phillip patisserie. The food consists of quality snacks, fruit, sandwiches and pastry. The only problem with this venue is that it's too crowded, cramped and confusing. We wanted to order some specialty crepes that we saw being made by hand, but we never figured out how to do that, because of the confusing and very rushed ordering process. The patisserie area could be a bit larger and less difficult to navigate. We tried the Cafe Vettro for one lunch and one dinner. We'll skip this venue in the future. The wait staff was rushed, inattentive, distracted, slow and not very friendly. Our entrees did NOT arrive hot, but instead, at barely room temperature. If you complain, the waiter will shrug his shoulders and say "it's not my fault, blame it on the chef." They won't offer to re-heat your food nor make an adjustment to your bill. Dining there during the sunlight hours means a lot of bright sun and harsh glare, so be sure to bring your sun glasses. We did enjoy the Lemongrass Thai food restaurant and Italian style Sirio Ristoranti. Everything was perfect, delicious and the staff was very friendly. These two restaurants quickly became our new favourites. Check-out was available on the electronic system in our room, but we choose to check-out at the front desk. It was quick and effortless. The lady at the check-out counter asked us "how was your stay?" We mentioned the problem with the bathroom water pressure and how it was never fixed. She apologized and comped all of our food charges, to demonstrate the hotel's concern for our problem. That's the moment when we became "hooked!" We will definitely be back again. The Aria is an excellent five-star hotel, the staff is incredibly friendly and they go out of their way to make sure each guest feels special. Try it, we think you will like it! :)

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: Montezsantafe
Reviews.Content: I have travelled throughout my life (I started young and now in my 60s I continue to travel). This is my favorite place of all time. Everyone is professional yet kind and the rooms and premises are beyond description. The Jetson's will stay here one day. (Check out their website).

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVE ARIA - from australia”
Reviews.Author: Kelly H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 7 nights during June 2010. We found the hotel to be extremely well kept, modern, and full of pleasant staff. Check in was quick, and we were even able to request a unit at a higher level without any problems. The rooms themselves were fabulous, exactly what you would expect from a las vegas hotel. Huge bed, huge shower and bathroom, huge lounge, foyer etc. The bed is amazing and it was the best sleep I had had in years! Yes you do have to walk a few minutes to the casion and out onto the street. But if you are physically fit and healthy then you wouldnt even be worried. The Casino is ultra modern, well kept, and has lots of restaurants nearby. We would def stay at Aria again, and we recommend our Australian friends to stay there on their trips

Reviews.Title: “High-tech toilets”
Reviews.Author: BenBombo
Reviews.Content: I purchased a room via Priceline bidding and paid $82 for a Monday night stay. Upon check-in, I gave the front desk clerk a twenty-dollar "sandwich" tip. He upgraded us to a corner city-view suite. It was room 16-042. It was phenomenal. A large living room, two bathrooms and a separate bedroom with a corner of floor-to-ceiling windows. The best part: A Japanese-style high-tech toilet with heated seat and automatic, hands-free washing. This is the sort of indulgent silliness I appreciate in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!”
Reviews.Author: Constantina I
Reviews.Content: The most elegant and modern hotel of all!! We traveled from Cyprus to go to Vegas and this was the perfect hotel for our honeymoon.! We booked the corner suite which was fantastic!! Thank you so much for a lovely stay !! The think that was very odd was that when we were checking out we called the porter to come for our luggages and he asked us if we booked a taxi and we said. O ,he tolds us that because we were staying in the suites we were entitled to have a limousine so he took us down to the limousine parking but then somebody called him on the radio and said hat we were not entitled so we had to take a taxi instead,that was confusing and not professional fir a 5 star hotel . P.s the hotel rooms are like 4000 but our check in was very quick,we were lucky and for those that expect to have a quick check in and don't have to wait they are not thinking correct ..if they don't want to wait so don't book such a huge hotel .

Reviews.Title: “WOW !”
Reviews.Author: Christine R
Reviews.Content: a friend stayed here while we were recently in Vegas. We went over to sit by the pool seeing our hotels' wasn't open as promised. It was a little different atmosphere than some of the other casinos in Vegas , it exudes class and comfort. From the sweet (and I mean this quite literally) lil chocolate shoppe and pastries to the fantastic cafes and other restaurants. We had lunch at the one of the cafes and the food was fantastic.... the pool was incredible , very attentive staff there to greet you with big fluffy towels ...although it did take forever for a waiter to stop by and offer to get us some refreshments. The rooms were absolutely lavish and made you feel like you were the Queen for a day...all touch pad controls from the light switches to the control to open the blinds...which opened to a fantastic view. This hotel may cost you a few more pennies at the end of the day , but it was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: WynterSong
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Aria and we were very pleased.We had a deluxe city view, which was well worth the extra cost.The view was very nice both at night and during the day.The casino was open and well ventilated.The bar staff were plentiful and readily available if you so chose and you were playing the games.We ate at the steakhouse in Aria, the service was superb as was the food.I thought,however,it was a bit pricey.We ate at the buffet every morning( three) and found it very good and the selection was great and for 16.99 each a good value for big eaters.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Mojeaux
Reviews.Content: The pleasant smell from the moment I walked in I knew I had made the best decision by selecting the Aria during my trip to Vegas. Check in took forever but I was looking around. The welcoming entrance to the room was nice. The rooms on the 8th floor were average in size. Everything in the room was luxurious and hi tech! The Deuce was a cool lounge to get the evening started.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back”
Reviews.Author: Ken S
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the ARIA because I thought you get what you pay for in Vegas. Boy was I wrong. At first check-in they had us on the 5th floor. I asked if we could have something higher and they said I would have to wait. That's fine, we waited. Four hours later they call saying our room is ready. They put us on the 5th floor again. So a quick talk to a manager and in secs we were on the 32nd floor. The cheapest table you will find in the small casino (smallest I have seen in Vegas) is $15 min bets. I spent $100 dollars at a table and didn't even get a drink. The service was poor. We would walk to the MGM or New York to gamble and drink. After the first day we left our room at 10am and had the room service light on. We came back about 8pm and our room was never serviced. I called the manager and he sent fresh towels up and it took 30 mins. They gave us a $50 dollar comp after being on hold for 10 mins with the front desk and hung up on twice. So we decided the next morning to watch tv and eat breakfast in bed with the room credit. Woke up out our TV was not working. Called the front desk and was placed on hold for about 5 mins. So we ordered simple room service (bagels and juice) and it took 35 mins. You get charged 25 dollars a day for wifi and gym services. The wifi only worked the first day. The ice machine was broken on our floor for 2 out of 3 days we were there. After it got fixed I went to use it and another man was walking out and said it is broken again. I went back to the room to call the front desk to let them know and it was busy for about 10 mins. So I finally had to go down to the lobby and speak to a manager in person. A plus...the bed was probably the best bed I have slept on. All in all I should have stuck to my gut and stayed at the Wynn again. I will never stay at the ARIA again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property”
Reviews.Author: mitsylavigne
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a great location, right in the middle of the strip and set back just a little bit. It is attached to some amazing shopping, and there is a tram that will take you over to the Belaggio if you are in heels and dont want to make the walk! The property itself is so gorgeous, everything is shiny and clean and the hotel lobby has a faint smell of vanilla, which is lovely the first time you walk in. Keep in mind I was there over March Madness and Spring break, so there where alot of people, and alot of people smoking. So that lovely vanilla smell slowly turned into "Eau de chain smoking gramma", and was not so lovely as the trip went on. It basically smelt like those girls at the bar who go out for a cigarette and come back in stinking like cheap perfume to cover up. I would say the ventillation system is not as good as other hotels I have stayed at. I came home sick, and scratchy throat from the smoke, which has never happened before when we stayed at the MGM. Other than that, the hotel was amazing. The rooms where quite nice, and we got upgraded to the Sky Suites. When you walk in the room the curtains automatically open and the entire room is ran off of one panel. Once you get the hang of it, it is quite easy to use. It was my friend's birthday, and the hotel sent up chocolate covered strawberries and a couple little desserts up to the room which was a nice touch. The spa was amazing. It was really clean, well laid out, and the hottubs and saunas where fantastic. It was a great way to spend the afternoon reading a book and relaxing. The beds where fantastic, I slept like I was at home. The restaurants, all the food was amazing, but it was a little pricey. So check it out before you go. I guess it just depends on what you like.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: 365travelNYC
Reviews.Content: Staff is very service oriented and friendly. The rooms are spacious and expertly upgraded with new technology including excellent lighting and window shade controls! Room/bath cleanliness was average. The soaps and shampoos are made in china- these are my only criticisms. Breakfast buffet is a good value compared to others in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Strip - Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: jetblue09
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic trip to the Aria for Spring Break (March 10-13). The hotel holds a 5 Diamond award from AAA, and the property definitely lived up to this rating. We arrived Saturday around 6pm. Our bags were collected outside and brought to our room once we dialed down. Right away I noticed the attention to detail and outstanding architecture of this mega hotel. The receptionist Maria was extremely kind and checked us in very fast. She also helped us navigate the hotel using a map. As a frequent traveler to Las Vegas, I have come to expect long lines at Check-in no matter what hotel. Luckily, we did not experience any wait.
