However, I think it was due to the fact our plane arrived a bit earlier before the rush hour 10-11 pm range. We reserved a room with two queen beds. As we entered the room, the T.V turned on and the curtains opened to reveal a nice floor to ceiling view of Vdara and the Cosmopolitan. The room also featured a cool high tech touch screen remote that controlled everything from lights, wake-up calls, curtains and the T.V. The beds were really comfortable and the bathroom was huge. In terms of dining, Aria definitely has the most options out of any hotel on the strip. There must have been at least 8 fine dining and 8 casual restaurants including the buffet. We ate at both Cafe Vettro and the Buffet for breakfast. Both were pretty good. I also had the chance to enjoy the massive pool complex. The Breeze Cafe is a nice place to get a quick lunch, but it was only opened on the weekends which was a little frustrating as I could only get lunch there one of the days of my stay. I thought the gym was top class with a plentiful amount of strength and cardio machines. There was also a really nice lounge outside the gym with a nice fire place to relax. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at the Aria. I took advantage of Aria's central location and proximity to Crystals shopping mall. I believe Aria's location in City Center gives the hotel an advantage in comparison to other hotels like Wynn. While Wynn is a great property, its location is impractical for a visitor and not convenient. Lastly, the service at Aria stood out to me. Everyone was extremely kind and helpful. If I were to come back to Vegas, there is no doubt I will choose Aria!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - proceed with caution.”
Reviews.Author: wineismylife
Reviews.Content: March 7th through 10th, 2012 UPDATE I reviewed the Aria Resort & Casino almost one year . A few things have changed since that review so I thought I’d post a quick update based on this visit. Personnel Generally everybody I came in contact with that worked for the hotel was friendly and helpful, always taking the time to say hello, ask how I was doing and occasionally asking if there was anything else I needed along the way. The housekeeping staff did a good job cleaning the room again this time including at least one follow up call from a supervisor to specifically check in to make sure the room was being cleaned to my satisfaction. Front Desk The front desk has service issues. It was bad enough during this visit it made me think at least twice about staying here again. The biggest issue was the wait. There wasn’t a single time that I needed to visit the front desk that I had to wait a fairly significant amount of time. It didn’t matter how many personnel manned the front desk there was always a line that seemed to crawl at all times. I arrived 3 hours before the official check in time. After waiting in the long line where other patrons seemed to think they could move freely back and forth between agents when a spot opened regardless of the fact you happen to be standing in that line. I finally managed to get a very pleasant front desk agent that took all of my information, checked me into the hotel and finally let me know there were no rooms available at the moment. OK, I can handle being asked to wait if I’m early (it wasn’t a problem the year before) but I am dumbfounded and quite frankly annoyed when I’m told I can’t have a room while the patrons on both sides of me at the time did get rooms but the gentleman two agents down was also denied. If you don’t have rooms available then OK, you don’t have rooms available. But don’t hand them out willy nilly according to some mystic assignment system that irritates half of your guests with that all important very first impression. I received my call two hours later (I requested a text yet received a call) so after wrapping up my leisurely lunch I returned to the front desk and once again encountered the long and extremely slow lines which included the dedicated key pickup line I was supposed to be using. Finally I managed to secure an agent from the VIP guest line (I was here as part of a trade show) so I grabbed my keys and headed off for the half mile walk to my room, irritation number two from the front desk finally behind me. I swipe my key and barreled into my room ready to finally get some much needed work done and quite frankly I was shocked at what I encountered: the room was already occupied. Open luggage in the corner, used bath robes on the bed and half empty water glasses spread across the room. Once it dawned on me what was happening I quickly vacated the room before somebody walked in on me and called security thinking me a thief or a pervert. So I made the half mile track back down to the front desk and you guessed it: I hit the long slow line for the third time. Ultimately I get not one but three very embarrassed front desk agents wondering how in the hell I was issued keys to the wrong room. I did eventually secure my keys to the correct room and made the half mile walk back to the correct room to wait on my carry-on bags to be delivered to my room which I wouldn’t have needed to check in the first place if they had my room ready the first time. Strike three front desk. You officially hacked me off. So in summary I’d say at the minimum Aria management needs to actually stand out there in front of their front desk for hours on end if need be and determine exactly where the system is breaking and take the corrective action before they start losing patrons. They probably have already lost some. Facilities The facilities continue to be in good condition showing little signs of wear and tear including the all important room condition. I still enjoy the rooms overall. Being a bit of a high tech kind of personality, I love being able to control all aspects of my room from the HVAC temperature to opening the curtains to watching the flat panel TV with a push of a button. If I have any complaints about the room itself it would be the HVAC seemed to have a problem with a sensor which prevented it from holding temperature right at 72 degrees. One degree above or below would work but 72 on the dot would swing constantly between 74 and 68 at times. The common facilities such as the casino floor, restaurants, lobbies and the like all seem to still be in really good condition. Clientele This visit was by far and away dominated by some of the rudest people I’ve ever had the displeasure of sharing a hotel with over the past few years. I couldn’t believe the general state of rudeness I bore witness to by my fellow travelers. I have no idea why it was so heightened but it certainly was (could it be the NASCAR race in town this weekend? One wonders). I will be the first person to admit you cannot hold Aria reliable for the jerk behavior of their patrons but I only mention this because they need to be aware of it as well as you, my fellow traveler. It is something to be observed, monitored and if not ultimately corrected in some manner avoided by switching to other properties. Aria: disappointing - proceed with caution.

Reviews.Title: “BEST Hotel I've EVER Been to”
Reviews.Author: Allan S
Reviews.Content: Here with friends and they upgraded two normal rooms to a two bed suite in the VIP tower (Sky Suite) It was an AMAZING two bed apartment with LARGE living area and the BEST view of the other side of Vegas. EVERY thing was spotless and yes it only happens in Vegas! WILL BE BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice oversized rooms!”
Reviews.Author: TravelgirlKaty_Texas
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many times and like to try different hotels. So glad we tried Aria. We had 2 rooms - one for us and another for kids. Rooms and bathrooms are very luxurious. We loved the personal touch with the controls to tv, light and curtains. The lobby wasn't all that great - I've seen better - but it was still very nice. Very clean! And a great location. Would definitely stay here again if I got incredible rates like I did this time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Hi Tech”
Reviews.Author: Jeneraltang
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel right in the middle of the strip. Like most Vegas hotels, you could probably spend your entire trip in just 1 hotel, because it has a casino, multiple restaurants, and lots of boutique shops. However, it is also centrally located, so it's easy to walk to Bellagio, Paris hotel, the Venetian, etc. Our room was only on the 3rd floor, so there wasnt much of a view, but it was very quiet despite its closeness to the casino and facing the street (FYI they wanted us to pay $30/night extra for a higher room, so we opted to stay where we were). As others have mentioned, the rooms are super high tech, with everything controlled with an ipad-like device, so you can set your thermostat, window shades, tv, and lights, all in one place. I found it a bit frustrating though, that you cant just turn on a lamp if you wanted to by flicking the switch. The room itself for a "standard" was spacious, the bathroom had 2 sinks, and areas for the toilet and shower/tub. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've slept on in a hotel. They have valet as well as self-park, we ended up just doing self-park because we thought it was faster, but either way, there is plenty of parking. Note, from self-park to the hotel lobby is quite the trek all the way through the casino...it may be best to just do the valet. I have to take off a star because of the insane "resort fees" that alot of the hotels in Vegas like to tack on, and it apparently really only covers wi-fi and the pool - which wasnt even open when we were there! And unlike the Luxor, we didnt get any coupons for free drinks or discounts either. Overall though, a very comfortable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, stunning, but not my style...”
Reviews.Author: MCADAMA
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake, this place is a visually stunning property. Excellent restaurants, gorgeous views, etc. However, no longer being in my 20's or 30's, the place is just to darned noisy for my likes. Music blaring on the main floor 24/7 on top of the noise of slot machines and people; made it very difficult to converse without shouting. My 30th floor room, on the other hand, was paradise. Quiet, clean, very luxurious. I just hated leaving it knowing I would have to go back down to the chaos to go anywhere, eat, or do anything. My only disappointment with the room is that by the time I returned to relax after a day of being away (maybe 4:00 PM-ish), housekeeping had STILL not cleaned my room. My company booked several rooms here for a weekend company event and I don't consider myself "old" by any means, but I'll leave these places to the drunk 20-somethings from now on. That seemed to be the predominant guest you saw walking the floor and on the guest elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Central resort with modern accomodations”
Reviews.Author: cmccord
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to Vegas, and by far my favorite resort to stay at. Sure, the rates may be another $30-$50 per night higher, but when you take into account the amount that you will probably spend on cabs coming from cheaper resorts, it's most definitely worth the extra price. Location: location cannot be beat. You are right next to the Cosmopolitan and Monte Carlo, with Bellagio, Paris, Caesear's, Planet Hollywood and other popular resorts within a very short walk. There is also a monorail (free) that will take you between Aria and Monte Carlo/Bellagio. Shopping/Entertainment: Among the finest in Las Vegas. More of a higher end clientele (Louis Vuitton, Gucci, etc.), but fun to window shop non the less. There's also a few other shops inside the resort itself, but also higher end for the most part. There is a new Cirque du Soleil "Elvis" show that we did not get to see, but heard great reviews. Food: something for everyone. There's a cafe that caters to all tastes, but then you also have your quick bar-food restaurant, tapas, and a couple others. Their morning buffett was among the largest I've ever seen - absolutely something for everyone here too. There's also a very nice and cozy pastry/dessert bar for your favorite up of morning joe, all the way up to some of the most elaborate wedding cakes you'll ever see. Our favorite of all the restaurants was the Tapas restaurant, Julian Serrano. Hotel Room: Very modern. Very clean and well equiped for their "standard" (aka deluke king) room, having some interesting features like remote operated blinds, lights, tv, etc. We did get to see a room with a view - so if you can swing it, you should. Casino: Plenty of tables, wide variety games (not unlike other resorts in the area). Loved the fact that it never seemed to smell like smoke, despite the few folks that did smoke in the casino. Dealers were friendly and enjoyable, and waitresses were very attentative with drinks. Overall, I'd recommend staying here. If you want a centralized location - you almost can't beat this!

Reviews.Title: “Large & Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: ut_ragazzo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed three separate times at this resort for work. MGM meticulously planned out a beautiful property that wouldn't require you to ever leave the property to enjoy your time in Vegas. Wonderful restaurants, spa, gym, pools and entertainment are the extras to your comfortable and large guest rooms/suites. Control4 integrated technologies and lush mattresses keep me well rested and happy while visiting. As with any MGM resort, I could easily do without the daily resort fee. I'd rather have an all-inclusive rate that allows me to use internet, gym, etc. Nobody feels excited to pay a mandatory fee for services they may or may not use.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS WHAT A HOTEL SHOULD BE!!!”
Reviews.Author: oscar888_10
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel this is, I stay there for the first time, I really enjoy the experience, this is what a hotel should be!! friendly reception, good size rooms with great facilities, good restaurants, etc. As far as I am concern, it is a must if you want to go to Vegas

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in the heart of the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: BillScurry
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel because of the modern aesthetic, with deep brown wood and beige walls/carpets. The rooms are totally kitted out, as you would expect, and the view from up top was diabolical. Make sure you ask for as high up as you can get, because it's a hell of a thing to come back home to at night. A neat thing they do here is have the TV and curtains hooked up to a motion detector, so when you enter the suite, the view opens up to reveal the expanse of Las Vegas Blvd. at night. We ate at the buffet and Cafe Vettro, and had nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony C
Reviews.Content: I was very, very impressed with Aria. From the moment we checked-in to the moment we checked-out the staff couldn't of been more friendly and accommodating. The hotel was immaculate and the room was great, the beds were so comfortable I even bought the pillows. The casino is huge, the pool is wonderful and the restaurants were great. I ate at three different ones, though they were on the expensive side (not all of them were out of the 10 or 12 they have) the food was fabulous and so was the service. I've stayed at other resorts on the Vegas strip and I would defiantly stay at Aria again. I highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Pleasure ++++++”
Reviews.Author: Rick K
Reviews.Content: The check in process was speedy and efficent. The rooms are second to none. It has every amenity you could dream up. The drapes are electric and the beds heavenly! When you want to call it a night all you do is push the button marked "goodnight" and it dims, and shuts of the lights, the tv and closes the drapes! There is no end to choices of restaurants on the property as well as the shopping at "Crystals" plaza. The safe which is built into the cabinet between the beds is spacious (big enough for my laptop) and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not fabulous”
Reviews.Author: SamandTaylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights because we got a good room rate ($79 +25 = 105/night) and because we like their poker room. Be aware, whatever rate you are given, there is an additional $25 / day resort fee. In our case, it increased our bill by 33%. I had factored it in, so there was no suprise for us. I do believe, however, that these 'resort fees' in small print are absurd and misleading. Just increase the quoted rate by $25 and be done with the games. This is a MGM scam (some other properties do this as well-shame on them too). The roon was decent, but not fabulous. Gripes: 1) At night, room dark even w/all lights on. 2) The lack of outlets near the bed was problematic, as we needed cellphones to be on charge near us, a CPAP, etc. (hint: if you take all 10 pillows off bed, there is an outlet centered behind the king bed: gotta reach down there blind & hope no sharp objects) 3) The electronics were cumbersome and rather silly. If I want to turn on a light on the desk, I should not need a 20 minute session with the control pad ahead of time (we ARE technically savvy - but this is just cumbersome) 4) Bath products not very high quality 5) As with most casino-hotels: no fridge (35$ upcharge/day) or coffee maker 6) It took 2 tries to get q-tips from housekeeping, and the dark carpet was not vaccuumed well 7) EVERY available surface in the room had some propaganda laying on it, meaning to set down your keys/wallet, purse you have to move some binder or magazine. 8) There is NO reasonably priced food in the hotel (coffee shop wanted $10 for a hot dog with no sides - not even a measly bag of chips). 8) Minibar/pay fridge should be optional. The positives: Nice stuff: 1) The beds - outstanding. 2) Robes in the room 3) Shower was big - we did not have 'moldy' smell like others complained of 4) no sign of bed bugs like others complained of 5) Call down valet to retrieve car 6) Bell staff/front desk staff very friendly Neutral stuff: Main self park and main valet is accessed via Strip - ick when navigating during prime traffic hours. There is a north valet and parking? off Harmon. It is a long walk to get to other properties. There is a McDonalds across the strip - from bags seen being carried by several other guests, it was well used. Check in and out was fast - we did both at 'standard' times. The safe is in nightstand drawer. For the money paid (and our deal was inexpensive compared to the standard listed price), I would stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wear your walking shoes”
Reviews.Author: englishteacher_11
Reviews.Content: Even though this resort is technically located on the strip, it is by no means close to Las Vegas Blvd. You need to walk from the front door of the resort through a shopping center and then you cannot cross directly to the other side of the the strip without walking even further. I would not recommend this hotel to any one who is not up to the walking challenge. Now, there are many pros to this resort. It is beautiful, safe, and very clean. Even the public bathrooms are beautiful! The breakfast buffet is well worth the money. We could not believe the fresh offerings on the buffet. There is usually a short wait for the buffet so budget your time wisely. There are several pools from which to choose. It appears that families frequent one pool, couples and singles the other pools. It was hard to find a lounge chair during the peak of the day, but the pools were crisp and relaxing. There is poolside bar service, but it is pricey! You can bring your own drinks as long as they are not in glass cups/bottles. The rooms are wonderful! Everything is very innovative. If you are not tech-savvy, you may find it difficult to control the drapes, lights, television, etc. But if you are a techie, you will have fun! I only wish there had been a small fridge in the room. The cons: Price- Be prepared to spend, spend, and spend some more. There are no inexpensive places to eat or drink at this hotel. We were able to find a Pizza by the Slice place in a hallway over at the Cosmopolitan, but the Aria provided only upscale or higher priced options. The snack/coffee shop near the casino floor was even pricey! Location- If you take a shuttle from the airport, they drop you off in the basement area, which is rather dark and maintenance like. You then have to walk...walk...walk to find the lobby. The check-in process was long. There was quite a wait to even speak to a front desk person. Our room was far from the elevator, which meant even more walking. I would not stay here again due to the long haul to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Resort”
Reviews.Author: cruisinguy_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days during the NASCAR races with my son. Excellent facilities from the room to the food services and pool. Had my boarding pass printed at the front desk and all the staff were most helpful and polite. Will stay here in September when we return for 17 days as a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel ....best service was the bell desk on departure.”
Reviews.Author: Denmother123
Reviews.Content: The ARIA is a stunning hotel! The service is what I will remember though, it took 20 minutes to get a drink sitting in the casino bar.I think the waitress and bartenders were competing to see who could deliver the worst service I have ever experienced. You would think that a Five Triple Diamond Hotel would have decent service. Also at the buffet we finished breakfast before we were asked if we would like something to drink. LIke I said the hotel is gorgeous and a site to see but service was terrible. Very disappointed .. Oh and if you aren't one of the " BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE" don't even bother trying to go to the Pool Bar Liquid. The only saving grace was Andy at the Bell Desk as he was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Aria A++”
Reviews.Author: CKTLS4U
Reviews.Content: Such a beautiful hotel! Rooms are first class.....service beyond reproach! The steak house was the best I have ever experienced....our server Rachel was so terrific, she was knowledgeable, friendly,and anticipated our needs! I am in the service industry and don't give compliments easily.

Reviews.Title: “My first visit to LV”
Reviews.Author: Heidi R
Reviews.Content: My recent 5 night stay at the Aria was great. Before I choose a hotel in Vegas I checked out TA and the reviews were mixed. I figured for my first time in LV to celebrate my BDay, I wanted to choose one of the best hotels and I have to say I was not disappointed. Yes you do notice the vanilla smell each time you step into the hotel, but after a minute or two you dont notice. Yes you do have to walk the Casio floor before you get to your suites, but I noticed that was with other hotels I visted, no drama there. Upon Check-In I asked for an upgrade and I got one, Level 17, my view was the M. Carlo not bad at all. The room was nice, clean, modern and bed was very comfortable. The only thing I didnt like was that lighting was not bright enough for me. Hotel is green & they use less watts. You can control everything by remote control, curtains, tv, lighting and check-out, not difficult to use, even for someone like me. I didnt open the mini-bar as all reviews mentioned as soon as you open the door you break the seal and upon check-out there is some sort of cost. Aria's location on the strip is very central. Upon check-out at 11am I asked if I could stay a bit longer and I got 1 hour complementary. When I need to confirm my flight dtls, front desk confirmed and checked me in for my Int'l flight to Sydney, all I had to do was collect my boarding passes upon check-out, this was great. I personally didnt enjoy the morning buffet here, I only went once. Over all I luved my first stay in LV @ Aria, I will be back. Enjoy your staff if you choose Aria.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to like it but I did.”
Reviews.Author: Ehhhhh
Reviews.Content: I like the property and it's very well done, but I like the Bellagio and Wynn more. The rooms are great, the food is great. It's a good property. The vibe was just a bit young for me.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: LOVEtoTRAVEL466
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ARIA March 9TH through March12TH THE ROOMS WERE VERY MODERN AND COMFORTABLE...We Had a few PROBLEMS...SAFE wouldn't lock one day but they fixed it for us and another day nothing WORKED LIGHTS,DRAPES, TV but we called downstairs and they came up and fixed EVERYTHING...WE ate at a few of their RESTAURANTS and EVERYTHING was GREAT...THE only real COMPLAINT was the SERVICE on the floor with trying to get a drink the girls were very rude and everytime we asked for a drink they said it wasn't their area so we ended up going next door to the BELLAGIO to gamble SERVICE there was GREAT at other casino...

Reviews.Title: “Love the Aria!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley A
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several places on the strip and I have enjoyed them all but I LOVE staying at the Aria. It's new, it's beautiful and contemporary, and the rooms are great- not huge, but not tiny either. This was my 2nd stay at the Aria and I was just as impressed with this stay as I was with my 1st stay. This last trip, I stayed in a regular room with 2 queen beds, a nice desk, tv, and GREAT mini bar! The bathrooms are gorgeous- seperate toilet, two sinks, and a nice rainfall shower head! But I'd have to say the best part about the rooms are how comfortable the beds are! Also the casino is very nice, the drink service is quick- and they put fresh orange slices in the screwdrivers (not bad for free drinks while you play slots). Overall, great service, plenty of food selections, beautiful accommodations, and a great location. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again, but not for reason you are thinking.”
Reviews.Author: courtneymccollum
Reviews.Content: Ok, we paid extra for a corner suite. Not worth the extra dough because we really were not in the room that much. Plus, corner suites are VERY far from the elevator. Not so fun w luggage, sore feet, drunken friends,etc. Also, the one we had was on the third floor. The "view" was of the aria express monorail. Plus the cosmopolitan night club was righ across from us and the booming bass was audible and annoying during the weekend. I realize it's Vegas, but when u want to sleep u want to sleep! But, the number one reason we won't be back is...our cell phones never worked in the rooms. We had four couples, different models of phones, different carriers, no one's worked in their rooms. Working on the casino floor was hit or miss. We had to go outside to call or text anyone! That was ridiculous and annoying!! I'm sure it has to do with aria being surrounded by other hotels, and it was a heavy traffic weekend, but still unacceptable. I think we are headed to the Wynn next time. Oh, the Aria Spa is fabulous ! Get a whole body polish!!

Reviews.Title: “Like Sleeping on a Cloud”
Reviews.Author: mjw716
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for a short three night trip. We were Vegas virgins and picked the Aria based on the ratings on TA. Upon arrival at the resort we headed to check-in. The process took entirely too long in my opinion. Maybe it was just a busy weekend and it was first thing in the morning, but seriously we only had two people in front of us and it took like a half hour just to get to the front. After we had checked in we used the map they gave us to find our way to our rooms on the ninth floor. I will say one really nice thing about the Aria is how it is so unlike the other casinos. Navigating is so much easier. They have great signage and everything is in a straight line (for the most part). Getting to the room can be quite the walk though once you are upstairs. The room was beautiful. However, the greeting did not work for us. Apparently when you walk into your room for the first time the TV is supposed to turn on to the room controls, the curtains are supposed to open and lights turn on etc. Nada for us. Kinda disappointed, but not a huge deal. We had a few issues with the room. The first night I went to have a shower and we had no bars of soap. Tried using the shower gel and didn't like it. Barely made a lather. I left a note for housekeeping the next morning asking for soap, which they did leave for us. The next night the TV system was broken. We tried watching TV and it would keep going to a white screen and then back to the room controls. It was so annoying. Then the last night our curtains closed and that opened them on the other end a bit. I would say that the system while really neat has too many kinks that need to be worked out. Like when I press a button to close the blinds why does it turn the lights off on my wife who is in the bathroom. The great things about the ARIA are the staff, the bakery, and the beds. The staff are very courteous and poilte. We talked to everyone from restaurant staff to housekeepers, to front of house and pit bosses. The best of them though are the bell staff. When we checked out we gave our bags to the bell services to store for us. The guy (don't remember his name) asked us how we were getting to the airport. We told him we were cabbing it and he told us how we could skip the taxi line. He was a huge help. The bakery was delicious. We had crepes for breakfast one day YUMMY! And the last day there we had gelato which was equally as delicious. The absolute best thing about this resort are the beds. We came home wanting to find out what kind of beds they use. The pillow top mattress was super soft (which we loved) and the pillows they used were great. It was like sleeping on a cloud. The only thing I didn't care for was the duvet cover. The opening for it seemed to be right where my feet were and a couple times i got all tangled in it. All in all our stay was great, but it was filled with little hiccups here and there. We would stay again though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Aria”
Reviews.Author: RedFi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria March 1st through March 4th. It was a girls' weekend celebrating two upcoming weddings, so we treated ourselves and stayed in corner suite rooms at the Aria. Here are a few of my thoughts on our stay: Corner Suites - The configuration of the rooms differed, and two were great (on the 300 wing and on the 000 wing), but one was only so-so (the 200 wing). The configuration in room 15246 was awful - lots of useless space, and the closet was in the bathroom and not in the bedroom. A real pain. Like many people note, the walk to the room can be quite far, and this is definitely true for the corner suite. However, the walk to the room on the 300 wing was significantly shorter - if getting a corner suite, I would request one on the 300 wing. The great thing for us was that the corner suite does include a refrigerator, which was nice for keeping water / pop cold. (Note - there are not any pop machines on the hotel floors!) My room (#22042) had a 'premium' view, and I think the mountain view is just as nice - it is definitely not worth paying more to 'upgrade' from mountain view. Staff - The staff was all great - very friendly throughout my stay - from check-in to check-out, they were excellent. Housekeeping / Turndown service - All of the rooms were in good condition when we checked in, although the mini-bar in my room had not been restocked by the time I checked in, and I was worried about being charged for a previous guest's snacks, but there was no issue whatsoever when I spoke to the gentleman who was restocking the minibar. The bathroom toiletries were great - they had a full kit of all you might need - including toothpaste and a shaving kit. (I'm not sure if this is only in the corner suite or not). The shampoo / conditioner / lotion was okay, but not great - not as high quality as I previously received at the Venetian, for example. The turndown service was hit or miss - we didn't get it every night. Food / Coffee - As many people have noted, there are limited cheap food options at the Aria. Like many resorts in Vegas, there aren't any coffee machines in the room, so you have to buy coffee in the morning. As I discovered on my first morning, the coffee shops at the Aria don't open until after 6:00 a.m., which is late for those who are jet-lagged and looking for coffee. I did find an open Starbucks at the Monte Carlo at 6:00 a.m. (in the food court, not in the mall - that one didn't open until later). The Jean Philippe Patisserie also had coffee once it opened - and is immediately adjacent to the guest elevators. The lines were always quite long, but you can get coffee at the store registers without much of a line. I was very unimpressed with the Patisserie - I had the worst almond croissant I've ever had there. We had some nice paninis at Sweet Chill - kind of expensive ($12), but very tasty. We also had a great breakfast at the buffet on Friday. The buffet is a good deal for weekday breakfast, but expensive for weekend brunch. We also ate at the Todd English PUB, which was good, but expensive, pub food. They do have a happy hour from 3:00-6:00, which would make the prices much more reasonable. For cheap eats, the best advice is to walk over to the Monte Carlo's food court, which is only about a five-minute walk away. Parking / Driving - The self-parking was very easy and we always managed to find a good parking space. Park on level 2 rather than level 1 and you won't have to take an elevator to access the casino. Check-in / Check-out There was sufficient staff working the counters when we checked in, as well as a manager-type person helping people. We managed to get our room a little early on Thursday (roughly 2:00 p.m.) and quite early on Friday (roughly noon). For an extra fee $112, we got a late check-out on Sunday, which was definitely worth it since we had the red-eye flight back to Minnesota. Pool - One pool was open for most of our visit along with the hot-tub. The pool area was very nice and not too busy because it wasn't super-warm yet. The staff at the pool were friendly and attentive. The pool area was really nicely landscaped and gave a nice view of the property. I was quite impressed with it. Location / Access to Strip - The Aria is back from the Strip, so it is a walk to get out to the real hustle and bustle, but it's not that far. It's a fairly easy walk from the Aria to Monte Carlo / NYNY to the south and to the Bellagio to the north. You can also take the tram to Bellagio / Monte Carlo, but by the time you've walked to the station within the Bellagio, you might as well walk the whole way! If you have any mobility concerns, this may not be the resort for you - there definitely is a lot of walking (but that's true of most places in Vegas!) Bed- I had heard all of the great things about the Aria bed. I thought it was okay, but not great - not firm enough for my liking. I also found it very hot to sleep on - I can't imagine what it would be like during the summer! Electronic Rooms I had read all about the fancy electronic controls for the Aria rooms. They're kind of fun, but not that big a deal. The panel next to the bed was kind of annoying because the screen was so bright, it had to be covered in order to get dark enough for sleep. The room descriptions claimed that you could attach an .mp3 player to the tv and play music, but we were unable to get the system to work in any of the rooms. If you want to play music, you may want to bring your own docking station. Casino - The casino is very dark, and quite quiet. The beverage service was hit or miss - depends on luck apparently. There is a good selection of machines, but they seemed quite tight. The table games all appeared rather sedate - this doesn't seem like a casino for a rollicking good time - more like one for sedate and elegant gambling! Overall thoughts - The Aria is a nice modern resort with a lot of (expensive) amenities. I'm glad to have stayed here, but I doubt I'd revisit. I far prefer the more luxurious feel of other resorts like the Venetian or the Wynn. It is very modern, which is just not really my taste - in some ways it felt very much like a larger version of a W hotel that you'd find in any big city. Not the easiest place to stay if you want to casino hop, but is a good location if you want to basically stay put within the City Center complex.

Reviews.Title: “not happy”
Reviews.Author: Yodapeanut
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Aria again this year and we were terrible disappointed. Our room was dirty, the sheets had not been changed, and when I requested new sheets (there's was hair all over them) the cleaning lady came by with the biggest attitude. The bathroom was clearly dirty...this is the second time we stay here and we find the room dirty. Dirty bathrooms and dirty sheets is unacceptable in my opinion Also, we ordered room service one night, and it took them an hour and 45 minutes to bring it to us. I would like to add that the bell boys and valet people are super friendly, and courteous, and the second cleaning lady the next day was a lot nicer. The Aria is a beautiful hotel but next year we will be staying at Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday present”
Reviews.Author: KimGasdorf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing but perfection. The hotel staff were very friendly and our room was always spotless, I cannot wait to go back. We had a penthouse suite on the 28th flr overlooking the strip. Fantastic view. We were given a free upgrade to the penthouse after we had checked in. It was a great surprise. Thanks Aria. The bed was very comfortable. It was my birthday and the staff made sure to make it memorable for me. They had chocolate covered strawberries in the room for me with a birthday card from the resort.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Sun City West, Arizona, United States
Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: Cathryn F
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay at the Aria and saw Elvis circ de soliel . Rooms were great. Excellent Staff. We ate at several little places . Food was excellent. Had a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, upscale & tasteful”
Reviews.Author: m_alancash
Reviews.Content: not the typical Vegas Kitsch, quieter casino floor, great restaurants. The Good night button that turns off everything and closes the window curtains is something that I would like to take home. The buffet is over priced especially on the weekend $36... really Great place for a meeting however, had a few days of training there,

Reviews.Title: “Aria Sky Suites”
Reviews.Author: red-fmp
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at MGM or Mirage suites when in Vegas but decided to stay at the newest property in the group, the Aria. I must say we were a little hesitant about changing. We loved it! From check in at the Aria Sky Suites to checkout, we were treated great! Of course, these are the sky suites we stayed in so I'm not sure how the other rooms and regular check in goes but I can speak to the suites and it is superb. This hotel is ultra modern and not your average Vegas hotel. It is the nicest of properties we have stayed at. It is a little farther set back off of the main strip (about a block). We had beverages and snacks available anytime of the day at the VIP/Sky Lounge. The rooms were beautifully furnished and beds were to die for! The bathrooms had a soaking tub/shower combo that was amazing! I will be back here.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA Resort”
Reviews.Author: Stephen Q
Reviews.Content: The room was way above expectations and I enjoyed the easiness of accessing surrounding properties. Also The Buffett was amazing. Anything you could ever ask for to choose from. Went to the Elvis show, was very entertaining

Reviews.Title: “Mixed impression, Nice hotel, Dark Casino, Empty Vibe”
Reviews.Author: dw732
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Wynn, Encore, Bellagio, Palazzo, Venetian, Mirage during our annual trip to LV in March. This time decided to give the Aria a try. So the comments that follow are purely by comparison to the other upscale strip properties. Stayed in a 1 BR Sky Suite where they limo you from the airport to the private drive and checkin- very nice touch, similar to Wynn and Encore. The room was everything one would expect for these upper tier properties. Pretty spacious, exquisite bathroom, bed super comfortable, excellent turn down service- the best chocolates in a little package. I'm not one for all the hi tech "control-everything-via-remote" extras (just give me a few wall buttons for the lights, curtains, temperature and I'm good), but I can see how this would add to the overall 'cool' experience for some. I never did figure out what 'room off' and 'room on' actually did! Not sure if I really liked the heated toilet seat or not. Also, at night I couldn't get the room bright enough for my liking, even with every lamp turned on high. While very similar, I would say that I would rate the Wynn LV and the Venetian/Palazzo rooms slightly ahead of Aria. Like the rooms, I found the overall property to be very dark and a little dreary contributing to a very dull and empty vibe, or lack of vibe. The casino is very much like this, dark lighting and all the tables very spread out which I thought really sucks out the energy. So didnt care for the casino at all. Very surprised that the sportsbook is fairly small. We did see Cirque du Soleil Viva Elvis which will be closing soon. Had heard mixed reviews but we felt it was pretty decent, well worth seeing, although not as good as Beatles Love, "O" , or Mystere. Did go for a massage at the Spa which was just ok and fairly ordinary- it has everything but nothing especially memorable I would say. Encore is the best Spa on the strip. It is a rather large property and has that sort of large cavernous feel to it, lots of high ceilings and big walls - much prefer the warmer intimacy of Bellagio and Wynn. Overall, I would rate Aria with Mirage and Mandalay Bay - behind Wynn, Encore, Bellagio (which desperately needs room renovations) and Palazzo/Venetian. Aria a little too large and honestly a little dull and boring. Wynn Las Vegas still # 1 hands down.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA UPSCALE AND ARTSY”
Reviews.Author: hooglesnorpus
Reviews.Content: The New ARIA property is full of art and has an upscale clientele. It is another HUGE vegas property. I had to ask directions anytime I wanted to go somewhere. It is setback far from the strip and is a long walk to any other casinos. The Buffet was overpriced, lunch was $28 with tax and had ok food. The steakhouse was excellent, high end and pricey as one might expect. Figure on over $100 pp for a dinner here. Alcohol and tip add more $s to the bill. My room was comped free. It was nice. Best part was the curtains that you had to push a wall button to open and close. There was also a "kill" button by the bed that shut off all lights, closed the drapes and turned the tv off all with one push of the button. There is a pricey minimall called the VDARA attached to the property. My overal grade for the extended property is a "B". Woulda been higher but the food prices and size lowered my rating.

Reviews.Title: “great addition to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Jeff L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the weekend of 3/9/12. This was our first time at Aria, but we're frequent Vegas travelers. The hotel itself is one of the nicest I've stayed at on the Strip - very modern, nice amenities, tons of high-end shops and restaurants. The standard rooms are a little smaller than average, but the bed was very comfortable, and our 21st floor room with floor to ceiling windows provided a stunning view. Water pressure in the showers was terrible, but that was the only real complaint about the room. High points: The pool area is fantastic and the restaurants are top-quality - we ate at Julian Serrano and Todd English, both outstanding. Service was great everywhere and the staff was very accommodating, even with our one bad experience - see below. The casino is huge and unlike many other places, Aria doesn't staff to the bare minimum, so there's rarely a wait for anything. Low points: Signage could be better. The casino, promenade, and Crystals (shops area) has an odd layout on two levels and it's very easy to get lost - we were there three days and still got turned around constantly. Stay away from the Breeze Cafe (outside the pool area). Our entire party either returned their food for a refund or threw it away. To their credit, no questions were asked on the refund. The $85 resort fee for a three night stay is exorbitant for what you get. Advice: If you're looking to eat and gamble on a budget, this is not the place for you. But for a five star resort, Aria mostly delivers. Gaming and restaurant options abound, and if you're willing to spend some money it's worth a trip to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Room was very nice.”
Reviews.Author: luvhb4evr
Reviews.Content: Had to attend a business summit at the Aria Convention Center in Las Vegas and booked my room at the Aria. The room was very nice!!!! Clean and comfortable and no smell of smoke. Bed was very comfortable! The lights, TV, Music and drapes were all controlled by the TV remote control. Took some getting used to. Loved the ceiling to floor windows. Only wish I would have had a better view. Was on the 6th floor. Ate at Jean Phillippe and at the Skybox to Go. Both were good. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: QueenOfHols31
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 night stay at the Aria. Stunning hotel, very modern, room was just perfect, views from our 30th floor were amazing! Rooms are very high tech, very well equipped and the bed - well I wanted to bring it home but my baggage allowance did not suffice (you can actually purchase the beds!!!) Hotel staff were all extremely helpful and polite. Great bars and restaurants too. Pool area is lovely. Drinks everywhere were very expensive but hey, this is 5 star so did not expect them to be cheap. Having thoroughly researched all the new hotels think we got the cream of the crop here. Anyone thinking of staying here should just book it, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best room I ever had in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sedona2003
Reviews.Content: We had a corner suite which had 2 bathrooms, 3 TVs, and a heated toilet seat. Great view and really great remote that controlled the blinds, TV, lights, everything! Great staff! Best bed I have ever slept in! SUPER COMFORTABLE.

Reviews.Title: “location..location..location”
Reviews.Author: kitty H
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Aria. We were there the first year it opened and were blown away by the contemporary architecture and interior design...just fabulous. The corner suites are a must, the floor to ceiling windows really add to an already fabulous city! The only downside this trip was not getting the "resort" view. I booked through Delta Vacations and we were given a "city" view which translated to LOUD. I had trouble sleeping all 3 nights despite being deaf in one ear. The street noise and music from the strip was very loud. A bit of the concrete jungle syndrome. Otherwise it was amazing and we would return and request the resort view next time. The service and staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “The Aria does impress.”
Reviews.Author: txidaho88
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a gorgeous hotel located in City Center off the Las Vegas strip. Very well appointed rooms, with the corner suites worth every penny to upgrade to. The hotel has a couple of cool bars with blackjack tables available. $50-100 min...The gaming floor is small and really quiet in comparison to other casinos. I personally like it. The bar right of Casino floor and by cashier has excellent martinis! The sportsbook is very nice with a good little restaurant located near it. The buffet near pool is decent. Certainly not one of Vegas best. The Pool area is nice with the adult pool being excellent! I did not give this a 5 star because of the restaurants. Very disappointed in the food to be honest. Sirio , the Italian rest., very pricey and just not very good. American Fish, ok not great, and the steakhouse just not even worth going into IMO. Cafe Vettro is just not worth the money either. Outrageously overpriced for what you get. There are 100's of better options on the strip for eating and Aria needs to improve in this area. Enjoy the priceless art throughout the hotel and the very fast checkin service ! Have your room key ready as guards do check for em .

Reviews.Title: “A definet 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: burgunde
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 days at the aria resort and it is definetly a 5 star hotel. This is one of the best hotels in vegas the view from the room on the 38th floor was amazing . The beds are like sleeping on a cloud,The rooms are large and well appointed, Security at the elevators 24/7 was great, as was the service on the front desk. We found dealing with the staff to be an issue, if you could find them. I was on the floor on the slot machines and was never approched by a waitress.Every one is aware that Las Vegas is expensive well the Aria takes that to a whole new level, I have never paid so much for a coffee in my life. The buffet was only average but was also well above the average price. I would not reccomend this hotel to my family or friends and we will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Street”
Reviews.Author: Hammy59
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aria during a conference last week and we were truly impressed with the place. From the moment we arrived at the front door until we left four days later we had no reason for any complaints. Reception was quick and was able to satisfy our requests, the bellman gave us an excellent guide to our room features and the room itself was big, comfortable and quiet. The Convention Centre was very impressive and with so much to see and do we hardly left the building during our stay. We ate at The Buffet, Lemongrass, Julian Serrano which were all faultless but Julian Serrano was our favourite. We drank and danced at Gold Lounge which was very classy and made us feel like "the beautiful people". My wife enjoyed the Spa while I thought the outdoor pool areas were well laid out and very clean. We loved how the Aria was connected to the Monte Carlo, Crystals and the Bellagio and used the private monorail between the three. While the Aria and it`s restaurants may not be the cheapest in Las Vegas we thought they were excellent value for what we spent and it will be hard for us to consider staying anywhere else now

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel.. Minor Problems”
Reviews.Author: Daniel Anthony P
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend Vegas trip. Went with my fiancee to celebrate our 5th year anniversary. We stayed at Aria because we were offered excellent rates via (Our Mife Comps). We were given room 5226. Upon walking through the massive casino we were surprised how clean and new everything still looked. The room was in pretty good condition, desk had some deep scratches as well as nightstand. We did how some issues with the room 1st our connect4 tv remote kept freezing and had to be rebooted. 2nd we had issues with our curtains they would never fully close or open That was also rebooted via the connect4 remote. 3rd our toilet kept running all night. I contact housekeeping and the front desk and was told a technician would come and look at it. He arrived 10 minutes later and adjusted the pump and it worked fine. 3 hours later it started again, I told the maid who was cleaning the room next door and she said she would contact maintenance and it would be taking care of immediately. We left for about 4 hours and when we returned it was still running. I contact the front desk and they said they had no record of a problem but it would get taken care of now. That was Saturday afternoon. When we checked out Sunday afternoon it still wasn't corrected. overall not a lot of major problems.we still had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Aria!”
Reviews.Author: Tara1016
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Aria in early March and we can't say enough good things about the resort. This hotel is truly incredible. Its central location means you can walk pretty much everywhere. The room was beautiful - nicely furnished with lots of space. The bed is so unbelievably comfortable! We loved the audio/video control panel - very unique feature. It controls everything - TV, lights, curtains, even your "Do Not Disturb" notice! The staff were very helpful and courteous. The casino is not as large compared to other resorts in Vegas, but it still has everything you need to have a good time. Aria has a large selection of restaurants, with both resonably-priced and more expensive options. The Buffet has a great breakast/brunch. Lemongrass Restaurant is just amazing. The food was incredible and priced just right. Make sure you check out the adjoining City Center. It is simply amazing. So many high-end shops and more great restaurants to check out. As far as Vegas shows are concerned, you can't beat Cirque de Soleil's "O". So original - we were blown away! For those who want a break from the city, I highly recommend visiting Red Rock Canyon. We booked it with Pink Jeep Tours, who are awesome. It's a 4-hour trip and they pick up/drop off at Aria. What's great about Pink Jeep is that the tour groups are small - no more than 10 people. We booked our tour at Aria's concierge desk. All in all, it was a great stay. We will definitely stay at Aria on our next trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Jodie M
Reviews.Content: Visited March 2012. Last saw this hotel on a previous trip when it was still under construction. The development looked special then and now it's finished it is beautiful. I found the staff very friendly and helpful. Any issues were responded to promptly and courteously. The casino floor is huge with many tables and machines. There shouldn't be a problem finding somewhere to play. The minimum play is usually $15 for things like blackjack which can get pricey if you're just playing for fun. We stayed in an ordinary room which is more than ample as a base. The bed was huge and so comfortable. Everything can be controlled from a panel next to the bed. You can open the curtains, change the lighting, tv etc without getting up. The shower space is big with a bath at the back. The minibar prices are steep. $5 for water or coke. Even a bag of crisps was $5 but there is a shop a short walk down the strip where you can stock up for much cheaper. The gym is lovely. Towels and water provided. There are many cardio machines as well as weights. There must have been 15 running machines so there shouldn't be a queue and when I went in the afternoon there were around 7/8 people there. The poker tournament is $125 at 1pm and 7pm. It's always popular and they can take hours. My husband played in a tournament of 120 and when he came back to the room 5 hours later the remaining 29 players were still going! Crystals shopping centre is very nice. Lots of high end stores for a treat. Beso steakhouse is a lovely place to eat. It's Eva Longoria's restaurant and the decor is elegant and the food delicious. I had the lobster and my husband had the chilli rubbed steak. One of the best meals we have ever eaten. Because of the lobster it cost around $220 but there is a selection of cheaper options which looked equally delicious. In the Aria we ate at Julian Serrano, a tapas style restaurant with a casual fun feel to it. The menu is extensive and you wont run out of things you want to try. There are seared scallops, lobster salad, paella, meatballs and so many more. Some of the dishes are very small, others are quite generous. Our bill was $170 for a bottle of wine and about 7 dishes. You can keep adding dishes if you wish. The food here was spectacular. It was beautifully presented and each dish was as delicious as the next. We have stayed in Vegas 5 times at different places and this one will take some beating. The location was perfect, very central. There is a free monorail to the Bellagio and you can walk under cover to the Monte Carlo. I was surprised at the few negative reviews as we found it to be a modern, luxurious resort and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally splendid”
Reviews.Author: klam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria on two occassions both in July and February. Both times were excellent. The hotel is super clean, easily to check in and a lot of dining options. Easy access to the strip and service was quick and professional. Rooms were amazing!!! we had a gorgeous view and I loved the automated options. Bathroom was good size, bright and clean. Beds were very comfortable and a good size. Room was spacious and loved the closet size. The pool during July was AMAZING!!!! felt like I was away on a tropical vacation; it was secluded from the hustle and bustle, and very private. Beautiful hotel and will be my go to spot in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that impressed! Horrid staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: houstonerica
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I stayed Dec. 2010. Staff was rude and VERY uncooperative with any issue. We've stayed in the Sky Suite and also regular rooms and there is a vast difference. The service is amamzing if booked in Sky Suites, not great at all in regular rooms! Technical problems with regular room proved frustrating and unresolved. Very disappointed with the front desk staff which were rude and some what snobby. Will def stay elsewhere in trips to come.

Reviews.Title: “1 Star Hotel, 5 star Facade”
Reviews.Author: Justin J
Reviews.Content: Some of you might be wondering how I could rate this hotel 1 star. Pretty simple. First and foremost, a hotels top priority is to ensure their guests can get a good nights sleep. It simply does not happen at the Aria. Not in my last 2 trips anyway. Let the review begin! The hotel: The only thing the Aria does well is greet their guests by their first or last name. It's sad really but you can tell the employees there are underpaid. They lack both common sense, and experience. Simple requests go unanswered, likely because they are not understood. I have NEVER gotten a good nights sleep at the Aria. This is usually due to some form of noise. The first trip the noise was due to the nightclub Haze. Knowing this I decided to book during the week when the club was closed. Would I get a good nights sleep this trip? Nope. This trip the culprit happened to be the housekeeping staff. Noisily cleaning rooms at 1am. Slamming doors. Slamming their vacuum cleaners into the wall. I understand the need to clean rooms at all hours due to the enormity of the hotel. However at later hours care should be taken to keep noise to a minimum. It's funny the rooms have such comfortable beds yet what good are they when you can hear loud banging noises even when wearing earplugs? Also be warned that everything is extremely overpriced. This hotel really is suckerville. $5.00 for Tylenol. $3.00 for a bottle of generic water. $8.00 for cookies. Mind you these are prices in their gift shop. You get 10 percent off if you are one of the suckers with a gold or platinum MLife players card (yes I am one of these fools). PS if you happen to have a players card and wish to get their oh so generous discount they ask you for ID like you're a criminal. Ya, I am trying to rip you off of a discount that barely covers the tax on your overpriced sundries. Anyway, I digress. I feel bad for anyone paying to stay in the hotel. I pay nothing due to the fact that I gamble, but likely will never stay again. On to the casino.... The casino: Tight, High Limits, Tight, You Can't Win, You Won't Have Fun That pretty much sums it up. Anyone who gambles more than $20.00 at the Aria is a complete and utter idiot. 90 percent of the table games have a minimum of $50.00 per hand, with many at or above $100.00. I guess the people who spend $3.00 on a bottle of water would likely play here. The slots are beyond tight. No payback whatsoever. Also terrible selection of machines. Get a roll of quarters and flush them down one of their electronic toilets. You likely will have more entertainment from watching the toilet overflow. The valet: Rude and indifferent. When I am picking up my car from valet at a supposed 5 star resort I expect to be both greeted and have my door closed. Not here. (yes I gave a tip) The valet guy might have well told me to screw off. I guess I deserved that kind of treatment it for being one of the suckers patronizing this place to begin with. Long story short. There is no fun to be had at the Aria. It's dark, depressing, and noisy. Setting your money on fire will yield far more entertainment. Moreover you won't be rewarding a terribly run resort.

Reviews.Title: “Love Aria!!”
Reviews.Author: Rknrbn89
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jan. 2011 for our 20th wedding anniversary and were blown away. Relaxed by their amazing pool and their three huge hot tubs. The views and the amazing amenities, wonderful customer service, great food made us book again this Jan. 2012 for our 21st anniversary. It's the most plush, comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Our favorite hotel in Las Vegas hands down. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Great service at a beautiful hotel and reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: bobindenver1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for a convention. I have stayed at many nice Vegas hotels including the Bellagio, Venetian, Mandalay Bay, etc. and I believe the Aria is the nicest. Being brand new, you would expect the rooms to be gorgeous, and they are. The room I had was very spacious, the king bed ultra comfy and the bathroom was luxurious and large. All the rooms have a remote touchpad for controlling the lighting, tv, and drapes and it's fun to be awakened in the morning by your drapes opening automatically. The only negative to the room is that it is dimly lit, even with all the lights on. Also, the two very stylish armless chairs were pretty, but not really comfortable. The lobby areas are beautiful and the proximity to the Crystals mall was terrific since we had three very nice dinners at restaurants there. An added note: the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I ended up leaving an expensive piece of clothing there and when I called, they had found it and ended up sending it to me at no charge. When was the last time you left anything in a hotel and actually got it back? That alone will make me go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Unfair to compare to Sky Suites”
Reviews.Author: VegasChick1
Reviews.Content: Last trip to this hotel we stayed in a Sky Suite which was magnificant.We were in a city view room this time & it is not fair to compare the two so I won't. Our room had a magnificant view of the strip from floor to ceiling windows which we loved.We felt lighting to be on the dark side & appreciated windows. We had 2 queen beds with great linen & were very comfortable. Bathroom shower tub arrangement was unusual since they were separate, but in same enclosure with a smooth marble floor which was extremely slippery & dangerous unless you travel with shower shoes.Shower pressure was just ok. Two sinks & separate toilet room, again behind glass.Housekeeping was very attentive & pleasant with managers everywhere to meet your needs. Front desk staff also pleasant.Would stay again, but probably in a Sky Suite if I could swing it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel with good rates”
Reviews.Author: alka_dallas
Reviews.Content: We got an American Airlines deal flying out of Dallas for 4 days stay plus 1 free show for 2. The room was nice but not spectacular. We checked in on Sat but the guy at the front desk asked us to check again the next day. So we decided to find out on Sun and the lady said she upgrade us to a suite on the 33rd floor for 50 bucks more a night. We were so glad we did that! It was a corner suite so it was like a penthouse with windows all around including the hot tub bathroom and views of the strip and casino's! Veryyy nice! And the toilet had all these fancy controls! Very comfortable. Also the property has 3 outdoor jacuzzi's and 2 big heated pools! Did not win anything in their slot machines tho!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: kirra99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in LV with our twin 5 year olds and grandparents in an adjoining room, which is heaven for the kids. We chose this hotel as with children it is slightly off the strip but still near everything. The rooms were spacious, modern, functional and quiet. The staff were friendly and more than accommodating. The kids loved the room service, done in style. Used the nanny service one night, came home and the kids were asleep, safe, report written, nice gift left and upon waking completely indoctrinated about God, which was a bit of a shock. Would definitely stay here again. The restaurant lemongrass at aria was delicious, great food and staff friendly. Went to see Elvis, unbelievably good. Don't miss this one...we are not big show people, so for us to be impressed..... No kids activities as perse.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tony G
Reviews.Content: I went with my girlfriend to spend the weekend, and the Aria definitely made the vacation worthwhile. Initially, we checked in early and they gave us a room on the fourth floor, which she didn't like too much. Afters short run around, they moved us to the 29th floor and the room was amazing! Contrary to some reviews, the employees were very hospitable and working in the hospitality industry myself,I felt they did a great job making me feel welcome. Also, some say the walk to the room was long, which said to me, that these people had never been to Vegas, or at least not on the Strip. The hotel is gorgeous, although the lines are long to check in or out, but they do offer alternative methods. I would definitely go back as I am putting together a bachelor pay in August and I hope that they have some great deal to accommodate us. LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay there more if I could afford it”
Reviews.Author: glowtsai
Reviews.Content: If you can afford to stay here, do it! I love the Aria and it's modern look and fancy tech advanced amenities in each room. There are plenty of food options and the usual games on the casino floor. The only negative thing about Aria is the pool and the death ray thing that it has going on. The 2nd floor is really under-utilized and there's lots of dead space there. Go and enjoy if you can!

Reviews.Title: “THE hotel to stay at when visiting.”
Reviews.Author: emelleme
Reviews.Content: common courtesy and friendly service remains timeless. The staff at Aria are very helpful and always greet you with a smile. Then you get to your room. Quality. Comfortable. Clean. Nice touch with remote controlled EVERYTHING. Food selection is excellent. Best hotel hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Best Luxury !”
Reviews.Author: Silva A
Reviews.Content: Aria is the Luxury you are looking for without breaking your bank !!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: sqze2
Reviews.Content: We stayed during February 2012. Nice room with fantastic bed. Had nice view of the mountains. Slept like a baby. Bath with large shower and tub. Nice pool, although we didnt swim. Did not try any restaurants but they always seemed full.

Reviews.Title: “You gotta try this Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: WalleyGog
Reviews.Content: First off, best looking hotel I have ever been in, and I have been in 100's of them. Must have cost billions to build it. And clean as a whistle, yet you never see anyone cleaning the casino and lobby? Even at 3AM.... Very strange. The staff here are oustanding, from the front desk, valet, maids, and wait staff. Foods is terrific, a wee bit pricey but very good, and lots of it, we tried the Lemograss tasting menu with the wine and cocktail accompaniment and it was actually too much food too east. They could cut the entre portion in HALF and 99% of the diners would still be very happy. Skybox great for a game, and the food's excellent. Gigantic clubhouse sandwich - might be 2 ft long - $14....... also try the onion rings. Did not do the buffet but heard it was great too. We went to the Cafe Amero? might have the last name wrong, but the food and service were great there too, go before 10 otherwise it lines up. We booked KIng city view room, and were travllling to celebrate our 20th anniversary. Without asking they upgraded us to a Sky Suite - must have been at least 1000 sf - furnished like something in a movie, it was awesome. The major hotels in vegas are all pretty nice,. NYNY is cheap and dirty, Bellagio?Paris and the Venetian,are all really quite nice. But for location, style, service and foods options the Aria is the best place to stay in Vegas. Check it out! Oh ya, try the Public Urban Bar in the Crystals for a good night of drinking. Great staff and the prices won't blow a hole in the wallet. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellersGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ARIA for 6 nights (previously stayed at Paris). There's only one word to describe the place - VAST. The location is fantastic, right in the centre of the strip with easy access to the Deuce and monorail at MGM, plus so many options for eating out, we only dined at ARIA once. We checked in at the same time as a couple of conferences, so our "guaranteed strip view" room was on the 12th floor (out of +50) and we had a wedge view, which was quite underwhelming. The furnishing and decor are nice, room was clean and the bed was amazing - so comfortable. The bathroom is well thought out - but weird that you cannot put a plug (stopper) in the vanity at all. A couple of downers for us were the fact that we couldn't make a cup of tea or coffee in the room (no kettle or perculator)and the mini bar fridge was one of those dreadful types that if you move anything it registers the cost of the item to your account. We were told that the mini bar items could not be removed so that we could store a bottle of wine or soft drinks. Also - the Resort Fee at $20 per day is a complete rort for what you actually receive. That said, it's still a lovely property and we'd recommend a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: TXTravelJunky
Reviews.Content: My husband & i stayed here Dec. 10th - 13th. Modern & clean. Beautiful rooms although smaller than I expected. The beds are so comfortable! I have tried several times to purchase the pillows but i cant ever get anyone to work with me. The spa & casino are top notch! We could never get the remote to work for our lighting. Staff was nice. The concierge was great at helping as rent a limo. The buffet is comparable to the Belagio, in fact it might be better! I would love to come back & stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not 5-Star Service”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a nice properly, but I think we'll go back to Wynn or Encore. We always had excellent experiences there from start to finish and there were certain areas of Aria that were disappointed. We arrived around 10pm and then have a long counter desk for checking people in. They had plenty of people working and helping people, but there was a line forming of maybe 5-7 couples, no one was standing around to direct. There was no velvet rope or anything to keep the line together and finally someone came over and said 'there's not one line, just go ahead and line up behind someone else at the counter' -- well this seemed a bit silly because you have no idea how long these people have been up there, who's going to finish first, etc. So we got behind someone and waited, and waited, I went to get drinks ($59 for 2 double red bull-vodkas!!!!) and came back and he still wasn't being helped. Finally we got up there and were given a room on the 4th floor - this seems crazy so we asked for a higher room and they said they were full but we could move tomorrow. We had paid for an upgraded room so we decided to suck it up and at least check it out. We sadly had to walk into the elevator bank for the lowest floor levels. We walk into the room and are overlooking a roof... what?! this can't be an upgraded room. My husband called down and after inquiring, they told us that we were in a standard room, not the deluxe room we had paid for, because they were sold out. Honesty is the best policy with me and this really rubbed me the wrong way, were they hoping we wouldn't notice? They moved us up to the 34 floor into an accessible room, which had a much nicer view, but only one sink in the bathroom, no tub, etc. They said we could move the next day. We had more problems the next day, with only rooms on low floors and finally decided to just stay in the room we were in. This whole process was disappointing though. They did end up comping us the difference between the standard room and the deluxe though. We had room service and that was very good. They brought a whole pitcher of water which was nice and the breakfast burrito was good and my husband liked his eggs. We went to the pool for a little bit, it took me 30 minutes to flag someone down for a drink. We caught someone's eye about 15 minutes in but she told my husband she wasn't our waitress... We got the big 32-oz drink which was like $60 or something crazy. The public areas are nice and the room were also nice (high tech with auto drapes and lights - the lights were hard to figure out though). i think it's a good option, but I don't like how they handled our room situation and you can definitely see a difference in service between this place and somewhere like Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near all the action”
Reviews.Author: steveg007
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 night stay at the beginning of March at the Aria. I found the casino to be one of the nicest we visited. Everyting was very clean and well kept. This continued into the rooms that were very comfortable and tastefully decorated. It might have been a bit bigger, but this wasn't an issue as we barely spent any time there, except for sleeping. The mini bar goodies were over-priced - we stayed away from those. The location was great. We had thought it was a bit removed from the strip initially, but a quick 5 minute walk and we were in the center of the action. There was also a free tram to shuttle between hotels like the Belagio.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great service.”
Reviews.Author: Camilo S
Reviews.Content: This was only my second trip to Vegas. Having stayed before at the MGM, the aria is more than I expected. The hotel is gorgeous; everything is very elegant and modern. The service in the hotel is outstanding. During check in I waited about 10 minutes because of the lines and the moment I showed any signs of frustration I was approached by a hostess to pass me to the next available window. The rooms are very elegant and functional. I loved the touchscreen remote that controls everything from the lights to the shades. The room even greeted me when I entered for the first time. I feel the rooms were not too expensive; however the restaurants are ridiculously expensive. The average check for a two people dinner was $150 without drinks. The tapas restaurant I recommend, but the seafood restaurant I would encourage everyone not to try it. The food is not worth its cost in taste. As for the casino… What else can you say… Just like in every casino in Vegas the service is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Vegas yet!”
Reviews.Author: Okie21
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our stay at the Aria last week. The property is new and it shows. The location was great, with other casinos within walking distance. Check in was a breeze and they were even able to get us in early since our flight arrived in the morning. The pool is beautiful and there was a waitress taking drink orders since the outside bar wasn't open for the season yet. The fitness center is very nice and offers complimentary evian water as you work out. I didn't try the spa facility since we weren't staying very long but it looked beautiful. The pastry shop on the casino level has a great selection for breakfast. The bar in the casino lobby was never too crowded and offered a great place to grab a drink and people watch or sit with a drink and a book. I loved how you could control everything in the room off a single ipad type remote device, so cool! They pump vanilla into the hotel which smells amazing! We would definitely like to go back again and stay at the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel, Regular rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tita1975
Reviews.Content: From the exterior this hotel is impressive, the front entrance especially, the common areas in the lobby and the restaurants. The rooms are on the small to average size. The lightning inside the room is very dim at night, something which I loath in hotel rooms since it is very hard to get ready to go out at night, same for the bathroom. The bathroom also felt a little on the small side, as compared to other hotels for the same rate. The technology is a little confusing at first, and I didn't particularly care for it. I found a great rate @ OTEL site for $138.00 -- that said, the price I paid was pretty good for these accommodations. Room service was good, a little on the pricey side, but that is regular for any hotel. We ate @ Lemongrass and the food was pretty good, I recommend it. We also had dinner at the Cafe Vettro and it was just regular hotel food and that was ok. We stayed one night for drinks at the Bard Moderno which has live music @ nights and had a good time. Something else I didn't like was the location, you must take a tram to get to the strip, otherwise it's like a 10 min. walk which adding up all the walking you already do is a little tiring after a while. I enjoyed staying here....however I will try someplace else next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Aria, not for me.”
Reviews.Author: mwasyluk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aria from March 1 to 4, 2012. First impressions were very positive, beautiful decor, very modern and attractive, but this impression didn't last long. Our room was lovely and clean, no complaints there, but subtle details detracted from the overall experience. The bathtub was in the shower stall (?), towels were on the rough and scratchy side, toiletries were sub-par (shampoo and conditioner left my hair a rat's nest). Technology in the room was unneccessary and confusing, would have loved to have just been able to switch a lamp on instead of having to search through the panel to figure it out. Accidentally hit the "goodnight" button and EVERYTHING in the room turns off, what a pain having to go around and turn everything on one by one again.... I soon realized that this hotel is just too big. With over 4000 rooms, there were line ups everywhere, often 50 people deep, just to get something at the bakery. It took forever to get anywhere and the crowds were annoying. I had to walk past 115 rooms to get to the ice machine on my floor. Crazy stupid. I wasn't too thrilled with the restaurants either. I don't eat rabbit or fois gras and avoid restaurants that serve it, which left me with nothing. We did have a meal at Blossom and it was great and they even gave us free dessert because we were celebrating our anniversary. Had dinner at Jean Georges Steakhouse and was very dissapointed.
