We waited 45 minutes between our appetizers and our meal, and when our steak was served, not all of our sides were ready, but came out half way through our dinner. The steak was good, but not great, the fries were overcooked and dry. The brussel sprouts were downright nasty. the only good thing was the truffle frites. They did not charge us for our late sides and gave us a free dessert, but even the free dessert was unimpressive. All in all, way over-priced, way under-expectation. Staff were always courteous, helpful and pleasant and accomodated every request. But I found they were apologizing for many things. I very much appreciated the combined resort fee of $25 a day that covered all wifi services, parking and valet services - other hotels charge enormous separate fees for these things. Location was great, views, not so much. I'm not a gambler and was never in the casino, but it did seem lovely and fun. All in all, the Aria was just too big and too busy. For bigger rooms, better food and better personal service, stay the the Wynn. Time for me to find something with a more personal touch....

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: patmccaskey
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Great rooms, very clean, very modern, staff was very helpful. Was impressed by security on hand. Could not find anything negative to say about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jruth3
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on a room here over the weekend. The hotel is beautiful and clean, but I was really impressed with the quality of the room. A big, fluffy bed, computer-controlled lighting and curtains, and a huge bathroom with a soaking tub. Heavenly! Absolutely worth every penny. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: LovesLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I was totally impressed with Aria when we spent the weekend there (Feb 24-27). The room was awesome - very techy and modern. The front desk clerk was very friendly and accommodating. The casino was laid back and drink service was very good!! We even mananged to win some money!! Overall had a great experience and will definitely return. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great stay, great smell!”
Reviews.Author: PGreview
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money. We got exactly what we were expecting in terms of value. Great food, great location (centre strip, about 100 yards back). For some reason this place always smells like vanilla. Great touch! Definitely recommend Aria to first time visitors. Great restaurants and if you enjoy the gym it's fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Never again- woke up with bites”
Reviews.Author: greenespace100
Reviews.Content: I went to the Aria as a part of a large conference and was excited to see it and City Center, however, that excitement didn't last long- I woke up the first morning with two bites, one on my elbow and one on my knee that weren't there the previous day. After calling down to the front desk, I was told that security would be up right away- they weren't. In fact, they took so long to come, they made me late for a meeting I was scheduled to be at. They then looked at my fresh bites, and said it was clear that they were bites- very possibly bed bugs- and said they would have to move me to another room. They apologized and said they would take care of everything. I was Ok with that, as I understand that, "stuff happens", and that they would do their best to make the situation right. They didn't. They proceeded to move me, but there was no, "Sorry for your inconvenience", or even a "Here's a small token to help make this right"- nothing. I called down and asked if there was anything they could do and eventually, they agreed to give me a $100 food and beverage voucher for my trouble. OK, not great, but I'll take it. Again, I'm not here to cause trouble or be obnoxious, that's not my nature. So I fly home. Then, on March 5th, I get a letter from the Aria and Denise Chilipka-Oltay who is in Risk Management, saying that they hope I enjoyed my visit, but they checked the room, didn't find bugs, and they will, "respectfully deny all any and all claims associated with this incident." What a bunch of jerks. I hadn't planned on filing anything in the first place, but this response letter has me on a mission to make sure that any future business my rather large host company was planning will NOT happen. There's a right and wrong way to treat people- especially people that could have made a huge deal out of this and DIDN'T. This was their way of making this right- by sending me a "CYA" letter. Add to that, the Aria itself reminds me of an upscale suburban mall- while beautiful, it simply lacks character which would make the hotel interesting. If you wander it for any length of time, you can pretty much see it and realize there's not a lot to do other than eat and gamble and watch an Elvis show, which I didn't do. So in conclusion, while there I got bug bites of SOME nature, got moved and offered nothing in return, then told that if I did come home and have problems- which it turns out I did- that I was on my own. And I paid a lot for this treatment. I'll leave it to you whether this sounds like a place you would want to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Still Trying To Decide”
Reviews.Author: Stormchaser1966
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference being held at the Aria in Las Vegas, and I must admit I'm not sure what to say. My first impression was somewhat of a "wow" factor, with its contemporary looks and high reliance on technology. After being in the hotel for only a few moments, I thought that this must be what hotels would look like in the Jetsons era. But. High technology may be important to some people -- and I am truly a techno-geek, by all means -- but here it's beyond the point of user-friendly. From perfect key placement to open the front door to figuring out how to operate the lights, television, etc. it felt a little overdone. (Okay, a LOT overdone.) My first room wasn't "functional" in terms of the technology, so I had to be moved to another room where I encountered several other glitchy issues -- room phones not working, the remotes on the blinds, etc. working sporadically, lamps non-functional, inconvenience of outlet placement, and so forth. Yes, there are operations instructions in the room -- many of them -- but after a looong day on airplanes, it took a while to find the answers I needed. And even then, sometimes following the operations instructions didn't work. Some of my coworkers said they struggled with trying to figure everything out. The decor is beautiful. I love how the rooms feel contemporary and retro at the same time. The rest of the hotel is so eclectic, as parts of it feel like a traditional shopping district, while others are more like an upscale, modern mall. The casino itself it pretty much like any other casino I've ever visited, but it is pretty cool, nonetheless. As with most of Las Vegas, you'll spend some money at this place, even if you don't go near the casino; nothing is cheap. I have to say that service was good during my visit; everyone was professional, courteous, and helpful, although just a tad "rehearsed". But they did their jobs well, and that's what matters. If you want casual, warm and fuzzy, go elsewhere, right? So I still don't know what my final opinion is. I think I'd visit the place again, but looking around the Strip there are so many choices that I can't say this place has completely won my business. I think many people will love it and many will hate it, and for exactly the same reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Blood spots from previous guest left on bed cover”
Reviews.Author: Ross N
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner checked in around 12 noon on Friday March 2nd. We entered our room only to find there was blood on the bed cover. My partner was very distrubbed at finding blood on the bed cover and called housekeeping right away. We told them we were going to the casino and hoped it would be changed out when we returned. We returned at 4pm to find that it still had not been changed out. He called housekeeping a second time and we left the room again to play in the casino. We returned to the room to get ready for dinner at 7pm to still find the bed cover had not been changed, we called housekeeping again and explained we were going to dinner and see their Elvis show. We returned at 2am to find once more that nothing had been done with the bed cover. This time he called the front desk and threatened to walk thru the casino with the bed cover in hand if no one came to our room to change it out. Housekeeping was at the door in 5 minutes flat. What I didn't tell my partner or the housekeeper is that the new bed cover was stain with blood also due to the fact that I was tired and ready for bed. I also found unnecessary credit card authorizations on my debit card from this property. They assured me that only $130 credit card authorization would be taken on the room for incidentals. There was a mysterious amount of the difference between what should have been charged and the remaining amount on the credit card authorization. I called, but I was told to call back Monday thru Friday bankers hours to get this resolved. I read many reviews on this website and found many were not answered by Aria staff. It is up to you to read the reviews and decide for yourself to stay here or not. This hotel is beautiful, but lack of communication by staff and attentiveness to your needs is what this hotel needs to work on.

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: kiwiyankee
Reviews.Content: If you want the quintessential Vegas experience do not stay here. I have stayed at Wynn, Bellagio, & Venetian and preferred all of them over the Aria. Why go to Vegas and stay in hotel that feels so generic and corporate. We live in NYC and the Aria reminded us of the mall at Columbus Circle-all glass and metal-it’s looks like a bank headquarters, modern hotel, or fancy mall that you would come across in any international city. It felt sterile and boring except for the entrance waterfall and the pool area. Since the hotel is set back from the strip the views are not great. Maybe they are better on the highest floors, but we had a suite on the 18th floor, and then a room on the 33rd floor, and neither had a great view of the strip. Many reviewers mention the technology panel as a negative-I agree-I wanted to take a vacation from my smart phone etc but found I spent way too much time dealing with the technology panel-it drove me nuts at times. And I took my ipod and the audio cable that I read you need to enable it to play it through their AV system (as there is no regular ipod dock) and I still couldn’t get my ipod to work. The blackout blinds in both rooms we stayed in had gaps so light came in. In one room the sun would come right in my eye at sunrise. We had an issue with our room/customer service that marred our particuar stay. Read on if you are interested in the details. Otherwise stay here if you want a place that is sleek and un-Vegas like, that is located mid-strip; and stay elsewhere if you want a place with some character, color, Vegas pizazz. When we checked in for three nights we were told that the room we booked, a king city view-was not available and all they had for us was a two queen bed room on the 7th floor. So we ended up being upsold to a Crystal suite city view, on 18th floor, for $100 extra per night. In hindsight they probably should have offered us the upgrade for free. The next day we ended up repacking and moving to the original category room we booked, on the 33rd floor, as we did not like the suite. The suite floor plan made no sense, as all the furniture in the living room and in the bedroom was turned the opposite way from the view, and hundreds of other Aria hotel rooms could see right into our bedroom and bathroom so we had to keep the blinds closed if we wanted any privacy. And the room was dirty, for example there were noticeable stains on the couch and seat-it looked like someone had a 'party' before we had the room-definitely needed a steam clean-gross; and the technology panel that controlled all the lighting & curtains etc was covered in food/fingerprint smudges. They didn’t have the new room ready for us until the end of the second day. They did say however that they would credit us back the extra $100 we paid for the suite on the first night. We had to go back to the front desk the day after we moved rooms as the $100 was still showing up on our bill (you can view your bill thru the TV). By then we had been dealing with this issue for two days-not good when you only have three days vacation. Once we were in our new room I was a lot happier but it's a pity we didn’t just get the room we had booked right from the start.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Brown_Sugar2
Reviews.Content: Loved my 3 night stay at this hotel. Check in took quite some time but overall I was in WOW with this hotel. The restaurants I didn't care for very much since they were too upscale for me. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible all around.”
Reviews.Author: Ariaspresident
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel and casino in Las Vegas. They poison the air you breath in making you spend more money and gamble every penny you have away. And even when you check out they will fraudulently charge whatever monet you have on your card that you used to check in. Crooks...

Reviews.Title: “Shocked at the State of my Room & Lack of Customer Service...”
Reviews.Author: tglenns
Reviews.Content: I went to the Aria Jan of 2011 for business - it was fairly new and quite nice - loved the modern decor of the rooms, and nice airy feel of the hotel. I came back two weeks ago and had reserved a Deluxe City View. The view was great, however the hotel room, not so much. Let's see. Two lamps weren't working - assuming burnt bulbs. It took 5 attempts to log onto the wifi for a $24 fee. The cordless phone didn't work. I used the iron to touch up a shirt and rust came out of the steam and stained my shirt. The curtains didn't close all the way - and didn't realize till the next morning with the sun came shining in at 6 am. Oh, and security was having an issue with the room next to mine - when I walked out of my room to go down for dinner - I asked Security if everything was okay - he replied with " Sir, this is none of your business, be on your way." I replied with - I simply asked if all is okay as you are standing outside my door. He didn't reply. RUDE. I then two days later got an email asking me to review the hotel - I gave all the feedback above and received an email from Brooke apologizing and offering me a corner suite upgrade on my next visit. So... I called last night and the number she gave me is only open M-F 8-5, and if you call other than those hours - speak to the front desk manager. I then called back and asked - spoke to Jonathan - and was informed that's not the usual upgrade and he could offer me a City View Room and nothing more. I read him the note and he said sorry - can't extend the upgrade for your arrival on Monday. I'm shocked, disappointed, and appalled at the treatment - they made a bad experience worse. I am a CEO and if any of my employees were to handle a customer like this - they'd be in training ASAP to ensure they could do better the next time. The Aria is so big and have many other customers and high rollers to tend to, I guess they don't care about the single reservation guy. Well, I put on events for up to 10,000 guests at a time all around the world. They've secured that I'll not be using the Aria for any of my client events moving forward.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, a few small glitches”
Reviews.Author: traveltoes
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Las Vegas before last week, so wasn't sure what to expect. The Aria was perfect for me. I liked that it was slightly removed from being right on the strip. It was like a little oasis and a break from the strip. Our room was lovely, with a nice view. There were really accomodating and arranged for us to have an ajoining room with our friends- whose room decor I preferred. pros I liked the decor of the hotel and the rooms- like a spa It was by far the least smokey of all the hotels we walked through good location lovely pool area comfy bed- I slept really well clean casinos and pool area the hotel stores were nice All of the reataurants that we tried were very good- especially Sage- it was EXCELLENT Cons I wasn't a huge fan of the tv/ light/ curtain controller. It was Ok, but I was always accidentally turning everything off. the pool closed at 4- it was warm and nice, so I was surprised, and the pool drinks could have been a little better for the price. we had some trouble getting really hot water in the shower Having said all this, I would stay here again, or perhaps the Wynn. Other hotels like Bellagio were just too smokey. I also like that they would let us upgrade our paper to the NY Times for no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service & lack of concern for safety of guests”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa R
Reviews.Content: I recently got back from what was supposed to be a relaxing 3 night stay at the Aria and was absolutely appalled at the low standard service that they hold themselves to and the complete disregard for the safety and well being of their guests. Day one went well, but everything quickly went downhill from there. We arrived on the last Sunday in February and like everyone else were amazed at how beautiful the resort was. At check in we were upgraded to a city view room on the top floor and upon entering our room were blown away by our surroundings. We opened the door and the lights slowly turned on, music begins to play, and the curtains open revealing a breathtaking view of the strip. Things begin to go downhill the next. We were on our way to the parking garage to go drive out to the Mob Museum downtown, cross the bridge from the casino and start walking down the aisle to the car. We get to the other side of the garage and realize that we had parked on the floor below the night before and needed to take the elevator down after getting crossing the bridge. At this point we are right next to the stairs so instead of walking all the way back across the parking garage we decide to just take the stairs and be let out right next to our car. In the stairwell we go down a floor to find the door, covered in footprints from people trying to kick it in, is locked. We go to the bottom floor, where the door opens and lets us out to what appears to be the back of the resort. Looking around and not sure which way to go to get back into the parking garage, or at this point just anywhere we recognize, we see stairs leading up to the monorail and decide we can just take the monorail back to the casino. Halfway up the stairs a security truck drives and he by asks if he can help us get where we are going. Thankful that someone has driven by we tell him what happened, at which point he sighs heavily, rolls his eyes, and tells us that we can't get to the monorail because the gate at the top of the stairs is locked and the only way to get back to our car is to walk up through the service tunnel and then back down the main self-park tunnel to our car, which i realize neither of which have sidewalks. This supposed to be a AAA four diamond resort. What he should have done is unlocked the monorail gate for us or called someone to give us a ride back to our car if for no other reason than to make sure we got back to our car safety. Instead, he drives off and we start walking up the first tunnel. Coming out of the first tunnel I realize that he means for us to walk down the main entrance of the Aria self parking tunnel, which is off the left as you turn of Las Vegas Blvd, meaning we have to cross 3 lanes of traffic coming the opposite direction with no crosswalk in site, in order to get to the tunnel. Obviously, there is no way I am going to do this. We ended up having to jump the wall we were clinging to as there was no sidewalk, cross the planter that was on top, and then jump the glass partition to get to the sidewalk outside of the shopping center. While obviously we somehow ended up somewhere we weren't supposed to be, it is the Aria's job to ensure that their guests are enjoying themselves, help them find their way when they get lost, and at all time make sure their guests are safe but apparently the security guard that stopped couldn't be bothered with any of that and actually told us "the only way" to get back to our car was to walk across 3 lanes of busy traffic. The third day, as we were taking the elevator down to get breakfast, it decides to stop working around the 30th floor and drops us. My stomach drops and we are staring at each other frozen in place for what was probably only a few seconds before the brakes start to kick in. Trying to stop the elevator the brakes are screeching loudly and the whole elevator car is violently shaking. We are completely terrified, not knowing if the brakes are going to be able to stop is in time or if we are going to crash at the bottom. Finally it stops, and I press the help button. The screen which normally reads "EZ" as you are coasting between the 3rd & 30th floors now reads--, the elevator is bouncing up and down and we have no idea what floor we are on. For all we could know the elevator could drop again. For the 20-30 minutes it takes to open the doors the only thing the dispatcher seems to be able to tell us is that help is on the way. I have been stuck in an elevator before, admittedly never dropped in one, but as they are getting you out what they should have done is tell you what they are doing every step of the way so if they have to move the elevator to get you out you know it is the maintenance people and not the elevator malfunctioning again. This never happened. Anytime the elevator moved or there was a loud noise we asked what it was and she said it may be the maintenance people trying to get us out but she didn't know. Not helpful or reassuring at all. The lack of communication between us, the dispatcher, and the maintenance people was appalling and made an already terrifying experience even worse. Additionally the dispatcher told us that someone from the front desk would be there when they opened the doors, which she wasn't. We actually had to wait for her. When we got out I asked the person who opened the doors what had happened and he said he didn't know and after I asked him how far the elevator dropped his mouth fell open and dumbfounded he stares at me and said "you dropped?" Obviously the people in this hotel have no idea what was going on. Just happy to be out of there we go over to the ice cream shop around the corner to sit down and wait for the person from the front desk that was supposed to be there when we got out. Fully expecting our stay to be comped I was shocked when she finally arrived she and had the audacity to tell me that she was only comping one night and I had to pay for the other two nights. I was completely speechless, and when she saw I was not happy she said she would also add a $100 food and beverage credit to our room before quickly taking off. She was with us for less than 5 minutes and the whole time she would not stop looking at her iphone. Apparently she had somewhere more important to be. I was just so done with them that I filled out my statement and left. That night we get back to the room and the message light on our phone is flashing. We press the message button, but keep getting a busy signal so we call the front desk to find out what we have to do to get our message. We are hung up by the front desk 3 times before I finally demand to speak to a manager. After spending another 20 minutes on the phone with him he finally says they are having phone problems and we may not even have a message. He is going to comp us half a night for our inconvenience (and this is only after I tell him about what happened with the elevator earlier in the day) and he will find out if we actually have a message and give us a call back to let us know. We never hear from him again. The next morning we wake up and just leave, so happy to be out of there. When we get home I have a message from the assistant manager from the front desk (the person we had to wait for after getting out of the elevator) saying she was calling regarding "the incident" and wanted me to call her back. Thinking that she finally realized how badly they handled the situation and was calling to apologize and comp us the rest of our stay, which should have been automatic when we got of the elevator, I call back to find out she is not there. The phone number she left was for the front desk and they told me that they would make sure she got the message that I called. It has been 2 days since I called back and I have not heard anything else. At this point I am done dealing with anyone from the Aria and I am just going to tell my credit card company not to honor the charge. They could not pay me to stay there again. I got much better service at the Cosmopolitan next door and I wasn't even staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FLtravelmom
Reviews.Content: I don't go to Vegas often- it has been several years since I was last there. I have previously stayed at the Mirage, Mandalay Bay, The Bellagio and The Venetian. My husband and I just got back from 3 days at Aria. We enjoyed the hotel- it is very contemporary and high tech. The room is all wired and TV, lighting, Music and draperies can all be controlled by a small panel at the bedside. Ours was not working properly and after fussing with it for a day we asked maintenance to come and look at it. After that it was much better. At times it was kind of a pain though- techy things can be that way. We did not eat at any of the restaurants at the hotel- although several of them are very highly rated. We ate in the mornings ( light breakfast) at Jean Philippe Patisserie - all of the pastries that we had there were amazing-I looked forward to it every morning. Our first morning we were up early and did the art walking tour- it took about an hour and was very enjoyable. We kind of learned our way around the resort. There is a tram that connects the Bellagio- Aria- Monte Carlo but the tram does not actually stop at Aria- it stops at Chrystals ( the mall) next door. We found that you could actually walk via an indoor walkway ( take the escalator up in the self park entrance) to the Monte Carlo in less time than it took to get to the tram station at Chrystals. Also, if you walk outside and across Harmon Circle and enter Vdara, you can get to Bellagio very quickly as well. We enjoyed the new Chihuly gallery- and really all of the artwork on the property. our room was very nice- bed was very comfortable- shower was great. We rented a car and dropping/picking up the car at the valet was very easy and the service was very good. I would stay at Aria again- the overall experience was comparable to the other hotels that I have stayed at in Vegas- but I actually prefer to be a little farther down the strip ( Bellagio or Venetian).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Laura L
Reviews.Content: We walked in the room to the curtains opening to a beautiful view of the sun setting over the Mountains and desert. Great first impression! Casino was nice with lots of gaming options. Don't miss Bally brunch on Sunday only at Bally casino and hotel pricey but well worth it. Full lobster tails, filet, king crab, Hugh shrimp, Xavier, you name it they had it and white glove waiter service. Outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a place!”
Reviews.Author: Vymean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the first time. Wow, what a place! Everything is high tech and very modern. Staff are very friendly, polite and helpful. We will definately stay at the Aria again next time! :^)

Reviews.Title: “Modern Wonder”
Reviews.Author: MarieV1021
Reviews.Content: My husband and I like to get away every two years without the kids and this trip was my Christmas present. He did good! Absolutely stunning. Very easy to get around and find restaurants, fitness center, shops etc. Speaking of the fitness center, staff was helpful and knowledgable. Plenty of machines. Our room was clean and the shower was awesome! The bed was sooooo comfortable. Once we got used to the TV remote or should I say everything remote, we were good to go! Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “One word ... "wow" !”
Reviews.Author: Denys_001
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a week in Vegas, stayed at the Aria. This hotel bils itself as a 5 star ..... i'd give it 6 if I could ! The attaention to service and detail is incredible. Our room was absolutely amazing. Located on flr 23, wall to wall windows, a remote control that controls everything (with the assistance of any of the 3 tv's we had in our room) everything : every single light, drapes, temperature, tv, music, etc ..... as other reviewers have said .. absolutely rocks ! Spendign long days walking the strip and nights partying it up, crashing in our suite's beds was simply amazing. We have travelled extensively and I can say - without reserveation - that the bed and pillow were by far teh most comfortable one I have ever had teh opportunity of sleeping on. AMAZING ! I can go on and on to describe how wonderful thsi hotel is .. however, I would simply be repeating what others have already said here. The bathroom was unreal ... heated toilet seats ! How cool is that ! ;-) If i can add some "negatives" which really do not change any of my perceptions of this hotel, when arriving by bus .. you are dropped off in the basement .... if you arrive past midnight, there are no bell hops and it can be confusing. Also, expect to do a lot of walking ! Huge hotel and a good walk to get around .... BUT overall ..... simply an amazing experience !

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: darkludus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria over a weekend for a friends birthday party. The hotel is still very new and it feels classy. We tried the lounge by the casino floor, the bottle service there wasn't a bad deal and we had a good time. There are blackjack tables in the lounge but at $50 min bet there wasn't much action, the dealers just stood around most of the time. In fact, I'd have to say the casino part of the hotel overall may have been the weakest part of the whole. There are a limited number of tables, the casino floor is very small. All of the tables had a higher minimum bet compared to other casinos on the strip. The club downstairs was jumping when we went - I'm not a clubbing person but it seemed impressive in scale. The restaurants were plentiful - I have to say the cafe that runs parallel to the casino was great - open 24 hours and reasonable. I had a terrible experience at the thai restaurant though. An older waitress helped us and I asked for a 4-star spice (out of ten). She said they are very spicy dishes, so I lowered it to 3-stars. I think she singled me out to mess with me (I was the only white guy in my group) as the food that came out was easily 10 or 11 stars on their 10 star scale. My friends ordered more stars on their food and they had much milder dishes. She seemed to be smirking about it, I thought it was very unprofessional but I didn't want to make a scene and ruin my friends birthday. It was inedible. Not cool. Otherwise everyone else at the property was very friendly and helpful. The tram is convenient and close by. There is a shopping galeria adjacent to the hotel, but not many stores yet. It was winter, so the pool was closed - can't rate that.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: motogrrl2003
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since I stayed here, but I have talked about this place a million times. It's the most awesome hotel. The rooms are noveau decor. The floor to ceiling windows overlooking the strip are magnificient. The TV controls absolutely rock! Tech geeks should love this place. Oh, and the shower rooms are awesome! I can't wait to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean And Friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Jim K
Reviews.Content: My 3rd time at Aria and always clean, friendly staff, smells good inside not smokey, good variety of slots, Staff were always cleaning and sanitzing slots, chairs, ash trays, My room was big and comfortable, great bed, Slept like a log. Will surely return. M Life on slots easy to use and redeem.

Reviews.Title: “Average place with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mura02456
Reviews.Content: Took awhile to figure how how to turn on the lights, turn off the music music, etc. This should be easy and intuitive. Staff was very friendly, but the room was not cleaned during the stay. The bed and bathroom were very nice. As usual, no coffeemaker in the room, they want you to spend money on everything. Overall, not a bad deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Overall - But a Few Annoying Cons”
Reviews.Author: NewMexBound
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property. The front desk was very helpful in consolidating 2 reservations when I checked in. They upgraded me at no charge to an upper floor room with an awesome view of the Strip. Rooms themselves are very nice. The bed is extremely confortable. The room price included some resort credits and free buffets, so the price I paid was reasonable for the value received. The hotel is huge and has an upscale, modern feel to it. The pool area is attractive. I ate a breakfast and a lunch at The Buffet. Also ate a dinner at Sirio. Both were ok, but nothing special. So what were the cons? - There's an all-in-one gadget that controls the TV, lighting, temperature and curtains. I found it annoying and time consuming to use. Technology overkill. - The room lighting is dull no matter how many lights you turn on - There's no power outlets near the bed and nightstands - Maids did not replace dirty glasses and trays, nor wipe down counters. Had to call House Keeping to complain about this after the 2nd time it happened. They brought new glasses 15 minutes later and did replace the room glasses the next day - Pool closes at 4PM - Long walk with luggage from Self Parking to Registration

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, clean, new and comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: DNAZ_SF
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many times and have walked thru the Aria lobby/casino but this was the first stay there as we were attending the Cirque Viva Elvis show and wanted to stay close by. Let's start with the basic pluses; newer hotel so rooms are in great shape; beds are very comfortable and you can get a good nights sleep there (once you make it to your room)!; everything in your room run by your remote which is great when the batteries are working (had to have maintenance come and change those when we checked in as nothing worked with the remote); Minuses: buffet is good value but selection is not as good as the Bellagio (you must eat at Bellagio one time as it is incredible for a buffet!); food at the Jean Phillipe cafe in the lobby and little cafe on the second floor is really expensive for just a sandwich with just OK panini sandwiches; hotel has a strong "waffle cone" smell when you walk in the door (most likely from the Jean Phillipe place in the lobby) and does not go away - it gets a little overwhelming after a while; slot machines were not paying out for any of our group of 4 during the 3 days we were there (always seem to do better at Paris and Bellagio for some reason Might consider staying there again, but if I can get the same rate at the Bellagio would pick that any day over the Aria

Reviews.Title: “Love the Aria!”
Reviews.Author: chrisboldt2
Reviews.Content: We enjoy getting away to Las Vegas and have stayed at many different hotels. By far, the Aria is the best hotel we have stayed in! The hotel and casino were very clean and well kept. The staff were friendly and accomodating. The weather didn't cooperate, so we didn't get to take advantage of the pool, but we did go out to take a look... AND...we will be back when the weather is better to take advantage of the beautiful pool area!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PBSDSF
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Aria. The staff was excellent as well as all of the services. Just wish we could of stayed longer. Our room was on the 28th floor and the view was incredible. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: damien d
Reviews.Content: It was my first time visiting Las Vegas.....I must say that the staff at the Aria made it monumental! From the several dining choices to entertainment and cleanliness of the resort I give it an 11 on a scale of 1-10! I plan on going back later this summer and you can definately count on seeing me at the Aria!

Reviews.Title: “FUN "sister time" at the Aria!”
Reviews.Author: Deb H
Reviews.Content: Had a great visit with my sister at the Aria during our stay in February 2012. Our room was beautiful and the staff was exceptional! Everyone was friendly and very helpful. We are planning on coming back to spend time at the pool and the spa - so beautiful and relaxing!!! If you are looking for a perfect spot to stay in Vegas the Aria is for you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Contempory but really nice for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Musttravel93
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Aria for three nights in October 2011. From the minute we arrived at the main entrance we were very impressed. We had been to Vegas before and had looked at most of the hotels on the strip. Our check-in went well and we were given an upgrade to a corner suite for a small price. The suite was lovely and the views were incredible. The room was very modern and had everything we could possibly ask for apart from tea/coffee making facilities. The bathroom was amazing with its egg shaped bath, walk in shower and separate toilet with heated seat & personal washing facilities - it was a fun gimmick! The bathroom was very well stocked with toiletries and they were replenished every day. We loved the high tech tv with controls for everything including closing the curtains from the remote! Everything could also be controlled at the bedside - a nice touch. As for the hotel itself it was very impressive and the choice of bars and restaurants was endless. We drank at most of the bars but we were not impressed by the servers, they were very unfriendly and didn't appear to be that interested in the guests. We tried a few of the restaurants which were very good, I would certainly recommend Lemongrass for a Thai meal. The coffees and muffins were excellent at Jean Pierre's patisserie, Vetro was good for a quick cheap meal. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Aria as the location was good and being attached to the Crystals Mall was a good thing. We really feel the management need to work at customer relations especially in the bars. The year before we stayed at the Wynn Encore and the staff there were excellent, maybe the Aria should have a look & do some comparisons. We would recommend this hotel if you like modern, clean surroundings. It is certainly not a tacky hotel as many Vegas hotels. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Aria - one and done...”
Reviews.Author: rossbo1
Reviews.Content: Visited Aria this week for one night as an invited guest... Not my cup of tea - much prefer Bellagio, Venetian or Wynn. Here are the pluses and minuses from my perspective.. Pluses * New * Super-comfy beds * Some really nice dealers * $10 craps all night long Minuses * Sterile, dark casino * High limits (I like $25 table games, but there were few to be found) * Remote location - too damned far from everything... * Rooms are too techy - remote controls for everything. I didn't like that at all. * Strange shower/tub layout and toilet behind frosted glass wall. Really? Why??? * A/C made strange noises all night long and din't run properly. * Got screwed on my comps when departure - "attitude" from the front desk guy wasn't cool. This may be a great place for some, but it just doesn't compare to my favorite places. Will not repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: suelinney
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back after spending 5 nights at Aria. First impressions very impressive and up market. We had a room on 22nd floor with amazing views of mountains & pool areas. Rooms are very big with massive windows. Next to your bed you have a thing that looks like an iPad that controls everything. Curtains open close, air con, lights tv, even says goodnight to you. Beautiful big bathroom with bath shower 2 sinks & toilet. The only negative point is 2 out of 5 days our rooms wasnt cleaned after leaving them at 7am in morning and arriving back at 4.30 and having put service sign on too. After a quick call down to reception this was soon solved and 50 dollars credit was added to our bill, which was a nice gesture. Casino area is massive & never sleeps, loads of restaurants to choose from too. There were 2 pools open during our stay but there is 4.. Very clean loads of beds with waitress service for drinks. Check in & out very quick service, security on lifts so rooms safe, only guest can access. beautiful hotel and great location free monorail to Belligio too.Crystals shopping centre attached to hotel. Shop shop till all hours! We went on Grand canyon trip with Sundance helicopters excellent trip with free limo pick up and champagne breakfast in Canyon. Very professional company. Use show time airport shuttle service out side airport for getting to hotel. 13 dollars return, just phone 24 hr before departure & arrange pick up very reliable.

Reviews.Title: “It was fab”
Reviews.Author: PaddyCoventry
Reviews.Content: It was my birthday, and thanks to the travel agents, Thomas Cook, we managed to get an upgrade to a luxury suite. The suite was 'awesome'. I really couldn't fault it. It was so good, I am almost thinking I won't be able to go back to Las Vegas again, because I can't imagine anything matching our stay at the Aria. Rooms luxurious, staff friendly, bars lively and enjoyable, food excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky Hotel but Missing the Small Things”
Reviews.Author: Infinity00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria for 3 nights in Feb 2012. Hotel check in was relatively painless except for the fact that the check in staff tried to sell us an upgrade that costs double of what we paid. Requested for a strip facing view but was told that we had to pay additional money, notwithstanding the fact that the occupany rate for the hotel was rather low as there were many unlit rooms in the evenings. It wouldnt cost anything extra to allocate a room for us with a strip view but I guess it's their business model to milk every penny from you. Room - small, furnishing was new. However, room was very dark even with all the lights switched on, made reading very difficult. And they had this touch screen panel which allowed you to control everything in the room, from lights to curtains, to tv, radio etc, which was cool to play witih for a while but became a bit of a hassle - i foresee older folks having some problems getting the hang of the touch screen. Bathroom was big, was almost the half of the room. However, the ventilation for the bathtub and shower area was not adequate, if you left the door closed throughout the day, there would be a musky smell. Also, the water flow from the taps at the wash basin was very high pressured, so much so that you will definitely splash water all over the vanity top when you wash your hands, no matter how careful you are. (I understand that this would ensure that less water is wasted, but the hotel should still look in to this). I must commend the housekeeping as they were very meticulous. They even arranged my toiletries neatly on a paper towel. Check out the next day was fast although the queue was long, it moved along rather quickly. They distributed bottles of water to waiting guests which was a nice touch. An additional thing that I want to point out was that we left our luggage with the bell counter when we left for the Grand Canyon and went back to collect it a few days later. The collection point was at a different lobby from the Aria lobby. I had to find a spot near teh valet to park the car and wait while my friends went in to collect the luggage. However, the valet drivers there had a very bad attitude and rudely insisted that I wait somewhere rather far away from the collection point, even though i explained to them why i was waiting there. And I wasnt even blocking the driveway! Not a good final impression of the hotel. All in all, I felt that Aria was nice, with a swanky exterior, lobby and room but somehow it just lacked the small things to make it truely good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Aria!”
Reviews.Author: Travelinder
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a long weekend here with a group of friends. The hotel is new and modern. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Our view was excellent. Bathrooms are well designed and roomy. Our room was located near the end of the hallway and though it was a bit of a walk it wasn’t as ridiculously long as some reviewers complain about. Seeing Vegas requires a lot of walking anyway and this took about 30 seconds longer than at most hotels. The hotel itself is very large so it takes a lot of walking to travel through the lobby or out to the pool area, etc. and we found this to be no different than at any of the other hotels were visited. Pool area is beautiful and spacious with three large pools, lush tropical landscaping and plenty of shade or sun. We were usually able to find loungers with no trouble except one early afternoon on a busy Saturday but even then we still found a group. Drinks were excellent and huge. Even though they seemed pricey they were actually a good value for the size received. Service was very good around the pool. We ate breakfast at the restaurant in the lobby on each morning and found the food and service to be excellent. There was usually a line but it moved quickly. We dined one evening in the restaurant on the other side and had a very good meal. Drinks in the casino lounge near the elevators were very good and the atmosphere was comfortable and relaxing. The lobby and casino area are dark and modern. Cigarette smoke wasn’t noticeable unless you really paid attention to it. They do a very good job with ventilation here. We didn’t gamble so I cannot comment on that. There are several good clubs in the hotel that we visited and had a great time. The location of the resort is excellent. Even though it is set back off the strip we easily walked to the Bellagio and also visited Vdara. A shopping center that is adjacent is convenient and also can serve as an air conditioned cut through to access the strip. The strip is so spread out it really is much better to take a taxi to your destination anyway and there are always plenty out front.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: freemaee
Reviews.Content: This was a quick overnight on the way to Zion Park. It is our 5th time at this hotel, we love it and this time we had friends book the hotel too. They loved it too and it became their favorite place. Love the layout of the suits, the way that the hotel smells (there is no smoking so it smell like flowers everywhere). The staff is nice and accomodating. The little market (coffee place) in the lobby is perfect for a quick bite at breakfast or if you want to grab a few things for your room. We were not crazy about their restaurant, however Aria next door has some great places. The Bar Masa is the best upscale place. Stay away from Cafe Vittro- the service is so slow that it's not even funny, the food is like a fast food too.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service. Rude employees.”
Reviews.Author: Ralph G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria in late February for two nights. We had never stayed there before so we were looking forward to the stay. The check in was smooth enough. We checked in without any problems. The rooms are small but nice, Comfortable bed and high tech gadgets. The bathroom was ok but not great. Now here is my mistake. I read the mixed reviews on this place and many of the reviews said the same thing about the service. The service here is bad! The hotel itself though confusing in layout and far back from the strip is nice enough but the Hotel employees are rude and condescending. The first problem we had was when we called room service to order ice cream. The lady that took our order spoke very broken English and was hard to understand. We thought she said the order would take 15 minutes but after 35 minutes we hadn't received our order so we called. The lady very rudely said “it's going to be another 20 minutes. I already told you it was going to take 50 minutes!” This was at 1 am so ice cream shouldn't take 50 minutes but that's beside the point. If she spoke clear English and we heard her right we would not have ordered the ice cream. So she proceeded to scold us and told us we can cancel the order this time but if we do this again we were going to be charged! WTF is that how you talk to hotel guests that are politely calling to find out the status on our ice cream? Strike number two happened when we went downstairs to checkout and complain about the room service attendant. The checkout line was disorganized and no one seemed to know what line to get into. After 5 minutes of confusion a really angry black woman employee came out with a clip board and yelled at the guests to form 4 lines. She was really rude and unfriendly. She should try smiling and saying hello to the guests, not treating them like children. When we finally made it to the checkout line we asked to speak to a manager and the girl at the front desk told us we would have to explain to her what happened before she could do that. So see above for my gripe about room service. We proceeded to explain to her what happened and she had the nerve to tell us we should’ve complained to the room service manager when the incident happened. It was almost 2 am and we were tired so we figured we would complain in the morning. She still wouldn't call a manager over even after I asked her to for the second time. She proceeded to call room service and told us that she confirmed that room service was busy and that’s why it took so long. I told her that’s fine if they were busy but the lady that answered the phone spoke very broken English and it's not our fault she's hard to understand. Second, she should not talk to the guest so rudely. She gave us an insincere apology and still refused to call a manager over! This is supposed to be a five star hotel. I’m appalled at how they treat their guests. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Aria--just OK”
Reviews.Author: Nana766
Reviews.Content: Impressive from the outside, but resort lobby has some of the most uncomfortable places to wait I've ever sat on. Food choices are varied but prices are ridiculous. We had bkfst 3x and each cost us $40 plus and we changed our menu choices each time. Concierge and Bell Hops excellent service. Front Desk and Housekeeping need improvements. Shopping is totally high end with nothing for the average person, in-room refrigerator stocked with over priced treats and drinks with 3 being charged to our room that we didn't use, but the mistake was corrected. Beds and pillows very comfortable, but heard outside noise including sirens from the street and we were on 12th floor, and music from another room. Travel to Vegas for vacation numerous times and probably won't stay at Aria again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, excellent service, just don't place a phone call from the room”
Reviews.Author: VancouverRickc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria for 6 days in a Sky suite during a convention- the set up was perfect to host numerous meetings in a private setting. The only drawback are the outrageous fees charged for phone calls- $15 for a one minute call is way over the top...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and casino, but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: DayAtTheBeach
Reviews.Content: Believe all of the great reviews you read. We arrived very early, around 10 am. There was hardly anyone waiting to check in or out. We were waited on immediately. We made a mistake with our reservation, but the woman at the front desk took care of it. Great service! The rooms are very nice. Everything worked great, they were very clean, and the beds are the most comfortable beds you will find anywhere. The only time we ate at the hotel was room service for lunch. The food was very good. But, believe it or not, drinks for the minibar $$$ were cheaper than drinks from room service. We opted for the minibar. We stayed over Superbowl weekend, so the rates may have been higher than usual, but the room was fairly expensive. The casino was very nice. It was clean and didn't smell of smoke. All of the games and tables looked new and well taken care of. On Thursday I was able to play $15 craps. But, Friday - Sunday the minimum rose to $25. I saw the same thing for blackjack. I guess they figure that if you can afford the room then you can afford a minimum bet of $25. My bankroll was not large and at $110 a hand for craps (PL/1x odds + place bet on 6 & 8) it didn't last long. But, drink service was great. This is a great hotel with a nice casino. Probably too nice $$$ for us. If you have the money I would recommend this hotel. It is a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Sky Suites are the Best in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: ForensicChick
Reviews.Content: As a birthday surprise, my boyfriend took me on a quick overnight trip to Vegas. I was surprised with limo pick up at the airport and we were taken to the private entrance to the Aria where we were greeted by a hotel representative. We were walked to the check-in area and showed the complimentary beverage/snack center. The hospitality was some of the best I've ever experienced. The room was absolutely amazing - large half bathroom, living room, dining room/kitchen area, bedroom and very large bathroom with walk-in closet. An entire wall of the room was floor to ceiling windows which were controlled with remotes/television. We were greeted with chocolate covered strawberries and champagne which was a great touch. The room was very comfortable and I was convinced to purchase the bed type from their website. The large jacuzzi tub was perfect and a great way to rest your feet after a night on the strip. We ate at the Tapas restaurant for lunch, but left the hotel to go to Joe's Stone Crab for dinner. The gambling was great and wish we could have spent some time at the pool. Guess we'll have to save some things to do on the next trip...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Upgrade to Jr. Suite!”
Reviews.Author: ChasTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb 23-26 2012, Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a Jr. Suite on 54th floor with a fantastic city view! Great room, jacuzzi, refrigerator & bathroom. Staff was good, would have rated it 5 stars, but both days while at pool, they closed the pool at 4pm, because "the sun was setting"??? Both pools were packed on Saturday, hard to explain why the would be willing to miss out on the revenue from the bar at the pool. Also, unable to order food at pool as grill is not open until April. They charge a $20 per day resort fee, but we did not get any discount because we could not use the pool after 4pm?

Reviews.Title: “Update from previous "not great" review”
Reviews.Author: SailAwaySanDiego
Reviews.Content: Drastic improvements! No issues with power failure this time and got to enjoy the city view and the attentive service. Hotel management is responsive and customer service is truly superb. Our flight was delayed and so check in was closer to midnight versus the original 9:30 pm set arrival time. Unfortunately they gave away our original room but upgraded us to a sky suite upon realizing that our room was cancelled. Too bad we weren't there longer to enjoy the comfortable beds and luxury bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: coloskier88
Reviews.Content: The rates here are outrageous for what you get. The check-in line was long (I was surprised there were even lines at a hotel that is supposed to be one of the nicest on the Strip). We asked for a non-smoking room but the room smelled heavily of smoke. The hotel nickle-and-dimes for everything. No fridge or in-room coffee are provided. Overall, the hotel has a sterile, generic feel that doesn't seem special at all. Staff do not go out of their way to help or be friendly. The only thing I really liked was the bed (very comfortable). Otherwise, the service and amenities are comparable to mid-range hotels that are half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressive with housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: Scott B
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Thursday to Sunday. Our romm was never cleaned, despite us calling numerous times. Finally, on Saturday night at 11:15 pm, someone came to clean the room. We were sleeping The hotel was understanding and did comp us one night which was appreciated. But, one should assume that rooms get cleaned daily and without asking. Other than that, the hotel is good. Nice pool but only open until 4 during the winter which is understanding. The buffet was very good. Front desk staff were very accommodating when I asked why our room hadn't been cleaned and mad up. Good shops and great location. Probably would stay again since hotel was accommodating regarding their housekeeping issues

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie20092012
Reviews.Content: Great accommodations, convenient, very clean. The beds are extremely comfortable and the room was very large and spacious. Everyone was very friendly. The "Buffet" was very very good and I would recommend to anyone! We say Viva Elvis and this was so convenient since the show was at the Aria. We stayed February 17-20, 2012 and enjoyed it tremendously. Couldn't have been any better for our first visit to Vegas! Convenient pick up and drop off for tour buses too. So organized!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: SoCalOma
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel shines...literally and figuratively. The staff were very attentive and pleasant. It was our anniversary and we were treated to a lovely room on the 51st floor and received chocolate covered strawberries and coconut bars as a 'congratulations'. The room was very clean and well appointed. Love the shampoo! The whole weekend was just fabulous! We are non-smokers and are usually bothered by the smoke in casinos; but here, the ventilation system is amazing--very very little smokiness.

Reviews.Title: “Very inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: runningman5k
Reviews.Content: Very mixed review and indifferent stay. Valet was a joke. No signage or direction- no one there to even greet you. If you want something done right, do it yourself and self-park. Our room had a nice view of the condos across the way... The rooms are nice but have way too much technology. One wrong push of a button and everything shuts off. Way too many button clicks to get something to come on or work, expecially the TV. Also, some of the outlets were wired backwards so pressing one button would turn something else on/off. The best thing about the rooms is the bedding- incredible. For the massive resort fee charged, you would think in-room coffee service would be provided. Ah... no. And they hit you with this honor bar fridge and snacks which take up a majority of the counter space. The service/hospitality of the staff was the worst part of our stay. It is what I would find at a AAA one-diamond resort. The front desk was abrupt and curt at check-in. The only thing the clerk seemed enthusiatic in telling us about the resort was to be careful when opening the fridge for the honor bar, as incorrect charges could take place. Gee... thanks. And actually that was the ONLY thing the clerk told us about the resort. Of course, everything is expensive and IMO extremely overpriced for the value. They like to cater to the conventions/meetings, as they are a captive audience and they can suck the life out of them with $5 bottled water and coffee. We were also barged in on by the "honor bar monitor" at 5 PM without a knock or warning (my bad for not pressing the DND sign button). However, our 1/2 naked requests from our bed to leave were ignored so I had to get up and escort her out. Maybe she wanted to watch... who knows. A call to the front desk "manager" yielded no resolution and the issue still remains unresolved. If you want BJ dealt out of a shoe, you will only find $50 tables or higher at night. You may find $25 during the day. If this is AAA's idea of a 5-diamond rating then their rating system is seriously flawed.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: CtRJPRN
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas several times, averaging 2 to 3 times a year. I have also stayed at most of the resorts on the strip. I recently stayed at the Aria ( for the 3rd time), I was able to get a CORNER SUITE. The room was spacious, beautiful and clean. The beds are to die for. The restaurants top notch. The staff was also great. The morning I cxhecked out, I went to the Concierge to print my boarding pass. There ws a large convention apparently checking out at the same time as me. The lines were long as would be, when checking out 2300 people. So I asked the concierge if checkout was possible through the players' club. She made a couple of phone calls and I was all set. he took the time so I didn't have gto. LOVE THIS PLACE !!!

Reviews.Title: “Love their beds! Million dollar view of the mountains”
Reviews.Author: DTM29
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Las Vegas the week of Feb 6th, 2012. We couldn't have asked for better weather, in the low 20's. Our first impression of the hotel was crappy, we got dropped off in the underground parking garage as apposed to the front lobby like most hotels. We had to take the elevator to the casino floor and had to walk through the entire casino with our luggage to the front lobby for checking. We were not impressed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The entrance into the room was breathtaking!!! Loved how the curtains opened overlooking the mountains and city lights from the 29th floor with jazz music playing as we walked in. Wow! The rooms are very clean and their beds are absolutely amazing, best sleep I've ever had, can't say enough about that. The hotel is set back a little so it's about a 5 minute walk from the lobby to the strip. We ate at the buffet 2x for dinner, both nights was the same food, had we known it would be the same, we would have eaten somewhere else. The breakfast was very good. The hotel is very nice and big and casino was quieter and not as busy as other hotels which we liked. Be sure to ask for a room facing the mountains, the view is spectacular. The hotel theme is very modern compare to the Venetian, Ceasers Palace or the Belagio, which we found more interesting because of the architecture. Overall very nice hotel and would definetely recommend it to anyone. If you make the trip to Vegas, be sure to go see the Phantom of the Opera playing at the Venetian, it was an amazing show, would see it again. Tip: sit in the floor area midway, otherwise you'll be too far away and hard to see. Viva Las Vegas! Enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Damaris M
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the Aria for 5 nights and we enjoyed our stay. When we arrived, the hotel was booked to capacity. We got a complimentary upgrade to the Sky suites and everything was great. The first night i noticed it was a smoke optional room and we are non-smokers. I called the front desk and they offered to clean out the room which they did. The staff were professional and courteous. The views overlooking the strip, the high tech electronic control (operates your TV, blinds and sheers with a touch of a button), very comfortable mattress, great service) - we had nothing but compliments. It is one of the newer hotels, modern with an option of valet or self-parking (Vdara and Mandarin Oriental, for instance, only have valet). I highly recommend it. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel....lacks with service”
Reviews.Author: jasonc001
Reviews.Content: Checked in without a problem. Even got upgraded for some reason, which was very nice. The room size was the same but it was on the Sky Suites level, not sure how that benefited me since the room size was exactly the same. Walked into the room and there was a dirty towel in the bathtub, cookie crumbs on the floor and trash in the trash can. Went back downstairs on our way out to walk around and told the front desk of the issue. They really didn't seem to care too much...just said OK thanks, we will have to verify this. Not sure what that meant exactly. Got back to the room and everything was fixed. Not even a call to check on us the entire week we were there. They just didn't care.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TYandJY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 4 lovely days at the Aria and could not be more impressed. It is simply a luxurious, modern hotel with all the amenities. The rooms are new, clean, more than adequate in size and have a very cool computerized system to operate the curtains, climate controls, tv, etc. The bed was so comfortable that on arrival at home I decided that we need to trash our new bed and buy one like the hotel. The gym was fabulous. We found the staff to be polite and accommodating. We had a glitch with our room bill at the end of our stay and it was quickly dealt with. On other visits to Vegas we have stayed at a timeshare at the Polo Towers, the Flamingo and the Paris. The Aria is in another league all together. It avoids the kitch of the "theme" and is a wonderful example of sleek modern architecture and design. We got an amazing deal on bookit.com that put the average price per night at less than almost every other hotel on the strip. It was more than worth what we paid for it, and frankly, we would be willing to pay a little more now that we have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Aria is nice, Cafe Vettro is awful”
Reviews.Author: Audreyhhhhh
Reviews.Content: Thought we'd have breakfast at Cafe Vettro one morning instead of Jean-Phillip. Big mistake. We were seated right away, but was 20 minutes before our coffee order was even taken. Very slow service even though they were not busy. Food was just ok but very expensive. Wait in line at Jean-Phillip instead. No comparison in the food! Aria itself is very nice, rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great new resort”
Reviews.Author: wellrested2008
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights @ Aria in mid February. Beautiful rooms, with great views of the strip. Rooms are all electronically controlled. One switch shuts off lights, television and closes blinds. Fridge is stocked with overpriced traets, no room for much else. Plenty of linens, comfortable beds. Large shower atrea, private toilet afrea. Ate @ Buffett (great, $ 32.00 weekdat dinner) Breakfast @ Cafe Vettro, good omelet. Drinks twice at Todd English Pub, servers were outstanding. Next trip to Vegas will likely be staying at Aria again.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly what I had expected....”
Reviews.Author: rgulli
Reviews.Content: With all the ranting and raving about the Aria we decided to "change it up" and stay there for the Pres Day holiday weekend. Yes, the rooms were very nice..new, BEAUTIFUL views of the strip, (which we paid extra)...stayed on the 30th floor.(as other reviews, ask for highest room). nice...close to the elevator so very convenient....and all the updated amentities. Nice having two sinks in bathroom...a different bathroom with shower and tub combo (separate) but in one enclosure. Pictures on website are accurate of what you'll get. Nice electronic upgrades, however find that in many 4 star hotels/resorts (my understanding is that this is a 5 star). Downsides... it felt like the "snack box" and refrig were "in your face". Snack box took up a good part of counter space and they must have many people who "dispute" charges on their bill since at check in they give you a "warning" that refrig is very sensitive and you'll be charged. BUT, if you have a problem call immediately and they'll adjust bill. ...Not exactly a good first impression. ...Not enough outlets. If you use electronics, need phone/other chargers and bathroom applicances there are two outlets in bath and two at desk...limited. Housekeeping is late...as in most hotels in Vegas..our first night was after 7 pm. ..and then they did not replenish shampoo, shower gel, etc, no wash clothes and 3 not 4 bath towels. Had to call housekeeping the next day..which was remedied, however for a 5 star hotel should not happen. Overall the room, lobby, casino, etc. were nice, however you never got the feeling of being appreciated or happy that you were staying at the ARIA. The young gentleman, Paul, who checked us in was nice, but other than that you never really had any interaction with employees or if you did, (such as the personnel that monitored those getting on the elevators) they were not what I would consider "top notch". Also, for a top of the line hotel and spa, I felt the shampoos, conditioners, etc. were far from "spa quality" and the toliet tissue seemed like it was meant for a truck stop instead...guess they pride themselves in being "green" but I didn't think that meant "cheap". Overall, I think if you can get a room for a 3 or 4 star price, go for it. But if you have to pay a 5 star price I think there are better values for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelly0331
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last march. Will be returning this march. Love everything about the hotel. Staff was friendly, rooms are large, beds are comfortable, the whole atmosphere was great. I usually like to try new places but Aria won my heart.

Reviews.Title: “New,HUGE, top of the line resort.On the strip.Monorail a nice touch.”
Reviews.Author: tluddy1
Reviews.Content: Excellent, new resort on the strip. Is HUGE, with something for everyone to do. Many nice pools. Staff very friendly, and there when you need them. Food is very good. Rooms large, not our taste, but beautiful, none the least. Great location, near many of the places we wanted to see. The monorail is also there to speed things along. A view overlooking the pools is a good choice. Needless to say, much to do in Vegas..

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mclachlan4321
Reviews.Content: I visit Vegas once a year for a convention, and this was the first time at Ariaa, and I liked it. It has a great location, really nice rooms and a fantastic range of restaurants and bars. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fine location, front desk needs some work”
Reviews.Author: Larryope
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the Average rating is based on rating this property against its peers, including Palazzo/Venetian, Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, and Mirage. I have stayed at all of these properties for business within the last 18 months. This was my third stay at the Aria. The location is central to the Strip, and it's an easy walk or cab ride to anywhere. The most consistent problems surround checking in and out. Check in lines are not only long, but unorganized. During times when east and west coast flights arrive, the staff seems overwhelmed with many of the positions at the desk unattended. While the clerks are friendly, the process takes an unusually long time. Check out is equally chaotic. While they tout the technology in the room, I have never been able to check out using the TV. I even proactively mentioned this to the concierge, who told me that sometimes the "system gets overwhelmed". I requested an email of my bill, and three days later still have not received it. Waiting in a long line to get a copy of my bill before going to the airport is not acceptable. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The housekeeping during my stay was outstanding, as was the service in the main lounge, Bar Moderno (thanks as always to Pablo, great guy and makes a terrific Mojito). The rates here are consistently higher than other properties nearby. Unless you have a conference here or a free stay, you'd be better off at a sister MGM property or elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad...”
Reviews.Author: XUACE
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying at Aria in the past month and my experiences are consistent. Rooms are new, clean and modern...great for relaxing or business and the automatic touch screen that controls everything is great. The casino is awful, the dealers are like robots and not friendly and the service is poor. The check in and out lines are LONG. The worst part is the cab line. Because the cabs are underground only one cab at a time can pick up so plan on 30min to get a cab in the mornings. Overall it's okay...not sure I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms. Other than that? It's a Las Vegas Casino”
Reviews.Author: kvasbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for new years eve. The location is great (on the most interesting part of the strip in my opinion) and the hotel is nice and new. The rooms are very nice with a large bathroom and great gadgets. The view can also be nice if you have a room towards the strip. Our room was on the 6th floor - it had a limited view but it was totally quiet, which is good. Other than that, it's a Vegas casino just like the rest of them.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected luxury”
Reviews.Author: Sed6257
Reviews.Content: Wow- I was impressed with many aspects of this hotel. It was my first visit to Vegas and honestly I was not too excited about visiting (mainly there for business). This hotel changed my entire perception of Las Vegas. The spa was amazing. I did not want to leave! The rooms were comfortable and the "city view" was very nice. We visited three restaurants at the hotel which were all top notch. I am not a gambler so the casino was not an attraction, however, the ambiance was very modern and pleasing (did not smell smokey). I am definitely coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Pro's Just 1 Con”
Reviews.Author: Islandmomma4ever
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in on Valentines Day and I was dreading check-in fearing long lines, I had read this could be an issue. Got there about 2:00, no lines but our room wasn't ready so we were upgraded to a city view on the 25th floor which was great! Went to gamble for a couple of hours and lost quite a bit but that's not the con, it's coming. As many have already stated it is quite the hike from the elevators to our room but every time I step off the elevator I love the smell of the Aria, it smells so good. We walk into our room and again as previously stated the curtains open automatically to our arrival, that's nice. The room is modern and in darker colors. First glance the room appears to look exactly as it did online and that's good. I'm settling in and my husband says he can't believe that I haven't tried out the bed and that I was going to love it. I thought he was kidding so I sat on it and thought it felt pretty good. More on this later too. When you walk in you have two large closets on one side complete with white robes. There is a chest of drawers in between the closets. Across from the closets is the bathroom. There is a separate and private toilet area with a very tall heavy glass door, the toilet area is complete with a phone because we all know that's where we make our phone calls right? So now onto the shower/tub. I've read a lot about this and nothing I had previously read prepared me for the shower/tub combo. I was thinking it was your standard shower/tub combination that just about everyone has. Boy was I wrong. So I want to make sure you get this from my review. You open up the shower door to get in the shower complete with a rain shower head and there is a full size bathtub in there too! This is like a big closet that has a shower and beyond that is the tub and they are both separate. So if you don't get the picture you could be in the shower and someone else could be in the tub at the same time, it's just a big room with both a full size shower and a full size tub, that was a first for me. Not much else to say about the bathroom except it does have shelf space and one drawer for your stuff. In the room there is an electronic pad on one nightstand that controls everything, the curtains, the t.v., the lamps etc. All of this is up on the t.v. screen, think of the t.v. as your monitor. the room is high-tech and if you're not - well you better be a quick learner. Then there is the normal desk and bar area with a frig. All the drinks and snacks are on a sensor so you're charged if anything is moved. Later that night I finally got into bed and seriously I thought I had died and gone to heaven and that I was lying on a cloud, even the pillows felt heavenly. If you like a firm bed then this is not the hotel for you but if you like cushy then you'll be happy here. Find the M channel on your t.v. and you can learn lot about all the M properties, Bellagio, Monte Carlo, MGM, Mandalay Bay etc there's lots of good info about restaurants for a lot of M hotels. The only con with the room is that the light comes into your room at the very top of your curtains. The curtains are automatic so the light is coming in just above the track and it's bright enough to keep your room lit all night. This is really disappointing because the rest of the room is great. It won't keep me from coming though because I love the bed too much. Over-all the Aria is new, modern, and clean. I do like that you don't have to walk through the entire casino to get to the elevators but they make up for it once you get to your floor. The staff on the 25th floor was the nicest staff of any hotel I've ever stayed at. We never passed anyone that they didn't genuinely acknowledge us with a smile and a hello or good morning. I was so impressed that I called the floor housekeeping supervisor up to our room and gave her my roses that I had gotten for Valentines Day. I don't know where Aria got the flowers for my husband to give me but they were still perfect when I left. i couldn't take them home and I wanted them to be shared by the 25th floor housekeeping staff. The supervisor couldn't believe what I was doing and said I had given her chill bumps. People are not used to getting kind remarks only complaints but I like to give credit where credit is due and the staff is wonderful. I was leary of staying at such a big hotel but my stay couldn't have been any better, I guess I lucked out because it was actually very quiet while I was there. Slamming doors is a pet peeve of mine since I always try to be polite and hold my door shut but I only heard doors a couple of times. For the record, there were all age groups there. I read a review a while back that said there wasn't a safe in the room. I guess they didn't look in the nightstand drawer. Ahhh that's a new place for the safe! My other little insider tip is that their is an escalator in Aria that will take you to a tunnel sort of speak, it's not really a tunnel but it has shops and restaurants etc that take you all the way right into the Monte Carlo! It's very cool and there's not many people down there I guess because a lot of people don't know about it. My favorite thing in this tunnel is the Cupcakery, a great place to buy some cupcakes! Also a great pub with a large selections of beer.
