I bought a $4.00 cupcake and my husband bought his tiny little $16 bottle of beer and we took our goodies back to the room, yes he was able to take the beer with him. I loved the Aria and I hope you will too, I don't see how you can't. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Major Quality Drop!”
Reviews.Author: Sean M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here for a Motorola convention every year since it opened. The first 2 years we were pleased. This year it we noticed a major drop in the quality of the food. The buffet was the worst I have ever tasted, not to mention my assigned server "Maria" was to busy chatting up her friend to ever come back to give me a cup of coffee. I paid 27 dollars for a buffet that served beef brisket loaded with fat, dried out pizza and you only get one cup of coffee :( The service in the casino/gaming area wasn't any better. Every time we gambled, we waited for hours for a waitress to come by. Finally I had to cash out and go hunt down a bar just to get something to drink. The food they served us at the motorola party was even more disgusting and I didn't think that was possible. I was taken back by the attitude in the patisserie, when I asked for the barista to give me a hot sleeve for my coffee. Rolling your eyes at your customer is not exceptional customer service. I work in the service industry, so I fully understand how customers are supposed to be treated. When we 1st stayed here, the rooms were very nice, new crisp sheets, nice towels, etc. This time, the towels looked worn out and the sheets looked so old and dingy and I'm almost postive they were not changed from the last guest, for thre were some sort of crunchy crumb substance in the sheets. As if the last guest ate in bed. Our tech screen never worked, so every day we woke up hoping we were not late for meetings. This experience ruined our stay. We are not sure if we would want tostay here again until some positive changes are made.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: caroblond
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon before moving on to The Grand Canyon. Absolutely loved it - great room, great view, good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding service...and absolute comfort”
Reviews.Author: CtDvy
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews, but after stay at Aria for a long weekend I was so impressed with the hotel that I had to write one. 1st the hotel service was wonderful...the front desk clerks, concierge, maid service, room service...everyone was very friendly and willing to help with a smile. We noticed a BIG difference in the friendliness when we visited other casinos, not as friendly. 2nd the location of the hotel is great, you can walk to most casinos and also the free monorail located in Crystals is very convenient. There is also a taxi valet right in front of the hotel and we never had to wait more than a minute for a taxi. 3rd UGH the bed!!! Seriously this hotel bed was honestly the most comfortable bed my husband and I have ever slept in. Who goes to Vegas to sleep?? WE DID! The pillows, the sheets, the mattress...and the room was so clean and beautiful that it just made it so comfortable. Also the maid service really did an amazing job when they serviced our room. They even organized all my beauty products for me, just little touches like that stood out to us. 4th the grounds are beautiful and clean! It is obvious the hotel is new...the casino has very good ventilation and you barely noticed the smoking on the casino floor. My husband didn’t even notice that you could smoke until we saw ashtrays on some of the tables. The outdoor pool and grounds is very well taken care of and has a great setup. There are I think 3 pools all situated so each one feels separate from the other. Also there are hidden Jacuzzis...very tropical feeling outside. 5th the restaurants and amenities at the hotel…you never have to leave Aria. There are so many restaurants, bars, and lounges that you just don’t have enough time to fit them all in. We dined at Sage our 1st night and very much enjoyed it. They have great drinks and the décor is very nice. Also there is the Jean Philippe pastry shop on casino level that has delicious pastries and sandwiches. We also ate at the buffet one morning and we were pleasantly surprised by the selection and quality of the food. The service here was nice, but I would say definitely not very attentive…although you are at a buffet so you can’t expect too much. I wouldn't say the hotel has a stand out feature...like the Bellagio has the fountains, or the Paris has the Eifel tower...but if you want a clean, friendly, comfortable stay...then I suggest you consider Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: LK1975TO
Reviews.Content: We chose Aria as our hotel for our honeymoon. It was everything and more that we could have asked for. The location is good for us as we didn't mind walking up and down the strip. The room was so high tech and new! We loved it! We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “New and modern”
Reviews.Author: travelsalotoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights for a convention and had a great stay. The hotel is new and modern and is very clean as are most of the nicer casinos. The lobby area is clean and the service was quick and all of the employees were very service oriented and friendly. The rooms are fairly nice and have a lot of electronic features and free wireless internet. There are a lot of restaurants and bars and the convention center is also ideally located away from the noise but not too far of a walk. Actually, one nice fact is that you really don't have to walk through as much of the casino to get to the hotel elevators as compared to many of the casinos which is a good design feature. The casino was also well laid out and was not as obnoxious as many of the other casino resorts in that it was a little quieter, especially in the day for those who choose not to gamble all the time. The only real negative is that there are bright lights in front that are not blocked by the curtains and the room was too bright for my taste. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Feb 22nd, 2012 hotel stay....Not good!”
Reviews.Author: JennZ33388
Reviews.Content: I'm staying at the ARIA on business. I highly recommend business travellers to stay elsewhere. There is contruction going on outside my entrance door. I spoke to the Manager about it and he couldn't tell when it was going to stop only that we are in Las Vegas and work can take place 24 hrs a day. How's that for an answer! He offered to move me to another room but my belongings are tucked away and I leave tomorrow. finally, if you use to having a clean room in the am. Forget about it. Cleaning stops by in the late afternoon. Make sure you are not working in your hotel room during the day. It's noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good vibe, nice restaurants, still New”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveller99
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Aria for 4 days while she was working at a trade show and I was chilling out. My first time at Aria/CityCenter having stayed at many of the other LV hotels. As people know who've been there, each hotel seems to have its own unique personality/niche market. I would categorize Aria as a younger urban/hip crowd. Rooms were spacious, with lots of windows/views. I tried several services at the Spa and was happy with all of them. The hotel has about 10 restaurants, my favorite of which was Jean Georges - great food and service. Haze was jammed on Saturday night for a guest appearance by CeeLo. The hotel location is good too - connected to Bellagio on one side and Ceasar's on the other, dead center in the middle of the strip. I really enjoyed Aria and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AT ARIA HOTEL-LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: linda_travel_review
Reviews.Content: Aria is as impressive inside their rooms as their lobbies. Very clean, well furnished, service is impeccable. I will stay here again and again. Everything is just perfect. Highly recommend to anyone that would like to stay around in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: AussieOhio
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott timeshare owners so are used to staying in nice places. Well my husband and I just returned Feb. 21st from a 3 night stay at the Aria. What a beautful place. We got their early in the day before normal check in and they put us in a 30th floor room looking out at the strip. The beds are wonderful, they feel so nice. The place was spottless and the decor was very relaxing. Anyone that says anything bad about this place must be spoiled cause everything was top quality. The bathrooms have a shower and soaker tub both.We ate at the dinner buffet, crap legs, prime rib, roasted chicken, sushi, and the deserts had everything even sugar free. My husband used the gym and it was one of the largest I have seen. I ask and the place employee 7,000 people. They were always cleaning something. Great place and I hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh, Aria”
Reviews.Author: Cashester
Reviews.Content: A+ accommodations and location. Although it is a block off the strip, it's an easy walk;the hotel is centrally located to the Strip's action, and there is a free tram to Bellagio and Monte Carlo. There is a great selection of restaurants - we enjoyed meals at Lemongrass, a Thai restaurant (a friendly and helpful waiter advised my novice ordering), and Wolfgang Puck's Pizzeria and Cucina in the adjacent Crystals Mall. Cafe Vettro is next to the elevators, which is convenient for sending one's husband to get breakfast and coffee in the morning (note there is no coffeemaker in the room; also note that the minibar is weight-sensitive, so anything that is picked up will be charged to the room). There is plenty for non-gamblers to do here. One may read about the resort's features on their website, and they are wonderful, of course. But my favorite thing is the "water wall" and dancing fountain at the resort entrance. There are several benches and a few "bird chairs" (i.e., a chair crafted as a bird) to sit in and enjoy the water show with your morning coffee or as the last thing before retiring for the night (when colored lights make for a wonderful display). Be sure to see the chocolate art window around the corner from the Jean Philippe Patisserie (chocolate shop).

Reviews.Title: “a GEM in the center of the Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: Sjrabbit
Reviews.Content: 5 star accommodations, 5 star food, 5 star service, 5 star casino ... a great choice in the city center area of Las Vegas ... you can't go wrong here

Reviews.Title: “ARIA is breathtaking with very Modern rooms!”
Reviews.Author: andrakat
Reviews.Content: The experience of the Aria Resort was a good one! The modern rooms are very fun but a little hard to get used too LOL. I may just be challenged in that department. We stayed on the 16 floor and did have a little noise but my husband and I sleep like rocks so that didn't really bother but someone who is a light sleeper may want to ask for a more quiet room than ours. My parents were on the same floor 16300 room and they had no problems hearing noise, so somewhere on the side would be better than 16119 =) The only minor complaints I had was the fridge didn't work and doesn't have any room for you stuff b/c of the full and expensive mini bar. Also there are no electrical outlets by the bed so your cell has to be plug in on the desk. (I like mine right by my bedside lol) Nothing serious at all. The bathrooms are amazing/ beatuful and luxorious bedding, like sleeping in a cloud. Staff was very helpful and nice. Casino was fun and they have a lot of places to eat but everything is on the pricey but well worth for the quality you get. Lots of shopping options as well.........

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria last week for a 4 night getaway with my spouse. I chose the Aria after extensive research and the hotel delivered an excellent experience. We come to Las Vegas about once per year and this was the first time trying the Aria. I would definitely return. After a very late arrival our check in was speedy and welcoming. The hotel and lobby is visually striking with a lot of open spaces and a very modern feel to it. Very different than a Caesars or Bellagio. Various art is placed around the property, nicely adding to the decor. Our room was large and modern. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was a good size. The soaking tub was very nice after a day of walking around. Everything in the room can be controlled remotely, from the curtains to all the lighting.....thought that was a cool touch. Housekeeping was fine, the room was thoroughly serviced every day although housekeeping was pretty late on one of the days. Wireless worked fine in the room too. The casino was superb. Any type of slot or poker machine you are looking for is bound to be there. Plenty of tables too. I used the sports book and it was impressive with excellent TV's. While there were plenty of people it never felt overly crowded as I've noticed at other casinos. Must be the layout. Dining options were plentiful but quite expensive, especially for dinner which we ended up eating offsite. However, we did have the regular breakfast buffet and it was delicious with a lot of options that were high quality. One other day we had breakfast at the cafe. Not as good and overpriced for what you got. The Jean Philippe Patisserie had some amazing treats. (Try the Nutella crepe, wow!) The fitness center was top notch with lots of machines, freeweights and treadmills available. The pool looked nice and while some people were swimming it was a little chilly outside for us. The Aria is in a great location, right in the middle of the strip. The Bellagio and Monte Carlo are readily accessible and the strip is only minutes away. We stayed at the Signature last year and, while nice, the Aria's location is better. Lastly, we had Viva Elvis included as part of a hotel promo. Fun show and worth seeing although we also saw the Beatles-Love at the Mirage which we liked even more. Overall, highly recommend the Aria. One last tip, if you want a nice day trip from the Strip rent a car and go to the Valley Of Fire Park, simply beautiful and well worth the drive.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here!!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony A
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, one of the newest in Vegas. The rooms and service were top notch! It really has that "wow" effect. Totally recommend the private cabanas by the pool if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Aria is Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Travels-with-Billy
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at either The Wynn or The Venetian. Decided to try The Aria for our anniversary weekend and had a wonderful time. We stayed in a corner suite and enjoyed the 180 degree views especially at night. The room was comfortable and state of the art. The common areas, restaurants and casino are all very well appointed and comfortable. But it all comes with a price. Everything, and I mean everything at The Aria is expensive. The days of lost leaders to get you on property are over, However, we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience!”
Reviews.Author: ronandmag
Reviews.Content: First time visiting Aria because of a recommendation from a friend. My wife and I were beyond belief at how beautiful this hotel was. The decor, atmosphere, landscaping, art, colors, service, comfort of the room, dining experience, etc. were above our expectations. Our room was absolutely wonderful and the view was unreal. We stayed in a Deluxe King room and it was deluxe starting with the colors, size of the bed, large bathroom with separate shower and bath, programable lights, tv, drapes, sheers and a small safe for security of valuables. We were there for our sons wedding and he originally had the same type of room that we had. While he was checking in the front desk asked him why he was there and when he told them of his wedding they upgraded him to a sky suite at no extra charge, plus they gave him a small gift for his wedding. The hotel went above and beyond to make our stay exceptional! We can't say enough about our experience that we all had. Thank you Aria!! P.S. we booked online through hotels.com and received a $100 hotel credit!

Reviews.Title: “A new favorite in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: IxchelLufkin_TX
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Comfy beds. Love technology in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel, but not easy access to strip”
Reviews.Author: Traveling M
Reviews.Content: This resort is by far the nicest hotel I have stayed at on the strip. It is easily a 5 star hotel from the touch screen remote that controld everything from the blinds to the desk light. The service was great and even though check in took a while (it was Friday afternoon) the rep that helped me was fantastic and very friendly. They also have security at the elevators and you are only allowed to use the elevators if you have a room jey. The casino has a great lay out and you have access to tables as soon as you get off the elevators. The room was very clean and if you needed house keeping service you would just hit a switch and that would let them know and they would come right up.The only down side to the hotel was that even though it is located close to the strip it is a pain to get to the strip by walking. You have to walk a good distance before you actually get to the strip. That is what is stopping me from giving the hotel 5 stars. Also my rating of 5 stars is a little off because I got this room through "Name your own price" on priceline and the price I got was a steal at only paying 35% of thier normal weekend prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but lacking in servicethat you would expect and want.”
Reviews.Author: travelapril
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aria primarily because of its' central location. The hotel itself is beautiful and clean. The rooms are tastefully decorated. The beds are very comfortable. Pillows are too full for our taste. The buffet is average. The main thing we didn't like was the level of service that was there. There weren't a lot of people around to help with anything. To us, that was a big thing. At best, it was average. I would stay here again but my next stay will be at Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning architecture, but so so room”
Reviews.Author: Utahtravelholic
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this visually gorgeous hotel in the city center. It's location is convenient to many strip hotels (Bellagio). We were on a non smoking floor, which was greatly appreciated. However, the mattress was much too soft and uneven for both of us. Neither of us slept well, and I got a massage at the airport to deal with the back and neck issues I had developed. We ate at both the Buffett and Terrazo. Food and service were excellent. However, the casino was poorly ventilated and led to an allergy attack for my husband the 2nd night. We entered several other casinos and none were as poorly ventilated. We will not stay there again. It's not a good value given what we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice long weekend in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jo00
Reviews.Content: We had a nice long weekend with Aria as our home base. Great location on the strip. New, clean, modern hotel. Rooms were well appointed and comfortable. Great pool, gym and spa facilities (no extra charge as we paid a dailly resory fee). Casino was clean, plenty of tables to play on and not too smoky. Did not eat at any of the restaurants other than Jean Phillipe which was great for breakfast, cofee, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pool, superb spa”
Reviews.Author: SteNYC
Reviews.Content: I don't gamble and prefer small boutique hotels. So my readers are probably wondering what I was doing in Vegas. Was there for the experience and at Aria I had it at its best. This place is sheer luxury. All appliances are state of the arts and actually work. Wireless available everywhere, high speed and no passwords... Rooms are gorgeous and probably the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. But for me the highlights were the pool and the spa. Pool is free access to hotel guests, heated water. Did not know you could actually swim outside and sunbathe in Vegas in february, but you can. The spa is magnificent (there is an extra fee to access it, but it's definitely worthy). So, when you're tired of slot machines and smoking gamblers, retreat to the salt room, the hot stone beds, or a more traditional jacuzzi overlooking the city.

Reviews.Title: “Sets the New Standard in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Almanzan
Reviews.Content: The Aria Resort & Casino sets a new standard of luxury and excellence in accommodations, dining, casino play, and service. Our standard, King Size, nonsmoking room reservation got us a "standard" room (no complimentary upgrades were available) on the 35th Floor, with incredible views to the West, including gorgeous desert sunsets each evening. The amenities in the room, especially the nightstand control from your bed of the automated drapes, TV, Music, temperature, and lighting made the stay even more luxurious. Incredibly soft bed and pillows. The shower and deep bath tub combitation was unique and the bath robes added to the experience. The casino is also on par with the Bellagio, especially the complimentary name-brand drinks offered (and in full-size cocktail drink glasses - the same as if you orderd straight from the bar, yourself) while gambling. We ate a Jean Georges Steakhouse - not to be missed, either.

Reviews.Title: “Hope to return again”
Reviews.Author: MinaMickie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Aria twice now. The first time in a junior suite, which was gorgeous; especially the bathroom. Sitting in the jacuzzi bath with a breathtaking view of Las Vegas was definitely a highlight of my trip. The whole suite can be controlled from a tablet in the bedroom or by buttons on the wall which control the curtains, lights and temperature. The second time we stayed in a Sky Suite which was breathtaking. We had a three sides of views over Las Vegas. The place was so spacious, clean, modern and well designed I didn't want to leave! The hotel itself has everything you could want; decent a la carte restaurants, shopping, a fantastic spa and gym. Right next door is Crystals, which has every high end designer shop you could want. We ate at the Italian restaurant twice. The service was good and the food was fantastic. We ate breakfast both in the downstairs restaurant and the buffet (they gave us $44 off the buffet every day with our Sky Suites booking, which meant on weekdays breakfast was free) Everything has been thought of; from the bath salts, toothbrush and shaving kit in your bathroom to the well equipped desk. Good selection of movies and a fantastic room service, and if you want to sleep off the jet lag just press 'goodbye' and the whole room will be pitch black and silent within seconds. If you're out and exploring each day the hotel is in prime position, if you want to hole up in the room and relax the gadgets, decor and staff will make you wish you could move in.

Reviews.Title: “We will come back to the Aria!”
Reviews.Author: Jill P
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a beautiful property and in a great location. We had a one bedroom sky suite and it was very large with 1 and 1/2 bathrooms. The master bath had a jetted tub, large shower, etc. The living area had a round table with chairs and a wet bar with sink and both a stocked refrigerator and one that was empty for our personal use. The decor was brown, so while it was nice to come back to a calm environment after being out and about, I think it was a bit too dark. Our daughter (over 21) stayed in the living room area and 2 nights in a row, she was kept up by a crying baby in the room next door. If we had it to do over we would ask that they move us or the baby's family The service was wonderful, everyone was friendly, and our room truly was a non-smoking room. It had no old musky smoke smell whatsoever. The lounge for the sky suites was great and the drinks and snacks were nice to have at hand. The closest shops are Crystals and they are high end designers like Harry Winston. Not in our budget but fun to window shop. We had a glitch in one of the shops in the hotel. My daughter bought some clothing and when we asked to charge it to our room we were told we were only authorized to use our card for our room. It took several minutes to straighten it out and was embarrassing. We, in fact, had given them our credit card upon check-in and it was a mistake on their end. That and the crying baby are why I knocked it down by a star in the rating. Oh, and the Jean Phillipe patisserie.......incredible!

Reviews.Title: “What a five star should strive to be”
Reviews.Author: lifeisshortOhio
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the bells and whistles with great electronic features in the super clean room.The linens,bedding and furnishings were excellent quality. Nice size shower and soaking tub. The rooms were quiet but would have liked a fridge although the ice bucket was the best I have ever seen and kept the ice from melting all night!.The staff was super friendly and the location is great. Casino had a nice selection of machines and the sports book was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A Modern, Contemporary Gem on The Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: WorldwidetravelerUsa
Reviews.Content: After staying at The Aria twice in the past 2 years, it has become my preferred place to stay on The Strip. The concept behind it is unique among the mid-to-upper price range hotels there. I would describe The Aria as "upscale" and "business-class" although it certainly would be nice for a long, relaxing weekend, also. The lobbies are open sparkling, the rooms are large and clean, the staff is friendly, the restaurants are fine, the pool and gym are nice, and there is no hype or high-pressure at all. The security is good and the wireless Internet access is excellent. Although the casino is open 24 hours, the real attraction is the location in the middle of the sparkling City Centre development of shops, restuarants, high-rise apartments, and other hotels. Make sure to take the free monorail to the Monte Carlo, the Vdara, or the Bellagio. It's only a short walk to the Mandarin Oriental, as well. If you've forgotten to pack something, need to fill a prescription, or want to pick up a few snacks and drinks at reasonable prices, Walgreen's and CVS are within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BennyPL
Reviews.Content: I arrived to the Aria hotel right after a trip from Death Valley. I spent there whole weekend. Excellent place to relax and party. About the hotel: great, modern hotel, the most fresh in Vegas I supose. Big rooms, modern style, very good service. Good food in poker room (this is the place I spent most of the time) Prices are really high unless you don't know any tricks to beat the price down ;)

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, different Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ombevorder
Reviews.Content: Loved the new Hotel layout concept. Allows for a weekend getaway which combines a gambling and non-gambling experience. There are lounge and restaurants enough away from the casino sections that we could experience a relaxed evening without constantly being barraged by casino noise. Yet, casino, with friendly dealers right there when ready to gamble. Stayed 3 nights for my b'day. Upgraded to very nice room overlooking strip. Not so positives - concierge desk did not seem to have any more insight about Vegas events than can be gleaned from the Internet. Although, my wife had reminded Sage restaurant it was a b'day dinner, there was no acknowledgement. Manager rushed out as we were leaving to apologize after realizing this but still no token offer to make up for such a basic mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay here everytime I go”
Reviews.Author: joebizzy21
Reviews.Content: I love staying at Aria when I go to Vegas. It connects to Monte Carlo or it has a free Tram that will take you to City Centre or Bellagio. The amenties here are top notch. I would recommend dishing out an extra 50 dollars to upgrade to a small suite, if you are in a regular room. Well worth it. My only complaint is that the staff is hit and miss, sometimes theyre nice and other it looks like they hate their job and it can rub off. But every other part of my stay was unmatched. I would recommend staying here if you are ever in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Addition to the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: naw5080
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aria in December 2011 - The hotel is new modern and definitely full of action. I only had a night here unfortunately, but found the hotel to be beautiful with top of the line amenities. The bathroom was large, modern with an amazing walk-in shower. The room was large, dark and very modern. From the top of the line flat screen to the electronic remote controlled curtains, this hotel is amazing. There is a universal touchscreen control that will dim lights, open the curtains, run the AC and operate the TV. My toom had a large king size bed and an amazing view of the Vegas Strip and I did not pay any extra for it. The hotel has a lot of activity, in fact I had to leave at 5:00am to catch a flight and the lobby/ casino was still going strong. The bars within the hotel are definitely expensive - plan to pay $10 for a drink if you aren't gambling. I am not a huge gambler, but the overall casino seemed nice and was not too smoky. The City Center concept is really neat as you have several hotels grouped together in a consolidated area. I didnt have time to check the others out, but that means more restaurants, etc within a very short walk (as compared with the rest of Vegas where the hotels can be sprawling and far apart). My only complaints are that the entry to the hotel doesnt clearly show you where the rooms are and the signs seem to weave you through the casino rather than take you the most direct route to the rooms. I entered and felt like I walked a mile to the check-in desk and then had to backtrack to get to the room elevators -- not a big deal unless you are lugging a lot of bags. Also, when I went to check-out, there was absolutely nobody to be found at the desks. Admittedly it was 5:00am, but still... I had a question and there was no service in sight. I would completely return to this hotel, I have stayed at several other top names on the Strip and this measures up to all of those fantastically well.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: 00000001London
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review late, stayed there in October for 4nights with a friend. Was amazing. queues to check in a little long, but to be expected for such a huge resort. our room was on the 14th floor, so not that high up, but still an amazing view of the pool. room- faultless! and it was just a standard room. two comfortable memory foam double beds, black out curtain (that pulls back to show you the spectacular view when you first walk in) bathroom, great. good lighting. good taxi service. great prompt breakfast room service for when you have a hangover. theres a store right around the corner, so you can pick up bottled water for cheap. only used the slots in the casio there. fantastic. clean. couldn't ask for more. pools heated (they ask for ID at the pool bars, which we forgot to bring) loved it!! would go back in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay at Aria”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelanytime
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Aria on Feb. 12th. We were there for 3 days. What a great hotel. Check-in was fast and we had booked a city view room thru Southwest Vacations, but when we arrived, we were listed with a mountain view. Explained this to person at check-in and she upgraded us to city view. Hotel was very clean and a modern state-of-the-art hotel. You opened the door to your room and it greeted you with lights, music, etc. My favorite thing about the room was the "goodnight" plate by the headboard. When you pushed it, everything turned off, and the drapes and sheers closed. In one instance, I was ready for bed and pushed the "goodnight" and forgot my husband was in the shower. Needless to say, he had to feel his way around until he could turn the bathroom light back on. The staff was very friendly and anytime you passed one of them, they smiled and said "hello". My only complaint was the price of the food at the restaurants. They were way over-priced. We went to a steak house there to celebrate our 50th anniversary, and the cheapest steak was $54 and that included nothing else. Also ordered a refill of coke, not realizing that there were no free refills. You need to get away from the high-end hotels to get better prices on food. Be prepared to walk a lot and wear comfortable shoes. What seems close as your destination never is. It is a beautiful city to visit and if I returned, I would stay again at the Aria. The beds were so comfortable and luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: ValentineBaby214
Reviews.Content: I booked a Corner Suite for my birthday, and was upgraded to a Parnoramic Penthouse Sky Suite without even asking. At checkin I was asked if I was in town celebrating a special occasion so I mentioned my bday. The guy spoke to the manager and came back with a big smile on his face saying that I got the penthouse. I was shocked. The manager even sent up a plate of chocolate covered strawberries and cake along with a bday card. That was really sweet. I def didn't expect that. I was just fine with the upgrade itself. The suite was GREAT!!! It's quite a hike to the sky suites, but it's well worth it. The views were jaw dropping, and the decor was very contemporary. I loved the technology in the room. That was my main reason for booking a rm at Aria in the first place. :) Everything worked without any gliches for the whole 4 nights (2/9-2/13). Overall the services was good minus the room service. We orderd a cheeseburger and BLT both of which were NOT very tasty. The french fries where ok though. The location of Aria is nice. We had a rental car, but used the tram a few times. It was very convienient and free of charge. The guys working valet were friendly and helpful with directions. I didn't gamble, but the casino seemed nice. The was a good mix of people ranging from young to more mature. The Crystals Mall has a pretty good selection of high end stores. I really like the art sculptures. I definately recommend Aria based on the service and location. However, the upgrade was a BIG plus so if you're travel for ANY occasion at all just mention it. I'd also recommend signing up for exclusive email offers on their site as well as MLife.com. Corner suites would of run me btwn 1200-1300, but I only paid $725. So to get the penthouse on top of that was a great savings. The found that the offers change quite a bit so be sure to pay attention. You can always adjust the promo your reservations is booked under. I changed mine twice without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a paid business trip, not the greatest.”
Reviews.Author: NYpizza
Reviews.Content: No doorman to get the door, and no automatic doors... not a great way to start. This is the first hotel where I was told I needed to pay EXTRA for 2 Queen size beds, instead of the king.. really? And extra for a view? It's not like there is a view of a beach... a little confused. It was a beautiful place, but to get to our rooms, we had to take elevators that were next to the casino floor - that was annoying. No fridge space, It took a long time to figure out all the high tech controls on our lights and curtain. Super squisy beds with no support for your back; maybe some people like that but not me. To get to the gym, you have to walk long hallways in your sweaty clothes, past all the business people getting to their conference. Overall, considering what you pay, there should be a little more luxury and privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Tip”
Reviews.Author: mskizzo
Reviews.Content: I visited the Aria for a business conference during the first week of February and had a great time. The business conference rooms were huge, great setup, great snacks and the bar staff for the many bars in the conference hall were pleasant. The staff checking our ID's to make sure we were authorized to enter were very professional. The restaurants we ate at were reasonably priced and very good. The buffet, excellent for breakfast, we heard lunch and dinner was good but wasn't able to make it there. Seranos is a tapas restaurant and it was very unique and staff knew every menu item from top to bottom. Lemon grass was a great Thai restaurant and the staff helped out if we knew we wanted chicken. He gave us an item that wasn't on the menu, I like spicy food and he only let me get a 4 out of 10 and it was very spicy. The Cafe was good, nothing to write home about but we ate there for breakfast 1 day. The bars were a good place to mingle and talk business as they had tables and chairs that you would just keep adding chairs as people walked past that you knew since it overlooked the casino. Very nice fitness center, is has around 50 treadmills/ellipticals/bikes and a decent amount of workout machines and free weights. The room was nice and everything (curtains, radio, TV, all the lights) is controlled by a touch screen which was cool. The bed is the most comfortable bed I have every slept in and you can buy them also for around $3800. Overall this was a pleasant experience and would return back for business or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Vegas Location”
Reviews.Author: Ann100
Reviews.Content: I really liked the modern feel of the Aria and the excellent location, minutes from the centre of the strip. The king deluxe city view on 25th floor gave great views of the city. The room was high tech and of a standard in common with other Vegas hotels. The pool area was attractive and well laid out (a bit too cool for swimming though) The patisserie in the casino area was a nice touch. I would certainly recommend this as a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: Riley S
Reviews.Content: Awesome restaurants on site, great view from my 52nd floor.... I wish the fridge had room to store my leftovers and other goods (it was pre-filled); I also wish the casino didn't take all my money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Work2TravelMore
Reviews.Content: Other than VERRRRRY long hallways on the room floors, Aria has really nice rooms, well appointed, although challenging for even the most adaptive technologists. Very clean, gret style, linens, etc. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at affordable prices- the aria hotel, LV”
Reviews.Author: Gmarotta12
Reviews.Content: With the number of new hotels and the downturn in the economy especially in Las Vegas you can now stay in one of the most luxurious holes in Nevada and the West. The Aria has a corner suite that is as large ad my house, almost 1000 sq ft. Not only did I get a great rate for two nights, they included $100 food and beverage credit. I stayed some months ago and can't wait to return in March.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: PLATNMAC
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Friendly staff. Central location. Rooms were extremely clean. Breakfast at the restaurant was delicious and the price was standard of a hotel of that caliber in Vegas. Our room was a good 7-9 minute walk from the elevator, but the view was beautiful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday at Aria”
Reviews.Author: mywatches
Reviews.Content: The hotel was high scale but not perfect. Loved tram to Bellagio. Conceigre was very helpful and VERY knowledgeable! Got us wonderful seats at LOVE-Beattles. A must see performance. Housekeeping left ALOT to be desired. They were not timely in our needs! Gaming was not for ordinary gambler friendly- very high stakes hense not busy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelingwithstyle
Reviews.Content: Aria is really nice place to be and especially if you take corner suite your life will be better. It's has all electronic gadgets controlled via TV and nice big bathroom with boublebath. =)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay....but drop that "resort fee"”
Reviews.Author: regalaone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights last week. The hotel puts all others in Las Vegas to shame when it comes to the beauty of the public spaces. Every where you look you see beautiful art and soaring open spaces. The design of both the interior and exterior of the building is without compare. The check in process was quick and painless....although I could see that during busy times it would be confusing because there is no queue, you just line up behind a desk clerk and hope your line moves as fast as other lines. The room was spacious and nicely appointed. The bathroom is large and functional. The bedding very comfortable. My only real issue is the silly "resort fee" that is tacked on to room rate. It only covers using WiFi, the pool and the gym. Most other hotels give you those items as part of the the room rate, and it seems like you're being "nickels and dimed" by having this carved out and tacked on to your final bill. Too bad because I was so impressed with all other aspects of the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Buffet”
Reviews.Author: jaiallen
Reviews.Content: I am never going to the buffet at Aria again. There was bacon in a spinach salad and no listing of ingredients. Staff behaved as though they were annoyed by questions about ingredients of unlabeled items. I was grossed out and my complaint was met with indifference. I circled the buffet and came out with an empty plate. Not fair to vegetarian or vegan guests. The staff was rude and unaccommodating.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep at the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: I'm typing this from the aria. Everything is rediculously overpricd. I've stayed at nearly every strip property and this ranks near the bottom. The dealers are rude, even though the tables at night are mostly 50 a hand and up! I'll be back at MGM grand again next time, I wish I never strayed. I refuse to give this property another dime!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel -- Don't rent from Avis counter at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: newtyinnc
Reviews.Content: We rented a car at the Avis counter at the Aria Resort and Casino to drive to the Grand Canyon and were forced to wash the dust off of the car before it was returned it or pay $75. When I questioned the policy I was told they have no way to wash the cars at the resort and if they did not make us do it they would have to pay the Avis staff at the airport to come and get the car and wash it. The hotel was nice. However, the housekeeping could be better. You could write your name in the dust on the fabric headboard. The casino on the first floor was extremely smoky. So, you had to endure cigarette (or worse cigar) smoke to get to the guest elevators or from the elevators to the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Oasis of Calm in an Awful Place”
Reviews.Author: Barbie1976
Reviews.Content: Before I start my review of the Aria, I admit to hating Vegas - I didn't expect to like it (I don't gamble, I hate glitz and all the OOT-ness which comes with Vegas) but we had spent 3 weeks on a bit of a roadtrip of California/Nevada/Arizona and we needed to fly back to London from somewhere so it seemed logical to fly back from Vegas, as opposed to driving back to LA. After spending 3 nights in Vegas, I can safely say that my opinon of Vegas hasn't changed, however the Aria was a gorgeous oasis of calm and a total sanctuary away from the mayhem of the Strip. The hotel is only a couple of years old and just off the strip (which I preferred - when visiting some of the other hotels (Venetian, Bellagio) I felt they were too full-on on the strip). The hotel is absolutely huge but managed not to feel too impersonal. Our room was absolutely wonderful - huge, gorgeous bathroom, amazing views and I could have quite happily spent my time in Vegas in the room! The pool area was lovely and the nicest I'd ever seen in any hotel - although by early afternoon it did become rowdy with pool parties and awful MCing. We had breakfast included one day and the buffet was one of the best I'd ever seen in a hotel, similarly we ate here at lunchtime on the day we left and the food quality was very good for a buffet and the selection was second to none. So 10/10 for the Aria but I don't ever want to go back to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: MalcJ
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring the Strip. Rooms were excellent with high tech facilities (I loved the curtain closing and opening from the screen by the bed). Usual casino but top quality patisserie and great coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “New Upper Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4FR
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just finished 2 years ago. Wonderful new Rooms with great views and a stable interactive system. Beautiful SPA&Pool, good Restaurants (Lemon Grass), huge Fitness Center and great Location. Very good Logistics. If you park in the public car park you have to walk all the way through the casino, since the reception is on the other side and walk to the third side to get to your rooms. So make sure you drop your bags off in front before you park.

Reviews.Title: “Great time @ The Aria Resort & Casino”
Reviews.Author: CancunBeacher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Aria Resort & Casino. We had a great time and the resort was fabulous! This was our second stay here. This time we stayed in a Corner Suite on the 16th floor which was great. The unit was large, very clean, very updated and had tremendous views of the strip and of the City Center area/pools. The staff was great from the front desk to the cleaning crews. This is our favorite Vegas resort and we've stayed at most of them. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Dining is the only saving grace”
Reviews.Author: Hookieplayers
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to not use your cell phone unless you want to spend a lot of time outside the hotel. Many "no signal" spots!! Coffee in the morning? Hump it down stairs and stand in line for "to-go". Enjoy remote controls for room functions? (TV,lighting,bill review, check-out) Very difficult to operate and has limited functions. The remote is WIRED and worthless. This place is just 2 years old!!!! Want help from front desk? Forget it! After 15 mins. there was no answer. Lots of disconnects. No housekeeping! I was away from the room 9AM to 4PM. Called for service and was ignored until my return appx. 10PM. Too late! I'm in bed. Be ready to use anything you remove from the Refrigerator or Bar (even to check it out) as the items are weight sensitive and will trip a room charge mechanism you won't find out about until you check out. Shower floor is very slippery!! Throughout the hotel and casino the Muzack plays so loud it is difficult to carry on a conversation with some one next to you. A couple of restaurants also have this problem. I could go on. 3 very good dining restaurants saved my stay. Won't return!

Reviews.Title: “A Suite Idea - Aria Sky Suites”
Reviews.Author: stacey s
Reviews.Content: I just finished a week-long stay at the Aria in one of their Sky Suites on the 54th floor, 54-029 to be precise. You have a separate check-in area from the rest of the guests near the elevators for the suites and you need to tell your driver that you are staying at the suites as there is also a different entrance. The view I had overlooked the western horizon and the views are spectacular. The rooms are not over the top opulent in a good way, however they have everything you would want and more. You enter the room into a living room type area with a large screen television. plenty of seating and a half bath. There is also a refrigerator (no freezer). But what will hit you immediately is how different the room is from other rooms in the area. The building is LEED certified, basically meaning that it is very green. For example, everything is electronic, from opening the curtains, controlling the temperature, the lights and the television. It is all on a control panel that you can control from your bed or other parts of the room. when you leave, you push one button and all electrical items in the room shut down, the curtains automatically close and the service light will come on to let the staff know that your room is ready to be cleaned. The bedroom is spacious with plenty of drawer space (closets are in the bathroom). The beds are comfortable. The bathroom is large, with a separate whirlpool tub, shower built for 4 (up to you what you do with it) and two sinks. The toilet, which I would normally not mention, has certain benefits attached to it, and I will leave it at that, and the seats are warmed. Benefits: There is always food and drink available without charge to suite guests, but it is a little tricky to find. It is located behind a wall in the sitting area near the Sky Suite check-in desk. The elevators to the suites have 24 hour guards. The hotel itself has terrific restaurants, gambling, better than average shops and you must visit the sweets shop. It is also very conveniently located near Crystals shopping plaza filled with high-end shops and a CVS across the street. If you are a convention goer, this hotel was designed with the conventioneer in mind. Walks are not long. In that sense, the hotel is more vertical than horizontal which makes for a better convention experience. My only complaint is that I wish the hotel had more no smoking areas, including a no smoking lounge. If they had one, I could not find it and as with most casinos in Vegas, smoking is prevalent. I think they also inject some sort of aroma into the air which, if it was not for the addition of the smoke, might be pleasant, but instead it combines into a somewhat unpleasant small that some may find it at worst annoying. Overall, a great stay at a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great spa”
Reviews.Author: fishtravelers
Reviews.Content: Took in aria spa treatment at end of January it was great and first-class, the outdoor shared pool had incredible views and was heated to right temperature. In total I spent 3 hours plus in spa area deriding and relaxing. The buffet wad good but hardly worth the 60.00 they were charging the public, see if you can get coupon when registering online.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Paul P
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit late but none the less. The first week of December I decided that I would treat my parents to a vacation in Vegas since it had been years since we were able to vacation together. The Aria was amazing!! From the time we pulled up to the hotel which at first we pulled into the wrong lane and missed the vallet parking lane the attendent saw this and came and got our car and said not to worry about it he would take care of it since we were on vacation. Check in was quick and smooth and all our requests were met no questions asked. The resturants at the Aria were all very good. The only negative I would have is that the slots in the casino were very tight, but other than that the stay was one of the best I have had anywhere I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Wow beautiful rooms and casino”
Reviews.Author: VegasMe
Reviews.Content: Rooms, casino, service, and room service were all very good. Only drawback is that its not easy to walk to any other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “The wow factor is constant from the moment we got off the shuttle”
Reviews.Author: adriangtzmb
Reviews.Content: The Aria resort is part of the MGM group and it is their newest property, opened in Dec 2009. Their use of technology is evident everywhere you look. There are many choices for dining at all ours. Their bakery "Jean Phillipe" had the best croissants I've had in this country, hands down! We also ate at the "Julian Serrano" Spanish restaurant and it was authentic and great. The hotel is located next (South) of the Bellagio so it is within walking distance to most of the strip, at least the part that is attractive. The Aria is connected through a mono-rail (it is actually on two rails but that is what they call it) to the Bellagio and City Center (An upscale shopping plaza). The air in the casino has a slight smell to vanilla which masks very well the odor of cigarette smoke. We went into various casinos and they all smelled very strongly like smoke and the Aria's did not. That was a big plus since we do not smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel / Terrible Layout”
Reviews.Author: jenida
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the superbowl weekend. The hotel rooms are first class in every respect. The only issue I had with the hotel room was that iin my case it faced towards the front and there was some sort of a light show in the front of the building that was initially interesting but quickly became annoying as the different coloured spot lights incessantly waved over the windows. Closing the blinds solved that problem. The hotel staff was professional and courteous. The gym and pool area was very nice. The biggest issue with respect to this hotel is the location and layout. The hotel is set far back from Las Vegas Blvd and they have designed it to make it difficult to get out. I am quite sure that this was intentional and not unique to the Aria, but the Aria has taken the manipulation of the hotel guest in this regard to new heights. You need to walk through a very large casino, and then through a connected mall to get to the strip (probably about a mile). I am fit, and I could laugh at the gamesmanship, but if you are not and want to walk to the strip, or if you are in a hurry to get between hotels, you should probably choose another hotel. Of course, on a related note, the gouging of the hotel customer who is now captive, is also distasteful. 5 dollars for a take out coffee? (by the way, no coffee maker in the room).

Reviews.Title: “Amore for Aria!”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe156
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our recent trip to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Upon check in my husband and I were discussing what to do for our anniversary dinner - much to our surprise later that night we were delivered chocolate covered strawberries and chocolate dipped macroons along with a note card from Shannon McCallum, Executive Director of Guest Services. What a tasty unexpected surprise!! Thank you! The room was nicely appointed, upon entering the lights turned on automatically, the curtains opened and music and our name was displayed on the TV set. Nice touch! Nicely spacious room with 2 closets, bathrobes, and an easy to use electronic pad to control the TV, curtains, room temp and lights. Bathroom was nice and roomy too, the shower had nice water pressure. Our only complaint about the room was the cleanliness of the bathroom, it almost appeared that the housekeeping staff was interrupted mid-clean. There was no toilet paper on the roll, but luckily there was an additional roll located on the back of the tank. There seemed to be missing towels and the floor didn't appear mopped. There was some debris and spots (we hoped they were just water)!! We liked the "service" and "privacy" switches located next to the door.....although it doesn't appear that the staff took much notice, even though we had the privacy light on when we stepped out, upon our return housekeeping had been in the room. Oh well. Biggest complaint about this place is that they don't have an in room safe. I normally don't care to carry my purse with me and will often lock it up taking cash and ID with me, but I was too nervous to leave it behind unsecured so I ended up toting it around all weekend. The bed was so comfortable!!!!!!!!!!!!! My husband and I never once complained about having back pain after sleeping here, once we were back in our own bed at home - the back pain resurfaced. Time for an Aria mattress! Hotel and Casino are really nicely laid out, easy access to the tram on the back side of the hotel that takes you over to the Bellagio. Easy cab access right out front too. No in room coffee / tea makers here - so be prepared to stand in a long slow line for coffee downstairs at a none too cheap price. Also, buy bottled water from Walgreens across the street - we paid $2.59 per bottle of Fiji here compared to $8.00 a bottle in your room. Be prepared to walk if you stay here, it is a little removed from the general traffic area but we honestly didn't mind it. We were here over super bowl weekend and the temps were in the 60's so coming from the Cleveland cold - we were just fine walking! Check out was quick and easy, just make sure to double check your bill - we were charged $24 for some misc food items but once I pointed it out, they promptly took it off. Perhaps we were charged for the chocolate covered strawberries by mistake?? We usually stay at the Bellagio when we visit, but this place has stolen our hearts.

Reviews.Title: “City Center more than a mall”
Reviews.Author: BxCigrFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria for a conference in Nov 29 - dec3 2011 and the hotel was wonderful. Check in was a breeze even with me having it booked through a co-worker and via expedia. the room was a smoking room and you could not tell that it was a smoking room. The best part is when you walk into your room for the first time of your stay the room welcomes you by electronically opening up the shades turning on music via the tv and showing a welcome sign on the tv. Bell hop brought my bags up very quick and showed me how to use all the electronics in the room. The hotel has someone stationed by the elevator at all times and only allows people with room keys to go on up. Thought this was a nicer touch then just security cameras. I really enjoyed my stay here and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: dustyness
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights and the hotel is extremely nice and clean, beds are amazing. Loved the ambiance of the hotel. We didnt eat at any of the restaurants, just not my type of dining. Great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Great new addition to the strip for those who want 4+ star on a budget”
Reviews.Author: bbotch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 30th birthday. The room is gorgeous, the bed one of the most comfortable I have ever stayed in and all the amenities are first class. The resort fee is quite a rip off; would forgo evian water in the gym for this charge; it seems a bit excessive since the weather isn't really pool friendly in the winter so sort of a back door way to add money to the cost of the room, but as I said it was a good value otherwise so not a big deal. The breakfast buffet is fantastic and had great quality food; wouldn't recommended the cafe in the hotel casino though.

Reviews.Title: “Love Aria!”
Reviews.Author: cwilker792
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in several hotels in Vegas and this is one of our favorites! The high tech rooms are nice and new with a control panel by the bed that lets you control everything from lighting to music, tv and window shades. The spa and workout areas are great and the pools are very nice. Fun restaurants, with something for all taste. Casino is a little small and not the friendliest of dealers on the strip, but the aesthetics make up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great service.”
Reviews.Author: toiler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Hotel staff were very good, really enjoyed the swift valet and bell service. Pool open in winter, a nice treat. Very nice rooms, but not a suite. As stated in other reviews, the rooms are a bit on the dark side at night. Lights are dim at the highest setting. And it is easier to make the room dark by pressing the wrong button, not so easy to turn them on again. Getting a cup of coffee was difficult. No in room coffee? Had to go the casino and then wait in crazy line up. Super 8 has coffee in room. Why not Aria?

Reviews.Title: “A solid choice”
Reviews.Author: MrSimmons51
Reviews.Content: Long overdue review. Stayed at ARIA for a weekend during the summer and love it. Obviously everything is new and clean. The clubs were good and the pool party, Liquid Lounge I think it was called, was awesome. I was with a group of friends so we got a 1 bedroom suite. We were originally in a standard room but we got to the room and it was never cleaned so they upgraded us for the inconvenience. The only negative about the place was that you couldn't walk outside and be on the strip. Had to cab everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “WORST VEGAS HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED AT!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBound1234
Reviews.Content: I'm usually not a picky person when it comes to hotels in Vegas since all I really need is a place to sleep at night. Who goes to Vegas to stay in their room the whole time? This was my first---and last stay I will ever have with Aria. I spent $600 on a 3-night stay and for that price, I expected a better experience than I received. My BIGGEST complaint was that I had absolutely NO CELL PHONE service there. I shared a room with my cousin. He has Verizon and I have AT&T. Both of our smart phones were not able to send/receive phone calls and txt messages nor go online when we were in our rooms. This was a major inconvenience for us because we consistently needed to check up on our pregnant wives at home in California. We were irritated with this so called the front desk to ask if we could use our room phones to contact our wives since we could not do so on our cell phones and asked to not get charged a phone fee. The front desk said this was ok. Upon checking my credit card statement today I found out I was charged 95 dollrs to make 3 eight minute phone calls!!! I called the hotel to complain about my fee charged and they only agreed to take off half of what was charged. So I am still stuck paying 50 for phone calls that combined were less than half an hour. Ridiculous. Also, the rooms are HOT not matter how low you turn down the thermostat and staff will still knock on your door and bug you even if you have your privacy light on. So very disappointed with this stay. Quite honestly I have stayed at $40 a night hotels and have had better service than I have at this "5 star" establishment. At checkout the front desk asked how my stay was. I told them I was disappointing that we could not receive cell phone service. The guy at the front desk made up some excuse about how cell phone service was bad because it was Superbowl weekend and they had too many guests staying at the hotel that weekend. So what does that mean???? Cell phones don't work when the hotel is at max capacity? My cousin and I are card dealers for a casino in California so we like to vacation in Vegas every other month just for fun. But this stay put a bad taste in our mouths. I will NEVER stay here again and will make sure my friends and family won't either. What makes me the most upset and sad about my whole situation is that no one from this hotel will try to right their wrong :(

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel on the strip if the price is right.”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time because of a great MGM Resorts online room rate offer. The hotel is very nice because it's relatively new and architecturally dynamic looking inside and out. The room was nice with a lot of electronic gadgets and controls that operate everything from the lights to the window curtains. This room compared to other upscale hotel rooms on the strip is somewhere in the middle, I didn't think it was that special. There are a lot of good restaurants at this hotel albeit a little pricey.The check-in process for us was disappointing as there was no organization to this process at the front desk which took us 20 minutes. It would have worked better if there had been a check-in queue line set up instead of people milling around trying to get somebody to check you in. Overall it's a nice hotel if you get a good price on the room, because the regular price for this room in my opinion is not worth the value as compared to other upscale hotels on the strip. I would stay here again only if I got a good room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KikiMira
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was nice, the rooms were great, beds were comfy. Service was great. Pool area was good. Buffet was good. Haze was fun. Cons: I personally felt really out of place, Im 26 yrs old and the crowd seemed older 40-60s. It is located a ways back off the strip, walking through the shopping plaza and through the court yard was annoying to get into the main hotel lobby/casino. I got ID for a glass of water. We upgraded to a strip view, which wasnt much of a strip view because you are so far back and have all the other hotels surrounding it limits your views - not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and room!!”
Reviews.Author: xiphoid76
Reviews.Content: We had a corner suite for the Super Bowl and absolutely loved the Aria. This was our first time staying here. The room is huge with a living room, 2 bathrooms and a beautiful bedroom with floor to ceiling windows. The master bath has a tub, shower and Japanese toilet with warm seat and bidet functions - so very nice!! There is an electronic control pad by the bed which can control lights, music, tv, and more. It was very easy to use - not sure why some people think it is difficult. The curtains are also controlled by that or separate controls. The hotel itself is very clean and every one was very friendly. Turndown service was a nice touch as well. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern urban oasis in sin city.”
Reviews.Author: Btj1972
Reviews.Content: The Aria is clean and bright. Spacious and uncluttered. The room was inviting and warm, the feel of the whole place was low key relaxed and comfortable. CAfe Vetro comfortable and elegant without pretense. room service very good if a little slow. Bar Moderno cool and relaxed. The buffet was okay. Overall a great, if expensive, Vegas stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel rooms could have been cleaner!”
Reviews.Author: kraziek234
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to the Aria. While the hotel itself was beautiful the rooms were not impressive. We requested a non-smoking room and upon entering you could definitely tell someone had been smoking in the room. The quilt had burn holes in it and the room was very dusty. We called to complain and we were moved to a different room. The next room didn't smell but it was just as dusty. I can't believe the lack of housekeeping at a quality hotel such as the Aria. Based on that alone I don't think we'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA STAY”
Reviews.Author: bigjohn1806
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful stay for my wife and myself. She is from mainland China and only arrived in the USA in 2011. We have travelled extensively in China in the past and she was most impressed by the quality of this resort and its location on "the strip". The food at "the buffet" was also very good, and our room overlooking "the strip" was clean and very well appointed. We will again visit this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGirl744
Reviews.Content: This hotel has incredibly comfortable beds - WOW! However for the price I was unimpressed overall. We had zero problems and the staff was very courteous, but next time I think we will try someplace else. If this hotel was located in a city where I would actually try to get a full 8 hours of beauty sleep, I would be much more likely to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No service issues here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were lucky enough to stay at the Aria for the second time in two years. We are always treated like gold and if there is an issue, they are quick to make amends. Case in point; last visit we mentioned that the WiFi wasn't working properly. We were offered a credit which never materialized. Instead of getting belligerent, I emailed and was immediately offered no resort fees for the next stay. We arrived this time, our file was updated with the credit, our room upgraded to a strip view, and we even received chocolate covered strawberries on arrival!!! There are many things on any trip that you can decide are going to ruin your trip....OR you can go with the flow and enjoy yourself. I will be a client of the Aria for a looong time because every time we stay, the friendly staff always go above and beyond to make sure the trip is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in LV”
Reviews.Author: tomytom
Reviews.Content: Rooms and the casino area are mind blowing. Location is great, prices weren't so bad and you can always find tables to lose your money. If you can get a decent rate, you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: nicoledenise
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a Deluxe room at Aria January 27-29 and it was hands down THE BEST hotel we have stayed at in Vegas!! PROS: The hotel overall was great. I loved everything about the look, decor and place on the strip. Everything was so sleek and modern. The room was amazing. The bed was amazing. I loved that almost anything in the room could be turned on, off, or switched with the touch of a button. * 2 cool things we noticed, if your door is not closed all the way there is a little notice that pops up on the handheld that lets you know that your door is ajar. The other is if you are using the deadbolt there is a notice on your tv that lets you know that you are using the deadbolt. Not sure if these notices come up on both the TV and the handheld but it was pretty cool. The tram is also a plus and it definitely came in handy as it takes you from Aria, Crystals, Monte Carlo, Bellagio AND back! I'm not sure if there is a time frame of when the tram runs but we rode it around 10:30pm just fine. The check-in staff were friendly and they were closing down check-out lines to accommodate people who were waiting in line to check-in. It made the line go much faster. CONS: Nothing really to complain about, the only thing would be the walk from the structure to the guest elevators. This wasn't an issue with the hotel but more with the people walking around the casino. No one knew how to look around or move out of your way...but that's something to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrainsPlainsAutomobi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria on our last trip to Vegas during the SHOT Show. It was in a great location as compared to the SHOT (which was at the Sands Convention) and made a fast and cheap cab ride to and from the hotel. The Hotel itself was amazing, the rooms were beautiful and very clean. Every staff member of Aria that we passed always greated you with a smile regardless of the time of day. The casino was very modern and the service was great. I dont know if I would want to stay at any other hotel after being so spoiled staying at the Aria

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: AFBT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Aria in a corner suite. We try to stay in the nicer hotels wherever we go and this one did not disappoint! We saw some of the reviews about bad customer service and unfriendly employees but we didn't find ANY of these problems!! We didn't find anyone that was less than gracious and friendly! WE LOVED our suite! The rooms were FULL of ammenities like auto curtains, lights, toilets, a refrigerator, great shower, jacuzzi tub... I could go on and on! Our bed was Fantastic! I usually have a back ache and neck ache by the second night but was kinda sad I had to go back to my own bed! I truly miss the heated toilet seats (full service toilets in the corner suites-WOW!) and great view too! There wasn't anything we didn't like about this place! Also loved the mall attached to this hotel. Lots of eye catching features you won't want to miss; not to mention the high end stores that made for great shopping! The gym was GREAT too. Had everything we needed and more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFromSoCal
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Aria for New Year's Eve/Wedding Anniversary celebrations. We arrived on Thursday and checked out on Sunday. Check-in was easy and the staff was there to direct you to the next available check-in agent. We booked a Deluxe King Room and received a Deluxe King Room City View without asking for an upgrade - loved that! The room was nice with a large shower area and a large bathtub inside the shower area - sounds bizarre, but it worked. Everything was controlled by the touchscreen remote on the nightstand (nice feature). There’s a mini-bar area with snacks on top and a small fridge stocked with items. Also, there's a small desk next to the mini-bar with all the connections you need for your laptop, cell phone, and any other toys you may have (DVD/Blu-Ray, game system, etc.). The flat screen TV was right above the desk and appeared to be a 42". There's a safe inside of the nightstand, which was large enough for a laptop and other valuables. Internet access was included in the resort fee, which was approximately $22/per day. The elevators going up to the guest rooms were staffed with employees checking room keycards. If you didn't have a room keycard, you couldn't enter the elevators. Our floor was quiet (19th floor), but one night we smelled smoke, even though we were on a non-smoking floor. Very annoying, but we couldn't tell what room the smoke was coming from or else we would have called the front desk to have them send someone to ask them to stop smoking. We tried the buffet for breakfast on New Year's Day. The food was O.K., but we thought the pricing for the buffet was high for the selection offered. We had a buffet credit from the package we booked, so basically we received "2 for 1" pricing. We didn't try any other restaurants in the hotel, but they all looked nice. The staff was friendly and helpful except for one incident on New Year's Eve in the casino with a cocktail waitress. We reported the incident verbally and received an apology and was given the manager's name and phone number. I filled out an online survey the hotel sent me after checkout and they responded right away, via email, with an apology. They also forwarded my experience to the appropriate manager. Despite a few negative experiences, I gave the Aria "5 stars", because this is an excellent hotel and I would recommend staying here. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: iixer0ii
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd trip to vegas and last time I stayed at Harrah's for my first foray into sin city. This time I chose Aria and I must say the difference is seriously night and day. Check in was a breeze and our guest service agent Ashly (01-28-12) was extremely nice and accommodating. Very professional and polite. When we got to the room the curtains automatically open up which I feel is a nice touch. All the rooms come standard with digital/automatic controls for the lighting, and curtains which I love. Those options are controlled either thru the TV or the beside tablet/alarm clock. I can see where people not so family with technology would have problems with this but again I loved it. Also they incorporated the room safe into one of the drawers of the bedside table which i thought was really slick. Looking at the safe I saw 2 mini usb inputs which I figured are for people who forget their pin, which if true adds extra security as there isn't a master password floating around somewhere. Next is the beds. I know everyone has their own preferences on what they feel is a good bed and as far as I'm concerned these beds are phenomenal. I think its just right where it's not too firm and not too soft where you sink in. One thing I found odd was there was no coffee maker in the room. I understand they want you to purchase coffee from their shops but I felt like coffee and a coffee maker should be standard. Honestly with this place I was expecting keurigs in every room. Not even for coffee but if I wanted a cup of hot water to make tea it was pretty impossible. Also the only fridge in the room was the mini bar and that thing was pressure sensitive and already jam packed so I dared not touch or place in left overs or beverages in it. The bathroom for my room which was 2 beds I felt was aptly sized. Had 2 sinks and a stand up shower along with a deep tub behind next to the shower. Also the rooms utilize a sliding door which saves on floor space and just looks nice as well. Housekeeping was amazing. Not only did they replenish and clean they even organized our toiletries for us and neatly put away or suitcases and other random items scattered on the tables. Moving on to the restaurant and food portion of the hotel this place pretty much has all bases covered. Jean Phillpe (sp) is right next to the elevators so you can grab a cup of coffee as soon as you get off. The buffet for weekend brunch is amazing. I didn't try any of the other offerings but honestly if the buffet is that good I can only imagine. One of the things that did annoy me a bit was the fact that registration and the actual elevators are quite far from each other and a bit confusing to get to. This is really apparently when you see a lot of people walking thru the floors with the suitcases trying to find/get to the elevators. So to sum up PROS Great staff Beautiful building and rooms Love the digital touch of the room Most comfortable bed I've slept in CONS Confusingly laid out logistics No coffee maker in room No usable fridge in room

Reviews.Title: “Business-like stay...wanted more "wow"”
Reviews.Author: zzzraymond
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights this past weekend. Just about every element of the experience was well executed. Here's what I liked: -- Very central location, a short jaunt to the Mandarin in one direction and the Cosmopolitan/Bellagio in the other. -- Fairly quick check-in (at 9pm) and the rep proactively brought up the dining credit that came with our booking, even though we didn't book through the hotel directly. She even warned me about the weighted snack bar and fridge. -- The deluxe room is spacious. -- Well-equipped (and well-attended) gym and a nice, heated pool. -- Food at Julian Serrano exceeded expectations. That said, unless I'm there for a business conference or get an incredible deal, I probably won't opt to stay there as my first choice in Vegas. It's just too much of a business-vibe hotel and didn't have enough of the visual opulence (Wynn/Bellagio) or even kitsch (Venetian) that I want in a Vegas getaway. Some minor quibbles: -- The bathroom was a bit cramped for Vegas standards. And no branded toiletries?! -- The room IS dark. And with the puny desk space right in front of the TV, I can't imagine being productive in that room on business. -- The bed was too soft.

Reviews.Title: “wow again”
Reviews.Author: dougiebaby
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at Aria in a little less than a year. We booked the romance package which includes a suite and in room massages at a very discounted rate. There's something so special about walking into Aria. It's not like walking into any other casino that I've ever been in. It's calm, it's quiet it's inviting and it's warm.
