We had a tower suite on the 53rd floor looking west towards the mountains. I really think that we enjoyed every minute of our time there. The bed is as comfortable as any that I've ever slept in. The bathroom has a shower and separate jacuzzi tub. The only possible negative was that the blackout curtain didn't quite make it to the wall and it was right in front of my face, but the truth is I wake up early as a rule and usually that doesn't change if I'm up late. We ate at at least 4 of the restaurants and enjoyed the food. We did pretty well at the tables and tried most of the bars. The house bloody mary is a bit spicy, but if you like them like that, theirs' will work for you. Spa was great. All in all, it's a wonderful property.

Reviews.Title: “terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Yee Y
Reviews.Content: i went to Las Vegas few times and this hotel is the worst ever!! The first day when we arrived to the hotel, the customer service promised that they would arrange one king size bed room the next day we stayed. However the next day, they said they couldn't do it due to no vacancy. I'm 100% sure that they have rooms available but they were just too lazy to help us to change! The customer representatives were very rude too! Also, the room was too bright that even we closed the curtain, the light still went through the curtain! I couldn't sleep well for 3 days!

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of praise and many return visits”
Reviews.Author: AK_foodie2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aria in mid January and it exceeded my expectations. The service was absolutely wonderful at the front desk. The gentleman took his time to explain the layout of the resort and provided a free upgrade even though I booked through a third party vendor. The room was a good size with large windows, awesome technology set up, and was spotlessly clean. While the bathroom was smaller than some other four star hotels, it was still large and set up well. The soaking tub is actually located behind the shower which is rather nice. The bed was amazing - not too soft, not too firm and it was very hard to persuade myself to leave it! One of the best selling points for the hotel was the great service in all areas. The valet and bell desk was polite and prompt, front desk amazing (even sent someone to make sure I liked the room), cleaning staff was quite competent and nice, drink service in the casino was extremely fast, and the spa was fantastic. Even room service was fast, tasty, and not too expensive. Location is fantastic! Aria is located in the middle of the strip so it is easy to walk most places. There are plenty of great restaurants and shopping close by. Also, take advantage of the tram system to the Bellagio and Monte Carlo. My only warning is making sure bills at the eateries are correct - there was a mishap with being over-charged at the sports bar. Also, be aware that the hotel places a rather large hold on your credit card (mine was over $500 and it took them about a week for them to lift it). Overall, I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the sophisticated, modern decor”
Reviews.Author: mrbelk
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend at Aria. We loved it! The modern decor was amazing and because the hotel is not a "theme" hotel like Caesars, Paris, Venetian, New York, New York, Luxor, etc. there wasn't a whole lot of transient pedestrian traffic in the common areas. The Julian Serrano tapas restaurant provided the best meal we ate while we were in Vegas and the "Cafe Vettro" provided a very good breakfast one morning. The casino was a nice size and the craps dealers were very patient with this rookie craps player. If I had _any_ complaints (and this is really picking nits here), it would be there aren't enough towel bars/hooks in the bathrooms. Unlike some reviewers, we did notice slight hints of cigarette and cigar smoke in the casino, but it wasn't suffocating.

Reviews.Title: “Spent so much time researching my stay, so here's a long review...”
Reviews.Author: byrdyb
Reviews.Content: I just spent 2 nights here for a girls weekend, and this hotel lived up to most of the previous reviews. The crowd isn't the 18-20 year old demographic (like the Cosmopolitan) or the 50-75 year old demographic like their sister hotel, The Bellagio. Instead, it seems to have just the right mix of experienced Vegas people and non-gawkers or deal seekers. Upscale and modern without being overly ornate (i.e. too expensive). The very first impression when we walked through the door was how nice the hotel smelled. For those of you who go to Vegas on a regular basis, this is unusual and very welcome! My friend said it smelled like freshly made waffle cones. The benefit to a new property is that they have obviously installed state of the art ventilation as they allow smoking, but you really don't notice it. Check-in was simple, and lines weren't bad even for a Friday afternoon. The room (15th floor and a long walk from the elevator) was comfortable, although next time I will request a non-city view as the lights from their small fountain shined into our room all night, despite the "black out curtains." Hotel halls were nice and quiet - I never felt like we were in the midst of someone else's party. The Master On/Off for the electronics was great, but we had glitches each day we were in the room. The iPod connectivity had to be repaired, the outlet on the connectivity panel flipped a circuit off, and the television knocked out twice and had to be rebooted by engineering. Be prepared to bring your own audio cord for the iPod, or you'll have to pay for one in their mini-bar IT kit. And be sure you don't even touch or slightly bump anything on the mini-bar as it's all connected electronically and you're automatically billed for it. The fridge does not have any room for anything you might bring in, so fill up on ice on the way to your room. Beds were very soft and comfortable, but the room does sleep "warm" so set your thermostat lower than normal if you like a cooler sleep. It was chilly outside, so the whole hotel was a bit warm in general. Pools are beautiful, and one was kept open despite the cool weather. We used the spa both days. The $30 fee seems high, and for the short amount of time we were in there each day, I'm not sure it was worth it. We opted for salon services (hair, makeup) rather than a massage. If we had booked a spa service, the day fee would have been waived. Their steam and sauna rooms are wonderful, and the plunge pools (including a roof top one) are beautiful. Lots of amenities in the locker room, and the showers in the spa are several steps up from the low-pressure showers in our room. Spa staff was OK, but not the friendliest I've come across. A few seemed grumpy, and seem too fatigued to even speak complete sentences. The Salon staff was very friendly, and went out of their way to make us feel at home and comfortable. The fitness room was huge, well-equipped, and very friendly. The casino was a lot of fun. Craps tables and the slots were great - casino staff and waitresses very attentive and friendly. We tried two restaurants - the main cafe for breakfast, and Lemongrass for dinner one night. Both very good and reasonable. The room service was tasty, too - also very reasonably priced. The Aria is connected to the Bellagio, Vdara, the Monte Carlo, and the Crystals shopping area. Two Starbucks are located within walking distance (through the hotel) at the Monte Carlo, and the Aria Express Tram takes you to all the stops. We hit the Hyde Club at the Bellagio on Saturday night, and we're so glad we did! Although the Bellagio is an older property, they've hit the nail on the head with the Hyde club - a lot of fun, great DJ and music. Another cool thing about this hotel - they offer a reasonable half-day rate, which is perfect if you have a later flight like we did. Allowed us a lot of flexibility to go to the spa, have a leisurely lunch and rest, and spend more time in the casino without having to drag our luggage around or check it at the bell stand. Definitely worth it. All in all, we had a good stay. I wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel again with a few small changes.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: biztravler50
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aria in January and was very impressed by this hotel. Besides the 'high tech' nature of the rooms, as referenced by other reviewers, the check in was very quick, hotel service was fantastic and the restaurants were very good. There is a little coffee and pastry restaurant by chef John Phillipe and the pastries were great! I also ate at the buffet and I was quite happy with quality of the food there. I especially appreciated the fact that the casino had NO smell of smoke. They pipe in a vanilla type scent and the ventilation system is so good that you don't notice it at all. If I had to say one negative thing, it's that there is no coffee service in the room so you have to leave the room and walk all the way to one of the restaurants for coffee. I think this is probably true of all Vegas hotels though so they get you out of the room and into the casino :) I would definitely stay at this hotel again on my return visits to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Luv_Montreal
Reviews.Content: Check in- We checked in on a Thursday, it wasn't so bad. We waited about 10 mins in line, and got our rooms and everything in about 10 mins as well. being with another group of friends, I was happy when they where able to put us on the same floor. Room- We had a corner suite. It was well worth the money. The space is just perfect, I didn't feel boxed in. The bed was amazing, i had no problem falling asleep. The view isn't the best on the strip, but for the location of the hotel, our view in the room wasn't that bad. It faced the Monte Carlo on one side, and the other side faced the highway with the back drop of the mountains. Like many hotels in Vegas we had room service twice a day. Everyone keeps complaining about the room technology, honestly people its not that confusing. Maybe cause I'm in my 20's, I don't know. but the main remote control is very easy to use, it turns on and off the lights in every room, as well as controls the curtains, privacy status, TV, and so much more. It took me 10 mins of playing around with it, till I became an expert. For those of you who are getting a corner suite, get ready for the LONG walk. Staff- our housekeeping lady, wasn't the friendliest person. She left her cleaning products in the bathroom, after leaving. took our bathrooms without replacing them, and barley mumbled a thank you after handing her money. Whatever I'm not one to dwell on the stupid stuff, but it was just an observation. Andre one of the security/door men made up for any rude staff we encountered. He was so funny, helpful, and knowledgeable. Chatting with him, was so great, always full of laughs. The casino waitresses are nice, but I was in utter shock when we handed a waitress 5$ Canadian ( we where out of USD at the time) , she looked at it and said I don't know what this is, and refused to take it. I was almost ready to bring her to the cashier and ask them to explain her the difference currencies of money. With the amount of Canadians that visit Vegas, I was at a loss of words to tell this lady. Location- Location of this hotel is good, right in the middle of the city centre, cant get any better then that Restaurant- we ate at cafe vettro 3 times, and every time there was a line, but when you finally get in the restaurant the first thing you notice are all the empty tables. Im convinced its a gimmick to have you wait in line; a way to make people think this place is happening, I could be wrong but that's my hypothesis. The food is good, nothing special to it. They have good breakfast, but like many hotel restaurants its pricey check out- We checked out on a Sunday, so I wasn't surprised when I saw the long check out line. It was to be expected, we waited about 30mins in line. Nothing more to say about that :) Overall its a good hotel, very modern. Even though we ran into a few hiccups. Somehow they made it up to us. my review may sound a bit negative, but my experience at this hotel is far from. I just want to point out some stuff that might be challenging for some people. This is so far my favourite hotel in Vegas, and I'm pretty sure we'll be back in a few months

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but a bit of a walk to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: LewNY
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with modern facilities. The rooms' technologies are really the best of the world. The fact that everything is so new makes the stay quite pleasant. One issue for this hotel though: it's not directly on the Strip. You have to walk past the casino, then the Crystal shopping atrium, before you can hit the Strip. And even after that you are still not on the ground but on an elevated walkway. This makes going out to the Strip and other hotels (i.e. Planet Hollywood) a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great. Two nights of comfortable and enjoyable stay. Quick check in and check out. We had arrived 5 hours late due to our flight being delayed,we were exhausted and the bed was very comfortable so we could get a good nights sleep. The rooms were very clean and my husband loved all the modern electronics.....hit the good night button and all the lights shut offand tv. Remote for the black out curtains and sheers. The main reason for our trip was to see the Garth Brooks show.....excellent we loved it and wished it was a longer show. He was a one man show (no band)and well worth it. Trica sang two songs with him and they were great together. We did find that the reastaurant for breakfast expensive.

Reviews.Title: “What ARIA waiting for?”
Reviews.Author: VancouverSquirt
Reviews.Content: the cleanliness of this hotel along with the state of the arr rooms will keep me coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: Macca48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aria in October 2011 for one week and throughout that time we had the most fabulous time. The hotel was the best we have ever stayed in sheer luxury, the staff were so professional, nothing was too much for them to make sure your stay was the best ever. Where the hotel is situated is right in the middle of the strip so it was just right. Everything at the hotel was second to none, the entertainment, the restaurants, and the shops. Although we had a slight problem at the beginning of the week, 2 different Assistant Managers made sure we were compensated without any fuss, so may I say to the ~Directors of this hotel, well done for the design of the hotel, and the training given to make sure all staff were pleasant, helpful, very very smartly dressed, and more than willing to solve any problem you had. I highly recommend this hotel as it has been the best we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Las Vegas option”
Reviews.Author: caymanboundanddown
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a wonderful location. Within easy walking distance to most other casinos, and a short cab ride to anything you want to see on the strip! Room was very clean, modern and different from the other "bland" hotel rooms you usually get in Vegas. Didnt gamble much in the casino at the Aria, prefer other casinos more (Wynn, Bellagio, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway at the Aria”
Reviews.Author: ccrider1953
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay was very special because of the modern decor, everything electric (drapes, lights, etc.) Very clean and the staff was very considerate and nice. The beds & pillows were so comfortable - could have stayed in bed all weekend. Had a good lunch in in restaurant for lunch which was very good, but our breakfast was not hot and the wait staff was lacking. If I come back to Vegas, it would definetely be here.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Football Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ligmv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria during the NFL playoffs and had a blast. The Sports Book is fantastic and the quality of the picture on the giant screens is better than we've seen at the other high end hotels. The Aria is beautiful but I do have to say that the air quality was not great. There was a lot of smoke. We had a corner suite that was wonderful but the bathroom floor had not been cleaned as well as I would have liked. Overall, though, I highly recommend the hotel. The crab legs at The Buffet were delicious and they steam them if requested.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: araxi
Reviews.Content: The Aria Hotel and Casino is a great resort. Specifically, I like the Gym and Spa and of course the Pool area. During my visit, it was a bit to cold to lay out at the Pool, except the Jacuzzy. The service is great, the rooms are well appointed, there is a great upscale Mall right next to the Hotel - Restaurants in abundance, ranging from Spanish Tapas at Julian Serrano to Seafood and Steak. Overall a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Naper2
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Aira. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are great. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom had 2 sinks, lighted vanity mirror, separate toliet area, and a bathtub. I never use the bath at hotels but did this time as I walked so much I needed to soak my feet! The shower was one of the best we've had lately. The drapes and lights open upon your entrance to the room. It was a bit confusing figuring out the drapes and lighting system but was convenient once it was figured out. The room did not include a coffee maker which was disappointing. Room service was very fast and good. The hotel has very good restaurants. Had great meals at Serrano and Lemongrass. The fitness center is very well equipped. Lots of weight machines and free weights and many cardio machines. The center looks out onto the pool area which is a very nice view. I would definately stay here on our next trip. I am taking off one star because there was no coffee machine in the room. I like a cup of coffee first thing and don't like to order room service right away.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and fresh environment”
Reviews.Author: GLFCHK228
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria the 19th through the 22nd of January and really was impressed with this "City Center" hotel. Immediately noticed the ventillation system must be amazing, as the usual smell of cigarette smoke was not overwhelming when you enter the casino. Rooms are large and comfortable with great views. I even forgot my prescription and housekeeping mailed it to me the following Monday. I will definitely return to this high touch service soon!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Vegas Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TeamGumz
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel location is that it is in the middle of just about everything. It's a quick walk to anywhere you want to go. The hotel itself was very neat and modern, well laid out and very clean. The service staff were very helpful, and the waitstaff prompt and polite. Our room faced away from the strip, which we saw as a good thing. The bed was excellent, the view stunning, and the technology was impressive (lighting, drapes, TV, music were all tied into a touch-screen remote- my wife LOVED this). We ate lunch at Cafe Vettro- excellent, had coffees and croissants at The Roasted Bean- tasty, and had drinks poolside- expensive. Everything was done very well with your typical Vegas showmanship in mind. The only real problem we had was the strong smell of vomit in the bathroom. We notified the shift manager who sent someone up right away. When we returned later that night, you could tell they cleaned well, but the smell was still there. Later (after 3 trips for housekeeping) we found out there was uncleaned vomit located in a hard to reach corner. To recompense us, the manager on duty offered to give us a free room upgrade which we turned down as it was not worth moving on our last night. Instead, they gave us a $50 dollar credit towards room service or hotel bar/restaurant bill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Clevelander5
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay was comfortable and enjoyable. Our bookings included free SPA passes, room upgrade and breakfast comps, which otherwise would have added quite a bit to the stay (there are a lot of deals out there!). The room was very comfortable, but it did take a little while to figure out all of the electronic controls for lighting, drapes, etc. Staff were all very courteous and helpful. The Buffet restaurant had a great deal on the weekday breakfast buffet at $16.95 (price of an omlette in the other restaurant). The only bad expericence was a marginal bartender in the casino lounge. Overall, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KaseyR
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas for business a few times a year, and I have to say, the Aria is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed in. The staff go above and beyond to make sure that your stay is comfortable, and that you're taken care of. My room was amazing - huge, great views, comfortable bed, and the automated room (lighting, tv, music, windows) is great! The hotel restaurants are delicious - I'd recommend dim sum for sure, the best I've had! A great hotel, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Danno80
Reviews.Content: Very clean, upscale hotel in a good location on the strip. Disappointed that MGM resorts charge a $20/day resort fee, just add it to the nightly rate. On a positive note, we received free tickets to a Cirque du Soleil show because we stayed 3 nights. The room was very technologically advanced, which was cool but we did experience problems with the motorized drapes the first day. The problem was fixed promptly. Like other reviews, it was a 'neat' feature but sometimes easier to just use a tv remote of light switches, especially if the control is located on your wife's side of the bed as was the case for us! The bathroom is setup rather odd, in my opinion, with a soaker tub in the shower enclosure. Maybe due to the setup, the shower seemed to smell musty. Oddly in a Vegas hotel, I couldn't find an in-room safe. The staff was great, we didn't eat at the hotel as we like to explore the city when we visit but we grabbed drinks at the lounge near the elevators. Very nice vibe with live music. Overall, Aria is a great resort, unfortunately due to the time of year we didn't venture out to the pools. I would recommend staying at the hotel, especially if you can get a good deal on the rooms like we did, otherwise I'm not sure it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but oh those room controls”
Reviews.Author: 65oski
Reviews.Content: Midweek stay at Aria to celebrate the wife's birthday. Love the architecture and the decor, plenty of restaurants and lounges. Room on the 21st floor with view of (part of) the Strip...probably better view from higher floors. Very quiet, lots of storage with two closets and several big drawers. Marble bathroom had good lighting (she likes that) and a makeup mirror. Funny, no way to fill the basin with hot water to shave, so I had to leave the hot water running...might be an opportunity to get "greener". Shower floor was marble, so be very careful as it can be quite slippery. I like a shower with more water but they have struck a decent balance between conservation and consumption. The touch screen room control supposedly handles all the room functions; lights, curtains, TV, temperature. I guess it does but what a pain. Found it faster to get out of bed to turn of lights, use the TV remote. Motorized drapes were about all that was really handy. Not a system Steve Jobs would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms still disappointing relative to other upscale offerings”
Reviews.Author: Jenz99
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Aria for a conference in early January, and was disappointed to see that no changes have been made to the rooms since I stayed shortly after the property opened. My biggest issue with the room is lighting - even with every single light turned on it is very dim, and makes working/reading extremely challenging. Now I know they prefer you don't stay in your room in Vegas, but I did need to get some work done and conditions were not optimum. Never had this problem when staying at Encore, Bellagio or Venetian. My other main issue with the room is the bed - I am a very warm sleeper, and never use any type of down bedding as it makes me very uncomfortable. Aria lines the mattresses with some sort of down mattress pad, which is impossible to remove if you don't want to sleep on a naked mattress. Even with the air conditioning set in the low 60's I was very warm and struggled to sleep more than a couple hours a night. Ended up going home with a cold after three nights of little sleep. From a service level everything was fine with our stay - check in took less than 10 minutes, we never had any issues with housekeeping and hallway noise was non-existent. All of the public areas were well maintained, and I was very impressed with the fitness center. Went down a couple of times between 7 and 8 in the morning, and had no trouble using whatever equipment I wanted. Internet speed was good in both the room and the conference facilities. Did not eat at the property other than the conference food, and was not impressed with anything served during the conference. Most of it was pretty bland, and looked like it had been left sitting out awhile before it was served. I am a big fan of the food offerings over at Cosmopolitan, and ate most of my meals away from the conference over there. Overall not a bad hotel, but I still think you can get nicer rooms that are not a half mile from the Strip for a similar price. If I was going on my own dollar instead of for work would much prefer either Bellagio or Encore, as they feel comfortable and warmer. Also like the ambiance of the casinos at those facilities a bit more. If you can get a good discount on a room would not hesitate to stay here, as the issues are minor and overall service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dreamer8313
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria in December 2011 and it had the best mattress I've ever slept on! The room was modern. My mom and I chose an Aria Deluxe Queen with a Strip View and we couldn't have chosen any better. The buffet was amazing, the food was great and the overall ambiance of the hotel was just wow! I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, family or business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Aria resort Casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elena T
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Aria many times and so far it's been always a good experience for me and my family. Cleanliness and pleasant scent in the air inside casino is one of a distinct feature I look forward to and Aria has that.Elvis show is very entertaining and excellent performance.The buffet at night has lobster and a choice of white or red wine and huge variety of food choice. The spa is one of my favorite things to experience everytime I stay there. The stone room and meditation room is a plus and the one thing i always want to do early in the morning to start my day and feel refreshed. I always recommend it to my family and the staff are excellent. Ginger and the rest of the staff are always very helpful even at their busiest times. Overall I highly recommend Aria resort & Casino specially for its modern details are pleasant to look at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TheWasabiPea
Reviews.Content: This is a newish, modern hotel in Las Vegas. The hotel and its casino have more of a regular hotel atmosphere than other Vegas hotels that I've stayed in. This can be good and bad. Apart from the slot machines, it doesn't feel like Vegas within this complex. While this can be refreshing after spending a few hours on the strip, in some ways I enjoy the Vegas-like atmosphere in hotels like Ceasar's Palace and the Bellagio. Rooms are well equipped with electronics, however there are no tea/coffee making facilities. The bed was very comfortable and overall the room had a luxurious feel without being over the top. We had a City View room, however I think it may not be worth paying the extra price for these rooms as the windows are very dusty. The view is ok, but not spectacular. Overall, service was as expected at large Vegas casino hotels - obviously don't expect personalised service that you'd get from a boutique hotel. Front desk were polite and helpful. However, it can be frustrating to arrive back at our room at 4pm and find the room hasn't yet been cleaned. On one day, we got back to our room late afternoon, the room still was not cleaned. We were getting dressed to go out that night when the cleaners arrived. We asked them to return in 10 mins. However when we arrived back later that night the room still was not cleaned. We had family staying in another room at the hotel that had the same experience. This needs to be improved. I think they are either understaffed or badly managed. We used resort credit to eat at the buffet for lunch, as the other restaurants were closed at the time. I'm not a huge fan of buffets, however the food was quite nice. Like most places in Vegas - be prepared for long walks everywhere! Other than that, Aria is a good base in a relatively convenient location near the middle of the strip. I'd recommend for regular Vegas visitors and those who prefer a more regular hotel experience while still staying at a casino on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good convention ctr, but not my top pick in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: VermontGolfer
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a conference and stayed on property. Pros: Hotel room was easy to get to convention center. Convention center was easy to navigate. Convenient to get to Vdara, Cosmopolitan, Mandarin or Bellagio. Check in/out quick and easy. Bell staff and bag retreival also quick and easy. Free wifi in room. Cons: No AT&T or Verizon service on property. I mean zero. Had to go outside to phone. Hotel room was small and understated for the money. The Venetian, or the Palazzo have mammoth rooms with all the same functions for the money. Gaming area felt confined. The ceilings were lower than other casinos on the strip. Smoke hung in the air. Didn't see many (or any) non-smoking gaming areas. What else can I tell you? Sports book was ok. Small for sure, but the lounge chairs are cool. Negative: can't order food while watching the games. Skybox Grille has great buffalo wings. Room service is prompt and got the order right. The room has auto blinds and some other tech which was convenient. The blackout shades don't exactly black out the sunlight - FYI. On balance - I don't think I would stay here if I was paying. But for a convention center facility - it wouldn't be awful if they can resolve the phone issue. That - is a big reason to go with the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Posh place!”
Reviews.Author: globikeki
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for a girls' weekend trip to celebrate a birthday. We both loved it! We were upgraded and had a lovely plate of massive chocolate covered strawberries and macaroons delivered to our room in honor of the celebration. It was a nice touch. We found the rooms very peaceful (given how loud and noisy Vegas can be!) and the decor was very relaxing -- made for an excellent night's sleep! Everything in the room is operated with a remote too - kill the lights, draw the drapes -- and we had a stunning corner view of the strip - it was the best. Granted the bathroom wasn't terribly spectacular...it was nice and I liked the glass and the separate toilets - but these types of amenities are de riguer these days in Vegas. I think the service, the peaceful setting, and the service made it great. I also like that they check "guest only" access to the rooms - you have to show your key card to get to the elevators. This is a pain, but then also prevents weirdos from coming up the elevators with you. I found the hotel extremely manageable -- as compared to walking miles and miles for an MGM room or Bellagio. I would defn stay here again - and it's adjacent to the best shopping and several delicious restaurants - JP, Serrano and Blossom were terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mayreese
Reviews.Content: Loved the customer service this hotel had! Our luggage were carried up to our room. 5 minutes later we get a complimentary tea with fruits and snacks. The room lighting, electronics, and curtains were controlled by a tablet beside the beds and there's even a master on and off switch near the door. You don't have to hang a privacy door hanger because they have a button for it already. The area was walkable distance to the strip. City Center mall in the same complex. Although the mall was mostly high-end brands. Casino just down the elevators. Variety of food place in the complex. Easy access to cabs. 10 mins cab to both South and North Premium Outlets. Room was clean and bathroom had 2 sinks, marble walls and floors, glass doors to shower and tub and toilet. I really liked the 2 sinks because my friend and I didn't have to wait for the mirror and sink to get ready. I actually don't know how much the rate was because it was a birthday present. =/

Reviews.Title: “Vegas for 30th bday”
Reviews.Author: KB-TTU
Reviews.Content: Really liked the Aria hotel. It was new so that meant very clean. Everybody was very nice and that included all of the dealers. My experience in the past all of the dealers in Vegas did not like there jobs or like dealing with customers. Arias dealers seemed to be having fun, well about as much as you can at work. We went to the Elvis show and thought it was so so. I have seen Beatles, Zoomanity, and others and would but the Elvis show at the bottom. They comped the buffet for breakfast and it was Great. I did see the price they would have charged and it would have been $75.00 for 2. Dont know if I wont to spend that for breakfast but if it is comped jump on it!! Also ate at Julian Sarrono (sp?) and it was very good. You also cant beat the location or the Tram that will take you to the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Unreal hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cheri V
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous! Amazing, state of the art rooms! Wouldnt stay anywhere else in Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great conference hotel and more”
Reviews.Author: Wimbledongirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a conference at Aria in Las Vegas. Wonderful location mid-strip, although this resort property has so many bars, restaurants and cafes that you need not leave to be happy. Connected by walkway are the Vdara and Monte Carlo and there is a tram for all the City Center properties, which will take you to the Bellagio. The rooms were fab. If you are technologically challenged, this is perhaps not the hotel for you -- but we found it very cool and fun to play with. Wonderful views -- even from the 19th floor from the full length glass windows. Concierge was very helpful, even called back a few times after doing further research on my needs. The casino on this property is not as large as some of the other hotels, but it is so much better in terms of smoke than any other casino I walked into. In some of them you could cut the smoke with a knife. In this one the ceilings are very high and they must have a better air filtration system (as it is a fairly new property) One fun fact -- the bathroom shower and tub are in a combined space with a cool design. Definitely use the tub and make sure you fill it fairly full. When you get in and it goes up over the lip of the tub it will drain straight into the shower (sort of like an infinity pool). I had only one slight complaint and this is not big enough to reduce my rating. The bathroom amenities were not the high quality that you usually get in a luxury property... Guess everyone is trying to cut costs.

Reviews.Title: “Aria--if the price is right, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rob--RK
Reviews.Content: From the start the service was great. Stayed in a deluxe city-view room. Most things were remote controlled. Room was clean. There was, however, a large spot on the carpet that was taken care of but the stain remained. A bit disappointing for a 5-star rated hotel. Everything else was great: bed-super comfortable, food, room service and service in general. Another creative hotel on the strip. City center is quite impressive as whole. If you can get a regular room for <$150, it's a good deal. I'll stay there again next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Aria is most definitely 5 Stars!!!”
Reviews.Author: Suzan K
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at the Aria Hotel in Las Vegas, it is absolutely a stunning hotel. We stayed in the Sky Suites, a corner 1 bedroom penthouse suite with a panoramic view, it was Awesome! The Aria had a limo pick us up at the airport and drop us back off at the end of our trip, My husband and I were celebrating 30 yrs together, and when management found out, they sent up their 'best' bottle of champagne along with a platter of milk chocolate covered scrumptious strawberries.... If you are able, do stay in one of the Sky Suites, you will not be let down, it is worth every penny. The room is almost 1500 sq. feet, we held a dinner party for some friends and it turned out fantastic, dinner was served in our dining room, with a night view of the Vegas strip that was out of this world! The management and staff truly outdid themselves, we had exceptional customer service, by everyone we encountered during our stay. Would have rated 10 stars if I able to!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really like Aria. Good Scent and Good Service.”
Reviews.Author: Viviana L
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip to vegas and I chose aria. I stay for 4 nights. The room is so clean and nice. Trust me, the lunch buffet of Aria is more more and more better than Wynn and Bellagio, best service and good food, beautiful view. Next time definitely choose Aria again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bktslt
Reviews.Content: Aria is a great, contemporary resort. It is, in my opinion, far superior to the ubiquitous kitschy themed hotels dotting The Strip. The rooms are fresh and modern in their design. Public spaces a classy and well appointed. Staff is friendly and amiable. My wife and I stayed here January 18-22. We had a King Strip View Room on the 19th floor. Room Likes: The technolgy in the room was great. The bedside, touch-screen remote that controlled the room ambiance (drapes, lighting, heating/cooling, TV, music) was pretty cool. There was plenty of storage, and the bed was super comfy. Room Dislikes: We had neighbors on the last two nights, and I could hear them talking in the mornings. There is a fountain with dancing lights in the main driveway. The lights bounce around shine pretty brightly into the room at night (only really an issue if you want to sleep with the drapes open). Room Tips: If you are looking for the room safe, check the drawer of one of the bedside nightstands. I was a little stumped, and it was the last place I looked. Safe is fairly small. We had a laptop and a tablet in there and there wasn't much space left. "Privacy" and "Service" buttons are located next to the door and dispay a red or green indicator light to the hallway. We left the "privacy" button illuminated the first day, and didn't get room service as a result. To the resort's credit, there was a message on our phone that room service had been skipped, and that they would come and clean later if we wished Public Spaces/Dining: The Casino is a more muted and classy than the themed hotels. The clean, dark color scheme and a lack of garishness were nice. The lobby, though busy, never felt crowded. We ate at the buffet for breakfast/brunch twice. There was a wide variety of choices: standard steam table breakfast fare in addition to, sushi, prime rib, brisket, deserts, etc. The optional bottomless Mimosas or Bloody Marys are definitely worth the additial 6 bucks pp. My only complaint was that the beverage service was a little slow on Saturday morning when it was pretty busy. To their credit, the staff had their hands pretty full. We also had lunch with friends at Skybox, the sports bar on premise. The food was good, and the service attentive. We had breakfast at Cafe Vettro twice as well. Food is tyical american breakfast fare, and was pretty good. Be forewarned: as with everything on The Strip, it's spendy. Between breakfast for two of us and a Bloody Mary and Mimosa, we were out out 80 bucks plus tip. Staff: We were consistently greeted when we passed staff members in the hallway. The wait staff at all of the restaurants were friendly. The cocktail waitresses at Bar Moderno, which due to proximity to the elevator banks was our official meeting point for travel companions, were friendly and efficient. Overall, we both felt that Aria offered a great value for the atmosphere it provided. We will definitely be staying at Aria next time we are in Vegas. Mr. BKTSLT

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy45
Reviews.Content: Had another fabulous visit to Aria Sky Suites earlier this month. We always feel so welcome that we sincerely miss the property and the people each time we leave. We spend about 40 nights per year at this hotel so it’s safe to say we are regulars and know the hotel very well. With that being said, after staying in many other hotels in Las Vegas this one is by far our top choice. The Sky Suites are a great choice with excellent service from the driver and limo at the airport to the speedy check in and escort to the suites. The rooms are beautiful and inviting. VERY Comfortable beds, large roomy bathrooms, steam showers, wet bar, fabulous view… what more can I say. Well.. a lot. People find a lot to complain about and I just don’t understand… Long walks to the room, smoke in the hotel (yes I hate the smoke too but its Vegas… hello!), inability to figure out how to open the blinds etc…. some people just can be pleased and should simply go stay at a small hotel off the strip or skip Vegas completely. Our most recent visit was during the very busy CES week. Our hotel was 100% full and extremely busy. There were a few times we waiting longer than usual for service at restaurants (which is understandable), but otherwise everything was wonderful. The staff is wonderful here. If you spend any time here you can get very attached to the wonderful personalities you will meet and continue to see on continued visits. They don’t seem to have a lot of turnover which tells me the employees enjoy their work environment. I’d like to send a shout out to Tyrone and “G” at the bar outside the sports book. Fast friendly service every time. We make a point to visit several times a day. We always enjoy visiting with them. While I have a hard time finding anything negative to say about this place we were disappointed with a visit to the Deuce Lounge on one particular evening. (this lounge is not owned and operated by Aria). We counted 78 customers in the lounge at 6pm and ONE server. That poor girl was running like crazy. The bar tenders and bar backs enjoyed watching the game while loading her with drinks at the bar and then continuing to watch the game. It was clearly the result of very poor management. Of all weeks to have no servers, this was not the one. Everyone came back from the conference ready for drinks before dinner. The bars were packed. On a positive note we have fabulous meals and service at Café Vettro, Julianne Serrano’s, Sirio, Lemongrass and American Fish. This property has so much to offer, it’s easy to love.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: blackdog1979
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed there for a business trip and 3 day weekend getaway. Aria is easily one of the best hotels and casinos in Vegas. It's well designed, comfortable, offers good restaurants, and does a good job of ventilating the smoke on the casino floor so you don't end up smelling like an ash tray. On the casino floor, the servers are friendly and frequent so you're never without a fresh drink for long. The spa was nice and my masseuse was great, but I prefer Caesar's for service, space, overall amenities, and atmosphere. There is also a noticeable difference in customer service that is provided to the normal guest rooms (where I stayed for business) and the sky suites (where I stayed for vacation). I highly recommend the suites if you can swing it.

Reviews.Title: “Missing the Bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: brains22
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nites at this hotel in jan 2012. It was amazing! Hotel staff were freindly and helpful. Drinks service on the poker machines were a bit slow but it was low season so we understood. The had the most amazing bed!!! Could not get out of it as it was the most comfortable one i have ever slept in! A remote that opens ur windows, turns off the lights and tv. Great shower and bath combo. and fantastic veiws of the strip. Will defo be going back to stay at this hotel!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: kvb1130
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights in December 2011. Room was clean and well appointed. Hotel is centrally located on strip with easy access to everything. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The lavendar-vanilla scent couldn't cover their problems”
Reviews.Author: djrhoffman
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like Aria Hotel but as soon as they started to win us over something would happen that would make me want to get the heck out of there. The most surprising aspect was the lavendar-vanilla scent that they pump in through the vents. Sometimes it smells good but sometimes it was headache-inducingly strong. If you are sensitive to scents in the least do not stay here. It permeates throughout the casino floor and event crept into our surprise $250 dinner at Bar Masa (those $25 rolls really add up.) Then our room. We had a perfect center view of the entrance and the strip but we had two major issues. Light kept streaming in from their stupid fountain. It was like a spotlight was being shown in the room. And then our room was freezing cold. We called up maintenance and the guy spent an hour tinkering (with us lying in bed just waiting for him to leave so we could sleep) and then it didn't even work. He did give us the interesting information that the hotel turns off the A/C and heat control in rooms to save money and basically waits for people to complain. So they moved up and gave us a nice $75 resort credit but then our new room was - I am not exaggerating - a six-minute walk from the elevators. If you have bags or any mobility issues you would never make it. Then the lovely strip view turned into a dirty window and a side view of the hotel. I will say that the rooms were pretty darned nice. Great bathrooms with deep sinking tubs and all the most modern amenities - curtains and lights you can put on a timer and a way to turn off all the electrics with the push of one button on your clock. The next most frustrating experience was checking out. We had signed up for loyalty cards and it took us over 20 minutes for the desk clerk to figure out how to credit our account with our points and split the bill onto two cards. Seems like a pretty simple operation and when you have a plane to catch, 20 minutes can feel like a lifetime. Our best dinner there was at Michael Mina's American Fish. I thought the spa was fine (but it pales in comparison to Qua Baths at Caesar's Palace) and the workout facility had everything I needed. I thought that Viva Elvis, though at times corny, was really fun and I actually liked it better than several other Cirque shows that I've seen. As much as I wanted to love Aria and as much as they tried to make up for their mistakes, I would have preferred for their mistakes not to happen. Unfortunately, I could not recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Top-tier Experience”
Reviews.Author: Aquasib
Reviews.Content: Aria is a gorgeous, contemporary, thoughtfully-planned hotel and casino right in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip. The entire hotel smells like vanilla, it's immaculate, there are a number of restaurant options and the beds are the BEST I've ever slept on. (And I'm a fan of the Westin Heavenly Bed - this trumps it!) You have to be somewhat tech-savvy to work the room controls, but they are a nice luxury. True black-out curtains, independent temperature settings, huge flat-screen tv's and luxurious bathrooms. You will need to be ready to walk a bit to get to your room, but it's well worth it. If you have a chance, go to the spa. Another all-time-best-spa-experience. It's spacious and well stocked with a variety of beverages, snacks and reading material. Everything you would expect from a spa and beyond: steam room, sauna, multiple-plunge pool options and for something different, a salt room, extra co-ed lounging space, and hot / rock bed room. Anything you're in the mood for, you're likely to find at Aria and it's easy to trek out from there via the tram or by foot if you want something else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: I have read quite a few of the other reviews (just stayed here recently for CES) and find it hard to understand some of those who have bagged this hotel. The hotel is 2 years old and is in very good condition. I have used Trip Advisor a lot to choose hotels and sometimes I feel some people have highly unreasonable expectations and get put off by very insignificant minor things. Often I also find that what you put out you get back (in service and response from staff). Often people expect top notch service whilst dishing out rudeness themselves (I witnessed this 1st hand in my visit this time around). To the hotel - the rooms are large and comfortable. The beds are like sleeping on a marshmallow (can be good and bad however). The bathrooms are in good condition. You would be very unlucky to get a room that was not cleaned. We found the cleaning staff to be very helpful and pleasant and had a good chat with a few whilst cleaning our rooms (seriously, some of the demands from customers they have to deal with....wow!). The hotel is also not as "over the top" as some of the other hotels in Vegas are. The Aria is more of a standard modern casino hotel rather than part hotel, part theme park. Check in and out was fast and efficient and the concierge etc were all extremely helpful. Even though we are not "high rollers" or anything like that, we never got the feeling that we were not an important customer or ignored. The technology system in the hotel room is actually easy to use. It is no harder than using an iPhone, but I can understand that some people may find it daunting at 1st. You need to understand that if you press a button and it takes a second or two for the curtains to open, you need to wait. If you keep pressing it expecting everything to happen right away, you will not get a result. This sort of system is what is being installed in homes around the world (it is a Control 4 system) and many hotels...and is fun to use. They provide very good instructions in the Aria booklet as well and offer assistance if you need it. The "room all off" button is great to press when you are falling asleep...very convenient! The food - is ok. The best place to have breakfast is in the Buffett. It is the cheapest way for any eating in the hotel. Elsewhere, yes you are going to get fleeced, but I have been at few hotels in the world where food in the hotel is not pricey. The hotel is situated right next to Bellagio. However, it is still a decent walk to the Bellagio as these hotels all sit on very large grounds, but location is still very good. One down side is that the minibars are sensor activated and they charge if you want a fridge. I think that this is a bit much...especially when Aria is considered to be one of the higher standard hotels in Vegas. Also note that this group that owns Aria charges a daily fee for access to internet, gym etc whether you use it or not and it is not cheap (about $20 a day). This is generally on top of your room rate. The Aria is set a bit back from the strip, and to get to the north side it can be a bit of a trek after having to go via road bridges etc, but it is close to a food court (south of the hotel on the strip), a Walgreens and CVS, plus other cheaper food options. The only one other issue I would have is the room rate. Since CES was on, all the hotels hiked up prices massively (some by double) which is pretty rich. As I was told by a few locals this is a result of such a large conference, where attendees do not gamble as much as normal tourists or visitors. So the hotels all ramp up rates excessively to compensate for lost "gambling" income. I can understand during periods of high demand for rooms that rates will not be heavily discounted, but to increase them well above normal max rates is just rude. This is not specific to Aria, apparently all the hotels in Vegas were doing this.

Reviews.Title: “Awful vacation experience”
Reviews.Author: Momwann
Reviews.Content: Terrible!! They were very rude. The front desk area acted like I worked for them. Everything was a hidden charge like the buffet I was suppose to get free with my package. Awful noise all night long I will never come back. I'll pay a little extra to stay at the bellagio or palazzo

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort in Las Vegas ..”
Reviews.Author: Sandra J
Reviews.Content: This is the best resort I have ever been to. I have travelled to las vegas several times & everytime I have stayed in different hotel or resort to see how they are but this is the best of the best from all the resorts I have been to in Las Vegas. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Don't like Vegas but loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: betsy1224
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference held at the Aria. While I'm no fan of Las Vegas,I really liked Aria, the location of this year's conference. My upgraded corner room was spacious, attractive and very quiet. It took awhile to get the hang of all of the electronics, but the lighting and motorized curtains are really cool. For the first time ever in LV, the room rate included free access to the exercise facility. Not only was the facility immaculate, large and well-equipped, it opened at 5:30 a.m. - a great time for people from the East Coast. While the hotel is officially on "The Strip," for those who like to be in the busy mid-section of The Strip, they'll find this hotel a bit far.

Reviews.Title: “Insomnia”
Reviews.Author: Twintime1
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely one of the worst place I have ever stayed. I did not sleep both nights due to noise. Thursday night due to traffic and Friday due to we might as well been in the nightclub trying to sleep. When we asked for some sort of white noise to help the hotel workers acted like we were out of our mind. NEVER staying here again. This place is awful!!

Reviews.Title: “A modern new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam F
Reviews.Content: First, I've been reading some reviews and I like to get something off my chest. There were many reviewers complaining about the walk to elevators and saying that you should ask for a room close to elevators. This is dumb. A room close to elevators will have a lot more foot traffic and associated noise (especially since this is las vegas and you have a lot of patrons in drunken state passing by your room late at night). Yes, it is true that if you get a room far from elevators then there will be a few minute walk due to size of Aria. But if this walk represents a problem then skip Las Vegas altogether. The traffic on strip is super congested. You will need to do a lot of walking whether you like it or not. Now to good points about the hotel. Aria was part of $8.5 billion project before recession when everyone was upbeat about the number and wealth of potential vacationers. The huge price tag really shows in the elegance and high crafts manship. It is really superior to all other hotels on strip. No expense was really spared during its construction as developers were expecting huge returns. Now, comes the weak points. Recession hits and there is no longer as much demand. Unemployed workers or people worried about job security do not simply book vacation in luxuary hotels in las vegas. This means Aria is not able to charge as high price as it was hoping for its rooms (for instance, it's cheaper than Bellagio). So, they are skimping on service. During my several stays there, I've seen dirty windows, under staffed room service not able to do its job in a timely fashion..etc. Having said all this. I still think Aria is a great hotel due to its innovative nature and architecture. While you might get unlucky and encounter a glitch or two in service but you will pay relatively low rates for fantastic rooms in a state of art hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel- more "calm" than many on Strip”
Reviews.Author: jpm
Reviews.Content: Aria is a nice hotel- LEED certified so it is very environmentally friendly- unique in LV. And, it has a bit more of a "calm" feeling than some other large hotels. It has a good location on the strip, but it feels like a long walk from the hotel through CityCenter to get out to the strip. But, a really good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Blackjack!”
Reviews.Author: fdl1
Reviews.Content: First Class throughout, from check-in, to check-out. All staff were exceptionally kind, even when they were taking your money in the beautiful, modern Casino. Downstairs, with the Casino, restaurants, clubs, etc was dizzying action. Upstairs, the hotel was quiet and restful, with plenty of dark woods and subdued lighting. As other reviewers have said, the remote controlled everything is a fun novelty. This hotel is what 21st century Vegas is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Vegasvegas”
Reviews.Author: VegasvegasLocated
Reviews.Content: Located in a good place to access the strip,food,shopping and site seeing.Service is great and rooms are excellent.Coner suite a plus.Nice layout of casino.Many restaurants with good variety.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas every year in April. Last year we stayed at the Luxor and this year I picked the Aria. We got a great deal through Allegient travel for about $400 per person flight and hotel for 4 nights/5 days. We had a regular room on the 36th floor. Our view was of the Aria entrance. Yes a strip view would be nice but really how much time do you spend looking at it anyway. It's Vegas! Your not spending that much time in the room. For starters there are No Coffee makers at any strip room in Vegas. Once again it's Vegas they want you to buy their $6 cup of coffee not make your own. I did get mine at their small cafe every morning it was very good and not that badly priced if you are used to Starbucks prices. The beds are amazingly comfortable and have plenty of pillows. The room is technically advanced so if you can not use a smart phone or iPod with ease this will not be a spot for you. We found the technology fun and intresting being able to control everything without getting out of bed. Check in was smooth. We checked in around 9p and there was no line. They were helpful and friendly. The clerk directed us to their 24 hour resturant because we were hungry. We did rent a car and valet was quick and curtious. The bell service brought our bags up to the room within five minutes of check in and offered to show us around the room and even get us ice. The lobby smells like vanilla ice cream and will make you hungry when you smell it. The smell was not over powering, just a nice difference from smoke. We will definatly stay at the Aria again!

Reviews.Title: “Dazzling, mind-boggling design and architecture”
Reviews.Author: Out_of_valley
Reviews.Content: Just to put this review in perspective, I hadn't been to Las Vegas in many years (decades, in fact) so I have very little basis for comparison with other Vegas hotels. I had never been to the City Center complex in Las Vegas. I had heard that the design and art and architecture were fantastic and i was not disappointed. I only wish I had the verbal ability to describe it adequately, but I don't know where to start. I will just say that I consider it a must-see experience. If you are interested in art, they have a brochure with a walking tour. And if you are a gym user, they have the best hotel gym I have ever seen. For me, there was a minor negative. The computerized control system for the room (lights, curtains, TV, heat, etc.) was so complicated that you need a master's degree in engineering to understand it. (I actually HAVE a master's degree in engineering and I had trouble.)

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Suzi580
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a fabulous looking property but unfortunately the service doesn't match the price tag or street address. Very poor rooming process left me without a room for many hours when others behind me were roomed. The room preparation was poor with hairballs in the shower drain, coffee cups and drink glasses not refreshed daily and no bath products several days. At 530 am I could get a drink, a cigar but no coffee and the gym was only open limited hours. A drunken guest was passed out in the corridor with no help from security even after several calls. When asked to move bags directly into the room, the bell service simply refused to help. So...great looking place, and lousy service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that has more flash than substance”
Reviews.Author: TommyJames
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of this hotel. I first stayed at the Aria when it opened in January 2010. This is my third stay in the same week while attending CES and this time we upgraded to a corner suite with a terrific view. This property overall is a nice place to stay if you want to be on the strip yet at the same time, the hotel isn't too crowded in public spaces throughout. The real downside came with the room itself. I had to request that the room be vacuumed twice on check in. It's obvious that housekeeping was in and out as quickly as possible and while the room may look clean at a distance, when you looked closer it was downright nasty. The space behind the sinks hadn't been cleaned in months (if ever) and the bathroom remote was so disgusting neither of us wanted to touch it. It had never-ever been cleaned. Sadly there were already signs that the rooms are not holding up all that well and that the rooms will look very tired in the next two years. If you're going eat at the Cafe Vettro, two people will spend around $60.00 per meal just for breakfast so while the room may be well priced during non-convention weekends, expect to get soaked in the restaurants if you don't leave the hotel. I gave it average marks for two reasons, one was the lack of cleanliness and the continued impersonal treatment you get while staying there. Like all the big casino resorts along the strip, they have a way of making you feel like no matter how important you think you are, someone else there is way more important and therefore they can't bother with you. Fat chance anyone will ever remember you ever stepped foot in the place or even look you in the eye and say hello as you step out of a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Angels sang when I opened the door”
Reviews.Author: LaurWander
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous, automated room, which at least attempts to be environmentally-friendly, and in Vegas, that's saying something. When you enter the room for the first time, the lights slowly turn on, the television has your name on it, and the blinds open to reveal your Vegas view. I like the energy efficient lighting, the low-flow toilets, and the programmable lighting, sound system and television. A really cool hotel on the strip. Also, it's quite pricey, but the bar in the center of the casino makes one of the best martinis I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Unvelievable”
Reviews.Author: 10Griswald01
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay anywhere, I would suggest this hotel. The rooms are totally automated, the second you open the door, the drapes open and the lights come on. Plenty of restaurants and clubs on sight with a couple of pools on site.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start the New Year”
Reviews.Author: CAR_UK
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be clean modern and and geerally of high standard. The standard deluxe rooms are spacious, well equiped and spotlessly cleaned each day. I would recommend asking for a higher room if you can get one so that you are able to get the best view. Im not sure what to say about peole complaining about the walk from the lift to the room! Really it was no inconvenience and i cannot understand why people complain, its hardly a long walk and i stayed in one of the rooms furthest from the lifts! Ate in the Thai and also the Todd English pub, both were decent and reasonably priced. The mornet buffet breakfast was of a good standard and worth the money compared with what you would pay elsewhere for breakfast. The Aria is certainly the most modern and clean hotel on the strip in my opinion but maybe lacks a bit of charm and character when compared to other hotels. Overall though this is a good hotel which offers very modern high standard rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Met Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Subiegt
Reviews.Content: Aria Hotel was a very clean and modern hotel. Regular rooms were quite large and had excellent storage area (his & her closet). Notable items: - Lights, tv, curtain, etc could be controlled by a hand held device which was different, but did find it had a lag. - Bed was comfortable - Parking garage was easy to use and close to hotel - Get a room closer to the elevator as it could be a long walk to end of the halls - Don't touch any of the goodies in the room (i.e bar, food) if you don't intend to buy them...some kind of sensor is in place and will charge you automatically Would go back to this hotel again as it was a good location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Aria--Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Devildog2
Reviews.Content: We booked through travelocity with airfare. A fairly good deal. Checkin was a breeze, the room was beautiful with a nice view. Bed was extremely comfortable. All the amenities. Although we really didn't spend much time in the hotel or their casino, we loved the hotel. The first night we managed to mess up the tv and had trouble "controlling" the room. I called maintenance, then we went out for the night. I guess they never showed up, because it wasn't working. Called next day, then we went out for breakfast and gambling. Came back and it was fixed. We really enjoyed it and would consider staying there again. Centrally located to the places we went. However the table prices were a little high for us. We are not high rollers and love playing the $10 blackjack tables. They didn't have any. We were there for the playoff games. Skybox and sports book were crazy. Had to wait an hour to get into the skybox lounge. I don't like the fact that you have to spend $15/hour/person after the first hour in skybox. But that keeps people moving and them making money. Overall, a good experience at the Aria. Checkout was also a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool room”
Reviews.Author: VegasLoverDallas
Reviews.Content: The regular rooms at Aria are very cool. As a matter of fact, the entire hotel is cool. This was one of my favorite rooms to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice architecture, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Kathy P
Reviews.Content: The hotel and casino are beautiful. The rooms are nicely appointed, but small. The automated in-room system was more of a pain than anything. Several times we hit a wrong button which turned off all the lights and closed the curtains. It was annoying to have to located and put on my reading glasses just to turn a light on or off. I missed having a coffee maker in the room and the fridge is such that it can't be used for anything other than their mini bar items. The hike from the elevator to the room (XX030) was excessive. Service in all 3 of the bars we visited was excruciatingly slow due to understaffing. It wasn't uncommon to wait 20 minutes or more to have our initial drink order taken and the table cleared. I think I'll try other hotels before going back to Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, absent managers, customer not heard”
Reviews.Author: FAoki
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with friends and had 2 rooms booked for 4 nights. We went out and came back every day at the same time and one of the rooms eas not serviced for 2 consecutive days. Housekeeping and front desk were contacted after the second event. We did not want the room to ve serviced anymore after 5 pm. For our surprise, we went out for a couple of hours and they serviced again the room that had been serviced earlier but not the other. Rates are expensive and service very poor, they only offer to make the room up, nothing else because we had pre paid the rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Aria NOT 5 star worthy!”
Reviews.Author: b d
Reviews.Content: I chose Aria because they are advertised as 5 star top of the line luxury and I chose it instead of 4 seasons because of the state of the art technology. If you use ATT your cell phone will not work at all. This is unacceptable to me as I had business to do. They fail to mention this fact until after you complain to the front desk. The service is not great. The phone reservation lady was clueless when asking her about packages for a single person. She waisted my time by putting me on hold for almost 10 minutes while she looked up the offers. She should have had a list already to go. Then she offered me a packages for a couples weekend for 2 times the amount when we just discussed I was alone. Then when I arrived they did not have any packages applied to my reservation and I had to wait 15 minutes while the guy at the checkin desk called to find out if I could have a package deal. I finally get to the room and it looked nice, drapes opened up as I walked into room without me doing anything. BUt when I turned down the bed it had blood stains and hair on the sheets. They were washed and bed was made but they did not get out the stains and still used them...gross! windows had greasy smudges too. I changed rooms. Had to walk forever to get there and the cleaning lady gave me wrong directions on how to get there so I went in circles 2 times. I finally get to new room, it seemed fine but not ultimate luxury. The TV is very complicated. Bed is very nice and comfy. bath is new and modern and nice. Looks clean. I ordered room service and again not happy. I expect great food but med rare filet was over cooked, apple pie was a frozen reheated mini pie and salad dressing was a just a store bought italian vinegar. I travel for work & have experienced a lot and this hotel is just an average nice hotel nothing special and I won't be back. Service is not great. I'm still here so we will see how check out goes. comfortable in the new room.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: blossom
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a beautiful hotel, and I thought they did just about everything right during my stay. We booked a corner suite at a great rate, and when we checked in, found we were put on the top floor (54)! We had a great mountain view from the room. In fact, between the floor to ceiling windows and the view from the amazingly comfortable bed, it was a room that was hard to leave! A few standouts for me: The bedroom, for sure, and the wraparound windows. The large shower with a nice ledge to put your legs on while shaving! (thanks designers!) Small real frig. The technology in the room was fun. Took a few minutes to "get" it all, but you could really get used to it, so cool. The toto toilet was great! A few (small) things I didn't like: No coffeemaker. (okay, okay, I know this is the way with 90% of Vegas hotels). But I do miss it. The furnishings overall were a bit too bland for me to get excited about. Would've liked a little more Vegas whimsy or pop of color in the room, but that's just taste, not a real complaint. The square sinks splashed a lot. The City Center location away from the strip. Overall, a very good experience. The front desk was very polite, and did a great job. The pastry shop Jean Phillipe, was nice touch for a quick breakfast and coffee. Hotel seemed a bit sedate for Vegas, which can be a plus or minus depending on your taste.

Reviews.Title: “If you're in Vegas, well...”
Reviews.Author: Bryan_N_JesY
Reviews.Content: It's a Vegas hotel. I have nothing to compare it to, but it was super VegasY! Very helpful and lovely staff

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aksweetie82
Reviews.Content: Really like this hotel located right in the middle of of strip. The price a a little higher than I usually pay. I would recommend this to friends that a planning a one-time blowout trip.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible security & service”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: We booked the vacation with "United Vacations". The flight was great and staff at the hotel are just lazy. The security was a joke and they forgot to clean the room one day. Security was called and someone was helping themselves to our the mini bar. Poor experience!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding !!”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly022
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas and stayed at Bellagio (beautiful) and Marriott Properties. Let me just say this is a very different experience - we stayed in the "Sky Suites" part of the Hotel. Separate entrance, concierge privleges and breathtaking rooms. The Suites/Rooms are state of the art - moving/blinds - lighing dim - bathrooms uh, wish I were back there. Service is amazing - Room or just regular Hotel requests. Courteous staff beyond great. I do know that this is a New Hotel, not easy to walk right into from the street, but there are moving escalators and after all Vegas is not just to be enjoyed inside right?? Shopping expensive, yes but you can find deals at the North Outlets. My husband and I loved it and will go again. The only thing about the Hotel is Restaurants are not for everyones uh normal tastes. Although I was pleasantly suprised I enjoyed the Japanese, Tapas, - but not the Steakhouse (overpriced, quality so/so and way overpriced) This is a great place for couples, Romantic, not overcrowded and again Service exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “No Service, Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: AussieinCHC
Reviews.Content: Super busy hotel with large rooms. However telephone or in room internet did not work. Trying to get this fixed became a major challenge and headache. Staff very good at delegating but not at follow up. Good location. Overall relatively good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better”
Reviews.Author: mark_0nline
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Aria Resort & Casino for 7 nights as part of CES 2012. Circa $3500 USD inc resort fees. My overall comment in relation to this hotel is that you can do better in Vegas. First; the good points of Aria. 1. Design, interior and exterior is outstanding. Aria inside and out feels classy and a step above many of the themed Hotels i.e. Caesars. 2. Smell. Aria does indeed smell like Vanilla. Initially it's odd but it's much nicer than cigarette smoke. 3. Location is OK however note that most of the strip action is around The Cosmopolitan. 4. Despite most likely being full or close to it for CES week the Hotel did not feel too busy - to me this is a mixed point because there was little buzz or positive vibe in this Hotel. Now; the bad points: 1. Service. My dry cleaning required two separate calls after it hand't arrived 24 hours after it was taken away. I understand it's busy but 24+ hours is unacceptable. 2. The rooms suffer from the same issue as many other Vegas Hotels. They are simply too dark. Not everyone is in Vegas to party endlessly and it was a frustrating experience trying to work at night time. 3. The bar areas and nightlife were very retrained. I stayed during the busiest time of the year and Aria still felt like a retirement village. 4. Bed sheets only changed on request. I don't this its unreasonable to change them every five or six days. If I was staying for two weeks, a month would I have to request a change or would they eventually change the sheets? 5. Resort fee of $20 to cover Internet i.e. WIFI etc which anyone who enters the Hotel also gets for free - odd. 6. No vending machines on the floors and few places to purchase drinks and snakes anywhere in the Hotel. 7. Very limited dining options in any of the restaurants for vegetarians. Overall I think the Aria hotel is a well located hotel that looks fantastic. Unfortunately like many things all that glitters is not gold.

Reviews.Title: “Time to Review after 2 stays”
Reviews.Author: chifinn
Reviews.Content: Great hotel... this is now our go to place for LV. We stayed 1 night in 2010 and 3 Nights in 2011 and will be booking 3 more in 2012. We did have a glitch when checking in this past time, the reservation was in my name and I dropped off wife to check in while I returned car. We have same credit card and same name but they would not give her the room without me. It took a manager to override the system. All was well beyond that great rooms and great buffet!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: HarryJ202
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Aria. Loved it both times because I was fortunate enough to get high floors with stunning views of Las Vegas at night. Both times my rooms were neat and clean. Love the high-tech electronic drapes and the lighting. Only downside was in the buffet, where the waiter was slow and nonchalant. Had to ask for drinks, then had to ask for water. No tea or coffee was offered. The only time he got perky was when I was leaving and left him a $6 tip, which probably was too much for the service on a moderately busy night. One more thing: It is a little tricky to find your way to the Strip but once you learn the routing, you're OK. I would go back to Aria but since I've been there twice would like to try other nice properties like Wynn, Cosmopolitan or Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms albeit 22nd century high tech. Great service, opposite end of strip to the best clubs.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas on an old fashioned boys trip and our wonderful experience at Aria set the foundation for an amazing weekend. Service levels at Aria were amazing, first of all, we were satisified with our initial suite, until our air conditioner started issuing a faint rattle. When maintenance came up to fix it, he was kind enough to suggest we get upgraded into an larger suite over looking the strip. Furthermore, there are staff which man the lifts and ensure that only guests with keys are able to access the lifts to the rooms. However, when we retired to our room with some new friends we had made at 5am, we felt well accommodated. A bottle of vodka we ordered at 7am arrived swiftly and our check out and in was smooth. The adult pool was also well serviced and a great experience, albeit expensive. The hotel buffett was enormous. I should also add that the resort is located at the opposite end of the strip to Wynn and the XS nightclub, which is a destination that all such minded travellers should experience. Taxis are plentiful and cheap in Vegas, however.
