Being brand new, everything in the hotel room is controlled by computer remote, so if you're a technology-challenged philistine you will have difficulty opening the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Best smelling hotel in Las Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: kelpez
Reviews.Content: I know it may sound weird but Aria has the best scent of all the Las Vegas hotels I have stayed at! Our stay there was superb. Rooms were large and nicely appointed, the food at the buffet was delicious, and the casino is nice. I loved this hotel and plan to return. If you are looking for luxury with a modern twist, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very smoky hotel that can't accommodate vegetarians”
Reviews.Author: tweets2012
Reviews.Content: The pros: Very chic, high-tech, modernistic resort.... very beautiful! The cons: First of all, the hotel was very smoky! I know it’s Vegas and it's ok to smoke indoors, but we've never experienced how obviously strong the smell was at Aria. We've visited Vegas many, many times and stayed at other hotels, and never felt like we couldn’t breathe. As beautiful as Aria was, it smelled like an ashtray. Second of all, we dined at 3 of their restaurants: Lemongrass Thai cuisine is typically spicy and flavorful, and even though we requested somewhat spicy food, it was not, and nor was it flavorful. Food at Lemongrass was quite bland. Skybox Sports Bar & Grill Our waitress was very rude. I'm not sure it was because we had a child with us or because she was just having a bad day, or some other reason. Our child wasn't running around or disturbing others. He sat with us the entire time like a well-behaved kid. After taking our drink orders, she returned with our drinks, (alcoholic drinks, that is) and asked what we wanted to eat. When we said nothing else, she scoffed and gave us a disappointed look. It is a crime to just want to sit down and have drinks? It is Vegas, people usually focus on drinks. Cafe Vettro Cafe Vettro was the most disappointing experience. When a hotel boasts about having world-class chefs and can't seem to make anything vegetarian for its guests, that's a problem. We asked our server (who was very nice) what vegetarian options they had cause we hardly saw any on the menu. He said would ask the chef if he can do certain dishes vegetarian, and kept coming back and saying that he can't. That was shocking! He suggested salad, but we didn't want salad, we wanted a proper hot meal. The only option was a margherita pizza, which by the way, had no basil on it! The chef couldn't even offer the pasta dishes which were on the menu and leave out the meat. Which can only mean that the dishes are pre-made! Very bad sign!!! When we asked for bread rolls because the tables next to us got them, our server came back saying that they ran out of bread rolls but he can bring us slices of sandwich bread with butter... again very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: NomadicCalgary
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at Aria in the past year. We booked a corner suite through a Westjet package. Although we had a partial view of the Strip, we were a bit disappointed that we would not be able to see the midnight fireworks from our room (part of the reason for booking that way) Ended up watching from the other corner - end of hall. If it is a big deal for you - I would specially book a room where you could see the Strip. The fireworks are quite spectacular. We were on the 33rd floor & saw those from MGM & Aria's overhead. We had dinner in the Jacques Georges Steakhouse - will review that separately. Also ate at Julian Serrano and Lemongrass - will review separately. We have had the buffet in the past - breakfast only - it was good & extensive & not hugely crowded when we went in Nov. Cafe Vettro is good for a quick bite - pretty average fare but pleasant surroundings. Had one salad there that was not great in Nov. The rooms are lovely, modern, very well-equipped & have THE best mattresses & pillows I have found - and we have travelled a lot. The corner suite was great but probably over-kill unless you plan on spending lots of time in the room. One surprise was an electric toilet (heated seat & front and back sprays! A bidet/toilet !!) in the huge main bath (there is a powder room off the small living room) The bathroom has a great free-standing soaker/jetted tub with a partial view of the strip & a TV to watch as you soak. There is a large Room was clean and comfortable. The casino is huge, high-ceilinged and unless you were sitting next to a smoker, generally smoke-neutral. The complimentary cocktails are of a good quality wine/liquor & I even had a decent vodka martini on the rocks. Amazingly comfortable as you make your donation to the machines! All in all a very nice place - upscale and modern. Not at all "old Vegas". I will also review Julian Serrano & Lemongrass under restaurants. Rooms are all modern & it seems they have worked out the kinks from our 1st visit & problems with the drapes not operating. They have a great gym - it's been too cold to try out the pool when we were there - but looks nice. There is a $20 resort fee added to the bill each day - this bothers many people. I guess it makes the day-rate look better when people are booking. Personally, I think it is okay when you have a great gym as they do & would be great when the weather is warm to use the pools. The spa can be accessed for an additional $30/day. Worth it if you don't want a treatment but want to enjoy the outdoor infinity spa overlooking the pools, steam, sauna, and meditation rooms. We have had massages all 3 trips & enjoyed the Thai the most. All very lovely & a peaceful place in not so peaceful Vegas! It is easy to imagine not even leaving the property if you are just looking for a weekend escape for 2. This is the longest review - but after 3 visits - I felt I needed to share our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Complete experience and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: olescrapiron
Reviews.Content: The stay a Aria was wonderful. From booking to check out. I booked in advace a Sky Suite and was assigned a person that took care of all my needs as well as others meeting me. From transportation to the room, service was excellent. The room was state of the art and comfortable.I compliment all. The only issue was a Pit boss that was not a service oriented person. After send time at the tables and slots mant in our group met at the roulette table. I did not play at first, just watched my friends and enjoyed. But requested a drink and was informed since I was not playing she would not serve me. Okay, I decided to play and requested $300.00 in $5 chips. I palce a minimum bet and asked to be rated.....The pit boss said he would not rate me unless I played over the minumum! ( now this is after dropping $1K at the craps table) I had to almost force him to rate me and then he watched me like a hawk. I did report this to our host and another "boss" came on duty and I returned to the same table with friends..no problems... Food was great. Limited selections at cafe but order was very tasty. Please look up the manager for Haze nightclub. One great person and service 2nd to none. Little walk to other places, and to get a cab was a walk also. I recommend Aria. Not a discounted hotel, but worth every bit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Modern”
Reviews.Author: KC8181
Reviews.Content: I love the touristy feel of some of the classic hotels in Vegas like the Venetian, Bellagio, Ceasars but when it comes to a place to stay, I want a nice, contemporary hotel. Past favorites: "The Hotel at the Mandalay Bay" and "Cosmopolitan" - My husband and I stayed at the Aria this past weekend and loved our stay there. The hotel itself has a very modern and clean vibe to it. The location isn't the best, but you can walk through "Crystals" and get to the strip fairly quickly. Its two hotels away from Bellagio and is across the street from Planet Hollywood. The hotel itself is clean and very modern. LOVED the rooms. Very spacious and everything is electronic. You can control the lights, curtains, TV, temparature all from one device near the bed. The decor is contemporary - lots of rich browns, creams and navys! Beautiful. We had breakfast at Cafe Vettro and got wonderful service. We only had 30 mins because we had to head out and the waitress was quick and efficient. We had ordered, received and ate our food all in 25 mins. Excellent!! Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational”
Reviews.Author: Fussypot13
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at Aria, and I can’t fault it. The rooms are spectacular, we stayed in a corner suite, they only downfall was the distance from the lift to our room! The cleanliness of the room could not be faulted, we had a view over the strip was is always great at night. We went over for a wedding and other friends stayed in over hotels, our room for the price was by far the best value, the room was huge and offered great amenities. Overall I’d recommend it and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great honeymoon splurge!”
Reviews.Author: Maureen B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon a year ago and fell in love with Las Vegas. The hotel was one of the nicest we've ever stayed in. It has great amenities and a more intimate feel compared to the other casinos on the strip. It also has a great smell in the casino. We will definitely stay here again in the future. We like it so much, we also visited it when we went back over Memorial Day this past year.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT! 5th Time & will keep going back!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel1444
Reviews.Content: Awesome Service, Awesome Rooms, Clean,...smells delicous upon entering the Lobby. Great restaurants, casino & pool. Doesn't feel like a far walk to strip...easy. Stayed in two bedroom room, stayed in Corner Suites & Loved both... If you love Modern & Contemporary styling then this is for you! Not so old & classic like the Wynn or Bellagio or Ceasers etc... Did try sister hotel VDARA, but it's too quiet and has no casino or action! Nice though...More like staying in a condo. Which makes sense as that was their intention originally.

Reviews.Title: “Aria - best hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: gamblebay
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel - all the rooms are Smart Room and nicely decorated. Hotel has fine restaurants and very good bakery. Casinos is huge. Nice shopping too and has skytrain to Monte Carlo,

Reviews.Title: “"Meh. Dissappointing"”
Reviews.Author: luvhb
Reviews.Content: Rumor has it that MGM Resorts ran out of money while completing their new City Center development (Aria, Vdara and Mandarin Oriental) - if that is true, it would truly justify the lack of attention to detail in the Aria Resort and Casino. Aesthetically, the Aria Casino, lobby, hotel common spaces and hotel room more closely represent a West Elm catalog than "spectacular / astonishing / extraordinary" design (to use the hotel website's adjectives). As for service, we had mixed experiences. We arrived early and since our room wasn't ready, we provided credit card and other information to the front desk individual, who informed us that he'd page us when our room is available. When his cut off time came and went with no page, we approached the front desk again and was told by a different individual that he had entered our information into their system incorrectly, which was why were weren't paged. Not 5 star service by any means. On a positive note, the rooms were large, comfortable and the push-button control center was very handy. Also, the location, as designated by the "city center" moniker, is excellent. My husband and I go to Las Vegas 2-3 times a year, and with so many incredible 5 star offerings in Las Vegas, however, it's unlikely that we'll stay in Aria again in the near future; we much prefer the Wynn or Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: nickstudio
Reviews.Content: Went to the Aria last April, and this was not my first time in Vegas, but it was my first time seeing the new city center. Aria looks great, as an Asian theme to the hotel, is very modern a looks in pristine shape. The room are amazing, not matter what room you take they are amazing, very modern large room, all amenities are in it and amazing remote gadget that control everything in your room, from the TV to the light, the curtains and your music and alarm clock, just plain fun!!! Front desk personel seems extremely rude, not helpfull at all seems to busy to talk to you and it was the low season. Bad thing is the location, some people find the city center fun, but it's just one big shopping center and the real fun of vegas for many is the strip and for walking in the hot Vegas desert weather the Aria is on the strip but also way off it, walking will become your best friend, its takes a least 20min just to get on the strip afterward you're close to planet Hollywood and the Belagio. The casino is modern but is not very popular it doens't have that vegas party and fun playing factor. its quiet, the casino floor is newer but seems very boring compared to many hotels. Overall next time i'll like to be more in the center of the action, but the rooms are great if you don't mind paying for taxis a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Room and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: carlp09
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I went on a "double date" with another couple to Vegas, and had an absolute blast at the Aria. It was a beautiful resort/hotel with fantastic amenities and great restaurants. I'd recommend it to pretty much anyone - young or old. For the price, I put it second only to the Palazzo in value in all of Vegas. 100% awesome and no complaints

Reviews.Title: “ARIA--NICE PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: slatsp
Reviews.Content: Excellent room. Has electronics controlling everything, lights, drapes, tv. You can do everything from one remote. When you first open the door, the drapes open dramatically. The casino area is very nice, clean and cheerful. Very spacious inside, high ceilings and not smokey! Inside of some older casinos are depressing, but not Aria. Multiple stores to shop in, connected to other shopping/malls in area. Multiple dining places located throughout. Directly across from Planet Hollywood and next to Bellagio, although it is a bit of a walk to Bellagio. Staff very nice. Lots of exercise just walking around property. Would definately recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aurea C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and the room looks brand new. The Casino is huge as everything in Vegas. The hotel is an attraction itself. You can arrange tours and shows at the hotel. Don't miss the Grand Canyon helicopter tour! It's just amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: devon t
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, it was located right on the strip, it was very close to the Bellagio, Vdara and other hotels. The service was satisfactory.I went on new years so it was very busy there, overall it was nice kind of pricey everything had a fee...

Reviews.Title: “Kind Of A Letdown”
Reviews.Author: cynthialynn516
Reviews.Content: Let me just begin by saying that I wanted to love the Aria. Some of my friends had stayed there before and raved about how wonderful it was so I was excited to check it out. Overall though, my stay was lackluster and not as good as other vacations I've taken to Las Vegas at other hotels. Check-in wasn't bad. We didn't have to wait in line too long and the front desk agent was very friendly. The selection of rooms wasn't very good. The hotel has like 60 floors? Well we were in their standard room and apparently the only standard rooms left were all on the 6th floor or lower so they wouldn't have that nice of a view. According to the front desk agent, the only thing higher than the 6th floor was a handicap accessible room on the 37th floor or something. I just found this really hard to believe because I work at a hotel. You're telling me that you have no standard rooms open on the 50+ floors above the 6th floor for someone checking in on a Wednesday night? I just find that really hard to believe. Anyway- we went ahead and took the handicap accessible room so we could have the nice view because I didn't really think I'd mind the lowered bed/closet shelves and the lack of the jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. With the package we booked, we were also supposed to get a complimentary city-view upgrade but when we actually got up to the room it wasn't overlooking the city and/or the strip at all. It was just overlooking the parking garage of another hotel or something. Either way- I didn't really care too much about the views to complain, but then my boyfriend walks into the bathroom and the main overhead light doesn't turn on. We try some of the other lights in our room and discover that both our reading lights above our bed don't work and neither do the lamps on each of the nightstands. I call the operator and let them know there are an abundance of lights not working in the room. They tell me that they will alert their technicians, then the technicians will call us with how long it will take for them to get to our room to fix them. That really wasn't acceptable to me when I needed to shower and get ready for dinner but was unable to because it was pitch dark in the bathroom. So basically they were telling me to just put off my dinner/plans for the night until someone could come fix the lights (and they didn't even know when that would be yet). I told them I really didn't want to wait around and asked to be moved to another room. They were able to move us to someone on the 6th floor (which also didn't have a good view by the way). We get there and all the lights were working but then the sink on the right in our bathroom wasn't working properly. The right pull for cold worked, but the left pull for hot did not. Also, the water that came out for the cold was almost dripping because there was no water pressure. Filling up a cup of water would take 5 minutes from that sink. We tried the sink on the left and alas, that one worked fine with strong water pressure. I didn't want to move rooms again because we were already running late for dinner and we could just share the one sink that worked but it was kind of a disappointment how many things were wrong with the two rooms we were in. Other random things: Blackjack/Poker minimums a bit high. Casino/Lobby floor smells like heavenly vanilla. The beds are so soft and wonderful. Buffet isn't bad but I prefer the Wynn's buffet. Gold Lounge is really lame. Haze is awesome- good sound/lights system. Would definitely go back. Ate at Lemongrass (their Thai restaurant)- very good food, highly recommend. Their rain type showers are awesome. Also their bathmats are so fluffy and soft. Gelato at the Chill cafe was very good. I feel like they need more dining options that aren't "fine dining". Our room was ridiculously far from the elevator and we got lost once. When I say ridiculously far, I mean it, I'm not just being a diva. Cocktail waitresses were very fast and friendly. Overall, it was an okay stay but I probably wouldn't go back. I prefer the Wynn/Encore over the Aria but I would be interested in possibly trying the Cosmopolitan if I stayed at the City Center again.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than anything else on the strip”
Reviews.Author: twoguysinnc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days before visiting family in SoCal. The Aria is a welcome respite to the typical Vegas experience. The casino is large and well arranged with good spacing between the machines. The rooms are very comfortable (we were in a tower suite) and the staff is beyond accommodating. We would absolutely stay here for our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “New resort with nothing special”
Reviews.Author: agodaire
Reviews.Content: This resorts furnishings and environment were new and modern but without 5 diamond service the hotel will still end up being forgotten umongst competitors. Our arrival experience at valet was poor, no welcome or assistance with luggage until after we checked in. Check in was okay but it was so loud that we couldnt hear our agent which led to a misunderstanding about buffet being included with our package (spent $120 on buffet that we thought was included). Rooms were clean with nice linen however the tv didnt work (fixed promptly when requested). Rooms were very dark and cave like due to brown everything. Towels were very stiff for 5 diamond. Service at duece lounge was terrible, Angel at the cafe provided excellent service, Sarah at the bfast buffet was great, and dinner at American Fish was great with knowledgable waiter and som. Overall I felt like we were nickel and dimed for everything we wanted or wanted to do and service was just ok. Will be staying somewhere else next time but might be back for Barmasa.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury IN THE SKY!”
Reviews.Author: RSTT3959
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pure luxury, upgrade to a Suite. Very high tech in nature. Rooms are a 10.

Reviews.Title: “although it's a beautiful hotel/casino...”
Reviews.Author: nutbass
Reviews.Content: we booked our room directly through their site - and were happy with the promotion ($109 per night plus $50 resort credit) - the promo clearly was a scam since the resort fee is about 23 bucks and food and drinks are way too expensive that the credit doesn't really cover the tips for valet, bell service etc... plus any call to or from your room will cost an arm and a leg! the room wouldn't get cleaned til about 7pm and always when we wanted to get ready to go out to dinner and such... why? Had a terrible experience at their "Bar Moderno" as my older parents were with us to have a night cap - the table was filthy with drinks and ashtrays - it took a waitress 20 minutes or so to clean the table and even longer wait to ask us if we wanted anything to drink... it was late and my parents were wanting to go - but it was our last night there with them and we finally ordered (after going to the bar and asking the bartender at least 3 times why we were not getting served - it wasn't even that busy!) ... we ordered one glass of single malt scotch, one margarita with no salt and very light and two glasses of the Oregon Pinot that was $22 a glass!.... what we got - a small glass of scotch, one strong margarita with salt, two glasses of Estancia California Pinot - EXACTLY what we DID NOT order!!!! We waited for the waitress to give us the check and she delivered it - then not 20 SECONDS later she was there to collect her pay - wish she would have been that prompt when it was time to order or clean our table!! How rude! When I called the manager to complain - he said there was nothing he could do except comp some drinks... well we were leaving early the next morning and not going to have any more drinks... I will try to contact the hotel and let them know of our experience there... Thinking we would have saved some money for doing the promo - 3 thousand dollars later we are very glad to not be in the Aria anymore. Sorry Aria - you have failed us ;o(

Reviews.Title: “Not the best of the strip”
Reviews.Author: MaverickRome
Reviews.Content: Rooms are new but not that big and pretty ordinary. You do have a remote control in your room for music,lights,tv,curtains but don't expect led effects or any other special thing. Bring with you an audio cable if you want to connect the iPod or they will charge you with 27 $ to buy one connecting kit. Bathroom is clean and big,but again no special light effects. Buffet "the buffet" is good and priced 32 during the weekends. In my opinion it lacks of genialities,you may find more cool and good things at the buffet at cosmopolitan. In our case the front disk girl accepted a tip but didn't upgrade us,didn't allow us a late checkout,didn't provide us with info about the nightclub,so she basically took money for nothing. Position is good,very close to bellagio,cosmopolitan,Caesar. Next time I would try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High-Tech Rooms, Nice Views, Long Walk to the Room”
Reviews.Author: Drew D
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Aria twice (both within two weeks of each other.) The Rooms Both rooms I stayed in were wonderfully appointed. I'm a tech geek so I really loved the remote control that could control everything from the TV to the curtains with the touch of a button. The beds are well appointed with soft pillows and plenty of comfortable bedding. The floor-to-ceiling windows provide you with great views of either the strip or the mountains. (I like the mountain view.) The Hotel The hotel and casino is really nice - it's sprawling - like most Vegas hotels and it can take 15 minutes to walk from your room through the casino, then the mall and finally arrive at the strip. There is a nice tram system that helps make this more efficient. I enjoy the Aria and plan on staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Devine Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Snoozeee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing short of fantastic. Everything was super clean&the minute we walked into the room the lights turned on&the blackout curtain,then the privacy curtain slowly opened to reveal a fantastic view of the strip.Everything in the room is controlled via the tv, air-conditioning,curtains,lights etc.You can even check out on it too.Wish I had this facility at home,all that would be missing is a 'let the dog out'button!The 'goodnight'switch at the side of the bed was particularly impressive as it closed the curtains&slowly dimmed the lights.Only downside2the hotel is the prices for dining here,but at 5* u got to expect that.Would love to stay here again. First Class at it's best.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice with partner!”
Reviews.Author: Stevenpga
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 9.00am and was nicely surprised to get the room straight away! 16th floor nice room, very modern with all the things you would expect of a newish Hotel. It's hard to explain my feelings about Aria after staying in many other Vegas Hotels. I guess the atmosphere is strange. The service is great, rooms are fine(a little noisy with adjoining door rooms) and the food is excellent especially at Lemongrass Thai!! If you go with your girlfriend/wife it's a fantastic choice because of food, shops etc...Going with friends for a fun time I would personally stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, still good”
Reviews.Author: Rosscopcotrain
Reviews.Content: This was a 6 night stay in December 2011 and my second time staying at Aria for a work conference. My last stay was in late 2010. The tech in the standard room is good and I had a good partial view of the strip on the 30th floor. There was plenty of space in the room including good storage with 2 large(ish) wardrobes and decent drawer space. Bed was large and comfortable. The service in the hotel seemed better this time around. For example there were less queues at check in and check out and any requests I had were dealt with quickly and efficiently. In fact I can't recall the nature of the requests which is either a good sign of the service being good or a sign that the late nights and lack of sleep impaired my memory! The bars within Aria are decent with the open plan View Bar being my favourite. The Deuce bar and Gold Lounge are also good. Haze nightclub is housed within Aria and is a decent place with various rooms and mezzanine areas as well as fantastic waitress service. There is also a good sized pool area but I only visited this to get some air and sun in between conference sessions. Overall Aria is a very good casino hotel although I'm not sure if it would be my first choice for a holiday hotel, but that could just be because I associate it with work and conference due to that being my reason for staying there twice. Also, the conference facilities are arranged over 3 floors and are very large and very good

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: toonerguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed Jan. 4 - Jan. 7/12 and had a great time. There was nothing bad about the suite. The beds, tv and the bathroom were awesome. Not sure about people complaining about a dirty window - they want the maid to hang out and clean it or not having a tv in the bathroom. There was always fresh towels each day and the maid cleaned up great, You are in Vegas, I think ,most people don't come here to watch tv or look out the window all day. The hotel was big, a lot of walking, but on vacation and who cares. The buffet was expensive but good. Didn't try anything else at the ARIA, but it was great.

Reviews.Title: “A Classy Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pflum21
Reviews.Content: Pictures from our trip, including a sot of our room at the Aria: http://www.flickr.com/photos/pflum21/sets/72157628692530841/ My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the Aria. It is a modern 5 star hotel and casino without the "Las Vegas theme style decor." There's no Venetian canal, talking Roman statue's or Eiffel tower, just classy modern decor and architecture. We found that the Aria was not on the must see list of the hoards of tourists in Vegas and therefor a less crowded place to hit the casinos and restaurants. We liked the fact that we could fight the crowds at the Belagio, Caesar's Palace and the Venetian then retreat to the Aria for some elbow room and more attentive service. The rooms were modern and clean with a large window. We were on the back side of the hotel on the 18th floor and had a great view of the mountains. The breakfast buffet was around $15 and was excellent. The location is great, right in the heart of the strip and about a 5 minute walk from the Belagio for the CAN'T MISS fountain show. Overall, if you're looking for a quiet, classy and high end hotel in Vegas, then you can't go wrong with the Aria. Pictures from our trip, including a sot of our room at the Aria: http://www.flickr.com/photos/pflum21/sets/72157628692530841/

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Tng8torgirl
Reviews.Content: First stay at Aria was in June. Enjoyed the hotel and gaming. Great pools. Went back again in November, with another great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leigh R
Reviews.Content: My son and I just returned from a wonderful 3 night stay at the Aria. I usually stay at Mandalay Bay and have loved it but decided on a change of pace so decided to try Aria and I am glad I did.. From the moment we were greeted by the bellhop getting out of our taxi until we left 3 days later we encountered excellent service. Check in was a breeze, the elevators are very fast (never had to wait more than 1-2 min. for one), rooms are gorgeous and all the high tech features are a blast. (you can control virtually everything from a control pad on the nightstand, lights, curtains, tv etc.). I really liked the button you can push to indicate either privacy or service needed. It activates a light outside your door. Beds were very comfortable and it was quiet. Casino floor not overly cramped and never too smokey. NIce selection of restaurants but as is typical of Vegas, food prices high. I did not have a spa treatment but did pay for day pass to enjoy the features of the spa. It was well worth it, very relaxing. In room internet service was flawless and the fitness facility was very nice and the daily resort fee includes use of it plus complimentary bottled water. Location in City Center is very convenient. I will definitely return to Aria on next trip to Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “BEST review of Aria - What you need to know”
Reviews.Author: RockStar707
Reviews.Content: Before booking my room at Aria, I spent HOURS reading reviews on TripAdvisor, Yelp and Hotels.com. I wanted to be sure that I had the best possible understanding of what it had to offer since it's a newer property and I hadn't been to Vegas in a couple of years. What I actually found during my stay is that some things travelers have reported are spot on - and some are rather rediculous. I'm a non-VIP, but non budget conscious (when in Vegas) traveler with a very positive attitude and reasonable expectations of other human beings when reviewing a property. Having said that, here's what you should know! I'll do it in a Good/Bad format with some important notes at the end - so read this in full! THE GOOD 1. Yes, the property itself is beautiful. The architecture is amazing and I found myself walking the casino and surrounding areas, looking around in awe. 2. The beds are as amazing as you've read in other reviews. I am a very tempermental sleeper and expected to be debunking the hype around these beds - but alas, they are that comfortable indeed. 3. I personally found most of the staff to be VERY friendly (ESPECIALLY housekeeping). There were a few exceptions (a young guy working at Jean Phileppe, several security people at the elevators checking room keys), but the overall feeling of the staff was warm - not 5 star service, but warm and friendly enough for my tastes (I don't require staff to gush at my feet for me to enjoy myself - but I know there are snobbish wanna be VIPS out there who do). The bartenders at both casiono bars we went to (on several different occasions) were also not only friendly but VERY funny and kept us at the bar ordering drinks just to shoot the breeze with them. Nice to see such personality at such an upscale property. 4. The restaurants (that I tried) on the property are EXCELLENT. This is one area I can claim expertise in and I would be more than happy to report if the food was lass than great. I ate at Julian Serrano, Jean Philleppe, Sage, Cafe Vetro (it's a 24 hour cafe - decent food for that standard) and even had lunch at the Buffet. Now I agree that Wicked Spoon (at the Cosmo) or the buffet at Wynn or Bellagio are all better in quality and selection. HOWEVER - the Aria buffet is STILL a decent buffet, I have NO idea where people who say it's bad are coming from. If you compare it to the aforementioned buffets, then yes, it's the "worst" of that group. But it's still on of the better buffets in Vegas, it's a few bucks cheaper than the others, and it will save you a trip off the property when all you really want to do is eat NOW. If you're a buffet connoisseur, the walk to Wicked spoon (next door - but still quite a hike) may be worth it. But if you just want a great buffet with PLENTY of food choices for your money, the Aria buffet is great. Okay, enough of that! 5. The touch screen panels in the rooms (that control lighting, curtain opening, temperature, TV, alark clock - even the privacy light outside your door) are indeed quite cool. Reports that they are "hard to figure out" or confusing are REDICULOUS. If you use a cell phone, ATM machine, or any other thing that requires touching a screen and following basic menus written in english, then you'll be fine. However, reports that the touchscreen can be slow responding on the TV are accurate. The TV is a satellite based system, so that doesn't help the response time to commands. Regardless though, it's a cool concept that's easy to use. 6. DO NOT believe other reviewers about the AWFUL, MARATHON-LIKE distance from the hotel to the strip. Rubbish. Yes, you have to follow a walk way down to the strip when you exit the casino. Approximately 1 1/2-2 city blocks in equivelent length. No different than staying at Bellagio, Encore or Ceasars. Not sure why Aria is getting a bad rap for not being DIRECTLY on the strip (like Planet Hollywood or Cosmo) but I love these people who will complain about the short walk to the strip - but then spend all afternoon walking 20 miles in each direction. Really? Okay, that was the east part... Now for, THE BAD 1. Personally I found it extremely annoying and a little insulting that the rooms (as reported by other reviewers) in fact do NOT have coffee makers (or refrigerators - touch ANYTHING in your mini-bar and you'll be charged for that item. But they'll be happy to RENT you one for $30 a night. No thanks.). I know, you already knew that, and maybe you don't drink coffee so you dont care. But consider this; it presents a glimpse into the misthinking of those who designed this multi-billion dollar property. It's an example of the "quanity not quality" aspect of designing a property with 4,000 rooms that has a sculpture in the lobby that probably cost more than what 4,000 $10 coffee makers purchased at wholesale would have cost. It shows the possibility that the money on this property was spent on getting people impressed with the impression because once you've checked into your room, your stay is non-refundable. Just sayin'... 2. So remember when I said the walk to the strip wasn't that bad? Well the walk from the elevator to your room IS (or I should say, MAY be - depending on what room you get). I had a room towards the end of the tower - I'm in my mid thirties, good health, good shape - but the distance from the elevator to my room really ticked me off. Not cause I couldn't do it, and yes, I am one of those people I mentioned before who spends the afternoons walking miles and miles up and down the strip anyway. So why is this different than the walk to the strip? Because there is a VERY reasonable expectation to walk long distances on the strip - or through the casino - or from the airport security to your gate - or whatever. But as a guest who's conveniences and comfort should be top of mind to the property, the designers dropped the ball on this part. Granted this is a moot point since no matter how many people complain, they're not going to tear down the building and rebuild it - but you should know, especially if you have elderly or handicapped people in your group, that you HAVE to spell it out for the front desk that you want to be close to the elevator bank (the ONLY elevator bank) on you floor. I didn't and ended up grumbling every time I walked to and from my room. 3. I was sooo looking forward to the famed "room greeting" that was to take place upon enetering the room for the first time. I unlocked the door, walked in and (as reported by other reviewers) - NOTHING. The curtains didn't open, TV didn't come on.... now this may also seem minor - but AGAIN, it speaks to the details and in this case, details that the fropnt desk clerk had JUST bragged to us about upon checking in (" wait until you see the way the room welcomes you!" she said...). Also, upon picking up the touch screen panel for the first time and truning on the TV, BOTH displayed the name of the previous guest (another thing that I had read other reviewers complain about). When I mentioned it to the front desk on our way to dinner, the agent said "oh they just didn't update the room info, happens a lot". REALLY? I wonder if them neglecting to update the guest info for the room also led to me not getting my "room welcome". I also REALLY dont like the idea of the NEXT guest after me, seeing my first and last name after I leave (should they again forget to updaste the info). Not good. 4.The table limits are indeed high. If you are a "just for fun" gambler (like I am) or you're on a budget, you'll most likely be going elsewhere to play table games (slots however, provided plenty of penny options if that's your thing). Our first night in town was a Monday and the lowest BlackJack was $15 and lowest Pai Gow (my fav) was $25. Now these table limits are not any higher than The Bellagio or Wynn - but they aren't offering specials on roiom rates to the extent that Aria is. So if you book a discounted rate online, don't think that the casino table limits will be as kind to your budget. 5 There is no "elevated" level of service at Aria. People are friendly. Professional. But when you arrive, there will be no one to greet you at the main entrance. Need help with your bags? Too bad, no bell hops. Want the two consecutive heavy, glass doors leading into the casino opened for you? Nope. Want a smile when you comply with security at the elevators and flash your room key? Don't think so - but they will snap "room key!" at you should you neglect to display it inbetwen holding your shopping bags, diet coke and camera (or what have you). As I said before, I don't personally NEED any of those things to enjoy my stay. But the Aria NEEDS them if they want to be taken seriously as a 5 star resort. 6.Okay, here's my biggest bad point (for some people it won't matter). I read several reviews complaining about a lack of theme or "energy" to Aria. I was fully prepared to find that to be a silly, self-fulfilling profecy of people who really just belong staying at The Palms or some other place that sepcializes in leasing suites to reality shows for months on end. BUT... I regretfully have to agree with those reviewers. Aria is gorgeous. It's an awe inspiring nod to human design and engineering. But I walked through the Cosmopoliton while on my way to dinner there one night, and I was instantly jealous. The place was alive, fun, colorful and so very VEGAS. For the most part, Aria is none of those things. For families, older travelers or people wanting the luxury casino experience that you would perhaps experience in a James Bond film, then the Aria would suit you just fine. But if the energy of Las Vegas is something you enjoy - the lights, the colors, the feeling that this is the only place in world where you could experience this - I'm sorry to say that Aria will most likely not fulfill that for you. I should mention that I was on a "couples" trip with my girlfriend and I don't drink or smoke - so I wasn't exactly looking for a wild party every night - but the Aria just goes too far the other way for my taste. Lastly, I should mention - I've seen a lot of conflicting reports on housekeeping. The quality of it, the timeliness, etc, etc. Although we were there for 5 days, we elected to NOT have housekeeping service, so I cannot comment on it. My girlfriend was troubled by the number of reports of theft, and not everything would fit in the safe - so we made our own bed and didn't live like slobs. I again should mention that housekeeping were the friendliest group of staff we encountered (including the front desk - which was friendly). We passed more housekeeping staff in the halls than I can count and I kid you not - EVERY time the staff member looked up smiled and warmly said hello or good morning/night. They were also happy to provide more "supplies" (shampoo, towels, etc) even though we requested to not receive housekeeping service. IN SUMMARY Look - at the end of the day, I can't tell you to stay at Aria or not. It's EASILY one of the more impressive properties on the strip from a sophistication and architectural stand point. But what will ultimately determine if you stay at Aria or not, is what type of experience you want from your stay in Las Vegas. I'm giving Aria 4 stars. Triple AAA will give it 5 stars because they haven't stayed there for a full week like I just did and they're grading it against every other hotel in the universe and not against other resorts on the strip. I hope this info helps anyone trying to decide where to stay for your next trip to Vegas. Forgive me for the spelling errors, Trip Advisor doesn't provide a spell check and I've been feverishly typing this review! I wish you a great stay in Vegas - wherever that may be! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience at check-in”
Reviews.Author: burbank310
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2-night stay. The hotel is new and beautiful, for sure, but the customer service at the front desk and the check-in policy were disappointing and frustrating, to say the least. Our rooms weren't ready when we arrived at 3pm. We were told to put our bags in storage and that we would receive a call from the front desk just as soon as the rooms were ready. Two hours later, at 5pm, we hadn't received the call. We returned to the front desk and were told our rooms still weren't ready and that we should "go explore the casino." At that point, we asked to speak with a manager, but were told she wasn't available to speak with us. We were told us that the hotel's policy is that you may check-in at any time, but that room reservations are honored based on room availability and that they could not guarantee a time that evening when we would have our rooms. We were told, "It could be ready at 6pm, or 7pm. I don't know." I've never before been to a hotel that will let you check-in at 3pm and then fail to give you a time when your room will be ready. We waited around for another hour and then we went back and demanded to speak with the manager. The manager told us that our rooms still weren't ready and that we should (again) go explore the casino. While our reservation was for adjoining rooms, we asked if there happened to be non-adjoining rooms available. (We had reserved adjoining rooms to keep our group together.) There were. It now being after 6pm, we agreed to take the non-adjoining rooms. We were not offered any sort of discount, or even an apology, for the delay and non-adjacent rooms. We won't be returning to the Aria again.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: jordan604
Reviews.Content: Been twice... once with friends and once with the girlfriend and had an amazing time both times. Love the smell when you walk into the Casino! Friendly staff and modern rooms. Took me a while to understand the electronics of the room but once you figure it its golden! Very clean place to stay and nice pool. Absolutely love the buffet (worth the money). ****bring back some 5 dollar craps please***** :)

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Manateelovers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria on Jan.1-4, 2012. The service went fairly quickly. The staff were very helpful and thorough. The concierge was outstanding. The hotel was massive and we ended up loosing my husband when we checked in! Thanks to the concierge we found him. They were very attentive and accomodating. They were always on the lookout for anyone that needed help. The hotel room was beautiful, clean, modern and technologically advanced. Lovely perks like housecoats, beautiful towels, toiletries, huge wardrobe, incredible bedding and pillows. Most of all the bed was like sleepiing on a cloud!!!! Rooms were very quiet and the view in 14039 was gorgeous! Did not care for the stocked mini bar...would have preferred to have an empty, complimentary water would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: jo_hearts_holidays
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel in the centre of the strip. It is unfortunately nowhere near the standard of the Vdara next door & although it is 5* for us it was not a 5* experience. Starting with the postitive aspects of our stay, we found the concierge/valet & housekeeping to be friendly & efficient. Our room was serviced everyday & I had contacted the concierge in advance with a couple of requests - all were taken care of. The location is good, centre strip & next to Crystals/Vdara/Cosmo/Monte Carlo so there are many eating/drinking/gaming options without going to far. WiFi speed is excellent & our flight/hotel deal with BA included the resort fee so even better. Dressing gowns in room are nice & beds super comfortable. Now onto the less so great parts. The check in took over an hour, the queue system needs to be improved to ensure the next in line is served rather than having 6 seperate lines. We only had 5 people in front of us but it took forever - not pleasant after an 11hr flight. We were dropped off outside the back entrance & had to drag our suitcases accross the casino, then back towards the guest elevators - not a problem really but the area is carpeted and its a bit of a hassle. The smoke smell in the casino area is overpowering but not nearly as bad as the fragrance that is pumped in to cover it up. On several occaisions room service trolleys were left in the corridors overnight or for prolonged periods of time and it smelt unplesant - not expected for a 5*. The room was adequate, spacious & tastefully decorated. A little dusty & the remote control is a bit OTT for me, hard to work at first & slow to respond. I did not like the bath being in the same cubicle as the shower. I like to have a bath after hours walking the strip but found it uninviting & dull. This is a 5* hotel but for me there are just too many little things that let it down. I would not stay here again but I would go back to the Vdara in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking.....”
Reviews.Author: Evz1976
Reviews.Content: Here for NYE. Shame. No 1: had to be moved as room wasn't ready when we arrived. Baby poo everywhere according to the maid. Gave us $75 credit to move to a worse room. No 2: booked my wife in for a massage at the spa. 30 mins late so we cancelled. No 3: put a present into storage ahead of our departure. Smashed to bits. Aria said they would contact us. Nothing yet. Very poor. Simon Evans

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Aria”
Reviews.Author: Cool_Breeze_78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 3 nights and glad we made the right choice. The hotel interior and architecture is magnificent. From lighting to decor is nicely done. The room was very clean and we got the view of the strip. The restaurants in the resorts all are very nice. Kind of expensive but worth the splurge. I tried the spa and it costs $30 to use the facility with snacks and drinks included. It was great to lounge by the infinity pool. The black jack table minimum was $15. Over, all it was a great stay. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Aria...Pretty Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: Root4Tigers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria in March of 2011 with my wife. We were connecting with a group of 3 other couples (who also stayed at Aria) for a weekend escape from the still-cold Midwest. This was my 4th trip to Vegas over the last 15 years or so, having stayed previously at MGM, Mandalay Bay, and the Palms. We picked Aria because they were running a promotion and the rooms prices were good. At the time of our visit, the Aria had only been open for a few months. In fact, I'm pretty sure the pools had only been open for a week or two. That did not turn out to be a problem at all though, as I thought the Aria was running pretty smoothly overall. There were some minor delays at check-in, but given how newly opened they were, we almost expected that. In my opinion, the delays had more to do with inefficiencies in the check-in setup and process, and not the staff. Furthermore, the check-in staff was friendly and courteous, so we just took the whole process in stride. The overall decor (from the building to the lobby to the casino to the rooms) was nice and clean and modern. It's not necessarily the scheme I would want for my home, but it's very nice nonetheless, and it should be able to stand the test of time. The lightly scented vanilla-ish aroma in the lobby was noticeable (and a little odd for this Midwestern boy) and ever-present, but I never found it annoying or bothersome. The rooms very very nice and modern. Everything was meticulous, which is to be expected with a brand new. billion-dollar(?) hotel. The whole-room remote was fun and unique, albeit tempermental at times. Bed was comfy. Bathroom was nice, big, and clean. The main pool was nice. Easy to find a lounge chair. Poolside bar was accessible and fine, but predictably overpriced. Only ate at one restaurant in the Aria. Can't remember the name. I believe it was Asian-themed. It was fine, but unremarkable. Much like the rest of the hotel, the casino was modern and, consequently, it felt different than any other casino I've ever been in. That's probably mostly a good thing, but it felt a little sterile at times. The table minimums were predicitably high for a hotel of this quality. For me, that just made me want to head out to the strip to find something that better suited my budget. (I prefer to go to a casino where I can play craps and, hopefully, make a couple hundred dollars last for an hour or two, not 10 minutes.) Overall, my experience was good. Would I go back? Maybe, if they were running another promotion. But, I wouldn't choose Aria if I could find a less expensive room at a hotel like Bellagio, or Mandalay, or Venetian, or Cearsar's.

Reviews.Title: “One great place for families in vegas”
Reviews.Author: workingmama28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here once in the summer and this past Christmas. Summertime is great because the pools are nice and kid friendly. The rooms are clean, modern, and beautiful. It's also in a great location when you have kids because it is close to M&M world and Mcdonalds! You can also get to the Bellagio for the light show using the tram. (It is hard to walk those long blocks with kids in tow). They have a game room, although it is very limited in games and hours. There is quite a selection and variety of bars and restaurants in the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Theft and terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Liz S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria over the weekend of 12/2/11. While I was there, my iPad disappeared from the hotel room when the room was cleaned. From reading many of the 1-star reviews, I have seen that this type of thing seems to happen frequently at the Aria. Shockingly, the hotel staff was completely unhelpful in the aftermath of the theft. Usually, at a hotel of this caliber, staff would bend over backward to assist in this circumstance. I found every single person I dealt with to be unhelpful, unapologetic, and unwilling to make any real effort to help me. The first person I dealt with, a member of the hotel's "security," failed to even suggest opening a report and told me that it was impossible that a theft could occur. He then told me to go to the front desk and speak with a manager if I wanted anything to be done about it. I then went to the front desk and was told that I needed to deal with security. When the case was finally opened, the hotel took a full 30 days (the amount of time in which they are required to submit a report) to make a determination. During this time, they told me that would call me and let me know the status, but failed to do so. I had to correct the phone number that they had on file for me at least 3 times. Additionally, NO ONE apologized that this happened. When the final report was made, the hotel told me that there was no evidence that I even had an iPad and that they had asked everyone who was in the room and no one had seen it. They told me that according to Nevada law they are not responsible. That may be the case. However, generally, a hotel of this level, will do the right thing in a case like this and make some attempt to make up for the loss. I am totally shocked at how poor the service is at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So friendly”
Reviews.Author: bebbles
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in most of the hotels on the strip in Vegas but have never been so impressed with one that i felt i had to tell people to stay there. The staff are very friendly, the food at all the restaurants is wonderful and not too overpriced either. I chose a standard room so i could upgrade if i needed to. No need to pay more as these are the best standard rooms that i have stayed in with added features such as robes and customized lights,tv settings and blinds that you can set yourself.The power shower was great. The casino is well laid out with good signs so no getting lost.Ample parking on site and quick elevators which always helps. Plenty of machines, tables and exceptionally friendly and helpful table staff and pit bosses. One in particular is John who works mostly on the craps table. He and his staff made my stay and i have already booked to go back at the end of the year. Being there are many, many casino's to choose from on and off the strip, i can say that over the years from the first time i went to Vegas in 1999 i have never stayed at such a nice, clean, friendly and well thought out hotel there. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. I will always comment on good and bad. I felt i had to call a manager when i left (Darren) not to complain at all but just to tell him what a wonderful weeks stay i had at the hotel. He asked me if there was anything i would change if i could.....the answer for the first time at staying anywhere in Vegas was a definate NO x

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sofiet
Reviews.Content: Staff: Accommodating and friendly. Hotel: Spacious and clean. Amenities were great, the pool was huge. Long line for buffet during Christmas. Dislikes: Weight sensors on the water bottles and snacks, our friend weren't warn about the weight sensors, they got billed, it was easily resolve as long as you speak to a rep ASAP. Quality of sleep: Average- pillows were too soft.

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: stevejam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria back in May of 2011 and ever since then they've been wanting us to come with some really good offers, which makes our next trip more reasonable.We are going to book it very soon. The Hotel is excellent, I have nothing bad to say about it at all. I recommend it highly. The rooms, the atmosphere, the excitement ,the views ,what more can I say. Try it for yourself. Don't listen to any of the people who put up any bad reviews about it. It's a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Establishment”
Reviews.Author: shivon7
Reviews.Content: I LOVE Love love the Aria. . .the whole establishment is very classy, up to date and beautiful. Rooms are very spacious, clean and nice. Stocked w/ everything you need! This hotel is brand new so everything in it is very up to date and the buffet is to die for. This will be the only place i will be staying when visiting Las Vegas again. I got a great deal on Delta Vacations for the flight and hotel. You will love it too!

Reviews.Title: “Ayo Technology”
Reviews.Author: Chantell_M
Reviews.Content: Aria is definitely one of the most upgraded hotels in Las Vegas. Everything in the room was so advanced with technology, even the basic rooms. Flat screen TV's to having a button that you press to simply cut off all the lights at night and close the curtains. The hotel is stunning from the set up down to the lay out. There is so much to do in this one hotel alone it's simply amazing. Club Haze on the bottom level is a beautiful spacious nightclub, also their restaurants. They also accommodate shows and of course have gambling so you're always kept busy. The only problem that I had at my stay was heating up food. I had gone to a restaurant previously before returning back to the hotel and had some leftovers that I did not want to throw away. Well when I asked where can I microwave my food if I get hungry later I was told I couldn't due to the safety of their guests and rules of regulations. I don't know what harm I would get from heating up my food but whatever you do don't bring food back to the hotel. Eat it all at the restaurant lol! Also their fridges are timed so if you take something out and don't put it back in a matter of certain seconds, you will get charged so be careful and ask concierge what the time frame is if you have any concerns. Other than that I would say my stay was quite awesome:-)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Lisey343
Reviews.Content: Aria was hands down an amazing experience! We had a fantastic experience staying there. The staff bent over backwards to help. Our first night we had very noisy neighbour's, the next morning after a quick call to reception they gave us another available room straight away no waiting time. The rest of the stay in the room was so quiet and relaxing! The concierge desk in particular were fantastic, any query or question we had they had an answer. They booked tickets for shows for us, made dinner reservations-it was awesome! New Years Eve was a definitely busy times and the main restaurant often had lines to be seated, but by New Years day it has quietened down considerably and no lines anywhere! The pub on the outside of Crystals (Aria's shopping centre) was our favourite! Delicious and not expensive! I highly recommend the Aria, luxury without the cost! We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “REVIEW”
Reviews.Author: KENNETH R
Reviews.Content: 5 STAR HOTEL .ROOM EXCEPTIONAL. Very quiet. Excellent room service. Good view of Las Vegas Blvd. Exceptionally fast elevators. Safe in room to store valuables. Excellent security. Food prices high- best deal where to eat in hotel-- Cafe Vitro?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patrick M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aria for four days at the end of November. It was a very nice hotel and worth the trip. No problems with checking in. They were very nice. I recommend taking a cab from the airport. The shuttle buses are terrible. The driver kept pushing for tips and they dropped us off in an underground garage instead of in front of the main entrance. I don't think the hotel allow the buses in front. We played the slots and the wife won 250. The food was also excellent but a little pricey. I wish I had stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but everything I wanted”
Reviews.Author: mchenryed
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the marathon and the room was everything we would want it to be. The bed was so comfortable that after our trip we called and asked what sort of mattresses they used so that we could purchase one for ourselves. Check-in was prompt and courteous and the elevators to the room (22nd floor) in which we stayed were always fast and in working order. We had to call house keeping to get more towels and such a few times and they were always prompt in getting what we needed. The room was a bit complicated to get used to. Everything is controlled by funny switches -- and I am not a techno-noob -- but we were still learning stuff every day. However, the basics were pretty easy to understand. Sometimes I wished I could just use a switch instead of a dimmer button. Gripes: Pricey -- everything about the Aria is expensive. Luckily the Monte Carlo / McDonalds is close by, so if you want to eat on the cheap, that is available (its just a bit of a walk). However, all the quick service, restaurants and buffet are expensive. We were able to get a nice deal on the room, but normally the price they've listed would be out of our budget. Also, presenting your key to access the elevators is understandable but it got to be a nuisance, especially when carrying coffee or what not. I sort of felt that the bathroom tile could get slippery when wet, so use caution. Overall I would recommend staying here. It is centrally located, impeccably clean, and we had no major complaints. The staff were always friendly and cordial as well.

Reviews.Title: “Go again and again!”
Reviews.Author: Hotyoga6969
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and casino. It is first class. Go to the beautiful pools, and the amazing spa. Enjoy the top rated dining, and the entertaining bars. You are missing out if you do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve Disaster”
Reviews.Author: 5dolla
Reviews.Content: the Aria set up fences to barricade people from returning to the hotel after the New Years Eve fireworks on the strip. Security people allowed 50 people at a time through a small gate, prompting the crowd to go from relaxed to an angry mob of pushing and shoving. A very dangerous situation erupted, particularly for elderly, children and a man in a wheelchair. The security people were beligerant, yelling at the crowd, which made things worse. A horrible experience. We will never return to this hotel. Other complaints: no coffeemakers in the rooms; you have to come downstairs and pay $4.00 for a small coffee at a restaurant. No way to manually turn on a light in the room; everything is controlled by an electronic panel. The check-out person did not crack a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: Melstu6733
Reviews.Content: This resort was very modern and sleek, our room view was wonderful. It is a large resort (as are most in Vegas), plenty of walking required. The room was well appointed with anything we might need. We did not have a wait at all during check-in. All staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Aria Poor costumer service negative atmosphere bad energy”
Reviews.Author: lmarnra5279
Reviews.Content: I been to many hotels this was the worst experience due to check in staff being extremely slow, lack of warmth or caring from floor staff, pool staff, bakery staff and managment. My friend esperienced racial discrimmination in the desert area which was very disturbing. We would never go back or recommend the Aria. The atmosphere was not warm, the energy felt very negative in the Casino area the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! This is a "blows you away" hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeef
Reviews.Content: We (my wife, her cousin and I) spent two nights at the Aria in Nov 2011. The experience did not start off very well - I wanted a twin room instead of a double and was asked to pay more for it. Moreover, the only available twin was on a lower floor. But from there on, it was all awesome... This is a fantastic, modern property with top notch rooms and facilities. As soon as we opened the door to our room, we were greeted with auto opening drapes, lights coming on in sync and the TV coming on with a personalised welcome message. Our jaws dropped. The rest of the stay was flawless with good room service and generally attentive staff. We explored quite a few buffets in Vegas and found the one at the Aria to be the best. The location of this hotel is also worth noting. It is bang at the centre of the strip and very conveniently located for whatever you need during your stay in Vegas. There is a shopping strip just outside and the hotel has a very fancy shopping centre attached (Crystal, if I remember correctly) with most known fashion labels present. Would love to go back here when in Vegas next.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Mjjj40
Reviews.Content: We had our entire wedding at the Aria resort! Our room was modern and felt like a small high end condo! Our wedding was in the blown glass art gallery by Dale Chiluly. Absolutely breathtaking everyone must go to the art gallery! Next, we took out guest to eat at Jean George Steakhouse. Our guest are still raving about the food! The decor is modern and beautiful. Lastly, we had our after party at the Golds lounge. This was a very trendy bar and the DJ was AWESOME! However, if you do not prefer loud "club" music this is not the bar for you! There are many more bars and lounges to choose from in Aria"s that will be more of a fit. A side bit is the chocolatier store!! Great chocolate! The spa and pool area was very relaxing and for the party goers dont miss Club Liquid, this is Aria's pool/day club. ( You will need to get info early to get in Liquid) Overall Aria's services were impeccable! I will definitely be back! Hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Breath taking experience”
Reviews.Author: jpramhus
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new place to stay while down in Vegas and I kept seeing ads for Aria and thought I would check it out and I am very glad I did. My trip was better because of my stay at Aria, wonderful view, amazing amentities, and well very sleak and modern. I did have a run in with house keeping though, I returned to the room to find an iphone that wasnt mine connected to my charger. I was slightly upset because I felt there was no need what so ever that house keeping should be using my personal property while they are cleaning. I called management and housekeeping about this and they appoligized, included a $50 drink voucher on my room AND upgraded my room to a suite. I had no problem brushing off the incident after that. The suite was incrediable and was a nice way to top off a wonderful vacation. I will definately be staying at Aria next time I book a Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MarkSumner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for business and pleasure. The ARIA is an excellent new hotel in Vegas. I've stayed at the Wynn, Palazzo, Venetian and several others in Vegas and the ARIA is as good as any. Better in many cases. The ARIA is a great place to stay. The rooms are large and very well appointed. Large bathrooms and very comfortable beds. It seems like the hotels in Vegas age very quickly, so it was nice to stay in a new hotel. The City Center location is excellent and convenient. There is plenty of shopping and restaurant choices. The only negative comment that I would make is that there really isn't a good breakfast choice. The buffet is pretty disgusting. Every hotel in Vegas needs something like the Grand Luxe at the Palazzo. Its a little frustrating to wake up and have limited breakfast options. We ate at the Thai restaurant, Lemongrass and loved it. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but WORST GUEST SERVICES ever!!”
Reviews.Author: rivers25
Reviews.Content: Spent new years eve here at ARIA and expecting to have a great time yes until after fireworks and went back to property and everything starts to show its real face. You cannot get back to the hotel regardless of how much you paid, the associates closed the entrance gates and allowed only 20 people at a time. Why do they have to do this where in fact we paid to stay at the hotel so we have the right to get back. Room is nice but expect that some of the services may not function as expected like remote control or just ask during check in if the room will be broken and if you need to pay more to get a working room. I can say that the engineers who worked on my room were really nice but the guy name Trevin, Eris and another guy were not that nice and expect bad customer service from them. I would recommend checking another hotel, you dont need a 5 star hotel if you get 1 star customer service.That was my biggest mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aapikyan
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for stay in Las Vegas! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Aria”
Reviews.Author: rlewis3113
Reviews.Content: Over priced star; not in the same glass as Venetian, Wynn, Encore, or Palazzo; service disappolnting; Buffet over priced with rubber shrimp

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBatten121
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel for 3 days over Christmas, something central on the strip, with a little bit of luxury. Aria was perfect! We've stayed in a lot of Vegas hotels, and this one is now one of our favorites! Check in was smooth, even reprinting our player club cards for us. Room was only a standard king, but very well furnished. Yes there is a resort fee, but the Internet access was easy to use, and fast. Room was luxurious, the panel to control everything was fun, if a little slow sometimes. Bathroom was big, bed very comfortable. One watch point - it's difficult to make the bedroom completely dark with all of the light switches and panels glowing! Fully recommend the weekend brunch in the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: pdd06
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I stayed in the Aria as part of our honeymoon trip. We found a good rate on expedia and decided to stay. From the time we pulled up to the hotel, everyone was great! We had a fast check-in. The front desk attendent was wonderful and even gave us a upgrade to a corner view room for a very very good price. The room was spottless, everything was in order and how it should have been. The bell hop the brought up our luggage was very very nice and showed us how to control our room. The buffet is to die for except for the lobster that comes with the meal. Our next trip to vegas, we will stay at the aria for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Room — Food Not so Good”
Reviews.Author: mohabian
Reviews.Content: This hotel bills itself as a Five Star Hotel so I’m being stricter with it than if it did not. First the room was great. I had a special request that was met with consideration at check-in. The room was high in the air with floor to ceiling windows. The bathroom was luxurious with a separate rain shower and tub. The toilet area was spacious and closed from the rest of the bathroom. Double sinks. Magnifying glass. The appointments in the room were handsome and there were many small details that are fun to discover on your own, so I won’t spoil the surprise of the small conveniences. The only real complaint I had was that the pillows were too soft. Way too soft for comfort. I did not sleep well at this hotel although it was quiet. Another small detail is that I was unable to control the temperature of the room. It was always between 72 and 73 degrees. I like it a bit cooler for sleeping. This Hotel is part of a hotel complex. There is a tram that takes you to the other hotels. It doesn’t run early in the morning though. Otherwise with the parking, etc. You are better off just taking a cab to another hotel. The food was not very good. I don’t really understand this. I had the breakfast buffet. Please don’t spend your money for this buffet. The breakfast buffet at the Bellagio is so much better, and even though it is inconvenient to leave this huge hotel complex, take a cab to Bellagio for the breakfast buffet there. I also age at the Lemongrass Thai restaurant. I’ve had more authentic Asian food at much lower prices. I was definitely not impressed. I had room service one night. It was a long wait and although the service was lovely, the food was mediocre. I left some personal items behind, and was able to recover them on my way back. Getting through to lost and found etc. was a bit of a hassle, but worth the effort and I appreciate the staff restoring my belongings to me. They deserve praise for their honesty.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, needs to work out some kinks”
Reviews.Author: FeynieLily
Reviews.Content: The good: Beautiful property, very clean, easy check-in, friendly staff, middle of city center, easy access to the strip The room service, as mentioned in some other reviews was at odd hours and not predictable. The good things is that you can call them and they will clean up your room, but who wants to have to vacate their room so it can be cleaned when you've been gone all day? In addition, when we checked in and got to our room - the mini bar had been depleted of certain foods and all the water. We called the front desk to let them know so we wouldn't be charged and had to call a couple of times to have them fill the minibar and also to ensure they wouldn't charge us. Finally, I saw the minibar attendant and had her come to our room to fix it. In addition, I consider myself tech savvy and had a tiny bit of trouble figuring out the tech part of the room - more specifically the lighting. Some of the buttons worked, some did not. Having said that, having the room all working as one big computer was pretty slick. The rooms were spacious and the beds were super comfortable. Check-in was really fast, easy and we were even able to check-in early. The Crystals shopping center was a decadent shopping space, having places like Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Prada...great window shopping (or if you can afford, shopping...) I've stayed in a decent amount of hotels in Vegas, and would definitely stay there again ... hopefully they can work out some of the kinks...

Reviews.Title: “You are number one at Aria”
Reviews.Author: Jbmarts
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely amazing from the limo at the airport to the room service to the bellman. Every single member of the staff we came in contact with for the 7 days we were there was absolutely professional, courteous, and went out of their way every time to get us whatever we needed. The sky suite was spacious, immaculate, and had an awesome view of the strip! This will be our new home away from home. Considering a step up to the sky villas on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not as wonderful as I expected”
Reviews.Author: 5startraveler
Reviews.Content: We paid high prices for two 2bed penthouse sky suites. The Amenities with the sky suites leave a lot to be desired. The complimentary snacks and drinks are always empty with a line waiting. They only bring out a small tray of snacks that feeds less than 6. The water supply very often empty. The hospitality room is shared with the lobby and was filled with foreign travelers in every seat 99% of the time. We felt very unwelcome and ignored. The rooms themselves are tastefully decorated, automated, clean, and spacious but poorly designed. The bathrooms have glass doors that make it difficult not to wake anyone. The closet is inside the bath limiting you to 1 person use for toilet, shower, sink and closet. The casino area lacks the life and vibe of others such as Pallazzo or Wynn. The location is central but the hotel seems a far walk to get to strip. The buffet is $30 and the room service quite expensive. A cheese and cracker tray for 4 was $70. We were there 3 days and still confused about the shopping, etc There was no orientation of the hotel, maps we had to explore on our own to find info on the spa, restaurants and shopping. Majority in our party of 10 voted to go back to Pallazzo next year.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would visit again!”
Reviews.Author: NYStar12
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous experience at the Aria in July 2011. Room was clean, well appointed and access was easy. We had a quick take out breakfast there in the morning and visited one or 2 of the high end celebrity chef restaurants in the evening during the visit. Definitely would recommend...and the hotel just smells awesome with the hints of vanilla as you enter.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA - One of MGM's Greatest Resorts”
Reviews.Author: chatter-box2go
Reviews.Content: My 3rd stay this year at the Aria & it's still as awesome as the first! Hit a couple of nice jackpots, enjoyed a comfortable room & bed, super nice technology & last but not least I still get treated like a very valuable guest each & every time I check in! Already making plans to return in the early spring!

Reviews.Title: “Bleh”
Reviews.Author: Shawn O
Reviews.Content: This is Vegas. You know what you're getting into. The room was nicely equipped and the bed was nice. But I didn't find it very clean. To me, everything in Vegas always lacks that 10% from being 'fabulous' and ends up being lackluster. This hotel was no exception. Not sure if I'd stay here again unless with a huge discount. Staying here was the equivalent of going to a Michelin star restaurant and finding a curly hair in my dish. It left a bad aftertaste.

Reviews.Title: “Standard issue Vegas mega-hotel...only the star-chef restaurants are worth it - otherwise, food service is kind of a disaster”
Reviews.Author: Onlythebest4
Reviews.Content: Had a great meal at Julian Serrano's Tapas last night. Pre-ordered a special paella - it was ready when we arrived, hot and delicious. As for the hotel's main food service options, kind of a disaster: long lines, average service, average food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, service a bit touch and go, resort fees need to be scrapped”
Reviews.Author: itismeap
Reviews.Content: The property itself is excellent, very modern, clean and fancy etc. Spacious rooms. Don't think it can be faulted in this area. We found some staff to be not very warming/welcoming, though I think this was hit and miss and some were very nice..I found that if you called front desk, concierge etc then they are very nice, when you walk to up staff it can be different. We found some staff at the restaurants to be very rude and on one occasion the service was terrible. The food itself was pretty good though.
