Just be prepared to spend  I think the resort fee is a junk fee and should be eliminated. I would prefer they charge for Wifi, newspaper, spa services etc separately if customers want it. I did not use the Wifi as I have data on my phone. I found out at the end of the stay you have to go collect your newspaper from the store there, it isn't delivered to your room.. I did not use the spa services yet had to pay $100 for this during the stay. Next time I visit, I will find another property to avoid the junk fees.

Reviews.Title: “Mini-Vegas Trip with Toddlers”
Reviews.Author: shaq4545
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are frequent travelers to Vegas and we usually stay at the Palazzo as it is a luxurious, clean casino that caters to both us and our two toddler girls (ages 2 & 3). We had stayed at Aria before without the girls but we weren't sure how it would be if they were with us so we took a mini trip (2 nights - 3 days) right before Christmas and we were very pleased. The casino itself has a very sophisticated, dark theme so my 3 year old wasn't too happy with that =) but the room was pretty nice. Not as large as the Palazzo though... the Palazzo has a separate space where they have couches, a desk, and entertainment center however at the Aria it's all one space. The beds are amazing. We had a little bit of trouble with the housekeeping so make sure you're on top of that. The cool thing about Aria is it's location. There is a large upscale shopping area called Crystals connected to the casino. There is a underground walkway that connects to Monte Carlo. There is a bridge that connects Crystals to Planet Hollywood across the street (but beware that the elevator wasn't working when got to Planet Hollywood so we had to get people to help us bring our double stroller down the stairs). Planet Hollywood has a huge mall with more affordable stores and tons of restaurants. We took a trip to M&M world (walking distance) and the kids really enjoyed it. It's four stories and has a small theater that shows a 3D 10-minute movie... very cute! At the bottom floor of this building there is a huge gaming center (arcade) that would be fun for older kids. All in all, we had a great time. Oh, and there are several art galleries near the Aria that are beautiful and a must-see.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price, but shy from a five star”
Reviews.Author: Maxstudio
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean. Bathrooms are huge. Air conditioning is very slow to respond. The hotel doesn't have enough restaurants, so there are long lines at lunch and dinner hours. Lots of fancy features--everything is controlled electronically, including door key. Front desk staff are friendly and helpful. The overall experience doesn't really justify the premium we paid for a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but.”
Reviews.Author: miklos220
Reviews.Content: New hotel with all the bells and whistles and more. We had a high floor room with a great view of the mountains and all the lights glittering in the other buildings. The room was very well appointed. The check in was fast. The weak points were; stained furniture and carpets, lack of vacuum use during our stay, very dirty picture-windows, pesky "resort fee" at check out.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: starlitsky3311
Reviews.Content: I stayed from Dec 25th for 3 nights. The property is huge so there's lots of walking, but I loved the style and the spaciousness of the rooms. The check-in was very efficient and the concierge was incredibly helpful with answering our questions, booking show tickets and restaurant reservations. It was great to have a tram straight to Bellagio. Visited the spa for a treatment as well and it was the largest, most comprehensive spa I've ever seen. The ambiance was great; you got the use of saunas, steam rooms and pools with your service, I felt completely relaxed and pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeding Expectation & Beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Dave L
Reviews.Content: Going to Vegas is not just to fulfill the basic needs of gaming and night life. True fun lovers and thrill seekers will constantly be seeking the ultimate level of satisfaction and I believe you can only find the totally brand new experience when you set foot on the ARIA Resort & Casino. The satisfaction is exceeding all expectation and beyond! Don't believe me? I bet you will try it, wouldn't you?

Reviews.Title: “I liked it, but didn't love it”
Reviews.Author: monieb1922
Reviews.Content: Aria is a very pretty property. I guess the theme is "trees" because we saw them all over, and the overwhelming color scheme was chocolate brown. If you are sensitive to smell, be warned, the vanilla scent is pretty strong in the casino area. There is lots of art and the Christmas decorations were very pretty and matched the "tree" theme. We stayed over the Christmas holiday, and the casino was pretty busy, which I was pleased to see, being a local. Check in was swift, and I requested a nicer room on a high floor. We got 21st floor with a view of the Cosmopolitan pool, so I guess that qualifies. The room definitely has all of the technology bells and whistles. Wave your key over the door panel and it unlocks the door. The tv remote controls everything from the curtains to the lights to check out, and there is a panel near the bed which controls l everything in the room as well. The curtains opened and the tv played music upon your entry. At times it was a bit confusing, but we figured everything out pretty quickly. However, I was not in love with the layout of the room. I much preferred Vdara in terms of layout to Aria, actually. The entryway seemed to be a misuse of space, and the bathroom was a bit strange. The bathtub was enclosed in a "room" with the shower instead of having the separate shower and tub. The water closet (ie toilet room) was surprisingly large, but had a frosted door rather than a real one, so if someone was washing their hands or putting on makeup, you could see the person in the toilet area handling their...business, which was kind of icky. There was no fan in the water closet, either. The bed seemed a bit too soft when I sat on it, but it actually was very comfortable. It was like sleeping on a cloud. Now for the bad... We left our room to do some post-holiday shopping at about 9:30am. We turned on the "service" button on the panel by the door. As we left, we noticed that housekeeping was servicing rooms right near ours (we even spoke to them) and figured that our room would be cleaned shortly. We returned back to the room at about 4:00pm to find that our room had NOT been cleaned, which was really annoying. I called down to housekeeping, who apologized and said they'd send someone right up. 30 minutes later, no one had come. We went downstairs to the front desk and put in another request for service. They said they'd spoken to a supervisor and would send someone up. We went back to the room, 20 more minutes, no one had come. We found a housekeeper on our floor and asked her, getting more and more annoyed. She radioed a supervisor, and FINALLY after another 15 minutes someone came to clean our room. Getting our room serviced at 6pm is a bit ridiculous, especially since we'd been gone all day!! Cocktail service was pretty nonexistent. I only played for about 30 minutes at a time, but never was approached by a cocktail waitress. The Spa, on the other hand, was absolutely wonderful. I will write a separate review for that, however. MGM and their resort fees...Whew! Tax and resort fees (which include free access to the gym and free Wi-Fi) totaled almost an extra $40/night. Make sure to factor that into your calculations. All in all, it was "fine", but I'm not going to go out of my way to visit Aria again for my next staycation.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas time at the Aria”
Reviews.Author: alylee777
Reviews.Content: The Aria truly is a lovely hotel with a very attentive staff and clean, super modern rooms. We stayed for 3 nights through priceline for $90 and were offered an upgrade to a Crystal suite for $50 more a night. The extra 450 square feet and miles of city views from the 33rd floor were well worth every penny. The bed was like a dream...soft and inviting with nice linen. We loved all the travertine and marble in the bathroom, the tons of towels, lotions, potions and even dental kits. The only strange thing I must mention is the frosted glass on the toilet closet door. Why not use a regular style door so 2 people can be in the HUGE bathroom without feeling awkward about looking in. The heated toilet seat was awesome but I was not courageous enough to try the bidet settings. I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat!! Left with $200 in BJACK winnings toooo!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Aria- Pleasantly Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cianmodel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel during the Thanks Giving Weekend. I had a lot of fun here!!! The room was just amazing!!! As soon as I walk in to the room,the curtains automatically opens and gives you the pleasant view of Las Vegas. Everything is digitally controlled with one single remote (lighting, tv, curtains). What I like about the hotel was the proximity of the place to the strip, easy access to the malls and clubs and unusual design of the hotel,it is just pleasant to the eyes! I did splurged myself at the spa! they have the salt room for meditation and do try laying on the japanese stone beds for relaxation. The spa has unlimited drinks that include different kind of teas and sodas and just enjoy the serenity of the place! Thins to do: 1. For chocaholics- Visit Max Brenner at Cesar's Palace and try the chocolate pizza, fondues, and the chocolate beer. 2. We did the buffets of all buffet for 50$ (24 hour buffet service for 7 hotels)- It's quantity not quality!! I prefer paying for 38$ at The Buffet at Aria because their food was excellent! 3. Besides gambling, enjoy the free shows that each hotel has to offer or just walk at the Las Vegas Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Hi-Tech rooms, nice location, awesome views”
Reviews.Author: rpunit
Reviews.Content: Located right near the action. You have direct access to the much hyped City Center, that is nothing but a bunch of super expensive shops, all laid out very prettily. The room is rather small but cozy. The quality of beds and linen is top notch. Room blinds, lights etc can be controlled via the TV/Cock remote. No coffee (like most vegas hotels), overpriced in room mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “pretty schnazzy”
Reviews.Author: Jordan Y
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. only thing that still irks me is the high tech control system in the room. they really should've given us a manual to operate that thing. it controls the curtains, lights, tv, radio everything. it was pretty irriating to control. several times accidentally turned the lights off while my friend was in the bathroom :p the room is stocked w/ snacks but be careful not to remove from frig or u will get charged- since it's got sensors. overall the room was nice, but i'll stick to the regular cheaper rooms next time, don't really care for all the fancy smanzy high tech controls.....regular on and off switch suits me better :p

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Smokey”
Reviews.Author: USMCCowboy
Reviews.Content: Next time I visit Las Vegas I will stay in a Non-Smoking Hotel. This hotel is thoroughly modern with incredible decor, and our suite on the 23 floor was magnificent. Upon checking in, we were informed of a $20 per day per person "resort" fee which we were not aware of. Prepare for lots of walking. We were origally shocked by how few clothes the waitresses are required to wear. This may appeal to some people but I prefer a classier, more elegant hotel. One of the members of our party was a bit elderly and not capable of walking great distances which made getting around City Center and off the resort a bit of a challenge. The property is very nice. I was not as impressed with the Spa and they have a $30.00 per day charge. The Spa at the Bellagio is much nicer in my opinion and costs approximately the same amount. I was most disturbed by the cigarette smoke.. You have to walk through clouds of chain smokers to get to the elevators and leave the Hotel which is not pleasant. The Aria has 16 Restaurants on the resort and we dined with 5 of them, and were not impressed. The Aria is a mixed bag. The Aria has many pro's and also a few cons to weigh when considering where to stay while visiting Vegas. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great room upgrade”
Reviews.Author: sandid
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room through Visa Signature Luxury hotel collection to celebrate our anniversary. We checked in Christmas day and James and Reginald went out of their way to make sure to find a room that suited our needs. Our reservation included a free room upgrade and we chose a suite that has a living room, half bath off living room, dining room with small kitchen that included a fridge and large bedroom with master bath. The master bath has dual sinks, a soaking tub, huge shower. The towels are thick and luxurious The room has 4 tvs and is huge and beautiful. We have a great view overlooking the strip. I wasn't sure what staying in a 5 star property in vegas would be like because 5 star service to me means being welcomed by name when we return to the property. Alas, this a big vegas resort with no one to even open the door for me much less great me by name. And there is a line for everything. However, for the most part, when we have sought out service or recommendations from the staff, they have exceeded our expectation. The hotel is next to crystals shopping center (very high end) with a tram to Bellagio. There is also a walkway to Mandalay Bay (there is a CVS right in front of Mandalay Bay for sundries). Walking on the strip takes a while to get anywhere. For instance, Hawaiian Marketplace is right across the Strip from Aria but there is no way for pedestrians to cross the Strip without walking a few blocks in either direction. There are walkways over the Strip and we have found many times to escalators are not working. I mention this only because at the time of our trip, my knee was injured and steps/walking were difficult for me. Back to Aria. When we arrived back at our room the first night, there was a nice tray with chocolate covered strawberries and macaroons from the hotel in honor of our anniversary. A very nice gesture. On the negative side, we reported a couple issues with the room when we first checked in. When we arrived back at our room one time, a technician was sitting on the living room sofa watching tv. Not good. We notified the hotel three times that the sinks in the master bath were very slow to drain. It was never fixed. All in all, a great experience especially considering the price we paid. If you are looking for luxury on the strip, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Cool concepts but average rooms overall”
Reviews.Author: HoustonConsultant
Reviews.Content: Aria is positioning itself as having "cool" and "innovative" rooms, but the basic rooms are pretty standard for a new hotel/casino in Vegas. The touch screen for the windows, lights, and TV is cool. However, beyond that, it is a generally standard nice room on the strip. The casino is nice, and there is plenty of shopping opportunities throughout City Center. It is far away from the Wynn, but you can get to the Cosmopolitan and Bellagio rather quickly. I have stayed here a couple of times, and there has never been anything wrong with my stay, but nothing spectacular either. If you gamble, join MLife. I do not gamble a huge amount, but even I gamble enough to get three comped nights every quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation, Ever!”
Reviews.Author: MJCAN
Reviews.Content: My room greeted me upon entrance and gracefully awakened me everyday! Even the house rooms are 6 star. I enjoyed the adult pool - Liquid. Loved the Topas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CazMuz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria in November with my friend for a girlie holiday. We were checked in quickly and were so impressed with our room. It was spacious and modern and it was only a Double Duluxe...would love to know what the Penthouse suites look like! The room service food is out of this world with massive portions. Pricey of course, but what isn't in Vegas! The service at check-in, concierge, in the business centre and in the spa was fabulous - they were falling over themselves to help. The only criticism is that it took them far too long to answer the phone from the room. Also, this hotel is completely beautiful and the bars and clubs are so glamorous. You must try the Carrot Cake cocktail in Deuce Bar!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: deblynn_11
Reviews.Content: We were splurging for Christmas. Check-in was slow and the rep. was not friendly or helpful. The first 2 rooms offered had dirty windows ( inside and out ). The 3rd room had a heat/air control that rattled all night and the room stayed at 78 degrees. Early morning we heard loud fighting next door. Fighting was still happening when we came back to room 9 hours later!!! Best hotel offered was to move us 12 floors down!!!! Security's excuse was that people get depressed and drunk on holidays! I don't know why we should have to pay the price for that. In addition to the AC/heating not working, the toilet flooded the bathroom on the 3rd day. We asked for a late check-out because of this, but we were declined. Be aware that this hotel has only high priced food options. And they are not very good either. During our 4 days we ate off-site as the prices were too high and the quality was low.

Reviews.Title: “5-star Resort”
Reviews.Author: Self_Guided_Tour
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria the week before Christmas. The good thing is that there were not a whole lot of people staying there on a weekday before holiday, so casino, bar, restuarants were not jam packed. Tje reort is slightly off the strip. It is centrally located, close to everything. The actual location is called the City Center. The building is a little recessed - connected to the strip by Cosmopolitan and Cystal (a high end shopping center, plus bar, plus club). I really enjoyed my time there, the room is very sizeable. The bed is particuarly comfy, comtemporily decorated. Full touch control is cool, I experimented and played with it time and again. It is very high tech, although it can be a little inconvenient at times. Bathroom is huge, with dual sinks. The tub is deep abd right next to the shower, which is convenient. Best expereince: when I walked in the room, the shade was open, light turned on and TV started light music, with my name on screen. Very nice touch. Worst expereince: I was charged $22 resort fee for parking, wifi, etc. Although it is not a gimmick, still a little steep on the price tag. Bottom line: a extremely nice five star brand new hotel/resort, with comtempory taste and high tech feel. Bravo, Aria.

Reviews.Title: “A few days in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: runningtrip
Reviews.Content: Very typical upscale hotel with some new features such as a a touch screen to control window coverings, lights, heat/air, music, etc.. The hotel is walking distance to many of the other hotels/casinos. The downside was the majority of the hotel had too much frangrance in their ventilation system especially towards the fitness/sauna area. Also the drinks & food were very expensive but not the least bit impressive with the buffett being unworthy of my lips.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located modern hotel at the City Center”
Reviews.Author: Yum E
Reviews.Content: Came by for a conference the other week. Upon arrival, the front desk was staffed with numerous front desk agents. The $20 trick upgraded me to a room facing the strip on the 24th floor. The room itself is technologically advanced with a touch-based tablet-like device next to the bed that controls everything from the wake up call, the motorized blinds, lights, music, TV etc. I had difficulty sleeping being a warm sleeper as the mattress is a memory-foam pillow top coil mattress. The water pressure for both the shower and sink were extremely low, resulting in a less than luxurious shower and sink experience. The conference facilities were good although the leatherette chairs became rather warm after a few hours as they lack the breathability of leather chairs. The room itself was very spacious...even too spacious. The mini bar and snacks on the desk are all motion-activated, fyi. The only outlets in the room are the ones by the TV, next to the TV, or in the restroom...

Reviews.Title: “ARIA is Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Miatt
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Aria, after loving Vdara, but wanting a resort with a casino, and let me say, we loved it just as much as Vdara. The check-in process was very efficient and the front desk agent noticed from my ID that it was my birthday and wished me a happy birthday and said she would send something up to the room. Like usual, we tried to check in early (around 12:00) and we were given a room right away, which was very nice. Our room was on the 12th floor and had a nice view of the Cosmopolitan. Nothing special, but better than looking at a parking lot or the I-15. There is so much technology in this room, it is a blast. You walk in and there is the usual on/off light switches, but there is also a Master On and Master Off switch. Hitting the Master On turns on all the lights, and opens up the sheers and the blackout blinds. That was very cool. Next to your bed there is also a tablet style touchpad that controls just about everything in the room. All of the lights, the temperature, the sheers, the blinds, the tv, the music. It is awesome. You can also set your DND for the door from the bed. You can also set a wake up alarm like no other. It will turn on the TV, open the blinds, turn on the lights and/or change the temperature. You also have a goodnight button by the bed which turns everything off and closes the blinds. If you are not ready for bed you can set the goodnight timer that will do all of that after a certain amount of time. Other positives about this hotel, they do NOT charge for Valet, which is very nice, but if you aren't in the mood to have someone else park your car they do have self park as well. The casino is fun to play in, but beware, a nice hotel means higher limit tables. Don't expect to see anything below 10 dollars, and the average table is probably closer to $25. One negative, and it isn't the hotel's fault is the location. As with any hotel in the city center, it takes a little bit of a walk to get to the strip. Or you can walk through the casino, and go through the Monte Carlo, or take the train to Bellagio and go through there. All in all ARIA completely lived up to its expectations. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and spacious. It is a great atmosphere and there aren't snooty employees like some nice hotels. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas trip ever”
Reviews.Author: bbscooter
Reviews.Content: Arrived after midnight and check in was a breeze. We booked a corner suite the room was fantastic! Every employee was amazing from the front desk to housekeeping, every time we walked by we were greeted with a friendly hello! Can't wait to go back, my new favorite on the strip. Aria staff you are doing it right! Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Great High Tech rooms and Wonderful Eats”
Reviews.Author: cuspdoc
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Aria my last four trips. Spend the extra to stay in a corner suite. Large and comfortable. Great choice for eats right in the hotel. Casino very nice. Never had any of the problems noted with the electronics. Set the room to have the drapes to open, lights to come up slowly and radio to come on. Very Nice with no problems. The bathrooms in the corner suite are great. The panoramic suite has a two person tub that sits in the corner with great views. Would highly recommend. Did I tell you about the heated seat in the toilet with a wash/dry cycle?

Reviews.Title: “Great location beautiful contempary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle60_11
Reviews.Content: Was at this hotel for my 50th birthday. The rooms are amazing very contempary. Love that everything is done electronically. The blinds open and the lights go on as you enter. The casino is comfortable although it is big it seems cozy. The Elvis show was excellent. The food in the regular everyday restuarant was excellent. They do have a selection of restuarants at the hotel. The one experience that was amazing was going to the Craft Steak House at the MGM Grand hotel. We also went on a helicopter ride and champagne lunch to the grand canyon. It was worth the time and the money. We saw the Terry Fator show and it was excellent. The service at this hotel was excellent. We have been to Las Vegas several times but we really liked this hotel. We spent time at the pool everyday. You are close to a lot of attractions all within walking distance from the hotel - anyway in Vegas you get your exercise. I recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SVS68
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel on the middle of the strip. Stayed at the sky suite and it is possibly the best suite I have stayed on my holiday anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “love the vanilla scent”
Reviews.Author: Lina333
Reviews.Content: We got to Aria at around 2pm and were able to check in but our room was not ready until almost 4. Had the deluxe room and it was definitely big enough for 2. the whole remote control thing for everything in the room sounds like an amazing idea but..... the remote is docked to the night stand so as soon as you walk in, the room is pitch dark or as you left it before; it also takes forever to flip through channels. one cool feature by the night table is that if you are ready for bed, you just click "goodnight" and everything turns off. As far as the cleaning service, its really bad. We were there for 4 nights and the first day our room was not cleaned until 9pm and the other 3 days it was not until after 4. There is a button you push called "service" that is supposed to let them know you are ready for them to come in your room. I had to call the house keeping line as well as hunt the cleaning ladies in the hall so that the room could be cleaned. The room was also very dusty, not sure how often they clean the counters Don't bother with the Buffet (there are better on the Strip) but do try Julian Serrano. Food and service there was amazing- Loved the PAELLA, CEVICHE, AND CROQUETAS. The pastry place (JP) as well as the Coffee Bean are good places for a grab and go breakfast/snack. We ordered room service one morning for breakfast and it was delicious. If you are not a fan of cigarette smoke, this is the place to stay at. It doesn't smell like it at all (unless you are sitting next to someone blowing it at your face). The spa and salon were both really good, a little pricey but its Vegas so that is somewhat expected. If you are planning on using those facilities, book your treatments earlier in the day so you can use the rest of the other facilities for free for the rest of the day. The Valet was also a great service that we used very often. They were very courteous and prompt. If i was to come back to Vegas, I would stay at ARIA. Definitely a plus that there is a free tram to take you to the Bellagio and Monte Carlo

Reviews.Title: “A notch above”
Reviews.Author: cph13
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights and 4 days at the Aria in mid december. The hotel was incredible, I have nothing but rave reviews for this place. We arrived early on thursday and were allowed to check in (915am). The room was top notch, the touch pad was a treat. Everyone from the hotel that I had contact with from the bellmen to the desk all called me by name (nice touch). The only problem we had with our stay was the bath soap. My wife is allergic to shea butter which the soaps contain, after a visit with the desk (James thank you) we were supplyed with another hand soap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, unparalleled price and location!”
Reviews.Author: Travellover1869
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in late December. We had booked a king bed room but upon check in we requested 2 queens and were upgraded at no charge. The hotel charges a daily resort fee of $20 which includes wifi access in the room. The room was modern with cool technology tricks and very clean. The bed was the best I have ever slept on. Bell service was prompt and brought us a bag of ice with our bags. Concierge was helpful and friendly. Everyone was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time of My Life!”
Reviews.Author: Morenita610
Reviews.Content: 1st time to Vegas and I was lucky enough to stay at the Aria! This building is monumental in size, so be prepared for a 20 minute walk before you even exit the premise. The entire hotel is modern and gorgeous. We stayed in the sky suites. The room service food is mediocre at best, but who cares? You're in Vegas. You're not here to eat. You're here to party.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Luxury Complex”
Reviews.Author: CheeseburgerBob
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family for a business conference. Very modern rooms and hotel/casino. Great views from tower (36th floor). Huge bathroom (actually tub and shower) but they are combined in one room and glass doors to rest of bath, so not really for families or "completely out there" use - as large as they were, you couldn't be in one are of the bathroom and have someone in another. Comfortable rooms - high-tech, but not impossible to figure out if working correctly. Vegas is not an "eat cheap" experience anymore and Aria and City Center are pricey for those on a budget - but McDonalds and Starbucks are across the street, too. Very nice, all around, and for Vegas a typical, large casino complex experience. For those that don't travel as much or don't stay in mid-high end hotels, this is a very upscale, high end experience, but being Vegas and with the large crowds there is still a herd the masses feel. Very high end shops in Crystals. If you win big or love to window shops the Rodeo Drive-type shops, this is it. The dealers are nice and most have good personalities. On the strip and easy to get to walking or right off the expressway, too.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service , mal servicio me robaron”
Reviews.Author: Betoelche
Reviews.Content: The bell boy robed from me a lululemon bag........ Worth 400 usd. Nobody paid to me nothing!!!! They say that they are making an investigation! But they are not responding my phone calls and my e mails. I am very upset with this kind of service i dont recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very attrative facilities”
Reviews.Author: DavidPortland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights mid-December on a priceline bid of $70. I was given a room with a terrific view but I couldn't get the temperature above 65 degrees. Called operator, asked that someone be sent to fix the thermostat and after several more calls including one to the assistant manager and a 1.5 hour wait, asked for a new room which I was given. Facility is very modern and attractively designed. Staff members, other than operator and assistant manager, very helpful. Ate dinner at the buffet one night and found the rolls to be stale but rest of food quite good. The $20 resort fee per day gives free local calls, free use of fitness center which is terrific, free USA Today, and free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Room blackout windos”
Reviews.Author: Homero L
Reviews.Content: If you are planing to wake up late in your stay be advise that the windos are not completly black out, I ask the front desk manager abouth this issue and they will fix this when they remodel the hotel and will not be soon.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Pricey”
Reviews.Author: aca828
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for a business conference. The room is completely electronic which sounds good on paper but was frustrating. The desk lamp would not work so after pressing buttons (lamp, remote panel) for 5 minutes finally called maintenance who thought I was a moron. They asked three times if I was pressing the right button only to arrive and replace the bulb. Next up was the TV remote - same story, are you pointing the remote at the TV? Replacing the batteries solved that one. The conference center was very nice. The wireless internet was poor as I kept having to login throughout the stay ever couple of hours. Restaurants were pricey but it is a sharp, well-appointed hotel. They still permit smoking in public areas. I have been to Vegas several times and would probably choose another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: el_hombre_rico
Reviews.Content: The Aria hotel is a fantastic choice when booking on the strip. It's located right in the center of the strip so you can easily walk to most of the big attraction hotels like the MGM and Bellagio. The Aria is still fairly new (only constructed within the last five years) so the casino doesn't have that cigarette smell that many of the older ones do. The rooms are nicely done, with modern technology controlling the lighting, curtains, television and temperature. There is a large soaker tub in the room and dual sinks. The beds are amazing! The casino itself is clean, the tables are fairly high end though, generally starting at $15 minimum for most tables. We had the breakfast buffet, which is fairly good. A large variety of seafood to choose from, including crab legs and jumbo prawns. It cost a little under $20 per person One thing I would recommend would be to buy the day access to the spa facilities ($30). You get unlimited access to the steam room, sauna, jacuzzi's, two relaxation rooms (one with hot stone beds, the other with vibrating chairs and salt aromatherapy) and a private infinity pool overlooking the main pool. It's a nice change of pace from the frantic Vegas atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Never fails to satisfy”
Reviews.Author: DTSecondHome
Reviews.Content: Our 4th time here this year. Aria rooms are very inviting once inside. I do still feel front desk needs to be more on their game, honouring requests. We did have a much longer wait for a room this trip but I do understand it was very busy. They did compensate us for the delay. The beds and pillows are the best I have ever slept on. Our room was always cleaned well and any requests quickly satisfied. The casino is full of new slots that are reasonable at paying out. The restaurant choices here are great. We have another trip booked for Feb. A great choice for a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: whitehart
Reviews.Content: Holiday 30/11/11-06/12/11 Have stayed in many nice hotels but never one on this scale before. Not dissapointed ! Check in -2 minute wait, asked how much suite up grade would be but unfortunately none available. Room 23106 not that near the lift but think many people exagarate about walk ! Cleaner missed room 1 day but honestly how many people clean their own home EVERY day ? Good size room and bathroom . Did not use mini-bar . Good security to get in lift. There was nothing bad so would definately recommend. Went in some not so fancy hotels were so glad of our decision to splash out !! Love the security of showing lift man room key. No complaints at all, ate at Cafe Vetro twice and good both times

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: CiaoNYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tastefully decorated, the rooms are comfortable, chic and have great views. The staff was super friendly! Everyone from the bartenders to the concierge to housekeeping. Very polite, friendly and helpful. Lovely pools, hot tub and great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Rooms, Great Service, More Refined”
Reviews.Author: STYLEONTHEGO
Reviews.Content: Aria, the premier hotel of the City Center project in Las Vegas, is a great place to stay. The location is perfect (halfway down the strip with easy access to numerous adjacent hotels and some serious luxury shopping). Aria features some signature dining choices, though we did not try any of them. The service is on par with almost any 5 star luxury property. Housekeeping responded to our requests for early cleaning each of the three days we spent there and could not have been nicer or more efficient. The rooms are airy, large, and feature oversized bathrooms, lots of closet space, great seating, and all the lights, window treatments, and the TV can be controlled from a very easy to use central command pad on the nightstand. The entire property is spotless clean and thanks to continuous pumping of a mild vanilla fragrance, you won't smell all the disgusting cigarette smoke in the casino lobby. The gym is very large and features equipment and arrangement / layout on par with Equinox or one of the other higher end national chains. If you are looking for a more refined, grown up place to enjoy Vegas from a bit of a distance, then this is the place for you. if you're looking for a theme, then go someplace else. The hotel features a buffet that can easily be skipped. Head to the Wicked Spoon at the Cosmopolitan across the street instead. The dining options that are hotel managed feature so so food at high prices. Beyond that, this is a very nice hotel and a relatively peaceful place to spend a Vegas vacation. The beds, by the way, are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and stay here”
Reviews.Author: Nvizble
Reviews.Content: Newer and gorgeous hotel in the City Center area of the Strip. High tech rooms with beautiful views, fantastic service and all the amenities you could ask for. Great atmosphere including the best hotel background "elevator" music I have ever heard. Casino was clean and modern with something for everyone. Excellent choices of restaurants and bars. Located right next door to the upscale Crystals shopping plex. The only drawback was the high prices on food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet & modern!”
Reviews.Author: popolin77
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business convention. This is a nice newer hotel that is clean and quiet. Reminds you more of staying in office space than actually being in Vegas. No compliants other than location on the strip. Would return but probably would select the palazzo or encore first.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Jfield29
Reviews.Content: Not only did we get screwed out of our room, due to management allowing guests to refuse to leave, they also charged our card over $300 2 MONTHS after our stay for unknown reasons. Absolutely disgusted with this hotel and will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tiki3
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Aria. I've been to Vegas many times and stayed at at least 8 different hotels along the strip. This is by far the best. The rooms are very new and you can control the lights, TV and shades from the remote. The room and bathroom are very spacious, and the hotel is only 2 years old. The casino and pools are also very nice. I enjoyed gambling at the Aria, too. Plenty of tables and slots. Be aware of the following: they will charge you an extra $20/nite if you want a room with two double beds vs 1 king, and they charge, as do most hotels on the strip, a $10 or $20/day resort access fee. The room rates vary throughout the year, but they are far better than some of the other comparabe upscale hotels on the strip. I did not like their buffet, but I tend not to enjoy buffets in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WeThree_Swiss
Reviews.Content: The Aria meets every expectation. Does it exceed them? No. It's Las Vegas....

Reviews.Title: “Super nice with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: FemaleTraveler85
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! My room was superb - loved controlling lights, curtains, alarm, heater, and TV from the TV remote control. Everyone I interacted with was very helpful - front desk, bell desk, buffet. Check in and out were quick - but you can check out from the remote control as well! Clean and well-appointed room. They do have a resort fee, which kind of gets on my nerves (just hide it in the cost of the room so I am paying for it but don't know it!) for Wi-Fi, free local calls, etc. Check out the Jean Phillippe Patisserie - amazing desserts! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the Aria every time”
Reviews.Author: sazzleDoncaster
Reviews.Content: We will be returning to the Aria in March 2012 for our 3rd visit, having initially stayed there when it first opened and again in October 2011. We loved The Aria's ultra modern theme, in sharp contrast to the classic, but now tired elegance of the Bellagio,and instantly, despite it's size, we felt at home there. Ideally situated in the heart of the Strip, access to other nearby hotels is achieved via the over head walk ways, the trams connecting to various hotels so as to save crossing the busy roads. Even that's no problem .......and I'm no spring chicken Check in to the Aria for us went very smoothly, quickly and efficiently and our request for a low floor room due to my fear of lifts was accommodated very easily. Our 3rd floor room was spacious, very clean, the large double bed extremely comfortable, toiletries stocks/towels were replenished daily and even the view was passable. I am sure the higher floors afford a more spectacular view of the Strip but for the time we spent in our room it didn't bother us in the slightest. There are numerous pools and recliners on offer so finding a suitable spot at any time of the day was no problem. The pool opens promptly at 9am. The only down side for us was the loud thumping music coming from the pool/disco on certain days but once warned of opening times it was easy to adapt our own schedule to avoid this. The pool side waitress service was 2nd to none, the girls were delightful, helpful and efficient, as indeed were all the staff we encountered throughout our 2 week stay. For health and safety reasons I had to ring for a security escort up/down the stairwell and again the security guards were all personable and very prompt to arrive at our door. We ate the breakfast, lunch evening meal buffets and were most impressed with the vast selection and high quality foods on offer. Highly recommended. I am at a loss to read how fellow travellers failed to notice that there is a hotel resort charge of approx $280 currently I believe. This was clearly detailed in all my holiday documentation at the time of booking and in confirmation docs. So as to avoid any unpleasant surprises always read your booking form very carefully. If you are a gambler it is essential to join the players club. By using your members card when playing the slots/tables, points accrue which entitle you to substantial discounts on items charged to your room and also free dollar slot play. The Aria's card can also be used at many of the Vegas casinos so, unlike the Wyn/Encore, you are not restricted to gambling at any one hotel casino. Reception staff also booked us in on line for our flight departure thus saving us any hanging about at the airport. Whatever your request, just ASK and everything will be done to accommodate your needs. Overall we cannot rate the Aria experience highly enough and are counting the days to our return. By booking this holiday via Ebookers/Topcash back site I also saved a substantial amount on what was already a great deal. We're getting 2 free buffets as well ! A superb hotel which we highly recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “What more can you want?”
Reviews.Author: robinvn
Reviews.Content: Checked in here around 6.30pm and was nice and quiet then. Check in was quick, easy and friendly. Have to walk through the casino to the elevators but gives you a chance to take a look. As soon as you enter the room, the lights come on, the curtains open and the TV comes on and a greeting on screen with my name there. A nice touch! The room was really very nice and the bathroom large, with a bath and shower. The shower gives instant heat, which is nice. There is a very well stocked mini bar but as you would expect in a 5* hotel, the items in there are quite expensive. A word of warning..I saw in the welcome book that you could be charged, just for moving items around in the mini bar. I did take a few bottles out, just to see what they were but after contacting reception, was pleased to see I wasn't charged! We stayed in the room with 2 relatives and the room doesn't seem too large with 4 people in there but is was still comfortable nonetheless. There is a small console on the bedside table, that will control everything in the room, from lights to curtains, temp and TV. I played around with that a bit but my wife wasn't too happy when I turned off the lights when she was showering! The inside and outside of the hotel are really quite stunning. The hotel staff are polite and friendly and always happy to help out and one of them approached me when I was queuing at the Concierge desk and saved me a long wait, by offering advice. We had breakfast at the buffet and there is certainly a large choice on offer and the food is great. We were on the 21st floor and not even half way up, so a big hotel! The room was always spotless, as was the bathroom. You can't really be better placed than at the Aria. It's right in the middle of the strip and has a tram running from the Monte Carlo next door, to Bellagios. Couldn't fault anything at this hotel and we would certainly be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Five star property”
Reviews.Author: nolan2
Reviews.Content: Check-in was efficient and polite and I was on my way to the room in only a few moments. Although I have stayed in many of the hotels on the strip in recent years, the Aria is one of the most impressive. The lobby and casino area is an architectural marvel with lots of chrome, glass, sculptures and very impressive architectural features. The rooms are spacious as are the bathrooms with double sink, a walk-in shower and separate toilet area. Rooms provide robes and have lots of thick terry towels and fine toiletries. They overdid the electronics which control the lighting, the TV and drapes. It is far too complicated. The lighting is poor as all the light fixtures have recently be changed out with low energy bulbs. The illumination is inadequate. Dinner in Blossom was excellent as was Sirio's, the Italian restaurant,

Reviews.Title: “Wow, a New Gem in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bluejay19golf
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in MANY places in Vegas and this ranks right up there. The rooms are large, the bathrooms are really cool, the appointments are luxurious. But the biggest difference is how everything (lights, curtains, etc.) are controlled via your TV remote control. Check-in was efficient and the clerk was courteous. Maid service was excellent as well. The only thing I didn't like was the Buffet. I'd been to the buffet about 18 months ago and thought it was much better then. Yes they have crab legs, shrimp and sushi but if you're looking for any other fish, keep looking. I finally found some red snapper smothered in onions -- yuck. Last time they had grilled swordfish or halibut! But overall this is a spectacular place. And the Jean Phillippe Patisserie is incredible -- it's like James Beard goes to Wonderland.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sammycat001
Reviews.Content: Go to Vegas 3 times a year from the UK, and I love the Aria. Stayed at them all before The Wynn, Bellagio , MGM, Mandalay, Ceasars , and many many more but I like this one the best.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing about this Resort, is their rooms & The Buffet Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: somy_forever
Reviews.Content: The 5 star resot has very poor service at their front desk and one lady that was security by the elevators checking to see if your guest of the hotel. She made a very rude comment, very unhappy lady. The rooms are beautiful, big, huge walk in shower and tub, tons of space in the bathroom! The Buffet Restaurant was my favorite, tons of great options. All you can eat crab, yum. So good, they can steam it for you too!! Overall i would not stay there again, only will dine at their Buffet!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Aria Experience”
Reviews.Author: springva
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my recent stay at the Aria Hotel in Las Vegas. I arrived at the hotel at noon and was glad that they let me check in right away. I went up to the 21st floor where my room was located, and upon entering the room, it amused me to no end to see the curtains open up, the lights come on, and the in room TV turn on. All controls for the room lighting, temperature, and curtains are located on the TV set or on the standalone controller that sits on the bedside. How cool is that? The room had 2 Queen beds as requested, 2 roomy closets with actual hangers (not the ones permanently affixed to the rods), and a beautiful bathroom with 2 sinks and a separate water closet for the toilet. Just beautiful! Nice, too, that everything is so new. The room didn't have much of a view, just the other buildings nearby and the mountains in the distance, but to get a Strip view, most hotels charge a premium. I used the hotel gym facilities, and found them to be excellent. Plenty of cardio machines, friendly staff, towels, water, and a separate space for folks wanting to use the floor to stretch or do work with balance balls. As an aside, there is a beautiful sitting area right outside the gym, complete with a built in fireplace that spans the wall! If you're looking for a space to escape the madness of the casino, that's the play. That said, the Aria casino is among my favorites! It's fairly quiet, good machines, lots of table games, adequate support staff working the floor, and plentiful Ticket Redemption machines. I ate at the fancy Italian Restaurant on the Promenade level, Sirio - very good food and service. Also tried the Skybox Cafe outside of the Sports Book (had a hankering for soup!), the food was good and the service was quick. Finally, I ate at the Buffet on Lobster night. The Buffet was fairly expensive (well over $30), but that includes a lobster, a glass of wine, and all the food from the buffet you care to eat. The lobster was rather tough, but the buffet in general was good. All told, I loved the Aria and would stay there again if I got a great deal on the room. It's rather expensive, but I feel it's a good value for the money. Great location, great service, fairly easy to navigate even though it's a very large hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Prices with Three Star Service”
Reviews.Author: JYGM
Reviews.Content: I don't expect a lot and am quite patient as I understand the service industry. However, the service at this hotel and it's restraunt vendors was lacking. My friend's luggage took hours to be delivered to her door. There were many instances of lacking in service. Most important to us: We wanted to watch the Super Bowl in their Sports Bar. Despite asking multiple restraunt employees and hotel staff regarding how to obtain seating in the end we weren't able to watch it there because all the answers were incorrect. It was as if no one really knew how it was going to be done. When we complained there was no apologies or offers to make our stay more memorable in a positive way. We will not return here.

Reviews.Title: “My fiancee & I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ashwin11111111111111
Reviews.Content: My fiancée & I loved it! We were there Thursday 12/8 to Monday 12/12 in room 18304. The staff was friendly and helpful and the room was superb. I would definitely go back. Details: We checked in and went to our room. The key worked, but the night latch was engaged. I called the staff from the nearest hotel phone and explained the situation. Security and maintenance arrived, unlatched the door, and discovered that the room was already occupied. After explaining our situation to the front desk, they happily upgraded our room to a corner suite. I love a clean, beautifully designed, and tastefully decorated room. Aria did not disappoint. We also had a great view of the surrounding mountain ranges. My favorite discovery during my stay was the commode with built-in bidet (by Toto). I’m definitely getting one when I redo my master bath. My fiancée and I were in town to get married at Victoria’s Family (a full service wedding campus) (also excellent, by the way). We were so busy with friends & family and exploring the Strip, we didn’t have the time or energy to check out the pools, spa, or gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. 5*”
Reviews.Author: Andre H
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the ARIA for 4 nights. I was in a Deluxe room which is the lead-in type they offer. However, it is still a great room. Large room (slightly small by Las Vegas standards) with floor to ceiling window. We had a great view of the strip. Separate bath/shower area. The lights, curtains and audio is all controlled from a panel by your bed! It's wonderful. The bed is very comfortable and they offer a turn-down service in the evening. Lots of closet space for clothes. There is a in-safe box in the room to secure any valuables. The large reception area is well serviced and smells amazing! The check-in was swift and painless. There are various lifts to take you to your floors and we never found we were waiting for a lift. There are various eateries within the hotel from main meals to snacks and drinks. I did not use any of them as wanted to explore the surrounding area. The ARIA is set slightly further back off the strip so is a quieter option. To enter into the hotel you have to walk through a shopping area, therefore, you have about a 5 minute walk from the strip before you enter into the reception area. Whilst in Las Vegas I did see Jersey Boys which was excellent and well worth seeing if you have the opportunity. We purchased our tickets on the day from one of the many discounted booths which are dotted at various points along the strip. Try and take a visit to the Grand Canyon. We did a flight with Vision Airlines to the South Rim which was just magical. A highlight of the trip. We also did a visit to Lake Mead (which included a ride on a paddle boat) and a visit to the Hoover Dam. Again, a great day out and worth doing if you can. The hotel is close to the Bellagio (approx. 5-7 minute walk) and a visit to see the fountains dance to the music is a nice touch. They run every 30 minutes from 1500 - 2000 and then every 15 minutes from 2000 - 0100. The hotel offers free wifi in all areas which is great. Not that you will want to spend all day on the internet (!!), but good for being able to check out where places of interest are and also things such as online check in. The hotel is central on the strip and therefore is a perfect choice for visiting all that Las Vegas has to offer. There is a bus which operates up the strip and cost US$7 for 24 hours or US$20 for a 3 day pass. Well worth it and saves your legs (!) but it is great to walk the strip and see the various hotels. On day of check out they will hold your bags for you before the flight but there are no shower areas to freshen up before your flight. This would be a nice touch. Would suit anyone. Great hotel and faultless. If you have any questions then please let me know and I will do my best to answer them. Book the ARIA with confidence and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Miu2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in many different hotels in Vegas. The standard room in aria just in average, and I got to upgraded to the conner suite which is so much different. Love the conner suite!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Experience at the Craps Table & Cafe Vettro”
Reviews.Author: SimonHollywood
Reviews.Content: AVOID PLAYING CRAPS where the BOX PERSON continually allows illegal rolls!!! I play Craps at various MGM properties 10 to 15 times per week. Quality staff is the norm. Tonight, I am at a table where Tom is sitting Box and the shooter who is right next to the stickman barely has to throw the dice 6 feet to hit the wall, yet fails to hit the wall 10 times. The rolls are going 3 to 4 feet at best. I bring this to the attention of my nearest dealer and he advises me that they have no rule to take the dice from the shooter should they continually not hit the wall (illegal rolls), and they can do is ask them nicely to do so. Getting no help from the dealer I directly and very pointedly as the Boxman to do something about the illegal rolls and he is obviously paying no attention as he has to ask the dealer if the person had been missing the wall. Nothing is done and the shooter keeps throwing short. How does an experienced Boxman miss 10 bad rolls when he is not distracted by anything such as a fill, a marker, or anything out of the norm and there are 3 people at the table and the action is minimal except for my play which is multiple black chips? How can this casino in good conscience take a Players money resulting from illegal rolls? Being the table I was at was not being ran professionally I picked up my chips and left for another table. In 20 years of playing Craps I have never had to do this. John was sitting Box at the next table and was not only in control of the game top to bottom, but also on a first name basis with every player, making sure their every need was taken care of regardless if they had $10 in front of them or 5K. VERY DISAPPOINTED with this EPIC FAILURE at keeping the game fair to all involved!!! On a side note, made a complaint about Cafe Vettro November 21st via Facebook and received no written response. So sad that Aria is hands down the best MGM property and has so many amazing things to offer, yet they seem indifferent to their loyal customers. 600,000 Mlife points under my belt sure doesn't seem to gain me any respect. :(

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: ddgmercado
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel at the (near) center of the Las Vegast Strip. Low key atmosphere with excellent amenties. I really don't know where the 3 and 4 star (circle) ratings are from....? The room isn't 'dark enough' or 'too noisy'....Really? Why, spend any time in Vegas in the first place??? From my perspective as a hotel snob, hotels don't get much better than Aria. I've stayed in 500, 600, 700 a night rooms in North America, Europe and Asia and Aria ranks right up there. If you're expecting perfection, it doesn't exist. Labor and income statistics would agree with me and say that 96% of you don't live in a nicer home than the Aria, so just enjoy this magnificent hotel. .... The food (I had) at the Cafe Vettro was above average. I had the NY Steak & Shrimp and it was in the top 10, maybe top 5 of my all time delicious steaks. The Magaherita pizza was also delicious and they serve decent Bloddy Mary's. "the Buffet" has a good selection for breakfast. I'm sure you can find a 'Top Vegas Buffet Award' buffet somewhere else, but this a great buffet nonetheless. ..and if you're not spending $60 + for a meal for 2, in Vegas, are you really living? The Aria gym/fitness center is well equipped. Plenty of Evian water and apples (fruit) to go around. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who isn't an annoying TripAdvisor reviewer. "NO SINK PLUGS" ......??? Why would they want you to overflow the sink? So you can complain about having to pay for the damage and clean up???

Reviews.Title: “Rescued our short trip!!”
Reviews.Author: missvcat
Reviews.Content: Myself & my fiancee booked a short trip to Vegas which we had to delay by 2 months and when we finally arrived in Vegas, our hotel was awful. Thankfully a friend of mine had recently stayed at the Aria so we booked it for the rest of our stay...what can I say....Clean rooms, clean bed sheets, bathroom, towels what a breath of fresh air compared to our first hotel!!! Worth paying the higher amount for this beautiful hotel and also THE BEST MOJITOS!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: 3CCC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria for 3 nights, our room was 24102. The room was nice and the location was great. The hotel is very clean and of course has that great Vegas smell to mask the smoking that is allowed in casino's. We stayed in a king room and the bed, linens and pillows were fantastic. The functionality of the room is controlled by an ipad like tablet which sits by the bed so temp, curtains, TV, lighting are easily accessible. The only negatives I have is that the safe did not work, water pressure wasn't great and the I would skip the buffet. Otherwise, it was a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Newer hotel starting to show signs of wear”
Reviews.Author: yosunC
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations for Aria, but were surprised to find the hotel rooms defective in their signature technology element in both of our rooms. The Aria brochures boast of their technology, but... The room-controls on the TV via remote were surprisingly slow, and limited in what they could do. (You could not program the music to greet you when you enter the room, for example.) In both rooms, when everything was turned off, the blue LED's from the room control system panel left an annoying noise, which we had thought was the buzz from the fridge. Maintenance brusquely unplugged the fridge in one of our rooms, when the front desk was unable to unlock it (the TV controls for un-locking the fridge was also defective). The first room - the wedge room had a tiny window - less than 1/8 the size of a proper city view window. We were put into this room when the front desk assured us it would be quiet, due to its having a smaller window surface. It turned out to be far from the case -- foot traffic from the three hallways that intersected right outside the wedge room. We were also placed on a floor that was not high enough from the HVAC above the first few floors of the hotel's city-side entrance. The second room had a TV defect with a long dead pixel line running down through the TV screen. The bathtub had a filthy old toilet smell to it. There were dark stains on the un-washed bedding. The bellman was very punctual, arriving five minutes early. He was also both courteous and competent - a very good combination, and the only redeeming quality to help Aria service's rating from receiving an abysmal 1 star. Amenities: The shower-tub arrangement in-room was interesting with the shower acting like an anteroom to the bathtub. Filling it up with hot water before a shower created a sort of water-based sauna. The fitness facilities had most of the usual. It was odd to find the lifeguards at the pool in parka's. What happens if they have to jump in? The in-room dining selection was limited, but there was a good selection of mid-level fine dining in the hotel. There was no in-room coffee maker. When we called about this, the front desk was bold enough to lie to us saying that, "There is no in-room coffee maker at the Aria because it's a fire hazard." At this point, it just seemed ridiculous -- given the fact that Aria is LEED-certified and some sort of bearer of cutting-edge hotel technology, how can they not figure out how to appoint coffee makers that won't burn down the hotel? As for Aria coffee shops... it's the similar experience of disappointment you get at a casino-owned Starbucks, where you overpay for a badly-done cup made by the barristas who are not properly trained. Conclusion: Aria really ought to train their staff in knowledge of what constitutes a quiet room, and where the HVAC is. Also, for a hotel that claims distinction in its technology, Aria could also function better by having a tech check done each time a room is turned over -- this would account for TV's not having dead pixels running through it, for example. Basic competency that you'd find surprising a so-called AAA 5-diamond hotel can't get quite right.

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation”
Reviews.Author: juju-anne
Reviews.Content: The rooms at Aria were very spacious with comfy beds and a great view. Everytime I entered the room I felt relaxed and they have motorized curtains which was very fun to play with. The enter room is also controlled by a touch pad beside the bed. I can't comment on the price as I had comp rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Casey S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on the strip. We were impressed with the hotel in general. The rooms are amazing. We travel to Las Vegas frequently and would like to try to book every stay at Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Five star ? Too many little minuses.”
Reviews.Author: MarkTilbury
Reviews.Content: Good points: Good location on strip Bed extremely comfortable Buffet - great food and good value ($16 breakfast, $21 lunch) Not so good: Some rooms too far from elevator, Bathroom sinks do not have plugs - the water flow at maximum is a dribble - our friends had the same problem, Shower only ok - not 5 star (wasn't that powerful), No tv in bathroom (like the encore), Music noise from nightclub was excessive in room - 19th floor too! The bathroom gels etc were in fairly cheap plastic bottles.

Reviews.Title: “Great first visit to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bob92691
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Aria. The room was very nice and comfortable with a beautiful view of the mountains and awsome sunrise. The drinks were rather expensive at the bar, but if you walked onto the Casino floor they were free if you were gambling. The food was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded!”
Reviews.Author: BaileyCR
Reviews.Content: Had a great rate for a corner suite w/a $100 resort credit. Upon checkin we were upgraded to a sky suite. WOW! Thank you Aria! We are not high roller gamblers but tend to spend a bit when we go to Vegas- shows, restaurants, shopping etc. Anyhoo....we really appreciated it and are the perfect victims for an upgrade because we will definitely look for a sky suite next time. There's a special check in and concierge area, a lounge with free drinks and food all day...it was really nice. The room was a 1 bed suite- very very nice. The resort is very well done and great location right next to crystals center.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: minitraveler2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for close to a week for a getaway. Initially we had the basic room, which was comfy but had an adjoining room. This became a problem part way through the week when they placed a family with young kids next to us & the kids were out of control. We were moved the next day to a mountain view room. It was equally comfortable, much quieter, and the view was good. The property is huge-don't plan on getting around in a hurry. Check in was quick and easy. When we switched rooms, our keys were switched automatically, with no trip required to the front desk. We made dinner reservations each night, that morning-they were all honoured on time. We ate at Jean Georges Steakhouse twice-the food was fabulous both nights. I order my steak in between two of 'the norms'. Not only did I not get a funny look like I normally do, they actually had a name for it-and cooked it exactly how I enjoy it both nights! We ate at American Fish, and both enjoyed the food-although the menu is fairly different than 'normal'. We ate at The Buffet, and it was okay-pretty much what you'd expect for buffet food. We used the gym numerous times. It was well kept, spacious and easy to navigate. When I didn't see an item I wanted, they provided me with it from a hidden spot. The equipment was all well kept. Being from Canada where the no smoking by-laws are plenty, it was difficult to walk through the hotel anywhere near the casino. While it didn't smell as bad as I anticipated, it was still definitely noticeable. Location was fine-it was about a $15 cab ride to/from the airport. Ask drivers to use Tropicana. We saw the Elvis show and while it was okay, it wasn't great, and wasn't worth the price of the ticket. There were very limited amounts of Cirque-ish acts-so that was misleading. The other major beef was that they had women singing Elvis songs-HUH?? They sang along with a recording of Elvis sometimes, as accompaniment, and other times, just sang the song. This was hugely disappointing!! If we were going to Vegas again, we'd stay at the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time anywhere else, this is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: RobCan03
Reviews.Content: I think my title sums it up! This place was fantastic from beginning to end.

Reviews.Title: “much ado about nothing”
Reviews.Author: Cdnskier
Reviews.Content: huge hotel with nice rooms. big rooms. food overall was mediocre although Julian Serrano is excellent spanish food and Bar Masa is terrific Japanese.

Reviews.Title: “Standard for the Strip - Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: JourneyChick
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria in late September with friends while attending the IHeartRadio concerts at the MGM. It was only my second visit to Vegas - my first was 10 years ago (stayed at the Venetian) and things have changed quite a bit with business focusing more on dining, shopping and entertainment than gambling. The new City Center complex with the Aria is very attractive and sleek, but the overwhelming vanilla scent pumped through the lobby of the hotel is enough to give you a headache. The pool area is nicely laid out, with three separate pools, but be prepared for very loud music pumping through the speakers constantly. If you want a cabana, you may well be on a waiting list and not know until as late as noon (the pools close at 5 pm) If you do score a cabana - which I definitely recommend if you are with friends, you will have a lovely day with great service and some semblance of VIP service. Rooms at the hotel are not as big as I had expected. They are decent size - we stayed in one with 2 Queen beds and a view of the strip, but not large. The bathroom is nice, but not special and there was a dirty towel in the bathtub that I noticed when I took a shower - eeww! The fridge is one of those that if you move ANYTHING you will be charged, and there is a room fee of $35/day if you want to rent a small fridge for your own items. My traveling companions staying in another room just bought a cheap cooler and used that for beer and wine. Let's face, Vegas is not cheap anymore. You do get the feeling you are at the mercy of the resorts when it comes to food and drinks. You can get resourceful however and hit the liquor store on the way in from the airport, McD's for breakfast and splurge on dinner. The food at all the dining venues is VERY average and totally overpriced ($7.50 for a yogurt parfait) and since all the food kiosks are owned by the same company, there is no pricing competition. I visit NYC on a frequent basis and most corner bistros there provide better fare than anything I had at the Aria. We ate at three restaurants in the complex, Sage, Julian Serrano and Blossom. Blossom was by far the best experience. The food was delicious and the service was quite attentive. I think the better restaurants are chef/owner run rather than the larger corp. that owns the complex. Service at Sage started out fine (we had an early reservation) but went down hill very quickly once the place started to fill up. One of our dishes - I can't remember which, was poorly prepared and we couldn't get the waiter's attention to address it. By the time he returned to us (20 minutes later!) the rest of our party had finished their meal. The wait staff could not get us out of the restaurant fast enough after our expressing displeasure with our meal. Really, really awful customer service. I worked in the food service business for many years in my past incarnations, and don't think I ever witnessed a worse experience. Dinner at Julian Serrano was just ok. Nothing notable, but not terrible either. The best meals we has were actually at two Wolfgang Puck restaurants. We ate at the MGM twice and the restaurant in City Center once. The food was consistently good, fresh and creative; the service was wonderful and the prices reasonable for the quality of the menu. I would highly recommend either of those restaurants and would definitely go again. Last day at the Aria was spent at the Spa. With an early checkout (11:00 am!) and no flight until 10pm, it is well worth paying for the daily facility fee ($30) As a matter of fact, I think this is the BEST DEAL GOING. You have full access to all the spa facilities - including the gym and outdoor heated pool.(Be aware that the pool - co-ed - overlooks the party pool area called "Liquid" with really thumping party music playing all day long - not too relaxing for your spa experience- someone should have thought about that when planning the layout) You can shower and change there using all their products - great if you've already packed your luggage and don't want to tote all your toiletries. You can also go in and out of the spa area all day, so you are not restricted to staying there. A definite plus if you have to spend the day without your hotel room!! Overall, I might go back to the Aria if I were going to party with friends. But if I were going for a special occasion or with 1-2 girlfriends, I think I would check out the Mandarine. Same general location, but more luxurious and better service.

Reviews.Title: “High tech”
Reviews.Author: Blondie74Paris
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a few month after the official opening, attending a convention. The decoration is somptuos yet sober and the rooms are very high tech. You can command everything from a single remote control! The staff is very friendly and ready to help, it was my first time in Vegas and I'm glad I stayed there.I would definitely recommend this hotel for business travellers and anyone looking for an upscale experience in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “It really doesnt get much better!!”
Reviews.Author: bigcheese88
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my second visit to the Aria this year. I really dont understand why it isnt rated alot higher. Its one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in, and I've stayed in some nice ones! They treat you fantastically, everybody from the valets to the concierge. Anyone you ask anything to is so nice and helpful! The smell!!! I love it! I bought the rediculously expensive scent sticks in the Aria store because I love that smell so much! I'd love it if I could find that smell outside of Vegas! The rooms at the Aria are so nice and very modern. Our room had a fantastic view of the strip and was just perfect for our needs. The amenities, from the pools, which I couldnt use this time, but I loved in May when I was here, to the restaurants, to the casino, to the fantastic location on the strip, to the tram that gets you farther up the strip, it just doesnt get any better. I've stayed at a few other places on the strip, and I dont think I'd stay anyplace else again. For the money it cant be beat. Of course, I say it has free internet, but thats really that resort fee. I hate that, but its still worth it..Thanks Aria!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: suekay1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Aria. It was our first time to Las Vegas and found the location on the strip really central to everything. Our check in was quick and staff friendly. We found our room with no problem, on the 12th floor. The walk from the elevator to our room was a bit of a treck but we found that all we did was walk everywhere,definitely not a holiday for relaxing.We walked for miles and miles,don't forget the comfy shoes. The room had a strip view and was lovely. Really clean and new decor. Couldn't fault this. The bed was really comfortable. We had a Kingsize, non smoking room. We ate at the buffet twice. The dinner buffet was nice but the breakfast buffet wasn't great,found the scrambled egg really buttery,not that warm and the pancakes tasted like they had been cooked in old oil. Also strange trembling sensation where we were seated the second time,not sure if it is located near the tram,but wasn't pleasant to sit and eat comfortably. Should have asked to be seated elsewhere,but didn't want to make a fuss. The casino seemed pretty busy but we aren't big players so we didn't spend much time there. We went to see the Elvis Cirque de soleil which was pretty expensive, $110 each,show lasted about and hour an a half. The theatre is lovely, some of the acrobatics was amazing but the actual story of Elvis's life was disappointing.Not worth the money. The maid service was variable.our first day the room didn't get cleaned until 4pm,the second and 3rd day before 2 and on our last full day,we were so exhausted that went back to the room to chill at 3 and the bed etc had still to be made,so we ended up just putting the private light on and made the bed up ourselves. I would maybe class the hotel as 4 star due to a few things that they could improve on but if we did ever go back to Vegas we would stay there again. I would gladly answer any question if anyone has any to ask about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Breathless!!”
Reviews.Author: Shakashawn
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas a number of times and each time we have picked a different hotel to stay at. This time we choose to stay at Aria and I have to say, this was the best decision that we could have made. Unfortunantly our travel arrangement were such that we arrived in Vegas @ 4 a.m. and we were kind of bummed because we thought that we were going to have to walk the strip all day waiting for check in time which was not until 3 p.m. but we figured we would make the best of it anyways. Well quite to our surprise when we arrived at the hotel that morning, they went ahead and let us check in @ 4 a.m. (NO CHARGE FOR EARLY ARRIVAL) and we were like WOW!! We also inquired about a late check out and was told that they would go ahead and put us down for a 1 p.m check out (instead of the usual 11 a.m) at no cost!! The next best thing was actually getting into the room, it was beautiful. it met and exceeded all my expectations. Huge comfortable bed, very clean. Large soaking tub and walk in shower combo. Curtains, lights, T.V that can be controlled all by a remote right from your bed!! Now lets get to the casino part of this hotel. Huge floor plan, Very clean, open and smelled great (I think they pump aromatics through the vents). All in all, It was nothing short of amazing!! A must stay. Very Classy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Food, Comps are weak though”
Reviews.Author: qmvsimp
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in December. I would give this 5-stars, but it was not a good value. I don't mind dropping 4-5k on gambling on a weekend, but to only get 10% of my losses in comps was disappointing. Most other places will give you a higher percentage. Jean George and the dinner weekend Buffet were outstanding. The crab, lobster and wine included (buffet) were excellent. Room service fast, warm, delicious, and expensive. The Elvis show is neat, but if you're not an Elvis fan, I wouldn't spend the money. We were supposed to get a non-smoking corner suite, but instead received a smoking center suite. While we had already left a deposit, we did arrive after 11pm. The room did not smell of smoke though. The suites have heated toilet seats that will wash and dry your private areas. The regular rooms do not have this feature. The hotel and common areas were very clean and had a nice smell. Sometimes they did not have enough tables open. The tables were $25 minimum for blackjack, and $15 for craps and 3-card poker in the evenings. A little higher than I normally like. Daytime was slightly lower. Everyone was nice and friendly.
