I don't think I will go back though. I perfer Bellagio to Aria, except for the constant crowd going through the Bellagio. Wynn beats both in service and comps.

Reviews.Title: “Aria Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RevenueManager78
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the hotel - very quiet and nice. I did not like the guest room desk chair as it was uncomfortable and too low for the desk. The bathroom was great and good closet space. Not a lot of holiday decorations but that's ok. Check in and out process was great. Long line for a taxi but it went fast the bellstaff managed the drive well. I would recommend staying here if you are looking for an upscale quiet stay in Las Vegas -- the tram is geat too and free that gets you to the Bellogio. My favorite part of this stay was the staff so friendly and professional -- the housekeeping staff was the best they greeted me everytime they saw me. Best service I have had in Vegas in a long time. I ate in two of the restaurants - the Tappas place was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Bart J
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel in the centre of the las vegas strip. The room had a 7 inch gadget that looked like a digital picture frame, from this you could control the entire room, open & close the curtains, turn the tv on/off, turn all the lights on/ff indivdually, change the room temperature. It was amazing. On top of this we had a great view of the strip. Location is dead centre of the strip too. As part of our stay we got free tickets to the Viva Elvis show too. As standard they give you free Valet parking too. I would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property, but would come back for the great service”
Reviews.Author: Daxious
Reviews.Content: We booked a corner suite and got a good offer from Mlife so it would be about the same price as staying at a regular room at a mirage or TI. The layout of the suite is great, however it is a fair ways from the elevator. This is not a bad enough issue to not go back, and really was the only issue we had. Room service was ordered every morning and it was really good, decent hot food, well under 30 mins. Very helpful friendly service as well from the servers. Expected from a property like this, but as you see in a lot of reviews not always delivered. Helpful front desk and support staff, had no issues with room or the tech features. I would say that the individuals that did have some issues, might also have issues using a laptop...just saying. GREAT drink service on the floor, we went to a bunch of properties and always came back to get drinks... spicy ceasers w/ 3 olives... yummy. Other properties serve vodka with some sort of tomatoe drink... Stay here...just not when I want to so I can get a better rate... but make sure you do stay.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 5-Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy128
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 days and I can safely say that despite their desperate claims the Aria is definitely NOT a 5 star hotel. MOTEL like Check In There was no bell hops curbside when we pulled up in the cab to a) open the door b) take the luggage (5-star service?). When we got inside the check in area was an unorganized mess, no lines just a big blob of people and it was difficult to tell who was lining up for what or who was next. Waited about 10 minutes and finally got to the desk. When I presented an email that I had received a week before I arrived that said I have qualified for a free upgrade the clerk looked perplexed said 'Ummm' and asked me when I got it. I told him last week and he said sorry but there wasn't an upgrade available and that he wasn't even sure if he had a king suite like I had booked 2 months in advance. Finally after about 5 minutes of just standing there watching him type and stare at the computer in silence he said 'good news I found you a room'. A nice stressful check-in. Then after all that confusion you are expected to see yourself to your room (if you can find it on your own) and carry your own bags the half a mile (literally). No bell hop and they didn't even have a luggage cart available for us to use. In any other 5-star hotel in the world they carry your bags and show you to your room but not in this place. Room was attractive but DIRTY The room looked sexy and was over looking the pool but once the initial cool factor of the blinds opening and the TV turning on automatically wears off, quickly I might add, its just another hotel room and a dirty one at that. Housekeeping had definitely not done a good job as the room was dusty, had water marks on the end tables and there was bits of paper on the floor and papers from previous guest still on the dresser. I looked behind the chairs and end tables and it looked like it had never been cleaned, ever. I called down to the front desk to request housekeeping and got an automated recording that all the agents were busy and to try again. After calling 4-5 times over the next hour and could not reach the front desk. Also the lighting didnt work properly and some lamps didnt turn on or would turn off at random. Not 5 star. The housekeepers should be FIRED The next morning we ordered bacon and egg breakfast for two to the room and although it came quickly it was $84. Definitely 5 star prices. The cart sat outside our room for all of the next day despite the fact that we called down to let them know we were finished. We noticed alot of plates with old food, carts and empty beer bottles sitting in the hall for more than a day on our floor everyday. Not 5 star. When we returned to the room that afternoon 2 housekeepers had just gone into our room. Instead of going downstairs we decided to chill out at the end of the hall a few doors down and just wait for them. After all it was a 7 minute journey to get downstairs, one way from the room. We heard the vacuum turn on and then go off after 8 seconds. No joke I timed it. Then the housekeepers left our room after being in there for only about 2 minutes tops. We went into the room and they had left garbage in the garbage can, empty water bottles on the end tables and they had obviously not vacuumed. I called them back and pointed the things out and they made a brief and obviously for show effort to care and ran the vacuum for another 5 seconds. Ive stayed in Motel 6's on the Interstate that have better housekeeping. Not 5 star. Much of the staff had a serious ATTITUDE PROBLEM and they act like the guests are a bother Perhaps its the economy, perhaps its the fact that the place isnt making money and the staff arent getting their profit sharing checks but there was a real noticeable rotten attitude with alot of the unsmiling, miserable looking staff. Now thats not to say we didnt meet a few great smiling people working there but there is something wrong with alot of the Aria staff. First the burly security guards are intimidating and you get shaken down regularly in the halls for your room key with just a gruff 'room key' and a hand out. No 'please', 'sir' or 'thank you'. I'm glad they check but the fact that anybody can just walk up or ride the elevator up to the rooms without actually inserting a valid room key shows me that the shake downs are just for show and they get annoying after the three times in the first day. One evening we wanted to watch a sporting event and called down to the Deuce Lounge and asked if I could reserve a table. I was told that they weren't taking reservations and that it was first come first served for seating. We headed down with lots of time and went to walk in and was stopped and asked for our reservation. I told them I called down and said that I was told that I didn't need a reservation and that guy told me I could only get a table if I put a $300 non-refundable deposit towards my tab otherwise we had to stand. Not being sure if we were going to drop $300 on a few drinks and an appetizer or two I asked if we could sit at the bar and was told yes but when it gets a bit busier you will have to move. Nice way to treat guests. We sat at the bar and ordered drinks and appetizers anyways. After about 30 minutes the place wasnt even busy and the manager type looking important guy came over and said 'Sorry but you have to move'. I told him that we just ordered food and that the place wasnt even busy he thought about it for a second and said 'Ok but youre going to have to move at some point'. Huh? Talk about treating your guests like children. Then finally as we were eating our second round of appetizers that we ordered the guy came back and told me he had to 'take' our stools. Now I was angry and reminded the schmuck that we were guests of the hotel, that we were paying good money for our suite and that in case he couldnt tell we were in the middle of eating and that we were not moving as it was completely unnecessary seeing as the bar wasn't packed, everyone had seats and there were people who had seats that weren't eating. He just walked off in a huff and didnt even say sorry or youre right or no problem. After that we stopped getting attention from the bartender and our drinks sat empty for a while, the bartender even cleaned our ashtray right beside the empty drinks and didnt bring us new ones. I knew that we werent going to get another beverage in there that night and left completely aggravated at the horrible treatment by staff after dropping $220 on drinks and a couple small things to eat. The next evening in the Gold Lounge we had a a mix drink and a beer and I tipped $5 on the $23 and we over heard the bartender say to the other bartender "Cheap b*stard". At that point we decided to not spend any more money at the Aria bars and instead went elsewhere making us really wish we hadn't stayed there. I could go on about how the service at the buffet stunk and we couldnt get a refill on our drinks for 30 minutes and how one of the security staff used the F word with my wife because she forgot her key upstairs or the fact that place just has NO SOUL and was the biggest regret and disappointment of my 11 years of going to Vegas but I don't want to write a novel the size of War and Peace. The Aria is definitely a sad addition to Vegas and if that is the future of hotels then Im not sure if I ever want to go back to Vegas at all. Its not fun, the un-inviting casino is like a funeral home and lacks that exciting Vegas feel. The Vanilla scent they pump into the place gave us a headache and permeated our clothing and hair. I could still smell it in my suitcase weeks later. Gross. Oh and check your bill carefully. They tried to charge us for a bunch of items in the mini fridge that we didnt even touch let alone use. Bottom line is I WONT BE BACK and the Aria should stop calling themselves a 5 Star resort because IT CLEARLY ISN'T. And if any Aria management reads this: Go and visit a real 5-star hotel and you will see all the things that you are missing, train your miserable staff on how to treat guests and clean your FILTHY rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad & The REALLY Bad”
Reviews.Author: toxypharmgirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at Aria in a Standard King with Mountain View Good: The room is very modern with a great view of the mountains (not strip), awesome bathroom. Shower pressure not the greatest but not horrible. The bed was one of the most comfortable we have ever slept in, although is definitely not firm. 24-hour shopping in Elements for Aria souvenirs, some clothing, jewelry and snacks. Speedy Check-in and Check-Out. Room wasn't initially ready at 9:30 AM but got text message within 90 minutes that room was ready. Location on Strip makes for easy access to shopping and other more lively casinos. Bad: The tablet computer that controls the lights, curtains, TV etc. is not very touch sensitive---really had to use a lot of pressure to get it to work and even then was a challenge. Is very intuitive but just annoying, although the curtain feature is very neat. Casino is very low key and the vanilla scent in the casino can be overwhelming. Hung out at Cosmopolitan which was a lot more upbeat. Prices in the casino for food are really high---paid $16 for a small coffee, a 16oz bottled water and a plain grilled ham and cheese sandwich---WOW!! REALLY BAD: Oh where to start, housekeeping needs to be seriously retrained. Day 1: On arrival the bed sheets were stained with make-up and there was hair on the pillows. Called for replacements, had to wait approx. 1 hour for replacements to be brought up and low and behold there is still hair on the pillows. Day 2: Blanket on the foot of the bed has a large crusty white stain on it when we return to the room. Called for a replacement, waited approx. 30 minutes for replacement and then they brought the wrong blanket so had to wait another 30 minutes for the correct blanket. Told that the foot blanket and bedspread are not changed with each new guest. We must not have noticed the stain on night one due to the way it was folded----should have looked closer that first night. GROSS!! Day 3: no housekeeping problems, sigh of relief Day 4: Leave the room at 1:00pm, left the service light on, returned at 11:00pm and the room had not been cleaned and service light was still on. Called to have someone at least clean the bathroom and bring clean towels which occurred about 45 minutes after the call making for a very late night with early flight the next day. Told by housekeeper that if you want to make sure the room gets cleaned you have to call before you leave the room (WHAT??????) Overall impression: Wanted to love this place because the room is really nice but the housekeeping service is so severely lacking that I cannot in good conscious recommend this hotel to anyone. Have had better housekeeping at $60/night hotel and this was $180/night, I expect a better than average housekeeping experience in this price range which was in no way met.

Reviews.Title: “5 star rating all the way-------”
Reviews.Author: peacefullduck
Reviews.Content: arrived las vegas airport early ..taxi ride to the hotel.check in line for invited guest was very short.desk clerk was very polite and we were on our way to our room with-in ten minutes.bell hop was up with our luggage about twenty minutes later.extremely happy guy and wanted to show us how all the features operated with the electronic aspects.how ever as this was our 4th stay at this hotel it was not necessary.maid service and turn down service every day.we had a room on the 25th floor and the view was excellent.we had breakfast buffet every morning and was good.sat was a bit heavy price wise.approx [55.00] dollars for two people.for the extra bit off seafood and who wants that at 7 am.sevice for drinks on casino floor was no problem.the tram that runs -ballagio-monte carlo a great boost.we did some shopping at the fashion show mall-cesars and the mile at planet hollywood.also the outlets down town.went down town by the duece bus. always lots to do in vegas.love the HYPE.also did some casino hopping on the strip.stay at the ARIA and you will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Need better cleaners”
Reviews.Author: Dancer9265
Reviews.Content: I sent my parents to ARIA for their 30th anniversary and unfortunately they were displeased with the first two rooms they entered. The first room they said was dusty and hair on their comforter and juts not clean enough for a 5 star hotel. The next room they entered was also dusty and they found pubic hairs in the bathtub. I was able to call ARIA and they were able to upgrade them and credited them $100 for dining. However, they were very helpful they still need better cleaning people if they want to run this 5 star resort the right way. The lady at the front desk was very helpful and polite about the situation and was able to accomodate my parents.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: 861Alain007
Reviews.Content: Staff was excellent. I was afraid that lines to check in were going to be long...as read but it moved sooo fast and the staff I spoke to were great and kind. Staff help us arrange dinner reservation, tickets etc... The rooms are hugh and bathrooms (shower, tub combo) are the nicest I've ever seen and I travel to different places monthly. Will definetly stay here again, loved my experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “If this isn't 5 stars, I don't know what would qualify”
Reviews.Author: Doug H
Reviews.Content: Before I start - note that this is solely a review of the hotel and associated amenities, not the casino or restaurants. This stay was my second at the Aria, and like the first, was fantastic. Check-in was simple and quick, and their automated check-out process made leaving for an early morning flight simple, even though their systems were down when I checked out. Despite the many floors and room volume, you rarely have to wait more than 10-15 seconds for an elevator, a surprisingly critical positive in the Vegas experience. The room is five-star in every way; the automated nature of everything from the blinds to the television to the bathroom lights appeals to me (although judging from some other reviews, may cause a notch down in star rating for others). The room was exceptionally clean, and I noticed very few, if any, signs of wear in the hotel's second year. Due to the conference schedule I kept while there, I appreciated the any-time-of-day room cleaning; whenever I set my room to 'Service' it was clean upon my return. The only small nit (very small indeed) was that the bed was a bit too soft for my personal taste, but the pillows/blankets were plush and in excellent condition. Across all my travels - of which my TripAdvisor reviews provide a good glimpse - this is one of my favorite properties for lodging and would continue to return here for future events. A quick tip - if going to the Bellagio from Aria, it is much faster to walk through Vdara than it is to take the CityCenter tram.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: pena5504
Reviews.Content: I try to stay in the best hotels. However, this trip I was traveling with another group who selected this place. I loved it. I was pleasantly surprised by everything! We were treated great. It's close to all the new stuff. (Citycentre) The decor is modern and nice. The best part is each room is controlled by the TV remote! From the lights, air, curtains, everything! It was awesome. The only negative thing I'll say is it's huge! The hotel is huge so ask for a room some what close to the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Raj77
Reviews.Content: I got an opportunity to stay in 2 different hotels in my single visit to Vegas and there was no comparison. I stayed 5 nights in Aria and 2 nights in some other hotel (would not like to name). I visited Vegas to participate in a trade show. Aria, is one of the most luxurious hotel I have seen. This is surely for the elite class. Rooms Luxurious rooms. Room size is very good. Highly comfortable. Free WiFi (atleast in our room), wonderful facilities & amenities. Ambiance Lovely ambiance, very neat & clean. The staff was also very nice. Casino Lovely casino with some beautiful restaurants/cafe. The bakery section is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “First Vegas Trip; Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: Melissaliss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aria for three nights, beginning on Sunday, November 13th. We arrived at the hotel at about 830 pm Vegas time. The bell hop was very nice, and our luggage was brought to our room promptly. Check in was incredibly quick and pleasant. All of the employees seemed very friendly. The hotel is beautiful, and very modern. Yes, there is a vanilla smell throughout the hotel, but not in the rooms. I thought it was nice, no complaints about it. The rooms are beautiful as well. We stayed on the 9th floor, and asked to be close to the elevators. It did seem that the hallways were quite long, so being close to the elevators is convenient if you can. I didn't hear any noise at night. There is a control panel next to the bed, which controls pretty much everything- lights, curtains, TV. Very high tech. The bathroom was great- separate tub and shower right next to eachother. There were plenty of hangers and drawers. There are robes to enjoy also. Being only on the 9th floor, the view was still cool in my opinion- the mountains were very nice, and we could still see some of the neighboring hotels. If you want a really good view, I assume the higher up the better. The beds are amazing! I slept like a baby indeed. There is a fully stocked mini bar that is pretty sensitive from what we were told, so it's probably best not to touch anything you don't want to be charged for. The safe is in the nightstand next to the bed. Housekeeping was certainly lacking. The first day, our room was not cleaned at all. We didn't really mind, because we just called and had more towels sent up. Day two, we were gone again, came back to our room at 230 pm, and the maid was just starting our room. We were surprised that they came so late, after having not cleaned our room the day before. Not a deal breaker, but could certainly be improved. It's still pretty new, so I'm sure it will be more efficient in time. As far as food goes, we only tried the buffet and Jean Phillipe Patisserie. The buffet at the Aria is pretty bad for the price. I think it was around 30/person for dinner. We expected so much more, and the food and setting were just bland. Jean Phillipe Patisserie is absolutely phenomenal! You can get up in the morning and grab a coffee and delicious pastry. (There isn't a coffee maker in your room.) We did that every morning, and the prices were not bad at all. Don't forget to grab your free paper across from Jean Phillipe, as it is included in the resort fee. Speaking of the resort fee, it's 20 dollars per day, so add it in to your rate per night to get your real price. The pools seemed nice, but it was a bit too chilly for us to go for that. The attached Crystals mall is one of those very pricey malls, with the fancy pants stores, so unless you plan on spending $600 on a shirt, it's not a great place to shop. However, it's great for the tram, which takes you to Bellagio and/or Monte Carlo. We loved using the tram- it really eliminated a lot of walking. Todd English Pub is also a great place to go for happy hour, and it's right in Crystals as well. We really enjoyed the food and drink specials. The location is very good. It's pretty centrally located. All in all, we were very pleased with our first Vegas trip, staying at the Aria resort. We are in our late 20's/ mid 30's, and this hotel seemed perfect for that age group, in my opinion. I think most people would be very happy with this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: thegardners060411
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband just got back from a four day vacation in Vegas and we had the pleasure at staying at the Aria. It was a very modern, gorgeous, and huge hotel and casino! When you walk in you get a huge whiff of this amazing vanilla scent. We walked through a lot of casinos and they all reeked of smoke, the Aria is the only hotel that allowed smoking that didn't stink. Our room was nice, we didn't notice anything that was out of place or dirty. Our king size bed was so comfortable! It was hard not to stay in bed all day long :) Do not take the treats or drinks that are stacked in the fridge because they are ridiculously overpriced just like they are at many other hotels. The buffet at the Aria was absolutely AMAZING! Especially the breakfast buffet. We had the dinner buffet and it was very good as well. When we arrived we were not aware that we would have a $40 credit a day and we used that to eat brunch each day we were there. The service was outstanding. The staff there really cares about accommodating their guests to their best means. When we re-visit Las Vegas we will definitely come back to stay at the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning,but completely missing the Vegas thing.”
Reviews.Author: Vegasvet
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at this hotel since it's opening back in november 2009. After about 2 years visiting casino and shops we finally decided to get a room for a few days. It turned out to be pretty much like the casino itself : ultra modern,plenty efficient and comfortable but completely dull and in desperate need of an identity. Vegas used to be crazy buildings and fun and lately crazy enoughl building with a touch of opulence,alas Bellagio/Wynn or Mandalay. We really felt Aria missed completely the point on this. And funnily enough even as active persons we found a bit boring the short walk you have to take to reach the Strip once you leave the hotel. We ate at Caffe' Vetro and it was the usual coffee shop stuff presented in a fancy way and with an ultra fancy bill at the end. At almost 39 years old I understand this building is probably aiming to those who are turning 21 today or will in the next 10 years,but even for them what is Vegas without a little bit of craziness ?? I will go back to this place if their prices will settle to a weekly price of $129 per night including the obnoxious resort fee. Until then I can get fancy modern rooms at the Treasure Island for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your charges”
Reviews.Author: TylerDConway
Reviews.Content: I'm very disappointed in this. I was charged for a martine shaker that was not taken from the room. I have just called, and was told, everything is on a weight system...??? Andrew told me this was supposed to be explained to me when I checked in. It wasn't....... One of my keys became un-magnetized and I went down, the next day, to replace the key. I did overhear someone explaining the mini bar, but did not hear the whole conversation, at the same time, found it odd that I wasn't told when I checked in. Anyway I am currently waiting on a call from the "Manager"...........It's been a reasonable time and since I haven't heard form the Aria, I will be posting my experience on all my social media.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fantastic, services were lacking...”
Reviews.Author: akforsyth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had an opportunity to spend three nights at the Aria in Las Vegas. Online pictures showed it to be a beautiful new hotel on the strip with lots of amenities so we figured we would give it a try. We arrived at the hotel at about 7:00 pm after clearing customs and our shuttle taking us to the hotel. We were dropped off in the basement level of the hotel and met by a bell man right away. We asked him where the lobby was to check in and he gave us the option of the escalators or the elevator, both of which would take us to the lobby. Well we chose the escalator, and quickly found out it did not take us to the lobby. Instead we were outside along the edge of a road with many people hurrying around to get taxis and limos for people. They were far to busy to answer us when we asked where the lobby was. So we went through the doors to where we could see the elevator. There was a sign in there saying entertainment lobby and pointing up another escalator. Well that was just for shows. So back down we came. We went into the casino which we could see through the glass doors. No where could we see a sign saying where the lobby was so we went in search of one. Well about two minutes into the middle of the slot machines we saw a sign saying lobby. So we followed it back the way we came.... which was not the lobby. Then after a little more wandering around and trying to ask staff where the lobby was we started back into the casino floor again. We finally came across some signs, but looking at one sign it would point to our right and you could see another sign further down that would point straight ahead. So after following one set of signs we found ourselves back at the exact same spot! So now my wife was pissed. We had been dragging our suitcases through the casino for 10 minutes not, no one would help us other than to point and the signs were crap! Well, we finally found the check in desk after about 10 more minutes of wandering around following different signs. I was on the complete opposite end of the hotel from where we came up! Check in was a breeze, the girl behind the counter understood our frustrations since we were not the only ones who have said this to her and she got us checked in nice and quick. We finally got to our room and even though it was on the back side of the hotel on the 15th floor, the view was spectacular and the room was amazing! So we settled in and learned how to use the touch screen to operate the room (it was amazingly automated) and then wanted to go look at the strip. So back down to the lobby we went. We arrived at the lobby and asked how to get to the strip. We were told to just go out the front doors and we would be there. Not. We stepped outside and were at the drop off in front of the hotel, but there was nothing but a road leading to it with ramps coming up and down and cars buzzing all over the place. So we walked one way along the sidewalk until we reached a pinch point that was quite narrow. So we stopped, this could not be the way to go, we must have turned the wrong way. The only things we could see was a big residential tower in front of us, so we turned back and went the other way until we ran into the roadway with cars coming and going so fast we didn't ant to cross. Still there was no strip in sight. We tried asking a bellman, but again we were ignored. So we gave up and went back inside to look around. We looked through some shops and laughed at the gouging prices of items. We looked at some restaurant menus and almost died at the prices they charged for food. There is no such thing as a quick or easy snack in this hotel, it is all high priced and "inspired by chef so and so". Blah blah blah. This is all this place had, overpriced stuffy places to eat! Well we were hungry so we decided to try Lemon Grass, the Thai restaurant (I'll be doing a review of it as well) and it was amazing! The food was fantastic and the service was very good. The bill at the end on the other hand was kind of ridiculous. or the two of us to eat our favorite Thai dish (Cashew chicken and Yellow curry) cost us over $100 including a glass of wine for my wife. Back home in Canada, we have the exact same thing for about $35 not including the glass of wine. So after dinner we decided it was time to wander some more and try to find the strip again. We ended up in the Crystal Center, a shopping mall filled with high end stored (Louis Viton, Gucci, etc) where there was nothing remotely practical about the items being sold. The one good thing we found was Mastro's Ocean Club (another review to come). Well we finally found some decent signage and found our way to the strip! Once out there it was fun to check things out. The rest of the stay had us cruising the strip and checking out other venues(which I'm hoping to do some reviews on). We really did not spend an time in our hotel as the food was way over priced compared to other places on the strip, and the entertainment was not there. We did find out in short order that because we dressed casual, the level of service was not there for us. I hate to think that it was because of our ethnicity too, but we had a few occasions where were were in line where other ethnicity were taken out of line or moved to the front. It always happened with one group. Even the dealers were catering to that group. I sure hope it was because I like to dress in shorts and t shirts that I could not be catered upon in this hotel. With that being said, I would never go back. Although the facility is fantastic. The staff and amenities were severely lacking. This hotel is one that caters to money and not a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon W
Reviews.Content: Everything is modern in this hotel. The room is centrally controlled by a touch screen pad that you can control the TV, window shear, lights, and room temperature. The hotel is right next to the Crystal shopping mall that you can walk toward to the main street and to the other fancy hotel called cosmopolitan. The hotel can be pricy during certain busy days. We stayed there during Tuesday-Thursday. The room rate was reasonable and the buffet line was surprisingly short. The only thing I don't understand was the $20 resort fee. Since it is mandatorily required, why don't they just add it to the room rate at the first place. It is weird to pay for the room, then there is an another mandatory charge. However overall it is a great hotel. We would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap knock-off hotel "suites"”
Reviews.Author: Recent_TravelerCinci
Reviews.Content: We are not big complainers but on our first night I turned down the bed in our suite and there was lipstick on the pillow and mascara on another. Every cheap hotel in America has an in room coffee maker or tea maker but we clearly can't have such an amenity?

Reviews.Title: “I liked it but not sure I was impressed.”
Reviews.Author: Ivan30501
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and very clean. It's all glass so the rooms all have a huge widows. Upon entering the room, the tv turns on and the curtains open. Neat stuff. The bathrooms are huge. The bed was so comfortable I tried not to lay on it during the day because I kept falling asleep. It's a great hotel but I don't think it's a 5 star hotel. The best part about this hotel it's the location. Huge new shopping center right next door with very creative architecture. Lots of things to do around this area so you don't have to walk very far. Tram takes you to Bellagio. I was not impressed with the buffet here since it's open and has the feeling of a cafeteria. If I come to Las Vegas again I would probably stay again. I have stayed at Bellagio and Vdara before so this area is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Catherine M
Reviews.Content: I'd read many reviews before we arrived. Check in was immediate, when we arrived a smiling young lady directed us to another warm smiling face who graciously checked us in and gave us everything we ask of her! Our room was amazing. This was my tenth trip to Vegas and by far my best stay. On the second night our smoke detector signaled it needed a new battery. I called the front desk and with in a few moments in was taken care of. Housekeeping was done every day and was spot on! The luxury bed and full panel wall window was breathtaking. I have to mention I hotwired this room and to this day I can not believe my luck! I also liked the fact that there is security who asks to see your room key to get on the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Pay_It_Forward
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend here for her birthday in January 2011. We both adore the decor of this property. Our room is also very comfortable and inviting. The casino is classy and the food at Sage and Jean-Philippe Patisserie are simply gorgeous. Make sure you check out the centre fountain at the main entrance, and the artwork outside the hotel. Very entertaining!

Reviews.Title: “It's OK, not Exceptional, Kind of Pricey”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: The rooms are new and very nice and the bed was comfortable. And the pool area also seemed nice. I was traveling with family who had been to Vegas before and they said the hotel was one of the newest on the strip and was among one of the nicer ones they had visited. But the service is not that great. I had a long wait from when I arrived to when I could check in. It takes a long time to get the rooms cleaned and they seem to intentionally leave long line-ups to the buffet but when you get inside there are tons of empty tables. The waiter I had at the lunch cafe was very nice but he took forever to bring me a menu and to take my order and then to bring the food. And a sandwich and a coffee cost me $20. Yikes. The checkout process was a disaster. I tried to do it on the TV but after scrolling up and down to enter in all the info it said that system was down and try later. So I phoned the front desk and was put on hold for 10 min. I phoned other numbers to ask if they could ask the front desk to give me a call. They said they could not help and told me to phone the front desk back. So I did and again could not get through. By this point I had wasted over 20 min and had to hang up so I could rush to get to my airport shuttle. Didn't get a copy of my receipt. I also thought that for the cost of the room and considering they also charge a $20/night 'resort fee' that they could stop 'nickle and dime-ing' people. Maybe it is a Vegas thing because I think that if they could find a way to charge for air they would. Turns out the mini-bar is programmed so that if you touch anything in it you will be charged for it even if you don't take it. I rearranged some items to try to make room to chill my own water bottle. Good thing I thought to check my bill the night before check out because otherwise I would not have had time to dispute it and I would have been charged for over $50 worth of water and snacks I hadn't touched. They sent someone to 'audit' my mini-bar who told me I should have read the room manual where this was explained and lectured me that the refrigerator was not for my personal use. Oh really? I went to the business center to print out my boarding pass (included in my 'resort fee'). The computers I was allowed to use to do this were in the main room sitting on a tall counter but they were not working. I saw other computers in private rooms but was told that you had to pay to use them. They did let me use them but cautioned me that if I did anything else I would be charged. What would it cost them to let that go given the others were broken and the place was virtually empty. Just cheap. I am not sure if I would go back to the Aria. The rooms were nice but with the mediocre service, the inconvenience of walking so far to your room plus the cost I think I would try someplace else hext time.

Reviews.Title: “Fun party weekend”
Reviews.Author: TwoNiners
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best bed I have ever slept in. Simply awesome! You can actually call and order the pillow, mattress etc directly from Aria. The rooms were modern, very hip and fun. Service was amazing. We ordered room service every day. Location was perfect. The late night crowd lingering was questionable. Security was great. All around a nice experience. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Rooms - Subpar Service”
Reviews.Author: Jon F
Reviews.Content: It's a bit odd when you check into Aria and go to your room and another man is already in it. It's a bit frustrating when you realize that they booked both of you into the same room and you only have 20 minutes to get ready for a business dinner. It's a bit disappointing that when you go down to fix the issue the staff acts as if it's no big deal and it happens all the time. It's extremely disappointing when they tell you there are no more non-smoking rooms and you say you need a non-smoking room and so they offer to upgrade you at no cost, then you go to the suite and it's not a suite at all. It's a regular room. It's a bit jarring when a test of the fire alarm that is supposed to happen in the casino and lobby (as explained in a letter from the staff) happens at 6 a.m. in every room in the hotel as people are trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our entire stay at thr Aria”
Reviews.Author: OlyaDallas
Reviews.Content: Modern, well designed rooms, great technology (remote control for lighting, blinds, TV and music - OMG, this IS the 21st century!). Reasonably efficient check in and check out for a hotel this size. Great design of the casino floor, fantastic restaurants, beautiful pool area and spa. Nothing is made cheaply, and everything you buy is expensive - but in my opinion it was very much worth the price. Loved the patisserie, lunch buffet was very tasty and a bargain for the price, Cafe Vettro had good food too.

Reviews.Title: “For the "premium" Vegas experience....choose Aria...”
Reviews.Author: Tremmers28
Reviews.Content: This really is a premium quality hotel which is ubber modern at every turn. It's nicely set back from the main strip and offers some of the best views you can get of Vegas. We had a room on the 32 floor which offered us views of the amazing skyline. The bathrooms are first class with lovely robes, a seperate shower and bath. The large beds are very comfy and the room is just generally well equipped with large TVs, mini-bar and a console that controls the TV, curtains, air con and lights. Across a four night stay it's tough to get to see all the hotel has to offer but we enjoyed Lemongrass, the thai restaurant the most. It's also quite good value in comparison to other restaurants in the resort. The pool area is very glam and luckily the sun isnt obstructed by other buildings unlike some hotels. I'm not normally a buffet person, but I would say try the weekend brunch buffet! ...put simply, it's the Bafta of brunch! The staff are excellent too - the hotel has 5 star quality but without behaving in a pretentious way. It has a modern approach to hospitality and doesn't have a formal feel to it, but equally you wouldnt feel out of place if you prefer that approach. If you don't like big hotels and you're looking for a personal meet and greet boutique experience, then maybe you'll struggle to find something in Vegas, but worth noting this place is MASSIVE and could be deemed in-personal! We didnt mind this - but simply getting from reception to your room is a nice work out! If you're looking for a premium experience, well located and at OK prices then pick the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Do not be lured in by the beauty of the room! Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Angela H
Reviews.Content: The concierge was asked to handle three things for me for my wedding day. They royally messed up all three, and then charged me twice. I had an overcharge on my credit card for food they say I billed to the room, I never gave that card to anyone other than the concierge! I wanted my salon reservations for 8 A.M. for my wedding day, they took it upon themself to make it at 9 A.M. because they said i didn't need that much time ( limo was to arrive at 11:30), and never sent me a confirmation. I had to rush to get ready. The maid was late every day. They put rose petals on the bed before the room was cleaned, TACKY! And then when the maid came in an hour later, they cleaned them up. They replaced them and charged me twice. I was supposed to have limo three hours, they booked me for a drop off and charged me three hours! They stock their refrigerator with expensive items, so you can't use it, but then if you need one for personal use you have to rent from them for over 30.00 a night. The room is beautiful, and gadgety, but not worth the irritation of the terrible service. Slots are tight, drink service is the worst.Don't expect a server to come around. For the price, look around. I had to fight to get any of the money back, and they still owe me for the food, or whatever it was, they can't seem to tell me exactly what it was. They insist a Manager will call me, but they havent after three weeks. They can have the 21.00, because they won't get another dime from me!

Reviews.Title: “We love Las Vegas and we love Aria too”
Reviews.Author: USGAB
Reviews.Content: We love Las Vegas and Aria is a good lodging option. Good situation (not perfect) communicated with Bellagio and Montecarlo with a tram Big new rooms, floor to ceiling windows, automatic curtains and lights, excellent TV with music (actually you can connect your PC or Music Player) big bathroom with all the amenities…. Everything perfect and everything you need to have a perfect stay in Vegas. Inside the hotel you have plenty of eating options (we strongly recommend “Unino” especially the Kobe Burger). Breakfast we enjoyed the Buffet (we had a promotion with breakfast included in our room) and was great. We don’t eat a lot, but you have a plethora of choices). Also: - Nice swimming pools (at least there are three swimming pools) - Elvis Show in the first floor. Pretty good show. - SPA: The perfect place to spend an afternoon with some massage. (We strongly suggest to enjoy the swimming pool outside the SPA) Something’s that you should know: - We booked a room with strip views. We got strip views but the views, due to the Hotel situation are not exceptional. - The self-garage is not so close to the reception but is the best option (time & money)

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for first trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: OrientKnight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 3 nights in September. I primarily chose the Aria due to it being new and therefore hopefully still nice a fresh. Our room was nice and modern although perhaps some of the technology was a bit gimicky certainly as sometime the screen buttons by the bed weren't very responsive. When we arrived it took less than a minute to see that the pillows left on our bed were filthy with someone else's make up. We complained at the front desk and they were very apologetic and gave us a $100 F&B credit to use in the hotel. While I appreciate this has minimal cost to them I thought it was a perfectly adequate response and showed good customer service, the offending pillows were obviously also removed. We had a Strip view, in hindsight I'm not sure if that was worth the extra money as we simply looked out over the Mandarin Oriental and Polo Towers - not that interesting or glamorous. From a gaming perspective I wouldn't have wanted to spend a great time in the Aria as personally I didn't like the smell - a bit of a vanilla musk... We only ate at one restaurant in the hotel - lunch in the Todd English pub which was perfectly tasty. Also really liked the location as we were in walking distance of the entire strip.

Reviews.Title: “Aria stay”
Reviews.Author: Howard Y
Reviews.Content: This is my first review ever. I loved the Aria hotel. It is gorgeous and smells like fresh vanilla every morn. The gym is nicer than any gym in vegas and nicer/bigger than the good life I'm a member of back home. I actually will gladly pay the resort fee for a gym like that any day of the week. The restaurants are very good and the hotel is pretty centrally located. Rooms are extremely modern, gorgeous and clean. They are modern to the point where when you open the door the window coveriings open automatically and the radio turns on. Pool is nice, ate at the spanish tappas restaurant which was good and the "normal" restaurant which was very good. Overall food was very good The only thing I can pick at (and this is just me being extremely picky) is the coffee situation. There is no coffee maker in the room and no starbucks in the hotel. So in order to get a coffee you either have to order room service, walk a block through the hotel (and spend 6 dollars) or walk to the monte Carlo starbucks. Overall I would stay here any day of the week. One of my favorite hotel in vegas

Reviews.Title: “My choice for staying in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JohannaBananaBee
Reviews.Content: My in-laws live in Vegas so I frequent Las Vegas a lot and love staying at the hotels, because honestly its a chance to live in luxury for the same price as a Holiday Inn in another city. I've stayed at Palazzo, Bellagio, Ti, Mandalay Bay, Venetian, Cosmopolitan etc... so pretty much all of them in the last 8 years. I prefer to stay at Aria because its clean, located ideally in the middle of the strip, and has great room amenities. I've stayed her a whole of 3 times, the first time they gave me a panoramic corner suite for the price of a standard room with an additional 50 bucks. This room was regularly 300+ dollars a night, and I thought it was nice of them to do that for us. I've stayed in corner suites ever since and just love them. All their rooms are operated by the TV, drapes, lights, temperature etc. Amazing bathrooms, they have a jacuzzi tub in addition to Toto washlet toilet seat that keeps the seat warm and clean you up after a #2. They also are prompt with turn down service and give you some nice chocolates, even on occasions where I never requested the service. Although I've never eaten at their buffet, I have tried a few restaurants around the area, my favorite being Jean Philippe Patisserie where they serve the most delicious sweet goodies. I've found the staff and service excellent and certain individuals have gone above and beyond. It is very sad that they do not allow dogs at this hotel, so lately I've been staying at the Cosmopolitan and the Four Seasons. I hope they follow other hotels around the strip and designate some rooms as dog friendly. Without a doubt I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Aria for Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: MDsquared
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria for the first time over the long Thanksgiving weekend. Public spaces fresh and modern. The rooms felt large with floor to ceiling windows, plush and comfy beds. Touch pad electronics had some glitches but were generally very convenient. Taking the tram to Bellagio made walking to Paris, Caesars, and Bally much less of a hike. The Spa is very large, but with too many coed areas. The "meditation" rooms were awfully noisy - you could hear the toilets flush in the adjoining locker rooms. Thanksgiving dinner at Sage restaurant was pricey, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieLee75
Reviews.Content: The Aria Resort was promoted on a travel show in Australia which gave it a great rap, and we weren't dissapointed. Our room was huge with a great view over the pool area, and had all the ammenities you could ask for. If I had one complaint it would be how far it was to get anywhere, but I assume most of the big resorts in Vegas are the same. You just about need a Segway to get from your room to the pool. There was also a lack of healthy options for meals, it was hard to find a place to get a simple breakfast in the morning. There is a monorail linking this resort with the Bellagio and Monte Carlo Casinos which is very handy as you do enough walking in Vegas as it is! Overall this was a lovely, clean, modern, well appointed resort and I'd certainly recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Great High Tech Luxury”
Reviews.Author: K_R_A_S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria for a conference and found the hotel to be very nice. The room was beautifully decorated and very high tech. Loved the bath tub. The buffet was good too. One thing I didn't like was there was no coffee pot. I went to target and purchased a small one to avoid having to get dressed first and go down and buy a cup every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Aria Resort Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: toyshan
Reviews.Content: The 5 Star Aria Resort & Casino 1/2 block of the Las Vegas Blvd was a place we would go again. It is so close to the eminities of the strip. The rooms were spacious and it was so endowed with the lastest technology. The service was excellent when U arrive to the hotel and the desk for the check in had several persons at their own counter plus the check out were separate from the check in which made it more convenient. In the room you can control the opening/closing of the sheers & curtains, the thermostat, the lights from the remote through the large LED TV. There is no coffe maker in the room. It was very simple to unlock the door with the card by just tapping on the circular puck next to the door and no more hanging a piece of cardboard on the door handle for Privacy or Service since the control panel by the door inside can be selected to notify the cleaning person. The room had unlimited free WiFi, but U have to pay $20 plus tax per day which also gave U a newspaper and free print out of your boarding pass and a safe. 3 phones (next to bed, next to the desk, next to the toilet). The elevators were separated in sections where if u are on the 27th floor it starts at the 25th floor to the 50th. There were 4 corodors for 4 elevators in each corodor so it made easy to get to your room so much faster. There were able restaurants in the hotel and there is a free tram that runs from the Monte Carlo Hotel, Aria Resort, and Belagio. The casino was large and busy, but you had to walk through the casino to get to the elevators. The Hotel is situated to where you can walk to the Strip to the other hotels and stores.

Reviews.Title: “The very best!”
Reviews.Author: markteach
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in a few places in Vegas and have been in most of the resorts. But our stay at the Aria was the very best! It is by far the most modern. You walk into your room for the first time and the lights go from dark to full lit by themselves. Then the curtains covering the floor to ceiling walls do a slow opening onto a beautiful view. And you can control everything with your TV or a pad by your bed. And this is where it starts. And, did I mention, this was their least expensive room. And since we had bought a package deal through the airline, the cost was about the same as most other mid-range resorts. Service was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Want modern and contemporary luxury?”
Reviews.Author: MrCaliAdvisor
Reviews.Content: If you like contemporary and modern luxury this is the place, the work out area is very nice and the spa as well, The restaurants are ok, but the buffet is one of the best ones around! if you want more simple vegas, the venetian or mirage will do the trick! BTW, the mirage has the best casino in town but linked with your card to the Aria

Reviews.Title: “Best Anniversary Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: cynsellsavon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aria for our 17th anniversary and couldn't have been more pleased. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was very very friendly, available and helpful. My husband, who is a "gadget" junkie was thrilled by the electronic wonders the room is equipped with. The comfort of the bed was awesome. The entire 5 days we were there, we do not have anything negative to say. The only thing that we didn't do was take anything out of the refrigerator or off of the snack bar. Too costly for our blood, but that's usually the case in any 1st class hotel. It's nothing against the Aria. Top class; way to go ARIA!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Aria worth staying”
Reviews.Author: etsusaki
Reviews.Content: Hello we just got back from las vegas. The Aria resort in las vegas is a good value the staff at the reg desk was top notch we had booked a promo that included a 50 dollar resort credit did some research and found another promo wich included a 100 dollar resort credit call to get the new promo res confirmed we had it but when we check in it wasnt their the recptionist took care of it outstanding job cudos to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME TIME!!!”
Reviews.Author: ninkho
Reviews.Content: I always, always have a great time in Vegas. Aria just adds to the already good experiences. As soon as you walk in, it smells like waffle cones. Contemporary stylings decorate the place and the service is impeccable and swift. You will not be waiting long to be served here! The rooms were very nice and beds comfortable. But who has time to sleep in Vegas??? The casino wasn't bad for winning and had many slots and tables. The food was really good and they offered several options as far as bars/clubs go. It was connected to City Center which offers more restaurants and high end shopping. The hotel is not far from the center of the strip which makes it convenient. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not good enough.”
Reviews.Author: bassiemom
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Aria for the first time as we were seeing a show there so we thought we would give it a try. Check in was easy despite the holiday weekend. The room was a good size, clean, very modern and had all the usual amenities. The lights and window coverings are controlled by wall panels that are a little confusing at first. The housekeeper arrived mid afternoon to clean the room which was a little inconvenient. We probably would not stay there again as there are better options on the strip for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE this place!”
Reviews.Author: kferg9
Reviews.Content: If you frequent Vegas and become a member of their Player's Club, the benefits are wonderful...we were lucky enough to stay in a corner suite and it was absolutely the most comfortable room we have ever stayed in...I love a room that has a powder room and a full bath and this one did! The amenities are top notch as well, even including a toothbush and tooth paste kit and razor and shaving cream...We love to order room service in the morning and the service is impeccable, and the food outstanding...We also love the casino and the beverage service is better than most casinos...we will definitely return...this stay was our third and we have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DavidZA
Reviews.Content: The rooms are extremely comfortable; curtains, lights, and aircon are all automated and operated from the TV. The pool is great, closes at 5pm though, which is a pity. Lots of nice restaurants in the hotel and the Buffet is great for breakfast. The location is good too, very central.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre - Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: RazzTazz23
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Aria. I travel to Vegas a few times a year and have stayed at the Venetian, Palazzo, Wynn, etc. I decided on staying at the Aria because I got a good deal on priceline. The hotel location is good - it is in the City Center complex in the heart of the strip. It is a very easy walk to the brand new Cosmpolitan, the Bellagio, etc. Self parking is free and the walk is about 5-10 minutes to get from the parking to the hotel - about the norm for Vegas. The decor is modern, dark and the hotel is filled with a vanilla scent. I don't mind vanilla, but I could see how it could bother some people. We had a standard king bed room on the 28th floor. The room is a good size and nicely appointed, though not up to the standards of other 5* hotels in Vegas. The room is entirely controlled by a digital ipad-type computer next to the bed. While the technology is cool, it isn't particularly intuitive and the touch screen is not particularly responsive, making it hard to use. The bathroom is nice but the frosted glass between the sink area and the toilet vault takes some getting used to. Oddly, the glass in our bathroom appears to be installed backwards. The glass is designed so one can see out but not in, giving some minimal privacy. Oddly, our glass one could see in, but not out. Oops. Also our bathroom, while clean, had shower head issues in that the shower head was not installed properly. A call to the front desk had it fixed quickly. The soaps provided by the hotel suck. They are some low quality chinese soap in Aria packaging. The other 5* hotels in town have fancy toiletries (i.e., l'ocittaine). So this was a big let-down. Also, the towels are small and are not soft. I was spoiled with the large soft towels at the Wynn and Venetian. These were mediocre towels at best. The rest of the room was ok. The bed is very very soft. If you like hard beds, do not stay here. I like a firm mattress and found the bed to be a bit unbearable. Also, we had issues with the phones in the hotel. Every once in a while they would short-out and reset, causing dropped calls. The front desk seemed disinterested, as if it occurred a lot. We used the spa which was nice. The spa was clean and modern. We had to pay a daily $20 amenity fee with our reservation which is a huge scam. It is supposed to include phone calls, a newspaper and internet in the fee. I never once saw my free newspaper and the internet only worked when there was a low load on the system - i.e. early morning or very late at night. It was nearly impossible to connect and use the internet between 5pm and midnight. Also, on weekends, there is a club that plays low bass-thumping music. We could hear every beat on the 28th floor. So keep that in mind if you are a light sleeper. The club isn't open weekdays so there was no noise except on the weekend portion of our stay. Overall, Aria is ok. I won't be returning because there is much better out there in town for similar prices.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTY BUT NOT MUCH SUBSTANCE IF THAT'S YOUR THING”
Reviews.Author: beckymonster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria July 2011 with friends (we are all in our early to late 20s). Aria is a gorgeous, sleek resort and one of the newest additions to the strip. Is it weird to say that their lobby/check-in area smells incredibly good? Their staff is pleasant and accomodating. Roomis are standard sized if you get a standard room. It's clean, it's lovely. Their pool area is divided up into several sections and makes for a very relaxing "resort-y" feel. With all that beauty, they don't have much else to offer. It isn't as big of a party zone as Hard Rock, Cosmo, or Venetian, which I found disappointing because they had similar aesthetic appeal. Good thing we got a good rate off travelzoo, because with that rate, I'd rather stay somewhere more fun. This hotel is best for people looking for luxury and quiet tiime.

Reviews.Title: “This and That”
Reviews.Author: bella2438
Reviews.Content: The rooms were lovely, very clean, and well maintained. The Staff was not very friendly, I should say most weren't, I did finally manage to find one that was friendly. The casino staff and server were terrible. The buffet was pretty good and the staff in the other restuarants were pleasant. I am sure I will probably never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with Million Dollar Views”
Reviews.Author: PoloKat
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal at Aria for my birthday weekend. The hotel was nice enough to upgrade me to a corner suite (#31144) for 3 nights. The view was incredible being able to see west to the Palms, east to Planet Hollywood, north to the Cosmopolitan, and slightly south. It was greater than a 180 degree view. There were no problems checking in and the wait was around 5 minutes. Checking out, there were front desk employees walking around with iPads reviewing the charges and checking us out on the spot with an email confirmation. It was just so easy. If you are going to stay at this hotel, spend the extra $50 and upgrade to the corner suite. There are always promotions going on and it really is so worth it. I took a bath looking out onto the Las Vegas Strip and the floor to ceiling windows make you feel like you are actually on the strip. However my favorite part was the bathroom. I never needed to use toilet paper during the whole trip and wouldn't go anywhere except my suite. In the bathroom, they had a wash and dry station for your derriere. I want to get one installed at my house! As far as dining, the only meal had at the hotel was at The Buffet. They had any and everything anyone could ever ask for. I just wish I was more hungry, but when I left, I thought for sure I was going to pop. The food was fresh and tasty from traditional breakfast items to Asian/Kosher/Italian/Southern cuisine as well as fresh fruit, made to order omelets, and pastries. They also had lunch items if you weren't in the mood for breakfast. I could go on and on about how nice the hotel was, but you just have to see it for yourself. And while it is a walk from the strip, it wasn't bad and you could take the FREE tram between properties.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing as usual!”
Reviews.Author: seattledude01
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd time staying at Aria. A wonderful experience as usual.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ellyse M
Reviews.Content: I am IN LOVE with the Aria. Fantastic staff, fantastic service and amazing rooms. The beds..oh the beds. Where do I begin?! If I could have one at my house I would they are that good. The scent in the aria is devine and I had to buy the incense for my home. I want to be back already!!!

Reviews.Title: “Resort great--Casino staff suck”
Reviews.Author: Fraser1972
Reviews.Content: The Aria Resort is beautiful and it was a great stay. The restaurants in the resort were great and the service was excellent. We had a corner suite which had fantastic views. There was nothing to complain about our suite/restaurants/hotel staff at all. The Casino drink servers were terrible. I was there for an entire week and not one server asked would I like a drink. When we went to other Casinos-Caesars, Planet Hollywood and the service was much better. Not a big complaint but it was crappy service.

Reviews.Title: “Ups & downs!”
Reviews.Author: RVer1
Reviews.Content: Celebrating my parents 50th anniversary, we purchased them a 4-nt. trip to Aria with us Thanksgiving week, Monday to Friday. I reserved 2 corner suites and we were all very excited about staying here. I paid an extra $284 per person to book the corners!! (Since this was such a special occassion, I didn't want to risk not being offerred upgrades upon check-in, which is the route we normally take and yes, it is generally much cheaper.) -Check in: Having done my homework, I requested rooms above the 25th (the towers are not as wide, requiring much less of a hike from the elevators) and a city view. The COLD gentleman behind the counter took a call and talked for a while, then casually handed us our keys--my parents were on the 10th floor, not city view, we were on the 17th, with city view. He claimed I only "paid for" one city view room and that he apologized for the lower floors, but that's what was available. Of course I wanted to trade rooms with my parents, but my father wouldn't hear of it. No upgrades were offerred and the clerk could have cared less that neither of our requests were honored. (I actually had tears in my eyes!) I must admit that this experience alone is the MAIN reason for only 3 stars. -The HIKE to our room: It was a loooong way to the room! The first few times we walked it, it seemed to take forever. After a while though, we just accepted it and it didn't seem as long...but it IS! -The first entering of the room: After all the reading and reviews, I expected this wonderland delite of lights coming on and curtains opening up, and the TV greeting us, and, and, and....NOTHING. We had to fumble around to hit light switches and turn things on. Disappointment #2 in only a matter of minutes. -The room itself: Our view was nice! I loved curtains in all rooms. It was like a mini apartment! The robes and slippers were awesome. The living area was comfy and I liked having a refridgerator...great for keeping that 1/2 a sandwich you couldn't eat earlier and some beverages. We didn't touch the mini-bar, but it was stocked up! The bathroom was interesting. The sinks take up too much of the counter space for my liking and I found putting curling irons and makeup places a bit awkward. The bidet brought lots of curiosity & laughter! Loved the heated toliet seat :) The bed was VERY comfy--I do prefer a softer bed and have a sleep number at home. (I'm a 35 and hubby a 40 on the SN and this was comparable.) The linens were soft and cozy. The pillows were absolutely wonderful and we are ordering 2 for home! (You can buy them in the gift shop if you have room to carry them home. Otherwise, you can have them shipped. They are $20 for a queen and $28 for a king, plus s/h.) The full room controller: I have an iPad, etc., so am comfortable using a touch screen and navigating around. It wasn't that navigation was difficult, but there were simply too many buttons to have to select to make things that you want to happen, happen...meanwhile, all sorts of things you don't want to happen, would happen! It was quicker to just walk over to a switch, but even then odd things happened. One morning I watched the sun coming up from the living room while hubby snoozed. I wanted more lights on, so I hit "room on" and the next thing I know I had opened up the bedroom curtains, etc. and blinded him awake! Oops, so sorry babe! (He hit a switch on the controller at the precise moment I decided to try the bidet, and I didn't know how to turn it off in the dark...yeah, it's funny now :) The pad in the room was also too bright! I prefer it dark when I sleep, so I told my husband to lay it down...he did and lights and the TV popped on....so much for that! My father said he had to lay a towel over theirs. -The casino: They do a great job with the smoke and smell! The slots were mostly digital, but there were a few fun ones that entertained with extra spins, etc. The dealers seemed nice enough, although many were a bit stuffy. The woo-hoo atmosphere found at many casinos when tables are full was few and far between. The most fun we saw people having was playing casino war! We had as good of and even better drink service here as anywhere else we went. -The food, etc.: We just did coffee downstairs at Jean's each morning and it was tasty. They also have an assortment of pastries. We also had the ___Vetra (?) cafe one morning and had the eggs benedict with lump crab--yummy, and super nice staff! We had the buffet one evening b/c we wanted to try the king crab legs. They are on ice, but you can get them heated up. They were tasty, and I loved they were split, but I would take the meat out and then squeeze it and water would just pour off--my plate was almost spilling over with water by the time I rang out about 7 or 8 legs...rather unappealing. The beef from the chinese section was my favorite part of the meal! They did have a nice selection, and to have king crab included for $29.99 really was a good deal! -Maid Service: They did a great job keeping the room tidied each day...no complaints there. They did take our robes on the last day and did not replace them. (I told my husband that this may be customary on the last night so people don't steal them...of course not so!) The evening turndown service made it so nice to come in and slip into a robe & slippers and look out over the city lights from the couch or bed. They leave chocolates and have soft lights & music on. (One evening they didn't turn down at all, which was a little disappointing.) I liked the service & privacy buttons inside the door--much easier than fumbling with a tag with the door open. -Boarding Passes: The concierge was sooooo friendly and gladly printed our boarding passes....thought we'd take advantage of the service since it's included in the resort fee. -Checking out: You can easily view your charges on the TV and check out. You just fill out a card and put your room keys with it and drop it at the elevators. HOWEVER, the charges are all broken down in ways that I was confused so decided to look over my bill at the desk....the charges were not broken down on that print out and made more sense. I also became a bit paranoid about not having our robes replaced and wanted to bring it the hotel's attention so we weren't charged $60 each for them. (That's how much they were in the gift shop anyway...) The clerk looked at me a bit suspiciously, but said she would note it. Good thing I checked out at the desk, or we would have been charged for stealing robes! In spite of a sour beginning and end at the front desk, we did enjoy the hotel and our room. The guys at the elevator were friendly to us and it wasn't a big deal to show our room key as others have complained about. (I certainly wanted to ensure I had it with me anyway before making the trek to the room!) The walk to the strip isn't that bad, although it is not "on the strip" and does require some effort. We cabbed it a few times to save energy...speaking of which, don't think you can go to the front desk area and get a cab--that is a drop off zone only and you have to go all the way across to the other side for pick up. Hopefully Aria will work on making guests feel more welcome upon check in & strive to meet (reasonable) requests. A better first impression would have made this hotel more appealling overall.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth J
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights in September. It was our third trip to Vegas, previously staying at The Bellagio but we decided to have a change and we were very impressed. The room was wonderful, very clean and spacious. Loved the remote controls!! The bed was very comfy - the best ever. Buffet very good and the service was excellent. Pool areas were very clean and the waitress service very good also. All in all a really great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms, Pricey Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: CheapEnglishman
Reviews.Content: I was there for three nights for a convention that was at the Aria. I got a discounted room because of work. The room was excellent, it was a little bit overly techno focused, you can't even turn the TV on at the TV. There is a central room system for everything from opening the curtains to controlling the lights and music. I found it fun for about ten minutes, then I found it annoying. The bed was very comfortable with good linens. We ate in the hotel twice, and found them to be very expensive compared to other Vegas places.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome place, decent service most of the time”
Reviews.Author: vegasjayone
Reviews.Content: Check in was a bit of a hassel, but the hotel was wonderful. Most of the staff demonstrate what would be expected from a 5 star resort. The buffet was outstanding! Front desk - 3 star (some minor kinks, they seemed disinterested). We got misinformation about our room locations - we were told that they would be together if they were on the same floor and opted for a lower floor, and sure enough, the rooms were on opposite ends of a really long hall. Rooms - 5 stars Valet - 5 stars Buffet along with service/server - 5 star Casino - 5 stars

Reviews.Title: “please read all my review for info”
Reviews.Author: blingster44
Reviews.Content: This is my 7th trip to vegas we live in the uk, got to check in we had booked via British airways and had pre paid well in advance booked a king non smoking room and was greeted with your room is queen's smoking we can move in you tom !! I said we have just taken a 12 hour flight booked King Non Smoking and thats what we expect he replied your room is not guaranteed !!! so why take the booking !!! I asked for the manager the manager did not appear but maricoulsy the receptionist returned with a king non smoking room !!!! Our room was deluxe city view 8th floor lovely room clean airy couldnt get to grips with the gadgets the room was freezing most of the time. On day two the room was cleaned maid took one of the bathrobes even after calling to request a replacement it didnt happen till I called again !! Good standard of soaps etc mini bar very expensive to to CV's on the strip for your drinks snacks .. Very happy with the hotel . The downsize just got back to the UK and checked on my Credit Card statement to be in shock that my room had been charged to my card again £653.00 this has never happened before I know they swipe which is standard but never charged.This was not explained at the check in desk My previous stays in Vegas have been Palazoo Venetian MGM Luxor Mandalay and Excalibur this has never happened in any of these hotels its a good thing that I didnt use my debit card.....PLEASE BE WARNED.. I have called and emailed the Aria spoke to Eddie who told me this is standard practice !!! its a new one to me We are worldwide travellers and this has never happened anywhere we have stayed yes a swipe is taken BUT NO FUNDS are taken... Please be warned I think other hotels are now doing this in Vegas more monies for them to make holding your cash....Being from the UK I am now just hoping that the exchange rate does not effect my refund and it fluctuates daily !! DONT BE CAUGHT OUT CHECK WITH YOUR HOTEL BEFORE YOU BOOK !!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: ADRBROWN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, was a nice, clean, modern hotel, the rooms were great with good views and the beds - oh so comfy you just sink into them! Good location, the buffet was good we ate there 3 times, the only thing it is a bit of a hike at night to some of the other hotels, but with this and the Cosmo next door there should be enough to keep you occupied. The casino has a modern feel to it, not too much carpet like the older hotels.....that didn't stop me losing though!

Reviews.Title: “Super place to reconnect with Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bill167
Reviews.Content: It had been a couple of years since we went to Vegas. So we tried out this new City center hotel/casino. It truely is well planned and the best air circulation and filteraion system. We don't smoke. The men's barber shop was excellant. I needed some grooming done. The Lady barber from Russia was the best(she used to be at Bellargio). The resort could have more late night/early AM places to eat. The one that is there is excellant, but another one would be twice as good. The staff is top shelf. Great at coordinating transport, shows, dining. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Broke our Vegas virginity !!”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Christine2006
Reviews.Content: We finally made it to Las Vegas this fall in September and decided to stay at the Aria Resort & Casino. It is a farely new hotel and supposedly a little more on the high tech side. It was a group of eight of us and for 6 of us it was our first time in Vegas. We were not disappointed ! The rooms are spacious and nicely layed out. Our room also had a great view of the mountains. The room controls are neatly controlled with a tablet style remote (air, TV,music, curtains and lights) The bars were great as well as the pools. The Aria is also located centrally so one day we hit the strip and headed north and the next day south. Whenever we return to Vegas we'll look at other options but the Aria will be on our list for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel with one odd flaw.”
Reviews.Author: cassindc
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new addition to the strip with sleek lines, well designed rooms and interesting modern art throughout hotel and City Center. One major flaw, at least for us, is that the bathroom vent lets smoky air (from casino?). We are on a non-smoking floor (24th, room 241) and the bathroom smells like second hand smoke. The vent is above the toilet and air flows out. You can shut the bathroom off (close the door to the toilet and then the sliding door to the bathroom itself and that keeps the air out fof the suite but still so irritating. Finally figured out to stuff tissue paper in the vent to stop the air flow entirely and that worked great. Only other oddity is that sinks cannot be stoppered, so hard to shave in the morning - modern design going one step too far. otherwise, a great hotel. Be sure to see the ice saguaro cactus, the whirrling water tornadoes and the enormoous living aloe tree in the Crystals shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Great And New”
Reviews.Author: GAZAS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in april great place good position . Rooms are large and the teck was great if you can use a tv remote you can do all the thing you dream of doing in your own place, Bed is very good slept well And the best thing is you can pay and book out from your room by the remote

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, wonderful rooms and great service”
Reviews.Author: BurntK
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here for my partners 40th birthday - and it couldn't have been better. Having contacted the hotel in advance they gave us a complimentary upgrade to a city view room, and delivered strawberries and macaroons to the room for his birthday.
