The room itself was immaculate, and on the 28th floor with a great view. Everyday it was cleaned and left spotless (as was the entire hotel) Everything is new - and the bed - oh my god, it must be honestly the most comfy bed in the world! I want one. The lighting was a little hard to figure out, and our remote control needed new batteries, but it was cool to sit in bed and make the curtain open, lights go on and off and change TV channels. Every single staff member we encountered, either in the hotel corridors or casino were so polite and greeted us - check in and out was quite prompt, and concierge was very helpful when we wanted to book some tickets. The pool area was also really good - heated spa pools were heavenly, and we spent some time there relaxing - bit cool for actual swimming, but plenty of people enjoying the sun on the comfy loungers. In all I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice comfortable place to stay. It was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: legogirl77
Reviews.Content: Aria was a fun place to stay...rooms were contemporary, but yet not cold feeling, and reasonably priced, especially compared to many of the older hotels on the strip. Hallways were a little dark (probably due to low (footcandle) light levels for the LEED certification, but always felt safe. Lots of gadgets in the rooms for the techy people out there...motorized shades, light controls, etc. Great location and fantastic artwork in public areas. Mini-bar prices were high (as they typically are in places like this) and vending was not available, so head to a drug store across the street if you want a cheap Coke.

Reviews.Title: “Becoming Our Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Donald H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Aria for the second time this past weekend. I have to say, as someone who has been visiting Vegas for 25 years and having stayed at most all of the top hotels on the Strip, Aria has quickly become one of our favorites. We choose Aria (over our usual stay at the Bellagio) at first because of the price and to try something different. We have been pleasantly surprised with our now 2 stays at this hotel. The rooms are great and very tastefully decorated, as is the entire hotel... it's nice to get away from the sometimes "over the top" themed hotels. The restaurants are first rate and the Spa and Gym were fantastic! I had mentioned to the reservation agent that it was our anniversary, and to our pleasant surprise the hotel sent up a very nice welcoming treat in recognition. The location is great and a short tram ride over to the Bellagio and beyond. I can't say enough good things about our stay at this rather new resort in City Center... Give it a try and I bet it's going to become one of your favorites as well!

Reviews.Title: “The best vegas!! has to offer”
Reviews.Author: LeeFletcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the aria last year and went back again this year awaiting dates to book for next year. The hotel is just of the centre strip so easy to get out and about. The hotel is big with all you need on-site. Rooms were comfy, clean, spacious, fully automated with queen size beds. All the staff were friendly and welcoming. we ate at the award winning jean-georges steak house the best steak i have ever had (and i like steak). And dont forget the elvis show by cirque de soleil and the night clubs many bars and bands. Just like to add a big thank you to Michael Lloyd for his time to make sure our stay was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Martha R
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at Aria casino and resort in Vegas in October for my birthday, Aria is a great place to stay, staff was wonderful, very friendly, the food was great as well. I would highly recommend the Aria to anyone who visit Vegas. We will go back we loved it, the rooms was wonderful, the bedding was just outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: BCCanadaLisaCanada
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night trip. I'll keep this quick. Check in was very fast, room very nice, room service excellent, ate at two of the resturants - very good food and service. Location was perfect. Prices for food, coffee and beer are high but not stupid high. I've stayed at 5 other hotels on the strip and ARIA has been the best.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, upscale hotel.”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: Hotel is incredibly nice. Very upscale. As in most nicer hotels, things can be pretty expensive. Rooms are nice. Everything in room is automated by the TV. Large property. Near the nice upscale mall (can't remember name). Convention center is incredible and the conference food was excellent (which was a wonderful surprise). Lots of upscale restaurants to choose from. Would like to go back. One of my two favorite resorts in LV. Location was right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Top rate hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: Slenda_Glenda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria Resort and Casino for 6 nights. The room had all the latest mod cons and "welcomed" us when we entered the first time by automatically opening the curtains, turning on the TV and lighting. Although we did not exactly have a view of The Strip, we could see the leg of the Eiffel Tower which was fun. The City centre Tram connects the Aria with the Bellagio Casino and the Monte Carlo which is very convenient and save walking in the hot sun. Being a new casino the air conditioning at the Aria was particularly good. Although I suffer an allergy to smoke I could walk through the Aria without being affected. The Cafe Vettro served good meals at a reasonable price. The pool area was massive and was probably the size of at least 2 football fields. The business centre was very handy for doing our flight check-in. The Crystals shopping centre was just across from the front door. Our main purpose in going to Las Vegas was to see the Elvis Live Cirque du Soleil. We had a friend who was performing in the show. The show was fantastic and I can recommend it to everyone, particularly if you are an Elvis fan. I can thoroughly recommend Wolfgan Puck pizza restaurant at Crystals. Fabulous pizzas.

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed Aria”
Reviews.Author: kathiDublin_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days in Vegas on business/personal trip. Have previously stayed at New York, New York, Paris, Bellagio and Caesars. We liked Aria; it feels fresh and modern and upscale. The staff was all well trained and we had good meals at Cafe Vettro and the buffet. Great band in the bar on Casino level on Friday night that got us dancing. We tried the nightclub on the Promenade level after we saw the Crique Elvis show but it was crowded and you had to pay extra to sit anywhere. They did give us a free drink coupon however. My husband thought he left an expensive item in the room and the housekeeping staff looked hard for it and kept us informed of their efforts. (it was in his suitcase of course) Only downside is that we felt pretty distanced with the set back of this property, from the strip. Tried the tram through the adjacent upscale mall Crystal, but it just lets you off at the very rear of the Bellagio and you have to walk forever through the hotel and out to get to Las Vegas Boulevard. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, technology, and exercise”
Reviews.Author: bargainhuntinginTN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. The lobby has its own fragrance as does the pool/spa area. Unless you love a vanilla smell, you'll prefer the spa and pool area's fragrance-nice. The resort is HUGE (with thousands of rooms). We requested a room closer to elevators, only to get one a bit closer. Not lazy, but everything in Vegas is a FAR walk and wanted to see lots outside the hotel too. The 3 restaurants we went to were great. The buffet is great. If you go at about 10:00 am, you can get some breakfast and lunch (which starts at 11). The room is tech-friendly with buttons on the remote to push for drapes, lights, etc. The casino was nice, but as all seemed to, it allowed smoking. Luxury room, sheets, service, pools, and spa. If you love art, have a scavenger hunt with the hotel's map of artwork nearby-fun. Ask about the winding piece of artwork above the lobby's check-in desk when arriving-interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: apple26
Reviews.Content: Aria is new, moderm and luxurious. Room very high tech, beautiful decor, comfortable bed, very nice bathroom. There are a number of great restaurant. We wanted to see Elvis, but was off on that week, so we saw "O" , amazing. Love Aria and we go to Las Vegas every year, and we have no plans to change hotel. Definitively Aria!!!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay in a year.”
Reviews.Author: travler1976
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a very interesting contemporary hotel located in City Center. This is my second stay in a year. For me the best thing about this hotel is the electronics in the room. The bedside control of lights, curtains, tv a/c etc is just ....FUN. The hotel offers some nice deals so it is affordable. Found the staff to be especially friendly and helpful. Valet service is quick and easy, check in not bad and the Concierge Desk is OUTSTANDING. I had a problem with some show tickets I purchased on line. Not only did they resolve the problem, but got me better seats and a discount, Great Job. Overall the hotel is expensive, with few casual dining options. But The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable. Just remember not to touch anything in or on the minibar, you'll get charged for it. The pool area too is especially nice and have never had a problem finding a chair. Go and enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Management Lacking”
Reviews.Author: WKDFINE
Reviews.Content: We recently had an incident that was handled extremely poorly. We were in a suite and someone ended up trapped in one of the bathrooms for quite some time. Nobody seemed to care or think it was a big deal. In fact, we were told not to lock the bathroom door next time. I informed the individual the door was not locked, only shut. His reply...then I would suggest not using this bathroom then. I contacted management, via email, and have never received a reply. I've heard management wasn't too good and this solidifies it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Sinatra1969
Reviews.Content: One of the Best hotels on the strip. Got an upgrade to a huge suite ....and never had before a heated Toiletseat,,,very cool and super luxury hotel. The huge bathroom invited youbto dance tango mand in the big jakuzi you can chill out till the cows comes home. The whole rooms had a multimedia sound system which allowed you to have your iPod etc..connected and enjoy in great sound. Also nice shopping area with great restaurants. The hotel feels like it was build yesterday, well maintained Und friendly proactive service

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: pookyCanada
Reviews.Content: Aria is new, modern and luxurious. Our room was really nice and high tech: curtains, temperature, music, tv, lighting, and room service all controlled via digital remote. The decor was nice and the room very spacious. Bed was super comfortable. Pool and hot tub were both really nice. There are a number of great restaurants and bars at the Aria. Saw Viva Elvis, loved it. Would definitively stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: grandhar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Las Vegas where we spent 4 glorious days at the Aria Resort and Spa at City Center. The staff from the concierge to the reservations desk, the restaurant and casino employees and the floor attendants and doormen couldn't have been any higher in standards and friendlier. The room was spotless and staff were everywhere to help. We stayed in a Junior suite which was beyond expectations with the most comfortable bed. Everything was computerized through the television. You programmed the opening of the sheers and black-out curtains, lighting, wake-up call, profile at the front desk (as to charged on your bill), heat and air conditioning and info on the hotel. Sophistication at its highest. The buffet must not be missed. There was something for everyone with different likes and dislikes. The price was very low considering what was available to choose from. The quality was very high. We found the casino floor very smokey but that could be that we are Canadians and not allowed to smoke in our casinos but we were prepared for that from previous visits. That did not hamper the urge to play the slots. The Viva Elvis show was also very enjoyable and the time went very quickly as it was very fast paced. The seating in the theatre is so comfortable you would think you were sitting in your own living room with excellent leg room. There is a tram running from the Monte Carlo to the Bellagio with a stop at the Aria/Crystal, similar to the one that runs from the Mandalay Bay to the Excalibur, but you still need a very very comfortable pair of shoes. Walking to the strip is a fair piece even though the address is on Las Vegas Blvd. There was only one (out of 3) outdoor pool open at this time of year but the outdoor whirlpool spa was being used by a few couples. All in all, we would recommend this hotel to everyone. Enjoy,.

Reviews.Title: “A favorite of mine in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MikeCSantaBarbaraUSA
Reviews.Content: The Aria Hotel was wonderful. This was the second time I've stayed there. Everything about it is first rate. The rooms are beautiful, the public facilities striking and the pool area quite nice. Get a corner suite if you can, the additional small upgrade cost is worth it. Restaurants are plentiful and all very good. Some great high end and some good more moderate priced ones. I would also have to say that my favorite buffet is in the Aria. A very wide selection of very well prepared foods. A perfect spot for breakfast. Oddly, I thought I was going to have a lot more great things to say about the hotel, as my feelings say that there are tons of good things to write about, but my pen is not moving. Let's cut to the chase--one of the truly great big hotels in Las Vegas. One of the few that deserves 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Haven for thieves”
Reviews.Author: S N
Reviews.Content: Our stay at aria was absolutely horrendous. We started the trip by waiting 2 ours upon check in for our hotel room keys as the system was down. The spa services received were overpriced for what you got. Our wedding rings were stolen from the bedside table while we were sleeping During the night. The hotel security is an absolute joke. There are no surveillance cameras on the hotel floors, the room safe is in a drawer which could easily be removed, the hotel room doors are not heavy enough to close on their own and anyone who has a room key has access to all the floors. Not what you expect from a supposedly 5 star hotel. The hotel staff managers, risk and security department have yet to return several calls regarding this matter. Absolutely appalling. I would not recommend this hotel if it was the last one standing.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding rooms, fair price”
Reviews.Author: frugaltravelerDC
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here recently while on a business trip. The Aria is new and gleaming, and a short can ride from the airport. My room was really neat - comfortable bed, lots of closet space, very cool bathroom...particularly enjoyed the automatic drapes! Internet worked well and is free. The lobby leads to guest elevators thru a casino and you have to show your room key to a bouncer-looking person before they let you into the elevators. This place is huge - so expect to walk quite a bit to everywhere (all the restaurants, bars etc within the hotel itself). There are some nice shops inside the hotel and a huge mall right next door. My only other beef is that all the restaurants (especially the coffee and sandwich shops inside) were very pricey and not worth the money. 13 bucks for a portabello panini? Another minor peeve is the general curtness of the service staff, but no big deal. We used their convention center for some client meetings - very poor service, they nickel and dime you for everything. Good place to stay in Vegas, but take your conference business elsewhere, and try to avoid the in-house restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Wano16
Reviews.Content: The whole visit to the Aria (five days) was a great experience. The staff, from the top to bottom was very friendly and went out of their way to speak to every guest. Those you saw on multiple occasions would even call you by name. Very quick check in and check out for such a large hotel. The building and grounds are spotless. The room is very modern with remote control for the lights, TV and curtains. You can lay in bed and hit one buttom, the lights go off, the TV goes off and the curtains close. You can even program the TV, lights and curtains as your wake up alarm. Nice sized rooms and very comfortable beds and pillows. The only thing we found not up to par was that the higher shelves had not been dusted in quite a while. I was there on business and the meeting rooms are quite a hike from the rooms, but this is very large place overall. Different banks of elevators for groups of floors so you never wait long for one. Many nice clubs and restaurants. We ate at a few and all were very pleasing and satifying. Usher showed up at Haze one night while we were there. We couldn't have been more pleased overall.

Reviews.Title: “First Timer”
Reviews.Author: William W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria and had the most fun with my clothes on that I can remember. The hotel is 1st class as well as the staff. The decor was not over the top but still glitzy. I had fun and felt they exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are the finest anywhere”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSherpa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our early 40's and stayed here Nov 13-16th. We booked through the hotel website and paid $604.00 final price after taxes each. We flew on southwest airlines and it was the worst flights ever. No seats assigned, it is a free for all. Luckily a nice man moved so we could sit together. No radio/TV/Movie for a 5 hr flight. The in flight meal was a Halloween sized bag of peanuts. I guess we got the deal so.... The hotel is wonderful. The rooms are the best ever, we are not gadget geeks but had no problem working everything in the room, lots of fun. The bathrooms were luxury. The bed is like sleeping on a cloud. Loved the room. The hotel is modern design and in my opinion is lacking in atmosphere.The bars are nothing exciting, we went to "the bar at times square" in New York New York hotel and had the best night out ever, an experience I expected and had at this bar in Vegas. The Casino has a nice vanilla smell to it, not smoky like others which is great. However it is hard to win here, the money was flying out of my hands!!! The hotel is big. I am in good shape and even my legs and feet were hurting from all the walking involved. The hotel is set back from the strip so it is a long walk to get there. Put on some good walking shoes you will need them. Also try and get a room near the elevator to reduce your walking distance. The breakfast buffet for $15.99 was not a bad deal believe it or not, basic buffet fare with bottomless cup of coffee and more. The restaurants are expensive however. The Elvis show in the spectacular Elvis theater was superb!! We had tickets included in our package and loved it!! Highly recommended. The great room trumps any not so good things about this hotel, and makes this a great hotel. Overall we loved our stay here, and would return on a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Futuristic, amazing rooms! Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dansocal
Reviews.Content: The Aria resort at City Center, Las Vegas is a unique experience. The property is huge and is attached to shopping, restaurants and even a monorail like train to get you to neighboring properties. When you enter the property its a little confusing where to go. I like to just get the parking over with and unfortunately the parking for the Aria is on the opposite side to the check in desk for the hotel. It's a long walk and once you arrive at the check in area, there is a sea of people lined up at the counters... I of course scouted out the shortest line and didn't realize this was a line for people who had checked in but hadn't received keys. Thats a new one for me! They were nice enough to still check me in and give me keys to my room. The room was amazing and actually has a programmed performance the first time you enter. The drapes open, lights turn on and tv turns on to welcome you. The room has an iPad like device that lets you control lights, temperature, drapes and even the tv. I have to say my favorite part of the room was the bathroom. It has a large walk in shower with huge bathtub right behind it. The only problem I had with the room was that I was on the North East end of the building which faced the Cosmopolitan. The Cosmopolitan has a nighclub on the pool deck which plays loud music till 4 in the morning. Unfortunately as good as the Aria's sound suppression was, I could still hear the thump, thump, thump and people screaming till 4... not what you would expect at this class of property. Definitely go for a room on the South side of the hotel. I also took advantage of the spa and got a massage. The spa is world class with 4 Jacuzzi's of varying temperature so you don't get overheated and a complimentary water and juices.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, classy hotel and resort”
Reviews.Author: Stacy C
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, comfortable bed and awesome buffet...the room controls were fab, at the touch of a switch the curtains opened and the lights dimmed...TV turned on. Compared to the Wynn, this room was quite a bit smaller and did not have a TV in the bathroom...you know how important that is! Also, the bathtub was actually in the shower, but not part of the shower...very odd...I would stay here again, but probably would choose the Wynn over this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy, luxurious, new "in" hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: susannita77
Reviews.Content: This is the new go to hotel in Vegas, in my opinion. It's tough to stay "in" in Vegas as a hotel for long. As for now, this is the place to be on the strip. The restaurants inside are gourmet pure. Shopping is bliss. It's the new Bellaggio - for 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Architectural Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HendyLim
Reviews.Content: Aria definitely is one of the stylish & modern hotel at Vegas. The room was so modern. From the curtain, the TV, the design all was so fascinating. But the best were the bed & the pillows, my baby who's usually not a big fan of day time nap (especially add with jet lag) seems had a very convenience sleeping time there. The rate was reasonable for us, considering we've got great offer (quite amount resort credits) from one of the online hotel reservation. The only minus was we had to pay a resort fee, which we actually didn't need all the facilities that includes in it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karniki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aria Hotel in Septmeber 2011. The rooms were very clean and the bed was so comfortable that we named it "the cloud" and could barely leave it to go out and see Vegas. Remote control blackout cutains were nice so you could have a nap any time. The resort was excellent- one of the better casinos I saw on my trip and very nice selection of restaurants. The pool was clean and aesthetically pleasing and the pool bar was very upscale and fun. We had a wonderful time and will return in 2012 for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: jkilthau
Reviews.Content: We usually book at the Venetian or Palazzo but decided to give the Aria "a whirl". Although this is a large property, it has somewhat of a "boutique feel" to it as the architecture and styling is so creative and beautiful. I was amazed at the quality of the materials they used throughout from the shower doors to the wallpapers which looked to be hand-stitched in some places. We should have passed on the buffet as it was very blase although the 24hr Cafe Vettro was very good and we shared a large slice of carrot cake which was the very best we had ever had (wifey tried to score the recipe, to no avail ;) I was so happy to find that they had a really cushy pillow-top on the king bed. Perhaps it is a down top mattress. Being in my late 50's, I usually wake up with body pains if the bed is the slightest bit firm. For the first time in forever I woke with no aches at all and reminded myself to buy one of these mattresses the next time we're in the market. We pulled the sheets and saw that it was a custom model made for the Aria by Sealy. Lastly I will say that the staff at the Aria was absolutely the friendliest and most courteous that I have experienced in Vegas. A number of people really went out of the way for us not only at the Concierge but at the buffet. All in all a great experience and, although the rooms aren't as big as the jr. suites at the Venetian, they are sumptuous, big and beautiful. Aria will be our first choice for future stays in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Aria & Me”
Reviews.Author: Jamdawn
Reviews.Content: Been here about nine times.love the rooms,love seeing my name on the TV when I walk in the room.Love the smell when I walk into the hotel.About my second or third stay here I ran into and had dinner with Eva Longoria at her restaurant(Bistrio)Alot of gaming on the floor,but don't like the smoke.Buffet upstairs has very good selections and good deserts.The corner suites are nicer that the regular rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Went there for a wedding and cameback with Legionnaire's Disease”
Reviews.Author: Carole L
Reviews.Content: I do not like writing bad reviews but I have never gotten sick from a hotel before. I stayed at the Aria in June for my daughter's wedding. Ten days after returning home, I got sick and it lasted all through the month of July. In Canada we only have a few months of summer and to be sick for one whole month of it is just awful. I was in contact with the Nevada Health District (NHD) and was told that Aria would contact me. I was never notified by Aria about exposure to the disease. NHD said it was Aria's responsibility to contact everyone who stayed there 2 weeks before the discovery of the bacteria, and 2 weeks after. That was in late July and Aria has still not contacted me. I always like to soak in a tub and read a book, then shower after the bath. That made for long exposure to steam. I am so thankful my elderly mother did not come to the wedding, as this would have killed her. I just wonder when and if they are ever going to contact me. As for the hotel itself, the beds are absolutely perfect. We had a really good maid, but when she had 2 days off, our room did not get cleaned. We were there for 8 days. Everything is really far and there is alot of walking. The rooms are beautiful and have deep soaker tubs. I don' t understand why management doesn't do anything about the customer service and the cleanliness of the rooms when there are so many complaints and bad reviews. It is such a beautiful hotel that will go to ruin fast if these problems aren't taken care of. I do not recommend anyone with any health issues staying at this hotel. ie the elderly. It is not convenient and is very expensive. The food is good but you can get just as good for less money all over Vegas. I don't know if I would return to Vegas. Being so sick really has scared me.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Vegas Hotels”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustCochrane
Reviews.Content: Simply you cannot beat the location of the hotel, right smack in the middle of the Las Vegas strip. The ease of walking access to all of the hotels is great. The rooms: the rooms are very well appointed with electronic controls to heating/cooling, lights, curtains, privacy/service, wake-up and nighttime. For the techno-geek, this will keep someone amused for a couple of hours setting your rooms to the perfect ambiance. The beds, pillows and bedding are all very modern. There is also a media centre allowing USB, HDMI access to the TV for those wishing to plug and play electronic devices. The furniture and decorations are also modern and in good repair. The bathrooms are spacious with separate toilet room/shower and tubs. The Aria supplied shampoo/conditioners were standard hotel types = not very good. Our room was not cleaned on day 2 despite leaving the service light on for the duration of the day. Not sure why, but at 10pm at night we didn't want to call housekeeping. Typical to hotels in Vegas with 4000 guest rooms, the walk to and from the elevators can be overwhelming. Ask for a room close to the elevators. Casino: The casino floor was easy to navigate with many food, bar, lounge restaurant, deli, snack bar options around the entire casino area. This is likely the most user friendly casino with well marked restrooms, directional signage to guest elevators and lobby I've ever seen. Food: Only purchased snack items at the hotel, preferring to eat offsite. I would most certainly return to this hotel and can easily say it is a favorite.

Reviews.Title: “first class”
Reviews.Author: johnmurphy
Reviews.Content: I got an exceptionally good rate for this hotel for a weeks stay in November but was a little apprehensive by some of the reviews on here. I shouldnt have been. I love this hotel. The smell. The rooms. The staff. The service. The location. All of it. Sure it is a little expensive but this is to be expected in the surroundings. As for the 10 minute walks to the strip - what a load of rubbish! Something I have not seen mentioned but I thought was amoung the best was the drinks service on the casino floor, which was better than anywhere else I have been. Did not get to as many restuarants in the complex as I wouldhave liked but they all seemed nice and busy enough to suggest they would have been a decent choice. I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: First trip to Vegas! Aria is a modern hotel with friendly staff and in a great location. They allowed early check-in and late check-out, great selection of restaurants, and next door to Crystals. The rooms are beautiful with comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 a Star, but nice.”
Reviews.Author: Ollie Z
Reviews.Content: I believe the Aria is now the largest hotel in LV if you go by the number of rooms. This may be why they have a bit of a hard time keeping up the service levels to truly call themselves a 5 star/diamond hotel. Here are some of the areas where they fall short: I stayed here for a week and found myself calling more then once for things like getting my room cleaned or having the batteries in the TV remote changed or even having the in room safe unlocked after the prior guest had left. A five star hotel typically also has name brand shampoos and lotions in the bathroom, The Aria instead chose to go with generic private labeled stuff. A five star hotel makes sure that all of their staff from the valet to the guy at the gym check -in are friendly and helpful. We encountered several people who were less then this when asked for simple questions regarding directions or program options. Also the bed was a bit too soft for my preference. What I did like about the place was the many dining options on site, although if you are a foodie avoid the Buffet. While the food is plentiful, the taste and quality is less than what you can find at the Bellagio Buffet The building's Green status with LEED Gold certification should be commended especially in a place as full of waste and excess as Las Vegas. Overall I think you can do better for a 5 star experience at the Bellagio, Wynn, Encore or Cosmopolitan.

Reviews.Title: “Continued Improvement”
Reviews.Author: MortyCanada
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Aria several times, with the first stay not long after the hotel had opened. We received a comped room for three nights, free show tickets and a $100 dining credit. A good deal for a couple of consistent low-wager, but consistently losing, gamblers. A request for a room near the elevator had been recorded, and honored with the assigned room only a few steps from the elevator Luggage was collected by the bellman from the taxi. The check-in was painless, with no one waiting at the 'invited guest' desk. Luggage arrived at the room within a reasonable time after placing the call. The electron controls for most aspects of the room is, even for these returning guests, a bit confusing at first. The room was clean and prepared nicely for new guests. The bathroom, with a small room for the stool, two sinks and seperate, but joined, tub and shower is very nice and functional. We found the towels to be rough and not very soft. The bed and other furnishings were in excellent condition, and the arrangement and furnishings are very functional. We noticed a major improvment in the services provided by hotel employess, with the exception of a couple of grumpy dealers.

Reviews.Title: “7 days in "Dreamland" !”
Reviews.Author: Markyboy1
Reviews.Content: Spent seven days at the Aria,at beginning of November (courtesy of my son & daughter-in-law, for 40th wedding anniversary). A huge complex containing (of course) rows & rows of gaming machines & roulette/card playing desks. Also, many restaurants and bars - as well as an adjoining shopping arcade (all expensive designer brands!). There are also 3 outside swimming pools with surrounding sun bathing areas & plenty of sun beds.The hotel is located right in the middle of the Strip with outside bars & shops within easy walking distance. Unlike many of the Vagas hotels, there is no theme... just a vast , plush hotel & complex. Bedrooms are spacious & fitted with all mod cons and free to use safes. You have a vast selection of food choice in the numerous restaurants within the hotel complex but they are expensive - as are the drinks. However, there are many nearby restaurants & bars with good choice of food at much more reasonable prices. ( Don't forget the waiters expect at least a 10% tip!).Also, within walking distance are several "themed" hotels -some of which have regular shows like the MGM where Rod Stewart was performing and plenty of others within walking distance. By the way, the flight ( by Virgin) was about 10 & 3/4 hrs going out & 10hrs returning to Gatwick.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay, Enjoyed "The Buffet"”
Reviews.Author: GodLovesYou
Reviews.Content: Lovely, modern hotel and good buffet. We have also stayed at the Palazzo, Venetian, and Bellagio. Good: - Location: Aria is next door to Crystals upscale shopping center (Tiffany, Louis Vuittan, Cartier, etc), in fact we walked through the mall to get to the Aria. It is also next to the Mandarin with Monte Carlo, and then New York, New York to the right. to the left is Veer Towers, Vdara, Harmon, then Cosmopolitan, Bellagio and Caesar's Palace. We walked to New York, New York and also Caesar's Palace. - Room was high tech with the TV doubling as a command center to open/close curtains, dim the lights. When we first walked, the curtains opened! We had a room with a view of the strip, Planet Hollywood and the pool at hotel next door. The windows were about floor to ceiling. Bed was very comfortable. Two chairs and a desk. There really wasn't a chair that you would want to curl up in and read a book though. Mini-bar with some items displayed on top as well. Don't pick them up and look since they are on a pressure sensitive platform. - Double closets with chest of draws between them. Nice, thick bathrobes. - Bathroom had a double basin sink and to the right was a large glass shower with tub behind that. Toilet was behind a glass door. The Aria toiletries were nice quality, less bad chemicals like SLS in other hotels but they did not have much smell. You can buy bigger versions at the gift shop. I should have bought some on Wed when it was really cheap because on Thursday, it was will on sale but for for a few dollars more. - Cupcake bakery was good. I got the Red Velvet and Creme de Menthe cupcakes. - Large pools and big, big drinks you can buy, like 32 oz. We got a mojito to split and it lasted us several hours. It was good but the big drinks were not very strong. We didn't get much of a buzz, but it was nice to have something cold and wet. - Julian Serrano tapas restaurant - so many things to choose from! We enjoyed our tapas. I tried the absinthe drink which was a dark green liquid dripped over a sugar cube. I did it for the novelty and to try something that used to be illegal but also enjoyed by Fitzgerald, Hemmingway, and other famous writers. It was a good value for the money in terms of getting a buzz if you could stomach the taste. It had a strong, burney alcohol, green taste - definitely a sipping drink. My husband said, "it was the worst thing I have tasted in my life!" with the appropriate expression to match. - "The Buffet" was really good and a good value. I thought the food was higher quality than at Paris, Paris, and it was very considerate that the cold Alaskan crab legs came split. Several meat choices (roast beef, chicken, fish, hamburgers, shrimp and some carving stations), fresh Indian naan bread, side dishes, and many delicious small desserts and cookies and gelato. We ate three lunches at "The Buffet." As a tip to you, I would suggest going for the late breakfast so your time overlaps with the lunch time, so you can eat for the lower breakfast price and then still get the lunch hot meal items. We timed it right although we had to wait in line to get in. Not so Good: - Funny, upscale subtle perfumey/expensive talcun powder smell at the Crystal mall and in the Aria. If you are chemically sensitive, this might not be a good place for you. I did notice it but fortunately, it didn't make my eyes water or cough. - It look a good 30-45 minutes to check-in. On the Wednesday, there were only 3 or 4 people in each of the several lines. It took an abnormally long time for the people ahead of us to be processed in and for the couple to the left of us. The front desk clerk stood there staring down at the monitor and I was watching to see if they fell asleep or not. For us, I had my credit card out and other than the short delay for them to find us a room, it didn't take as long for us to get checked in. - The Casino was done in dark browns, so as some reviews have said, it is like being in a cave or at least a modern one. - The Buffet service - it can take a while to get your first drink from your server. The first time, we were mid-way on our 2nd plate of food before someone finally came by. Pretty much, you can bet on no drink refills or a long wait for your refill unless the server brings you two drinks at once. Tip: You may want to ask for two drinks at once if you like to drink a lot with your meal. We were able to get coffee once for dessert but even then it took quite a while. It can also vary on how long your dirty plates stay on your table. Some of the wait staff are more attentive then others. We were there on a Wed and Thursday, so we were not even in the weekend crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Aria”
Reviews.Author: rob255314
Reviews.Content: First trip to Vegas, wary of reported delays in booking in, not so arrived 12.30am, only couple checking in, extremely helpful staff, when we arrived at our room on the 17th floor we were greeted by modern technology with everything operating by remote control, amazing.We both fell in love with the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in, wonderful views from room which was immaculately clean, bathroom well appointed with great amenities.We enjoyed dining at the Julian Serrano and Lemongrass restaurants and breakfast cafe and buffet were great.Location at end of strip no problem with City Centre free monorail from nearby Monte Carlo and general monorail operating from MGM. Technology in refrigerator a bit tricky, if you lift something out and then return it you will be charged even if you do not consume it, no problem when explained to staff.All in all a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “would return”
Reviews.Author: lelmax
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews to date . We booked our trip as a package throught allegiant (room and air) so upon checkin we were shocked at having to pay an additional $20 a day resort fee which came to $80 plus taxes- We were not impressed , and complained, however they would not budge. They said it was for wifi and fitness center-and we said we had no interest in using either- she said it didn't matter it was compulsory. We had not been informed of this. Drinks in casino for players basically non-existent. Rooms are lovely but ask for one closer to elevator. We had their buffet and would recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Best value I've ever gotten from a hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaineyBlu
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference, and wanted to have some fun luxury days on the Strip beforehand. I saved up for months, and got a deal through a Vegas travel website for the Aria, which looked really nice from their website. I got a good price on a corner suite. I decided to share my room with a friend, and when I added her to the booking and asked for a rollaway bed, I asked about an upgrade to a larger room. They said an upgrade to the level of suite just above a corner suite was not available, so they gave me one level above that, for only the additional charge of what the unavailable suite would have cost on top of the regular price for the corner suite, not my lower special price. Basically, I got the suite two levels up for barely more than the normal corner suite price. When we arrived, they said the room wasn't ready, and we could wait 15 minutes for cleaning, or take an upgrade. I asked how much, and they said no charge. We ended up with a MASSIVE suite, with a nice bedroom, huge master bath, giant shower, huge jacuzzi tub, kitchen with a sink and mini fridge, dining room, nice living room, big flat screen TVs in nearly every room (4 total, including the master bath), and another small bathroom. The decor was sleek, modern, and everything was clean and stylish. Everything in the room was high-tech, including the toilet. You could control lights, temperature, curtains, music, and TV in any room with the TV remote or light switches in any other room or the control panel by the bed, and set all those things to activate as an alarm clock in the morning. The only downsides were that the sink in the wet bar/kitchen area didn't work, and the toilet bubbled alarmingly at random times. Huge, loud bubbles would suddenly start coming up in the toilet for no reason. The staff assured us that this was due to maintenance and would be fixed on a certain day, but it did not stop on that day. I suspect that like most Vegas hotels, constructions was slap-dash in order to make a quick buck, and that there are just flaws in the way it was built. Also, the light switches were way too complicated and we never quite figured them out. We were constantly closing curtains in the next room when we wanted to turn a light on in the one we were in. All the technology was cool, but when you need instructions for light switches, it's a bit much. The air conditioner worked a little too well, and despite being there in summer, we kept having to turn the thermostat up to stop the air from coming on and freezing us. The restaurants were pricey, and just OK. We got tickets to Cirque du Soleil's Ka, which was excellent, through the concierge desk, and they seem to have given us a big discount because of the plumbing problems. Staff was always extremely polite and helpful. The M club was an excellent deal and better than any other players' club we looked into or had used recently. The location in City Center was gorgeous and felt much nicer than the gaudy Strip, but it was right there in the middle of everything where we could just walk right to any Strip location we wanted. Pool area was absolutely beautiful, with several pools and nice private areas where you could get away from all the people. I love this hotel, and will stay again if I can ever afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room! Would definitely go back. Security staff are awful though.”
Reviews.Author: 182Sophie
Reviews.Content: I have so many good things to say about this hotel. The waterfall feature out the front is really pretty, especially how the water falls in "waves". The check in and check out was fast and the staff are really nice. The room was incredible! It was a corner suite. The bed was so soft, apparently they are custom made for the Aria. We'd just come from this terrible apartment in New York where we had to sleep on a little futon, so getting to lie on this enormous, pillowy bed was just amazing. We had a separate living area with comfy couches and a huge TV. There was no view though, really. Out the bathroom window you could see the monorail track, and out the bedroom and living area windows you could see down onto the roof and the front of the hotel. Wasn't a big issue to me as I've been to Vegas before. The bathroom was out of this world! The toilet doubled as a bidet and it had a heated seat - no joke. The shower was huge and the bathtub was really big too and had built in spa jets. I ended up having a bath every day because it was so nice. There's a restaurant near the lobby with these weird greenish glass cones at the entry. The breakfast there was delicious. The only bad thing I have to say about this hotel was the security staff. I accidentally left my pajamas in the bed and the cleaning staff must have picked them up with the sheets. I called housekeeping and they were really apologetic about it and said that they would get Security to call me so I could put in like a stolen goods report. I told them this wasn't necessary and it was obviously just a mistake, but they insisted. Someone from Security called and asked if they could come to the room the next morning at 9. We waited til 10am, and no one showed up. I called the front desk and they said that in fact I didn't need to talk to Security, I could just put in a lost and found report, and they would get someone to call me about it. The woman who did call me was so rude. She kept saying I needed to put in a stolen goods report, and I kept saying I had been told I didn't need to. Then she said someone would have to come to the room to take a lost and found report, and I said "but isn't that what you are calling me for?" Then there was just silence on the phone. I asked for her name and she got really nasty then. Turns out she was actually from Security. So I have no idea what was going on. She took down some of my details and told me that I needed to call the hotel in a few days to see if they found my pajamas. I asked then why she was taking my details, because wouldn't they call me if they found them? She started yelling at me, saying really slowly and loudly that the laundry was done off site (well, of course I knew that) and I would have to call back. Oh my goodness...don't lose anything in this hotel, you don't want to have to deal with these people. Needless to say I never saw my pajamas again. Upsetting because they were from Victoria's secret and the shipping costs more than the clothes they sell to be sent to where I live.

Reviews.Title: “The New Best Western”
Reviews.Author: keh825
Reviews.Content: The Aria Hotel and Casio is a nice property with all the modern amenities you would come to expect from a hotel on the the Vegas Strip. On that note there is nothing that sets this apart from the competition. And really nothing. At its current rate it will be no better then the Hooters Hotel in 10 years. The staff were very accommodating... although the check - in process was very slow for our group of about 30 ... over half an hour just to check- in . Nice visually and the public art collection is not to be missed. Skip Jean Gorges Steakhouse.. food was over prices and the service was inexcusably bad.

Reviews.Title: “No need to have worried..........”
Reviews.Author: Freder445
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit to Las Vegas over the last 7 years having stayed in the Excaliber and Bellagio previously. This was an extra special visit as I had arranged to take my parents for a suprise celebration of their 40th anniversary. A number of the TA reviews had worried me although the comms I had before with their guest relations over requests I had made over my parents room reassured me somewhat esp as we were staying for 7 nights. The last time I was in Vegas was 3 years ago where I stayed in the Bellagio and along with the Cosmetpolian, Adara etc were new additions to the Strip. First impressions: super modern and the rooms where better than anywhere else I had stayed in espcially with all the high tech gadgetary. Unfortunately and despite a number of comms with them about being next or near to my parents rooms, they put us opposite ends of the hotel albeit on the same floor. This wouldnt have normally been a major problem but as the hotel is so big it took 10 mins to get to each others room. When I said that I wasnt happy to the check-in staff member - they asked me to come back in the morning to get a closer room. When I went back in the morning - they asked me to come back after 11am. As I was getting frustrated, I asked my wife to sort and she rang the manager who took 5 mins to confirm the next door room would be available in 2 hours (this is the reason for giving them a 4) as they clearly dont have any proper system to ensure special requests as properly actioned. Personally, I really liked the location of the Aria and whilst it is slightly set back from the strip in comparison to the Bellagio for example - I think it would be harder to get a better location (within the best part of the strip). The casino area was spacious and modern although to be honest they are all very similar (esp the newer ones with part marbled floor as opposed to purely being all carpeted which I think look more dated). The only aspect which I think could be improved was the Crystals Shopping Centre which was linked and adjacent to the Aria. I can understand why they have put all top end boutiques and jewellers there but it didnt help to make a particularly good atmosphere due mainly to the lack of shoppers. We preferred the amphoshere across the road in the Planet Hollywood Shopping mile precinct and could at least afford to buy a few bits and pieces!! In summary - as we did wanted to stay somewhere we hadnt previously been to (Bellagio for me and my wife and the Venitian for my parents) it was perfect. Would fully recommend the Aria especially if you like super modern rooms and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Aria!”
Reviews.Author: DNiemeyer
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 12th anniversary at Aria this summer. When calling to confirm the reservation we booked through their website, the operator asked if we were coming to Las Vegas for any special reason and I told her it was our anniversary. She said, “ok, you will have a nice surprise from us!” I didn’t think anything would actually come of it, but on our first night, they delivered a tray of chocolate covered strawberries and macaroons to the room with a nice card wishing us a happy anniversary. Nice, personal touch! I wish check-in could have been faster, but once it was finally our turn, we had our room key and were on our way to the room within 5 minutes. Even after dealing with at least two disgruntled customers immediately before us (who didn’t have reservations and had declined credit cards) the clerk who checked us in was still very friendly to us. Our room was right around the corner from the elevator so it was not a long walk to the room. It was very quiet in the room. I never heard anyone in nearby rooms or in the hallways. The room is amazing! We love the modern feel and the technology in the room. We did not find it difficult to operate in the least. (there were light switches on the wall for those who are technologically challenged….) The bathroom was very clean and I liked the interesting configuration of the shower/soaking tub. The bed is so very comfortable! The view was AWESOME! We would sit in the chairs and have a drink while admiring the view before hitting the strip each evening. My only complaint was that cocktail service was slow and spotty in the casino. The first day when we arrived it was not time to check in so we left our bags at the bell desk and sat at a video poker machine. After sitting for 20 minutes, we still had not seen a waitress and had already blown through 20 dollars. This became a consistent theme when playing at their casino. Sometimes a waitress would come by and other times we would not see any. Lemongrass is a GREAT restaurant (separate review) and the only one on the property that we visited. The coffee shop makes great macchiatos! Pool area is really pretty, but it was quite windy the day we went to the pool, so we didn’t stay long. The fitness area is nice! I would gladly return to Aria!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice.”
Reviews.Author: lpucker
Reviews.Content: The location is in City Center which is a little off the strip. The rooms are very nice with remote control for everything including opening the drapes. The accommodations are quite luxurious and I would have given the best rating if the walk to our room was not so far. It seemed like we had to walk for 10 minutes to get to our room, then another 10 minutes to get to the pool area. Overall though a very nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot at the city center....”
Reviews.Author: welovelasvegas
Reviews.Content: first time at the Aria, and we enjoyed ourselves immensely. The rooms are spacious, beds super comfy, the modern technology in the room takes a bit of time to navigate, but we did so quickly and liked the convenience. Easy Check in, check out. We did not have so great of a view -but no worries. we didnt really care. the rooms are clean, the bathrooms have plenty of room as well as the closets/drawers. easy walk to the strip- or monte carlo and the tram is wonderful to get around......overall, great spot, . only complaints...... when i normally pay for the resort tax in vegas, i dont mind too much because i then use the spa-and steam room, this place keeps the steam room and other stuff in the spa- which you have to pay to use per day, the free included stuff- the gym-daily paper that you have to go and get-internet in room (i go away to get away from this stuff, so i dont use it) so the 20$ a day resort tax is a waste of money in my opinion. also- we gambled a little bit in the slots and the waittresses NEVER came around in the hour we were there. so we then went to play the video poker at the bar (always something we like to do- to watch the sports on tv, get to know the bartender, and the drink service is excellent.) well, while we were at the bar, there were about 5 waittresses just hanging out and gossiping in there. perhaps that is what the casino wants them to do?? dont know, but frustrating none the less. we think we will try Aria one more time, but maybe just stay there, and eat and drink and gamble elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: charlierdu
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Las Vegas for a week-long business event. We stayed at the Aria and had a terrific overall experience. The Resort is quite new. The rooms and common areas reflect this nicely. The rooms are contemporary in style. Many items in the room were controlled electronically including the curtains, lights, etc. Everything worked very well. The bathroom was very nice -- well appointed, good amenities, etc. The television serves as a sort of information hub with everything controlled through the remote control. The hotel has a beautiful fitness center with plenty of equipment and room to workout. The pool and spa areas were great. There are a number of bars and restaurants to choose from throughout the Resort. The ice cream and sweet options made it challenging to walk through the common areas without grabbing something. I can highly recommend the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back already!”
Reviews.Author: BKHKGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at ARIA for 3 nights for a business trip. The conference was at the Bellagio but it's very easy to get there via the tram that runs next door at Crystals. I absolutely love the hotel! It's sleek and well-kept. Enjoyed my overall stay - from the check-in process to the automatic opening of blinds upon arrival in your room to the friendly service at the concierge. Plus: free wifi throughout the resort, excellent treats at Jean Philippe Patisserie & wide range of slot machines. Minus: plain toiletries and not enough light in the room. Would I come back? YES I want to return next week.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed by the Hotel, Housekeeping must be improved”
Reviews.Author: Gunc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Aria btw 6-8 November with our 11 month old boy. We are very impressed by the hotel. The check-in was very nice, and they provide our additional requests for our infant timely. (no fee for infant crib - but we had to pay 30 USD for a kettle to provide hot water for infant formula, so our baby had the most expensive formula ever:)) The rooms are clean and very new. The panel system is very cool but sometimes confusing.. Bathroom is excellent. Overall we are happy with the hotel. It would be rated 5 if they had not forget to clean our room. We were out all day and housekeeping did not clean our room, at around 2pm we went to our room and saw that our room had not cleaned. We left the room at 4pm and request our room to be cleaned from the staff on the corridor, but they did not clean our room. We went to room again at 7pm, and the room had not been serviced. We intentionally turn on the "please service room" light on until 9pm and nobody showed up. The next morning we checked out and informed the reception about the issue and they asked if we called the front dest for housekeeping. I think I do not need to call the front dest for this primary service. So, very nice 5 star hotel but no cleaning for 2 days in not acceptible.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel right on the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: My_Travel_Book
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aria for a night in early Nov 2011. We wanted to experience a new hotel on the Strip. The hotel was just great. The rooms were amazing. The bed was very comfortable. The casino below is very huge. The location is just superb right within the center of the Las Vegas Blvd. The only comment that I would have is just the long walking distance from the parking lot to the hotel lobby. But this is the norm for such big hotels in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: meh2424
Reviews.Content: If I am paying 300 bucks a night it is pretty much what I would expect. Room was larger than normal rooms, modern, nice, clean. Bed was comfortable. I was mesmerized by the views outside my window. But the concierge service was what made this hotel standout. The concierge fees are built into the daily resort fee so use them! They handled all my requests in a timely, knowledgeable and friendly manner. We asked about restaurants, shows, they even printed our boarding passes. Location- be aware that this is set off the strip just a tad. It is located right next in line from the Ballagio, Caesars and Cosmopolitan. This is in the heart of the strip near all high end Vegas hotels and the Aria fits in their category although maybe a little less "buzz" at the Aria when we walked the strip on Saturday night. Restaurants- Jean Phillipe Pattiserie should not be missed. Grab a coffee and a pastry. We also hit the Tapas place and was good. Right next to the hotel connected to the mall is a place called Todd English Pub. Excellent beer selection and good bar type food (and raw bar). Good vibe in there too. Go early and get the 10.00 beers at half price (ha! its vegas everything is expensive). I would give it 5 stars but cant due to the hotel bars and nightlife. I did not see a bar in the Aria that looked like drinks didn't cost 15 bucks apiece. And they are all on the casino level and look like they cater to the gamblers (we were not there to gamble). And the nightlife, there are 2 clubs - but you get the typical Vegas huckle buck when trying to get in the door. The bouncer wanted to charge us 30 bucks cover charge. As other "younger" folks were getting in no problem. We are in our mid 30's so not our game... we just laughed it off and and made our way to Fremont Street, more our speed, and HAD A GREAT TIME.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Boidster
Reviews.Content: The ARIA Resort & Casino is the anchor and flagship hotel of MGM's City Center development on the Las Vegas strip. As such, it is a top-notch hotel, with interesting, modern architecture both inside and out, well-furnished and comfortable rooms, a variety of dining options, and of course a full casino. Right next door is The Crystals shopping center (bring the platinum card; it's more Gucci than GAP) and the Mandarin, Vdara, and Bellagio are all a tram ride away. We stayed in a Corner Suite and it was, in our opinion, a decent value. (Prices have gone up since our stay, however, and if having a casino on the first floor is not a requirement, the Vdara might be a better value.) Beds were comfortable, the room was quiet (being at the end of the hall helps), and the electronic room control was kind of neat. Food and drink are good, but expensive. The Tapas place was probably the least-impressive; we would not eat there again. There is an Italian restaurant on the floor above the lobby that was quite good. The gaming floor is less bright and garish than some other casinos, which we appreciated. Gaming limits were high, as you would expect for a 5-star hotel. You can get to several other casinos via tram or short indoor walks, to find cheaper tables. This year we're staying at Vdara, since their Corner Suite is significantly cheaper right now than ARIA's, but appears to be of the same quality. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at ARIA again, however. It was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A poor experience in a strange hotel that has lost the plot!”
Reviews.Author: davepat77
Reviews.Content: This hotel /casino is blighted by poor reception and concierge service. We - my business partner and I attending devlearn booked 2 single rooms and waited 20 minutes to check in, and where then allocated 1 room, despite our paperwork clearly showing we had arranged 2 rooms, this then took another 10 minutes to sort out, and after 20 hours travelling was not good. Getting Concierge to check us in and print boarding passes for our return flight journey was equally frustrating, - not able to print boarding passes, though we were assured by concierge we were checked in on our flight - we were not! You really need to check what they are doing carefully as competence is in short supply. Overall this is an odd hotel - from the aroma to the layout, which is all very disorientating indeed. You have to drag your luggage through a casino to find the lifts on arrival, and the darkness and poor signage means it is very easy to get lost! (take a right at a roulette table I think). I would sum up the layout and style as an expensive mess, totally in-coherant in style and ambience, I realise hotels in Vegas are over the top and seek to differentiate themselves, but whoever designed this one inside really lost the plot as differentiation equals disorientation in my view. The rooms are OK, well equipped if the stuff works - you are rather dependant upon the TV controller (which in my colleagues case did not work) - so bring your own batteries, the light switches are temperamental and take some getting used to, and the plastic surrounds have a habit of falling off! Room service is OK but it seems that you can return to your room at 4.30 and it still has not been serviced. Beware of the fridge full of goodies.... a kettle to make a tea or coffee would be of much more use. Food in the buffet is very good indeed and the staff very helpful indeed. Other restaurants tend to be very expensive. I had a walk in a few other hotels and would say they were much better in layout and ambience, - especially the Bellagio - it had gardens and a coherent style. Do visit to see how not to design a hotel for guests and the Elvis how which is very good, as is the Elvis shop - the staff there were super!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: injustifiiable
Reviews.Content: After reading so many mixed reviews, I was a little hesitant about staying at Aria. I figured I'd give it a shot after getting a room offer from the m-life Player's Club. After staying in 2 other hotels over three days, this was the one I was looking forward to the most. Check in on a Saturday morning was busy, yet it all went very smoothly. They had enough lines open and clerks working, which is always a good thing. I was totally wowed after entering room 31-131. The curtains open, the TV turns on to some music, and the lighting comes up. The room had a view of the back of the CityCenter campus and Vdara. For a standard room, it's VERY roomy. I believe it's around 520 square feet of goodness. The bathroom area was equally as rich, with a BIG shower and tub (they are not combined, but located behind the same door), his and her sinks, and separate toilet area. I love technology, so Control 4 was definitely a treat. You can literally control everything - the TV, curtains, lighting, temperature, making service requests, and even the Do Not Disturb sign - from the television as well as a small tablet located on the bedside table. Loved the Wake Up scheme, which opens the curtains and turns on the TV at whatever time you set in the morning. I also enjoyed the turndown service at night, since that big bed has a lot of comfortable pillows!! My offer came with a comped buffet, so I went there for Sunday Brunch. I enjoyed it a lot, and would certainly go back. Service around the resort was top-notch. Everyone was very attentive and friendly, from the housekeepers, valet people, bartenders, Front Desk staff. CityCenter is massive and it WILL take a while to get your bearings, but once you do, it'll be easy to get on and off the Strip. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Dawnyj47
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Aria for 7 nights in May 2011. We simply could not fault this hotel. Everything was perfect, check in was smooth, room was amazing, facilites & location were excellent. We had breakfast in the Aria and it was simply delicious. We would highly recommend this hotel. We loved it so much we have booked again for December!!!

Reviews.Title: “High quality accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Steamer27
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria after a disappointing stay at Planet Hollywood. The rooms are excellent with everything from the TV to the curtains to the lights controlled by remote. Nice view of the Vegas skyline. Hotel is set back from the strip and pretty spread out so this is not a good spot if you don't or can't do a lot of walking. The Aria was quite pricey as were all the restaurant on site. Overall - a very nice hotel with a speedy check in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, freindly and good location.”
Reviews.Author: GraceDanielle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria from 20 Oct to 24th Oct. to celebrate a big birthday, with girlfriend and daughters. Rooms are great ceiling to floor windows, electronic curtains were a novelty. Beds were really comfortable soft and loads of pillows. Bathroom, really good shower, only down fall the tiled floor was dangerous but the size made up for it. Bathrobe supplied but no slippers or shower cap! The buffet breakfast was good, marvellous choice so no one could complain and Sunday brunch was amazing, huge prawns and crab legs we loved it along with sparkling wine we spent about 3 hours that morning. We found the foyer light and airy, the choice of restaurants good, the tapas was great. Only negative was the pool closes at 6.00, we would have liked a chance to sit round the pool before we started our nights out. Location not exactly on the strip but close enough, also you can get a free monorail to Caesers Palace and the Cosmopolitan. Right next to a shopping mall (but very expensive shops all designer) Cab to shopping outlet was only 10mins and cost about $15. All staff seemed very friendly and the organisation when arriving departing is great no hastle just as you would expect. Would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Aria - 10/30 - 11/1/11”
Reviews.Author: SF2UK
Reviews.Content: As others have noted...a clean and modern hotel. Was warned by some friends about the difficulty in using the control panel...but overall found it fairly easy to figure out. Some of the lighting controls I didn't quite understand...but it's not like I wanted to sit in the room and figure it out as it really wasn't that important. Bed was huge and super soft...which was great for me...but could see how it might be too soft for others. Mostly had the experience that we were expecting for the 2 days. We never left the property for the entire time w...as we were there simply to relax and get a few sun-rays before heading back to the London grey skies. The only reason I'm not giving it a 5 star is that they seemed to be running at minimum staffing. Although check in went pretty quickly, we waiting about 30 mins for the bell hop to bring up our bags, and it took about 1 1/2 hours for room service on a Sunday night. The guy on the phone did say in advance that they running close to an hour...so we were warned...but still think that's a bit too long to receive service (we ordered a small pizza, some asparagus and a beer and glass of wine). That being said...when room service did come...he was very attentive, courteous and service was what should be expected from a 5-star hotel. Additionally, the bell hops were extremely courteous and helpful. Dining prices were expensive...but on par with comparable places on the strip and Vegas as a whole. Pool was nice and relaxing...which probably was due to the time of year and time of week. Overall, it was a nice stay and if you did want to leave the hotel and experience the rest of the strip...the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: jenny433
Reviews.Content: I've been to LV 6 times and stayed at many different hotels. The ARIA was a very nice hotel and probably my 2nd or 3rd favorite so far... it's very modern and it smells really good (most of the nicer hotels pump some sort of "smell" into the casino and lobby). We arrived around 7:30 AM and were able to check in and get a room --- a BIG plus considering that normal check-in time is 3 PM. Our room was on the 17th floor and was great, clean. We had booked on Priceline so I was a bit worried. The screen to control the curtains, lights, music, and temperature was a bit "touchy" at times and it didn't work for the temperature of the room but no big deal -- still a very cool feature. Opening the curtains with the alarm in the morning is super cool -- I wish I had that at home! The beds were oh so comfy and super soft. I had two GREAT sleeps there. The room was pretty spacious as well and our city view was pretty. Basically one of the four walls is a window so it's very open. Our room was pretty far from the elevator so ask for one closer if that's important to you. The hotel is in a great location in the center of the strip. It's a bit of a walk to actually get to the strip (and that walk is a bit tricky) but that's true for most Vegas hotels. It was nice to be so close to the Bellagio too. The food is a bit pricy in the hotel but that's expected mostly everywhere in LV. I thought it a little weird that the hotel didn't offer turndown service as I thought this was standard for 5-star hotels... at least it has been at all of the ones I've stayed at. So that's really my only qualm.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Shangayle
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Aria after ten in the evening we had shuttle service from the airport, the driver dropped us at what appeared to be the back entrance and there was no staff there to help with luggage it was a long trek to reception desk and we were not too happy when we got there however check -in staff were very apologetic and couldnt have been more helpful very pleasant friendly workforce in this hotel.Rooms are lovely and cleaned daily the french pattisserie was divine if a little crowded at times restaurants very good lots to choose in buffet would definately visit the ARIA again . Would just like to add receptionist made us aware of the sensors in the mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA 10/31-11/3”
Reviews.Author: Ben M
Reviews.Content: Arrived the evening of 10/31 around 9pm. Of-course, what you would expect of a 5 star Las Vegas hotel; very beautiful exterior and interior. Check-in was simple and easy, and arrived to the room short after. The lady at the front desk however was quite vague as to explaining the hotel itself. For the price this hotel charges, I expect excellent customer service. Not saying I have to get treated like royalty, however at least make me feel welcome, if I wanted mediocre, I would stay somewhere along the lines of a 3 star hotel or a less-expensive resort such as Luxor or Flamingo. The room was very nice, with great linens, bathroom accessories, and entertainment. But keep it clean; housekeeping failed to show up the next day and we had to complain to the front desk for their lack of "luxury." When it came time to check out (11am on Thursday) I asked if we could go ahead and check-out, then go have lunch at the buffet and use our 75$ hotel credit and apply it to our account. Knowing that the hotels are capable of re-opening your room account for charges (since they love to take as much of your money as your willing to spend), they made it extremely difficult when it came time to use our credit for lunch. After speaking with the supervisor, we eventually got what we asked for and went about our ways. The concierge was unable to complete our early check-in to our flight home (which is supposed to be included in your "resort fee", so we had to wait till we got to the airport to do so. Overall I would rate this hotel a 2 of 5, due to what expectations should be, and what you receive. Honestly I would not pay to stay here again, and would recommend staying at the Venetian if your wanting to pay the price you would to stay at Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but uncomfortable sleep”
Reviews.Author: goony51
Reviews.Content: Modern and clean newish hotel.Few minute walk to the strip so should be listed as an off the strip hotel. Good choice of restaurants. Mattress was very soft which some people may like but I found it to be too soft for my liking and had a sore back after a few days, this was enough of a problem that I would not return there when there are so many other hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Aria”
Reviews.Author: Verity E
Reviews.Content: The quality of the room was excellent, the location is superb. Customer service was generally good. We did, however, have a poor experience. Having booked a site seeing trip to the Grand Canyon which was not cheap. The concierge asked us if we required a wake-up call. We said yes and didn't set an alarm. No wake-up call. Luckily we woke up in time. On complaining there was no apologies and nobody seemed prepared to accept responsibility. If we had missed the trip there would have been no refunds, we would have lost a not inconsiderable amount of money due to the hotels oversight. Apart from this we would recommend the Aria as a hotel to stay in on any trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Weaver37
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel...We had a great time...I must admit it was very expensive to eat at the hotel.We ate elsewhere. The rooms were beautiful clean and make sure you do not eat any of the snacks or drinks in the room there is a sensor that will detect which item was picked up and you will be charged. I had a fabulous time please go have a great time. I am not a gambler but my husband won something.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful time we had at aria”
Reviews.Author: cherylr r
Reviews.Content: my husband and i arrived in late august after a long trip from australia, when we arrived at the hotel after travelling 17 hours, we were treated with efficency and kindness......everyone was soooo helpful, and we were made 2 feel so welcome. the room we were given was beyond our expecations, beds very comfortable, and the bathroom amenities 1st class...we fell into the beds, that r comfortable beyond belief................ the pillows 2 die 4, in fact i have ordered 4 2 take home with us. the staff were excptional, very friendly and helpful. food at the buffet was the best in las vegas, and very reasonably priced. again, nothing was 2 much trouble for the staff, they were friendly and courteous........and made us feel sooo comfortable. the pool areas are so modern and have food and drink available, as well as private cabanas that can be used 4 the day.............a lovely touch. the position is a 45 minute walk 2 the mirage, and when the weather is not 2 hot, it is a comfortable walk. would stay here again in a heart beat. cannot rave 2 highly about the staff, the concierge desk was wonderful 2.

Reviews.Title: “Backed up shower, mildew smell and BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: This place was praised highly by one of my co-workers, and so I decided to take the GF out to LV for a vacation and booked at the Aria. First impressions were good. The room was well-appointed and the buffet while not excellent, was good. The service, as a rule, was good throughout the entire facility. Friendly and informative. The nightmare begins when the lovely shower drain backs up. The water pools overnight and by the time morning rolls around the whole bathroom reeks of mildew smell. They sent a plumber up and he said that they couldn't do anything about it. The real nightmare began when my GF started showing bedbug bite marks very shortly after our departure (we stayed 2 nights). I thought I was in the clear until little welts started showing up on my body not long after her. We counted over 100 bites EACH.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Amazing”
Reviews.Author: kriss205
Reviews.Content: The Aria is beautiful. Beds are amazing. We were there for birthdays and our family back home had special requests delivered to our room- wine, choc. covered strawberries, etc. While there was some mix-up and delay, we finally got it and they did add a gorgeous fruit plate (however, not actually sure if there was extra charge -- if it came as substitution or compensation). Also, the gross cigarette ashes in the toilet when we first came in to the room was enough to ask for a different room. They responded quickly and nicely. Guests should know there is not coffee in the rooms. Restaurant and food shops in the hotel are great, though! We would return to the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “very modern and sleek”
Reviews.Author: jadebynikolai
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times. It has always been easy for me to check in and the rooms in the sky towers are fantastic! The beds are extremely comfortable!
