The bathroom nicely designed and always stocked. I love how everything is digital and can be programed to your needs from the tv, alarm to the curtains. Just a push of the button. The rooms are excellent!! The casino is a bit dark for me and the feng shui is not so positive. But it's a gamble either way when you gamble. Love the restaurants here! The buffet is excellent, all you can eat lobster and wine. Love the buffalo tomato salad shooters. Lemongrass also very delicious. Nice assortment of shops and small eateries. Jean Philippe Patisserie is excellent for coffee, sweets and the yummy flaky croissants. But you need to get the croissants early. They sell out quite quickly. The spa here is fantastic. Even when I am not staying at The Aria Resort, I come here to get all my treatments done at the Spa at Aria! A really wonderful spa to relax and enjoy! Highly recommended. There is also another private pool for the spa that is very nice to use. The pool for the hotel is wonderful. The service here is hit or miss. But for me I know Vegas very well so it did not bother me. Best bet is to ask the door man for assistance. They are extremely helpful. City Center is near by and also a fabulous place to visit and enjoy. Over all the location and the hotel is wonderful. No complaints and I have been back several times more.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drashba
Reviews.Content: Aria was a great hotel. Rooms were top of the line with amazing beds, the motorized shades were cool, all of the amenities’ you would expect from a top tier Vegas hotel. Front desk was great, the offered a city view upon request and were able to accommodate a late check out (6pm) for a small fee. Casino, pool, and restaurants were average. Nothing to complain about but nothing really wow’d me. Location is excellent located in the middle of the strip. I never made it there, but I heard from staff that the pool at Liquid, the pool club, was very dirty and they have seen some awful things happen in there. I would def stay at Aria again but I will not be swimming at Liquid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: K V
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. The location was ideal being on the strip. The rooms were very clean and staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: Chefvette
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at Aria. The facility is very sleek and modern. The gust rooms are clean and high tech. Everything is controlled by the TV. The AC, lights, curtains, everything! The fitness center is great! You can connect your ipod right to the machines. Table games are at the prices you would expect from a high end property but there is a good selection. They have a great selection of slot machines. Really the best selection I've ever seen. I like video slots and they have a ton. The movie themed ones are especially fun. Try the Ghostbusters and Star Wars machine. They are a blast, even if you lose. Drinks while you are playing are high end. Nice big solid rocks glass. They don't cheap out like other casinos. City center is a great property and I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: neilsellers
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a corner suite for a few more dollars and was well worth it. Lots more room and amenities. Beautiful hotel! Front desk staff not very personable but very accommodating. Beds were extremely comfortable. Overall a very good stay and would definitely stay here again. If I had to be picky, it would be that the rooms would get warm if the shades were left open and cell phone reception in the room was poor. The casino has very good ventilation and very little smoke. Lots of choice on slots and table games. Table minimum bets kind of steep and some of the table dealers looked uninterested in their jobs. Drink service was hit and miss. Pool area very nice. No trouble finding chairs to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! A Lot!”
Reviews.Author: jodcha
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! My husband and my in-laws love it too! This is one of the LEED Gold buildings of the City Centre, I feel it is important to choose a hotel that has sustainability awareness. Next time going back to Vegas, I will either book this or try the Vdara. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, and it smells sooooooooo good. I actually went to their shop and bought the scent stick that has the Aria smell. Service is superb. When I check in, I picked a line that the front desk person is in training. It is actually his third day of work, yet, I think he was doing amazing. It was a bit slow, but I am on vacation, I have no problem be in his line for a little wait to help him with his training! We called for service several times, and it all went well. They have Privacy and Service button as well. I think the last time I stayed at Trump, they have it too. I like them, you know you won’t be disturb by housekeeping in the morning when you are in Privacy mode and the Service mode make sure you get your housekeeping done! But if need any type of delivery or service, make sure Privacy is off, else they won’t even knock on your doors. I love their one click button in the room and it will turn off all lights and close your blinds before you leave, it saves electricity and lower the cooling energy use – very green and convenient! Their bed and pillows and bed sheets are like heaven! I want to take them all home! I LOVED them. I travel a lot. My best hotel is the Ritz @ Orlando. And I have to say Aria is now my 2nd favourite from all the hotels I have been @! If I have to point out bad things, here they are: - The Buffet isn’t that great for the price. - Check in / Check out line could be a bit messy, as they are all individual lines, and they are close together, it is hard to know which line you are lining for. It would be better if everyone all line up together and we can go to the next available counter. – but a lot of other hotels like Bellagio has individual lines too! - The in-room control panel touch screen isn’t sensitive enough (I know, it is not Apple product!), need a bit of patience to use it. - For one day, housekeeping change our towels that were NOT on the floor. And two days, housekeeping turned on our lights and did not switch off when they leave. I was expecting a Green hotel would do extra to make sure all department do their best to maintain the sustainability commitment. - It is a big hotel, and there is only one location for elevators (they are fast thou). So if you live near the end of the floors, it could be a long walk. - The Self park is quite a long walk – but it applies to ALL other Vegas hotel anyway…

Reviews.Title: “Great but is it really worth it???”
Reviews.Author: Localdj77
Reviews.Content: This hotl is great in every way but I'm just not sure it was worth over 300 a night. I see that you might be able to score it for 120 a night and that is for sure a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Oct. 28th - 29th”
Reviews.Author: tommyt1869
Reviews.Content: We checked in early, 2:00 p.m. on Friday and when we saw how many people were also checking in we worried, but there were lots of employees working the desk and also someone who would direct customers into a line. Our wait was no more than 6 or 7 minutes. We had a standard king non-smoking room. The decor of this hotel is awesome. From the floors to the celling you can tell there was a lot of attention to detail in how this hotel was decorated. You have to show your room key 24 hours a day to gain access to the guest elevators which I think is great. I also like that you just have to put you key in front of the lock to open the door. Very cool. The words I would use to describe the room are; clean, cool, modern and hip. When we first opened our door the drapes and sheers opened automatically and music started playing, now that's what I call wow factor. There are his and hers closets in the entry way along with a big four drawer dresser. The room itself is spacious with a desk, and mini bar area, bed, side tables, 2 chairs and a small side table. The bath had double vanities, and shower and tub area. You opened the glass door and there was the shower area and right behind it was the soaking tub, pretty cool set-up. The toilet area was also enclosed behind a frosted glass wall and door. You are able to control everything in the room either with a bed-side remote or through the television. I mean everything, drapes, sheers, all the lights in the room, TV, music, housekeeping, check-out. If you are a techie you will love this room. The only place we ate in the hotel was the buffet. We found the food to be very good and thought there was a good selection. We like the lay out of the casino, most of the slots are new and the touchscreens are great for accessing your player information. They also had $10 table games during the day and some $15 dollar tables at night and this was on the weekend. The sports book is on the small size but worked ok for me. Cocktail service was fine. I have had faster and I have had slower. The have 3 pools and 2 hot tubs which are accessed from the promenade level which is the second floor. Again, you must show your room key for access. I can't say enough about the service. We never passed an employee who did not greet us. We put the privacy light on and we were contacted by housekeeping and they told us that even though we requested privacy if at any time day or night we wished our room made up to just call. On another occasion we had stopped to ask an employee in the lobby for directions and rather than give the turn by turn directions, he took the time to walk us for about 3 minutes through the hotel to make sure we didn't get lost. My wife and I have stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas and we both agree that Aria could be our new home in Vegas. If Aria continues to give this level of attention to all its guests then this will be one of the premiere destinations on the strip for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Aria”
Reviews.Author: Lisa987_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aria in June for business so I wasn't at the hotel very often but I was blown away by the beauty of the hotel and the rooms! The rooms are huge and are quite upgraded--everything to the modern bathroom to the curtains opening as the morning alarm. Huge closet space, good views, and there are controls right beside the bed so you don't even need to get up to turn off any lights or lock any doors. Not too loud and good clientele staying at the hotel! I would definitely recommend Aria. The only down side to this hotel is the price of the restaurants, but it's Vegas so that is not out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Check In Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: tigbits
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at Aria was overall pretty good. The only complaint I would have is that they need to work on their front desk staff. There were 6 of us travelling together and when we checked in early morning we had asked that our rooms were on the same floor. The first person told us that wouldn't be a problem so after 45 minutes we walked away and waited for our text message to tell us our rooms were ready. We finally got the text, went to pick up our keys and were told that one room was located on the 17th floor, the second on the 29th floor and the third wasn't ready. After arguing for about 30 minutes they managed to get two rooms on the same floor and then promised us that the third room when it was ready would also be on the same floor. Again after the text was received that our room was ready we went to pick up the keys for the third room and were told that the room was on a totally different floor from the other two. Had to argue again with them and received no help what so ever. The manager was not very customer service oriented at all. The first time we asked to speak to the manager in the morning he didn't even bother to come over and see what the issue was. There was a different manager in the afternoon from the morning. We wouldn't have been so annoyed if we just hadn't been promised twice that we would be on the same floor. It was a very frsutrating start to our stay. I did however enjoy the rooms and the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Aria is central on the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: RMarieMpls
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Aria Resort and Casino because of its location, proximity to my favorite haunts on the Strip. The casino is smaller, which makes it easier to get from your room to the Boulevard. The rooms were comfortable. A little small, but the amazing bed, automatic curtains, and the nice bathroom compensated. I have never slept so well in a hotel. The linens were soft, the housekeeping prompt. It was semi-difficult to figure oput the little screen controls, but once I had everything programmed, it made life easier. I had free breakfast/lunch vouchers, but they were only valid until 11am, so I only made it once that week. The buffet was of average quality, with not a very diverse selection. The service in the buffet and the mimosas were wonderful. I would stay again. Pictures to come.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel but be aware of cost and size issues.”
Reviews.Author: cn1429
Reviews.Content: I visited in October 2011. I have stayed at Caesars, Harrahs, Rio, Ballys, Hilton, Wynn and Venetion and can report the room was very nice. Almost as nice as Wynn, almost. My situation is I was offered 3 nights comped to us for a previous visit of very minimal casino play, a welcomed opportunity. The 200.00 casino play is much to do about nothing. You have to use your money to get the slot working with the free play and it is difficult to keep up with the play during the process and at the end, won nothing plus the money I put in I lost. Study the instructions before you do it. Second the 50. food credit was certainly required. Minimal dinner (small steak and she had a pasta dish) in the cafe was $80.00 but less the 50. credit now its down to market value. 1 coffee, 1 OJ and 2 yogurt parfaits were 26.00 for breakfast. Ouch. On the other hand the buffet was close to 40 a person but hey it was WORTH it and the best! Lobster, crab and everything imaginable. Fantastic. The only downside in this hotel is for older folks be prepared to walk walk and walk. Another downside its a heck of a walk to any other casino. The place is borderline to big. My girlfriend says incredible; I say very nice. I doubt I would stay there if I had to pay full price for the room, it would easily be a thousand dollar weekend just for hotel and food.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Sharon R
Reviews.Content: This is one fine hotel / casino. We upgraded to a corner suite for a 7 night stay and what a great decision that was. The service was immaculate and the room was amazing. The casino was classy and perfect after a night of site seeing. The beds are very comfortable and the team at the concierge always assisted with thoughtful insite. It was my birthday and a lovely birthday note and chocolate dipped strawberries were delivered to our room. The little extras in this hotel ensure that your visit will be a special one.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and modern”
Reviews.Author: Aquae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria Oct 29-31 and loved it. My mom actually had 3 nights free from all the comp points she earned on the last trip from the casino! The casino goes on forever, the beds are the very best I've slept in (must be some sort of new memory foam??) Wow! Everything is controlled in the room from your little ipad-like alarm clock, and things turn on and open the drapes as you enter the room. It was all ultra modern and yet cozy in neutral colors with some greens and blues. The only downfall was that they didn't let me check in when I got there 8 hours before the rest of my group because I technically wasn't on the reservation. So, just make sure you put all of your group's names that will be in the room when you make the reservation! We ate a few restaurants in the hotel as well (I'll review those separately!) Awesome hotel, great service, though lost our money in the casino lol!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abgirl63
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times now. This has become our place to stay in Vegas. The rooms are beautiful, especially the corner suites. Floor to ceiling windows, modern decor. Remotes in each room that do almost everything for you, open curtains. Everywhere you go in this hotel the staff are very friendly. Large clean casino. Great restaurants. So much to do. A must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Aria Scores High”
Reviews.Author: ajay04_10
Reviews.Content: The Aria is an oasis of style in a desert of mediocre bling that is Vegas... the smartness is in direct contrast to the contrived tack of the themed biggies which seem to rule the roost there. Tourists flock in with conditioned notions of Venetians and Bellagios and New York New Yorks, but the Aria scores much higher in my book. The rooms are designed for comfort and convenience, the common areas are beautifully done, and the staff conduct proceedings with courtesy and an attitude to cater to your wishes. Dont miss the spa, which is a steal at the daily price, and will rejuvenate you. The restaurants provide food that is as well prepared as it is presented. (Try the banana cream pie). Location couldnt be better. A true relief from Vegas overkill !!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Classy and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Cormell
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Aria which is quickly becoming our new favorite resort in Las Vegas. Our first stay was right after it had opened and we didn't have a very good impression at that time, but we gave it another try in May of this year and were pleasantly surprised by how well the resort had come together. When we decided on another weekend in Vegas this past month we once again chose the Aria and were not disappointed. The Aria is an ultra modern glass and steel creation with exquisite and varying marble floors throughout. This does tend to give it an austere feel at times but mix in a casino, night life and your usual Las Vegas crowd and that quickly goes. The rooms are certainly one of my favorites on the strip, full of high tech toys and high quality fixtures. Everything in the room from lights to curtains to entertainment is controlled through a bedside tablet device along with the usual switches on the walls. This is both convenient and just fun if you like electronic gadgets. On the other hand I could see that getting to be a pain for some people. In addition to the cool controls there is a full blown A/V interface panel on the desk to the rooms TV and sound equipment including iPod dock / USB. Be sure to bring your own cables or you'll be stuck purchasing the cable kit in room for $50. The Aria features quite a few quality restaurants with prices in the mid to high range for dinner offering every kind of cuisine imaginable. The buffet as well is one of the best I've been to on the strip. On the down side prices are high and there are very limited options for quick or inexpensive food. At the Jean Philippe Patisserie a cup of coffee and a pastry will set you back $15. For those looking a better budget option, you can take a walk through the connected hallways into the Monte Carlo next door which has a food court similar to what you would find in any mall. For gambling experience, the Casino at the Aria is a solid choice. On each of our 3 visits we've found that the odds are good and that machines regularly pay out a reasonable amount of money to make your entertainment / gambling dollar go farther, which let's face it, is what it's all about. Lastly, I have to also recommend the new MGM players club "MLife" This is a much needed overhaul of the MGM club that still has a ways to go but their new tier system and features are certainly drawing us away from the now aging Ceasars / Harrahs club which we've been active participants in for the past 10 years. I would recommend in Las Vegas that you always join the players club where you are staying and use your card wherever you can. If you do your next trip will be discounted or even free depending on your spending habits.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: pragueresident
Reviews.Content: I was fortunately stuck in Vegas due to Irene and had to spend 4 extra days. So this gave me the opportunity to try this place for 2 days. I loved it. Did early check in with no hassle. Very friendly staff. The room was modern and had a very good view. Amenities were top notch. I spent most of my time at the pool. Its not as crowded as Venetian or Bellagio. There were ample free seats. Also the palm trees provided much needed shade in the August sun. Poolside service was good, not great. Other pluses were on site restaurants, good security. I will definitely stay there again. Highly recommended for singles, families as well for business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Attended a conference at this hotel - great food and convention center.”
Reviews.Author: girlcats
Reviews.Content: Although during a recent visit to Las Vegas for a conference, I did not stay at this hotel a number of my colleagues did, so I checked out the rooms and what I saw (and they agreed) the place is stunning. The views from both the 20th and 30th floor rooms are astounding. Rooms are beautifully appointed with everything from nice towels/amenities to automated drapery/tv/lighting. A friend referred to the rooms as the Starship Enterprise. Everyone said they got a pretty good nights sleep, save for the occasional noise generated by a wayward hotel guest having trouble finding their room, but having no trouble generating volume in doing so. That is to be expected in a hotel of this size. According to my friend who had the experience of the loud hotel guest, a quick call to the front desk expedited security to the hallway to escort the wayward hotel guest to their room. The hotel convention center was phenomenal! The rooms were well lit, clean (no nasty carpet stains), prejection systems were great, bathrooms were everywhere and large (mouthwash and hand lotion were stocked at the sinks), and the view from the common area was great. The food served was incredible. Of course every conference is a bit different but the kitchen/chefs are typically the same, so I'm pretty sure food service is great across the board. Breakfast, snacks, lunch, and dinner was impeccably presented and as good as a very nice restaurant. The staff for the convention center were polite and managed to herd wayward conference goers without being rude. Actually during the 4 days of the conference I attended I saw the same staff members time and again and they greeted me cordially. Given that it was a huge group I was impressed with the level of customer service. I hope next year I find myself at the same venue! I'll give up a few Marriott points next year in exchange for staying at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: WiMomof3
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Great location, fabulous service and food. The room was amazing with the remote controlled lights, curtains, TV, etc. I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “If you like Vegas, stay here”
Reviews.Author: Mantraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. The only things I didn't like about it are things that you would find anywhere in Vegas so I guess my issue is more with Vegas than with this hotel. For example: - I hate that you have to walk a mile from the elevator to your room, and the Aria is no exception. - I hate the breakfast buffet, being in a mess hall with 1,000 other tourists, lining up to get sloppy tasteless food. The Aria does it no better than the other Casinos. The breakfast was gross. - I hate having to line up to check in, and line up for anything you want to do. - And I hate that self-parking seems like its in another suburb. But these are all qualities typical of Vegas. Vegas is big, overcrowded, tacky and filled with American tourists who love the tizz. Bless them. It is what it is. That aside, the Aria is definitely the pick of the bunch. The rooms are beautiful. The hi-tech elements are great (and definitely not difficult to navigate - ignore what others have said here - they must be technophobes). The rooms are huge. I had an amazing view of the strip, the Bellagio, and Planet Hollywood. The bathrooms were beautiful, complete with huge tub and separate shower. And there's no tizzy kitschy theme to this hotel - it's just style. AND I was worried about the location of this hotel based on the reviews here on Trip Advisor. Now having stayed there I can not believe that people have written that it is off the strip. It is in the dead center of the strip, but just happens to be set back and has a driveway that leads up to it. It IS on the strip, and don't let anyone tell you otherwise. The location is perfect. To top it all off, I got a Royal Flush on the video poker machine (but now I'm just showing off).

Reviews.Title: “Best Casino Hotel on the strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: RollPositive
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at every high end hotel on the strip and by far, Aria is the hotel! From the Airport a short 10 min ride about $13. cost. We stayed at Vdara 3 months ago and the one thing about City Center its buffered from the hustle of the strip crowd. Check in a Aria was fast, our check in person not the most warm, and didn't give anything when we told him it was our real Anniversary! We had upgraded that day at the airport prior to flying in to a City View Deluxe. Great room, very large lots of room to move around. The hotel is pretty hip, nice colors and just over all very plush. Lots of good places to eat, room service very good and dont miss the pool area! Only place we checking in to from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel... something missing...”
Reviews.Author: De22ick
Reviews.Content: I was at Aria Oct 8-12. Having previously stayed at Bellagio, Wynn, and Caesar's, I have to say that there is something lacking about it. The hotel in general was nice and modern, which I very much enjoyed but it also lacked minor things that I associate with a luxury 5-star hotel, including better soaps/shampoos, better lounge chairs by the pool, and a dining area - it was very uncomfortable ordering room service. My biggest issue with Aria was the lack of an exhaust fan in the bathroom... the bathroom gets very steamy after a shower. Also, the sliding door, while contemporary, doesn't provide much sound insulation from the bathroom, which is something I like to have. I understand stars are given out based on services and amenities and not necessarily for the items I mentioned above but it is the little things that separate a great hotel from a good hotel. Aria does have some positives: Great pools that weren't overcrowded, excellent location, and an excellent gym. The casino was quite nice as well and certainly comparable to every other major casino.

Reviews.Title: “Technologically Intriguing”
Reviews.Author: PaulaR57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Aria this past April. The room was very intriguing! It had every technological bell and whistle right down to charging the room for any items used. The room had a large number of snacks and drinks available for purchase however if you picked it up and didn't place it back in that spot you could be charged for it. Each item had a sensor under it. I loved being able to check out through the TV. Only negatives were that the casino part felt dark to me. Perhaps due to some continuing construction taking place. There also could have been a couple of smaller eateries. Overall, wonderful experience! The artwork and the use of metal, etc. was fascinating to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Enjoy Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mtownmac
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a weekend in Vegas with friends. Service, Staff, and Rooms were all great. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Near-Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Jeepgirl179
Reviews.Content: We booked a package deal with airfare and hotel on Southwest.com, and ended up at Aria Las Vegas. The Property is new and beautiful. To a person, the staff were friendly, ever-present, and helpful. When you call down to the desk, they even know which guest in your room is calling! The food is pricey, since this is a five-star hotel, but good. One disadvantage to the property being so big is that there are a lot of long walks, from the casino to the pool, etc. Also, it's a little challenging to get down to the pedestrian part of the Strip even though you're right on top of it. City planning and the casinos make sure you only walk where they want you to! I think the most outstanding part of Aria besides the beautiful property is the friendliness and great service we got from every staff member. The property is beautiful and clean, and our corner suite had amazing views. The only drawbacks were that our supposedly "non-smoking" room smelled very smoky, but it's Vegas so I'm sure a lot of previous occupants had broken the rules. Some might enjoy everything in the room being remote controlled (lamps, toilet, tv, curtains) but I found it a little complicated and annoying. The bath was absolutely sumptuous, I took a soak in the tub before going out, while enjoying the breathtaking view of the strip. One more annoying thing was when we were getting ready to check out on Sunday, my girlfriends and I had spa appointments and so wanted to do a later checkout, but they wanted to charge us $99 for this. Not worth it. I would think letting us check out late wouldn't be a huge inconvenience since I imagine there aren't a whole lot of new guests coming in Sunday night, so I was surprised they wanted to charge us. We just ended up checking our luggage with the bell staff and checking out at noon. The weather was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: lil_msbeautiful
Reviews.Content: ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL! This hotel is one of the best hotel (besides Marquee) to stay in. If you want newer, sleek and modern this is the hotel! AMAZING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just say Yes”
Reviews.Author: Van M
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at Aria and, as a result, are switching our allegiance from Harrah's properties to this one. It is top shelf with great rooms, new technology, clean looks and great food. The people watching is second to none. Won't stay anywhere else in Vegas unless we are going downtown.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest all around LV resorts”
Reviews.Author: creighc
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas 40-50 times and stayed in all the upscale hotels. This was our first time at Aria. Overall it is very nice. The plusses are: The very comfortable beds The fun technology in the room The staff was very friendly The casino is werll laid out and not too huge The pools are relaxing Nice bath/shower area The property is well-kept, clean and beautiful Cocktail service in the casino was great and plentiful The things I though that could improve: We had to move rooms twice to get what we wanted even though I explained clearly at check-in. The 24 hr restaurant was very sub-par The sports book is small and food service is a bit of a hassle Food is expensive (but equal price to most top Vegas hotels) I still prefer Encore and Wynn, but aria may be the third best. We enjoyed our stay and very well may choose to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GerardoGonzalez
Reviews.Content: Nice Las Vegas hotel, every thing just the way you may expect to be.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel180987
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria Resort and Casino for six nights in October 2011, and had a great time. Location... The hotel is located in the City Centre complex, with a free shuttle which runs regularly between the hotel and Monte Carlo, Vdara, Cosmopolitan and Bellagio hotels. Bedroom... Everything about our stay there was smooth running. Our room faced out onto the New York New York hotel, and had 7" touch screen control for the temperature, TV, music system and curtains. The towels were changed each day, along with the toiletries, and the mini bar re-stocked. NOTE: Just be careful when taking anything from the minibar, as each item is on a pressure-sensitive pad which registers when you've taken the item, and it's charged straight to your room (you can check your balance at any time through the TV using your control pad). If you knock any of the items on its pad (as we did), the touch pad will sense that it has moved, and charge you for the item, even if you don't actually take it out! The bed was SO comfy, it was hard to drag myself out of it every morning, and the room itself was quite spacious. I think it was a King City View room. There was also an iron and ironing board, and plenty of hanging and drawer space. The hotel... is HUGE! Like many of the newer hotels I guess, it seems to have everything! I'm sure we didn't even get to see some parts of it, as we were too busy out exploring, but as with all the hotel/casinos, it's always buzzing. The buffet breakfast was $16.50 (I think - more expensive on a weekend), and was a great way to stock up for the day ahead. There is everything on the 'eat as much as you want' buffet, from pastries and cookies, to Chinese stir fry, to bacon, sausage and eggs, to pancakes and waffles, to rotisserie chicken, to omelettes, to salads, to fruit, to seafood.... the list goes on. Plus coffee, tea, juices etc. It's really good value if you like to stock up at breakfast time to see you through the day! The pool... There are 3 pools, and all had plenty of beds on the week days when we were there. There are always bar waitresses walking around to take your order, and there are a couple of water dispensers located around the pool areas too to use free of charge. We noticed on the Friday and weekend that all the pools were MUCH busier, and it was difficult to get a sunbed. There were also a couple of hot tubs, but we didn't get chance to use them. Other... There is an AVIS car hire desk located down in the bottom of the hotel, which was very convenient, and this is where the trips pick up from too. We were told at the check-out desk that check out was 11am, but as we weren't flying until the evening, asked if we could extend that. We were able to extend until 1pm free of charge, anything extra would be charged at half daily rate. The staff were always friendly and courteous, and there was always someone around cleaning and tidying. Overall, a great stay, and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Office tower with rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bkvacationer
Reviews.Content: At check-in I was told that a non-smoking king room was not available. (My reservation was at Aria website). No choice but to take a smoking king room. Each room is computer controlled through the TV remote and TV. It took 2 hours to figure out how to set the alarm clock. two telepnones in room would not connect and could not be used. Dinner buffet ($32) was awful and the dining room looks like an office cafeteria. Cafe Vettra is expensive but breakfast was so bad that we walked to the Bellagio each day. Coffee is $4, Beer is $8, liter of water in the shoppe was $8. This is a very large Glass and steel structure which is noisy and caters to young singles most of the week. You don't get the feeling that you are vacationing anywhere special. On the morning we were checking out, I called for a bellman to pick up our bags, "Angel" picked up twice and immediately hung up. I don't think the people giving this place a five rating actually stayed here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but losing its appeal”
Reviews.Author: NYtoPA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 4 times now and I always feel like something is missing in the way of service. The rooms are really fantastic - they might be my favorite ANYWHERE. The bed is heavenly. Seriously, I could sink into those pillows and sleep all day long. My husband loves the remote-controlled EVERYTHING in the room (the lighting, curtains, etc. are all controlled by one main hand-held computer/remote. Very high tech and you know how men love their tech-y toys! We even did an upgrade to a corner suite once and it was well worth the money! The pool - eh, I don't know. I feel like I'm lying on top of people depending on what time of the year I'm there. But the drink service is great and there are some really great beverage options. So why not give it 5 stars? I don't even know how to explain it. I just feel like it's that type of in and out place where even the simplest request from a guest is met with resistance and no one goes out of their way to provide exceptional service. Does this make sense? We had a resort credit this visit and, when we tried to charge a pastry to our room and their system for charging to the room was down, the server asked us to pay cash. Our response was, "we don't want to pay cash, we have a resort credit." And he basically implied that we had to pay out of pocket or he wouldn't be able to sell to us. He didn't think outside of the box to find a solution, didn't call anyone, and didn't try to rectify the situation. We left without the pastry and I called the front desk. They said there was another solution, and the server could have had us fill out an authorization form. So big deal, we left without the pastry… but it's just an example of the lack of customer service at this resort. Anyway, if we continue to get decent deals to come here, we probably will. But there are many 5-star properties on the strip and I'd be happy to gamble and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Faux Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Katie P
Reviews.Content: While the Aria looks nice, and some of the staff is helpful (concierge was great, the front desk not so much), it's not a true upscale resort. They still used old fashioned bed covers on the beds (no nice duvet covers changed for every guest). The light in the room is extremely dim. The bathrooms are weirdly set up and poorly planned (the only place to plug in a hair drier knocks everything over on the sink). The elevators appear very beat up for a newish hotel. And worst, they don't appear to have enough housekeeping staff. Of the three days we were there, our room wasn't serviced for two of them. Both days we left the room by 10am with the Service light on, and when we returned (5:30 pm and 4 pm) the room hadn't been serviced. On the first night we called and scheduled for them to come in while we went out to dinner. The second night we came in, changed, went back out, and when we returned at 11pm the room still hadn't been cleaned. I have never had this happen anywhere else, and while one day may be a fluke, two is inexcusable. Despite its supposedly high rating, the breakfast buffet was poor. The selections were odd, and the eggs were not real eggs. We found the casino to be very low key and not very fun. We ended up gambling elsewhere, including the Bellagio and Mirage, where the staff was more helpful and friendly to us. We had other problems with the hotel, including the Aria not honoring a $75 per night resort credit that we had booked through Southwest. (Southwest did their best to get Aria to honor the deal, and ended up giving us a credit themselves to make things right.) Frankly, there are so many choices in Las Vegas where you can stay, that a hotel where they can't bother to clean your room, and where they nickel and dime you on everything isn't worth the time or money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Lovegoodthings
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria from Oct 18 to 21st this year. We had never stayed there - they sent us an offer we could not refuse. Vegas was very expensive on those dates because of the Republican Debate and other things... Check in was great - the guy at the counter was polite and helpful and gave us a room with a great vew of the mountains - the Palms and Rio. That was okay with us because it was certainly not our first trip to Vegas. The room was beautiful and modern with dark wood but not very big. I loved the electronics and the floor to ceiling windows and agree with some other people about the dirty windows. They had spots on them but I think that could be because they were clear glass a not darker like some other hotels. The bed was very comfortable but the reading light was dim and no way to make it any brighter. As far as the housekeeping goes - the first day our room was not done till 3 pm but that was the only day it was late. All other days our room was clean when we returned in the afternoon. The housekeeping is not the best and there was no turn down service in the regular rooms but we we okay with it as long as they cleaned our rooms everyday. Overall I found the Aria a little dark -not as cheerful and bright as some of the other hotels and the energy in the Casino was not great. Drink service on the casino floor was slow. I am going to give it 4 stars - it was a very good modern hotel, people were friendly and helpful, the restaurants were good, and the price for the rooms seem reasonable at least for now. I liked its close proximity to the Cosmopolitan, Bellagio, Planet Hollywood and others. We used the spa and the pool and were very happy with it. The shops at City Center were very nice too. I would definitely recommend that you stay at the Aria once and see judge for yourself. I would certainly stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: 2009G8
Reviews.Content: We were offered a complimentary room stay which we took advantage of on Sunday, July 31. 2 adults and 2 teens. They gave us a regular room with 2 beds. The view was not spectacular but that really didn't matter. The room was very impressive especially since everything was so new. The new technology in the room was fun to play with and everyone took turns operating the lights/windows/tv/etc from the tablet beside the extremely comfy bed. The room was clean. Any staff we encountered were very professional and polite. Although the slot machines were not paying out at all, we did enjoy the atmosphere in the casino. The complimentary beverages here are a decent size compared to the other resorts. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Architecture, Great Location, Poor Lighting”
Reviews.Author: Rannynm
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful new hotel this is for Las Vegas. Very nifty modern architecture. You feel like you're at the Space Port with all the hip design features throughout. Our room, one of their standard ones, was adequate but nothing to write home about. I would love to see the Sky Suites. The worst aspect, as others have pointed out is the very poor low level lighting. Our desk light was out and thus, we could see nothing in that area of the room which included the space where we had positioned the luggage racks. I called to have them fix it and suggested that they needed to increase the light level in the room. The response was "many people have complained about that." Really!? Perhaps they should address it. Oh, and the light on the make up mirror didn't work. I was happy that there was free internet, or rather that the daily resort fee covered that. This is a personal pet peeve for me, particularly in higher end hotels who charge an outrageous fee of $20 + per day for internet access. I mean, if Motel 6 can offer it for free, shouldn't they include it when you're paying for a 4-5* hotel? Other small complaints. For no reason whatsoever, twice, all the lights in the room went out and the curtains closed. I might explain that all of these are controlled by nifty little touch pads on the wall, and on the tv monitor. However, whatever ghosts were in the room to randomly trip this was more than a nuisance as I was putting in my contacts and my honey was reading. We did see the new Cirque de Soleil Elvis show and were not disappointed. Lovely and fun. We did try out several of the bars and restaurants and all were outstanding, with great help except for one. Breakfast at the main Cafe, Cafe Vettro I think it is called was a huge disappointment. I ordered a cappuccino which I am almost certain came out of one of those automatic machines and is simply terrible. I asked our waitress to replace it with a regular coffee ($4) which was equally bad. The break with breakfast was also terrible and I can't say much good for the eggs. On the other hand, the little French bakery near the elevators is simply lovely. Great coffee, croissants, quiche, etc. But, if you want a more substantial breakfast, leave the property. Another somewhat confusing thing is that there are two valet locations. The main valet and the north valet. Pay attention to where you park or you may end up walking the endless walk to get to your vehicle. Hint: your valet ticket says which one it is for. Another example of bad planning is the very long distance to either of these valet stands which means dragging your roller bags a very long way across carpet - not an easy task. Would someone tell the architects that most of us travel light with roller bags and it would be nice if they considered that when they look at the traffic pattern from door to elevator. One more thing. The English Pub is fantastic. It's just outside the property. The portions are ample, the selection excellent, the help outstanding. Try it for lunch or a non fancy dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emily C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a quick trip to Las Vegas last weekend, and were very happy with our experience. Check in was very smooth, and staff was super friendly and chatty. The room itself was beautiful and modern, with floor to ceiling windows looking out over the City Center complex and the Strip. It was definitely understated elegance, with none of the flash and themed silliness you can get at some of the other hotels. I'm a bit technologically disabled, so I can't really comment on how advanced the room electronics were, but I know my husband enjoyed figuring out all the clever ideas they had come up with. Everything was still very clean and new looking. The spa is fantastic, and well worth the entrance fee even if you aren't getting a service there. They have several different meditation rooms you can relax in, several small pools of different temperatures, and a lovely private pool on a balconly overlooking the main pool down below. My girlfriend and I hung out in the spa for several hours, and still felt we hadn't been able to spend enough time there! The only misstep of the entire trip was during our arrival. When we pulled up to the front of the hotel, there were a couple of bellmen standing directly next to the car, but who could not be bothered to open the car door or welcome us to the hotel. They looked bored, and it was a bit of an off-putting introduction to the hotel. It was only a very small thing in the grand scheme of our great stay, but it really highlighted the difference in the level of service we got there, as opposed to the Mandarin Oriental next door. Overall, we had a lovely trip, and I would definitely recommend staying at the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: mltnw
Reviews.Content: Everything about Aria was excellent except for housekeeping. We stayed for seven nights in a city deluxe view room. Windows were very dirty, hard to keep windows clean in such a large hotel but come on I paid for a clear view. Everyday after room was serviced something was not done. One day no wash cloths, another day no soap, another day did not clean ice bucket or replace glasses. One day left room at 10:30 am left service light on, returned to a clean serviced room but had received a voicemail at 12:30 pm saying they would not clean our room because we had the privacy light on and if we needed service to call housekeeping. The biggest thing is housekeeping on our last night threw away our bag of goodies to be taken home away. Supervisor explained that we had left the bag where the silver trash can was supposed to be. Folks we were there for almost six nights and there was never a silver trash can in the living area. Offered a gift basket but declined could not replace items given to us by friends. Aria has a long way to go to match housekeeping fom the Wynn where we usually stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rub-a-Dub-Dub; Beware of the Tub!”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegFlatlander
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria in October on a 4-night booking and although this hotel is one of Vegas's newer venues, we were disappointed with many aspects of the room and the front desk service. Firstly, the room lighting is totally lame. At night, if you hope to read anything, you'd better bring a flashlight with you. There was no way to increase the luminosity in the room and the automatic controls were confusing to operate. Secondly, the bathroom shower and jacuzzi tub area is truly dangerous. When my wife went in to shower, she stepped back and almost fell into the raised marbled tub area. If the back of your head hits the tub, or its surround, you just may find yourself on the next episode of "1000 Ways To Die." The proximity of the tub to the shower stall and the knee-high level of the hard surround are lawsuits just waiting to happen. Thirdly, the on-screen programming for wake-up calls and TV channels is frustrating due to the extremely SLOW reaction time when pressing the remote keys. Also, twice when the wireless network wasn't working, my wife called the front desk to hear that the network was "down." Later, when paying the Resort Fees, I mentioned this to the front desk clerk and stated that a modest reduction on the resort fee would be fair. She stated, after checking with her supervisor, that, under no circumstances, could they refund any portion of the resort fee; even though internet service is one of the key items that you are paying for. Finally, the back lane style shuttle pick-up area is far removed from the hotel lobby and room elevators and the trek to and from it is a long and winding journey. For the money, we wish that we had booked one of the older, more established Vegas Strip hotels, most of which are still nicely maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: VinnyGerard
Reviews.Content: Simply the best room at which I've stayed. Very modern and luxurious. I loved the touch pad with which you control everything in the room, even the curtains. The bed was incredible, I had excellent night's sleep. I loved the look of the hotel in general, very modern and well decorated. Not to mention the characteristic perfume of the lobby and casino. The only downside of the hotel was having to pay for everything, from breakfast to internet. But I guess that's standard in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Living the Dream in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jacquiw383
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and great postion on Strip. Stayed for 7 nights from 19th October. Weather was amazing over 86 every day.We dont gamble so were a bit worried as it was our first stay in Vegas. It was amazing, so much to do... I loved the smell in Hotel....everything was clean and well placed. Our Room was on 9th Floor and was massive!! I loved the Bed, Great to sink into after a long day walking around the sights. The room was cleaned everyday apart from Sunday. I loved the Pool area, dont take Towels as you get fresh ones everyday at pool. I had 2 everyday. Hairdryer in room was good, it will save you taking one. a little less weight in your case. We also went to see Viva Elvis show in hotel, great if you like Elvis however too expensive. I even got 30% off staying in hotel. Its not worth the money to be honest. loads of other shows on strip cheaper and better. I also saw Barry Manilow and Gladyis Knight....amazing!!!! If you do a Grand Canyon trip...go with Mustang..they were brill. They are Maverick helicopters but at least a $100 cheaper than flying direct with Maverick. Would I come back to this Hotel.....hell yeah!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Its was just ok!”
Reviews.Author: Rhymesavers
Reviews.Content: First timer in Las Vegas, my friend who had been to vegas had never been to city center so we decided to rent two seperate rooms at aria. For the price I was expecting so much more! The room was a little small the fancy electronic touchpad that basically ran the room was slow, plus the tv remote didnt work, so i had to deal with the delicate, slow touch pad. The aroma was only in the hotel lobby my room didnt smell of it.My friends room down the hall had this fancy warm footcover at the end of their bed plus two small pillows on their seating chairs which my room did not. The best thing about Aria is its location, it was just ok!!

Reviews.Title: “The new standard of modern luxury in L V”
Reviews.Author: CrzyCdn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay @ Aria. Safe to say it impressed on all accounts! All the staff I dealt with or passed in the hallways were extremely friendly & did everything within their power to be professional and accommodating. The convention facilities & service were top notch....I did not hear one complaint from any of the 300+ attendees from our organization. The pool area was excellent....well laid out so that people aren't piled on top of one another like they seem to be at other Vegas hotels. My wife also tells me the fitness centre was excellent...(perhaps I should have gone there instead of instead of taking all the 5's & 6's out of the deck @ the blackjack table LOL) If I were to raise one issue, it would be the cost of the simple amenities. $4 for tea, $3+ for a simply bottle of water is pretty steep in my books. My best suggestion is make a list of any snacks / beverages you may want for your room and take the 5 min. walk to the CVS pharmacy just down from the hotel on the strip. Overall, we had a fabulous stay and would recommend Aria to anyone I know for an upcoming journey to America's playground...enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: JWALL5910
Reviews.Content: First time at this resort usually play it safe with Palazzo or Ceasars. The rooms are very very nice and the bedside control for everything in the room was really cool. We will be staying here from now on. The staff was polite and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: noogiesmom
Reviews.Content: I loved the scent of the hotel! Noticed many other hotels doing scents too! The rooms were amazing...only thing missing is a coffee maker for sure! But beds are major comfy! Safe wierd place in the draw in the nightstand! Wish they had made more elevator banks though. You never had to wait but the walk to the room was a killer after walking the strip! Great great location, excellent valet service, check in and out a breeze room ready at 12 when we got there! Buffet is pretty good as well....thought it very good till we went to the Wynn buffet oh my god! Pool is very nice (cabanas a bit messy) and they have plenty of chairs around the three pools. Smoking in casinos was a bit of a killer. The bars were great the waitress service while gambling very good and great drinks! Martini in a martini glass! Sports book a bit small to watch the games sunday. Jillian Serano (spelling?) great restaurant for tapas loved that- his little place amazing stuff too for desserts! All in all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Smells like vanilla clove cigarettes”
Reviews.Author: kjsa
Reviews.Content: Nice new hotel with beautiful water features outside but it's a whole new experience when you open the lobby door. You are smacked in the face with a wave of air that smells like my Uncle's pipe, vanilla incence and cloves. The smell was so nauseating we didn't gamble there. We went to the other casinos. Our room was nice. Bed very comfortable and the location on the strip is ideal. Still, I'd never stay here again. I'll be back at the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “business and family”
Reviews.Author: SHOSHICRAY
Reviews.Content: high class new hotel. VERY pricy. And no coffe maker no breakfast, reading lamp did not work ( very disaapointing compared to price). Excellent location, excellent interier and view, very good design and very comfy sleep (excellent matress). did not had vanity kit and shower cap, but had shower rob( very handy). good variety of food (expensive though: crep 11 $, capuchino in the paper cup 7$). Had good variety in the bar but overpriced ( e.g. fuji water 12$). ausome view!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrob1
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Aria on a package deal with Orbitz and was certainly not disappointed. It is a great hotel ! new , clean and even though there is smoking in the casino the ventillation system takes most of it out , the older hotels do not. The rooms are awesome, big nicely furnished great bathrooms, and when you walk in the TV turns on and the drapes open up and you have your great view. The controls for the drapes and lights are right by your bed so you don't have to get out of bed . The service at check in and out was quick and they couldn't have been nicer. It is right by in the City Center so it is a nice location don't waste your time looking to stay at other hotels you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, top notch”
Reviews.Author: Tintin423
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and I was completely WOW'd by the Aria. It was very clean, super high tech (took a few tries to figure out the lights!) and the perfect location, smack dab in City Center. The bed was very comfortable and there was tons of space in the room. My boyfriend had been to Vegas a number of times and said the Aria was far and away the nicest hotel he's ever stayed there. We didn't gamble much there as the tables were pretty expensive, but we pretty much expected that given the quality of the place. Dinner at Julian Serrano's was great, too. The pool was pretty crowded until we realized most of the towels on the chairs belonged to people who had already left. Drinks at the pool bar were crazy expensive but tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great location, few flaws”
Reviews.Author: PhreshPhil
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in September, mini-holiday with my new wife. Rooms were very well-appointed, tasteful decor, and a nice view. The remote control is a cool concept but flawed execution: Having to turn on the TV and navigate some laggy menus to turn the lights off or open the blinds gets tiresome real quick. No obvious cigarette smell! Although they did use a freshener in the lobbies, my scent-sensitive wife had no issues. Staff was impeccably friendly, helpful and thoroughly professional. The layout of the resort is a bit poor: you have to wind through endless lobbies (and slot machines) to get anywhere, be it a car rental, restaurant, or the strip itself. They could use some more elevators and stairwells. It is located right on the Strip, between the Monte Carlo and the Bellagio/Cosmopolitan, with a very posh shopping plaza attached to the lobby (Crystals), and the whole of the Strip nearby. Great resort for someone looking for something a bit more elegant and less tacky. There was certainly a bit of a subdued and exclusive vibe which was (I sheepishly admit) quite welcome after those loud and brash vegas nights. Recommended for couples or families; bachelor parties should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Casino and Pool”
Reviews.Author: Jacmac00
Reviews.Content: Great place, perfect location in the new 'City' development within Vegas, lovely hotel, all you would imagine from a top hotel. I stayed for four nights over the weekend, place was buzzing, loads to do within the hotel but also very close to other top spots within the city complex. Yes, go, enjoy I am planning to go back already next year.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: ChamKim
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a bit small. I would rather pay less and stay at the Palazzo. Buffet was horrible at the resort. Overpriced and not that great of a selection.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Sucks!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly P
Reviews.Content: Aria is a very Nice Hotel. My 3 friends and I are black PYT's. We were treated with the WORST service.First we didn't get the double non smoking rooms I requested.At check in the receptionist was very unhelpful she had a major attitude. She literally called my credit card company to verify that the card was mines and I had funds to cover the bill. Next day at the pool the waitress didn't even recognize us until after 2 hours to see if we wanted to order something to eat or drink. When getting towels we had to prove we were hotel guests when no one else was questioned. At the pool Cafe, I ordered a glass of wine. The waitress brought the wine to me in a small plastic cup when everyone around us had wine glasses. WTF!!! I will not spend my money to stay here and be treated like a animal!! VERY UNACCEPTABLE!

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Didn't Quite Hit The Mark”
Reviews.Author: Ricard013
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay at the Aria for 3 nights to attend a wedding in October. The wedding reception was in "The Gold Lounge" which had great service, food and drinks. We liked the "High Tech" room that we stayed in but some seniors have problems figuring it out. The restaurants in the casino were overpriced and minimum bets on some games are a little high. The service overall was excellent and drinks served promptly though. The hotel is huge and we had to walk a mile from our room to the elevators. The layout isn't user friendly and I would chose a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “4 star yes- 5 star no”
Reviews.Author: cindyz50
Reviews.Content: Aria is a nice new hotel, but I would maybe consider it a 4.5 star tops. When we first got there to check in we had to wait an hour. It was a nighmare. They had about 8 people checking guests in and it was soooooo slow. Then we constantly had issues with our room cards not working, so there we go waiting in line again. The rooms were nice, the bathroom had great finishes but could have been a bit bigger. I went in May, while the hotel was still very new maybe they have grown out of these little problems now that they have been in business longer. I would recommend staying here if you get a good price. It's a nice hotel just not luxury

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: SirVaysah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aria hotel in October of 2011. I was pleasantly surprised to find no line at the check in counter (granted we checked in at 5:00 p.m. on a Saturday). The gentleman at the front desk was very friendly. The room is a standard size room for this category of hotel; however it is nicely appointed with modern dark wood furnishings (nightstands, dressers, etc.) and textured beige walls with modern artwork. The bathroom has a shower and tub enclosure sporting floor to ceiling marble tile. The hotels is Las Vegas have water flow restricting shower heads. The Aria is no exception, however the shower head allowed more water flow than most other hotels I have stayed in, making the shower a very pleasant experience. The tub is very large, another great amenity. The room is tastefully decorated, reminding me of a boutique hotel with a modern, almost European feel. Although I did not use the pool area, I did walk around the pool deck and saw three large sized pools set on a rooftop on the second floor. The pool area was ringed with palm trees and modern art pieces. My wife and I walked around the City Center and were very pleased. High end restaurants and shops are within walking distance of the Aria; in fact, my wife wanted some sundries from CVS (as the selection of goods at the gift shops located within the Aria was limited). On of the staff directed us to a CVS store located within 200 yards of the north entrance. The great thing about the Aria and the City Center is that all of the shopping and restaurants you need are within walking distance. You don't have to leave the property, unless you want to. I highly recomend the Jean Philippe patisserie, located adjacent to the casino floor. The cherry danish is fantastic, as is the coffee. (I take my coffee black; not sure about the coffee drinks.) I also recomend the crepes that Jean Philippe offers. Overall, a great experience at the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room for basic rate, tight tables :/”
Reviews.Author: exotik
Reviews.Content: Of course staying in Vegas hotels ruin the hotel experience sometimes for other cities, since their basic rooms are like upgraded rooms in other cities, but hey they probably owes us, since most of us gamble there? Property as you know, typically beautiful Vegas style. Nice pools too. The Cosmopolitan seemed to have all the best ambiance and they let you win sometimes too, as I have never won at the Aria, a sore loser, that rarely loses. The City Center has many nice shops & restaurants. People were nice at Besos. I think next time I will stay at Cosmo because that is where it is poppin'!!! Aria...ehhhh ok, yawn here and there. Great room if that is what you are there for though...the room ;)

Reviews.Title: “SIX STARS!”
Reviews.Author: Jeropero
Reviews.Content: The young lady who checked me in,,(her name is Summer),,was very very helpful,,I wanted a great view on a higher fl,,she made a phone call and I got what I asked for..A great view of the front of ARIA! A very beautiful resort,I was in my room within a few minutes,,and it was before noon.I loved my room,,it was very hi tech and the bed had the greatest mattress,,very comfortable with 6 large fluffy pillows..I want that mattress but didnt get the name. Great Restaurants .The buffet was convenient,,with a nice selection,,but didnt change that much each day I was there..I was very impressed with the night club HAZE,,,the DJ was fantastic and the club/gogo dancers were very talented.The Pools were very good with great service and The LIQUID POOL/CLUB was outstanding! I hope to go back soon and I want one of the larger suites,,since the rates are so low..

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and modern”
Reviews.Author: Ctrigg1
Reviews.Content: Great property, beautiful decor. Pools were awesome. Restaurants were diverse and very good. Room was nice. Bed was uneven so not the greatest for sleep. Large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Michael R
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the front desk to groups of people all staning in front of a couple of check in desks, and after 45 minutes, we finally get to the front desk and a very RUDE exmployee tells me that our room will not be available until 3pm, which is check in time. I said "that is not acceptible, it is 11:30 and we told you what time we are arriving". He said it was the policy of the hotel, then I asked for the manager. I told her that we come to Las Vegas every year, and usually stay at the Bellagio, and this is rediculous. How can you possibly run a hotel like this with all these people checking in and no one can get into their room until 3pm? She "found" a room for us. The room was dirty, the bed sheets looked like they had not been changed, and they had makeup stains on them. The furniture is already wearing out, the carpet it worn I had to call down to have the room cleaned after 2 days and get fresh towels, and the hallways are all scuffed up and the walls are scratched from the maids carts. Overall experience was bad, the staff is rude, their systems for dealing with guests is terrible. On the second day, my 72 year old mother was checking in, and same thing, "no room until 3pm", so I expected this and had a nice restaurant that we could eat at. Then i asked where could we leave her luggage? He pointed me to the other side of the lobby, and when we got there, they said "no, we don;t take bags here (the sign above the area said BELL STATION), and they said, take them outside to the curbside bellhops. You know, if you know that you have groups of people that are thinking they are going to have a room, and you have nothing available, WHY NOT PUT SOMETHING IN PLACE TO TAKE OUR BAGS AND HELP US OUT A LITTLE BIT? We won't be back! I strongly recommend that people NOT stay here, it truly was one of the worse experiences I have had in traveling!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel--you wont be dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: Wetravelthere
Reviews.Content: I'm a persnickety about hotels. The Aria made is a nice hotel: rooms were very clean and well appointed; plenty of in house restaurant and bars, good location on strip, terrific ventilation in the casino area-which is appreciated by non smokers. The only probably was check in--it took a little longer than expected, but still the staff was friendly. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One word - WOW”
Reviews.Author: DIORLOU
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the best hotel we have stayed at. I dont know what to rave about first. We booked our Vegas trip through travelocity, considering the that this hotel was highly rated i thought the price was a deal and it was. This hotel was built a little over a year ago so everything is very modern. The BEST thing about our room was THE BED!!! OMG, the mattress was like sleeping on a cloud and the pillows were heaven!!! Sidenote: you can purchase a mattress and pillows if you like, they ship it to you and the price isnt outrageous. All the lights including the TV is powered by just one touch by a touch screen pad on the night table, this was SO convenient when the hubs and i were already comfortable in bed and forgot to set the privacy sign on the door and didnt power off the lights, all i had to do was reach out to this nifty touch pad and controlled it all from there. Absolute genius! My husband and I booked this trip to celebrate our anniversary. we mentioned this at the front desk when we checked in because the agent asked us if it was our first time in Vegas. Sure enough they brought up some chocolate covered fruit and a sweet card from hotel management congratulating us on our anniversary. I thought it was a very nice gesture. The hotel is located in city center which is not exactly ON the strip so it is a bit of a walk to the strip. However its easier if you take the tram to the Bellagio or the walkway to MonteCarlo and walk out to the strip from there rather than walking it outside. The staff was very friendly and helpful. the Taxi attendant was very prompt in getting taxis to the the guests in line. The housekeeping was top notch! We always found our room picked up after we would leave our stuff thrown around after a long day...There is not one single complaint i have about this hotel. I recommend it with my eyes closed! Aria, I miss you!!! I do! Thank you for an absolute wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: drhooper
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a large Sky Suite and it was fabulous. The suite was very high tech and was appointed with the finest, from the heated toilet seat to the TV controled drapes and lights. The Sky Suite staff is over the top. They are exceptionally well trained and accomodating. The management has done a wonderful job in preparing the entire staff to go the extra mile for their customers. Even the cleaning staff greeted me by name. This is what 5 star treatment should be like evrywhere. Great job Aria!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with lovely pool”
Reviews.Author: bluebird033
Reviews.Content: By staying at the Aria you are in a perfect place on 'the strip' in Las Vegas to enjoy all the sights The hotel is fairly new so all the rooms are fabulous, spacious and quiet with all the essentials for a good nights sleep. The rooms have electric curtains, great outlook and a beautiful bathroom. The pool was great with pool attendants helping you to find a lounger. Definitely would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: M68
Reviews.Content: This is my 6th visit to Vegas in as many years but my first time staying at the Aria. The hotel is fantastic. Unlike some of the other comments, we did not have to queue at check in, but I guess it depends what time of day you check in. The rooms are fabulous. Very nicely decorated, very modern and bright. Fully stocked mini bar with plenty of choice, although obviously a bit pricey. Electronic curtains, tv, lights etc. The bathrooms have to be one of the best, with dual sinks, and a large walk in shower which also incorporates a bath. Two large wardrobes with plenty of hanging space including hangers, ironing board, iron & dressing gowns. The breakfast buffet is among the best I have experienced. 15$ + tax for all you can eat, and the selection is huge. Although the drink waiters were a little slow. You do not need lunch after this ! We had room service one evening. I was expecting meals on a tray, however in came the waiter with a table, fully laid with our meal. For room service this was surprisingly fairly priced and again huge portions. Yes the Aria is on the strip but set back a little, however it takes a 5 min walk to actually stand on the strip. You can also walk through the Aria into the Monte Carlo or Crystals or get the tram to the Bellagio & Crystals. I recommend the Lemongrass Chinese restaurant. Very good service, and very good portion sizes. Yes you do have to show your room key each time you want to use the elevator to your room, but it's no big deal. Overall this is a fantastic hotel, and I would not hesitate in staying here next year when I return.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sprinkle2
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here at the end of September with my wife and we both had a very good time in Vegas. This is our second time to Vegas and we thought that we would like to stay in this hotel because it was under construction on the last visit. We were not disappointed. The room was wonderful with the most comfortable bed that we have ever slept in. The control of the lighting, curtains, air conditioning and TV were all controlled from the bedside touchpad. The bathroom was much better than expected with double wash basins and a bath & shower in a walkin wet room. The facilities provided within the hotel were excellent with staff that were very helpful, especially in the buffet section where there was a good selection of food available. We spent a lot of time in the casino but did not come away as winners but happy with our lot. The only slight problem was the smell in the corridors which my wife said was a bit sickly and was probably to do with the air conditioning in the circulation areas. Will we stay here again - yes we will and hopefully sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Great but needs Improvements”
Reviews.Author: Roccox
Reviews.Content: This is a great and modern hotel with a huge and elegant casino. This was my first time at Aria Resort and I liked but have some comments to consider: Although the hotel is modern and High Tech, it lacks the personal touch and small details that make a difference; for example, the bed was extremely soft, very difficult to sleep, it guarantees you free back pain next morning...Too Soft & Hard Sleep. The Buffet looks great and has a great variety of food to chose from but once you taste it your impression change from positive to negative. I selected Eggs Benedictine which looked great but they were completely cold..terrible experience with this. Staff needs more customer focus. The room was good with high technology, the problem for me was that I arrived at night and it was very, very difficult for me to find the way to turn the lights or even to move the curtains..they should provide guests some advise and/or instructions to get familiar with such high Tech bedroom. The bathroom was OK, nothing special, toileteries were of bad quality, no special brand or articles...very basic. I liked a lot the casino, it has good service, excellent staff and great high class atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Vegas has to offer !!!”
Reviews.Author: weebo79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ARIA with my girlfriend for a week in October on the recomendation of a freind who works in the travel industry, and after staying would pass the same advise on to others. For a Vegas hotel the ARIA has it all, a good Casino, superb wellness centre including large outdoor pools top end gym facilities/spa and a supern choice of restaurants and bars. Rooms were of a decent proportion and came equiped with everything you would expect of a five star, only negative or advise is to watch out for mini bar expenditure at 6pounds for a bottle of water you may want to stock up. Location is central and a short walk to the Bellagio and nearest mall and transport links. Main lifts to rooms are located a short distance into the hotel something to be wary of with many large Vegas hotels, the MGM for instance main lifts are a good 5mins across the hotel. Whether you want to party by the pool at one of Vegas top day parties or relax in tranquil pool gardens and hot tubs, gamble the night away or shop til you drop the ARIA has it all and has the service to match. On going back top Vegas ARIA will be my first choice I would advise anyone to Consider it as theirs. Only thing to watch is if you are on a tighter day/food budget this may not be for you, apart from a 15dollar breakfast AMAZING... Drinks come at a premiim as do most restaurants, but no bother as the hotel is a short walk to meet all requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience - poor service”
Reviews.Author: Renee R
Reviews.Content: Extremely dissappointed in this hotel. We have stayed at other five star Vegas hotels before. Myself, my brother, my father and two other couples all got rooms there. I am only going to list only the 5 MAJOR service issues. 1st issue check in 2 lines were 6-7 deep with people waiting to check in/check out. Behind the counter were 6 people holding cash drawers waiting to take stations - only problem was with a lobby full of people checking in and out and plenty of open counter slots (8) these people stood there and chatted or looked at people in line for 8 minutes until it was the top of the hour. 2nd issue although there were 4 groups in our party we were not given rooms even close to each other (floors 52 22 12 and 4) what a pain - not only that since each room was in a separate elevator tower you had to go all the way to the main floor to go to another room. Staff was just not able to accomodate us. 3rd issue my Dad when he made reservations made them for a handicapped room - at checkin even though he is standing there pushing his freind in a wheel chair he was not given a handicapped room. We had to call down and request a handicapped room - no apology - the only good thing was we did not have to go to the lobby to get a new key but had to go all the way to the lobby to change rooms - wheelchair luggage & all. 4th issue - once couple felt the bed was too soft for them they needed a harder mattress - the staff told them that everyone loved the beds - it was not the bed but they would see if they could maybe find a BOARD to send up - they really said a BOARD - again not apologies. 5th issue and this is the one that caused us all to decide that even though we had 2 days left on our stay none of us would spend or gamble another dime at the Aria - it was Sunday morning 7:30am My dad and his guest, myself and my guest & my brothers and their wives were meeting for breakfast at the buffet. My Dad is 78 years old and was pushing a wheelchair - he got there first the buffet was basically EMPTY - he paid and was seated.
