My brothers & I show up a few minutes later and were waiting for him when my Dad calls and says he is already seated. We go in, pay and approach the host and tell them that we want to sit with my Dad (he is in one of those long booths at the side chairs on the other side seating area (would set probably 20 people on each side). The host basically has a scared look in his eyes & says groups of 8 require notice at the cashier and a 18% gratuity be paid - it has to do with server stations. So we get seated across an aisle from my Dad because even if we pay the 'BUFFET gratutity' in an #$&@ empty room we can not sit with him. Then the kicker is that we have the same flipping server! After we eat my brother asks to see the manager who is steadfast in the fact that it is policy and next time we need to pre-announce. Well guess what there will never be a next time and we will NEVER EVER recommend anyone stay at the Aria. It made us miss the Bellagio even more. If you want service and expect to be somewhat pampered forget the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but the wall is thin”
Reviews.Author: R H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice. The room was clean and modern with remote control to control everything from light, curtain, TV, etc. It was 1 of the newest hotel in Las Vegas. The service was good. During my first stay, we could hear the next door neighbours at night. We could also hear the voice of other people walking by on the hallway. The second time we decided to stay at this hotel because they had larger swimming pools comparing to Vdara--we stayed at Vdara on our first trip to Las Vegas. We liked it there but we thought the pool was small. Anyway, our room for the second stay faced Vdara pools and we noticed there were more than 1 pool there, unlike in our first stay. Vdara was definitely quieter both in the room and in the lobby (there is no casino). The bathroom layout of Aria was better than Vdara since the shower and bath tub were in the same enclosed area but still separated. Also the shower door was sealed better than Vdara, so we didn't have water leaking out through the shower door during shower. The casino was okay and there were many choices of restaurants both in the casino floor and the second floor. Another good thing about Aria than Bellagio or Monte Carlo was it was not as crowded as those 2 hotels in the casino, restaurant, and lobby areas. If you like to stay in a hotel that has uncrowded casino, this is definitely the hotel for you. If you like quiet room, this is not the hotel for you and you should stay at Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: aks120LasVegas
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate and did not regret it. The hotel is modern and has a great atmosphere. The rooms have everything you need, with a comfy bed and great bathroom. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal service, average facilities, technological nightmare”
Reviews.Author: OzTraveller888
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at Aria and am still left wondering what all the fuss is about. Arrival was like being pushed through a budget airline check in with the attending staff member rudely ignoring my wife (who had actually booked the trip) and deferring to me. Upgrade? Not likely - never even asked why we were visiting Las Vegas (50th birthday - thanks for asking!). They did warn us (and every one else) to not touch anyhting in the mini bar as even touching it could result in our room being charged (nothing like a little fascism from the mini bar!) but turned out to be a profound warning about their high tech rooms when the system in our room never worked properly and deteriorated to a point where it was taking over half an hour to respond top commands (Yes I timed it while waiting for the technicians to come and fix it). Couldn't even turn the lights or TV off as there is no "manual" backup. Food - average and overpriced. Pool - would have been nice if they could decide whether it was a dance music blaring zone or laid back relaxing zone. Location - being set back from the street made it a walk to even get out to the strip, with at least a block each way to cross the road.The much touted sky rail is a wank only running between the two hotels either side! Overall appearance is quite pleasing which you would expect from a new hotel, but beyond the veneer, not much to recommend this hotel. Plenty of other options in better locations who seem to understand how to treat guests.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and Modern Look - Excellent time”
Reviews.Author: AdventuresTraveler
Reviews.Content: I am late with this review but I felt I had to get around to it eventually because I really did have a great time at Aria. I went last December for the Rock and Roll Las Vegas Marathon and stayed a week. The entire city center area is fantastic, if you are into modern design you will love this place. Front desk service was exceptionally polite and efficient. As everything in Vegas food and drink is expensive but the rate I got for the week stay at the Aria was a steal. The room was great with a stunning strip view. Would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: mjwandssw
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Aria for a 3 night conference last week. We had a corner suite which gave us access to the "Invited guest check in". The process was fairly quick and we were off to our room in just a few moments. Given the amount of technology it takes to run some of the basic's of the room I think that the hotel should not let anyone go up to their room alone to try to figure it out. We ate at Sirio the first night, we felt the portions were small and not overly impressive for the price, they did however have a great Wine selection. The remainder of the trip we ate dinner and all lunch’s off premise. The Buffet was our breakfast place of choice and the food selection / quality / service was good. My complaint as it relates to breakfast is it is tough to get food anywhere in the hotel before 8AM. The gym had a great variety of high end cardio and weight equipment, the staff however was very unfriendly. Both my wife and I thought the Bed was ridiculously soft and did not provide a good nights rest. The room was cleaned adequately; however, when we used up some of the various toiletries, they were never replaced / replenished. It seemed to get old (to us) to constantly have to show your room key, to get access to the elevator section, to get in the gym, and to get into the pool area… etc. Don’t get me wrong, we enjoyed the Aria, I just felt as if the "Ritz Carlton touch" was missing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but maybe not for Vegas virgins.”
Reviews.Author: Brannigan84
Reviews.Content: I've not long arrived home from Las Vegas where I stayed 6 nights at The Aria Resort & Casino. This was my 6th visit to Vegas, and I like to try a new hotel each visit. Check in was prompt & easy, with friendly staff greeting you upon arrival. We had all 3 rooms upgraded without even asking. When you walk into the room, you are welcomed, lights automatically turn on, and the curtains open to show the strip (a nice gimmick). The room was as clean as you would expect and full of all sorts of fancy buttons & controls to alter the slightest setting in the room. Although the room was certainly not small, it seemed smaller than the rooms in both the Bellagio & The Wynn. The rooms were more modern than Bellagio's but I wouldn't say 'nicer'. And I certainly preferred the actual rooms at The Wynn. The hotel was clean and full of friendly helpful staff. The swimming pools were nice and were not too crowded with idiots. The casino floor is relatively small in comparison to other Casinos. There were several nice restaurants inside the hotel, the Tapas one being the best. The location was a major positive but also a big negative. The positive is that it's slap bang in the middle of things, which is The Wynn & Encore's biggest downfall in my opinion. It has the 'City Centre' complex around it, it's next to Bellagio, and there is a concourse service connecting it to other Casinos. But if this was my first visit to Vegas, I could easily get lost and disorientated with the location of the hotel. The hotel is so big, and then you have the City Centre complex, as well as walking through hotels such as Cosmopolitan & The Mandarin. It's almost like its a little bit of a vacuum. If you know where places are, and where exactly you want/need to go then it's fine. But it did seem like it was quite separate from the rest of the strip even though it is so central. I don't think you would truly grasp what Vegas was all about if Aria was the hotel of your first ever visit. But after all said and done, I enjoyed it and thought it was a great hotel that suited me personally. Haze nightclub inside Aria is fantastic and the Elvis Cirque show is a must see for any Elvis fan!

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tboyland
Reviews.Content: It cost $6bn to build this complex and it shows. The sheer size let alone the quality speaks for itself. Unlike others I didn't find the walk from the elevator to my room to be excessive, even though I was at the end of the corridor. The technology in the room is cool and the facilties of good quality. The only room complaint would be that the water from the tap spurts out and could be better regulated. The pool area in particular is stunning and the pool party at Liquid is a real blast on Saturdays and not stupidly crowded. Of course it is expensive but then this is Vegas. With regard to service overall it was of the quality expected for a five star hotel. The only complaint on that front are the queues at reception, this needs better management. Overall though I highly recommend Aria for the non-budget conscious traveller

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to enjoy the strip from”
Reviews.Author: JeremyCPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: OK, so this place lacks any real 'theme' unlike other hotels such as Ventian, Paris, Luxor etc but what it lacks in that department it more than makes up for with style. And actually, it was nice being able to walk around places like the Venetian and Bellagio (which were swarming with people) and to then come back to the Aria which was a little quieter although still having a great buzz to it. The hotel is brand new and looks incredibly well finished. We checked in without any queue and headed straight to our room which was kitted out with all the latest mod-cons. Everything was controlled by a hand held terminal which operated the radio, TV, curtains, lights etc. The room was a really good size and the bed was extremely comfortable. The only complaint I could make (and hence why this is not a 5/5 review) was that the rooms were not that well sound proofed and one night in particular the noise was very disturbing. However, this is to be expected in Vegas I suppose. The hotel has some great places to eat including the sports bar which did burgers and mexican food, a tapas bar and there is also a really good pizzeria in the conference centre next door. The hotel operates a train that runs to the Bellagio which is also really handy. The casino has a great atmosphere and the croupiers are very friendly. However, if you are on a budget all the tables are very expensive to play and you are better off heading to Paris or even the Stratosphere which had cheaper tables. ($5 blackjack), The hotel buffet was rated one of the best in Vegas and I can see why! We went for the brunch option which had unlimited champagne (which they were very liberal with!). The buffet catered for all tastes and the food was of a high standard. We also bought tickets to see Viva Elvis at the Aria which was expensive but worth every penny. Such a slick production and non stop entertainment and action whilst still managing to tell the moving tale of Elvis' life. If I went back to Vegas I would certainly stay here again. Stay here, walk into the gimmicky over crowded hotels and then go back to the Aria!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in the ARIA in April and thought I would write a review to quosh any bad thing syou may have read. I have been to Vegas a few times now and by a long margin this is the best hotel I have stayed in! Upon arrival the check in desks were VERY busy however this didn't stop us being checked in in record time. As the queue got bigger, more positions opened! The room was amazing, we had a standard queen room with a view and we couldn't have asked for more. It is one of the more expensive hotels but it is worth paying the extra. A short walk to the lift and your on the cosino floor. ARIA doesn't seem to get as busy in the evening as other casinos on teh strip due to the fact that is set slightly back from the strip (a 2 minute walk) and I imagine people either dont know its there or just walk into a casino with a door that is actually on the strip. This isnt a bad thing though as late evening other casinos are rammed and its very hard to get to a table. ARIA seemed to always haev space and was just busy enough to create the perfect atmosphere. During our trip we attempted to go into every casino on the strip (no easy task when we were only there for 4 days!) and nothing comared to the ARIA. We have booked to go again in April 2012 for a week this time with a large group of friends. They are all staying in a different hotel as it was slightly cheaper however the people that stayed in the ARIA are staying there again. Nothing compares! As you can tell I liked it a lot. Stay here and you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Business trip to the Aria”
Reviews.Author: niceep
Reviews.Content: LOVED the hotel/resort itself. Room was gorgeous, loved the "control panel" that controls everything in the room. I could have honestly have never left the resort, plenty of restaurants, shopping connected to the building and within the bldg. It's a bit of a walk to the strip but is connected to Bellagio and Monte Carlo. I would definitely stay here again. Did not have an opportunity to use the pool. It seemed a bit too crowded everytime I looked out there. The beds were very comfortable!!! The only problem I had was the distance between the rooms and the conference center. I literally walked probably 3/4 of a mile to the conference every day. Yes, it was indoor but still!

Reviews.Title: “new kid on the block”
Reviews.Author: vegasbud
Reviews.Content: Vegas has a new kid on the block with Aria. My wife & I stayed here for 7 nights in October and found it to be an amazing property. We loved the amazing bed, the bathroom, the way the windows are (very clever design to give fab views) the entertainment and control console, super fast wi-fi - we could not fault anything. We have always found Aria to have one of the best drinks service of any hotel on the strip and not a bad return on the slots also. All staff encountered were pleasant and efficient, even check in took less than 10mins. I can appreciate what other members have said about it not being right on the strip but once you know the short cuts its very quick to get to the strip, Monte Carlo, Cosmopolitan ect. As for people saying it takes 10mins from your room to the elavator - they must have had way too many mojitos !!! we were in the middle and I would say it took 1-2 mins. I've read other reviews saying about the price of restaurants or the bars - its a 5* property what do you expect, a Macdonalds or Dicks Last Resort in the middle of it !!! - I don't think so. A 5min walk to the Monte Carlo or CVS will take care of any cheap eats ect. The pool is the jewel in the crown i feel, great beds, towels, music not too loud, free water, the beds aren't crowded, there are parasols (very rare in Vegas), shaded areas - I could go on & on, so well designed and a beautiful place to spent a few relaxing hours away from the madness !! Please don't listen to any poor reviews, come and make your own mind up. I think some people come expecting a high level of personal service as its a 5*, but with over 4000 rooms this just isn't going to happen ( its Vegas ) just come and have a good time and dont moan about small petty things - I prefer my pillows harder, I prefer my shower like this or that, the window was dirty, its too far from the lift, I dont like the smell - stop trying to find faults or just stay at home!!!!

Reviews.Title: “High tech room, soft bed, forget pool side”
Reviews.Author: limemeat
Reviews.Content: We went with three other couples, two of which also stayed in the Aria. The rooms are impressive when first unlocked; the shades, music plays, dramatic entrance. His and hers closet and separate commode area all nice touches. The shower was spacious. I didn't care for the bed as it was too soft for our preference. 2/3 couples did not care for the 'marshmallow bed' as we nicknamed it. We were on the poolside on the 16th floor. If you are and like to take a nap during the day, forget about it. The pulsating music from below is just enough to keep you from drifting off. That said the pool wonderful and a welcome respite; well shaded in spots for those who have skin that burns instead of tans. The high tech room had a panel by the bed that controlled everything from light switches and temperature to the TV. It took some getting used to but was also good fun to figure out. All in all Aria was a nice place to stay and City Center is something to see. With so many choices in Vegas though, I'd likely choose somewhere else next time. P.S. There is a "convenience charge" above and beyond the quoted prices when booking of $20 a day. It covers internet and a newspaper that you have to go down and get on your own. We were all annoyed by the extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Teeter21
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a Sunday morning and lines were really long but seemed to move pretty quick. We didn't ask for an upgrade and were given our room keys immediately at 10:30 am. Our room was on the 4th floor about 5 doors down from the elevator. Of course we didn't have much of a view, but the room was great. Loved all the technology with the lights, curtains, etc. Loved the bathroom with the tub on the other side of the shower, I want to do that at my home!! We had one small issue....after checking in and looking at everything, I noticed an open bottle of Fiji water with half missing. I called the desk to make sure we were't charged $8 for the water. We weren't charged, but how did housekeeping miss throwing that away?? I really loved everything about the Aria except the fact that it did seem a very long walk to get anywhere on the strip! I also didn't love the fact that there really isn't anywhere cheat to eat. We ended up walking over to the Monte Carlo for our cheap lunches or breakfasts. We did use the pool one day and it was really nice....loved how they have several pools and there was no problem getting chairs together. Pool scene was very quiet and relaxing! I'd definitely stay there again if we got a great deal like we did this time.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality chic hotel, great location, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: Paulh616
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria in June on our 7th trip to Vegas having seen it being built over last few visits. Well located, practically mid-strip, the Aria is a stunning hotel with a sleak and chic finish throughout. The gaming area is smart and stylish, usual slots are available, although there are no 'value' tables. The bedrooms are great quality and we found the technology easy to use and functional. In room 'secret safe' was very useful. Other nice touches are quality towels and luxurious bedding. There is a great gym and all the usual ameneties with a few extras, most notably a great general shop selling pretty much everything. Have always found this a problem in Vegas and previously had to go to CVS or Wallgreens to buy essentials, but not here. Range of restaurants is very good and the steak house, although expensive, was great quality. There is however, a price to pay for all this quality - and you do have to pay... a lot. You will go through a lot of money if you eat at any of the hotel eateries including the buffet. Bar drinks are also slightly more expensive than other hotels we have stayed at. That said, the Aria is far superior in all areas - particularly service and the bedrooms, to the Bellagio at a similar price. No hesitation - will stay here again but need to start saving now

Reviews.Title: “For the price, I'd stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: thecase33
Reviews.Content: Aria does really well with the top end, but it seems to miss on some of the small things. Overall ambiance and smell of the casino area are nice. Rooms are awesome, and decent size, but towels are scratchy and the service is pretty average. Also, the casino, while on the strip, is really a half block back... so walking to other casinos usually takes a while to navigate through the mall. Sports Book is tiny. If you want to watch a game, getting there 1.5 hours early is not enough. Lines for EVERYTHING were long. Lunch/coffee places had lines 20-30 people long it seemed like at all times. For my money, I wouldn't pay the premium to stay at Aria again. I'd pay less and stay elsewhere (Mandalay, MGM, etc), or pay the same and stay at somewhere like Wynn or Belagio.

Reviews.Title: “A gambler's point of view”
Reviews.Author: Cathy0411
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Vegas for years and always stay at an MGM property. My room and food is always comped because I gamble a lot of my stay. Most of the reviews I have read about Aria do not mention much about the casino, so I will focus my review mostly on the gambling part of the trip for those of you like me that come to Vegas to GAMBLE. The Casino is avgerage size. Not as big as MGM, but bigger than Bellagio. I never found myself bored in it with many options on the slot machines. A lot of old favorites like Blazing 7's and Quick Hit, but a lot of new machines that I have never seen before as well. The thing I noticed the most was that no one was hitting the smaller progressive jackpots ($1000+). The biggest pay out I hit was $600. That is very unusual and I would have thought I was just unlucky this trip, but no one else was winning either. I heard other people talking about it too. I did not play the tables, but the minimums I saw were $10 during the day and $25 at night. I had a corner suite and it was wonderful. I had no problems with all the controls for drapes, TV, etc. You just need to take a few minutes to figure it out and you will be fine. I wish I could have taken the bathroom home with me. It was perfect. I have read a lot of people saying that it is a 5 minute walk from the elevator. They must have been crawling on floor if that was the case. I had the room furthest from the elevator and it took 62 seconds to walk to the elevator. I spent some time at the pools. I was surprised the chairs did not have cushions considering the high quality of the hotel. There are 3 pools. I suggest if you do not have kids and do not want to be around them... go to the last pool down the walk. It seemed like all the families stayed at the first two pools. Service for drinks was great. They came by aften and brought your drink back quickly. During the week you can get a cabana for $200 (weekends $350) which is a pretty good deal. The only thing negative was that the only food the servers would bring to you was a turkey sandwich or a chicken wrap. If you wanted anything else you had to walk to breezes and get it yourself. they could make a lot more money if they served a better selection at the pool. I ate at several places at the hotel... Julian Serano, American Fish, Union, Cafe Vettro and room service. All were great. I went to the buffet one morning for breakfast, but they wouldnt let me in because I didnt have my I.D. with me which is crazy because in all the other places I ate in they never asked me for I.D. (Long walk to the buffet, so I just went back to my room and ordered room service). Overall, I was satisfied with my stay at Aria. Not sure if I will stay there again just because of the poor pay off in the casino. I'm used to at least one big $4K -5K payoff per trip and did not get it here. That influences where I stay a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at Aria”
Reviews.Author: PatUNH1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights at a conference in October. I really liked the lobby and layout of the shops, restaurants, gym, etc. Very compact relative to most of the large Vegas hotels. The gym was fantastic- one of the nicest I have seen. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The rooms was very nice and high tech as the hotels claims. While it was nice to have electronic controls for pretty much everything, I felt that the controls could be far more intuitive. Being in my 30's, I couldn't see anyone over the age of 55 being able to navigate the multiple menu options. The bathroom was nice, but the water pressure in the shower was lacking. Overall, it would be hard to be unhappy here, but I personally prefer the Bellagio, Wynn, or Venetian/Palazzo over the Aria in terms of the hotel. If my expectations were slightly lower, I would probably have given this a 5 star TA rating, but I expect a bit more from a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for a visit to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Waitingforvacation
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Las Vegas for a conference, and stayed at the Aria. It was my second time at this property, and it is my favorite place to stay in Vegas. It has the feel of a W Hotel, with lots of dark woods, modern feel. The rooms are very quiet, elegant (although not oversized), and very high tech. When you enter the room, the curtains part, the TV comes on with Spa styled music playing. It is a large property, and you can have a long walk from the elevator to your room because of the unique design of the property. It is part of the City Center Complex, which has a very different feel from the rest of the strip, like a modern city block versus the tackiness of the classic Strip casinos. The Pool, Spa, and Casino are all top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Fun as a new car”
Reviews.Author: DrJonz
Reviews.Content: The room was as fun as getting a new car. I walk in and the curtains open and lights and TV come on, with my name on the TV and a menu system to control everything via remote. Another similar touch screen by the bed has the same menu system on it. Great views from the hotel's central location on the strip. And the bed was heaven. Quiet room. Check in at the lobby was pretty slow, but that's my only complaint. The casino is surrounded by amazingly gorgeous, upscale restaurants. The architecture and design leaves you in awe. It's one of the quieter casinos on the strip. I lost my USB charger for my phone, but the concierge was able to charge it for me. I'd love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay...but stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: BeachesOrBust
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this resort. Our flight got in late so we opted to stay at a closer hotel to the airport and a cheaper one. The first hotel we stayed at was amazing (La Quinta South)...i couldn't say better things about that hotel...24hr shuttle to the airport/strip, free hot breakfast, 24hr pool and very clean. We were pretty excited to be staying at Aria, but we were pretty disappointed in the stay. Not what we expected. So here is what we found: Good location, nice rooms, beautiful resort and friendly staff. What we didn't like: pool was only open from 9am-6pm, room shampoo/amenties were not good, boring atmosphere, not much going on in casino/hotel, expensive, no free shuttle or airport pick up. The hotel was okay, it was clean, nice decor and very comfy beds, but overall it was not worth the price. We would not stay again at this hotel..there were far nicer ones on the strip for a lower cost. Save your money and stay somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Loved Aria. Perfect holiday!”
Reviews.Author: cuteontariocouple
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort! I worried a bit about parking and being set back from the strip, but it was never an issue. The self parking was super easy. If you park on the 2nd level you can walk right into the casino, otherwise you take an elevator down to the bridge. We arrived at around 9pm and had booked a non-smoking King room. There was no line at check-in. We had an older male clerk who was super friendly. I’d mentioned in the reservation it was our anniversary and he said happy anniversary. He said all he had available in non smoking was 2 queens or a King smoking on a low floor. I was very worried because we had to accept a smoking room last year for one night and it was unbearable. But he made a call and got us a King non-smoking on the 39th floor. (I was so happy at the time and just loved the room, but now that I think about it, why did he have to make a call instead of just being able to give us the room we booked? I don’t understand hotels sometimes.) We both just adored the room. It was very, very spacious. We loved the bathroom layout and the electronics. We were able to master it quickly and had no trouble until our last day when we couldn’t get the TV to work. No big deal though. Our view was of Vdara, Cosmo and Rio and the Palms in the distance. During the day we could see the Vdara and Cosmo pools below. We loved the robes and the bed was very comfortable. Service was great we had tons of towels. We generally left the room between 9 and 11am and when we came back after 5 our room was always clean. Except one day we were in the room until almost noon and it wasn’t cleaned by 6 but we went down to the pool for ½ an hour and it was done when we got back. The pool was nice. The first morning we went down at 8:30 thinking it would be open but it didn’t open until 9. There was a big crowd lined up when we came back at 9. The 3 pools are all about 3.5 feet deep. Early in the week they were not too busy. On the weekend they were much busier but we never had a problem getting a seat. We only went after 4pm though. I used the spa, just the facility pass, and I loved it. It was just gorgeous and the service was excellent. We ate at Sage for our anniversary. We had a great prix fixe menu with wine and beer pairings. It was a wonderful experience. Delicious food and great service. We also got coffee at the coffee place and had Happy Hour at Todd English PUB next door. We would pop through the convenient entrance to Monte Carlo and use their food court just for a snack occasionally. The casino at Aria was really fun. Drink service was the best we had anywhere on the strip and the drinks were tasty! They have lots of new, fun slots in the casino. We also used the tram to get to Bellagio and cut through the Crystals mall to get to Cosmopolitan and across to Planet Hollywood. Normally I like to stay at new places in Vegas but we would love to stay at Aria again! One of the nicest places we have ever stayed!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stegar001
Reviews.Content: The first time I went to Vegas I stayed at the Paris Hotel. This time my wife and I spent 4 nights at the Aria. There is no comparison. The Aria is new, fresh, so clean, the technology is the latest, and the service everywhere was fantastic. If I go to Vegas again there is only one place that I will be staying at - the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay!!!!!! Don't do it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Makeupbyhawiza
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? I am so angry, I am writing this review while I am still here!!! Don't stay in room 19239! Check-in - long wait!!! They finally open 2 more counters. The lady that checked us in wasn't very helpful. Bell desk - it took them more than 30 minutes to get our luggage. Our bell man was nice. Room - a five minute walk from the elevator to our room. Comfortable bed (the only good thing), filthy windows, high tech but nothing works properly. On the second night, everything (lights, curtains, television) stopped working. Nothing would turn off. Called front desk at around 11 and they told us that it will take 15 minutes to "reset" the room. 30 minutes later, still not working. Call again and they told us another 30 minutes and the person on the phone told me I just have to wait. We finally went to sleep with everything still on. At 12:30am, we got a wake-up call from the front desk to check if everything was working properly. The answer was no since we kept hearing the automatic curtains trying to "reset". Casino - nothing under $10 minimum which was ok but you "HAVE" to bet a $25 minimum on tables to get the points on your mlife card. Drink service took forever!!! Security - not very secure since I lost the $400 that I left in my suitcase. Couldn't find the safe that was hiding in the nightstand next to the bed. Filed a report with Patrick (nice guy). They told me management will get back to me in 3 business days. I will get back to you on what they say. "5 stars" hotel with a 2 stars service. Had better service at a Holiday Inn!!!

Reviews.Title: “Aria is a winner!!”
Reviews.Author: PurrcyCat
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our second stay at this resort and I loved it just as much the second time if not more. We booked a corner suite through hotels.com, which was half the price of booking through the hotel directly. We also received a $75 credit that we could us at certain places such as Elements and the buffet. The hotel is off the strip a bit but not too far – just a couple minute walk. I love the location as it is close to City Centre, the Vdara (where our friends were staying) and the Cosmopolitan, which is also a super nice hotel. You can also get to the Monte Carlo quickly through the back of the casino. We arrived at the Aria on a Saturday around 6pm by limo (we were celebrating my hubby’s 40th!) and were able to walk right up to the counter to check in. They gave us a beautiful suite on the 17th floor with a lovely view. The room did not come to life as we walked in like some other people experienced – the curtains did not open and the TV didn’t turn on and welcome us, but that was fine. We just hit the master switch and these things happened along with the lights turning on. The room is very hi-tech which is very cool and takes a bit of time to figure out but once you do it is great! You can turn off the TV, the lights and close the curtains all with the touch of one button. Pros: The staff is friendly and extremely helpful. The king-sized bed is ultra comfortable and was such a welcome after a long day of walking. The bathroom is huge with a jetted tub, a TV, two sinks and a toilet with special powers. The bedroom is huge and has a TV. The living room was great since we were there with another couple and we had them over for drinks prior to going out. It also has a TV. The resort has several excellent restaurants, a buffet, a coffee shop, a café, a large convenience store and many other amenities. I loved playing Batman in the casino. We ordered room service once and it was prompt and delicious. The pool is beautiful. Cons: I had to knock a star off just because there was a broken curtain in our room so when we tried to close it we had to keep hitting the button until it went all of the way. The TV in the bathroom did not work which didn’t worry me, but you’d think they’d fix these things. The maid service was inconsistent – they did come every time we put on the service button (I read other reviews about absent maid service, however, you do have to remember to put the service button on). However, they didn’t always put a towel in the spare bathroom for some reason, sometimes there was mouthwash, sometimes not, sometimes there was a paper on our front door – sometimes not. The first day we called for extra glasses and they brought us a menu instead. We did get the glasses so, no big deal. That’s about it for cons. I would definitely return to the Aria. In fact, we didn’t want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Poor security and management”
Reviews.Author: dawn s
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely, but management did very little to follow up on a complaint. While we were out of our room, an individual from maintenance stopped by to change a light in the bathroom. When we returned, someone drank water from our glasses, left a white powdery substance on our nightstand, and left knee high stockings in our bathroom. We were not offered to change rooms and management did not follow up with us based on numerous requests. I will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classy joint!”
Reviews.Author: Mike90275
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Clean fresh open look, friendly staff, and great places to take a meal. I don't think I ever walked pass an employee without them greeting you. The pool area is awesome, nice big, plenty of lounges (but a lack of shade). Poolside bar service is attentive. The rooms are new and stylish. I could do without the room control electronics --- great for you house, but the learning curve for a hotel room is a bit of a challenge. Nice bathroom, fun soaking tub and shower. Everything is clean, well kept. We had a minor problem with the TV; never took the time to call it n. Ran into a maintenance guy in the elevator and mentioned it to him. After all of these apologies, and of course the "why didn’t you complain" --- when we returned to our room later, we had a new TV. I seem to recall that prior to opening the advertisements said the casino was going to be smoking free. Apparently that didn't work out for them. But, it much better ventilated than most casinos, and tolerable. Room service was also a treat. Very attentive and well presented. Also the poolside restaurant was very nice. All in all an excellent visit --- and if you like Elvis don't miss the Cirque show "Viva Elvis." Also, amazing shopping opportunities, even if all you can afford is to do is look!

Reviews.Title: “FAVORITE hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: sugarcrisis
Reviews.Content: The first time I went to Vegas, I passed thru Aria by chance while sight seeing. We decided to book for our second time there already knowing it would be pricey ahead of time. So we planned waaaay ahead to get better deals. It was totally worth it! We are looking into getting a timeshare there eventually. The hotel smells AMAZING and is hip and modern. Even a basic deluxe room is decent for us commonfolk. It can be pricey but just check out their amazing deals ahead of time

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Aria”
Reviews.Author: Bro_Thomas
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Aria, I got a great deal through price line and we were interested to see what this place would be like. Our room was clean, modern and sophisticated. We enjoyed the Aria Express tram that takes you to the Bellagio and Montecarlo,... we had a great view of the strip and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Aria. All in all I would have no problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at ARIA”
Reviews.Author: kchartsf
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Aria in a corner suite. The room wasn't much more expensive and was well worth the additional space/sitting area. A wonderful room and view of the Vegas landscape/strip. City center is a great location. We did get locked out of our room (key didn't work) and it took 3 calls and more than 30 min for security to make their way up to let us in, which was not our favorite part of the trip. For our inconvenience, they waived our resort fee, which I thought was acceptable. Expedia had a $75 resort credit promotion which was nice. Lots of options for dining in the hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you're a high roller?”
Reviews.Author: cheekychubbychops
Reviews.Content: The Aria reminded me of being in Rodeo Drive - very nice to window shop but if you're not very rich you just have to watch everyone else pretending that they're having a good time.. Apparently we got a good deal on price, I don't know exactly what we paid for it. The rooms are very impressive. Lying on one of those beds is like being kissed by angels (I imagine). The public areas are immaculate, shiny and clinical. The complimentary breakfast was OK. There is a $15 minimum bet on the tables so we didn't gamble there. This was pretty common though, the fun element seems to have left the Strip and if we had time we would have gone down town. We opted for the $5 Excalibur tables where the atmosphere was much more fun and relaxing and we got more bang for our buck. I gave it a very good rating because it seems impressive and I'm a sucker for a great bed, I just don't want to ever stay there again. It's too up itself, has zero atmosphere and that smell just knocks me sick.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: melissa N
Reviews.Content: The price was fantastic, love how modern and new and clean everything is,the hotel smells like vanilla all the time so it helps get away that smoke from the casino that every hotel has. the food in there is amazing the pools are great and clean ,the help was fantastic for booking shows or anything you need. the bed was so comfy i could have slept al day. I WOULD DEF GO BACK LOVED IT

Reviews.Title: “Prestige hotel in Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: nipo
Reviews.Content: Very nice , new hotel in the mid south strip. We visit Las Vegas on October with 2 kids and liked the hotel. pros: the room- clean and high tech, big screen TV , excellent bathtub and comfortable beds - location in the middle of the south strip right next to new york and MGM and the show at the Balagio. - staff very helpful and nice cons:- the lobby is full with gambling machines and you have to go through the whole lobby coming out and in - the hotel is too big, it takes up to 10 min to get to the room from the lobby - they add resort fee like it is not part of the hotel price, since it is mandatory fee , it look like an extra tax, they should state it as the hotel price

Reviews.Title: “Aria Resort & Casino...Luxury, Comfort, Great Location & Casino, But A Few Service Issues Need To Be Addressed”
Reviews.Author: Mandirae
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at this beautiful & luxurious resort & casino. Both times we were really spoiled and worked out a stay in a one bedroom corner suite... thanks to our wonderful casino host. This room is pure luxury and indulgence. Among other incredible amenities, love the heated toilet seat and deep whirlpool soaking tube in the room size bathroom! There are floor to ceiling windows in the bedroom that extend to the living room with beautiful views of the mountains/city. Love the warm brown tones throughout the hotel,halls & rooms. The Aria is in a great central location and is connected to the Bellagio Hotel by a tram ride, , City Center with residential and other high end hotels and a high end mall. The Aria is the only hotel in City Center with a Casino.The Aria Casino is warm, inviting and vibrant. It is larger enough to play what you want,slots & table games,etc... without being too large, overwhelming or crowded. We have stayed at the Bellagio Resort many times, and we now prefer the Aria Resort. It is lower key great amenities & location,comfortable luxurious rooms, inviting casino & great restaurant. This is our place to stay in Vegas and we will definitely return soon. The Elvis Cirque du Soleil show is entertaining, but after seeing once,( in my opinion), is enough (unless you are a real Elvis fan). "O" , "Mystique" , and the Beatles "LOVE" are my favorites. As far as the service issue the check-in process can be a bit slow, depending on your timing. That also goes for the VIP line. I did not notice much of a difference, since they also took people off the regular line. Also no one available on the lobby floor assisting guest, i.e make sure quests on right line or assure that ONE line for all check-in/check-out staff. Unfortunately can get chaotic with people just cutting the lines without realizing or aware that there should be one line. They really need to have better organization with this issue. Hope they work on this and make some improvements. The Aria has the potential to have a 5 star rating with some service improvements. I have found that if you are a gamer and have a host, you will fare better in terms of the room choice, amenities and benefits. Also look out for special offers throughout the year. Remember to ask the hotel reservationist. Since they are fairly new and in competition with the surrounding hotels, they are anxious to draw in more people. Any questions or if additional information needed. Please don't hesitate to make contact.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: xmcd7
Reviews.Content: Took a boys trip for the weekend, the hotel was clean and very posh, will be returning next year

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Neets77
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Aria and will definitely be my last. We arrived at Aria on October 7th around 11pm. Our room was on the 11th floor directly facing the Cosmopolitan pool. Note: There is music played from the Cosmo pool all day with thumping bass that shakes the windows. I went to take a quick nap one evening around 4:30 and couldn't sleep. It wasn't a huge problem since we are rarely in the room during the day. For those who may need to be in the room during the day, i would request something on the opposite side of the hotel. Our room was the last room of the long hallway. A good 5 minute walk from the elevators. Our check in was fine. Once we arrived in the room we decided to start our night by doing a little gambling. We looked for the safe and were not able to find it in the room--in retrospect, we should have called downstairs but, thinking its a 5 star property we were not too worried. Note: the safe is located in the nightstand. So we took our gambling money for the night and left $1100 in our suitcase. Thankfully the remainder of the cash and our passports were hidden in my boyfriend's shoe---again we should have looked for the safe but didn't think much of leaving it inside our suitcase for the night. The next day I we went to grab a coffee and my boyfriend went upstairs to get some more money. Housekeeping was in the room so he asked him to leave while he went to get some money. When we went into the suitcase it was gone!! We were literally downstairs for 30 minutes! We called hotel security who took our statement and said they would investigate and give us a call back. Today is the 12th and I still have not heard back from anyone at ARIA. We will definitely NEVER stay here again. We spoke with a few of our taxi drivers who mentioned ARIA has a horrible reputation for money being stolen from rooms. Not sure how true this is but it did happen to us. I did give the review a star because I used the Spa facilities and had a great experience. the Signature massage was just amazing. A good way to relieve some tension after being robbed!!

Reviews.Title: “Hot times at Aria”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeSam13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Aria during some of the year's hottest days! We took advantage of a summer room special and were joined by another couple as the husbands were celebrating their birthdays which fell on the same day. I had previously submitted our room requests and when the check-in lady learned that we chose Aria for our birthday celebration, spent about 30 minutes with us looking for an available upgrade and arranging a welcome gift. This first contact with the hotel was so positive that we looked forward to seeing if the rest of our experience would be the same. We were astounded by the upgraded room we were shown into as the curtains opened to reveal a gorgeous city view - it was like looking at a HD screen, especially at night. A lovely gift of chocolate-covered fruit also greeted us, as did a bottle of champagne in an ice bucket. After negotiating the "electrics" of the room (everything is remotely operated by buttons/switches) we quickly settled down to enjoy a truly lovely room. Surprisingly though, there were no in-room coffee/tea making facilities. We found the casino and restaurant staff friendly and genuine and appreciated the rapid response of staff on the casino floor, be it for slot help or drinks orders. While I seemed to have "recycled" most of my winnings, my wife and our friends reported a somewhat more profitable experience! Access to the amenties was excellent and we especially enjoyed the beautiful pool area but could have done without the loud booming music emanating from the Liquid Pool. The Aria has succeeded in creating a beautiful and pleasing atmosphere with its decor, furnishings and a host of seemingly "invisible" improvements which all add up to a great resort experience. For our stay, there were a couple of unpleasant "glitches" which we put down to the newness of the Resort but when we advised Guest Services of the same, they responded quickly and fully - a class act! The Aria is truly a lovely Resort and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “I Like Aria Alot!”
Reviews.Author: BigCountryBoi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Aria several times and I like it alot! Love the cool hip rooms and the service! The location is good, the mall is perfect and it is the perfect modern hotel for a Vegas Trip! The security at the room entrance is a plus and I have never had a bad time there! The skybox cafe is delicious with big meals. The connecting monorail to Bellagio is nice and the connecting walkway to Monte Carlo is nice! Aria room prices are also cheaper than their competition. If you are players card member you can usually get 3 nights free and additional night around $159 or under! If you are looking for a cool modern place check out Aria!

Reviews.Title: “5-star price with 2-star service”
Reviews.Author: Zitallis L
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to LV two weeks ago and stayed with Aria. Having reading many positive reviews online, I decided to give it a shot, although I, myself, have always been a loyal customer with Wynn. This was our FIRST family trip, and it was also my mom and aunt's first time to Vegas, so I was expecting Aria, as a "5-star" hotel, would be able to provide great customer service and give my mom and aunt a very pleasant LV memory. Sadly it was all disappointed!! 1. It was a Friday, and I expected that hotel to be super busy. However we reserved two rooms with two beds. Then they said there was no availability for tww-bed room! I paid for the price and I paid for my rooms!!! Okay, my for the other room. They said they needed charge EXTRA!!!!!!! In general that's the case, but not when I paid for the price of TWO-BEDS ROOMS!!!!! 2. When we went to our rooms, several lights were out at both rooms. They had their technician came up in 30 minutes and changed the light bulbs. We found out there were no coffee machine in the room, so I called and asked if we could have one. They said they would need to charge for "renting" that coffee machine! 3. The following night, we decided to try the buffet at Aria because it did look like a good buffet at around $35 per person. Well food was not bad, nothing too surprising, but Wynn is still the BEST among all. It was the SERVICE that drove me nuts! My mother and my aunt went in and got their seat. My uncle, my sister, and I then went to the buffet restaurant and joined them. First the cashier lady told us we needed to get a ticket before going in there. I understood, so I told her that I would like to find my other parties and made sure that they had arrived. The cashier lady was nice and fine. My sister followed me, and there was an American-African lady came out and stopped her and said, "This isn't a shopping mall, madam!" to my sister!!!!!!! That was very very rude of her to say such thing! When my sister asked for a manager, she said she was the one! Oh well, I calmed my sister down and told her to let go for the moment, since there wasn't anything we could really do at that moment. 4. That same night, when we were heading back to our room, passing the check-in counters. I went and asked for a band-aid, thinking it would be a quick easy thing that they could do. That girl told me there was a "store" next to whatever that name was and told me that I could get band-aids there! WTF! A FIVE-STAR HOTEL???? REALLY??? You dont have ONE band-aid?????? I was very upset and disappointed. It was supposed to be a very unforgettable and pleasant trip for my mom for her birthday and for my aunt who just survived through breast cancer! And it was ALL RUINED!!!!!!! The very last day when I spoke to their Assitant Front Desk Manager, she seemed nice, patient, and understanding, she then promised she would get back to me personally and would investigate the whole thing. Well I did receive the email few days after the trip, and it offered a "free ungrade" to the corner suite and is "based on availability and excludes holidays." Look I receive such special offer from Wynn all year round!!! All I can say, Aria is NOT worth the money spent!!!!!! I am VERY DISSATISFIED AND DISAPPOINTED at Aria's customer service! It should NOT be rated a 5-star!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ARIA Resort & Casino”
Reviews.Author: Vivian V
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Vegas, staying at Aria for 2 weekend nights,10/8-10/10. Used to stay at Vdara in previous trip, was impressed about its delux suit's contemporary high-end design, we chose Aria since it is rated better than Vdara, just for a trial. Pros: - Delux room, to compare with Vdara's, has almost same contemporary design, clean and spotless. - Room service is OK, down turn service is OK, provided more than enough towels for party of 2. As long as all used towels are on the floor instead of being hung on the hooks, they'll replace them. I was a bit concerned when reading the previous reviews, but somehow I believe hotel room service is quite standard. - Check-in service was OK with, no complaint, we were able to check-in quickly because I was calling in earlier for reservation. Front desk was nice, helpful, same as concierge, especially Lisa. Cons: - Delux room, to compare with Vdara's, is quite smaller, narrow space, and no options for strip view or Bellagio's fountain view at all. I requested upgrades with strip views or higher floor , both by phone, before and at arrivals, but failed. Corner suites were also booked up. - The buffet has poor quality, almost same price with Bellagio's and other 5-start hotel's but not same quality. We had lunch buffet around noon time, not off-hour but option was quite limited. - The Wifi was slow and same as TV. Spoiled by Vdara service (intranet cable was provided in the room, wifi was pretty fast), I didn't bring extra cable this time. Guess what, you'll have to pay if want to use intranet cable for faster service. I ended up using Iphone to check work email. If you're not going to Vegas for gambling, or preferring nightlife activities, but love high tech design, go with Vdara. It's quieter, closer to Bellagio which has good food and other entertainment options.

Reviews.Title: “This is it!”
Reviews.Author: Steve8010
Reviews.Content: Absolutely stunning .. this is what you would describe this hotel as. It is definitely one of the new(er) hotels on the strip and is within a stone's throw of all of the other casinos and hotels along the strip. The entrance is grand and the facade is beautiful. The hotel and casino are on a grand scale (like everything in Vegas) and our room was located on the far end of the floor. So, it took a little while to get to the room itself but once there - luxury all the way! Everything from the automatic blinds to the rainshower/oversized bath were amazing. The bed was just incredibly comfortable and made for a great sleep after trapsing around the sights. Absolutely recommend... Definitely one of the best hotel rooms I've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel amenities, slight service issues for those of us that aren't VIPs, overall enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: A-Max30
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas with a large group for a Kickball tournament and had an issue with the filthy room at the hotel that our entire group was booked at through the event. I called the Aria on Friday morning for a room that night through Sunday. I was given the same the same rate even though it was a late booking which was fantastic. A few others in our group were also staying at this hotel. There was a slight issue with the room type booked as a King instead of two queens which was frustrating but the hotel quickly offered a rollaway at no additional expense. The rooms were exceptional! Clean, comfy beds and linens and robes. The room was equipped with a remote that could do everything from open and close the curtains, operate the tv, the lights, lamps and set alarms. Check out was quick and we had no problems with unexpected charges. I would definitely recommend this hotel to to others!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to go before going to Afghanistan!”
Reviews.Author: kp7j4x
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria with a friend before I deployed to Afghanistan a few months ago. I got a special rate through the MGM M-Life program that included free play, a great room rate, as well as buy one get one free MGM show tickets. Hotel was very easy to find and get to, Valet was very quick and efficient. Check-in was also very quick and efficient. As I like views, I asked for a high floor, it really did not matter what I viewed I just wanted a high floor. I ended up on the 3rd floor. I asked if I could get a higher floor but was advised the hotel was booked full(It was a Monday through Thursday stay. The room was very nice, and very advanced. The wifi was easy and responsive, and was available throughout the hotel. The bed was quite comfortable, and the bathroom was very nice. The pool was great and the poolside service was prompt and efficient. The casino slots were a tad tight, but its the strip, if you want lose slots go to Freemont street. One very important tip though........There is back entrance to this hotel. When traffic is heavy on the strip there is a road that runs paralell to the strip that has an entrance to Aria as well as City Center. This entrance has a Valet and proved to be quite convenient!!!! I wish though I could get the air freshener that they have in the lobby here in Afghanistan!!! Also this hotel is not as Casino oriented as most hotels on the strip, it seems to have found a nice balance! I would also venture to say if your traveling to Vegas with children this would be a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Aria Resort & Casino”
Reviews.Author: JordanK11
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Aria Resort & Casino. The room was spacious and clean with a contemporary look. The staff at check-in were pleasant, helpful and patient. It did get crowded at check-out since everyone seemed to be checking out at the same time. However the staff handled the situation as best they could. The casino was clean and inviting. The shops on the casino floor were a good attraction. The cafe offered a variety of choices for all meals and snacks. It was nice that the shopping center was right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: billyhoo
Reviews.Content: We made reservations online at an excellent price and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The fully-automated room was grand, with a beautiful view of the mountains west of Vegas. THe bedding was first class and lead to a good night's rest. We are not gamblers, but the casinoo appeared nice. THe shops in City Center are fun to stroll through. We had a delightful meal at the restaurant Sirio in the hotel. At checkout there were no surprises the bill was exactly what we expected. All-in-all we look forward to a return visit before long.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuy2000
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the review of a friend who had stayed there recently and I was not dissapointed. It isTHE new place to stay on the strip. I had the entry level room as I was travelling on business and it was excellent. New, clean and high tech. The hotel Spa was the best I have ever seen or experienced in my travels. The hotel / resort really did have everything and is in a great central location. I know a number of other friends who have also stayed there and everyone has reported a great experience. You really can't go wrong, just look out fo a good online rate as they can fluctuare by 300% night by night depending on what else is happening in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern hotel central on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: adamreeddesign
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay. The hotel and rooms are beautifully designed incorporated with the latest technology (e.g., touchpad by the bed to control the TV, curtains, lighting, etc.). Fabulous bathroom! Floor to ceiling windows provided amazing views. Friendly staff and good service. Great central location made it easy to walk or ride the tram to each end of the Strip. Good restaurant options.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: logansgramma2009
Reviews.Content: i just got back from Vegas, stayed at the Aria, this is one of the nicest rooms i have been in, I stayed in a corner suite, there was nothing I could say bad about anything from the wonderful bed to the heated toilet seat . The room was spotless and had service twice a day, the chocolate they left at night were fantastic The gaming floor had lots of choice for slot machines, tons of tables and a lot of friendly people. The restaurants were mainly very good, had a small issue at one but overall the food and service were great,. The only reason i am not giving this a 5 star rating was the servers on the gaming floor they were very hard to find and not around very often, they did not talk or even really smile but had there hand out immedialtily for there tip, luckily i did tip but one gentleman beside me was upset it took an hour to get a drink did not ,tip when the server came back she did not take an order from him,. I guess I am just stuck on the fact that tipping as far as I know is optional, I have not yet seen anything to tell me that they passed a law making it mandatory. This was a small issue and did not spoil my trip, i would go back in a minute .and stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Views from 52nd Floor Corner Suite”
Reviews.Author: ESHORVAT
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Aria several times since opening in December 2009 and they have spoiled my accommodation expectations forever! High quality EVERYTHING and you truly enjoy your stay IN your room. We were fortunate enough to get a corner suite on the 52nd floor and the views were spectacular and it was difficult to leave such a plush and luxurious room. The casino is one of the best because it doesn’t feel like your typical Vegas casino nor does it smell like one either – fresh vanilla scented luxury! ~ The Horvat Family, Utah

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bryan-P-C
Reviews.Content: Shares a 2 bedroom sky suites penthouse with another couple - we were both celebrating anniversaries. 55th floor - dizzyingly high! Excellent layout, all very modern, shame no way of heating water in the room for tea/coffee seeing as there was a kitchen! Nice that both rooms were masters and very large bathrooms. Beds were hugely comfortable. The hotel itself is big - what else. Different form a lot of the chinz of other older hotels. Far more modern. Good sized pool are with 3 pool and a private adults pool(for payment). gets pretty busy but the staff are looking for spaces of those who have left all the time. One complaint pool never got deeper that 3'6"-4'. Is this health and safety gone mad? So they were more wading pools than for swimming. Good selection of restaurants - we only ate in the Thai which was very good indeed. All in all I would stay there again if visting.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: DBinYak
Reviews.Content: Problem 1: Didn't honor the room type request of king non smoking. Stuck me in a double queen on what turned out to be a smoking floor. Problem 2: The smoking room was disgustingly dirty. The bathroom and foyer floor had splatters of something I'm telling myself was only coffee and a dirty shoeprint in front of the also dirty looking toilet. No trash bin in the entire room. Problem 3: Room switch was inconvenient. The correct king non smoking room type was also at the very end of the tower. A good 4 minute walk from the elevators each time you came and went. Problem 4: At 9:30 a.m. while playing a slot machine in the casino, being solicited by a prostitute. Problem 5: Management response to this was to offer only a room credit for the first night. Result: I'll never stay here or another MGM property again. This was not at all a first class or resort experience. This was without a doubt my worst trip ever to Vegas and for being what is billed as an upper end hotel, it felt like a sleazy cheap low end off strip experience. If this hotel can't find a non smoking room in a hotel with 4000 rooms for a guest and can't keep the hookers out of its casino, all the pretty decor isn't going to save the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great new addition to las vegas”
Reviews.Author: rammenon
Reviews.Content: Aria is a new hotel in the City center Complex right on the strip. The hotel is touted as one of the greenest in the world and the it delivers. A welcome change from garish lobbies, over priced stores and smoky walkways through the main casino which is usually Vegas at its best. The convention center is well situated/ lots of light and the typical Vegas convention of sitting in artificial light all day was not missed. The rooms are well designed without being over the top. Nice views. The Sky suites are especially muted. The technology and slick- reminded me of Hongkong or Dubai, where the flat panel works on the first click and wireless internet is smooth. Some wonderful new restaurants and being at a conference, the in house food delivered during the conference was edible. They have an interesting new gelato store in the main hallway and even the buffet style restaurant is shorn of Vegas blandishments of 9.99 " all you can eat buffet" trimmings or day old salads. All in all a stylish new addition to the strip, which is worth a stay. Only point to note: As with all vegas hotels- if you ever order room service on a hungry stomach be prepared to wait 60 minutes- that has not changed. But then its Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dukes24-7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Perfectly located in the city centre complex with direct access to the new shopping centre and the Cosmopolitan. Because this hotel is new, it has a great modern feel to it and casino is bright and funky, and also the hotel smells great. Room was a decent size and extremely modern, and lifts were quick and simple. The bed was the best bed I have ever slept in Plenty of restaurant choices, we ate in Lemongrass many times. Pool areas are huge and plenty of chairs available. For the price Aria is a great deal. Obviously not as lush at the Encore, but better located and a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice!”
Reviews.Author: melbournetravellers
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Vegas & thank god we chose Aria! We spent 4 nights at the hotel and we really loved our room, the bathroom & the views. It wasn't until we walked through some of the other hotels that we were so thankful to be staying at Aria! Most of the hotels in Vegas are old and tired...and they stink of smoke!! The pools at Aria were great, but a little over crowded for our liking so we didn't spend much time there. We ate at Lemon Grass Thai restaurant which was fantastic and we ate at Jean George Steak Restaurant which was very expensive but the steak was amazing! We were also given a $40 voucher to use at the Buffet which we used on our first night...I am not a huge fan of the buffet as I feel like I am having dinner in a food court but I have to say the food was very good quality and there was plenty to choose from! The only negative I had was the service..but apparently thats normal for Vegas! I had to ring house cleaning 4 times to get my bathroom vacuumed, as it was not done when we got into our room and still had someone else's hair all over the floor! Very frustrating! Vegas wasn't my scene at all & I certainly wouldn't go back - but I would recommend Aria to anyone going. Also - a MUST do is Mix Bar at The Hotel (next to Mandalay Bay)- views are AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jamesmac32
Reviews.Content: great hotel and amazing rooms! The view from my room (11th floor) was incredible with a view of the desert and mountains. State of the art rooms and the probably the biggest bathroom I have ever seen! I would highly recommend this hotel if you're looking to go to Vegas! It's relatively close to everything on the strip as well which is great! Beautiful swimming pool and great gym! I didnt try the hotel spa myself but it looked really nice and, from what I hear, it is supposed to be really nice! I was there for a conference and the conference facilities were top notch as well (1200 people and the execution was flawless which is rather impressive!)! on the flipside: this is Vegas so the mantra is 'bigger and flashier is better'! If you buy into this then Aria is the place for you! The resort is huge which means that everything can seem a bit impersonal (but hey, it's Vegas right!?!)..!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, personable staff.”
Reviews.Author: sharon820
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. We stayed 2 nights after trip to grand canyon. Location on the strip is good, especially liked the tram to other hotels. Rooms are roomy and very clean. Staff very helpful and friendly. A little pricey for most Vegas hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend getaway at Aria”
Reviews.Author: mdlvc
Reviews.Content: Came here with a discounted rate and was not disappointed. Checked in early at noon and was told that room was not ready. We were ok since we arrived around lunch, so we decided to grab something to eat and come back. But, after a few seconds, the lady assisting us at check-in said, a room just became available on the 18th floor. Great for us as we got to freshen up before heading out to eat. Our room was overlooking the pool at the Cosmopolitan Resort and we can see part of the strip as well, not bad at all. The rooms are very spacious and I love the techy, modern feel of the room. You can control and access everything through a remote on your bedside. I found this easy and convenient but it may be confusing to other folks who are not used to operating electronic gadgets. I love the spacious bath with a separate bath tub/shower and toilet area. Plush robes and comfy chairs were a great plus. Staff overall was friendly. Great restaurants (dined at Lemon grass and the Aria buffet) and easy access to everything plus you're right in the center of the strip. The spa was out of this world and was truly an experience worth having. The only thing I wasnt impressed about was the pool area, it just lacked character and nothing to really rave about. Other than that, we had a great time and will be back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexonboard
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in new downtown area of Las Vegas. This hotel was gorgeous and the casino was not as overpowering as it is in some other hotels. The breakfast/pastry bar was fantastic and being near the crystal shops was dangerous (in a good way!). Rooms were large, high tech and very luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Great style, Green and efficient”
Reviews.Author: Willem54
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, perfect beds and high tech room features that are user friendly. Excellent restaurants and bars, but avoid the buffet as the value for money does not match up to the other restaurants at the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely did NOT disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: MrsCombs
Reviews.Content: Check-in: Quick, easy and smooth. Since we were across the way at the Vdara, I walked over to the Aria before we checked out to see if a room might be available early. I booked a Panoramic room and had been automatically upgraded one level for $50.00 more a night but that room wasn’t ready. They had a Panoramic Sky Suite available and I ended up taking that upgrade for a bit more a night. TOTALLY worth every penny. The remainder of the check in process was quick and easy and over in a flash. Everyone that provided service was pleasant and courteous. There was a bit of a line but it moved swiftly. There were about 6 people in front of me and it was very organized and moved right along. I didn’t get much of a briefing on what the “Sky Suites” entailed which later caused some confusion when the bellman took our luggage down where we were to meet the limo. Our limo driver met us at the main entrance where we thought he was supposed to, not realizing that we were supposed to use the “private” entrance for “Sky Suite” visitors. The bellman assumed that we were using the hotel’s limo since we were in the Sky suites. No matter, we got that solved, got our luggage and made it the airport on time when we were leaving. My fault for not asking what the benefits of the Sky Suites were but a little more explanation would have been nice too! The dreaded “scent” in the hotel. I noticed a slight aroma of vanilla but it was not as over powering as some make it out to be. It gently masked the odor of cigarettes so I didn’t mind. Even though there was smoking in the casino area the smell was not as bad thanks to good ventilation and the nice vanilla odor. The Room: We had a 52st floor Panoramic Corner Sky Suite. The room while at the end of the hall was not that far from the elevator. I’m really not sure why so many people complain about the hike from elevator from the room. From the moment you enter the room you really appreciate the effort put into the décor and layout. The entire exterior wall of the room is floor to ceiling windows. We had amazing views towards the airport, the strip and the pools. - The room was very clean. No complaints there. The décor is clean and modern. Interesting art work and sculptures. The couch in the living room was comfy as well. There was a 4 person table, a sitting area between some pillars as well as a desk behind the couch, facing the TV. The wet bar area had the full compliment of snacks and drinks but we did not use any of them. I had a slight heart attack when the room service lady placed a huge dish that was on the table on the wet bar, dislodging some of the $12.00 nuts from the sensor plate. Thankfully it wasn’t enough for me to get charged, crisis averted. The room had complimentary Wifi which worked very well for us and all our Apple technical gadgets. - We had room service several times and the food was good and delivered quickly and hot. Server’s were always pleasant and helpful. They tell you to call when you are done and they will pick up the dirty dishes but we generally left them for housekeeping when went out for the day. - As many have observed, there is no coffee pot in the room, nor is there a microwave. We did have a small refridge in the wet bar for our drinks. The fridge wasn’t cold so I called maintenance who promptly replaced it with a working model. I planned ahead and had a coffee press and water warmer so I was able to make my own coffee in the AM before I had to face the day. - Bed: Very comfy. Not much that I can add to what others have previously mentioned. Very comfy. - Bathroom: The Bathroom was absolute heaven. The jetted bathtub was wonderful and the steam shower was heavenly. Unlike the Vdara, the large tub was designed with the drain at the end of the tub rather than right in the middle. There was a small TV in the bathroom that allowed you to soak and enjoy a show at the same time. Of course the toilet had the bidet which my dear husband really liked. Have to see about getting one for him  at our house. - Noise. The room was so peaceful. Never heard a peep of noise from any other room or even in the hall. The only noise came from the pool bars during the day but by night time it was quiet. Not sure what it was but there was a strange popping noise that occurred during the night. We think it was the glass as it cooled from the hot desert sun. - Location: Well much as been said about this already BUT we really didn’t find it that bad. We walked through Crystals and ended up right on the strip. Pretty easy. No complaints from us. I can see why some people found it annoying but we really didn’t mind. - Dining options: Other than room service, we only at in the hotel once. We had nice dinner at Jean Georges Steakhouse. I originally tried to make a reservation on line and then by calling the main reservation number, not realizing (once again) that we could use our private concierge for this. The time we wanted was not available via either the regular number or the online option but the “Sky Suites” concierge was able to get us a table. Since we had a reservation just as they opened we were one of the first seated and until much later we had a wonderful, quiet and intimate meal (very refreshing and hard to find in Vegas). I think that we were in a special section for sky suite visitors because while part of the restaurant was filling up, our section remained empty until just before we left. Our meal and the service was AMAZING! - Security: There was a doorman at the entry to the Sky Suite elevators and while he kindly held the door open for us, he never asked to see our room key. The alternate entrance required that you swipe your key to get the door to open. - Rental Car: If you rent a car through Alamo and pick it up at the Aria, make sure you know where you are going to pick it up. The office is located past the main Valet and down a level and around a corner. You won’t find a sign to direct you until you are right about to go down to the garage access. Thankfully one of the kind event security guys took pity on us and walked us to where we needed to be. - TV Check-out: Tried to use the TV to check out but it was not working. I ended up using the “text message” option and that worked like a charm. I immediately got an itemized PDF bill sent to my registered email address. Again, no waiting in line, just headed for the door. - Bellman: We called and asked for a bellman to get our luggage because we had quite a lot to get down to the lobby. I asked for him to come at a specific time and he was there on time and quickly loaded our stuff. As stated earlier there was some confusion as to where we were meeting our limo. The bellman does not bring your luggage down in the elevator with you so be clear where you are meeting especially if you are on a time crunch. Overall we really enjoyed this property and all that it offered. The Sky Suites are amazing and well worth the extra expense. Please feel free to PM me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Might be listed as a 5 star hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: natalie152
Reviews.Content: I was there last week with my mom - Sat through Wed. I was already a little peeved due to the extra $170.00 we had to shell out to ensure there were two beds in the suite, but I was sincerely hoping that it would get better. Well, here are the positives and negatives.
