Room - well, it appeared clean, but we found many random "porn ad cards" that people are snapping to you on the strip in random places - gave me a willy feeling that the didn't clean the room as well as the could have. Beds were way too soft, pillows were crappy. Bring your own. Floor was sticky in the main foyer. Technology was fine (not like other reports) but so unnecessary. The TV ended up being hard to control to actually get to the TV. And no food network. TV was very slow and faded in and out. We could plainly hear the neighbours in the ajoining room - They were loud in the day and went out to party, coming back at 3am. We had to call to get them to quiet - but you can definitely hear the noises. And this ticks me off - no coffee machine. It's a 5 star. Would it break the bank if they put a Keurig or a Tassimo? The coffee in the hotel is bloody expensive. Closest Starbucks was in the Monte Carlo. I paid $5.75 for a mediocre latte. Also, the fridge situation. If the food is expensive, I'd love to buy yogurt and little things to stash in the fridge, but here you can't. It's weight sensitive. As soon as you remove something, it goes on your bill. One morning I went to get the free paper at the gift shop (which they don't really tell you you can get) and there was a nasty waste basket filled with vomit in the hallway - it was so gross. I called and they did get it right away but I went down at 10 - really? It took that long for someone to walk the halls? Casino/Hotel - The vanilla smell they pump in to counter the smoke from the cigarettes and cigars was plain nasty. I hated vanilla before and loathe it now. It made me nauseous. Shops and food were very pricy. Go elsewhere. CVS for liquor is just outside the hotel on the strip. Pool - The weather was fantastic so the pool was a very nice thing to have - except for the hours. 9am-6pm? We tried twice to go out after dinner to put our feet in the hot tub, but they closed so early! And even earlier on the Tuesday night for a "private party" which had no warning. Drinks by pool were pricey - stick with the cans of beer. The servers are far and few between - they come back every hour or so. Buffet – Was just ok – Bellagio is better. The only decent thing was the crab legs – it makes up for the cost if you eat your fill. Server was a little off and not helpful. I didn’t get any such deals for a free show etc – which I think was crappy – we stayed 4 nights and had no perks. Bottom line – we wouldn’t stay here again and I wouldn’t recommend it. I would rather stay at the Four Seasons (which we would have had the Sat been available) where you get more personal attention and better treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but lacked personality”
Reviews.Author: mandyb64
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Aria in Las Vegas, having stayed in LV on two previous occasions. The hotel itself is quite lovely, but just lacked any charisma. We felt as though we were in something of a production line for check-in, which was decidedly un-slick. That said, the reception staff were helpful and polite as you would expect. The place is beautifully decorated and absolutely spotless, it just all felt a bit faceless and impersonal. One day, even though we were out for the best part of the day, we still had to chase room service. The place seems to lack the customary American quality of service and charm that we've become accustomed to. We did however thoroughly enjoy 'Viva Elvis', which though not as spectacular as some of the other Cirque du Soleil productions, is still incredibly impressive. We though the hotel was good value and 'did what it said on the tin'. I think we've just got used to getting a little more

Reviews.Title: “Aria Sky Suites - Good not Great”
Reviews.Author: balimontana
Reviews.Content: Last year in 2010 we spent three weeks in a penthouse at the Aria Sky Suites. This year we returned for a quick one night business trip. My impression of the Aria Sky Suites remains the same - it's good not great. Room On both occassions we had a penthouse category room. A nice large living room and a bedroom. The penthouse suite rooms are large and well designed. Comfortable and stylish. One category up is basically the same suite with a large dining room and bar. Not necessary unless you're entertaining as they are basically the same suite with the addition of a dining area. Room is solidly 4 1/2 star. Why not 5 star? It lacks some quality details that make a 5 star hotel genuine. The telephone is super cheap and the speaker phone doesn't work. Petty? Yes a petty detail. But the difference between 4 and 5 star hinges on the details. Also the internet connected television is slow and clumsy. Difficult to change channels. Slow to respond. Again, petty detail but it adds up to be an irritant and detracts from enjoying the experience. On this most recent stay the water was shut off to the bar sink tap. Silly and irritating. Service In a word - SLOW. Service is not 5 star at the Aria. Not by any measure. Room service, housekeeping, engineering - all requests were slow to be fulfilled. Overall the Aria - especially the Sky Suites - have the potential to be 5 star. What's needed? More staffing, quicker service times and a bit of refinement added to the rooms / suites. I recommend staying here only if you get a good rate. There are better options in Vegas such as the incredible Mandarin Oriental, Wynn Tower Suites or the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great!”
Reviews.Author: SCNancylee
Reviews.Content: The room is very high tech but things did not always work as they were supposed to. We had great difficulty getting the room cleaned every single day. They have a high tech "clean room " sign but no one looks at it. Houseekeeping was not very pleasant when we asked to get it cleaned ( at 5 or 6 PM). We had been gone all day and expected the room to be done by that time of day!! They were also very cheap with the amenities like soap You have to ask for every single thing you want!. It is very trendy. For the money, there are much nicer customer oriented places to stay

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Smells Good!”
Reviews.Author: ShShCdn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria in April 2011 because we got a great deal and wanted to try a new hotel. The decor in the hotel as well as the rooms was amazing...very modern and chic. We loved all the technology/gadgets the rooms had and the beds were so comfortable! The other nice thing was that this place doesn't yet have the characteristic smokey must hanging in the air...if you are at all sensitive to tobacco smoke then this is your place! They pump a vanilla scent into the air (which gets sickening at times, but once you walk into any other hotel you appreciate it!). I can't say we really dined or saw any shows at this hotel...there are too many other things to do and places to eat in Vegas! We did gamble at the casino a little bit, but found it expensive at times compared to other hotels on the strip. The only real complaint we have was the front desk service...they didn't have our room ready when we came to check in and we ended up having to wait in the lobby with all our luggage until they were ready. Overall, it was great to try something new and we had a pleasant stay...I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and selective service”
Reviews.Author: Triple3star
Reviews.Content: Place is new - But I was not happy. Was fair and tried to resolve with management - after all no event or business is that smooth. Problem here is management is always too busy. Room was nice - but not at agreed price. They change it and give a long story that the special was only for one of the days! What? Plus when they do find the time to talk with you, they promise to 'make an inconvenience adjustment" that never seems to make it on the account. What? Why do all the charges make it? This would have made me happier... My experience is they are happy to charge you (sometimes extra), even when you don't get what they promised or you ordered. When you call to dispute or resolve - you are on "hold for ever". ??? More wasted time, more effort required. Line staff are helpful and polite, they just can't do anything and need a manger to make any decision. The convention center was incredible - best in Vegas - never had an issue there. Just the hotel. Based on my experience, stay somewhere else where value is better and management actually cares. I am still trying to resolve - but now I have to do more paperwork and state whom, I spoke to... and when... seems they do not believe you. Ouch... Just dig this hole deeper. Only way I will comeback - is if someone else makes me.

Reviews.Title: “2 stays 1 Negative 1 Positive”
Reviews.Author: scentforyou
Reviews.Content: In March 2011 my company gave me and co-workers an all expense paid "Thanks for a job well done" trip to Las Vegas. We had a choice of any hotel in Vegas. We chose the Aria. Check-in took a longer than usual (1 hour) because our company President used the company credit card to pay for the room and all room charges. The information was faxed and we confirmed Aria received our fax, we had a copy of the paper work and the card used with us. We get checked in and make it to our rooms and was impressed, until we got a closer look. The room was dusty, there was hair in the shower, and the bed looked like a child made it up. After calling house keeping we made it down to the casino. The was a wide range of slot game to choose from. We played a while and when a waitress came by we ordered drinks, which took a while for them to return with them. We noticed during our stay that this was the norm. Several times when we flagged a waitress we got comments like "this is not my area" or "My shift is over". Once when we went to the buffet we asked for a window seat and was told by the hostess "go see if you can find one". The service from all staff varied from great to lack luster.That is the negative. The positive: I wrote a customer service letter regarding my stay and I received a phone call from the Vice President of Operations. He apologized and invited us back for the same length of our previous stay in the Aria Sky Suites he also ensured me that he would forward my letter to the department heads of each department that I complained about and the issues would be addressed. My second trip to Aria was September 18, 2011. From the moment the Limo picked me up at the airport my stay was amazing. I was greeted by name when I walked in the door to the private check in area. When I arrived I was told my room was not ready, but the time we finished check in the had a room for me on the 52nd floor with an amazing view of the strip. We had a 1 bedroom suite that was beautiful. It had 1/2 bath, living area, bedroom and a huge bathroom with footed spa tub, seated shower, toilet with heated seat among other things. I requested an ashtray which was brought to me in less than 2 minutes and 5 minutes later someone check to make sure i had received my requested item and asked if I need anything else. On the casino floor you could find a waitresses everywhere, when I request a window seat at the buffet they were more than happy to seat me, and I received great customer service from everyone I encountered. My overall opinion is that Aria is a great hotel with great customer service with a handful of employees that was not aware of that, once they were called on the carpet regarding their level of service they had to shape up or ship out. I will stay at the Aria again, but it will be the Sky Suites because now I am spoiled!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the Bad Reviews, this hotel is perfect”
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and sweet, but would like to open it by saying dont get caught up in all the bad reviews up here already. We stayed at Aria in September 2011 for 7 nights and it was a very positive experience. Technology was Brill, Staff very courteous and friendly, Room very clean, room service perfect, towel supply perfect, beds really really comfortable. We were also given a City room upgrade, just by asking!! I had read negative reviews on here before travelling and was a bit nervous, but there was no need to be....it was beautiful. Well done Aria....we will be back...very soon! J from Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: Ildi_K
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night in this hotel, we didn't pay for the room - it was for my hubby's work outing. The design/interior of the ROOM and the bathroom were very impressive. Even little gadgets like electric curtains, temperature setting from the tv, etc. Room was very quiet = sleep quality great. VIEW was very nice from our room - 14th floor, strip-side. The TRAM that brings guests to other hotels was very convenient. But even if you don't take the tram, the LOCATION is perfect as the hotel is on the strip. Staff seemed friendly, even though we didn't have much interaction with them during our short stay (and we didn't have any issues anyway, so we didn't need help). We didn't get to try out the pool, looking at it from above it seemed nice but quite busy. The only annoying thing was that we had to walk for absolute ages from the PARKING lot to the front desk/room. That wasn't very 'uplifting' as a first experience,especially with a fussy baby in the stroller. Just a small precaution : a friend who also stayed in the hotel told me not to even look at stuff in the mini-fridge, because there's a sensor under each item and if you move it you get charged instantly (even if you put the bottle/snack back). Just like other hotels in Vegas, this one doesn't seem to have BABY changing facilities which is quite dissapointing :-/ Overall, the rooms and the look of the hotel are great, but I would not pay this much for a hotel room (300 usd per night), when there are many good hotels in Vegas for a LOT cheaper. The rooms might not be as fancy in cheaper hotels as in this one but definitely clean and nice. (in fact, I heard you can stay many days for free in some hotels (even the posh ones) if you are willing to listen to their time share presentation :-) )

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Chic Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Seedelman
Reviews.Content: - Beautiful modern rooms with tech-rigged lighting, sound and window fixtures - The pool area is nice (not over run by the MTV crowd which can happen at tons of other pools) but cabana service is slow. - Good location on the strip but a bit pushed back from the main road - Casino floor empties out around 3am (Sun-Thurs) and table minimums go to 5-10$ - Lots of good food options- including Julian Serrano's tapas restaurant. - Check in takes a long time and staff are not overly friendly - Like many Vegas hotels- the floors are HUGE and we got stuck at the end of the hall so it took 3-4 minutes from getting out of the elevator to reach our room - Good value if you book early through twitter deals or their website

Reviews.Title: “Too many other great hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Renee48170
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria over Labor Day weekend and were disappointed. We expected so much more for one of the newest hotels in Las Vegas. The customer service was terrible! It was almost like they had just opened and didn't have the training/staffing/systems worked out yet. The food at the various hotel restaraunts, including the buffet was average at best. The rooms would have been better if all the high-tech cool features they offered would have actually worked. The location is good with all that city centre has to offer but we probably won't stay here again, there are too many other great hotels in Las Vegas with great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and maybe a little too high tech!”
Reviews.Author: molissa83
Reviews.Content: Prior to arriving, I called and asked when check in time was and found out it is anytime; awesome I was thinking! Upon arrivial the hotel lobby was packed with people standing around looking lost, with no defined lines to stand in. When we reached the counter, check-in seemed to go flawlessly until it was time for the keys to our room...their system was down and they were unable to create any room keys! After about 15 minutes of postponing the inevitable, they had to have security let us into our room; later that evening we went down to the front desk and got our keys. Other than the key issue, our stay was good :) Great room with good size, nice large bathroom with shower and tub. The view was poor, considering we were on the 25th floor... we had a view of a spotlight right outside our window with the highway in the distance. Security at the elevators 24/7; there were a lot of straglers/peddlers outside on walkways this time of year. Lots to do at Aria and City Center. Beware: if you are looking for breakfast...the little coffee shops are drastically over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if it's free”
Reviews.Author: Melissa98563
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I would not pay to stay here but it really is a very nice hotel. We stayed in a room facing the Cosmopolitan, not the strip, on the 17th floor. The room was really nice, it was decorated beautifully and was fairly clean. There was a used Q-Tip in a dish, that was sort of gross. I like the scent that is in the casino (vanilla), but the scent in the room was a bit much. It smelled really musky and gave me a bit of a headache, if you are sensitive to smells do not stay here! The hotel is located pretty far from the things I wanted to see (TI, Venetian, Mandalay Bay), but that all relative to what you like to do and see. The restaurants were expensive and I bought a grande latte and it was $7!!!! If you want to sightsee and have things to do besides gamble do not stay here. Two things I loved about the hotel was the free tram to the Bellagio and the mojitos. The mojitos are very good, I only had three total in two days because the cocktail service was some of the worst I've ever had. It's not because we didn't tip either, we did every time. All in all only stay here if it's free.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for our Wedding”
Reviews.Author: cmjmrm2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed from September 3 to 10 for our wedding. We didn't realize when we booked that Labor Day weekend in Vegas would be absolutely crazy and when we got to the hotel, it was crazy busy. It was 11am and we had no problem checking in however, our room was already ready. We asked for a room not facing the Cosmopolitan because I had heard it could be noisy. The elevators are divided into about 5 banks (floors 1-12, 14-19, etc.) which was a tad annoying as we were travelling with about 40 people and if you wanted to go to someone else's room you had to go all the way down to the lobby, change banks and go back up but since it was our wedding week people came to us :). We got checked in which took about 15 minutes or so but the whole process was pleasant and easy and the employees are so nice! We ended up switching rooms halfway during the week before the week because we wanted a suite and twice we got champagne and choc. covered strawberries and macaroons (to die for!) delivered to our room which was awesome. The hotel is visually stunning... naturalistic with neutral colours and so many interesting pieces of art and water fountains. The rooms are gorgeous, so spacious and the beds are incredibly comfy. I loved the techy stuff in the room but the phones drove me nuts. Ours wouldn't work about 4 out of the 7 days which was really annoying as I wanted to call the rest of our group a lot... Everyone we passed by in the hallway as well would say hi and ask how we were. One man was even cleaning the carpets and as we walked by he turned off the machine and stood to the side - amazing! There is no room in the fridge that is in the room but if you have medication like I do *cough cough* they will bring a fridge up to your room free of charge. The walk to the strip is not as long as people say especially if you walk through Crystals and there is plenty to look at on your walk through there. ARIA is also very central on the strip - so close to Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, Caesars and Cosmopolitan! We ate at the Cafe Vettro probably 6 out of the 7 days we were there, my favourite item off the menu was the breakfast parfait. Portions are huge and prices were pretty good. We also ate at Lemongrass one day and it was delicious - highly recommend! The pool area was gorgeous with plenty of seating, even on Labour Day weekend. The poolside cafe also had great food (same prices as Cafe Vettro which weren't all that bad considering you're in Vegas). And the drinks - although expensive - were delicous! 16oz strawberry mojitos are the way to go! The gym is stunning! I worked out early in the morning and it was not busy at all. The cardio machines have a view of the pool and everything is brand new! I may be a bit biased as this was my wedding week so nothing could've ruined it really but I am so glad we stayed at ARIA. All of our guests loved it as well and I would definitely stay there again next time!

Reviews.Title: “City View Room”
Reviews.Author: niesha f
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in Las Vegas for our honeymoon for 5 days and we loved every minute of the hotel. The customer service was create and the rooms were very clean. If we ever needed anything the hotel was willing to bend over backwards to get it for us. The buffet to us in this hotel was the biggest and best that we saw and we ate at buffets all the five days that we were there! They helped us find our way around and everything. We are actually planning a group vacation back to Las vegas next year and we are trying to go back to this hotel!!! :) I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel / great location”
Reviews.Author: Manchester_LV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 2 nights in September 2011. This is a great hotel, good location, very modern, reception staff were great, fantatsic rooms and very clean hotel. Overall, a great hotel and in our opinion one of the best on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsatl
Reviews.Content: I need to start reviewing all the places I have been! Aria was a very nice hotel. The girl that checked us was not friendly at all, but everyone else was super nice!!! The room was nice, bathroom was small...however, I loved the shower and seperate toilet! Food was very good, but expensive. I would recommend the breakfast buffet, very inexpensive and has everything you would want.. We ate there twice. Make sure to ask for two drinks, you will not receive refills...the service here isn't the best, but it's a buffet!!! Lunch and Dinner buffet are the same menu. I would say go one time, but not for both. Food was good for a buffet. Casino was nice, but didn't pay at all. I would recommend the Belagio or Mandalay Bay for their casinos. The location was perfect. I highly recommend Zumanity!!! This was an awesome show, very funny, very sexual! I would not recommend KA...it was very slow and boring. The best part was the last 20 minutes of a 90 minute show. Ohhh...if you take a taxi to and from the airport, it should only be $14.00. We asked the one driver to please take the shorter route...ummm, he took us on the highway...$25.00... I read on here that people were complaining about the smell in the casino...it was a light sent that smelled very good. I overall would recommend this hotel. Beds and pillows were amazing...control for the rooms were a bit confusing to use!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but don't expect follow ups...”
Reviews.Author: Vincent L
Reviews.Content: Checked-in, room not ready. They took my cell number and said they would call when ready...result, never received a call. I checked in a few hours later and the room had been ready for some time. So we get our room key and when I had originally reserved on the Aria website I had asked to be put up as high up as possible since this was our 5th wedding anniversary and our first trip since having the kids...result 3rd floor! Really! 3RD FLOOR! When I complained, they said they would call us in the room to let us know when our new room would free-up....result no messages. I then called down and they asked me to call later because nothing was available. They just seemed to give me a hopeful answer everytime to get me out of their hair. We went for a drink at the Deuce lounge. The waitress came over and gave us a menu but never came back!!! Its not as if she was busy, there was maybe 6 customers in the whole place including us two... She seemed to be having a good time at the bar though. I'm sure I could of heard her laughing from my 3rd floor room. So we left and went to the NY NY for a drink. The place is nice. Our room was clean. Nothing stood out. I would not return, but if your not expecting much in terms of customer service then this place is great. The Paris Las Vegas' restaurant in the Eiffel Tower however underlined our anniversary nicely. Merci Beaucoup!!!

Reviews.Title: “Please think twice and choose it only if you save a lot!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lapequenia
Reviews.Content: My stay was in Sept. 2011. My room was facing the Cosmopolitain. Shall you decide to choose that hotel, please ask for a quieter room since music stop at 04:00AM!!! The bed was very soft on one side and hard on the other half, so I tend to roll all night.. Wasn't a greatnight, trust me. I had to insist to change room the day after and I had to ask for a refund before they finally accepted. The new room had a VERY soft bed, So I didn't slept all week. My business partner had the same problem in his room, so I guess some of the room are aging badly.... The new room didn't have paper toilet, tissue, pic for ice and hygenic bag for the ice. What an hotel!!!! Since we been to the buffet and no dring were offered they gave me finally a 100$ discount after I yeld a bit for the treatment, better that the other: I am so sorry... They gave me previously. Unless, the hotel has a way lower price, I don't understand why you should pick this one!!! Paris has more prestige, better bed, better buffet and I enjoyed my stay previously and YES I should I went back!!! I leave it to you...

Reviews.Title: “ARIA Resort”
Reviews.Author: EvaVony
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, nice room, carpets could have been cleaner in room, beds very comfortable, food for me was mediocre, and not worth the price. Very helpful and professional staff throughout resort. Slots are tight!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Dilberta02
Reviews.Content: We're frequent Las Vegas visitors (20+ visits in five years) but this was our first stay at the Aria. After reading the mixed reviews prior to our trip I wasn't quite sure what to expect and was entering into our stay with a bit of intrepedation. Apparently, Aria management have been digesting and acting upon guest feedback as many of the issues called out by other guests have been addressed and/or were non-existent during our stay. First, valet parking was great. There was no wait as we pulled up, the valet person and bell check were both very helpful and friendly and our car was unloaded immediately. Check-in was immediate with a guest relations person assisting people in getting to the most readily available clerk. Our front desk person was very friendly and knowledgeable and we received the room we requested. It was ready despite that fact it was only 1:00pm. Our room was absolutely beautiful, immaculately clean, fully stocked with toiletries, ammenities, lots of plush spa-like towels, spa robes and a well-stocked snack bar. (Warning, don't touch anything in the snack bar or you will be charged. We knew this so we didnt' touch anything). When we entered the room, the curtains opened and the music came on. My husband had to figure out the i-pad type device that ran everything in the room but once we did it was fine. There's a flat screen TV and too many other really cool features to list here. There was a dressing area with a full dresser and two wardrobe closets. The bathroom was to die for - it had a large spa-tub and shower room, a frosted glass commode area and was marble and travertine throughout - and very clean. We will echo what others have said and say the bed and pillows are the most comfortable we have ever slept on in our lives, (with the exception being our own, which are almost identical to the hotel's mattress, pillows and linens). What's cool is you can push a button which will reflect in the hall that you want privacy or if your room needs to be serviced. Each morning as we headed out the door, we'd hit the 'service' button which electronically signals the staff to clean the room. Every time we returned the room was clean and restocked with everything we needed. The rooms are also extremely quiet - not sure if it's because they did extra sound proofing or what, but we never heard our neighbors and we rarely heard even small sounds from the hallway. Unlike MGM where you can hear every room door bang shut or drunk returning to his room all throughout the night. We slept like rocks! The hotel staff were all amazing, friendly and helpful. We didn't meet a single rude person during our stay. The hotel itself is quite lovely and we loved that it didn't wreak of cigarette smoke. The lobby area had a really nice vanilla smell. Everything about the place was clean - the public areas, the restrooms, the elevators, the pool area, etc. Never a wait for the elevator either, which are often way overcrowded at the other strip hotels. We've stayed at MGM multiple times but it's really starting to show it's age and wear and tear but didn't realize how much so until our stay at the Aria. We spent one day at the pool which was amazing - no pounding top-40 rap music, no partying 20-somethings looking for a hook-up and monopolizing the area, nor 5,000 little ones running amok around the lazy river. It was fabulous - nice music, older crowd, uncrowded, no smoking, no drunks and no underdressed young people being, well, stupid. Very relaxing day with plenty of trees for shade, comfortable lounge chairs and very good service. I totally didn't want to leave - the pools themselves are amazing too. The last evening (we stayed three nights) we ordered up room service for dinner. The food was fabulous - we had the new york steak and the salmon. Forewarning, the accompaniments are ala cart. For the steak, salmon, baked potato with each, side bread and one dessert, with tip, was $114.00. We were okay with that though as we had a $75.00 food and beverage credit. We used our express comps to pay for the remainder of the dinner too. We used the business center to check-in for our return flight home, pay for our luggage and print our boarding passes. The staff there were so nice and very helpful. The center was gleaming it was so clean and the internet connection was faster than anything I had ever experienced. Awesome!! The only thing I would call out about the Aria though is their slot machines are pretty tight. We never really 'hit' on anything, not even small wins, but they did give us $100 in free play with our stay so that helped a bit. Even at that, we dropped quiet a bit on gambling. We had a car during our stay, (self-parking is very easy and the garage is not very far from the casino or hotel rooms). This helped manage expenses as we were able to get off the strip to buy beer, wine, water, snacks and go to off-strip restaurants. Otherwise I think you'd rack up a pretty sizeable food bill if you ate (and especially drink) at the hotel or strip restaurants all the time. We paid $15.00 for one drink at a bar in the hotel and I about had a coronary. We were extremely pleased (and impressed) with our entire stay and would stay there again anytime. I'm very glad that Aria management has been listening and acting upon guest feedback. We look forward to returning soon - I think we're too spoiled by this visit to stay anywhere else now.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favourite Vegas Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: writetosfa
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the ARIA Resort & Casino in Las Vegas. We've stayed at the MGM Grand, Mirage, Bellagio, NY NY, Paris & Vdara and previous to this stay, I would say that the MGM Grand was my favourite place out of all of these. We absolutely LOVED the ARIA - it was fantastic. We stayed in their standard resort room, the resort was full so there wasn't an opportunity to upgrade, but the standard room was great. It was spacious, nicely decorated and I loved the automatic system that controls the curtains, lights, tv and temperature. You could set your alarm to open up the drapes instead of hearing that annoying alarm sound or telephone ring! I also fell in love with the beds. Each night I couldn't wait to get back into it! They have the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The bathroom is great as well. The bathtub is so deep and very relaxing. The ARIA has a large casino which smells so wonderful. My friend loved it so much she bought the scent sticks for her home from the gift shop for about $25. Could not smell any cigarette smoke at all - but like all Vegas hotels, the air was pretty dry. Jean Phillipe has amazing pastries and other goodies, The Buffet has a great lunch spread and Lemongrass served up fantastic Thai. Couldn't believe how helpful all the staff were. Everyone you encountered spoke to you, make small talk and asked how your stay was going. The dining room reservation line agent talked our ear off! Didn't have time to use the pool facilities, but they looked pretty great as well. If you have the chance to stay at the ARIA - take it! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing design and amenities but falls short in a few areas”
Reviews.Author: thsieh74
Reviews.Content: Being a huge geek, I was prepared to fall in love with the high-tech amenities of Aria's rooms. But my stay at Aria was like a first date with a beautiful woman who has something stuck in her teeth - one flaw that distracts and detracts from the overall experience. First the positive - Aria is a BEAUTIFUL hotel. You can tell the designers spared no expense in the decor of the casino, restaurant and lobby areas. My buddy who is in the construction industry was marveling at all of the intricate detailing in the lighting and the facades of each area. Everything seems extremely clean and new, which is as it should be since it was just built a few years ago. Some care also went into the overall layout - the front desk is just inside the main entrance, and the main guest elevators are a short walk away. No trekking through the majority of a gigantic casino is required to get to your room. Also, Aria has a distinctive smell of vanilla that is most noticeable around the front desk. It's a very different aroma from the rest of Vegas, and I appreciated that most of the resort doesn't smell like smoke. The rooms themselves were very spacious. Even though we didn't have a view room, we had a lovely view of Vdara and its pool area, the Cosmopolitan, and the surrounding Vegas mountains. I found the view to be mesmerizing at night time, with all of the hotels lit up and people coming and going through the main entrance. The bathroom was not huge, but they did incorporate a large shower and a separate tub within the same space - very unique. One of the reasons I was looking forward to the Aria is the technology they incorporate into each room. All of the lighting, sound, curtains, temperature, etc can be controlled via the TV and remote, OR by the touch panel by the bed, OR by the individual control buttons along the wall. In addition, there is an input panel that allows you to plug in your laptop/iPad/iPhone/Android phone and playback your own videos or music through the TV, as well as charge your devices. Very cool! The big problem was that in our room, the technology barely worked. There was an excruciating delay, up to a minute, whenever we tried to turn a light on, or change a channel on the TV, or even open the curtains when we first entered the room. This delay occurred regardless if we were using the remote, the touch panel, or the hard buttons on the wall. Technology is great when it works, but when it doesn't, it makes even the most simplest activities (like watching TV) agonizing. If I had been staying longer than one night, I would have definitely asked the front desk to fix it or move us to another room. As it was, we barely spent any time in the room so it wasn't worth the effort. Also, the beds look comfortable, but in reality they were way too soft for my taste. Aria uses some sort of pillow-top mattress, which meant that I literally sank into the bed when I got in it. Ultimately I had a good night's rest, but that may be more about how tired I was instead of how comfortable the bed was. It certainly wasn't comfortable to be in while awake. Service-wise, I can't complain. From the valet to the front-desk, service was fairly prompt and courteous. I also had the opportunity to use the Spa at Aria. That was an amazing experience. The spa facilities are top-notch, with the highlights being the co-ed therapy pool overlooking the main Aria pool and the co-ed meditation room with hot stone beds. Since I was with my wife, it was great to be able to spend time together in the spa instead of being separated in the men's and women's sides. The hot stone massage was fantastic and highly recommended. There are quite a few restaurants I would have liked to try at Aria, but I ended up only having the time to eat at Jean Philippe Patisserie. The sandwiches and pastries were very tasty, if a tad overpriced (although probably fairly priced by Strip standards). I appreciated that I was able to get something to eat quickly (it's located right by the guest elevators) and people-watch while eating. Overall, my wife and I agreed we would both return, but I'll be looking out for malfunctioning technology next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Aria but do not go if you are depending on the kindness of your Casino Host.”
Reviews.Author: CookieCahill
Reviews.Content: We spent for days at the Aria Resort & Casino in August of 2011. To me, the hotel is not a decorative style I like, but our stay was very comfortable. The first day it does take a little time to get used to the fragarance they pump through AC system in the Hotel, Casino and shopping areas. I traveled with my 74 year old mother and like many posts before, the lights and remote was a little more than my she could handle. But we got thru it. The beds were comfortable but I hated the pillows. What is it with hotels that do not provide firm non feather pillows? They were all of the $10 Bed Bath & Beyond stuffing pillow quality. The Bathroom was great except our tub was was in with the stall shower. Kind of a different set up. The shower head was dreadful - it was of the rainbath style and can not be adjusted. So if you like rainbaths, you are good to go but if are like me that has thick hair, you struggle to get the shampoo out. Pet Peeve of mine, but I do not like blow drying my hair in the bathroom when staying at a hotel and you have 2 people sharing a room. I wish there was a mirror and plug near one another on the outside of the bathroom. There are no cheap eating options at the Aria. The buffet and cafe was just OK and expensive, there are other much better in Las Vegas. Note, I only ate at the buffet and cafe for breakfast. Sirio Ristorante and Jean Philippe Patisserie were divine and were worth every penny. The Elvis show was the best Cirque de Soliel in Vegas as far as I was concerned. The concierge and front desk people were also very helpful. The spa was good but pricey and though I did not sit by the pool, I did walk thru the pool area, and it looked to be very enjoyable. Now onto the reason this hotel is getting only 4 stars instead of 5 by me. The casino host were rude and not helpful. Actually out any Casino host in the country, I have never encountered such rude hosts. And it was not just to us, but it seemed they "rolled their eyes" at every guest who came their way. Just on that, I would never go back. So if gambling is your number one reason for going, there are other options then the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JRhouston
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Aria and had a great time. I got a special price of $79.00 a night so it was hard to pass up. I arrived early in the morning (9am) and they gave me a room right away. I had given my bags to the bellman coming in because I thought I would have to wait for a room. When I got to the room I was greeted with the curtains opening on my arrival and music turning on. I called the bell services when I got to the phone and they had my bags up in 5 minutes with a bag of ice for the ice bucket. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Of course by now most travelers know not to touch anything you don't want to buy in/on the mini bar. They are all weight sensored, but I did not have any trouble with it. I bought a ticket to see Viva Elvis from the casino offer and was given a great seat at a discount. The show was very good with lots of talented musicians and singers and lots of Elvis soundtrack singing but all live backup. The set was incredible in true Cirque fashion. I was also able to pick up my Terry Fator tickets at Aria, even thou he is at Mirage, at the concierge desk. This saved me from a trip to the box office for will call at Mirage. The room was always well maintained. The privacy lights at the door are great - no hanging of tacky tags outside the doors. When you were ready for service you could put on the service light or call housekeeping. All the staff was very nice. I ate at the cafe and the food was excellent as was the service. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the buffet. I went on "gourmet dinner" night but the extra price was not clearly listed out front. It was $39.00 instead of $29.00. I found out from my waiter that this included a half lobster if I desired and all the wine I wanted. Well I don't drink wine and the lobster was not that great. As for the other items on the buffet I was disappointed with the selection. Very average food - hardly gourmet. I found the Bellagio weekday prices and food much much much better, especial the breakfast.. The rest of the stay and service at Aria was great, I highly recommend it. The ladies in the Aria store were all very nice. The sundry items are very overpriced but thats vegas in a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Poor Services”
Reviews.Author: ghpBR
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in Aria Resort Las Vegas, for sure it's the most wonderful hotel I have ever stayed but they have the worst room service I have ever experienced, and I will explain why in details, to help you to choose or not Aria. We were traveling in 6 people, so we got 2 triple rooms. (20256 and 20258) First day both rooms were fine, awesome view, even though it was not to Strip Ave. Rooms are high tech, and very clean, at least in our first day. Second day, room 20258 was cleaned up but no new towels were left in the room, and room 20256 was cleaned as well but no soap were left there (we took shower with left overs soap). Third day and the most painful day. Room 20258 members were locked out the room because of a locker issue. After 4 calls to housekeeping, 1 hour waiting outside the room, and 3 different departaments involved to fix it, it was finally fixed. They almost missed the night show, and the attendent didn't care about it. When they finally got in the room, surprise...!!! the room was not cleaned because nobody couldn't get in and the cleaners did not call housekeeping to fix the locker. It was really ridiculous, and all we heard in hotel was appologies. In the last day, we went to a grand cannyon tour, we spent the whole day away from the room, and when we came back at night, room 20256 were not cleaned. We did not even call the housekeeping, but I decided to write this review. We were very upset with the hotel service, since it should be impeccable. I don't recomend Aria for the reasons above, but I do recomend it's buffet, there is lot's of variety. We also had dinner at Beso SteakHouse at Crystal's wich I really reccomend as well. And don't forget Sirio's, very nice dishes in there.

Reviews.Title: “Aria 5 day stay”
Reviews.Author: kdaroush
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria Hotel for 5 days and enjoyed the room and the quiet nature of the hotel. Room is nicely furnished and all controls are from the TV or from the bed console. Everything was neat, clean and the service staff did an outstanding job. Beds a little too soft for me almost to the point of being unable to move during the night.

Reviews.Title: “More Signs”
Reviews.Author: compaq38
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. They put us up in the suites. Great view of the strip. Got all the bells and whistles you'll read about with this hotel. Sheets where tucked tright. Just had to yank those suckers loose. The rest was ahhh.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TazzyCat16
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Aria in September 2011 and love love loved it. The rooms are luxurious and clean. I stayed in a deluxe city view room and the view was great! The big king bed in our room was like sleeping on a cloud and I highly recommend the dinner buffet which is reasonably priced with an excellent variety of fresh food. I agree with previous reviewer who commented on the ice cream cafe on the way to the pool. I stood waiting to be served for a long time while the 2 guys working chose to ignore me... so I left without the coffee and icecreams. The pools are clean and the concierge of the hotel very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay at the Aria again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Karen44881
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria from 9/12-9/16 and had a great time. Aria is a very beautiful modern hotel. The rooms are great with very comfy beds and floor to ceiling windows. The remote control access to the lights, drapes, television, etc. was fun. The pool was great zero entry, plenty of chairs,pretty landscaping. We had dinner at JG Steakhouse and it was wonderful service and food were great. Siro's was also wonderful. We did alot of walking it is a very large hotel, very spread out. If walking is an issue you may want to ask for a room closer to the elevator ours was a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Good Vegas addition”
Reviews.Author: Thejinxs
Reviews.Content: The hotel was overall a great experience and very few negatives. The pools were great and always plenty of room. The breakfast was fantastic and no long lines. Staff were friendly and helpful enough if we needed anything which was there, but staff in the ice cream/cafe place on the way to the pool were appalling. Rooms were awesome, quite big, awesome bed and great entertainment features in the room. Housekeeping wasn,t the best unfortunately there was a pistachio shell under the chair on arrival so I thought I'd leave it there and see if it got cleaned up. Was still there on departure. If that's the only fault well that is pretty minor for a hotel of this size. I hope they can keep the standard up at this place. Would recommend this one, and picked up an outstanding deal on ba website.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 824tripster
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and decided to spend a little more to get a 5 star hotel, and VERY worth it, The hotel was very clean and very modern. had a great pool area. Our room was not the city view, but we still had a awesome view of the mountains,

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - would definately recommend the Sky Suites”
Reviews.Author: nicole_hobley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 5 nights at the end of our Honeymoon. We were a little apprenhensive after reading some of the earlier reviews on here - but WOW what a hotel! We were greeted at the airport by the limo driver who took us and our bags to the hotel where we were greeted by the reception staff. Everything was ready for our check in and we were then shown to our room. The Sky Suites have seperate guest elevators so there is never a queue. The bellman dropped off our bags and showed us how to use the in room technoalogy which was great. The room itself was excellent, the floor to ceiling windows in the living room and bedroom made the view of the strip fantastic especially at night. We had a problem with our TV's not turning on at one point. However I told them in the morning, they sent someone up but it still didnt fix the problem so I notified them again and they credited our room with a $100 food and beverage voucher and sent someone up within 30 minutes to solve the problem. The atmosphere in the hotel was very relaxed. The pool area was good. We also spent a couple of days in the spa which I would definately recommend. The SkySuites guests also have access to a private lounge where there is a supply of coffee soft drinks and snacks. They also provide wine in the evenings. I would definately return to the Aria and would book a skysuite.

Reviews.Title: “Aria is an outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jake S
Reviews.Content: My wife to be and 2 friends stayed at the Aria from August 24th for 7 nights. The check in was very smooth even though we arrived at 7.30pm on the Friday evening, the bell boys took our bags up for us which was great. First impressions were that it has a very modern feel about it and it feels very opulent and everything is soo big! The rooms are impressive and still feel new and yes the beds are really comfortable and the air con is fine. We tried the Jean Georges Steak house which we had the best steaks we had ever eaten and the tapas place which was lovely. The pool area is top class with lots of young fit good looking people trying to look cooler that the next person, we laughed as we are in our forties and all have over active pastry glands. We visited all the other casino/hotels and thought they all looked very tired apart from the Bellagio(classy) and the Wynn Hotel. We saw Rod Stewart at Caesers Palace which was mind blowing and Viva Elvis at the Aria which was great. There is an English pub that is next door to the Aria called Todd English and it serves some really good ales/beers/lagers so we visited there quite a bit. All in all I would go back to the Aria or maybe the Bellagio if I was going back and 7 nights is about right as there is so much to do. Jake the Snake

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lilbiglady
Reviews.Content: My husband just turned 40 this year and I chose to give him a get away trip to Vegas "Vip Style". I decided to stay at the Aira in a sky suit. From the time the limo picked us up from the airport until the time it dropped us back off it was awesome!!! It took us less then five minutes to get checked in (from the Vip entrance) and our room was... As my husband would put it" the best he ever stayed in". The bed was amazing! There were a few problems... But all it took was a phone call. The staff was very friendly and helpful... I could go on and on.... But let me make it short and simple..... I LOVE THIS HOTEL!!!!! If you are thinking about staying here get a sky suit, trust me u want b disappointed.... My husband said this was the best birthday he ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Technogeek's dream!”
Reviews.Author: darksoax
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend recently took our first trip to Las Vegas and hotel hopped between 4 different hotels. This is the hotel of dreams for anything techie/geeky person out there. I knew right away that was in the right spot when we walked in the room and everything turned out and the curtains opened up to greet us. The Aria makes it so easy for you to not have to leave the bed if you don't want. You have full control over all the lights, the curtains, the room temperature, the bathroom, all from the comfort bed with the use of a remote control. It does not stop there through, not only was the room extremely nice in addition to the technology features, but the staff also was the best staff that we experienced as well. Everyone was so friendly. When we were leaving Vegas and getting our bags from check out, one of the staff members even remembered my name from the day before when I had checked in the bags. Made me feel that they really cared. I will most definitely be staying here on any future trips!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carley N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for our anniversary and we LOVED the Aria! We decided to pay a little extra this time since it was a special occasion and we were NOT disappointed. The only complaint we had was the checkin process. It took us about 45 mins because we were there during check out. However, the first thing you recognize is the smell of vanilla lavender. Aria pumps this in throughout the hotel and it is the best ever. It covers up the smoke smell. When you go into all the other casinos, you appreciate your hotel much more. It smells fresh and clean. The rooms are amazing! More clean and contemporary than any other hotel on the strip. The beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on. The hi-tech with the curtains opening and lights coming on when you schedule them to is awesome. My husband figured it out in no time at all. But he also understands and loves electronics. Follow instructions and it is easy. Also, you can call the concierge for help. The people where amazing. The casino was great...even though we left most of it there. It is not too far to walk, it took like 3-5 mins. Plus you have access to different routes if you actually look it up and know where you can go. There are trams that connect you to other hotels. The area s great. The restaurants around the hotel are awesome. Beso was good and the mexican restaurant next to the hotel to the right of aria. Bottom line, if you want a modern, clean, upscale - but not too stuffy, fresh and new, hi-tech place to stay, then Aria is for you. My husband and I will never stay anywhere else. When we went to other casinos we always wanted to cone back to our hotel because it was more comfortable....and we love vegas and gambling anywhere. Try it, I promise you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Luxury”
Reviews.Author: LovinTheJourney
Reviews.Content: Just had our second stay at the Aria. Love this place! We ended up extended to six nights. I especially like the atmosphere and decor. It is classy and modern. Once you enter the room it is all about luxury and relaxation. We had a room overlooking the pool this time. The room is automatic and you can control most lights, drapes, etc. from your TV. Fun! The "Goodnight" button by the bed that turns off all lights and closes the drapes is great. I want one at my house. Housekeeping did an awesome job keeping our room super clean. There is also a button to indicate when you need service. We like the location of Aria since it is within walking distance to other hotels, restaurants and shopping. My husband enjoys the gaming floor and staff there. The casino and lobby always smells soooooo good. The pools are nice and we spent lots of time lounging there. The one small complaint I could make is that on Saturday the "Special" pool for singles plays music so loud that we could barely nap on the 19th floor of our pool view room. But the rest of the afternoons were just fine. Chocolate heaven is right by the entrances to the guest elevators. You can also get pastries, coffees and other goodies there. Worth the visit alone even if you don't stay there. The staff is great and attends to every wish we have. We will certainly stay at the Aria again. We have stayed at almost every nice hotel on the strip and the Aria is on our top five list!

Reviews.Title: “Still lots of "glitches" at this property”
Reviews.Author: smvhou
Reviews.Content: How can you spend billions of dollars on a development, & end up with a hotel property where there are still so many little "glitches"? Have stayed 5 times since they opened, always in a very nice suite, but have yet to get a bathroom where the sinks drain properly. The place must have major plumbing issues. And while the place is filled with many fine branded restaurants, the "hotel" restaurants have been unimprressive to the extreme on every single visit. The food in the main hotel dining room could not be more average if it tried. I've had better breakfasts at IHOP. At least the meals were served while the food was still warm, & they were not $15-25 for the same stuff. Every single meal we have had in one of the hotel restaurants -- not the name-brand locations, but the hotel-owned & managed facilities -- has been very lacklustre. And service in the hotel restaurants/bars has gone from mediocre, to bad to horrendous since opening. On the last visit we walked out of Bar Moderne & City Bar because we simply never got waited on after 20 minutes. Aria, like many casino properties, have apparently cut back so deeply in staff levels, that it is becoming very obvious. Still a very lovely place overall, with spectacular art & decor, but this place is still fighting to get its act together from an operational standpoint. Hotel staff are friendly, helpful & professional. Bar & restaurant staff definitely a cut below.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, But still needs grooming.(A little hard to find where to enter)”
Reviews.Author: Nicolei_07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel this last weekend with a group of my girlfriends for a fun Vegas trip. The concierge staff was great! You can print for free there and they are very friendly. Before you can go to the guest elevators you have to present a key to ensure you are a guest-(FANTASTIC IDEA!)- This is a great policy to avoid unwelcomed guests following young woman or men to their rooms. When we got to our floor we could smell a very heavy scent of weed. And actually, the smell never went away the entire trip(All 4 days). I didnt complain because the room did not smell of it at ALL, it smelled of cigarette smoke but thats because it was a smoking room. The rooms are really cool. They have a touch screen menu that controls pretty much everything in the room. The bathroom was beautiful(we did find a bandaid in it) but for those of you that need more space in the bathrooms, a regular TQNN was not big enough for 4 girls. We managed but the layout wasnt grand. My complaint was the Staff, they were all on different pages and quoted us different policies each time we called down to ask a question. I think management should think about retraining or at least having a refresher on the policies. Other then that, everything else was great!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Craps_11
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks in Aria Sept 2011. Accommodation was first class. The technology that others mention is fine to operate and quite handy, A room safe is located in the bedside drawer. The room was clean, the bed was extremely comfortable and the daily room service was excellent. The pool area is extensive and we had no problem getting a choice of bed. The music at the pool was excellent and not blasting. The service at the poolside was also excellent. The gym facilities are excellent and the staff very helpful and courteous. ALL the staff at the Aria were very courteous and helpful throughout our visit and made us feel very welcome and important. The Aria is set back from the strip however walking is part of Vegas and in reality it not that further back compared to other resorts. We made good use of the Aria Express tram which runs from the Monto Carlo via Aria to the Bellegio. Overall we had a great vacation and as frequent visitors to Vegas we would recommend the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: magpie23_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights this month and have to say OMG and WOW factor.An outstanding hotel,the best hotel we have been to-and we travel alot.Exceptional!!Anyone thinking of going,should not hestitate to do so and prices are very reasonable.Thanks ARIA!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: pennybob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 6 nights at the Aria. I stayed here last year with my 2 sons. The rooms are fantastic. We received a free upgrade to a strip view room. From the 53rd floor, the view is simply great! We liked the casino, the many restaurants, the shopping and the service. The entire facility has an open, modern, clean and inviting feel to it. We have nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “House Keeping is the worst”
Reviews.Author: crew4ae
Reviews.Content: Room nt ready had to wait 3 hours.The room was nice once we could finally go to our room... Just not happy with the way for our room..

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, stay away”
Reviews.Author: NJpucks
Reviews.Content: From the time I arrived to the time I left I was highly disappointed. Poor service checking in, housekeeping a disappointment and the hotel is very understaffed. Ask for directions to other areas of the hotel and you may be misdirected. The casino design itself seems to lack direction. As you walk through the casino you are hit with sounds from several different areas which are distracting. The energy at the craps table was nonexistent. Even the pool energy was not great. I have stayed at many places in Las Vegas before and found this place to be one to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “A seasoned Vegas visitor”
Reviews.Author: LUVDIAMONDS
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel. Nice size rooms. Fantastic Pool. Loved the umbrellas and the shade from the palm trees. Loved settling in for the night and with just a push of the button, the drapes closed, lights and TV went off!!! This hotel is on the strip but a long walk to get to it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Vegas, great suite, poor service”
Reviews.Author: rpolicicio
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Aria in July with my husband, and we booked a Panoramic Corner Suite after a lot of research online... I wanted that suite for our trip, so I booked it specifically. Getting to the hotel, we were checked in right awaya (around 3p) and with no long line at the counters (it was a Wed after all). When we got to the room, we found a great room, but... a smoking room, with a very strong smoke smell. I have booked a non smoking room so immediately asked the front desk to be realocated... thats when the disappointment started: my options were the stinky room or a lower class room!Wwell, if I have booked (and paid extra) for the room and the view, it should be clear that I wanted that room category. Staff was not welcoming or helpful at all (and it was their mistake) but not very pleased, we chose to keep the smoking room, and had to tolerate the smell during our 4 days there. During our entire stay we avoided using the hotel´s service as we felt it was the best in class (for a 5 diamond hotel after all) - exceptions being the buffet (average as Vegas´ buffets and bad service) and the pool (crowded but ok). Location is good, not at the Strip, but easily reachable, that was not a problem during our stay, The suite was very nice, clean - bathtub at the glass corner, nice living room, nice TV, comfy bed. Amenities were nice and complete. the only but was the jacuzzy which started by itself, oyut of nowhere, twice during our stay - and it really frightened us as we didnt expect that. The remote for the appliances never seemed to work - and that considering my husband is a techy guy... anyway, there are other ways to make things work...

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: Gems26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference for 5 nights. The rooms are of good size and beds very comfortable.... pillows to die for. Rooms are very high tec, can control everything from the bed. Yes here is a vanilla smell to the hotel, which is very nice compared to the smell in some of the older hotels. Check in was very painless, despite the hotel being very busy. There is a huge choice of restaurants plus the ameneties of citycentre. I very much enjoyed this hotel and would defo return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Royalprincess50
Reviews.Content: I have spent nights in many hotels across the U.S. And a few in Europe and I have to say that this was the best ever. The view alone was spectacular (corner suite). We were able to have people in and having a guest bathroom was a wonderful option. The food at the buffet was great, ate there twice and the gelatto tasted like gelatto I had in italy. We stayed three nights and will return for another visit. We had turn down service and they left us chocolates. What a nice treat.

Reviews.Title: “Shame our stay ended!”
Reviews.Author: LorrainePC
Reviews.Content: Each trip to Vegas ( and this is our sixth 2 week holiday) we stay in a different hotel. As one of the newest hotels on the Strip - our expectations for the Aria were high - but we were not disappointed. All rooms are High tech with all the gizmos and gadgets needed to control curtains, tv,music etc etc from the comfort of your bed - which incidentally was super comfy, huge and had very soft pillows. We were on the 10th floor with a view onto the strip. We could also see the Monte Carlo pool next door which did have a pool party most days. This was quite loud and tended to interrupt my other half's afternoon siesta ( but it is Vegas and our requested quiet room really was very quiet!) Housekeeping was super efficient and all staff really friendly and helpful. Loads of really good restaurants in the hotel and we also sampled the buffet which was also excellent. Only minor comment - when playing the machines /tables and looking for a 'free' cocktail - the waitresses were a bit unreliable and if you were parched - it was sometimes a long wait! Definitely a 5 star hotel with facilities to match...

Reviews.Title: “I always look forward to returning!!”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy45
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our 11th visit to Aria (4th this year). I can’t say enough great things about this hotel, the staff, the restaurant and the overall experience. I have stayed at many of the hotels on the strip and I admit there are some fabulous choices, but Aria is our home away from home and now the only hotel we choose. It is chic and classy and it is absolutely beautiful. Sure you won’t see any canal boats floating by or circus acts, but that is totally ok with me. Keep the sightseeing tourists in other hotels as far as I am concerned. I have never stayed in a regular room, but we have stayed in the corner suites twice and the rest has been a one or two bedroom sky suite. I absolutely love the sky suites. The private entrance is also a great benefit. One my first visit I did experience long lines at the main entrance, but that was when the hotel first opened. I have only used that check in once since and they seemed to be more streamlined. Now we just use the private entrance at the sky suites and we are checking in very quickly and swept away to our rooms within minutes of getting out of the limo. In fact we never have to touch our bags from the time we arrive in baggage claim until the time we arrive in our room. GREAT SERVICE! The rooms are beautifully decorated and offer a fabulous view no matter what side of the hotel you are staying. I love the technology in the rooms and have not experienced many of the problems other reviewers have mentioned. I find it very easy to use. There has been one or two occasions where something in the room did not work properly but the staff was very quick to respond and send an engineer to our room. It happens, no big deal. The variety of restaurants in the hotel is overwhelming, in a good way. I love the choices. Lemongrass in one of our favorites. The best Thai on the strip. Julian Serrano’s is a favorite as well and we visit it often. Try the shrimp and grits at American Fish. AWESOME! I can say I am not a fan of the breakfast buffet. We have never been thrilled and usually opt for another hotel when looking for a good breakfast or brunch buffet. Otherwise the other restaurants on property are absolutely fabulous. We are gamblers and Aria is our casino of choice. The casino is large and offers a lot of variety. (I saw a previous poster mention how small it was. Obviously he/she did not do a very good job of looking around! Note: It is rated in the top 10 LARGEST casinos in Las Vegas and is noted to be the size of THREE football fields). We absolutely love the casino staff. Keyia is our favorite dealers and we always look for her. She makes playing at her table an absolute adventure. There are so many more we love and too many too mention. The dealers are so nice and we have made great friendships with many of them. Some of whom we keep in touch with on a regular basis. I have never encountered a rude or unfriendly staff member at this hotel. I think that the people who complain about the staff here were probably rude to the staff members to begin with (which we see SO much of) or they are mad that they lost money. Don’t blame the staff! I cant tell you how many times I have seen people get rude with the dealers and think they are god because they are making a 10.00 bet. Rude people really need to get a life. I would also like to say that Tyrone and “G” at the bar by the sports book are two of our favorites. They are always our very first stop when we arrive. We love those guys. Be sure to stop in for a round of vidoe poker, watch a game or just have a cocktail with two of the nicest bartenders in the world. I have already booked my next two returns which are scheduled within the next 3 months. I cant wait!!!

Reviews.Title: “5*s all round - total luxury”
Reviews.Author: rsas87
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria for 5 nights as part of our honeymoon. We paid to upgrade to a "strip view" room rather than a desert. Was worth it as the Aria is located bang in the middle of the strip so the view was amazing. Right from check in, through to the men that help you get a taxi to leave every single member of staff was polite and helpful. Rooms were spotlessley clean as was the rest of the hotel. One of the only casinos where you could order a cocktail from the waitress (for just a dollar tip). We went up to the pool just for a couple of hours on our last day (too much to do in Vegas!) and it was so stunning. There are 3 hot hot spa pools which we spent most of our time in, the pool looked nice too but didn't appear to be any actual swimming going on just standing in there with your drinks to cool off. Monorail is a bit pointless tho, you can walk to the two hotels it offers in just as quick. Highly reccemonded and we'll hopefully visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort / Hotel -- AVOID LIQUID POOL”
Reviews.Author: MKent01
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at Aria. Beautiful hotel, great service (except see below), awesome room and view. For a LV strip hotel, this is very nice. All was excellent until we received 2 free passes to Liquid Pool. This is advertised as the 'adult pool'. Ok, we decided to check it out. The ticket guy at liquid pool asked to see my wife and my IDs. I explained that we are at the pool and I dont carry my ID & haven't all week. Note that we are 40, not teeny-boppers. So, I made the 20 minute round trip back to the room. Round 2, now we were not allowed to bring in our unopened water purchases at the Aria gift shop. He recommended that we throw the water in the bushes... yea, 10 bucks worth of new water. And the reason?? Health code violation. BS! Spend time at Aria - nice place. Don't wast your time at Liquid Pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a bacherlorette party”
Reviews.Author: Annie G
Reviews.Content: Usualyy when we go to Vegas we don't care much about the hotel since we spend little to no time there, but for my cousins Bach party we wanted to do it up right. The Aria was amazing and luxurious. We had 4 girls to a room and there was plenty of space. Unusual for Vegas. The bathrooms were completely updated and gorgeous. The rooms were very high tech so after a night of going out it was tough to even turn on the lights. The location was perfect. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault this place......beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mcfairy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week for 7 days , and I was very impressed , check in was quick and front desk guy was very helpful and friendly as were all the staff even the guy giving out towels at the pool. The room was a double delux which I think is the basic room ....it was huge and immaculate, it had a touch screen next to the bed which controlled every thing in the room , lights ,temp ,curtains tv. The pool area is also enormous and you have a choice of 3 pools to sit round one of which is an adult only pool , plenty of waitresses looking after you with cold beer and fab margheritas , they will also serve you when you are in the pool. The only annoyance, which in no way had to do with the hotel is the helicopter tours which fly right over the pool area, its not that often but they are very loud. We tried the breakfast buffet, which was very nice and a huge choice but if you do not eat alot it is a waste of money. I would stay here again and hopefully it will be soon I love Vegas ......

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels for the money”
Reviews.Author: Traveltotheend9
Reviews.Content: This hotel has no character, I won't stay here again, stay away from the mall next to the hotel it's very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “High tech rooms!! Awesome and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: NPilot98
Reviews.Content: Rooms are really high tech. I love it. Bed is really comfortable. This is our second time staying. We are happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: SalesGirl77
Reviews.Content: I travelled to the Aria with 5 other girls for a stagette. This was our 3rd trip to Las Vegas, in the past we have stayed at the MGM and MGM signature (which are both amazing). Check in went fairly smoothly although we were disappointed with the smoking room (understanding that non smoking is only a request not a guarantee, however there is just no escaping the smoke in this casino). The smell that others commented on is quite noticeable and was pleasant enough at first, by day 4 I was glad to be leaving it behind. The room was nice enough, although with all of the high tech options we had a really hard time plugging in ipods/iphones into the system for music. The beds were very comfortable and the washroom, tub/shower were fine. We had a cabanna poolside one day and this was a highlight, we've rented cabannas at the signature and this one was definitely nicer. The casino itself isn't that large which was a bit surprising, the table dealers quite obviously wanted to work somewhere else. We ate at the buffet (nice options, tasty enough food), the cafe (great service, good food) and Jean Phillipe (delicious, long long lineups/wait). I think the main reason we won't stay here again was the general lack of good customer service. There was a bit of an issue where we had to speak with the front desk and security, everything got resolved but the way it was handled wasn't on par with a 5 star resort (IMO). The beauty of Las Vegas is there is always another option!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: scattycat30
Reviews.Content: Having read lots of negative reviews on here, I was quite apprehensive about staying. We arrived for a 3-night stay at about 3pm and waiting approx 5 mins to be checked in - plenty of people at check-in desks and only one person waiting (maybe we just timed it right but check-out was just as efficient) We chose to self-park and there is a short walk to get you into the casino area, followed by quite a trek to the check-in desks (the hotel is massive so you can't expect all things to be within touching distance - there are signs everywhere so you don't get lost) The vanilla smell within the hotel is lovely - not at all overpowering and it covered the smell of cigarette smoke well. The location is fabulous - quite central, with a train that runs to the Bellagio. I can't disagree more with people who complained about the distance from the hotel to the strip - yes, it's set back slighty so you can't step out of the hotel onto the strip but it's not that far! It would take longer to walk the length of the Forum in Ceasars Palace. It's simple if you don't like walking, don't go to Vegas! Our room was fabulous, spacious and modern and the bed was like sleeping on a large cloud! I can only echo what others have said about the technology - Plenty of storage for clothes and luggage, lovely bathroom with 2 sinks and shower/bath behind a frosted glass door. The toilettries were nice and were replenished even when they weren't completely used up. We saw a few room service trolleys which were outside the rooms for a few hours but were never still the there the following day. On our second day we got back to the room at 4pm and it hadn't been cleaned (even though there were cleaners along the corridor and we'd put our service light on). My partner saw a supervisor just along the corridor who apologised and send somebody round within minutes while we went to have a drink. We had a standard room which was at the far end of a corridor (even this wasn't a long walk, despite what people have put on here) and overlooked the pools which was lovely. The hotel itself was spotlessly clean everywhere and we were constantly seeing maintenance people about and one day there was a large water spillage on the tiled floor but it was dealt with quickly and somebody stood by it to ensure nobody walked through it and slipped. My only gripe about this is that upon entering our room, it was pitch black as the black-out curtain was closed and it didn't open! I've read that they're supposed to open and your TV comes on but we were left groping around for the light switches for a few moments but it was fine once we got the hang of the controls. I've stayed at the Bellagio and Mandalay Bay during previous visits to Vegas and have to say that I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average”
Reviews.Author: Sasso74
Reviews.Content: Really nice place. The rooms were pretty high tech - everything controlled by the remote control (i.e. curtains, lighting, TV, room tempeture). This novelty wears off very quickly and becomes somewhat annoying. The smell of the casino is refreshing. Kinda like coconuts and babypowder. Gave it a Caribbean resort kinda feel to it. Having said that - The ARIA doesnt have a Vegas Hotel feel to it. They did miss giving me my wakeup calls and my pillows were somewhat dirty - but they rectified the matter right away and reimbursed some of my resort fees which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Aria”
Reviews.Author: SoutherncaliTrojan
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay, the service was awesome all of the people were very helpful. I have had better buffets but it wasn't too bad for the price. I was there for my friends bachelor party and I actually came up a little later so only got to stay one night, but the suite we stayed in was pretty awesome. A whole bunch of flat screen tv's, a huge bathroom very nice, and awesome living room. The casino was cool too I won a lot of money playing black jack and the drinks they were bringing me were pretty strong. Had a great time! oh and on a side note I flew to Vegas from LA and the bus from the Airport's 2nd destination was the Aria. If you are flying it's very easy to get there....
