Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda5555
Reviews.Content: Our room was amazing.we had a beautiful view of Vegas.when I first walked in my room the drapes opened to the view and there was music playing with my name on the flat screen welcoming me.room service was great.we had left our room an absolute mess and when we came back that evening it was spotless! The pools and views were amazing.staff very friendly,amazing gelato.only downfalls were the food at the buffet and 24 hour cafe were just average.everything very spendy and long walk to get to rooms.the casino was pretty empty. Overall had great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Had a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Cristina F
Reviews.Content: We liked a lot, but since we like to experience all the hotels on the strip, we're not staying here again. The hotel its in the citycenter area, so its about 15-25 min walk from your door, to the strip. Or you can take the aria express train (free for everyone), that takes you from the aria to the bellagio, or to the montecarlo. We arrive at 7:30 am, so we were expecting to hold our baggage, but we try to check in, and the staff was very helpful, because they gave us a room, and since the check-in time its at 3:00 pm, we were glad and thankful for that. I found the hotel and the rooms very clean and with a very nice smell. The decoration its modern and high tech, and so are the restaurants. The rooms(we stayed in the deluxe room city view), are not that far from the exit, so we have nothing to complain about that, and since we know that in vegas its all walking and walking. Our room was fab and spacious. So as everyone says, it had the control to customize the lighting, curtains, tv etc. The bed was supreme!! Very comforting, and I think it was the best thing of the room. The bathroom its fine too.Two sinks, two mirrors, a weight balance, eco-friendly products,the tub and the shower are next to the other, with a glass door. I have only two things to complain about: -The view. We pay the deluxe room city view, so we assume it was a full view of the strip, but what we'd get, was a view of the city center facing the strip. It was OK. -The noise.We were in the middle of Cosmo's Marquee, and Aria Liquid dayclub, so, in the day, we hear a little bit of the music coming from these 2 places. It wasn't a high noise, but we notice that. We also went to the pool and we liked a lot. There's a lot of pools, and they have a cafe bar behind the pools (Breeze cafe), but I agree with other user reviewing that there are a lot of helicopters in the area. Generally, we had a very good stay,and I recommend this hotel, specially if you like sleek contrast and high tech stuff.

Reviews.Title: “THE Hotel for the Design Conscious Visitor to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: danieltjames
Reviews.Content: Having researched extensively about the new hotel, I was pretty confident about what we'd get and it lived up to the hype and more! Starting with the location - let's get this out of the way - I've read a few comments that suggest that the location is poor or it's a terribly long walk from the casino floor to the strip etc. well, i can put that to bed right away, there IS a walk from the casino floor to the strip but it's the same at every other hotel. That's Vegas surely? Yes, there's a short walk to the strip from the hotel but either - [a] if you are happy in the hotel then it won't be an issue or [b] if you're heading out, then you'll be prepared for the walk or the taxi drive. Getting to and from the strip is simple and is actually a pleasant experience. There's plenty to look at and if you do head through the stunning Crystals Shopping Centre then there's always shops and bars to stop at. I wouldn't ever moan about the walk to the strip especially as when attending events at other hotels, I'd suggest the walk was considerably shorter at Aria than at other hotels. Onto the room, we had a city-view suite which was stunning, packed with features, The bathroom was great with 2 sinks, wet room, shower and bath and lots of toiletries that were refreshed every day. The room itself had lots of storage space, drawers, wardrobes etc. and plenty of space for storing cases and shopping too. The in-room technology was cool and fun to play with. We ate and drank at a few of the in-hotel bars and restaurants are were delighted with them all. Only one minor issue with a surly waitress but even that couldn't dampen our affection for this new establishment. Incidentally, i did read a couple of comments both within reviews and on the LV forum about the smell of vanilla in the hotel - well compared to other hotels in Vegas, I'd say it was easily the cleanest of them all and there was only one time that we smelt smoke and that was when we walked past a woman puffing on a huuuuuge cigar! Each to their own! We did find that other hotels had varying smells ranging from urine to pine toilet cleaner so a soft, inoffensive vanilla was much preferred to stale smoke or sweat! The only point that means i'd reward this hotel with a 9 out of 10 rather than 100% is when checking out, I wasn't asked if i'd enjoyed my stay and my card was charged before I had chance to tell them that i wanted to pay cash. Not the end of the world but a little annoying - not that I had huge amounts of cash following a dismal casino performance!! :) Overall, a great hotel, top location, super modern and stylish and so much better than any of the many other hotels we visited whilst in Las Vegas. We'd definitely recommend it and will certainly stay there again next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JosieCat-MN
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a corner suite from 9/11-9/14, 2011. I'll be honest. I probably would have liked the room more had I not gotten a suite on the 4th floor - which meant basically no view, which of course, is why I wanted a corner suite - for the fabulous view. The room was nice, bed and pillows were very comfortable. I had no noise issues at all. The room is a bit of a hike from the elevators, but as the suites are at the end of the hall, there isn't much you can do about this. I only mention it for any one who has mobility issues. The bathroom was very nice. The tech stuff in the room took a while to figure out, but we eventually did. I did have a few issues with housekeeping, the first being them helping themselves to the tip I left, without actually cleaning the room first. They did come later that day and clean the room, but I thought that taking the tip first was a bit tacky. Second issue with them was the next day, them calling and leaving a message saying they couldn't clean the room because we had left the privacy light on all day, which we hadn't. The room HAD in fact been cleaned. They came knocking on our door at 9:30 that night waking us up, wanting to clean the room. Food - I ate at the Buffet twice, and the Skybox twice, and had room service breakfast. I thought the food was good, if a bit overpriced, but then we aren't big "foodies". It filled the hole. Gambling. Absolutely no luck, but that's gambling. I didn't care for the selection of slot machines there. Every machine is brand spanking new, which means you won't find any of your old favorites there. Poker schedules are not good at all. Location - not really great for getting to the strip. The casino itself was very nice, the signs to get around were helpful. The staff was all very nice and very helpful. I liked that you had to show your room key to get to the elevators. There were no shortages of cocktail waitresses. I personally would probably not stay there again due to not liking the slot machines and location, but it was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay suite--awesome restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: Bwhiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Tower Suite room--not as roomy as I had hoped and they got some things wrong. For example, there is a HUGE walk-in shower but, one, lonely, ordinary shower head. What?!! Also, the room is very high tech. Every aspect can be personalized, however, the open/close black-out drape feature did not entirely close the drapes in the bedroom so, the morning sun shined through a 6" slit. Uh-oh. Now, this hotel has soooo many pools, restaurants, and stores (not to mention casinos) that you better bring those walking shoes, especially if you want coffee in the morning without paying $28 + tip for a carafe. The food? Yummy. We dined with a group at Barmasa. Exceptional food!! My husband and I shared a $75 Sashimi sampler and it was perfect for two. He had the foresight to ask if the chef could muster up fresh wasabi instead of the powdered version. A waiter brought it to the table and prepared it for us. What a treat!! It did cost us $10 extra but, was worth it. And, it was a fun experience. We will definitely do that again. They too have a wonderful selection of martinis, wines, and (of course) sakes. Overall, the staff was polite and accommodating and the Spa professionals were just that. A lovely, relaxing time. Will we stay there again? No. However, we WILL enjoy Barmasa on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: doodles_CT
Reviews.Content: A very mixed review. Many excellent things overshadowed for me by the lack of clean white bedding. I found a dark/oily spot on our bedspread. At this level of hotel, I don't see any excuse for not providing freshly washed duvets. The other low point was the lack of coffee in the room, and limited options early in the morning. The line for coffee was pretty long before 7AM! Now for the good: beautiful bathroom with large tub and shower, bathrobes in the closet, high tech controls of the drapery and lighting, and free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: SharkBaitGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful, modern and very clean. Good service though a little slow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cosy new hotel”
Reviews.Author: choco_holics
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights is Aria. Deluxe room with city view. High tech room amenities control which is quite fun. The best part got to be the bed, it is so comfortable which I wld rate a 5 star rating! Worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Super Fancy and Modern”
Reviews.Author: teknoturtl
Reviews.Content: My husband's work had a convention at this hotel, so my "tween" age kids and I basically spent the day exploring on as little a budget as possible. First, the hotel is super fancy, the rooms are very high tech with remote control blinds, lights, radio, etc. The bathroom is huge, adn includes a stand up shower and soaking tub. The hotel is quite large and has lots of interesting art/architectural features. The hotel is "connected" to several others via a free monorail. There is still a good bit of walking to get to the stops of the train though. The pools are incredible, heated, and very enticing b/c they had the edge of the pool was sort of a "vanishing" edge, so it resembled a lagoon or something like it! There were several pools, but only one was open when we were there, and it closed at 4pm, which was kind of disapointing! There were also several hottubs, hidden in little areas of tropical trees, etc. All of the pools were outside, but we were there in January and swam outside just fine! Overall, my kids and I enjoyed this place very much!

Reviews.Title: “Top of the notch - corner suite”
Reviews.Author: True_review_for_U
Reviews.Content: This is a high tech room, it got remote for everything. From blinds, TV, room temperature to radio; even the toilet has watch and air wash if you stay at the corner suite. In the suite, they have two big tv, one small in the bathroom. A whirlpool tub, and stand up shower, toilet with TOTO brand that has warm water and air washing function. A fridge you can store stuff and also mini bar. The view is incredible from the room, it has 180 degree view over look the strip. With the lights and lively neon ads from planet Hollywood, you felt like you're right in the center of the action but actually lying in a comfortably tub oversee everything. If you wanna get room service, it got pretty good size of living room that you can dine comfortable with four people. With two restrooms and plenty space, it's no problem to invite friends in. Only down side is parking. It's better to valet; only cost you few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Super slick Vegas spot”
Reviews.Author: Claphamite
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with Aria, having stayed for 2 nights at The Venetian beforehand we didn't know what to expect but loved the clean modern decor design of this place. Having wondered into most of the big hotels on the strip, I thought this one stood out in terms of design, quality, layout and smell ! Great rooms, great pool area and very modern and slick casino.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amy60849
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the one bedroom penthouse was perfect! A limo to & from the airport, very friendly & helpful staff everywhere we went in the casino. We couldn't have asked for more. Our check-in was very fast & since we got to check in early it felt like we got an extra day to tour the strip. The bed was softer than anything I've ever felt & the main bathroom was huge! Loved the bidet and heated seat features the toilet had more than I would have imagined. The jetted tub was wonderful but I really fell in love with the shower with a steam jet. I think I could happily live in that steam shower! The in room technology was great and having our own mini-fridge came in very handy for the alcoholic beverages we purchased from CVS. Not only are the property and sky suites beautiful but we felt so pampered by the staff members. If you're looking for an upscale place that is built to soothe all your senses I would certainly recommend Aria's Sky Suites.

Reviews.Title: “So far my favorite.....”
Reviews.Author: pdx2vegas
Reviews.Content: I visit Las Vegas several times a year and try to stay at different hotels most of the time. I've stayed in 10 different hotels ranging from Bally's to Wynn. So far, Aria is my favorite. In terms of quality and luxury, it's right up there with the Wynn but because of it's more central location, I don't see any reason to stay anywhere else if I can get a great deal on a room. I understand some of the reviewers' complaints about the rooms being too high-tech, and I must admit, I did hit the "good night" button twice accidentally which shuts the blinds and turns off all the lights. But after you get used to the remote control, it was very convenient to access the lights and the blackout curtains from the bed. Perfect for lazy people like me. The clientele at Aria tends to be more towards the over-30 age group so the hotel is much quieter than hotels like Planet Hollywood, Tropicana or NYNY. I found the front desk staff, housekeeping, and servers at the restaurants to be very friendly and helpful. Overall, Aria is my favorite hotel out of the 10 different hotels I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellen045
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria resort recently and were very impressed. The rooms are nicely decorated and the amenities are first rate. With the TV remote you are able to control the drapes, room temperature and lights,as well as check your bill. The casino is great, though we are not big gamblers so only used it sporadically. We ate at several restaurants and found them excellent, though not inexpensive. The only issue we had was the mini bar. We were told that if you remove anything, you are charged after 60 seconds. Therefore the refrigerator in the room is not for your convenience--it's there only to sell you overpriced drinks and snacks. That was very disappointing. I've never understood why hotels overprice mini bar items anyway--if they were more reasonable, we might actually avail ourselves of the items. But $3.50 for a Snickers is ridiculous. All in all, a great time and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Love to stay here”
Reviews.Author: snowdctr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Aria 3 times, and it's been great every time. Location is fantastic, rooms are modern and clean (the queen rooms are nice, and the corner suites are amazing). There are 3 pools with lots of lounge chairs (although they do fill up late morning). Will stay here every time!

Reviews.Title: “loved out stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Neelam102
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed there and we loved it. casino was very clean and didn't smell like smoke like other casinos did. Rooms were spacious and clean as well. would love to stay there again.....

Reviews.Title: “Rude service from front desk”
Reviews.Author: Jhudd
Reviews.Content: We are at the Aria right now - upon entering our room we gagged from the worst smell you can imagine. I can only describe it as some guys dirty socks. I called the front desk and was actaully laughing since obviously this was not 100% the hotels fault - whoever had the room before us really had a problem. Of course i asked for a new room. The front desk said the only room they had was not as nice as the room we booked - I said I did not think it was fair to get a "downgrade" and all she kept says was "its all we have" and repeated "how can I help you" over and over again ina condesendign rude manner. I asked if a manger could call me (I was now standing in the hall) and she said I would have to come back down to the lobby because they were all on the "floor" I asked when someone could call me back and she said she did not know and "how can i help you" after a few of these I hung up and waited 10 min and called back only to get the same rude person. They offered to spray the room and air it out (gross) so i hung up again and called the bell desk to get my bags - I'm a meeting planner with friends at other hotels. I wanted to Try Aria and frankly if my guests are treated this way I would never hold a business meeting here. I told this to the bell desk and they offered to try and help - they moved us to a lower floor and we had to wait 45 min while room keys were all messed up and security came to let us in and then another wait for room key delivery - what a mess. Even security had an attitude! I have read negative reviews about the staff and now I believe it!! they need a much better attitude to be a premier property.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, What a Place!”
Reviews.Author: NWY
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome. We stayed here in July and loved it. I've stayed at other places but this place was clean and fresh. Other places we've stayed have been smokey and dirty, but enjoyed great reputations. We had a great time and recommend it to anyone. The restaurant were very good, the staff was polite, and the pool scene was good. There was a gift shop with everything (even booze) and was reasonably priced. A+.

Reviews.Title: “Sitting by the pool right now...”
Reviews.Author: TumbleweedSmith
Reviews.Content: ok. you have to leave the casino occasionally! We've been to Vegas several times and this is another behemoth on the strip. Lacks a bit of charm, but this is not a land known for such. Accommodations are clean, spacious, and remote controlled! All the staff has been more than kind, and helpful. Many attractions nearby- bring good walking shoes- really! Fabulous pastry shop next to the casino floor- worth a stop if you are nearby! Several pools accommodate large numbers of patrons without feeling cramped. I'd come back!

Reviews.Title: “So so stay... this is VEGAS, wow me a lil”
Reviews.Author: shaybaby25
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas several times and always like to try out different hotels. I didn't hate this place but I wasn't 'wowed' either. Went with some girlfriends for a Bachelorette weekend. So the good... the hotel is nice and connects to Vdara & Bellagio. The rooms were nicely decorated. The lobby has a nice sweet smell. the so, so... the room is so high tech (and I am pretty techie) - you have to use a touch screen remote for everything - got annoying because it seems to have been used so much it has lost sensitivity. The hotel was kinda boring... the bad... the shower/bathtub smelled like mildew (ewww). The casino tables, even during the day were like $15 mins - to me, this is too high and the tables were empty. It rained while we were there and they closed the pool and even after the rain stopped... they wouldn't let people back in for over an hour and the pool security guy was a jerk!! They have a 'not so convenient' convenience fee of like $22 a night - - and you really get nothing for it!! I'd rather they have the option to pay it for access to the gym. I wouldn't stay here again... there is just too much other 'wow' in Vegas and Aria is lacking.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go again!”
Reviews.Author: nepite
Reviews.Content: This resort is one of the most spectacular resorts in Vegas at this time! The architecture alone is magnificent (inside and out). I highly recommend that you book a corner suite - way worth the price. The amenities were incredible - from the wonderful comfy bed, to the bathtub & shower, to the Toto toilet/bidet, to the floor to ceiling glass windows & blackout curtains that open & close with a touch of a button- amazing! You feel like a queen! Check-in was great with Jayden (I think I spelled it right)- very friendly and courteous + she took her time to get to know us & give us tips on the resort. We didn't feel rushed but very relaxed immediately upon entering the hotel. It was sensory stimulation (smelled liked a spa everywhere -unlike other hotels where you come in and it's smokey + the lighting, architectural details (i.e. the glass bubbles at the tapas bar, the cool Alice in Wonderland - that's what i named the Bar Moderno, the cafe clear & green glass decor - all amazing). The pool area is not as big as other hotels but it's always happening. The guests and hotel personnel are very nice and courteous unlike other hotels like the Wynn (very snouty). Liquid Club is interesting - they get you in with a free ticket but then you have to pay a lot for drinks & $10 fee for men. Not worth it! The pool lounge at the Venetian (Tao Lounge) is way better if that's what you are looking for. Also, this is not a family hotel - mostly adults. If you want to take your family, the Vdara is better as it's an all suite hotel with kitchenettes & a non-smoking hotel since there is no casino. We went to Beso - Eva Longoria's restaurant and the food & service were phenomenal. Visited the Cosmopolitan Hotel lounges & bars - love the 007 theme throughout & the pool was very hip. If you are visiting Las Vegas - check out this new hotel - great location (center of strip). I walked all the way to Wynn in no time. Another plus in Vegas - FREE PARKING!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: Beezee06
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at the ARIA while in town for business. The room was very comfortable and spacious. Hotel staff was accommodating, and we ate in two great restaurants in the hotel - Barmasa and American Fish. ARIA is centrally-located and around many great attractions on the strip. Pools are great as well, and the outdoor area in general is very nice. There is a ton to do right in the area, whether its eating, gambling, shopping or seeing Viva Elvis. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Aria - "you have class"”
Reviews.Author: jardaNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria on September the 6th-7th- Love, love, love the Aria- When we were registering they asked if it was a special occasion and we told them, which we were, celebrating our 48th wedding anniversary- they gave us the most beautiful room with a spectaluar view on the 37th floor- it was a spectacular view during the day but at night which all the lights on- what a view- We went out and when we returned they had sent up chocolate cover strawberries and little cookies- now that is class- Loved all the electrical gadgets you could control from your bed/ curtains, lights, etc- Excellent buffett- cold food was cold- hot food was hot-great crab lets, chinese food When you walk in Aria you get this fresh smell of something they are pumping in the air- do not have a non-smoking area, no hotel in Las Vegas has any, but the air was so much better- did not smell any smoke unless you were sitting next tothe person -overall the smell was minimum. Smoke in the Bellegio made my husband ill- nose bleed, coughing, sorer throat-Yike- Lots of places to eat- try the French pastry shop on the first floor- cannot remember the name but lst floor in the back- the best buttery croissiant I have ever eaten- not cheap at $4.00 but with a great cup of coffee you have your breakfast- love love love the Aria- my favorite hotel/casio in Las Vegas- hope ;to see you next year-

Reviews.Title: “The luxury side of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gmashell
Reviews.Content: Love the Aria! The hotel is easy to get to and is just a fabulous delight for the senses. The decor is earthy and you just want to touch everything. The lobby offers a fresh vanilla aroma and is fashioned like a city park, with benches and trees.Several one of a kind art sculptures offer a "water" aspect...very pretty. Check is was quick and easy. Our room was a corner suite on the 37th floor with exceptional views, high-tech amenities like automatic curtains and light controls, large luxurious bathtub and plush, comfortable bedding! Viva Elvis.....GREAT SHOW!! Service at the Aira is exceptional and Shannon McCallum is a delight! Her warm and welcoming personality made my birthday surprise a cherised memory. Pack a bag and head to the Aira! You will be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: JohnG-travel
Reviews.Content: Aria is nice and new and overall a great place, but, bring your wallet. AVOID the Elvis show as it is by far the worst Cirque show I have ever saw.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: gardentourgirl
Reviews.Content: Nice new hotel with all the modern touches, incl bedside touchpad that runs everything in the room. We got a very good deal from the hotel thru e-mail that incl $250 resort credit, so cannot complain at all. We were upgraded to a City View room but they hadn't cleaned the windows in some time, so any view would not have made a difference. Highly recommend the Cafe Vettro for good food and great service. Found the biggest problem with this resort is the location. You cannot easily get to anywhere without a long jog thru the large Crystals Shopping Centre. We did find a shorter route by walking over to Monte Carlo and across the road to access transportation. This complex is kind of "on the wrong side of the street" and set pretty far back for easy access to anything. Definately worth a try is you visit LV a lot, but not if it's your first time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, we love Aria!”
Reviews.Author: EmmEff
Reviews.Content: Aria was everything I've ever wanted in a hotel. For my first trip to Vegas (and my honeymoon), I couldn't have asked for anything more. The room was spotless and well appointed. The hotel restaurants were also excellent. The concierge was also very helpful getting us a rental car and show tickets without waiting or hassle. The in-room technology (touchscreen on the nightstand controlling everything like TV, lights, music, curtains, etc). All of this comes at a cost, but for my money, it was worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Aria”
Reviews.Author: fletcher9999
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas many times over the last 10 years and have to say, my stay last week at the Aria Resort is at the top of my list. The hotel design and architecture was really stunning. Do yourself a favor and check out even if you stay elsewhere. Many choices for food, from casual to elegant. Plus you are in walking distance to many other hotels, so you have tons of options to choose from. I had a beautiful view of the strip from the 22nd floor. The room was modern and tastefully decorated and the beds were very comfortable. I had a great nights sleep, which is sometimes hard to do while in this city. Housekeeping was courteous and efficient. I spent a few hours at the spa, which was incredible. Make sure to try the Japanese hot stone beds. The aromatherapy steam room was incredible. For only $30 dollars you get to use all of the facilities at the spa for the entire day and you can come and go as you please. That is a terrific deal. The pools were nice. I spent a few hours at the regular (kid/family friendly) pools and checked out the (adults only) Liquid Pool Party. It was not nearly as large as many of the other pool parties in Vegas, but a fun time was had nonetheless. Everyone I encountered at the Aria was super friendly and very helpful. The only "tiny" gripe I had was at check-in. The only room available was on the 3rd floor. No way I am going for that so I had to check back a few hours later to see what else was available. I did get a room on the 22nd floor, so everything worked out. Maybe they were at capacity. No points taken away... Aria will be my "go to" hotel while in Vegas. They did everything right and deserve my business. Looking forward to my trip in January.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms, styling, and pool, and classy Casino too”
Reviews.Author: cocolondonKX
Reviews.Content: We had a great room, with a view of the strip. Fabulous electric curtains and control for whole room, big bathroom. We loved the pools. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Not for everybody”
Reviews.Author: Sebastianmiki
Reviews.Content: Aria Resort exceeded our expectations. As a five start hotel we have what we wanted, but what it makes Aria special and different from others Resorts, it is the atmosphere and energy. With the great modern design and eclectic feel, Aria attracts mostly trendy and sophisticated adults. The sense of fashion architecture along the other Resorts in the City Center, makes the perfect spot for fine Clubs, nice Restaurants, Ultra Lounges and Sky bars. The dark and sexy ambiance also in the rooms it was perfect for our 16th Anniversary, just enough. Enjoy Life, enjoy Sin City... "Travel with good attitude and you will have no problems otherwise just stay at home...” Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: StaceAndFrank
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay a lot. Modern amenities, lovely room, great location. Lacks a bit of personality compared to other hotels on the strip but is value for money in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: titantraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vegas quite a few times and this hotel tops the lot so far. In terms of room comparisons the MGM Signature rooms are probably slightly better but location and facilities mean the Aria trumps the others. The lobby area is massive with fantastic architecture, lots of checkin desks but they did always seem slow checking people in, we had quite a wait and there was always a queue. However minor detail as everything else was fantastic. The room was very well appointed, the tech in room was brilliant and really easy to use, no fridge only mini bar although I think you could request a fridge. Bathroom was a good size great walkin shower/ wet room area which included the bath - so all enclosed with sinks in a dry area which was well thought through. The toiletries provided were all natural, paraben free products which was an added bonus. The entire hotel was amazingly clean, fresh and safe. The casino wasn't the biggest but a decent size and just right for the hotel. In terms of location it was an easy 10 min walk through the hotel, crystals etc to get to PH resort or Bellagio via free monorail. Ultra modern resort, clean amazingly comfy bed and great location. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: Carson D
Reviews.Content: Aria is perfect for the mature Vegas traveller. Don't expect wild parties here... you can find that across the street at Cosmopolitan. Fantastic, clean, modern, spacious rooms. Great casino with sports book and poker room. Outstanding spa, gym and facilities. Large, relaxing pool... The restaurants are very diverse- Asian, Italian, Steakhouse, Sports Bar, Coffee and Pastries... etc... Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarie B
Reviews.Content: From the beautifull smell off vanilla that hits you the minute you walk through the doors, to the friendly staff on the front desks, the rooms, food, the friendly staff on the casino floor, the spa and pool area. Overall I feel that this hotel ticks all the boxes.....

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: emquad46
Reviews.Content: Check in took five minutes. The room was ready and very beautiful. The appointments in the room were well conceived. The views were wonderful even though we were on the 18th floor. The Casino is ultra modern and the attention to detail was excellent. Many high end restaurants are available and the pool (or should I say pools, three of them) are beautiful and beautifully designed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotel that I've stayed”
Reviews.Author: robertomn
Reviews.Content: Last time that I was in Vegas I stayed at Wynn. Some friends suggested to me to stay here and I was not confident that it would be better than Wynn. In my opinion, this hotel is nicer than Wynn. It's unbelievable the architect and decoration details in this hotel and the complex around. It must have been a woman! The other hotels in Las Vegas are also beautiful, but this hotel raised the bar. The Cystal shopping is also the nicest mall that I've ever been. I think the Wynn swimming pools is better than Aria and I don't know why there is a constant sound when you are there. I think is the AC machines, but you only realize if you pay attention. The location is also good. If I come here again, I'd stay here instead of Wynn. For me, the only advantage of Staying at Wynn is the Swimming pool and the Fashion Mall in front of Wynn. The only problem that I see on the Aria Hotel Project is that there is only 1 hall of elevators per floor, so you would walk up to 150 yards depending of the room that they will give to you.

Reviews.Title: “What FUN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Law_mama09
Reviews.Content: I love the Aria resort! Always what I expect when I travel. The rooms are fantastic and getting a room with a view is a plus ... not discounting the fact that they are super clean. All the electronics from opening to closing the drapes and turning on and off the lights ... Having an electronic key is one of the safety features. Beautiful resort and fantastic customer service. This trip was for a wedding ... Thanks Aria!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property”
Reviews.Author: scherzva
Reviews.Content: This is my choice hotel when visit Las Vegas. I find the service impecable (it is an AAA 5 Diamond property), beds are comfortable, the architecture is world class (designed by Cesar Pelli who also designed the Petronas Towers in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA Hotel - High Tech/High Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Stan R
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights over the Memorial Day weekend May 26-30, 2011 at Aria in Las Vegas. I love this hotel, great location in the "middle" of the strip. Arrived at the check in counter around noon, no wait and had my room key within minutes. Recommend arriving in Las Vegas early if possible. If you fly in - your luggage arrives at baggage claim quicker, fewer people in line at taxi stand, and check in is smoother. Room - great size, approx. 520 sq ft. - very nice comfortable bed, due to the mattress padding. Favorite feature, good night picture icon: press it and all the electronics in the room turn off: Lights, TV, curtains and drapes close. Great restaurants, nice sports room with TVs everywhere, casino floor not too big, very nice fitness center and spa. Remember it just opened in Dec 2009 so everything still seems new. A couple more things: great Poker room, although it is beginning to attract more higher limit gamblers so come with deep pockets - you can sometimes obtain a poker room rate as low as $99 weekdays, $139 weekends. I'll be back real soon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Corner suite”
Reviews.Author: luvseafood_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aria at the end of July. We had a Corner suite the view was of the Cosmopolitan Pool it was great. The bathroom was spectacular soaking tub had two views. Although it did cost 900 for 3 days over a weekend it was worth feeling like a king for 3 days. Pools were nice not very crowded drinks are expensive.No luck in the casino played lots of slots and video poker. Overall great place probably wont stay there again. Belaigo is still are favorite place on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Sterile, boring and expensive just to seem haughty”
Reviews.Author: Eodyne
Reviews.Content: The Aria Hotel had one good thing going for it - the beds. Best night's sleep I've gotten in a long time and I even asked where to buy the sheets. The buffet was pretty good, but not the best. The pool was decent, but wait service took forever. The downside? Hotel check-in staff was unsmiling and unhelpful and the lines were really long. They pipe in some nasty air scent (vanilla?) that is everywhere on the main floor. The rooms are oddly shaped because of the half-circle building, so the closer you are to the elevators, the smaller and more angled/less windows you get. If you're further from the elevator, you get a larger room, but with a seemingly endless inception-esque walk. Bathroom smelled like sewage most of the time and had very little air flow. Shower pressure was not good. We had drink tickets and discounts at check in, but all the bars charged way too much, so we ended up lesving the hotel. There is no personality to the hotel, it is bland, which is probably fine for someone attending a convention, but for the money, stay somewhere else on a vacation (Bellagio is usually the same price)!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but didn't wow me”
Reviews.Author: psycherie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Las Vegas for a getaway with 4 other couples, one of which was also staying at Aria. We chose Aria because we wanted to stay in City Center. We hadn't read much good about Vdara and the Cosmo's prices were outrageous, so we settled on Aria. The last two times we have gone, we stayed at Wynn, which we really liked. The things we liked: beautiful lobby and decor, the room had these awesome little tablet-type things that controlled everything in the room (lights, tv, temperature, curtains, etc.), two sinks in the bathroom and a huge shower. They also had a really nice (but very crowded) workout facility and it was included in the daily resort fee. Which people make a big deal out of, but I didn't mind considering you got that and wifi included. Oh yes, also a really good blow dryer! The things we didn't like: difficult to navigate to if you rent a car and drive there, as we did. We turned on to the wrong road apparently and got to a valet where they didn't have bell service (???), so had to turn around and go back and wind around another way. Our bed was also pretty uncomfortable--it seemed to peak in the middle and then slope down on each side, so we always had a feeling that we were falling out of the bed. And a couple of minor things--the hot water fixture on one of the sinks was quite loose and constantly moved around and the light on the magnifying mirror didn't work. Overall, it struck me as a very modern, nice hotel. I would stay there again, but I think they have a lot of competition from other really nice hotels on the strip. I didn't find much of an advantage to staying in City Center. Crystals is nice but way beyond my price range, that is what I would see as the only reason to stay there in particular.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Diamond00
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, spacious and well-appointed. The property is also clean and modern. The casino itself is not overly smokey and it seems more upscale than some of the other hotels. The pool was not crowded when we were there and it was very relaxing - my only negative would be that the music was too loud out there and in the gym. Though the gym is very comfortable with lots of nice, new equipment. This is our go-to hotel in Vegas - if you can get a good rate, don't look anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “High tech but low service”
Reviews.Author: buddymedbery
Reviews.Content: Upon checking into your room at the ARIA (after the Las Vegas obligatory march through the casino with its heavy pall of cigarette smoke), you find yourself in a high tech room such as I have not previously experienced. Everything from lights to curtains is electronically controlled and programmable. We had a room with a city view and it was very nice at night. However, although I understand the rationale for making you enter through banks of slot machines and blackjack tables, the smoking policy makes this a difficult experience for some, including me. Our room never got cleaned until mid-afternoon, making for an unpleasant experience if you cam back from activities and wanted to take a nap before the evening's festivities. Service at the check-in counter was desultory, and the concierge somewhat better. Overall, a decent place to stay, and probably better than many in Las Vegas, but could use some fixes. The location in City Center is as good as any.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Break From Typical Las Vegas Gaudiness”
Reviews.Author: zydechef
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 4 nights at the Aria at CityCenter in Las Vegas for my wife's birthday. We both really enjoyed the slightly toned down atmosphere at the Aria...the distinct lack of neon, flashing lights, gaudiness, faux gold "opulence" and on-going casino noise that typifies most of the Vegas hotels and casinos. Yes, I understand that's what many people go to Vegas for but its not what everyone wants. We ate twice at the Julian Serrano Spanish restaurant and really enjoyed both meals. The pools were beautiful and relaxing, other than the noise coming from the obnoxious Liquid Lounge. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the fitness center is well outfitted with weights and cardio equipment (though it gets quite crowded on weekends). The only nit we had to pick was that we couldn't find a safe in the room and no mention was made of a safe in the guest directory. We stumbled across the safe when we were checking out and opened the drawer to the nightstand...turns out it's hidden in there. We could have asked at the front desk but with nothing in sight and no mention of one in the directory, we just assumed there wasn't one. Also, as some of the negative reviewers have mentioned, they inject incense into the air in the common areas, this gets a bit annoying and may really bother people who are sensitive to perfumes and other strong smells. All in all, the Aria was a wonderful place and we would go back there if we ever return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time At Aria!”
Reviews.Author: D&MUpnorth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just finished a five night stay at Aria Resort and Casino and have mainly good things to say. Both check in and check out were done efficiently even though there were some line ups. When it was busy, some of the concierge staff went around with iPads and checked people out. Everyone that we dealt with was pleasant and helpful. The hotel is connected to the City Centre complex which has numerous stores and restaurants. There is a free tram that you can take to get to the Bellagio complex as well. When getting used to the layout of the hotel and surrounding area, we asked any of the hotel staff who are posted around the property for directions and were always given good advice. The room itself was excellent. We had a king room in the Main Tower with the mountain view. This turned out to be a bonus because in some of the other parts of the hotel, rooms overlook either the Liquid Bar at Aria or the Day/Night Club at the Cosmopolitan. You can hear the thumping of the bass from some of the other rooms until dawn apparently. We heard nothing. In fact, other than a few noisy people going by our door at night, the room was very quiet. The room was cleaned well each day. When you leave, you simply push the Service button by the door and the cleaning staff are notified. The cleaning staff came by once when we were in the room and they did not try to enter. A notice was left hanging on the doorknob. It asked us to notify them when we were ready. There is another button to light the Privacy light outside the room. No more Do Not Disturb sign hanging from the doorknob. We were also impressed with the wall to wall picture window with a great view of the mountains. The vanilla aroma that is pumped throughout the hotel is not overpowering at all. We found it pleasant and it covered much of the smoke smell in the casino. We had no problems dealing with the technical side of the room. As others have noted, you have an iPad like device next to the bed that can control the lights, curtains etc. You an also use the tv remote to access all of the room controls. There is a convenient Good Night button on both sides of the bed. When pushed, lights and tv go off and the curtains close. On the desk by the large flat screen, that has HD tv, there is a control panel where you can plug in your iPod or computer to listen to music etc. on the tv. We enjoyed the pool on a few occasions and, again, all of the attendants were very helpful. It’s definitely not a quiet place though. You have tour helicopters going overhead constantly and there is the fairly loud music from the Liquid Club when it’s open. We thought that the hotel might have made one of the pools No Smoking and will suggest that to them. It can be annoying to have smoke wafting over you as you sit to read or lounge in the pool. And, yes, some people actually do smoke in the pool! We tried two restaurants in the hotel, Michael Mina’s American Fish and The Buffet. Our meal at American Fish was the best one we had in Vegas. Everything was extremely tasty and well presented. The Buffet was nothing spectacular and had a cafeteria like feel to it. The food was good, just not something we’d return to with so many other options available. . All in all, we were very pleased with our stay at Aria and would definitely go back and will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “No smoke smell!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CarmenH2
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Las Vegas we stayed at the Excalibur which was fine, but when we got home everything smelled of cigarette smoke. I also had to take out my contact lenses if we stayed for an extended period of time in the casino. I can not express enough how amazing it was to be in a hotel/casino that allowed smoking and you had no idea. We stayed at the Aria for my 30th birthday with a large group of my family and friends and several in our group are smokers so it was nice for them and even better for us to not really notice it. Even above it not smelling like cigarette smoke, they infuse some fabulous smell through all areas of the casino and it is noticeable but not overwhelming at all! My cousin who is a smoker said she thinks about that smell all the time since our trip. It is a gorgeous and modern hotel with beautiful rooms, soft beds, and cool marble bathrooms. I enjoyed the buffet there as well. We went for the lobster and wine buffet for dinner one night and then brunch on a Sunday. I would highly recommend this hotel! I realize it's a little pricey, but for me even if I'm not planning on spending much time in the room I want to get a great night sleep and that isn't possible in some of the more inexpensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Something Different”
Reviews.Author: MDtravelertoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aria for two nights in September, one including the night of Vogue's "Fashion's Night Out". I have stayed in eight different hotels on the strip and one off and it was nice to do something different. While not as luxurious as the Wynn or Venetian, the Aria is definitely worth a visit. I enjoyed the technological advances in the room, particularly the one touch "Goodnight" button that closed the drapes and turned off all lights. The thing that separates this from the ultra luxury line is the bathroom. The shower and the large soaking tub are right next to each other with one door leading to both. You open the door and step into the shower or take another step to the tub. Different for sure. In addition, the double sinks were closer than other luxury hotels and there just wasn't as much room to spread out makeup, contact stuff, etc. But there was plenty of closet and drawer space, which was nice. I had a deluxe city view and that was great to see at night - the colorful fountain and all of the city lights. Hotel walls aren't all that thick and I had frat boys out in the hall at 3:30 am chatting it up, but I guess that happens in Vegas!! I found all personnel very friendly. I have seen complaints about checking in, but I arrived on a Wednesday and had no problem. Checkout lines were quite long, but to their credit, there was an employee checking people out in the lines with a mobile device, so that helped speed things along. For the millionth time I tried to check out of a hotel via the television, only to be told at the end of the process that it didn't work! That always happens to me. But I read the fine print underneath which explained how to text on the phone for checkout, and that worked fine. I enjoyed my stay, which included a great dinner at Sage, and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Aria is the new creme de la creme in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Meesh8325
Reviews.Content: Being our first trip to Vegas - picking the right hotel was our top priority! With so many wonderful properties to choose from (and they are all wonderful) I was blown away by our stay at the Aria. My parents had visited this hotel and said it was right up our alley. And it was! Far from the typical overly gaudy Vegas hotels on the strip - Aria is modern, chic, lavish and still over the top! Room - We loved the room - possibly one of the best hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. Huge comfy bed, great bathroom with two sinks, sunken tub AND a great shower, and a super geeky integrated control panel that powered all the lighting, curtains, temperature, music, and TV. We ate it up! There's nothing like walking in your room and having your room curtains go straight to sheers open to give you a fabulous view of the city. Or being able to go to complete "blackout" when its time for bed in Vegas. Food - On our first day we did brunch at Le Village Buffet at the Paris Hotel. We'd heard great things. And while we enjoyed our food - the brunch at the Aria was much better. Less of a wait and more selections. The only thing missing was a crepe station :) We also loved all of the restaurant selections at the hotel - Julian Serrano was our favorite! A great tapas restaurant right in the main lobby. Casino - loved this casino! Great selection, never overcrowded, fun, great music, and clean and modern. Service - top notch service. Check-in was a little slow but other than that everything was great. Pool - beautiful pool area with three great pools, plenty of chairs, great cocktails, and so relaxing. I definitely recommend trying the Aria - whether you've been to a Vegas 100 times or it is your first time! I'd love to go back to Vegas and try a few other hotels to see how they compare but I'm sold on the Aria for life! Best new hotel in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous accommodations”
Reviews.Author: christine_sam36
Reviews.Content: My family (everyone is over 21) met in Las Vegas for a 4 day get-away, i was in charge of making the reservations for a nice place to stay. The Aria resort was like hitting the jackpot. Beautiful accommodations perfect location and very friendly staff. We felt comfortable throughout the entire resort. (And no we are just average folks looking for fun).

Reviews.Title: “A touch of class in a city known for crass”
Reviews.Author: BGericke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took advantage of a discount offer at the Aria and were very favorably impressed. The hotel is beautiful with inviting bars and public areas. Our room certainly rivaled the room we had in the Wynn and had some of the same amenities, such as electrically controlled curtains, stocked bar with snacks, great climate control and a huge glassed in shower with a large soaking tub. If I were to think of anything that wasn't wonderful I would mention shear size. The hotel is big and our room was at one end of the building. To get to the room from self parking almost required a lunch and a lantern. It was quite a hike. They have a world class fitness center with classes of various types (for a fee). So far our favorite Las Vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Bed....”
Reviews.Author: Rachel295
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite new as it was opened not long ago. I definitely love the air freshener in the hotel (very light baby powder smell) comparing to other hotels I have stayed @ in Vegas. The smell did not cause me headache and everything was clean. I have to say there are not a lot of food options on site as the pricing are so high. I ended up walking to the food court at Monte Carlos next door to find some cheap chinese, or sandwhiches, even McDonalds. You have to pay $20 a day for resort fees. And pools got really crowded early and we couldn't even find a spot to put down our towels. One thing i Have to say about this hotel is the bed and pillow. OMG!!! I called it my heavenly bed during my trip because all i wanted to do is to stay in bed and cuddle wiht my soft pillows. I slept so good and constantly wanted to nap because of the comfy bed. And I was in VEGAS!! Who sleeps or naps in Vegas? i think only me! I would recommend this hotel to friends if they have the budget for it. Otherwise, Vegas is Vegas, it's ok to stay @ Paris or Harrah's just to have a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Trip”
Reviews.Author: TVSeay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria 8/26-29 for a Girls Getaway. The hotel is SUPERB. The bellman was very helpful, since we arrived prior to check-in they offered to hold our luggage while we had lunch. The front desk was very accommodating and professional. The room was beautiful, the bathroom was like being at a spa. Our only negative was housekeeping, on Sunday our room was half-way cleaned; dirty towels left in the room, sheets not changed, pillows on the floor with no pillow cases. But we called for service and the woman who came up to correct the mishap did an excellent job

Reviews.Title: “Give it time, I think they can do better”
Reviews.Author: JanetT8
Reviews.Content: Since this hotel has only been around 2 years, I give it benefit of the doubt that it can do a lot better as time moves on. We arrived really late and didn't get into our room until 1am but that's because the check-in-process took so long. The lady at the front desk didn't know what she was doing. The room was already paid for but there were these "extra" charges. Long story short, my husband made the complaint the next morning and the manager was very nice, according to him, and she comp us for breakfast at the buffet. The Buffet was nice, I know they are trying to be as good as The Wynn buffet, but I think it still needs work. Overall, I think this hotel can do better and will improve over time and they do need to re-evaluate their staff and do some more training on customer services.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, very little smoking and great location!”
Reviews.Author: DHancock
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at Aria. We got an amazing deal, the location is perfect, there's very little smoking in the casino which was wonderful, the rooms are GREAT, bedding is wonderful and overall it was just a really nice experience; especially compared to many other places we've stayed on the strip. I HIGHLY recommend renting the pool cabanas at Vdara; they are spectacular and the least expensive around!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!! Exquisite! Corner room Suite!!! Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: judiebell
Reviews.Content: We're not like most Las Vegas tourists....we don't gamble and we don't club, but we do spa and drink cold beer. Arai's spa and fitness center, for $30/day was the best deal going. My husband and I spent hours each day relaxing in the quite outdoor spa pool removed from the larger, more noisier pools, relaxing in the salt room and heated stone bed room, sitting in the jacuzzi hot tubs each with their own temperature so you can choose your comfort level, enjoying the complimentary juices and teas, nuts and fruits. I read by the large fireplace in my bathrobe while my husband worked out...to us, $30 /day for each person was an incredible deal and just the way we wanted to spend our days. As for our corner suite...oh my it was lovely. 2 bathrooms, heated toilet seats, floor to ceiling glass on 2 sides of the room...very nicely appointed in every aspect. The City Center shopping mall, connected to the Aria, was exquisite...top of the line stores whether puchasing or just enjoying window shopping. You can eat and drink in the City Center and they'll put it on your room bill...we ate and drank at Wolfgang Puck's, Yummy. There were a few places in Aria, like the sports bar, and connected to Aria, like the Irish Pub, that offered some happy hour deals...we liked that. Pints for $5 dollars. Some appetizers more reasonable priced. We ate at Aria's breakfast buffet and lunch buffet...it was good. Cheaper than some of the other buffets, like Bellagio's buffets, but not as incredible as them either. Nice food and very nice selection at Aria but I wouldn't say incredible, which is what I say each time we eat at Bellagio's buffet which is the building next door so go there if you want a WOWEE!!! buffet. Overall, we loved ARIA and all it's offerings. It was our first time at ARIA and we can't wait to go back for some more R&R in the spa and then retire in our incredible corner suite.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel EVER.”
Reviews.Author: Meg_Vancity
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were just in Las Vegas for the third time, staying at Aria. We loved the casino, restaurants and our room was incredible. Nicest hotel room we have ever stayed in. We upgraded when we arrive for an extra 30 dollars a night and got a room on the 40th floor overlooking the strip. The view was unreal! The cafe downstairs is where we ate most mornings and I cant express how fantastic the serive and food is. We loved it! I have heard complaints that Aria is too far from the strip, but there is a free shuttle that runs every 2 minutes! And we walked down to the strip without using the shuttle and it takes 5 minutes, so I am not too sure what these people are complaining about!! I have recommended Aria to everyone I know. My brother and his girlfriend are going together next month. I will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive and not a good value...”
Reviews.Author: JITWTAL
Reviews.Content: We went to a family wedding and stayed at Aria due to other family members staying there. I have to say that while certain things were high quality, overall for the price, I would not stay here again. The cost of drinks at their bars was outrageous ($30 for a glass of wine - are you kiddding me?) and the breakfast buffet was nothing special but they jack the price on the weekends and it's $30 per person prior to gratuity. So for 3 of us having breakfast on Saturday, it was a $90 bill. Just to give you examples. The restaurants in Aria were very nice and the food was really good in general. The rooms were adequate but again the price for what you get is overrated. We were given an upgrade for free but it turns out we had an awful view so it kind of negated that good feeling of getting something for nothing. Anyway, overall I would stay somewhere else as the value received to what was paid was out of balance.

Reviews.Title: “Aria Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: robertoangels69
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel , room are very itech ,restaurent very very good but expensif ,hotel service and room service are also very very good 2 time wee travel to Aria and still the p^lace to go !

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: HNEW44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria from 8-11 Sept 2011. The room was a deluxe room with city view. It had a view of the Cosmopolitan, Vdara, Rio and Palms Hotels. The room was automated so that you could open the curtains, turn on/off lights, turn on/off the privacy/service door signs and set the alarm within your TV for wake-up. The bathroom was very modern and I would love to have it in my home. The beds were the ultimate in comfort and even though I love a firm bed, the softer bed in the Aria did not hurt the back. There was also a hike to the elevators from my room; but there was no wait time for an elevator, because there were separate elevator banks for the different sets of floors. I had a hot stone massage at the spa there as well. Robert was a professional and awesome masseuse. The best time to go to the spa is in the morning so that you can wake up slowly and comfortably with a massage or any of the other spa amenities offered. The only drawback was there wasn't an outlet at your bedside so that you could keep your phone close by to charge. The only charging outlets for phone/laptop was on the desk across from the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and convenient”
Reviews.Author: VegasVet53
Reviews.Content: We made our annual Anniversary trip to Las Vegas this June and decided to take advantage of an offer to visit a property that we had not previously stayed at. Arriving on a Sunday afternoon was a little hectic but the staff at registration was so helpful and considerate. When they saw that we were Players' Club Members and were taking advantage of a promotion, we were upgraded to a city view room with a spectacular view of the strip. The multiple swimming pools were a real treat. The security staff even offered suggestions at to the best locations to find some shade on a sunny 100 degree Vegas afternoon. We took the show "Elvis" and thoroughly enjoyed both the production and the theater itself - sitting on sofas/couches instead of the traditional seating. We had lunch at the buffet - especially worthwhile if you a fan of fresh shrimp and crab legs that have already been split for you. The casino itself is large and offers many choices for gaming. The new Players' reward program lets you keep track of your perks and you can decided how to utilize them. Checkout was a breeze. The staff had notepads and stood in the registration desk area. You just gave them your room number and they could call up your statement, ask you to verify a few things, and then would email you a receipt. It took longer to get our car from valet (complimentary) than it did to check out. Definitely on our "do it again" list. Also, its location in City Centre gives you access to all the fine restaurants, shops and transportation(Tram) to other nearby properties.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Al4luv
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the rooms at the Aria. Everything from lighting, music and even room temperature was controlled by the remote through the TV. Overall I found the hotel to be very modern and sheek. My only complaint is that two of the clubs gave the impression that we would either recieve free drinks or VIP treatment of some sort either of which was true. Another disappointment was the lack of comps. Other casinos we visited offered us free meals, $5 credits for the slots, etc. The Aria was pretty skimpy in this department. However more than make up for it with the accomodations. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Premier first class hotel right in the centre of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: androidmilf
Reviews.Content: Aria is the jewel of CityCenter and of Las Vegas Boulevard South (a.k.a. The Strip). From its spacious casino floor to its three amazing outdoor pools, a guest is always treated as a first class customer. Aria also has an amazing fitness centre. The guest rooms are environmentally friendly as the hotel is LEED certified. As the hotel is centrally located on the Strip, a person can easily walk and visit other attractions on Las Vegas Boulevard South. I highly recommend staying at Aria in Las Vegas, as it offers great value for price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel we loved it”
Reviews.Author: wiggy10004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week at the Aria Resort at the beginning of September. After reading the reviews I was apprehensive about checking in especially after a 10 hour flight from the UK the last thing we wanted was to have to wait in line for hours on end. We arrived at the hotel at about 4.30pm on a Thursday afternoon, there wasn't one person waiting to check in. It took all of 5 mins and we were on our way to our room. They did take our credit card for incidentals but never mentioned charging anything to it like on some other reviews! There is a smell of vanilla in the hotel but we both thought it was quite pleasant. The notel is very modern and the rooms were excellent. Loved the control panel at the side of the bed where you could control everything from the curtains opening to the temperature. The "goodnight" button was the best because that turned everything off! After reading reviews I didn't expect our room to get cleaned but for the first 3 days there was no problem and the room was cleaned before lunch. On the 4th day the room didn't get cleaned so on returning at 11pm my husband rang guest services and within 10 minutes someone brought us up some clean towels and a bag full of soap, shower gel mouth wash sewing kits etc for the inconvenience! Next morning my husband went to reception and asked that our room be cleaned and that he wasn't prepared to pay the resort fee of around $20 plus tax for the day the room wasn't cleaned. If anything the only complaint would be that the buy-ins in the Casino were too expensive. My husband likes poker but $125 is just a bit too expensive and the minimum $10 chips for roulette were too expensive. The best bit was when we went to check out and found that they hadn't added any resort fee to our account and that we owed them nothing! I have kept checking my credit card statement just in case but we have been home 5 days now and so far nothing has been charged. It was our first time in Vegas and we loved it but considering it is such a long way we probably won't return. I wouldn't have a problem with staying at the Aria Resort though if we did return and I would certainly recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room, Great Pool for Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: MrMikeAppleValley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after getting a good mid-week rate on Priceline. Be aware that the $20.00 resort fee (just another way to jack up the price) is in addition to the price quoted by Priceline. The resort fee is supposed to include a morning newspaper, but none was delivered to the room and I didn't see any available for the pickup anywhere in the lobby. Check-in was on the slow side, they didn't seem to have enough clerks. The checkout was also slow since they have an 11:00 AM checkout time and many people waited until the last hour to checkout. We stayed just after the Labor Day weekend and the hotel didn't seem to be crowded, so check-in and out could be a problem on busy weekends. The room was pleasant and well designed. The bed was exceptionally comfortable and I liked the lay out of the bathroom, although it was not especially fancy by luxury hotel standards. House keeping was good, but there was a long, easily visible black hair on the window sill and the chrome in the bathroom was very water spotted. There was no trace of smoke smell on our non-smoking tenth floor. The electronic room controls are fun (especially the drapes that open automatically when you enter the room), but are actually a little tedious after the novelty wears off. The touch pad is not very sensitive and you have to press firmly to get it to respond. No ipad sensitivity here. As a result, what should be the room's most modern feature (the touch pad) seems a little dated already. The automatic drapes are the one really worthwhile electronic feature. The window covers the entire outside wall of the room and really opens up the room, so good drapes are a real necessity. Getting a room with a good view will be worth the extra money. The hotel is going to have a problem keeping all these windows clean and ours could have used some attention. The main pool was great, but doesn't open until 9:00 AM and closes at dark. The pool is shallow (about 4 feet) and decreases in depth at one end so you can just walk in. This is great for children and just relaxing, but it's not a swimmer's (or a partyer's) pool, which is probably a good thing for most people. The hotel is in a great location and right next to the incredibly up-scale shopping center. Bring your high-limit credit card if you want to shop there. Overall, this was a very nice stay. It's not up to the quality of a true five star hotel (It's a AAA five diamond hotel), but one of the nicer hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Resort Casino on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: seaver41
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Aria. Was originally going to Cosmopolitan but it was much more expensive. If you are flexible you can get a good rate at Aria and ths hotel is very noce. The rooms are fantastic with computer controlled everything. A Security Gaurd checks that you are a guest before you can get to the elevators. I like this. Although, I will say Las Vegas is a very safe city. Staff is very helpful and very friendly. The casino is not very smokey, which is great. Some of the older casinos, the cigarette smoke is just too much for me. Aria has plenty of restaurants and upscale shopping. It is also very close to CVS drug store, Walgreens for cheap supplies. Fatburger and Hard Rock are right across the street. Free WiFI and free printing of boarding pass is now an option and was not during my first stay

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: jenny m
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights and loved every minute of it! We had read the reviews and were ready not to be impressed by some things but we were nothing but impressed. There was no queue at reception and the receptionist was very pleasent and helpful. The room was lovely and housekeeping were excellent - the room was cleaned and fresh towels left everyday. We expected that everywhere in the hotel would take ages to walk to but we walked to end of the corridor and even if you are at the very end it only takes 5 minutes max to get to the lift. The hotel is also less than a two minute walk from the main strip and is no further away then the Belligio or Mirage which are just off the strip as well. The pool area was large and beautiful and you could always get a sun lounger even on the weekend. We stayed over labor day weekend and thought there was no chance we could get near the pool but there was plenty of sun loungers all day. The hotel was expensive to eat and drink but that is what you expect if you stay at a 5 star hotel. We did eat and drink at other cheaper hotels so it does not always have to be expensive. The Todd English pub had great food. If we go to Las Vegas again we are definately staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED the Aria!”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne B
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day, 5 night vacation at the Aria Resort & Casino. Everything was wonderful. We loved our room--it was nice and spacious and the one-touch technology was awesome. It remembered our settings for when we entered the room and it was so nice to get into bed and with a touch of the finger, the curtains closed and the lights went out. The marble bathroom and garden tub were gorgeous! Our friends and family were "wowed" by our pictures of the hotel room. We can't wait to go back next summer and couldn't imagine staying anywhere BUT here. I was quite nervous about checking in since I read plenty of "horror" stories on this website before leaving. I even braced myself for the long process. Much to my sheer surprise and delight, we faced NO challenges during check in. In fact, we both thought since we got into town early ( we arrived to the hotel by 11am) they wouldn't let us check into the room so early. We ate an early lunch (we were coming in from the East coast) and around 1230 we decided to walk by the desk and see when the earliest check in time would be. They were already checking in people! We waited in line for maybe TEN minutes and we were all checked in and off to our room. The one thing that we weren't prepared for was the $130 a night incidental hold they put on your credit card. We had a $650 "hold" put on our card that we weren't expecting. I know many hotels have similar policies, but we did feel it was a bit much per night. It was a fabulous experience from the beginning to the end and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: ashlee123
Reviews.Content: First off the vanilla sent is not that strong I can't believe people actually complained about this. The hotel is huge and beautiful. The rooms are amazing with a great view. If you're not good with technology then don't stay here because everything is controlled by a touch screen pad which was awesome. Comfy beds and clean rooms. Excellent buffet which on weekends serves amazing brunch. The steak house was excellent as well. My boyfriend and I came here on labor day weekend and all of Las Vegas is packed. The liquid pool was fun, its a pool party so if you're not into that then hang out by the regular pool. I love Vegas and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but check your bed!”
Reviews.Author: GremioRoma
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 7pm; no line at the front desk, nice new and modern atmosphere. But once I got in the bed aiming for some rest (jetlag), I realized this was undone and full of somebody elses... hair!! Yuck! The housekeeping got upstairs after 45minutes, despite my two calls, and the guilty portorican type tought I wanted to simply have the night Service done! On the negative points, the scent of vanilla in every area is anoying on the long lasting period. Apart from this, the position is ok (close to Bellagio) and the resort areas are very new and modern. The Jean Philippe bar is awesome for a tasty breakfast or a quick lunch. Nice poker room, where I met the star Negreanu! Overall a good solution. But the best to me remains the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars for the room- o stars for the hotel itself”
Reviews.Author: sophisticatedlady_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four night stay at the Aria. We absolutely loved the corner suite and the wonderful housekeeping staff, but the check in process was abominable! It took 5 hours until we finally got a room. We had to wait in line for an hour to check in and then 5hours later, waited another 45 minutes in another line to get the keys. When we got to the room, one of the keys did not work. We waited for security 30 minutes standing on our sore feet next to the room until security finally came to fix the problem. They gave us a 50.00 credit only after I called to complain about all the time they wasted of our vacation. By the way, we were celebrating our anniversary. Not a fun way to start a romantic getaway. Besides the service being awful, the music is non-stop loud and annoying. You can only take the constant beating of the drums and that synthesized singing for so long. The same songs play over and over. No matter where you are in the hotel- the pool, the restaurants, the fitness center, you cannot get away from it. When I go on vacation, even Vegas, you want to be able to go sit in a bar or a fine restaurant, and hear some soothing music. I will review the restaurants in which we ate in the Aria individually. I will say the room was gorgeous and the bed was comfortable, but I will not be back. Perhaps Vegas is only interested anymore in catering to people in their 20's and 30's, but they are losing the rest of us. We miss that "old rat pack feel," when you came to Vegas and felt like a "king." Now you feel like a peon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Modern, Comfortable, definitely 5 star!!!”
Reviews.Author: ELVISROCKS
Reviews.Content: Just home after 9 nights staying at the Aria and I have to say this hotel is definitely 5 star, the rooms are huge, modern with wall to wall, floor to ceiling windows with panoramic views which we were lucky to have a view of the strip, absolutely spectacular at night. The bed and pillows were unbelievably comfortable and my hubby loved all the mod gadgets for opening the curtains etc... The bathroom was fantastic with a wet room style shower and housekeeping were first class, everything was spotless and nothing was a problem when I asked for extras. The smell of the hotel was yummy and a breath of fresh air to come back to every day. I have travelled to many places all over the world and stayed in so many hotels including a Royal Residence and I have to say that the Aria was definitely high on my list of great hotels. We looked at other hotels in Las Vegas and some of them were amazing but the Aria definitely won us over with the huge modern bedroom. Anyone heading to Las Vegas, make sure you bring a foot scrub and cream if you suffer from dry skin around your feet as the dry heat will dry your heels and crack!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edsgirlAustin
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a 3 night stay at Aria and really enjoyed everything about our stay. I received a pretty good deal from my MLife players club and decided to give it a try. Boy, am I glad we did! Check-in at 2:30 in the afternoon was quick and very friendly. The clerk did her best to give us the best room for our needs. I was a little disappointed that the corner suite was not avaliable for upgrade but once we got to our room the disappointment was over. Very lovely room, bigger than I thought it would be, and very modern and clean. The casino was fun, the pool area was fabulous, the spa was breathtaking, and every employee we encountered was friendly and helpful. My only complaint would have to be that the bed was too soft. It felt great when you first laid down on it but I do have a bad back, like so many other people, and would have prefered a more firm mattress. I would like to point out that the cocktail service at the pool was great. On the second day that my husband went out, the server remebered his name, what he liked to drink, and even which team he was rooting for in that nights football game. This made him feel very pampered! We will definetly choose Aria as our home base for our next visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Competes against the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dseesel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria between the 5th and 9th of September, and really enjoyed our stay. (As a comparison, we have most recently stayed at the Bellagio, Venetian and Four Seasons hotels in LV.) The Aria was very aggressively promoting packages during what was probably a slow midweek right after Labor Day, so we feel like we got a good value...$139 per night plus a room upgrade and $200 resort credit for our four-night stay.
