Keep shopping for "deals" and you may be equally lucky...certainly at that price the Aria feels like a good value. We liked the "modernism" of the City Center and the Aria. Some other reviews have described the hotel as "cold," but it simply aspires to be more contemporary, without the "theme park" feel of some other LV hotels. We found the Aria staff uniformly friendly and well-trained, and had no issues with the check-in process that other reviews have complained about. Enjoyed the restaurants (especially Lemongrass and Jean Georges) and the pool. Loved the combo shower/tub, did think the bed was a bit soft for our taste. Some of the negative reviews need to be taken with a grain of salt: Having to walk a bit for your free (repeat, FREE) morning paper is not a big deal. Figuring out the technology in your room is not that difficult. And yes, there is a room safe (in the dresser)...hey, if you can't find it, call the front desk and ask where it is!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rimk44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aria for 4 nights beginning Labor day and could not have asked for a better hotel experience. we had a corner suite on the 51st floor, and the room was fabulous. After a little work with the remote which controls all of the room's electronics, we figured it out and were impressed with everything. We didn't touvch the minibar, but the room was equipped with a small refrigerator that we used regularly, especially as there was a cvs on the strip within walking distance. The concierge scored us great tickets at the last minute for "O", and the valet parking is well organized and easy to use.Aria also has a great tram that moves between the Monte Carlo, Aria and Bellagio. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. I've read complaints that the rooms can be far from the elevator. We were in the corner and it is a 30 second walk to the elevator, not an obstacle at all.

Reviews.Title: “Long Check-in process, hung up on 3 times when calling from the room.”
Reviews.Author: met2323
Reviews.Content: Room.was not totally cleaned prior to our entry. Called front desk, hung up on 3 times... Found employee in hallway, he cleaned bathroom immediately. Carpet not swept well. We even checked in an hour late. Casino was fun and safe. A little over priced, restaurants just a little too "fu-fu". I will try other hotels if I go back. It was my first visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: kamaldaye m
Reviews.Content: I flew into aria on 09/03/2011 stayed till 09/08/2011 with my mom.This as a first time traveller was the most awesome experience.Sure it is a little costly to eat at the restaurant but if you are going to vegas and have to complain about spending some money then you may have chosen the wrong place.The rooms are beautiful, bed is a cloud to sleep on.Immaculate clean, the staff is the most willing , efficient , courteous, eager to please, helpful, knowledgeable, kind people.As a single mom, on her dream vacation.UNFORGETTABLE.WOULD LOVE TO GO BACK.WISH I NEVER HAD TO LEAVE.the hotel itself is artistic, beautifully designed, poetry come to life.would definitely recommend.Oh ,free of bed bugs and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay at the New Aria”
Reviews.Author: jrprvs2000
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Room - Especially liked the remote control curtains!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelduchess25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just celebrated our 27th anniversary at the Aria, and we could not have picked a better hotel, check in took 5 minutes at the most, contrary to what other travelers have said about that, the front desk people are very professional and courteous, there is an amazing scent of vanilla that floats through the entire hotel, loved walking into that after a hard day of shopping, site seeing etc, very pleasant.The room had a corner suite view, we were on the 16th floor so it was incredible and the bed really is amazing as the pillows, which they do sell in their store on the main floor!!, we had a few minor problems upon checking in, mostly with the housekeeping dept there was shaving foam left on the front of the couch!, and candy wrappers on the window sill, but that was cleared up with no issues, it would have been nice to walk into the room meticulous, being our anniversary, but that wasnt the case, oh well, however the next day we were surprised with chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary, this hotel has really set the bar for other hotels, its way up there in the modern deco field, you have absolutely everything you need in the vanity dept in the bathrooms, and also mini bar is full, but watch you dont touch anything you DONT want!,as you will be charged for it, as it is all sensor touch. I will definitely be back to the Aria, and highly recommend this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: skingKansas
Reviews.Content: I always hate to write negative reviews, but with all the great lodging options on the strip I felt compelled to. I had read the reviews prior to my stay and I wish I would've listened to them. The hotel, even with being new, does not keep up with simple maintenance issues in the room. I am not sure how many rooms the hotel has but I can guarentee that they could've put us in a room that was a little less worn. Bathroom knob broken, lights/curtains malfunctioned ect. It was not a cheap stay either! We would never stay here again and felt there was very little service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: DeveA666
Reviews.Content: As part of a holiday to Southern California this property was tagged at the end for 2 nights. Hotel is set back from the strip beween the Monte Carlo and the Cosmopolitan, A shuttle monorail operates between, Monte Carlo Aria and the Bellagio. Check in was swift and room was available midweek from 1pm. The hotel has a polished finish. Fixtures and fitting are above average/very good in the room and furthermore communal area like pools, lobby, restaurants are spotless. Staff are freindly and courteous. A more sedate feel to it this hotel is more laid back and less buzzy than the resorts on the strip. As a family this suited our needs, Very enjoyable and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in an Excellent Location that lacks Five Star Service”
Reviews.Author: vampiresa05
Reviews.Content: The Aria is indeed a gorgeous new hotel on the center of the strip. The hotel impresses with the decor and the grandeur of the architecture. The rooms are a good size with the latest in technology (somebody not too tech savvy may have a hard time operating the control pad that operates everything in the room). I must say it was nice touch to walk-in and have the curtains open upon your arrival as well as music playing. The beds are super comfortable and the bathroom is really nice (there is even a magnifying mirror- great for girls)! The hotel itself has every commodity possible- though at a price of course. It is a pricey hotel but it's expected given the type of hotel. There is a CVS and a Walgreens super close, so go there for anything you may need such as water. There are plenty of restaurants at all price ranges and different types of foods. We ate at Julian Serrano and though the food was really good- the service was terrible. The waitress had no personality and she made us wait a lot. It took her forever to clear our plates and did not ask once if everything was okay. This was my birthday dinner, so it was disappointing. We alerted management, and the manger didn't convince me in him trying to fix the situation. He didn't care either. As far as service- it's a hit or miss really. It just depends on who of their staff you interact with. My check-in process was good, though I did have to wait more than 15 minutes to check-in. They don't have a streamlined process to do this as it is not one line but just open and people get confused and skip others. I approached the front desk about an issue during my stay and the agent was not pleasant or customer service oriented. She was not compassionate and didn't care about what I had to say. On the flip side, I did lock myself out of the room and one of the housekeepers rescued me as I was on my way out to catch my flight and needed my room opened ASAP. This was at 3:30am and that person was really nice and understood my sense of urgency. With a hotel that large with so many employees, it must be hard to ensure that everyone is on point when it comes to customer service. Room hygiene is something the Aria should really focus on. The rooms are not cleaned the way they should be. It seems the housekeepers do a very superficial cleaning during your stay- more like make the beds and empty trash. The common grounds were very clean. The pool area is really nice and even though I went during Labor Day Weekend, there were enough chairs. The drinks at the pool are super pricey- FYI (expect to pay $16 minimum for a drink). We also went to Gold Lounge- great place to warm up with drinks. Beware though, they sell you open bar for $10- it's not open bar it's only well drinks like cranberry and cheap vodka. For Vegas though, I think that is a good deal nonetheless. We partied at Haze and that's an awesome night club! We had a blast there and definitely recommend it. Overall, this is a great place to stay and worth the money if you get a good deal on the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: jacknmacksmom
Reviews.Content: This a very sleek, modern and new resort in the huge City Centre complex in Las Vegas. Check-in was quick and painless, but of course you have to lug your bags through the casino to get to the elevators. Our room was fantastic and a nice surprise. We booked a corner suite and it was very spacious, well decorated and had a great panoramic view of the Strip. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the bathrooms were nice too. The only real issues we had were with housekeeping, which appears to be a common theme in reviews. The room was cleaned nicely and turn down service was a nice feature that you don't get at all Vegas hotels, but I wasn't able to take a bath because of the gross ring around the tub. Also, the windows were dirty and a cord that we needed for the TV to work (which they said they had) was never delivered to us despite two calls. The worst infraction: walking into the room while the privacy light was on. Luckily, the door chain was on because I was not dressed! As well, be warned to bring earplugs if you want to sleep at night. The thumping of the bass from the clubs below will keep you up all night. It is Vegas! The three pools are lovely, although a few more umbrellas might be in order. The casino is also nice, with a great ventilation system for us non-smokers. The hotel features some good restaurants. The best was probably the Jean George Steakhouse and the weakest was Julian Serrano Tapas. The brands have been stretched too far in my opinion with both of these chefs. Overall, a nice romantic weekend in a nice hotel, but they could do a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas for the non-gambler types”
Reviews.Author: anotherroadwarrior2
Reviews.Content: A newer property on the Las Vegas strip, Aria has a huge advantage. It's still in remarkably good condition and provides rooms that are a solid step above what you get in many hotels in the city. The room was really clean and well appointed and everything was comfortable. But this being Las Vegas, the room is meant to be used sparingly as they want you in the casino. However, it still provided a good work space for me. I was here on a business trip, which is why a non-gambler like myself ends up in Las Vegas all the time. For your business planners: the meeting rooms were very good and the technical service was quick and polite. We had an audio problem and they fixed it fast. Of course, like all these Las Vegas hotels, it felt like a 10 mile walk to get to the meeting rooms, so plan your trips carefully. Forgetting something is a real pain. And the business center was useful, but overpriced. The Aria swimming pools are marvelous, with a good number of choices. I decided again the "adult only" pool, so I can't comment on that. But the main pool area is clean, chairs are plentiful and if you plan well, you can even find shade. One last point: like so many other hotels on the strip, the Aria is attached to loads of high priced shopping and marathon like walks from place to place. Keep in mind that there are budget choices nearby, such as CVS for immediate needs (at normal prices) and even McDonald's not to far away. So everything doesn't have to be Las Vegas style!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1 bedroom suite, room was very spacious and comfortable with great mountain views, the hotel had a pleasant vanilla smell which masked the smoke smell, hotel is located in the middle of strip which is convient to get around, the 3pools are fantastic, restaurants are over priced, for a fantastic pizza and pasta head over to Crystals and visit Wolf Gang Puck's Pizzeria mmmmm.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this resort”
Reviews.Author: MrGeek
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Aria over Labor Day weekend for our 10 year anniversary and enjoyed every second of what Aria had to offer. The whole City Center Area is beautiful and clean. I was very impressed to see a large cleaning crew at 0400 outside making sure the property was ship shape when I needed to make a quick jaunt to the CVS down the street.. I actually recall seeing the property being cleaned 24/7. Are the costs a little bit higher? Yes but if you want cheap and crappy, stay at Bally's or Imperial Palace. I will pay a little more to stay in a place that holds itself to a higher standard. The pool was a good time. I'm sure there are nicer pools in Vegas but we still managed to have a blast drinking and splashing all day long. I strongly suggest Barmasa for a sushi dinner. Our waiter, Chris was outstanding and was a shining example of the level of service Aria demands from its employees. Every person we interacted with was eager to serve and made this special weekend very memorable for my wife and I. The only thing i can think to say in response to the negative reviews is that I don't get it. This resort is fantastic and we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Modern and friendly”
Reviews.Author: monocar
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked into my room at Aria, I knew this was going to be a great experience. The lights came on, curtains opened, and music played. What a greeting!! And the bed...ohh the bed!! It was like sleeping on a cloud!! (what a pity it wouldn't fit into my suitcase) The rest of the room was fantastic too, with a huge flatscreen TV, audio panel and spacious bathroom complete with tub. Aria staff were super friendly and obliging, and I was always greeted with a smile in the hall by housekeeping. The pool is devine with plenty of sunny or shady areas, and I highly recommend a visit to the Aria spa..the salt room in particular. I was there for a mix of business/pleasure, and rate the conference/ballroom facilities very highly too. My only criticism was of room service, once out of the numerous times I ordered from them, when my order arrived 25mins late and I didn't have time to eat before running out the door. Like I said, this was only once, and can happen anywhere. This issue paled in comparison to the rest of my experience which was five star all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! An amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Gill M
Reviews.Content: We booked this as a night without kids and a real treat. It didn't disappoint! Check in was rather long winded as it seemed to take ages to check each room in, but after about 10 minutes we got ushered to a VIP check in which was quick and painless. The room (we booked a deluxe with a view) was fantastic. As we walked into the lobby of the room, the music came on, the curtains drew back to reveal a stunning view of The Strip. The pools were on the second floor, and really quiet and we watched the sun go down through the trees. We had the buffet in the hotel and it was really great, again, not crowded at all. A treat all round. Stunning room, stunning lobby, stunning experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mgill339
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Up to date rooms and spacious. Awesome washrooms. Love the keypad that operates the lighting, curtains, tv, etc. Perfect location, centre strip. Vanilla scent as you walk in is a bit overwhelming, but just in the lobby area. Pools and hot tubs are amazing. Lots of loungers available. Gym was super nice and big. Only issue, whilst trying to take a mid day nap, we could hear another hotels pool party from our room, and we were on the 21st floor. Hotel doesn't have any strip view rooms because it's set a little further back from Las Vegas Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Tough to beat”
Reviews.Author: MickyDionisio
Reviews.Content: Before our stay at Aria we loved the Venetian. After our stay at Aria, Venetian now feels dated. You walk into the room and the lights and curtains open automatically.It was a great welcome touch. Everything is pretty much remote controlled from TV, to curtains, lights to checking out. The decor is right up our alley, very trendy. The crowd is also chic and young. The location is as advertised - city center making it easy to get right in the middle of the strip. We are most definitely going to be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “A sure bet! Wish it could be kept a secret!”
Reviews.Author: ILove2Travel95
Reviews.Content: After reading a number of mixed reviews, I was becoming skeptical about staying at Aria and was considering canceling our reservation and selecting another hotel on the Strip. I’m so glad I didn’t! Having just returned from a week long stay during the last week of August, I can happily say, Aria is a refreshing Las Vegas hotel experience, somewhat of a departure from the frenzied nature of some of the other big names on the Strip, while still providing that uniquely Las Vegas casino and hotel experience. I look forward to going back! Aria is immaculately clean. There was always someone cleaning something when we were walking around the hotel grounds, cleaning glass, railings and dusting. Aria is beautiful to look at with stunning architecture and design elements throughout. The lobby is infused with a wonderfully relaxing yet intriguing vanilla scent and the common areas are decorated in rich, dark tones. The casino area is very open and spacious, and everything is thoughtfully laid out around the hotel, so, although it is a big property, it was never difficult to navigate and never took a long time to get anywhere inside the hotel as it often does in many of the other larger hotels on the Strip that seem more labyrinth. Staff in the dining venues in particular were very friendly and willing to talk, offer suggestions based on our requests, and we never felt rushed. The Sky Box Bar and Grill was excellent for a bar style meal with typical American bar fare such as burgers and wings, nachos, and a few other types of sandwiches and desserts. There were plenty of TV’s for watching sports! We had dinner at Lemongrass, the Thai restaurant, and it was fabulous! I’d definitely go back on a future trip. The food was fresh and ultra flavorful, dinners were served hot, and the service was very friendly and attentive, yet unobtrusive. We opted for breakfast at the Jean Philippe Patisserie several mornings, which is very convenient as it’s just a step from the guest elevators and the staff works quickly to move people through the line. There’s a large selection of breakfast pastries, quiches, yogurt, granola, panini and crepes, among some other items. The chocolate muffin was my favorite as it had a small yet awesome layer of fresh chocolate creme infused into the muffin. Yum! We returned to the Patisserie later in the day on several occasions to try the gelato, which was, of course, great! The Buffet had good quality food on offer but service here was the only somewhat negative exception among the venues in the hotel, as we had a minor glitch the first morning when we were never acknowledged after being seated in order to request coffee and juice. A number of other tables around us were seated and greeted, and received beverages while we sat there for an extended period of time. I eventually got up and walked to get someone’s attention, because the staff attending to the tables in our area wouldn’t even look at us. Later, as we were finished eating and getting ready to leave, someone who I figured out was probably our server did awkwardly come by our table and looked at our table, but not really at us, and she didn’t say anything and moved on. No coffee refill was ever offered after the person clearing tables eventually brought me my original cup, but I suspected that in advance, so I rationed my one cup. It was very odd, but really the only exception to our time there. I did use the spa, and while my massage was excellent and relaxing, I feel the spa common areas could have been more thoughtfully designed. Spending some time there was still a great retreat, however, the lighting in certain areas was too bright in my opinion. On the brochure, they show the wet area with the whirlpools and sauna and steam room dimly lit with warm colored tones of stone and lighting. In reality, the area is brightly lit with white lights, and although it was still relaxing because I had just had a great massage, it had somewhat more of a gym locker room feel than a tranquil spa feel. There were only a small handful of lounge chairs in the whirlpool area, and they all were being used or had towels on them, so there was no opportunity to relax with a book or fall asleep for a brief nap after the massage. The eucalyptus steam room, however, is very spacious. Also, while using this area, while relaxing in the whirlpool, you can hear loud dance music from the Liquid pool party that takes place outside. So, all in all, in my opinion it’s not necessarily the most relaxing place to hang out and soothe your mind if that’s what you’re looking for in a spa day. In the co-ed area there are heated stone beds and a salt room. They were both small for a hotel of this size, and the stone beds were not warm enough. The stone beds were mildly relaxing until someone was emptying garbage and changing can liners in the hallway just outside the door and there were garbage bag noises that continued on and on for quite a period of time. I found the pool area to be particularly relaxing and enjoyable. It is very approachable, with little pretense. The pool grounds are very nicely laid out with wandering pathways and three separate pools and plenty of lounge chairs. We never had a problem finding a chair and were greeted promptly and offered bar and food service by a very friendly waitress. As for the rooms, they are stunning, as are the views, and the decor is warm and comfortable. The in-room technology is great, and the console next to the bed controls everything in the room including the curtains, lights, thermostat, television and wake-up settings. The console is a touch pad and it is not as immediately responsive as many people’s touch screen phones or tablets or similar devices that are out there today, but once you get a feel for it’s function, you adjust accordingly. The curtains were cool to play with (it’s the little things in life, right?), and it was amazing when entering the room for the first time (or any time, really) as they parted to reveal our spectacular Strip view. Oh, and yes, the beds and linens are amazingly soft and comfortable and available for sale. I may just have to splurge at some point! I do agree with some other reviewers in that housekeeping service was a bit inconsistent and didn't seem to have any rhyme or reason to it. A few days of our stay housekeeping was in our room but nothing substantial seemed to have been done except the bed made and our toiletries randomly re-arranged on the counter, no refills of soaps or shampoos or folding or refreshing towels. A few of the other days, many things were done and little touches were added, such as, I found my loose change that I had left on the dresser all organized on a mat, stacked neatly in separate stacks by coin type. One day used food wrappers were cleared from the table, another day they were not. One morning a newspaper appeared at our door even though we were supposed to go to the shop to get the daily newspaper. No newspaper any other day. Turndown service was only provided on 2 of 5 nights. Some of the furniture and furnishings were showing signs of abuse and the hotel is only less than 2 years old, but that is unfortunately due to guest abuse. Upon check in our shower had long some long black hair by the drain and we hadn't used the shower yet and I don't have black hair. It makes me wonder how well the shower or other surfaces are actually cleaned and I feel there should be more attention to detail in a hotel of this caliber. I feel that if I had asked housekeeping to attend to certain issues, they would have responded, but there was nothing so bad and the room was awesome, so we moved on. Overall, despite some of the very minor things I’ve commented on for the purpose of this review, Aria was truly a special experience and has so much to offer both within the hotel itself and throughout the City Center complex. I can’t recommend it more highly and am eager to return someday on a future trip to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “All around beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: XxHollyxX
Reviews.Content: Stayed at aria from August 20-23 and had a great experience. I was upgraded to a city view room and the view was great! Ordered room service and although food was pricey, it was delicious. Loved how everything in room is high tech, everything from ac to tv is controlled from a tablet looking device. Staff is nice and always greets you when your walking in the hallway. I also loved the fact that in order to access the elevators to the rooms, you need to show your key. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and I plan on staying at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “poor house keeping”
Reviews.Author: Ken G
Reviews.Content: I arrived on 8/24. That evening I took a drink up to my room, the glass was still on the night stand Sat.morning when I checked out. There was a white cigarette butt outside my door,it was also still there on sat.morning. The door to the mini bar wouldn't close, a girl who came up to replace a battery in the door ,placed her knee on it an pushed,it closed. She said a lot of them do that..The floor lamp didn't work, she said someone would look at it, no one ever did. I usually go to Vegas at least once a year. The Aria is very nice if you like to be in the middle of everything on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, systems, aspects...stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: brian g
Reviews.Content: We were all excited to stay here...had gambled here before and found casino to be really nice, good layout, and modern styling. So we booked our Labor Day visit and stayed here....HUGE mistake! First impression...slow check-in, friendly bell staff but lazy counter clerks too busy chatting with each other to get a move on. Room is really nice and modern but everything slipped downhill from there. Broken lighting in bathroom (took 2 days to repair) NO in room coffee maker (buy it downstairs after a long hike) free newspaper with your $20 resort fee...but be sure to walk downstairs 200 meters to pick it up yourself...no room delivery, or even lobby pickup... Plus, the in-room internet service is so slow and poor as to make any internet experience a big frustration. Concierge won't print out boarding passes unles you are actually ...hey, I could go on and on. You get the point --- nice facility, but service and accomodating a pleasure traveller is fairly weak and iffy. And do NOT explore the mini-bar or charges will magically appear on your bill. We have stayed elsewhere at Vegas but the Aria may state that it is a resort, but their structural support for pleasure travelers is a little lacking. NO ventilation in bathrooms, weak batteries in remote, NO outlets that can be used by the bed....you get the drift. And don't get us started on the gaming table minimums...or the overpriced and far-flung food options. If you want to go to Vegas stay at the M...and skip the Aria. The M will show youi how service is done.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Everything, Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: techmaximum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the third week of June and was very happy with practically everything. Room was immaculate, great furnishings, lots of space, very soft bed...some might say too soft. Our room was on the ninth floor and at the end of the hall, which meant we had a very long walk to and from our room. We got our share of exercise to and from our room, but we were ok with that. After staying at the Wynn, Pallazzo, and Monte Carlo on previous trips to Vegas, we rank Aria among the best. Our package included 4 nights and free buffet for a very reasonable price. The buffet ranks with the Wynn and is far superior to most we've tried in Vegas and would consider going back for sure. The casino in Aria is large and dark and provided above average wins, which is why we spent a significant amount of time there. Drink service in the casino was steady and the ambiance was great, so we were never in a rush to leave. If you like high end shops, there's plenty available surrounding the casino area, just remember to bring your wallet! The architecture in Aria is a reason to visit this place on its own, as it features some of the most brilliant curves and designs we've ever seen. Everywhere you go throughout Aria is an awsome experience to see! I highly recommend Aria for those who like the best of the best and suggest staying here soon if prices remain affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Holiday”
Reviews.Author: LaurieHS11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the last week of August and had a great holiday - chose a deluxe city view room for the four of us - 2 adults and two girls - 20 and 21 years old. The view was spectacular and the room size was great for the four of us. Which is saying a lot with three women and one bathroom. The dual sinks and private water closet allowed more than one person to get ready for the day at once. Room service was quick and professional - ate in two of the restaurants and both were excellent. We will stay here again and recommend to others. You get exactly what you pay for and expect from this 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: advising
Reviews.Content: You will enjoy the Aria, its pristine and neat and its a refresher from the strip. and beautiful view. The Trump las Vegas beats it because of luxury and size, here you have 2rooms and a balcony

Reviews.Title: “Best Beds in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sally3662
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Aria and I've never slept better in Vegas (even after losing money!). The beds are amazing and all the high tech gear was pretty cool. Nice pools, great restaurants - especially Julian Serrano, and just an all around grown-up vibe. No drunks in the elevators, no room service trays in the hall and not a lot of smoke in the casino. You can walk to Monte Carlo if you're looking for lower table stakes, or take the tram to the Bellagio. Check-in went fairly smoothly although it did take a while for valet parking to take our car. My only complaint was that the safe wasn't working but didn't really want to waste time waiting for someone to fix it. The rooms are not as big as the Venetian or Wynn, but otherwise we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A+ for bling but D- for customer service.”
Reviews.Author: 2011trips
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 10 staying at the hotel ( separate rooms). When we checked in we were told we would have a king size bed when we had requested 2 queens. The lady was so rude and kept on repeating " YOU choose the wrong option while booking". When we asked if they had any other rooms it was a flat out NO!. On the second day we left out service light on for housekeeping, when we came back housekeeping was still cleaning the room (no big deal) we asked when they would be done so we could come back later and were advised 10 mins ( great) when we came back to our room NOTHING was cleaned. We complained and were told it would be done immediately therefore we again left the room and came back 2 hours later and the room still looked the same. Very disappointing and absolutely no empathy from the front desk. Doesn't seem like a big deal however but it is just the principle! We were not looking for any hand outs...just a clean room. Will never stay there again. I would even recommend the IP before the Aria to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: SteveMedicoff
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Aria. At first, i was a bit nervous, as it was one of the least expensive resorts in Vegas. What a surprise, amazing hotel, very friendly staff and beautiful accommodations. Much nicer than Mandalay Bay or The Bellagio. The only complaint i had was that there was no in room safe, which i thing in Vegas is important. Other than that, amazing central location right on the strip, you can walk to most of the main Hotels and Casinos, beautiful pools, great restaurants, couldn't ask for a more beautiful and friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: kricar
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Its so beautiful and the room we had was amazing. My husband and I went with another couple and we had a Sky Suites, 2 bedroom penthouse. There was a TV in every room. The bathroom was the size of most peoples bedrooms and the service was fantastic. We also had our own bathroom in each bedroom which was great for geting ready to go out. This was a big splurge for us but worth it. A free limo picked us up at the aiport and took us the a private entrance at the back of the resort for our very speedy check in. The hotel is connected to Cosmopolitan and a very nice mall. You can walk to Mandalay and MGM but if you want to go to Encore which we did love you need a cab. One minute from the hotel is CVS and Walgreens to buy any item you forgot and snacks. There are also plenty of shops to buy something for the people back at home that arent too overpriced. Liquid is the party pool in this hotel and its a fun time. Not too young and not to crazy, its a little small but the music and food are good so its worth going. The portions they give you are actually big for lunch menu. They also have a huge pool which the music isnt loud and you can very easily relax. I would stay at this hotel again and we were all happy we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “First time at Aria a memorable one”
Reviews.Author: missmattie
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed in September 2010 but I don't have the option of selecting the month of September... We stayed for one week and it was our first time at this hotel. LIKES: - The distance from the self-parking garage to the elevators was not too far, a 5-7 min walk. - The rooms were spacious and modern and I liked the decor - There was plenty of space to store your clothing & luggage - We had a view of the strip and of the adjacent hotels. - We loved the smell inside the casino! - The food at the Jean Phillippe Patisserie downstairs was excellent! The lines were long during lunch but it was worth it! The crepes were our favorite and you could get them any time of day. - The buffet was insane! It was huge and had so much variety I didn't even get to try it all. Our dinner also included a lobster and bottle of wine. - The hotel is right on the strip with easy access to many of the adjoining hotels and attractions (Bellagio Fountains, Miracle Mile Shops, Hawaiian Marketplace, etc) - Concierge was very helpful and gave us good advice about some of the outlet malls we were interested in going to. - There were so many things to see and do in the hotel area that we didn't need to go far to do anything (ex. Elvis show & store, pool, spa, various restaurants, Crystals, art galleries) DISLIKES: - There was a lightbulb missing in one of the lamps in our room. I called the front desk to let them know and to get it replaced and no one ever came even after we called them again to remind them. - The shampoos/conditioners were not replaced after we finished using the ones that were originally there. I had to call housekeeping to ask them to bring some up. - Wi-Fi not included in the resort fee (at least MGM had free wi-fi) - No fridge in the room. Sometimes I brought home left overs from lunch or dinner but I had nowhere to keep it, so I usually ended up throwing it out - Express Check-out from our room did not work so we had to check out at the front desk. - Pool was very far - Dessert section of the buffet was pretty boring - a lot of cookies (who goes to a buffet like that and wants a cookie for dessert?) It wasn't perfect but it was definitely one of the nicest hotels we stayed at in Vegas and would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but lacking in character!”
Reviews.Author: bossafin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brand new and we found a great offer online so we thought we would try it instead of our usual Wynn/Palazzo/Bellagio. It bills itself as a five star place, but I beg to differ. Much of it was intangible, but it just didn't have the posh feel of the other places. The room was just okay, could have been a Holiday Inn. The pool was also just okay, but the sun reflected off the glass buildings and drove people away because of the intensity of the light and heat! Nothing was really wrong, but it just was missing that extra pizazz and flavor!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star...except”
Reviews.Author: iluvink
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ARIA for 5 days around July 4th, in a corner suite. The room was really nice and well kept, as it should be. It is very techy and we like that sort of thing. Be careful not to bump anything on the minibar, if you don't want to buy it. It can be very sensitive. Not being a high roller or big gambler, nothing was complementary, but that was expected. We just wanted to play and relax a bit. Service was good, and for the most part, they made you feel welcomed and special. I would have given them a 5, but two weeks after our stay, we received a letter in the mail, warning of a possible exposure to Legionnaires' Disease. We are ok, but there goes our repeat stay or recommendation. It is a very nice place, and it is a shame about the bacteria. I just wouldn't be able to get that out of mind.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA A definite winner!”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeTraveler68
Reviews.Content: Being a regular to the strip, it was a pleasure to have the opportunity to stay at an upscale luxury hotel such as Aria. It was a no decision to stay there since we were comped for our entire stay. The room was top notch with technology everywhere. As soon as you enter the room.....the flat screen and lights turn on and the curtain opens automatically. Just look for wall switchs that operate several functions if you want things turned off or on. Beds were very comfortable although a little on the soft side. Bathroom was definitely tops. Overall the room and room service was excellent. The casino area downstairs was small by Vegas Standards but had all the latest slots. Very convenient to other hotels, shopping and restaurants in the City Center. My only recommendation would be to have taller bar stools in the Bar Moderbi. Being a tall person, my chin was still resting on the bar. Otherwise we enjoyed it and will look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lee T
Reviews.Content: Great hotel all the staff from check in to check out could not do enough for us. The rooms are large and comfortable and the staff were always ready to assist even when we were asking questions about other hotels and casinos. The breakfast buffet is the best I had in Las Vegas with plenty of choice and at a reasonable cost

Reviews.Title: “Manager not accommodating with our circumstance”
Reviews.Author: Anoini2
Reviews.Content: Left passports in safe when we checked out. Dan Flores, manager, refused to have security access the safe with the provided combination. Therefore, missed our international return flight because of lack of his assistance. We finally got our passports AFTER we missed our flight. Had to stay another night at the hotel. Darren Flores said that the 'privacy' light was on. He said that they NEVER will go in the room because of it. We went upstairs ourselves and it was OFF. We took a picture to prove it. He did not accommodate our special circumstance. We did not ask to go to the room ourselves. We asked that the security manager and himself go and open the safe with OUR code. We even described our what contents we left in the safe. I believe that he did not want to go up to because his shift was over soon and did not want to get involved in helping us. Fortunately the front manager after him was more helpful and we got our passport back but only after our plane had left. We had to wait the next day to leave. Costing us a change fee and time (one day of travel) . Our original flight was a direct flight and the one we took the next day had a layover and we didn't get to our destination until 10:00 pm that night. Had Darren Flores accommodated our special circumstance, we would have made our flight because (get this) the airline was accommodated us and was willing to check us even when we're late just as long as we were there at a reasonable time. I am very disappointed in his lack of compassion with our situation. Also, we received an e-mail offer right when we got off the plane that Aria is offering $150 credit if you stay over two nights. Our original stay was three night (four for missing our flight). It was a slap in the face getting that e-mail offer and we can't avail it. But this was something that I overlook and proceeded with having a good time during our holiday. I can not recommend this hotel because of the ill-treatment that we received.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely very hi tech”
Reviews.Author: Topcat2011
Reviews.Content: Massive hotel right in the centre of las vegas with very clever technology in the room. Quite classy and everywhere smells of vanilla. It's nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel says Monte.”
Reviews.Author: MontyBiggs
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel. A little dark in some areas, but quite nice. The pools were a little small, and perhaps a little too shallow as well. The front desk staff seemed like robots. Upon checkin, we requested a high level room. Gave us the 16th floor. Yeah, thanks! Joe the slot manager was fantastic though. Made up for the front desk staff. Great gym for a hotel too! Monte would stay again though. Nicer than most in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Under-impressed”
Reviews.Author: Qaquacker
Reviews.Content: We were comped 2 nights at the Aria back over 4th of July weekend. We agreed we would never go back. Upon check in, our room was not ready. They took both of our cell phone numbers and said they would call when they were ready. We went over to the Cosmo while we waited. 5 hours later, they never called. We went back to the front desk and they were totally dead. I asked about our room and they said it was ready. When I asked why they didn't call they basically shrugged and said they don't know why we weren't notified. Wow - this set the mood for the trip. We went up to the room and my husband went to get ice. In the mean time, there was a knock at the door. It was security stating they had activity on the floor and told us to stay in our room. Whaaaat? Well, an hour later we called security and asked if it was alright to leave our room and they didn't know anything about it. They finally notified the couple of employees on our floor and they said it was all clear. We asked what ws going on and they couldn't give us that information. They could have come back around and told us it was OK to leave our rooms!!! Anyway, the next day was when we heard there was a murder at he Cosmo. Wow, this is like something out of the movies - we'll go back to our M Resort and NY NY - thank you very much. As for the room, it was very nice. The remote control was very confusing for us. I would try to change the channel and the drapes would open. I tried to shut the light off and every light in the room went on full blast. I'm sure it was user error but I was there to gamble not learn technology. The gambling was very tight too. We actually used our $100 free play and left. The tables were much higher than what we were used to at other strip hotels. It is definitely a place for the young crowd. We are in our 40's so maybe we are just too old for this place!

Reviews.Title: “BLING BLING fanatastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: Queenniki
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere was electric from the hotel to the strip. The staff were fantastic & friendly. Las Vegas truly exceeded all my expectations and the Aria Hotel was right up there on making my stay FABULOUS !!!

Reviews.Title: “Aria has a lot of features, with a couple of bumps”
Reviews.Author: TravelingKat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful inside and out. The rooms are ultra-modern, and controlled by a single remote control. I stayed on the 31st floor, and had a nice view from the floor to ceiling windows. The mini-bar is sensor controlled, so watch what you touch, or you'll be charged for it! The hotel was booked at capacity during my stay, so the line-ups were really tedious. I would have thought that the hotel would have staffed up to meet the demand, but no- even a phone call to front desk took 12 minutes of waiting on hold. As other reviewers have said, the beds are very comfortable, and the rooms are very nice- clean, well stocked, and not scented with the vanilla fragrance that they push through the vents of the casino. The bath and shower are separated from the vanity area by a glass door, as is the toilet. Privacy is obtained by a sliding pocket door which was a nice touch. Towels are the big fluffy white ones. The room didn't have a microwave or a spare square inch in the bar fridge if you wanted to bring some personal refreshments into the room. A kettle or coffee maker would have been appreciated, but was not offered either. It's true- prices in Vegas, especially on the strip, have risen quite dramatically. A croissant and a small latte ran a $12 bill. Much more worth it to check out "The Buffet" for breakfast or brunch. $18.95 for breakfast, or $24.95 for the brunch/lunch buffet was better value- kept my friends and I satisfied a good 8 hours. I had one hiccup at the Aria- the night before my fiance was meeting me, I was taking a nap after a long day. It was around 7pm, and I was shaken from my rest by a loud banging on my door. I nearly jumped out of my skin. I went to the door in my bathrobe, to find 2 people from housekeeping at my door. They told me I had to check out "now", when actually, I was booked in the room from Saturday to Saturday, and it was only Tuesday. They did apologize, but I was really shaken, being nervous in my room alone. I called front desk to complain (there was the 12 minute wait! Don't have an emergency!) and was told they would investigate. When I went down, I decided to speak to someone in person. The manager on duty offered me a late check-out. I then asked to have a credit on my account, and she said she would investigate and get back to me. Within 20 minutes she called back to confirm a $75 credit on my account for the spa (which I later converted to a room credit since there is nothing at the spa for under $75) These "comps" were appreciated later. Overall, the property is really nice. Lacking in that personal touch, over-priced, but well located, clean and modern. Sue at concierge was a wealth of knowledge- she referred us to several restaurants, and didn't ever miss!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!!! love it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angie C
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful, the view is gorgeous, the service was great & the hotel had soooo much to offer, casino, shopping, spa, free internet, great food & decent coffe!!! and last but not least the cost to stay there is soooooo affordable!!! I would stay there again & again!!!!! Darren the night manager looked after us Thank You!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You can bet on Aria for a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Hobie58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for a few days of entertainment, gambling and fun with friends in Vegas. It was 110 degrees outside, but inside the Aria it was cool and inviting. The tall ceilings of the hotel and casino spaces, combined with the contemporary design elements throughout, created a feeling of luxury and calm all in one. Go outside to the pools, and dine at any of the restaurants within, and that feeling continues. Finally, I need to mention the rooms, because they were magnificent...they are smart rooms offering the technophiles some fun, but the bed and the amenities are top-of- the-line and equally satisfying. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in time? Three hours after you arrive.”
Reviews.Author: Theo1982
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 4 pm, and we got a room at way past 6pm. I asked the front desk what time is the check in and told me its 3pm. No apology, no complimentary drinks, just a rude attitude from the them. I even call the manager after we got a room to complain and still no apology, not even "im sorry sir you had to wait for 3 hours to give you a room". The hotel was amazing, the interior and exterior beyond anything you have ever seen. The room was perfect, great view, top notch technology. The food at the restaurants was to die for, and the prices were reasonable. If you guys want to catch a show or an event, use the concierge, very helpful people over there. And i would have to agree with a previous review that the hotel is understaffed and we had to wait for everything. SUMMARY: If you are someone that is used to luxury hotels with 5-star service then ARIA is NOT your hotel, but if you want a room with great view, near the strip then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: tookaute4u
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel! It is amazing. Since its part of the citycenter its near most of the major hotels. Not to mention how beautiful the hotel room is. This is one of the best hotels I've stayed in. Only negative I have is that there weren't any microwaves in the hotel so I have to throw my leftovers from the restaurants o visited. Other than that, I give the hotel an A+!

Reviews.Title: “HIGH TECH”
Reviews.Author: KashaTornetta
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Aria resort end of June 2011 We go to Vegas every year. Our check in was fairly smooth and quick and personal. Our room was spacious with a lovely view of the pool. My first overall impression of the room was that it hadn't been cleaned to Pookie's standard. There were smudges on the mirrors and glass the floor wasn't particularly clean with fluff in the corner in the bathroom, however there wasn't anything I thought was bad enough to complain about. When we returned from our day out the room had not been cleaned. Now Pookie got mad she grabbed the maid in the hall, we made her give us clean linens and we cleaned the room our self . The room is very high tech. comfortable with sheers, drapes, T V and lighting all controlled with wall switches and t v remote. Pookie could not figure it out....every time she tried to watch a "Raymond" re- run she would close the drapes. The pool was very nice and sharp ... however it was so hot and the reflection of the hotel windows , made my hair and news paper catch on fire. One un fortunate thing happened while we were there - the hotel had an out break of Legionnaires Disease no "biggie " xoxo Kasha Room Tip: Great shower head.....I liked so much I got one just like it for my home shower.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great first time experience here PRO/CONS”
Reviews.Author: southerncanuck
Reviews.Content: This was a long overdue trip back to Vegas for my wife and I (about 8 years), so we decided to try this hotel based on ratings on the web (and to try something new). Pros - very nice rooms overall with a modern feel - very comfy bed - very cool 'smart' rooms (the one touch command center) - very nice pool area (3 to choose from) - pretty central to the strip (the walk to the strip takes about 3 minutes) - food quality was very good at the buffet and the cafe that we tried - check-in/out (for us at least) was no problem Cons - the 'scented' air pumped into the casino was irriating to both of us (smelled like the old women's perfume 'Poison' from the 80's). Thankfully, it wasn't in the rooms. I get the oxygen pumping into the casino, but there is no need to scent it in my opinion (what do people with scent allergies/sensitivites do?) - overall food/drinks were very expensive (this seemed true all around Vegas). Again the quality was really good, but priced too high (trying to make up for gambling $$ being down??). For example, a very simple breakfast in the cafe (eggs, french toast and coffee/juice ran $50. That would be less than $25 at any high end restaurant. Also poolside drinks were crazy...$16 for a margarita in a beer cup? I can see $8, but not that much. - as others have said, the disco over at the Cosmopolitan was pretty loud, you heard the bass pumping all night. I am very surprised that the hotel can't get the city to clamp down on their sound levels that late at night (even if it is Vegas) - Like everyone else, the ' resort fee' is complete BS ($22.50 with tax per night). I shouldn't have to pay for Wi-FI at any hotel these days. I can see if they want to charge a maintenance fee if you decide to use the gym, then al least you only pay if you use it. If you are going to try and make some more money, just add the cost to the hotel rate. A bunch of hotels are now advertising 'no resort fees' and to be honest, that would make me inclined to patronize them, all else being equal.

Reviews.Title: “Great high tech room but watch location”
Reviews.Author: Magnum357
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room with sheers, drapes, tv and lighting all controlled with wall switches. Location really matters. Since I have stayed here several times the view can vary from looking out at the lights of city center to being level with a rooftop. Ask about room location if you care about what you look out at.

Reviews.Title: “totally understaffed”
Reviews.Author: nycboy25
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel.. but thats all .. service was the worst I have ever seen. right from checkin to dirty rooms. to check out.. be prepared to wait for everything you do.. check in waiting to be sitted at buffet wait to have room semi cleaned they dont always change the sheets ... (i am serious).. the service in the casino was awful waited almost an hour for our drinks to arrive checkout was also a wait.. every morning there is garbage in the halls.. when you make a complaint they say they are understaffed and its the truth.. but the rooms were great when they were cleaned stayed 5 nites room cleaned 3 times only after complaining..

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: solarmaster
Reviews.Content: Awesome we stayed 4 nights in the sky suites!! WOW WOW what an awesome hotel Soooo clean so beautiful the service is second to none the atmosphere is there if u are young or even if u have a family as we do. They make u feel welcome. We are going back next year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Aria - Welcome to Modern”
Reviews.Author: tmm32776
Reviews.Content: The Aria Hotel and Casino is an absolute delight if you enjoy clean, super modern, and sincerely pleasant locations. The technology placed into the guest rooms is a wonder in creature comfort. Everything, perhaps because it is new, is clean, spotless really. The staff in every location is friendly and knowledgeable - and you get the sense they are genuinely happy to assist you. The casino is well laid out, nicely modern tech-wise. Food options are pretty good, a bit pricey but the value is there. Only drawback is the hotel is set back just a bit from the strip but an easy walk. I would return in a heartbeat. Oh, and the attached shopping is very classy.

Reviews.Title: “FOREVER Check-in”
Reviews.Author: beachbum020
Reviews.Content: We were standing in line waiting to ckeck-in. Approx. 4-5 folks in each line.It took over 1 hr. "Helen" was slower than molasses.Finally the guy in front of us was being helped, his buddy was in another line and both of them had issues with their reservations. The buddy came over when he was finished and then "Helen" proceeded to try and help with his issue. That is just wrong. Also had a problem with the buffet for breakfast. I went in there with my bathing suit top, shorts and a coverup on. I was told I could not come in due to the dress code. I saw no dress code anywhere and there were other ladies in clothing that showed more skin than I was.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrippyLawyer
Reviews.Content: We live in SO Cal so we go to Vegas alot. We have stayed in all of the upscale properties and this one beats them all. The rooms are amazing. Incredibly well appointed. The staff is incredible for such a large casino. But the nicest thing was they had "family pools" and "adult pools." If people started getting rowdy or drunk, they were asked to go to the adult pool. Also the class of people was just better. We did not see the booty call, slutty looking women or men getting trashed and cussing at the pool. Also, there is a level you can go to where you can get around the hotel without essentially having to go through the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Superb place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ibnbatutaa
Reviews.Content: Bang in the middle of the Strip, with mono rail connection to Bellagio, Aria is an excellent hotel. I am surprised that's it's ranked out side top 10 in Vegas. It is a relatively new property,very chic. The pool side is excellent and so are the bars etc. The room is well appointed. A convenience store in right outside on the road. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A solid four star experience”
Reviews.Author: BENZAMG
Reviews.Content: Aria met all of my needs on my recent three night stay and would say it is the best property mid strip.Service isn't over the top like the Wynn but everyone I came in to contact with was polite and professional.The rooms while on the small side are well appointed and comfortable.Housekeeping was excellent,Pool area is nice and had great pool service.I was expecting a lot more from the spa and my massage therapy was uninspired to say the least.Had one of the best meals of my life @ Sage.Sit at the bar and let Leanne look after you.I also had a lot of fun @ P.U.B. as it is a casual resto with great beers on tap and $2.00 oysters.Dealers were friendly and cocktail service was the best I have had in recent stays.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: vincentinparis
Reviews.Content: The Aria stands among the most gorgeous hotels on the Strip, with its striking curves from the outside and an elegant feel to it that is neither in-your-face nor inaccessible. It may also be among the least Vegas-y, which in my book is a plus, as I quickly find the roaring crush of people and flashy need to impress of popular places like the nearby Cosmopolitan or Bellagio draining. The well thought-out public areas of the Aria, from the casino to the reception area that – up to ten people deep at every available position when I first walked in, not unlike a supermarket check out – manage to combine space and calm without losing buzz. Even the restaurant where we enjoyed the above-average brunch, was hushed rather than frenzied. Natural light and the soaring atriums of the two lobbies add to the openness of the place. Leaving by the spacious north lobby proved to be much closer to the guest rooms, and waits for cabs were also shorter. Even the basic rooms are good size and well-appointed. Furnishing are standard understated modern hotel, but comfortable. Bathrooms are spacious and I liked the bench in the shower, the separate toilet and the sliding door that his it all. Closet and dresser space is more than ample for two people. They pride themselves on their technology, but oddly it doesn't all work. The automatic curtain opening in the rooms is a nice touch, as is the good night button for switching everything off all at once. The alarm clock opened the curtains in the morning, but didn't turn on the TV that was also programmed. Three options for automatic check out were provided, but two – video and text - failed to work. As I wanted to avoid the lines at the front desk, I finally sent an e-mail to check out (option 3) and about six hours later received my receipt. The biggest technological failure however is that the bars and restaurants have to phone for approval before making a charge to a room or a card, causing unnecessary waits, unpleasant particularly in a hotel of this calibre. When dozens of people are waiting for the buffet, the process is painfully slow. We were asked to pay cash to expedite seating and were able to, but most people in line only had cards or rooms. There were some minor housekeeping issues, too. Glasses left outside a room across the hall from me were still there the next morning. An extra bed appeared outside my door a day before I checked out, and there it sat. Otherwise any actual contact with staff was professional and friendly. A note on the very good brunch: the unlimited “champagne” is in fact just mediocre sparkling wine. Acceptable in a mimosa, but really not worth the trouble if you're drinking it alone. Next time we'll try the the bottomless bloody mary instead. The Aria, airy and light, wears its name well, but still has a few bugs to work out. I'll look forward to staying there again to see if they are able to address the minor issues I encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous show.”
Reviews.Author: PMTK_11
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at the Aria - we stayed next door at the Vdara. We went to the Elvis Cirque de Soleil show at the Aria. It was fabulous. Barman at show was telling us to hurry up and make our minds up on what we wanted to drink though - cheek!! Other hotel staff were really helpful when we were trying to find our way to the show. But when we checked out of the Vdara, we took a wrong turn in our car and ended up in the Aria valet parking. Valet was just shouting at us that we were going the wrong way and when we asked which way we should go he just carried on shouting and wouldn't help us to get out of there. Big, fat black mark for Aria valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant... Aria”
Reviews.Author: JMJ024
Reviews.Content: We go to Las Vegas two to three times a year, and have stayed at many of the hotels on the strip. The room was booked online through Bookit.com but I have also received similar promotions through their e-mails. When we checked in, the arrogant woman at the front desk informed us the room would cost $100 more per night. Luckily I had a copy of my confirmation with me. She said the rate we received was subject to availability. When I asked if this type of room was available she said "yes" but wouldn't give us the confirmed rate. After demanding to speak to a manager, we finally got the rate on the confirmation. We met another person, at the convention we were attending, who also had their room rate bumped up when they checked in at this hotel. We found the staff to be pretentious and indifferent, whether it be in the restaurant where we ate, the private area Liquid, by the pool (which is overpriced), and the bellman who arrived over 30 minutes after we called. To top it off, the Valet brought us the wrong car when we checked out! and no apology. In this economy, the Aria needs to teach their staff that customer service comes first in the hospitality industry.This beautiful hotel is overshadowed by its staff. It's no wonder they are offering rooms at a discounted rate. Customers get wise to the bait and switch routine fast. Needless to say, we will not be staying there again on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Not So Good"”
Reviews.Author: johnnyboomboombuck
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this 'property'....I liked many parts, but just could not love it. Check in was smooth and quick and our suite was modern, spacious and mostly clean...mostly. Clumps of long red hair were in the shower drain and behind the toilet...sigh. This is a quick and easy fix for housekeeping and should not have been there. Consequently, I cleaned it up myself. The air conditioning was also a bit wonky. It could not keep up with the 105 degree temperature outside. At bed time (around midnight), it was still 82 degrees while we had set the thermostat to 70 degrees in hopes that it would cool off (we set it at 10 am, so there was more than enough time for the system to catch up...). The restaurants, while a tad expensive, were quite good (we sampled ALL of them during our stay!). Not one for buffets, I was highly impressed with the offerings on the three visits we made to the Aria, well, buffet! Now, to a small issue that I have noticed growing in Vegas: The smaller things are getting much more expensive. Breakfast at the coffee kiosk, which included yogurt, a muffin, hot chocolate and a latte cost $36.00 US. Seriously. That is uncalled for. A liter of water was $4.00. Again, I know times are tough, but this is beyond acceptable. I can afford the cost, but that left less for the gaming...... The gaming WAS good, BTW. I left UP, and that is always a positive. 'Nuff said. Now, the thing that really irritated me: We spent a day at the Aria spa. We had the normal massages, facials, etc. They were fantastic. The young lady who took care of me was particularly skillful, and explained all about my "chakras"....not my cup of tea, but interesting. In any event, the issue was the $200 extra charged to our room for the pleasure of hanging out and using the facilities. Now, I can understand the need to do this to a certain extent...however, considering there were well ove 40 guys on the men's side alone while I was there for my 2 hours, the cost seems a bit prohibitive. Charging me and my wife $100 each to use a crowded facility is just excessive. Not telling us up front was unacceptable..... Check out was...interesting. Apparently, there is not single line at the front desk that feeds to the various stations. What this means is that, depending on how fast the variety of Aria staff check guests out, multiple people may finish the process before you. It's like being at the supermarket. It's a crap shoot which line you choose....(this IS Vegas, after all) What is the bottom line? Would I stay here again? Not necessarily. It's certainly 3 star, with aspirations to be more. HOWEVER, charging four to five star prices before they reach that level will not inspire me to return anytime soon....sorry, Aria.

Reviews.Title: “"Very classy resort"”
Reviews.Author: maugham
Reviews.Content: I booked my rooms through Hotwire, where they were offering an unnamed 5 star hotel for about $100 a night. The hotel turned out to be the Aria. My family and I loved this hotel. The rooms were first-class -- we especially loved the bathrooms and the handheld remote that controlled the lighting, curtains, TV, etc. As compared to other hotels in Vegas, we found the Aria to be quiet and easy to negotiate. The pool and fitness center were very nice -- well-appointed, but not too fancy. If you're looking for an action-packed, over-decorated, over-the-top Vegas experience, the Aria probably isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - modern, stylish & smells incredible!”
Reviews.Author: Jules_S_4
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend for his 30th - I was very keen to get the hotel right, being Vegas, I felt this could make or break the experience! Aria was definitely the right choice. From the moment we arrived we were in bliss - the staff are friendly, the facilities are at the forefront of technology & the whole casino smells incredible!! I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Amber M
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Las Vegas Aug 18-21, 14 ladies for a bachelorette party. We were very excited to stay at the new, vibrant Aria. There were definately alot of pluses but unfortunately the service was lacking in all the outlets so much, it overshadowed what could have been a great experience. PROs Rooms are quite esthetically pleasing. We had a great view Beds are amazingly comfortable Resort itself is clean and safe Hotel was quick to address our concerns CONs `Not once were our towels replaced without calling (no indication to leave in tub to have replaced like some hotels) `We ran out of toilet paper `Service at front desk was painfully slow. Took 45 minutes to check in and it was not overly busy. Same to be said about checking out `We ate at the buffet, Union Lounge as well as the cafe. Service was painfully slow at all, and food was mediocre at best. Waited in line one morning for the buffet for an hour, only to walk in and see it a quarter full at most. `Room had AC set at 20 celcius, but couldn't get enough AC to drop below 23 celcius. Made for very uncomfortable sleeps. - Casino and rest of the hotel has a stifling vanilla smell. Very potent to those sensitive to smells. I would likely not stay here again, but go back to an old faithful, like Mirage or Bellagio, that has customer service nailed down. For a city like Las Vegas that relies on amazing service, Aria has a lot of learning to do.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Vegas hotel - if it fits your style”
Reviews.Author: so_traveller
Reviews.Content: Location: The location of the resort is good. It's part of the new CityCenter complex. However, at this point, the true city center on the strip is probably still around Bellagio/Venetian/Caesar's area. You can take a tram to Bellagio, so no big deal. As many have noted, the hotel is huge (it's Vegas) so it's just a lot of walking to most places. This is not a complaint because it's good to walk off all the eating. If your shopping budget allows, the Crystal shopping place is very convenient. However, I wish there's a tram to their MGM resort. It looks like it's just right across the street, but it's about a half an hour walk. Service: Check-in was professional. This was the SkySuite check-in area. We had to wait about 5 minutes, so that's fine. However, later that evening, the small area was packed. I would have been pretty upset if I have to wait over half an hour for check-in if I paid for premier check-in. The limo services (both ways) were good. Housekeeping is fine. Food: There are quite a few restaurant on the premise. Sage was excellent: beef tartare and oysters amazing, service was very good with exception of bartender (bored look); American Fish was good: brazino and flounder were nice, service was very good, sommelier helpful; Julian Serrano was very nice: most tapas items very good; brunch buffet was bad: below average quality for most items, desert was nice. If you have to do one Vegas buffet, I recommend choosing another casino. Gym/Pool: The gym was very nice, lots of new and complete equipment. Pool area looks like what you expect a new Vegas pool area to look like. The spa was ok. We were expecting more lux setup from Aria but it's definitely not in the Qua or Canyon Ranch league. Room: The skysuite was very nice. The section has a separate entrance from the main casino, so you do not have to drag your luggage through the casino. The room was modern and has all the requisite Vegas touches. Toto toilets with built in bidets are great - hope the trend continues to all US hotels. Overall a very nice property. I can see that if you expect a "theme" hotel a la Bellagio or Venetian, you will be let down. It's like Wynn, except a lot more minimalist. There are no wow public installations that I can see, but I do appreciate the overall layout of the hotel (and the complex). Also, it seemed a lot less crowded then the other hotels, so that was nice not having to weave through the crowds in public space.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Aria!”
Reviews.Author: Lucky854
Reviews.Content: We had a tremendous offer to stay at the Aria, comped room, 150.00 food/beverage and sizable free play amount to gamble on the hotel. Service was great, room and beds we nice and comfortable. We had a host, but never talked with her, when it came time to check out, just talked with their VIP service, everything was comped as promised, if we went over on the food, we used the express comps that you earn from gambling. I'd definitely go back. Aria was more fun to gamble at too, we found that their slots were a little looser than the other properties!

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris75
Reviews.Content: For some reason I was upgraded to a Corner Suite, with quite fantastic views from the 50th floor (views on Monte Carlo, MGM, Mandalay Bay, ect...). The suite was large, comfortable , and very pleasant. I was less impressed by their Deluxe Room King, not very large. The three pools are really beautiful, quite crowded during the weekend (I didn't have enough time to go to Liquid Pool). Aria buffet is supposed to be one of the best of Las Vegas, it's true that everything is very good. For breakfast Café Vettro offers a good choice. Gold Lounge (close to Elvis Theater) is a great club. Long queue and too much wait for checking out on sunday, it's always the problem with huge resort hotels. Overall Aria is a good modern resort hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tipical Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Paolo015
Reviews.Content: The premise is that the attractions in Las Vegas are represented by the Resort, and Aria is one of the newest one in town. I visted Aria after my stay in the Wynn, and maybe my expectations were vey high because what people tells around. The hotel is in the mid south of the strip, but is a bit isolated. The shopping center in front of the hotel (Crystal) is new, with the best brands but almost empty and oversized. The Casino is very nice and the atmosphere is very proper to Las Vegas. Rooms are large, and bathrooms are nice, but it looks to be a business hotel more than a Las Vegas ambient. Personnel is also nice. Reach the strip a is a real trip, because the hotel is not properly on the road, and you have to walk a lot, otherwise you can take a train that takes you to bellagio in 1 min. In my opinion this is not one of the best hotel in town, even if one of the newest.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaVegasLover
Reviews.Content: We booked a weeks stay at Aria in August for relaxation by the pool and fine dining at night. If you are into design and beauty this is the hotel for you. Their employees were extremely pleasant and helpful throughout the stay. I booked a deluxe room and was on the fence about paying the extra $25 a night for a strip view. I decided not to and was very happy with the view of the pool, city lights and mountains. It was a long walk from the elevators, so ask for a room close to elevators if you do not want a long walk. Gorgeous views all around. The valet was always quick, maid serviced the room daily and refilled bath amenities daily. There was enough action for my husband and I however if you want a loud party crowd this is not your place. It has a great atmosphere but definitely not "party". We wanted to book a couples massage but the Spa was WAY pricey. We decided to go next door to the Vdara which was about half the cost. Cafe Vettro has great salads and the best Tuna Melt my husband has ever had. Not bad for Cafe food. Jullian Cerranos Tapas was also a delicious treat for the taste buds. The pools were good and it was easy to find two lounges together during the week. The larger pool had a tendency to fill up with kids and at time seemed to be a playground, but the two other pools were more relaxing. A pitcher of Mojitos is $43 or by the glass for $18.They were weak but it is Vegas. Good but I have had better at Red Rock. The pool girls were not around enough and it took them awhile to bring your drinks. My favorite little bar to end every night was the View Bar by the lobby. The Diva was a little slice of heaven and the bartenders were great. All in all I rate this hotel 5 stars if you want art, beauty, style, relaxation mixed with a casino in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel but maybe a little too much technology.”
Reviews.Author: nettey78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Aria Sky Suites for 4 nights recently. The staff was amazing, the chauffeur even helped install our carseats in the limo. This was great especially considering that families with small children aren't their target market. We shared a two bedroom penthouse suite with my sister-in-law and her family and we had 4 adults, 3 toddlers, and an infant in one suite and we had plenty of space. The food at the hotel was great, especially at the Lemongrass. The pastry shop was also very good but a bit pricey. The only drawbacks were that the sink in the wet bar didn't work but not a big deal since there were 5 other sinks in the suite. Also, while the technology was mostly great occasionally all of the tvs in the suite would turn on by themselves and once the whirlpool tub turned on by itself. All in all a great experience, we will definitely stay at the Aria again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Four Star”
Reviews.Author: travelingfish
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and a great option for vegas if you want a luxury hotel but do not want to pay top dollar (i.e. Wynn Tower Suites, Four Seasons, Bellagio, etc). The rooms are the best part. Very luxurious and super high tech (you feel like you are a visitor on the star ship enterprise). Everything else is tasteful and well executed. The gym is well equipped and very well maintained (also very large). The pools are nice (but can get crowded). The buffet is very well done. It is not the over the top luxury experience of Four Seasons or Wynn Tower Suites but for the reasonable price, it is close enough. If you are looking for a nice room in vegas, you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “We were expecting better”
Reviews.Author: nicenrelaxed
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Aria resort in March 2011 a short break and our first time in Vegas. Our check in was fairly smooth and quick if a little impersonal. We had specified that we were on an anniversary break but no reference was made to that at our check in. Our room was spacious with a lovely view of the front enterance of the hotel. My first overall impression of the room was that it hadn't been cleaned to the standard i would have expected. There were smudges on the mirrors and glass the floor wasn't particularly clean with fluff in the corner in the bathroom, however there wasn't anything i thought was bad enough to complain about. Unfortunately when we were showering the next morning we found a large amount of long dark hair on the wall in the bathroom and chewing gum stuck to the window. (gross)We spoke to the concierge on the way out that day and explained and she was very apologetic and said she would send someone in to clean straight away.
