When we returned from our day out the room had been cleaned and the chewing gum removed however the hair was still in the bathroom. We struggled to see how they had been in and 'cleaned' the bathroom but still had not seen the mass of hair on the wall? My husband complained again at the front desk and was assured that the room would be cleaned when we were out that evening. Again when we returned at 11.30ish the bathroom still hadn't been cleaned. Again we complained and had our room cleaned at 12.30 am we had to hang around the casino while they were working. We did complain about the poor service and recieved some compensation from the holiday company however we would rather not have had the inconvienience. the location of the hotel was good but i wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I would have much rather stayed at the Bellagio. The staff there were much more warm and friendly and the hotel had a better atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Need to train the staff more on customer service.”
Reviews.Author: ibizatan
Reviews.Content: The wait times were long no matter what we did whether at the front desk or the buffett or housekeeping to clean room. We were not treated special at all.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay but with a couple minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Trekman
Reviews.Content: My third stay at the Aria, two nights only comped with $150 resort credit. Arrived Friday noon and check in was very quick and efficient in the Invited Guests line. I had a king on the 31st floor facing the Cosmopolitan. Minor issue number one: The Cosmopolitan has an outdoor pool party/club that booms loud music from noon to 3am which I could clearly hear from my room on the 31st floor. I tolerated the noise but it might be bothersome to a lot of people. Other than that the room was just fine. Issue number two: I ordered a glass of chardonnay wine at their Moderna Bar and was astonished that it cost $23! $23 for a glass of very ordinary white wine that most other nicer casino bars would sell for $10-$15. The couple sitting next to me mentioned that their two beers came to $35. On the other hand, I really liked the Aria casino and within two hours of slot play already had three hand pays for a total of $4,800. Drink service was also fast and efficient. Overall, I enjoyed my third stay at the Aria but next visit will avoid the Cosmopolitan side of the building and stay away from the Moderna Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Resort with Many Entertainment and Dining Options”
Reviews.Author: 745Entertainment
Reviews.Content: Typically, this resort would be out of my price range, but on this particular trip to Vegas, a friend of mine and I were offered a comped room at this resort if we were able to change our return flights and stay an extra day. There wasn't any possibility of me flying home and telling people I turned down a comped room here, so we changed our flights. (Separately, I'll never fly Continental or United again as a result, but that's a different review.) We were comped a room in the Sky Suites, which had its own check-in area and elevator attendant. The staff was all incredibly friendly and helpful. We did not have a negative experience here. After around 11pm, I would recommend gambling in The Deuce (small bar/lounge at one corner of the casino floor). It's got a small ultra-lounge feel, but the table game dealers inside are all very attractive women wearing cocktail dresses. We ate at Union (which was expensive but very good) and Sirio Ristorante (and the Fusilli Verde was the best meal I had in Vegas). Overall, you'll notice a difference between the way people in Aria are dressed and the way people in say NYNY are dressed. It's more of an upscale experience (but not exclusive of others) in Aria, for better or worse. That typically isn't my type of scene, but we happened to have decent outfits left in our bags so it worked out. The room we had had an IP based remote control on the night stand that controlled everything from the lights to the curtains to the TV. It was fancy, but cumbersome. I can't say enough about this resort. If you stay here, you'd be hard pressed to find a reason to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Dea C
Reviews.Content: Worst time in the world. Not only did my granddaughter and myself get bitten by bugs in the bed, it was inferred that we were liars and used precious items in the "mini" bar which we didn't. The only thing that was done regarding the "bugs" was a $50 credit because an ongoing investigation was still going on. I have never been treated so shabbily and accused of lying about something we didn't do. I will never use MGM Resorts again and will make it known to all my friends and family who regularly travel to Las Vegas to stay away from them. After changing our room I slept on top of bed or at least tried to sleep because I was afraid I would be bitten again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again, but....”
Reviews.Author: Dinkumseed
Reviews.Content: After reading a few so so reviews on Trip advisor i was wary but booked anyways. Stay if you: Aren't fussed about customer service Dont mind that 1-3 dealers are mundane and wont talk to you even if you try Enjoy a quite pool with nice drinks Want a good location on strip Want variety in restaurant choices under 1 roof Like a well presented Hotel Dont stay if you care: That the rooms are poorly maintained That the beds aren't great That pool drinks are rather $$$ (but delicious) and tips do not seem appreciated About variety in gaming tables That the atmosphere is Moden and not quite as vegas as other hotels All in all, I liked the pool and the drinks, the bellmen and about 30% of the dealers. The Lobby was nice and open and well ventilated but...other reviews are correct about the customer service. We weren't even asked if we enjoyed our stay on check out! I wouldn't stay again but I didn't hate it...I think i was just a little disappointed that it didn't live up to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best newest fanciest top of the line hotels in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Hermit58
Reviews.Content: What do you want? The Aria will make sure you have it. This place has it all. A great hotel with fantastic rooms, super suites, phenomenal service, great food at a huge selection of restaurants. It's hard to describe the Aria experience. You have to live it to believe it. Once there, you are the king of the planet. Virtually anything you want is within grasp, or will be brought to you. Ask and you shall receive. How else can I put it? The modern design is very inviting but relaxing. The new electronic video slots are loose, believe it or not. The table games are always hopping. Direct access to Crystals shopping, Bellagio and Monte Carlo via tram. It's all "green" and environmentally sound. The views are superb. Artwork is displayed all over the place. Don't miss the Jean Philippe Patisserie. You can't miss the hot drink servers, and they serve great drinks to order. Use your M-Life card for comps like food, rooms, shows, etc. Elvis show is crazy good. If you go to Las Vegas, you MUST visit this property and check it out. We've stayed there 3 times already, and plan to return soon. It rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Nice”
Reviews.Author: Patinca29
Reviews.Content: The ARIA rooms are very modern, possibly even too modern for some travelers. The lights, television, and even the curtains are controlled by an LED touch panel screen. Once you get used to them, they actually are quite convenient. As the building is very new, the rooms are still in very nice shape. I've stayed there twice and was satisfied both times. The casual cafe is large enough to prevent lines and serves well prepared, reasonably priced food.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jayne2164
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay in 12 months and not disappointed. Large room, super comfy bed, well appointed bathroom plenty of wardrobe and storage space. Excellent value for money. Aria must have the best pool complex in Vegas! Table service in bars and at the pool desperately slow but the solution is just to order at the bar, no big deal. Will definitely stay here again. If I could change one thing it would be the fragrance pumped through the air con in the lobby and casino. Horrible horrible sweet sickly smell. They could take the lead and ban smoking for clean air!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe too huge for it's own good”
Reviews.Author: DebLuvsVegas
Reviews.Content: Aria is a new and beautiful property. The casino floor is clean and fresh. Most of the staff I came into contact with were friendly and helpful. Yes, the beds are fabulous. I had a meal that was possibly the very best I've ever had at Union restaurant. The hotel is very cutting-edge. Despite all that, unfortunately Aria didn'tt quite measure up, and i'll explain why. I was travelling solo, meeting my sisters in Las Vegas for our "sisters getaway". We decided on the Aria for our 3 night stay. Upon arrival on a Sunday afternoon, I pulled into the valet. The valet attendant took my keys, gave me my stub, and ran to the upcoming cars behind me. He didn't offer to unload my luggage. I slung my duffel bags over my shoulder and rolled my suitcase along to the entrance, struggling to open the door. Not a very good first impression. Check in - wait time was about 25 minutes - probably the longest i've waited to check in a hotel in Vegas. There was a staff member with an iPad that I thought was there to help speed things along, but he was basically just greeting everyone and answering questions while they waited. Odd. The girl at the reception desk was very pleasant. The connecting room I requested to mine was available early (1:45 P) so that was good. I entered my room and was not "greeted" with curtains opening, lights coming up and TV turning on. No big deal; everything worked fine in my sisters connecting room and they enjoyed the wow of the greeting. It is true that the hotel is set back from the strip. This only seemed to be an issue when trying to walk from the Cosmopolitan. There is no sidewalk, so you are pretty much forced to cab it - or walk up to the strip, then across, and back over to the Aria. (no quick jaunt) Walking to Bellagio wasn't bad at all via the connecting walkway. Day two - housekeeping made our beds - period. Trash wasn't emptied, toiletries and towels were not replaced, carpet wasn't vacuumed, nothing was tidied up. My sisters had a plate of leftover pizza from in-room dining the night before that was left behind. But... on the third day housekeeping was spot on perfect. I just didn't get it. Bellagio offers twice daily housekeeping service, and I missed that here. I ordered room service twice, and each time it took over an hour. The second time I ordered soup. Yes, over 1 hour. For soup. The server and I actually had a chat about that, and he informed me management has been inconsistent with training employees. Also possible understaffing. (You think?!?) I felt sorry for him, as it was by no fault of his. It was quite obvious to me there were MANY inconsistency issues in different areas of the hotel. I got the impression staff was having trouble keeping up with the average daily demands of a hotel of this size. Maybe it's something they'll be able to work out in the near future, but until then be advised... On a last note, upon departure I needed the assistance of 3 employees to find the North valet. It's too easy to get disoriented in a casino this huge. The valet service was just as bad as when I arrived. Again, no help loading my car - in fact, the valet attendant watched and chatted with the bell desk gal as I loaded up. That being said, giving credit where credit is due, one of the highlights of our trip was dining at Union restaurant. We had the filet mignon, and at $45, it was worth every penny - and then some! It was absolutely delicious. I would definitely visit the Aria for the restaurants and casino, but personally I would stay elsewhere next time. This isn't a bad hotel - just not up to par with what it touts itself to be.

Reviews.Title: “Clean your the rooms”
Reviews.Author: LilySpring
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Las Vegas for a very long time and the "Five Star Aria" is not truly a five star quality in my book it is not a clean hotel. The bed spread, the bathroom had mildew, the carpet was dirty and not vacuumed it took three phone calls and two days to get the carpet vacuumed when it should have been cleaned after a phone call to housekeeping/front desk. The front end staff seem to be great it is the behind the scenes staff that need work, Aria needs to up the anty what ever that might entail .

Reviews.Title: “Aria Sky Suites”
Reviews.Author: canucktravel
Reviews.Content: Just retuned from 4 noghts at Aria. We reserved the 2 bedroom sky suite. After many trips to Vegas over the years, Aria is now my favorite hotel, After a horrible travel experience with numerous flight delays (THANKS AIR CANADA) we arrived in the baggage claim at McCarran airport to find our limo driver waiting for us. He could not have been more professional and accomodating. He collected all our bags and ushered us to the awaiting stretch limo outside the baggage claim doors and wisked us away to the VIP entrance at Aria. On arrival we were lead to the Sky Suite check in where we were immediately checked in and offered cold drinks. We had requested a non smoking floor and two double beds in one of the bedrooms - both requested taken care of. i had called the Sky Suite concierge earlier in the afternoon as we would not be able to attend the evening performance of LOVE we had previously booked due to our numerous flight delays (THANKS AGAIN AIR CANADA) The concierge had taken care of everything, and we received a full refund for the 4 tickets we had purchased. We arrived in our Sky Suite and it could not have been more perfect. It was more spacious than I had imagined and spotlessly clean. the views from the floor to ceiling windows were great. There were flatscreen tvs in all the rooms, including bathrooms. Also had a dining table, sink, separate fridge from the mini bar and all the utensils required for making coktails. It was like having our own apartment. Previous reviews have discussed the room technology so i will not go into the details other than to say I had no difficulties working any of the features ( and I am not the most tech savy person) The suite contained a 2 piece bathroom and a huge ensuite bathroom with each bedroom that included a free standing jet tub and separate shower/ steam room and a private water closet with a heated toilet with bidet features.Every bath product that you can think of was provided including hairspray, dental kits, bath salts and razors. We love the entire hotel. The openess of all the public spaces, the unique architectural elements and the water features were all great. All of the staff we encountered were very professional and pleasant and could not do enough to assist. Even in the casino, all the employees were extremely freindly and eager to answer any questions. All of the restaurants we ate at were fabulous ( except the buffet, but I am not a buffet person) Julian Serrano for the tapas was our favorite, so much so we ate there twice. The pool area is also unique with four different pools and several large hot tubs all secluded by many palm trees, sculpture and flower gardens. You would never know you were in Las Vegas. Service at the pool was very good although drinks a little steep. I can not recommend this hotel enough and felt realy sad to leave! Plan to return ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pool Area and Lemongrass - GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Javagirl08
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time (group of six ladies with two rooms), for our three night stay (arriving 11 August). The check-in process was slow, due to their computer system (Aria management - please listen to what your customers are saying about this!) Our room was on the 15th floor (overlooking the Cosmo pool area) and had everything that we needed for comfort; large bathroom, comfy beds, ample storage for clothes, efficient A/C, bathrobes (which were a nice touch) and clean. The ventilation in the bathroom is horrible though (for shower steam). The housekeeping staff work very hard. Please remember to tip them! They will go the extra mile for you. We ate at Lemongrass (Thai restaurant at the Aria) and had a lovely meal. We celebrated a milestone birthday and enjoyed the food and champagne! The manager and our waiter were great. If you get the tasting menu, be prepared for a lot of food. We received VIP guest passess (like many ladies do), to Haze, which included free drinks until midnight (and no waiting in line). What a bizarre place. It was seriously like something out of the Twilight Zone. Aggressive bouncers, nowhere to sit (tables are bought at $ 550 plus tip) and there are VERY limited places to stand (or even to set your drink down). It because a joke to see how long it would take for a bouncer to come over and either ask us to move, or our drinks (one minute was about average). HORRIBLE dance floor, music and smoke. We lasted about 30 minutes. The place was full of posers trying to play the part. What a joke. We ended up for drinks at the Deuce. Very expensive but 2 for 1 drink tickets are freely distributed. Our waitress was very nice. The pool area is FABULOUS! Three pools to choose from (one being Liquid). Ample shade, umbrellas and loungers. Pool service was excellent. Drinks are very expensive (large diet coke is $ 11 plus tip). Welcome to Vegas! The cafe next to the pool was also nice. Food was okay but the service was excellent. The hotel is classy and modern and we would return for sure. The hotel is set back a bit from the strip but big deal. Vegas is a walking town. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous hotel you have to see!”
Reviews.Author: ShananiganZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria August 14-18th. We booked through Priceline and got the room for much cheaper than the posted price. When we arrived the lobby smelled like delicious vanilla. The check-in wait wasn't bad only a few minutes! I don't like how Aria and so many Vegas hotels make you walk through the casino to the elevators but I was expecting it. There is a daily resort charge of $22.40 for the room and they put a $130 per night authorization on your credit card for incidental charges. The rooms are beautiful & there is wifi. The pools are perfect! The hotel is beautifully done but I do have a few things I wish were different. There are only "aria" brand restaurants there are no chains or things you recognize, it's a bit back from the street so our room didn't have a great strip view & there is no crosswalk to the other side right at the hotel. You can walk through citycentre to cross a pedestrian overpass or walk to Monte Carlo and cross the street. Not a long walk but when it's 108 degrees by 9am you think about efficiency. There is also a tram that goes to Monte Carlo & Bellagio. We had a great stay and plan to return soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Just got back last night....”
Reviews.Author: lenflady
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night from Vegas and the Aria. I was really skeptical having read numerous bad reviews from this site after booking the package through Bookit.com. I had only read the reviews from vacation booking sites which generally have only positive reviews. Anyway, I was pleasantly surpised and put at ease when I arrived (Monday morning). The bellman promptly opened my cab door and offered service. I was able to check in immediately to a room without having to wait until 3pm. I was in line behind two parties so my wait time from in line to desk was 8 minutes. I could see how it would be caotic if I had arrived during a very busy time. Part of the wait with each party is people asking questions! It took only a minute or so for the desk clerk to check me in so the problem is "conversation". The desk clerk was very friendly and made eye contact. I was aware of the $20 + tax/day resort fee prior to my arrival so I had no reason to argue (though I would have preferred not to pay it!). My room was very nice and spacious. i had a room on the 8th floor facing the pool and away from the "nightclub side" facing the Cosmopolitan. There was quite a bit of dust but I think it may be due to the air conditioning unit as I have this same problem at home. You can dust and it'll come right back! There were some "marks" on furniture from most likely the vacuum being pushed against the lower parts of the furniture. I didn't feel the furnishings were of the best quality but the room was nicely appointed. At least I didn't experience some of the things other reviewers wrote about: trash/food on floor, unemptied waste baskets, etc. My room was clean except for dust. Be sure to check your mini bar upon arrival. I found mine to be short a Coke and made sure I wasn't charged for it. As a matter of fact, the front desk was able to lock it while I was on the phone with them. I also made sure not to bump/touch any of the items on top as they are sensored as well. Since I had read about the recent outbreak of Legionnaires Disease there, I brought my own cleaning spray and sprayed down surfaces, etc. Insuring my own health was more important to me than relying on housekeeping to do what they are supposed to do. I used bottled water to brush my teeth and peroxide to disinfect the toothbrush after rinsing it with hot water from the sink. At no time did I risk ingesting the hotel tap water. Towels were quite rough though nice and thick. The electronics in the room sort of worked but worked enough for me to stay 4 nights. I felt the bed was too soft and kept moving to different spots during the night once I sunk in. I prefer hard mattresses and this was way too soft for me. I found the staff to be very friendly, speaking as you walked by. The only person I would complain about is one desk clerk that I asked about computers in the business center. Although he didn't speak rudely, I felt he was being a bit snide in telling me the kiosk beyond the bell desk adjacent to the casino had free internet (he said the business center did not have computers to use though the center was included in the resort fee!). Clearly they did not as you had to use a credit card to operate it! He seemed knowledgeable enough to to give me info regarding the kiosk so he should have known they weren't free! I wasn't trying to "get over", just trying to send an EM since my touch screen phone froze up and I needed to let someone know to call the room since my phone wasn't working. My package included free breakfast buffet every morning. Overall it was good but served the same thing everyday. But it was free and had no problems with it being charged to the room as some people did. They didn't even show it on the bill (make sure you show the promo card to the cashier). I ate at Lemongrass. After having spent two weeks in Thailand, this is not authentic Thai food. It wasn't bad but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there again. Find a restaurant off the strip if you want Thai food that bad during your stay. I really liked the connection between hotels and the Monte Carlo. There is a convenience store right outside so you don't have to go across the street. Overall, it was a very nice stay and beautiful property. The vanilla scent was nice in the casino to mask the cigarette smoke/odor. I would consider staying again as long as there are no health issues. I also think they should consider a "pay as you go" instead of the resort fee. The free newspaper isn't even delivered to your room - you have to go get it yourself from the 24hr shop!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Sleek”
Reviews.Author: Anne O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in April. It was our first time away without the kids and my first time to Vegas. The hotel is huge! I know all the hotels are big there but this one seems to be larger. It is a hotel that is extremely modern. There is a remote for everything including lights, drapes and music. You can even check-out using your TV remote. The hotel was clean and the mattress was probably the best mattress I've ever slept on. Everything about this hotel is sleek. You will find modern art, modern furniture and a crisp feel to the air. It might even be to impersonal to almost feeling cold. The hotel had a more business feeling to it as opposed to the Bellagio or the Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: hvtrillo
Reviews.Content: Aria Resort and Casino is absolute bliss. We had a Tower Suite, which was wonderufl. Beds are to die for. Found a shady spot at the pool and spent 4 hours there the first day and 3 hours the second. Their pina coladas are top notch. The steak at the steakhouse was fabuous, and we enjoyed the cafe 2 mornings. Pricey, but everything is first class. Most casiono give you a choice of chardonnay or chardonnay for drink service, but Aria had several choices, including pino grigio which is my personal fave. We had salads and wine at 11 pm in Todd English's bar just at the edge of the hotel, perfect end to a perfect day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, and I'm picky!”
Reviews.Author: ckc33
Reviews.Content: There was a housekeeping problem with our room when we checked in. This was disappointing, and I expected to get the run-around. But I was wrong! A manager was there within 10 minutes and the situation was handled with prompt, courteous professionalism. We were so impressed! The location can't be beat, the room was a total treat, and the place felt fresh and clean. We went clubbing in other hotels and they felt dated, loud, and smoky. The pool area was beautiful. You will pay a LOT for drinks, but it's Vegas, baby. My only tiny criticism was I felt a bit 'guilt tripped' by a bell hop. We tipped when we checked our bags (for a later flight), and then when I didn't tip a different fellow on pick-up I felt a bit awkward - I refuse to double-tip to roll my suitcase in and out of a room. He could have been a bit more gracious, or a fee could be posted and I'd be happy to pay for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at the lack of attention given by housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: jbidder
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Aria and actually love this hotel. However, on this trip, I had the most horrible experience due to an unkempt room. When I arrived, I called housekeeping because my toiletries were used as well as the note pad. The bath tub honestly had (you know what kind) of hair in it - it was never cleaned from the previous guest. There is still a used bandage on the shower floor ( I noticed this when I was in the tub) - how disgusting. In this particular room on the 24th floor, the door is jammed and the bellman and housekeeping staff member that re-cleaned the room called and an engineer never came to fix the problem. Back to the nasty room - one of the glasses in the bathroom had the previous guests toothpaste dried on top of it and there was hair in the foyer and on the bathroom floor. Finally, one of the pillow cases had (what appeared) to be tiny blood spots on it. In all fairness, the young lady who was called in to refresh the place was disgusted at what she saw. Also, the housekeeping manager was also very apologetic. I was totally in shock and will definitely write a letter to management regarding this unsanitary room. With Aria being in the news lately, you would think that their housekeeping department would be on top of things. I hope this is brought to managements attention - the room was 24219 and the person who re-cleaned the room was a part of the evening crew. So, they need to really check the housekeeper who did not do his or her job. this was such a terrible representation of such a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Current, modern, trendy”
Reviews.Author: Rockies_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Not really much to say other the place is really cool, very current, modern design, modern room, technology savvy accommodations in the heart of City Center. Rooms were spacious, front desk was accommodating for our group of 5 to have adjoining rooms for a bachelor party. Highly recommended to at least spend one of your Vegas trips in this hotel/resort. Additionally, I would highly recommend spending the day access to their spa, use the eucalyptus steam room, dry sauna, hot & cold tubs, and the lounge pool. Very much worth the $30 for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but noisy neighbors!”
Reviews.Author: kathypleasanton
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very classy. Big, well designed, electronic curtains, and a wonderful bathroom. The furnshings are top notch. We were on the Cosmopolitan dise and there is a pool at the Marquee across the way where the party is jumping; it was so loud we wer shaking. It went on till 4 am on a Monday night! Stay away from thst side of thr building. The spa was incredible too.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it and Highly Suggest this be your next Vegas Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LizzyS721
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and very top of the line. The overall Hotel was gorgeous!! The Casino was spacious and I never felt like there were people hovering over me. Many new state of the art slots. A great find for a decent price. Definetly check out Southwests packages for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel....”
Reviews.Author: snowcatcara
Reviews.Content: We were able to upgrade for $15.00 a day---gorgeous view of the strip!!n We kept the curtains open at night, and it was spectacular. One thing that we noticed (and very important) we could not hear ANYTHING from outside thru the windows, although we could see outside. The bed was extremely comfortable. The only thing that was a bit 'unacceptable" was the frig was one that was weighted. We did get another frig (usually $30. per day) for water and milk---just said it was needed for 'medical purposes. They did not charge us (it was actually the suggestion of the person in housekeeping.) We are going back in a couple months,,,,,and will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here, rooms already showing their age”
Reviews.Author: koalatm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria about a month after they opened and thought it was a fantastic hotel. Had I rated it first time around they would have received 5 out of 5, which is a score I don't throw around lightly. The second time around I am shocked at how quickly the rooms are starting to show their age. The mattress is already entirely worn out with 3" body indentations. The integrated shower/tub area was showing signs of peeling, cracking trim work. Pot lights in some of the ceilings were popping out. One of the faucets leaked constantly. The bar fridge wouldn't stay closed so the expensive bar fridge treats were not only (expensive) but they were also nearly room temperature. I am quite disappointed with their (lack of) service regarding the front desk/billing team. I've now requested an invoice for my stay on two separate occasions and have not received anything. My 3 out of 5 is because the hotel is still reasonable value for money. The Casino is still one of the better ones in Vegas and the food quality at most of their restaurants is very good. The resort is also kept immaculately clean so I cannot complain there either. Based on the room condition and the lack of service regarding a simple invoice request I will not stay at Aria again.

Reviews.Title: “I don't like the services in this hotel I called the customer”
Reviews.Author: joojookhzam
Reviews.Content: I don't like the survices in this hotel ,Icalled the customer survices to reports my stoling parfum they kept me on hold almost 1 hour ,I lost my Prada parfum in the room it was a special gift from my love that's happened 2 weeks ago they cannot find it in lost and found they say we will call you back and I kept call them they say it will take almost a month to respond me ,Im never think to put my parfum with my jullury in the safe ,but now I will cause some housekeeper they don't care they steels everything so you guys be careful....

Reviews.Title: “Fresh and clean”
Reviews.Author: orgias
Reviews.Content: The first impresjon/ feeling of the place was cold and catered only to business travelers. The 24-45 yr old crowd didn’t have much of a reason to stay in the place unless it was paid for on the company card. But this was so not true, im glad i gave this hotel a few days.. it just super i every way and knoks the crap out of the Cosmopolitan in every way. Pluss the Poker room is superb and the action is great. After playing a few days the staff started to realy take care og you, and im for sure comming back to thos poker room next time

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Jimaaaaa
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Aria is on point. The standard rooms are all clean and modern. If you can stay here for the right price you should!

Reviews.Title: “We like the Aria, we just think it's overrated”
Reviews.Author: tangointahiti
Reviews.Content: ARIA is a AAA triple diamond hotel and has a three star rating from Frommers. With those reviews we expected a truly world class hotel. Aria is a nice 4 star but it's not world class. The rooms are a bit dull and the only truly world class feature in the hotel is the spa ( which is $30 per person ON TOP of the resort fee). We do love the Spa though and if you're at Aria it's well worth spending an afternoon there.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas, truly an adult disney world, and Aria hotel completes the vacation!”
Reviews.Author: livelaughandtravel
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Las Vegas, prepare yourself for luxury, excitment, and to end the night in the most comfortable beds to ever exist at Aria hotel! From the moment we arrived in Aria, a sweet vanilla and berry aroma captures your senses; the hotel actually puts out a scent throughout the lobby area and entrances into the hotel which smell amazing, and it is calming at the same time! The rooms are incredible with remote controlled curtains, lights, room temperature, music and more! You can even control these options from your television, as there is a channel specifically designed to open your curtains ect. You can even set your alarm clock in the morning to automatically have the tv turn on and the curtains open. Like I said, this hotel is just amazing. We had the best stocked mini fridge, with everything you can think of from champaigne, wine, V8 juice, frappucinnos, water, m&m's, chocolate bars, gummy bears, peanuts, I can go on and on! The only catch there is beware what you touch for 30 seconds! All items are sensored and will be charged to your room once held for a period of seconds. Either way, still very convienient should you ever need anything! The rooms are clean, the staff are friendly. But as I mentioned, Aria hotel completes your vacation, after a long day of walking around Vegas because there is so much to see and do, you become so tired, and the beds in Aria were probably the best beds I have ever slept in and I have done quite a bit of travelling. If anyone has ever stayed in the Sheraton hotel with their new sleeper comfy beds, which are great, these beds are 20x better! You just have to see for yourself! The food within the hotel is pretty good, the buffet for lunch for $19.95 was excellent! I enjoyed the variety of food offered. There is also a great bakery place right outside the elevators to all the main hotel rooms and they also serve excellent pasteries, cakes, and breakfast paninis! Of course if you are looking to save money, there are a number of places with cheaper options, even in some other hotels you would be surprised once you actually look around! The casino is great in Aria and probably my favorite out of most of them simply because of the layout. Vegas casinos are huge, but somehow in Aria the way it is layed out it makes it easier to find others and I really love the modern decor throughout the casino and hotel! When you are playing, the girls will come around and offer drinks which are free in the casino as you play. I noticed in all other casinos, such as Bellagio, Caesers, Monte Carlo, and MGM being the worst for that, the girls were never around offering drinks, where as at Aria, as soon as you take a seat there they were! As well, the most important thing about Aria hotel is it location! Location, location, location is key in las vegas!!! By staying in Aria hotel, you are only a free tram ride away to Bellagio, which is then close to Caesers and Vdara. You are a walk away to Monte Carlo, or if you head the other direction about 10 mins walk to New York New York and MGM. Based on the location, even if my experience was terrible which it wasn't, I would stay in Aria again due to its location. With the amount of walking around you will do, free tram rides, or moving sidewalks are key when you can come across them! I loved Vegas and I will be back, especially at the Aria hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Our first stay was much better”
Reviews.Author: herbertzacher
Reviews.Content: Past Jan we stayed the first time at Aria after our Casino Host went from the Mirage to the Aria. All was very pleasant and we gave it a 5 star rating. Last week we returned and where a bit disappointed. It was my Birthday celebration which we have always had at the Mirrage for Years. Looks like the MGM Casino/Hotel Giant is cutting back on customer promotions! The room was not made up, the second room was not the same as promised, little sweet details whre missing such as a Birthday treat, our Host was on vacation and no one else was asigned. Looks like we will return to the Mirrage the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: petmav
Reviews.Content: We visited Aria hotel during our honeymoon and we enjoyed the Las Vegas experience. Check in was very good and gave us a free upgrade to city views (which was very cool) and sweets from the hotel's sweet shop. The room was very spacious and everything is automated. The hotel pool was not the party pool you may expect but there is an independent pool club call Liquid within the hotel which was decent. The only negative point was the housekeeping which although they kept a clean room, they were not always consistent with their visits which meant we had to call them to tell them that we will leave from the room. On a separate note you should all beware of the taxi drivers which will try to charg you as much as possible by taking you from longer routes.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it!!!”
Reviews.Author: PennyKitchener
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday- amazing hotel! We arrived too early for 3pm check in but valet kept luggage and it was delivered to our room within minutes of us calling to tell them the room number. Check in was fast since we waited till 2 which was after the noon line ups were gone.Gave us time for lunch, exploring hotel and first shot at Casino. Rooms were beautiful- drapes opened as soon as we walked in. Bathroom was large,toilet separated from rest of bathroom, double sink, long vanity, shelves to put cosmetic bags, etc. Shower with tub set in behind in glassed in area. Bedroom had large flat screen TV with controls for lighting, temperature, drapes, TV, Movies etc. Room service was fast, reasonably priced and large servings. Buffet brunch was really good and supper at $37 seemed high till we found out included all the wine you wanted and a lobster. The staff was wonderful... polite but very friendly and eager to accommodate. Casino was bright, clean and seemed smoke free-you'd never know smoking was allowed. Our room was on a smoke free floor. Elevators were broken down by floor numbers so very little waiting time ever!! 3 pools were very nice settings and lots of shade available. We had an amazing stay and would go back again in a heartbeat. It may cost a bit more than others but it is well worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “30TH BIRTHDAY BASH & DETAILS ON CITYCENTER VEGAS!”
Reviews.Author: mb1reviews
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a great resort - located in City Center and $15 cab/taxi ride from the airport. Easy access to Vdara, hotel with condo style living, inside bridge access (thru Vdara across the street from Aria) to Bellagio. Beautiful architecture, pool grounds are nice and fantastic pool parties, variety of restaurants and excellent breakfast and lunch buffets. Liquid pool is where the pool parties happen in Aria. Wednesdays are less crowded and a little cheaper to rent the beds or lounges, etc. Thursdays are Industry days - resident DJ plays and sounds are fantastic & Thursday nights is Industry night at Haze nightclub in Aria - fantastic DJs. I have celebrated in July, August, New Years and it has all been fantastic - ladies are free before 12am and guys have a cover charge of $20. The queen rooms at Aria are great but the bedding is OK, in my opinion - nice colors and all but, I found the King room bedding softer and the rooms at Vdara had more comfortable bedding. Great cupboards to store your belongings - plenty of hangers. The room is "techified" but you can get used to it - no extractor fan in the toilet, nice bathroom. When you go to Las Vegas - if you like to dance/ club - there are different venues on different nights that are great. Mondays - Marquee at Cosmopolitian/The Bank at Bellagio Tuesdays - Pure at Caesars Wednesday - Surender at Encore (beautiful hotel) Thursdays - Haze at Aria Fridays - various nightclubs in hotels - check with local promoters -they are walking everywhere in Vegas. Walk around and through the hotels - they are great. For soft drinks, ask the cabbie to stop at a gas station very reasonably priced - drinks, snacks, etc. There is also an ABC store in Miracle Mile shopping center - walking distance from Aria and across from Bellagio - they sell alcohol and a whole lot more We went to see the Lion King - all adults - great show bu,t we think it was a bit long - so not for children personally, who are too young & they should have patience - approx. total of 2 hours and 15 minutes including intermission. Aria concierge was very helpful and go to them to print your boarding passes and check in for flights before you leave - you now are airlines can bump you these days. Enjoy Las Vegas - 3 nights is enough but, you can do 1 more night if wished. Have a drink on me when you visit. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay At The ARIA!”
Reviews.Author: chatter-box2go
Reviews.Content: Flew to LV for a three night extended weekend stay at the ARIA for my Birthday, 8/5 - 8/7! Happy to say this was my third invite to this marveleous hotel & casino & have always been treated as a treasured guest! The staff, room, room service, food & overall casino always takes my breath away! I truely love this casino & plan to return within the next several months!

Reviews.Title: “WOW WOW WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: princessl0z
Reviews.Content: When you walk in to the hotel lobby you are simply blown away its beautiful. There was only a small line to check in when we arrived. (This was around 3.30pm). Check in was fast and easy!. When checking in, we found out that we didn’t have to pay the resort fee as Virgin Holidays covers the cost, we were very pleased about that!. After checking in, it was easy to know that we made the right choice to stay here!. The resort is gorgeous with modern decor. I loved the smell of vanilla throughout the hotel and casino you can't even smell smoke - even in the casino!!!. We stayed in a city view room which i recommend paying the extra. The room is by far the best hotel room i’ve ever stayed in. The bed is the most comfortable bed I have slept on, you never want to get out of bed!. The remote control in the room was very easy to use, which controls the curtains, lighting, television... everything!!. ( I just want one at home now!). Room very clean, the staff were professional and friendly. We used all three hotel pools, there are plenty of sunbeds to choose from. We did not eat much in the Aria so I can't say much about the food but we did try the buffet. Make sure to check out the Buffet during your stay. Extremely good value for money and they literally have everything.. far too much to choose from. Location in great, middle of the strip. Use the free tram to the bellagio. We stayed for five nights and wished we could of stayed for longer! My boyfriend & I are pleased we picked the Aria for our first holiday at Las Vegas We highly recommend the Aria Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel, International crowd and 20 Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRunChgo
Reviews.Content: ...my kind of place. Nested next to Vdara, Aria is a new addition to the infamous LV strip. The only thing that was less than flawless was the amount of time you have to wait to check in...other than that, the pool, the spa and the almost twenty restaurants, are all becoming your playground. You can play with chips, as the casino is eternally open, of course, you can play with your food, or you can just take it easy, at the very relaxing spa...prices on the higher end, though.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but I would probably stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: sreecha
Reviews.Content: Pros: - This is a relatively new hotel on the strip and looks absolutely beautiful. - The rooms are very comfortable and are pretty hi-tech! [you can control the lights/temperature/shades from your TV-remote and also from a little device next to the bed]. - Very nice restaurants. -- The 'Lemongrass' Thai restaurant was awesome. -- 'The Buffet' restaurant offers one of the best buffet's in Vegas and probably the only one with Indian dishes (like indian bread, curries, tandoori items) in the dinner buffer. Cons: - VERY long checkin time (to be fair, I noticed most of the other vegas hotels have this problem too). The checkin lines are relatively small but it takes ~10 mins to checkin every guest. I am not sure why they have not streamlined it. - Extra Deposit for room service: We were told we need to deposit an extra ~$150 (I don't exactly remember how much) for room service. Don't remember the reason but that felt a little odd. - LONG walks. Pretty much a long walk to everywhere. The hotel is technically on the strip but it is a non-trivial amount of walk from the strip to the lobby. It has a 'tram' service that connects all the city-center buildings and 'Bellagio' but the tram station is behind Bellagio hotel and it is still quite a walk to get back to the strip. [If your goal is to get to the Las vegas blvd in front of Bellagio, you are better off walking instead of taking the tram]. This is the main deal-breaker for me.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: CHERYL L
Reviews.Content: This was our first overseas trip and our Travel Agent had recently stayed at this Resort which is only 18 months old and recommended it to us. Coming from Townsville this town is Big and so is the Rosort but very easy to navigate. The rooms are a good size and very nice. You have a good view over the strip. The bed and pillows are soft and luxurious - Very good sleep. The choice for meals is very good and varied. The staff were very nice, friendly and helpfull. We would stay here again if we return to Vagas.

Reviews.Title: “lovely room”
Reviews.Author: happytravelers97
Reviews.Content: the room was amazing. when you open the door, the electric shade/shears open. nice sitting area. great selection of snacks ($$$) stocked. the bathroom was fancy, shmancy. there was some trash on the floor behind the sitting area so that was a little creepy for the germ phob. the pools are long enough that you can swim laps (even tho they aren't lap pools). the faster food was definitely lacking. we didn't want to spend the time in the bigger restaurants so picked the little sandwich shop and the coffee shop. i ended up not eating most of what i ordered each time.

Reviews.Title: “Zombie Nation Below Our Window”
Reviews.Author: PropellerJourney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ARIA on August 12 & 13. 2011. Do not accept a room on the MARQUEE Day and Night Club(Cosmopolitan) side of the ARIA! Otherwise you'll be faced with hearing endless cords of the Zombie Nation Song (from the year 2000) sounding like ooooo0000oooo with the DJ yelling: can't hear you-- louder! + the earth splitting BASS. There's another night club on the other side of the Strip that just adds to the noise. The bass almost moved our bed! Not really but seemed like it. We should have relocated the first night but were too tired from driving. The second day we moved to the other side of the ARIA. The rooms were very nice as our photos show. You have to be very computer savvy to turn off one light without turning EVERYTHING OFF. Each light, TV and Curtains are computer controlled–hit or touch the wrong button and everything turns off and the curtains close. The beds provided a great night of sleep AFTER we changed to a quieter room. The bathrooms were large and robes were provided. There is light Security at the entrance to the Hotel's Elevators–they want to see your room key. The ARIA has a delightful vanilla-cinnamon fragrance that emanates from the ceiling thus blocking out the usual Casino/Hotel smell! If you do not know what I am referring to, just note the smell in other Hotels. The self- parking lot is great with wide spaces to avoid door dings. There is no issue parking here. We highly recommend the quiet side of the ARIA

Reviews.Title: “Aria Hotel and Casino/ Great Vacation !”
Reviews.Author: pajoreview
Reviews.Content: Wr arrived for an 8 night stay August 1 st to the 9 th, no lineups.We stayed 5 nights in a regular king room.Spotless.T.v. wasn't working but maintenance came and fixed it right away.Loved the room.Housekeeping was excellent.Bit disappointed in the buffet as they have removed some dishes but overall good.Cafe Vetro's breakfast was quickly served and hot.Again great service.Ate at Sirios, Georges Steakhouse and Sage.All good, especially Sage.Highly recommended and Johnie was fabulous.Best meal I've had in Vegas for a few years!Taste and presentation exquisite.Jean Phillipe coffee and patisserie very good.Friendly staff. Tried to pay for an upgrade to a suite at the players club check in and was told none were available from a young man at the desk.We weren't impressed by his attitude. The last 3 nights were spent in a corner suite.Go for it.It's beautiful.The only negative was the bathroom floor was not cleaned Other than that great housekeeping every day!We loved the casino and drink service was fairly frequent.Check out great.Looking forward to returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and High Tech Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreakboyChicago
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel has a wonderful smell as you enter. The rooms are big and beautiful, full of technology just push buttons and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay, looking forward to our next stay”
Reviews.Author: DTSecondHome
Reviews.Content: We really have nothing But good to say. The corner suites are just so wonderful. The views are lovely. I wish our condo was designed like these rooms. The bathrooms are beautiful and luxurious. The beds are so comfy, one day I will buy one. The housekeeping was great, room was always very clean, and many extras left for us. The staff were all very friendly and attentive. Only negative I have is self park is way to far from check in. This is our #1 choice for Vegas. We enjoyed the casino area a lot. The cafe Vettro is great for a variety food options. The service was always A+ This visit was for our 25th anniversary and we could not have asked for better. We are very picky and we loved everything! Take the negative comment with a grain of salt. This was our 4th stay and it just Keeps getting better. Looking forward to our winter stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, great beds!”
Reviews.Author: estrella-bella
Reviews.Content: It was an easy enjoyable experience from beginning to end. Free parking/valet service, quick check-in process, wonderful beds and beautiful surroundings. The food at the Lemongrass was worthy of a return visit. The pools were nice, nothing over the top, but the service was always timely and pleasant. Definitely would consider a return visit.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Great Smoky Mountains National Park, Tennessee
Reviews.Title: “Corner Suite - Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: joaks
Reviews.Content: We got an offer via email for 3 free nights and $150 a day food. I checked in on a Wed., about noon. Check-in was easy and very straightforward. The lady at the desk was very polite and explained all the details on the offer and answered any questions I had. She told me I could have a 5th floor corner suite now, or wait about two hours and get a 30th floor suite, since the cleaning crew hadn't finished that early yet. I chose to wait. Got a text on my phone almost exactly 2 hours later, went back and the room was ready. Room 30-144 The room itself was one of the neatest rooms we have stayed in. Everything from the TV to the lights and curtains was computer controlled either by wall panels or through the TV. The room had a stocked minibar/fridge, 1.5 bathrooms, living room, and master bedroom. We had a view of the strip (PH) on one side, and a mountain view from the other. We could see the Cosmo and Vdara Pools from the room. The room comes fully stocked with shampoo, conditioner, soaps, shower/bath kits, sewing kit, dental kit, etc etc.. The bed was one of the most comfortable we have ever stayed in. We ate at 3 different restaurants, including The Buffet while there, plus room service several times and the food was excellent. I would definitely pay to stay here next time, offer or not. My only negative was that it seemed like the AC had trouble keeping the room below 74 during the day, even with the blackout curtains closed, but thats really irrelevant since we never spent much time there at noon. We were always out moving around the strip or the Aria. Oh, and the walk from the Aria to the strip isn't as short as other strip hotels, but that didn't bother us none. My wife enjoyed going through the Crystals to get to the strip each day. We didn't use the swimming pools, but I walked through them one day, and the swimming area is huge with lots of cocktail service, 3 pools, and a nightclub there. Very isolated from the crowd as well. Definitely worth a visit if your a pool lover.

Reviews.Title: “The newest five-star on the strip”
Reviews.Author: jddamore
Reviews.Content: We booked Aria through our Visa Signature card and got a good deal for a four-night stay. Since Aria is rated as a five-star resort (AAA), we wondered how it ranked compared to the other biggies on the strip (i.e. Wynn, Bellagio, Venetian). Overall, we were very pleased and think it's made tangible improvements over some of the reviews we read before our stay. Pros: - Aria is beautiful. Well designed casino and restaurants plus an immaculate pool and gym. - Service is a plus. Since we had resort credits through our booking, we had to get a manager to help at the front desk. We met Patrick who was incredibly helpful and responsive. We also ate at Sage, a truly delectable and service-driven experience. Unlike other reviews, check-in and check-out were also efficient. - The rooms are great. As others have written, the technology is well-above other hotels and the interface is very intuitive. Plus a very comfortable bed makes these rooms a great place to escape. - Wifi is included (with mandatory resort fee). The signal is strong and fast everywhere we went on resort. Cons: - While on the strip, Aria is set further back than most hotels. This creates a bit of extra walking, but the free monorail was great and you never encounter the crowds like the center strip resorts. - The prices reflect the hotel's status, so don't expect to stay/eat cheaply. While several of Aria's restaurants deserve their rave reviews, the buffet doesn't measure up to other hotels. - Resort fees. They're a staple for MGM resorts, but I never like to see them. Can't they just add this to hotel price? We would certainly return to Aria and think the hotel will mature into a true competitor with other greats on the strip. Right now, I'd still give a slight edge to the Wynn or Bellagio, but I think the management of Aria is closing the gap quickly and gracefully. A fun time and great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room with Great Strip View”
Reviews.Author: GREGPittsburgh_Pa
Reviews.Content: We visited in July for 3 days and found that everything exceeded our expectations. In particular they have some great restaurants that offer a theatre menu from 5:00 PM to 7:00PM with very attractive prices for high quality food.

Reviews.Title: “awesome clean and new hotel”
Reviews.Author: parthenon007
Reviews.Content: located in the middle of the strip, so not too far from the major other hotels with various attractions. had a junior corner suite with the jacuzzi and great view. the hotel is new so doesn't look dingy like some of the other known old hotels great but expensive restaurants awesome pools, spa and service. good night life, but we didnt get to do that much since we had a toddler with us. the best feature of the hotel room was the automated lights, music, curtains, and the tub of course. the BED was awesome, we slept like babies. really comfy. you'll not enjoy sleeping on another bed again!!

Reviews.Title: “Totally spoiled!”
Reviews.Author: jujuking
Reviews.Content: We had booked through Priceline and got a pretty decent rate. My hubby asked if it's possible to get a room with a view of the strip. We ended up with a stern European looking lady to check us in instead of a perky coed so my expectations were in check. Then she said something about sky suit. It didn't register for us since we booked a regular room through Priceline. As we walked through the swanky casino floor, we realized that there is a separate elevators for sky suites. Instantly we felt like high-rollers as we took the sky suites elevators. Even the hallway looked modern and high class, no tacky design carpets and cheap paintings here. The room was spectacular, actually it was a 1 br suite. As soon as we walked in, the lights came on, the curtains started to open up and a soft music greeted us. I was floored! What a welcome! I checked the view immediately from our floor to ceiling window, which didn't disappoint. I believe we were on the 18h floor so we had a great view of the strip facing MGM. Then I checked all the amenities and features of the room. The decor was cool contemporary with a lot of dark wood and muted tones. The bed was so comfortable with gazillion pillows. I loved the huge sliding bathroom doors to the bathroom. The bathroom was so spacious. It had a jacuzzi tub in the middle, nice walkin shower and a toilet with Toto bidet. That is luxury my friends - to not have to sit on a cold toilet seat. The thing I loved the most was the master remote control that controlled Tv, music, curtains and temperature. You can also set do not disturb message via the remote. I so wish my home could be wired lime Aria suite. The suite was very spacious with high ceilings. The furniture isn't nicest I have see in Vegas but the overall decor and ambience were classy and cool, nothing garish. I also loved the newness of it all. We have no idea how we got upgraded to a suite as we don't gamble and it was our first time there. Perhaps we won some kind of upgrade lottery? Anyway, it was hard to leave my suite at Aria. I got so spoiled that when we stayed at Vdara a few months later, I scoffed at its pedestrian room but it would have been a fine and even better than average room if my standards weren't so skewed by My Aria experience. I totally enjoyed my stay at Aria. I took advantage of their gym (loved it!) and the pool (cool yet family friendly). Also their buffet is great and the line wasn't nearly as atrocious as bellagio buffet's. Aria, you spoiled me!

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back”
Reviews.Author: jett124
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I've stayed in while in Vegas. Slow check in, slow check out. The vanilla smell they pump into the hotel is a little overwhelming. Dirty room, food on the floor from the last people, stains on the pillows and sheets. Had to call housekeeping 4 times to clean the room properly. I had to actually show the housekeeper how to clean it. Was not compensated for a crappy stay. Will never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel. Perfect new modern rooms with great views!”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel34
Reviews.Content: The Aria is grand in grand ol Vegas. It's one of the best and most modern places to stay on a trip to Vegas. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Views are phenomenal overlooking the great highsvof buildings from the full scale wide window. Bathroom fantastic clean and had 2 sinks with walk in shower and huge bath. Not a noisy hotel at all. Casino in house is on an equally large grand scale and lots of bars and restaurants not forgetting Viva elvis that shows. Great show. Restaurants in hotel very good especiallybthe Spanish Tapas bar and the Steak house. Worth a visit. Outside pool area clean and lots of sun bed availability with waiter service. Def worth a visit! We will go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Part of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LimpingHiker
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I didn't care for Vegas and I have no intention of going back, but the hotel was great! I was in town for a conference and we used the meeting rooms in the adjacent conference center. The coffee and catered meals were better than usual "conference" buffets and I had lunch in one of the on-site restaurants (can't recall which but it's on the 2nd floor next to the Elements gift shop). Service and food were both excellent there. Nice baths, TV, comfy bedding, lots of electronically controlled features - my view wasn't great but I was on the 4th floor so I wouldn't have expected much. I could have paid an extra $40 to upgrade to a "city view" room but I didn't spend a lot of my waking hours in the room so no need. I did spend a lot of time in the conference center. Lots of ladies rooms and never a wait. Better than average conference chairs, good lighting and a/v options. Staff was great and always around to take care of the small details that add up. I hope I don't end up in Las Vegas again but if I do, the Aria would be a good choice as a home base.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: RussontheRoad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night at Aria in early August. The hotel is beautiful, on par with many Vegas hotels, but what separated it from many others is the service. The people at the front desk, pool and restaurants were fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty damn good”
Reviews.Author: BigHolidayDog
Reviews.Content: Having read many of the negative reviews, I did have a couple reservations before I visited here. To sum up: Check in was pretty quick, maybe 5 mins. Room was great, really clean and modern. Comfortable bed and everything is easy to work via the tablet. The vanilla smell which I thought I would hate was actually fairly nice. More like a faint smell of incense, that anything over powering. Pool was great and we found all the hotel staff to be of a high standard. It also was easy to navigate and a short walk to the strip. We were not overly impressed with the buffet for breakfast. The selection wasn't that great and never changed. Still ok ,but I have had much better buffets in Vegas. Overall we had a great stay and couldn't really find fault with anything

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel.. very busy”
Reviews.Author: Alecka
Reviews.Content: We went to the Aria Hotel in August and it was really really nice. the room was great. All the electrical gadgets were really cool and I loved that they had my name on the tv. I found that there wa plenty of room and our view was of the pool and it was nice, not the best but nice. The hotel casino itself was great. There were plenty of machines and the atmosphere was really nice BUT I found that the coffee shop was very pricey. Actually, all the restaurants were very pricey. I bought a coffee for $6 and it was just a regular coffee. I also find that they can make some adjustments to the free offers they give. They are not very generous with the offers. I think with the high prices you pay in the hotel, they can at least offer a free breakfast, or coupons to nearby restaurants etc. It was a nice hotel, but I think you need to bring super extra cash to really indulge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, but check-in needs an overhaul”
Reviews.Author: Vic28
Reviews.Content: The room is fantastic: large room, large windows, fully computerized, with remotes on the TV screen – a geek’s dream room (just wondering what happens if/when the computers/remotes fail), luxurious huge bathroom, all the usual luxury amenities (bathrobe, toiletries, etc.). The room service is quick and efficient. However, the hotel is HUGE, as are a lot of other hotels in Vegas. Walking even to the elevators can be a trek. The only real gripe I have is with the ultra slow check-in; it reminded me of lineups at the bank on payday. You would think an expensive luxury hotel would have a better system…

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-tight machines”
Reviews.Author: rneu
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days this past week. I read the reviews pro and con for the last 6 weeks, so knew what to look for. This is the best place to stay in Vegas as I have been to town 10-12 times and stayed in many hotels. Check in was easy. I had package which included arrival items. When I got to room nothing there so called VIP services and items were there in 20 mins. Players Club was visited by us and on phone and all questions were answered quickly. We used the in room service which was all excellent. We had a Spanish waiter who was excellent twice and more then gracious. I felt the 5 star rating was correct as the hotel is worth it! The employees were more then what I expected and would go back anytime The only problem was the machines which were very tight and wouldn't let you play much. We moved around to other venues and played better.

Reviews.Title: “This was one of the worst experiences of my life...”
Reviews.Author: slsbrokers
Reviews.Content: I checked in and went up to my room which was a huge disappointment. walking thru the hotel smelled like vanilla which got all over my clothes, permeated the lobby, the casino, the elevator, and my room. i called down to the front desk and they said there was nothing they could do. The service was so bad that i checked out early and went to another hotel 2 days early. I travel all over the world for business and have never had anything this bad!

Reviews.Title: “Mother/Daughter get away”
Reviews.Author: chocdreamer
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 days at the Aria with my daughter for her 30th birthday. We loved this hotel. It is very clean, modern, and every employee was friendly and helpful. Even the people who worked in the stores (of which there are many) were polite and didn't seem to mind helping us when we were just browsing. The hotel doesn't have that smokey scent like some of the casinos. It is huge, though. You could walk miles and still be in the same hotel! Many beautiful pools to enjoy outside. We loved walking through the Crystals shopping center attached to the hotel even though we could never afford anything at those shops. We did eat at Wolgang Pucks pizza restaurant there and enjoyed a reasonable meal. Also had dinner at Lemongrass, the Thai restaurant in the Aria. Very posh and yummy. You can't buy a bottle of water or a cup of coffee for under $4.00 anywhere in the hotel, but that is no different then any of the other high end hotels. There is a free shuttle monorail that goes between the Monte Carlo, Aria and Bellagio. Wish we would have known that on our first day but we finally figured it out. We had a room with two queen beds and a view of the city, which, at night, is fun to look at. We also enjoyed the technology in the room. You can control everything, including the temperature and the drapes, from the t.v. Yes, we would stay again. Beware of the resort fee tacked on. This $22 a day fee gives you the fitness center, a free newspaper (but it isn't delivered to your room), and free Wifi. We didn't need any of that but they still charge you the fee. So when you think you are getting a good deal on a room, don't forget about the hotel taxes AND the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: backpackluxury
Reviews.Content: It's new and I wanted to try City Center as well, having stayed about everywhere else in Vegas over the last couple of decades. I was very disappointed. Rates were good but they should be as expensive as everything else is in City Center. It's like they capture you since there's no real easy way to get around to other places even though it's right in the middle of the Strip. Get this... checking in my daughter and I received two complimentary drink coupons. We stopped at one of the lounges and ordered a couple of Bloody Mary's. Waitress said coupons weren't good for Bloody Mary's. Are you kidding me? This is a new hotel trying to win customers and we're in LAS FREAKING VEGAS and my stupid coupons aren't good for a Bloody Mary? That's kind of what I said nicely so she went and asked the manager and came back and said: Nope. No can do. So I tore the two coupons in half and asked her to give them to her manager and BRING ME TWO BLOODY MARYS AND CHARGE ME FOR THEM!! AND NEXT TIME I'LL STAY AT THE VENETIAN! So, off to a bad start. The rooms are really nice and it takes a few minutes to get up to speed on the really high tech features. Unfortunately, we both awoke every morning with very sore and scratchy throats and felt like we were getting sick. Later I found out that they have had some VERY SERIOUS health issues in the hotel. Google it. And in the future, don't give me a stupid complimentary drink coupon if you want to stiff me on the drink! They won't see me there again anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, now if they could get the casino part figured out”
Reviews.Author: TonyYandow
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and very responsive staff. Nice size with amazing amenities. My only issue is the smoking in the casino. Normally I stay at the Wynn and the smoke is never a problem. For some reason at Aria, the smoke in the casino area was horrible. I threw out some of my clothing rather than bring it home. It smelled of smoke so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Voyageur10
Reviews.Content: The hotel check-in area is a free-for-all of separate lines and woe be it to you if you get behind someone with a problem (like us) as you will wait and wait and wait. Instead of feeding the various check-in stations from one line, you pick a spot and hope for the best. A hotel employee told me that the hotel used to use stanchions to form a single line - first come, first served but stopped doing so for aesthetic reasons. Now the lobby looks good (whatever that is) but is full of disgruntled clients. It took our small group with two rooms about 40 minutes to check in due the problem noted about and to differences between the promised Internet rate and amenities and the hotel's version. Promised breakfast included with the room rate turned out to be a $40 credit for ONE morning's breakfast for two guests. (The manager referred us to a mythical asterisk on the website leading to an explanation of the breakfast offer.) You are on your own for the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are very hip, very cool”
Reviews.Author: atlfan1970
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Aria are very nice, with lots of hip touches, like iPod ports and universal remotes that control everything in the room from TV to the lights and blackout curtains. The rooms is large, and each one has a floor-to-ceiling wrap-around window that offers the feel of a corner room. The bathroom was large and unique - the walk in shower was combined with a jacuzzi tub, with the tub being behind the shower - hard to picture but pretty neat. Separate water closet - always a plus with me. All in all, the room alone makes it a worthwhile place to stay if you can get a good rate. The casino was visually stunning. It is overwhelming to the eye, so you have to force yourself to stop and view the small touches to truly appreciate everything that has gone into the design and decoration of the casino space. I personally hate automatic shufflers, and every blackjack table south of $25 had one. We gambled next door. Several good restaurants as well Unfortunately, the pool is below average. Nothing specal at all. That didn;t stop me from finding a shade tree and drinking beer all morning, but the pools are round, 3.5 feet deep, and small by Vegas standards. It is obvious that this is where they cut expenses when the project went bankrupt. Hopefully they have plans to upgrade. Kind of a pain to get to from the street too, unless you are taking a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “You forget there is a casino downstairs”
Reviews.Author: TWelshGeneralMgr
Reviews.Content: We spend lots of weekend in Las Vegas, and I love to try a new hotel each time. I enjoyed Aria's comfort and beauty. The bed was extraordinary, and while the bath shower combo is funky - the soaking tub was perfect before a night out. You feel like you are in a major city, and the experience is much different than your average strip hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh,Bright and Amazing interior”
Reviews.Author: sohamda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my favourite not only for the amazing unique interior design but for their lavish widespread buffet as well. The whole place gives a sense of freshness (unlike many hotels, which stink and have gone pale because of the smoke) Aria definately a place to stay,eat and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelor Party”
Reviews.Author: MichaelCir
Reviews.Content: We rented two sky suites and had an amazing time. The rooms were set up and furnished perfectly. Staff was excellent from moment to end. Limo from airport was nice extra touch. Pools and casinos were really nice as well. Good for travelers of any kind.

Reviews.Title: “Good but if you are picky.........”
Reviews.Author: Wontacceptanameilike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Aria resort and it was very nice. Thanks to the reviews on trip adviser we were able to avoid extra charges. I did have to call the desk once to make sure we weren't charged for something my wife took out of the fridge to make room for something of ours. During the call we were told the fridge isn't really a fridge and it is just insulated cool not refrigerated cold so we asked for a fridge and they brought it up real fast. I'm pretty sure that anyone that stays at Aria will have a nice time (if they can avoid the extra charges) but I do have a few nit picky observations I would like to share for those of you who care about the details: I thought the hotel portion of the resort had a lot of unresolved minor repair issues for such a new building. For example, the baseboards in the room were very marked up, the framed picture had an obvious blemish, the touchscreen (master control for room) had a big nick/ding on one corner, and the wall paper and wooden paneling in the hallway (8th floor) had many nicks. I just felt like they aren't planning on taking on the cost of minor maintenance issues in such a new building and it shows. Regarding the technology, it seems like a good idea but I didn't feel like they pulled it off well. The controls are fairly user friendly but those that are technically challenged might struggle. The TV stopped working as soon as we arrived. The staff member who brought the fridge couldn't get it to work but told us he would send a technician up. An hour later we had to call the desk and ask for assistance. Eventually it was fixed. On day two, we had the privacy switch on (shows a red privacy light outside the room for staff) but house keeping still called to ask if we wanted to have the room cleaned which was fine but we said no and a little while later someone entered without knocking so why did they bother to call? While walking the halls I witnessed house keeping knocking and announcing through the door but this person just walked in on us. She then put an old school privacy sign on the door handle despite the advanced privacy light which was working so they don't even trust their own technology (or the guest's ability to use it properly). The TV remote was really mundane and the system wasn't very responsive to the buttons (there was usually a delay) for a room that was supposed to be technologically advanced.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but the temperature in the casino is fr..fre..freeeeeezing”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_McGee
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can say bad about the Aria is the casino was so cold, I brough the coverlet from our bed down to the tables to drape over our laps and legs. I know casinos are normally cold, but this was beyond ridiculous. The vents were large boxes that stood upright behind the dealters and blew cold air directly on us at the tables. Other patrons were complaining as well and the dealers all said it was always that cold. Decor was gorgeous--black, brown, bronze, silver....very pretty! Room was high tech with one button to shut your drapes and turn off all the lights. Large walk in bathrooms nicely appointed. Service very good as it was my hubby's bday and I arranged ahead of time for a birthday cake to be delivered to our room. The concierge was very helpful with this. I would stay here again but probably not gamble here much due to the temperature. We did leave and go to some other properties as a result.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Once Again Aria!!!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryBeBe23
Reviews.Content: First i would like to say that this was my 2nd time to Aria in 7 months ... This hotel is amazing and i would return over and over if i had already stayed at every other hotel on the strip. First impression my 2nd time around was WOW this place has really picked up from the last time we were here.. Diego at check in was very patient with us we had 2 rooms and we needed them side by side we also checked in really early around 11 am he had both rooms put next door and he was fast! So thank you Diego you really helped make our trip better. I like how housekeeping will call you every day to make sure you have everything needed. If you have your privacy light on they will not bother you at all. There was a doorman at the elevators who would check our key to make sure we were hotel guest at all times which made me feel very comfortable and safe. To get to the strip its a 2 min walk which did not bother me at all if i didnt feel like walking i would take the tram to monte carlo the next stop and just walk out the front doors. Overall I LOVE this place and i love how they really try hard to impress their guests .. Taxi service to concierge handling our bags ... everyone was just awsome! We WILL BE BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to receive a heavy dose of Oxygen”
Reviews.Author: Ty S
Reviews.Content: First the hotel is amazing, very beautiful. The hotel is well laid out and designed to do one thing. Get your money! And they do an excellent job at it. First they don't want you in your room they want you gambling and shopping, so they pump the rooms with oxygen. My decision to stay here is do to me having a very stressful job and so I decided to spend additional time in Las Vegas before my conference, so my goal was not to party, gamble or shop.
