I wanted to relax and it is very difficult to relax with all this oxygen is in the air. If you can really afford it stay here the hotel is large with a ton of rooms beautifully decorated. But be warned you will feel like a meth addict with all the oxygen in the air.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking....”
Reviews.Author: 12travel12
Reviews.Content: After a rave review from a family member we booked our honeymoon at this hotel. It was a mess from the moment we arrived as the "computer system" was down so they were trying to book everyone manually which meant standing in line behind 2 people for 45 minutes! Then once finally checked in we take the 10 minute walk to our room which was OCCUPIED! Once back at the counter meant another 45 minute wait to find that everyone they were putting in rooms was having the same problem and had to move us all. Once in the new room we found dirty tissue int he bed in the sheets, the previous gusts check out book with room key inside never picked up, and his cloths in one of the drawers! When returning to the front desk the next morning we returned the cloths, room key from previous guest and only got a "I'm sorry" and $75 food/beverage credit. I guess we should be happy we were given something but the additional 20 resort fee with tax on the resort fee so more like 23 whether you use the facilities or not is silly. Oh and our minibar was locked and the computer system controlling everything next to the bed was not working correctly. For how pretty the building is it was not the best stay I've had in Vegas and would look elsewhere. Very disappointed and will not be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkCornwall_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Aria in April in a Sky Suite room; it is a fantastic hotel with good facilities, spacious room and good service. The buffet was particularly good value and my wife really enjoyed the casino area. The pool area is nice although they could improve the system used for ordering food from the Breeze Café as it is clearly removed from the kitchen area and relies on one person scuttling backwards and forwards, hence it’s not always accurate or reliable! Some areas can get very busy particularly Jean Philippe Patisserie during breakfast time with long queues forming. They are very strict on children around the pool area, so no balls or inflatables or other pool toys of any description and if they are under 14 then they cannot be unsupervised or go into a hot tub on their own even of you are in the pool area with them. There is a good range of movies and TV for children in the evenings if you want to go to the casino and we were able to leave our 12 year old with our friend’s older son. I believe they do a baby-sitting service for those with children too young to leave on their own. We had a great time in Vegas on this our second trip and enjoyed some shows particularly the Lion King which was far better than I thought it would be and in particular the Cirque de Soleil show “O” which was brilliant and jaw dropping in parts. We would definitely return to The Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: songaff
Reviews.Content: Pool: 3 large pools which you are allowed to drink in. (Frozen cocktails are fab!) They are surrounded by beds but not all the beds have umberellas so remember your sunfactor! There is also a smaller pool in a seperate area where DJs play. This pool is referred to as the Liquid pool and to use a bed in there, you have to spend a minimum of €50 in one go on drink. There is free drinking water available in the pool area which is a nice touch. The pools are quite shallow and there are two lifeguards on duty at each pool all the time so they are quite safe. Spa: Modern and cosy and a day pass is only $30. A day pass allows you access to the infinity pool, 3 differnet temperatue jacuzzis, a sauna, steamroom and two relaxing rooms. Its lovely to visit if you want a break out of the sun. Lockers, towels, robes, slippers, showers and well equiped dressing rooms are all available as part of the package. Cirque Du Soleil Elvis show: A 90 minute show full of dancing, singing and acrobatics. The acrobats were amazing and the staging and set design were fantastic. Very impressive. The 90 minutes flew by and it would definitely encourage me to go to another Cirque Du Soleil show. Room: We had booked a regular king sized non-smoking room. We were only on the 12th floor but still had a great view - MGM, New York, New York, the Monte Carlo etc. The room was spacious and cleaned really well each day. The bed was super soft. The technology to use the electrics in the room was easy and convenient to use. The bathroom was large with two sinks and a shower and seperate bath. Gambling: Slot machines and tables - min bet on the tables was $10. Location: Perfect - New York, New York, MGM Grand Monte Carlo and Excalibur on one side and Casers. Paris and Bellagio on the other. A free tram runs from the Monte Carlo through the Crytals shopping centre (which is in front of the Aria) to the Bellagio. This is very handy when its too hot to walk. Food: Large selection of restaurants everything from snacks to steak/seafood dinners. The breakfast buffer is great value for money - about $18. By far my favorite place to eat in the whole of Las Vegas was Todd Englishes pub which is attached to the hotel. Huge portions, great variety and amazing tastes. Best chicken dinner I ever had. They also havea good selection of beers/lagers. Staff: Very courteous and helpful from the second we stepped out of the taxi on arrival. Mary at the concierge desk deserves a star for all the help she gave us - information, booking tickets etc,

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel! Can't wait to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Huskies04
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Aria and I can promise it won't be my last! Being connected to the City Center is a huge plus. There is soooo much to do in the complex. The check-in at Aria was very easy and the staff was super nice to deal with. The lobby and casino layout is very nice. We had a deluxe king room and it was spectacular! The bed was amazingly comfortable. Best bed we've had in any Vegas room. The bathroom was spacious and very nice. I've seen some reviews complain about rooms not being clean, but ours was as clean as can be. No complaints at all about the room. There is plenty of food options in the hotel and then even many more just next door in the city center shopping complex. The pools were nice. My one complaint the whole stay was that when we ordered a 16 ounce mimosa for $16 we got a 9 ounce mimosa. Obviously when you order a drink for $16 you expect to get exactly what you ordered. When we first complained to the pool waitress who brought us the drink, she said she was sorry but that nothing could be done as it was just a misprint on the menu. We later went to the pool bar and spoke to the bar manager and he was very apologetic and gave us a second drink for free. He said there has been numerous complaints about that misprint on the menu and new updated menus were already being printed. So we were very happy with the managers response and action. Overall, I can't say enough how much I loved this hotel. I highly, highly recommend this place to anyone going to Las Vegas. I've stayed at some amazing hotels in Las Vegas and this one is right there with any of them as being one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Aria -- deceptive practice”
Reviews.Author: LHVA
Reviews.Content: We were the victims of a highly deceptive practice by Aria; we booked a room "breakfast included" special, and were told at check-in to just to go to the buffet each morning and it would be credited. We were shocked at check-out that breakfast (a $30 per person charge) was not included; instead, there was only a small credit. This information did NOT appear anywhere on the Aria generated confirmation and this was NOT the information provided at check-in. We filled out an Aria service form,specifically asking for someone to respond, but it's been a month with no response. Nor did we ever receive notice from Aria that we were potentially exposed to legionnaire's disease during our July 4 weekend stay, although Aria has all our contact information. So, we're going back to the Bellagio next time, where service was friendly, honest, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Wynn next time”
Reviews.Author: wicked51
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, first night, they gave us two queen beds. Our reservation was for a king. The staff just apologized. We changed to a room with a king sized bed for the next few nights. Housekeeping did a lousy job, there was dust on the dresser, some pillows, and even popcorn on the floor, next to the bed. The pool was somewhat decent. Unfriendly dealers and pit bosses on the casino floor. Going to stay at the Wynn next time.

Reviews.Title: “Definition of Sexy”
Reviews.Author: Milanista21
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas several times, went last August and will be going again this August. Aria has changed my hotel experience life. The moment you walk in and smell the vanilla circulating through the air you're already hooked. Then you walk through the hotel and pass by the most amazing dessert place I've ever encountered. Then finally when you open the door to your room, the blinds open and then you are immediately welcomed. The specific moment you lay on the bed, your life changes forever. With all the hustle and bustle Vegas is, once you lay on that bed, it immediately relaxes you and you are transported to heaven. I will never stay at another hotel again in Vegas other than Aria. We had delicious food throughout the hotel as well as the room service. It is the definition of sexy relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Maria111144
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our vacation in Las Vegas. We were at the Aria just one night as a last minute change when we added one day to our trip. I will say that the view and architecture of the Aria is beautiful but customer service was some of the worst I have seen recently. My husband and I went to sleep but early but about 12am we both realized that the room was slightly warm even though we had the temp set on 70. About 1:30 am we both woke up and both said how warm it still felt so we lowered it to about 68. By 3am we both knew it was not going to get better. From there on it was basically just small naps till our wake up time of 6am. Our bellman came for our bags about 10am and asked if our stay was enjoyable which we explained that it was not because of the temp in our room. He said to make sure we spoke to the front desk concerning that. When we did speak to them a few minutes later we got nothing more than “Im sorry but you should have called so we could have sent a technician to your room.” My husband then explained that it would not have helped us by 3am to call and have someone come to our room as we would have gotten even less sleep. That got us nowhere. While my husband tried calmly to reason with them I began to notice two other couples becoming very frustrated with two different ladies at the checkout area. I am very disappointed in this outwardly beautiful hotel with the extremely poor customer service! Before the Aria we stayed at the Venetian and were so pleased by excellent service from the entire staff. Although we had no issues with the Venetian I did over hear one couple and another individual that was not happy with certain things during their stay and the front desk immediately responded with “I will take care of that right away.” You could see right away that they had a customer for life! I now refuse to stay at the Aria due to their poor service and leave this review for others to decide for themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Get ready to walk-”
Reviews.Author: Pips_14
Reviews.Content: My first trip to the Aria was pleasant. Check in was easy and painless. However, I had reserved a deluxe king room and was told that all were taken upon my arrival. The desk offered to "upgrade" my room to a double in their North tower on the 25th floor.  I took the room (didn't have much of a choice) with no idea that a lengthy walk would ensue.  Approximately 15 minutes later I arrived at my room which was very modern with cool decor. Everything being remote controlled was great!  Beds were comfy - room was clean - and the bathroom was nice. The air conditioner seemed to struggle a bit to keep the room cold - the best I got it to was around 70 degrees.   When on the 15 minute walk to leave the room/property, I always saw the  hotel staff cleaning or straightening.  There's a wonderful aroma to the hotel and the decorations are very pretty.  As far as parking goes, more walking - For self park, it'll tack on another 5 to 7 minutes. For valet, which isn't at the front door, so off you'll go for 300 yards to pick up your car.  I don't mind the walk but people should be prepared. Cell phone service in this whole area was sketchy. A lot of times no service at all.   Once I returned from Vegas I was perusing twitter and saw a tweet about Aria guest being exposed to legionaries disease on the days that I was at the hotel.  The post said if you were a guest during such and such dates to watch for symptoms.  The following week I received a letter from the hotel that an outbreak had occurred but luckily for me the incubation period had past so I wasn't affected. Perhaps research this if you're staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “ONE of the Nicest and Most Comfortable hotels I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: ED12348
Reviews.Content: From the time of checking in to the time of checking out this was one of the most enjoyable experiences I have had with a Hotel . The room was excellent and more than just clean and tidy . The bed in this room was like magic and I can say in my years of travelling in the world it was the most comfortable and gave me the best sleep ever . I have definitely bragged about this hotel and recommended it to friends .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Feelkarma
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Aria can only be described as excellent. We arrived there in the evening of July 3rd, directly from LAX after a long transatlantic flight. Combine the 3 hours it took us to extract ourselves from LAX, the 5 hours trip by car and the 9 hour difference with France and you can guess how tired we were when we finally reached Aria. Check in was a breeze, we asked for a nice view and got it, in fact we were up in our room within 10 min from leaving our car to the incredibly efficient (and free) valet parking. As described by others, the rooms are really beautiful, with nice little gadgets and amazing beds. Somehow, the toilet had not been cleaned and was therefore really dirty. This was however solved very efficiently and rapidly with a profusion of appologies. the next day, we were offerred chocolate strawberries, as the person at the check in desk had asked wether we were celebrating anything special, which we were (third anniversary ;]). Nice touch even We loved the modern architecture, the attention to detail everywhere in the hotel, the comfort of the room, the kindness of the staff and the even the vanilla smell. We never had problem with noise, so it seems that this has been soveld. We tried the breakfast buffet which we found expensive compared to the Bellagio's. In fact, we were not overly impressed with the restaurants we tried, with the notable exception of Mastro's in Crystals which was truly exceptional. Actually, we liked Aria so much that we decided to change our plans and to spend another night there on our way back from our trip to the national parks. Second experience was as good as the first one. We will certainly stay there again when we come back to Vegas - which we will certainly do!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE it and would totally go back!”
Reviews.Author: dimplescanada
Reviews.Content: We have stayed and lot's of hotel's in Vegas and I have to say Aria is the best hotel we have stayed at so far. Amazing hotel, great service, great rooms and close to everything. We would totally stay here again and recommend this hotel. When you stay at this hotel it doesn't even feel like you are in Vegas. The bed's we awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but totally worth it...”
Reviews.Author: Gbabigurl84
Reviews.Content: I'm a picky hotel person. I've stayed in plenty of places on the strip but have to say Aria was quite superior in my opinion (hence the price). We had a Deluxe 2 queen room facing the strip. Everything was clean, technology worked, and bathroom was definitely the best I've seen in Vegas. Front desk and housekeeping were friendly and quick to provide us anything we needed. Love the fact they check keys before letting anyone up the elevators and this is an all day thing not just at night like most hotels. Casino and dining was also top notch. And well location can't be argued with. Can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - you will not be dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: RedheadTrvlr
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Aria for a girls getaway. There was no line for check in, and imagibe my delight when I learned we were upgraded to a SkySuite. It was jaw dropping amazing - a huge apartment with floor to ceiling windows, 2 bathrooms, foyer, living room/office, kitchen/bar and dining room, and huge master bath with a walk in closet. The toilet even had a full panel of options next to it including front and rear cleansing and drying with an optional oscillator. And yes, this was a toilet and not a bidet. The suite amentities included compliementary breakfast pastries/fruit/coffee, and wine/cheese and cookies and bottled water. It was a luxurious experience and the rest of the property did not dissapoint. We spent a day at the spa and i enjoyed my massage, plus taking advantage of the sauna, steam room and whirlpool. They offered delicious herbal teas and snacks. Plus, there was an outdoor whirlpool for the spa which overlooked Liquid, the high energy pool club so you could watch the fun without actually being in the action - it was very "MTV Spring Break". The main pool areas were beautiful and calm - several mid size pools allowed for zero crowding and lots of privacy, plus there were a few hidden hot tubs. The chairs, tables and umbrellas were plentiful and comfortable and beverage service was frequent. We had a great tapas meal at Julian Serrano - service was incredible and the sangria (both white and red) delicious.We also enjoyed pastries at the patisserie on site and gelato to die for. We had breakfast one day at the cafe at Vdara, a non-gaming property adjacent to Aria. The fitness center was large and very well equipped, with windows looking out onto the pool area, providing cold towels, bottled water and fresh fruit. The location was perfect - not too far from anything. It was easy to cut through the Crystals Mall to get to the strip and a short walk to Bellaggio, Paris, or other main hotels. While in Vegas, we saw Jersey Boys at the Venetian (really fun!) and ate at many celebrity chef restraurants, the highlight of which was the tasting menu at Craftsteak - with wine pairings - a phenomenal event not to be missed. I can't wait to go back for another relaxing vacation and I will definitely stay at the Aria again. I have no idea why we were upgraded - perhaps it was because it was mid-week stay during the summer, perhaps it was because I signed up for MLife to get a good deal on the rate - but even if we were in a standard room I would happily return in an instant. Go for it if you haven't tried Aria and I'm sure you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dessny
Reviews.Content: Seriously, the best gym/spa I've been to. And the spa has a separate pool! The whole place was accessible. Its got everything but seems like there is less time to get from place to place as can be an issue in Vegas. But it just was a smooth, beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loved it, more for shoppers than anything though”
Reviews.Author: willi348
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and the room. The bed was incredibly comfortable and I loved the pillows so much that I ordered some for my home. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were immaculate. This was our first time staying in the new part of the strip and I don't think we'd stay there again. If you are going to Vegas to do some great shopping, it's for you but it's quite a ways from the rest of the strip. My husband and I enjoy walking around to the different casinos and it was hard to do from the Aria because it was a 10-minute walk (from the front door of the hotel) just to get to the street. I loved the hotel but wish that it was a part of the main strip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort, but a bit pricey where food is concerned!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiihound
Reviews.Content: My mother and I visited Las Vegas for a birthday get-away July 10-15, we stayed at the Aria. When we arrived, it was earlier in the morning on a Sunday and we were told at the front desk that they were not checking people in until 11 a.m. The check-out line up was enormous at that time. The staff told us that Sunday is their busiest day for check-outs. So we checked our bags with the bell desk (personnel there very, very pleasant & polite) and then decided to grab a quick bite to eat. We headed to Jean Phillipe Patissiere right off the hotel casino. One sandwich, a fruit bowl & 2 bottled juices came to $31 US. We found that a bit pricey for a quick bite. Once 11 a.m. rolled around, we headed to the front desk to check-in and found an enormous line-up with only 3 windows open for checking-in. There was a hotel staff member there directing people so the wait was not very long at all (maybe 15 minutes). However, our room was ready once we checked in and we headed right up and called for our bags which arrived within 7 minutes. We found the staff wonderful, polite and very helpful at the resort - would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge modern plush casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: looboo500
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at aria twice and throughly enjoyed both stays. The lengthy walk to the rooms is worth it once you see the huge super king bed... Wet room and huge oval bath!! We play a lot of poker and enjoy the $125 tournament each evening.. Fab restaurants and great mono rail like to monte Carlo and then short walk to belaggio

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here! save your money!”
Reviews.Author: whiskerstravels
Reviews.Content: we arrived early morning on friday july 29th. arriving the hotel lobby was breathtaking, they front desk was really nice and service lady was so nice she gave us a room right away. We get to our room which by the way was really far, and the room was immaculate. We were greated with our curtains opening lights turn on and things are just stunning. I then realize that we were charged 22.00 a day on "resort fees" . You pay those fees when you arrive to the hotel. we settled in and played with all the gadgets and how technology savvy everything is and we immedately went to the spa. The spa is really pricey, but is gorgeous.We go back and shower and start getting ready to hit the town. There are two of us in our room, where we realize we paid extra to have another bed. ive never stayed somewhere that you have to pay for another bed. I went with a friend who is also female. We had hairdryers going straighting irons on and we start to realize that the room is starting to get hot. We call downstairs and they tell us a technician will be up shortly. 30 minutes later a technician arrives and we are still doing our hair getting dressed and its getting hotter, the room is now a nicely chilled 82 degrees. The wonderful technician then advises us there is no ventilation in the bathroom and that they get extremely hot if we have a hairdryer on.. wow.. The technician then asks me to please let him use the chair so he can repair the air, which I give him , I was at the point sitting on chair doing my makeup. He uses our towels to clean up his mess from aircondition, left lots of wet dirty towels on the floor. WE were late to our expensive celine dion show, that i had been looking foward to going to for a long long time. We went to our room and the room was cool.. what a relief.. BUT when we get back we are extremely tired and ready for bed but now the curtains wont close. The wall switch doesnt work and large remote doesnt work. So AGAIN I call front desk and this time no one answers...They finally answer and i speak with front desk and male tells me it will be 45 min to get technician to me. wow.. technician arrives just like they said but this time in 30 minutes and takes about 30 minutes to fix curtains so they can now close. When i call downstairs to express my concern i was told that they did not have the staff to accommodate 4000 rooms. so i was told to do what i needed to do. I felt like everyonoe was nice but overworked due to the size and the amount of people that are there. STay somewhere else save your money.

Reviews.Title: “wow, Just wow”
Reviews.Author: kave_m
Reviews.Content: Aria Resort is Huge, Modern, Clean, fine. We were there for three days with my uncle and wife. I like the architecture Room, Casino, Lobby, Resort are clean, beautiful and modern the hotel serve us strawberry Chocolate in room because we celebrate our anniversary. Bad point: The drinks in casino are not good the time for check in and check out is not fair. you have to pay for Resort even if you don't want to use resort and it in not fair. the Resort breakfast is not good

Reviews.Title: “Nice welcome!”
Reviews.Author: CurrentMrsGreen
Reviews.Content: While I liked the 'welcome to the room' when you enter. The lights and music turn on for you. However, the room itself is on the small side. Nice linens and cool remote for all electronics bedside, but strange bath setup with the shower/tub combo. Overall we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice modern hotel in the middle of all of the strip”
Reviews.Author: PolishPauper
Reviews.Content: Booked the Aria to stay while in town for a trade show at Mandalay Bay and was having second thoughts about the distance, but after arriving super late due to flight delays we were upgraded to a suite. Wow, the bedroom was roomy with two walls of windows, two bathrooms and was very room overall. The location was perfect, after visiting several of the other resorts the Aria was as soothing comparably. will be definitely staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: nat1227
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really really nice. Rooms have everything you could want, everything is computerized. Bathroom was nice. The bed is to DIE for.... too bad its $2600 bucks. Slept like a baby. We were only there 3 days but i would definetly go back! We requested a king and got a double room.... tried to argue with them about it, to no avail. Once we made peace with the room all was well. The pool is entirely too hidden. The buffet we went to kinda sucked.... the other restaurant on the main floor wasnt too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite Vegas Spot”
Reviews.Author: roamingraider
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 5th anniversary at the Aria this past October. We debated quite some time before settling on this property. We had both been to Vegas many times and decided to try something new. We couldn' t have been more pleased with our decision. The rooms, casino, restaurants, shops (I could go on and on) were top notch. Our room faced behind the strip and had a beautiful view. The room is basically controlled by one controller (about the size of an Ipad) that controls the tv, thermostat, window shade, alarm and lights. I guess the only downside to our room was the bed. It was so comfortable that when we got home we couldn't sleep on our old bed any longer and had to buy a new one. As far as the casino the dealers were all very friendly and willing to give advice if you asked for it. The casino didn't smell like smoke like a lot of other ones it actually had a vanilla smell that was very nice. I never had a problem gettting on a blackjack or craps table. There were always plenty of available slots to choose from as well. We ate at several of the local shops/restaurants and were never disappointed. The SkyBar was very good and "vegas affordable". It is a short walk to the Monte Carlo's food court if you are looking for something on the cheaper side. As far as entertainment goes we had a great night our last night in town thanks to the concierge at the Aria. I went down to talk to her when my wife was resting in the room and said I would like to take my wife to dinner and a show that night to celebrate our anniversary that had actually occured several months prior. I explained that I work in an industry that doesn't allow us to do much for our anniversary due to me being so busy. She got us a reservation at Jean Georges Steak House (at the Aria) and discounted tickets to Viva Elvis (also at the Aria). Our dinner was amazing. The staff was beyond helpful and even gave us a free desert for our anniversary which we had not even mentioned. Many dollars lighter in the pocket and pounds heavier in the belly we headed for our show. Once there we were again upgraded to a better seat. We loved the show and I am not even a huge Elvis fan. It was truly a great night. Without a doubt I would and have recommended the Aria to any and everyone I meet.

Reviews.Title: “You will LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BB85Canada
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in quite a few different properties on the Strip in Las Vegas, I did not expect to be as awed as I was by the Aria. No detail has been spared on every aspect of this beautiful hotel. I found myself randomly reaching out to touch a wall, a pillar, an upholstered surface, just to see what material was used to make it as spectacular as it is. The rooms are amazing, even the basic deluxe will wow you. Upon entering your room, you will be greeted by the blackout drapes gliding open to reveal (in our case) a view of the pool, the Tv will come on, the lights will turn on and the AC will start. All of these features are controlled from a single control panel box by the bed, very handy, no more searching in the bedsheets for the TV remote or having to get up in the middle of the night to crank the AC when you underestimate the Vegas heat. You can even push a button by the bed entitled "Goodnight" which will slowly dim the lights to off in the room after you have crawled under the covers. This is a handy feature for childish people like my spouse and I who find it funny to shut all the room lights off when someone is busy brushing their teeth in the bathroom when they are least expecting it. The concierge is very helpful, and thankfully there were usually at least 3 of them behind the desk most of the time when we were there, although there was usually still a line-up. Even while waiting in line, there is a person who just stands there waiting to ask everyone in line if they can help them with something or answer a question to hopefully prevent you from having to stay in line. This happened when we were waiting in the concierge line to print our boarding passes and were directed to an open kiosk nobody knew about. There was a long line-up to check out Sunday am, but every spot at the desk was staffed so this was just a result of so many people being at this fantastic hotel. It is worth a line-up, nobody was even mad that they had to wait in line because there was ample service available. My only criticism would be that some of the "guards" at the guest elevators were not so friendly, but this tended to be the exception to the rule. You must have a dessert at Jean Phillippe Patisserie, there is a reason for the line-up there. The pools are great, lots of chairs, get there early to get a good chair and umbrella before it gets packed. I can hardly wait to go back to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Innovative Technology, sleek, and modern”
Reviews.Author: MrsBigNuts
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for a conference and stayed here for 2 nights. Decent prices for a brand new hotel. $200 per night in June. LOCATION: Great central location, near Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, MGM, and its part of City Center. But, we got lost trying to find this place. So here's a tip. Stay on Las Vegas Blvd towards Mandalay Bay. It is NOT Harmon Ave. The entrance will be a drive way that turns into a ramp on your right. Large lobby. There appears to be 2 lobbies to check in. We just went to the one on the right. Covered/air conditioned area to wait while valet gets your car. SERVICE: Good service. Check-in was fairly quick. Although, valet did take a awhile to get our car the first time,but they did apologize, and were quick the next 2 times. They have someone standing in front of the guest elevators that check if you have a hotel card. I think it's only when you have baggage or random. Who knows. Check out line was long as anywhere in Vegas is. They did try to charge us for knocking a bag of chips over, SO CHECK YOUR BILL BEFORE YOU PAY! The food/drink items are weight sensitive. He took our word for it and did not charge us, no questions asked. HOTEL/ROOM: Beautiful waterfal cascading along the wall of the hotel. Innovative technology where the lights, curtains, tv, etc which are regulated are on a touch pad! So COOL! Toilet has a door, so someone can be using the vanity area while u do your business in privacy. Modern, clean. Long walk to room though from elevator. Great bakery with long lines downstairs. Hotel connects to Crystals Mall/Tram to Bellagio/Vdara/Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rockeyb
Reviews.Content: Cannot believe anyone could be negative about Aria, loved everything about it. The entrance is just stunning, modern and the smell of vanilla is gorgeous. The room was spacious and immaculate and housekeeping kept it spotless. Had no problem sleeping as the bed was ultra comfortable. Only small moan I had was where the plug socket was, my hairdryer and ghd's cable did not reach where the mirror was. There was a large picture between the wardrobes which would have been perfect for a mirror. Only a few minutes walk from the strip, plenty to look at on the way. Absolutely loved the pool area and the layout of the three very different pools and the small spa pools. Always plenty of loungers available at the pools. The only restaurant we ate in at Aria was the Thai, Lemongrass. Some of the best Thai food I have tasted and the service was superb. We ate there 3 times during our stay. I will be booking Aria for my next Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travillinguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria for 5 nights, upon check in we received a king room (we booked a 2xQueen room with a travel agent so not Aria's fault), so Aria provided us with a rollaway bed complimentary before moving us the next day to another room even though they were fully booked over this weekend. The pool area is very nice and the gym well equipped. The food is a little on the expensive side for what it is - the Buffet is approx $40 for dinner but other hotels have them for $20?! There's a free tram between Aria, Vdara/Bellagio and Monte Carlo which is convenient considering it's so hot outside - beats walking! The atmosphere in the casino seemed a lot better than other casino's we went to while here - just a different style/class of people compared to the trash you get in some casinos on the strip. The room was great size, our friends stayed at MGM over the same weekend and when they visited our room they were really impressed with our room over there's! Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: manda1405
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in July and loved this beautiful resort. Arriving around 3pm we expected long queues (as previous posters have reported) to check in. We were pleased however to find no lines and were able to check in immedietely. We checked into a mountain view deluxe king room on the 29th floor and upon entering the room found the view to be spectacular, incorporating views of both the mountains and also of the strip through the floor to ceiling windows. The room "greeted" us by automatically opening the curtains and playing music from the 42inch plasma tv...very special! The room was perfectly presented and spotlessly clean. Bed and linens very comfortable. Bathroom had a spa feel to it with marble twin sinks and seperate shower and soaking bath. Everything down to the smallest detail was of the highest quality. The room can be easily controlled from a tablet at the bedside and via the tv allowing guests to open/close curtains, alter temperature of room and request privacy or housekeeping when required. Room service was reasonably priced, presented well and delivered promptly. There are many restaurants within the resort and range from the expensive to the reasonably priced therefore catering for many. Swimming pool areas are clean and well presented with lots of loungers available. Aria Casino is clean and smoke free with lots on offer catering for all types of gambler ranging frtom $1 slots to high roller rooms. Aria is located within the City Centre complex and the Strip can be easily, and relatively quickly reached via the free tram which will take you to either Crystals shopping centre, Monte Carlo or The Bellagio. Check out was quick and easy utilising the service via the tv. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: seattledude01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for three nights in July, 2011. Even for Vegas standards, this hotel blew me away. It is ultra-modern, sleek, hip, you name it. The rooms are amazing and fully-automated. Please ignore the negative reviews, and trust me - this hotel is worth it and more!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TECHNOLOGY”
Reviews.Author: Mililani
Reviews.Content: This hotel is almost futuristic - everything is electronic----drapes, TV, lighting, stero, clock. The Bathroom is huge and is like a glass bathroon. Beds were great and very comfeeeee. Not to mention the views - we saw the South end of the Strip, but it was really cool, especially at night. Restaurants were great===especially the buffets. We attended a Wedding there so we has absolutely wonderous food{{{yummo}}}. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here my next trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kmonimac
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, nothing but world class sevice was rendered. I entered the room and the blinds were timed to open to greet me. The room was PERFECT!!! I love interactive and you could access pretty much evrything from a small console on the night stand table. The room was immaculate (I am a germ-a-phobe) and housekeeping could not have been better. I was on the 18th floor and had a nice view of the strip. The restuarants located throughout the hotel were lovely as well even The Buffet (I SOOOOOOOOOOOO do not like buffets). The amenities provided were natural and that is always a plus. I did not use room service or indulge in the in-room bar, but the selection was broad. The hotel is centrally located offering easy access to "The Strip". I would defintely recommend this hotel and I am planning to revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hotel, will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Connoisseur143
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so grand, it took my breath away. Right from arriving at the hotel, the entrance had a gorgeous water fall type wall and the lobby was large and well lit. The service was fantastic and the restaurants were plenty. Each restaurant had a different type of cuisine and really captured the authentic flavors. The casino had great gambling options and my favorite part was the exquisite room with all of the high-tech features. I was able to set wake-up calls by having the curtains and sheers open, I was able to dim the lights from the tv, and set the temperature without getting out of bed. Everything was very grand about the hotel and I would definitely return. However, for those of you skeptics, there are a couple downsides which aren't major concerns but I thought I'd address them as we all like to know every detail we can. So, the casino games are more expensive than other hotels, even in comparison to other high-end reputable properties as well, the hotel is technically on the strip, however it is quite a trek to get back onto the strip as the entrance is located deep into the streets of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Already booked another stay here”
Reviews.Author: onygo12
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Aria. The hi-tech rooms are beautiful & most comfortable. The staff throughout the hotel were all extremely friendly and helpful; the pool area is beautiful...definitely a winning combination

Reviews.Title: “So cool!”
Reviews.Author: joanne777
Reviews.Content: group of 18 of us stayed here for a 40 th birthday celebration. The front desk was extremely efficient and helpful keeping our rooms close to each other. I liked the vibe and the smell of the place despite what others have said. The spa is amazing love the lap pool outdoors that overlooks the strip. I think you need. A spa service or pass to use it. rooms are great spacious and quiet. Definitely recommend this hotel and casino.

Reviews.Title: “World class hotel”
Reviews.Author: moemoe182
Reviews.Content: At first when we read some of the negative reviews about Aria, we weren't sure what to expect. But, two friends of mine recommended Aria, so we decided to give it a chance and we are glad we did... When you first walk into the hotel it smells like vanilla; my mom and I loved the smell, it is way better than smelling stale cigarette smoke all day. The room was very fancy and more importantly very clean. granite counter tops everywhere, marble all over the bathroom. The bed was very fluffy & comfortable, it was like sleeping on a cloud. The high tech tablet in the room was easy to use. Some reviews said you can hear the discotech from the cosmopolitan at night if your room is facing it- I faintly heard it but my mom didn't, but I found a solution to block the noise. I just turned the a/c fan on high and you won't here any noise from outside :-) We went to the buffet for breakfast, and it was great. Huge selection of food, something for everyone... We are slot machine people, and I did not expect to win anything at Aria (because it is a high end resort/casino) but i won 500$ there, very good casino. We went to Harrah's casino and they didn't give us anything... Aria is in a good location, in the middle of the strip. The only negative thing I can think of was on our second night stay the housekeeper forgot to give us soap/shampoo, so i contacted customer service and within 2 minutes it arrived and fixed the issue. That's service! What we were most impressed about was the excellent customer service at Aria. All off the staff went out of their way to greet you everyday, and see if they could do anything for you. I would definitely stay again & recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “House Keeping really lets this hotel down”
Reviews.Author: FournierTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December 2010 and thought the hotel was so nice I booked again for our 25th anniversary. We left early one morning to go on some excursions and when we came back at 4:30 our room haden't been done. We had a nap and left the room at 6:30 but this time I made sure to turn the service sign on. Came back at 11:30 only to find the room still hadn't been done. They offered to do the room but we were tired and needed to go to sleep. The next morning we went to the pool early so they would have time to do the room for us to get ready for our wedding vows booking. Came back at 11:30 and of course the room still hadn't been done! I called to complain and was told a supervisor would call. She called 15min later and had no clue what she was calling about! I can't believe the staff didn't even fill her in on the issue. At this point we were in the middle of getting ready for our wedding so I said I didn't want to see anybody. The next thing we know they are repeatededly knocking on the door. When I turned on the Privacy sign the phone started ringing again.... The hotel is beautiful and everything else was great. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Already Planning our Next Trip!”
Reviews.Author: fnkybee77
Reviews.Content: The Aria is all about luxury and feeling spoiled. From the moment you walk in to the hotel lobby you smell an aroma of vanilla and are greeted by smiling faces. There was a little line for check in but we were quickly lead to an available line. We didn't wait longer than 5 minutes to check in and this is right at 4:00 when you would think check in would be busy. Check in was fast and easy. We headed up to our room and we when we entered our room we were blown away. We were on the 23rd floor and the view was amazing. The room was very clean and modern. As I was putting our things away I noticed our bathroom didn't have a hairdryer. I called down to the front desk and the lady was very helpful, she had me look in a couple of different places to ensure I just wasn't missing it. When there was no hairdryer to be found she sincerely apologized and said one would be right up. 10 minutes later there was a knock on the door and I was greeted by name with a hairdryer on a tray. This is just the first in a long list of Excellent Service. Let's talk the bed...Hands down the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on while on vacation in any hotel. You didn't want to get out of it in the morning! The hotel itself is pure beauty. You notice all the lines of the designs, the different textures, the smell, everything is top notch from the linens to the customer service. The casino was fabulous and clean. All of the dealers were amazing along with the pit bosses. It was late in the day one evening and we were looking for a $10 blackjack table and all were full. We asked the pit boss if there were any others in case we missed a table and there was not so he allowed us to sit at an empty $15 table and play for $10. I was very impressed! Even after the table started filling up I was allowed to continue to play $10. Food..Everywhere we ate was amazing. We hit up the buffet one afternoon and everything I put on my plate was delicious. I was sad when I became full because the food was so good. We also ate at Sirio for dinner one evening. It is the Taste of Tuscany. I picked a Ravioli dish and I have to say it was the best Italian pasta I have ever had. It was divine, along with the service and atmosphere. The Aria is connected via tram (which is free) to the Monte Carlo (which you can just walk to), Bellagio, Crystals and Vdara. We took the tram many times back and forth to the Bellagio. Excellent. When ever we left to explore other casinos on the strip we couldn't wait to get back to "our home" for the week because no other casino/hotel compared. My overall review of the Aria is it is absolutely amazing and we cannot wait to return. This was our 2nd trip to Vegas, the first being 5 years ago and we stayed at the Venetian. Before our trip this time was over we were already making plans to come back to the Aria and hoping to make it an every 6 month trip. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! I would also recommend booking through the hotel site. I looked on every travel site there is and their site was the only one that offered non stop flights AND it had the best package prices!!! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Aria!”
Reviews.Author: sanderson_72
Reviews.Content: Beautifully designed, and ideal location on the strip. The spa, gym and pool are wonderful, and I enjoy the fresh vanilla air throughout the casino...not like one of those bad air fresheners trying to cover up the smoke! I've stayed here twice, and would stay again, seems to draw a solid 30-something crowd...also the beds are amazing, i want one at home!

Reviews.Title: “What a Treat”
Reviews.Author: MrB1966
Reviews.Content: A fantastic place to stay. luxurious, indulgent and class all at once, with simply the BEST SHOW ever in Viva Elvis by Cirque du Soliel.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TripComment
Reviews.Content: Perfect !!!! Modern Hotel, just located on the middle of the strip. Pool Area is great but drinks are expensive by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and easy elevator access from casino!”
Reviews.Author: travelnut27
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about how far the hotel elevators would be from the casino floor area because of how large the place is. Everything was great! The rooms have all the high tech features like the Wynn and Palazzo. The only complaint I have is no coffee makers! That goes for most hotels in Vegas though from what I've read.

Reviews.Title: “Very big and very nice”
Reviews.Author: FMeister
Reviews.Content: The Aria is like a little city, similar to some of the other major Las Vegas hotels, but that didn't seem to affect the service we received, which was excellent. Room was spacious, nice and clean with a good view. Everybody was friendly and service was prompt. When we had a question, the response was quick and effective. I cabbed in from the airport and we took a taxi back to pick up our rental for some touring in Utah. Glad I did, because traffic on the strip was scary and I would probably still be trying to find the parking facility. We got a package with Viva Elvis (Cirque), which made it a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Aria is amazing”
Reviews.Author: SunCity97
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and very high tech. You control lots of features in your room with the TV remote. Bed was very comfortable. Towels were lush. It was a great experience

Reviews.Title: “Experience Vegas in modern style.”
Reviews.Author: SimonLiebel
Reviews.Content: Aria is fantastic for the young party and fun seekers. It has everything you need in terms of bars restaurants, clubs and gambling. The rooms are spectacular and with everything in the room controlled by remote, it's technology at it's best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: beachlover839
Reviews.Content: Aria was great. Our room wasn't ready when we got there so we went to eat. An hour later it still wasn't ready so right away they upgraded us from a city view corner suite to a panoramic corner suite. We got to the room and I found a dirty comforter and immediately called the front desk. Immediately they put me on with a manager who moved me 5 floors up to another panoramic suite and sent the housekeeping manager in personally to inspect the new room. Not only that but for our trouble they gave us 100 dollars to use for food and drinks. The room was always cleaned and the food there is awesome. The breakfast buffet has great french toast and fresh fruit and the casino was generous.

Reviews.Title: “BEST TIME EVER - And it smells GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: WPG_WHALE
Reviews.Content: State of the art rooms, great casino, great fun!!!! Message me with any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Second time back to Aria”
Reviews.Author: pschmeda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Las Vegas around 3 times a year. out of our last 3 trips, we have stayed at Aria twice. We get a corner suite and just love the room layout. Rooms are clean and room service is yum with friendly employees. The casino is nice. The restaurants are fantastic and the spa is wonderful! Aria is in a great location if you want to get out and about. We pretty much don't stray far from the area since everything we need is right there; Aria, Caesars, Bellagio, Mirage, etc. We will definitely stay at Aria again. We do always look for email special room rates before booking and jump on the specials. Great deals for a great hotel resort!

Reviews.Title: “expensive”
Reviews.Author: haulndan
Reviews.Content: loved the hotel room and the service was great but I found the food and drinks to be very expensive. We would take the ped way and eat at the monti carlo. the aria has no cafe when your looking for just bacon and eggs or a small salad. Pool area was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Deluxe”
Reviews.Author: moxie-senior
Reviews.Content: From the moment our taxi pulled up to the front of the Aria we felt a calm, comtemporary openness. The only thing lacking at 9:15 am was a doorman to assist 3 women with baggage. But not a problem we're quite able to open doors. My two adult daughters and myself decided to take a girl's trip to Vegas and our hotel choice was the Aria at City Center. It is a magnificant comtemporary complex of hotels and shopping and convenient to one another. As we entered the lobby we immediately got the artistic feel of the complex. Beautiful artwork and sculpture all around. The decor is simple yet elegant. The feel is airy and it appears that the outside comes into the building. Everyone was so courteous and helpful...since we had arrived so early in the day they held our luggage for us and notified us with a text when our room was ready. The rooms are once again very contemporary but lovely...too many amenities to list...you even have the convenience of closing the drapery, turning off all lights, setting alarm...anything you want from a small control panel by your bed and the rooms are very quiet. We had requested a high floor and a city view...it was awesome...we had a view of the mountains, planes taking off in the distance and a great view of the strip. The room temperature was always just how we wanted it and the bedding and linens were awesome!!! In fact I plan to buy some in the near future. We enjoyed the pool area...easy access and lots of attendants to assist you. The Spa was wonderful...very relaxing and enjoyable and we also utilized the fitness center every morning...once again attendants to assist you and it was very well equipped. We ate at several of the eating establishments and all our food was delicious...a little pricy...but always good. The casino was fine...but not one of our favorites...seemed a little "cold"....we never felt excited to be there and it always seemed dark and subdued compared to several others that we've visited. Overall it was a very enjoyable stay and we would definitely go back...hope you enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: GaCare
Reviews.Content: This is my new Vegas favorite. It is top notch all the way. We stayed in a corner suite with the bet views of Vegas. Everything is automated with a little ipad type thing sitting next to your bed. You can control the door, the curtains, the TV, the temperature, the lights all while sitting in your bed. It is beautiful and clean and the customer service is incredible. I HIGHLY recommend the Aria!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: menlodesigns
Reviews.Content: The room was the normal room...no upgrades. It was truly outstanding and memorable. Extremely comfortable beds. The hotel design and casino area were modern and sterile. Highly recommended for those who want a place to crash and do not care much about design. The 5-star rating is for the room and not for the ambiance of the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest Experience!”
Reviews.Author: leeware1969
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I take a yearly trip to various spots and this year was Vegas. I chose the Aria based upon my research and looked forward to seeing the property in person. When I arrived I was first impressed by the aroma that is pervasive throughout the property. It was wonderful and smelled of vanilla, therefore we did not smell and cigarette or cigar odor. Upon opening the door of my room, the curtains parted and a lovely instrumental played on the television to welcome me. The room was well appointed with a well stocked mini-bar with snacks available. The bathroom was beautiful with a sunken tub and a roman shower on one side and an enclosed toilet on the other for privacy. I adore Vegas and this property, by far was the most beautiful. I am already planning my return trip! The pool (although it does not open until 9AM) looks like a private oasis tucked away. I had a hard time remembering that I was in a city and not on an island. Of course, it is Vegas so there are many restaurants and shops to navigate to. Again...loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Cool new hotel, loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: imathew48
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas several time and typically stay at Wynn, this time my wife and I decided to check out Aria. The hotel was great, lavish, extravagant, you have everything you need in here and most likely won't step out of the casino. The rooms are very contemprorary with latest technologies and its very spacious. The staff was friendly espcially the cleaning crew. Only issue I had was with the "The Buffet" restaurant, it was very mediocre, nothing spectacular. Since I had received vouchers for two days we forced ourselves to eat lunch at this place otherwise I most likely will not revisit. The food is bland, the sushi's are cheap...its something you would expect at Reno or Atlantic City. Several other restaurants that were good was one the spanish tapas and as the french pastry (i can't recall their names). Special thanks to Keri at Deuce lounge for spectacular service and Sol at the Blackjack table, this guy was an amazing dealer, he was so into his job, most of the other dealers looked frightening, not welcoming at all, maybe because they are being overworked, however Sol was very positive and taught us the game patiently.

Reviews.Title: “immaculate design”
Reviews.Author: jchepak
Reviews.Content: Aria in my opinion is the best hotel on the strip. The design of the hotel is absolutely breathtaking, from modern decor to tiny details to the water fountain wall outside to incredible rooms with stunning views. I stayed at this hotel for 6 days for work and leisure. Our company had a conference at the hotel and the business center is wonderful as well. I was VERY impressed with the room, especially automated features to turn on/off the lights, open/close curtains, TV, mood lighting, radio, etc - everything is done through your TV or digital screen on your night stand. The bed are absolutely heavenly - linens are luxurious, feels as if you're sleeping in a cloud. In addition, the casino is not smokey at all, in fact, it smells very nice and fresh throughout the entire property. They must have a state of the art ventilation system in place. Yes the price is steep, but oh so worth it! Aria is BY FAR a great addition to The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Lord_of_Canterbury
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for a conference. My standard room was very large, modern, and clean. Loved all the high tech touches, including the large LCD TV. Great bathroom and comfortable bed. Fantastic room! The conference center was nothing special, but did overlook the pool area which was nice. The gym was huge and filled with all the latest equipment (used it every day). The pool area was very nice and filled with comfortable furniture (pool service was so-so). The food inside the hotel was good and the service was fine (I'm low maintenance). Its slightly off Las Vegas Blvd, so its a decent distance to the strip, not the best spot if you plan to walk to other places. More of a destination hotel. The mall next door is great for window shopping, but I did not see anyone actually buying anything from Tom Ford or Louis Vuitton the days I walked by.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: AgileTexan
Reviews.Content: I wasn't going to write this review, but I got a letter from Aria, and decided to sit down to write. I went to Vegas for a conference at the end of June. First, check in took 45 minutes. Some folks said they waited an hour and a half. Our room was nice, but not large and no view. There weren't any upgrades available at check-in. My friend has a breathing machine, and there are no electrical outlets except two at the desk. We had to get two extension cords to plug in her machine and reach the bed - very poor engineering/planning. Would have preferred electrical outlets on the nightstand to all the fancy lighting controls. Next, the first night we left a few small cash tickets and our unused drink coupons on the dresser. They were gone the next morning. Maybe housekeeping thought they were a tip? I never tip till the last day, and I've never had anything taken like that. Next, the last night I went to check out so we could avoid the lines the next morning. There was $80 worth of mini-bar charges on my bill that I had to argue to get removed (housekeeping?). A couple walked up next to me. They had just been checked in and when they got to their room, someone was sleeping in the bed. Finally, I got a letter informing me that some guests during the time I was there contracted legionnaire's disease from a problem with the water supply to certain parts of the building. Fortunately, I have not been ill.

Reviews.Title: “Big Slick Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: Hennipenny
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Aria Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas. Usually we stay at Bellagio or Mirage but wanted to try something different. The Hotel is very modern and has the lastest of everything. The rooms are large and they say they have received many "green" awards for their hotel. Drapes and sheers are button operated and interactive tv is quite something. The bathroom is very nice and has a separate toilet area and a separate combination shower/bath area. Beds are very comfortable and linens/towels are top quality. If you like cutting edge and don't mind walking alot, this is a great hotel. We find that we like Bellagio because it is a warmer feel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed EVER!”
Reviews.Author: JofromWales
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in May and overall I was pleased with Aria. I had booked this with Low Cost Usa for a good price which INCLUDED the resort fee so I was a happy bunny! I checked in about 10am on a Sunday morning and was able to get to my room right away. However the room had not been cleaned properly so back down to Reception I go and this time they "upgraded" me to a City View room. I am glad that I did not pay for this upgrade as all you could see was the side of the Monte Carlo and a bit of MGM Grand opposite. Room was lovely, fab bathroom with large shower and tub combo, plenty of storage space, lovely flat screen tv with plenty of channels available and without a doubt the best bed I have ever slept in. If I could have flown home with it I would!!!! Maid service was spot-on every day, leaving me plenty of extra soap, shampoo etc etc. I did leave a daily tip though as I think those ladies work damn hard. All the staff I encountered were friendly, and I had great service from the cocktail waitress on the casino floor. Plenty of 1c and 2c slots to choose from and I had a great time trying them all out. Lots of luck on American Idol and Sex and the City games though. Dorothy obviously has no time for the Welsh as she hated me each and every time. Pool was lovely with plenty of chairs available both in the sun and shade. Very tasty (and pricey) cocktails were consumed but what the heck....its Vegas. Music is played around the pool but it was at a decent volume and did not disturb me. Saw Viva Elvis whilst I was there and so enjoyed it. It was my first Cirque show so had no idea what to expect, but the acrobats and the dance sequences were fab!! The only negative I had with Aria was the location. I did know where Aria was but did not realise it was set so far back from The Strip. They did not make it easy for you to just leave the hotel and pop accross to another. Trying to get accross to PH for example was a nightmare. The tram to Bellagio was useful, but a bit of a walk. Having come from the Flamingo when you just fall out of the hotel onto the strip, this was a bit of a shock. Overall, a lovely hotel with great rooms and service. Not sure if I would come back purely due to the location.....but maybe if the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Vegas Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: S T
Reviews.Content: Great Restaurants, Shopping, Spa, Gambling and Rooms! So far, this is my favorite resort as I am a big fan of Vegas. This is my fourth stay here since they opened their doors. I've stayed at other properties(Wynn, Ventian, NYNY etc).

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to like this place, but...”
Reviews.Author: trvln_foodie
Reviews.Content: the staff here was so poorly managed. they seemed confused. the front desk kind of rude. i dunno. this place was really pretty though...hmmm and that's all the positives i have to say. look this is what happened and believe me, this was certainly brought up with management: 1. we got here during memorial weekend..and i KNOW. its busy. but don't get snippy with your guests when you've made 12 of your guests (3 rooms) wait three hours to get to their rooms. 2. missing luggage....3 out of the 12 girls had their luggage missing or misplaced or delayed upon after getting into our room. 1-3 hour additional wait. 3. please fix the clogged sink ASAP, and don't wait till the next day to resolve this. 4. please get the room keys right the first time. it sucks to go back ALL the way to reception to get it fixed. 5. please get enough housekeeping to get the rooms cleaned so people can get into their rooms in time. i went back to my room and lo and behold, the housekeeper was in my room trying to finish up quick. it was 3pm when i got back to my room (we left the room at 10am to start our day) and surely 6 hours would have been plenty of time to get the room fixed up by then. i was so tired, i asked the housekeeper to work around me. she told me she had to double up on rooms because there wasn't enough help to go around. i felt sorry for her, but HELLO?! Aria, hire more folks when you know your entire resort is booked! anyways, like i said before...we brought this up with management. we were offered drink coupons galore...so many in fact that we couldn't finish them all between 12 bachelorettes. plus we were compt for our troubles, which essentially paid for our 12 guest dinner at their restaurant Lemongrass. so overall, 2 stars for prettiness and being compt. but thats it. sorry, aria.

Reviews.Title: “Sense-sational”
Reviews.Author: luvgraphix
Reviews.Content: Very modern design and attention to detail. Friendly staff. Smells fresh! The rooms are classy with comfortable beds. The dinner buffet includes lobster and a glass of wine. Good food all day long. Crystals is next door and is artistically designed. There you'll find the Tram station offering free transportation between select hotels. It's as good as the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: fivestarhedonist
Reviews.Content: Being frequent vacationers to Las Vegas, my wife and I do our best to experience many of the hotels along the strip. For the past few years, there has been only a few hotels that always exceeded our expectations...that is...until we stayed at Aria this past July! Aria is unquestionably our new favorite and here is why: It's location is great, as City Center is just that...in the center of the city. No matter where we wanted to go, we always felt like we were very close already. The rooms were extremely comfortable and very well appointed...all the way down to the higher thread count sheets and the automatic drapes. The architectural openness of the lobby and main floor don't give you that "cramped" feeling that so many of the other casinos do. The air never weighed heavy with smoke; as a matter of fact-it held an essence of vanilla. We dined at Cafe Vetto for breakfast and enjoyed the Italian delights at Sirio for dinner one evening--both were very nice. Without a doubt, the pool area at Aria was a change of pace from the typical big pool scenes in Vegas, as it is comprised by 3 pools that are cleverly hidden from each other with well placed plants and shrubs. This creates a bit more of a secluded feeling, even though the atmosphere was very active. The service staff seemed to sense when we were out of our room, as it was always refreshed upon our arrivals throughout the day. To the gamblers out there, you will not be disappointed, as there is a great selection of table games and slots, along with a room reserved for poker tournaments. If you're headed to Vegas and you are looking for a top-shelf experience...Aria is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, location and atmosphere mediocre”
Reviews.Author: vacationtraveller_10
Reviews.Content: The rooms were big and well appointed, though the intelligent lighting system had a mind of its own. But, the casino and other common areas lacked much interest or atmosphere. Spa is nice. If you're walking north on the strip, you need to go through the upscale mall which is not really direct route and gets old after a few times. Front desk staff was not terribly friendly or helpful - check in took at least 10 minutes. We won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Posh and contemporary”
Reviews.Author: Norie
Reviews.Content: Posh and contemporary. Very modern yet elegant decor and appointments. Electronic control of drapes, tv, lights, etc. I won't recommend it if you have small kids and are planning to use the pool. Not quite family friendly. High end shopping access. Awesome buffet. One of my Vegas favorites. They make fresh Nan bread on site among other things you don't see in other buffet restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “First Time In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: golfgod1956
Reviews.Content: Sad to say, but I am 55 yrs old and this was our first trip to Vegas. I can't say enough about the Aria and all of the people who are part of their hotel. This started with the great Valets, The Check in Desk, and Business Center. In fact, I spoke to a young guy in the business center about his job and he was so proud of his job and company and had a plan for his career. I guess I always though working at resorts was only a stopping point, but this kid was stoked about the future. We had an upgraded room and it was great. Really no complaints and absolutely loved the fact that there was no casino at the Aria. I was not a big fan of the location at City Center only due to the very long walk anywhere you wated to go, and at night, I don't think many people woudl consider it a relaxing stroll, feels more like going down a back alley. But , i guess that is what cabs are for and it does connect into the Bellagio and you can go that route. We did see "Jersey Boys" down the street and had a great time. Vegas was even good enough to keep some of my money.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: cindy5o4
Reviews.Content: Service: all staff were friendly. I was charged a welcome amenity but they adjusted immediately. Valet staff started a friendly conversation with us while we were waiting for the cab. Made us feel at home. I required a smoking room, but was not available on first night. Front desk said they would move us on 2nd night. When I call back to confirm, another agent said they were fully committed. Room Service: Expect to wait at least 1 hour each time you order. We had room service twice and both times it took 1 hour to get to our room. THE BUFFET restaurant: Lamb had gamey taste, almost like spoiled meat. Alaskan King Crab Leg wasn't fresh. Prime Rib of Beef was not tender. I paid $35-40 per person for the buffet. This is considered cheap in the hospitality industry. High End buffets typically cost $60-$65 per person. Corner Suite: Brochure mentions room was 920 sq. ft. Suite looked nothing like the photo on their brochure. Room seemed small. Did not use their fancy remote that controls the entire room. Easy to use, but the touch screen made it difficult. Had to press screen really hard. The normal remote for TV doesn't work either. RECOMMENDATION: all the restaurants on the Strip will charge high prices. Don't expect to get what you pay for. The best meal I had was from In-and-out burger...$5. I recommend going away from the strip...try downtown area. We had cab also take us 15 minutes away from the strip to this Dim Sum place (Orchid Gardens) and their Crab meat was more fresh than THE BUFFET in Aria. Room accommodations are average. There was nothing unique in the rooms except the blinds can be open/closed with remote. However, service was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “It's Beautiful...”
Reviews.Author: Emsasnyder
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. I've stayed at MGM, Paris, and now Aria within the last 6 months. Aria would be my favorite. The rooms are pretty cool. You are able to control everything with a keypad beside your bed. The thermostat, radio, alarm clock, tv, and I believe you could also open your window treatments. Only one caution about the room...the water. Don't drink it. You could barely rinse your mouth after you brused your teeth. I received a notification a few hotel guests had contracted legionaires disease about a week after my stay. No joke. Also be aware of all of the mandatory room charges...I believe it was around $18-22 per day. This included a free paper (you had to go get.), access to the gym (regardless if you use it) and I believe use of the business center. So just because you might be getting a good internet rate...beware. Go and enjoy the Vegas experience...but don't forget your on the Strip. Its very expensive. There is no such thing as the $5.99 buffet anymore. Ok...maybe there is...but not at this hotel. A frozen drink at the pool was a little more than $19 without tip...yes, I had more than one. A sandwich, fried, and diet coke was around $23. w/o tip. Just keep this in mind when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: BiserDimitrov
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is top class! Bars, restaurants, the apartments, the pool! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business or just for fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: protech1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria as part of a week long business trip. Upgraded to a suite on arrival - worth asking for best rates on arrival. Fabulous room with great views, large size bed and bathrooms and well equipped. Huge choice of restaurants - we chose Sirio and Vettro - both amazing with huge portions so think about sharing. Pool areas are superb but busy. Spa is extraordinary and is a must do. Great shopping too and of course the casino - great people watching. Overall great choice and good location in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Friskie_11
Reviews.Content: wow, wow, wow. Thats the best I can do to start :) everything from the top down was perfect. We arrived at 7:00 friday, there were a lot of people in line but we were through the whole thing in under 20 min. A little piece of advice,... tips at the front desk can go a long way......... :) Room was beautiful, way larger than the other "standard" rooms in vegas. We did not feel crampt at all. I would stay again in the standard room without hesitation. It was clean, lots of towels/amenities, housecoats.. AND THE MOST INSANELY COMFY BED EVER!!!!! The casino is really nice, the table limits are high but thats to be expected for the main strip on the weekend. We ate at the sushi restaurant Barmasa the first night, it was awesome as well. too expensive for what you get, but deliouces all the same. $10-15 per peice of sushi is crazy. Also ate at American Fish, what an amazing diner. the service was un-toppable. All the bars were nice and the drinks perfect. The pools were perfect! there is some concer witht he shaloow pools that the hot sun will heat them, but not here! the pool was the perfect refreshing cool all day. The service at the poolside was awesome. We were never without all day. We checked out the Liquid but deceided that the 100 per chair was a litte high for what was happening. It was dead in there and quite small. We opted for pool three. you still go the music from Liquid all day so it was awesome. Its obvious that the desiogn was intended to keep the kids around pool 1 and it works perfectly. We had a wonderful day poolside. I really do not have single bad thing to say. THis was our 6th trip to Vegas in the past 2 years and it ranks as the best so far. Thansk Aria!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Medicore stay followed by notification of Legionaires' Disease”
Reviews.Author: Brownpillow
Reviews.Content: After what can only be descriped as medic ore stay except for check in which seems Chronically plaques by long lines ( this was my third stay), I received a letter informing me I may have been exposed to Legionaires Disease. See copy here: http://www.arialasvegas.com/facts/ I find it unacceptable that the hotel will not tell guests if their particular room tested for elevated levels of the legionnaire bacteria and that the response to this health crisis was slow, I recieved a letter today over at least week after notification was placed on the hotel's website. Email would have been a quicker way to communicate this important information to guests. My email is on file. Also there has been no apology from the hotel management for the inconvenience and stress this has caused guests. While no systems are perfect, something more should have been done to inform guests in a timely manner. The take away message is if something goes wrong at the Aria don't except the hotel to make it right you.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA is a great hotel. A few minor issues aren't worth removing a star for.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in July with a few friends who had just gotten engaged. The grounds are very nice pulling up in the taxi with some pretty cool art and water features on Aria and City Center grounds. When I first walked in I loved the design and chocolaty decor of lobby, checkin desk, etc. as well as the tall ceilings and very open feel. I was immediately put off however by the extremely heavy vanilla scent they were pumping into the place. Don't get me wrong, I don't really have a problem with adding scent to a hotel like this in order to give it a memorable identity (all the big hotels and resorts do it) but I really have a problem with vanilla. For one, vanilla is a fine line because a lot of people like it, but a lot of people (like me) hate it. Not only that, but it is really overdone and could be severely scaled back and still be quite noticeable. The good news is once you get into the casino area the ventilation really mutes the smell and by the time you are in the room areas up the elevators is is almost non-existent. The staff at checking was extremely nice, so all these reviews about terrible staff are surprising to me. I guess it depends who you deal with. Every single housekeeping, bell, and other staff member literally asked my if I was enjoying my stay for 4 days straight. I found them to be quite welcoming. The rooms are awesome. Upon entering the first time the curtains, lights, etc. all activate automatically via the central control panel. It controls everything in the room including AV, temp lighting, etc. and is very easy to use. The bed had a ridiculous pillow top built in and was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in in my life. The pillows were also great and large.
