One thing I thought was unique was that our friends' room down the hall was the same layout, but the art, wallpaper, and color schemes were different. That's pretty nice attention to detail to give everyone a unique experience. Housekeeping was very good. They roam the halls almost 24/7 and respect the privacy indicator on the door panel. When we set it to "Service" mode, our room was cleaned and refilled while we were out at dinner. No problems at all. We had a view of the main entrance and the driveway out to the strip (Aria is just a small walk off of the actual strip). The view during the day was fine, but at night it was great when everything was lit up. Our room seemed to be a very long distance from the elevators. This is kind of annoying when you're trying to get up and down all day, but actually helpful when trying to go to sleep at 5AM when you get home drunk from the clubs. I didn't go to Aria's nightclub (HAZE) but I would like to next time. The hotel is in a great spot in relation to everything. It is removed from the strip by a small distance (easily walkable in about 10 minutes) but obviously close enough for most people not to care. It is connected to the ultra high-end Crystals mall where I can't afford to buy anything, with stores like Prada, Gucci, Miu Miu, Balenciaga, and other stuff like that, and a complete indoor walk all the way over to Cosmopolitan, then you are at the strip. The casino is very nice, and does not appear to be the focal point of the hotel, which is good. That's not to say it is small or anything, but the layout is actually navigable (unlike most hotels) and the high ceilings and "airy"ness of the whole place makes it very a comfortable atmosphere. It makes you feel like you can stay there for a long time without itching to get out, which I'm sure was the goal. We didn't eat at a ton of the restaurants in this hotel. The Cafe Vettro has great food but if it is busy be ready to wait a while for the food. The little breakfast, lunch, and quick food nooks are great and easy to find. The three main pools are very nice. They were crowded on Saturday, but actually not too crowded to enjoy yourself as you would expect. They also have an adult pool lounge called Liquid, which is actually a "day club" if you will. We had intended on going there, but never got around to it. There are people passing around cards to anyone that looks like they might fit in there, but it does have cover all the time for guys, and ladies get in free with one of the discount cards. I wish I would have tried it but we ran out of time. We also walked through the Spa area, which looked and smelled very nice and relaxing (and quiet, amazingly) but did not have time to try any services. Overall, I thought it was a great hotel. I would most definitely stay there again, if only there weren't so many other damn hotels that I wanted to try. The few negatives (elevator distance, vanilla smell) are not enough for me to remove stars from my review. If you are ultra-sensitive to artificial scents however, watch out. I would recommend this to anyone who is used to staying at normal-class Vegas hotels like TI, MGM, etc. or even middle-upper scale hotels because it will be a great and enjoyable upgrade. I have stayed at Bellagio and Venetian and ARIA compares favorably or better than either of the normal rooms I stayed in in those hotels, but that could be because it's still very new.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: YR18
Reviews.Content: ive never written a review about a hotel before (or anything at all for that matter :) but i had to give credit when it is due. so here goes: Location: in the heart of the new city centre, between the new and stunning cosmopolitan and Vdara. youll walk for maybe 2 minutes out of the hotel and you will be at the very heart of the strip. location is AAA! Check in: a breeze! we arrived to the hotel at around 10am. after a very short wait of maybe 5 minutes, we came up to the counter and the very friendly attendant greeted us, checked us in, gave us a brief overview of the hotel and the amenities and we were on our way. We expected the rooms not to be ready, as we arrived about 5 hours prior to the scheduled check in time (check in is scheduled for 3pm). We were wrong. The hotel had both rooms ready for us, and we simply walked right up and away we went. Rooms: SUPER CLEAN!!! the hotel is brand new, so the rooms are very modern. huge 42 inch flat screen on the wall with a remote that controls everything in the room: lights, blinds, alarm clock and ofcourse, the TV. very user friendly too. The bathroom has double sinks, a large oval tub, a stand up shower and an enclosed toilet. Lots of closet space, floor to ceiling windows and very comfy beds. There is a fridge in the room but it is fully stocked and all the good are on sensors. The hotel charges you for anything you take out of the fridge, weather you used it or not. If you need an empty fridge in the room, they will gladly send one to you room for $25/night. If you require a fridge to store any kind of medicine in it, the hotel will provide you with the fridge at no charge. Casino: this place is awsome. Yes, they happen to take your money, but the atmosphere is great. Its beautiful, and there is not the slightest scent of smoke (and i hate cigarette smell). They probably use fabreze on steroids to keep it smelling that good, but it works! Room Service: Very fast. we ordered room service several time and the wait was never longer then 20 mins for food, less then 10 minutes for towels. The fridge we ordered to our room upon check in, got there about 2 minutes after we made it to the room. Front desk access: never had to wait to speak to someone. Everyone was readily available. Check out: over the phone. very easy. you can actually pull up your final bill on the TV in your room. Hotel amenities: Pools: 2 types. There is Liquid, which is a closed off party pool for adults over 21. Great music playing, great parties, very fun atmosphere. you pay $100/lounge chair but you get $100 credit for food and drinks while youre there. you actually dont have to pay anything if you dont need a lounge chair, but youre gonna want to relax and have a drink and some food anyway, so why not treat yourself? We had an absolutely amazing time there! you must go! The other pools are the general pools, typical 5 star vegas hotel pools. shallow water, mix of different people, young, old, kids, etc. these pools are beautiful as well and are great if you just wanna relax and soak up the sun. cold water fountains are available around the pools as well. Gym - Huge, stocked with everything that you need and more. Buffet - Delicious food, and lots of it. you actually dont feel like your in a buffet. it feels more like youre at a great restaurant and the food just happens to be served buffet style. Other resto's were very good as well, try the cafe for good food served quickly as well. General comments: - hotel is beautiful but huge! youll find that you have to walk about 10 mins from your room to the pool. not a big deal though, as you will be passing by different stores, restaurants, etc. - hotel security will require you to show them your room key anytime you go to your room. its kind of annoying cause you have to fidget and find it, but it shows you that the hotel does not compromise on their guests security. only hotel guests can get up to the room. They can bring anyone they want with them though. - wait for cabs is very short. the hotel will have one ready for you anytime of day or night. - hotel is meticulously maintained. constantly being cleaned, flower arrangements are change frequently, etc. This is a definite 5 star hotel. I would not hesitate to recommend ARIA to anyone looking for a top of the line vegas hotel. Keep in mind, our group of 8 guys are not high rollers by any means. We were there for a bachelor party, hence, we werent the easiest group to deal with, but the hotel was extremely accommodating. STAY HERE IN YOUR NEXT VEGAS TRIP!!!

Reviews.Title: “Aria is great except for the corner room in summer”
Reviews.Author: Phrank45
Reviews.Content: The Aria was an excellent hotel and the amenaties great. Upgraded to a corner king suite which was the best ...except...room was on the west corner of the hotel # 24246 and the AC could not keep up with the heat from the windows. The curtains were closed and the room still reached a temperature of 85 degrees. Not the best place to stay in July! Elevators are located in middle of building so it is a long walk to the room on the end of the building. Use a bellman for the luggage. Loved the hotel and will go back but won't stay on the west side in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aliwishes
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel! Everything is electronic...you can even check out using the TV. I loved the modern room and bathroom design. Rooms were spacious! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cookie Cutter Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Purim
Reviews.Content: I'd say the Aria was a "standard" Vegas luxury hotel. Rooms comparatively small. No undue signs of wear and tear. Technology was disappointing. Remote seemed sluggish. I am sure no one would be disappointed staying here, but nor would anyone be wowed by the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel. HIghly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: amontal
Reviews.Content: we booked 2 nights in Aria Hotel (weekend). it is an excelent hotel. I cannot say a bad word about this hotel and the service. the room is big, clean, everything is controlled automatically, the check in was quick although it was Friday and many people were in line. at the last day we asked for late check out - Aria allow us to stay until 1pm with no extra charge. also we ate at Aria buffet which is excellet as well. we had a charge of 35$ from the mini bar (when you pick up an item and return it back they charge you) but they remove this charge since i was not using the mini bar. in summary - highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: eljay15
Reviews.Content: We pre-booked a no-smoking room and paid extra for city views, We checked in (after waiting in a long queue, only to find we'd been given a smoking room (that really did pong). Back in the queue, given another key, only to find the cleaners still in this room. We waited another 20mins only to discover we didn't have the city views that we'd paid exra for. Back in the queue. Over an hour after we arrived we finally got the room we paid for. Not a great start to our holiday. On the positive side, it was the most comfy bed i've ever lied on in my life.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to stay at.. we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: amanda_9187
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here during the 4 days we were in Vegas. For our first visit, this was a fantastic hotel - lovely decor, ambience and very typical of a hotel on the strip. Our room was amazing! We stayed on the 18th floor. The beds were super comfy, shower pressure excellent and it comfortably fit 3. Our room was always serviced once we got back in the evening and the concierge was very helpful when needed. We did not have enough time to use the Spa & Salon - it was very pricey but all massages and facials sounded very tempting! The buffet had a great price for an all day breakfast but had very long lines and wouldn't have been worth the price with us only eating 1/3 of the value. The Jean Phillippe Patisserie near the main casino was excellent! I recommend. Beautiful pastries, great yoghurt parfait and if only we could have fitted in the dessert crepe! Chocolate truffles also very nice as well. We didn't really dine at the Aria and seemed to enjoy exploring the strip and other eateries instead but the menu's at some of the tapas bars looked devine! To think of some negatives.. it would be the lighting in the room, slightly too dull! and the CHECK IN process took forever & was not very efficient. The man did not explain clearly enough to my friends regarding the $520 holding deposit for the stay, so we had issues with a travellers card. I would definitely come back to stay at this hotel on my next trip :)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it, but expected more.....”
Reviews.Author: sunloverEast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria in June, this was our 3rd visit to Vegas. We travelled with family, their first time in the US, so we wanted to show them a great time in Vegas! The good: The place looks amazing - very impressive outside and in....and the bedrooms are awesome. Very nice decor, and the remote controlled lighting etc is very cool. We celebrated a birthday whilst we were there, and got complimentary chocolate strawberries in the room one day, a very nice touch. Pool area really nice, water stations around each pool, and always able to find a sunlounger. Needs improving: We waited 50 minutes to check in! Service was very slow!!! That was a frustrating start to the visit. We had booked a deal which included complimentary breakfast buffet each day....however, we were told that day 1 buffet was valid for our arrival day (we arrived at 4pm), so impossible to use the breakfast voucher for that day! The pool opened at 9am each day....well, it was meant to. Each morning we had to wait in line to get out to the pool...one of the days, the pool didnt actually open until 9.20am as there were not enough staff around On our 2nd visit to the breakfast buffet, we gave our details and waited in line to be seated....we waited and waited and waited! This was a virtually empty buffet breakfast, but they were totally understaffed! We waited 35minutes to be seated. We complained, and the manager agreed to credit our room for the day so we could get breakfast on day of checkout. Our previous stays in Vegas were at Wynn and Mirage.... whilst Aria is very impressive to look at, we were disappointed with the service..... when we go back to Vegas next year, it will probably be to Wynn. If you can get a good deal, then dont rule this place out.... if they resolve the staffing levels so that there is faster service, it could be great.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of good, but the ugly, is ugly.”
Reviews.Author: PixieGirl_TO
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Canada Day/ Independence Day long weekend The Good – Nice shiny newly built hotel in an incredible location. Rooms are spacious and could comfortably accommodate 3-4. We were only 2 in each room and had plenty of room to spare and they were able to offer us adjoining rooms. The washrooms are well designed to accommodate multiple people at once – one using the washroom, one showering etc… while still maintaining privacy. Beds were unbelievably comfortable. The pool side service and pool itself were also amazing and the servers were so friendly and really looked after us. Hotel food was great with plenty of variety and by hotel standards and even Vegas standards, didn’t seem outrageous. You are in Vegas afterall, so things tend to be on the pricey side, but we didn’t find it outrageous at all. We also liked that you could charge meals and drinks at other MGM hotels to your room. We dined at the Bellagio and just signed it to our room. Breakfast buffet, which was included int he cost of our room, was also amazing and so much variety. Checkin was fine and quick, though the person who took care of us lacked some attention to deal and kept having to ask over & over for spelling of our names, despite having our passports right in front of her. The Ugly – Turns out the room we were assigned hadn’t been turned over from the previous guests and there were food bits all over the sheets. We couldn’t be bothered to move rooms, so they just came up to clean the rooms and we all moved on with our vacation. On our second day, we noticed a discarded condom wrapper on the side of one of our beds. My friend and I know both that wasn’t our party! Gross to say the least. Lastly, the clincher, we just received a letter that the hotel had an outbreak of Legionnaire s Disease. Apparently limited risk, but still. The Bad – Customer service. This is where Aria really falls short and shows just what a young and inexperienced hotel they truly are. To even get a hold of someone in customer service was a challenge and once we did, they were very unsympathetic and didn’t seem bothered by any of our concerns. For our condom wrapper troubles, they offered to credit the room tab $50. When we went to check out and view our charges, we noticed the credit had not been applied from the previous day. Again, we went through the process of chasing someone and long story short, resulted in a further $50 credit. I know from others who have stayed at Aria that customer service was a concern, so it’s up to you on whether to stay. Given the number of other Vegas hotel options, I’m still on the fence on whether to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!!! BUT... Room for improvement..”
Reviews.Author: LLind90157
Reviews.Content: To start out with, let me say this was a free stay offered by them... I don’t even gamble much but it was free, so thank you Aria...3 nights stay.. Extremely nice hotel! Check in was long and our room wasn’t ready until 5pm ( we would have liked to use the pool during the day. Hotel and Casino, Top of its class... When we got to the room there were some noticeable misses. Trust me, I'm not picky either. Housekeeping missed alot. Hair on the bathroom floor, not vacuumed, very obvious, burnt match and Kleenex on the floor (smoking room, I smoke) huge greasy hand prints on the floor to ceiling window ( cleaned it myself so we could enjoy the view), and most of all the furniture looked as it hadn’t been dusted in a while. The furniture is all black so it's extremely noticeable. I bragged about this hotel stay to my girl heavily, so I was a bit embarrassed.. It just looked like housekeeping rushed to get it clean. Room 28078, July 18th (Just in case Aria is reading this).. Other then these few things the room was very nice and modern.. Touch screen at your fingertips, curtains, lights air everything.. Had so much fun playing with it I accidently killed the lights while my lady was showering.. It was funny.. So I have to say our stay was delightful!! 5 gold stars for the terrific bed! Couple of more heads ups. Food is WAY overpriced. I only ate at the property once so I cannot speak to the restaurant/food quality. I will say this though, after a long night we came back to the room. I ordered a cheese burger fries and a chocolate milk... $30.00 and very mediocre at best. I swear on this, 1 1/2 hrs to get delivery! You would think that after 20yrs these mega resorts would have fixed this little glitch. Oh, and at the pool, 45 minutes from the time of ordering to get our drink. These 2 things were my biggest pet peeve. I didn’t want to tip, but couldn’t bring myself to do that. This kind of problem I blame management for. Don’t want to completely bash so let me say. Customer service was top of the line, staff was great! Twice day housekeeping. Cleaned room once in the am, came back, went for a swim, used all the towels, went out came back and the room was all refreshed, even vacuumed! Very nice touch indeed... Is it worth $150.00 a night? Absolutely! Would definitely stay again! Just be sure that money is no object for you.. Haha…

Reviews.Title: “$3 Wine in a Dom Perignon Bottle!!”
Reviews.Author: TrippidyDoo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at actual exclusive 5 star resorts. This is a glorified motel. The place looks luxurious and elegant but I have received better service at a truck stop greasy spoon (and better food). We were given drinks 3 times where the glass had lipstick on the rim. We had to call twice to have our room cleaned. Not once did a host or employee go out of there way to ask if we were enjoying our stay. THE PLACE WAS BORING! Most guest went to neighboring hotels for night life. The best part about Aria was the thrid party restaurants like Beso Steak House, Todd Eglish Pub. The casino and hotel could learn alot from the service these establishments provided. Aria, please do not put $3 wine in a Dom Perignon Bottle and try to fool anyone anymore. The Aria cannot hold a candle to Belagio. The resort fees are also a scam...just like the 'Shop Supplies" charge when you take your car in for service. NEVER PAY THESE! Overall, horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: john_ecko
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expections and I had high ones for this. We arrived and the lobby was cool and spacious. There was also a smell of vanilla as you first went into the hotel too. We waited a few mins to check in and we allocated a room on the 3rd floor with a view of the monte carlo hotel.. we asked could we be close to our friends who we were travelling with, the lady at reception put a request in the booking for 2 rooms close on a non smoking floor. she told us to go back to reception the next day. we went back and she allocated us on the 34th floor next to each other with a lovely view of the city of Las Vegas. the rooms are big and there is lots of room. everything is controlled by a ipad like touch control screen where you can press one button and everything is off, curtains closed and its completly blacked out for sleep. the bathrooms are huge. the shower is massive with a bath next to it and the toliet has its own door and phone. the pools are a decent size although of a weekend they get extremely busy due to the locals and californians going for a vacation. casino is big and if your playing the machines its free drinks too. free parking is available too which we used and was so easy. most hotels in vegas have free parking. when we checked out the reception area was mad busy with hundreds of people checking out and in but we still didnt have to wait long. the hotel is located in the citycenter. which is nearly in the heart of the strip a 5 min walk and your at the bellagio fountains which are a must see. overall this hotel is great

Reviews.Title: “Overall an excellent hotel and casino!”
Reviews.Author: etelzrow
Reviews.Content: Our flight hit the Vegas tarmac at 1pm, Monday, July 18 and our group of five were excited for our 3 night stay at Aria (despite the Legionnaires scare, which we were hopeful had been addressed..yikes!). Taxi to casino was quick, and first impression of exterior of casino and front desk was classy, architectural and welcoming. The vanilla scent (which I feared when reading other reviews) was actually really good and inviting and negated almost all of the smoke. The front desk was not too busy but I did notice it was essentially a free for all (not one line but many - and pick your poison) but there was a staffer waving people to open spots, so I was seen within 5 minutes. Girl helping me was nice enough - got us adjoining rooms and a roll away for free (usually 35/night) - but would not give us the city view as that would be 15/extra per night and I refuse to pay upcharges for what I know can be free. She said the rooms she had for us were not clean and it might be a couple hours (it is now 1:30). Since our group was hungry we were hopeful we could have a leisurely lunch and then get up to our room. I gave the girl my cell and she would text me when rooms were ready. We checked our bags and explored our options. The Aria is connected directly to the Crystals shopping center which is almost more of a clothing museum than a mall - only the highest end shops and beautiful architecture within - and we ate at the DELICIOUS Todd English's P.U.B. A bit pricy but dang good. I made the mistake of ordering the Bloody Mary which did not sit well with me. Nevertheless, it is now 3:45 and I have no text for our room. We swing back to the casino and my girls get their game on while I investigate our room sitch. Since we have adjoining rooms we would take even one if it was available, and we find out one of the two is ready although the desk agent looked unsure. We were happy to even have the one for the time being (desperate to get to the pool) and head to the 21st floor...not bad, right?! Wrong. I open the door and get HAMMERED by freshly smoked marijuana. Seriously, we were in the room for 5 minutes and I swear I was getting high from the fumes. Frankly I'm surprised housekeeping approved the room. I immediately called the front desk and told them this would not work. (It's now 4:30) The desk agent was nice and moved us to the 18th floor, city view for no upcharge (see I told you), and my keycard would magically switch over to that room. We gladly made our way to 18 but my room key did not convert as I was led to believe. I'm kinda getting irritated (the front desk is a bit of a hike) and walk back to the front desk. Luckily another agent is able to give me proper keys to both rooms while my girls are back waiting outside the door. We finally get in our room (now after 5pm) and are pleased with the view, space and cleanliness. This is what we were hoping for, yay! I did note that the doors adjoining our room DO block the A/C vents when open, but I just kept the adjoining doors off the vents at night or when we left the room. The room technology (remote/shades/TV/etc.) worked fine as noted in other reviews but weren't really all the mind boggling to me. Nice touch but nothing that innovative (it is 2011). We quickly dashed to the pools for about an hour and a half and were very impressed at the cleanliness, service and atmosphere. Very peaceful, plenty of places to sit and swim, cute and friendly waitresses, etc. We never went to the shi-shi pool Liquid because it cost to get in and we were very happy with the main pools. Big moneysaving piece of advice #1: Get one of the 32 ounce drinks (be ready for sticker shock: 10 for a soda or 20+ for an alco-drink) so you can GET THE CUP. Then, send a friend to CVS down the street and buy your normally priced liquids (alcohol, mixers, etc.) to keep in the room. Then, when you go down to the pool, you can premake your drinks in the room and save literally hundreds of dollars. You can't bring a cooler to the pool but you can bring your fat drink! Anyway, we got a taste of the pool then headed to get ready for our 8:30 reservation at Serrano which is in the lobby. Got there no problem and had a lovely time, then off to gamble! The casino itself is crescent shaped and has plenty of gaming action. It's spacious and the clientele were considerate and having a good time. The great thing about Aria is that it is so far off the strip you won't have the sad looking gamblers you might spot often spot in other casinos on the strip - the people playing at Aria are also staying at the Aria and are generally cleaned up for a nice vacation...which I personally think Vegas should be about - high end class not chintzy cheese. Aria provides the former, thank god! We gambled a bit, won and lost per the usual, and retired by midnight - tired from travel. We went to bed admiring the night city view (which was fantastic). I had the roll away bed which was fine if a bit short (I'm 6-ft and my feet hung off a bit) and the ladies were generally happy with the beds. We woke early to get our gym on!! The gym at Aria is dang nice, plenty of treadmills with individual t.v's, weights, plenty of towels and bottled water. Worth the trip even if you don't workout as the lounge just outside the gym has a cool fireplace and lounge. We explored the spa area which looked nice but we found it too pricy to get a massage. Afterward we headed to the casino floor to the Jean Paul Patisserie for coffee and pastries - they were really good and we returned every morning - then back out to the pool! Another lovely day followed by some shopping at the Miracle Mile (Earl of Sandwich - great $10/lunch) and eventually out that night to Paris to eat at Mon Ami Gabi and watch the Bellagio fountains. All perfect. We even went to the Chateau above the Sugar Factory to party with Dennis Rodman at his 50th birthday (random!). Needless to say the rest of the trip went really well - more pool and gambling at Aria which was wonderful. We had an interesting contrast when we went to Treasure Island to see Mystere - we felt the casino there was dirty, dated and had too much foot traffic while Aria was clean, current and only had people that were meant to be there - not just passing through. We had no other issues other than a housekeeping guy getting upset with us for putting a canned drink from CVS in the mini bar fridge (it messed up the weighted system) and for some reason, every day, we found orange tic tacs littered throughout our hallway. On Thursday when we were leaving (5pm flight) we got a late 3pm checkout which we strongarmed out of them due to the checkin issues, so that was nice. When I checked out there were no surprises on the bill - it was exactly what it should have been and not a penny more. We were certainly sad to leave and I can say I would love to go back! I love to try new casinos and have new adventures but my fear with leaving Aria is that another casino might be a step down. I've never stayed at the Bellagio so that might be an option, but I'd really love to go back to Aria and get a suite. One final caveat: our trip was during the off days of Monday-Thursday and I imagine that from Thursday-Sunday things could get a bit hairy at the Aria when it comes to service and turnaround time...but that is true of EVERY casino in Vegas so if you are going just expect some wrench somewhere and be very thankful if there is not one. Also, if you are a shopper like me check out the Aria men's and women's clothing stores - they are freakin awesome! Kudos to their buyers. Hope you found this review helpful!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel With A Couple of Problems”
Reviews.Author: deighter
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in early July. Check in was quick, under three minutes, and all the staff were helpful and friendly. Some reviewers have said the rooms were a bit small -- they are not -- they are spacious and nicely furnished. The bed is just right, and there are huge his-and-her twin closets, two bathroom sinks and lots of storage space. The lobby is clean, stark, modern, sort of like a mega-mall in Dubai, and not all puffy with red and yellow flower carpets, like the Wynn. So what are the problems? One: the bathrooms are poorly designed, with the tub in the same enclosure as the shower. And the shower floor is smooth SLIPPERY marble. Some day, someone is going to slip and fall and be seriously injured in one of these. Mark my words. Solution: Put the fuzzy bathmat in the shower, on the floor first. Second, be sure to ask up front for a room that does NOT face the next-door Cosmopolitan Hotel! They have a patio disco playing thumping music until 4 a.m.... HUGE noise pollution that vibrates the windows of the Aria, even 30 floors up. Other than that, its a pretty good place. Large, too. Be prepared for some serious walking, if you want to use the so-so swimming pool or the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Aria Las Vegas-reviews are all right -it depends on how you look at things”
Reviews.Author: FierceTraveler
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I have traveled to Las Vegas extensively for the past 20 years and have stayed at most of the Hotels, both high-end and regular hotels. This past month I traveled 3 times to Vegas (2 on business and 1 for vacation) I stayed at New-york-New york and Caesars on my past trips and this last time to Aria, since I got a terrific deal for $139usd including $50 usd daily resort credit, so we decided that we should try it out. The Hotel itself is gorgeous, upscale ambiance and very modern decor, the vanilla smell you either love it o hate it. It´s not on the strip, but not many hotels are if you consider where the elevators to the rooms are, so I do not feel that is an issue, specially in vegas where you have to walk if you want to see the city. The check in process was fast, arrived around 4.30pm and took us 10 minutes for the 3 rooms, we got. they were all in the 12th floor and not far from each other, (a nice touch.. even though we call in advance to make sure they were.9 We were celebrating our anniversary and birthday and got some chocolate covered strawberry on our room, when we arrived. The rooms are nice, not that big, but very comfortable. the beds are amazing, and the only detail that I found odd was that the tub was next to the shower, so I wouldn´t want to go in there because it would feel crowded. The pool area is nice and very large, even though there were people, you could get a bed with very little effort. The food: We went to the Gourmet Buffet Dinner on sunday, with unlimited wine and a lobster for 2. Food was Ok, with some outstanding selections, specially desserts, but If I hadn´t had the resort credit, I would definitely spend my money somewhere else, since its expensive and not the best buffet in vegas by far. Try Wynn or Bellagio, same price and more selection, or go outside the strip to Red Rock Hotel and casino or M Resort, for a very inexpensive dinner with the same quality that you will find in all casinos. we also went to 2 other restaurants and the Jean Phillippe corner, all where good but pricey for what you got. I would definitely recommend to eat somewhere else, if you don´t get comps or special discounts at the hotel. Gambling was Ok, but costly, there aren´t tables below $15 to $20 usd, where in other hotels, you can bet $10usd per hand. Overall I consider Aria one of the top 6 hotels in Vegas: Wynn, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan, Mandarin Oriental, Caesars (the nicer suites) and Aria. But food options are limited, specially if you are on a budget, and there are better options around the strip. Service was Ok , but nothing to die for, I would not stay here, since I didn´t feel its my thing, but the Hotel is certainly nice. It is just not my thing, but I can say anything bad about it. By the way, Viva Elvis is nice if you like his music. If not go to Mystere or ka and you will enjoy it more.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel - very high tech room!”
Reviews.Author: dandkm88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria on a business trip. Like many Las Vegas hotels, the Aria is huge. With meetings in the conference center in the hotel, I had to plan on a 10 minute walk from my room - a long walk even from the elevator to the room. That being said, this is a very nice hotel, with very nice standard rooms. very high tech amenities including curtains that automatically open and close, an awesome entertainment system, all marble bathroom with a huge shower and tub. Fun place to stay and in the center of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and even better amenities!!!”
Reviews.Author: LadyKosi
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and spectacular property. Right out of the lifestyles of the rich and famous if you can afford the condos or penthouses:). Not us though! This is a great luxurious place for "normal" everyday people. The Italian gellato place and downstairs buffet is AWESOME and affordable and it serves American nd gourmet foods.Price for 3 days was around $400 after a price break on Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Something New this time around”
Reviews.Author: SimplyGirlie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria as it was new and gave hotel credits, room are modern and clean, the central control system was a good tech toy for those who are into it. Location was harder to get to as alot of walking required to get form the strip to hotel. Buffet was nice but didnt have the best selection though staff were extremely pleasent. Pool area was nice and fun.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL FOR VEGAS TRIP!!!”
Reviews.Author: gfkguhguk
Reviews.Content: this is the worst hotel ever that you can go to!!! buffets are overpriced and the food tasted horrible and it sucked!!! there arent any shopping places and the pool sucked!!! if you have reserved a room the manager doesnt care and will give it to another group of people what kind of freaken hotel is that. the manager is so un helpful and they make you pay $50 for a roll up bed. what a really great new hotel to start off with :D we dont expect to pay $500 and sleep on the floor! THERE ROOM SERVICE IS DUMB IT TAKES LIKE TWO HOURS JUST FOR FOOD SERVICE AND HOUSE KEEPING. MY FAMILY AND I, HAVE BEEN GOING TO LAS VEGAS EVERY SUMMER. AND STAYED AT MANY LUXURIOUS HOTELS. WE WERE TRYING TO LOOK FOR A DIFFERENT HOTEL, BUT EVERY OTHER HOTEL WAS TOO PACKED IT WAS THE FOURTH OF JULY!! PALM IS LIKE LAS VEGAS BUT ITS WAY CHEAPER AND BETTER AND YOU DONT LOOSE TO GAMBLING![

Reviews.Title: “The WORST experience in a so-called 5-star hotel. Period.”
Reviews.Author: LordBlunt
Reviews.Content: Quite possibly, no, the WORST experience my wife and I have had in a hotel. We have traveled to 18 countries around the world, have stayed in countless hotels/hostels/inns and the like, but nothing (not even a 3rd-world hotel!) can match the replies/explanations that we received at Aria in our last (and final) stay. While we were both asleep in bed at 2:15 A.M., a 'general alarm' woke me up and threw my wife out of bed and onto the floor. This alarm went on for nearly 10-minutes, and ended as abruptley as it began. We called a total of 3 times during and right after this alarm to ask for an explanation as to what occurred, and we were given 3 different explanations, ranging from "someone opened an Exit door," to "something happened, we dont know yet.".... After attempting to calm my wife and washing her face for another 10 minutes, I went downstairs to ask about the situation, and the receptionist >snickered< and laughed at my question, all the while never making eye contact and brushing me aside. When I asked to speak to someone in charge, I was told that I "am blowing this out of proportion. Please return to your room." (!!!) During checkout about 7 hours later, when I again asked for an explanation, I was told that "nothing happened last night, only a short fire alarm." No apology, no response, not even a simple "We are sorry for what happened."... The only thing that I was asked, by "here is my boss, her name is Tiffany" was, "would you like me to call an ambulance for you?", followed up with, "would you like to make a report to head of security?" INCREDIBLE! Simply INCREDIBLE!!! And this is supposed to be a 5-Star hotel???!!! My family, my relatives, and most of our friends have already listened to our ordeal. At least one relative has decided to not book with Aria, and I hope others decide to not stay at this joke of a hotel as well. Sincerely.

Reviews.Title: “Something in the water?”
Reviews.Author: DicePunk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at ARIA for three nights and loved every minute of it. The ambience of the spa and resort property was refined and classy. I was comfortable among the crowd, not too snobbish or stuffy. I was comfortable in shorts and a Hawaiian shirt or dress slacks and dress shirt. The casino floor was active and full of energy. Table game minimums were high enough to keep out the riff-raff. Nickel craps or blackjack players need to look elsewhere. Slots seemed a little tight, even though I hit a few small penny progressives. The rooms were large and comfortable, the technology was awesome. The only thing I disliked was the water pressure. It took me 4 times as long to shave. The water just dribbled out of the faucet it practically evaporated before it hit the sink. Pastries at Jean Phillipe was out of this world. The buffet was decent, though a little pricey. I would most definitely stay again. A big shout-out to James at the front desk, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, but giving realistic review”
Reviews.Author: That_vacationer
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Aria. After normally staying at the far end of the strip, we decided to try a hotel closer to all of the “action” of Vegas. Overall, we were happy with our decision and satisfied with our stay. We would return if we could find a similar deal that we booked during our stay. Here are the pluses: Bed and pillows in the room- The bed and the pillows were awesome! So comfortable, it was easy to fall asleep each night. Pool area- The pool was lovely! Definitely worth going to the pools! (But wished they stayed open later than 8pm…) I liked how there were different pools to choose from, it never really got overcrowded. If you get there before 9 or 10am you can choose seating near the sunbrellas and be seated comfortably in the shade. After 11am, you’ll want that shade!!! It’s also a nice touch that guests can get their own chilled water at several stands around the pool…no waiting for the waitresses or walking far. Also with the pool, we really liked Breezes Café. Yes, the prices are a bit inflated, but this is Vegas. It is convenient to get a snack or quick breakfast and eat it poolside. Their breakfast items (breakfast burrito, egg sandwich, fruit platter, etc.) were yummy and we liked their BLT, too. Would rather eat this than the buffet or go somewhere else in the hotel. Customer service- We did initially have issues with our room and were relocated several times. As another traveler noted, it is nice to not have to trek all the way down to the front desk for new room keys. However, be prepared to wait awhile for security to bring up new keys…we had to wait at least 20 minutes outside of our new room and it was stuffy and hot in the halls. A HUGE thank you to Heidi at customer service (?), who made all of these issues worth forgetting!!! I have never dealt with any customer service rep EVER who was as nice, polite, and accommodating as Heidi. There were no excuses, just apologies and kindness. Honestly, I hope her supervisors read this because she deserves a raise! Another big thank you to the concierge desk. Once again, they were beyond polite and helpful! Cleanliness- One of the few hotels that had a really clean bathroom. Didn’t have to worry about seeing the previous guests’ hair in the sinks/floor/shower. That’s my biggest pet peeve. (On the other hand, housekeeping takes forever to clean the rooms. We left in the morning and came back at 3 only to find that our room hadn’t been cleaned yet and we didn’t have new towels.) Mostly adults- Liked that there were very few kids in the hotel, saw mainly adults and only some kids at the pool. The tram- The tram was a plus. We could take it to Bellagio and go across the street from there to other hotels. Some things to consider: Rooms- Yes, the rooms are smaller than what we’re used to. For the same price we could probably get a larger suite-size hotel farther down the strip. But I guess you pay for location, right? Also, the remote control started to get on our nerves. I’m not anti-technology, but would have rather preferred simplicity over this remote. It was probably just in our room, but the blackout curtains did not black out the room completely as there was a sliver of light that got in each morning. Staff- Despite our luck with some staff, the rest of the staff was indifferent. The front desk was unfriendly, very blah. Didn’t even ask how we were, if we were first-timers, or if we had any questions. The staff who patrol the elevators were rather strict in a harsh way; I understand that you would like to keep your hotel secure, but there’s no reason to bark at me about my room key. Restaurants- There were only a few restaurants within the hotel that we’d actually dine at. For food we preferred to walk across the street to Paris and Planet Hollwood or to Monte Carlo. They had more casual, less expensive options. And one more thing—Yes, we were part of the group of guests that were exposed to legionella. Really gross! I experienced some stomach issues while staying there, but not sure if it was related to the outbreak.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location without a car”
Reviews.Author: pippy204
Reviews.Content: The hotel is big, Vegas style and has many restaurants to choose from. The brown décor was not to my taste but each to their own. Upon Check in I was told the non smoking floor I had requested was not available and the hotel was full. I spent two nights on a smoking floor before I could be moved by which time I had a sore throat. The staff were not very helpful regarding the booking. The room was so far to walk to right on the end of one of the towers. I timed the journey from my room walking to the lift, down through the casino, through crystals shopping centre (all high end stores Prada, Gucci etc) and finally out onto the strip - 20 mins! I am in my early 30's and walk fast and am very fit. However, I found this really annoying as It took too long to get anywhere. The pool is great, three pools with plenty of sun all day long and even a day club for those party animals. The fitness centre was good and I used this every day, good new machines and plenty of availability. The hot tub spa's upstairs were very relaxing as were the steam and sauna rooms, well recommend and afternoon in the fitness suite even if you dont use the gym. The restaurants in the Aria were first class, couldn't fault them and ate in several. I don't gamble so I cant comment on the casino, although if you are looking for old school Vegas its not here! Upon check out I found several additions to my bill. Several pool drinks and a meal in their sister hotel Vdara! I had not even eaten in Vdara let alone been in there! Attention to detail is certainly missed here and staff are very unapologetic. Luckily I was able to prove I had not eaten at Vdara by my restaurant receipts from inside Aria. - Tip, check your bill thoroughly before you leave! The feel of the complex is very much like Aisa. My experience wasn't bad but I would choose a different hotel next time due to the amount to time to get off the complex.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary and great location”
Reviews.Author: IrisCZ
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel because we like modern clean contemporary designs. The hotel room is big enough with trendy bathroom, unlike other old fashioned hotels in the US but that's up to everyone's taste. The location is great as it's fairly close to everything on the strip. Check-in was a bit of nightmare as big queues at every desk and staff walking around trying to direct people into the queues, they would be more useful if they opened more counters and put these "helpers" behind, but that's US, not sure how that works in other hotels, maybe we were there just at the busy time, other than that, can't complain:-)

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, comfy bed, no Ipod dock.”
Reviews.Author: Moholo
Reviews.Content: The Standard Rooms at ARIA were very nice and much larger than the regular rooms in Vegas at some of the older hotels. The beds were comfortable and soft, although the heavy bedding was quickly removed as the A/C struggled to maintain a comfortable sleeping temperature in the room. Yes, it's the middle of summer in Las Vegas and 100+ outside, but would have enjoyed a better climate control experience. Check in was a a little lengthy and despite our ONLY request being a room away from the noise of the Cosmopolitan, our room was on the 19th floor directly over the pool and the bass thumping was blaring. I was on hold with the same busy front office about 15 minutes before contemplating making the journey downstairs in person when a capable and friendly agent moved our room away from the noise. BONUS: No trip to desk or security required to re-key our existing keys to the new room. This made it simple for us to get down the hall and away from the noise! The rest of stay was uneventful and problem free which makes it pretty darn good in my opinion. My only gripe aside from the pool party original room was that the marble shower was quite slippery. Considering the average BAC of a Las Vegas hotel guest, I can imagine this could be an issue. Easily solved with putting a bathmat inside the shower space. Good stay, would stay again. OH and despite the technology in the room, there was no iPod/MP3 Dock. In order to play your own music you need to bring an AUX cord.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again!”
Reviews.Author: SolofemaleNelson
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else I read the reviews and thought 'how bad can it be'? The check in was fast because I arrived on a Tuesday night at about 7:30 pm - far from prime time. What was frustrating is that the hotel charged almost $700 to my credit card even though I was comped for my stay. Since most charge $300 this was excessive to say the least. When I got to my room I immediately went to use the facilities and found feces smeared on the front of the toilet. Looking closer, I noticed the bathroom floor was covered in hair (not mine!). The carpet in the bed area had not been vacuumed and there were drink rings on he counter tops. I stopped looking after that and called housekeeping. I said it wasn't necessary to change rooms but they needed to send someone asap to scrub the room down. Housekeeping was all over themselves apologizing and said they would take care of it immediately. I left the room and when I came back a few hours later it had been cleaned properly. However, every day after that the housekeeping seriously lacked. Trash cans were not emptied, soap dishes were scummy, no vacuuming done etc. To add to my delight the report about an outbreak of Legionnaires disease at Aria hit the news while I was staying there. Super! On some plus sides, the pool area was pretty nice and the cocktail servers polite and quick. The check out was quick because it was at 5:30 am and my bill was correct. Based on the housekeeping and the feeling you get they are just not paying attention to cleanliness I would not stay at the Aria again even if it is a freebie.

Reviews.Title: “Great room. Incredible view.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLAC
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 3 nights at the Aria. We stayed in the sky suites, and I have to say it was the nicest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Very clean and all if the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The view was Amazing!  We walked around to 6 or 8 other big casinos along the stop and the Aria was our favorite. It was less smoky, fewer children, and generally more pleasant to spend time in. Thierry sports room was also the best of the several we saw. The pool area was also very nice with the best drinks and lots of shade. We did not eat much in the Aria so I can't say much about the food, but the exclusive suk villa lounge with water, juice, snacks, coffee, tea, etc was a great feature. The only negative I found was that there was no place to get a real breakfast other than the buffet .  The only other breakfast options were room service or were pastries, delicious but not filling.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel! by far the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in! front desk service not so good :(”
Reviews.Author: cmuffin
Reviews.Content: we splurged on the penthouse suite for a girls getaway! room was stunning, beds so cozy, spacious suite & very well appointed! bellmen were FANTASTIC and very helpful. limo service to and from the airport was a great touch. room service was super slow - we waited almost 2 hours! the girls in vip sky suites reception were extremely unfriendly :( they told us at check-in that one meal in the buffet or cafe would be complimentary and gave us a ticket. at the buffet they had no idea what we were talking about but there were others in line who were told the same thing. they were instructed by the front desk to charge it to their rooms and it would be comped at check-out. not so. while checking out we were told that many people get confused about the complimentary meal but the ticket was simply a pass to move to the front of the line. we reserved a private cabana at the pool ($500). the cabana was nice and cool - very comfortable! we asked for an extra lounge chair (3 times) and waited over 2 hours to get it. we were also charged for drinks we didn't order. an honest mistake - glad we looked it over before signing. we paid a premium price hoping for a magical getaway - some aspects were amazing but the overall experience (specifically with the front desk & the wait on room service) was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: knlfaz
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews on the ARIA before making our decision to stay at this hotel and were so pleasantly surprised. We arrived at the hotel rather late in the evening and although there was a line at the desk for check in, it did move rather quickly. The reservations clerk assigned us to a room very close to the elevator, even though we asked if we could be situated at the end of the hall to avoid any outside noise. She assured us that the hallways were very long and we probably didn't want to be assigned to a room so far from the elevator. We were too tired to argue with her and decided that we would give the room a try and if too noisy, would ask to be moved the next day. Well, the Aria must have the most soundproof rooms in all of Vegas, aided by the white noise provided by the air conditioning unit. We ended up being very happy with the location and never heard a sound unless the door was ajar. We made our way to our room and were so pleasantly surprised. I read about the 'thingymabobber' by the bed and the safe being tucked in the nightstand drawer -- so felt a bit prepared, but didn't know how truly wonderful everything would be until we plopped down on those beds!! MGM-Mirage does such a great job with all their beds and this was no exception. These may have been the most comfy beds and pillows in any one of their properties. The bed had an ultra cushy pillow top and plenty of nice soft fluffy pillows. From the thingymabobber (as someone described it...so I kept referring to it as that) by the bed, you could open / close the curtains, turn the tv on and off, check the flight schedules, adjust the temp in the room, set the privacy or service sign to light up outside your door, turn lights on and off, etc. How truly wonderful....felt very spoiled. There was also no hint of smoke in the room -- which was great as we requested a non-smoking floor. The bathroom is also fantastic with plenty of very nice towels (extras in the drawers and bathroom shelves) and nice toiletries. The lighted magnification mirror is always a nice touch, as were the 4 robes hanging in the closet upon arrival. Everything was in working condition in our room and as I mentioned, very soundproof. The temperature control worked perfectly and sometimes that isn't always the case. The only issue I had with the room is that the bedspread was kind of dirty and actually had someone else's hair left on it when we checked in. This was minor, as we only needed the blanket at night and choose to turn the bedspread all the way to the end of the bed. OK -- that was the ONLY issue with the room during our 3 night stay. Again...very minor but unexpected for such a fabulous hotel. Everything else was spotless and the bathroom was kept extremely clean throughout our stay. We found there was never really a wait for the elevators and made our way down to the casino with ease. We also used the monorail back from the Bellagio and used the escalotor that is within the hotel itself to make our way over to Monte Carlo. Very convenient location. Also, they did a fantastic job filtering the smoke out of the air in the casino. The players club desk agents were very friendly and quite helpful -- all with a great sense of humor. We experienced a problem when attempting to use the freeplay or point play while we were there but ended up finding machines to accept it. They were doing some work on the system and for awhile, all machines were down. I don't think our play was accurately recorded at this time but not too much of an issue. We didn't go to the pools as our last morning there, it was raining and that was the time we set aside for relaxing by the pool. Maybe next time. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants at the hotel but some did look inviting. But, too many other places to go to, so many next time. Also, never used the gym so cannot speak to that either. One thing that was quite impressive was the fountain and the wall of water by the taxi area. I think we sat on the bench out there for well over an hour enjoying this area. The lights shine off the dancing water in the fountain while behind you, there is a wall of water falling in waves. You have to experience it to understand what I am trying to explain. See it at night for the full affect. The staff at the concierge desk were so helpful and friendly. There is also an internet kiosk just down from the bell desk to check in for your flight -- although the printer didn't work for us to print our boarding pass. After staying at several hotels in Vegas, this quickly became our favorite and cannot wait to go back. I would give this 4.5 stars out of 5 -- not 5 only because of the very minor problems we experienced with the slot machines and the not so clean bedspread. The staff, save just a couple, were outstanding. Even the cocktail waitresses were fantastic and more than willing to suggest that special drink to hit the spot. NICE!! So, trying to figure out how / when to get back to the Aria for another great experience.

Reviews.Title: “It was a gamble”
Reviews.Author: off2thekeys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great weekend planned in Vegas. We usually stay at the SkyLofts at MGM, but I wanted to try Aria since it would be new for us. We had a lovely penthouse suite but... 1. There was personal residue from the previous tenants on the sofa. We asked housekeeping to clean it, and it was not done. We called housekeeping and they sent someone to clean it. He arrived with a small bucket and a scrub brush. He "cleaned" it but the sofa looked like it had large, dry, crisp areas on it. Finally, we spoke to the concierge for the suites and she said it would be dry cleaned. The sofa was finally cleaned, but since it was so wet, we could never use it. 2. The fact that the sofa had remnants of others is not only disgusting, but also a health hazard. 3. The staff in the hotel and casino were very friendly. 4. The food options were pretty good, though one guest was vegan and there is not much option for vegans. 5. Because the hotel needs to be filled up, the caliber of guests may not be what you expect from such a nice new place. It at times was a bit sketchy. 6. We went to the spa which was nice, but they do not give a list of what products they used. That is not good for me or the business of the spa. 7. At checkout, we received a survey via email that took 20 minutes to complete. Both my husband and I completed it. At the end, it asked if we would like to be contacted...we are still waiting...it has been a month. I think we will continue with SkyLofts.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: hrtravel500
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and convenient to the CityCenter. Upon arrival we experienced hour wait time for check-in food. The same night my spouse experienced poisoning from "The Buffet" (since no one else reported problems risk mgmt would not comp the $80.00 meal). For dining try the CityCenter Wolfgang Puck Pizza and the Mirage BB King Club. This was my first trip to Las Vegas and I was very dissappointed. Thanks Aria!!

Reviews.Title: “Great property with a 5 star rating, but it's a 3 star experience.”
Reviews.Author: Rock-Man-94
Reviews.Content: If they put you in a room that gets full afternoon sun in the summer months refuse it - system can't keep the room cool. Other than that very good experience. Once management gets it act together this will be a great resort destination.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: lkeiter
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel ,clean well run ,rooms are clean and beautiful and it doesn't smell like smoke everywhere. It was easy to get to attractions from this location and we won money !

Reviews.Title: “Read the bad reviews, then had zero similar experiences. It was great!”
Reviews.Author: John60878
Reviews.Content: Spend five minutes to become familiar with the control panel upon arrival. It will save you frustration later. If you can use an iphone, this thing is a breeze. Room was super modern and clean. Loved the his and hers closets. Big bath/shower area. Slept like a log in the comfy bed. Great view of the pools. Take the Tram to Bellagio, and then cut through the casiono and shops to access the Strip. Walking in A/C vs. the July heat is a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: anthony725
Reviews.Content: If you plan on going to vegas then this is the place to stay. From the moment that the door swings open you get the smell of vanilla that circulates the air at all times. The rooms are top notch and everything is controlled by your remote. From your lights,curtains,temp all controlled by a remote. This is a ultra modern lush resort. This is the best vegas has to offer even though the resort has a $20 per day resort fee. Trust me its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Exposed us to Legioneers Disease!!!”
Reviews.Author: blkrkct
Reviews.Content: I found out today that several cases of Legioneers Disease were reported at the hotel during my stay!!! I did notice that the hot water in the sink seemed to be only slightly warm, but didn't really care at the time. Now I find out the reason is the water supply was infected!!! I drank the water during my stay! Never was I told there may be a problem with the water, or given bottled water to drink and brush my teeth. This place knowingly exposed me to a potentially deadly bacteria!!! Don't stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “wow!”
Reviews.Author: Aggies7
Reviews.Content: I was meeting a group and stayed at the Aria on my own as they had booked into another hotel. The room was fabulous, and I felt safe as they had security at the elevator entrances and throughout. The booking was last minute and I got a terrific deal, the restaurants were beyond amazing. Room service ( which I used often) was prompt and the food was great. I attended some shows and ate out lots, the location of this hotel can't be beat, the decor and the staff were top notch and it was a lot of value for your money. Loved it!! will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “We'd Stay Here Again... And Again”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy9631
Reviews.Content: When we looked at the reviews, we started with the worst, and we nearly didn't go to Aria, there seemed to be so many problems. But all the hotels had problems, many a lot worse, and a colleague had recommended Aria, so we gave it a shot. Boy, are we glad we did! We only stayed a brief time, but we encountered absolutely none of the problems mentioned. Granted it was a Thursday and Friday in July, but, when we pulled up, there were a dozen or more bellmen to take our bags. Let us say right off the bat that the most impressive thing was the staff. They couldn't have been nicer, more helpful, and more accommodating for our entire stay. The check-in was really fast, with ample counters, and when we waited for a minute, an employee came to us, escorted us to a new window, and we were checked in immediately. Our bags arrived at our room in less than 5 minutes after we asked for them. The room was clean, with plenty of everything - towels, robes, shampoos, pillows, and electronic everything. If we walked into the room during the day, the curtains opened automatically as we entered, and at night closed automatically when we entered. It took a while for us to figure out how to use the remote, which controls everything in the room, but we figured it out. I went down to the gym, and found everything I wanted. I use the treadmill, and there were a dozen ones not being used, each with its own TV and jack for an iPod. Headsets were available and free (I wish they were in my club at home), free cold water, free towels, a weight machine circuit, and just around the corner when I was done, 3 pools to jump in to cool off. A note: the pools are only three and half feet deep, but more than ample for swimming. The entire time we were there, there were plenty of empty beach chairs, and we were able to find umbrellas if we got there at a reasonable time. The umbrellas are free. A word of warning: there are workers who circulate and, if a chair is unused for 30 minutes, they will take your things off and bring them to the main desk, so, if you're thinking of staking out a chair and then going somewhere else, not going to work. Some caveats: the place is huge, and I mean huge. It can take 15 minutes to get from your room to one of the dozen or so restaurants or the pools or just about anything. Allow even more time to get to the self-park garage (again, no charge). They don't tell you this, but you need a photo I.D. to buy anything -- meals, a newspaper, anything. We learned quick. The food ain't cheap, especially around the pool ($8.00 for a small coke). The buffet was okay but a huge number of things to eat. Breakfast will run you $40.00, which, strangely is the same with a tip it'll cost you at a restaurant there, but without 150 choices and as much to eat as you want. Of course, a lunch will run around $50, and a dinner easily $100, unless one eats in the Crystal mall Wolfgang Puck pizza place. We should say that, while it is true that the Aria is located on The Strip, it is on the south end of the strip, and it can take a half hour to walk (you don't want to drive) to take in the "theme" hotels, like The Paris, The Venetian, and so on. Finally, check out was a breeze. We have absolutely no complaints, and our only regret is that we didn't have more time to stay there. I know this might sound like we're being paid to write this, but we're not, and this is probably the first time in our lives (we're not young) that we've written about a hotel or anything else that wasn't to tell people how bad it was and to avoid it. Read the negative comments, and, perhaps, their problems were real, but either they've been fixed, or exaggerated.

Reviews.Title: “The Aria is super great”
Reviews.Author: cherforme2
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Aria and I am so glad we decided to stay at the Aria . Our room was so fantastic. It had an amazing view of Las vegas and the mountains in the distance. I must mention room service.....It was outstanding. the people and the food. We really enjoyed our stay At the Aria

Reviews.Title: “Clean And Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Magazinedude
Reviews.Content: Good Service and friendly Staff. Just what you expect while in Vegas RIGHT? The hotel is new so everything works perfectly! Stay here. Also the Elvis show is right there. Restaurants are cool and nicely decorated. ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Try to avoid rooms opposite The Cosmipolitan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fats55555
Reviews.Content: Just got back after a week at thr Aria in las vegas and had a great time. Room was right opposite the cismipolitan hotel which has a very loud music system throuhout the day and into the early hours. Not every night but everyday, and if you decide you need a little nap its very hard to sleep, its like a constant boom boom boom. Other than the position of our room it was a most enjoyable stay and the staff could not be more helpful and polite they where excellent,. we would stay thier again, but not on that side.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed for the money! Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: fijiqueen
Reviews.Content: This hotel overbuilt themselves from what I understand but are offering great rates b/c of it!! It was $163/night after tax and resort fee and they waived the 3rd person fee for me on the phone! (Vegas hotels charge $34 per extra person over 2ppl per night). The whole hotel had fabulous modern yet Zen-like decor and had surround sound music everywhere you went. Very nice atmosphere. The rooms are awesome! Ceiling to floor windows with curtains controlled on the wall (opens when you enter the room). Huge bathrooms! Lots of space! It was the best deal of our entire trip! (We stayed at the PALMS the following weekend when we finished the national parks and it didnt hold a candle to the ARIA.... and was way more expensive!). The lighting can all be controlled and is made for comfort... a BIG plus. The one thing at the ARIA we did not like is that we called ahead (from another hotel) to the ARIA to see what their "4th of July" price was on their buffett and were told $31.95 by the front desk. Only to go up there and be charged $36.95/pp. Not the biggest deal, but for 4 of us it was $20 and they handled it all wrong. We called back downstairs right in front of them and had the front desk tell them the price they had on file.... the manager still wouldn't honor it for us. Not good customer service... but again, that was the buffett. Also you can skip it and go to the Wynn or Bellagio buffetts. Both are much better,. everyone in our party agreed.

Reviews.Title: “Aria vs Bellagio”
Reviews.Author: marie32
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Bellagio when we travel to Vegas, but got a great offer for rooms at Aria, so decided to try it. Long story short, we would probably choose the Bellagio over Aria if the price was equal. The rooms Aria are larger and newer with huge floor to ceiling windows - amazing!! The casino seems smaller (not a bad thing) but nice and smalls great. However, cocktail services was practically non-existent. The pools are much better at Bellagio and slightly more family friendly. The Liquid Lounge (outdoor pool bar) at Aria plays loud music with a big base beat that becomes distracting background noise, and it's almost impossible to escape it at any of the three pools. The Buffet at Aria is smaller, but nicer and very well organized - not less food, just less redundancy and less chaotic. The workout facility at Aria is fabulous and big!! We prefer the Bellagio location as it is more central and also not set as far back from the strip - plus the fountains :). Also, it just has a livelier vibe; Aria and City Center had somewhat of a deserted feeling in places, though Aria definitely has a younger vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Sleep but not to Gamble”
Reviews.Author: vhoeven
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria in July for 4 nights with my husband and another couple. THe hotel is beautiful - very well designed in every inch. I especially liked the peace and quiet on the hotel room floors. Amazed at how peaceful they were - a lot of hotels don't provide you with a restful room experience but Aria does. The remote technology in the rooms was cool but not necessity. My husband fumbled a few times trying to figure out the lights but once we got used to it, pretty cool. Check in and out was great, no waiting. We checked out via TV which I recommend to anyone! Pool was very nice with very few families. They let you have plenty of towels and allowed us to bring in our beverages although we had to pour them into plastic cups. My biggest complaint is the casino. Every open table we saw was a $25 minimum. Occassionally a $15 blackjack table would exist but was always packed with no spots open. They are very proud of their casino. So we didn't really play there very much because at $25 a hit, the money doesn't last long. Instead we headed over to Monte Carlo (connected to Aria) and played there for hours at $10 tables. Restaurants are OK but pricey. Crystals is a joke to the typical American. Lots of empty Prada, Gucci, Mui Mui stores. In general, the Aria is beautiful and will give you a great nights sleep when you want a little peace from the bustle of vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Aria, the suites were awesome and the service superb!”
Reviews.Author: DCRANE88
Reviews.Content: The center of the strip location was perfect for our stay, the food was excellent and plenty of different options. The service from check in to check out was also excellent as was the maid service, we asked for a door to be oiled as it was squeaky and 30 minutes later it was done. The rooms are elegant and comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and clean. The only drawback was it was a very popular place and crowded most of the time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade Baby!”
Reviews.Author: luvachon
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Aria (our first trip to Vegas). We are spoiled. My other family members stayed at Circus Circus. Comparing the two is impossible. When we arrived we checked right in. I suggest taking the red-eye and checking in late/early. The lines are long during peak hours. The desk attendant asked if we needed anything else? My sister asked "Can we get an upgrade"? And we did. Have you seen "The Hangover"? The suite was amazing! Six flat-screens, two bathrooms, living room, conference/dining room, steam shower and an awesome view.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: oodavski
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed their for a few nights for our honeymoon,we had a great time. The generator blew up and we lost power for a night but all the staff where very pleasant and helpful,they kept us informed on what was going on and a approx. time on when it would be fixed.Other then the minor hiccup we had a ball and couldn't fault the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back to this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mijungra
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aria Hotel for 3 days from July 4th. It was absolutely terrible experience. In the bathroom, they did not replace shower supplements and even hand towels. They also left cotton swabs I used for make up. When we got back to the room at night, the mattress was all set up but, when we lift up the blanket, there was hairs all over which means they did not change the mattress covers.I m sure it wasn't but, even worse was that mattress cover felt like someone has been used, not fresh feeling. The minibar was dusty but, I can understand that. However, other things were very terrible. I used to stay at Venetian, Wynn and Caesars Palace but, I wanted to try new hotel and Aria has five stars rating. Can you believe this five star rating hotel? I will never go back to this hotel. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place!!”
Reviews.Author: mrasjank
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! Beautiful inside and out, great customer service, and the vanilla smell overrides the cigarette stink. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Beds specially made for the hotel are so comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic from start to finish... if only I was as good at the poker tables.”
Reviews.Author: Mrrunbad
Reviews.Content: I based myself at the Aria for 1 week the beginning of June, so I could play in the World Seires Of Poker and elsewhere. This was a solo trip and having only been to Vegas once before and stayed at the excellent Bellagio, my expectations were pretty high when deciding upon the Aria. I wasn't disappointed!!!!! After a smooth check in with a very helpful member of staff, I upgraded to a city view room for an extra $15 dollars a night on the 24th floor. My one gripe would be the $20 a day resort fee which is payable upon check in... this basically covered things that I actually didn't use... wifi, spa etc... has to be be paid though, so nothing you can do. The first thing that struck me as I walked through the casino to the elevators, was the amazing feel of luxury and fantastic smells that waft through the resort... no old smoke drifting through the casino and instead filled with very fresh aromas. Casino itself was excellent and the poker room was one of the best I played during my time there... and I played quite a few of them. For those who do play, they have an excellent daily $200 buy in that had a sizeable pot on both occassions I played... granted numbers were probably inflated at that point due to the number of visitors there for the WSOP. As I entered my room I was delighted to find a spacious and immaculate room with fantastic views of the strip and all the amenities one could need. The bed was amazing and I literally didn't have to leave it to access anything like the lighting, tv, curtains etc... as they are all controlled via an ipad like device next to your bed. Bathroom was spacious with an excellent shower and tub. It was a great feeling every morning to wake and have the drapes open at the touch of a button to reveal the strip in all it's amazing glory. Onto the buffet and all I can say is WOW...... I ate here most mornings as it really wasn't worth the while going elsewhere when it was so good. Ok it's not the cheapest place to eat at $20+ but the variety and quality is superb. I had the Bellagio buffet one morning and it didn't come close to Aria. Overall a fantastic place and easily will return in the future thanks to it's location.. standards and facilities. Gutted to go home but will return with my partner and daughter.... that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it. We did not want to leave. Will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Great50
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Aria. From the ouside of the hotel which catches your eye to the beautiful lobby. The rooms were really contemporary & very clean. The casino was great. Plenty of restaurants and shops. Crystals connects to the hotel for all of the shopping that you ever want. Loved it!!! Our view was of the mountains. Beautiful! 3 pools

Reviews.Title: “Affordable amazing luxury”
Reviews.Author: maltafaz
Reviews.Content: Our partner retreat was held at Aria. I was shocked by the fabulous rooms with wonderful furnishings, great views and electronics that I had not seen in a standard hotel room. One may program the drapes to open at a set time in the morning. You can control most functions in the room from one's bed. Tv, radio, lights, alarm clock, etc. Wireless Internet was excellent. The decor is right out of a magazine. Comfortable and beautiful. Aria's basic room is everyone else's suite. All for a price of a room at a lesser hotel without the luxury. The use of stone and natural materials, is simply beautiful. I have not been a more well equipped and beautiful workout facility. Waterfalls and a full length fireplace greet one as you enter the gym. It is my number one choice in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, location, food, but cleanliness was a problem”
Reviews.Author: happysaint
Reviews.Content: Stayed Easter weekend with friend and sister. Was not as crowded as thought considering it was week of spring break. Aria looks huge from the outside but once inside not as difficult to get around. The crowd more towards 20's and 30's as oppose to the Wynn and Palazzo. Definitely had more fun gambling in Aria than at the more older and upscale places. Tried two restaurants, both yummie. The tapas bar definitely fun and delicious. Sage is award winning so worth a try. Both have very friendly vegetarian menus. Hotel and casino staff mediocre, housekeeping staff very friendly. Best part of hotel, The Spa!!! I love their spa, it's so tranquil and huge. Better than Wynn's or Palazzo's. We could have hung out there all day. Worst part of hotel, cleanliness of the rooms were just not up to par. The carpets in our room weren't even vacuumed or at least it seemed that way. We had two rooms and both had issues with food crumbs on bed or floor. My friend's room also had used shot glasses leftover. Very surprised since it's an MGM owned hotel and we never had issues like this at Bellagio. We didn't make any complaints but hope they improve and that is reason for the average rating. Otherwise really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Cant wait to return!!"”
Reviews.Author: bettepenng
