Reviews.Content: From airport pickup with the hotel Limo to the special entrance for the skytower suites-- the service ,property, service and food was spectacular clean delicious and inviting

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: rgoldberg17
Reviews.Content: We had a great trip. We stayed at the Suites.The service was excellent and the rooms were very nice; modern, clean and comfortable. Excellent spa. Enjoyed all the free cookies at the Suites reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, we are likely to return”
Reviews.Author: DHeilbrunn
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. we did notice that there was a lack of adequate air conditioning in certain elevators as well as the waiting area for such elevators near the Sky Suite area

Reviews.Title: “Modern Great place”
Reviews.Author: north12345john
Reviews.Content: stayed here last week with my girlfriend what a huge hotel we both thought the hotel was great very spacious and airy check in was fast room was great wasnt the best view but we got a cheap deal so didnt mind. lots of technology if you cant handle technology do not stay here also long walks to the rooms didnt bother us at all though, the bed was extremely comfortable. pool was great also all the staff were helpful afew things were pricey but it is expected in a 5 star hotel on the strip, overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “1st Time - Doesn't Get Better Than This!”
Reviews.Author: MainAccents
Reviews.Content: The room was georgous! It was clean and comfortable! The staff was nice and incredibly helpful and the service was outstanding! Everything we did i.e. workout, shop, eat, gamble...it was all exceptional quality! I would come back again and go no other place...no need to!

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel...expensive drinks”
Reviews.Author: gc779
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aria for 6 nights and 6 days. Upon arrival the check in lines were long as I overheard a woman say that they were "overbooked" due to the July 4th weekend. We got to our room and even though it was on the 22nd floor, we could hear the loud thumping bass coming from the cosmopolitan's pool which is adjacent to the aria...So, after requesting our room change we headed over to our new room on the 17th floor on the other side of the Aria. A good tip here is to know that you will be walking a lot on the Aria property it is large and nothing essential is close ie: the pool, buffet, or main valet for that matter...but hey at least we burned off our calories from the buffet walking to the valet were we headed to the red rock canyon to do some local exploring. A must do is visiting Jean Philippes Patisserie on the casino floor for their amazing crepes - have the nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream...oh and for breakfast definitely go with a fresh warm almond croissant! There are many pools to choose from but steer clear of the one with fountains...that's where all the kiddies are. Finally on a hot 110 degree day in the desert it would be nice to have a mojito and a strawberry daquiri...but not at $32 for little 16 oz cups...plus tip...wow i could get a better deal in NYC. On another note the beds are very soft and the room was kept very clean by the staff. you may search a while to find ice on your hotel room floor..but hey it is a huge hotel. we walked thorough city center and crystals which is their high end shopping destination and felt it is worth the window shopping. I guess we would have liked a more intimate hotel because the aria is luxury but it leaves you a bit disconnected with the rest of the world.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pb62
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sky Suites. The service and accomodations were terrific. Get a pent house suite.........truly fabulous. I do not gamble. I was VERY busy at the pool, in the incredible gym and enjoying the spa treatments. The restaurants are delicious and first rate. You don't have to be rich and famous.............At Aria they make everyone feel that way! Go... you will really enjoy:)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: ahughson
Reviews.Content: We were shocked at how wonderful our stay was. While the Resort was large, the service was intimate and flawless. Also, the rooms were immaculate, well furnished and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The beds are to die for”
Reviews.Author: wildcat2003
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our extended family and each couple remarked how amazing the mattresses were. SO comfortable! The rooms were well-appointed and pretty swanky compared to our normal hotel choices. Beautifully decorated and the whole hotel smells wonderful. Really enjoyed our stay. Just don't try to gamble there (or really anywhere on the strip). Slots are super tight ... Old Vegas is a better bet than a brand new hotel/casino.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Technology”
Reviews.Author: MIcalobeco
Reviews.Content: A group of nine celebrating our birthdays, we requested our rooms to be close together, but 3 ending up on the 18th, 1 on the 20th and the last on the 10th floor. Two of the rooms recieved a birthday card with chocolate strawberries, the other three rooms didn't. Each night I thought I had everthing sent on a timer, but woke up each morning with either the tv or the lights on. We met downstairs at The Deuce (430pm) for appetizers and drinks. There was no patrons in it, the menu posted at the door, but to hours.We asked a tall guys in a suit (in the bar) what time it opened and we were rudely sshhh'd! (He was on his cell phone) Terrible first impression and very poor customer service. We played a few slots came back and went in. We were the only ones in there, probably because the time. That jerk never apologized and contined to walk around with his cell phone in front of him. Drinks were pricey although we had 2 for one coupons and the appetizers were very tastey. Rooms were very comfy and spacious, and I had a great pool view. My friend had the service light on her room from 8am and the room was nevef serviced when we came back at midnight. :(

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lauraflirt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from staying at Aria for the weekend. We loved this hotel. Everything is so nice and new. The rooms were spectacular!! The room was very technologically advanced... we had an electric controller that opened the curtains automatically, turned on/off lights, music, HVAC. It was so neat! The bed was unbelievable!! We will definitely come back. My husband went to the spa and although its $30, he said it was the most amazing spa he'd been to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: saralee1234
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth and fast we asked for a room with a great view and got it! Our room had the lastest technog and it was great the curtains opened up and the light s turned on when we opened the door. The comforter was dirty and we found a piece of gum on the floor we called housekeeping and they came up and cleaned the room. Staff was very friendly. Pool was average. Drinks were ok. Building was beautiful artwork was amazing! Gym was included in our price and was very nice and my husband liked we did not have to pay extra. For the inernet! I liked that the hotel smelled great! The hotel is located in the heart of it all and there is cheaper dinning at the monto carlo next door! We go to vegas every year and we would go back .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Architecture, But Issues”
Reviews.Author: savyboy
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice but curtains did not work properly, there was no coffee machine or table in the room to eat breakfast on and they attempted to charge us for items not taken from mini-fridge. Oh, and there was no way to use the mini fridge for our own items. The worst thing though was check-in and out. UGH! Waited 30 minutes to just get to the check-in person. And check-out was worse, only two people on duty and had to wait another 25 minutes at 6AM! TV check out would not work because it was "too early" ! Sorry Aria, for the prices you charge the overall experience was not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line hotel, just needs more front desk attendants”
Reviews.Author: srlndstrm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aria for 1 night for a quick bachelor(ette) party in Vegas. The hotel itself is really beautiful and modern. It was clean, open and spacious, didn't stink like smoke like some casinos do, and had really great rooms. My king room was huge, with curtains that opened and lights that turned on when I entered the room for the first time (very impressive). Everything can be controlled through the TV (thermostat, curtains, lights, music, etc.). The shower is big and gorgeous (although a little slippery) and the room had floor to ceiling windows. Finishes were really modern and seemed high-end. The bed was really comfy too. I liked it! The only issue I had with Aria (that keeps it from being 5 stars in my book) is the front desk. I arrived prior to check-in time and was able to get into my room a few hours early (awesome!), BUT I stood in line to check in at least 20 minutes. I had the same issue with checking out and had to wait at least 15. Granted, I could have done auto-checkout but needed to adjust some charges, so that wasn't a great option. I also tried calling the front desk during my stay to get connected to a friend's room (whose room number I didn't know, so I couldn't dial direct) and the phone rang and rang for 5 minutes without anyone picking up. Limited AT&T cell reception in the building kept me from getting in touch with my friend directly. Aria has good restaurant and shopping options and a nice pool area, plus I love modern and new hotels, so I'll stay there again. However, I'll do auto-checkout, get my friends' room numbers ahead of time, and bring my patience for the check-in process.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: npetrillo
Reviews.Content: I found the front desk to be very unhelpful. The Bell desk was almost impossible to get a hold of, stayed on hold for 23min before someone picked up to bring our bags up. Over all, unprofessional. Previous trip we stayed at the Wynn, the two hotels are night and day. Aria should not be rated 5 star it should get at 2 at best

Reviews.Title: “Great Place- Don't Get Sticker Shock - Mind Your P's & Q's”
Reviews.Author: treishag
Reviews.Content: Luckily, I read the reviews on TripAdvisor BEFORE going to the hotel, so I was prepared for the "resort fees" that were going to be added to our vacation package. We bought a vacation from Delta Vacations who did a great job of disclosing the fees that would be charged in addition to our package price. Delta Vacations also made us aware of the single king bed vs double bed issue. They stated that most rooms are one king bed, but you can inquire if there are double beds available at a higher price. Upon check-in there was at least 7 long lines of guests trying to check-in. We were lucky we had a helpful Service Repsentative Julie who was able to review our request for a double bed and provided our breakfast buffet coupons promised from Delta Vacations. She also warned not to touch or open the mini bar because there would be a charge if anything was removed for 30 seconds. The property is beautifully adorned with art work and interesting architecture. The room was nicely appointed with a nice size bathroom with double sinks, bathtub & shower with seated area and separate space for toilet. One of the best features of the room is the control pad that controls the whole room. I spent a few minutes touching all the buttons like a little kid. Be careful of the Front Desk Staff, I have witnessed where they don't have the same training/resolution tactics. I had an issue where something was incorrectly charged and one staff member told me nothing could be done. I went to another staff person who was able to give a possible resolution and the issue was resolved. It was my fault for not following the correct protocol. Aria is a great visual property, but you need to know ALL the rules before a charge gets placed on the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressive”
Reviews.Author: John072011
Reviews.Content: 1) lighting is weak in the room. no where I could turn on the floor lamp. cant read in room. bathroom is even brighter than the bedroom area 2) front desk person wrote the wrong room number. we tried times to open the other room until we took a risk to try the room across the hall. acceptable error 3) club music 24 hrs round. i lived on 25/F. could still hear the music even at 4am when i woke up in the middle of the night 4) $20 resort fee is kinda high. i read the binder inside the room saying we get free newspaper and 2 cocktails everyday. however, we never get them. Be fair 1) central location, walking distance to most of the places

Reviews.Title: “Always a good time”
Reviews.Author: b168
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Great hospitality. Buffet wasn't great. Bellagio will be the best for me. Aria's buffet, oddly, didn't have a salad or fruit bar and they charge resort fees to get wifi in your room and allows you access to the fitness center. What if you don't work out or bring a laptop?? They still charge you for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BUbear81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria while my husband attended a conference. The hotel is new, and the decor is very modern. Our flight was delayed, so we were late checking in. The desk clerk tried very hard to get us a king room on a higher floor. He was not successful, but offered for us to change rooms after the first night. He gave us meal credit for that night for our trouble. They were not obligated to do that since our reservation through the conference was simply for a king room. Food and service were both very good. Room was great with control for TV, lights, curtains, AC all on the bedside table. Only small complaint was that it was a little hard to get to the strip if you were walking.

Reviews.Title: “Was pretty Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: donotcomplain
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a wonderful hotel to stay at for a Vegas experience. The check-in procedure was smooth and easy. The rooms are beautiful, a bit of a perfume smell upon entering, housekeeping used an o-zone machine in our room and that helped for a day and then the odor returned. The pools are simply beautiful, with enough lounge chairs for everyone and the atttendants remove unused towels periodically (a practice, I wish more MGM Hotels would follow.) The casino was fun; clean air, available machines and the cocktail waitress came by regularly. I will definitely return to Aria.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful! sleek and modern”
Reviews.Author: jenjenjenmarie
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. Perfect central location for exploring the strip. Beautiful large comfortable clean well equipped bedrooms. Only downside for me is the air freshener in the hotel was really strong and gave me a bit of a headache/nausea. Couldnt spend too long in casino without needing some fresh air! But luckily it wasnt so noticeable in the bedroom. I'd definatel recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We keep all the smiles in the back room.”
Reviews.Author: Andrewpunch
Reviews.Content: The wife and I went out over the 4th of July weekend on a comp offer from Aria. We are 34 and 32 years old. I go to vegas for conventions/sales often so I have a few comparison points to judge Aria on. We had room 7217 the basic king room from what I could derive from the website. We arrived around 11:00 AM not expecting a room to be ready. We waited in line at the invited guest checkin for approx 20 mins. The girl checking us in was not overtly rude but the check in could have been done at an automated kiosk for as warm as she was. It took till we were leaving for her to make eye contact with me during the checkin process. Head down at the computer the whole time. We get to the room and get everything turned on. The room was very nicely decorate and had a good feel to it. I will say our view wasn't anything to write home about but I don't really care much about it. We were on the backside of the hotel so there wasn't any noise what so ever. I played with the touchscreen controls for a while and found them easy to use. The one thing I didn't like was the length it took to go between screens for TV channels. I abandoned the touch screen and went to the remote control also in the room. I just found it easier to use. There was one minor issue with the room. The shower head had a leak at the joint that sprayed water 90 degrees into the bathtub. There is no reason to raise a fuss about this but it just showed me that Aria doesn't take care of the small things. We did eat at the skybox cafe and it was good sports bar type food with the typical resort prices. The pools were amazing. That was the best part of staying at Aria. I didn't visit liquid because I was having more fun in the main pools than I expected. Check out was a breeze, I did the text message checkout process that was fun. The one tip I have for anyone staying here is: If you are grabbing a Taxi go to the North side taxi stand it was almost always empty. When you get off the elevators turn right and follow the sign past the Jean-Phillpe shop. It is much closer than the main entrance as well. To Sum up: The rooms are very nice. There is nothing special about the hotel. Unless they plan on training/retraining the staff, I would put in self-service check in kiosk. That would save MGM some money and eliminate the lines. Mlife comps are not as good as the use to be. Sidenote: I am a share holder of MGM Mirage and read the quarterly statements regularly. City Center has yet to turn a profit so as good business management they are driving out cost as much as possible and increasing revenues where they can. I feel this is why everyone at Aria is grumpy. There isn't any extra money floating around for the staff. My stay was fine and that is just the problem it was just fine. If given a choice I would stay at Wynn/Encore, Venetian/Palazzo, Bellagio, Caesars or Paris before returning to Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern - very impressive”
Reviews.Author: RichlandMiniBreakers
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with all the amenities. Tram service to Bellagio was very convenient. It's very much the 'hotel of the future.' The buffet is A+ - we went during 'gourmet' night (or some such event - it's what's offered on Friday and Saturday night) which included a glass of wine, huge crab legs and a whole lobster for us to split, as well as any other food imaginable. The only other restaurant we sampled at the hotel was the Coffee Bean, where we had breakfast twice. Much more expensive than Starbucks and no place to sit (we had to go to the Sports Book) but pain au chocolat to die for. So - the criticisms. They possibly went too far with the 'modern-ness' - everything is controlled via a central remote. Navigating through this thing is not so easy or quick. It took a couple of days to realize that much of this can be controlled via the TV remote control. Hard to describe here, but I would say that older patrons or those who aren't techie naturals may have some trouble. We're pretty tech-savvy and had trouble upon arrival ... but we did figure it out. The other bother was their $22/day 'resort fee' which apparently includes internet, USA Today, some of the gym, and probably a couple of other things. It's funny to me how the cheaper hotels offer all of these types of things for free, but the expensive hotels charge for all this type of stuff. With the exception of the gym, these amenities are the same wherever you go. The cheaper hotels will leave you USA Today at your door - at Aria, you had to go to the back of a gift shop - finding out how to get the paper was almost like a scavenger hunt. We had pre-paid everything, but apparently our pre-payment did not include the resort fee ... and wasn't aware of it until we checked in. I considered this a bit of a rip-off. For this reason, while we'd recommend the hotel and probably stay again, it won't be on the top of our list the next time we visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: DawnMarie418
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Aria in May and were very pleased with our hotel. Our room was cleaned everyday, our bed was so comfortable and we did not experience any noise issues during the night. The only thing that happened that was a little inconvenient was when we came back to our room on two different days around 4:00 in the afternoon and our room was still being cleaned. That was minor; we did not have to wait long. I appreciated that there was someone posted on the main floor by the elevators to monitor that only Aria guests were using the elevators. As far as the restaurants, we only did the breakfast buffet which was great. One day at the pools, we had to search and then wait a few minutes to get lounge chairs. All in all, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but has a few shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: lksium19
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to stay at the Aria for a conference I was attending in June and having it be on the room block at a rate of $159/night I couldn’t pass up the chance to try this spot out. Upon first arrival, I was a little distressed to see that there was no door man at this 5 star hotel to hold the door for you. I had 2 large suitcases, a backpack and my husband also had his hands full with his own luggage. One would think that someone would be available to assist in holding the door, but there was a man just inside the door who stood there staring out the glass instead. I’m not quite sure what his purpose was. Once inside, there was a PAINFULLY long wait to check into the hotel. There must have been about 10-15 positions open with 5-6 people in each line. Some people seemed to be standing at the counter for literally an inordinate amount of time. I don’t understand this either because presumably you have a hotel booked and all you really need to do it give them your license and your credit card and you should be on your way. When it was finally my turn to check in, the employee at the counter was pleasant enough and sent me on my way to the guest elevators which required you to truck it through the casino (where many places are carpeted) trying to wield your suitcases around everywhere. When we finally got to our room, it was very modern looking and had some interesting gadgets inside. The curtains even opened the first time you walked in the door. The major gadget boasting from the room was a touch screen panel which could control everything from the curtains, to your AC to the “privacy” light at the front door and more. You didn’t need to use this tool in order to access items in the room, it was just another option, and while as cool as it was, it was pretty unnecessary and I never really understood how to use it properly. I believe there is something on the front of it which dictates how dark it is in the room or something and it shines pretty bright at night, so I would put it face down on the side of the bed and twice when I picked it up to see what time it was, it activated everything. Turning on all of the lights, the TV, the lamps… at like 4am. Needless to say, my husband wasn’t too thrilled to be woken up that way! Our AC didn’t appear to be working and we were very hot the first night in the room. The temp only getting down to about 73 when we had it set at 63, so I called the front desk to have someone look at it and it appeared it was fixed while we were out one night because the temperature did feel colder, but not as cold as the number displayed which by the time we left was 67. There are many drawbacks to the room which I feel are worth noting: -Lack of outlets. There is a panel in the desk area which holds two outlets and many other plugs for things like hooking your laptop up to the flat screen TV. Unless I am doing a presentation in my hotel room for some reason, I really don’t see any value in this, particularly in Las Vegas. Besides that there is an outlet by the front door and then that’s it (with the exception of one in the bathroom). It would have been nice to have one adjacent to the bed to plug my phone in at night, instead I had to plug it in on the desk and then wake up in the middle of the night to retrieve it so I could use it to wake up. -The “blackout” curtains really aren’t “blackout” curtains in my opinion. Yes, they stop the light from entering, but only what it actually covers. The curtains hung about 1-2 inches from the ground which meant that light streamed in under the entire bottom of the curtain, and the way the curtain folded at the top allowed light to come in the entire length of the top of the curtains. The curtain is substantially long as the window runs the entire length of the room. This meant I was disoriented first from the 3 hour time difference I had and then again because I thought it was like 6am at all hours of the night. -The bed is um… not that good. Maybe if I had been sleeping alone I would have found it ok, but every toss and turn from my husband sent me feeling like I was on a waterbed of sorts the whole night. In addition to this, as others have commented, the pillows are terrible (unless of course you like “squishy” pillows). For my neck and shoulders they just left me in pain every day I stayed there. -Turndown service? Not sure if they actually have this, others have commented they have had it, but no one ever turned down our room the entire time we were there. -Trashcans- There are only 2 in the room…. Both in the bathroom. Just a little odd. There is a "resort fee" which is a daily fee charged to your room, but our group had that waived, so I am not sure how much it costs but it does cover the internet in your room and "the use of the pool and fitness center". One item we didnt realize was that you could actually also get a daily paper with your room key if you showed it at their little sundries type gift shop. The pool is also nice there. There are three enourmous hot tubs which fit 45 people each...one which appeared to be broken and there are cabana rentals available. One of the members in our group rented one for the day and it was very nice and well appointed with a flat screen TV, sodas, waters, light snacks, comfy lounge beds and a waiter type guy who would check on you for drinks. The pool on the weekend is a madhouse though. I felt like it was an MTV SPring Break special going on, so if you want to go in the pool, just be ready to push past people while in there.

Reviews.Title: “"Aria kicked it up a notch!!"”
Reviews.Author: jackie1223
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! My boyfriend and I heard such good things from friends and fellow co-workers about this place that we had to try it out. It was his first time in vegas and my second time and boy, was it ever a nice place to stay! Check in was super easy for us. We waited in line for maybe 5 minutes before they took us on..This might have been because it was late at night as we were catching the red eye coming in. The front desk staff were so friendly and accommodating to our requests..we asked if there were any upgrades available and he stated that Aria had overbooked but if we called the next day they would try and see if there was another room to upgrade to. We decided not to because our room was FANTASTIC! We loved the electronic tablet that welcomed us and the greeting was very neat. The tablet was great to control the temperature of the room, music, tv, blinds (our favorite part was the goodnight button next to your head that turns everything off). The bathroom was very nice with the glass shower and tub beside it. Our room was very spacious-be careful of the minibar though..if you take anything off the minibar or out for more than 30 seconds, they will charge you-fyi! Our room had a great view of the pool and other areas of vegas!! The pool is gorgeous with 4 pools, one that is the adults only dance party pool called Liquid which has cabanas and chairs for rent. There are 2 small hot tubs/whirl pools but it was so hot, i couldn't imagine seeing anyone sitting there. The pool area does get busy but there are so many chairs around that you are bound to find a spot. To get to the pool you have to bring your room key and its on the Promenade Floor. There are a few restaurants in Aria-we only tried Jean Philippe Pattiserrie which was very yummy! We basically had breakfast there every morning (probably not the smartest thing since it cost us about $25 for 2 sandwiches) but boy were they yummy! We had the breakfast buffet at Aria which was about $15, not too shabby, they had a bit of variety. Their casino area just didn't do it for me..Don't get me wrong, its a nice place, but there are many other vegas hotels that just give you that 'viva las vegas' feel and aria just didn't make the cut in terms of the casino..this is why i'm actually only giving aria a 4.5..Go play the price is right game-its a lot of fun when you can get the showcase showdown or play the games such as hole in one. Also! there are cocktail waitresses that come quite a bit so be sure to get your free drinks before you head on out! =) Overall, Aria was an amazing place to stay..the housekeeping staff always greeted us wherever we were and everyone seemed so friendly to help us out or even chat with us. The bellhop guy outside of aria was super friendly!!! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone as it is a great location and there is a tram that connects to monte carlo, crystals and bellagio..I can't wait to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “No WOW factor...”
Reviews.Author: FortMacPrincess
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas for my birthday and a well needed girl’s weekend. We stayed at the Aria resort and although the rooms were very nice the hotel itself lacked that WOW factor. Check-in took well over an hour which in my opinion is much too long. They only had 3 people working the front desk and a lineup of over 100, I am no mathematician but I could figure out we would be in the line for a long time and we were. After check-in we went to our room and were very happy with the cleanliness, newness, and the upscale features of the room. When it came to food that is another story! After 10pm we couldn’t find anywhere to eat in this massive hotel…at 10pm…in LAS VEGAS?!?! That was very disappointing as we wanted to spend the evening eating appetizers and drinking martini’s; that was a no go. When we did find somewhere to eat it was a very large, bright ‘café feeling’ restaurant. The food as bland and the service was lacking, so not the hip, vibrant feeling that we wanted in Sin City. The pool was lovely but again we couldn’t get food or drinks as only one waitress was working the whole pool, we ended up leaving and went to another hotel so we could eat and drink. We spent all of our time away from the Aria as the amenities were lacking. Check-out was very easy because you could do it over the phone and they were very fast at adjusting our mini bar charges (my sister and I touched everything and ended up with a large bill) The Aria has a lot of potential but they really need to hire more staff, offer better restaurants and iron out some of the problems before I will return as this is one of the most expensive hotels in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Burglars and Club Music”
Reviews.Author: Zorack89
Reviews.Content: On my fourth night there someone tried to break into my room at 2am. after yelling at him as he was slamming against the door repeatedly he finally went away. i called the front desk and they could care less. Also there was club music noticeably thumping in my room night AND day, They left food trash behind when they cleaned, didn't give me a new shower gel until the second try, didn't give me a liner for my ice the first day, and other small room issues. I am by no means a picky traveler often staying at the Luxor, or the Trump when i needed something swankier. Outside Vegas I often stay in a motel 6 type hotel. Though the room itself is far nicer than say a tower room at the Luxor, its many other negative qualities make it far inferior. Whoever gave this place 5 stars is crazy or on the take.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas Experience Yet”
Reviews.Author: ArcNeonBedlam
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about my stay at Aria. Room was large with beautiful view. Lights and blinds can be operated via TV remote. Casino itself is roomy, not crowded like others on the strip. Dealers were polite and friendly. Got a $50 per day hotel credit by booking through Southwest Airlines - This made the restaurants and room service reasonable. Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service and cleanliness, not so much.”
Reviews.Author: debbyirw
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very pretty and spacious. For a new hotel, I would expect the bathroom to be much cleaner. Vegas is so busy trying to make money, they've forgotten about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: A_Canny_Scott
Reviews.Content: Not as good as it looks. For all the money spent on this hotel it is very sad that it is let down by probably the most important part of any hotel, ie the housekeeping. When I made the reservation we had asked for a non-smoking high floor room. When I booked in the reservation staff didn't even look at my requests as we were offered rooms on the 8th floor one smoking the other non. We took the non-smokng one. When you enter the room all the money has been spent on the gadgets, and they are impressive, open the door the lights come on and the motorised curtains open to reveal full length windows. But lookng behind the gadgets and we came upon a broken lampshade about to fall off, someone's phone number left on the writting pad, food sauce dried onto the bar menu cover, bent and squashed boxes holding the bar snacks. And worst of all someone had been smoking in the toilet! So we complained and got put into a non-smokng room on the 10th floor which is a non-smoking floor, why weren't we offered this in the first place? Although better we did still have the previous occupants hair all over the duvet and sheets and they did have a slightly off white appearance as if not washed properly. If you are not bothered about the gadgets the Aria has go to the Cosmopolitan instead far more pleasant staff and very clean rooms, isn't that what a hotel should be about, the illusion that you are the only person to have used the room. Aria could do a lot better

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms & Amenities But Sub-Par Service”
Reviews.Author: foxmanb71
Reviews.Content: It was my 40th birthday and my wife and I decided to spluge and stay at a Vegas 5 star hotel. The Aria is one of the 15 or so 5 star hotels in vegas and after doing some research decided to stay there. We booked a vacation package on the Aria website which included Southwest airfaire and the room. I thought the price was reasonable at about $1100 for everything. Since we booked this trip 5 months ago, we also purchased the cancellation insurance for $100 just in case. When we arrived at the hotelat about 6 p.m. vegas time, I thought the entrance and lobby was gorgeous. However, the first thing I noticed was how long the check in line was. Sure enough, I waited about an hour before I reached the front of the line. It seemed like they didn't have enough people working the front desk and everyone was taking their sweet time. It got very frustratiing. When I finally reached the check in desk I was informed that the only King bed room left was on the third floor with a horrible view of the 2nd floor roof covered in air conditioner units and lights. I could have a room on the 19th but it was 2 queens. I was pretty upset since I booked the room 5 months ago. The employee then notified me that the room was at 102% capacity, which I thought was weird. She said I could come down in the morning and try to move to a better room after people checked out. At this point, I was tired of waiting and just wanted to get to the room and shower. We also were running late to our dinner reservation. So, I reluctantly took the key card and asked for a bell hop to take up our luggage. I was then told that it would take at least 2 hours for my luggage to be brought up. At this point I got really upset. Fortunately, my wife found a bell hop, batted her eyes at him and he agreed to take us up. I don't know how she pulled this off, but I wasn't about to question it. When we entered the room, the lights turned on automatically and the curtains opened up to a horrible view of the air conditioning units, just like I thought. It really made me upset and ruined my first impression of the room. To be fair, the room itself is very nice. The bed was extrememly comfortable, the bathroom is big and the shower is great. Everything seemed very clean and new. I really liked how everything from the lights, to the temperature can be adjusted using the television or the flat panel by the bed. The next morning I went to the gym and found it to be great. Lots of equipment and everything was modern and new. We then all met for breakfast at cafe vetro and the bad service continued. It took forever to have a server come over and take our order and even longer for the food to arrive. It got to the point where we had to speak to the manager of the restaraunt. When our meals did come, one of my friends order didnt' come out. He ordered the same thing as me but the server messed up and only put it in the system once. Again to be fair, they took his meal off the bill and gave us a few menu items for free. The food, when it did arrive, was fantastic. When breakfast was finished, I went back to the lobby to see about switching to a better room. When I arrived, the lines were even longer then the day before and I had no idea who to talk with. There was no line available for people that were already guests so I decided to wait in the check in line again. After about 20 minutes of waiting, and the lines not moving, my frustration was boiling. I decided to go over to the conceirge and see what they can do. Fortunately, I spoke with a friendly gentleman and he went and spoke to a manager on my behalf. He came back, took my cell phone number and said they will call me if a room becomes available. I told him that I was told that yesterday but have yet to recieve such a call. He said that's the best he could do. I then left for my room in "steerage" not feeling anybetter. Lo and behold, as soon as I got out of the shower I got a call from the front desk saying I got a room on the 54th floor and they would send someone up to take my bags in 30 minutes. Success!! I quickly repacked everything and was ready for the move. The bellhop came, we moved to our new room which had a great view of the strip and was about 100 squarge feet bigger with an extra closet. Needless to say, I was happy with the end result. The rest of the stay was very nice. I really enjoyed the casino and found the hotel itself to be very nice. On our last day there, we got a cabana at the Liquid lounge, which is the hotels adult only pool. You can get a cabana if you spend at least $500 on food and drink. Otherwise, you can get a chair for $50. It was very nice and the service was fantastic. All the beautiful people were there and I felt like I was in an episode of Entourage. It was a great way to spend the day and stay cool in the Vegas heat. My wife and her friends decide to get a massage at the spa but said the wait was very long. Other then that, she said the massage was great. $160 for 50 minutes. Check out, unlike check in, was a breeze. The line was short and quick. We were able to leave our bags with the bell hops after check out because our plane didn't leave until the afternoon. So, we walked the strip and did some shopping to kill some time, then came back, grabbed our bags and a taxi and went off to the Airport. In the end, I had a fantastic time. I know that Vegas is struggling in this economy and I got te feeling that the Aria just didn't have enough people on staff. The sense of 5 star service wasn't there and thats enought to make me want to look elsewhere the next time I am in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: jackzero
Reviews.Content: I dropped by Vegas for a day on a roadtrip and we stayed at Aria. I got a great deal online and wanted to stay at a nice 5-star. The room was spacious and amazing in every way. It's a bit off the strip, but there's a walkway to Bellagio and a tram to City Center. My room had a side view of Bellagio and I could see the fountains at nice. Parking is by valet only, but it's free except for the tip. There is a $20 resort fee on top the the price you are quoted. There's free WiFi and a small kitchen, which I didn't use except for the fridge.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: PinaColada02
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for a work conference and decided to come early and do a long weekend of fun before the conference with my BFF. I was debating staying here or the Cosmopolitan and I am glad I chose the Aria. It is a beautiful hotel - very stylish, modern and chic. The room was spacious with a high tech system that controlled the lights, curtains, temperature, TV, etc. that was fairly easy to use. The bed was so soft and really helped me sleep well, despite the loud music pulsating from the Marquee club at the Cosmopolitan which was across from my room and audible from there, despite the distance (I'm a heavy sleeper too which helps). The bathroom was stylish and roomy enough for me and my friend to dress and get ready each day. The pool area is really nice and there are lots of different areas to hang out. My only complaint about the pool is they need better food options pool-side but the drinks were awesome. The gym is incredible - huge with lots of machines and really cool ones I've never seen before. In terms of restaurants, we ate at Julian Serrano (average) and the Buffet (average). We had a few drinks at Deuces Lounge which is your typical hotel bar. I actually found the Vesper bar at The Cosmopolitan to be much cooler and the restaurants there better but it's easy enough to go from the Aria to The Cosmopolitan. If you like shopping, one nice thing is that the Aria is right next to a shopping center (Crystals). Overall I was really happy with the hotel and would definitely stay there the next time I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has the WOW factor!”
Reviews.Author: french4us
Reviews.Content: New hotel - we had to be in Vegas for a business event - so we splurged a bit on our hotel and chose the Corner Panaramic Suite - and WOW is all I can say! So worth the money we spent. Views of Vegas from 3 different sides of the room! Even the bathroom had windows on 2 sides and you could sit in the soaking tub and stare at all the lights at night! Service was great - lots of restaurants to choose from on site...also has a walkway over to a mall-very high priced stores. and it connects by a tram to about 4 other hotels-so it saves alot of walking. Only down side we had...no coffee makers in any of the rooms-you have to order in or go down to the lobby to buy at the pastry shop...which does have an amazing selection!

Reviews.Title: “Most fab hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: urban-anthro
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Aria in a year. I loved it the first time around, but was even more impressed this visit. Perhaps it is because of the truly wonderful service we encountered at every turn. This hotel is an architectural jewel, with meticulous hi tech rooms and fabulous restaurants. Spent 3 nights here, and one night at the Bellagio. The Bellagio seemed quite worn and dated in comparison. This property is a WINNER.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyScarborough
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Vegas for a surprise 35th birthday for my fiancee. We both loved ARIA. Overall, I thought it was an amazing experience and the ARIA is a great hotel with a superb staff. Check in went quickly. There were lots of people in line but there were also several lines open. We had reserved a city view room for 3 nights and got exactly what we requested. The room was very clean and very comfortable. The mattress and pillows were beyond comfortable. The in room technology worked great. I loved the electronic blinds - when I woke up on East Coast time the first morning, I opened the blinds with a touch of the button and got to see the sunrise over the mountains before going back to sleep. Housekeeping did a great job of keeping the room clean while we were there. The casino is very clean and well ventilated. I'm sure over time it will start to smell like the other older casinos but for the time being it is still very fresh. All of the staff on the floor were super friendly. The pools were clean but definitely crowded. Staff is nice but perhaps a bit understaffed on the poolside service. That being said, the pool bar is close enough to the pools to get your own drink if you can't wait! The gym was super clean and a great place to work out. The price to go to the gym is included in the resort fee. They have several different types of machines and weights. Also the fresh towels, bottled water and fresh fruit are a very nice touch for after a good workout. The only negatives I can attribute to the hotel were: - Room service took forever but it was late on Friday night and when the food arrived it was delicious; and - We had extremely poor wait service in the Cafe Vettro (i.e., it took 30 minutes to get a bloody mary and it had to be requested several times); however, other tables and servers seemed to be doing fine so I think it was just one bad person in a bunch of other great servers. We did not go back to the restaurant because of the poor service but there were so many other great places to go within the hotel and on the Strip that it was not an inconvenience. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to others and I look forward to going back again, hopefully someday soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Shawn058
Reviews.Content: MY wife and I stayed at the Aria for 4 nights on the 29th FLR. The view was great. from up there We loved everything about our room and the hotel aminities. In our opinion, this is the best hotel build on the strip. We will certainly go back to Vegas and stay at this hotel again. But for next time, we've just decided to stay longer. We strongly recommend this resort and casino to anyone looking for an excellent hotel to stay at, which is conveniently located on the strip as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Mceedees
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Aria from June 9th to June 12th. We have been to Las Vegas for our annual kid get away for the last eight years and have never had a better time. The room and service were amazing. Although I've read negative reviews concerning wait times at check in/out we never had a problem. We're not the type to go through the room with a magnefying glass. We stayed in a corner suite on the 38th floor with breathtaking views and room amenities that were far above any resort we have stayed in, The dining options were plentiful but pricey, then again you get what you pay for. We never encountered a bad meal or service during our stay and look forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: elgaz
Reviews.Content: Where to start......! Myself and my partner had planned a 5 night stay in Vegas as part of a long holiday travelling around California and Nevada. This was to be the last stage of our holiday, so we wanted somewhere nice to end on a high note. We looked extensively at the large variety of hotels available in Vegas and eventually settled on the Aria. Most of the hotels along the strip seemed to be excellent and have good reviews, but as we're both a fan of very modern hotels (versus the more 'traditional' style you might find at the likes of the Wynn or Bellagio) we decided the Aria was perfect for us. Having only been built relatively recently, it stood to reason that it would also have suffered less use and wear than the other hotels and would have fairly modern amenities. On arrival at the resort, the first thing that struck us was the size of the resort. The hotel and casino, coupled with the adjoining 'Crystals' shopping centre, truly takes up a serious amount of space. The entire front is glass-surfaced and has a beautiful water feature running along the wall which spans the length of the frontal pickup area. We had read reports that check-in times were quite slow, but I was happy to find that as almost as soon as we had set foot in the check-in area, we were immediately directed to a shorter queue and had no more than a 2 minute wait. There seemed to be a large amount of staff at the check-in desks, so perhaps this is something the hotel has recently remedied. Check-in was quick and the staff friendly. As is the norm with most of these resorts, you have to drag your luggage through the casino area to get to the elevators but luckily the casino floor didn't seem too busy at our arrival time. The ultra-quick elevator had us on the 26th floor before too long, and we noted that everything we saw en route was kept immaculately clean with no signs of wear at all. As soon as we entered our room, the curtains opened automatically and the TV came on with a personalised greeting. Nice touches. The room itself was excellent; large, spacious, with good quality furniture, a 42" Plasma TV, large minibar and numerous other features which were welcome. The bathroom was also large, with a fantastic shower and dual sinks for him & her. It was in the room that all the modern touches we were fond of became apparent. All the automated features of the room (the curtains, lighting, privacy/service lights at the door, music, billing, etc) were accessible via both the TV and also by a small touchscreen panel next to the bed, much like a small iPad in size and shape. It's a small thing but it's nice to be able to manage everything from the comfort of your bed for those lazy mornings when you don't want to get up. I wouldn't have enough time or room here to describe the resort itself in detail, so I'd recommend you spend a while on the Aria website which has detailed information on everything available. Which is, suffice to say, pretty much anything you like. There is a very large and well-run pool area, numerous restaurants/cafes, and numerous small bar areas dotted round the Casino. Although we did venture out a few times into the unrelenting heat, I'd imagine you could spend an entire week in the resort and not have to go outside for anything if need be! Unlike a number of other resorts which have a smokey smell in the Casino area due to the relaxed Vegas smoking laws, the Aria pumps a slight vanilla scent through the air conditioning system and this ensured that the Casino area smelt clean and fresh at all times. We found all staff we encountered to be extremely friendly and courteous, always making a point of saying "hello" even if only passing in the corridor. Room service was prompt and efficient, and I'd recommend you try it once - we were very impressed not just with the prices for room service food, but also how it was presented and how it tasted! We also noted that there is always a member of security at the elevator areas who checks that anyone travelling up to the room areas has their door card - always a good way to ensure there's no randomers roaming round the corridors where people are staying. Now, no hotel is perfect so I'll quickly mention what little negatives we could see. These were observations more than anything. First off, if you're a fan of 'character' you may not immediately take to the Aria. It lacks any kind of running theme like you may find at the Italian-themed Venetian, french-theme Paris Hotel, etc - it's simply a very modern building. This wasn't a problem for us as we specifically wanted that type of hotel anyway and found the modern design/decor very refreshing, but for those of you who want your hotel stay in Vegas to be more of a 'theatrical' experience, it may be worth looking at a few of the other longer established places. Secondly, the eateries in the hotel are not the most expensive around, but they certainly aren't the cheapest either. If you're on a tight budget, you may find the slightly-above-average prices a little much, especially if you're only after a small breakfast or lunch. There are numerous other places nearby on the strip which offer lower prices so it may be worth venturing out. In saying that - we had breakfast in the hotel buffet once, and thought it was excellent value. You can pretty much fill your plate as much as you like and the variety (and quality) of food on offer was superb. Other than that, we had no negatives whatsoever and would highly recommend the Aria. We're hoping to head back to Vegas in a couple of years and Aria will definitely be our hotel of choice again.

Reviews.Title: “It was better than I had hoped for.”
Reviews.Author: LarryJohnson64
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable. The things you could do with the tv remote was awsome, curtains, lights, tv, etc. We were on the I-15 side and still was an impressive view. We also attended the Elvis show and loved it. The food was excellent, but pricey at the ones we eat at. The decor was very well done for the hotel and casino. Excellent location for getting around on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy rooms, but service at this hotel is lacking!”
Reviews.Author: CardQB
Reviews.Content: We decided to try out Aria after four nights staying at the MGM Grand with the hopes of finding a new MGM property hotel for next year. After trying out the Aria, we're going back to the MGM Grand. For such a new hotel with such high ratings, the service at this hotel is lacking. We arrived in our own car to valet, pulled up, got out of the car and waited.. and waited. Finally a valet attendant came up to us to take care of the car. We asked for the bell man to get our luggage. The valet had to yell out three times to get someone to come and get our bags. So much for first impressions! Valet and bell service, both negative. We went to the check in desk, were only one person back, and the wait was too long. Must have taken 15 minutes and my wife and I had split off for two clerks and it didn't help. We got our room no problem, regular room, city view on the 15th floor. Once up to our room, we called down to the bell desk for our luggage. It took nearly 30 minutes for our luggage to arrive. Unacceptable!! We had places we wanted to go and had to wait and wait and wait. The room was clean and fancy. Wouldn't expect anything else from such a new hotel. The high tech features were fun to learn and use (We loved the privacy light and lighting controls). But the room controls showed the name of the previous room guest our whole stay. There were fingerprints on the ceiling, really annoying to look up at when in bed. The "blackout" curtains did not make the room dark.. as soon as the sun came up the room was bright since the curtains don't stay flush against the wall and window. So much for playing at night and sleeping during the day! While we are spoiled by MGM Grand's suites, the room in Aria felt congested. They used the nice size refrigerator and stocked it full of mini bar items to buy and even used a good portion of the desk area for more snacks and drinks to buy. The restroom was small with two sinks in such a tiny space and be careful.. the shower floor is slippery!!! We love to play poker on our stays in Vegas. Always hit the MGM Grand poker room and was excited to try the poker at Aria. Wow, what a difference! We were there on a slow Wednesday and yet the people at the podium to sign up for poker with were rude, made little to no eye contact and quickly brushed you aside to perform their other duties. Oh how it made us miss the smiling faces at the MGM Grand poker room. Dealers at the Aria were silent, just going about their duties, didn't have smiling friendly dealer at all. Looking forward to a nice dinner in the evening we made reservations at Bar Masa for Japanese. We arrived and were seated right away (positive!), but were given a dirty look when all we wanted was water with our meal. Guess they expect everyone to buy fancy wines?? My wife ordered two sushi items, California Roll ($28) and a Spicy Tuna Roll ($22) that normally cost $6 to $8 anywhere else. I am not a seafood fan, so ordered the Kobe Beef and Garlic Fried Rice for $34. We patiently waited for our food that took WAY too long to arrive with the restaurant nearly empty. Our water glasses ran dry while waiting, but were filled up shortly before the food arrived. The Kobe Beef rice contained about a handful of rice and beef (maybe a total of two cups?) for the $34 price and tasted mostly like soy sauce and was way over priced for such a small portion. My wife enjoyed her tuna roll, but found a crab shell/tendon in her California Roll and informed the waiter. They took it and return with another and told her to give that a try. She ate a couple pieces and found it was so salty she couldn't eat it. We again told the waiter and asked for the manager. The manager came over and my wife told her she just didn't want it.. said sorry, took it away. And our waters ran dry again! The next thing we knew the waiter came by with our bill, set it on the table and said here you go. No apology, no offering if we wanted something else, no saying if it was removed from the bill. Fortunately, it was removed from the bill so we quickly paid and left. Nearly $70 for a sushi roll and some rice. Horrible restaurant, avoid it at all costs!! The next day we woke up early because of the sun shining through the blackout shades and just wanted to get as far away from Aria as possible. We stopped off at one of the bars to get our free drinks with our coupon from the front desk. It was the slowest bartender we have ever seen, slowly finding his lemons for other customers drinks, ran out of something, slowly walked to far end of bar and spent a minute or two there. Ridiculous! When it was our turn he just walked up and look at us.. no hello, no can I help you, nothing! (he didn't see the coupons yet) We know the routine, so just told him what we wanted. I laughed to my wife that we should have just had a stare off until he spoke to us at first. Bad service.. only thing he said was "thanks" when we left. To get to valet we were directly all the way around the casino, instead of out easily out the front door. Sure, great to get people spending more money in the casino, but not good location or service for the customer. The bell desk was a tiny portable podium off to the center of the driveway that we gave our ticket to. The valet waiting area was cramped and tiny, but air conditioned at least. Bell man was friendly and polite! FINALLY!!! One out of... we lost track. To sum it up, great hotel because it is so new.. looks great, very clean, fancy.. staff and service subpar. Expected so much better. Aria should take notes from it's bigger brother, the MGM Grand, on how to take care of customers. We won't be back to Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Lynette51
Reviews.Content: Being frequent visitors of Las Vegas we tried the Aria for a Father's Day stay. Beautiful resort. Check-in was a little slow as has been mentioned in other reviews. They do mention several times if you so much as move any item from the tray or tray itself from the counter in your room, you will be charged for misc. food items. There is plenty of counter space though so just steer clear if you're worried. We had a standard king room that overlooked all 3 pools. As soon as you enter the drapes open and music comes on. The hard part was finding the in-room safe. Hint: it's in the nightstand. Ours was locked so we had to call housekeeping and they were there promptly to open & clear the combination. The bed is so comfortable. You literally sink in it. And the pillows again heavenly. There is a control bedside that controls everything ie: drapes, sheers, housekeeping, temperature, tv, music & lights. The bathroom does have the tub within the shower. But again plenty of room in the bathroom and plenty of towels. Housekeeping service excellent. When exiting your room yu push a buton for housekeeping. Room amenities are good and abundent. Pools are nicely kept. We did not see any children anywhere and lots of shade if you're not a sun lover. The staff also constantly walk around and remove any towels left to save a chair, which is nice, allowing plenty of seating for everyone. Check-out was no problem. You can check out via your TV. We did notice an error in our bill so we went downstairs to check-out and were prompty greeted by an agent with an ipad that made the adjustment and checked us out without having to stand in any line. All in all a very beautiful resort & worthy of the a 5 star rating. Hint: If driving in from out of town and using their valet, drop your vehicle off at the North valet. No waiting ever to pick up your car. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it would stay again”
Reviews.Author: marygg21
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our daughters 21st birthday. The hotel was wonderful very clean good location, staff at the hotel where friendly and helpful. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: JacsMB
Reviews.Content: 5 nights in Vegas and the room was wonderful, the service fantastic and all in all a wonderful stay at Aria. I loved Crystals shopping complex and the restaraunts in the area were all fab. The staff were very helping when it came to organising tours and bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Over promised...under delivered”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamust
Reviews.Content: I was number two in line to check in at 11:45pm,and it too one hour an 10 min. The lady at the desk new nothing and had to keep going back and forth to her supervisor. We had to wait in lines everywhere as there is so many people and not enough staff. Valet and bell desk are on opposite side of check in and so are the cabs. Just not thought out well. My stay was comped from the beginning, but targeted had paid somewhere else for better and faster service. We will never stay ther again...even if the comped again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!!!”
Reviews.Author: OJulie67
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at Aria hotel this week on a trip planned to celebrate my husband's 40th birthday. It was a surprise and he had no idea where we were going. We were only going to be there for 2 nights but we were ready to make the most of the short time we had there! We arrive at Aria and walk in to the hotel to the pleasant, sweet smell of vanilla. My husband immediately says, "WOW-what have you done?" The hotel is amazing. LOCATION~Location is good. Not far to get to the strip. A quick trip through Crystals mall or down the main entrance and down a long sidewalk and your on the strip. Really don't understand the complaints about the location. It's not THAT far back. CHECK IN~Check-in is fast. We only waited about 10 minutes in line. Angela is our desk clerk and she was outstanding. I tell her about my husband's birthday and she gets on the phone to her manager to ask for an upgrade. I had booked a standard king room. After a few strikes to the keyboard she asks me if I would like a junior suite, but explains that the TV is not facing the bed but rather a couch area instead. She also tells me the room is not going to be available for another 4 hours- I pause as we like to watch TV in bed and we really wanted to change our clothes and put on shorts as it was hotter than hell already! She notices my hesitation and offers me a City view room on the 18th floor, several free drink cards since it's his birthday and "some other goodies for us." I accept as we really wanted to freshen up, drop off our things and change. Now that I get home and look online and see the suite...I think we should have waited. WOW! Lesson learned!! ROOM~We walk into the room and the music starts playing, the curtains open and we see a pretty incredible view of city center and Monte Carlo. I was totally happy with the floor to ceiling windows, the ultra plush bedding and the view. The bed is probably the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever had the pleasure of sleeping in. OUTSTANDING!!! Husband is floored by the room. Probably one of the nicest hotel rooms we have ever stayed in...and we have stayed in many. He is immediately intrigued by the control panel that controls everything in the room. System is easy as pie to control and anyone who complains it's too complex must still be typing on a manual typewriter. I cannot understand how it's confusing to people. The room was clean, but I did notice a bit of dust on some tables and the phone in the bathroom. Now, normally I wouldn't even comment on this...but being a 5 diamond award winner, that just is NOT the norm or acceptable. BATHROOM-kind of a weird set up with the tub and shower in the same shower area. Never took a bath but I can see that being strange if we stayed longer. Ammenities in the room were restocked daily and the towels were standard towels but an ample supply. The shampoo, conditioner etc were nice but lower end bottles. 2 sinks and a nice hair dryer that worked perfect! Plenty of drawers and storage. Toilet has a seperate glass privacy door. CUSTOMER SERVICE~Later in that first day after a full day of exploring around the strip we come back to the hotel to get ready for dinner and a show and as soon as we get in the room, we hear a knock at the door. A guy is standing there with a tray of chocolate covered strawberries and chocolate dipped macaroons and a thank you/birthday card for DH. Nice touch Aria and Angela! Thank you! DH hates coconut and everything including the strawberries had coconut on them…so I am the big winner in this! Delicious! Scrumptious! Yum. Nice touch! POOL~The pool area of this hotel is perfect! Day 2- I get down to the pool about 9:00am and the pool is just opening. Nice older gentleman running the pool area is handing out magazines and checking room cards etc. I go in, get towels (they let you have as many as you want) head all the way to the back on the left (I hear this is the pool with the less kids) and find a chair. The pool area is stunning. Very well landscaped and pretty. Clean. The pools are gorgeous. There are 3 pools plus the liquid party pool. The first pool on the left has several kids in it. I pass. 2nd pool was all shade but looked nice for later in the day. I pass. The 3rd pool was just perfect! I feel like Goldilocks telling this story!! Drink service is fast and efficient but expensive! $15.13 for a grey goose and pineapple...but hey! It is Vegas. The liquid pool was not too busy the day we were there. The music sounds great but is not obtrusive to the other pools. Never went in as the crowd in line seemed to be of the MUCH younger early 20 variety and resembled that of a college frat party or Jersey shore crowd! lol Definitely not OUR scene. RESTAURANT~Had the pleasure of trying American Fish inside of Aria. We went for drinks and an appetizer and loved it so much we stayed for dinner. The service from Christian at the bar was so good. He was very friendly, but not over the top and really good to check on us often and had a great personality. DH had a beer here and I order the pinot gris and it was very good for a happy hour selection. We also get the white truffle mac and cheese and the fish and chips. (happy hour version small but delicous samplings) Everything was delicious. Devine actually. We are still kinda hungry and have time before heading over to the show so we stay for dinner. Halibut for myself and scallops for him. Succulent and delicious…we also shared the horseradish mashed potatoes. I know that doesn't sound like it really goes with fish, but it really was delicious! REALLY, really great meal. I wish we could eat there once a week! It was so good and one of our favorites of our short stay. Also had the pleasure of eating at jean philippe patisserie. Tried the chocolate croissant and it was the best dessert type yum to touch my lips in years!! ;) A MUST DO. SKYBOX BAR~Great little sports bar to grab a drink, watch the game and play video poker! Service was excellent. VIEW BAR~Not really sure what the "view" was, but the service was great! lol I guess it's mostly a place to people watch! EMPLOYEES~The employees at this hotel are outstanding! I cannot even begin to tell you how fast 2 1/2 days went or how much we enjoyed our stay here. From the taxi hailers to the management people-the customer service was stellar. I loved everything about the hotel. If I had one complaint it was that there is no fan in the bathroom. How weird is that? I saw the "vent." But we could never find a switch that actually turned on a fan...not even on the techno wizard thing-a ma-bob. But, if thats one of my only complaints...I think they are doing just fine!! CHECK OUT~check out was kind of a nightmare compared to check in. I got to see what some people complain about. The lines today were crazy! It was Friday, so much busier than the Wednesday morning we had checked in. There is no organization. It's somewhat like trying to pick the "best" line at the grocery store and then you have that annoying crazy lady complaining about her coupons not coming off her bill correctly. DH stood in one line and myself in another and finally one of us made it up to the clerk. He wins. No problems after that. Amazing place and I would certainly stay again!! Only longer!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel but the check-in and check-out process is horrible”
Reviews.Author: disneyfamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Las Vegas. We usually stay at the Palazzo but tried something a little different this time. I loved the look of the hotel. The rooms were very nice and the pools were never overcrowded. The one negative I have is that it took way tooooo long to check in and check out. We were able to get in our room way earlier than the posted time but the lines were crazy. Everyday we went down there they were long and we checked in on a Sunday morning. I can't imagine how long they would be on a Friday or Saturday. Not sure why I took so long when you have a reservation but that would be the only reason why I would not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not my favorite on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: gabeboyd
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Aria, it was a really nice hotel, super new, smelt really good (kind of tropical) and my room was insanely huge. Although this sounds really good, it wasn’t one of my favorite places to stay on the Strip. I live in Los Angeles so travel to Las Vegas quite regularly and have stayed at a handful of hotels on the Las Vegas Strip. Pros: • My room was amazing, I had booked the standard room and was upgraded. My room was almost the size of my apartment – it had a huge living room area with a full couch and flatscreen TV, very comfortable king size bed, bathtub (which I did not use), two sinks and a TV in the bathroom. I had a view of the Monte Carlo (a hotel I love) so that was quite cool. • Design of the casino and lobby was quite cool. There was also natural light coming through which was nice. • It was easy to get around the hotel and I never had to wait very long for the lifts. Cons: • Checking in and checking out took a long time • No vending machines anywhere in the hotel. So if you didn’t want to buy the expensive mini bar water you had to go to the convenience store on the lobby level, I found this quite frustrating. • The place where you leave your bags is outside, this was really annoying that you had to take your bags outside after check out. • The pool was okay, we had a large group and it was initially hard to find seats together. Going to the pool is one of my favorite things to do in Las Vegas and the pool experience at Aria was just okay for me. If you just want to go to the pool and lie there, this is the place for you! If you want a DJ and games and that kind of atmosphere, then it’s not. • Was a little pricey compared to other hotels I have stayed it, I guess this is because it's new. Also be sure to check your bill, they didn't take my resort credit off my bill which they were meant to. Overall I would have liked to have given it a three and a half rating, it was the pool scene and the other cons mentioned above that lead to this rating. For me a huge part of my Vegas experience is the pool and at the Aria pool there wasn’t much atmosphere by the pool. There is a pool club, which charges admission of at least $20 even if you are a hotel guest, but I often find these a little too much for me.

Reviews.Title: “Modern nice hotel but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: AgentM99
Reviews.Content: We divided our 5 night stay between Aria and Caesars and I wish we had never left Caesars. While the hotel and room itself was really nice, clean and well equipped the cons I am about to list made it a place I won't stay at again. Firstly check in took an inordinate amount of time. Not only was the line long but each person was standing at the counter for ages and ages. My check in was a straight forward one in the sense that all my information was already there, it was pre paid etc but it still took forever. I have no idea what the person at check in was seeing and typing on his screen but it took for-ever. This really put me off. Secondly, bag storage is outside the hotel. Not a biggy but after standing at check in forever the last thing you want to do is drag everything outside again. Thirdly, while the Aria is described as being a center strip hotel, considering how far back it is from the strip you may as well be staying as far down as the MGM. The driveway is very very long (can I suggest a moving walkway?)! and it was a pain in the butt! and the number 1 thing that put me off. Fourthly, we got charged $8 for a weight sensored bag of chips we must have moved. Some clearer signs on the mini bar.snack policy wouldn't go astray. Lastly, as somebody else has said the views are pretty unimpressive.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Modern”
Reviews.Author: tynetraveller51
Reviews.Content: Located in the middle of the strip. Ideal location for short stay in vegas. Very large modern hotel eg curtains draw back automatically when you walk inroom. Lights, cutains etc controlled with a remote control. Comfortable beds. Excellent buffet if you decide to eat in hotel. Our room was very quiet, not near lifts and well above the casino. Pool area and public areas very clean. Staff helpful. If you are intending to see more than one show check out the discount ticket shops on the other side of the road.

Reviews.Title: “Aria Las Vegas - all you need in one hotel”
Reviews.Author: SingleonSafari
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this new resort hotel. We drove from Palm Springs and it was great that on our first night, we could enjoy a great dinner in Sage, the signature restaurant, see a great show, Viva Elvis, play the tables and get the elevator home. It is a hotel with lots of modern sleek lines and on arrival the exterior is an impressive, massive infinity waterfall wall. Loved the funky tech features: as you enter the room the aircon & interactive TV comes to life and the curtain sweeps back to give you a jaw-dropping view of The Strip from floor to ceiling windows. Our suite was high up and my favorite thing was lying in marshmellow soft bed looking out at the Vegas night life. The suite interiors are hushed, cool tones that offset the crisp white linen on the magnificently soft, orgy-size Sealy bed. The first thing we do when unpacking is put our valuables into the room safe and this was no ordinary safe... built unobtrusively into a bedside table its solid enough to secure the Crown Jewels and your winnings! The Aria pool is THE place to be seen, sipping on a frozen Mojito. The jugs are better value and you need one, in these desert temperatures. We parked ourselves at the bottom end of the main pool and its was a never-ending parade of bikinis and boardshorts. It rocked! We arrived at the pool in the afternoon, too late to hire a cabanas, but would recommend the exclusivity and the private mist spray to keep your cool in these temperatures. For a big city I was amazed how easy Aria was to get into and out of and the free self parking is simply a bonus. Last thoughts on Aria, do dine in the Sage restaurant. Its subdued lighting oozes uber chicness, a respite from the sensory overload of Vegas. I recommend the creme brulee fondant of foie gras followed by the New York Strip steak. Yum!

Reviews.Title: “Better than our home away from home, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: KSherman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria Sky Suites from June 15-June 18, 2011. This hotel as the best customer service I have ever experienced. They assisted with booking show tickets, reserving dinners, and even checking in for flights home. They have this amazing turn down every night at 5pm...we would return to our room with it cleaned again and little chocolates at other side of the night stands. This hotel is so clean, all staff are super friendly, the restaurants are great value and amazing food. We spent 3 days by the pool and it was a great experience! The cabanas were a splurge well worth the money in the 42 degree weather. I can't wait to go back and stay at the Aria again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Please sort out the smell”
Reviews.Author: colandchaz
Reviews.Content: Aria was excellent, modern & had everything we expected to find in a Las Vegas hotel. The room was large with excellent bathroom facilities and a well stocked mini bar (Expensive) The brochure boasts views of the strip from every room however, they fail to mention how bad the vast majority of them are. The one big gripe we had was the smell in the casino which was a sickly vanilla mixed with smoke smell. We visited the majority of the hotels on the strip & the Aria casino smelled the worst. Food is great however I would avoid Jean George's steakhouse on the first floor which is seriously overpriced for the quality of the food provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Fantastic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: LucaSora
Reviews.Content: We got in early (10 am ) and got a room straight away! There was a small issue with the first room and they changed our room allocation within seconds - we didn't even need to get new room keys. Top friendly staff and very competent! Got a room on the 26th floor overlooking the pool! The curtains open automatically when you enter the room! All is controlled with a remote device - top notch! We had a few great meals at the restaurants! Our favorite was the coffee shop with the super jummy bakery! The rooms are huge!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you build a 4000 rom hotel, make sure you can handle the numbers!”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria as delegate at a conference. Firstly, I arrived at 1.00 pm and after standing in line for 15 mins at check-in was told to come back at 3.00 which I did and was told to come back again in half an hour. This was particularly irritating because others who came after me were sent straight to their room. The most frustrating wait was for breakfast!
