A line zigzagged like the security line at the airport and on the first day I assumed it was because we were waiting for tables! No - not at all - it is because of the ridiculous prepayment system they follow including producing photo ID together with your hotel key card. If I were the GM I would make a priority of eliminating queues. There simply has to be a better way and surely these things are taken into account, more so if you build a 4000 room hotel. Bottom line - impersonal and frustrating!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: HFTSM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful I loved everything about it. Check in was fast and efficient. Every employee you passed in the hall always acknowledged you. The room was fantastic. I would love for that to be my bedroom at home. We wanted a more casual dinner so ate a Cafe Vettro and the food was delicious. We also ate at The Buffet which had a great selection of food and all that we ate was very good. The desserts were beyond good. You have to go to Jean Philippes as everything was really good. We had drinks at a couple of the bars and the service was excellent. I really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to everyone going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Can they get anything right?”
Reviews.Author: GlobalSShoper
Reviews.Content: Ordered Room service was told it would take 70 mins and we were okay with this but it never showed up. The casino floor (poker room) was filled with angry dealers. And can we always say when you stay at Aria you might never receive the service you pay for. I always believe in giving someone a second chance and yes I wasted my money again, but the good this is I had a back-up plan this time. So I would like to add the personal needs more training in what customer service is, you cannt have a great product and not have exceptional service. I love the rooms but its not work the price since I can get better service at a budget motel

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice for business travel”
Reviews.Author: melody103
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to my stay at a "five star hotel" for a work trip, despite not really wanting to go to Las Vegas. I had hoped the Aria would be so awesome, it would outweigh being in The Tackiest City in America. Nope. From the massive, confusing and poorly-signed entrance/valet area (where outdated 90s one-hit-wonder tunes are blaring), to the young, naiive front desk staffers in the massive, perfumy lobby, to the loooooong walk through the casino floor to the elevator area (where more outdated 'hits' are blaring), to the so-5-years-ago chocolate brown hallways and rooms...to the also massive (did I say that again??) Vettro restaurant which is also (amazingly!) blasting music no one really wants to hear anymore....this place was a huge let down (massive). Speaking of Vettro...the first place I've seen dinner served under a metal cover since visiting a nursing home/hospital. The food was about as good. I can only reason that my table was so...far....away...from the kitchen door that the cover was needed to keep the food warm on the journey? Our server was very nice, if a bit odd. One plus was the meal at Jean Georges steakhouse...the server was also very nice, and the food, what little there was of it, was very tasty (thankfully the bill was being expensed...I could buy a week's worth of dinners for the price of a steak, one side, and a glass of wine there!) As for the actual room...while the fancy bathroom area was quite impressive, there were some quirks (I'm not the only person on here who found the toilet to be a bit high), and I don't like having my toothbrush, etc. all rearranged for me by housekeeping (ewww!) I would prefer an empty, cold fridge for bottled water, to an extortionist vending machine in my 'luxury' room (who 'buys' this stuff?), and if I had to do much work in my (dark) room (there was a desk lamp, but if you leave it on for an hour, you could brand cattle with it), I would have really been irked...I'm sure it's great for lounging, not what I was here for. The bedcover was all snagged, as if someone rubbed a giant piece of velcro all over it...it made the room seem kind of 'used up'. However, the bed itself, and especially the pillow, were very comfortable. I could not get the hang of the push-button lights/curtains/etc., and I had a total Mr. Bean moment when I tried to set the fancy touch-screen alarm clock and could not stop opening/closing the curtains and turning the music and bedside lights on and off repeatedly....the whirrrr the power curtains make is kind of eerie, especially at 5:30 in the morning! Really effective at waking me up though! (altho I set my phone alarm too after all that, just in case) I bet lounging for days at the Aria (I never did see the pool) is awesome, if money is no object. (I did have a quick manicure, and thought what I saw of the spa/salon to be really nice....the blank marble wall in the manicure area was like a spa for the eyes!) However, if you're in Vegas for business, overall, this is not the best, most functional location. Too much wasted time waiting for or walking long distances to things you need quickly.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: maria262055
Reviews.Content: we stayed in aria 5 nights in april. the room was clean and comfortable with an amazing view.from check in to check out everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a great hotel and worth the extra cost to stay there”
Reviews.Author: FZappa
Reviews.Content: We were just down for a short 3 night family visit and had a marvelous time staying at the ARIA. The rooms are not big but are well done. The bed linens, which I always find is a key indicator of how good the hotel was, are wonderful, very comfortable. A very good air conditioning system meant very good sleeps on all three nights. It did take us a short while to learn how to work all of the electronic controls in the room but after that it was very easy. The pools (there are 3 including one oriented more towards kids) are great. There are lots of trees providing shade if you don't want the full sun and they also give the impression that you are not in the middle of the strip in Las Vegas. There is good service from the pool bar. I cannot say enough good things about the concierge service. They are very professional and like all of the staff are friendly. They make complex things look easy. The casino is present in the hotel but does not dominate. Unlike the older hotels, the ARIA appears to be designed more as a good place to take the family, have business meetings or attend a convention. The staff appear to have been selected for their people skills and besides being friendly, have been given the mandate to correct any problems during your stay there. The exercise facility is well run. When you first arrive they provide you with an exercise towel, headphones, bottled water and papers/magazines if you wish to read. The machines there are professional quality and the facility is clean. I don't run into many places that make a point of how "green" their facility is and how they recycle. This is one of the few and the owners are to be commended for doing it.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Comfort, Both Relaxing & Exciting Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Girl76
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Aria. The bed was heavenly, the room spotless, the hi-tech features fun, the soaking tub relaxing, and the decor oh-so chic. Citycenter was a wonderful location for exploring the Strip. Very convenient. Especially easy to get to The Cosmopolitan, Monte Carlo, and Bellagio. It wasn't too much of a hike through the casino to get to the guest elevators (as it can be in other Strip hotels). There were tons of awesome dining choices both in the hotel and nearby. I liked the vibe in the casino; it was a nice place to hang out. The Spa was heavenly (although a bit pricey)...wonderful massage and common areas. I would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: CazzieD
Reviews.Content: Wanted to try one of the new City Centre hotels, so picked this one. It was definitely 5 star. Loved it! The room was amazing. Huge TV and tablet by the bed that let you control the lights, curtains, air con and the TV obviously! You could set the system to wake you up by the curtains opening, and the TV coming on to a chosen station. Bathroom was lovely. First room we got became very noisy mid afternoon. It was the disco at the Cosmopolitan Pool. I rang down to the desk to see if it was likely to stop later, but was told that since it later turned into the nightclub, it would go on through the night, and that they were aware there was a problem, so they give us a different room.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA Corner Suite sooo Suite!!!!”
Reviews.Author: StibFlorida
Reviews.Content: ARIA Checked in at the ARIA on a Friday. I am so in love with this property. This is our second visit and this time we used the corporate M-Life comp. Three nights in a Suite with some food credit and some free play. That is the nicest room I have ever stayed in. I have stayed in a Premium Palace tower room and, Augustus Tower room at Caesars but there is no comparison to this property. Even the regular rooms are outstanding at ARIA. “But on to the suite!” Wall of windows in living room and a 55 inch wall hung TV. Dining table, couch, desk, and a bar complete with a refrigerator. (Minnibar fridge also) Wall of windows turns a corner in the bedroom, and back wall window in bath. All windows are floor to ceiling and the curtains automatically open upon entering the room to a fantastical view of the strip and city center complex. Wow!!! WOW!!!!!!!!! Simply too nice, only room I ever spent any time in Vegas. All controls can be operated from the remote control. I never had to turn out a light of adjust the blackout curtains, just melted away on the comfy couch until I completely dissolved into the comfy bed. Powder room just off the entrance is handy for master bath privacy and contained a glass sink top that was approaching art status. Travertine bathroom with jetted tub, TV, large shower, dual vanities and toilet room. Futuristic toilet with a “Washlet”. This thing warm water washes your backside, front side, all sides and warm air dries the jobsite, all which come from the comfort of a cushioned heated toilet seat. A Japanese innovation that is just too dang cool. Real innovation here; I am not fond of gimmicky things but after my Vegas stay I have got to get one of these. They can really change the landscape so to speak; a full moon never looked so good! Price research reveals they run from five hundred to twenty five hundred bucks. The gambling was fun and up and down. The table limits were ten bucks and fifteen and up on the Friday and weekend. I love this casino. Layout and decorations just fit me and I am comfortable and happy here. We ate the weekend seafood buffet brunch at the ARIA. I came for the legs. That was done well. The price included a two pound lobster cut for two and it was good but having just had lobster at the “Palms” it did not compare, just a distraction really. The king crab legs were very good, medium to large if you looked for them but they were split so it was quite easy to maneuver. They are served cold but I had them steamed in about two minutes and that made them excellent and reduced the salt content. Quick and easy! The other buffet items were not good. Unlawfully overcooked lamb that even though I knew better I tried. I cried! Jerky was mere minutes away. Beef round that was just rare but tough and unpleasant, and no lamb chops. Pizza was good and I am not a pizza fan. Comes with wine but we drink water. Desserts are creative and excellent. Flan that was perfection, cooked to just the right consistency. Oreo something that was nothing like a cookie but was a divine chocolate something. Excellent gelato, I guess we have to call it that because we are in Vegas but it was fine homemade ice cream and sorbets. Also ate breakfast there once and although the egg station cooked was efficient and precise the other selections were mundane buffet food. No fresh squeezed OJ ( not the criminal, the fruit) but again the dessert was nice. Lago at Caesars by a mile. I am so sorry that I cannot express delight in the ARIA buffet but after two trips we swore off anything but a restaurant experience. That is my sole complaint with this property. I also will say that as I have gotten older I am not running to the B to wait in line for year to get buffet that is better but just another fancy buffet and you waited in line for a year!!! The other dining choices on this property are very good to exceptional. Lemon Grass Wonderful lunch here. Dim sum cart was fun, fresh, and tasty! Had the Pho which was very good and wife had a corn soup that was excellent with Satay Chicken. About fifty bucks for a nice lunch with three selections of wonderful dim sum. A beautiful restaurant with excellent service. Jean Philippe Patisserie This is a stellar operation. World class pastries, fresh salads, pannini, tasty sandwiches on an array of breads you would expect from a bakery. Wonderful coffee, and a world class cinnamon roll make this place my “go to” when I want a CharlieSheenWINNING” experience. Julian Serrano I was just itching to eat here. I have lived in Madrid and was impressed that Julian Serrano was from there and he was bringing his native food to Vegas. I just loved the food in Madrid and I was expecting the memory stimulating fine dining experience of yesteryear. Although the preparation was excellent, and the service sterling alas it was not the synapse building meal I had wished for. The restaurant was beautiful and alluring reminding me of Madrid’s tapas bars. The paella was beautifully presented just too similar to Jambalaya, not close enough to the classic Castilian paella. Too much tomato flavor and not enough saffron flavors. The rice was red from tomatoes instead of yellow orange with saffron. The chorizo was original and excellent and the seafood was fresh and tasty but overall it failed my test as perfect paella. The potatoes bravas were very good and the sauce was fresh. A well done dish but again in Madrid at “Las Bravas” potatoes bravas is a classic tapas dish that cemented synapses for future reference and Julian did not send a signal over those neuron pathways. Calamari was excellent presented with an aolei sauce. IMHO only! Very good just not the exceptional experience that I was expecting. About fifty bucks a person for everything. Paella was for two and takes thirty minutes to prepare. Now that part is authentic. American Fish by Michael Mina This was the exceptional dining experience I was seeking. I have to seek adverbs to distinguish this meal. First the restaurant is lovely, tucked away behind the escalator on the promenade in ARIA. The bar was beautiful with a birch tree forest behind the bar mirrored so it looks like it continues forever. Happy hour was four to seven and we thought we would try the menu as it contains many of Michael Mina’s dishes in smaller portions for five bucks each. One of a kind cocktail’s for seven bucks each. We had the shrimp and grits, fish and chips and a cheese steak sandwich. IT WAS STELLAR. Food was fresh and well presented. Shrimp and grits were the best I have ever had and I am from the gulf coast where many chefs prepare this classic dish with great success. Perfectly prepared grits, thick and creamy, containing chunks of smoky bacon and lightly laced with a smattering of cheese melted and mixed into the grits topped with a heavenly jalapeño sauce that was all flavor, subtle spice and two inch flags of crisp thin bacon standing between the shrimp which were grilled and on top of the grits. Perfect! Fish and chips were hot crisp bits of battered fish among golden fried potatoes accented with malt vinegar. Excellent!! Sandwich was a tremendous hit but was relegated to third place because of the first two unusually exceptional choices. We repeated the shrimp and grits and the fish and chips because of adoration for the flavor and my deadly sin of gluttony. Had a few cocktails, “Remember the Maine”, "Jasmine" and a "Blood and Sand" that were unusually interesting and prepared with utmost care and presentation. Excellent and just seven bucks each. We were so impressed we ventured towards the dessert menu. A sampler of four of his best and it was the final jackpot of the night. JACKPOT, JACKPOT, JACKPOT!!!! A mascarpone cheesecake, smooth and creamy perfectly prepared; rice pudding with lemon sorbet, tangy and sweet; a carrot cake topped with unbelievable carrot sorbet. It was a fine and creative combination; cake and carrot sorbet, beautifully colored and delicious. The final of the four was an excellent chocolate mousse selection topped with mocha gelato. This will be indelibly imprinted in our minds as a fantastic overall experience in dining, and all for under a hundred bucks. Thanks for the very happy hour Michael Mina!!! Praised the staff, took pictures and stumbled to the confines of the finest room I have ever seen in Vegas, an ARIA corner suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: scorpy_lin
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few months ago with family. We usually stay at MGM or Venetian, but thought to give this new hotel and its entire complex a try. Flew from Toronto and picked up a rental by the airport. The drive was very short and the hotel is very easy to find. Parking entrance was clearly marked and spacious. Very beautiful, minimalist and modern entrance. Well scented with a deep dark brown wood. Check in was very smooth and fast. Very little questions asked with very attentive front desk/concierge. Walk to the elevator was confusing at the beginning, but that's a given since all Vegas' hotels are like this. Once you get your way around it, it becomes a breeze. There was an added security to the elevator area, which was nice/annoying, depending on your mood. Rooms were marvelous. It's very nice to have soft music playing and the curtain open automatically when you first walk into the room. Very pleasantly surprised. My only concern is the touch screen master remote control. I found it easy to use, but I'm quite sure many will not. Like all top quality hotels in Vegas, the standard high quality amenities were provided. Aria is very spacious and its restaurants/food options are plentiful. Like every other Vegas' hotel, there is always a line up for the buffet, even when half the restaurant is empty. Food presentation was quite minimal, just like the hotel's overall design. But the quality was most definitely there. I counted 5 carving stations. But the highlight of the meal was most definitely their dessert. They have one of the BEST buffet dessert in Vegas. Connection to other hotels through its monorail system is easy to access and it runs quite frequently. All in all, it's definitely a place I'll wouldn't mind staying again, even when its price is steeper than other surrounding hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!!! Highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: citychic31
Reviews.Content: We simply loved it. The restaurants inside the Aria Hotel had incredible food to try. (YUM) We had an amazing city view of the strip from the 37th floor. Our room was very modern with the most comfy bed, it had a state-of -the art key pad to open curtains, dim the lights, music even check out....etc. It's so nice you don't want to leave. This place has a great casino, friendly staff, nice pool and a super location. Visited the City Center and there was plenty of shopping to do there, enjoyed the art galleries too. If you love Elvis you will enjoy this rocking "Viva Elvis" show by Cirque Du Soleil. All we can say is, "we had a great time and we are ready to go back for more!!"

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything except service in the bars”
Reviews.Author: Cookswoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights mid-week in June. It was our first visit to this property. The room was great. I pushed for a quiet one and was able to secure a room overlooking the pools on the 22nd floor. The only downside to the resort was the lack of staff in the bars. We had to wait or go to the bar itself to get drinks on a number of occasions. There were also few wait persons around the pools. This kept the property from being five-star.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Aria = Perfection”
Reviews.Author: cheekee
Reviews.Content: I loved Aria, and they were really great with service, cleanliness, and just the overall of the resort! We went to celebrate our anniversary, and they gave us a complimentary upgrade, as well as some goodies in the room. The room was equipped with a touch navigation control screen that controls everything from curtains, lights, tv, temperature, and much more! The stay was very personalized, and I'm sure that was the case for every guest in the resort! Their immaculate care and detail doesn't go unnoticed! For more about my experience, visit my blog at Aria Experience

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: mannyandmabel
Reviews.Content: We did not regret choosing Aria over the other newer hotels, and even compared to the established 5-star hotels. We stayed at a corner suite and it's very modern and hi-tech w/ a quiet zen ambience. The breakfast buffet choices have to be improved though.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with a strange location and great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: zuko3984
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is ok. Main lobby is nice but nothing spectacular. Check in was super fast. Casino was also ok but again nothing special. I also found the place to not have that fun lively vibe that i got walking through Caesars and Bellagio. I especially found this true late at night. I found Aria kind of dead after 3am while most other places on the strip were still going strong so if your a night owl it's something to think about. Room was really nice. Big and comfortable. I liked the whole touch screen technology that controls everything in the room. My main problem with the Aria is the location. It's set way way back from the strip. All the other hotels seem to be easy to walk right off the strip into the hotel. Aria seemed like a 10 minute walk to get from the hotel to the strip. If you like to walk from hotel to hotel in my opinion the Aria is not for you. Food options were good. For casual dinning I liked Lemongrass. Skybox was pretty good also. Jean Philippe Patisserie was amazing. Probably best thing about the hotel. For the more upscale restaurants Barmasa was pretty good, Julian Serrano was also good but kind of limited menu. American Fish is nice if you like seafood. Sirio Ristorante is very good italian food. Overall i thought the Aria was ok. I didn't hate it but it didn't excite me the and with so many hotels to choose from I wouldn't stay again and wouldn't recommend it unless it was at a really really good price.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian/Grazie rejects - come on over!!! This is your new home!!!”
Reviews.Author: LTTO78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria on June 2-6, 2011. This was our first experience at this new property, and had some reservations about trying it out based on some of the reviews we had seen. I should also say we had been loyal Venetian/Palazzo Grazie customers for almost 10 years, but it appears their ownership no longer appreciates customer loyalty, and we were looking for a new home. This was a combined business/leisure trip (jewelry shows), and the shuttle services provided were very good. We did arrive early on the 2nd, and thus our room was not ready which was expected. The bell service was extremely courteous and took cake of our luggage while we shuttled off to the jewelry shows. I received a voice mail and text shortly before noon that our room was ready, and we returned at about 2 PM, quickly retrieved our room keys andgot settled in. We had a 36th floor room facing west towards the mountains that was a great view, very peaceful and calming, something you don't get too much of in Vegas. It was a very nice contrast, and would gladly take the same room again! The hotel, rooms, restaurants were all very clean, well appointed, and very warming. The staff (from front desk, housekeeping, dealers, etc) all very genuine and gracious in their delivery of service. Pools are great, food is great, especially Jean Phillipe's for anything sweet....Expect to walk a lot if you want to get out, but that is not a negative from my perspective. I walked to/from Mirage, Caesars, Bally's, and Paris for the trade shows, and had no issues...Am definitely returning sometime soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tamigaga
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Aria Sky Suite and I highly recommend it. The limo service was prompt and the driver courteous. Check-in was a breeze with no wait whatsoever. The Sky Lounge was very convenient offering coffee, tea, unlimited bottled Fiji water as well as soft drinks and beer and wine after 4pm. with snacks at different times of the day. The room was spotless and had a fantastic view with a great layout. The room service was prompt and delicious. I am a very discerning traveler and extremely selective of the hotels I will return to but I will definitely return to Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience at Aria”
Reviews.Author: Kathy080912
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend (four days; Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday). My husband and I were a bit concerned at the mixed reviews of Aria posted on Trip Advisor. However, we did not encounter long lines at check-in or check-out and the staff was very friendly and competent. The bellman told us to use the invited guests check in, even though we were not invited, which was quick and no questions asked. We loved our corner suite; it was well worth the upgrade with a huge master bathroom plus second half bath, nicely sized bedroom and separate living room with couch, side chairs and desk. In addition to the mini-bar, there was a small refrigerator as well. The technical aspect of the TV, Lights, Thermostat and Curtains was cool, not at all difficult to figure out. The bed was comfortable although not as over the top fantastic that I was anticipating. Housekeeping always cleaned up the room within our requested timeframe. TIP: Always call housekeeping when you are ready to leave the room and tell them you need it cleaned as soon as possible or by a specific time. We enjoyed the pools; they were very nice although fairly crowded. Had lunch at the Liquid Pool, which is the party pool. TIP: If you don't want to pay the cover charge entrance fee to get in, they will allow you in if you have lunch, but you must spend $50 per person per hour. Liquid is loud and wild, lots of eye candy, but as a middle aged couple who prefer mellow music, the techno blast was a bit too much for us. While at Aria, we attended the Elvis Show, which was very good. We had breakfast at Cafe Vettro, which was average at best. Our best dinners were at Beso and Todd English PUB at Crystals next door, as well as the Palm at Caesars where we ate after the Celine Concert. (Main reason for our trip to Las Vegas was to see Celine; she was fabulous as always; 4th time for us). We enjoyed "window shopping' at Crystals, but it is very high end. There are some interesting "art pieces" at Crystals and we enjoyed the waterfall wall at Aria. We did very little gambling at Aria as the blackjack minimums start at $15. Our only complaint about Aria and it is a MAJOR ONE; the noise level from one of the nightclubs in the complex. We were inundated with the thumping music till 4:00 in the morning on both Friday and Saturday nights. We were on the 19th floor, so I can only imagine how much louder the music must have been for the lower floors. All in all we enjoyed our stay at ARIA, but if we return we will insist on an even higher floor and as far away from the source of the music as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Aria sets the bar for class in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kenika91
Reviews.Content: Fantastic property bar none. Last year I stayed at City Center's sister property, Vdara and loved it. After staying at Aria, I love City Center even more and will now make this my destination for Las Vegas everytime I visit. The room was on the 22nd floor. Great layout. Bed was top notch, with fantastic, very comfy linens. Bathroom was first class all the way. Loved the soaking tub and rainfall shower. Generous amounts of shampoo, conditioner, soaps, and lotion. View was spectacular - no view of the Bellagio fountains, but didn't mind at all. At night the surrounding City Center Complex reminded me of something out of "Blade Runner." I love everything about City Center. From the shopping at Crytals, to the dining options, to the gaming in the casino, to the lounges, and to the pool - it is all fantastic. To the management of the Aria - don't change a thing. You cannot improve on greatness. You have done the city of Las Vegas a tremendous favor by raising the bar of excellence and stellar service to visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - night terrors!!”
Reviews.Author: Practicemanager0
Reviews.Content: I am staying at Aria with my husband and daughter in corner suite. Travelling from uk we we tired when we arrived. At midnight someone accessed our room in the outside area where my daughter was sleeping. This terrified her and we we away on and off all night. We were advised next morning that it was housekeeping that came into the room. Why at midnight? Last night the room above were partying - ok even at midnight or 1 am - but not at 3 am. loud music and people gently having fun and crashing around...when others need to sleep. What disappoints me the most is the way the front desk staff handled my request as to why this behaviour is allowed. We now have to change rooms because the security policy at Aria is at this anti social behaviour is allowed at 3 am. We have to disrupt our four day stay and change rooms this morning. We have been offered $60 dollars which is kind, but what I want is for the hotel to get it right. Deal with the trouble makers don't offer inadequate monetary compensation and spoil our holiday rather than dealing with the issue.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ujustdoit
Reviews.Content: I attended the Aesthetic Show. Convention center was fine. Registration was sloppy. Receptionist was not very friendly and also marked the wrong Room # on my card. We arrived tired late night and ended up having to sort out the mess before we finally got into the room. Room was mediocre. No in room coffee. Housekeeping was also mediocre. Visited the Thai restaurant... OK Nothing great. Submitted a survey with concerns and never heard back Will not be back

Reviews.Title: “Super!! Will defintely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Gwinnett3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Aria Sky Suites and will return! The limo transfers to and from the airport and private check in was fabulous! The sky lounge where you could get water, soft drinks, coffee and tea 24 hours a day was an added bonus. There were always tasty treats there t0o and wine for happy hour. The suite was immaculate. The service was great. Free in room wireless access. Free access to the fitness center. The pool was fun. We have stayed at the Bellagio and Mirage in suites and this was by far a nicer room with extra amentities that made it m uch more bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not my top rated in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SJA in PA
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Aria with a group of friends/couples as a week-long vacation. We visit Vegas every year and this was our first stay at Aria. The rooms were awesome, but overall not my favorite hotel in Vegas. The fitness room was good, as was the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: babymomma36
Reviews.Content: So this would be hotel #9 in Vegas for me, and let me tell you...BEST EVER! First of all if it weren't for the service at the front desk it would have been #2 or #3...they didn't have any more rooms with a king bed in non-smoking, as we checked in very late, so they upgraded us to a corner suite...we won't stay there again unless we are in this suite (it is so phenomenal, and worth the extra $$$). Panoramic view of the strip, budai (sp?), 52 floor, one-touch control for EVERYTHING! But the best (in every room, might I add) is the bed...we actually bought pillows while we were there, as that is the biggest things we could fit in our suitcases. Also the food was great...snacks to mains...the casino felt like it was our own...even though it was busy in the evenings due to it's location etc. I just have to say the people that work there, the service, the food, the rooms...EXCELLENT! The pool was great too....no issues finding even 4 spots together!?! Never had that luxury in Vegas before! Loved the Aria, and will be back...and will pay the extra for the corner suite!

Reviews.Title: “Great newer Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: UsKosherTraveler
Reviews.Content: Free wifi - very walkable for conferences and otherwise. Central location. Comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: suebhoney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after receiving a terrific incentive offer from MGM, although a requisite resort fee was added to my bill. Overall, I thought the hotel was over-rated for the price. It's an average hotel masquerading as an above-average one. Although recently open, the room was showing wear & tear around the edges. The room was was noisy, very very noisy. I stayed on a mid-twenty-something floor, facing north, and the street noise bounced off & up the exterior of the buildings and reverberated at all hours of the night & day. In addition, the electronic controls in the room were difficult to figure out. The parking garage was difficult to navigate, and I resorted to parking at the Monte Carlo rather than the Aria after a couple wrong-way turns. The buffet was mediocre at best. The casino itself was very dark & cave-like -- not inviting, so I did not play at the Aria. While I appreciate the presence of security at the elevators, it made me wonder why it was necessary in the first place; as a female traveling alone, it was a bit of a concern. I found the employees -- from the concierge & check desk staff to the coffeehouse & buffet servers -- to be unfriendly and inconvenienced by my presence. On the plus side - the location is great and the pool area fab. I am glad I had an opportunity to stay here for a couple nights, but I doubt I'd ever go back. I think there are better values & friendlier places on -- and off -- the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ReadytoTravel51
Reviews.Content: My first time in Vegas !!! This was a solid hotel in a good location. Easy access to everything. Quality of the hotel food was so so.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Poor Ambience, Needs Better Restaurants and Bartenders”
Reviews.Author: checkde
Reviews.Content: Visited Aria for 3 nights with some friends. By the middle of day two we were spending all our time at the Cosmopolitan which had superior bartenders, food, and ambiance. The Aria hotel rooms were really nice, but the casino area is kind of bland and the bars (lobby, city bar, the one by the elevators) produce really poor drinks. The food at the 24 hour diner was awful and Sage was really overrated. The Tapas place was good and Bamboo was acceptable for a casino restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: danh31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is GREAT and we have no complaints. From the casino, the pool, liquid pool and restaurants ALL were great. We ate and both Union and the Buffet. While difference, both were amazing. Union is a expensive restaurant but it was worth every penny! Like others said, the hotel smells great and the decor inside is stunning is many different ways. We had a standard room, which was a nice size and extremely clean, bathroom was very nice too. The room service is the fastest I have ever seen- We called for more towels on several occasions, and by the time I hung up the phone room service was knocking on the door with fresh towels! We will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not my favorite in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CBrinker
Reviews.Content: Really nice new hotel, looks retro modern throughout the lobby and conference areas. Have to admit the gadgets in the room were really nice and the room service was GREAT! It was neat to be able to control all of the lighting in the room as well as the curtains through the TV remote. The two free drinks tickets at check-in was a nice bonus. Also, the waitresses on the casino floor come around often even if you are at the slot machines - that was a nice surprise as well. Food throughout the resort was very good, a bit overpriced but what do you expect in Vegas? Conference facility are well appointed and very spacious. Gym was perfect size, just enough machines and they all had TV's and good views of the pool area. Had a REALLY hard time figuring out where the gym was located...here's a tip - you have to go into the spa entrance to find the entrance to the gym. Another great trip to Vegas - thanks Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, user friendly elegance in the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: kimtaylor
Reviews.Content: The hotel was the most un-casino like of any that I have stayed at in Las Vegas. The air was cleaned well, there was daylight, interesting architecture, and user-friendly amenities at your fingertips, both at the resort in general and in the room. The restaurants were quite good, the Liquid pool bar was hopping, and the other pools were an oasis of calm. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The design: so great!”
Reviews.Author: Potvin_D
Reviews.Content: Very nice room. Very quick room service. You have to go down to receive your newspaper, I would prefer receive it at my door and read it with my breakfeast. Good security. We really appreciate the location of the hotel. The major shows were near. The most impressive thing: the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianSurrey
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out everything about this place was great. Would stay here again and would recommend to friends or family looking to stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dand1031
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and fantastic rooms! The rooms remote control will make you want to stay in the room...almost! Everything at the touch of your fingertips.

Reviews.Title: “Classy girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: L2Connelly
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for her Bachelorette weekend. It was just the 2 of us and we wanted to relax, see some shows and eat great food and shop. I had seen this hotel featured on "The Bachelor" and thought it looked amazing, so we decided to give it a try. It exceeded our expectations. This hotel is gorgeous! It's always exciting to stay at a newer venue. The rooms were very cool. Super comfy beds and the bathroom was large, which was great for 2 women. We had our own sinks and the bathroom had it's own separate door for privacy. Shower and bath are separate. Everything was electronic and high tech. When you wanted housekeeping to come, you punched it in to this master control panel, which lit up outside your door number "service please". They come right away too. My friend got hit with the stomach flu and housekeeping was amazing about returning to clean our bathroom multiple times. The hotel has many quality restaurants and a big variety. I did not feel the need to venture out of the hotel for food. The room service was top quality too. I had never had a better pizza in my life than the one on the room service menu. How random! :) Connected to the hotel is an upscale shopping center, with interesting shops and modern art. It was a bit out of my price range but if you love designer clothes and accessories, then you would love it. The pool area is quite nice and has a large area for lounging there. The spa was quite lovely, but I must admit, I had not experienced such an expensive spa before. Usually I can find something I can afford, but I just couldn't do it at Aria...this trip. Next time, hopefully, because it looked stellar. I am very impressed with Aria and this is definitely my Vegas hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChuckNYCUWS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the following hotels on the strip: Wynn, Venetian, Caesars, Mandalay Bay, Tropicana and MGM. Aria was, hands down, the best. Beautiful room with nice amenities. We were only on the 6th floor, but loved the room. Everything is hi-tech. Stayed here with a gay couple from San Diego and my partner and I were there for my birthday. We had an incredible time. Will definitely stay here over and over again. Only downside is the spa. Just so so. I booked an 80 minute massage with Chris H, who was awesome, but the spa itself was just "eh". Qua at Caesars is the best on the strip and the spa at Mandalay ranks a close second. Overall, I loved Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lmguyton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas for our anniversary. After alot of research we decided on Aria. The entire hotel is beautiful. The enterance, gaming area, pool area and the rooms have a great contemporary, but comfortable feel. We booked a standard room, but were offered an upgrade upon arrival. Our package came with transportation from the airport. This was a little tricky. We were dropped off and picked up in a loading area far from the hotel lobby. Dining in house was very expensive. Overall, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great addition to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: TheRanj
Reviews.Content: We got a last minute deal to this hotel and tried it out a couple of months ago, and were pleasantly surprised. The whole City Center complex is quite nice and busy. We went to a couple of restaurants on-site (can't remember the names) and Gold Lounge one night and were quite happy with all. It is a very clean hotel (maybe because it is newer), and the Casino was fairly smoke free. One blemish was our time at the Spa, we both booked a package for it and were quite happy, but they overcharged us and we didn't realize it until we checked out. We had to escalate to the front desk manager who resolved the situation for us, but otherwise a great trip. Another nice feature - the valet lets you call down before you come to their desk to bring your car up earlier, a first for us in Vegas. I will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Guilherme_Mendes
Reviews.Content: We loved: everything !l : big and confortable room, big size beds,spetacular view, good pillows, first class bath accessories, location, staff, services, pool premises. It was the best cost-benefit hotel we had for more than 35 years on the road. We hated: restaurants and bar prices. Very costly.

Reviews.Title: “Chrome, steel and high tech”
Reviews.Author: dkhay
Reviews.Content: Nice room, took a while to figure out the lights, TV, curtains, sound - all controlled by high tech panel off the TV screen. Bad pedestrian traffic pattern for City Center - no easy way to get to Aria, Cosmo and the rest of the strip. They should just take the vehicle traffic off of the Strip and run a monorail down the center.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: kirbdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria from June 06-11 in a city view single room. We loved everything about the place. The room controls are very easy to operate and I am not very technically inclined. Great view of the strip. Room number was 17032 and the area was very quiet. No issues with the shower/bathtub combination whatsoever. Visited the pool area three times and even in the middle of the afternoon there was an adequate number of available loungers. Drink service was good, and the drinks are a little high, but you are in Vegas, I didn't have a problem with it. Was very pleased with the friendliness and overall professionalism of every staff member we encountered. I like the security personnel in the elevator areas on the casino and promenade level. Cafe Vettro is good food at what I consider reasonable prices. I do think that they need to decrease the size of the area that the waiters are responsible for, however. Buffet was good at breakfast the one time we ate there. My wife had her hair colored at the salon and very pleased with the result and the price. Elements, the "general store' was well-stocked and convenient. I would certainly recommend this hotle and we would stay here again. Bellman service was quick and professional upon arrival and departure

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: christy819
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice but the reviews and all the hoopla are way overstated. O top of paying way too much $$$ a night, there are charges for everything you do here. They advertise that the rooms come with a mini fridge, but what they forget to mention is that, like most overpriced hotels, it is fully stocked with $4 sodas and $12 bags of peanuts so you cannot use it for your drinks and/or water. On top of that they have another fully stocked/overpriced bar that sits right on top of the desk that you lay your purse down on. This is so that you knock over all of the $20 bags of almonds when you go to grab ur purse and "accidently" bump these items and have to pay for them when you do not consume them. They also have a resort fee that is not included in the price and it includes things that you typically don't use when in Vegas anyway. The bars that are inside the hotel lobby are just as overpriced as everything else here. The minimum for a drink is $20.00, so you are better off going to a destination outside of the hotel. The casino is the one place you want to stay away from. I am not a big gambler at all, but can tell you that the time I spent there, I never saw anyone win and the ones I talked to said they had not won nor had they talked to anyone that did. This hotel is not anywhere near worth the money it costs to stay there. I canot recommend this hotel at all. When we go back we will stay somewhere different. You are not in your room when ur in Vegas anyway, you are out on the strip or sighseeing. You are definitely better off to not spend money on an overrated hotel that you only use to sleep in. There are hotels in Vegas that are clean, safe, and walking distance to the strip that do not charge resort fees and are much more economical than the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel lacking in customer service”
Reviews.Author: pols0019
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern, nice and clean. Check in was pretty slow, we waited in line for about 20 minutes. We were staying with some friends (at the same hotel) and they were not able to put us in 2 rooms near each other. this was a huge disappointment. During our 3 night stay I had to complain everyday in order to get our room cleaned. apparently I was supposed to hit a button on the wall in order to get the room serviced. On the positive side, the bed and pillows were one of the most comfortable I never slept in. The room also had floor to ceiling windows that gave a great view. the restaurants were all very expensive however the ones we ate at were very good. burgers at the skybox were excellent. the buffet was also a pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MickBaby8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were down in Las Vegas recently for a quick get-away and we stayed at the Aria as this was one of the hotels that we have not stayed at. Had a wonderful time there. Really enjoyed the room - it was well appointed and quite high tech. Loved how all the lights turned on and the curtains opened just with us walking into the room. There was a control panel right by the bed which allows you to control everything in the room from the lights, to the TV to the tempurature. My only complaints was that the toilet was "dirty". What I think was someone did something to it and marked up the toilet, so I don't think you could clean it (not that I tried!) but it was just disconcerning everytime you have to go and you look at a "dirty" toilet bowl. Also there were a few lights in my room that weren't working. I would think that the housekeepers would check these when they clean up so the guest wouldn't have to report it when they check in. Beyond that I really liked the room. The hotel was really nice too - we ate at the bakery, it was alright - nothing great (crepe, coffee, salad). The Elvis show was not bad - when we bought our tickets we got the second row and the person selling us the tickets kept saying how great our seats were. Well, they were close yes, but they were off to the side and so we couldn't see everything that was going on, so just keep that in mind if you are going to watch the show. The casino is nice and we enjoyed all the games they had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed with Las Vegas' Aria Resort”
Reviews.Author: Webmiller
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Aria Resort and Casino in Las Vegas. We were sent a special invitation through the mail for 3 free night stays. The Aria is part of the MGM group of resorts. The rooms were exceptional and very modern. Upon entering our room the drapes opened automatically and the television turned on and welcomed us. The beds were great, the room plush and the service excellent. The buffet is also something I highly recommend. Excellent food and a large variety of choices. Everything is a bit pricey but this is a high class resort so we expected that. The casino slots were a bit tight and the table games were good. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JudyJackpot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria on our last trip to Las Vegas. As members of their players club we were offered a comp stay so we couldn't pass it up and went for my husband's birthday. Upon arrival our check-in was a breeze and we were off to our room. The room was large and we had a view of the mountains as well as the pool down below. Everything seemed to be in order or beyond as far as cleanliness goes; clean linens, bathroom, carpet. All of the employees we encountered (check-in clerk, housekeeping, the waitress at the cafe, casino staff) were courteous. I am definitely looking forward to our next visit to Aria!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, But Wouldn't Spend the Money To Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: truenic
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about anything at the hotel per se, just that everything was really expensive! So, it's more a matter of where your priorities lie. We're backpacker type people who don't mind staying in pension/hostel type places but also stay in nice place when travelling for work (and the company is footing the bill). Personally, I don't see the value in spending hundreds per night for a place where you're only going to be sleeping & showering (but that's just me). If you like fancy, upscale, then this is the place for you. If you're just as happy at the Gold Dust, then skip it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Best Beds-Ever”
Reviews.Author: artsafire
Reviews.Content: I'd stay again, and would love to try all of the restaurants, Sage will be on my list for the next visit. We went to Juliano Serrano's Tapas Bar- twice....lovely food and nice modern twist on tapas, perfect for lunch and light bite before a show. We saw Elvis, fun and great couch like seats. There was more to do than we could fit in in 3 days so....take that extra day.

Reviews.Title: “I travel 80 days a year...and this is my favorite hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Jaewriter
Reviews.Content: I could move in here and never leave and be one happy puppy. Upgraded to sky suite. Livingroom, dining room, bedroom, 2 bathrooms, 6 flat TVs (I lost count!), steam shower, walk in closet, high tech operations, insanely fast wifi. Everything you need and amenities you never dreamed of. The hotel even smells good. In Vegas, that is insanely important where the smell of cigarette smoke usually makes me stink and soaks into my clothing. Great restaurants, great location, great service. I am notna huge fan of Vegas, but I am already planning my next trip to this haven mid-strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: opalset
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 3 nights. The wait for check-in can be a bit long but once checked in the rooms are great. The "electronics" take some working out but once sorted are easy to use. The hotel is clean and efficient and we ate in the hotel 2 nights and the food was superb. The hotel is slightly off the strip but a quick walk soon gets you to the main strip Well worth the stay

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again definitely!”
Reviews.Author: musicmama28
Reviews.Content: Went on a couples 40th birthday trip to Aria and loved everything about it. In fact, after touring lots of other hotels on the strip, all couples said they liked the vibe more than any other hotel and everyone would stay there again when/if we go back. There was just something about the "less flashy" feeling that we all liked. Modern, uncluttered, clean, classy, new, techno are all words to describe this place. Customer service was great. Room was good...loved how high tech it was. Enjoyed our cabana on pool day and enjoyed all meals that we had at numerous places on - site during our stay. Also, the clientele here was a notch above many other casinos. Shout out to Tom our favorite bartender. Aria is 5 star for a reason. Wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property for Fun and Value”
Reviews.Author: Lola1177
Reviews.Content: Although we had played at Aria before, we had never stayed there till this trip. Check in was a breeze as our room was comped; the room was a standard vegas "up property" type room with standard ammenities. Gaming was tight but as long as you were playing, comps were plentiful. However, if you are not gaming, expect to pay a "preimum" for everything. We ate breakfast at the buffet which was a shade above average with good food and service. Although we did not go tp the Elvis show there, we heard a lot of great things about it. The pools were very nice, what you would expect from a 4 star property. We will be going back to Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: gnnl
Reviews.Content: we checked in on the 10th of june, they first gave us a room on the 23rd floor. When we entered we found 2 items from the mini bar already opened and not replaced. We wanted our bags and found all the lines busy it wad busy for 45 mins. We had to go down again and inform them itseems the phone was bad. They shifted us to a new room and the room cleaning service didnt clean our room yesterday.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MerBear480
Reviews.Content: When you walk in the door, you immediately notice that this hotel smells of vanilla! And not of nasty cigarette smoke. The smoke is still there,of course, but the air seems very clean despite it. Check in took more time than I expected, but it was about a 10 minute transaction. Our room overlooked the pool area, which was great for me, as I could see where the beach chairs were available. The room is controlled by the TV, which was kind of a pain, because our remote control was slow and sometimes you would press the button and nothing would happen....so you would press HARD on the button, but still nothing. However, there are controls on the walls as well. The shower is in front of the bathtub, which is interesting but not very convenient if you want to take a bath and someone gets in the shower. I was sad that there was no drying line available in the bathroom to hang up wet swimsuits. And the electrical plug in the bathroom is in the middle of the two sinks, so if you blowdry your hair, you will sweep everything off of the sink with the hairdryer cord. The toilet has a glass partition/door that you can still see through, so no privacy there....Overall, the room was clean, the bed was super comfortable (if a bit soft), and the staff is very friendly. The pool was fantastic, it was not too crowded but very hot (it was June) and the pool drinks take 20 minutes to get to you and they cost $20 a drink. The frozen mojito was awesome though, very cold and minty. I saw some people that brought alcohol and mixers out to the pool, which is a great idea (but where to get the ice cubes?). The casino was clean and nice, mostly $1 or penny slots and lots of table gaming. We only at at Cafe Vettro, which was good food but terrible ambiance. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, it is a very nice hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “overall great hotel...but there's always room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: nmiraglia
Reviews.Content: With almost every vacation, there are plenty of ups and downs. Overall the hotel was very nice...the staff for the most part were very friendly and at times helpful. Concierge said they'd help with planning some entertainment (shows/plays/lists for night clubs/etc) but never had any follow through - other than that no complaints with the staff. The rooms were kept very clean. The hotel did have a lot more rules than other hotels in vegas, especially concerning the pool (i.e. proper attire going to and from the pool rather than just a towel and bathing suit). Liquid pool bar/pool party is a joke and a waste of time. Very small pool compared to the other pool parties in vegas (wet republic, rehab). Again, had a lot of unnecceary rules. Must use their towels, but can't let their towels by the pool. Also, you have to check your clothing and shoes when you get there because anything left on the floor will be picked up and discarded. Other than the few minor mishaps, the hotel was good for a hotel in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Worst treatment I've ever received from a five star hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Nena0123
Reviews.Content: I went to ARIA to celebrate my boyfriends birthday. What was supposed to be a romantic and exciting vacation turned into a total nightmare. When we first arrived after a long flight, the room they sent us up to wasn't ready. Then we had to go back down and up to another room. On top of that on saturday we went to their brunch buffet and I got sick because of it. The rest of my trip I spent in the bathroom vomiting etc... The Hotel didn't compensate me fairly afterwards. They acted as if I wasn't telling them the truth. I told them to check their cameras and check that I was. I felt humiliated, sad, and disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: MartinsRJ
Reviews.Content: Aria in one of the newest hotels in Vegas. It's located at a spot called City Center, right at The Strip (Las Vegas Blvd). This complex features another two hotels - Vdara and Mandarin - and a high-class shopping, Crystals (Prada, Gucci, etc.). It's very close to Bellagio and his fountains, Paris and the Eiffel Tower (great restaurant!) and many other attractions right on the street. Aria is a high-tech hotel. Rooms are spacious, well decorated and filled with up-to-date electronics - lcd tv, media center connector, power curtains, programmable lighting, all under control of a touch-screen tablet. It's a geek paradise. Aria also has a casino. Almost all Vegas hotels have, so what's the point? The point is, in general, you have to cross the casino area in order to reach the guests elevators, and Aria isn't different (ok, there's a shortcut, but just a few people use it). Crossing a casino area is the best way to get "smoked" by cigars and cigarettes from gamblers. For those of us who don't smoke, this is disgusting. And here lies the main difference. Everywhere you wander around inside Aria - including casino - you smell vanilla! You can smell your clothes, after crossing the casino area, and you won't find any cigarette smell in it. Fantastic. Aria has a wonderful buffet, where guests usually have breakfast. Food has superb quality (for a buffet) and price is generous. One minor glitch is the sunday breakfast. You can't have your ordinary buffet breakfast - you have to have brunch, and price is higher. The option is to have breakfast in a pâtisserie, in the first floor, by the casino. It's also good, but it's not the same. And we can see no point in having breakfast by slot machines... Staff is very nice, both front desk and concierge. Daily rates are fair - in fact, with all those newnesses and amenities, it's a good deal. We had one problem, though. We had cancelled our reservation at Vdara and switched to Aria, for they had a promo including breakfast, limited to US$ 40. We had understood that those US$40 were a limit on a daily basis, not for all the stay, as they said. This wasn't clear at their website and they knew that, because, when we complained, they "granted" us another US$40, for the "inconvenience". So, here's the tip: if they have a promo, double check it. Anyway, of course we would come back. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: TravelPort101
Reviews.Content: We had the chance to stay at Aria hotel. This new hotel has some of the latest technology only found in your upscale hotels. The draperies opened electronically while the LCD TV turned on with the lights as soon as we entered the room. It also has hookups for your laptop. Wifi is available for a fee. You can control all electronic with a touch screen or remote control. The room is much larger as a standard with two wash basins and a separate shower and tub. The decor is modern and clean and our view was great. I would give this hotel a 5 out of 5 however, there was one problem with our arrival. We followed the signs to Aria hotel which brought us to rear of the hotel where there is no baggage service. We had to carry our baggage to the reservation desk at the other end of the hotel. The valet said we should follow the other sign that said Aria suites to get to the front of the hotel. We ask if we could get our baggage delivered to the rear of the hotel and the reservation desk was not sure, it would depend on who is working and how busy they are. We ask if they can deliver the vehicle to the front and she said they do not do that any longer. The signs from Harmon Ave should be clearer for new comers.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room lighting”
Reviews.Author: vegasgirl063
Reviews.Content: Strike 1 - The lighting in our hotel room was so bad that we could not even read by it at night. For a fairly new hotel, this was a definite negative. Strike 2 - We called ahead for our rental car to be brought up. When we got to the front of the hotel, the car was sitting there but they wouldn't give us the key because they said the number didn't match. It took 30 minutes to straighten it out on their end. Strike 3- we called for a bellman to help us with our luggage at checkout and waited 45 minutes. He never showed up and we had to take everything ourselves so as not to miss our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good place especially if you aren't in Vegas to gamble”
Reviews.Author: Gubbini
Reviews.Content: We were at the Aria for two nights and had a standard room on the 15th floor. I was there for business and my husband came along to see the sights. Good points about the hotel were location (we walked everywhere), service (hotel personnel are everywhere and are very helpful), and the decor (very, very nice but not as over the top and garish as others.) I appreciated the fact that gambling did not appear to be the hotel's sole reason for its existence - - yes, you have to walk through the casino to get to your hotel room, but just about everything else in the hotel was free of gambling mania. While I have some complaints, on balance if I have to go to Vegas again, this is where I'd choose to stay. Check in on a Sunday afternoon was surprisingly slow. There were plenty of hotel clerks available but each transaction seemed to require 10 or more minutes. Our reservation was on file and was processed quickly. Our room was clean but not immaculate - - there was dust on the knick knacks (easy to spot when you opened the curtains) and the very dark color of the carpet was a dead giveaway to where more vacuuming was needed. Neither of us liked the mattress (too soft) but that's personal preference. There's a 'sophisticated interactive panel' that controls the lights, music, TV and curtains but I found it annoying. By the time you figure out how to use these things, it is time to leave. Some people may enjoy these kinds of gadgets but I would much prefer the 'old fashioned' on off switch. Check out was easy if you use the Express check out. However, we've been back three days and I haven't received the email copy of my bill, as I was promised. The pool area is beautiful. We ate at the poolside Breeze cafe which was less fabulous than advertised but it was nice to be able to sit outdoors and enjoy the weather. There's a spa which we did not use and the Cirque du Soleil show was 'dark' the two nights we were there. We also ate at Cafe Vetro for breakfast (overpriced, in my view) and at Sage for dinner (expensive but the food is very very good). We also had a very late dinner at the tapas place and loved it. We walked through several of the other big hotels during our stay and while I can't speak to their rooms, what I liked about Aria was the fact that it made me feel like I was in a very nice, high end hotel. The other hotels were, for my taste, so ostentatious in their decor that I felt like I had been dropped into some parallel universe where everything is outrageously oversized and overdone. At least that's one person's opinion!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay - Worth every Penny”
Reviews.Author: Turtle71
Reviews.Content: As my headline stated, this hotel was definitely worth every penny. Classy, upscale decor throughout the place. Not huge rooms, but not small either. Great views, great food. Nothing is inexpensive, but you shouldn't expect that if you are staying here. Everyone was very friendly, from the quick check-in (2:00pm) to housekeeping to the restaurants. You truly could just stay in the hotel/city center and never go anywhere else in Vegas. One piece of advice, be sure to make reservations for the nicer restaurants - although the sports bar food is great with not a long wait if you forget and can't get in to the restaurants. Our room was just a standard king room on 20th floor overlooking pools and mountains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay- Clean and Modern.”
Reviews.Author: 3va
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 4 nights in May in the deluxe room with city view. Despite the bad weather (cold and raining! Not the type of weather I was hoping for in Vegas) and some service issues, we had a fantastic stay at Aria. Pros- The location was excellent as it was right in the middle of the strip. We were able to walk up or down the strip no problem (about 25min walk to the Mirage). We ate at a few restaurants in the hotel (Sage for dinner, American Fish for happy hour, Cafe Vettro for after show snack). All three restaurants were great- Go to Sage if you're looking for a fine dining experience. The service was superior and the food was exquisite. American Fish has a happy hour from 5pm-7pm. They had a selection fo appetizers and drinks for $5. The food was delicious yet small- great for a pre show drink/snacks. Cafe Vettro is good for casual dining although service was a little spotty. The room itself was clean and modern. I love the bedside remote control (where you are able to control everything!). It was so nice to open up the blinds in the morning without having to get out of bed. The view was pretty good too- request a floor above the 30th floor. Cons- They didn't have a king bed available for the first night of our stay but offered to switch us the 2nd night. They told us they would call our room around 12 so we can do the switch. However, we had to call them 2-3 times before we were finally able to switch. In the 2nd room, the remote for the tv was missing and we called for room service to bring one up- but it never came. Also, we didn't have housekeeping one of the days which we found extremely strange.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: whyaske
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night at Aria and were very pleasantly surprised by the gorgeous, well-appointed room, though a bit on the small side We checked in and were asked if it was our first time visiting Aria. We said yes and were thanked for our choice and were sent chocolate covered strawberries to our room as a thank you! .The touch screen control at the bedside was a definite plus. It was nice to be able to control all room functions with the touch screen. There was a wide variety of music choices via the wide screen TV as well.We enjoyed the atmosphere, though I enjoyed the dark wood in the rooms and casino more than my husband. The check-in and check-out processes were efficient. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Aria and will be back”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_momof2
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Vegas and we decided to try a different hotel after previously staying at the Mirage. I must admit that after reading some negative reviews about the length of time to check in/out, cleanliness of rooms, and quality of service and staff I had my doubts. We checked in early, at 12pm and there was only 1 person in line ahead of us. Check in was quick and we were lucky to get a room right away. Check out was equally as quick. After reading how previous guests found hairs on the sheets as well as in the bathroom, the first thing that I did when we entered the room was to pull back the bedding to look at the sheets. No hair! and No hair in the bathroom either. The room was very clean. Big room and gorgeous bathroom. We found the service quick. Asked for a fridge and it was delivered within 15 minutes. It was fun having the room operate by remote control on the TV. Read previous reviews that people couldn't open lights when accidentally shutting off the room, but you can still open lights and the curtains by the panels on the wall, so no need to be in the dark waiting for security to help you. I loved loved loved the vanilla smell of the casino area. Many hotels reek of smoke in the casino but not this one and I am so sensitive to smoke. We are not gamblers but my husband did play the slots a couple of times and found them to be generous. I do have a couple of negatives. While the bed is very soft with a nice thick pillow top, it did sink in a bit on the sides. The bed at the Mirage was more comfortable. We had a couples of massage that was great but overpriced. Location was very good. Didn't eat at any of the restaurants so can't offer any comments on them. Pool was very nice. Water no where near as cold as the pool in the Mirage. Didn't have a problem getting seats at pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around experience”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleIllinois
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my dad and brother in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom sky suite. Fabulous bedrooms and bathrooms in the suite and private limo service to and from the airport to private entrance. Sky suites also include a private check-in area and beverage/snacks lounge on main floor. First class experience in most every way. Great pools, restaurants and casino.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: scottymain
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nites on Memorial Weekend, Vegas was buzzing! the hotel is part of the city center complex right in the center of the strip and connected to the Crystals Mall(all designer stores) and to the Bellagio by a tram. Massive hotel with over 4000 rooms & suites but never felt overly busy even on Memorial Day weekend. Room was large and bathroom was big as well. TV, Air-con, curtains all operated by a i-pad device at your bedside, pretty cool! we had a good view of the strip from our room. staff were always helpful and friendly. some of the other posters said the casino smelled of smoke and also of vanilla, of all the casinos we visited the Aria defo had the freshest air, and anyone who thought the smell of vanilla was overpowering really must have the smelling senses of a dog, as we thought is was fine and bearly noticeable. we had the champange brunch the hotel do on Saturday & Sunday, cost $36 per person for unlimited food and champange, wow what a feast!! pool area was very crowded with no loungers available but I guess this isn't the norm and it was to do with the massive amounts of people in Vegas that weekend Really top hotel compared to some of the other older hotels on the strip, would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good!”
Reviews.Author: ggom
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Caesars since they comp me there regularly. I decided to pay for one night at Aria 110$ (not a bad price for Memorial Day Sunday) Check in was quick and easy. I had asked for a high level floor and only got the 21st floor. (room 21234). The room had a nice view of the Vdara and Cosmopolitan, but I would not consider it a strip view per say, but nice nevertheless. The room was spotless and the bed was awesome! I did have an issue with the control panel as it was not as responsive as it should be. I also could not use wifi with my iPhone (wifi is included in the mandatory resort rate) All in all a good stay... Just a beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Locations”
Reviews.Author: Ksteff
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas to celebrate my friends 25th birthday. Upon arriving they asked if we had been before and if a room on a lower floor was ok. I said we hadn't and she proceeded to move us to a much higher floor, one of the top in fact. AWESOME! We got in the room and it was huge, great views and the bathroom was incredible. Overall the hotel was great, lots to do with several pools (family friendly and VIP) along with a huge casino. The restaurants were great and the hotel was located right in the center of everything. Overall amazing experience and a great way to celebrate turning 25 :)

Reviews.Title: “Somehow it smells good in here”
Reviews.Author: elh76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aria in December 2010 for a friend's birthday. It was a nice departure from the older hotels in Vegas (including Bellagio, which I've stayed at and is grand) because it is really shiny and new and in a cool more 'young' part of town called CityCenter. The smell of the hotel was clean and yummy, and whatever that signature scent is, I'd like to bottle it up and take it home with me. Apparently it was not for sale. The rooms had great views and were surprisingly spacious. The bathroom had a luxe spa/bath and separate toilet area. I love that, because when you're traveling with friends it makes it easier to all get ready in the bathroom at the same time! Cozy beds, luxurious comforters, easy access to the clubs downstairs. I don't think we really left the hotel. A few of the newer hotels at CityCenter weren't open yet, but I was excited to go back and try them, too. There's nothing in particular at Aria that would draw me back and make me say I wasn't going to stay anywhere else. Room service was delicious and efficient! Apparently they have a soaking pool near the spa that you can have separate access to - we didn't have time to check this out but I think you can pay a smaller fee just to visit that soaking pool. Check it out - these new hotels and this entire area is really fun and exciting for Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: JerryStockholm
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was impressed when I opened the door and the curtains slowly opened automatically. The room was huge and very nice. The furniture and the decoration is something I woule love to have at my place! So, the rooms are great, the property is also good. The pool area is average. But the whole place might be lacking some identity. Anyway, a good pick in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Wicked Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peak_10
Reviews.Content: I planned my husbands 30th surprise birthday in Vegas and we stayed at Aria. This hotel is immaculate. Great staff, clean hotel, lots to do, great restaurants! We stayed in a corner suite and it was well worth the money. Would stay there again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jen_Mark12
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Aria (usually stay at Wynn) and what a nice surprise! Beautiful hotel from top to bottom. They have the most amazing ventillation system - the place always smelt great - no smoke. Room was amazing, resturaunts were great and the pool was very relaxing. Special mention to Justin at the Viva Elvis ticket office for helping us book our package tickets for another night - great customer service. We plan to stay here from now on as nothing else comes close (and we've stayed at pretty much every 4 and 5 star hotel on the strip (including the new Cosmopolitan).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Venus69
Reviews.Content: This is the 7th time we have visited Las Vegas. So thought we would try the Aria out this time round. The only thing that was slightly annoying was the touch screen remote for all the electrics in the room, but apart from that nothing short of perfect. We stayed for 10 nights so make sure you have plenty of money with you if you are staying for a long period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Pack a lunch to check in/out”
Reviews.Author: skipper1415
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Still new with modern amenities. Beds are very comfortable. Check in/out was slow as they need to streamline the process as most other Vegas hotels have some.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel/casino with awesome restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: UCF_Chick
Reviews.Content: The rooms are amazing & very high-tech. Outstanding views of the mountains and the strip. The gaming offerings were typical, but this casino has an excellent air filtration system...it never once smelled smokey during our three-night stay. Service from every level of employee was excellent. I would definitely stay at ARIA again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room - less than great service - not sure if I'll return.”
Reviews.Author: JennAly
Reviews.Content: Given the very mixed reviews of Aria, I wanted to be sure to write a review of my recent trip; we were at Aria May 30 – June 2, 2011. To give some background, my husband and I are in our early 30s and go to Vegas about every four months. I am not particularly loyal to any hotel in Vegas, but the Mirage is probably our favorite. As soon as Aria opened and we saw their corner suites, we knew we wanted to stay there at some point. We arrived at Aria around 11:00 a.m. and waited in line for about 15 minutes hoping to check in. While in line I noticed that nobody was able to check in but the front desk clerk seemed to go through the same charade of looking for rooms for every customer and then telling them they had nothing available. I understand fully that check in time isn’t until later in the afternoon, but what I don’t understand is why they waste the time acting like they are looking for a room and then telling you they have nothing available. This happened to at least 10 people while we were in line. No surprise, when we got to the desk they took our credit card info and did all of the registration for us and told us that we would receive a text message when our room was ready. This clerk was not overly friendly, but certainly wasn’t rude.
