We booked a corner suite, and I requested a non smoking room on a high floor – hoping for something over the 50th floor – the told me that they could request a room on a high floor (which I was informed meant anything over the 12th floor). Being that it wasn’t the weekend, it didn’t seem that this would be an issue. We went to eat and received a text at around 1:30 telling us our room was ready. We went back to the front desk to pick up our keys; the clerk on this encounter was EXCEPTIONALLY rude – quite honestly she was the rudest front desk clerk I have ever encountered on any trip anywhere. She tells us that we have a room on the 7th floor – this is really disappointing because the reason we wanted a corner suite was for the views. I asked if it was possible for us to get anything else and she said she had a smoking room on the 11th floor. She said she had no idea when another room would be available because many people would not be checking out until after 6:00 p.m. Begrudgingly, we took the room on the 7th floor. We got into the room and it was nice enough. While waiting for our luggage to be delivered we both started noticing how worn the room was looking for such a new hotel. Spots on the carpet, scuffs on the walls – things you won’t imagine you’d see at this hotel at this point. The longer we were in the room we noticed that one of the toilets was running non-stop and the mini-bar was warm. These issues were nothing in comparison to the window rattling noise from the pool/day-club at the Cosmo. I felt so old for this to bother me – but it really was extremely obnoxious and it was the loudest in the bedroom. After showering and getting ready, I decided this wasn’t going to work for me – had the trip been comped I might have been willing to overlook it, but given that we had paid for this trip especially paid for an upgraded room we needed to be moved. I called the front desk and this time got an extremely friendly clerk, she told me that she would move our room but that they didn’t have any other corner suites available so we’d be getting a larger suite. She told me that she’d call me back after she got everything squared away; nearly an hour later I hadn’t heard anything back (shame on me for not making a note of her name). I called the front desk back and got another friendly person, she looked it up and there were notes on the room – she was able to get us assigned to the new room while I was on the phone, she indicated that the keys should work to get us into the new room. She didn’t know what kind of suite the room was but indicated it was a city view room on the 25th floor and it was on the opposite side of the Cosmo so the noise shouldn’t be an issue. We went to our new room and were pleasantly surprised, this room was in much better shape and the views were outstanding. After looking at the website I think that the suite was a Crystals Suite although the floor plan wasn’t very much like the one they show. The room was beautiful, regardless of how I feel about the service, the casino and the hotel as a whole; I will not deny that this room was outstanding. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on – I was not looking forward to going home and sleeping on my bed after this! The technology in this hotel really is cool, I love that the curtains open and shut electronically. As others have pointed out the touch 4 system that controls things is a bit slower than one might like, but it was still a nice feature. I’d like to add that you can still control your lights, curtains and temperature from switches on the wall, you don’t have to use the touch 4 control panel to do so. The bathroom was unbelievable, floor to ceiling windows all along the front and side of the room. There was a tub facing the windows so you could take a bath and look at the city all lit up at night. There was even a really nice sitting area with two chairs in the bathroom to enjoy the view from. I did find it odd that there was virtually no counter space in this bathroom, there was also only one drawer – oh well – not that big of a deal. Housekeeping did a great job throughout the stay and even provided turn down service on our last night without us even asking. At the end of the stay we tried to use the TV to express check out, but it encountered and error and told us to call the front desk. Our dining credits from the promotion we booked came off without a problem – it was good to not have to argue about that, as it seems some people have had to. To be perfectly honest, I’m not entirely sure whether or not I’d stay here again. Don’t get me wrong, we had a great time on our trip – but I don’t think it had anything to do with Aria. I feel like there were too many little issues, that all kind of ran together and left a bad taste in my mouth about their service. I’m very certain that there is no way that every single suite that they had was either occupied or dirty when I checked in on a Monday – even if it was after the holiday weekend. Furthermore, I’m sure that not every single guest room was occupied – so why weren’t other people allowed to check in. Little things like that really go along way in making people recommend a hotel. To that end, I have NEVER been turned away at Mirage – I have checked in there as early at 8:00 a.m. and they were happy to get me into a room at that time. My advice to anyone would be to have reasonable expectations – I would say that this hotel is not really operating at a 5 star/diamond level – the service is lacking, as is some attention to detail (there was a recessed light out in the living room that was never attended to). If you get a good deal and can get a suite, I think you really will enjoy your room. If you are staying over a weekend and don’t want to hear the noise from the Cosmo, I’d recommend asking for a room on the opposite side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to look at”
Reviews.Author: kingmanOrlando
Reviews.Content: Adding our comments agreeing with other reviewers who said the place is gorgeous, but for the money, the service and amenities don't add up. The lighting and TV controls are a mess to opperate. We give the bedding, pillows and toiletries in our Corner Suite a C, and the curtains in all the rooms do not come together enough to block out the glaring sun if you need a late afternoon nap before hitting the casino or many wonderful restaurants. We were glad to have stayed at ARIA to check out City Center with Crystal shops and explore a different part of the strip. On our next visit, however, we will try something different or go back to one of the many tried and true choices for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but horrific service”
Reviews.Author: rcr1760
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a stay at the ARIA just after the Memorial Day weekend. Given that the ARIA is billed as a 5-star property, it's only two years old, and we reserved a premier corner suite, we had very high expectations for our stay. Sadly, the horrible customer service we received upon check-in marred our perception of the resort. After a 25 minute wait at the front desk, I was finally "assisted" (if you can call it that) by one of the surliest customer service representatives I have encountered in years - and I travel frequently. She quite literally did not speak to me when I first approached the counter; I spoke to her first to inform her that I was checking in. She then said "name and credit card", and never uttered another word (no greeting, no courtesies, no addressing me by name - nothing). I was stunned by her rudeness, but the story gets worse - she next disappeared behind a rear counter for several minutes, where I could see her conferring with a colleague, but was offered no explanation of the delay. When she eventually returned, she informed me that the non-smoking suite booked was not available, and I had two options: I could either accept a higher-category suite on a smoking floor, or wait 3-4 hours for a non-smoking room to be available. Obviously, neither option was acceptable to me, and we went around and around on this before I was finally situated in a non-smoking suite. This entire process took a full hour, and I was livid. Later that evening, my husband and I started chatting with another couple and discovered that their check-in experience had been nearly as bad - they too were informed that their designated room category was not available, but were then told that they either had to wait hours for a room, or alternatively pay $75.00/night to upgrade to a higher room category. On the plus side, the suites are stunning - if you can overlook the ordeal at check-in and finally gain access to your room. The decor is sleek and modern without being sterile, and every inch of the place was spotless. There are some particularly nice features, such as the plasma TVs in the living room, bedroom, and bathroom (located opposite the whirlpool tub), and the automated lighting, sound, and service menu that is accessible from the TV remotes. I would also highly recommend the hotel restaurants (we ate at three). If you're looking for a bargain, go elsewhere, but we definitely got what we paid for - quality food and exemplary service. Perhaps the restaurant servers should conduct customer service workshops for the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very attrctive, but the technology is dumb”
Reviews.Author: DPW67
Reviews.Content: Aria is lovely to look at, and our room was comfortable enough, but the room control panel -- for lights, television, curtains, thermostat -- was kind of idiotic. We felt like we were in a scene from "Sleeper" by the time we figured out how to turn the TV on. I don't think we're especially technologically challenged. We're accustomed to touch-screen technology. This version just seemed glitchy and counter-intuitive. On another note, we found the floor tiles in the bathroom and shower to be incredibly slippery, especially when wet. They were attractive but kind of dangerous. For those who like to self-park, there are ample spaces, provided you can find the garage. Aria could work on the signage to help guests reach it. On the whole, though, we like the whole resort complex. The casino is fun, some of the restaurants are enjoyable, and it's nice overall. Those rooms are weird, though.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will surely go back”
Reviews.Author: uboora
Reviews.Content: An ultra modern hotel, very well designed rooms with all the modern touch. Remote controlled curtains and lighting. On arrival baggage was collected from the foyer and you were handed token to call the desk once you checked in. Check in was very quick and we were offered an upgrade for an extra $50 a night for a bigger and a better view. Luggage came within 5 mins of our call. Good cafes and restaurants and the Cirque de Soleil show on Elvis was awesome, we got the tickets at discount. Rooms were cleaned and sheets changed regularly. Staff was always helpful and everything was just a phone call away.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! All modern rooms!”
Reviews.Author: RichardEarle
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our visit to the Aria. The bed was wonderful. I also liked the large shower. Our room was very quiet and peaceful. My only complaint would be the distance to walk to your room. Also dined in one of the great restaurants on premises.

Reviews.Title: “Want to stay here from now on”
Reviews.Author: jloatx
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the stay at the Aria. Have been to Vegas nine times now and each time I like to try a new hotel and casino, but from now on I want to stay here. I LOVE the smell wafting through the casino, but I understand it might get overwhelming. Love it or hate it I think it's better than most casino smells on the Strip. The room itself was wonderful. Clean and modern. The only problem we had was working with the bedside panel. At times things did not respond and hence got very frustrating. Did like that you could open everything up or shut it all down when you walked in/out the door. Loved the bathroom and the shower. Interesting layout. Lighting was great in there and even though I don't really want to check my face out at 25x magnification it was nice to have for makeup. Ate at the breakfast buffet and was pleased with all the choices. Layout is nice and really liked the glass tiles on the walls. Very retro. Pool area is lovely and the 3 pools are nice with plenty of lounge chairs. Keep in mind that it does close around 6 so get out there when the sun is high to enjoy the cool pool, it gets a bit chilly in the water when the sun goes behind all those towers. Enjoyed the variety of slots on the casino floor and especially the newer ones that have surrounding sound and vibrations in the chairs! Dealers at the tables were nice and very helpful when learning a new game. Servers came around often and the drinks were not watered down. Overall great stay in a nice, new, modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless on the North side!”
Reviews.Author: mikebeaudry
Reviews.Content: Changed rooms twice in 3 days because of the Cosmopolitan night club music that runs from 10pm till on average 6am on Thursday-Saturday and at times on Mondays. According to the staff this problem started Dec. 2010 and has yet been corrected. Believe me were not the only couples that requested room transfers. My wife even tried sleeping in the bathroom to lower the decibels to no avail. We were offered ear plugs and repeated apologies, and on my third request the manager only credited 150$ for the inconvenience. Keep in mine that we went from the 31st floor to 25th and finally moved to the 50th on the south side to find peace. Very nice hotel although the scent from the ventilation system gets too you after a few days. Please avoid the north side!

Reviews.Title: “Sheer luxury”
Reviews.Author: silverfox123
Reviews.Content: If your looking for the highest standard of comfort and cleanliness, the Aria is the place to be. We have never slept in a more comfortable bed and the room offered all the latest technology and cleanliness was first class. The three outdoor pool areas are very pleasant. The hotel is set back from the strip which reduces noise from both traffic and revellers. I belief this hotel is in the centre of the strip, turn left and there's Bellagio and Caesars, turn right and there's Monte Carlo, New york and Excalibar. Only downside for us was the food and drinks were expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel! We had an amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: cval64
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay at the Aria in April & had a wonderful experiance! We had a beautiful view that looked out over the city center & out onto the strip. The room was spacious, beautiful & very modern! The bed was very comfortable. The best part of the casino for me (not being a big gambler) was that it always smelled so fresh! I could actually sit in the casino/lobby area & enjoy it without the cigarette smoke smell in my hair & on my clothes. This alone is a great feature of this beautiful hotel! As guests at the hotel we recieved a discount for the cirque show 'Viva Elvis' & it was fantastic! I strongly recommend you see it, if you have the chance! The only negative we found was that the outside area of the hotel is not marked properly. We drove in & had no idea which doors to enter the in to check in. There was no bellman to assist us or direction as to where to go. BUT once inside it was wonderful & everyone was so kind & helpful! We will be back to Vegas this summer & will definitely be staying at The Aria!

Reviews.Title: “Aria- work on customer service and you will be top nothc in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: skidog88
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful trip to LV. Stayed 4 nights at the ARIA and 2 nights at The BELLAGIO. In a nut shell, all previosu revwies about check in are correct and the rip off of "servie fees" at Aria are ridiculous and annoying for a lovely 4.5 star hotel. It makes the hotel seem cheap and unworthy of sophisticated guests. If Aria is going for a high standrad it needs to treat its guest like the Ritz or Mandarin does. I also had the credit problem and was suppose to get $50 a day credit. Never did but didn't want to stand in the long check out line so forgot it. I had called the front desk upon arrivale 2 x's and no one awswered. That is totally unacceptable. If that happens at the Ritz hotel chains, they call you back . not at the Aria. On a positive note, we had an amazing room , corner suite that was perfect. Big windows, gorgeous view, light, modern.Compare those rooms to the old dark, worn out rooms at The Bellagio and you will stay at The Aria. I love the Bellagio but they lacked customer service on my visit. called housekeeping at 5 pm to have roll away set up when we returned after the O show and it was not done. There is no excuse for that. Room was dark, old, and worn out. Bathroom lights have no options for 1 light on instead of all 5. No nightlights and no fan. Music from a club pounded the room all night long to the point where I did not sleep. At the Aria the rooms were soundproof. The Bellagio needs room updating and the Aria needs better customer service. Combine the two and you might have the perfect LV vacation. Check out at the Aria via the tv or cell phone- very easy.

Reviews.Title: “most amazing hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: haywane
Reviews.Content: this hotel is amazing. went here with my family last christmas. the place is amazing, the rooms are full of gadgets and luxury. it is expensive, but for what you're getting is well worth it. the breakfast is a MUST, absolutely amazing, i still remember the strawberry cream cheese! when i went the swimming pool wasn't ready but we used the pool for the bellagio hotel! deffo check this hotel out!

Reviews.Title: “Pay for the privilege of feeling like you are constantly being ripped off”
Reviews.Author: thehappytraveler_24
Reviews.Content: Even ignoring the $20/day resort fee that goes on top of your room rate (standard these days) and the $200 above your room rate that they demand you authorize on your credit card for "incidentals", I could not help be feel like the hotel was trying to siphon money from $20 at a time. When going to Vegas I expect to get ripped off at the tables, at the bars and a dinner, but not by my hotel. When I booked our room I signed up for the "free breakfast" deal. When we checked in (a process which took 45 minutes given everyone in front of us needed an explanation for all the random charges they drop on you) we were told to make sure we take advantage of our free breakfast. On Sunday morning we head down to get our free breakfast buffet, when we try to enter we are asked to sign a room charge of almost $70, we ask why as our breakfast is free and are told that it will just be deducted later. Somewhat perplexed, we ask why it isn't automatic and the woman explains that she doesn't know how much of a credit we have so can't just let us in without us agreeing to pay. Just to be safe, we decide to head to the front desk to confirm our breakfast will be free. Shocker, it isn't. We only have the weekday free breakfast (interesting given we are not staying on a weekday morning) but we can apply that to the weekend breakfast, so the breakfast is only $30. At not point would this have been clear without going down to check. It is only $30, minor blip in the weekend expenses, but really poor form by the hotel. I argue with the desk person who agrees to have the additional $30 waived. Feeling better, we go off to have easily some of the worst food ever. Later in the day we head down to check out. A process which takes an hour given everyone in front of us is arguing about the strange charges on their final bill. When we review our final bill, the $30 for breakfast is there at which point I have to argue the point again. The hotel eventually took the charge off, but I remain livid that they would try to get that extra sliver of money. Had the overall experience been better I would have spent well beyond that at the hotel, instead we went other places, and we would go back, we will never stay there again. Overall, the management is running this place in an extremely short sighted way, there are plenty of hotels of equal or better quality that will tell you what you are paying up front and not try to grab an extra $20 here and there for the rest of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great.”
Reviews.Author: AMB024
Reviews.Content: I was excited to visit ARIA and had heard good things about the hotel. Unfortunately, the room hadn't been dusted in ages, multiple light bulbs were out, half full amenity bottles, the remote didn't work, and then housekeeping flooded our bathroom while cleaning. The manager did move us to a room on a higher floor. However, even on the 54th floor, the thumping noise from the pool club was unbelievably annoying. It was like staying in a college dorm room. The casino area was sterile and very smoky for being a new hotel. The only shinning light was the level of service at the lounges and restaurants. The pool area and cabanas were also nice. But, the resort fees are a bit of a joke. $98 for internet service and 2 free drinks? I won't be staying here again. Going back to the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Suites are wonderful”
Reviews.Author: newjune11
Reviews.Content: I was speaking at a conference, and was put up in a suite at the Aria. While i don't have much to compare it to, it was wonderful. 3 TV's, curtains that opened when I opened the front door, nice background music, sink/bar area with eating table, separate living room/couch area, desk to work at, and a huge bathroom. I'd give the room a "10". The biggest complaint i had was upon arrival, i waited in the normal line to check in, and it took at least 20 minutes. Why???? They must know that waiting in a checkin line is the first impression one has of a hotel, and to annoy guests before they get to unpack seems foolish. It wasn't even a particularly crowded time, they just only had 4 counters open, and the checkin process seems to be long, as none of the lines were moving much. Other than that bad start, the rest was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: darren8161
Reviews.Content: So glad we cancelled a booking elsewhere so we could stay at a higher rated hotel.We loved everything about this place from the rooms to the cafes the steak restaurant and even the Casino.Not sure how anyone could find too much fault with anything about it but i guess some people just cant help but be critical.If we ever go back to Vegas there will be no other Hotel considered,its Aria all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Pretty big, but that's Vegas for you”
Reviews.Author: ajn74
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Aria. Terrific rooms. Great buffet for breakfast. Lovely pool(s) area with plenty of sunbeds (although we went for the cabanas as there was quite a few of us.) Would recommend as a place to stay. Have not been to VEgas before so have nothing to compare it to there, but would stay there again if i went back

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - But too Trendy for Average Couple”
Reviews.Author: Jhonny137835
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of great things to say about the aria, we had great customer service and they even allowed us to check in several hours early. The hotel was very clean and in a perfect location, almost right in the middle of the strip. The views from our hotel room were amazing and the room was definetly great, with plenty of space, a beautiful bathroom and unbelievable bed - it was seriously difficult to sleep on my own bed after sleeping on theirs for 3 nights. The pools were also very nice, there was plently of room and again the service was great. The casino was what you would expect, very large with plently of ways to blow your money - although it just didn't have the same atmosphere as alot of the others. My only issue with the hotel was that it was almost too trendy for the average couple. Most of the bars, resturants in the hotel were more of your high class places with a high price tag. Also the shopping area right nearby the hotel was neat, but I didn't even have enough money to walk in those stores (ie. Gucci, Versace, Louis Vuitton). The hotel also has a tram that takes you down only a couple of hotels, not really a long ride but it beats walking through the storm of homeless or people trying to put you on vip lists or sell you show tickets. My wife and I walked through the Monte Carlo Hotel just nearby - it seemed like a hotel more suited for the average person, with resturants youve actually heard of, a pub bar, and a pool that had more than just a circle of water, with a lazy river, a wave pool, and a little bit more flare. So, in summary - the aria was a great hotel with great service, but we found ourselves going to other hotels quite often (Monte Carlo, MGM, Bellagio) to do things at instead of ours. If your an average couple making an average salary - the Aria hotel may not be the best selection for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Aria”
Reviews.Author: JMOrlando
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home after 4 day stay - we absolutely loved the Aria. I had read the reviews before leaving and was a little worried. We have the M Life Players Card and they had sent a comp for 3 nights, show tickets and a little free play - we couldn't pass up the deal to try the Aria. The room was amzing as well as hotel staff. We were able to check in at the Invited Guest Counter and did notice long lines at the regular check-in counter - however it seemed that each guest was totally taken care of when their time came and were not rushed with their questions. Absolutely would go back - very relaxing hotel and the pool area is very nice!

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TravellingHaPpY_11
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel. The many restaurants a high standard. The bars great. In 3 minutes you are in the Bellagio via the free city tram. A special mention to the bedding. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: AN1987
Reviews.Content: No compaints- it was amazing! The pool was great. Rooms were great. Elvis show was great.. everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Was better last year”
Reviews.Author: sktnchk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last year after it first opened and had no complaints. Our room was a city view last year, everything was clean, service was great. This year however, we were stuck in a "wedge shape" room with a small window. After a long first day on the town we went to crawl into bed only to find snot wiped onto the head board. We called the front desk to complain and no one ever showed up to clean it. The night stands were very dusty at the base and had fingerprints all over the front. The backsplash in the tub looked like someone had spit on the wall and it had run down the sides. We were really unhappy with this last visit and will likely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than the first time”
Reviews.Author: kris1019
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I have stayed here a few times now and I love it. Excellent restaurant selection, the buffet is fantastic, and the service is superior. The only issue I take from this hotel is the difficulty in getting back out to the Strip. You either have to go through the large Crystals shopping center or walk on a busy street that has no sidewalk.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymon Trip”
Reviews.Author: smurf100
Reviews.Content: Have to say this hotel was a perfect place to start our two week honeymoon to states. After nearly travelling 24 hrs check in was quick. We were orginally checked into a interconnecting room, but after a quick call down to reception we were moved to a different room. The room as you all ready know is full of the latest gadgets, we found the room and bathroom to be generous in size. I have to say I found the pillows extremely comfortable. The only downside was, we found a few rubbish items from the previous guest (under side locker and in a couple of drawers) other that I could not complain about its cleanliness. The hotel is just off the strip so we found it perfect to explore Las Vegas. Dining we could not fault it, my husband especially enjoyed the buffet breakfast, a great way to start his day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property -- lousy service. Get ready to wait for everything.”
Reviews.Author: drfaust206
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in May 2011. What you read in others' reviews about the service here is basically what we experienced. We arrived and waited in line to check in for over 30 minutes, even though there were only 4 people in line ahead of us. We were told our room was not ready (we showed up around 2pm), and that they would call us when our room was ready for check in. That happened around 4:25pm. That's bizarre, since the published check-in time is 3pm. After we got to the room, the bell service had our bags to us in about 5 minutes, which was a big surprise. Pretty good, IMO The next morning we, we were in a hurry to eat quickly so we went to the buffet. At the cashier, we tried to charge the buffet to our room, but she said that we couldn't because we hadn't left a credit card at the front desk. But we had. She said she would call the front desk to find out... wait wait wait wait... We had left our credit card, but hadn't authorized room charges on it, apparently. Bizarre. I've never heard of a hotel taking your credit card, but not authorizing room charges. Cashier said she would try to get it authorized... wait wait wait wait. Then she hung up and said she'd call them again. We were out of time, so we just paid there with the credit card. She tells us to talk to the front desk. So then we're shepherded to a waiting area. No line or anything... they just make us wait for a table. It was 7:30am and the buffet dining room was practically empty. Wait wait wait. Wait some more. Then... randomly, we're taken to a table. No one left, they didn't clear any tables. They just make you wait. After breakfast, I go back to the front desk to try to get room charges authorized, but of course, I have to wait in line for 25 minutes. She tells me that you have to explicitly authorize room charges on your card when you check in. There are lots more incidents like this... mostly involving poor service followed by waits to make up for the poor service. It seems to me, if they did it right the first time, there would be way less waiting for everyone, since people wouldn't have to stand in line 3 times to get one thing done. The in-room tech was interesting, but malfunctioned on us a few times. We couldn't get to the blinds to open and close, etc. At check-out, we tried to check out via the TV, but it didn't work. I didn't want to wait in line at the front desk, so I called downstairs and of course was put on hold for 10 minutes. That's probably shorter than the wait would have been in the lobby, actually. Actually, the best service we had was picking up our bags from the bellman when we were getting our cab to the airport. It took 3 minutes, he was incredibly friendly and helpful. A few nice things -- the property was beautiful. The casino was great, and the dealers were great. I enjoyed the spa, the pool and the fitness room. And the quality of the breakfast buffet was far beyond what I anticipated. I usually don't hold out much for buffets, but the food on this one was quite good. I'd stay here again, but only if I can get a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Manager on duty 5/27/11 pm sucks”
Reviews.Author: Dano713
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms, king and two queens. Hotel was overbooked so they offered a rollaway bed to compensate for the two queens. When I said that wasn't satisfactory the manager on duty told me that I could cancel the room and try to find rooms at another hotel. Don't book through players club, rooms not guaranteed.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Breannlisa
Reviews.Content: Just leaving after a 6 day stay and I could not disagree more with those stating that they received poor service. Everyone was friendly, room was clean and modern, and the pool, gym, and location was fantastic. The staff at Sweet Chill was a little slow but pleasant and the rest of our experience was great. Will say there again for sure, much better than last trip to MGM Grand

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel to stay, services was excellent”
Reviews.Author: Gi12
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel to stay, the room was really nice, we were on the 32th floor, nice view, bed was comfortable, I would go back anytime at that hotel. I twas my 2nd time in Vegas, and I really enjoy my stay at the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA "The best"”
Reviews.Author: stevejam
Reviews.Content: Okay, I just got back from the best hotel ever. I read all those negative reviews, and almost switched, but i'm so glad I didn't. Let me start with check in. We walked in waited no more than 3 minutes, and went right to the window she was so nice, it took her 5 minutes to check us in.As far as the Vanilla smell everybody was complaining about, I didn't even notice it until my girlfriend said something.It's so faint, you hardly notice it. We stayed in a deluxe city view room and it was perfect. We were on the 23rd floor, our views were spectacular. If I knew how to upload a picture on here, I would so you could see it. I can't compare it with the corner suites, because i didn't see them,but this was a great room,We were in room 23050 it was four rooms from the elavator but we wouldn't have cared if it was 100 rooms from the elavator. We're not lazy. We enjoyed every minute. Our room was spotless, the bed was super comfortable. The contol panel was very easy to use. Room service was great.Anything we asked for came up in just a few minutes. As a matter of fact, when we needed more towels, the guy came up with them on a silver platter.As far as gambling, we did good.The Aria is very quiet It's like nobody is there,because it is so big. It's totally different than any of the other hotels.We got to use our comp points to eat.Speaking of food, try the philly cheese steak at the sky sports bar, best you'll ever have.We never paid for drinks because they are free when you gamble. I can't tell you too much about food because we didn't eat alot. Check out was easier than check in. They printed our boarding passes for us. We will definately will stay here again. Im' trying not to leave anything out. Everybody was friendly. The dessert place(Jean Phillip) was good but not great. You can take a tram to hotels like Monte carlo or bellagio and then get out and walk to cesars that part of the strip or if you want to go to luxor or mandelay bay you take the monte carlo tram and walk, nothing is far from the hotel.You can walk, it's easy, but crossing the street, you got to find a bridge or a crossswalk. I'll tell you, anybody that complained that wrote bad reviews, must have a tough time in life with everything. It was perfect and must go back soon. One thing they should add is a coffee shop like a dunkin donuts or starbucks for Ice coffees. You can get them, but they're not the same. But that's no big deal. AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME and believe me I'm kind of hard to please

Reviews.Title: “Consistently bad service made our stay unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: smarttraveler123
Reviews.Content: So, my husband and I stayed at the Aria from 5/21-5/24. We had booked a Deluxe King Room thru Orbitz since it was almost the same price as the other lesser rated hotels and this one was rated as a 5 star. The hotel itself is impressive. HUGE! And just beautiful inside and out. This was our first time to Vegas, so we had no expectations or anything to compare to. However, service in this hotel is non existent. We travel a lot domestically and internationally and are not that hard to please, IMO. This is my first negative review about a hotel. First, when we checked in, the lady was very curt and not pleasant at all. We had booked a package where 2 free buffets per day were included. We had to argue with her and show her proof of the offer which luckily I had brought along. She still had to get a manager who also made a big deal about honoring the promotion and said "Orbitz has hung us out to dry" as they didn't have any details about such promotion. Second, the room was on the 12th floor and since the hotel is so big, we had to drag our luggage all the way across the casino and then find the appropriate elevators to get to our floor. No sign of any bell hop or anyone to help guide us. Third, the room was nicely decorated, however we came to realize that housekeeping at this hotel is horrible! There was dust and grime on the furniture. There were make up stains on the linens and towels. There was no garbage can in the bathroom. The door handle on the bathroom door kept falling off every time I closed the door. This is not what I would expect from a 5 star hotel that is relatively new. During our entire stay, housekeeping was consistently negligent on basic things, like refilling toiletries and replacing towels and wiping down furniture. Although the electronic drapes were a cool feature, the control pad to control the lights, TV, etc., was so frustrating to figure out that we just did everything manually. And mind you, both me and my husband are in the computer industry and consider ourselves electronics savvy. Lastly, and what really showed us how bad the service at this hotel is: On the last day of our stay, the water shut off during the middle of my shower! Just completely stopped! I felt like I was at a cheap motel, not a new five star hotel! I waited a few minutes, but still nothing, so I got out of the shower, and to my dismay realized that housekeeping also forgot to replace the bath robes in the room. UGH! I tried to call the front desk as I was freezing and soaking wet. After 10 minutes of being on hold, I got what was actually a call center. I told them the situation and they said that there was a glitch in the whole tower and that they would also rush up a bath robe and personally call back when the situation was rectified. Of course, no bath robe was sent and no one called back. My husband also went down to the front desk to complain and finally after bypassing the long check in line and hailing down a manager, he was given a "there is nothing we can do it is out of our hands". No apology, nothing! Also, when we checked out, we still had to argue about the buffet comps as the charges were still on our bill. What a waste of time! I'm sorry, but we have stayed at plenty of lesser rated hotels and have received MUCH, MUCH better service than this. I was extremely disappointed with my stay at this hotel. We visited almost all the hotels on the strip during our stay and were constantly greeted and smiled at. Not at this hotel! We will not be staying here again and I definitely plan on writing a review on every website I can think of.

Reviews.Title: “"Aria" must not mean "service" in Italian”
Reviews.Author: gohappy103
Reviews.Content: With all of the hotel options in Las Vegas, you would think it would be a constant contest among hoteliers to provide the BEST service possible in hopes of filling every room, every night. Not so.....at least not at the City Center's Aria. My 4 day stay there last week was reminiscent of trips to DisneyWorld, where everything requires a wait in line and you are just another face in the crowd anticipating that you WILL eventually get your ride, your meal, your ticket, etc. The difference is that you expect it at Disney - it's part of the experience -- but not at a swank, new hotel where you are paying minimally $200-300/per night. Let's start with check-in. Upon arrival, there were 3 open windows (of the ~15 or so available) and we were guided to the shortest line where the old adage "the shortest line always takes the longest" proved itself to be true. There were 2 parties in front of us, the first of which was there at least 20 minutes AFTER we queued up while the clerk seemed to struggle with the computer and whatever requests they were making. I finally inquired as to whether they were just renting a room for several nights, or closing on a loan to purchase the property -- it was taking that long! Finally, we were directed to a newly opened window, where the gentleman apologized for the delay and handled our check-in with ease. The higher floor room I had requested was not ready, so he keyed in a RUSH order and said that it was one of the first RUSH requests of the morning and that it "shouldn't be too long. He directed us to bag check in, explained the process for key retrieval when the room was ready, and invited us to enjoy the casino and/or pool. Two+ hours later, we had not yet been summoned, so we returned to the desk and accepted rooms on a low floor. I don't know about you, but RUSH to me certainly means inside of several hours. Bag delivery to the room was prompt, and the bellman was very cordial + knowledgeable. The room was just a room....nothing special, nothing particularly well or ingeniously appointed....nice enough, but a plain room. Here's the crazy part: the lights & electronics are mostly controlled via the TV screen....which is real cool & techy I guess, but it is a bit tedious to have to turn on the TV and scroll through the menus every time you want to switch on/off a light or open the curtains!! There is a curtain control panel on the wall I discovered, and some assorted light switches here and there, but it was a bit inconvenient and confusing....designed apparently for travelers WAY smarter than me. The bathroom had one hook for robe, towel, hand towel, etc., as there were no other towel bars. Clean towels & washcloths were left on the edge of the sink daily. The tub was located INSIDE the shower stall....not that you were showering in the tub..... the shower stall contains a place to stand and shower AND the tub separately but within the shower stall walls....yep....odd. The next day, I returned to the room late in the day (4:00-5:00) and the room had not yet been made up. I don't leave my own house for the day a mess, so I expect that when I'm paying $200-300/night for a room I'd like it to be tidied and serviced by my return at the end of the day. All of this is to say that the ARIA just seemed to be grossly understaffed. Everyone was cordial and seemed to be doing the best they could, there just weren't enough workers to service the size of the property and the number of guests. The pools (3 + "Liquid" the adult pool) are lovely and for the most part, peaceful (well, not Liquid,,,it's a party). Plenty of big white towels, lots of chairs, good food at the outdoor restaurant. Service though again, was SO slow and inconsistent. You would think they'd be in a bigger hurry to sell more of those pricey drinks....seemed understaffed. The best though, was the night we ate at the Michael Mina restaurant, American Fish. We started at the bar, where the bartender was very good and told us a lot about the menu, the specials, etc. Then, we were seated in the bar area at a table. The waitress assigned to us (an seemingly to the entire rest of the place...but certainly to the entire bar seating area) was amazing in her own right. Sounds like a broken record, but I don't make this stuff up.....the place was way understaffed. This lovely young girl named CARMEN, was literally, nearly running from table to table...to the computer....to the bar. She gave us our menus and explained the specials, then she was off. At one point as she whizzed past we asked her to send the bus person around with water.....she appeared shortly with the pitcher and filled our glasses. Later, we ordered a bottle of wine which she said the wine steward would be delivering. A few minutes later...POOF...there SHE was uncorking and pouring the wine. Off she went....back with the food....and on it went. And I'm pretty certain she was doing the same for the other guests around us. I believe SHE could have single-handedly taken over that entire resort!!! LOL!!! She was something to see! Perhaps she should be promoted to "Director of Service Training" there!! The coffee + pastry shop was decent, but get there early, or yep......you wait in a long line. Same at the candy store and the sandwich/ice cream shop on the way to the pool...long lines, slow service. Again, nice folks just too few of them it seemed. Nice casino, great location, loved the pools. I'm going to mark that I would NOT recommend to a friend, but I would with reservation, to anyone with more patience or time to kill than me I guess....and for the right price. Oh...very nice fitness center! And if you're looking for the safe, it's hidden in the nightstand drawer! It is always an adventure in Las Vegas....enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: MPLSguy78
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Aria in May. Parking was easy, getting from garage to front desk was a long walk. We arrived on Wed night. There was no lines and check in was very fast. Everyone was pleasant and we were given a room on the 25th floor with a strip view. Room- Open the door, the lights come on, the shades open up. Very clean and fresh. The view was awesome. The bed was heaven. The electronics was easy to use. Overall awesome. Casino- We are not high rollers, we are on a budget. I enjoy gambling however I didn't want to play $15 blackjack or $25 Pai Gow per hand. We had to go down the strip for that, but the casino is very nice. No smoke. They have a fragrance in the air, but I enjoyed it. Fitness Center- This is included in the "resort fee". Very nice gym. Tons of equipment to use. Free bottles of water and towels Pool- Didn't use (too cold) but looked very clean and relaxing. Overall, we loved the Aria. Of all my trips to Vegas (30+), this has been the best. Keep in mind we got a $79/ night special.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary & Chic”
Reviews.Author: jatins
Reviews.Content: When you are in Las Vegas, you usually do not spend lot of times in Hotel Rooms. And that is what we did most of the time... party, dinner, casino, shows, pool, etc.. But while we did all this, we still went back to the room to spend some quality time with its gadgets and the bed. We were at Aria for 5 Nights and we got a special deal for our stay. Our Booking read early check-in and we were there @ 10am but got the room only @ 1pm. We did not complain about this as we were already in the vegas mood. We saw the room and loved it immediately. The Curtains opened up as soon as our Room Door was opened and it was so cute (hheeeee). The Room was good average size and so was the bathroom. There was a Remote Control Panel (hand held) next to my table and you can operate music, tc, curtains, lights, wake up alarm, and just everything from that small remote panel. Light was so easy for those 5 Days. I think they could just add just a bit extra light to the room and it would be perfect. TV had good channels for fun, news, sports, etc. But for Movies, you had to pay-up which I think was pretty cheap thing to do. Bathroom was nice and so was the Bath tub. I think they Toileteries could be up-scaled to much better quality. We did not try the Restaurants and we were eating out most of the time but did go to Vetro (Coffee Shop) which was right next to the Casino and had Coffee & Nachos which was 10 out of 10. Casino stakes would be low during the day (minimum was 10) and went up in the night (minimum 15) which I think was not really steep. But I think the Casino was average size and was definetly not too big. But that cool as you can play in any casino in Vegas. Check out was prompt. Hotel Lcoation is decent but you surely have to walk a long way into the hotel. There is a train that goes upto Bellagio but if you want to walk upto the strip, the walk is nice. Overall our experience was just brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Hi-Tech All the Way”
Reviews.Author: DCPRPRO
Reviews.Content: This place is really gorgeous... the rooms are nice and the pool and spa wonderful. Everything is about technology... automatic curtains, music... They need to work on their check-in desk though. The lines were terrible when I was checking in... restaurants are pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: “Best Conference Hotel I've Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: ksbrownutah
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about this hotel. I stayed here for a week as I managed our company's annual conference. We had 400 of our customers stay at the resort: everybody was pleased. I stayed in a Corner Suite. The rooms are well-planned and designed. They feel very roomy, yet make great use of the space. The rooms are impeccably designed. Every texture, fabric, and color blends perfectly with the theme of the hotel. If you love technology, you will love the room controls. You can customize the curtains, the air conditioning, the sound, the lighting, and more. The toiletries smell great. The bed is very comfortable. I ate at many of the restaurants in the hotel and they were all superb. The patisserie was top notch, especially the gelato. I loved Lemongrass, the Buffet, Cafe Vettro, Julian Serrano, and Jean Georges. Our convention services staff was top notch. They were attentive to our needs both on-site and prior to the event. The conference rooms are state-of-the-art and very well furnished. The conference space is amazing. It's the most light and airy of any hotel I've been to. If you want a trendy, luxurious alternative to the stuffiness of the Wynn, Encore, and Venetian, then you should stay at the ARIA. I can't say enough great things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lisamarie1988
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many times and out of all the hotels I staid at aria was my favorite. It was very clean and had great service. The technology they have in the rooms were amazing. The only downfall was the size wasn't overly to huge. The smell in the hotel was amazing. (as odd as that sounds)

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay in my life”
Reviews.Author: Bigdaddykane
Reviews.Content: At check in I ask for a high floor and that it was my first time visiting the Aria. I end up getting the 53rd floor after unpacking I go to the bathroom to discover no tub and that it is wheelchair accessible. It is a Friday night and I call down and they said they could not move me until Sunday. I find hair in the soap dish. I go to get my free Daily newspaper at the gift store they give me a USA Today. On Sunday I go back for the local Sunday paper, I am told that only the USA Today is free. I say that it does not say this in the resort fee guide it says free Daily newspaper. She says I can have another copy of the USA Today again. One day I needed a taxi quickly as I was running late there was a long line so I asked for a car service while waiting the head taxi guy called Frank comes over and tells me where the back of the taxi line is. I tell him I ordered a car but if it doesn't come soon I will have to walk. He tells me to go ahead and walk. The next day I see Frank again at the front of the taxi line opening the doors for people. My turn came and I told him I would open my own door. He called me a piece of ..... I sent an email to the Aria but got no response. Absolute worst hotel stay ever.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a $100”
Reviews.Author: AnnaS1976
Reviews.Content: Was looking for something nice in $100 range on Priceline and got this hotel. Overall I liked our stay there. The hotel is located in a new CityCenter development where everything is still new, shining and squeaky clean. We arrived on a late flight, lines at check in were not very long. Even though we booked through Priceline we were upgraded to SkySuite . It is not really a suite, just a bigger room, but a really nice room with an outstanding view of the Strip. It was also probably the most technologically advanced room I've been to - everything (lights, TV, curtains) is controlled from a portable sensor panel. As for hotel itself, it is a typical mega-casino hotel with lots of restaurants, nightclub and of course casion action on the main floor. We tried the buffet (good variety , service was ok) and a pastry place (very good!). Didn't try any of the full-service restaurants. The hotel has a very nice pool area, but it was too cold during our stay, so we just walked around the pools once. If you planning to gamble, you might sign up for their loyalty progam - might get some freebies. And a tip for check-out - lines during the day can be very long, if you don't need a printed bill, use 'express checkout card' provided in your room. You can just drop it off in the lobby and be on your way without standing in line.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but commercial!”
Reviews.Author: thepieshop66
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at the Aria resort with a friend. This place is easy to locate and has excellent free self-parking. The hotel is very large and rather 'commercial' which is as expected as its all designed to get people in to the casino. Service was excellent however lacked the personal touch alot of the time. Most staff were courteous and polite but there was one or two who lacked this service. The quality of the resort is fantastic and the HAZE nightclub is a must at the weekend! Room service is good and the food is top quality. The room itself was very clean and tidy. The conceirge staff are able to arrange tours / trips etc and they were most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay at City Center”
Reviews.Author: Stillwatertravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria Resort & Casino at City Center May 13-16. We had a great experience from check in to check out. We arrived at about 9:00 PM on Friday evening and check in was quick and efficient for us. The Bell staff brought our bags to our room within 5 minutes of our arrival, along with a bag of ice for our mini bar. Our room had a nice view of City Center with the canoe sculpture in the forefront. We ate at Julian Serrano, a Spanish Tapas restaurant on the Casino level and had a great meal (beware the pitcher of Sangria!) The room was modern and clean and the bed was one of the best we have ever slept on. The control panel worked well for us and was easy to use. The hotel floors were very quiet, with no evidence of smoke or smells. We had a great stay and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jleather85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. Rooms were spacious and clean. Only thing we didn't like was the long wait to check in or check out. Either they need more staff or expediate the process somehow. This hotel is huge. A lot of walking. They also need more signs to show where everything is. We spent a lot of time trying to find our room. Also, in the snack areawhere they sell chocolates and baked goods on the casino floor, you get free refills. They don't tell you that. Lastly, the sports book and bar are incredible. We checked out many hotels and their sports book and bar and the tv quality on the large screen tvs are not anywhere near the Aria's. If there is a big game on tv, watch it in the Aria's sports book room and bar. Awesome tvs.

Reviews.Title: “typical fancy casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: rss36
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a not-so-busy-work trip - as in, there was some free time to play. I'm not a big gambler, so I find the lobby of these hotels disconcerting - they always make it very hard to find how to get to your room, or do anything really besides gamble. This is also a HUGE hotel so there was just a lot of walking every time I wanted to go anywhere. If I forgot something up in my room, it was a big ordeal. I am pretty sure my colleague and I would have lost each other if we didn't have our mobiles. I paid extra for the gym/spa, which was very nice - and I think worth it, but not open very early - most business travelers (esp those of us coming from the east coast) like to work out in the morning but I guess this isn't the point of the hotel. The room was fabulous - super comfortable and a giant remote control that does everything for you. But you definitely have to pay for anything extra. The toiletries were nothing special. Pools were luxurious and typical Vegas party scene. I ate at the buffet one night, very casual, more like a cafeteria than a buffet, but the food was good. I haven't eaten at other Vegas buffets, so I don't have a comparison. The other restaurants looked very nice, and there is an Elvis Cirque de Soleil show in the hotel, which I would have loved to attend, but didn't make it this time. Hotel is on the strip, attached to lots of good shopping, so if that's what you're looking for, you're all set. And we parked our rental car, which was free and easy, there is also a valet for tips. So no major complaints - I just think Vegas isn't my scene. I did get a government rate, but they don't honor that on weekends, so we had to move into another hotel Fri. night (work went through Fri. afternoon.) Still the gov rate for Vegas is very low, so I did appreciate this - I believe that applies to all MGM hotels - and you do have to call and ask, there was no way to book online.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds! Great price!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBobby77
Reviews.Content: Great Vegas hotel, new and clean. If you are wanting to hang out at the Cosmo, this place is very easy walking distance to their restaurants and clubs and is about 1/2 the price. I know the last thing you probably care about at a hotel in Vegas is the bed, but their mattresses had an extra layer on top making these extremely comfortable beds. Check-in and check-out had long lines but the front desk was pleasant and they did their best to get people through as quick as possible. I would stay here again based on price, location (shopping mall Crystals is attached to Aria), great restaurant selections. They had free high speed internet too which was nice!

Reviews.Title: “The Aria was great - didn't expect any more or less”
Reviews.Author: Sarah0120
Reviews.Content: My mom and I spent 4 nights at the Aria May 15-19 and had a fantastic time despite the not so fantastic weather. Check-in took about 10 mins, and our room on the 10th floor facing the Vdara was spacious and clean. My Mom noticed a few crumbs next to the bed, but it's better than finding a dirty bathroom, so it didn't bother us. The ipad control thing was easy enough to figure out, but we didn't really use it. They still have light switches on the walls and a remote control for the TV, which was a lot easier than going back to the control pad for everything. The beds are as amazing as everyone says, but I thought the pillows were too squishy. I was still congested from having awful allergies in NYC, but couldn't really prop myself up enough to breath using 2 pillows. We used the gym each morning, and it was wonderful. They give you water bottles and towels, and have most of the machines you'd find at any gym. It's also huge so there are always machines open even if it's crowded. Same with the pool. Last year we stayed at the Mirage, and though the pool there is prettier, everyone sits on top of each other and that isn't the case at the Aria. With 3 huge pools areas, there were always plenty of chairs. Yes, the drinks at the pool are expensive, but no different than any other 4-5 star hotel. If you're looking for $1 beers, go to the cheap casinos on the street or bring your own. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants besides Sweet Chill, which has really great gelato. Instead, we went to the restaurants in the Miracle Mile mall across the street for breakfast. All of the bars serve breakfast for under $10. The PBR Rock Bar was the delicious and gives you SO much food. We also went to the Wicked Spoon Buffet in the Cosmopolitan for brunch and it was worth every penny. The Pub in the Monte Carlo is worth mentioning because they had he best nachos ever and over 70 different beers. The only place that wasn't worth going was Freemont Street. It takes forever to get there on the bus, and is actually a little scary. On our last day, our flight wasn't until 10:40pm so we stored our luggage and that couldn't have been easier. It took 2 mins and when we went to pick it up, it took another 2 mins and they got us a cab immediately. Overall I didn't really have any issues with the Aria. It's clean, and spacious, and right in the middle of everything. It is a little set back from the Strip, but we found it quicker to walk through Crystals or take the tram to the Bellagio. That especially helped when it was windy and cold at night.

Reviews.Title: “What we expected.”
Reviews.Author: Oldbikers
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay May 15-20. Beds very comfortable and maid service great. Valet service at South valet very good. Location excellent! Due to our players club past play, we had good rates for total stay. Enjoyed the casino and tram. Easy to get to Monte Carlo and Bellagio. Hoping to receive offers for our next trip in October.We were celebrating our anniversary and was told by the person checking us in that a "surprise" would be sent to our room later that afternoon. It never came which was not big deal to us!!!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE,WOULD RATHER STAY AT MOTEL 6”
Reviews.Author: VINCENT1BIGBUCK
Reviews.Content: I'm not usually a negative person but the experience we had here May 17th- May 22nd was really bad. We will never stay here even if its the only hotel left in vegas.When we got there we had 2 rooms reserved , the computers were down they said, and the lines were long. They told us to go eat lunch and they should be back up when we were done. We get done eating and go check in, one room is ready and one is not. We go up to first room open door and it smelt like a bar room and was supose to be smoke free room on a smoke free level he said. Tryed to get him to go up there but guess he was to lazy to go. Finally gave us another room and it was dirty had not been cleaned only beds were made with old sheets ( you could tell if you know want i mean ) old soap still in soap dish. 3 phone calls and 2 hours later still nothing,could not see manager and superviser done nothing ,finally found a nice man on night shift that done cleaning and he was the only person we saw the whole stay that i can say took care of us and done what he said he was going to do.They were going to get the other room done next right after we got the first room. 4 hours later they call and said it was ready.We were not asking for nothing free just wanted what we paid for. I have stayed in $49.00 a night hotels with better service and cleaner. The green friendly [-] was for the birds and didn't work half the time either.Ask 2 more times to talk to manager during stay and never got a call or seen him,guess he was staying at another hotel too. People down stairs ( most of them )were dumber than a box of rocks. Can not speak for all of them but ones we talk to were. Pool opens at 9:00 am and closes at 6:00pm but front desk will tell you it opens at 8:00am, 4 other people told us same thing at pool.Will never tell anybody to stay here and we will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!! EXTREMELY PLEASANT!! GREAT LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetbi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is INCREDIBLE!! Great Location! My husband and I celebrated our anniversary & stayed here for the last 5 days May 18-22, and ARIA HOTEL & CASINO made our experience AWESOME! From the moment of arrival, our bags were taken to our room, so we could go check in, we received a complimentary room upgrade..rooms are extremely clean, beds are super comfy, in-room control was very easy to use...Every staff member we dealt with either on phone or in person was extremely pleasant and went above & beyond...extremely professional & helpful. I cannot say enough GREAT things about this hotel. I think alot of these negative reviews are honestly people being too picky! I am a picky traveller and my experience was top notch!! I will stay at this hotel definitely Again and Again. As with every experience, nothing is perfect so the only two negatives I could say was (1) Waitress staff never came around to us while gambling - it was very busy (2) Union Restaurant got us in right away however extremely over priced, we left still hungry.. Overall, this hotel is AMAZING!!! Oh and if you get the chance...go see Viva ELVIS at the Aria!! The Absolute Best Show we have ever been too!! Overall, I will recommend & refer any friends & family to stay at this hotel!! EXCELLENT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Communication”
Reviews.Author: JATraveller80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautiful, and the rooms are very nice. When you walk in the Tv turns on to play music and the curtains open... All very nice. During our stay, the power went out... rather than communicating with their guests that there were power issues (You wouldnt know it as all the casino machines were still running) they told us the elevators were down and should be up in 20 minutes. It was 5:30 am before we were back with power. Choosing to run your casino on backup power instead of your guests paid for rooms, is unacceptable. The previous guests notepad with notes, and room key were all on the desk when we arrived, and our room cleaning on the first day was merely making the bed and getting up the towels. After walking around and seeing all the hotels (this was our first time in Vegas) I would recommend the Bellagio or Cosmopolitan instead. They seemed to be nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Luxury Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adventurem0m
Reviews.Content: I went there with my BF for my 40th B'day. We had a blast!!! When we were checking in they asked if it was a special occasion and I said it was my b'day. Well when got to the room there was chocolate covered macaroons and strawberries waitiing for us, Delicious!!!!! The hotel is very modern with impressive rooms and decor. We had a city view room with two queen size beds (beds were ultra comfortable)The bathroom OMG the bathroom, loved it!!!!! Everything was very clean and well laid out. The pool area is simply gorgeous!!! Hot tub small but very nice!!! I would definitely stay here again.... Pros: Nice location (Next to several stores like CVS, ABC (great for souvenirs), M&Mstore, Diablo restaurant (excellent drinks)... Hotel and Room decor Staff is very helpful and friendly Swimming Pool Security (at night you had to show room key in order to go up to room) We visited other hotels and their security was lacking Late Check out (upon request w/o charging) Cons: Trying to figure out the remote that controls everything in the room (you really need directions)LOL Need a better check in system (only had one person handing out room keys, ridiculous!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Aria....check-in could be better”
Reviews.Author: MagicNumbe
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a group of friends to celebrate a big birthday. When we arrived at the Aria we were very impressed with the hotel, spotlessly clean and stunning decor, inside and outside. The check-in girl was very unfriendly - which was a pity - because the rest of the staff we found could not do enough for you. We had requested a room upgrade and the check-in girl was not going to give it to us, but we persevered and got a room on the floor we wanted. The positives are:- Wonderful bed and pillows Beautiful room with magnificent views - day or night A big hotel, but not as big as some of the others. Not tacky at all Lovely restaurants and bars Great pool and jacuzzis Location perfect ly positioned along the strip Casino was a good size but not too big compared with some others The electricity went off last Saturday night because of a fire next door - it was done for safety reasons we were told. That was not a fault of the hotel, just a safety precaution. All in all, we loved it and would go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: pkpdbacation
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Aria. We usually stay at Bellagio but decided to give Aria a try. We were impressed with Aria. The room was very nice and the bed was perhaps the most comfortable we have ever had in a hotel. We like the central location of Aria on the strip and thought the hotel was great. We saw Elvis and it was excellent (the Fat Tire beer at the concessions was cold and good!). The workout room is nice and the pool is good too. Aria is a worthy challenger to Bellagio as a place we will stay this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at Aria!!”
Reviews.Author: Vegas123049
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to let everyone know about some unfortunate experiences I had last weekend at the Aria hotel. My girlfriends and I come to Las Vegas every year for a trip. We have stayed at the Mirage, Venetian, and MGM hotel and Signature Towers. We wanted to try out Aria because we kept hearing about it, and it was one of the newest hotels on the strip. We stayed there May 13-16, 2011. The hotel itself was very unimpressive. I have been to all the 5 star hotels in Vegas and this one does not even compare. The casino/decor overall is just "blah". I guess they were trying to go for a "modern' theme...to me, it just seemed cold. It was understaffed wherever we went. We had to wait in long lines to check-in/out, at the buffet, and at the pool bar. It was nearly impossible to find a waitress to take our drink orders at the pool. We had to end up going to stand in line at the pool bar for 30 minutes! This is not exactly what we had in mind when we go to relax at the pool. Everyone in line was annoyed and unhappy. There were 2 bartenders for a huge line of people. We wanted to buy another round of drinks, but did not want to waste another 30 minutes of pool time waiting in line. The buffet line was just as bad. The ladies up front ringing customers were very slow. The restaurant had plenty of open seating. There was no reason for that line to be sooo long for a breakfast buffet. We almost missed our flight due to the line at the buffet and check-out. And once we got into the buffet, there were hardly any waitresses! We had finished our food before we got our drinks. This is ridiculous. Everything in the room is controlled by a touch scree (like an ipad). Sounds cool in theory, but it was confusing and didn't work much of the time. For older people who are not good with technology, this would be a major deterrent! We set the alarm to wake us up after a nap and it never went off. Also, it would be nice to add more outlets in the room. Most people like to charge their phones on the night table. There was no outlet anywhere near the beds. The power was completely out for hours on saturday night. The pillows were too fluffy/big for a stomach sleeper like myself. The beds were comfy, but I didn't sleep well b/c the pillows were too big. Also, the so called "black out" curtains, do not block out the sun. We got woken up every morning at 6:30am by the sunrise. I have never had this before at any hotel. I love the idea of the big floor to ceiling windows, but you guys need to figure out a better curtain system that blocks the light out. It was very bright in our room very early! I constantly heard noises around us. It sounded like a bowling alley was literally above us. I don't know if they were moving furniture or what, but it woke us up several times. We could also hear people having conversations walking down the hall. Between the noise, pillows, and light in the room, we slept awful the entire trip. I am usually not a negative person and have never complained about a hotel in my entire life (and I travel often). We will not ever be back at Aria again. The whole experience was underwhelming and disappointing. I wish someone would've warned me before we went! We will be back at the Signature Towers next year!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, but lacking customer service.”
Reviews.Author: AlohaRick
Reviews.Content: The Aria, is a very nice clean and modern resort but not a 5 diamond establishment. The service at the Aria is on par with its neighbor the Monte Carlo. The front desk is the worst I have ever encountered in Las Vegas. I had to double check the name on the hotel because I was given some Whiskey Pete's treatment in a 5 diamond establishment. I was able to book the room for $75.00 on Priceline and understand now the old saying,"you get what you pay for". How can a 5 diamond resort have $75.00 room rates. By having 1 diamond customer service. The check-in the was the bane of my trip. I was standing in a long line for 20 mins when a hotel rep with a Ipad tells me to move lines. So I moved lines and watched with disappointment as my old position in the previous line was being helped. The line which I was moved to had a issue with every check-in. Now its been 20 mins since the person in my old position was check-in and enjoying Las Vegas. So its finally my turn with front desk clerk TIna after being in line for almost 1 hour. Tina calmly informs me that I was standing in a closed line and she is on break now. I informed her that I was moved into this line by a hotel employee and I would like to be checked in by her or any other employee. Tina without saying anything just walked away from me. I had to ask the attendant next to her station to call a manager for me. It took another 5-10 mins for Ron the manager the show-up who was professional. Ron tried to justify that they are working out all the kinks but a 5 diamond resort should have all those things worked out before opening the doors. Ron accommodated us with a room with a view but did nothing for the bad taste in my mouth. I made it a choice not to send a additional penny at the Aria. The Aria is a very beautiful modern resort that needs to take some lessons form the Bellagio and the Wynn on service.

Reviews.Title: “Living it up in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: joolstravels
Reviews.Content: Being our first visit to Las Vegas, we agonised over where to stay but were very pleased with our choice. The location was great, about mid-way along the strip and positioned just a few yards back from the main road. The rooms are well decorated, very clean and the beds were amazingly comfortable. With over 4,000 rooms I was apprehensive as to how the staff cope but they were lovely, polite, friendly and helpful. We did have one or two minor issues but they were dealt with quickly and satisfactorily, without fuss. I would recommend staying here as opposed to the themed hotels, it is an oasis in a frenetic destination. I would stay at the Aria again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: SistaTrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria May 15 through 19. It was excellent, service good, check in no problem and speedy, given complimentary extra hour to check out since our flight did not leave until 3:40. Cafe Vettro food was excellent, service great and a good value. Service in the Skybox Bar was excellent and waiter friendly. I would definitely stay there again, ready to go back!! The building design is great and ecco friendly. The only problem I had was trying to get all of the electronic gadetry working like automatic lights and drape closure and safe. Beds were a little too plush and soft for me, but otherwise great as most people may not want a hard bed as I do. The view was also great. The value for the money was good. I had great bell service to help with the bags upon arriving and very friendly and helpful. Oh, the Spa was great too!! I usually stay in the Wynn when I visit at least once a year so tossed between the Wynn and Aria now!!.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: VeraK77
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in LV and only heard good things about this hotel but I was left very disappointed. Service is terrible, check in times are too long, trying to get attention from any hotel staff is close to impossible. When I got to my room there were footprints in my bath, assuming there was a light bulb above the bath being changed. So why not fix the other too broken lights in the room and clean up afterwards. My room was never cleaned on one of the days I stayed there even though I had specifically asked for it to be cleaned. Two things that are important to me are cleanliness and good service but unfortunately the Aria possess neither of those. Wireless is too expensive compared to other hotels, that's a no choice fee and does not always work plus there is an additional charge of 130 dollars a day (refundable - depending) which was never explained to me at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: MlsGuy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the best Hotel on the strip, look no further. It is a beautiful, clean and well located place. The staff are wonderful. The casino is pretty, although I didn't win!! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, poor customer service in response to issues!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenndurm
Reviews.Content: First, the positive - VERY COMFORTABLE BED When the smart panel works, it is kind of cool! I set the alarm to wake me up and when it did the blinds opened, the TV turned on to the channel I chose and the lights I opted to have turn on, turned on... that was cool. NOW THE NEGATIVE (AND THERE IS ALOT). Upon check in the front desk clerk was curt, cold, and not informative. To get a double bed room I would have had to pay 30$ extra - and we were two women staying in a room. We went up to the room and right outside our room there were two drinks on a tray that had not been picked up. I started to think that the room might be occupied. When we went into the room, the carpet was dirty, the room was dusty, and the blanket had a bunch of hair on it. I called down to front desk and they switched our rooms -- however, they had noone come up to assist and honestly for the inconvenience I thought they should do something as an apology..(maybe give us double beds).. they did not. We got to the new room and everything was cleaner (thankfully). The first night everythng worked well, although we had difficulty getting the temperature just right and for the black out curtains there is a gap so if you are up late gambling and sleep past the sunrise, it could be annoying (it was). Saturday night I went out and when I got back to the casino I gambled for a couple hours.. EXHAUSTED, I went back to the room wanting to watch a little TV. NOTHING WORKED. I couldn't watch TV, shut the blinds, even some of the lights were an issue. Then I went to the bathroom and the water wouldn't run, after using the restroom GROSS. tried to call the front desk, my phones weren't working. So I tried to call them via my cellphone and I got a message they were closed........NOT WHAT YOU EXPECT FROM A 5 STAR HOTEL!! The next morning, I coudln't wait to get out of there. I called the front desk and explained ALL that had gone on over the last two days (they had also messed up a breakfast credit).. and they told me they could offer me a one night stay in the future.. I requested they remove the 44$ resort fee (this alone ticks me off - I didn't use anything that this fee is for.... I didn't use wireless, or the fitness center - I just gambled in their casino and I still was going to be charged this)........anyway, they did take off that fee and informed me that my breakfast credt was on my account -- on friday they said it wasn't! SO DISORGANIZED... so we went to a 50$ breakfast with our 40$ credit.......NOT EVEN close to a good buffet by Vegas standards.... truly not. I was just so disappointed in this experience.
