I also have friends that live in the area and it is VERY inconvenient for them to access. YESTERDAY, I GOT the free one night stay paperwork in the mail and there are ALL SORTS of exclusions.. and it is for a standard room, when I stayed in an upgraded/view room... RIDICULOUS!! not worth the price!!!! I also filled out a survey a few days ago, thinking that maybe they will respond in a way any customer would expect. No response to this date. For 30$ more I could have stayed at a Mandalay Bay 2 bedroom Suite -- they had a promo......REALLY WISH I HAD STAYED THERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and confortable”
Reviews.Author: NJRES
Reviews.Content: Just made it back from ARIA. For a casino hotel, it is a very beautiful place. There are 3 pools to chose form in the immediate area. Also, there is Liquid, the "party pool". Drink service was a slow at the pool. In order to get a decent meal, you should leave the pool and go inside. If that is important to you. It is a quiet scene unlike the Hard Rock or Wynn pools. The bedrooms were wonderful with plenty of room and very high tech. A LCD touch screen controls all features in the room. Comfy beds. Maid service was good. Not much more to report. Typical high end casino hotel. Overall, I enjoyed this place due to its location and cleanliness. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great!”
Reviews.Author: Vegas41604
Reviews.Content: Went with friends for a long weekend! We go to Vegas at least twice a year and normally stay at the Hard Rock. Still love it there, but Aria took Vegas to a new level. Had a beautiful room and were ajoined with friends in the next room. Wish I could bring their beds home they were so comfortable! Great restaurants and clubs! Loved Liquid.....went twice! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility with horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Drifter1956
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Aria in a taxi at 11:30AM on May 13th, there was no valet directing taxi traffic. Our taxi had to stop in the far left lane to let us out. We had 5 bags and despite my shouting for some help with the bags, the bellmen either ignored us or didn’t hear us. My wife and I had to drag our bags while maneuvering through several lanes of traffic. Fortunately other guests saw our dilemma and offered to help me get the bags into the lobby. That same couple shared with us that they had had a similar experience when arriving and that they were planning to move to another hotel just because the service was so bad at the Aria. I walked the length of the front desk looking for the shortest line. A man in a suit (I assume a manager) approached me and told me to “just pick one; they are all moving at the same speed”. I picked a line and after waiting for 45 minutes to check in, I was told no room was available but that I would be called on my cell phone when one was available. We dropped our bags off with the bellmen and after a couple of hours I had not received a phone call so I checked back and was given a room key. The only positive experience I can relate is when I asked to use the honor bar to store my medicine and the front desk clerk quickly arranged for a refrigerator to be delivered to my room at no charge. We ate at the cafe Vettro on Saturday evening, May 14th. The food looked and tasted as though it had come out of a frozen box then been cooked in a microwave. The au jus tasted like it had been made from a beef bouillon cube. The food was really terrible. Our server had a cold with laryngitis and was coughing. I didn’t want to be rude and ask for another server so we took our chances. The manager of the restaurant should not have allowed that server to work around food. 2 days after being served by that server, I came down with a cold and was unable to complete our planned hike in the Grand Canyon. While shopping at the elements gift shop Sunday, May 15 at noon, my wife selected a sweat shirt and started to walk towards the cash register in the front of the store. The cashier looked at us approaching from about 12 feet away and then abruptly walked away from the cash register and headed to the back of the store and through a door without saying a word. We walked to the register at the back of the store and waited behind 2 other customers. We ate at the buffet 3 times and the food was pretty good with a nice variety of selections. I had omelets on 2 occasions and they were both great (nice and fluffy). I thought the buffet was a pretty good value. The only complaint would be that we visited 3 times and on all three occasions, I could not get the attention of a server to get a drink refill for either coffee or iced tea. I’m guessing there is a policy of “no refills”. I called room service at 10:50PM on Monday, May 16th and a young lady answered the phone. From her tone, it was clear that my call was an irritant to her. She seemed genuinely perturbed that I had taken her away from another conversation (that I could still hear in the background). When I tried to place an order for food, she interrupted me and told me it would be at least an hour and would that be okay. I was a bit incredulous when I repeated back to her “an hour?”, she responded “Absolutely!” as though she was proud of irritaing me. I declined and went looking for food elsewhere in the hotel, but at 11:00PM the Café Vettro was the only option and I had already had a bad experience there. We called room service back and somebody else answered and it did indeed take 55 minutes to get a cheeseburger and fried rice delivered to my room. (Dominoes could have brought me food in 30 minutes). I could relate a few other incidents, but if you have read this far you got the point. I do not recommend this hotel. Throughout our entire 4 days at Aria, I didn’t have a single interaction with an employee that made me feel like they actually cared or were even interested in what I wanted. In fact, several interactions made me angry because I felt belittled. Even the best interaction had the same emotional impact as a purchase at a convenience store with barred windows. It is new and a very nice facility, but the service is the worst I have ever experienced in any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My current fave place on the strip...”
Reviews.Author: Not2Girly
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Aria. We booked a City View Deluxe this time rather than the corner suite we had last year. It was perfect for us - we don't spend a lot of time in the room so we don't really need the larger suites. Check-in is still a bit of a pain there. We waited in line and decided to hold out for a room on a higher floor than was currently available. I wish there was a way to reserve that in advance, but it is luck of the draw as to what is open at the moment you get to the front of the line. We did eventually get a room on a decently high floor. Our room wasn't too far from the elevator and still fairly quiet. I heard noise in the hallway a few times, but not to the point that it bothered me. I never heard anyone above us - which is always nice. The room this time was clean - a major major sore point from my prior stay there. Housekeeping seemed to have improve greatly over our last stay, though we never did get turndown service. Our minor complaints 1) Drink service at the pool can take an agonizingly long time. They need more servers out there when it is busy. 2) Waiting in lines for restaurants that are practically empty. You should not have to wait in line at Cafe Vettro or the Buffet when there are miles of empty tables. Super annoying especially when the food is only so-so. 3) The resort fee is a joke. They need to end it and stop pretending it is a convenience for the guests. Whatev. What we like - 1) the SMELL. Some people complain about it - they are dumb. It smells heavenly. 2) The decor - it suits our 30something taste to a tee. I love it. I feel relaxed and calm and at home there. I love that is both contemporary and warm at the same time. 3) VERY FEW KIDS - OMG, I love kids, but I DETEST people who bring their kids to Vegas. What is WRONG with you? Don't you know everyone who passes you is questioning your parenting? Vegas is just not a family friendly environment so I don't get what possessed you to bring them there. Not to mention that everyone goes to Vegas to escape reality and your children (adorable or not) intrude on that. Leave them at home or stay at Circus Circus. UGH - it is what drove us away from Mandalay. 4) Cabs line up underground... such a small thing, but makes a difference in the vibe. 5) LOCATION - people who complain about it being far back are lazy. I don't WANT my casino to be located right at the front of the strip where all of the riff-raff are wandering. I love Vegas, but I am apparently a bit of a snob - some of the people there just make my skin crawl. I like the Aria vibe and the class of people that frequent the property. 6) Restaurants are okay. The buffet is terrible and I wish they had a decent contemporary Mexican place to balance out all of the Asian offerings. The tapas restaurant (Julian Serrano) is decent - some of the offerings are fabulous; some are terrible. The Todd English Pub is good, but beers are ridiculously expensive. Lemongrass was a good lunch. DISLIKE the Cafe Vittro. Bottom line - I love Aria. If you are a thirtysomething who likes a contemporary (but not cold) vibe and you are not going to bring your children there - book away!

Reviews.Title: “the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: messenger71
Reviews.Content: We were given a corner suite on the 19th - a non smoking floor. The panoramic view was magnificent. My wife got to see her " purple mountains majesty." Everything in the suite worked, from the flat screen TVs, in every room, to the remote controlled drapes and lighting. Wish we had this at home. We got spoiled. Put on your walking shoes to get to a corner suite from the elevators, but the view when you get there is worth it. We aren't high rollers by any means and we must say all the staff were very friendly and helpful when needed. Some even went out of their way to be extra nice when it wasn't a part of their job. Check-In could be a pain since everyone coming in to the main lobby clumps together like one big mob and it becomes a guessing game as to who is next and "I was here first" issue. It may take away from the overall decore they are trying to convey but roping off lines may help smooth out the check-In process. Aria is centrally located and really not far from the other major casinos on the strip. Let's face it, just walking from one casino to it's neighbor is going to be a hike. Distance here is very decieving. As for transportation, we used the tram from Crystals to Bellagio and Monte Carlo a lot. This got us off of the sidewalk crowds for a bit. Taxi service was readily available and was never a problem. Dining in Aria is not cheap but neither are most of the casinos in this area. If you're on vacation you've got to be flexible enough to roll with it. We experienced a few days of unexpected bad weather, but, I wouldn't blame the people at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased”
Reviews.Author: nadia2617
Reviews.Content: The hotel design and style is very intriguing, but that's about it, We were forced to pay $20+tax fee on daily basis for the unlimited internet usage, gym and something else. We indicated that we prefer to use our phones for the internet, but no, we either had to pay or leave.... Now, why would a 5 Star hotel force that charge if their "valuable customers" have a preference of not paying that amount.... On the top of that, from the time we checked in the room, the bathroom sink had hair from the previous guests, and throughout the entire stay, that hair was NOT cleaned up. The first night our TV went off, and we had to wait for a tech to show up and fix it the next day. The next night, the universal remote control went off, thus we could not even close the blinds, operate the lights, or the TV..... That's what happens when you rely on technology too much. Overall the stay was unpleasant.... first the charge, then tech difficulties.... and uncomfortable bead and pillows. Extremely expensive buffet for the charge of half of a lobster and unlimited wine, which was so cheap and limited because the waiter was too busy to serve us. Overpriced drinks. I had much better stay at the four star hotels. In conclusion, we will never stay in the hotel ever again. Just a hint for the hotel owner, stop forcing your fees on something that your customers have preference of using or NOT…. We would expect more perks from the so called “FIVE STAR HOTEL” for the price we paid for it. Besides from its look, the hotel is no different from any other hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry Aria...too many misses”
Reviews.Author: SailAwaySanDiego
Reviews.Content: Won't be coming back here even with a fairly good M Life Player deal. I have stayed at almost a dozen 4 to 5 star Vegas hotels and I just don't see how they earned the 5 diamond award. Check in and check out were the worst of any hotel. We were trying to get adjoining rooms rooms with another family member who also had a reservation. He said that we could wait for one to open and he could text us. He also mentioned that there were currently 2 adjoining rooms on the 4th floor but if we wanted a higher up room, we should wait. No problem - we'll wait. Almost 3 1/2 hours later at approximately 3:45pm we were texted that our rooms were ready. Turns out the only proximity of our rooms was that they were on the 20th floor. Both rooms were on different wings at the furthest end of each wing. We contacted reservations regarding the problem and they said they didn't have any adjoining rooms. Sorry. 2nd issue....power went out on Saturday night for at least 4 hours. We contacted guest services and waited on hold for about 10 minutes...likely due to other guests calling to report the problem. We were told that they were working on it but didn't know when it would be fixed. Guest services should have followed up with each person who complained or reported a problem and offered some sort of compensation for having to brush their teeth in complete darkness and not being able to shower. Also, that day it was close to 90 degrees so sleeping with no A/C is unacceptable in a AAA 5 diamond hotel. We weren't asked if there were any problems at check out. I decided it didn't matter as I wouldn't be returning anyway. Only reason this wasn't a 1 star review was that the hotel is clean and the casino is decent. We didn't like the vanilla smell at all. It was way overpowering as others have mentioned. Come to think of it this should have been a 1 1/2 star review.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel-but digital room controls are a hastle”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Bret
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It is gorgeous! The only downside is the digital bedside controls. The hotel seems to believe this is some kind of miracle system that will add a new level of comfort to all their guests. The opposite is true....at least for us. This new system was so complicated I gave up on trying to get it to work after an hour. I had to put my glasses on just to turn out the light or change the TV chanel. Everything including the curtains were controlled by this one little tough pad. Perhaps a younger person who is more savvy with techno-gadgets could have mastered it.....but i doubt they would have $270 to spend per night for the room. But other than that I was extremely impressed with place. It is five stars!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: BPRQ
Reviews.Content: Great location, professional staff - and I must admit that I am a hard to please traveler. I loved the modern design, and the connecting Mall (Pucci & DK, among other shops). Security was high, and the staff seemed to go the extra mile to provide the detailed attention that I really appreciate!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, great proximity and has everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: cmnj4
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the coolest rooms with everything you need at your finger tips. The bathrooms were very cool, beds and linens were amazing. The staff were fabulous and the location to the strip and Thomas and Mack was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but staff could be more helpful”
Reviews.Author: KevinMissionBC
Reviews.Content: We found the Aria to be a nice hotel in a convenient location, but they need to up their level of assistance. First off, we chose to arrive by shuttle. Obviously those who choose a shuttle are viewed as second class by the hotel, as we were dropped off in the parking garage, not the front enterance. There was no one there to assist with our bags and we were left to find our own way to the front desk. It was only once we made it to the front desk, which was a good hike away when packing four bags, that a bellman offered some assistance. The room was really nice. We got a deluxe king room. It had a beautiful marble bathroom with a huge soaker tub. Lighting, curtains, etc are all controlled automattically with wall push buttons or a remote control. Once the controls were figured out, they were oky to use, but I think a simple switch is just fine. One thing we found odd is that the bedding is VERY heavy. The comforter felt extremely weighted and uncomfortable to sleep under. I weighed it out of curiosity, at 18 lbs. We solved this by having housekeeping bring up a blanket and left the comforter on the floor for our stay. Other than the bedding, the room was quite comfortable and extremely quiet. Elevators were quick with verry short wait times. On our first night there, we asked directions to the strip. The staff member showed us a route between the two towers that felt like you were walking down an alley, was poorly lit, and needed multiple crossings of the same street as the sidewalk didn,t run the full distance on either side. At night it didn't feel like a safe place to be. The following day we found the other main way to the strip that we probably should have been guided to in the first place. The hotels pool was really nice, the shops and restaurants were suitable. We went to the dinner smog which ws unite good, but we were seated for sometime without anyone coming by to take our drink order. We finally had to track someone down to do this. Overall, this is a very nice hotel rated at five stars, however the staff operates at the level of service provided by hotels with way poorer ratings. When we left, we took a cab instead of our prepaid shuttle so would not have to stand around in a parking garage waiting for our ride. We have stayed at other hotels in Vegas before and will likely go back to one of the other before the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “definitely 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: LoCaMi
Reviews.Content: Unlike most of the other resorts on the strip this one doesn't seem to have a theme (probably urban, hence the name city center). As you enter the hotel it looks new and upscale and is without the overpowering smoke smell (unlike some of the other places). The room was impressive and really high tech with a universal remote that controlled everything from the lights and TV to the curtains. The bed and linens felt wonderful. The bathroom was modern looking. I can’t complain about the room or the casino, which by the way was very nice.The only complaint (if you could call it that) for me was that it was a fair distance from the best part of the strip (Caesars/ Mirage area), but of course I knew that going in.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA's service deplorable!!!”
Reviews.Author: thomas196212
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas at least twice a year. This time I made the unfortunate decison of trying out Aria Hotel at the City Center. We had 5 couples attending a 40th bday get together. The service from the moment of check in until check out, three days later was terrible. At the time of check-in, 2;30 p.m. they had no rooms available. They were suyppose to call when a room became availble, but never did. Had to stand in line for another hour. The Hotel is completley understaffed. If you go to the pool you need to bring your own drinks as they have one girl tending to 300 customers. Room service took over an hour. Check out took 45 minutes at 5:45 a.m. beacuse they only had two people at the desk with 20 people in line... almost missed my flight. To top it off they lost power for most of one night to most of the hotel. Dont waste your money,,,, rooms are not spacious nor clean.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet retreat from the madness!”
Reviews.Author: dippylippy
Reviews.Content: Could not fault the Aria. Found our room to be a lovely relaxing quiet retreat with one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in away from home. Its location on the strip was great. Of the 3 restaurants we ate in, they were all excellent. Never a problem finding a sunbed by the pool. My only one little complaint would be - no coffee/tea making facilites in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoe025
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a great stay at the Aria. It is a really impressive, modern and new looking hotel. Compared to the other hotels on the strip (apart from the Wynn which we didnt make it to) I am really pleased we stayed here as it is so much more modern and sophisticated. We were impressed by the staff in the Aria, everyone was very helpful and friendly and we had no issues to mention. The drinks service on the slots was the fastest of all the hotels we went to and strongest drinks. The room was as smart as the rest of the hotel, quite large and as others have mentioned the bed is to die for. We had dinner in Julian Serrano's which was really tasty. The buffet was good value for lunch, great seafood and deserts. We were given free passes to Haze nightclub and this was the only area of Aria i was not impressed by- very small club with no atmosphere- i would say do not bother going. The only other area below expectations was the cleanliness of the room. This is why I gave 4 stars not 5. After reading other reviews I was worried it would not have been cleaned at all. Luckily it was. However I had a look at everything perhaps more than I would normally. The under pillows had mascara marks on them (were they not changed?) and there was black hair in the shower base. I understand they have a lot of rooms to clean, but this is meant to be a 5 star resort and it is a shame they let themselves down as apart from this it was a perfect trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it. Lacking in so many areas.”
Reviews.Author: tvizz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the corner suites which we booked with the Viva Elvis tickets. The room was a bit "disjointed", not an open concept which we tend to prefer. The beds were comfortable at first, but very soft and ended up giving us sore backs after a couple of nights. We ended up eating at the Cafe Vedro in the hotel for breakfast each morning. You will learn very quickly that the drinks are expensive. It was 7.50 for an orange juice and $4 for coffee. The service at this place was horrible - I don't know if it is because the servers were too busy as they had too many tables in their section or not as the servers were kind, but very very slow. They pump a strong scent through the hotel which can be overpowering in certain sections of the hotel. The gym was nice - but the staff is not very friendly at all. The location of the hotel is okay - but if you are more interested in doing some shopping, it is quite a distance from Caesars, the Venetian and Fashion Show Mall. The casino itself is very dark and the vibe wasn't that great. The Cosmopolitan (next door) was a better environment for gambling. The pool area is nice - but nothing that different from the other hotels on the strip. The Viva Elvis show was okay - probably great if you are a huge Elvis fan - but not quite the same spectacular show you would get from most Cirque de Soleil shows. We have gone to Vegas several times and we've tried a different hotel each time - our favourite is still the Wynn with the Venetian taking second place. The price of Aria certainly is not worth what you get. It's a hotel that is just lacking in so many ways. I do question if this would be everywhere right now as I found the same level of service I used to love about Vegas was absent just about everywhere. The best service we received on this trip (and wonderful food) was at Sinatra's (restaurant at Encore/Wynn) and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: AliHWatford
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from Vegas I had to write a review for this amazing hotel. It is so well situated in the middle of the strip between the Bellagio and the Monte Carlo. It was very large and very modern. There are Fine Dining Restaurants if that is what you want or great places to Catch a coffee and a cake or a great Salad. The staff we encountered could not do enough for you. It is so well placed on the strip and you can get the Monorail to the Bellagio or the Monte Carlo. The beds are so comfortable and the pillows amazing. We found it very reasonably priced on a deal with Expedia. The pool area was very clean and there was a great pool restaurant. I would definitely recommend this to everyone. Tip Do not be tempted to buy tickets for the Hop on Hop off open Top Bus, it was very badly run and the bus stops were not obious and it was a complete waste of $35 for 2 days. Use the Duece bus or the express they were much better. The Premium outlet Mall is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and modern”
Reviews.Author: floshel
Reviews.Content: We went for our 25th anniversary. The place is very clean, modern and chic. The staff is very helpful and attentive. All was great.

Reviews.Title: “Makes you feel like a king and queen”
Reviews.Author: DTSecondHome
Reviews.Content: From beginning check in to check out we were treated very well. Slight glitch in the beginning but they resolved it very quickly and nicely as well. The room was glamerous and very clean. The dining was wonderful with the likes of delicious Chinese from Blossoms, to great food selections, and service from Vettro cafe. I could not find fault with any part of our stay. I worry sometimes reading some reviews but think some are just from grumpy people in general. Every staff we came across was extremely friendly and helpful in anyway. The beds are beyond like sleeping on a cloud. Our room was a corner suite so now we are more spoiled to say the least. Highly reccomend Aria to anyone looking for a classy, wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Drobank
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. We never had to leave the city center. Food was good room was great. This will be my hotel from now on

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms. Better than I had hoped for.”
Reviews.Author: Jack_Shaw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Aria in April and were very pleased. Check-in was a breeze and the rooms were terrific. Lots of space, fabulous beds, very nice bathrooms. We would have liked a tub in the room and the lack of a coffee maker is ridiculous, but that's Vegas. The pool area is nice and chilled. Dining options aren't particularly affordable, but there are lots of alternatives nearby. The only negative was that service was not terribly friendly nor attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Slow check in”
Reviews.Author: Cyril59
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas for my wife's birthday and thought we would try a new hotel the Aria. We arrived at the hotel at 2;00 and were told there were no corner suites ready to occupy. I was told the rooms were not vacated yet. What??? 11:00 is checkout. We went out to grab a bite and received a call at 5:00 our room was ready. There was a whole line next to us complaining their rooms weren't ready. Yes I read reviews about this nightmare and it happened. Moving on. Everything after that was wonderful. The corner suites are beautiful and worth the splurge. Very nice hotel and great location! I would stay again. The hotel just needs the check in improved.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Aria”
Reviews.Author: MartinWpg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria for three nights with my wife this past weekend and we both thought it was a good experience. The hotel was busy, but we didn't wait long at the check-in. They didn't mention the weight sensitive snack tray in the room so when my wife picked up a box of almonds to see what they were she didn't realize until after that we would be getting charged for them ($12). Not a problem though, we called the front desk and they took the charges off our bill. The hotel itself is very contemporary with all the amenities you'd expect from a prime hotel on the Strip. The rooms are large and comfortable with plenty of drawer and closet space, as well as a spacious bathroom. The electronic controls for lighting, curtains, etc will appeal to the techie travelers, and there's a control panel to hook-up your laptop to the flat panel TV. We were on a smoke-free floor so we didn't have to deal with cigarette smoke other than on the main floor areas. We're not gamblers so we didn't really spend any time in the casino other than walking through to get to where we were going. In comparison to others I didn't find that it was overly noisy and navigating through it was pretty painless. There are quite a few restaurants to choose from if you eat in the hotel; getting pastries at the Jean Phillipe Patisserie is well worth it, fresh and delicious, although out of our entire stay this was the one place we thought where the service didn't meet our expectations. One night we were getting a late snack and although we were already inside looking at what to get before they closed the doors they refused to serve us saying that the customers at the cashier were the last ones. The other time my wife had ordered a crepe and the person taking the order wrote it down wrong so when the girl was making it my wife pointed out that isn't what she ordered; the girl eventually made the right one, but had all sorts of attitude about it. We ate at the buffet for breakfast one morning and there were many things to choose from; the food there was no better or worse than other Vegas hotels we've stayed at and we didn't find that there was anything wrong with it. It is still a buffet, so don't expect it to taste like its all been cooked a la carte (except the omelette station). We also ate at the Julian Serrano restaurant which serves a tapas menu. Between us and the other couple we traveled with we ordered eight dishes and they were all very tasty. The service was very good. There were three large outdoor pools with plenty of loungers; we never had a problem finding one, and there were no issues with getting enough towels. We didn't order from the bar at the pool so I can't comment on the service; it seemed like there was always someone coming around to see if people wanted to order something, but we never found it obtrusive or annoying. Overall I'd say we had a good stay and would consider staying at the Aria again. In the past we've also stayed at Treasure Island and the Red Rock Resort & Casino. We found the Aria to be similar to the Red Rock in terms of the contemporary styling, comfort and service. The TI was fine too, but seems a bit tired by comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for a 40th Birthday Party”
Reviews.Author: Bluetoad
Reviews.Content: We celebrated a 40th birthday at Aria with 18 people. We kicked off the weekend with an in-room cocktail/fajita party in our Penthouse Suite on Friday night and then had dinner at Julian Serrano on Saturday night. Everyone was happy. The service, rooms, spa, and food were great, the beds were awesome, and the casino didn't reek of smoke! I can't imagine staying anywhere else on return trips to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “great place and excellent buffet”
Reviews.Author: billncpd
Reviews.Content: Before going to stay at the Aria, I read many negative comments about the buffet in the hotel. THOSE PEOPLE COULD NOT HAVE BEEN MORE WRONG. This buffet was equal to or better than Bellagio or the Wynn

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: cp1971Toronto
Reviews.Content: I visited the ARIA for a three-night stay in early May with some friends. As soon as we arrived, we proceeded to the check-in desk, and only waited for about five minutes in line. We were upgraded to a city view room at no charge, and the woman at check-in was friendly and polite. We were warned not to move the stuff on the mini bar or we'd be charged as they are weighted. The hotel itself is absolutely stunning. It has a clean, modern feel that's quite different from the other more kitchy hotels on the strip. Our room was spotless and gorgeous, and just as many other reviewers said, the beds are awesome. The remote controlled features are extremely easy to use, and I can't understand how anyone could have trouble with them. Just be careful with the safe. If you stuff it too full it may not open, and it takes about half an hour to get someone up to help you with it. The pools were amazing, as well, although we didn't check out Liquid. Yes, the drinks are very expensive by the pool, but you can buy your own drinks from a corner store and take them with you. I didn't find the vanilla scent offensive in the least, and I'm not a fan of perfumy smells. We didn't try any of the restaurants as they are a bit out of our budget. The hotel is huge, and set back from the strip. You'll do a fair amount of walking, but that's to be expected in Vegas, right? We ate most of our meals at New York, New York down the street as it was cheaper and the food was pretty good. There's also a McDonald's across the street if you need a cheaper breakfast option. And The Earl of Sandwich in the Hard Rock Cafe is AMAZING. I can't comprehend any of the two- or three-star reviews. The place is gorgeous, spotless and the staff are friendly, respectful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Aria, five star hotel, two cent mentality.”
Reviews.Author: BOB0339
Reviews.Content: From the time we were dropped off in the dungeon and left to find our way to the front lobby, robbing us of the opportunity to enter into a grand lobby it was a very disappointing experience for a so called five star hotel. We stayed six nights and two of the first four nights our room was not cleaned. Upon arrival the flush area had two long black hairs and stains on the floor. When we checked out six days later the two black hairs and stains were still there. The day we were to check out I called the front desk and asked for thirty extra minutes as I was running a little late. The response was rudely stated, "there are no late check outs today." At check out the desk clerk never asked me how my stay was. A five star hotel with a two cent mentality.

Reviews.Title: “If you visualize the word stunning - this is what will come to mind.”
Reviews.Author: Tschanz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a vacation to celebrate our annivesary, and I was told that we were going to do so in Las Vegas. I searched hotel review web sites for over two weeks, and read in the neighborhood of 500 reviews of various hotels up and down the strip. Just like you I read that the Aria had issues with their cleaning staff, a "dark" casino, overpowering smell, and poorly tranined staff. Taking all of those reviews in to account, I decided that I wanted to try out this hotel for myself. Having just been awarded the Five Diamond Status, I found it hard to believe that it was as bad as some had said. Our stay was four days and three nights, from Monday through Thursday. Please keep in mind that we are not high rollers, in fact we spent less than $500 gambling in the casino the entire length of our stay. We are also not rich by any means, this was to be our only vacation for the year. So, here is my review of the Aria Hotel in Las Vegas, NV. Upon arriving at the hotel, the first two things you notice are that the hotel itself is huge both vertically and horizontally. The other is an amazing waterfall that runs the length of the front of the building. When you walk in the front doors, just walk straight and the check in desk is directly to your right. We waited less than five minutes before a spot opened up at the front desk. I had originally booked a King Deluxe Room with City View through Expedia, and paid around $130 per night. I did try the sandwich trick, slipping a $50 dollar bill between my ID and my credit card. I told the desk agent that my wife and I were celebrating our anniversary and wanted to know if they had any Corner Suites available for a complementary upgrade. She handed me back my fifty, and told me to hang out for a second while she spoken with her manager. I figured that I was sunk, and resigned myself to the fact that I would not be getting any upgrade. Oh how wrong I was. She came back in a few minutes and informed me that I would be upgraded to the Tower Suites on the 36th floor with a view of the strip. I thanked her profusely, and then my wife and I made our way to the elevators (the Aria has a security guard posted at all elevators - no key, no access). When we got upstairs, we walked in to an amazing space. The front entry had all marble tiles, and a table with tray for your keys/pocket contents. Just ahead was the living room with a very comfortable couch and large 52" television. behind that was the desk and small lamp. Directly across from there was the amazing king size bed and legendary mattress. Floor to ceiling windows ran the entire length of the room, including the bathroom. Then I walked in to the enormous bathroom. To the left was an amazing jacuzzi bathtub unlike any I have ever seen. Behind it was a shower that was stone/glass with a bench in it that could have easily sat four adults. Behind the shower, and in its own room with a frosted glass door was the toilet complete with bidet (which I was far to scared of - although my wife did enjoy it). At the end of the bathroom was the closet and safe. On the opposite side of the room were two sinks and a 20" flat screen that you could watch from the bath tub. Many people have complained about the high tech gadgets in the rooms. I will break it down as easily as I can. The unit is roughly 8" x 10" and looks like a picture from. On the screen are icons representing everything from the TV/Lights/Curtains, etc. The unit is easier to use than most universal remotes on the market today. I was like a kid in a candy shop as I ran through the various functions and watched the entire room respond to my finger tips. PLEASE do not let this detour you from staying at this hotel. The unit was extremely simple to use - and added to the overall modern feel of the room. There room itself was spotless. There was nothing in the tub/shower/toilet/sinks that should not have been. The floors and bed were freshly cleaned, and every surface was dusted as well. All in all, I had only two issues with the room during our stay. First, the sinks seem to drain very slowly. Second, and even more miniscule than that - on our last night the room safe wouldn't open for me. After a call to the front desk I had a tech and a security guard in my room within thirty minutes to open the safe for me. Turns out I had hit the wrong button when I last locked it and had cleared the combination I had programmed in to it. Around 7pm on the first night of our stay we decided to grab some dinner and walk up the strip. We returned to our room around 11pm and found a plate of chocolate covered strawberris/maccaroons along with a Happy Anniversary card sitting on the table be the front door. This was a very thoughtful action, considering I had only mentioned it briefly during check in. We had room service twice during our stay, and both times well after midnight. The food arrived to our room hot and fresh, and always within less than thirty minutes. Make sure you ask for turn down service on the final night of your stay. We were suprised to find that along with the turn down, we had been given chocolates. Not just one chocolate mind you, but instead a box of 6 chocolates on each pillow! At the end of our stay I did the express checkout with my Blackberry. My bill was emailed to me with zero issues and all charges accounted for. As we walked out the front door, I did notice a large amount of people waiting to check in. That was to be expected due to a major fight as well as the Kentucky Derby having been scheduled for the weekend. Overall, this hotel far exceeded my expectations. In fact, I can say that this facility is without question the best I have ever experienced. Every detail, every smile from the staff, and every aspect of this hotel puts it far above anywhere else I have every stayed.

Reviews.Title: “How do the room lights work ??”
Reviews.Author: longjim
Reviews.Content: There four days and still couldn't figure it out. Everything in the room is controlled by the tv remote and don't even try to set the alarm on the bedside clock.

Reviews.Title: “Most modern and chic”
Reviews.Author: travelingwfamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the most modern and updated in Vegas. While it has all the benefits of all the others in the same great location, this one combines them with class and up to date furniture. This is too combined with in room technology such as automated blind shutting and light control. While the other hotels in vegas are great for visiting and strolling through throughout the day, this is the perfect hitel to return to. Not too tacky nor worn out due to use as the others. It is located on the main hotel zone and has easy access to all other main resorts. It smells great when you come in and has beautiful decor. I would return to this htel no doubt

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not recommended for first time visitors”
Reviews.Author: kvealg8r
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Aria while I was there for a business trip. We stayed 4 nights for a 3 day conference in the Aria convention center. The rooms were very nice, probably the nicest hotel we have ever stayed in. We received a free upgrade from one of the standard rooms in the conference block to a city view room, 14th floor. When we walked in the room for the first time, the curtains automatically opened as we walked in the room showing off the spectacular view. All facilities in the bedroom and bathroom were clean, comfortable, and state of the art. The conference fee included the resort fee, which gave us access to wifi, the pool, fitness center (we did not go there) and spa (also no time to visit). My husband enjoyed the pool as I was in meetings all day. The reason I say this isn't recommended for first time visitors is that there are other hotels that I would consider more centrally located. We were able to take the tram from City Center to Bellagio. Also not a bad walk to Planet Hollywood or to Monte Carlo. Restaurants in the resort that we visited included Roasted Bean (lattes as good as Starbucks, great muffins and bagels), Lemongrass (satay was good, remaining menu a little pricey), Skybox (good for bar food but really expensive). Overall great service, felt like we got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: samcarol
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for our 25th Wedding Anniversary in April 2011. Excellent choice - hotel was everything we thought it would be - brilliant location and hotel very clean and modern with notably fresh smell on entering foyer. Hotel room very spacious - plentiful supply of clean towels and toiletries. King size bed sooooo comfortable. Layout of room excellent. Controls in room brilliant idea. Good breakfast menu to choose from (Jean Philippe restaurant) and staff very friendly. Concierge staff extremely pleasant and helpful. Overall a most memorable stay which I would highly recommend. Only one negative point - charged around 22 dollars a night for some sort of tax when we checked in (this included a free daily newspaper but you had to go and collect it yourself instead of it being delivered) - however have since discovered most Las Vegas hotels do this.

Reviews.Title: “As big as a City!”
Reviews.Author: Cherie2812
Reviews.Content: Walking into Aria was an aromatic delight. I'm not sure if I was inhaling the scent of Vanilla or Chocolate, or both. Every time we walked back into the hotel from outside, I took in a deep breath to get as much of the intoxicating scent as I could! The hotel is large. They certainly named it correctly. Everything you'd ever want was within reach. Spa, Pool, Entertainment, Casino, Shopping, Nightlife, Restaurants, fantastic views from the rooms, cozy and luxurious accomodations, tram to the City Centre and the Belagio, and then some. Since it is a large hotel, be forewarned that you will wait in a long line for Breakfast/Brunch. The hotel staff is not as welcoming as they could be, and we learned of daily charges to the room when we checked out that were not explained to us upon check-in. This hotel is exceptional but it is not for the person looking for a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ...but once is enough”
Reviews.Author: HarleyLover
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel but there are others on the strip that I like better that are not as expensive. Everything was nice and new though. Loved the pool area and the jacuzzi, that was the best part for us. We 'toured' the Liquid Lounge...don't get that at all. It's ridiculous unless you are 20 something with a hot body and pretend you have tons of $$ to blow. Because we walk everywhere and prefer not to drive once we are in town, the walk from the strip to the hotel was quite a walk. Overall it was nice....if the prices were cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, but there are better.”
Reviews.Author: Andy_0nT0ur
Reviews.Content: I have to preface this review by noting I only stayed at the Aria for one night. A longer stay may have changed my opinion. I booked the Aria as the latest 5 Star on the strip (usually stay at Wynn and Encore) and was looking forward to being wowed by my stay. Whilst enjoyable I have to say I felt a little underwhelmed. Without doubt it is a beautiful hotel, but it seemed to lack a little something that elevated it above being just another good hotel on the strip. The casino large and getting a spot at the card tables, or on a machine was never a hassle. The shopping at near by City Centre is worth checking out, but leave your credit card behind lest you be tempted by the latest high fashion. The rooms are nicely appointed and relatively spacious, and boast a high-tech system that allows you to control every aspect of the room using the TV remote. Whilst a neat little trick, the remote and system is a little cumbersome. The bathroom is adequate (though don't expect a large bathroom). Room service had good quality food which was surprisingly affordable for a hotel stay, and friendly staff. Being such a massive new hotel the rooms can be a fair way off from the elevators. My room 22033 felt like it was about 600 meters from the elevator, and the corridor kept on going. Overall the Aria is a good quality hotel that just lacks a bit of Wow. Others may love its appeal so it's worth checking out. For me though, my next stay will be back at Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, Amazing rooms and fabulous beds!”
Reviews.Author: Katetk8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria in April 2011 and it was everything you expect from a true 5 star hotel. Fabulous location, right in the middle of the action. Stayed in a king executive room on the 24th floor, was very spacious, definately worth the extra, paid $90 per night plus resort fee per night on expedia, fabulous value! Warm chocolate brown tones provided a great environment, the room was spacious and the beds were amazing! I am going to buy the bed it was that good! Casino is not a themed one but fabulous. Great dining options also. Hotel is still quite new so everything is next to new. Pool area is also fabulous with three different pool options! Definately reccommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the hype on TA”
Reviews.Author: Xtina_R
Reviews.Content: We read many reviews before settling on Aria so we expected a lot before we even arrived. The bedside computer panel room control thing was neat. I can see how it could be a bit confusing, but once we figured it out (in all of 30seconds) it was simple. The location is great. it was a bit of a trek to get to our room - there was only one bank of elevators smack dab in the middle so if you had a room close to either end it was a bit of a walk. The gym was great and clean. We didn't use the spa as there was an additional $30/day charge on top of the $22/day resort fee we were forced to pay upon arrival. <we went for massages at Qua at Caesar's so used their facilities, very nice> 2 lightbulbs were burnt out in our room and we advised front desk the day we checked in but nothing was ever fixed <closet and bedside> Liquid lounge was okay but go before 1pm to get your stamp for free in and out for the day. After 1pm you have to pay a cover charge on top of the $50 min fee for a lounge chair ($500 for the daybed and no idea how much more for a cabana). The other three pools were great and we never had trouble finding a chair. All the hotel staff was very courteous. Casino was nice but smokey in the evening- like all the other casinos. Hotel dining was great (Sage, Jean Philipe). The "Pub" food was okay, service was terrible, but to his credit I think he was the only guy on the patio an it was full. Not impressed with the buffet for brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but deserving of a 5-Star”
Reviews.Author: talluta
Reviews.Content: Travelled with friends for a weekend trip and had a great time. This is my 4th time in Vegas staying at Caesars, Mirage, Wynn, and now the new Aria. The new Aria is a fantastic hotel. It is centrally located and very big. The hotel is a little tedious to get out of, however, once you get the hang of it, the strip is easily accessed. The design of the hotel is spectacular. The colour scheme works and the details in craftmanship are mindblowing. The Casino is average size, however, never seemed crowded. Limits are manageable and there are a variety of tables and slots. Sportsbook was better than expected, but not as good as Caesars. Facilities are outstanding. The gym has a variety of machines with towel, water, and fruit all part of the experience. A great way to start the morning. Never did the spa, but heard good things about it. The pools are great. There is something for everyone. There are quiet pools and an adult only pool/club called liquid. If you can afford it, I would definitely recommend booking a Cabana. It was probably the highlight of the trip. Rooms are amazing. We had a standard room and I can't imagine how anyone would want anything more from a hotel room. Comfortable bed, quality materials, great design, all the amenities and toilletries you would expect from a 5-Star. What separates the Aria's rooms from other hotels is the use of technology. From requesting housekeeping to drawing your curtains, everything is done through a remote. I would definitely suggest spending 10 minutes walking around the room and seeing what everything does. I really don't understand how anyone can complain about the service. I can't imagine better. The housekeeping is the best I have ever experienced. We were two men in the room and left the room a bit of a mess every day and every evening came back with the room in perfect shape, including our clothes and toiletries. Any requests from the front desk was dealt with promptly and with a smile. From the front desk to the baggage handlers, it felt that everyone was there to make sure you were happy. The restaurants in the hotel are expensive, but spectacular. We ate at Jean Georges and it was excellent. The tapas restaurant and the sportsbook restaurant were also very good. Overall, the hotel is one of the premier hotels in Vegas. It's only flaw is how expensive everything is, however, for what you get, the costs are warranted. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “It was great but just missing something!”
Reviews.Author: Freeway12
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was very hesitant about staying at the Aria after reading some of the negative reviews however, we had absolutely no problems at all. Hotel is GORGEOUS, Check in line went fast (but have to agree with other reviews that they should have a single line instead of everyone going to just any line). We got there around 10 AM on a Friday and we were able to get our room immediately! Room was beautiful with a City View, housekeeping came everyday and did an excellent job and the beds were very comfy. We ate at 3 restaurants including room service and all the food was VERY GOOD. We didn't have any problem in finding chairs by the pools and we went to the pool every day at different times. All the staff memebers were great and went out of their way to say hello! I have to admit that food and drink prices were over the top and I think the Aria could give their customers a break here! We were also disppointed in the MLife card credits. We dropped a couple thousand dollars and only got $32 comps! Mandalay Bay gave us much, much better comps when we were there in the fall. We aren't sure we would stay here again but it would depend on if we could get a deal. Like I said, everything was great but there's just something that was missing and I can't put my finger on it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic, great value hotel, in very central location.”
Reviews.Author: glencdawson
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night Easter break, staying at the Aria. Having previously stayed at the Wynn, we were not expecting this hotel to be up to the same kind of standard, but were very pleasantly surprised. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would stay here again, subject to it remaining competitively priced. Plus Points: - Location: The Aria is located right on the centre of the Strip, being very close to Bellagio / Paris. There is a free monorail that links the Monte Carlo, Aria, Vdara and Bellagio. Being in this central position means that there are plenty of shops, bars and restaurants, all within a few minutes’ walk. - Bedrooms: The bedrooms are incredibly modern and comfortable, having lots of ‘techie’ toys to play with, such as the iPad like control panel, that controls everything from the room temperature to the position of the curtains. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Despite our room being one of the more basic, we still had plenty of space and were high up enough to be able to watch the sun go down over the distant hills, of an evening. The bathroom was equally as impressive, being extremely modern and having plenty of space. Despite the hotel being fairly busy, we were never disturbed by anyone from outside the building, in the corridor or from the adjoining rooms, so the soundproofing must be fairly good. - Amenities: There were at least 8 restaurants and several bars throughout the hotel, although I couldn’t comment on the quality of the food, as we chose to eat outside. They ranged from the ‘Sports Bar’ where you could get takeaway burgers, to several top end restaurants with European chefs. The hotel gym was fantastic, probably one of the best I have ever used, with almost every piece of kit that you could ever need. The swimming pool complex included 3 pools and was great for relaxing after a day out shopping! Other amenities included a fairly decent shop and health spa that offered a number of treatments. - Check In / Staff: Despite it being the Saturday before Easter, we managed to check in within around 10 – 15 minutes. In fact we got from the plane to our room in less than 1 hour! The check in member of staff was very polite and gave us all of the relevant information that we needed. To avoid any queues on check out – we used the ‘express checkout’ option from the TV in the room, which was fairly straightforward. Negative Points: (Fairly minor) - The safe was designed for a laptop and therefore you would struggle to lock up more bulky items such as an SLR camera. - As with most hotels, the items in the fridge are touch sensitive, so you can’t move anything without being charged for it. This means you can’t store anything else in there that you may have purchased outside. - On arrival you are made aware of the resort tax – which for the Aria is $20 per night plus tax. It was slightly disappointing to find out there was extra to pay, although this did include free use of the gym, free WI-FI, two free drinks and a complimentary paper every day – all of which we used, so it wasn’t quite so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Typical strip hotel...great location but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: AZ-Traveler85253
Reviews.Content: Against my better judgment, the guys in my golf group convinced me to stay on the strip for our annual golf trip. After some research, I picked Aria, since it was a new property. I predicted what our stay would be like, and I was right on the nose; pretty, good location, but overpriced and not fun. ROOM: Check in was fine, although they have no structure for a line, so you just stand behind somebody and hope they are quick. Unfortunately, I picked the problem check in and other guests in other lines who arrived after me were in their rooms while I waited. The view was great and the automated system for monitoring your room was cool, after the learning curve. Even with the blackout shades drawn, the room was still way too bright. Beds were really soft and fluffy pillows made for easy sleeping. I thought the shower/bathtub setup was a little weird, and with glass doors, offered zero privacy. Shower pressure was fair. We came back to the room at 4pm on Friday and Saturday to a room that was not cleaned, so that was a little irritating. FOOD: D minus for quality and price. Holy cow...$18 for a breakfast buffet and it had half the selections of any Station casino and almost 3 times the price. Not to bang on the strip hotels, but wow, what a rip-off. $7 for a glass of OJ, $5 for coffee...I could go on. Every restaurant and bar at this place was severely overpriced, and the quality did not match the lofty costs. Serrano's was a joke...(tapas)...$14 for flat iron steak, and what arrived was 4 small pieces...and I mean small small pieces. Same with all the other dishes they said are for two people. We spent $200 and another party spent $400, and we both walked away hungry. Bar drinks can run you $20-$25 per specialty drink. This place is way out of touch with their food and beverage costs. GAMBLING: I go to win, not just to play. Therefore, I play single or double deck blackjack only. Aria had one table of single and one of double with a minimum of $50. Yeah...I may bet that eventually, but I like the chance to decide. I had to go downtown to gamble. The dealers were wither surly or indifferent, with a couple exceptions. Mostly continuous shoe blackjack, which is the highest advantage to the house. If you are a serious BJ player, this is not the place for you. Nice poker room though. My wife commented that the fitness center was the best she had ever seen. So, Aria proved to be exactly what I thought it would be; overpriced and a terrible experience. It is new, and beautiful, and has a good location, but that doesn't do anything for me. When I go to Vegas, I want to enjoy myself, both gambling and off the floor. Aria never gave me the chance with their overpriced food and beverage, lack of fun staff and non-player friendly games.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: Kijijiken
Reviews.Content: Was there with my wife and son for 3 nights. Had 2 towels and a half used container of shower gel. Had to request towels and soap. Floors were not cleaned at all the time we were there. Some staff could definitely use an attitude readjustment session. They easily forget you are the guest xnd it is their job to be polite. If you want to connect your iPod to the tv there is a kit for $20. My son cut his finger in the room. There is a first aid kit but it also is $20. The pub food was average and meals arrived late and at different times. If you arrive by the airport shuttle you get dumped off in the basement. A very long walk to the front desk. Do not spend the money on the Elvis Show. This is not Cirque quality. Very poorly done. We and other people left before the end. Vegas hotels do nr seem to provide the service and quality from previous years.

Reviews.Title: “Aria has changed; saw a bug this visit”
Reviews.Author: jbidder
Reviews.Content: My last review was excellent with the exception of a few cashiers. Again, someone need to re-train the cashiers on customer service. My review has changed due to the filthy windows which cancelled any view that I tried having from my room with my morning coffee. Also, I noticed a bug on my white duvet and I almost went insane (don't know what type it was). Additionally, these rooms are very dusty as if housecleaning never dust the place. Finally, I have achieved Gold status and was never offered any upgrades (not at check-in as stated) and I checked in on a Wednesday (they didn't appear crowded, yet no one offered me an upgraded room0. The water in the bathroom still has a terrible splash which is so annoying. The good things about Aria are: clean casino, excellent food at the Buffet, security at the elevators and having a few of my requests met by housekeeping (extra lotion, soap, etc). Aria has the best toiletries than any other hotel that I have stayed in). Plus, the beds were very comfortable..

Reviews.Title: “An awesome room, good drinks, a bit cold atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: cunparis
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas many times and this was my first time in a 5* hotel. Everything was perfect. The self-park was well indicated and was very close to the lobby. I'd estimate a 5 minute walk from our car to our room. That's really important because in some casinos it can easily be 15+ minutes. When we walked in the air was full of a wonderful scent. Checkin line was not too long. We had a corner suite on the 34th floor with a strip view. This room was amazing. I've never had a room so nice. Everything was perfect. Our alarm was set to open the curtains. Much better than a buzzer. The breakfast buffet was great and had some lunch type items. We ate just before 11am so it was cheaper. The pool was a bit weak but we didn't come for the pool. Instead of 3 small pools I'd prefer one large one. If you really want a great pool this is not it. The atmosphere was a bit "cold". It was chic and very refined but just seemed to be a bit too much so. Table game limits were high so we played the slots which were nice. The free drinks were great. One of the best pina colada's on the strip! Overall this trip was truly excellent in every way and Aria would be my first choice for our next trip. We spent a lot of time at the Venetian but it was much cheaper to stay at the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Just L-O-V-E-D it!”
Reviews.Author: mawola
Reviews.Content: Great location, fantastic rooms - but not an old Vegas-with-history place - but a good place!

Reviews.Title: “Aria Pool”
Reviews.Author: TNG
Reviews.Content: Pros: 3 Pools, Hours 9-6 and abundant lounge chairs as well as towels. Visited Mon - Thurs Cons: Drinks are expensive $12 or $22 each, only 2 choices for drink size Limited number of waitresses by pool, had to go to the bar myself, couldn't find a waitress Could not get food served by waitress, they only had turkey wrap To get food the outside restaurant is open only on weekends,. so had to go to the restaurants carryout stand next to it and it took 45 minutes for 1 turkey club. Boths days had the same problem. WiFi in room didn't work

Reviews.Title: “Sadly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: InquisitiveTessa
Reviews.Content: From driving into the self-park to check-out, this was not a great experience. It wasn't horrible, just wasn't good. Their signage is horrible...so it's not easy to get to where you want to go. Long, long lines at check-in. We were wondering why it was taking so long with each person. Once it was our turn, we figured it took so long with everyone else because they messed up their reservations just like ours. We had pre-payed for a specific room and had our written confirmation in hand to show what room we should have been given. We were only told that the room or any similar room (king bed, non-smoking, with a city view) was not available. They offered to put us in a king, n/s with a mountain view. When we said we didn't want a mountain view, we wanted what we paid for and requested to speak to a manager, they indicated they could take $30 off our room if we accepted the mountain view room because it was $30 cheaper than the one we paid for (though they didn't indicate that at first when they were trying to put us there). She also indicated that even though we pre-payed for a specific room, that they weren't obligated to have one for us and insisted that the confirmed room was only "options" that they would provide if available. I can accept that a king bed is optional. But city view is not optional and a non-smoking room is not optional, especially for medical reasons. She refused to bring us a manager, went to speak with the manager herself, and came back and told us the manager said the same thing to her that she said to us. Anyway, after a half hour at the check-in with a long line of people still waiting behind us, we agreed to take the lesser priced room. For our trouble, we were given 2 coupons for a free glass of wine or beer (with no limitations on type). Finally made it through the casino to the elevators to the room. The room was clean and looked nice. However, there were no wash clothes in the bathroom...so I had to wait for those to be delivered before getting ready for a show. Remember the drink coupons? Later that night when we went to have our glass of wine and go into the casino, the only wine they would give us was their house wine, which tasted slightly of vinegar. So, we didn't drink the nasty wine and also decided not to play in their casino because we didn't want to take the chance of giving them any more of our hard-earned money. We were supposed to be able to check out via the television (as one option). It had the wrong person's name on the room so we couldn't check out via that method. So, long process of checking out later, the reason we couldn't check out that method and had to go through a person is because it flagged us for having a credit (the $30 credit that was applied to our room at check-in because they didn't have the room we were supposed to have, minus some other fee equaling a credit due to us for $18). What a pain in the neck it all was...and then trying to find our way back to the self-park was also not easy due to poor signage. So, I will never go there again. The weekend before we stayed at the Encore. We couldn't have been more pleased with the Encore. That's where we'll stay next time we go back...and will not step foot in Aria again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! What's that amazing scent when you walk in the lobby? Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: redshoegirl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, great views, amazingly comfortable beds and high-tech rooms. Only wish they had a coffeemaker and/or small fridge. We kept using the garbage can for an extra ice bucket. Would love to can and bring home the vanilla/lavender/bergamot scent from the lobby. Only bad thing is that drinks are (not) surprisingly overpriced at pool and in casino, and the stairwells are locked. We tried to get from 16th floor down to visit our family on 15th floor (we had requested rooms on same floor but that didn't happen). By elevator, we had to go down to lower levels, switch elevators, then take another one back up because one set was 3-15, next one (ours) was 16-34, etc. If you tried to take stairs, you could get in, but couldn't get back out because they were locked. Kind of an inconvenience considering 3x we requested and were told our group would be on same floor. Otherwise, a refreshing change from the older places in the middle of the strip. Closeby CVS pharmacy had everything we had forgotten or needed. Friendly staff, everyone very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “How can you not like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: abbo8
Reviews.Content: 6 of us have just spent 7 nights in this amazing hotel. We are in different age groups and preferences ,we all loved it. The most comfortable beds ever. The high tech rooms are so good. The casino is one of the most generous for giving you drinks even when playing 1 cent machines. The aria certainly lives up to it's 5 star rating. As usual reading some other reviews people manage to find faults with even the best. If you do not like this hotel there is no hope for you.

Reviews.Title: “New and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pkil
Reviews.Content: A new Hotel Very Clean Rooms Very Friendly Staff Great Buffet Good Location Good Value for the price Technologicly advanced rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality for your money!”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeMama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Aria in Las Vegas. It is a beautiful hotel with a good location and state of the art architecture. The bed was wonderfully comfortable while the room was lovely. We were able to get a great deal on this 5 star hotel which was very nice. This was our second trip to Vegas, and the only other place we have stayed was the Wynn. I would have probably rated this at 5 stars if I had not previously stayed at the Wynn where everything is absolutely perfect and immaculate, but you pay a price for that kind of place! The only drawbacks to the Aria was the lack of variety in some of their dining. Everything seemed kind of the same going from one place to another. The pool was spacious and beautiful, but the poolside service was not anything to write home about. There was an overwhelming smell of coconut in the casino....not bad by any means, but a little too strong. The casino service was great and the variety of machines were also top notch. I would definitely return, and we had a great experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, food not as nice”
Reviews.Author: janileigh
Reviews.Content: Impressive walking in and the hotel and casino are beautiful and modern. Such design, it was amazing. We were upgraded to a city view room, very nice. Room was clean and smaller than we are used to but we knew the square footage so that's not a complaint.. The maid service was very good and they were always friendly when seeing them in the halls. Check in and check out took about 5 minutes each time and we arrived on a saturday afternoon, checked out on Wednesday morning. The design is very cool and we didn't notice the music being annoying, we liked it. Every casino has music. The smell was not bad but we didn't love it. It was a litle heavy but didn't smell like vanilla at all to us. Many nicer hotels in LV have snacks in the room and a fridge. They explain how it works so if a person picks stuff up then they should have listened. We did get charged for a beer and we didn't even open the fridge so we had to get that taken off. it was no problem but she did argue that I had to have picked it up and I swear....we didn't even open the fridge and it was before any maid service ever came to the room so it was strange. Cafe Vettro.....very very very poor quality of food and expensive. We ordered nachos and they had cheese whiz and some nasty looking old toppings. It was the quality of a ballpark or movie theater. The steak sandwich was horrible and fatty with grissle and stale bun. I am not picky at all and rarely not happy with any food in Vegas but this was pathetic. The prices were not just expensive like you expect but even higher than most cafes. Go over to Bellagio cafe if you want a cafe, it's excellant. The buffet is ok, not bad at all but for the same price you can have the brunch at Bellagio or Wynn which both blow this one away. Also, I had a massage at the spa. It was nice but not as nice as the one at Palazzo and it's the same price if not higher. Oh, one more thing. I hear about how amazing the beds are but our bed had a big hump in the middle and it felt like we were rolling out of the sides. I didn't like the big fluffy pillows either, I like a flat pillow but that's just me. We missed out bed.

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyed my Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: joparke
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and had a corner suite which was totally worth it! The space was wonderful the views from my bedroom was breathtaking and bathroom area layout perfect for relaxing. The room had an additional 1/2 bath area in the foyer for guest to use. When we check-in the lines was not very long and it moved pretty well. I am unsure why people complain about lines at check-in because ALL hotels have lines and it truly depends on the time of your arrival. If you come to Vegas to complain, you can find a great deal to complain about but waiting 5 to 10 minutes in a line is not a big deal for me. On Thursday we decided to check out Liquid Pool - the best idea my friend came up with for the entire trip. We got there about 12.15 and learnt that there was free champagne until 1 pm and free entry for hotel guest with the VIP pass. The staff was very accommodating, the drinks was the usual hotel prices and the day was perfect. Everyone was in a good mood, the music was pumping and we stayed there until about 5 pm because we had dinner reservations at 8.30pm at Carnevino. We went back to Liquid Pool on Friday again because we were so relaxed and happy the day before. The sum for the Daybed (which includes food and beverage) increased for Fri and Sat but we ordered above that amount in any event and it was great! The service was even better on Friday because we had Bobby attending to us! My room service was great! Each person would ask if they could lay out my meal or pour the coffee/open the bottle or whatever. The food was very tasty particularly the turkey burger! Yummmy. The casino staff was friendly and of course you would meet the rare miserable dealer but all in all, I thought they were great. They were patient with my friend Candice who was learning the game and the craps dealers was giving me advice on my bets and thankfully I listen and won big that day on hard 8! :) I think the layout of Haze and the lighting is great but on Thursday night the DJ it seem to me that the DJ played the same music over and over...boring. So we left. Did not visit again during our stay because there are so many options in Vegas but would try it again on another night. Check out was a little complicated because I booked a second room via a 3rd party for a friend in our party using my credit card etc and the $50 credit was not made initially and although the lady on check-in said she would follow-up she obviously did not. But Stephanie and the other young lady on Monday night/ Tues morning took care of everything and they did all the calls to the 3rd party and quickly handled it. When I got home I follow-up with a call to ensure that the credit and comps were made and although the guy on the phone was a bit impatient at the beginning once I called him out on it he calm himself down and realized I was right and actually found another credit I should have got and did it for me...now how can I complain about that! I would stay at Aria again. Hopefully I would be able to get the 2 bedroom suite the next time so we can all stay together but those suites are very popular and hard to get so secure it in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: jessietan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new and clean still, compared with older venues which smokers have already ruined by their smokes. They shd consider keeping their casinos like those in Canada smoke free so as to maintain the excellent image and ambience of all 5star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Isitwarmyet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 8 nights. We went for our anniversary. They upgraded our room when I told them we were there for our anniversary and also sent to our room a card and plate of chocolate covered strawberries and cookies. The room was very quiet. We had a wonderful time. The Aria is very, very nice. Excellent staff-they were alway very polite and helpful. The fitness room is very nice but a little hard to find. You have to go through the spa to get to it. NO bedbugs-I'm sure everyone would like that info as that has been a concern for people traveling. Would stay there again-in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA - Nice hotel, nice location, nice look!”
Reviews.Author: NOLA2STL
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze! We went on Easter weekend. There were a lot of travelers checking in (about 4:00pm), but many desk clerks to assist. The hostess explained ALL features of the resort, including daily fees and amenities. There were no surprise charges...everything explained upfront. The room was very nice. It does take a few minutes to learn how to "control" the room with the automated features. The vanilla smell of the casino is very nice and NOT overpowering. The water features and artwork throughout the hotel are delightful. The central location on the strip is ideal...nothing too far away. I plan to return to Las Vegas in a year, and ARIA will probably be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “OMG Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Acc888
Reviews.Content: My Hubby and I love vegas and go about every year or two years. We wanted to stay at Aria or the Cosmopolitian but decided on Aria. What a nightmare, it was one thing after another. Our vacation was booked through a 3rd party so my Hubby couldn't check in first cause they said he wasn't on the file, (Which I confirmed with 3rd party and paper work had his name) so they make him pay for a new reservation which they claim they can merge with our prepaid package when they paper work gets resend to them After 30 mins go by paper work magically appears and they say they have successfully merged the 2 reservations. So the next nite we return to hotel and we are locked out, we call down they said they have us checked out. All our luggage still in there :( We ask them to recheck and they say they have another reservation under us so they send the bellman up with the new keys, took 20mins to come up. Same nite a drunk guy manages to open our door with his key in the middle of the nite and starts yelling, good thing we sleep with the security thing on the door. Go complain the next morning get new keys. Next nite keys don't work again call down this time no reason why keys deavtivated. Takes 15 mins for bellman to come up with new keys. Nite before we check out I go down to front desk to make sure that every is all fixed and no charges will be made since prepaid, woman said she confirmed with manager, we we're all set. Come back home and I was charged for 2 extra nites cost me. Call the hotel to get a refund they can refund one of the nites. They blamed the 3rd party company for messing up the reservation, but in reality the day I arrived they had me in the system. The rooms are nice, beds are comfortable, but all the headaches that came with this trip were not worth a second visit.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: RunBoston4X
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nites in City View room. Check-in was easy. Room on 22nd floor facing Vdara (postage stamp of a pool btw...). Room was great. AC was quiet.
