Did not even peek into the minibar lest I get charged. My focus was on pool. Pool area was great. Three pools. All basically the same although one pool did appear to attract more kids due to the shallow entry. Drinks are pricey but good. 32oz mojito/mai tai runs $22. Music is just loud enough and not obnoxious. Liquid was up and running but it wasn't overly loud. Service was frequent and friendly. In fact staff @ Aria all great. Very welcoming. What I really liked bout Aira was that you did not have to schlep through the casino to get to the pool. Too often you have to hike thru the smoke and din of the casino floor. Not at Aria. Very well laid out. A definite bonus and clearly a benefit of smart planning. Spa was good. They have some co-ed rooms and then the saunas, whirlpools are guys/gals only. There is a heated pool that overlooks Liquid which is outside. Ate at the buffet once. It was fine but had I full explored the options would have ate elsewhere in the hotel. Reasonable meals can be found but it takes a while and I ran out of patience. Hotel's design is great. Like the use of stone and wood. It's a very comfortable and contemporary place to stay. Saw the Cirque Elvis show. Was alot of fun. Not as athletic or artistic as Mystere or O but it's hard to beat The King. There's so much more but I'll leave it to others. I'll be back. Enjoyed it all.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service”
Reviews.Author: elviegal
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, very clean. Refrigerator full of snacks and drinks. My husband was so curious and looked at the items when he lifted the items it automatically charged our room. We bought a coffee creamer in the nearby pharmacy and we put it on top of the soda in the refrigerator . When we came back it was gone. When we asked the front desk the rep said it was not allowed for us to put anything in the refrigerator. There was no note and if was not allowed why didn't they just left it in our room instead. Why took it. When we went to front desk to dispute the charges we never incurred but there was a very very long line of people in check out stand and it took forever to get done with one guest. A lot of their crew and manager walking back & fort in the front desk but not helping the people working at the front desk. There are lot of open stall. The general manager could order all the hotel crew ( and so is the manager ) to help the guest but no they ignored the guest annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Looks WOW but very unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: REBELHEART10
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a corner suite on 6th floor for 6 nights as part of our Honeymoon. Was shocked at how unfriendly the check in guy was, had a bit of a laugh with his collegue at the next desk which made us feel very uncomfortable, at check out the girl just asked the room number, asked if I wanted it on the credit card & printed the receipt. No smiles, no hello, no Thanks for staying with us. Really felt like we were just a number, they don't care if you enjoyed it or not as they have guests rolling in and out of the place everyday. We didn't get a higher floor or a free drink or anything even though our travel agent had stated it was our Honeymoon & after paying $1650. The corner suite was fabulous though. Floor to ceiling windows in sitting room, bedroom & bathroom. Very modern & comfortable. The restaurants are a shocking price, in all honesty unless you were rolling in it you couldn't afford to eat here every night, in any of the 16 restaurants bar the buffet...which is just a buffet! and Oh you have to tip before you get inside the door, I thought tipping was for good service?? Get out your wallet cos they ask for 18 - 20 % ! The Aria is nice, clean & modern. Corner suite was fab. I'd recommend it for that but to be honest I wouldn't go back there, no friendly or heart warming stories here :(

Reviews.Title: “Party Central”
Reviews.Author: drinkwiz
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 night deal through Southwest Airlines Vacations that was to include a $50 per day property credit. Never got the credit as Southwest vacations did not print it out on our documents! The hotel had no proof so can't blame Aria. Wish Aria would have worked it out with SWA Vacations but they left that to us. NEVER again will use SWA vacations as they are a third party, nothing Soutwest can do they say. Check in was a short wait for us but I watched others as they waited in line for an open counter. There is not one single line but several lines behind each open counter. The lady felt bad for the hotel credit thing and gave us a better room which had a pool view. We knew about the $23 per day resort fees but were shocked when we were told there was a $30 per night charge for a 2nd bed! Once again SWA Vacations did not disclose this. My brother in law and myself were not about to share a bed so we paid the fee. We will contact our credit card company to work on these issues!!! Our room was beautiful, clean, big & comfortable!! Beds were perfect as were the pillows. Love the remote that was like an ipad. Took a little playing with it to figure it out. It operates the lights, curtains, television, movies, music, etc. We used it for an alarm that opened the curtains and turned on the lights and tv when ready.There is also a regular hand held TV remote if you dont like the electronic one! Not much noise from neighbors or outside. Everything was clean for us. Fully stocked frig and snack box. Everything is touch sensored. Only one electrical outlet near TV desk. The safe is in the 3rd drawer near bed. Two large closets with dry bar in between. (4) comfy robes, iron board wth iron and lots of hangers. Full length mirror. Lots of large drawers for clothes. Bathroom has sliding pocket door and the shower is European style with huge shower and soaking tub all enclosed in glass. the toilet area has frosted glass with large door. Double sinks, hair dryer and lots of towels. More towels in drawer near closet. Other reviews said no service but we got service. Each room has electronic switches near door that have an external message at room door wall. You can press PRIVACY that will turn on the red light that says the same. Or you press SERVICE for the green light that says the same. If you press nothing you will NOT get service except if your checking out. The maids usuall start cleaning rooms early so ipeople expect their rooms to be cleaned late in afternoon, forget about it! The maids can't wait until 4pm for you to leave room. Pool areas were huge with room for all ages. There was an ADULT only area that charged $20 for men and $10 for women. This was to only get inside to use pool or stand and people watch. If you want a chair to sit they said it was $100.00 WTF? There was a D.J. though and lots of people going inside. Yes, you must have a bathing suit to get in. Lots of chairs at the other three pools. Valet was free and they were fast. Taxi line was fast too. Dollar car rental place was VERY hard to locate when I returned my car that I got from airport. Self parking is very easy and has underground entrance!!! The Restaurants were many and the prices were EXPENSIVE. I ate at the American Fish restaurant where the staff was very friendly. Had the best drinks and lobster corn dogs! The bars were fun and had dollar video poker machines. To get comp drink, deposit $20 and try your luck! I got two four of a kinds in 10 minutes, walked away $500 ahead and with a buzz!! Casino was very tall and open with lots of games to play. The tables were starting with $10 minimum bet. I did good at roulette and blackjack. You got to go with a limit for each day you play or you can lose quick like I watched others do. Casino smelled of vanilla like a waffle cone, even from outside and in the mall called Crystals. Very easy to get around to the strip through there. Also opposite end mall area connects to the Monte Carlo. Casino was very nice and lots of fun. The customers or clientel at the Aria were much more to my liking as they were't as shady or GHETTO like the Monte Carlo, MGM or Excaliber. Hands down the best looking women at night. There is a night club there that starts happening after 11pm. I watched the people coming out until 4am the next morning. Yeah that crown was from 21 - 51 it looked like. The Aria is new with lots of fun things to do. Yeahh it is very expensive but if you got the money, enjoy it! I will go back if I can get a great deal. It is comparable to the Wynn Hotel Casino that I like but is to far down the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Have had better service at a 2 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tonic1968
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that the rooms are actually really nicely appointed. Very modern with push button curtains that you can set to open for an alarm clock (very cool). As per usual with a Vegas hotel you have to walk through the Casino to get to the lifts, but you kind of expect that. Unfortunately thats were the good comments have to finish. They have built this fabulous hotel to a very high standard but then forgot to tell the staff that they are not working at a Motel 6. First of all there is no line to join at check-in, they have about a dozen or so people there but you have to try and guess which line you think is going to be best. And yes, just like the supermarket, you always end up in the one where someone in front of you has a problem. Then if you have to leave your bags with the porter because your room isn't ready they won't deliver them to your room when it's ready, like the good service of old, you have to call them when you finally get your room and then wait for them to bring them up. And then they have the hide to tell you "it's for your convenience". Trust me it's a saying you'll learn to hate. For your convenience they charge a $20 daily resort fee for which you get the paper (which isn't delivered to your room, you have to go and get it yourself), in room wi-fi and the use of the gym. And finally if you are catching a flight out of Vegas, when you check-out don't rely on the porters, take your own bags down with you. I called and was told 7 to 10 minutes, I called back after 20 minutes to be told that the computer had broken and that all the porters were out. I asked how long it would be and was told, and I quote "I don't know, just wait". After thirty minutes I carried all the bags by myself as my wife had already left to check us out. To my disbelief when I got outside the front doors of the hotel three Porters there just standing there talking. So be warned, the rooms are really nice but don't expect any kind of service while you are there and have a little chuckle each time you hear or read "For Your Convenience" because it means you are about to be stung.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade Heaven”
Reviews.Author: richiewoods
Reviews.Content: Travelling in from Mammoth Lakes with wife and 3 kids in tow, I didn't know what the hotel would hold for us...after dropping the car at valet I was met by a 5-7 person deep queue at the check-in. After driving for 5hrs, I wasn't pleased about this but sent the family to sit down whilst I queued. I had booked a $500 per night suite, as I was treating the family to some luxury because I wanted to hit the casino. Once at the front desk, I asked the check-in lady (Christina) about upgrades and used the '$20 upgrade gambit' and secured a $900 per night 2 bedroom penthouse for our two night stay. We didn't get a strip view, but I wasn't complaining (not sure there's much of a strip view anyway). Two large ensuite bedrooms(one with two doubles), dining room, bar, lounge....amazing accomodation - the best I've ever stayed in. We were all very happy. Service was good, slight smokey smell walking through the casino.... Jean Philippe's cakes are/were amazing and yummy. The Cafe Vettro was good at the evening (try a Cosmo!), but try to avoid late breakfast queues.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cuffs24
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights with my wife. It is an absolutely beautiful hotel. From the lobby to the rooms, everything was fantastic. Every employee we came in contact with was courteous and professional. We ate at Jean Georges and the tapas place and food was delicious. You can skip the buffet as it was average. I didn't gamble there much other than the poker room(quickly becoming best on the strip) as the table minimums are crazy high at night. I do wish they would add a couple better casual restaurants because vetro was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, slow service.”
Reviews.Author: judith590
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully designed hotel, modern decor, with large rooms. The service, though, was consistently off the mark. Long wait on check-in, at the pool bar (5 people behind the counter, a short line, and still a wait!), at the patisserie (and they forgot to call our name to say our food was ready), and even at the gaming tables they were slow getting our drinks. The staff doesn't acknowledge that they see there is a line and there's a lack of get up and go. The management needs a customer service culture change! Nice pools, beautiful business center. Buffet was good, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Top Drawer!”
Reviews.Author: Philly1971
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, set in the heart of the Las vegas strip, and almost a perfect location as you can get. Its is modern, vibrant, and above all there are no gimmicks! It delivers in every aspect, with friendly staff to ultra modern rooms. The Casino is great, with a buzz unrivalled by many other Las Vegas casinos. Every facility is on offer, and somehow it all just fits! Only 2 very minor drawbacks, firstly the queue at check in was way too long... needed more staff, and secondly it didnt have a starbucks (although there was one within a 5 minute walk in the Monte Carlo) The technology in the room was very clever, but you have to experience it to really appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: irishraven1874
Reviews.Content: So, I'm not going to come on here and leave a review that just rips the hotel apart because I do take responsibility for my error however... My hotel room was robbed while I slept in a twin room (12096) with a friend. We didn't shut the door properly when we returned home. Unfortunately, 2 iphones 4's, ipad, $1,200 in cash and an ipod were taken during the night which pretty much ruined our entire stay. This is where I think the hotel failed; when security came to our room the next morning they explained to us that there had been other rooms robbed over the last while due to the doors not closing properly. It would have been nice to be made aware of this before hand. We never once heard from a manager or customer care rep after the incident, I had to call the front desk to ask to be moved to another room as we didn't feel safe in this one. I had just lost over $3,000 in personal items and not even a call to see how we were? On checking out of the hotel the following day we met probably the most disrespectful and condescending human being that ever worked in 'customer service'. (won't go in to that for this review) Anyway, I was going home the next day and was told someone would be in touch. Heard nothing for a week and then called them myself to see what the story was. I got a lovely email from their head of claims who told me that they hotel provide a safe FREE of charge and that we should have used it and that they were not responsible but hoped we would come back when staying in Vegas the next time. (she is kidding right?) So, my question to her was this but have had no response - "We had two laptops in your tiny safe which left us with no room for anything else, where were we supposed to keep our things?" So to sum up, it was my fault for the leaving the door open and inviting the would be robbers into the room and I should be more careful. For a 5 star hotel they are miles off where they need to be - you feel like a number in this hotel, the staff I dealt with were rude and obnoxious and the follow up communication was slow and arrogant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Eschanne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aria for 5 days to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The first thing I noticed was the wonderful smell of vanilla as you entered the hotel lobby. It did a wonderful job of masking the smell of smoke as you walked through the casino. I know many reviewers have complained about the smell, but it was not overwhelming to us. Pros: Room was large and very clean - I am very picky about cleanliness Maid service was not a problem Elevators were quick - no long waits Loved the computer controlled functions for the room Beautiful views thanks to the ceiling to floor windows Good restaurants (we especially loved the Tapas restaurant) Very good buffet and fairly priced One of the BEST BEDS ever!! I can't remember the last time I slept so comfortably in a hotel. Loved the bathroom layout -- tub was behind the shower, double sinks, and separate toilet area Great location on the Strip - quick walk to other casinos/hotels/mall/restaurants Tram to the Monte Carlo and Bellagio Friendly staff Overall service was good up until the hotel started filling up with guests. Cons: For a luxury hotel, the towels were terrible -- very thin and rough Took forever to check out!! As mentioned, not enough staff to provide good service once the hotel started filling up. Julian Serrano Pastierre was very expensive -- paid almost $50 for two sandwiches with drinks!! We did not get a chance to check out the pools, night clubs, spa, and fitness center since we were out and about for most of our trip, therefore I cannot comment on those areas. Overall, our experience at ARIA was wonderful, relaxing, and enjoyable. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “I WILL VISIT AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: mskeke
Reviews.Content: Birthday trip me and a couple of friends .Great hotel great rooms. I loved the shower and tub combo .Took me a couple hours to adjust to the remote that controls everything in the room(lights air curtains and tv) Which was needy when no one wanted to get up to turn out the lights .That was cool the pool was cool the buffet wasnt all that during breakfast time.The location was great right across the street from planet hollywood right by cvs Very good locaton . The only thing I dislike about this hotel was the vanilla scent mainly on the first level i believe it was to kill the cigarette smoke in the casino it was too much and made me a lil sick sometime especially by the pool area where it seems to be very loud. Other than that I would definitely will stay here again. It was a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Could be GREAT but falls short”
Reviews.Author: PATravelGirl_9
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this hotel 3.5 stars. Its not quite 4, but deserves more then 3. The hotel itself, the rooms, the casino and and pools are very nice. The touch screen panel to control the room is a nice touch. Not getting out of bed to open the curtains is kinda cool. The bed is super comfortable. The room is decorated nicely. The people that work there are very nice but the problem is that there just isn't enough employees (even though one blackjack dealer told me 4,000 people work there). The second day we were there we went to the pool, it was a Friday and crowded. I was with a GF (husbands were gambling) and we wanted two chairs together and there wasn't any. We found two but they weren't together and there was no one around to help (thankfully a nice gentleman at the pool did help us). But with 4 pools (and thousands of rooms) you would think they would have pool attendants to help manage the chair/towel situation. Then I decided to get some drinks at the pool bar. I waited in line for no less 30 minutes! Way to long.....the people next to us ordered drinks from the waitress right after I left and still hadn't gotten their drinks when I got back. My husband and I use the mini bar a lot and we had to call almost every day for it be refilled (they kept telling us they would come daily but never showed). Housekeeping is a little slow also. We're from the east coast so we were up pretty early most days. We would leave for breakfast, come back to change for pool, etc and come back @ 2/3 (nap time :) and the room still wasn't clean. I never saw anyone cleaning before 10am but yet there were numerous rooms with the "service" light turned on by or before 8am. We went to the "Liquid" pool (day club kind of pool). It was fun, not trashy. All types of people; fat, skinny, men, women, young, old. It was a pretty cool vibe and not "stuck up". We "rented" two pool lounges and I think our bill with drinks, tips etc. was $500 for the day. It was worth it. The DJ was pretty good, in fact we went to lots of clubs while we were there and the one at Liquid was probably the best. I forget the name of the pastry shop/cafe in the Casino but it was good for a quick sandwich. The pastries looked amazing but I didn't try any. The buffet was good. I am not a fan of buffets but we are lunch there twice and it had a good assortment of food. The hotel is in a great location. We walked to Cosmopolitan, Planet Hollywood, Bellagio. Crystals (very high end mall) is connected to Aria and another shopping mall (abercrombie etc. is right across the street) We only paid $159 a night for the room (which we ended up getting comped anyways because of gambling) and would most likely stay there again for that price. I would actually be willing to pay more for better service. I really did like the location and the overall "feel" of the hotel. It just seemed like we were waiting a lot. Check in/Check out, restaurants, pool, mini bar etc. Overall, I would recommend this hotel but if you are regular 5 star hotel kind of person you might be underwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and facilities for our family of 5 inc kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had one of the Aria sky suites for our recent 5 night stay in LV. There were 5 of us: myself and my 2 kids (aged 9 & 6) plus my patents. The suite met our needs beautifully, it was so spacious and had 2 separate king size bedrooms with massive ensuite and walk in robe. We all came to love the heated toilet seat and bidet- even the children! Lol. All in all, very happy with our choice to stay there and would again. The little extras like limo transfers and the lounge with refreshments made it excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful young stylish new hotel- the upmarket malmaison of vegas with beats”
Reviews.Author: scotcat28
Reviews.Content: went to vegas for a friends wedding and loved this hotel- nice and new, lovely plush rooms not too heavily vegas-ed out- much less tacky than some of the other vegas hotels- more classey but also felt a very young stylish hotel- my parents would not have been at home around the pool- but i loved it- dance music played from speakers at the pool and girls comig round to check you had enough drinks from the bar. mild nightclub/pool party like atmosphere at the poolside. did not see any kids or loutish behaviour at the pool at all. ate in the restaurants and the food was beautiful- even simple things life french toast for breakfast was superb although not cheap. wonderful attentive staff. check in a little slow as busy and they hadnt complied with my request for 2 queen sized beds that i had requested 3 months earlier but i think that is fairly standard vegas practice that you get what is left on your check in day (even if it is annoying). all in all loved it and would go back with my girlfriends to party- beautiful hotel. only major problem was the perfume they pumped into the air con in the casino floor made me and my friends sinuses block up when we were havign a cocktail so we had to leave even though we were enjoying the bar area otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Har2301
Reviews.Content: First time staying here. I've been going to Vegas for 25 years for a broadcasters convention and this is the first time a hotel felt "different". Nicely laid out, lots of choices for food. Room very comfortable, great sleeping bed. The "City Center", where the Aria is located, is a great place to just walk around and ONLY window shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-”
Reviews.Author: annmai217
Reviews.Content: Let's get to the pro's on this hotel: Excellent service Loved the vanilla aroma smell in the casino Decor is beautiful and very clean Convenient walk to the Crystal Mall and strip 7 different pool areas w/ great trance music playing outside Cons: Room is definitely far walk to the elevator The buffet was horrible But I guess I really can't complain since we had the room for free....

Reviews.Title: “The BEST on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: GinNorway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria for 3 nights. Check in was prompt. We had prepaid with a vacation package and were slightly annoyed that there was a resort fee, but I guess all of the hotels are getting away with this these days, so don't be surprised. It includes Wi-Fi, 2 drinks in one of the hotel's bars, access to the fitness center, and daily newspaper. The rooms are ultra modern, new, clean. We loved the ability to control everything from the curtains, to the lighting, to the TV via one touch screen. The beds are amazingly comfortable. Concierge was very helpful with questions about golf and shows. The pool area is huge, with several different pools to choose from, and several hot tubs. The fitness center is state of the art, with lots of equipment to choose from. The treadmills have personal TV's, and I guess they even have fitness classes (if you are willing to pay the steep price). One thing we noticed right away, is the fragrance that the hotel spews into the air...in some areas it is a vanilla scent and in the spa area it is a flowery scent. Toward the end of our stay I felt the smells to be overwhelming, but it certainly masks the cigarette smoke in the casino. Food and drinks were expensive, but I guess that is the norm on the strip. Overall, we loved the modern, luxurious feel of this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: Pink_bear19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my birthday and though we'd splurge on a panoramic suite. From the moment we stepped into the room, we were pretty much speechless. Extremely comfortable bed (with an abundance of pillows to throw around), 2 bathrooms and TVs everywhere you could possibly need them. The absolute highlight was the bathroom - floor to ceiling windows and jutting out so that you can enjoy a bath while gazing at the Strip. The touchscreen panel controlling lights and curtains was a little confusing but we enjoyed playing anyway. Great resort with everything you could need - good restaurants and a gorgeous pool area. Would highly recommend others to stay here and would recommend splurging for a suite.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Texas wishing i was on the beach
Reviews.Title: “It was heaven”
Reviews.Author: bkstar00
Reviews.Content: Loved it from the moment we got there . This was a trip that I won and when the wonderful check in person realized it - she upgraded us to the Sky Suites which was another world! The 2 bedroom suite was AMAZING. The view was beautiful. Everything was remote control which was really cool. The service from the Sky Suite lounge was excellent. Had no issues checking in and checked out using the TV. Can't wait to go back!! Room service was great - hot food and exactly the amount they told us it would be there.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: nandonco
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end, the Aria did not disappoint. From the service to the room to the pool, there was not one thing to complain about. We mentioned to one another that we would stay there again for sure. It came highly recommended by a friend and we will not be recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Their ads don't lie. This is the new center of the Vegas strip.”
Reviews.Author: eurovandriver
Reviews.Content: As hotels go, the nicer they are, the more expensive services (dinner, casino, etc...) seem to be. Aria is no exception to that rule. But hey, it's Vegas right? We arrived via shuttle service to an underground "loading" area and were immediately met by a bell person who whisked our luggage off to storage while we checked in. They directed us towards the lobby area which takes you on a journey up to the street level and either through the Casino, or past the nice fountain feature at the main entrance (skip the casino and check out the fountains.) We arrived earlier in the day, so I was surprised to see the longer lines at the check in area, but with 4000 rooms, I guess I should have expected a crowd. Check in seemed to take longer than necessary, but was gracious none the less once we made our way up to the check in counter. One quibble would be that the lines seem to blur between one and two queues, so you never know which line you are exactly in. Our room wasn't ready, but they would call me when it was. Once the room was ready, I waited in another line to pick up my keys, and then took the ubiquitous trip through the Casino to get to the elevators. Elevators are divided into different floor zones so you NEVER have to wait more than about 15 seconds. Nice. We had a standard room with a strip view. But when I say standard, I mean really, really nice. Say what you want about the computerized touch screen control for lighting, curtains, tv, and temperature, but I liked it. On the bad side, it was frustratingly slow to respond to inputs. Not the computer type, just hit the Master on switch at the entrance of the room and use the good ol' light switches on each one. The bathroom was nicely appointed with double sinks, a make-up mirror, hair dryer, and even a scale. The shower and bathtub room was nice for those early morning steam showers needed after a late night. Other travelers have mentioned the beds in the rooms. They truly are AMAZING! Absolutely the best mattress I have ever slept on. The Casino in the hotel is nicely appointed and extremely easy to navigate (unlike the mazes of other casinos.) As with most of the higher end properties, you aren't going to find minimum bets under $10 for the table games. But if you are looking for a quick comped drink, head to the lounges and play $1/hand video poker or black jack. Restaurants are numerous and priced towards the higher end. You can expect about a $45 minimum for two breakfast/lunch, $60 for dinner (and only one out of two in my party was drinking alcohol.) The buffet had the usual fare plus a tandori oven for Indian food, snow and king crab legs. The title of the development really says it right. City Center. You really are right in the middle of the action. It is hard to put into scale how large these hotels and resorts are until you have to walk through them. The nice part is that several properties on that side of the strip offer a free tram service, with Aria being included in that bunch. Take advantage of that. Aria may not be as timeless as the Bellagio, Wynn, or Venetian, but that isn't what they are going for. If you are looking for an upscale property with a stylish edge and a agreat location, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “City view... ask for a big window!”
Reviews.Author: LongBeachJack
Reviews.Content: To be fair, we had a great visit overall. But here are the PROS and CONS: CONS: - We had a City View room, but the window was pretty small. It looks like 50% of the windows are large and 50% were small because of the architecture. - Only 1 robe in the closet which was strange. - Curtains were ALMOST black-out. Light filtered through the top. PROS: - Great decor in rooms and hotel. - I liked the tub and shower lay-out. - Bed was very comfortable. - Cocktail service at the casino tables was good.

Reviews.Title: “If service matters to you ... stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: bjwhite_85
Reviews.Content: We were totally disappointed in the service at the ARIA. We tried to set up spa services by contacting the hotel prior to our visit, plus spoke with several staff members upon our arrival with no results. We contacted the concierge early in the day for dinner reservations only to find out (when we returned to the hotel to get ready for dinner) that they were unable to set up the reservation. And the pool service was awful!! There was one girl for hundreds of people. There was a walk up bar but the line was so long they were actually handing out water as you waited. I could go on ...but I think this give you a good idea of the poor service offered at the ARIA

Reviews.Title: “Clueless!”
Reviews.Author: RecTraveler
Reviews.Content: If you want to spend 1.5 hrs checking in and 1hr checking out...this is your place! This newer hotel is in need of new management. The concierge folks don't have a clue and front desk is even worse. We were quoted a price with other perks that was not honored in the end. One of the rooms was actually charged for a cabana that we did not use. It took an epic battle with the front desk and managers to get the charge removed. Waitstaff aren't much better..."the lemonade here is homemade - it's made out of sweet and sour mix and Sprite...it comes out of a gallon jug". And the rooms are not as clean as you would think for a newer hotel. All of the above is known by the locals. Multiple cab drivers stated that they had heard the same complaints from others. One even laughed when he heard our complaints. This hotel needs some help!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Room...forgettable food”
Reviews.Author: TR993
Reviews.Content: Check in was very slow, with 5 people in line a head of us, we stood in line for 35 minutes. When we reached the check in desk, the agent was surly and unhappy. Room is fantastic. No maid service on our only full day, they must have forgot about us. We ate at Cafe Vettro for breakfast. Scrambled eggs were not made to order (from a vat like you would get at a cafeteria) and were undercooked. Eggs Benedict was tasteless and eggs were so undercooked that they were transparent. Tried dinner at Lemongrass. This is a very poor excuse for a Thai inspired restaurant. A warning that the dishes were hot from our wait person should have been our first clue that we were not going to be thrilled with our meal. The waiter finally took the meals off the bill. All other service was fantastic. Staff people would approach us to make sure we were happy with our stay. The beauty of the hotel is only surpassed by the Cosmopolitan Hotel just across the street. Swimming pool service was terrific as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel- Don't understand the bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: nycrunner5
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about coming to the Aria since there are several bad reviews on this site I have been to Vegas 9 times and have stayed at the Wynn, Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Caesars, Bally's, and Planet Hollywood. I can say the Aria is on Par with the Wynn and the Bellagio which I think are the 2 best hotels I have stayed in, but you also can;t go wwrong with Caesars and Mandalay Bay. We arrived Thursday night and got our room immediately. It was a kind size bed city view room. I just like the layout of the hotel, casino, and the pools are awesome. I can only say great things about the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ahn1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights during a conference that was going on at the Aria. My husband attended the conference, and I was tagging along for the trip. I was initially very impressed by the Aria...the building itself is gorgeous, staff was beyond helpful with the check-in process, even taking our bags and storing them for us and giving us directions to another place when we weren't ready to go to our room yet. The room was fantastic with beautiful views and was beautifully designed. Yet, there was something lacking in the hotel. It didn't feel like "Vegas" is supposed to feel. There was no excitement, it felt kind of stale. Shops are WAY overpriced here, and the pool is a bit small for the size of the hotel. We ended up going to the Bellagio and Caesar's to gamble, my husband did not care for the casino at the Aria. Oh, and one morning he went to the gym to work out between conference sessions....and was told that they would charge him $30 to GO INTO THE LOCKER ROOMS TO CHANGE CLOTHES. Seriously. Thirty dollars to change clothes. So, if you want a beautiful, comfortable place to sleep while in Vegas, this might be a good bet for you. But if you want a fun, Vegas experience, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Spoil yourself and stay somewhere really special”
Reviews.Author: mikeg084
Reviews.Content: travelled to Las Vegas with family to celebrate a special birthday last Sept/October.My daughter had stayed there before and recommended it. The Aria is a relatively new hotel on the strip .It is very modern in design and has all the facilities that you would expect from a top Las Vegas hotel and much more.The staff were all excellent.They were always polite and always willing to help . The rooms were fabulous with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in.Lighting,heating,air conditioning,curtains and TV were all controlled by a key pad that was simply to use.The hotel had numerous restaurants,bars,cafes and a pub together with a fabulous buffet on offer for breakfast,lunch and dinner.The hotel is centrally placed on the strip and we were able to travel to other attractions easily.The casino was very big and well staffed.I have been to Las Vegas on numerous occasions and I can say that this time was the most enjoyable of all. I am looking forward to returning there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel, but not a great casino”
Reviews.Author: kassie666
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Aria for a 5 day/4 night vacation. Arrival - We arrived on a Saturday late afternoon/early evening and had no wait at the front desk. The front desk clerk was friendly and efficient. Room - The room was fantastic, we were in a king room facing the mountains. Besides the long walk from the elevator (huge hotel), the room was everything we could ask for. The closet space and changing area was huge and well appreciated. The bathroom double sinks and extra space was a great advantage. The bed was one of the most comfortable that I have ever stayed in. Finally, the electronic gadget to run everything in the room was easy to learn; however, was a little slow to run the tv guide. Restaurants - We had snacks/smoothie at the Patisserie in the casino which was expensive, but very good. We ate at Beso Steakhouse in Crystals. This was not a very good experience. The service was slow, we had to refill our own wine glasses from the bottle away from our table for our entire meal. For the prices they charge, this should be a fine dining restaurant, but it is far from it. On our final night, we ate at Mastro's Ocean Club, also in Crystals. We had a fantastic experience, from the food to the service and the atmosphere, everything was the best. I would HIGHLY recommend it. Casino - The casino was ok; however the vanilla smell that was pumped in was awful and left us both with a headache and stomach ache if we stayed down there too long. There are not very many gaming tables and all have high limits, even if no one is playing and the cheaper tables are full. The highlight was the tram that runs to the Bellagio, we rode it nightly to gamble at the Bellagio, as we preferred their casino environment much better. Shows - We saw Viva Elvis and absolutely loved it. Purchased our tickets at a reduced rate from the Tickets4Tonight stand across the street from the Aria and had great seats. I would highly recommend this show. We also saw Le Reve at the Wynn and just thought this was ok. We enjoyed the individual strength and ability, but we were not wowed. Location - The location is great. It is right in the middle of everything and allowed us to walk to most things that we wanted to do. Other reviews discuss that it is too far back from the strip; however, we found it to be fine and the same distance as the Bellagio, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Most Relaxing Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Toxoman
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great surprise and a very enjoyable experience. It is beautifully done and, although huge is size, has a comfortable and almost intimate feeling about it. The rooms are sound-proofed and the beds are plush and comfortable - I suffer from a bad back and can be very sensitive to new beds, but I always awoke feeling rested and without back pain each morning. The staff could not have been more gracious and friendly, from the check-in staff to the housekeepers to the bell men. Also, one doesn't feel lost in the vast casino as it seems to flow from one comfortably sized area to another effortlessly, with each area designed differently enough to make it feel like you've walked into a new room. The restaurants are top-notch, even the ones without a designer chef attached to their name. We inquired about possibly getting an upgrade from a standard room to a suite and were "comped" a corner suite n the 16th floor with views in three directions. The suite included a free-standing whirlpool bathtub situated in the triangular "point" where two of the windows met together, so it felt as if we were bathing in the clouds. At night, there was a lot of splendid lighting and motion from the surrounding strip, City Center and monorail visible through our windows, but not a sound came in through the glass or from neighboring rooms. All draperies are electronically operated and can be controlled through either the wall panels or the remote control that operates the TV sets (one in each room, including the bathroom). The lighting (which is mostly soft and ambient) can also be controlled through the remote. When laying in bed at night watching the light show outside, you just need to push one bed-side button and all lights slowly dim out while the drapes close themselves. The pool areas (there are three pools) are as beautiful and well landscaped as any I have seen anywhere in the world. Compared to what we saw in other resorts, including the Bellagio and the Wynn, we felt that we could not have done any better than what we got at the Aria. It's just a different style; more clean and fresh and modern, and less of that hokey plastic fake-luxury decor of most of the other hotels. Each day we both remarked that there really wasn't much reason to ever leave this resort if we didn't want to. Everything we could want for a relaxing vacation was here and were were extremely happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay - my favorite spot in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BetterTravelled
Reviews.Content: Notwithstanding the mixed reviews that Aria gets on TripAdvisor, I found my 4 night (Weds April 6-Sun Apr 10) stay at Aria to be very pleasant and mostly free of problems. I arrived off an east coast night flight at 10 pm on a Wednesday to find VIP check-in not being staffed, which was annoying. Waiting in the poorly organized area (multiple lines for each desk spot rather than a single line for all) took about 15 minutes standing on the worst of the lines. (I would note that at check-out on Sunday, they had organized the space better, which the single line feeding into all the windows) Fortunately, check-in was pretty much the only low point of my stay at Aria. The basic room is very nice - not as large as "all-suite" places like Venetian or Encore but definitely larger than average. I shared a room with a buddy and there was plenty of place for our stuff; we essentially only used the room for washing up and sleeping and it was more than up to those tasks. The bed and pillows were exceptionally comfortable, the room was clean, the bathroom was very nicely done (except for the annoyance of the not-entirely-opaque frosted glass separating the toilet area from the rest of the bathroom), and the much-maligned Control 4 electronic console was totally functional and at worst silly. There were no tech issues throughout the stay - I would only discourage the most technophobic people from avoiding the Aria because of Control 4, so long as you don't rush your commands the system is extremely basic and user-friendly. I'm a big fan of the Aria's casino. The Aria space is as high end and pleasant for gambling as the best of the strip, places like Wynn and Bellagio, yet multiple tables of quality blackjack rules (dealer stands soft 17, etc) can be found at the $50 level during the day, even Saturday afternoon, and $100 level at night. The competition keeps minimums much higher, which makes Aria a great place for the $50 player to go and get top quality games and service in a very nice atmosphere. Its also a decent casino for players all the way down to $10-15 - though you have to play on a continuous shuffler, at least you don't see shoe games paying 6 to 5 on blackjack. Video poker pay tables are as bad as anywhere on the strip, unfortunately. Besides having good rules, the Aria casino also has a unique design. It is much more modern and less European in style than the other fancy joints on the Strip; I found it to be beautiful, though some of my friends thought it was dull in comparison to Bellagio or the like. Food at Aria was also great. Jean Phillippe Patisserie is really wonderful for quick food, the paninis, crepes and pastries are all extremely tasty and it is very conveniently located right next to the elevators. Caffe Vettro is a standard high-end 24 hour coffee shop, and there a buffet (didn't try it) and a wide variety of fine dining options. We ate at Michael Mina's American Fish, which was really excellent, and had some great meat in addition to the fish. A lot of people here kvetch about the resort fee, and I understand why in principle, since it would be more honest to put it into the room rate. On the other hand, I pay $12-15 for internet access all the time at hotels, so having it included in the resort fee was nice. My roommate used the fitness center every day, and it was a first-rate facility, nicer than your average Equinox - for us, the resort fee turned out to be a money saver, since daily use of the internet and fitness center at other Strip hotels would cost more than $22. While check-in was crazy, the check-out process on Sunday (when half the hotel is turning over) was much calmer. Boarding pass printing at the Concierge proved to be a simple, no-waiting task, and was included courtesy of the resort fee. Express check-out went through without a hitch. Aria should be judged on what it is - a giant Strip hotel. This is not the Wynn Tower Suites, and you are not paying Tower Suites prices, so don't expect that level of personalized service. But for what it is, Aria is exceptional. Its luxurious, edgy, modern look is really refreshing in a town full of high-end faux-European hotels and mid-tier generic American joints, pricing is very reasonable for the high quality stuff you are getting, and the food and location is tremendous. I would highly recommend Aria and plan on returning here often.

Reviews.Title: “Plush and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: dalexlegis
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and location is perfect (right in the middle of the strip) but the hotel is overpriced. If you think buying brands like Gucci or Prada is the thing, this hotel is for you (the boutiques are located in the same complex called City Center). If you want true value, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but......”
Reviews.Author: TamaraTammy32
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the pros, the hotel has a nice scent upon entering the lobby. The room was gorgeous and elegant. We received a room with a beautiful panoramic view of the strip/city. It was breath taking! You can control your lights, TV, and curtains with one touch with the bedside alarm clock. The beds are to die for. Very comforting, and the mattress "hugs" you. I loved it! The bathroom had a soaking tub and separate shower. Housekeeping kept our room clean and fresh towels were delivered on a daily basis. There's a checkpoint to get to your room, so keep your room key handy, as the security will not allow you to walk where the elevators are to get to your room. We also received many free-be's from the hotel (free drinks, food, and extra's to "play" with). And the Hotel is centrally located, so it's in the middle of the action. Now, the cons. Our stay at the Aria was for 8 days March25-April 2nd 2011. If you rent a car, please utilize the valet services upon check-in. There is, and I repeat, there is a VERY LONG WALK from the parking garage to the entrance of the hotel. Not only that, when you first enter from the parking garage, you will have to maneuver your way through the casino (and it is a big one) to the lobby where the front desk is located. The front desk clerk was very......................................ethnic. Because we were African-Americans, she utilized a lot of Ebonics, which was very unnecessary. Nonetheless, she did her job and got us checked in. I will say that I was very aware of the fact that there is a resort fee of approximately $25.00 per night, but she also informed us that the hotel would like to charge an additional $133.00 per night for incentives. We told her we were only paying the necessary resort fee. Since we arrived in spring break season and we were located in the middle of the strip, we encountered countless drunken college kids that all seem to belong in a strip club of some sort, or one of Hue Hefner's entourage. And since the hotel is so big, they were walking barefoot with shoes in hand, laughing and partying like a rock star. I come to Vegas a lot and although the Aria is nice, the rooms are a bit smaller when compared to other 5 star Hotels. The Encore, (The Wynn's sister property) is much nicer, and caters to a much more mature crowd. Overall, I did enjoy my trip and the Aria is still a very nice hotel, however; I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Aria - Tall, Boring, Soul-less”
Reviews.Author: beicholz
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, this is an OK hotel. It's very clean. The staff are very nice. And the rooms are pretty nice. But I just don't like this place. It lacks the excitement of places like Bellagio, Venetian, and Encore. There are no breathtaking spaces here...just nice generic, ordinary architecture. Worse, is the "Center". You'd think a place called City Center would actually HAVE a center. Well get this...the center is like a multi-storied freeway with cars speeding in and out. There's no restful, wonderful public space here. There's absolutely nothing memorable. You might think that with a name like "Aria", you might hear the occasional opera selection...or see music-themed decor. No dice. Everything, even the music is generic pop. The only theme here...is no theme...no soul. Just a building, nothing more. Finally, the location is terrible. It's far away from everything else, and transportation is awful. It's not near any Express bus stop, and the Monorail is so far you can forget it. To compound this, the taxi lines are SUPER long all day. I'm very sorry I spent $1,200 for 5 days here. All of City Center is worth a quick walk-through, and that's about it. Oh...and bring a huge wallet if you plan to shop here. The prices are all ultra high in all of the stores.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Liverdoc
Reviews.Content: The rooms are wonderful, clean, and well functional. The rooms are automated, will all sorts of bells and whistles. The shades, lights, and TV are all centrally controlled. If you are a bit less techno inclined, this might be a problem to get full use of the room and what it can offer. I am sure the staff can assist in setting things up. I ate breakfast one dat at Cafe Vettro. The meal I had was excellent. The time it took to be seated was very slow, despite open tables. High speed internet is available, but part of a $24 daily "resort fee". The athletic center is real nice, with helpful staff. I understand use of the showers and steam are additional. All and all I will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Three time in one year!”
Reviews.Author: Digiart247
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing. I'm a young 23 yr old bachelor who went to Vegas for spring break, forth of July and in September for my grandma's 80th birthday! I stayed at Aria each time and it is by far one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The service is great. The location is perfect. The pools are amazing! Never had a problem getting a drink or food or finding a place to gamble. The staff was very nice and we made friends with them easily. Special shout out to Kat, a poolside girl, who took care of us almost everyday we were there. Overall as a young guy the contemporary design and atmosphere is what I like the best. I have been traveling to Vegas with my family since I was a kid and I am over all the theme hotels. Aria makes you feel like a high roller even if you aren't. Got a great deal for a four day weekend visit over the 4th too. just under $500!! The one downside I would say is if you do get a great deal there which you probably can, the restaurants in the hotel are pricey! And also my friends stayed in the upgraded city view suite. and we didn't. Their window was kinda gross and the view kinda sucked. Where as our window was super clean and the view of the mountains and surrounding area was incredible. So I just recommended not upgrading because personally i think they are charging for the wrong view! Unless of course you get a corner suite or something, I hear those, especially facing Bellagio are pretty awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Jag346
Reviews.Content: I attended a recent three day conference at the Aria and stayed an extra three nights of leisure. I haf seen some reviews of the hotel and expected a first class stay. I was really disappointed. The check-in process was a nightmare, even at 9:00PM. There was a very long line and not enough clerks to process the registrations on a speedy fashion. The room was nice. However, the housekeeping service was dismal. One day they would do the bed, but would not pick up the trash from the trash cans, or they would take the towels and not replace them. There were two bottles of Fuji water for sale on the room, which we consumed every day. Most of the time we needed to call for replenishment as the staff forgot to do so. The towels were rough and worn out, which was a big surprise for a relatively new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star quality”
Reviews.Author: Valerie341
Reviews.Content: I was spending the last 2 nights of a 5 night vacation solo, so I booked this 5 star hotel as a treat to myself. Total disappointment; I'll explain... 1. They certainly do try "nickel and dime" you every step they get. I booked on Price-line and standard is a 2 bed on the site. I asked for a room with a view of the strip and that I was okay giving up the 2 beds for a 1 bed, I was told it was a $30 per night charge for this upgrade; which I was okay with. Now I am reading reviews on here, they actually charge people $30 for a room with two beds... so because I gave up my 2 beds in a room room, they actually made money because I bet they charged someone else the 30$ extra a night for the room with 2 beds I gave up, AND then I paid $30 a night for the view upgrade. If they were honest with customer service, I really should have paid nothing for the upgrade with a room with 1 bed. 2. I went up to my room, opened the door expecting the best with the curtains opening, lights turning on, tv greeting me... NOT THE CASE! I walked into a room that was TRASHED! The room had obviously been "partied" in and not cleaned; I actually started looking around for personal belongings feeling bad I may have been intruding in someone else's room. I sat in the mess of a room on the phone for 10 minutes waiting for the front desk staff to pick up. When they finally did, I got a "sorry, this is your new room number." I then let them know I felt that this was totally unacceptable to just give me a new room being that this was to be a FIVE STAR hotel, my first impression of the room was ruined. They replied that they would give me a room upgrade however there were no suites available during my stay, They then offered a $75 food credit. So I go to the newly assigned room.... 3. I entered the new room expecting this experience with being greeted by the room... again disappointment! I walked into a pitch dark room, couldn't see a thing... here again they did not live up to the 5 star standard. I then called down again now very frustrated. When I asked if they could take the $30 off per night for the strip view, I was told "No, we can't do that" REALLY??? This is where I dropped the calm attitude I had and let them have it. Their idea of fixing my first impression was re-setting the walk-in feature and having me walk outside my room and re-entering... what a joke!! When all said and done, I got a 75$ food credit, my resort fee taken off the bill, and a complimentary upgrade to a corner suite for the "next time" I say there, If I ever do again. Now take it I only got this because I opened my mouth and called them 3 times. If I had not, I highly doubt they would have done anything to make my stay better. I will say that the bed is comfortable and the floor staff are very nice (house keeping and someone who walks the halls, for safety I guess). The remote features for the temp, curtains, lights, and TV was a nice feature; although the TV guide on the remote reacts about 3-4 seconds after touching the screen, which can get annoying. A 5 star hotel is given 5 stars because they are to be the best of the best, flawless... and when mistakes happen (because they do, we are all human) a real 5 star hotel handles it in the best manner and would truly rectify the situation to have the guest staying and leaving the hotel with a good impression; I basically had to tell them to do something to try make my stay better. No coffee maker in the room either, they want you to go pay for gourmet coffee downstairs; and no refrigerator. This hotel may have 5 star because it is brand new, but with they way it's run and they way they charge for every little thing, this is not going to keep the 5 star for long.

Reviews.Title: “Proof of Booking”
Reviews.Author: BarbPan
Reviews.Content: Aria is a gorgeous hotel with superb linens/bedding & bathroom. Cafe Vettro has excellent choices, food is exquisite and service excellent. Unfortunately check in/out counter leaves much to be desired. We booked a room through MLife Players Club was given a verbal confirmation # nothing by e-mail with cost on it when we arrived the cost was almost triple and they denied ever having a price that we were quoted. They did lower the cost and originally offered tickets to cirque - when we went to claim the tickets they changed saying it was buy one get one free.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: nki65
Reviews.Content: In Vegas, hotels pop up all the time. Aria is by far the prettiest of them all. Its a huge complex and absolutely beautiful. when you first walk into the room, everything is controlled by touchpads and remote controls. Very high-tech. The beds were so comfortable. They have three pools - one is for adults only. There is a variety of restaurants and bars in the hotel. Aria by far is my favorite hotel on the strip now.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but terrible for allergy sufferers!”
Reviews.Author: krmap0lice
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a beautiful, modern hotel with a lot of excellent amenities. I did have a few issues with the staff and hotel overall though. 1) Was told that a late checkout "won't be a problem" when I booked the room. Our flight was late at night and I really needed a place to stay until our flight. When I talked to the front desk on the last day of our trip, we were only given 2 hours after checkout, and was denied the 6pm checkout that I was told about upon booking. 2) An extra $30 a day for queen beds, instead of a king. Really?! With the gaming we were planning to do in Aria, it was discouraging to be charged this amount to have a friend stay with us in the room. This friend was planning to gamble as well! Aria will lose guests if this fee continues. 3) The vanilla air freshner throughout the entire hotel was initially cute, until my husband started having extreme allergy attacks in (and only in) Aria. We had to leave the hotel to just give him some relief from the air freshner!

Reviews.Title: “Made my first time in Vegas wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Shyneice
Reviews.Content: I had the corner suite. It was simply amazing. I went on a weekend getaway while on R&R from Iraq. Service was wonderful. Hotel was great. Haze nightclub was so much fun. The casino was very nice although I''m not much of a gambler. I would stay at the Aria again!

Reviews.Title: “Meh - better to stay at Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTravellerSJ
Reviews.Content: For the beauty of the lobby, I was just not that impressed with this property. I wished I had gone old school and stayed with my group at the Wynn - but wanting to try something different I decided to stay at the Aria. First off, room service food was mediocre at best with nothing particularly interesting or inventive. Restaurants that we tried (Sage and Maestro's) were decent, but nothing special. My massage at the spa was average, and I definitely prefer the Canyon Ranch at the Venetian. All in all, you can probably find a good deal but if you're looking for a bit of luxury, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: DrumMajor500
Reviews.Content: A local said it best, "You could drop the Aria Hotel in any city and it would fit in". This to me is hardly a compliment for what most people come to expect in Vegas especially when compared to the Wynn, Bellagio or Venetian among others. We stayed at the Wynn on our last visit so all of our comparison were to there.The rooms at Aria were nice but in going for the sleek, modern, Asian influence certain amenities were missing like towel bars in the bathroom. Who wants used towels and washcloths laying around on the vanity top or on the floor? The in-room electronics were highly touted in the advertising and on the website but only worked part of the time. Plus who wants to spend time trying to figure out how to electronically dim the lights, open the curtains or just tune the TV set. I enjoy rock music but the oldies (70's-90's) sound track throughout the facility even in some of the restaurants was pervasive. I won't even talk about the smell of vanilla, hope you like it because it is overpowering at times.We did find the staff to be helpful and friendly for the most part. The casino was very smoky which was annoying. For the most part the guests at Aria appeared to be mainly in their 30's and perhaps the decor, soundtrack and vanilla smell is geared to this age group. For this 60 something give me the elegance, sophistication and fresh flowers at the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Promontory
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is the rooms. Rooms were truly outstanding, very large, modern, luxurious and comfortable. The restaurants were very good quality, alot of options. There were some annoying and/or negative things: This is a huge hotel and there were alot of crowds everywhere, which is typical in Vegas. It was hard to find a quick, good breakfast without waiting in a long line, no matter what time of the morning. Room service for breakfast took over an hour and a half. The casino/lobby had an awful cheap vanilla scent - very strong - diffused throughout at all hours which was too much and headache provoking. Finally, I found erroneous charges on my bill that needed to be corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome must try”
Reviews.Author: Malaysiantraveller10
Reviews.Content: have to say this hotel is impressive, the rooms are great, service is great. Love it. must try- so convinient as well

Reviews.Title: “A different Las Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: embdmb
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Aria. From check in to check out, we were pleasantly surprised. The room was excellent. A modern, large space with excellent amenities. We explored the total "City Center" area. This is a very interesting architectural space. If one is looking to take a break from the casino, just walk around the area. Although we prefer a "sit down and be served" breakfast, we were urged to try the breakfast buffet. The buffet was superb. I would call it one of the best in Las Vegas. The price was an unbelievable $15.95. We had one dinner. It was at the "American Fish" restaurant. The dinner was not good. Food quality was poor for this type of high priced establishment. When we checked out, we needed to go to the front desk. For some reason the express TV checkout did not work. The desk staff was one of the most effecient we have ever experienced. All the people here were terrific. We did have one minor problem. We had to call for the room to be cleaned. When we called, the apology was over the top and a cleaning person was there within 10 minutes. This kind of thing does happen everywhere. In closing i just want to mention that we are 'Vegas veterans". We have gone here many times. We have been "preferred guests, comped guests and have paid high prices for rooms". The Aria met or exceeded any place we had previously patronized.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but watch the front desk's every step”
Reviews.Author: Travels_from_CT
Reviews.Content: Location, rooms, beds, atmosphere, food are all phenomenal -- excellent in every regard like everyone before me has described. I had several problems with quoted rates and extra charges on the bill. The Front Desk and their management was very service oriented and accomodating, but it required effort on my part. First of all, we got stranded in Dallas on our arrival date due to Southwest Air fusilage-related cancellations, so I called and explained it to them, and they shortened the reservation by a day and did not charge us for the first night (Saturday at $269) when I asked them if they would do this. Very accomodating and loyalty-building. It went somewhat downhill from there, however, when they gave me the rate folio to sign, and it was $269/night, even though I had booked all the other nights at $139, and I had the printed confirmation to prove it. This required their manager to fix, which they did. We had also booked the special "Upgrade to City View and Breakfast Credit" and I confirmed the credit when we checked in, that it was $40 per day, and the clerk agreed. The last day of our stay I looked at our folio online to-date, and there were all the breakfast charges, except the first day. I called, and the desk told me it was "per STAY, not per DAY." It honestly does not say that it is either one or the other on the confirmation that I received and the printout I had from their website describing it. It was totally reasonable to assume that it was just like a European plan, i.e. breakfast included daily. This took a trip to the front desk and a front desk manager who looked at the printout of the web site I had, agreed that it was ambiguous, and took off 3 days of breakfast charges. We would have never eaten in the buffet each day if the rules were clear. I just reviewed my final bill, emailed to me, and we were also charged $10 for Almonds from the Refreshment Center. The non-chilled stuff is on the credenza and monitored by weight; we probably bumped it at one point. I called them and they apologized and took the charge off. So, every front office problem was graciously fixed -- except too many of them happened and they all required me to initiate solving them. Go and enjoy, but bring copies of all your confirmation material! Absolutely everything else about our stay was first class.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, Mgmt not so great, but outlets great!”
Reviews.Author: gogo2travel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mgmt was cold and not genuine. Service in food outlets was great with great food! Gaming was great, but too dark with all the dark wood. Rooms were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base”
Reviews.Author: ColumnsCoventGarden
Reviews.Content: Possibly not quite the attraction which the themed hotels have, but a very ultra modern hotel with beautiful rooms, (it is well worth the supplement to have a "City Strip View'). Clean, good staff, although the location is just a tad annoying and the pool area probably not big enough. That apart excellent all round hotel.

Reviews.Title: “huge but friendly”
Reviews.Author: IndianaEssex
Reviews.Content: we had a really good experience here...bit daunted by the size of the place but had a great reception and a free upgrade to a city view room. Very clean, the most comfortable bed and pillows I have ever had in a hotel. Staff friendly and pools were really great and waiters/resses were efficient and polite. Only issue was that on a couple of ocassions, the pool cafe was very, very slow. Would recommend and definitely return to the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: U646
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at The Aria. This was my first time staying here although I have gambled here previously. I checked in around 11am on a Sunday. My room was ready and check in was smooth. The room was wonderful. I had no problem with the "technology" in the room. I thought it was handy and made things easier. I had a view of The Cosmopolitan pool from the 17th floor. My room was very comfortable and classy. The bed was amazing!! The elevators were quick. I rarely waited long at all. Although this place is huge, it was not difficult to navigate. I really enjoyed The View Bar next to the hotel lobby. The location is the only downside. It does not front The Strip. The most direct way to walk there is by walking through the shops in Crystals. So walkers don,t just wander in, you have to want to go there. The Aria is connected to The Monte Carlo, and very close to The Cosmopolitan.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated...”
Reviews.Author: christianabrewster
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to hotel it took us 30 minutes to get checked. The clerk insisted on telling us about every amenity the hotel had to offer, and after traveling all we wanted to do was get to our room. On the first day we left our room at 8am and arrived back at 4pm, to see that housekeeping had yet to clean our room. We called the front desk and they acted as if the room was not going to be cleaned. I had to tell the service desk that we insisted our room be cleaned and we would call when we left for dinner. They did clean the room but did a poor job of it. The next 2 days our did not get touched and I figured I would just make my bed myself. The drinks at the casino where watered down. The only good thing was the breakfast buffet and the swimming pool. I have stayed at several other hotels and will not be revisting the Aria due to poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfan95
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria for 3 nights with husband and another couple. We have been to Las Vegas many times before and stayed at Bellagio, New York, Venetian, Pallazo, & Mirage. We loved the Aria! The room was clean, and very up to date since the hotel is only a year old. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. The only downfall was the room was a little high tech for us. Everything was controlled by the clock on the nightstand (drapes, tv and lighting). It was confusing. Other than that, beautiful room and bathroom. Service was also top notch. We had an issue with a drunk man trying to enter our locked hotel door, he was unsuccessful, but after calling security, they were at our door within 30 seconds! Very impressive for a 4000 room hotel. With 17 restaurants, casino, 3 beautiful pools, shopping and spas, there's no reason to leave the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful trendy hotel at City Center - 2 thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Ontario315er
Reviews.Content: We checked into Aria on 3/30 around 11:30AM and we were able to get our room right away. The wait time to check-in was a little slow, as the computer system went down for almost 10 minutes but overall not too bad. The check-in clerk was very nice, apologized and tried to upgrade us to a suite or strip view room, but none was available because of the Michael Jordan golf tournement that week. Our room was on the 29th floor - not a strip view but was still very good. The room itself was very very nice...clean, large and looked very trendy. The bathroom tub and shower combo room was great...we used both almost every day. The room remote control was easy to use and worked flawlessly for me...although my wife had some difficulties figuring it out. The bed was probably the most comfortable we have ever slept in and the linens were always clean. We found no dust or dirt in our room, and housekeeping was very attentive for us. Aria casino doesn't have a lot of gaming tables and overall it's not one of the bigger casino's on the strip, which was fine for us since we are not huge gamblers anyway. The pool area was phenomenal - 3 separate pools and the Liquid nightclub pool. We even saw a few celebrities at the pool we were at! The bar at the pool was extremely slow, so I recommend using the waitresses for ordering any food or drinks. The pool area was very clean and water temps were nice and warm. Aria breakfast buffet was not very good at all...cafetria style and the food was bland. Highly recommend walking next door to the Cosmo's Wicked Spoon buffet instead...same price and way way better quality, taste and ambiance! Overall we have to rate the Aria as excellent! The entire City Center complex is THE place to be in Vegas right now. We will definitely be back...hopefully soon!!

Reviews.Title: “One and Done at the ARIA”
Reviews.Author: sunstew
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four day trip to Las Vegas. We decided to stay at the ARIA, as we had seen pictures of the resort, and liked its location at the center of the strip. We usually stay at the Venetian, so our expectations are high when it comes to Las Vegas hotels. We were extremely disappointed. Check in was unstaffed when we arrived, and the only person available for check in was at the "Invited Guest" line. He kept looking over to the regular check in desk hoping for someone to bail him out. This was one of the highlights of our stay. After 20 minutes of waiting (we were the only ones in line), we finally got our key and headed up to the room. The tile floors in the room were dirty. There was lint everywhere, and we ended up wearing socks when we walked on the carpet or into the bathroom. We were able to write our names in the dust that was on the end tables and desk. We assumed that housekeeping overlooked it and would dust them off when they came in the next day, and also pick up, and or vacuum, since my wife noticed a stray hair pin, bottle cap and hair tie on the floor, obviously left by the previous guest. Since that didn't work, we put in a call to the housekeeping manager, and were told that they would take care of our issue. We went out for some sightseeing and came back and nothing had been done. We ended up checking out early and moved to another hotel. The ARIA has a lot of amenities, but some of the electronics don't quite work right. Our in room control panel had the name of the prior guest on the main screen, which seemed strange. Also, the temperature gauge constantly read 59 degrees for outside temps, even though it was 80 + degrees during the day. The air conditioning was set at 70 degrees in the room, but it never felt like the temp ever got under 78. And for some strange reason, the maid always turned the heat up to 80 degrees whenever she came in the room. The casino was nice, but the decor didn't seem to quite fit all together. The staff rarely smiled, and the only authentic "good morning" we recieved while there, was from the maintenance guy who was in the middle of painting one of the hallways. The location is nice, as it is in the middle of the strip, with close access to Monte Carlo. It is a little bit of a hike to get to Cosmopolitan, or even back to the strip, but no more than 15 minutes. We usually walked through Crystals, especially when it got hotter after 3 pm. Long story short, If you like dusty rooms, poor service, and a generally blah attitude, this is the place for you. Next trip, you can find us at The Venetian!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room! Great service! Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: stephhayden1
Reviews.Content: So, I read most of the reviews and knew what to expect. Upon arriving, we learned that they had sold out of all of the rooms that we had reserved. We were upgraded (for free) to a Crystals Suite City View. The Room - The suite was amazing!!! The bathroom was exceptional. The bed - I wanted to take it home with us! The views were unbelievable. We honestly couldn't have asked for any better. Working the lighting, curtains, temp, TV was easy! Two tiny complaints - one day our TV controls in living area stopped working but you could watch TV and then one of our keys stopped working. When we got it fixed, the other one stopped working. The Service - from check-in to check-out all of the employees were so nice. From housekeeping to the bell staff, we had friendly customer service. Big kudos to the bell staff who were super friendly when we stored on our luggage on last day. Restaurants - were expensive but it was a short walk to the Monte Carlo food court so we did that a couple of times. We ate at the Union Restaurant in the lobby one night and it was $150 for 2 filets (one large/one small), order of asparagus, order of pureed potatoes, glass of wine, and a cocktail. However, the food was top notch so worth it. Viva Elvis - Great show! Not as good as "Love" but good none the less. We got free tickets when we booked a room. We were upgraded to closer seats upon arriving at the theatre, so that made the show ever better! The Gold Lounge was nice as well. Pool - while the weather the weeks proceeding had been cold, we had 80-90 degree temps each day. We spent 2 days at the pool, and it was great. Music wasn't too loud; pool was heated so perfect temp; hot tubs were nice; adequate chairs. My only small complaint would be that they needed someone to pick up after everyone. It got sort of messy at the end of the day. Also the strawberry daiquiris and pina coladas were good. We got BIG ones, but they are $$$$$$$. ($22 each) Casino - I don't gamble very much at all (pretty much never), but my partner does so while he played, I sat down at a penny machine. I didn't know exactly what I was doing but the bells kept going off. I put in $14 and cashed out when I hit $60 after only 5 minutes. I'm not a serious gambler so not sure how other machines are, but for those on here saying they didn't win, I decided to provide this example. Haze (Nightclub) - we went to the Club. We had friends in the VIP section so we got to skip the line but it is LONG. Very popular club. Not sure we would go back unless we were in VIP section again because the dance floor was so full that people couldn't move. We would stay at Aria again. We love Venetian as well. I think it would be a toss up between the two for our next trip. We will probably go to whichever is offering the better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty - Avoid”
