Reviews.Author: Breaker64
Reviews.Content: I found a dirty sock in my bed the first night. A black fuzzy sock on white sheets! I complained and didn't even get a sorry or an offer to have the sheets changed. "Thank you for bringing this to our attention" is what I got. I didn't want anything other than a 'sorry' and didn't ask for anything. I can deal with the dried urine that was on the toilet seat that was there when we checked in, but a dirty sock in the bed! And poor customer service in dealing with it... They claim to have twice a day room cleaning. If I hadn't already paid for the stay, I would have left immediately.

Reviews.Title: “The Aria Made My Vacation Memorable”
Reviews.Author: willyray66
Reviews.Content: I just recently completed a 4 day 3 night stay at the Aria Hotel and Casino. Before booking my stay i read all the reviews from this site and was very suprised as to the number of negative reviews. In most instances , people create unrealistic expectations for a hotel to meet before they walk in the door. In my case, I came in expecting nothing and I received a memorable vacation. From the moment we walked in the lobby ,we were greeted by a very pleasant hotel employee who welcomed us to the hotel and walked us to the check in area. The lines were extremely long ,due to a HP convention that was checking end at the same time. The employee assured us that even though the lines were long, they were moving quite quickly. Having our doubts we got in line and prepared ourselves for a long wait, but to our surprise we were all checked in by 20 minutes. Hotel employees were passing out bottles of water and information regarding services and amenities that the hotel had to offer, which helped occupy our time waiting in line. Upon entering our rooms , we were pleasantly suprised by the trendy modern decor , which added a new dimension to your basic hotel room. Large flat screen t.v., soft beds, plush linens , and modern furnishings were also present . Everything in the room ( lighting,tv,air conditioning,curtains) are all controlled by a easy to use remote. The bathroom was large with double vanities,enclosed tiolet , granite floors and seperate shower and jacussi tubs. The casino is small compared to others on the strip, but presents you with the same gaming options as far as slots or table games. The dealers were quite personable and polite, as well as all casind employees that we came in contact with. We ate at two of the restaurants located in the hotel, as the food was exquisite and the service top notch.Prices are a bit high, but you definitely get what you pay for as it was well worth it. The Aria is a five star resort in every sense of the word. Every area of the hotel from the conceirge, bellman, security , front desk, bartenders were extremely polite and helpful and helped us enjoy a very relaxing and stress free vacation . I have stayed at other MGM properties on past visits to Las Vegas, but the Aria has become my new home away from home. If you want to enjoy your time in Vegas with first rate service and no worries, than theAria is where you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “it's just a 3 dressed up like a nine...”
Reviews.Author: angeleighty
Reviews.Content: stayed at this resort march26-30. the first night we called the front desk twice about an extremely loud party going on beside us at about 6am. finally a security guard came up and told them to tone it down a bit. well when people are intoxicated it is hard for them to judge what toned down is. there was also strong smell of marijuana in the hall. (no smoking floor) so i am sure that should of been frowned upon as well. anyway the third call down we were told we could possibly change rooms around noon thurs as none were available. unsatisfied with that my husband had to get dressed and head down. after speaking in person he was told oh there is a room available on the 20th floor we could move now. well we did. although i do not believe it is fair we had to pack up and move rooms in the middle of the night when it is others causing the disturbance. and it is pretty bad he had to go down and argue to get a room that was obviously available a few minutes earlier when i had talked to them on the phone. shame on them!! i know vegas is a party town but i think at 6am its time to shut it down when its disturbing other paying guests. if we had not booked though west jet holidays we would of left then and there. we have stayed the mirage and the monte carlo in the past and had wonderful customer service there with no noise issues. we could of stayed at one of the lower priced resorts to get the party next door experience if thats what we had wanted. we got to our new room at around 7am slept until about 9 am showered and came back that night to an uncleaned room. (sunday) monday late afternoon came back from swimming to shower- room still uncleaned..so towels had stayed wet for 2 days..again unsatifactory . we finally went to talk to front desk and were pretty much told oh sorry..she said she'd comp a nights stay but we were paid through west jet so we told her to credit 20 dollar a day resort fees instead.(which is a bizarre fee in the first place) its not about the money its about the fact it was like we were at a mexican spring break tour and should just accept it .their website seems like the aria was a upscale hotel but after staying there i would have to say its just a 3 dressed up like a 9..it is beautiful but not so good otherwise. we will not be able to recommend the aria to others. in fact my sister and 7 others friends are heading down and after i told her of our experience they will not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Ahh-mazing”
Reviews.Author: jami245
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with his parents just got back from a 4 night stay at Aria and had a wonderful time. Check-in was fast and easy. The person working the front desk was very friendly and was very upfront with us about the resort fee and the mini bar charges (it's weighted so don't touch anything unless you wanted to buy it). The hotel itself is so beautiful. Very modern and yet still very warm and relaxing. The lighting is typical Vegas (dark!) and there was always music pumping through all common areas. It wasn't obnoxious at all. Our room was wonderful. We had a standard room with a city view upgrade. It was a short walk to the elevator and was very quiet. We never heard noise from other rooms. We loved the touch pad control, the bathroom (excellent shower) and especially the bed. I got the greatest sleep! It was so comfortable. For us, the only way the room was lacking was in lack of electrical outlets. There was one in the bathroom, one by the front door and one at the desk. I like to have my phone charge through the night on the nightstand but there was nowhere to plug it in. My in-laws did note that they wished the room had a coffee maker. I don't ever use in-room coffee makers, but if you do, don't expect to get one here. I did feel like the restaurant options weren't great. There was no "food court" where you could get more inexpensive quick food, only high end coffee shops and restaurants and, of course, a buffet. It was never an issue though...whenever we wanted cheaper food, we just walked out to the strip. We did have breakfast at the pastry shop. It was over $20 for a croissant, a cinnamon roll, an iced coffee and a small soda. It was all delicious but not worth the price. The lines to this place get very long. I would recommend going to the other end of the casino (by the taxi stand exit) and getting your morning coffee at "The Roasted Bean." It is about the same price, but never a line. We also had a few meals in the attached "Crystals" mall. We ate at Todd English's P.U.B. I'd never go back. The find of the trip was at Wolfgang Puck's Pizzeria and Cucina. They have happy hour all day every day. After seeing a show, we went there, sat at the bar and had $18 pitchers of Sangria (YUM!) and bar bites ($7 each for mini pizzas). It was delcious and an excellent value. Overall, I'd definitely stay here again and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasmagorical”
Reviews.Author: ark18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the hotel at the end of our trip - since we were flying out of Vegas early the next morning. By the time we returned the car and got dropped off it was already 6pm, and while we left quite early the next morning, this place was great. I gave it a lower location rating because it's pretty tucked back there in City Center - but if you love shopping you're right where you want to be - attached to a mall. The hotel's architecture was wild - cool angles, great colors, water sculptures. And they have public art, in Vegas of all places, everywhere! I think they'll give you a walking tour map at the front desk if you want one. The casino feels new and fresh, and there's a second floor with walkways and such if you want to avoid cutting through there. The rooms were interesting. I can use technology, but I could not figure out the master remote which controls everything from the lights to the curtains. This got old. Very quickly. The room itself was huge - very cool bathroom too. Overall it was a great place - I'm sure we would have loved it more had we stayed even longer.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, much better hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bummer1145
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong the hotel is nice but you will get sick of the smell of vanilla. The rooms are okay the maid service was horrible, they don't clean just make the beds. They will nickel and dime you every chance they get. Don't even touch the mini-bar or they charge. We had ours taken out of our room for that reason. Drinks by the pool range from $14-22, they don't use much alcohol either. The best part of the room is the bedding it was awesome best sleep in a hotel. Nothing is free nothing, no coffee maker,paper nothing! A coffee in the lobby was $10. I am not a cheep person but for what the rooms cost you should at least get coffee. For the amount of time you are going to spend in the room it is not worth the money. If I do go back to Vegas which is unlikely I would probably stay at Paris and be in the heart of it. Oh and on top of the price they also charge you with a $22.50 resort fee for fitness room and internet, whoopie!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Victorious82
Reviews.Content: Booked the Aria for my husbands birthday. First impressions were good. The vanilla smell they pump in was ok. My husband hated it but it did disguise the smell of smoke. Stayed on the 53rd floor. I requested higher floor on check in. The grand entrance into the room when the curtains open to reveal the view...didn't work! Bit disappointed. Rooms are nice & big-stayed in a deluxe double. Bed is amazing. Wanted to take it home. Good location. Teasing walking through Crystals shopping centre to get to walkway bridge over road with all the designer stuff I couldnt afford!!! Overall, wasn't bad. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of Heaven in Crazy Vegas”
Reviews.Author: frog0823
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria with a group of friends during March Madness and loved it. I know this is a new hotel but we were very impressed with how clean everything was - from the rooms to the lobby to the casinos and restaurants. I'm not much for super modern decor (Bellagio is more my speed) but Aria's sleekness does not leave you with a cold feeling. In fact I thought the overall vibe of the place was very warm with the rich woods and warm colors. The rooms were well sized and I loved how everything was controlled by the remote/home panel by the bed. The double sinks in the bathroom were great as were the larger sized toiletries. The beds were the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. Food was pricey but very good. The tram to the Bellagio was very convenient (runs every two minutes) and I liked that we were on the strip but set back a bit. It gave Aria a more relaxed resort feeling. Overall we were very pleased with our stay and will definitely return to Aria on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “So great”
Reviews.Author: lynzi042084
Reviews.Content: If you find a deal for this hotel do not hesitate. Amazing spot on the strip. Beds and pillows were amazing only wish I would have slept more!!! Also the pool was great. But as mentioned before service out there SLOW.. Just go to the bar dont wait for a server.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, classy, calm atmoshphere with exeptional service”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler99
Reviews.Content: I was at the Aria this past weekend with a large group of people celebrating a friend's 50th birthday. I thought the hotel room were very nice and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is beautiful and low key compared to many of the other hotel/casinos. I ate at 3 of the restaurants and thought all 3 were excellent. Yes, they are expensive, but this isn't the Imperial Palace folks! At first I wasn't sure I liked the casino (it's dark) and lacked alot of the pizazz that some of the other casinos had. But I came to actually like and prefer coming back to its low key ambiance after all the noise and flashing lights from some of the other places I had been to all day. I think the staff and service was exceptional and all around a very classy high end casino. All of the table game employees were well trained and very hospitable and fun. The pool was fabulous! I would higly recommend the Aria. As for comparisons to the Cosmopolitan casino, I'd say the Aria is classier and much more subdued and sophisticated. The Cosmo is geared to 20 somethings trying to hook up and for rich wannabees!

Reviews.Title: “Look nowhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: jmd919
Reviews.Content: After much research, my wife and I chose to stay at Aria for 3 nights march 25th-28th. During our stay, we cruised thru almost every other casino/hotel on the strip, and I have to say that there was no place that I'd rather stay than Aria! The location is perfect..basically in the middle of the strip. The room was very modern and very comfortable..everything is automated. Our room was a standard room on the 20th floor overlooking the pools and the red rock canyon mountains. The entrance (waterfalls, fountains, etc), lobby, casino, restaurants in this resort are all absolutely beautiful. We ate at the buffet twice for breakfast/lunch (best buffet I've ever had). We also ate at Cafe Vettro, Jean Phillipe Patisserie, and Blossom, and they were ALL excellent. This was our second time in Vegas, and the next time, we will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: sparker1977
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Vegas every year with friends for March Madness and have stayed at nearly all the hotels on strip, this one definitely is the best for the price (we had a sweet deal through MGM). First our flight was delayed and we missed our connection. After calling Aria they agreed not only to cancel the first night of our reservation without a fee (on the same day we were supposed to check in) but also allowed us to check in the next day at 8am with no additional charge. The lobby area is clean and granted it was early, but check-in was super easy. The rooms are spacious, clean, and as others have mentioned the whole remote control set up is pretty cool. Hard to believe it took this long for someone to figure out an alternative to hanging a "do not disturb" sign on your door knob! Shower and bathroom were large, and the pillows were to die for. My friend even bought one at the gift shop :) We had drinks at many of the lobby bars and all the staff was accomodating. The pool had just opened the day before our arrival, so service was pretty slow out there, but I'm guessing after a couple of weeks they'll get the hang of it. The pool itself was really laid back...music, but not that loud. The only warning I have is for folks sensitive to smells. I was fine with the vanilla air they've got pumping into the casino, but could totally understand someone getting a headache. Oh, and definitely grab a pastry or sandwich from Jean Philippe Patisserie, AMAZING.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at Aria”
Reviews.Author: cwashi6
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria March 24-March 27. Great experience. Was a little nervous at first after reading some of the posts. Outstanding service from beginning to end. Check in only took about 10 minutes. We stayed in a Tower suite. Room was very clean. Very modern. Entire room can be controlled with hand held touch screen panel. View of the mountains was spectacular. My wife and I spent a half day at the spa. Service was excellent. We had a private spa suite package. Worth every penny! We had dinner at Jean Georges Steakhouse. Had an excellent bone in ribeye. Lobster mashed potatoes were awesome. Casino was very good. Would have liked a few more blackjack and roulette tables. Food is also very good at Cafe Vettro. Would stay at Aria again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: missychococat
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've stayed at in Vegas so far. It's a great location. I arrived around noon and the check-in only took 5 min. My room was perfect. Immaculate and plenty spacious. Love the touch screen remote that controls all the lights curtains, television and room temp. Yes the mini bar is expensive and weighted but aren't they always. There is a 24 hr CVS a short walking distance from the hotel so you can pick up any snacks or amenities you've forgotten to pack. I ate twice at Cafe Vettro and the service and food were both good. Had drinks at View bar which was also good. Only downside and it's a big one is that I got food poisoning after eating dinner at Lemongrass. Would definitely recommend no one eat there. Food was not good service was poor. I also made an appointment at the salon and the service there was really good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Aria has the nicest guestrooms ever!”
Reviews.Author: pferg50
Reviews.Content: Great hospitality and guestrooms. Everything in room controlled by a small touch panel. AMAZING!! The decor in this hotel is beautiful. The beds are super comfy and the bathrooms are very nice. Rainfall shower head and oval tub enclosed in a huge shower area. Our friends had a corner suite which was absolutely georgeous!

Reviews.Title: “why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: reel76
Reviews.Content: just got back from my first stay at this hotel and couldn't be happier. Stayed in one of the sky suites and, unlike some other reviews indicated, the housekeeping staff visited at least twice a day and the room was immaculate. Never heard an outside sound while in my room. Even a dinosaur like myself found the technology in the room user friendly and fairly intuitive. Yes, the hotel is large so you have to walk some (i noticed that some think this is a bad thing) but come on folks, if you stay in a place with 4000 rooms, you'll have to walk! The service was unbelievable for such a large place and all the staff were happy and helpful. The casino was a lot of fun....I would recommend they add a few more blackjack tables but it really wasn't a problem. A final point that was very impressive to me.....this trip was a gambling trip but since i had never been rated at a MGM property, I had no history at Aria but wanted to stay there anyway. Upon making the reservations, the hotel promised that they would rank my play during the stay and then retrocatively comp based on the play. I have to say i was skeptical about that coming up on someone's radar prior to checkout but unbelievably, a very nice hostess FOUND me at a gaming table and introduced herself, met us at checkout, handled the comps as were justified and even walked with us to the limo taking us to the airport! Incredible service all around.....Incredible hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Aria Sky Suite Luxury”
Reviews.Author: dokken
Reviews.Content: During this USA trip we went to Las Vegas for the first time. Thought I'd go a bit "Vegas" and booked a Sky Suite at the ARIA hotel/casino at the new City Centre block on the strip. I've seen a few mixed reviews of the Sky Suites, but our experience was awesome!! Sky Suite bookings include a stretch limo pickup + drop off at the airport. You're taken to a separate (VIP) foyer for check in at the rear of the hotel, the staff swarmed all over us getting our bags etc. Check in was also in a separate foyer (just for Sky Suite guests). A quick check in, then they take us up to the suite where they take a little time and show you all the features. The main "different" feature is the touch-screen remote that you can use for lighting, TV, curtains, aircon and many other things throughout the suite. I've seen reviews where some found it confusing and hard to use, but all the features can also be accessed by on-wall switches and TV remotes - so no real problem. The suite is huge and the views of the strip (from our one) was great. Big, spa bath, his + hers vanities, lots of dresser, cupboard space. Nice king bed with great linnen. The only things we didn't like about the suite was there appeared to be no tea/coffee making facilities and the touch screen remote (next to the bed) is REALLY bright at night - we covered it up with a black T-shirt, but it's the only visible clock in the room. Sky suite guests have a small lounge serving coffee / tea / breakfast (continental) in the AM, then snacks + drinks, then in the evening wine + cheese. All free (well - you are paying a bit for the suite). Quick access to the Aria casino and then easy to get to other venues on the strip. All the staff we dealt with (including a dedicated Sky Suite Concierge) were excellent and any requests + bookings we made were dealt with quickly + efficiently. I have no other Vegas hotel experience, but this one was great.... A new, shiny property in a new (for Vegas) development. I'd go back there anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Note to self.... Do not choose the Aria for next LV stay”
Reviews.Author: carla0262
Reviews.Content: Check in took forever (1 hour or so in line) Hotel was so large that I could not even find the coffee shop in the morning. No signage anywhere telling where anything is located. Left hotel in car to find coffee Room was a queen suite...shockingly small!! (although online photos make the rooms look spacious) Daughter ordered lunch room service pasta/chicken/potato chips $ the bill came to 41.00 after all of the "resort fees" were added on Aria charges $35 per night extra for each person in room even small children "Resort Fitness Fee" of 20.00 per day is charged, even though we did not use the fitness center. Our daughter went down at 8pm to use it & it was closed!! We did not even go to the pools or have any desire to look for them as our room was so far away from everything and we were tired from walking Room is completely controlled by the remote control through the television..drapes, tv, wale up calls. Our parents could never stay here as they could not operate the system. There is food (for $$$$ purchase) all over the counter in your room and it states if you remove or lift it you will be charged. Our mini bar was damaged and would not lock. We had a teenager and did not want to temp them with removing $8.50 bottles of water or candy Had the Margarita pizza at the cafe and became violently ill immediately after Heard a baby screaming for 3 hours underneath us. Quality of towels and bedding was very good View was very nice We would never stay here again even though our convention is here for the next 3 years. We will staya t another hotel and drive to our MHA convention here

Reviews.Title: “UK bloke in Vegas for 1st time”
Reviews.Author: Skid450
Reviews.Content: Never done Vegas before , don't do gambling , and a friend booked hotel. A good choice. Right in the middle of the strip and the newest hotel and prides itself as being the most technically advanced. Rooms are fab, large and clean. Note to UK blokes: mini bar are weight sensitive, so don't put stuff in or stuff out if you are not going to buy. Food and drink in Vegas across the board is expensive The only place to escape the constant music is your room Fully recommend as a hotel, but cant rate casino as don't know anything about it, apart from don't put $10 on 12 black.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly expensive”
Reviews.Author: HAHMD
Reviews.Content: Be ready to spend money, and lots of it, at this hotel. Some examples: the drinks are $12, one chocolate dipped strawberry is $3.50 and one cookie is $4. Two coffees and one pastry $21. Stone massage $290. The interior of the hotel is modern and edgy, but no where near as beautiful as the Venetian or the Bellagio. We had trouble getting our room cleaned, it was skipped twice in four days, even though I was at conference all day -- I did get a $50 credit for food and drink each time, but with the above prices that did not go far.

Reviews.Title: “No Quiet On This Western Front”
Reviews.Author: Ways2go
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard king room on the non-smoking fifth floor. The Room—The Good 1. Our room and bathroom were immaculate. There was no mold, dust or hair anywhere. Kudos to the housekeeping staff. 2. Room was pleasantly decorated. Contemporary art graced the room and bathroom. Wallpaper, drapes, carpet and most of the woodwork was brown/dark brown/black and provided a soothing contrast to the glitz of Las Vegas. (If you find brown depressing, this may not be the place for you.) Lights and curtains were automated. Very cool! It took a few minutes to figure everything out but if you can work your cell phone/microwave/computer, you can do this. Read the handy-dandy remote control guide provided in the room. Floor to ceiling window spanned the width of the room. Plentiful closet, drawer and counter space. Three phones—one cordless. Drawer safe. Full-sized mirror on wall. Good temperature control. Very comfortable bed, four fluffy pillows and beautiful white linens. Well-stocked mini-bar. Large, flat-screen TV on wall. Great audio visual panel at the desk—again, read the guide provided in the room. 3. Bathroom was gorgeous. Lovely light tan/brown stone. Exceptional lighting, double sink and large mirror. Soaking bathtub was part of the shower area. Very cool concept. However, even with the grab bar, this area might be problematic for an older person getting in and out of the bathtub if the shower was recently used. (It would be in Aria’s best interest to provide a safety bath mat for the shower floor.) I appreciated the drawer and shelves in the bathroom and the lighted magnifying mirror. The Room—Improvement Needed 1. Lighting was inadequate. A 40-watt bulb lamp and a 25-watt wall sconce on each side of the bed is not enough lighting for reading in bed. There was a small, just adequate 60-watt reading light for the desk. There was only a 40-watt lamp near the chair. 2. Electrical Outlets. Let me count them for you. One double in the bathroom. Two singles at the desk. One double near the front entry. Six plugs in all. None of them are anywhere near the bed or near the chairs. The Resort—The Good 1. Aria’s architecture is contemporary, elegant and simply beautiful. Every day, I discovered something new to appreciate. If you find contemporary style “cold”, this may not be the resort for you but otherwise…wow! 2. I found Aria’s employees to be extremely hard-working and dedicated. This resort was huge and crowded at times and I thought the employees did an excellent job under the circumstances. I was also impressed that the employees took such good care of the inebriated or otherwise indisposed guests—all without being condescending or judgmental. There is a lot of compassion here among the rank and file workers. 3. The Aria has some of the cleanest bathrooms I have ever seen. There is an attendant in every bathroom and they are always cleaning. I did not mind tipping. 4. We enjoyed the restaurants in the Aria. They were expensive but the days of the cheap buffet are gone. In the resort, we ate at Lemongrass, American Fish and the more casual (read “relatively inexpensive”) Café Vettro. We had room service a couple of times. Dinner arrived within 30 minutes and breakfast came promptly at the time we ordered it. 5. Very nice, sophisticated casino! I am not a big gambler and even I felt comfortable here. I noticed that a few reviewers said the casino and the nearby hallways were smoky. I am very sensitive to smoke and I did not think that this was the case at all. The Aria must have a tremendous air conditioning/filtering system. I could smell some smoke but it was not at all issue for me. I am fairly high-maintenance on this issue in any environment so my take on this should speak volumes. The Resort—The Bad I put the following comment at the end of my review because this is a complete deal-breaker for me but it may not be for other travelers. I personally will choose not to go back to the Aria for this one reason. I like rock music and I love to dance. I also can appreciate the energy that background music gives a space. However, occasionally, I need a quiet space to work, read, conduct a quiet conversation or simply daydream. However, Aria management makes no effort to provide any kind of *free*, music-free, public space. Rock music was constantly and unrelentingly piped into all public spaces. My best guess is that a hyper eighteen-year-old and his Ipod were put in complete control of the hotel sound system. I understand that a smaller hotel might not have the resources to provide a free quiet space for its guests, but a large five-star resort should be able to provide this amenity. One should not have to pay $1.00 per minute (yes, Aria’s going rate for a small business room) to get a music-free space for reading and working. I spoke to someone about this issue at the front desk and she said that other people had complained about it also but that Aria management had no intention of changing their policy. They like it this way. This business decision on their part leads me to believe that I am not part of Aria’s target audience and that I need, unfortunately, to listen to my own admonition. This resort is not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but REALLY, not all that...”
Reviews.Author: scottp95
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria March 13 - 17th (comp'd 3 nights paid 1 night, Corner Suite 53rd floor)...Customer service was fast, friendly and efficient from the Limo driver to Housekeeping. Other family members stayed at hotel the same time and DID NOT have the same experience. They experienced dirty rooms (when I say dirty I mean DIRTY gross DIRTY) upon check-in and had to switch twice, nightmare for them. The rooms are just okay compared to others on the strip, nothing really out of this world. The in-room technology I guess is neat but more of a bother than a convenience. The casino (slots only) the worst selection of slots on the strip. I could not find anything that I really enjoyed and I ended up playing at other MGM properties and Planet Hollywood across the street. It's a convenient location but plan on doing a lot of walking. The tram is nice but I think walking would be quicker to the Monte Carlo and Bellagio due to the fact that you have to walk soooo far to get the tram etc. not worth it. The Breakfast Buffet is good, nothing special. A lot of expensive restaurants. Architecture is beautiful, there is a strong smell of vanilla pumped into the hotel/casino area which didn't bother me but could see that it might be bothersome if you don't like the smell of vanilla. Would I go back? If it were comp'd again, MAYBE...it's just not as convenient as one would think (I run 3 miles a day and bike 2) I don't mind walking at all but it's walking in circles to get someplace directly across the street that drives me crazy. The slot selection is very strange and poor, especially SPIN the high limit area, just not a good selection. The pool area was nice, closed early and was small, other family members went to Caesar's instead after their first day. Overall with family we had three rooms and all of us said we would not stay there again. Honestly, there is so much competition and Aria does not live up to the hype which you would think they might of thought of before sinking the billions of dollars into it. Bellagio, Wynn much better options. I WANTED to like it, but IMHO there are much better places to spend your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Marine-CajunQueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had never been to Las Vegas and decided to give it a try. While we would not visit Vegas again as it's just not for us, Aria was a wonderful hotel in a great location. Connected with other hotels/casinos and a nice little area of shops and restaurants that most are open around the clock (Subway, McDonalds, etc). We loved the room and had a great view of the Strip and the mountains; the bed was very comfortable. Loved the modern vibe it had.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is beautiful...one of the very best in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jennyt1551
Reviews.Content: We booked four rooms for a birthday celebration and were all upgraded at check in. Staff were knowledgeable and polite. We loved everything about the hotel and the casino and the Spa was beautiful. We stayed four days and every day was wonderful. Room was very clean, beds are extremely comfortable, closets were roomy and bathroom was beautiful. We had a great experience at this hotel and will most definitely stay here again. In fact we are traveling to Las Vegas again in April and hotel is sold out...the word must be spreading about how wonderful this hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “Everything that we thought and hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: OmahaGriswolds
Reviews.Content: Booked two corner suites for a stay from Wed thru Sunday during March Madness. Upon arriving, we asked for an upgrade to a two-bdrm Penthouse and through some negotiating, got the room for around $700 a night (plus tax--12% and resort fees). Penthouse was amazing with a great living room and huge wet bar. The whole placed is wired to control TVs, lights, curtains, tempertature and the alarm clock. Trust me, spend 10 minutes with the touch panel to figure things out. The hotel was very swank with the gaming floor arranged very well. The cabana was above average for Vegas, but the pools are somewhat smaller. You will either like the smell they pump into the casino/hotel or be indifferent. Sports book is very small, but there is plenty of seating in the skybox cafe next to it. Didn't try the restaurants this time, but will be back in May for another go at it. The complaint about being too far off the Strip is true, but we found it manageable to walk thru the Crystals shopping area. Overall, I think if you are between 30 and 50 years of age and like Casinos/Hotels that are upscale, a little hip, and not too crowded, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “High tech room,very cool”
Reviews.Author: dg27311
Reviews.Content: Check in was ok, then it's a little hard to find your room but was you are there it's pretty cool. The rooms have all these gadgets such as you can turn your room "off" and everything goes back into it's default setting. You can customize everything to your needs as well. The bed was great, room clean and good service when needed. I don't really spend too much time in the room when in Vegas but the time spend was relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kab27
Reviews.Content: If you are registered for a MLife Players club card you may receive discounts to stay at one of their participating hotels. We took advantage of a discounted rate via the MLife Players Club. We were so impressed with this hotel. They were not stingy with the drinks at the casino. The swimming pools and hot tubs were spectacular. Our room was clean and very modern. Everything was operated with a touch pad controller. Lights, temperature, curtains, privacy control...everything!! The view was perfect. It is located across from Planet Hollywood and is part of the new City Center. They let us check in early and the check out was at noon. We had a late flight and held our bags for free. Most hotels do this but I just wanted to point out that the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but inconvenient location for getting to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: inseattle30
Reviews.Content: We frequent Las Vegas & have stayed at many different places on the Strip. This was our first experience at City Center and we chose Aria. My only real gripe with the casino is the accessibility to the Strip. In order to get out of the hotel/casino, you must walk through the Crystal shopping center or all the way around it. It's not a quick walk either. As for the hotel room, we had little to complain about. The first room we received had a really nice view and was on the 14th floor. But, there was a door adjoining our room to a room next door and we could hear every single word our neighbors were saying when they arrived home at 3 am. They were loud college guys and it was impossible to sleep at all. We checked in around 12 am and had to request a room change by 6 am. The front desk was great- they assigned us another room without any question. The only downside was that our new room was on the 4th floor without any kind of view (we saw a roof from our window). It was however very quiet. The rooms were smart with controls for the curtains, lights, tv etc. I found them to be easy to understand and convenient. It was nice to just use the Master on/off when leaving the room to shut off everything and close the drapes. The bathroom had a shower and soaking tub enclosed together which was fun. Also, they had a nice sitting area in the standard deluxe room that included two chairs and a table. This was in addition to a desk with full controls for your computers, phones etc. Overall, once we changed rooms to a quieter one, things were great. The beds were also very comfortable. The second room had a soft down comforter that was heaven. The first room had a rough duvet cover that we couldn't sleep with so I was a little chilly. The casino had a really nice perfume smell pumped in and the architecture/ design was modern and fun. As with any Vegas casino the food was expensive (expecially at Skyboxx where a sandwich will run you $27)! They do charge a daily service fee for high speed internet and the fitness center/ pools. We used the fitness center each day and found it to be great. The machines were all new and all the cardio equipment had iPhone/iPod connections and a TVs. The pool area was also really great and b/c it wasn't too warm we found seats easily and enjoyed some time outside. I will not stay at the Aria again because of how difficult it was to get anywhere. I think we will go back to Bellagio or Planet Hollywood. I think this casino is beautiful but not as nice as Bellagio or Wynn or some of the other higher end ones. Also, about the shopping... none of the stores at the Crystal shopping center were worth visiting for us. They were so high end that it wasn't worth spending time at. We walked through the mall several times a day to get to the Strip and honestly the stores were always empty. I prefer to shop at The Forum Shops at Caesar's or Planet Hollywood. I don't consider myself very cheap but when Prada and Pucci are the least expensive options, it's not much fun to browse.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff not friendly”
Reviews.Author: Fifytje
Reviews.Content: Hotel is big, but clean. You easily get lost. At check-in one of the staff members, Rachel, was very unfriendly and totally not interested in accomodating the guests. This is a bad first impression for Aria. I read more reviews about the rude and unfriendly staff so maybe Aria can give them some training. That lady got me really pissed. And yes, even for that i would stay somewhere else like the Wynn where the staff is much much better and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience at Aria”
Reviews.Author: EYEHAVEYOU
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend (at the time, more on that later) and I booked a standard room at the Aria for our Vegas vacation. As I had planned to propose on this trip, after the booking I sneakily called the hotel to upgrade to a nicer suite, which they were able to accommodate. I mentioned my intentions to propose as well. The check-in line was massive upon our arrival, but on the phone I had been told to check-in at the unmarked desk on the left that had a much shorter line - might be something to ask about. Upon checking in, we were told that we had been upgraded - I wasn't sure what this meant, perhaps they had been trying to cover up my upgrade in front of the gf? Once we got to our room I realized I was wrong - they had set us up in one of the penthouses, simply an amazing room with views to match. From the moment we arrived onwards, the service was outstanding. The bell-hop was quick to greet us and seemed friendly and happy, as did the staff at large. Chocolate and coconut strawberries were brought to our room the first day, along with a card stating "we hope you enjoy your special occasion" - was difficult to play that one off in front of the gf as I hadn't proposed yet. On the second day, I worked with the concierge to setup a trail of rose petals leading to the bed which was also covered in rose petals. They did an excellent job at this, and also provided champagne and more chocolate strawberries. She said Yes, and I'm happy to say I left our trip with a fiancee. Room service did a phenomenal job of cleaning the rooms. The pool was very nice as well. We didn't try many of the restaurants in the hotel - went to the buffet once that cost $60+ with tip for two people. The other restaurants looked very nice, just preferred to try other, more established restaurants in Vegas. Being at the heart of the strip, the hotel is in a great location to walk to many other locations. Hotel is also very close to the Crystals shopping mall. If your lady has an expensive taste, be careful there - lots of LV and Gucci proved quite a distraction. Only complaint is that the separate check-in area for the sky-suites was incredibly hot, almost broke a sweat in there! Perhaps a/c wasn't working at the time. Our stay at the Aria will be one that we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: maxandmazy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights - if you get a taxi there make sure you ask the driver to take the short route and not go via the underpass. If the driver uses the underpass route it will cost $35. The entrance is very impressive and our check in was pretty quick. Room was bright and airy with all the gadgets that have been mentioned which are fun to play with. It was a fair walk from our room to the lift and it is easy to get lost but that's part and parcel of staying in a bigger hotel. It's really not that far a walk from the strip with at least 3 different routes onto the strip which can be as short or as long as you like. All services we used were very good, room cleaning was efficient. It's just that as the hotel is so big & so new it's a tad souless at the moment. Like most of the Vegas hotels the resort fee is a bit of a con if you don't have any use for wi fi, fitness room, spa and the newspaper which you have to collect yourself, so make sure you take your fitness gear & swimming costume if you have them and get something for your money! Use the Sweet Chill cafe on the Promenade rather than the pateserrie in the casino if a quick coffee/cake/paninni - the queues are a lot less. We would go again at some point but will try others on the strip before returning to the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “noise is deafening”
Reviews.Author: phrosen
Reviews.Content: The noise level in all public areas, including elevators, is audio abuse. The wall of sound, PA systems blasting different sound tracks from different venues, is enough to damage hearing.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE disappointment! and so not worth the high prices!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzabobizza
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas as a reunion with friends. Upon arrival, the receptionist couldn't find a room like what I had reserved and kept telling me I'd have to upgrade to a suite. She finally found the right room type, but on the second floor and accessed from a different elevator lobby than our friends who we had come to see. Plus I had booked at a rate that included comps at the resort, which no one could seem to find when we got there! As for the room, the layout was awful and we were constantly tripping over stuff or getting hit by doors. don't be fooled by the high tech hype. We could never find the light switches, the tv and mission broke for a day, the sound system is nothing special, and the usb port is only there for charging phones. However, the aria mattresses were very comfortable. The staff was inconsiderate and incompetent with the exception of the pool staff. Oh, and the pool closed at 2pm! WTF! There were obscene taxes on everything, which I found out later were "taxes" imposed by the resort, not to mention the steep resort fees. I would NEVER stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Aria-mazing!”
Reviews.Author: goin2vegas2006
Reviews.Content: Aria Sky Suites is the way to go for a complete VIP Vegas Experience! The suite ammenities are unrivaled and the views are to die for! Everyone was exceptionally nice and accomodating-I couldn't ask for anything more..........2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Decent new hotel - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ajb69
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Check-in the usual Vegas go-slow, and you have to walk through the casino to get to the elevators, but so far no different from any other hotel in LAS. Room large for the price paid, but watch out for the mandatory resort fee. Room itself very well done (as you;d expect for a new hotel), comfortable bed, enormous TV with very good picture - curtains, climate, billing, TV all controlled from a bed-side touch-screen - very swish, and honestly lots of fun, but perhaps I'm just getting old when I say I find bog-standard light-switches simpler to handle. Other than that it is in the middle of the strip, lots of food and drink options inside and out - pretty standard Las Vegas hotel, but a cut above most simply due to being new and un-slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Horrilbe hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flyboy47
Reviews.Content: Not kid friendly,dirty room, slow room and pool service, save ur $$. Stay away from aria hotel or any MGM hotel, they can't handle. Customer service

Reviews.Title: “The A in Aria is for Amaaazing!”
Reviews.Author: CS310
Reviews.Content: This was our first Vegas hotel experience, so yes we were impressed! Though, we had great reason to be impressed..The hotel is magnificent and grand, without being over the top. It's posh, stylish but with real substance. Clean lines in the decor throughout the hotel and in the design of the room itself. The technology was so fun to play with..and as other users noted, it was high tech without being intimidating. It was my fiance's birthday so we were immediately treated to an upgrade on our room. We received 4 free drink tickets and a plate of Jean-Phillipe chocolate covered strawberries and macaroons compliments of the hotel manager. The view was gorgeous and I would highly recommend this hotel to my family and friends. We bid for this room on Priceline and won it for $70 bucks! All in all, great stay at our first 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “LOCKED OUT OF ROOM ARRIVING AND BEFORE CHECK-OUT TIME.......:-(”
Reviews.Author: chanel49
Reviews.Content: we arrived and were given keys to our room...which did not open.....called security....waited in hot hallway with no air( too long ) before someone came and let us in.....checked out at 9 in the morning 2 days later after breakfast went up to our room to pack and our key again did not work.....called security.....waited for 20 minutes ......no one came......hot hall again...(could not breath)......my husband then went down to get key to work.......check out was 11 not 9.....called manager from room.....requested compensation for our aggravation twice.......manager did not care!!!!!!!!!!!!..(BEWARE NO AIR IN HALLWAY OR ELEVATORS) ..:-(.........pool restaurant not open.......extremely smoky in the hotel.........like the palazzo much better.......no personal attention at the ARIA.......P.S. at checkout they told us we took candy bars and diet cokes out of the mini bar which we did NOT.....they have that touch method in the mini bar......which makes mistakes........so look at your bill really good for hidden costs that they add on!!!!!!!!!!!!won't be going back to this hotel again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TCK33
Reviews.Content: Its new, its beautiful, there are so many really good restaurants to choose from - what more could you want. Its very stylish without being uncomfortable, stunning designs throughout, great rooms and service. The breakfast buffet was a definite weak point - terrible selections compared to others. We stayed on level 52 and never had to wait for a lift, they were so fast. Its really got everything and is away from the more tacky side of Vegas across the road.

Reviews.Title: “First Aria Experience”
Reviews.Author: NGRG123
Reviews.Content: We read many negative reviews but had friends who had stayed at the Aria and loved it so we decided to give it a try. My wife and I were very satisfied with our stay. Upon arrival, we were treated to a free room upgrade to a city view on the 29th floor. Our bags were delivered promptly and the bellman gave us a room orientation which was very helpful. We required additional pillows and housekeeping was very timely with their delivery. Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The room technology was user friendly and not intimidating. We only ate at the Skybox, Cafe Vettro and the Buffet. The Skybox and the Buffet were both good but Cafe Vettro was expensive, service was slow, and the food mediocre. The poker room was comfortable and the staff attentive. My wife and I enjoyed the Aria and plan to stay there on our next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “For those who want a more restrained Vegas....”
Reviews.Author: dzhenna
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Aria and we found that the style of the hotel suited us perfectly. We're not big gamblers, but did visit many of the other casinos on the strip to compare. After visiting places like the Cosmopolitan (a slap-dash nightmare of over-the-top poor taste), the Bellagio (my second favorite, but a bit too much), and the Venetian (good service, but a bit too twee for my taste-- I'll take the real Venice, thankyouverymuch), we were relieved that the Aria had a more reserved style and approach. We ate at Julian Serrano, had absinthe at Sage, and drinks at several of the bars-- all with great taste experiences and pleasant service. We did have a long walk to our room, but we were pleased with the amenities and comfort that the room provided.

Reviews.Title: “Aria has TERRIBLE customer service”
Reviews.Author: Ewing31
Reviews.Content: This is the first time my wife and I have stayed at this hotel and I must admit, it is absolutely beautiful. I'm still here right now actually on their WiFi. However, we just got back from the pool and the experience was horrible. No food or drink served pool side, and it tool forever to find any such thing when we left our chairs to do so. To top it all off, there was literally POOP in the pool. And all the lifeguard said was that someone was on the way to clean it up, but it was still there when we left and hour later. They did comp us our food for the previous day because we complained about said poop and service.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: RichardBLincoln
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel ,stunning design throughout . Check in was easy and fast as was check out ( not so for those who arrived at busy times ) and our room ( Corner Suite ) was pretty good although the view was mainly of the Vdara Hotel and Car parking. If you book a corner Suite be prepared to walk a good 200 paces from the elevator to your room...it doesnt sound much but after a long walk down the strip its not what you need . Loved the remote control curtains ,lights ,tv, temp. Liked Breakfast Buffet although the team were stretched and coffee could take a while arriving , Jean George Steak restaurant ( although overpriced ) and loved Julian Serrano Tapas Restaurant ....the food here was outstanding. The Todd English P.U.B was terrific....a huge menu of beers ,friendly team and amazing food. Only a bit of bad news......be prepared to listen to your neighbours TV . In our case we had to listen to next doors porn movie at 2.00am...which was interesting. The sound proofing is not good. Resort Tax ( hotel profit ) is a whopping $20 per day plus tax ! There is no excuse for this ..sadly its just extra room rate for which you receive nothing extra. Every Vegas hotel charges something for Resort Tax but the Aria is the most expensive.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA is the bee's knees!”
Reviews.Author: thollandam
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided us with a free upgrade to a city view, which was spectacular on the 19th floor, and my friend and her husband stayed on the 21st floor. Aria is in between Monte Carlo and the Bellagio. Just about everything you need or want is within walking distance. The rooms were clean and the hotel provided top technology. The only thing I wasn't too pleased with was the restaurant within the lobby. The food cost more than it was worth. If you want a late night meal, just go to a fast food place on the strip. All the restaurants close around 1o or 11, and the one in the lobby stayed open all night I think, but the food was not worth it. I would have been more pleased with fast food. The club life looked hot, the casino was nice, and this hotel is located right next to the Gucci store.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful ultra modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: papasquid
Reviews.Content: We loved the Aria. It is in a great location right on center strip. We take a Vegas trip about 3 times a year. We try to stay at upscale hotels. We have stayed at Pallazo, Wynn, MIrage and many times at the Golden Nugget downtown. All of these hotels are very nice but I think Aria is our new favorite. The rooms are not quite as large as Wynn or Pallazo but all the gadgets are great and the rooms are quiet and super comfortable. The restaurants that we ate at in the hotel were excellent and we loved the Viva Elvis show. The only possible objection we could offer is that the whole City Center Project is so enormous that it requires a lot of walking to get anywhere. The check-in was swift and efficient and our room was ready when we checked in (11:00 AM). If you are driving or have a rental car the parking can be a little confusing but once you learn it is easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: g4480
Reviews.Content: This is a great new option that seems to be very popular. Everyone I know who has been to vegas lately have all stayed here. Maybe cause its the shiny new complex right in the middle of everything. Its well located amongst the other hotels and casinos but as is the case in Vegas still a long walk to even next door. The hotel is clean and full of modern design touches which I usually love but I think the hotel will look dated fast. Unlike other places, there seems to be no overall theme other than trying to look like a lot of money was thrown at the place. The casino floor had no character but I guess that doesn't matter when your staring at your chips or cards. It also seemed quiet but that may be because it was January. The rooms are nice and large with comfortable beds and features like electric panels that control everything. Overall, it was very good. Book to stay at the next new place in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: atcod
Reviews.Content: Check was expedient only to be followed by a much appreciated pseudo security check at the elevators, for registered guests only. Upon entry into the suite, we were delighted with a slowly, yet ambiant opening of the curtains and glimmer as the lights turned on automatically. The TV is also set to a pre-porgrammed channel with your check in status, name etc. on the TV. Honestly, the list of positive comments is endless. We will be staying here upon our return to Vegas in July. Highly recommend ARIA, not one complaint. My wife and I frequent Las Vegas and have stayed at a myriad hotels in Vegas. From Bellagio, Wynn, Monte Carlo to PH and Flamingo. Hands down this IS the new best place to stay in Vegas. Please free to contact should you have any questions. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Yodapeanut
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice, but the floors were dirty..i found spots of blood witch was kind of gross. Conveniently located between three major hotels where you can do lots of shopping. The bed is very comfortable but a major issue was the fact that the room was NOT DARK ENOUGH at night. Overly price but most things are overpriced in Vegas. The food at Cafe Vettro was horrible so that I wouldn't recommend. Other than that, it was a great place to stay with my husband who was there on a business trip and my 17 month old baby. And most importantly, THERE WERE NO SIGNS OF BED BUGS!

Reviews.Title: “Much Better This Year”
Reviews.Author: Retailwonderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year and gave it a 2. Didn't want to come back, but was forced to because of a business convention. I was pleasantly surprised to see they had fixed most of the problems. Check-in and check-out were fast and efficient. The room technology worked fine. Fitness Center didn't charge just for basic working out. The casino seemed to have better ventilation. Staff members were polite and unobtrusive. The bathroom faucets still splash you and anything on the counters. Good soundproofing on doors and windows. Convention facilities were excellent. Ask for a room approximately 10 rooms away from the elevators. That's far enough to be quiet, but not too far to walk; some of the rooms can be quite a hike.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Did Not Stand Out”
Reviews.Author: dcrose
Reviews.Content: Pretty much what I expected and similar to the other higher end hotels on the strip. Like all Vegas hotels, the distances are a hassle...for example, just to get a quick coffee in the morning is a long walk from the room and back and inconvienent. The pool area is nice but due to the season just one pool is open and the chairs were all full by late morning. There was only one pool waitress working and as the pool area was full, she could not keep up. The touchscreen control pad in the room was not very sensitive to touch so had to use the remote control and program the alarm through the tv. The fitness center was very well equipped . The hotel was nice but for me it did not stand out in any particular way vs the other higher end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kthkmk
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel the highest rating. After reading reviews I wasn't sure how this place was going to pan out, but I was not disappointed. I dont agree with the negative reviews. I am a very picky traveler when it comes to rooms and cleanliness, I have left many hotels before. We had a standard room with a view of the strip, the panoramic windows are unbelievable, I loved looking out of it at night when everything was lit up. The room we had was very clean, no complaints there at all. When we arrived there was no waiting in line in the lobby, we arrived early so our room was not not ready yet, but they texted us when it was and it was ready by about 11:00 am. I found the workers to be very friendly and helpful. Never came across anyone rude. The location of the hotel was great, in walking distance of so much. Pricy, yes, but your in Vegas on vacation at one of the nicest newer hotels, you should expect it. I thought the room prices were quite fair, drinks a little pricy if your buying them at the bar and not gambling, but free if your gambling. Black Jack dealer named Joseph was great, I didnt know much about it, and he helped me learn, super nice guy! I loved the smell of vanilla in the casino, I am not a smoker so I dont like the usual smoke smell in bars and casinos, but I never once smelled smoke while we were there. Had a walkway for access to the Monte Carlo which was convenient also and a tram to the Bellagio. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Near miss...”
Reviews.Author: Aroyola
Reviews.Content: Aria...nice looking property, upon arrival your greeted by friendly staff and LONG LINES....check in process was really long and seem disorganize. Casino ventilation was horrible, smoke everywhere and for a hotel with such grand plans this part of my stay was overwhelming. From the restaurans, hallways and even near my room I can smell cigarettes. Vento cafe was like a fancy Denny's; the menu was not extraordinary, served cold bread with frozen butter, huh? Maybe never, I much prefer Pallazo over. Aria...this is one sure bet in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to Hype”
Reviews.Author: jasontraci2006
Reviews.Content: Pros: located in middle of strip, easy check in, new Cons: valet rude, drop off car and pick up in different location very confusing. Drinks very expensive, everything is ala carte. No vending machines on guest floors, be prepared to spend 5 bucks for a coke. Daily resort fee. Stayed on 3rd floor, could hear the night club pounding until 3am. Not going back.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent”
Reviews.Author: MarkTRex
Reviews.Content: My first and likely last stay at the Aria. I'll save the boring details and share the low and highlights. - Incompetent desk and concierge staff. No follow through. Basically slaves to computer screens with cheery faces and no talent. I remember a time when a concierge was able to make things happen not just a web interface. - Very nice casino. Clean, stylish, very little cigarette smoke - Food at the small bars around the casino fair to poor. That said, I did not try all of them. - Rooms are nice and stylish. The windows on the 17th floor are a bit thin. Was surprised how easily I heard the loud bars and traffic at 4AM. - The "trendy" night club is nowhere near the effort, silly lists, exorbitant prices. Basically a bait and switch.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: CGladwell
Reviews.Content: Just got back. I would not recommend this hotel. Phone did not work. Room was so light at night could not sleep. Hi-tech stuff did not work correctly. Had to leave early for a medical problem and they still charged me $22.00 fee plus the room rate for the nights I had booked. This place is a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “I dont give Aria 5 Stars, I give it 10 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: Las21
Reviews.Content: Every Year me and my Family go to Vegas at least twice a year and we usually like to stay at well respected Resorts. So this time we decided to try out the Aria Sky Suites and it was well worth it. It all started with a complementary Limo ride to the Private Sky Suites entrance, way better than arriving by the main entrance which is typically busy. We were greeted by a very helpful bellman upon arrival, and escorted to the check in desk. Once there we checked in to our Aria 2 Bedroom Suite on the 51st Floor. And by the way every floor has a different smell for arousal of some sort, Our floor smelled like Oranges and it was very pleasant, how cool is that! The room was amazing, 1630 sq feet with floor to ceiling windows very ultra modern furnishings and electronics, the bathrooms even had different mood lighting for an occasion! and as well a cozy steam room built into the Shower, a heated toilet seat! and cleaning apperatus to wash your behind when you are done your business! It was just over the top amazing. Also, there is a exclusive complementary lounge for Sky suites guests only, and what a treat that was. 24h coffee, pastries, juices, anything you want! and starting at 5PM there is chocolate strawberries for an added touch. Eating wise, the food was excellent around the hotel the buffet was well worth the money with anykind of food imagineable anytime of day, Jean Philippe Patisserie is there as well with the BEST GELATO EVER! TRY IT! and other tasteful treats as well. They have a huge casino with a great selection of Slot Machines and table games, dont get lost! and dont worry waiting on a drink the waitresses there are attentive and fast paced getting drinks. I also tried out the workout center, which has a great variety of Workout machines and its probally the biggest workout center I have ever worked out at at a hotel on the strip.There is complementary drinks, and snacks while working out there as well, very nice overall. Entertainment is great as well Me and my Family went to Viva Elvis show situated in the Aria and it was a fantasic performance, and is probally one of the best shows me and my family have ever been to! A great recommendation to get these tickets is at Tickets for tonight which have half off tickets for shows and good deals on meals as well, we got our tickets for a good deal for a VIP seat! Instead of $150 for box office prices each we got them for only $90 its well worth the savings. You can find these places across the Street from the Aria at the Hawaiian Marketplace, Showcase mall, or Fashion Show Mall across the Street from the Wynn. Thats only a few they are scattered all the way down the strip. Aria is very close to most attractions on the strip and is in a great location. Overall Out of every Hotel I have stayed at this is the Best one and I will be coming back very soon, the Staff were wonderful and helpful and provided great service. I recommend this hotel to anyone it is a great retreat from everything. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “unpleasant, uncomfortable, and unprofessional.”
Reviews.Author: DonaldC4
Reviews.Content: Customer service is below par and very dissatisfying and not very courteous, when encountering a situation, and trying to negotiate for a solution. From hotel manager/assistant hotel manager, lobby clerks. Promise solutions that was never honored, no accountability for discrepancies on the hotel's behalf

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but don't like the flowery smell in the casino”
Reviews.Author: elynchking
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at pretty much every 5 star hotel on the strip and enjoyed my recent stay at the Aria. The rooms are very comfortable and nice furnished. A couple of things: The electric curtains for the floor to ceiling windows are great but a line of light comes in all along the top - poor design. Light bulbs in 2 of my lights didn't work and it was hard enough as it was not to feel like I was in the dark. I enjoyed the electronic controls as soon as I figured everything out. The bed is super comfy. Biggest downside for me: The casino has an overpowering floral scent. It's like walking into a department store perfume department. I got a headache every time I was in there for more than 20 minutes. Might explain why the casino was relatively empty. Had a really great meal at Julian Serrano. Liked that I didn't have to walk a mile from the front desk to the elevators. I had a special deal with a $50 a day resort credit which I confirmed on check in. When I checked out they hadn't credited me. I had to ask and it caused a pretty long delay that involved a manager and some complicated accounting maneuvers... Check your bills! Am going back in May and trying the Cosmopolitan.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service from valet to security”
Reviews.Author: djlewis40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were given tickets to see Viva Elvis for our 42nd anniversary. I am quite the Elvis fan. Both my husband and I are disabled, he has a scooter and I use a walker to get around. When we arrived at the Aria to see the show we were greated by the valet who explained where the showroom was and was concerned about my walking that far.He told me to call security when I went in and they would get me a wheelchair. We spoke to Harry, the security officer and even though they were have some kind of a security problem and their security lines were tied up he got an override and took me up in an elevator to wait for time to be called for tickets. He went to the ticket desk and explained that my husband and I were waiting to get in and to let us know when it was showtime. About 45 minutes after getting there Harry came back to check on us and took us to the front door and into the showroom. We really enjoyed the show and would recommend it to anyone. I only wish I could have got a scarf, we were under the balcony. Right before the show ended there was someone there waiting with the wheelchair right behind me. I was very impressed even the valet asked how we enjoyed the show. I have lived in Las Vegas for about 20 years and have never received such service . Thank you Aria Staff.....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! We even bought the pillows!”
Reviews.Author: rossmony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 4 nights over valentines day. A beautful place, the rooms were beautiful, the bed and pillows were ultra plush. We have a select comfort mattress at home that I love, but this bed was even better! The pillows were the right amount of soft till giving support. As I said, we loved them so much we went to the aria gift store and bought them, reasonable at $28 for a king pillow. I did see they had convienience foods at this store also. Housekeeping was great only 1 or 2 of the days did they take our tip for them. They even lined up our shoes for us! In the shower my toiletries and shaver were neatly placed on a paper mat for us. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants but they all looked great. I did have some sorbet which was very good! It was definitely worth the extra $300 I spent as an upgrade over a package for the luxor. Well worth it! The location is just as they say.....right where "the center of entertianment has shifted". We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room at the Aria”
Reviews.Author: cab514
Reviews.Content: We, my husband, 16 year old daughter and myself, stayed at the Aria for six nights late last month while my husband had a conference in Vegas. Since we were going to be there so long, we decided to splurge on a corner suite. For the price of a mediocre room in NYC we got a two room suite that was over 900 square feet. It had two bathrooms. A half bath off the living room that my daughter used most of the time and a full bath off the bedroom. The full bath featured a whirlpool tub, tv set (my daughter got a kick out of watching tv while taking a bath), a nice big shower, a heated toilet seat and two sinks. You can program the curtains, tv, temp etc from either your television set or a small screen by the bed. When you set the alarm, not does the alarm sound but the curtains open too. Very cool. We don't really gamble so I can say much about the casino except I can tell you that the air scrubbers did a good job - never smelled cigarette smoke. While the prices of the room are very reasonable, the food prices are pretty expensive. The buffet was tasty. The price ranged from about $16 for breakfast, $25 for brunch plus tip. The bakery was unbelievable (Jean Phillipe) but pricey. Cup of tea was $3.50. Fruit cup $7.50. Roast beef sandwich $9 or $10. The staff was as friendly as can be. The rooms were beautifully appointed and very clean. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “great new property”
Reviews.Author: suman_sasmal
Reviews.Content: went for a business meeting. room quality is superb... location right on the heart of city, room was clearly next-gen, filled with electronic gadgets. the conference center was quite plush, the food good. overall - a great experience

Reviews.Title: “Not $120 a night. $142 a night.”
Reviews.Author: Swarby10
Reviews.Content: Not recommended. Staying there right now. Checked in and was surprised to learn that they charge an extra 22 bucks a day for a newspaper (that we never got) and the gym (that I won't use). I'm not cheap and actually fairly well off. Money isn't the issue here, but I hate being taken advantage of. Where does it stop? It wouldn't be right to add an extra $100 per day. What makes this 22 dollar fee appropriate Also had a king bed reserved for our honey moon. We are in 2 queens. Not a big deal but far from what my wife had dreamed about ffor our special trip. Very disappointed and complaining to the desk isnt my thing.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great.. a little lacking in customer service”
Reviews.Author: WasatchSkier35
Reviews.Content: Overall great. Rooms are clean, new, had a great view of the strip. Convenient location. Only negative was the customer service with the bellmen and valet. Nice, but really not helpful. Made me carry my own bags, and had to trek two bicycles across the entire lobby with no effort to help. Overall worth the money and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Waste Your Money at the ARIA”
Reviews.Author: edwards4307
Reviews.Content: I recently booked what I thought to be a great weekend trip to Las Vegas with southwestvacations.com. When I booked the trip, I upgraded to a corner suite with strip view for an addl $365. I checked in thinking I was going to a corner suite, but what I received was a corner room overlooking the parking garage (for an addl $365, I dont think so). I asked the asst front desk mgr for a room change. She offered a room change for yet an ADDL $425. i WAS LIVID!! I explained that I had already upgraded for $365, she did not care and did not try to help any further. I asked to speak to her mgr and she stated she was the only one that could help. Therefore, I went back to my room and called to make a complaint. Another mgr said that the issue would be corrected by noon. Well at 1:00 the mgr called back to say that all corner suites with a strip view was taken and the room change request was made at 9:00 ample time to make a change. THIS HOTEL HAS NO CUSTOMER SERVICE and the staff is very rude. Pls take spend your money at a 5 star hotel with 5 star service because you will not get it at the Aria. I have also made a complaint with swavacations, with no resolution yet. Tina E. Houston, TX

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY ARIA IS HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: winstonzach
Reviews.Content: The Rooms are filthy, bathroom door handles are broke. Called to be changed to another room and was told nothing available. Stood in line for 2 hours to get my show tickets that were reserved 2 months in advance and they lost the Tickets. Got locked out of room not once, but twice had to stand in line for 2 hours to get new room keys. Lost my freeplay on the slots and management did nothing about it. All complaints are heard on deaf ears they don't want to hear anything and if you have to deal with Rose in accounting she is the worst. They don't even have a soda vending machine or any where to buy one on the property. Save your money avoid the place!!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL A++++++++++++++++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: Gr8te_karma
Reviews.Content: What a truly wonderful hotel. Lap of luxery. Excellent Service, the people we dealt with were very helpful and courteous. The hotel is in an excellent location in the city center close to the Manderin and Vderra, short walk to Cosmopolitan and Bellagio. The rooms were spacious and very clean. A touch of a button and the curtains would open and close, the lights would go on and off and the tv went on and off. Really modern hotel room. The beds were confortable and clean. The shower was awesome with separate big tub. 2 Bathrobes available for us, in room safe, 42 inch tv, really really well equipped room. What a great place to stay. The pool was beautiful with several hot tubs. Would recommend this hotel, great, awesome, comfortable, clean, luxerious stay. We were extremely happy to stay here. There were previous mixed reviews which I am not understanding why, this hotel and resort was perfect. Next time we come to Vegas we know we will stay at the ARIA!

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING TO BE AFRAID OF HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: cvsguy
Reviews.Content: 5 NIGHTS FEB20. I had convention at Mandalay Bay, but I was offered a good club rate at Aria. We checked in at 6 pm. It took maybe 15 minutes total. My wife waited at nearest slot and turned $2 into 30 on a penny machine... a good omen? I tried a $50 sandwich but the clerk laid it on the top counter. Only upgraded to City-View but on 22 floor and threw in a mini-fridge. I said the 50 was for a suite but gave him $20 anyway. It was President's Day eve after all. The most striking features are the dazzling front of Aria at night and the aromatherapy vanilla smell throughout the hotel. It is very much preferred to cig smoke for me. And through the week, when we came in that scent seemed to say that we were home. We genuinely enjoyed it. The room was very nice... close to Panorama room at Wynn that we enjoyed in September. The bed was among the best mattresses of any hotels we have stayed in. Bathroom was fresh and thoroughly cleaned and stocked with top-end toiletries. The electronic control panel was okay. Many Seasoned Citizens would be stumped to use it. Between panel, wall controls and switches on lamps themselves, it was an effort to get lamps on for the first time. The view was great and we kept drapes open 24/7. Housekeeping was good for 4 days but stumbled on last night. We left the room at 8:30 am and stopped in for just minutes during the day. We turned on the electronic "Service" light at the door each time that we left. Finally, at 4 pm when we returned from the pool with wet suits the maid was in our room. She said she was just starting and nicely offered to come back later. Rather than stand outside shivering for 20 minutes, we accepted the offer. And she asked when she should return. I said an hour. So, we had an"appointment" - Great!! When we returned at 8 pm, you guessed it...no sign of a maid. We had a 3 am wake-up call set for an early flight and had plans of an early bedtime. A call to housekeeping got us a rude lady offering full service or just towels!! i thought for a quality hotel we should get the full treatment, so she would send someone right away. Well 45 minutes later they showed up and we settled for just towels. I told the front desk at check-out and they did comp our buffets. Very satisfactory. All of the food is quite expensive, but we had plans to go out for many meals. The buffet is a good value. Breakfast buffet ran about the same price as a pastry and tea at the counter service around the casino. Mellow music in public areas...lots of Cheryl Crowe. The pool area was beautiful and OPEN, which is more than most LV pools in February. We Northerners need a little sun, even if it is only 60 degrees. The casino treated us well. Staff was great and friendly. We are low stake VP players and the machines seemed to be very gentle and the money lasted a long time. Trips to other casinos during the week reminded us how fast the 50's evaporate at some machines. The Aria casino waitresses were a hoot! Sometimes hard to find the first time, but once they got that first tip, they re-appeared regularly. We had very cheap res at TI for the last 3 days in case we felt like switching, but I think the slots would have eaten up that $60 per day savings. We stayed put.
