Our stay wasn't perfect, but everyone except the HK supervisor was very nice, the slots and free drinks were a hit, the bed was a keeper, the Jean Phillipe pastries were killer and the whole place smelled like Grandma's Kitchen. If we are offered the right rate, we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: Furhank
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Bellagio, Venetian, Mirage and a few others over the years. This was over the top. Got a corner suite and was amazed at the level of comfort, attention to every detail and over the top COOL of all the features. The room had every automatic feature such as curtains, lighting, you name it. Beds were the most comfortable imaginable. The only negative was the check in process which seemed to take forever but once that was over, the rest was bliss.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, brand new, little pricey”
Reviews.Author: tmarcone
Reviews.Content: Being right at City Center is a great spot to stay, walking distance to most of the strip easily. Check in was as long as any Vegas hotel, staff was very friendly. Vanilla smell is overpowering but you lose scent of it after a while. Rooms were super clean and modern. If you can work a laptop computer you can handle the remote control of the room (my parents would have sat in the dark for days if they were here). We found the table games ran $25-50 most of the time and house glass of wine was around $10 which I thought was pricey for the strip. All of the staff we encountered were very nice and accompdating. $20 service fee for the hotel (per dya) is excessive but their fitness center is amazing if you can make it there.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but could be better”
Reviews.Author: tray75
Reviews.Content: As with any hotel, the quality of stay is sometimes dependent on your neighbors. The first night we were woken up at 2 am by very noisy neighbors. I called the front desk and they told me to give it about an hour for them to settle down. An hour? Well I called back 30 minutes later and they said they would tell security. I called again 10 minutes after that and still no security. The neighbors happened to leave the room right after that last call so we went back to sleep. They returned at 4 am only to wake us up again. I called the front desk a fourth time and this time they sent security up and the people left the room. The next day I went to the front desk and told them what happened and showed the documented times I called and the gentleman seemed a little concerned that security never did anything until 4 am. We had our room changed and had no problems for the next 4 nights. The room itself is very nice. The upgraded technology thing is kinda neat and fairly convenient. The bed was very comfortable. I am not very keen on the idea that all the snacks and sodas are weight sensored meaning that if you just move something or knock it over, you get charged for it. Seems like a cheesy way to make more money. How do they know the maid didn't do it? We had no extra charges on our bill because we were careful. Just make sure you understand they are weight sensored. We joked about this as we walked throughout the day. You wanna take a shower? $10. You used the toilet? $3. You slept in the bed? $15. Just seems fairly ridiculous. Not sure if this is the standard for all other hotels in Las Vegas. We did one lunch buffet while there and it was excellent. Very pricey at $20 per person for lunch. Breakfast is $15 which we did not do. Dinner is $28 per person. One of the newer things I saw was a 24 hour buffet pass for various places. At Excalibur you can have 24 hour access for $25 but only at their buffet. Still pretty good. At Total Rewards casinos you can access any or all of them for 24 hours for $45-$50 per person. I wish the Aria would do something similar and give hotel residents a discount like offer 24 hour Aria buffet for $50 per person for hotel guests, $60 for nonhotel guests. Just a suggestion. Some of the other hotels like Venetian have multiple small cheap snack type shops in their lobby. All of the Aria places including the cafe are pricey. It seems as though Las Vegas used to be the place to go for great cheap food buffets and with the economy downturn and people not gambling, the hotels have chosen to now make money off of food so don't go thinking you will get great food deals. I can't say I would not recommend this hotel since every experience is different. I can't say the hotel wasn't nice. The neighbor noise is not their fault - that could happen anywhere. And I chose to stay there knowing the food costs. Next time I go though, I will try someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: debs58
Reviews.Content: Things I LOVED list: The whole place is very elegant. Friendly and efficient staff all around. The rooms are gorgeous, high tech, spacious. Beautiful bathrooms, lots of towels, comfy bathrobes. One of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in and great pillows too! Good soundproofing between rooms - I heard some cheering from an adjoining room once. It's really clean. Loved the free monorail to the Bellagio. Thing I LIKED list: the casino is not blaring loud music all day and night like some others we walked through. Located on the strip but a bit removed as well, as the entrance is up off the boulevard. This is a plus if you want some relief from the crazy pace of the strip. It's a negative if your feet are already aching from all the walking around you just did. Things I DID NOT LIKE list: Airport shuttles have to drop you off at the "bus lobby" down below and at the back, which is a disappointment, as it feels as if you're going in the servants' entrance. I would have liked to pull up to the front door of the place and been wowed by the elegance! It's a long walk from the bus lobby through the casino to the main lobby to register. The bathrooms had no towel bars and just one hook on the wall. SUGGESTIONS: Use the free monorail if heading towards the Bellagio - your feet will thank you for it! From the bus lobby to the main lobby, it's faster if you walk around the front of the building than through the casino. And my final suggestion: go to he Aria - it's a beautiful and top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler1983
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Aria for 5 days in January of 2011. The hotel itself is upscale and caters mostly to business clientele. Since I was in Vegas for a business meeting, I chose this hotel with the hopes that it would be quieter than many other hotels while still offering a great location. The food was delicious and the hotel offers many on-site options. Many other reviewers have complained about the cost. I didn't find Aria to be exceptionally expensive considering Las Vegas itself is a fairly expensive city for meals. The hotel's off strip location allowed for it to be quieter and a peaceful retreat. I will be returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A bit over rated”
Reviews.Author: ecastro77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria after hearing all the hype but after staying there I must say that the Aria Hotel & Casino is a bit over rated. Don't get me wrong the hotel is great the service was fantastic the food was amazing but my wife and I couldn't do much at the Aria other than play in the casino, order room service and catch a show. The shopping at the Aria is mostly for rich people, I can't afford Gucci or Fendi, Prada, Cartier etc. so we had to go to Planet Hollywood or Monter Carlo to shop. Also I they let people smoke in the casino even while they have "No Smoking" signs everywhere, and getting around the hotel is a big pain because you need to be going up and down stairs. To get to the strip you need to walk about a Vegas block just to get to get to the strip. If you can afford to shop at Gucci, Fendi, Prada etc. then the Aria H&C is perfect for you but if your on a buget and like your Gap, H&M etc. then you may want to stay else where. If I become rich I'll come back without a dought but for my next trip back I'll stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: FourfriendsCanada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 5 day stay at the Aria hotel in Vegas. We had some concerns after reading reviews on this site but kept an open mind. We found the hotel to be lovely. The staff were welcoming and we enjoyed talking to a few of them and hearing their stories. Check-in and out were smooth and fast. The pool area was beautiful. We ate at the buffet and found it to be excellent and a good price. The Elvis Cirque show was tremendous. The decor is modern and sophisticated. The rooms are lovely and the beds amazing. All in all we had no complaints. We would recommend the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Modern Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: Nooner27
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with every aspect of our stay at Aria. The hotel rooms and casino floor were decorated in a warm contemporary fashion. The staff employees provided excellent service throughout. We really enjoyed both of our dining experiences at Cafe Vettro for breakfast and at the Patisserie for dessert. I highly recommend Aria as one of the top places to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before leaving your room, it may not be there when you come back!”
Reviews.Author: dennisyt
Reviews.Content: I know this sounds pretty inconceivable, but it really happened. I read some strange complaints on Tripadvisor throughout the years, but I don't remember seeing anything like this even for a Motel 6, let alone for a place claiming to be 5-star and AAA 5-diamond. In a nutshell, we packed all our stuff in the morning of our checkout day and headed out for breakfast. The plan was to come back to our room afterwards, pick our stuff and proceed with checkout. When we come back, we were shocked to find our keys not working, our room already occupied with new guests (poor people, did they even clean the room?) and our belongings nowhere to located immediately. But hey, it is not even checkout time and we certainly did not complete the checkout procedure. It took them about an hour to sort things out. On the positive side, our luggage turned up after a long chain of inquiries. Ironically, it was at lost&found! But good luck if you were planning to catch a plane at that point! Amazingly the front desk staff and manager was more defensive than apologetic throughout. (Where is my mistake here, again?) Once the luggage is located, all they wanted was to have the security report signed off so that we can declare nothing is missing. That clears them of any liability, at which point your status officially becomes unwelcome. Onto the review of the property, the hotel is new and very elegant with contemporary design. Rooms certainly have a wow factor with beautiful furnishings, large flat-screen TVs and rather high-tech room integration. Bathrooms are immaculate with separate soaking tub, shower and WC areas. Make no mistake, just by its looks, this is a 5-star property. It is located right at the heart of The Strip so that you can walk in each direction easily. I tried the Sunday brunch at the buffet. While it is priced on par with Bellagio or Wynn, by its presentation and food, it must be one of the most forgettable buffets I have been in Vegas -- and I have been to quite many of them over the years. They have unlimited snow crab legs, but food selection and quality is very poor otherwise. My last remark is, while what happened to me was probably uncommon (or is it?), given that it is a major screw-up on their part and their part only, I am certainly not happy with the way it was handled. My advice to travelers is that if you can get a room here through Hotwire or Priceline at 50-60% of published rates, you can still go for it as you typically start overlooking things for the value you are getting; but if you would pay the list price thinking you are getting into a world-class 5-star property with impeccable service, well, you might be a little disappointed there.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: saundra14
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth trip to Vegas, and I must say i was quite impressed. the rooms were fabulous and very high tech. there was a remote as well as the clock in the room that controlled everything sorta like an ipad , including the curtains,tv, lights and the temperature. the refrigerator in the room was completely stocked (not free of course) but a great selection. Because we always buy snacks while traveling including beverages, we asked housekeeping to supply us with a refrigerator, and it was no problem. Everyone at this hotel was extremely frinedly and not once did i encounter a rude person. The layout was fabulous and being right in the center of the strip made it even better.There was a monorail that connected to Bellagio, and Monte Carlo and there was also an overpass to walk to Planet Hollywood. I had read the reviews regarding the buffet and was a bit leary about trying it. We went our first night there and was very impressed. I must say the food was fresh and the service was good. The casino was not as large as I had anticapted,but this is the only casino that i won any money in. There was a resort fee of 20.00 per day ,but unlike others that reviewd we were advised of this upon checkin and this was not a problem. When we checked in ,we were intially given a room on the 4th floor and wanted a higher floor for the view. We advised the person waiting on us and he found a room on the 12th floor, with a partial view of the strip, but not a problem, Overall the hotel was great and we will definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT HAPPY AT ALL”
Reviews.Author: Teejayy1955
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Aria were fine, but in Vegas how much time do you actually spend in your room. Everything was very expensive, the food was way overpriced, the buffet price is way out of line. Almost $70.00 for two people. We went to the Golden nugget buffet which was every bit as good and it was $38.00 for two people. The Bellagio which is beautiful and a much better atmosphere was much more reasonable in price also. The gambling atmosphere at ARIA was unfortunately the worst I have experienced in 20 years of going to Las Vegas. The service for such an Elegant building was only ok. Very dissapointed in this Hotel and will not return to the Aria. I will however be back in Vegas in September. Most likely stay at Bellagio or Bally's. Bally's is a little out dated but the service and the atmosphere are wonderful. And what makes a memorable trip...the fun you had??...or the sleep you had.?? May also consider the Venician. Good luck to all heading to Las Vegas. And this $22.40 a day money grab that they call a resort fee is simply a money grab. A lot of nerve adding this to your bill after charging you $5.00 for a bottle of water in your room..What a joke

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at Aria”
Reviews.Author: haztaz69
Reviews.Content: Last Thanksgiving my wife and I visited the Aria Casino and loved it. So, we booked a room room for last weekend. The room was very high tech and the bed was the most comfortable we've ever had in a hotel. We enjoyed the gambling, restaurants, and just walking around City Center visiting the shops. We've visited Las Vegas over 40 times and stayed in most of the more popular hotels. We like the Aria the best.

Reviews.Title: “For the most part it was great”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousIllinois
Reviews.Content: I loved the room - clean, spacious and modern The staff was very friendly and helpful contrary to what others have said Dealers and pit bosses were kind of condescending as I am not an expert gambler by any means- I guess taking my money was not enough- had to make comments and laugh

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, enjoy the newness of Aria.”
Reviews.Author: FunTravels123
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Arai - everything was new and beautiful, and the rooms were VERY cozy and clean. The casino is the best smelling one around due to the newness, but don't expect to find any tables under $10 if that's what you're looking for. For $5 blackjack go to Bill's or Freemont Street. The pool closes at 4pm in the winter, and was packed right up until 4, when they had to kick people out. But if the weather is nice in the middle of the afternoon, go down and enjoy a cold drink by the pool. There is a free tram that connects you to the Bellagio, and although it's super short, it'll save you a little walking at least. The hotel is steps away from the city center which offers some very upscale shopping. Great if you're looking to spend some money, but also good if you just want to window shop and admire! If you've never been to Vegas before, bring comfy shoes, because to see everything you will do a LOT of walking! Which works out well because with the buffets you will definitely gain a few pounds! Overall I would definitely recommend Aria if you can afford it (especially while it is still new and clean and smells nice!). If not, stay in a cheaper place, because you spend so little time in your room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing time in the Aria Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leela27
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights to celebrate a 30th birthday.. We had booked a King Size room with a City view, but when we checked in, we were told that there were no rooms available and would give is a Queen room instead and upgrade us by placing us on the 24th floor. We had an amazing view of the strip and very rarely closed our curtains so we could view the strip at all hours of the day / night! Luved the panel that was beside the bed that controlled the workings of the room, from turning off lights, closing curtains, changing the temp in the room, turning on or off the television etc, without even getting up off the bed! R room was spotless and everyday the room would be cleaned. One day we had privacy on, and they inturn left us a voice mesg on our phone that if we did want our room cleaned later that day that all we had to do was to press the house keeping button and they would be up. The bars in the Hotel were very modern and trendy and the cocktails were yum... Luved the 2 free hours that the Elvis Gold Bar gives on a Thursday, $10 for women to drink as much drink as you could within the 2 hours (9.30pm - 11.30pm) and $20 for men, considering most drinks were about $9 - $12 (vodka & coke). Enjoy the buffet breakfast and also enjoyed one of the breakfast at the Cafe near the Casino at 4.30am, yum, and only $13! The Casino was great, though later on in the morning, 4am, they ask you to move tables as they were closing down some, even when we were winning, the only small thing that annoyed me. Found all the staff very pleasant! The sports bar was very good (for the lads on our trip) as they enjoyed the football! For such a big Hotel, I found that when you were in your room that you couldn't hear next door, or anyone in the halls, it was brillant that it was so quite ! All in all would definitely return to the Aria Hotel when I next return to Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good second time around”
Reviews.Author: soleilk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept and thought it was pretty nice so we booked a vaca through Southwest Vacations to stay here again since it was one of the cheapest. The rooms are nice and very modern and hi tech, nice big shower and tub and central location on the strip. I was surprised when we checked in that there was a new daily $22 resort fee. it included access to the gym, WiFi, and 2 complimentary drinks. I wanted to use the gym when we stayed there before but it was $30 a day to get in since it was in the spa area, which I also thought was excessive. But, i didn't even end up using the gym this time. The WiFi sucked and I ended up using 3G on my iPhone anyway. And who needs free drink passes at a casino? They included free boarding pass printout at the concierge desk as a perk, but that was free last time. I can't complain about the staff since i hardly interacted with them. Checkin was fine. The line at the concierge was long. It took until 4:30pm for our room to be serviced. We ate at the breakfast buffet, which was great and pretty reasonable at $15. Everything from eggs benedict, made to order omelettes, sausages, congee and kimchi and pastires. We went before and learned that if you go around 10:30, you'll probably still be there when they change over for lunch :) Had a late lunch at Julian serrano and prices there was reasonable too. No ceviche on the lunch menu, but the gazpacho was best thing we ordered. The stuffed peppers were also very good. Tuna and raspberry bites weren't that great--overpowered by the raspberry. We also went to the happy hour at American Fish. $5 is a great deal, but the selections were so so. 2 Oysters and 2 pieces of yellowtail sashimi were not bad but pretty hard to mess up. Lobster corndogs and fish and chips pretty uninspired. The aioli and tartar sauces were the best parts. We didn't go to the clubs or eat anywhere else in CityCenter. We went on a bike trip in Red Rock Canyon through the LasVegas.com website (operated by Vacation Adventures)--Great time! Only about 20 minutes away from the strip. Beautiful scenery! There is a 13 mile paved one way loop. We biked about 11-12 miles of it. Even though we started a couple miles in, the first few miles are all uphill. It killed me, especially wilth the elevation. I only made it about a 1/2 mile before I got back into the van to ride up to the top. The rest was flat or downhill. We saw a couple wild burros too :) Some pluses and minuses, but probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Aria - very average”
Reviews.Author: McGlynp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in aria as a last minute option after being cancelled going to new York. Thought this would be a good opportunity to try the resort. Having done so I would have to say I was pretty underwhelmed by the experience. Firstly I would say that there isn't really anything wrong with aria and city center. But I can think of no compelling reason to return. The restaurant choices are good, the casino is a bit dark and not really inviting. The whole city center has an office building feel with prices of corporate art spread around. The rooms feel smaller than their size, probably because there is furniture in front of the full length windows. Oh and yes the windows are filthy. The room automation is clunky, unintuitive and slow compared to standard systems. It feels as though someone thought that this would be a wow factor, but it gets in the way and didn't work half the time we were there. Service was competent without ever being good. Oh and the crystals shops are a awful, someone seems to have installed some silly high end shops in an aircraft hanger. All in there is no reason to goto aria with so many more interesting resorts in Vegas. I would go back if i could get a really great deal as there is nothing about aria that is offensive, but that's hardly a ringing endorsement of a 10 billion $$ resort

Reviews.Title: “F A B U L O U S!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: slotqueenEastCoast
Reviews.Content: Words can not express how happy we were with our stay at the Aria. From the time we pulled up in a taxi and the gentleman opened our door, until the time we checked out we were 100% satisfied. The employees went out of their way to make sure we were happy. Our resort fees were waived! The front desk clerk gave us an upgrade without us even asking. We were on the 23rd floor, room 23110! Security was awesome. Even the slots were generous to us:)) The food was a little pricey so we ate most of our meals at surrounding locations. We did enjoy the breakfast buffet. You couldn't beat the price, $16.99. I am really surprised by the negative comments, but I guess everyone has an opinion! This will now be our new home when we visit Vegas. The Aria is a must see! You will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Aria: What a huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: darwinsden
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights and arrived with eager anticipation and very high expectations only to be sorely disappointed. Upon check in, they gave us two free drink vouchers, to presumably offset the aggravation of charging outrageous "resort fees." Everyone checking in was visibly and audibly annoyed. After making our way thru the casino, we tried to redeem the free drink vouchers by ordering two corona's from the bar, only to have the bartender try to bill us $15.00 after we had already given him our free drinks voucher. Strike one against the Aria. The room itself was new and attractively designed, though this was completely marred by the fact that upon closer inspection there was dust all over every surface in the room and the maid service had obviously not vaccumed as there were nail clippings next to the bed. That night after we came in from dinner, we noticed that housekeeping had thrown out everything that we had stored in the hotel fridge including $20.00 worth of pastries we had purchased from Jean Phillipe downstairs. I called downstairs to find out what had happened to our personal items in the fridge, only to met by an extremely rude front desk clerk, who was abrasive and anything but helpful. Had to call back and was waiting for 20 minutes to get through. The manager offered a half hearted apology and offered a $100 food credit for the inconvenience of having everything in our fridge discarded. We should have accepted the food credit, because we decided to cancel our prior dinner reservations and eat at Julian Serrano which was located inside the hotel. The food was extremely overpriced for the bland and disappointing food that we were served. The next day upon check out, we noticed that we had in fact not been credited $100 in food, even though the manager had in fact promised it would automatically be taken care of. We had to call downstairs to the front desk once again and had to have the charges waived. A new sleek trendy hotel with great promise, though we were met with horrible service at every part of our stay. What a huge disappointment. Aria: never again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at an enormous resort”
Reviews.Author: scollinson79
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal at $90. a night through the name your own price feature on Priceline. The Hotel is fresh, clean and enormous. My room was on the 19th floor. It was modern, tasteful and not one of the tacky "themed" hotels of Vegas. Up to date linens, towels and a good comfortable bed. All Vegas hotels have resort fees----get use to them people. Ate at Sage----their tasting menu is superb. Jean Phillipe is good----prefer Bouchon at the Venetian though. I expect that all Vegas hotels are somewhat impersonal given their size. While I enjoyed the Aria I'd love to stay at the Cosmopolitan the next time I hit Vegas. Comme Ca has an amazing Prix Fixe for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible exercise facility service”
Reviews.Author: jdlhi
Reviews.Content: Both my wife and I plugged in our ipod to the connection on the treadmill at the excercise room. Two separate machines and both fried our ipods. Could not turn on after use. Complained to the manager and Kathy Robison at Risk Mangement. Both said it's not their problem and it's never happened to them before. The person servicing the excercise room has terrible attitude. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Aria in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLuv2Eat
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas to see a show at Wynn - but decided to stay at the newest, hottest place - Aria. We were EXTREMELY disappointed! It was a pleasant February weekend - temps 72 and perfect for sitting around the pool. 1 small pool was open, no food and only 1 cocktail waitress. Waited nearly an hour for a drink - forget it! The next day - there were NO seats near the 1 small pool. Again, 1 waitress, limited drinks and no food. The "lifeguards" were police officers telling you that you couldn't get near the pool with your drink! Aren't we all adults? And don't most resorts have swim up bars?? That's only part of the disappointment. A lot of the restaurants and bars were closed and "seasonal". The service at the restaurants and bars was terrible! The last straw... our room was not serviced on the last day of our stay. We left our room at 9am and put the service light on. We returned at 4pm and our room had not been serviced, no clean towels, etc. I called housekeeping - they would come up right away. We left the room and returned at 6pm - our room still not serviced. Finally before 7pm we received clean towels. What am I paying for here? A fancy automatic curtain/drape??? Whatever! If you are looking to get what you pay for - don't stay at Aria!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “In the lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: janespigel08
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this resort. I have stayed here three times and August was the most recent. First off, the Aria is beautiful from the outside and inside. When you walk in, there is a lovely scent of vanilla and cinnamon. I look forward to that scent. The interior is decorated nicely, modern and lots of deep rich colors. One of our favorite slot machines was the Sex in the City, where I did win $94 dollars! The service is always great with many helpful people. The casino is kept impeccably clean and lots to keep your eyes busy. The rooms are very nice and the beds are amazing! My friends and I loved the pillows so much we're looking into purchasing them. By far the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The rooms lights, curtains, music, and television can all be controlled on one touch screen remote. If you're not too tech-savvy you may find this troublesome. The bathrooms are nicely maintained with an awesome shower and large tub. One problem we have had with the Aria is that the bathroom doors stick or a handle in the bathroom is loose. You can easily contact the front desk and they send someone over ASAP. The pools are great with plenty of great staff to find you a nice spot to lay out or stay in the shade. I definitely recommend everyone sign up for the Player's Club in the casino area. The last two times I have been were complimentary stays. In other words, free rooms. Their are tons of restaurants and buffets. I have not visited the buffets, but I went to the Spanish restaurant, Julian Serrano and it was deliciously amazing. The food is a bit expensive, but the food and service was great. We visited the Skybox, sports bar, during the World Cup and we great food with nice service. One warning...beware the spicy hamburger. Their was a warning included on the menu, but my friend decided to try and she paid the consequence. Though it made for a great story and memories. We had crepes at the Jean Philippe Patisserie, which were delicious! Overall, this is the first place I prefer to stay in when going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the decor and location”
Reviews.Author: isen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the corner suite on the 21st floor. One bedroom with living room area and 2 TV's. Perfect! The bathroom was huge - hot tub and showe; dual vanity sinks and to top it off with ceiling to floor windows. Spectacular views of the mountains and the surrounding areas. We had asked for extra pillows and blankets which came promptly to our door. We tried the Cafe Vettro which was just alright. What's worth mentioning is that the pizza our friend ordered was not worth $15 so don't order that. It was tiny! The other things we ordered turned out ok. Buffet (breakfast & dinner) was good though so we do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but...”
Reviews.Author: Pip1827
Reviews.Content: We went for 3 nights for gambling and fun and stayed in the sky suites...which are very depressing. The bathroom is the most cheerful to be be cause it's the only spot that doesn't have the dark brown walls. There is minimum dull lighting as well that makes it even more depressing. They have a bulky remote that controls the curtains lighting and tv...so dumb...and the beds...lol...let's just say if u enjoy being swallowed by a mushy gushy bed made of fluff then then u would love it. My fiancé and I were so uncomfortable with that awful bed and 75thousand pillows that were even worse then the bed. Lay your head on one and u will practically be sitting up! Oh and if your like me and don't use the Internet and work out on your trips then be aware that they charge you 60 bucks a day for that even if you don't want or use it. The carrot cake martini is awesome at deuce lounge the cafe spot is great and union too. Oh and the dealers are the friendliest staff there.

Reviews.Title: “I don't like Las Vegas but I loved the Aria and would go again!”
Reviews.Author: marydresser
Reviews.Content: I am a very anti-Vegas person. I've been there five times over 30 years, and was always underwhelmed by the tackiness of this town. That said, I would go again and again, just to stay at the Aria. There's no reason to ever leave this gorgeous resort. They have a low-key casino, which doesn't reek of cigarettes like every other casino. The room was beautiful, and had a gorgeous view, even from the 15th floor. We looked out over the mountains, and I would choose that very view again. Let's talk about the bed. That was the best bed I've ever slept in. In fact, I just ordered that bed from the Aria, along with sheets and pillows. I already have a European Sleepworks handmade all natural bed, and the Aria bed is better. The spa was my second favorite thing about the Aria. What an elegant and beautiful facility. I loved the three hot tubs inside, the eucalyptus steamroom and the heated stone beds. I would highly recommend this hotel and spa to anyone who needs a nice relaxing get away for a few days. I didn't gamble at all, and didn't miss it. I thought the restaurants were very over-rated, and too claustrophobic. I ended up getting room service instead, and the people in room service were incredibly friendly, helpful and fast. Also, the food was very good. I would love to visit when it's warm because this hotel has not one but three beautiful pools in a gorgeous setting. I was at this hotel for a convention, and the facilities were nice. My only problem with the Aria is that it is so large, that one has to walk long distances even to get to the elevator. There were times I actually had to rest my legs, as each trip from the room involved a total of miles of walking, and I'm not exaggerating. But hey, I'll take exercise anywhere I can get it. All in all, I loved the Aria and would recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...but not as great as I expected.”
Reviews.Author: steph21480
Reviews.Content: We travel to Las Vegas every year on my birthday (which happens to coincide with Valentine's Day). We usually stay at the Bellagio and love it, but last year we happened to walk into Aria and smell the nice vanilla scent (rather than smoke) and decided that we would try it on our next stay. Since it's my birthday, we go all out and try to have the most luxurious experience possible - we booked a suite and requested a high floor. My husband used the limo service to pick us up from the airport and worked with the concierge to arrange for flowers, chocolate-covered strawberries and my favorite Willamette Valley wine. However, when we arrived, we were faced with a very long line. This wasn't a huge deal, but it was the first part of the experience that didn't feel "first class." When we were finally ready to check in (about 25 minutes later) they informed me that we would be on the 5th floor. I politely asked if we could possibly get a high floor as I had requested and the clerk paused and asked if we were celebrating any special occasion. My husband said we were, that it was my birthday. He walked away for roughly 10 minutes and came back to inform us that there were no other rooms and that this was the only one. He recommended we call back the next day as it would be a Sunday and request a higher floor then. We thanked him- not the end of the world - and went up to our 5th floor corner suite. While the room was very modern and nice - the loveseat at the end of the bed was dingy and covered in cigarette burns! Despite the gorgeous bathroom, sitting area, comfortable bed, etc, it was hard not to stop staring at those cigarette burns! When you stay at a five-star hotel, in one of their suites, you do not expect to see that! It really spoiled the luxe feeling that the room had otherwise. At this point, I was even more ready to move rooms, so first thing the next morning, we called and requested to move to a higher floor. We were again told they could not accommodate us. We were disappointed by this, but it wasn't a total deal breaker. The room service was excellent, the main areas of the hotel are gorgeous and best of all, no smoke smell in the casino, even though there is smoking! I'm not sure how they do it, but it's great. Had we not stayed in this particular room and been refused to move, my review would have been five stars instead of four.

Reviews.Title: “A Spa-like Retreat in the Heart of the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: ZenMama74
Reviews.Content: I suprised my husband with a trip to Vegas for his 40th birthday. We had several friends join us for the vacation. A colleague had recommended staying in "City Center" so I looked into the relevant hotels and found good reviews and rates for Aria. The hotel was great. Everything was very earthy and serene, even in the casino, which was a pleasant surprise being in Vegas. There were peaceful water fountains everywhere and a scent of vanilla was present throughout the hotel, which made me feel I was at a spa. The food was good, the service was good and my room had an incredible view of the mountains and city (not the strip, though, which was ok). The rooms have an iPad-like controller that controls everything -- the TV, music, lighting, curtains... It was very cool. The bathroom was gorgeous with granite countertops, marble tile in the shower and a full sized tub. The exercise room was giant and had everything you would need. I didn't use the pool because it was cold. The spa pricing was a bit high so we opted out of the spa experience but the brochure looked very inviting. I think my favorite thing about the hotel was the overall ambiance it created --- a spa-like retreat in the heart of the Vegas strip --- and the rooms. The least favorite aspects were the expense for food (hard to get breakfast for under $15, including coffee) and the high spa pricing. However, that would not prevent me from staying there again and recommending it to my friends. Overall we had an incredible time and hope to repeat the trip in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: FutureMrsMartel
Reviews.Content: I visit Las Vegas a couple of times per year, and prefer to stay at Bellagio for its combo of quality and location – but gave Aria a try this time thanks to an Expedia deal. Here are some of my thoughts: Location: Decent – 10-15min walk to Cosmo, PH, Bellagio, and 15min the other way to NYNY, MGM, etc Casino: Decent – seemed a good mix of ppl, and a good overall vibe (we stayed over weekend). I’m a slots player and there was an ok amount. My one beef with the slots at Aria, is that almost all of the penny slots only had 40 credit or 80 credit options (or higher) – so your 1 cent slot machine actually costs you 40-80 cents + per play – that felt a bit like a scam, they had literally removed the other buttons from being options! This is the case at other hotels as well for sure, but not to this extent! The drink girls circulated well, never waited long for a drink. Tho their hands were open for a tip before they even put down your drink, and barely any thank you’s when being tipped (in contrast to the Cosmo drink girls who seemed genuinely thankful everytime I tipped) Room: Arrived to a reasonably clean room – which I was nervous about given the TA reviews..one negative upon arrival, the Fiji water for sale was half drank! Gross! We never called down to front desk, so chances are we’re also going to get charged for that water!! I am a tech savvy person, programming phones and other devices for friends/family all the time – but I found the technology in this room needlessly complicated. It’s fine if you want to setup your home this way, and you have the time to learn the system, but for a hotel room, I at least, want everything to be very simple and straightforward – which this room didn’t always provide. We eventually stopped using the main panel on the nightstand for anything, and just used the actual switches themselves, worked just fine  The best part about the room for our needs, as we were a group of three girls traveling together, is that we all fit in the bathroom at the same time to get ready! This was super handy, and is not always possible in a hotel bathroom, so really allowed us all to get ready efficiently. Staff: Front desk girl was fantastic, really helpful, explained everything with the technology, room key, sensored mini bar, etc (which I already knew from reading these forums, but still helpful). Other than that didn’t encounter any other staff members, but front desk girl was so friendly I had to call it out. Price: Would not pay full price for this hotel, given so many other quality options nearby, but if you can snag a deal, it’s worth checking out, once Other: The vanilla smell did bother me somewhat (especially when hungover), I am a bit smell sensitive.. Overall, this was a nice enough place to stay, but upon next trip to Vegas, will either return to Bellagio, or try Cosmo.

Reviews.Title: “A very big, new bold-looking hotel”
Reviews.Author: dont-Winnipeg
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Las Vegas. This hotel was recommended to us by our son who's been there several times. I think that the Aria is the newest hotel. It wasn't made cheaply! It was so big that it was overwhelmimg. I've mentionned to others that you could stay in the hotel and visit the very expensive shops for a week and never come out for fresh air. It was new and clean and big, but it lacked the atmosphere that existed in some of the other hotels that we visited, like Ceasar's Palace, which might be even bigger! We discovered the buffet quite by accident on the second floor. The food was okay ( lots of choices) and relatively cheap ($15) compared to the other meals of the day. The Elvis show looked interesting but we weren't there long enough to see it (only two nights). The prices for the shows are EXPENSIVE. Look for deals at the ticket booths on the street. Obviously, everyone else did because there were daily lineups for tickets. Electronic gamiung machines were everywhere. If you play, expect to lose it all eventually. I didn't see a winner anywhere. If you haven't been to the strip, you have to go, even if it's just to see it. The world is represented in its architecture (all scaled down representation) and in its visitors. The Aria is centrally located to visit a lot of different hotels. However, don't expect to walk the entire strip in 30 minutes like we thought we could. The entire trip (Mandalay Bay to Stratosphere) would take you the day. Use the mono-rails and busses if you plan on seeing it all. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Vegas by far!!”
Reviews.Author: HeatSeekerAlberta
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Vegas with my spouse and we had an amazing time! First off for people complaining about walking great distances, welcome to the strip, you cannot avoid this at any hotel on the strip. If you want close proximity, stay downtown in the "old school" part of vegas. My spouse and I travel usually 2-3 times per year, and I am a very picky person. If I am staying at a 5 star I expect a 5 star experience, after reading the reviews I was prepared to have some complaints and/or issues. Overall I was very impressed! Previous visits to Vegas was at the Luxor, Bellagio, and now Aria, and hands down Aria was the best by far! Check in/Check out was fast and efficient. Room was beautiful, spacious, clean, and comfortable. Got 23 floor and view was amazing. Our three nights there, not a sound was heard outside of the room, it was pure bliss! Technical gadget was neat, but took forever to change channels. Could imput a service notice on the wall outside door to say request service, and by early afternoon our room was not done, no big deal, just replaced with privacy sign so we could have a afternoon nap, and housekeeping choose that time to ignore the privact sign and try getting into the room, thank goodness for deadbolts, but that was the biggest negative we ran into, after nap, and an evening of entertainment our room was always done for bedtime. From the players club, to the attendants running the floor, room service, servers...service was amazing, super friendly, talkative, informative. Definetly 5 star customer service. We ate at the Buffet, as well as room service, other than that we ate on our excursions. There was a Mcdonalds/Subway/Pizza in the mall connecting Aria and Monte Carlo hotel so we would grab a quick bite there so we wouldn't interupt our fun time. Bonus they had a harley store on the way! IF you don't like crowds (in Vegas...yeah right) go during the week. We stayed a wed-sat, and come friday it was a packed house, but the service was still top notch! As for resort service fee, most hotels have one, so we knew what to expect. We got a good deal and it was worth every penny....if I had to pay full price i would have expected more bells and whistles. Casino, we didn't do too bad, got some big pay outs on the penny machines and had ALOT of fun doing it. Probably the best pay out of all three previous trips. Going back in April and hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: JgolfT
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty picky first off. I suppose with all the cuts back, "normal" service was lacking but, when my room wasn't cleaned after the first night and incorrect information given to me at the front desk regarding show tickets... I was immediately turned off. I hope it was an isolated incident. Other than that, the hotel was HUGE. Room was nice and thought was bigger than average. One touch controls were neat....sort of a pain in the butt but, still cool. Smell of the hotel (vanillia I think) was a little annoying. Location was good....pretty much right in the middle of the pack of hotels. The free tram was useful. Other then that.... if you get a good deal on the hotel I would recommend it... if it's full pop I wouldn't.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Valentine's Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MarinaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel - and yes I did have to wipe off osme toothpaste myself from the wood panel in the bathroom - yuk. It shouldn't happen, but I guess the cleaner missed it. Also bathroom glasses not cleaned each day. So aside from the small bathroom cleanliness issues the rooms are fantastic. The bed is to die for...SO COMFY...and the sheets - we loved them so much that we bought some fromt he gift store. WOW! We didn't win much at this Casino compared to the others. But we loved Aria...it has a great vibe and central location...Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: SLCH
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel from priceline for 75 dollars / night. Initially thought it was a score but was concerned after reading TA reviews. I thought I would try it anyways but was horribly disappointed and appalled. Upon checkin, we were hit with a 22 dollar resort fee per night, thus making my 75 dollars seems less of a deal. The hotel itself is modern with dark brown as the main color. Walked into my NON SMOKING room and immediately got a faint whiff of smoking smell. Walked into the bathroom, although gorgeous, immediately smelled of uncleaned urine on the floor. Walked to the closet and found someone left their T shirt in the closet. Went to the bed and noticed makeup stains still on one of the pillows. Seriously, by this time, I was about to hurl. Called housekeeping and asked them to clean the room again - housekeeping was nice but the urine smell continued through my entire stay. I wore shoes to go to the bathroom b/c I didn't want to walk barefoot around the toilet. Five star hotel this is DEFINITELY NOT! I should have just dish out 149 to stay at the Venetian. I will never come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, contemporary new hotel”
Reviews.Author: lainie78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria for 4 nights. Room is clean, modern, nicely designed. Upon entering, the room "turns" on (lights, curtains, music/television). The room is controlled by a central control console. Our view was of the strip, so it was quite amazing to see all the lights when the curtains parted. Overall...a good stay. Hotel resort/casino is huge. There is a lot of walking to get from reception to guest elevators to self-park lot to restaurants. Be prepared to walk a lot. :)

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad but we only slept there”
Reviews.Author: RichandVic
Reviews.Content: It was ok, beautiful and very modern if you like that sort of thing. We did very little in the evenings or by day here, we just slept here. The rooms were great and comfotable tho. We were always out. It is super expensive to eat there too. On Sunday we went out to watch football at Ceasars and had breakfast there it was amazing. We wished we had stayed there instead. If you get a great deal, I would stay here but the location is very awkward and know you will be doing a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch advertising tactics”
Reviews.Author: snwarf01
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay one night of our 5 night trip to see whether we would like Aria. Other than Mandalay Bay, we've never stayed at an MGM property. While the room itself was nice, we were very upset at check-in when they did not honor the $50 resort credit that was advertised on their website when we booked. We were staying over the Chinese New Year and had decided at the last minute to stay at Aria. When I first checked online, the resort credit was not offered for our date. However, a couple of days later it was unblocked so I figured that they needed to fill rooms. This is what made me choose Aria over the Venetian for that night. Needless to say, at check-in we were told they were not honoring the $50 credit and that it was blocked for that day - despite the fact it was not blocked at the time of booking and the website allowed me to reserve the special. No attempt was made to resolve the issue, nor did the manager come out to speak with us. This left us with a sour taste about the hotel so we did not gamble, eat, or spend any money at Aria, nor would we return due to their unfriendly attitude and their bait and switch advertising tactics. Had that NOT occurred, my review would have said that the room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. It is a very cold, sterile hotel and feels much more like a generic convention hotel than a Vegas hotel. I'm glad others had good experiences there, but my husband and I will be stayind anywhere but Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Great Super Bowl weekend”
Reviews.Author: mike0steff
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by how well appointed and beautiful Aria actually was. It is definately one of the nicest hotels on the strip. Check-in was somewhat slow but was a breeze once I fianlly got to the receptionist. Like most casinos you have to walk past all the gaming to get to the elvators, food, shopping, etc. - no surpise there. The room was great: decent size and electronics (integrated lights, drapes, music, etc.) was great. My room was very quiet and the bed was tremendous. Room service was too long and the food was only adequate. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was there to see watch the Super Bowl (huge Steeler fan that refused to go to Dallas...) and found space to be limited. Aria's casino and sport betting is smaller than most casinos so it is a challenge during big sporting events (i.e. Super Bowl, Final Four, etc.) This, however, would only make me pause about returning during those specific events. Overall, Aria is a terrific hotel that I will definately visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Amazing beds. Slow service.”
Reviews.Author: SMASHLYBLAZE
Reviews.Content: Traveled here with my spouse for 3 nights. Arrived at 11am to a LONG check in line. Moved pretty well, took about 20 minutes to get to the counter. Our room was ready and we were upgraded to a suite on the 4th floor. View was awesome ( Mountain view) Strip view or a higher dloor would have been better. Room was clean and beautiful. Floor to ceiling windows wrapped the suite. Living area with a huge bathroom, double sinks and deep soaker tub. As well a small powder room with a toilet. The bed was AMAZING. If you don't like ultra soft beds DO NOT stay here. The beds are heaven and I slept like a baby for 3 wonderful nights. Alright here are a few cons to this hotel. -Room service was slow and expensive. 20$ with tip for a pot of coffee and took 20-30 minutes to deliver each time. -The rooms are soundproof EXCEPT a silly vent that was connected from our bedroom to the room next door's bedroom. We were awoken at 7am to very drunk men just coming home. Also, during the day you could hear simple TV through this vent. -Beautiful views but the windows were quite dirty. -The Location is top notch BUT its a little annoying to get right to the strip from the hotel regardless how close it looks. You end up having to walk through the City Center or all the way around the building which can be time consuming. So leave time if necessary. We did not try any of the Dining options here as they were quite expensive. Sat by the pool one day and entered the hot tub. Pools are nothing fancy in terms of Las Vegas pools. One was heated and open but still a little chilly to enter. Room was cleaned each day by the time we returned from lunch midafternoon. Overall a great new hotel. Just be prepared to wait it a long check in line as I noticed there was always a line no matter what day of the week. We would defiantly return if the price was right,

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendingostravel
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay in Vegas. All modern and new. We stayed a couple of days in the sister hotel Vdara which we think is even nicer. Only downside - you are not able to make a coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “AN EMPLOYEE STOLE MY CAMERA”
Reviews.Author: xtrk8u
Reviews.Content: I received a special offer for comp nights at this newest MGM resort. I've been an MGM member for 10 years, so I thought I'd take advantage of a free offer. NEVER AGAIN! Prior to checking out of my room after 4 days in Vegas, I placed my camera bag into a white plastic shopping bag with souvenirs and gifts. I tied the bag shut. The bellman picked up our luggage from the room. I watched him put the white plastic bag on the cart with my luggage, and saw my camera for the last time. The valet took control of the luggage and personal items from the bellman and placed the luggage and personal items into my truck. Upon arrival at home, I unloaded the luggage. I saw that the white shopping bag had been untied. I couldn't find the camera. I searched my truck, but there was no camera to be found. Hmmmmmmm... how did the bag become untied, and where is the camera?? I made several calls to my casino host, a pit boss who's card I had from a prior incident in the hotel, I made a telephone report with the security department, I called the housekeeping department and lost & found. No one seemed to care. I was told cameras are lost all the time. Mine was not lost, it was stolen. My casino host would not make the effort to compensate for the loss, even after I told him I would take my gambling business away from MGM after 10 years of dedicated play. In my opinion, either the bellman or the valet stole my camera. On a side note... I'm an EMT. During this stay, I witnessed a medical emergency on the casino floor while walking to brunch on 7/4/10. A person was laying on the floor, unconscious, in a position of distress. The security staff was not rendering care, they were keeping people back & talking on radios. I identified myself as a NREMT and asked a security person if I could help this person. I was told Yes, so I began administering care. After my assessment, I began treatment. While this person was legally under my direct medical care, a female security person from the ARIA casino told me "sir, please step away from this person now". I looked up and asked her if she was an EMT. She said "No". I asked her if she was a Paramedic. She said "No". I explained that my national protocols state that unless she was a higher level of care than me, by law, I can not abandon care of this person until someone of a higher level of care assumes the patient care I've already started. The female security person told me "sir, I'm asking you for the last time to please step away from this person, or I'll arrest you for trespassing". All this was happening while I continued to administer care. Just as I stood up to confront this woman face to face to again explain federal law, thankfully, Clark County Medics arrived on scene. I gave a professional turn over to the medics who praised my efforts. Afterward, a casino pit boss named Jack Konhorst approached me. Shook my hand & said I did the right thing. We talked & Jack agreed, The security person was wrong asking me to stop giving care. I told Jack the resort needs to have people trained to handle medical emergencies. At minimum, first responders who are trained in CPR and basic first aid. Call 911 if you need medical help. I wouldn't depend on the MGM staff to help me or my family if we had a medical emergency during our stay at any of their resorts. After reading the above... Would you? Buh Bye MGM. You've lost my business, my trust, and any future referrals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: freadcat
Reviews.Content: What a huge place! Loved the staff. Loved the feel of it. Everything is controlled by your remote in your hotel room, very high tec. If you are not a TECH don't stay here, you will be soooooo frustrated! The entire town (including Aria) was celebrating Chinese New Year. What a great event. There was even a Dragon show outside the hotel. (this I could have done without since we were trying to make my birthday dinner reservation at the Wynn, then La Reve after). Location is great, on the strip near lots of shopping and eating. Gambling was good too. I'm a slots person, since I don't really do the gambling thing too much. Won some lost some. Celebrated my 30th birthday here. Reminded them it was a birthday event during check in and was upgraded! They also sent Chocolate covered strawberries and cookies with a nice Birthday card to our room. Nice touch! TRICK for non-smokers- ask for a dehumidifier for your room, will help a lot. Thank you Aria for a very nice long birthday weekend. Make sure you get a room with a bathtub. So worth a soak every morning. It can fit two also. Off topic- Make sure you hit Freemont Street for some OLD Vegas fun. (my Travel Agent advised this- she is excellent! Thanks Beth Sparling from Honeymoons and Beyond. http://www.honeymoonsandbeyond.com/ )

Reviews.Title: “ARIA "ROCKS"”
Reviews.Author: Nettie015
Reviews.Content: This hotel is "POSH POSH" all the way from the bottom to the top! Aria is the only hotel that I know of, when you walk into the place it smells like a spa! Not cigarettes! Every staff member was pleasant, and very helpful. We were there over Super Bowl weekend which was also Chinese New Years, and they had alot going on. FUN..FUN..FUN.. We are definitely returning to ARIA. Thank you for making our stay the best we have every expierenced! P.S. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud!

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: cmonka13
Reviews.Content: A little late, sorry! We went to Aria for our anniversary and were not disappointed! The Hotel is first class, and the bedding is to die for! They bumped us up to a suite and it was amazing! The casino is great, restaurants fab and the smell of vanilla is everywhere! We walked everywhere and it was not a problem after eating exceptional meals every evening. Will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: aussied0c
Reviews.Content: Aria hotel delivers style and sophistication with excellent customer service. Excellent location. My jaw literally hit the floor when I first entered my room and the drapes automatically opened revealing an amazing view of the strip. Beds are the most comfortable I have experienced. Room service is amazingly quick, well priced and tasty. As a large hotel occasionally it is difficult getting through by telephone to the front desk or housekeeping but this is a minor quibble. I would unhesitatingly recommend Aria to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - impressed on many levels.”
Reviews.Author: mmtrip
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th trip to Vegas in the last year. The last three times I have stayed at Aria. This time my sister and companion met me there from the midwest. Everyone was impressed with the hotel. I would agree that on my initial visits there were a few "opening kinks" that needed to be worked out, but they have certainly taken care of those issues and everyone was very well-trained and friendly on this visit. Valet parking was easy, check-in was seamless, bags were delivered within 10 minutes for both parties. Rooms were clean and kept clean by housekeeping daily. Check-out was just as simple and everything in between was relaxing and easy. Don't let older reviews scare you off. This is a very, very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ozziegirl007
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to vegas. We arrived at the hotel around 8pm and I have to say that this was the longest checkin process I have ever encountered. However we were a party of four staying in 2 separate rooms and we were trying to be accomodated on the same floor. We had booked corner suites and although impressive with floor to ceiling windows and touch button curtain control we found the rooms to have less of a WOW factor than Bellagio suites where we had stayed in October. The hotel itself was amazing though and overall we had a very pleasurable stay.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic experience !!!!”
Reviews.Author: foreverfree
Reviews.Content: The whole trip was excellent- - from the time we entered the hotel. Wow !! I cannot find a negative thing to say about this hotel.The remote control drapes were the first thing we experienced and from there it just got continually a fine memory. The beds were to die for !! Oh- - the bathroom- - finest shower ever, and wonderful soaker tub !!!!! Even the free bthrm items were of the highest quality, which you could purchase same in larger containers.. The staff were extremely helpful, pleasant, obliging. Security was very much on their toes, too, I noticed. The slots were very enticing- - so comfortable no matter where we went. Yes, I LOVE this place !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas chic”
Reviews.Author: OzPhoenix
Reviews.Content: This gleaming crystal tower's understatement helps it standout. Rooms are beautifully appointed. Gym has everything - latest spin bikes, weights, etc - only wish it was a little warmer that would have made taking a plunge in the very enticing pool an option. Food and beverage venues lack personality and all meld into one another - better to opt for Todd English Pub or Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina in the Crystals shopping centre next door, both of which are great. Only watchout is the rooms on the backside facing the Interstate 15 can be a little noisy at night, even on the higher floors (we were on 29).

Reviews.Title: “MY NEW FAVORITE HOTEL ON THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: drewomite
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights at the Aria and loved it. The check in receptionist was professional and very friendly. Same with Concierge staff. Loved the room and the IPad like device next to the bed that allows you to control everything in the room. I set the alarm to wake, open curtains and turn on my stock show and it all happened on time like magic. I dined at Jean Georges, Julian Serrano and the Buffet. All were excellent. I really liked the fact that this property is not jammed packed with tourists and over crowded. Just a good vibe. Easy to grab a cab by going to the back entrance. I will stay at the Aria my next trip to Las Vegas and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms. Rude Staff.”
Reviews.Author: travelingwawa
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. I was looking forward to my stay at this hotel because of the technology and the stylish decor. The first room we checked into had oily fingerprints on the 2 nightstands, mirrors, cabinets, and door. There was what appeared to be splattered toothpaste on the bathroom walls. We opened the bed and there were many small hairs. There was crusty white substance on the bed scarf (you decide what it is). We were moved to a second room one floor up with a view of the strip. The second room had 2 obvious drops of dried urine in plain sight on the toilet seat, hairs on the bed and pillows, oily fingerprints all over the furniture, and small hairs in the restroom. At this point, it was becoming sort of a joke. We were moved to a third room. The third room had urine around the toilet seat hinge, hairs, eyeliner shavings, and lint in all the corners of the bathroom floor and under the sink vanity (obviously not swept and mopped), hair in the shower, oily prints on the walls and furniture, and the bed had small hairs in it. At this point the housekeeping supervisor had to come in to verify these things, which all were verified by him with his own eyes. He said a manager would call us. We waited 15 minutes and no call, so we called down because we were tired and wanted to just get the heck out of there. The front desk wasn't too helpful and said that they would have to charge the first night even though we had not stayed for more than 5-10 minutes per (dirty) room. Wow, what lack of common sense to do that to a guest. We needed to speak to the manager if we wanted to leave without a charge. We spoke with the manager and she said she personally went up and found the rooms to be up to standard. I showed her all the pictures I snapped as evidence and she then realized that housekeeping had touched up the rooms by the time she went to check them. No sincere apology, but instead she was confident that they had a great product and was sorry we did not get a chance to see that. Major lack of cleanliness, attention to detail, sincere customer care, and efficiency and effectiveness of communication. If you don't mind a few hairs on your sheets and pillows, unmopped bathroom floors, fingerprints on the furniture, crusty white stuff on the bed scarf, toothpaste splattered on the bathroom walls, and urine on your toilet then this hotel is for you. It's a good looking property, but that's all that it is. If anybody wants pictures of what I saw, you can contact me.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with prompt service, BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: boyblue4502
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to leave the miserable weather in NYC for a spur of the moment trip. We got a great deal for a little 4 night last minute getaway and since I heard about the Aria was game. First I want to start with the good. The hotel itself is beautiful. It is very sleek and modern. They were also preparing for the Chinese New Year so there were Rabbits and red all around us. The check in process itself was very quick. The only caveat was that they were out of single beds on non-smoking areas and had to opt for 2 queen sized beds if we wanted a non-smoking room. (It forced my wife and I to sleep closer together, so not necessarily a bad thing) I read some other reviews that the casino pumped some sort of vanilla fragrance in the casino to mask the cigarette smell. As a former smoker, cigarette smoke does not bother me (it does my wife however) but I didn't find the scent they used overpowering or bothersome. Personally, I like the smell they used. Going to the rooms, what I liked was that there was a security guard at the elevators that would not let you access them unless you had a key card. I like the idea of limiting access to guest elevators to actual guests. (I assume it is to keep out thieves and prostitutes) The rooms are well appointed and modern. The issue I can see with some people that are not tech savvy is that everything is electronically controlled by a touch pad, from the TV to the curtains to the lights. I didn't find it an issue and thought it was pretty cool. We had a huge window and saw the Palms and other casinos from our hotel and our beds were very comfortable. There is a nice large flat screen TV in HD, not that we spent much time in the rooms, but it was pretty cool never the less. When we got there, we noticed they only had one bathrobe. I called and within 5 minutes house keeping were up with more bathrobes. An issue I also noticed was that the tub drain was not stopping the water properly. I called and noticed it was fixed later on. I was on the 22 floor and it was extremely quiet. I didn't hear any noise at all from other guests or the casino. Now maybe the lower floors had issues, I can't speak for them. But from the 22 floor at night, I could hear a pin drop. The Bad - The only major issue I had with this hotel is that the food is ridiculously priced. At their low end Cafe Vettro, it was $13 for eggs and an additional $6 for bacon...... really? Their fine dining establishments were expensive as I would expect that they would be, but the casual dining experience was EXTREMELY expensive. My wife and I ate elsewhere, but it was silly how much they were charging. Another issue, was when I closed my sheer curtains, it made a loud grinding noise. I called housekeeping to address the issue but they never did. Another issue I could see with some people is that it is set back a little from the strip. Some people may be picky and want to be ON the strip. You do have access to a tram and to walk onto the strip is about a 3 minute walk. To me, this wasn't an issue at all, but for people that might be picky about their location, it could be. Just bear that in mind. This hotel is definitely geared toward higher end clientele, being next door to a high end mall (Louis Vuitton, Fendi, etc). I would honestly stay here again, but again, my only issue is how they hit you over the head with high prices for food. Other than that, it was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “By far my favorite hotel in Las Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: briguy73
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a third party site and got an amazing deal. I have watched City Center being built from the ground up and was always wondering how the entire complex would turn out. Well - it is simply AMAZING! Aria is by far one of the highest class, cleanest, and best service Hotel and Casino's I've ever been in. And, to top it off, it is a LEED Gold building, which scores big points with me (I work in the building industry, so I'm a building/architecture geek). Aria just does everything right from the moment you walk in (what is that scent? Vanilla? Awesome!!) to the masculine and tasteful decor throughout the lobby/casino. We got a room on the 8th floor, which wasn't my hope, but I still couldn't complain at all. The room was everything and more than what I had hoped for. I was expecting it to be nice, but I was totally blown away! I do have to say that my only complaint is that the separate little room for the toilet was enclosed in a frosted glass. While this is nice for a little privacy, it doesn't really provide the privacy of a solid door. If I was with someone other than my wife, I really wouldn't have liked this. My wife said that this would not work if she was there with girlfriends all trying to get ready in the bathroom. The other complaint was about the bathroom as well. While in the shower, good luck trying to have a conversation with someone else. The marble walls and floor provide a lot of surfaces for sound to bounce off of. When I talked in the shower, the echo was unbearable. As for sleep comfort? My wife has major insomnia and I was dreading having her toss and turn all night. This was completely not the case here. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in. It was soft, yet firm. I didn't really feel my wife moving around (which was either because the quality of mattress or because she was sleeping so soundly!). You get the point on the room. This hotel rocks. I even decided to use the fitness center in the mornings. I belong to a very nice health club back home and have to say that this fitness center rivaled mine at home. It had plenty of cardio equipment as well as machine weights and free weights. We also checked out the pools. It seemed very nice. It was in the middle of January, so there wasn't anybody swimming, but we had good enough weather to lay out on a chair for a little bit to soak in the rays. Looking at the pool made me wish it was summer. I probably wouldn't have gone anywhere else but the pools! Well - I could go on and on about this place and do nothing but ooze compliments at it, so I'm going to stop here and just tell you to go for it and try it out! You WILL NOT be disappointed!!! I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: mattandtash
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to be able to travel to a few states in the US for a month in Oct and Vegas is a stand out for my husband and I. As we travelled with friends & their 5 year old daughter, we were able to do alot more than just go to casinos and gamble. We got to see Vegas through a childs eyes as well. Starting with Aria from the moment we stepped into this hotel i knew we wouldnt want to leave. The architecture, restaurants,shows,shopping, pools, day spa,rooms were everything you could want and more. You have to see Elvis Cirque Du Soleil it was amazing. When we are able to come back again to Vegas Aria is where we will be staying. Our room was immaculate and the beds and pillows were dreamy i just melted into them after our long days and nights out. The Hotel is presented beautifully. We even had what we call "the incident" where security was called and we were even impressed with this. The 5yo was having daddy daughter day and left her rashvest in the toilets by the pool as she was tired and in the shower her dad said he would run down just quickly and grab the rashvest, she was more than happy with this agreement. Daddy was gone for 5 mins and in this time 5yo had decided she wasnt getting left behind & being the cheeky monkey she is decided to wander the hallway where a cleaner found her crying and called security . Daddy came back to find a security guard with his daughter standing there hands on her hips smile on her face. Daddy got the 3rd degree about leaving children unoccupied in a casino. We all thought it was hilarious when we heard about his day. But as i said we were impressed with the security in this situation. The only negatives we experienced we found the restaurants over priced. Which didnt really bother us because we just went to other hotels. But when we did eat in the hotel the food was good. Also 1 nite we were having a snack near the casino tables and a young guy was absolutely smashed (drunk) I know he was having a good time but he was constantly yelling whilst he was in the hotel, for a classy establishment i thought it was tacky. As we know the security in Aria was great we thought this guy would of been approached by security to tone down or no longer be served alcohol but this didnt happen. We also found check in very slow. None of this however turned us off as we loved everything else about Aria. Our highlights are a helicopter over the Grand Canyon, Elvis show at Aria and we saw a basketball game. LA Lakers and Sacremento KIngs. Ask at the hotel about the treasure island show, bellagio water fountain show and there are lots of other things to entertain the kids as you walk down the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Aria is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: sammybee00
Reviews.Content: Although you won't hear that from many locals.. Anyway, I have a condo in Las Vegas, I always take my free room comps where ever I can so I can drink and still crash on the strip without having to drive.. and recently I had the pleasure of staying here, I absolutely love technology and modern rooms.. When I realized I could operate the room temperature, the curtains, the lights and get the weather with a click of the TV remote, I was in awe.. Every restaurant is clean and food is great and you get what you pay for..... This is not a cheapo budget hotel so I hope one would know that just looking at some pictures of this place... It can take awhile to get a drink on the casino floor..except during the week when it is slower, that is not a problem. The pool is beautiful and open year round, unlike most pools in Vegas...Location wise it is right beside the brand new cosmopolitan hotel, and connected to new York new York, which is connected to Luxor, Mandalay bay, Excalibur & mgm... I just like the atmosphere in Aria, high ceilings, the place always smells amazing, (no smoke smell) , the architecture and artwork in every detail of this place is really great... Out of Caesar’s, Paris, Rio, Harrah’s, Flamingo, Bally's, Orleans & palms.. I would say this is my favourite I have not been to the spa here... or any of the night clubs, so I can’t comment on those yet

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: CarolDenverCO
Reviews.Content: We take 4 - 6 nice vacations each year. I am an avid user of Trip Advisor, but it is frustrating when I read negative reviews when we get there, the places are fabulous. Apparently, some people are never happy. We go to Vegas about twice a year, and usually stay at the Venetian (which is a bit grander and the rooms are all suites). We tried the Aria this time as the room was comped. The bed is heavenly, towels are wonderful, and the remote control for the TV and drapes is NOT hard to figure out. If you like a firm mattress, these are soft pillow tops. Check in was a very pleasant experience; our room was ready when we arrived at noon on Saturday, and we only waited in line about 10 minutes. We asked for a strip view, and Jennifer gave us a room with a spectacular view. One reviewer couldn't find the safe; we were told where to find it at check-in. Check out was also very convenient. We are non-smokers, and the casino seemed smoke free. Our clothes never smelled of smoke which was great. The cocktail service at the casino was also one of the best in Vegas. We tried the buffet, and it was also the best we have had in Vegas in terms of service, taste and cleanliness. All the staff at the Aria were very friendly. Here's a tip. You can walk inside from the Aria to the Monte Carlo. Along the way there is a nice food court including a McDonalds. We wen't there for breakfast and had Egg McMuffins - saved a lot of money! Another thing that I'm baffled about - those that said it's a long walk to the strip -walking is good for you, and it's not that far. There is also a free tram to the Bellagio from the Aria. Forget the negative reviews and just go there!

Reviews.Title: “Our New Vegas Favourite”
Reviews.Author: West_Coast_YVR
