Reviews.Content: We booked in for two nights on a casino special ($79 per night, incl. free play and buffet). We got a great comp upgrade at check-in to a panoramic suite (950 sq ft) and literally we felt like we were in heaven. Room was amazing with windows stretching from bathroom to bedroom to living area. Resort fee is a tad high ($20 per day) but included internet and a voucher for two free drinks in any bar. IN all, we had a great time - didn't win but we didn't lose either. So for Vegas, I'd say that's pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “Everything a Vegas hotel should be, but no atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: G-zer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with fab rooms, great views, good location but lacking in personality. Trying to be a modern Belagio but casino & bars are empty & souless. The food & the facilities were excellent, & during our stay were were upgraded to an amazing room with fab views of the strip. Don't get me wrong, the rooms were fab, the huge sunken bath was to die for & the gigantic bed was very comfy, but the staff were like ghosts & thr hotel somewhat lacked the Vegas charm.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - Will Stay Again.”
Reviews.Author: Mavesv
Reviews.Content: We are in our 40s and were lucky to have a weekend away from the kids. From the initial valet to check out the staff was amazingly polite and very helpful and the hotel was clean and beautiful. (we were so pleased with the hustle of the valets.. never waited for our car.. ever - can't say that about the Palazzo). We had a corner suite on 14th floor - it was huge, modern, beautiful, clean, comfy and we loved the electronics of the room. We used the "goodnight" button to close curtains, turn off lights and set the music to play for 30 mins. more.. very cool. We enjoyed the weekday breakfast buffet and found the food to be very fresh with many healthy choices, salads etc. - we loved the spanish tapas restaurant and Tood English Pub... even with all of that you must must have breakfast at the cosmopolitian... the buffet is unreal)... The Casino was nice...great drinks and very nice champaigne provided at the tables. The walking never phased us..we were pleased with the location .... everthing in Vegas is a walk.. enjoy it.. its the trip not the destination. Our room rate came with two day spa passes - next time, even if its not included.. we would purchase the passes - very relaxing and pampering spa.

Reviews.Title: “great location, courteous staff, stylish room ... and a great poker-room rate”
Reviews.Author: Gaviano
Reviews.Content: I've read a few reviews here complaining about smoke at the Aria ... all I can say is, whover wrote that, is obviously not used to Vegas hotels! The aria has a new, very efficient extraction systems - try visiting some of the older hotels in downtown vegas if you want to see what a smoky casino looks like! Anyway, I thought the Aria was a top-notch hotel all round: friendly and efficient staff, super-comfy bed, enormous rooms - but most of all, very well insulated. So many hotels have paper-thin walls that let you hear the guy in the next room; not the Aria. My room was quiet and very comfortable, with fantastic shower, top quality HD TV and quality furnishings. Also, I got more than $400 of the cost of the room, cos I was playing a lot of poker in the casino downstairs - make sure you ask about that if you're staying there! I'd recommend this place all round - and if you read some of my other reviews here, you'll see i'm generally quite hard to please!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: LAWienke
Reviews.Content: We checked in and this hotel is so big you have to walk for miles before you even get to your room, also before you get to your room you have to walk through the smoke central, wow what bad circulation in this casino. The room had food on the floor and two of the lamps over the bed wear broken with the glass on our bed. This hotel is so far off the strip, you feel like your in a different city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Stay. Skip the Casino”
Reviews.Author: Bosley02
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Aria during a Las Vegas trip with friends. The Aria has a very nice, modern feel, and a courteous staff. Everything you would expect at a nice hotel We were definitely impressed with our room which had a large floor-to-ceiling window on the entire exterior wall (as far as I know this is a standard room). All the lighting, TV, alarm, sound and window controls are integrated on a remote, which was something new. We found the hotel's location on the strip to be very central....an easy walk to most of the main casinos on the strip and about 20-30 minutes to get to the most extreme north-south ends of the strip (Mandalay bay or Wynn). Also, it is connected to the City Center, a high-class mall, if you like to shop. The pool area looked fantastic for the summer. We did not spend a ton of time in the casino, but the time we did have in there we were not impressed. It's a pretty small casino and as a result all the tables were crowded all the time. If you enjoy playing the inexpensive video slot machines or low minimum bet tables, this is definitely NOT the place to go! Also, we ate at the Aria's buffet one morning for brunch and it was nothing special. better off spending your $$ at Bellagio, Wynn, or Paris buffets in terms of quality and variety. They do have a fantastic pastry shop near the casino floor, and I have heard some of the other restaurants are good, but cannot offer a personal experience there. All that being said, the location is key and Aria has pretty fair rates compared to some of the other hotels in close proximity on the strip. I would recommend it to others for just the hotel quality alone, but I wouldn't consider it at the top of the list for the one-stop hotel/casino/restaurant properties on the strip. One final thought--this hotel advertises itself as the first LEEDS certified ("green") hotel on the strip. It may have been constructed in an environmentally friendly way, but there's nothing about their operations that seems particularly environmentally friendly...I mean, the pastry shop provides gigantic boxes and oversize gift-style baggies to cart out one little baked item, and I did not see anything indicating that they're encouraging recycling or reusable materials or anything... what's that all about?

Reviews.Title: “Aria is a real stinker - literally.”
Reviews.Author: pavoga
Reviews.Content: Airport shuttles must discharge passengers in a sub-basement, which is as far away from the registration desk as it is possible to be in this hotel. You have to walk through the casino, which reeks with a sickly vanilla odor (to mask the smoke?). The desk clerk was well-meaning, but ineffectual, and had to call her manager, who was snippy and borderline rude. The room was odor-free and had a nice view, except for the grime on the windows. Housekeeping was slipshod. I had booked a tour to Death Valley, and three successive employees did not know where the Tour Bus Lobby was. Another told me that coffee was available before 7:00 a.m. only in a restaurant located clear across the hotel; it turned out that a bar just behind us had it. Terrible odor, poorly trained staff, inconvenient layout.

Reviews.Title: “If smoke bothers you; don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: stollyboy
Reviews.Content: THe rooms were great but the ventilation system was terrible. Everytime we walked by the casino, the smoke bothered us; even the person that smoked could not stand it . The very good french bakery was great but the lines were always long ,so if you wanted to grab something good and you didn't have a lot of time to waste: then kiss the bakery goodbye!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel . . . .High Tech . . .. Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Yankman04
Reviews.Content: I was meeting my college roomate (1975) and his wife in Vegas for 4 days. I had allready booked the Aria. My college roomate insisted that I stay with him at the Pallazo. I'm glad I decided to stay at the Aria. This hotel is magnificent. I arrived at 10:15 am and my room was ready! Everyone was so nice at the hotel from the Valet to the Casino waitress to the bellhops. The room was clean and state of the art. The hotel is centrally located right in the heart of the strip - actually just next door to the Belagio. Couldn't find one thing to complain about. I had a magnificent view of the strip from my room. Would stay there again if the price was right. Got a good deal at www. earlyvegas,com/promos - got the third night free!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING QUALITY and value for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: AlirazaTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: This is an absolute 5 star experience, from check in to check out. Yes you pay 5 star hotel rates but you get 5 star service and quality of stay in return. EVERYTHING is new of course! You get condominium style living. The bath is full marble and glass. The windows are floor to ceiling. The room just feels very "new" and you know that you are experincing the best in current living accomodation. I enjoyed swimming in the spa pool. There are 5 total pools I believe. 3 are spa pools which are heated and powered by jets. 2 are full size heated pools. I made an 8 minute YouTube video reviewing the room and the pool which I tried to post here but the file size is too large and TripAdvisor will not take HD files but if you want to see it, go see my name AlirazaTravel and you can get a visual supporting this review. In the meantime, check out my awesome SLR photos of the room I stayed in. This hotel is worth EVERY SINGLE PENNY. Me and my spouse made so many memories in just 4 days of stay. We were very thankful we did not cheap out to stay at a discount hotel (we are frugal and were feeling guilty of spending this much money but BOY was it worth it). OH and the negative reviews? I even mentioned them to the check in lady at the counter and when I left I mentioned them again to the manager - saying that I was shocked it has poor reviews and the answer was simple. It's the competition coming here to TripAdvisor posting adverse comments. FOLKS, if you want to make great memories and truly enjoy your stay in Vegas, please, don't cheap out, at least for a few nights, and stay here. You will remember it for life.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: krmiller18
Reviews.Content: The ARIA is by far one of the nicest hotels i have EVER had the pleasure of staying in! My husband and I traveled to Las Vegas for the concrete convention in January and I read tons of reviews on the various hotels in Las Vegas. I was planning to stay at Ceasars Palace but a friend whom had recently stayed at the ARIA recommended it & I am SO glad i booked it! Everything is controlled with an electronic Ipad like device! Upon walking into the room at check in the lights came on, the curtains opened to reveal an entire glass wall overlooking the strip! The bathtub was luxuriously big with the shower next to it all encased in glass. I am VERY picky about cleanliness & i must say hands down this place is CLEAN! They freshen up the room daily bringing in new towels, making the bed & wiping everything down. I read reviews complaining about it being TOO big, i didnt get that feeling and NEVER waited on an elevator as they have 6 elevators for each floor grouping(every 8 floors)! I CANNOT wait to stay here again next year when return for the convention. The prices were SO good I will end up booking our employee rooms here as well next year when they travel to the show with us! Also very nice that it is located next to City Center! Louis Vuitton, Prada & Gucci were just steps away! By far the BEST hotel yet!!!!! Great Job ARIA!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: ChoppyMcQueen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here after abandoning our pre-paid reservation at the Flamingo. The headlines are that the Aria is a nice, clean comfortable hotel. Some bullet points: 1) The hotel is spotlessly clean. 2) Every employee seemed well trained and service oriented (especially Thomas at the front desk). 3) The rooms are comfortable and interesting. They are technology focused, but after a while become a little frustrating. Executing simple tasks, like turning on a light, can be a little tricky. 4) This place is not cheap. I know resorts and hotels charge a premium for drinks, food and sundries, but this place takes the cake. I don't mind paying a little extra for convenience, but you feel like you are getting gouged every now and then. 5) The Aria's location lends itself to a wide variety of dining options. Anything you might want is there, but be prepared to pay out the nose. The Todd English P.U.B has awesome food and every beer under the sun. We would stay there again and enjoyed ourselves. BTW- Try a pomegranate mojito at the City Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Place to go in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: redwrangler8
Reviews.Content: The Aria in Las Vegas has been an extremely positive surprise. I stayed at this hotel for a company conference and was very impressed on all aspects of this stay. The hotel is located on the South Strip and therefore right in the vicinity of all you might want to see in Vegas. It is a very modern and appealing hotel, with nice outside waterfalls. It might not offer some of the spectacular sights like some of the other Las Vegas Hotels (namely the Bellagio, Paris Paris, New York or Venitian), but it still has a very rounded concept. This high rise beautifully illuminated hotel has over 4,000 rooms, but what service is concerned you would not notice. The check in was extremely efficient and cordial. The rooms are large, very clean and offer state of the art amenities and technology. Touch screen devices manage every aspect of your room. The bathrooms are very large with extensive shower and bath facilites. I am in absolute awe about the greatness of these rooms. Besides the great rooms you find everything desireable in this hotel: nice pool, exquisite fitness facility, spa, great restaurants, appealing shops, Elvis Musical (though I did not visit it myself, colleagues told me it was great), and a nice casion environment, where the "cheap" Las Vegas does not shine through. What the conference I attended is concerned I can only give the facilities and the staff an A plus. It was incredible how they managed and served 2.5K plus people and fed them without any problems. The night club "Haze" has also proven to be an incredible clubbing location which leaves nothing else to desire by providing a great night! This Aria is definitely a keeper, and though I know I might be attending similar company conferences there in the next two years, it would definitely also be my choice on any private trip to LV.

Reviews.Title: “Will not recommend”
Reviews.Author: pcl933
Reviews.Content: Number of events happened : Room : 1. the floor surrounding the toilet is wet with puddles of of clear but sticky detergent like liquid (size like 3 letter size paper); 2. Toilet seat is loose; 3. Nails found on carpet; 4. Pea size white dirts found on sofa and on the "letter to guest" on counter top.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: LeisureTraveler12
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to stay in an Aria Sky Suites for our 48th anniversary. The suite was exquisite, super modern and very high tech (and the technology was easy to figure out). Service was wonderful from the time we left the airport and were picked up and returned by an Aria limo (which came with the suite). Our suite was ready for us on arrival at 8:30 a.m., which is different than experiences at other Las Vegas hotels where we waited til 3:00 or 4:00 for check-in. Concierge staff was extremely welcoming and helpful in making reservations for us. We are now spoiled to luxury accommodations in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: summer06033
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze. We got an upgrade to a corner suite panaramic view for $75 more a night. The room was beautiful and spacious. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on and we have a Sleep Number bed at home. The room was very clean and all the staff we encountered were courteous, friendly and helpful. We were on the 24th floor with spectacular views of the strip. We never had to wait on the elevator and most of the time we had the elevator to ourselves. We had the breakfast buffet. There must have been 80 different choices and what we sampled were excellent. We had lunch at the sports bar, drinks at a lounge within the hotel, snacks at the cafe. All excellent. We even had fun at the casino and we are not big gamblers. The weather was perfect for us. It was 74 degrees the day we got there. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next Vegas vacation

Reviews.Title: “I'm positive this is what heaven is like”
Reviews.Author: lalwilliams202
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler whose on the road more than 50% of the time, so staying at a hotel where you're comfortable is key. To say I was comfortable at this hotel is putting it midly. I big proponent of new. And this place is only abt a year old. This hotel has completely shifted my thoughts on what nice is. The lighting, the city views, the touch pad operation of all things in the room, completely blew me away. And to say I fell in love with the "good night" button is putting it midly. I was huge fan of this place. Not to mention all that it has to offer from a restaurant perspective. I never had a need to leave the hotel at all. The only minor quirk that I had abt the hotel was the fact that they didn't have any outlet plugs close to the bed (for those of you who prefer working in bed versus the desk). Other that, I completely loved my stay. I will say that the check-in and check out lines were a complete mess, but I enjoyed my stay in the room so much that I completely overlooked the madness. I've sung the Aria's praises all week. It was quite dreadful when I had to stay at another Vegas hotel the next week due to a convention. Needless to say it paled it comparisons. They'd literally have to burn down the Monte Carlo and build again to be on the same level as the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Teething Issues - One Year Later?”
Reviews.Author: CAJason80
Reviews.Content: So the wife and I finally broke down and stayed at ARIA - we've stayed at pretty much everywhere else on the Strip, and wanted to give ARIA a shot after it opened up last year. We ended up going with her family as well right after Christmas, in between Christmas and New Year's, so we had a good couple of days. Our overall impression was that the hotel has a ton of potential - but for some reason, the staff still isn't quite executing the vision of the hotel. It's a shame, really - it's dragging down what is otherwise a very lovely hotel. Upon checking in, we quickly realized we'd been put in a smoking room, so had to call downstairs to get another room. I figured I'd have to go downstairs (yet again) to swap keys, but nope - just had to jot down the room number over the phone and walk in to the new room. The keycard worked in the new place immediately. So, that was nice - not so nice was winding up in a smoking room to start with. The 'free' wireless internet was included in a daily resort fee - fine, I suppose, since I always use the internet - although it would be nice if the wireless internet actually, y'know, worked. It rarely connected in our room and when it did it was mind-numbingly slow. You could connect to the 'wired; internet for free - but only if you happened to bring your own RJ-45 ethernet cable to connect, otherwise you were more than welcome to use the hotel's provided "Internet Amenity Kit", provided for the low-low price of $20. Ahem. The electronics in the rooms are pretty nice, all told - there's a bedside touchscreen that basically controls the room. Ours worked....when it wanted to, which is a way of saying, not very often. Pressing the "Close Curtains" button would often only work for a few feet, and then you'd have to mash it again....and again....anyways, you get the idea. Again, great idea - poor execution. Casino floor was nice - craps tables paid out for us and the family (and that's always a plus!) - we had dinner one of the nights at Lemongrass, the Thai restaurant in the place, which we thoroughly enjoyed. The cafe down on the casino floor (Cafe Vettro) sold some nice casual fare - have to admit, we about devoured their nachos from that place. I would comment on the buffet, but every time the wife and I tried to head there the line was at least 45 minutes long, and I wasn't going to wait. Checkout (should) have been a breeze, but of course - true to the theme of the stay, the automated check-out did not work and we had to actually go downstairs and stand in line to check-out, where a woman was doing her best to check people out in the line with a pen and paper. Decidedly non-technological, and rather annoying. Overall, if I could give the place a 3.5 I would - my wife and I both really enjoyed the actual comfort and size of the rooms and the restaurants, but it was the little annoyances that prevented us from truly enjoying the stay. We'll likely return at some point, and I'm hopeful that the teething issues will have been solved by THAT point. We'll see how it goes.

Reviews.Title: “DONT EVER STAY HERE YOU WILL BE SORRY !”
Reviews.Author: JDfromLR
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself looks nice but the people who work there are the worst I have ever encountered anywhere. The Cafe Vettro service staff was horrible. Took over 2 hrs for lunch in the middle of the afternoon. When we complained they did nothing but sneer and act like they didnt care. So I called the hotel manager from my room. Told her the story and she was very nice. Said she would comp our lunch tab since we got such poor service. THEN that night when I got back to my room she left a long winded message on my phone. Said she talked to the manager and now she was NOT going to comp us. The manager lied to her and said we said we didnt want her to do anything? Can you imagine? Pay all this money and get treated this way? The rest of the time was the same. Every where we went. Lousy terrible service. At the buffet for breakfast we waited 20 mins for coffee??? And then they said" we cant leave a pot on the table?" For $51 for 2 you cant leave coffee? I have to wait for you to come back? each time I want more coffee? And they were never around. Stay at the Wynn or Encore anytime you can. Everyone in town knows Steve treats his people best and they are all helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Beware of dishonest cleaning Staff - Our money got stolen in the room”
Reviews.Author: alecheverry
Reviews.Content: I'm going to try to be fair in this review, but as you can see from the title, me and my colleague didn't have the best stay at this hotel... The Aria is an spectacular new hotel in Las Vegas located in one of the best parts of the strip. It is connected with a free tram to the Monte Carlo and to the Bellagio, saving 15-20 minutes walk if you want to see the fountains. Just be ready to walk a lot in order to get to your room, as the elevators are located in the center of the building and if you are unlucky, your room will be located at the other end of the building. The rooms have everything automated so you can open the blinds, tv, control the room temperature, alarm clock from your TV/remote...it was very impressive and nice gadget to play with. The bathroom had an awesome design, two sinks, shower + Tub, all the ammenities, bathrobes....it was a really first good impression.....but then all started to go downhill: The water pressure (we were in the 20th floor) was not the best that you can ask for, very low pressure and not what I expected. Also, the room wasn't cleaned the first day until late in the afternoon....In addition, the glasses (where we were drinking sodas the day before) weren't replace after the "cleaning" and some trash wasn't pick up (Maybe because he/she was busy going through our stuff). Also, we started to observed and hear things not expected for this type of expensive hotel: We took one of the elevators and found condoms on it (Check the pictures)....and one night it was almost impossible to sleep because of the sex marathon/spanking session next to our room & the bum bum from the music coming from one of the discos [Remember, I was in the 20th floor so I wasn't expecting the music to be heard at such hight floor)...I would have expected the rooms to have a better sound proof system in place (The beds were amazing, too bad the noise was to loud to be able to enjoy them). Anyway, turning back to the title of my review: We came here for a business meeting and decided to stay an extra day to be able to gamble during our last night...Of course, when we arrived to the hotel, we looked everywhere for a safe to keep our money but we weren't able to find it anywhere (We later find out it is located inside the night stand and not in the closet/under the TV as in other hotels). So my colleague kept his money inside his backpack....only to find out the last day that the money was completely gone. We reported it with the hotel security, tried to narrow the time were it could have dissapear, sign a statement and that was it....The worst response from management really.... I was expecting either my colleague's money back or no charge for our rooms.... I definitely won't be coming here again. Again, if you wanna party like crazy and you don't mind the loud noise, the trash in the elevators

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kramerpuss
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel. We had a corner suite with all the bells and whistles. The automatic everything impressed us all. From the lights, to the curtains, to the Tv, all fun. I liked the Tv in the bathroom. There was a fair bit of construction in the city area with the new hotel, but Aria a great base to see Vegas. The casino was amazing, and didn't have the awful smell that most of the casinos seem to have. I think the high ceilings and the newness help with that. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!!”
Reviews.Author: lucyandtariq
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Aria last week for 3 nights. From the second we entered the hotel to the second we had to leave it, it was perfection. I had emailed the hotel to let them know we were celebrating an anniversary and when we arrived to check in (no long queing at all) we were told that we had been upgraded to a beautiful corner suit with a city view (not to mention a whirlpool bath,a living room, guest bathroom and 3 flat screen tvs!) On our first evening we were surprised by a beautiful plate of chocolate dipped strawberries and macroons delivered to our room, with a card saying "happy anniversary". I thought it such a lovely gesture. The actual hotel interior design is beautiful, its modern, luxurious and very clean. The casino has a gorgeous smell (which i now miss!) -with honestly no smell of smoke or alcohol. The casino is just the right kind of busy- but not crazy busy which I loved. Drinks are free if you're gambling, so I took full advantage and drank champagne everynight! We went to see O in the Bellagio which was incredible and worth every penny- I'd go again in a heartbeat!We watched the water fountains from a bar in the bellagio - which was very romantic! The room is controlled by a touch screen controller- very simple to use, and the bellboy gave us a quick lesson anyway!The service was top-notch. I'm a very picky lady and quite hard to impress, I notice things straight away and honestly this hotel is 5 star. Definately going back next year! Thanks again Aria

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay at Aria”
Reviews.Author: Canada_girl28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria for a week in January 2011. Mandatory "resort fee" ($20 or $30 USD per night) gets you access to pools and hot tubs. I received services in 3 different spas (Aria, Mandarin Oriental, and Bellagio) during this trip and this is the spa I would least recommend. For value for your dollar, visit Bellagio instead. The Good Stuff: decent ventilation in the smoky casino, great location on the strip, nice lobby, room had a good view, room had awesome plugs to power all sorts of devices, nice flat screen tv in the room, good restaurants in the hotel, nice pool area, great hot tubs, great buffet. Nice showers in the room (hot water came quickly). Water pressure was sufficient. Within 10 minutes walking distance to Bellagio, Monte Carlo and NYNY as well as a CVS pharmacy. Internet access was super easy. No passwords to goof around with makes it user-friendly! The Not-so-Good: most soft, squishy, uncomfortable mattress we have slept on in a long time and in many travels. After 3 nights we actually flipped this pillow-top nightmare over so we slept on the bottom of the mattress. Firmer to sleep on but sort of like sleeping on a box spring! I thought their internet was supposed to be fast but it was average. Because of the size of the hotel, I think they lose on the details (ie replenishing everything in your via housekeeping, keeping up with burnt out light bulbs, they left dirty drinking glasses in the room)... if housekeeping even comes at all! One night we called them at dinner time because they hadn't come yet- we needed clean towels. When we arrived I felt the bathroom wasn't very clean because I counted 12 hairs in the bathroom (sinks, floor, etc...) They don't have any variety of pillows available- you get what you get in the room and they are synthetic but squishy like feather pillows. Beware- your room could be a looooong walk from the elevators. There is only one elevator bank and there are some very long hallways. Despite the weak points, I would recommend this hotel (only to people who like soft squishy beds, mind you). It was generally clean in the public areas, the decor is nice to look at (they have some beautiful textured wallpapers and art in the hotel). The food was good, the pool was nice etc... so overall it was a decent stay. As for us, we will try someplace else next time we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: lou9900
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! beautiful rooms, great staff, very reasonable rates! and amazing food everywhere you go! i have stayed at a lot of the hotels in Las vegas and this is my favorite! not all hectic like the bellagio or the venetian, stay at the aria you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and top notch.”
Reviews.Author: Music3000
Reviews.Content: I have just spent four nights at the Aria with my wife. The room, cleanliness, and service were exceptional. I have read the reviews that others have written on this hotel and can only respond that we did not experience any of the problems mentioned. In contrast it was a wonderful experience

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Fresh, and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: toecoz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aria on the 3rd week of Jan. We are in our late 30's and like to gamble, have a few cocktails, and stay in a modern comfortable quite room. The Aria provided everything we were looking for on our Las Vegas trip. The check in area is huge and stunning. The people at the counter were accomadating and efficient. Before we were able to get onto the elevator we had to show our room card to a security gaurd standing in the hall before the elevators. I thought that was great. When we got into our room we were extrememly pleased on the modern upscale decor. Flat panel T.V. that allowed you to control everything in the room from the temperature to the opening of the curtains. Our view of the Manderan hotel and the strip was awesome. The washroom was just the right size with a double sink and a great shower. The best part of the room was the amazing bed!! Once you lied down it was hard to get out of it. 24hrs. room service was fast and delicious. The Skybox Restaurant is good for a quick bite and a beer. I highly recommend the Prime Rib burger!! The Casino seemed small compared to other hotels, but was nice and there were alot of $10 tables throughout the day and night. The location of the Hotel was great. It is located between the Monte Carlo and The Cosmopolitan. Friends of ours stayed at the Bellagio and the walk was about 10 mins.(they thought our hotel was much better) One other thing, which may be important to some but not others, was the wat the Aria pumped in a Vanilla type smell, it didn't smell like an ashtray which some others do. My wife and I both agreed that the Aria will be the hotel we go to from now on. Check out the Spa for $30 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Girlie410
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite beautiful and not as chaotic as the typical casino resort in Las Vegas. The beds are unbelievably comfortable and everything is electronic in the rooms including the curtains. The restaurants within the resort were very good and a good value for the money spent. Housekeeping was not that great. Bathroom could have been a little cleaner and they left the battery out of the scale the whole time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible beauty”
Reviews.Author: Minicoco
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to the Aria. Everytime I've stayed here was on a comp, so I guess I should feel lucky I didnt pay for the experience. Every single time I've been here, the technology that is so touted has failed. My curtains didnt close, the room reservation system was down, the players club was changing over to M-Life. Nothing at the Aria is simple, even down to the bell desk. There is a desk inside the hotel, but they make YOU take your bags outside and drop them with an employee. What is the purpose of the bell desk inside then? If you drop your bag with the outside person, you then need to walk to another valet entrance to get a cab. Definitely, NOT worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GreatTraveltime
Reviews.Content: Nice room in a great location. The room controls were frustrating at times but I would stay again at the Hotwire rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: dcbi
Reviews.Content: I was here on business so didn't explore all this wonderful property had to offer. But I did eat at the tapas restaurant for dinner and the 24 hour restaurant for breakfast. Food and service was great at both. They are a little slow to seat you in the morning so make sure you allow extra time for that. The rooms are very cool. When I first opened my door, music came on and the curtains opened up. My favorite part? The goodnight button by your bed. Press this and everything shuts off and closes up. Casino looked great with lots of tables, slots etc.

Reviews.Title: “Opening doors, opening windows and reaching sights unseen.”
Reviews.Author: Mulltea
Reviews.Content: Awe inspiring resort. I felt like I walked into Bill Gates bedroom. This hotel is a gorgeous, modern exotic destination that will leave you thinking, ' Who has time to gamble?'...maybe not, but I could have spent hours upon hours in the room. All service personnel also added to my ultimate experience. From the Check in staff, to the helpful security, dining service staff and Casino floor personnel,everywhere I found myself I was met with a smile and professionalism. If you look in the dictionary under Hotel and Casino Resort you should see a picture of the Aria. I even found that the prices in the shoppes were not much higher than what I would expect to pay at home. To create such an exotic and fantastic atmosphere at reasonable prices with such professional and down to earth friendly service is an accomplishment on any scale, much less a resort of this magnitude. Check it out for yourself, as soon as you can!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PaulRevere44
Reviews.Content: Reserved above 25th floor which is supposed to be best floors for city view. Called hotel two more times close to departure date and reservationist assured I will get just that. Got there early 12-12:30 pm. Woman offered 14th floor only and was quite stubborn about it. I asked for manager. Somehow, within 2/ 3 minutes there were three 50th floor rooms available. One I would have to wait for the other two immediately available so I took a 52 floor room the room overall was average for a good LV hotel. I can clearly see why the post re. getting an above floor 25 is the right pick unless you don't mind shiny steel roofsout side your window. On 52 the view was spectacular, boasting city and mountains in back drop. Great big hi-def. tv. Generally clean but found a decent sized toe nail clipping on floor ( not mine) as I was alone. Nice shower but water pressure was low. All lounges a bit slow most of the time. Joined friends outside hotel for dinner so only had late nite turkey club sandwich at Cafe Vettro. Very dry and thin served with lots of ketchup. Not mayo. Hope this is not reflective of other restaurants at hotel. If you like perfumed air hang out in and around the lobby. Oh, I would set the thermostat at 70 only to come back to thermostat at 78 and too warm form my blood. I voiced my negative concerns to a manager and after much "investigation", points and counterpoints all of which made total sense to him, he offered me a refund for the turkey club sandwich which I refused. Thanked me for my comments and would use my input to help in serving future travelers in order to maintain the "5 Diamond" status. The only thing I forgot to complain about was lots of aggressive young slutty hookers roaming the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but SNEAKY!”
Reviews.Author: BeeHerd
Reviews.Content: I'll get right to it. The basic room which I booked was beautiful and the bed exceptional for comfort! The sheets were softer than the usual stiff scratchy linens hotels use. However, the room was smaller than what you can get for the money (eg.Venetian). Another draw back was only 1 TV! The Venetian has 3 so you and your mate can enjoy your choice of shows. Beware! They charge a resort fee and I did not come to use their gym or read the newspaper which you have to get yourself form a far walk to the venue. I did not need a boarding pass either! They call it a convenience fee but, it's just a sneaky way to up the price. If they were smart, they would credit you back this fee on charges made at the hotel. Instead, they pretend they are doing you a favor by uping your rate $23 per day!. I say we should all rebel with our purses and wallets! Then, management would remember, the (paying) customer is always right! On a nother note, when I asked to speak to a manager, no one was available, nor did a manager find the time to call back the whole weekend. Instead, they present a talking head that has no authority to do anything other than say "I understand how you feel". Since no one found the time to call, I hope management finds the time to read about it in these awsome trip advisor reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Yzoos
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from five days. The beds were the most comfortable ever. Everything was computerized or electronic and you could not just turn things on and off. It took a while to get the hang of it. Certainly there was not enough light in the room. Everyone was very cordial and helpful. Airport shuttle bus left you off and picked you up far from the main lobby and they did not offer bell hop service at checkout. All that being said I would definitely reccomend this hotel. Very clean and modern and the restaurants were good. Also, somewhat more low key than the other tacky and crowded hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not great for a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: DMHrly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas for a 2 day trip and were ecstatic to get tickets on priceline for $80/night to stay at the Aria. Not having gone to Vegas in over 4 years we had only read a few reviews on the Aria that were okay...but still excited to stay in a 5 star. The pros to staying here: very clean, pleasant employees, nice pool space (3 pools and 3 hot tubs), and a fun modern decor. The cons: we personally did not enjoy being in the city center as it took far too long to just get across the street, the beds were very very soft (i usually like a soft bed, but these were too soft to sleep well in), and the resort fee was an unwelcome surprise at the end of our stay...it is $22.50 per night, and claims it's for all the things you would expect any hotel to provide, such as a pool, fitness center, and wifi in the rooms. The high tech rooms were fun, but didn't have an iPod doc..the only tech feature I look for in a room. Over all, having gotten a good deal on priceline, I was somewhat pleased, but after the extra $22.50 fee per night, it wasn't such a great deal and I won't recommend anyone stay there unless you are looking for 1 hotel to stay in your entire time in Vegas. If you want to get out on the strip, I would not recommend staying at the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Business or Leisure......This is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were exhibitors at a convention at the Mandalay Bay Convention Center, but decided to stay at the Aria. We also brought along another couple (our best friends). I booked our trip through Travelocity, but in retrospect, I would have booked directly with the hotel and airline instead. It is too costly, and a pain to make any changes through Travelocity. Upon arrival to our hotel, we were very happy to see a modern lobby. The check-in line went quickly, and our requests of non-smoking, high floor and our two rooms close together were accommodated. The lobby was not too far from the room elevators, and it was nice to see a security guard checking keys to verify you were a guest before you could get to the room elevators. Many people mention the fragrance in the hotel. It is noticeable when you walk in the doors, but much less noticeable in the casino, and we could not smell it at all in our rooms. The Aria has 54 floors, and our rooms were on the 52nd. We had King City View rooms. The view did not disappoint. As discussed in many other reviews, the room is controlled by a main touch screen, and in my opinion, was easy enough to use. My suggestion would be to take 5 minutes to get familiar with it, so that when you have had an evening of fun and return to your room, you're not fumbling around trying to figure it out. Both our room and our friends room were very clean, and modern. The only complaints I would have about the rooms would be that the vanity counter space is limited (towel bars would be helpful), and the room itself was not huge, but plenty big for the 5 nights we were there. The his and her closets were spacious and had plenty of hangers. We spent time in the sports bar and in the casino. We had a blast at the craps table and all walked away winners. The slots were fun although we didn't win on them. Almost anytime of the day or night a cocktail person would approach you asking if you needed a drink. The hotel is in a great location and is connected by a tram to the Bellagio and the City Center Shopping Mall. It is also about a $10 taxi ride to the Mandalay Bay Convention Center. The hotel has just been awarded the 5 Diamond Award, and in my opinion, is one of the better hotels on the strip. We plan on staying again.

Reviews.Title: “wow, wow, wow”
Reviews.Author: nycadman
Reviews.Content: some places just speak to u. this property was dead on. gorgeous rooms. stunning pools. amazing restaurants. so close to the new crystals mall and steps from the hot cosmopolitan casino. amazing bed. great bathrooms (loved the shower and tub in one enclosed space) and furnishings were first rate. can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Exquiste and Upscale, Worth every Penny!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: coco1969_10
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Las Vegas on a business trip and my colleagues reserved our rooms here. I was hesitant because it was a unknown hotel and a further out than we wanted to be but price dictated where we stayed. Upon arrival the staff was a amazing and very professional. Here is my HUGE surprise... Upon entering my room... Lights came on, TV came on, and the curtains opened. This is outstanding and very modern. I could even set my alarm for all of this to happen. WE HAD A outstanding and WONDERFUL fun filled stay; even though we were there on business. When going back to Las Vegas the Aria has won my heart and loyalty. Thank you Aria for making my visit to Las Vegas an memorable experiene. Just so everyone knows it wasn't just the room it was the casino, spa, pool area, and the whole up to date aura of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: smith_oz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over Christmas 2010 (2 couples) and could not fault it. Check in was relatively smooth - a little wait, but not too long. The rooms were absolutely beautiful, beds very comfortable and immaculately clean. The blinds and lighting were a little confusing, but soon mastered. The Casino itself is not smelly like most in Las Vegas. I am definitely a non-smoker and finely tuned to this type of thing, and was very comfortable sitting in the bar at the casino for a drink. All in all a great stay and the location cannot be beaten

Reviews.Title: “Nice but won't be back”
Reviews.Author: FortMac
Reviews.Content: I wasn't going to write a review at first, but here is a very honest account of what I thought. We stayed Dec 14-19. My DH & I stayed in a corner suite. Not the panoramic view suite, just a normal corner suite. We were on the 37 or 39 floor, can't quite remember now. Well the corner suite was just fine I am glad we didn't spend extra for the panoramic. Awesome views, comfortable bed and the best housekeeping. Really enjoyed the bathroom, separate shower, toilet and jetted tub. Nice to relax in the tub after an eventful day and watch t.v which is located on the wall across from the tub. We ate at the Buffet which I thought was not very good. Had dinner at Union which was delicious and very $$$, so worth it though!! We do at least one fine dining on our trip. If you are a gambler and enjoy comps however I would pick another hotel. They are very tight!!!! This is why I took away a star. Never had a problem with getting anything comped at any other property, but this one not a thing not even a meal. If you are a high roller then this hotel/casino may be for you. If you are mid or low roller forget it. Glad I tried it out, but will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “something i would never expect in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: polandpi
Reviews.Content: We have been upgraded into suit while it was Monday and hotel wasn't full! fantastic room with great view at the Strip, food is good, shopping nice, casino is very fancy and pool is soooooooooo nice! it's not typical Las Vegas tacky hotel, it's very elegant and so well design with great art on every corner! i strongly recommend that hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Modernist elegance - great value”
Reviews.Author: Phineas55
Reviews.Content: Our third stay here in a year. So comfortable. Quiet rooms with fabulous views. Sybaritic spa. Casino is dark - in a good way. Restaurants all superb, especially Jean Georges steakhouse - but not moderately priced. We're not buffet people, but enjoyed the one here.

Reviews.Title: “They need to improve on some things for the hotel to get my repeat business.”
Reviews.Author: celticgirlLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas for CES as i go every year with my spouse and this year we both went to the convention, though he went everyday. I had an easy check in, and was pleased my room was not far from the elevator. The hotel was packed with people from the convention. My main complaints are for what they are charging i was underwhelmed by a few things. First the pillows are huge, and not in a good way. They offer no other options so if you can't sleep well on a thick fat pillow you are out of luck. Second, the blackout curtains should be a priority in Las Vegas where you may want to sleep at odd hours. The room has a button that opens and closes the sheer and thick curtains but i found out quickly in the morning that they did little to block out the light. The top of the curtains let in a ton of light as did a three inch gap on the floor and also the side by the bed. So what is the point of having blackout curtains that DON'T block out the light??? I paid the entry fee to the spa to have a jacuzzi/steam one late afternoon last saturday and when i got in the jacuzzi it was barely warm. The soaking tub in my room had filled up quickly and was quite hot, so I was surprised I had paid 30.00 to come to the spa and was having a colder jacuzzi than the bath I could have had in my room. I mentioned to the spa staff and a woman finally came over with a thermometer and then left and never said a word to me. While I sat there about five different women got in and then said 'why is it not hot?" and they would get out. We ate at Sage and spent quite a bit on the tasting menu, drinks, gambling later and I'm not sure I will stay here again or reccommend it to friends because I would like a dark room, comfortable bed and pillow , and a spa that works when you are only at a hotel for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “LV trip”
Reviews.Author: A1bs
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with high standard of service. Rooms are large, nicely appointed and bed was very comfortable. The "technology" in the rooms was a novelty which wore off after 2 days, standard light switches are much more user friendly. I also stayed at the Wynn during my stay and in terms of service, room quality and overall feel of hotel, I preferred the aria. The cons was the housekeeping which could have been better and wear and tear was noticeable on the furniture, which was a surprise consider how new the hotel is. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: quentin23
Reviews.Content: Just a great place to enjoy Vegas. The amenities, service, casino, and food makes you feel at home. You do not even leave the casino for anything. The entire trip was well worth being at the Aria. Recommend this resort and casino to anyone coming to the city. We have been coming to Vegas for the last ten years and hurrah for Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paintedturtle78
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great from start to finish! The decor is wonderful and very elegant. Our room, like the others, has touch keys for the privacy settings, service setting, curtains - scared us the first morning as they opened and we didn't know what was going on but very nice. The bathroom is large with two sinks and a shower and tub next to the shower-very big perfect for three girls getting ready to go out. The room was clean and had hook ups for our ipods and computers. The coffee down in the casino was great there are two little cafe's that I could see, a chocolate shop and a great casino floor. The only thing I didn't like was the resort fee that I had to pay. It came to $67.00 for three nights which gave us a drink, free internet and access to the fitness center - we only used the drink voucher. Close to the main part of the strip we could walk to everything!

Reviews.Title: “New, Modern Hotel Skimps on Service”
Reviews.Author: Westlakeguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days during the Consumer Electronics Show. Upon checkin I asked for a room on a high floor--they said the best they could do until the next day was the fifth floor, which didn't make any sense to me. Two hours later I checked back in and they suddenly had a room on the 25th floor. Upon checking in, found that both bed lamps were burned out, the scale didn't work (no battery) and the shower handle kept on falling off. Clearly, either the cleaning woman didn't do a once-over or they have no check of the room prior to the next guest. I called housekeeping and was told I'd be next in line for the service person. After one hour I called and said that as it was midnight I needed to go to sleep. She promised they'd be up in 15 minutes but I declined. They did have everything fixed the next day but it should have been checked prior to letting a new guest into the room. Then I received a note that there was a package for me. I called and asked for it and was told it would be up in 20 minutes. After one more hour I called and said I had to leave the room; they promised they'd have it in 15 but I didn't believe them and instead had them hold it for pickup (they normally keep it in a holding room). Other than that, the room was very nice and the bed very comfortable. While I was on a no-smoking floor, the toilet room always smelled of smoke, most likely coming in through the ventilation system. The touch screen system is a nice amenity but the screen is not of the highest quality; it often required multiple touches around an icon to get it to respond.

Reviews.Title: “Good but sickly sweet”
Reviews.Author: nettyli
Reviews.Content: Great gym. The best gym in a hotel I've seen! It's a full gym basically, not just a few machines in a converted hotel room. Fantastic! Very high tech rooms...good or bad depending if you are used to using touch screen panels to control EVERYthing! A bit fiddly sometimes for those not tech savvy. The worst thing was...as soon as you walk into the hotel you are overwhlemed by a sickly sweet smell which made me gag. It was very very strong. Luckily, this was not a problem in the rooms. Another bad thing: everytime I called concierge I could never get through! I just got a recorded message saying the desk was very busy and unable to take my call, please wait. Annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Door entrance system to be upgraded and staff retrained”
Reviews.Author: EarthDiscover
Reviews.Content: My Mom, my brother and my Uncle lives there in 3 separate rooms. When I walk into my Mom’s room it has a strong toilet smell. I check the ventilation and it is working fine. I ask my Mom not to turn off the ventilation when she is out of the room. When I ask my brother and Uncle, their rooms are fine. The security is tight in the hotel as the entrance to the elevators is next to the casino and a bar. You have to show the room key in order to pass through. Along the wall there is a long sofa that my Mom usually can seat there to wait for us within the secured area so that she can see us approaching. My Mom has forgotten her keys a few times, the security is kind enough to open the doors for her. The sensitivity of the induced door key is not always working. You have to try many times to open the door. Sometimes you have to call security to open the door or to exchange for another one. Both my Mom and my brother have such incidents. One negative experience in the lobby is that the staff competes the passage way with you. I have experience that, my Mom, my brother and my Uncle all have such experience. I do not expect a 5 star hotel the staff is not trained on this aspect. The hotel is located in the most newly developed complex including Aria, Mandarin and the Crystals Mall. There is a side door that you can go outside for 15 seconds and enter the mall. The mall is a very high end mall with most of the top end brand names. You can find the latest model here when they are out or just on the magazine. You can connect this hotel to Bellagio and Crystals Mall via a monorail. The good part is that unlike the other route in Vegas, this one is free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, room a little smokey”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaDoglover_50
Reviews.Content: Don't know what all the haters are griping about. Seemed very 5 star to me, beautiful room with great luxury, fun gadgets with all the electronics, and bed to die for. [I did get the room on reduced rate from hotwire--which made it all that much sweeter] Service was GREAT--very attentive Only tiny complaint (realizing it IS a smoking hotel in vegas) stayed in a non smoking room, I'm pretty sensitive, and I'd give it a "mild" rating on how smokey. However, I'd stay again. Casino and lobby are more smokey

Reviews.Title: “super amazing”
Reviews.Author: camig25
Reviews.Content: if you are like me and can't stand the smell of cigarrents on all the casinos in Vegas or any other place you go, well this is the hotel for you!!! it was the cleanest hotel i've been to, and i fell inlove with the decor, its definetly for the modern taste people, if you like the old time fancy decor from say the ceasars you probably won't like ARIA, but if you like clean, slick, and modern this is the best place.. when you open the door, the curtains open on their own, the lights turn on, the tv turns on and music starts playing, and in the tv screen they have your name customized per room, you can regulate curtains and lights from your own tv remote, and its just fun, the staff is very helpful and nice, and its in the middle of the strip its a great place to go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time!”
Reviews.Author: AriaDream
Reviews.Content: I went to the Aria on a special deal right after New Years. It was great value for the money! I had a lovely time... the room was clean and the soaker tub was wonderful. The restaurants and the casino were perfect and the buffet was nice. Of all the restaurants, Lemongrass was probably my favorite. I very much liked Blossom as well... I went there for Dim Sun on Sunday. The Crystal's shopping plaza was a lot of fun. What I really loved, though, was all the penny slots. There's a tremendous variety for small time gamblers like me. :) The only complaint I would have was that the room service was - a touch over energetic. XD They didn't need to coil up the cord for my laptop and cell, lol, although it didn't really hurt anything. All in all I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: SonyKris
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at Aria with my spouse. The hotel was very clean. There was room service every day around 11.00am. There are a couple of restaurants within the casino that are open till midnight and some even till 2;00am, which is very convenient if you catch a late night show. Overall great hotel, good location and there is a shopping center with mc donalds, walgreens near by in case u need to buy everyday utilities without spending extra money. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a view....”
Reviews.Author: Piedra
Reviews.Content: 36th floor, opening courtiains when we came into the room... astonishing! Very pleasent stay! Spacious clean room. Very nice brand new Hotel! Only prices of Minibar were... Well... Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel/Casino on the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: JazzMomCalifornia
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the Trip Advisor reviews of Aria, I was concerned about what we might encounter at the hotel, especially in terms of cleanliness. But I shouldn't have worried -- the hotel was immaculate. We booked a travel package through the hotel's website and managed to score a corner suite with a spectacular view -- at a very reasonable price. The suite was stunning -- more like a one-bedroom apartment. Foyer with powder room, big living room, separate bedroom and well-appointed bathroom. (A visiting friend, a local resident, wanted to move in permanently.) We found the electronic controls to be relatively easy to work -- rather fun, actually. The hotel decor is elegant, modern, textural -- not the gaudy "theme park" style of some of the other casino/hotels on the Strip. The smoke in the Casino was well-vented; you could smell the occasional cigarette/cigar as you walked by a smoker -- but no cloud of smoke to irritate your eyes or soak into your clothing. The staff at Reception, Room Service, Housekeeping, and throughout the Casino was excellent; right down to the doormen hailing the cabs. One evening, as my husband and I strolled through the Casino, two well-dressed businessmen walked by, one of them saying to his companion, "I really like this place." I certainly agree.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful Hotel...smoking allowed... yet VERY CLEAN air.”
Reviews.Author: Cjae
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing from the moment you arrive. The shuttle picked us up at the airport and was right where they were supposed to be... no hassle. Check in took about 10 minutes... very professional and friendly. I liked that the elevators had a security person there all the time and having to show our room card every time made me feel secure. The room was very nice, curtains opened as you walked into the room all lights came on. Room was just a regular room, yet very elegant. The remote by the bed did all the things you wanted to do in the room with technology... opened the curtains... turned on the lights/tv/set an alarm was different. For the challanged with remotes it took us a few days to get it right. As for the service..... found a left over pair of underware in the bottom drawer... when I told the housekeeping person the next morning she was very good about it... Servicing your room, if your not an early riser they will clean your room later in the day. We did learn that when your going out for the day talk to one of them in the hallway and they will clean it when they are finished the one they are working on. You need to ask them to change your sheets if your there for more than a few days, we were there for 7 nights. They did a tidy up every day, but found they did not vacuum each day. The VERY POOR was that they had a small fridge in the room full of the hotels water/booze/treats that are very high priced. No room for anything we wanted or needed to keep cool. if you move anything in the fridge its your and added to your room price. NO coffee pot/kettle in the room this forces you to go downstairs and pay $6.00 for a coffee. I talked to others from other hotels and this seems to be the way it is in the upper end hotels. So reccommend you take a 1-2 cup maker with you if you love your coffee. The overall we found the staff to be very helpfull/polite. When they found out it was our 20th Wedding Anniversary they had a special treat of chocolate covered strawberries brought to our room... very nice. My husband is not a seasoned gambler and would have liked to try the games at the tables and not just the machines... there are no learning tables! If you do not understand how to play I do suggest you ask others before you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay with a Few Annoyances Though!”
Reviews.Author: FairFoodCritic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aria for 2 nights (1/2-1/4). For the most part, I enjoyed my stay. The lighting in the casino area was of a dark theme. We booked two rooms and requested connecting rooms since I was travelling with my baby. Initially we booked 1 king and 2 queens, but when we arrived, they could not find connecting rooms with that setup and she wanted to find a higher floor room, so we said 2 2 queen rooms would be fine, but they had a problem finding those rooms so we said 2 2 kings would be fine and any floor would be fine as it's more important we got connecting rooms. When we were given the initial bill, she made a mistake on the total probably because of our initial request and the difference in rates for kings and doubles ($30 more per room), even though I informed her that was what was quoted to us and advertised on their mail outs because my uncle had a players card. After a bit of time of sorting the situation out, we got it cleared up. We got connecting rooms on the 4th floor. The rooms were nicely appointed. I liked how we could operate the blackout and sheer curtains and they were so quiet! The bathroom setup is nice with a 1 glass door entrance to bathtub and shower and a separating door for the toilet and the entire bathroom closed off by another door. What thing that was unusual today was the bathroom door automatically locked when my uncle who was inside the bathroom swore he did not lock it. So be careful if you have little ones! Another thing is the light switch in bathroom...it was at times sensitive when you want to turn it on and at other times would not register when you want to turn it off. The bed was soft and comfy! I'm not sure I like all the functions of the television...I guess I didn't mess around with it enough as it was a bit of a challenge for it to use some functions especially checkout when you type in your email address wrong and you accidentally punch the wrong key, you have to start all over. After several tries, I just called the front desk to check out. Okay to my other annoyance situation-Anyhow on my 1st night there, my 15-month baby woke up from his sleep and started crying. I had just put him back to sleep (for the parents out there you know how hard it can be to put a baby back to sleep at times) when I hear a few knocks at my door. This was at 11:30 pm! I did not open the door right away as I was trying to make sure my baby was sound asleep again. Anyhow as I was approaching the door, a housekeeper used her key to open my door! I was so annoyed as I thought my baby would soon be awake again and of course the lack of privacy! She, however, did apologize and said her supervisor sent her up to check to see if the room was vacant. How could they not know that room has been checked in? I called operator from the other room and explained what happened and the person who answered said it was probably a glitch in the system and directed my call to the front desk who made me wait for over 5 minutes before they picked up the call. Then after I explained what happened, they just directed my call to housekeeping to explain story again. I didn't want to get anyone in trouble but I just did not appreciate what happened. After going through that, I finally decided that it was not worth filing a complaint as it would probably get to no one. I know mistakes do happen but still, you would think they should double check before walking in on someone late night! I quickly learned that I will just use the privacy button from now on. I didn't check this out in detail but there's a service button option as well. If one doesn't push that button, does it mean one's room will not be cleaned? I'm not sure. After the housekeeping annoyance, I started noticing how room service carts were left outside guests' rooms for quite some time (next day) and yes, you could smell it. I ate at the Buffet at Aria on Sunday night (around 5 pm no wait when we were visiting) when they were still serving the Gourmet Buffet (half lobster per person and unlimited wine). The seafood was fresh and I especially liked the prime rib and naan bread (as that is not served at many other Vegas buffets). The selection at this buffet is limited compared to other buffets though. I think if you have unlimited wine and want fresh seafood, it's worth it for $39.95 charge. However for kids it may be a ripoff as children under 3 are free and the rest are charged the $39.95 fare. I used the $50 food and beverage credit towards the buffet and it took them a while to figure out do the transaction. Forgot to mention, for each room I was given 2 welcome complimentary beer/wine coupons to use at one of the hotel bars. I did not get a chance to used it though. I also tried the crepe place (Jean...) and it was pretty good for a late night dessert. Overall, it was a good stay after I overlooked the nighttime housekeeping situation. Next time, I'd probably try other hotels such as Cosmopolitan (after they work out their grand opening issues) but I may consider staying at Aria in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I needed a good bed after 2 other hotels”
Reviews.Author: Charstorm
Reviews.Content: I don't really know about the other reviews as I didn't use services other than the players club. I LOVED sinking into that bed every night., the room was nice, the electric curtains were a delight to open and wake up to see snow. Went to several restaurants on sight and can't say I was overwhelmed but it was still enjoyable. If a comfortable bed is priority then this is the place, I can't remember a more comforable bed since staying at a Sofitel. My room was very clean, each and every day.

Reviews.Title: “Too big to provide good service”
Reviews.Author: cmkr1969
Reviews.Content: Avoid the Aria Resort....it is far too big to provide good service and, aside from some comfortable beds and convenient room amenities, it is really a poor quality hotel in every respect. We were especially disappointed in the room service....the menu was abysmal, with a very limited and rather odd selection of food, and there was an error in our order nearly every time (including missing items and day-old bread on some sandwiches), although for the most part what we did receive was good quality and good tasting. Personnel at the hotel were generally courteous and friendly but, most of the time, there was little they could do to rectify problems in a timely way. In some cases, they were the cause of the problem...for example, we had a problem at check-in when my credit card was erroneously declined due to the clerk's not swiping it in the machine properly. I thought I had a fraud hold or something else wrong with my card, and so I spent the next thirty minutes on the phone trying to get ahold of VISA to figure out what was going on, only to find that the card was fine and it was the clerk's mistake all along. Very irritating when you just drove six hours and are very tired and hungry and just want to get settled into your room and relax. Errors were also made with respect to our show tickets that were booked through the Sky Suites concierge, which created needless inconvenience and annoyance. The concierges made diligent efforts to correct the problem, and ultimately did so to our satisfaction, however, the hassle took quite a bit of the excitement out of the evening. The last thing you want to do when you're excited about seeing a nice show is sit in the concierge's office for the better part of an hour trying to resolve stupid problems that never should have occurred in the first place and that were purely the result of human error on the booking agent's part. The rooms had great views but were less than stellar in terms of the following: 1. Layout: suite was too broken up into small areas, and felt smallish even in the 2 bedroom, 2100 sq. ft. Sky Suites 2. Cleanliness: relatively poor housekeeping was evident, and the room was showing a lot of wear and tear for a one year old hotel 3. Soundproofing: there isn't any! You could hear the guests upstairs clearly, especially when they moved chairs or ran their bathtub, both of which were very loud and disturbed us on many occasions 4. Bathrooms: were somewhat unclean upon arrival, there were very slow drains in the sinks, almost no pressure in the faucets. The way the sinks are laid out, the water tends to spray all over the counter and mirror, and there are also no sink stoppers, so you can't really do hand laundry in the room (maybe in the tub?)....however, we did like the steam showers (although mine had a strong mildew odor), and my husband liked the Japanese style bidet with the heated toilet seat 5. Amenities: there's no microwave and no coffee maker!! But there was a nice, good size hotel refrigerator at least. I especially didn't like the lack of a coffee maker in the room...they say it is fire regulations in Vegas that prohibit this and the installation of microwaves, but then the least they could do is provide good coffee somewhat close by the room. As it is now, you have to go all the way down to the Sky Suites check-in area lounge to get complimentary coffee, which is really just what I like to call "brown water", i.e., it's not very good or very strong coffee. Oddly enough, the closest vendor is terrible, a French pastry shop in the lobby. 6. Functionality: instead of doing what we wanted to do, we had to spend several hours on successive days trying to resolve various problems in the room, such as stopped up drains, light bulbs out in the shower, dead batteries in the remote controls, etc. The problems themselves were relatively easy and quick to fix, but the maintenance staff is so overburdened that it takes an hour or more to get any service. Another thing we disliked about the hotel was the labyrinth-like layout of the lobby, casino and shopping areas, as well as the City Center itself. The hotel employees are poorly trained in terms of providing guidance to guests seeking directions, and nearly all of them we asked for help had no idea how to direct us to our destination. The signage is also poor and of little help in navigating the premises. The City Center is hard to navigate and it is almost impossible to walk directly between buildings or out to the street in any expeditious manner. The City Center is also poorly located near the end of the strip, close to the airport, so it is a fairly long distance to any other hotels or attractions. Allow yourself a lot of extra time if you have to get somewhere outside the hotel. Another serious problem is the food at the restaurants. Overall, is very expensive and very trendy. Most of the food we tried was not at all good and certainly not worth the exorbitant price. The buffet in the Aria is especially bad in this respect....the food was average and the price was nearly $40 per person. Unless you have a lumberjack appetite it's hard to justify spending that much on the buffet, and there aren't a whole lot of other options nearby. One final note: as is the case at most hotels in Vegas, the Aria is still allowing smoking, and the smoke in the lobby and casino is very thick and annoying to non-smokers. The neighboring Vdara is completely smoke free, however, and has a lovely spa. In retrospect, it might have been better to stay there. The new Cosmopolitan was next door and also looks to be a nicer hotel, with great balconies, unlike the Aria which has no balconies and no opening windows for fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosscopcotrain
Reviews.Content: Aria is a nice, clean and modern casino hotel on the LV Blvd. I was there for a company conferernce for 5 days and was allocated a standard room on the 19th floor which provided a good view out to part of the Strip. The room was a reasonable size for Vegas, the bed was large and very comfortable. I enjoyed getting to grips with the room 'controls' which allow you to control lighting, curtains, AC and a few other bits at the push of a few buttons on the TV remote control. There is also a bedside control unit which wasn't working in the room I was in but I didn't feel the need to report this and ask for it to be fixed as I could do what I needed via the TV. Not sure if there were additional controls and options available via this unit but maybe I will find out next time around. I found the service to be very good throughout the hotel. Room service and the availability and helpfulness of the staff throughout the hotel was great. The only time I didn't find this to be the case was when I was trying to call down to reception and could not get through for a while but this was no big deal. The only other complaint I would have was that the WiFi was quite slow at times. The conference facilities at Aria were very good also and we will be back there next year! Overall a good stay. Especially as we got tickets to go and watch Amir Khan retain his WBA Light Welterweight title against Marcos Maidana. Great fight and a great win for Amir. If you are ever in Vegas and a World Title fight is on at the same time I would highly recommend that you try and get tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vegas luxury”
Reviews.Author: ro_reeve5
Reviews.Content: quite simply the nicest hotel I have stayed in ever - AMAZING value amazing rooms - asked for a high strip facing room with great view - with hindsight would also ask for one nearer to elevator if I went back bathroom was about as big as my whole apartment at home! bed soooo comfy only ate in hotel once- at the buffet - which was great. amazing location taxi from airport great value well def be going back. just remembered - no free internet - would have liked this to email family etc but popped over to the macdonalds and used theirs!

Reviews.Title: “World Class Resort”
Reviews.Author: gokartmozart
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Aria for three nights. Everything was superb. The rooms are gorgeous. Service is top notch. I highly recommend Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views and wonderful bed, but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: weightnc
Reviews.Content: The views from our room were beautiful and the bed is absolutely amazing! But I expected more from a 5 star hotel. The staff was great, the rooms were spacious, the casino was nice, the spa is lovely, the restaurants were good, but the cleanliness in the room was sub-par. The bathroom floor didn't get cleaned once in our 3 night stay. Additional, when we returned one evening after dinner the room appeared to be cleaned, but when my husband used a 'new' towel to dry his hands after washing it was filthy. We called downstairs and they did send up clean towels, but it should have NEVER happened.

Reviews.Title: “First time, won't be last time!”
Reviews.Author: MilyOntario
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my first time trip to Vegas and love it!! We stayed at the Aria and loved the smell in the lobby!! The hotel itself is gorgeous and well taken care of, the only problem I had was with check-in and service. Our reservation was given to away to someone else so we had to wait for a new room and you had to wait forever for a beverage. When you spend the kind of money we did, you'd like a drink or two. Other than that we loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice But Not As Nice As It Use To Be!”
Reviews.Author: iyi
Reviews.Content: It is becoming another strip hotel. It is already showing signs of wear and tear. Staff is friendly, but not as accommodating as they were in May of this year (2010). Many banks of slots were down because of computers crashing. That shouldn't happen at a 9 billion dollar facility. Long, long lines to check in because not enough staff at front desk. Long, long wait times for room service, 75 minutes for breakfast. Waited so long for room service, had to call and cancel because we were falling asleep. Barely detected a smokey smell in the casino in May of 2010. Can't miss the smoke 7 months later. It was awful. Be very careful in the bathroom. The floor and shower floor is very slippery. We put down a hand towel on the shower floor so we wouldn't slip. Sirios restaurant was excellent as was the service.

Reviews.Title: “Corner Suite Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: jacuzziqueen
Reviews.Content: The Pros: We enjoyed the Aria very much, upon check in I offered a tip and we got an upgrade to a corner panorama suite. Floor to ceiling windows all throughout the 1 bdroom suite, with a spa tub in the corner of the bathroom with a awesome view! The vanilla scent we read about didn't bother me at all. All the controls got alittle confusing, but it was fun playing with them! The cons: Our issue was that most of the restaurants were closed, and the one's that were open closed at 9:00 p.m. that's the downfall if you stay sun - thurs, when it's slow they don't even open the best restaurants, it was very disappointing not to find a restaurant open, other than the cafe at 10:00 p.m. Luckily the beautiful mall right next door had several nice restaurants. Room Service was not the best, I received a comp at the spa because my room didn't get cleaned until 4:00.
