Tip: request the south side it has a better view, the location of the Aria doesn't give you a strip view, only a city center view. The Cosmopolitan wasn't open yet, but that's where I'd stay next time, on the side facing the Bellagio fountains! City Center is a great location, we walked all over. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gwhizz63
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying here. Room was awesome with the full electronic controls. The seafood buffet is well worth it - includes half lobster and unlimited wine. No luck gambling on their tight machines but had fine. Only complaint is most restaurants and the shows are very expensive but food very good. Nice pool area and good quick room service. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but dirty”
Reviews.Author: kingo904
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a beautiful hotel with all and everything you can ask for but.... for being such a nice new hotel it's pretty nasty. When you walk into your room the blinds open and lights all turn on. But when I went to lay my weary head on the pillows I noticed that there was what appeared to be womens mascara on one of the pillows, which led me to believe that the linens were not changed. This is not ok by me I don't care about much when I stay in a hotel as long as it's CLEAN, I don't need to be waited on hand and foot and I don't need any of the mumbo jumbo I just like to be in a nice clean room. Moving on when I got out of the shower and went to put on the bathrobe I put my hands in the pockets one of the pockets had a used tissue in the pocket...this also leads me to believe that this bathrobe had not been washed...like I said I don't really ask for much but that is just plain nasty. Also don't plan on using the restrooms downstairs truck stop bathrooms are cleaner than them. This hotel is a beautiful piece of work its just sad that they don't keep it very clean...Stay at the Wynn/ Encore they are a lil further off the strip and cost about the same to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “heavenly”
Reviews.Author: mjknows
Reviews.Content: was lucky to spent a glorious few nights in a huge 30th floor suite of the Aria Sky Suites tower several weeks ago and I've been thinking about it ever since. Highlights - - the king sized cloud of a bed - the stunning mountain views from floor length windows - a massive wood and stone bathroom with stand alone tub, double sinks and a 4x5 shower (no steam, however) - delicious and quick full-service room service breakfast (portions are huge) - tv's everywhere - limo to / from airport - proximity to pool and spa (see separate review) ...I could go on. It was so very luxe in the room that it was hard to leave, even to take advantage of the freebies (breakfast and snacks?) offered in the private lobby. It's a quiet oasis right in the heart of City Center. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good from afar, but far from good; don't be fooled.”
Reviews.Author: shopaholic4life
Reviews.Content: Looks great if you're passing through, but definitely a big so-so. Despite the sub-par reviews of this hotel, we decided to find out for ourselves booking a 3 night stay. I regret to say, they was some truth in them and we should have listened to the reviews more carefully. Monte Carlo would have been a better choice. Not to say this is a "bad" hotel by any means, but 5 star class? I have my reservations about that. Staff appear friendly and courteous, but again, it is an empty shell. Effectiveness and true service leaves much to be desired. Quite disorganized. The hotel prides itself on its high tech amenities, gadgets and "connectivity", which only work half the time if that. Internet is slow, if you can even log in after 30-60 min of frustration; you're better off running to a Starbucks and using their public wifi. On the up side, plenty of diverse TV channels to flip through, but alas, our TV didn't work until this afternoon (we leave tomorrow morning). It took 4 calls over 2 days down to the front desk, each time waiting for 10-45min before someone would answer, who would promise to send a technician up within the hour, nobody ever came. Was I not tipping enough? We spoke with the Bell Desk at 8pm, 11pm, 1am, 4am to check on the baggage, still nothing. We finally received the next morning, it was logged and received by the hotel just before 2am. The Bell Desk sent our baggage to the wrong room, and had to wait overnight for our toiletries and clothes to show up. I hope checkout will be less painful. Not a very enjoyable stay to say the least, Bellagio, Venetian, Monte Carlo much better picks, especially during promotions.

Reviews.Title: “I will go again”
Reviews.Author: love_going_vacation
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Aria for 4 days with a friend. Aria is gorgeous; you feel you do not need to go anywhere else. Has the best location. At the moment it is the best place in Vegas. I am a big spa person, and spent 3 days in the spa. The spa is good, expected more; however very nice. The rooms are nice and comfortable. The bed is too soft; however that is a personal preference. The room was not clean to a 5* standards when we walked in; however we called and room was clean in no time. I will definitely go back. The hotel by itself is a piece of art. Must see! Enjoy your stay. Make sure you have a desert at the local patisserie.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC! I "heart" ARIA”
Reviews.Author: my4greys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Vegas every year for his work conference. We're VIP's at theHotel at Mandalay Bay and as such, receive many perks and discounts on our room. However, when I called to make our reservation this year the rate was ridiculous. In fact, the rate on two of the nights was $700. When I asked why, I was informed "our rates are based on occupancy and there's the rodeo, conferences, awards banquets, etc". Uh, yeah. Thanks but no thanks. As I was talking with the rep from theHotel, an email from ARIA popped up and their rate was only $129 - no brainer! We were guests at the grand opening last year and toured the property so I was a tiny bit familiar with what it looked like, but it was the cost that closed the deal. From the moment our cab from the airport pulled into the front of the hotel, we were in love. The beautiful water features, the gorgeouse lobby, the tasteful Christmas decorations, the lovely scent everywhere in the hotel (My husband hates over scented ANYTHING and from everything I'd read here previously, I thought for sure he'd hate this so I never mentioned it to him. Surprisingly, he liked it!). We had a corner king suite on the 36th floor and it was spectacular. People complain the walk from the elevator was far, but I don't understand that complaint at all. We're 48 and 50 years old, not young but not old. It was never an issue for us! People also complain ARIA is "far from the strip". It's IN THE MIDDLE OF THE STRIP!! Our room was always immaculate, it was cleaned quickly while we were out during the day and tidied up again if we needed it. The technology is really nice as well, though it may take some people a bit of getting used to if you're not familiar with it. I could see my parents having trouble with that sort of thing. The one single thing we didn't like is the trek through the casino from the lobby to get to the guest elevators. I believe the architects should have designed that a little better. We will never stay anywhere else in Vegas. ARIA is our new favorite hotel and we'll be there again in May! Love-Love-Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Aria should be re-named HAIRIA”
Reviews.Author: sweetnyctravel
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival on a very rainy day, there was no bellman in sight to help with luggage. The check in process was quick and the hotel lobby is modern and beautiful. The room is ultra modern, but I don't think they thoroughly clean between guests. The first room I checked into had hair on the toilet seat and the toilet was dirty. I changed rooms and there was a ton of hair in the shower stall and hair on the floor around the toilet...whoever stayed in that room must be going bald. There was also hair on the bed when I removed the comforter. Gross!! Check out took a bit longer as there were only 3 people at the front desk and a line 15 people long. Upon exit, once again, not a bellman in sight. The valet instructed us to follow the sidewalk to the taxi stand half a block away. Beautiful hotel but too much hair.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cm7872
Reviews.Content: I found the hallways dark and the room numbering confusing. The hallways were confusing too for some reason. I always seemed to get lost trying to find my room. I thought the card key to the room was cool. You just waved it over a spot on the door; you do not insert it. I also like that you got real time airline flight information on your TV. You would get the same departure/arrival information in the same format that was being shown on the monitors at McCarran Airport. It was like having a monitor in your room. The room was very nice. I did find the hotel to be too far from the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Aria Las Vegas was a good find”
Reviews.Author: Kai-Lan-Chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria Nov 27-29, 2010. The hotel is modern, clean, and well-located on the strip. The rooms are well furnished and everything is controlled via the television remotes. The bed was awesome. The only notable negative was the walk from the elevator to the room itself. For some odd reason, this was lengthy. This is not much of a negative, but if we had any complaints, this was about it. Somewhere along the line, we had read that there was no gaming or smoking on premises. This is false: the lobby was a bit smoky and the casino is adjacent to the elevators, of course. It is a spa resort, but the spa is outrageously priced and the services are average at best. One thing to remember; Las Vegas in November is quite cold. Don't even think about walking on the strip at night without good outerwear. It gets down to the mid 30's F.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous-The Best of All in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nicolas617
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous, plush, beautiful. I am a former Encore/Wynn having stayed at those hotels 4 times - but won't stay there again now that Aria is in town. It's hard to imgaine how such a massive place can be so beautiful and intimate. This is my second time at Aria - and I wanted to stay again before writing my overall review. I had the overall same impressions on my first stay. But on the first stay I had a King room - that seemed to be reserved for Solo travelers. I was oddly shaped and had a tiny crooked window. Overall beaiutiful but too small for more than 1 night. This trip I got a double queen bed room - which was quite a bit larger. Not huge - but good. Nice size windows, wonderful bathroom. I would definitely go for this type of room in the future. Checked out the SPA - which is gorgeous. The African American guy at the desk of the gym was the only staff member who was disappointing. He has a real attitude, for a desk clerk. Loved the Patisserie, Liked the Thai Restauranta lot and Cafe Vettro was pretty good. All seemed more reasonably priced then Wynn/Encore. Buffet seems fine - but not as good as Wynn. Overall great place - but don't get the strange King room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: coffeesnob47
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel from the moment we entered the lobby. The Christmas decorations were beautiful and tasteful. Hotel staff excellent from beginning to end. The room was perfect as well - loved that it was a "smart" room. The bed was so comfortable and bedding luxurious. We will stay again on our next trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience of our lives”
Reviews.Author: FamoffourTucson
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many places, in many cities, on several continents. We have never, ever, felt the need to write a review for any reason, good or bad. Who has time for that!? Well, we do. This hotel was the absolutely most gorgeous luxurious and comfortable place we have ever stayed. Anywhere. The beds were incredible. The linens were incredible. Even the heated toilet seat was incredible. The two roll away beds for our two teenage sons were each a luxurious nest,with their own bathrobes, lofty pillowtops and every bit as amazing as our king bed. The view was gorgeous. The flowers in the lobby were world class. There was simply nothing that wasn't amazing. We will never stay anywhere else when next in Las Vegas. In fact, we will likely return just to stay again at the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: studiodekadent
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at Aria for my first ever trip to Las Vegas. I simply fell in love with the hypermodern architecture and technology, so in spite of the mixed reviews I decided to give this place a chance. To make a lame pun, that bet paid off. Every single space in the hotel looks modern, sleek, sophisticated and understated. The true spectacle comes from the futuristic architecture which is utterly amazing; Cesar Pelli designed Aria and he did a fantastic job. I'll always remember walking into the lobby which has this wonderful vanilla-sandalwood smell, and looking up through the skylight and seeing the glass towers against the Vegas sky. So strikingly beautiful. This is not the "tacky" Vegas of stereotypes. It is something different. That said, the somewhat restrained aesthetic may feel "cold" or "unwelcoming" to some. I tried the Twenty Dollar Trick. It didn't work, but I got a 53rd floor room with a strip view. Phenomenal. The room was done in whites, silvers, browns and blues; again all sleek and modern. The room control system was very high tech, although I rarely used it given I spent most of my time gambling. The casino was great. It felt like a classy nightclub; everything is decorated in browns, golds and silvers, with splashes of blues and purples to offset things. Its dark-ish, but I liked that... it felt suave and mysterious. I had some good luck and some bad luck at the Blackjack tables, but overall things were great. Cocktails (complimentary, thankfully) came every half hour or so, and delivered by attractive women wearing less skimpy outfits than the Bellagio waitresses. The dealers were very friendly. The pit supervisor even let me bet below the table minimum at a $50 table when the $25 table had filled up! By the end of my stay, I received complimentary late checkout as well as a significant food comp. They also let me take one of the coat hangers (yes, I asked). Service in the restaurants was overall very good. The hotel concierge was helpful. Given its a 4004 room hotel, I didn't get (nor did I expect) personalized service. So overall I think I got very good service for the kind of hotel I was at. What I truly found striking was the value. This is a very good hotel and I only paid 160 per night. I'm from Australia; in my home country this kind of hotel room would easily cost at least 250 to 300. Given the location, the aesthetics and the quality of the rooms, I think I got an excellent deal. My only real complaint is the beds. They were far too soft for my taste. I know many people love Aria's bedding, but for me its waaay to yielding. Additionally, Aria does feel slightly disconnected from the rest of the Strip; it isn't quiet by any means but it is clearly less energetic than most Las Vegas Strip resorts. I liked this, but some people may not enjoy it. Overall, Aria is a drastic aesthetic departure from the usual Las Vegas experience, and it looks fantastic. Fans of modernism will adore this place. Fans of architecture and cityscapes will be drooling. The restaurants are great, the bars have very nice cocktails, the casino feels suave and dramatic, and the overall atmosphere is very nice; elegant yet understated and completely devoid of the pretentious "euro neo-roccoco italiano" Bellagio/Wynncore paradigm which often dominates most people's ideas of 'high end Vegas.'

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room with geat view!”
Reviews.Author: Simli
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here whilst in Vegas! Fantastic room with great view of strip and friendly, approachable staff who will go out of their way to help you. Great casino and pool area also. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a fantastic and comfortable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Aria Resort & Casino - Absolute Best in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: travelling_heart143
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! 5 star most definitely! Best in Vegas! We stayed at the Aria from Nov. 28 - Dec. 5.. The location on the strip is perfect! We were warmly greeted at the check in line and didn't wait even a second for an agent. All our room requests were met with ease! We had a beautiful city view, non-smoking king room by the elevator (Room 24064). The beds are really comfortable and much needed after a long day in Vegas. Our room was cleaned immaculately every day! The buffet is an excellent value with great variety for everyone's taste. Room service is quick and delicious. Roasted Bean is fantastic for a coffee and breakfast to go. Cafe Vettro has the best fresh apple juice EVER! We loved playing at all the MGM casinos. Aria's casino is especially large and gorgeous! All staff are extremely friendly and professional especially the concierge, hotel security, restaurant waiters & room service personnel. We definitely would go back to the Aria again! A Vegas dream come true!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Eferino
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely amazing. Service is incredible and at times you don't feel like you're in Vegas! Valet was super fast with very professional attendants! Check in was smooth with no line, which was surprising because it was the Friday before the marathon/ rodeo/ weekend! Modern room with technologically advanced features lots of extra towels, 4 robes and amazing shower with a huge tub tucked behind it. The room controls take a second to figure out but totally worth it. The bellman even brought us an audio cord for the iPhone so we could listen to music through the system! Haze nightclub was fun and drinks are at a Vegas standard in price. The valet gave us comp passes after he found out we wanted to go that evening. Room service was tasty and hot when delivered. concierge was also amazing. Recommended social house which was at crystals (great food and service) and got us on the guest list at tryst nightclub at the Wynn. Casino is very modern and has all the games that I like to play. I could go on and on but I won't. I hope you all get the point. Give it a try. It's not kitchy Vegas. If you want that stay at the other dumpy hotels with pirate shows at the entrance or carnival theme casinos. This is class all the way with amazing service!

Reviews.Title: “New and improved !!”
Reviews.Author: pilo11
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself was fantastic in the sence it was new and had many technological features. The decor, design etc...was fantastic. However it lack atmosphere, the employees on some tables were BORING !, they seemed digruntled and very un-Vegas. i chose to play at planet hollywood for that fact. i recommend staying there without a doubt, but this hotel needs time to build its reputation and place on the strip. its definetley a work in progress. you could get similar at half of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, quiet, elegant room”
Reviews.Author: sunbunny31
Reviews.Content: The Aria is absolutely gorgeous. Since I traveled to the hotel as a member of a large group of people, the check in line was very long, but the staff circled around, providing water and offering to answer questions. This hotel is very new and top of the line. I had been offered a choice of a King room with smoking option or a room with two queens on a non-smoking floor, which is what I opted for. The room was beautiful. The entryway held plenty of storage - two closets and nice big drawers. There was a nice desk, with lots of plugs for computers and chargers, and under desk storage so that you could keep the clutter to a minimum. The beds were immaculate, and very comfortable. The big flat screen tv as well as the bedside clock are designed to allow you to control room options, such as wakeup settings (open drapes, turn tv on, turn on lights). The blackout curtain and sheer curtain on the floor to ceiling window are controlled by a touch panel (or the tv or clock). Really nice, and not difficult to figure out. What really stands out is the bathroom. It's intelligently a two sink bathroom, with a huge round tub that is set behind the shower. Frosted glass separates the toilet from the sink, while transparent glass separates the shower/bath from the sink. Complete privacy for the bathroom can be had by closing the main door. Gorgeous, immaculate tile and marble throughout. It was a pleasure to return to this room every night, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply awesome place to live on Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: Libra007
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel to stay and relax on business or leisure. the scale, design and facilities are just awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Tried Aria, but will return to Bellagio”
Reviews.Author: cboogles
Reviews.Content: We had always stayed in the Bellagio but tried Aria for this year's trip. The great aspects were: the bed-wonderful, the room cleaning service-thorough, and the hotel itself-beautiful. On the other hand...there was a pretty long wait to check in, the casino seems smaller, and the hotel location is quite a walk to the stip..... it doesn't look like it...but it is. It was a nice 4 nights...but we both said we would return to the Bellagio the next trip>

Reviews.Title: “INCOMPETENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: sierramadretravler
Reviews.Content: Troubles began with check -in. Offered a free buffet breakfast..."just charge to your room and it will be comped" and when we checked out, we had to stand in line and argue until it WAS comped. "Wait a while in your room, there is a birthday gift courtesy of the hotel arriving" NEVER found out what that might be, since nothing arrived. Small bathroom and room. Weak, bad drinks at the casino bars. Surely bartenders. All the stuff that you expect Vegas to get right, they get wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service- Management goes above & beyond.”
Reviews.Author: Vacationqueenm
Reviews.Content: My other half & I had checked into the Aria last week to celebrate our anniversary. We requested a king bed & late check-in. Upon arrival we were informed that there were no king size beds available. We went up to our room to find our room with double beds. The employee at the desk had offered no solutions to our dillemna. I immediately went to the Arias facevook page & complained. 9 am the next day the manager Patti had called apologizing for the incident offering us a much better room. The hotel immediately corrected our issue. Our room was amazing. We were also granted a late checkout (7pm) for half of our daily room rate. The food is excellent everywhere on the property including room service. We had an amazing stay at the Aria for the second time in the last 3 months. We are looking forward to returning next year. We would find it very difficult to stay elsewhere because of the excellent management, the amazing rooms, & central location.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice, but value wasn’t the best”
Reviews.Author: KeppenK
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and casino– ok location. Walking around City Center is unfortunate: signage is really bad- hard to navigate and get out onto the strip. By the second day we knew where to walk, but it took a while (even with our smart phones). Not like other hotels were you walk outside and there’s the strip. Rooms themselves were very nice: great beds and good linins. Down side is there was no coffee maker so you have to run downstairs where they charge you $5+ per cup (of regular black coffee). Technology that they brag about was slow, but still pretty cool. Bathrooms were nice and very roomy. Pool was great, too bad it was cold the days we were there, looked like they would be a lot of fun. Casio was nice, lots of marble and granite, appealing color scheme, and a nice layout. Very clean and the servers did a nice job too. Restaurants were pretty expensive and the quality was just okay, I wouldn’t recommend the Italian one we ate at, Sirio. I ordered the ravioli and was a little disappointed, I’m a small woman and for $40, I would expect to be full by the end of the meal, but was not. They did have homemade lemoncello and that was GREAT! Overall it was a nice experience but I don’t think I would stay there again. Too many other great hotels in Vegas with better locations and better values.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: chimp29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in September - corner suite - Ok, the technical stuff in the rooms is a little daunting - but WOW!!!!!! Fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “For sheer luxury at a great price, you cant beat this.”
Reviews.Author: iwaswayoff
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star hotel and it shows, so for the price it is good value. Try staying in a place like that anywhere else for under $200 per night. The casino floor is a bit boring, this is a hotel review. I was a bit shocked when I fiddled with the mini bar but they gladly did not charge me for everything I returned, which was nice of them. Floor to ceiling windows give some of the best views around. The pool looks nice. The crab legs are great in the very good for value buffet. There are complaints on here about the room service for cleaning. If anything, I kept getting messages saying they were trying to clean my room and to call through when I needed it done. There are different experiences that I will continue to try in LV. But for sheer luxury at a great price, you cant beat this.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: curly270
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick. Clean hotel and room. People were friendly. The Viva Elvis show was really good, and I normally despise Cirque shows. Only draw back was the restaurants. Todd English Pub, the food was good and the service was subpar. Don't bother going for the Cask beer, they NEVER have it the server told me. Beso, the food was subpar and the service was really good. The prices in ALL the restaurants were way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustJudie
Reviews.Content: As is the case with all huge Las Vegas hotels, this is a big, sort of impersonal hotel. We found the service to be adequate, but as I said, impersonal. However, that being said, this hotel is quite beautiful with a lot of really attractive architectural spots throughout. I enjoyed just walking around the hotel and the attached high end shopping mall just because there are unusual and attractive spots to see. At check-in we decided to upgrade to a corner (means its on a corner of the bldg and you have great views from all windows) one bedroom suite. We were not disappointed! Really lovely layout and the bathroom was to die for! Walls made only of glass looking out on all of L.V. , big deep jacuzzi tub, great shower, heated toilet seat with a nice bidet too! Nice comfy bed, and you can run the whole room from the TV set! Lighting, music, drapes etc. It was really futuristic! Had the buffet, it was good. Be sure to see the Chihooley (i know i am spelling it all wrong) glass collection in a gallery attached to hotel. Such beautiful blown glass creations you will not ever forget. Overall, the Aria is lovely, and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected rude service”
Reviews.Author: Segwayguy
Reviews.Content: My g/f and I stayed at Aria for 5 nights in early December. We got the wrong room number upon first arriving that set the tone for the stay. Upon getting into our room after a re-key my g/f and I went right down to the cafe to get some food after the flight. Our waiter was new and had a trainer. My chicken soup did not have any chicken and the waiter said he could not do anything so the manager said all you have to do is yell at the kitchen staff to get some chicken (we got another bowl). Guest services that is supposed to review your play seemed like a cool idea except that they were open banking hours only. Since we did not put down a CC upon arrival (just paid off our credit before booking the vacation), we were not allowed to get any erned comps. The system for getting comps for gambling excessively is by billing to your room (fixed that situation on the second day of the trip by giving my Bank Card). The systems don't update right away so in the restaurant and room service they didn't believe i had a card on file so jumping thru hoops and calling multiple departments was a common practice. Checking out was the last step to the stay and since the Guest Services is not open when we had to leave at 7am we could not get any comps that we earned. Yes, we missed our flight after i told them please hurry so we can get to the airport (35 minute checkout process). Asking for the manager once during the stay, I was denied access to a manager. This hotel should follow some of the established hotels like it's sister property NY NY. I will not ever recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Jenz99
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas 3 or 4 times a year and got my first chance to stay at Aria last week. Have stayed just about everywhere on the Strip, and it is not quite as nice as Encore or Palazzo but seems to have improved from early reviews. The only part of the room I was disappointed in was the bathroom - relative to other properties it was small, and tough for 2 people to be at the vanity at the same time. Also not a big fan of the bathtub and shower setup. My one other general complain is lighting - not much in the main room besides a reading light over the bed and a desk lamp. Talked to some of my colleagues also staying there I they had corner lamps, so maybe our room was missing that. Otherwise the bed was comfortable, loved the huge flatscreen HD TV and had no problems operating lights / shades. Room was also quiet - I know we had people on the other side of us but never heard them. I did enjoy the casino even though I did not win. Lighting has improved since I walked through during opening weekend, and the ventilation system does a good job dealing with the smoke. Good selection of tables, and several with lower limits since it was midweek. Did not get a chance to try any of the restaurants on property, but did eat one night at Social House in City Center and found that enjoyable and not terribly overpriced. If you can get a good rate I would not hesitate to stay at the property.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Playhouse”
Reviews.Author: brandigurl012
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a grand hotel located in a great place on the Vegas strip. Every room seems to have a view of some sort. Even though we couldn't get a corner room dedicated to see the strip, we got a deluxe king, where we could still enjoy the view of the strip and shopping center through the ceiling to floor windows. Alot of cool upgraded room features! The hotel has a huge gambling area, resturants, and sports bars.. Service is great and if you do need something don't forget to just ask! Easy check-in and check-out.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the nicest hotel we've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: glacierhiker
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Sky Suites and our view was looking toward the mountains - which we loved. Room is amazing with huge floor to ceiling windows, wonderful comfortable bed and bathroom with a bidet! When we arrived there was supposed to be a private limo to pick us up, no one at the airport seemed to know what this was about so we purchased a ticket on the hotel shuttle. 45 minutes later we arrive in the parking garage of the hotel and lug our bags up the escalator to the lobby for checkin. The wait wasn't too long but the hotel clerk was disinterested and barely made eye contact during the transaction. We asked about the limo pickup and she said we should have called first!? We booked for 5 nights and on the 3rd day we discovered that Sky Suite guests have a private lounge available with wine/cheese after 4pm and light continental breakfast in the mornings. We were never told this. But we enjoyed the service after we discovered it. Room service was terrific and twice daily maid service as well. The hotel restaurants, hmmm, well we ate at most of them and would not recommend any except for the Tapas place and the buffet was ok. The service in all but the tapas place was horrible horrible and the food yucky and overpriced. The worst meal was in the sports bar, they have a signature pork slider and it was soggy and cold and the server was surly. The pool is nice and the poolside service was ok. The pool closes at 5pm!! Don't know why but during our stay is was very cool in the morning so you couldn't really enjoy the pool until later afternoon and then they close at 5. There is a fitness center but you have to pay to use it. My husband used it once and the place was mostly empty except A-Rod was working out on the treadmill. I wonder if he had to pay too or if they paid him? Used the limo service to return to the airport and the service and car was 5-star.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel on Strip (decent Location)”
Reviews.Author: shaqquitta
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at the Aria because it was a new hotel on the strip. I have stayed at many hotels in Vegas (Palazzo, Venetian, Monte Carlo, MGM, Planet Hollywood, Excalibur, Hard Rock, Paris, Harrahs just to name a few) and this one is average. It may have been my high expectations of the hotel that didnt live up. The room was a little on the small side and the bathroom was clean, except for mildew around the tub. The location of Aria is great, there is a monorail that takes you to Monte Carlo and Bellagio. All the fancy bells and whistles of being computerized is over rated. I did not find it necessary to have all the lights controlled by one panel. I just want to be able to turn on and off the light on my side of the bed without walking to the lcd screen. The hotel itself was a bit dark for my taste. Service was ok, buffet was decent for the price. They do have crab legs. Overall an ok hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Full disclosure- I did not stay but...”
Reviews.Author: MossiDivo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel and City Center is absolutley beautiful, and the staff was very efficient and kind. We went to the casino to gamble but quickly wanted to leave as the scent that they pump into the lobby and gaming areas was absolutley putrid. The smell was like a strong perfume or cologne smell combined with kind of a tropical smell and an industrial cleaning smell as well. It got into our nose and sinuses and stayed for a couple of days and caused us to sneeze and cough for the next day.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Vegas ....First Class Vacation”
Reviews.Author: betdan
Reviews.Content: First let me say, we are not gamblers or looking for a bargain. Vegas hadn't been on my A-list because of this.... My husband picked the Aria because it was new. I read the reviews and was worried.............let me say I was not dissappointed at all.. it was clean, classy and friendly... Like everyone commented beds very very comfortable.... the only thing was the fridge was stocked and you were not allowed to use it for your own beverages.... We had breakfast in our room.......... jeannepierre pastries.........excellent.... expensive but worth the extra bucks..............The fitness center was extra but the pool area was awesome............ we were on the 28th floor and paid extra for a city view......well worth it.... We did several shows, the elvis at the aria very good................. highlight for me was Garth Brookes............and trisha.......... two and a half hours.......unbelievable........... Grand Canyon trip via plane with helicopter and boat ride.........expensive but worth every penny............. you were treated well, you felt you were with a reliable secured company and because you flew in an airplane to the helicopter area you did not waste the entire day in a bus........... the Aria's breakfast buffet was excellent,,,,,, it came free with our trip but well worth the fifteen dollars, if you eat all you can eat buffets............... they don't loose money on me but I enjoyed it very much... We spent seven nights there/////// most people think that is way to long for a vegas vacation but we will do it again and hopefully at the Aria. I think once the word it out the cost will rise..................

Reviews.Title: “Great value - nicely run operation”
Reviews.Author: socaltripper
Reviews.Content: On a Friday at about 4pn, check in took about 5 minutes. Our room still had a new feel about it and was nice. As far as the technology aspects of the room go, you get used to it. Overall, we found the Aria to be clean and nicely run. There, we saw the Elivs show, which was good entertainment. We ate at the following in-house venues: Cafe Vettro (a nice breakfast and good service) Skybox Sports Bar and Grill (a good turkey burger and chicken panini sandwhich) and Jean Phillippe Patisserie (very good baked goodies and coffee for breakfast or desert on the go) Todd English's P.U.B. (good fish 'n chips, sliders and plenty of beer with a fun laid back aptmosphere). Walking places - We went to Bellagio via the Aria tram and also walked the strip to New York New York. Walking to NY-NY took about 20 minutes. From NY-NY you can cross the strip via pedetrian bridge to MGM and access to the monorail which runs down most of the strip. Look for deals on this place. We had a mailer with $100 of free resort credit and a good room rate. We used the resort credit for meals and had no issue with billing. This made our stay not only pleasant, but a great value. We'll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service ruined my stay at a beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ArlenePrince
Reviews.Content: I paid for 3 rooms for a special birthday getaway and was promised a sweet treat would be sent to my room. One of the keycards didn't work, so the front desk sent up a new set 20 minutes later and they didn't work either. Bellman recommended I call engineering instead of the front desk because it would take longer instead offering some assistance. I called the front desk and they said security would have to come up and let me in the room. She stated she would compensate me $50.00 food and beverage. Several minutes later a woman from security showed up and watched make use cards that did not work. She used her card to let me and told me I had to call the front desk and tell them the cards needed to be recoded. I left the empty room open while I went to check on my other guests settling in and security followed me to their room. They were having problems with opening the curtains and I asked security to help. Her only reponse was "this is new technology and I can't come in the room to help, but I should not have left that other room open." I told her why would I close a door to a room that does not have my belongings in it knowing I can't get back into it unless she lets me in!! At that point I fed up with this drama and walked the long walk to the front desk to ask for a manager, but I was shuffled to another far away desk to be assisted by an employeed who was not a manager. After explaining it to him he said he would give me new cards for the room. I insisted that I did not want to walk up there to try the 3rd set of cards that did not work and if I did I wanted to be the night free. So, I tried the 3rd set of cards and of course it did not work, but the only person to witness this was a maid named Shelia who was cleaning a room a couple of doors down. She let me in the room and I explained to her what happended and she empathized and apologized for the other staff not doing more to help. She called down to the front desk for me to help speed things up, eventually I had to request a new room because I had spent over an hour trying to get into a room I paid for. Front desk said the card I had had been recoded for the new room. So Shelia and I go to the new room and of course those cards did not work. She let me into that room and I asked for a manager to be sent up to the rooms to see the problem I was having. I was put on hold for several minutes while a new set of cards came up that worked. Eventually, the manager came to the phone and I asked for the room to be compensated for the room and they gave me 1 of the 2 nights free. She really did not apologized for the bad service, but encouraged me to go out and have a good time. Eventually I received some chocolate strawberries and Shelia left me a personal birthday note and toiletries because she saw all of the drama I had to endure. The Hotel is beautiful and the bed is out of this world!! The casino is the best to gamble in because it does not smell smoky. Makeup artist at salon was wonderful! The bathroom shower needs a nonslip surface instead of marble and 2 of the rooms had a dirty view that I paid extra for. I would visit the casino, but would have to pass on staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but we got a shock when we got home!”
Reviews.Author: Isky
Reviews.Content: This place is huge but fantastic! My husband arrived earlier in the day, and I could not get to the elevator without a key card so I had to go to the front desk and get one. The heater would not work so an engineer had to come to the room and fix it. He was quick and it worked perfectly after that. Request a room near the elevator, because this place is gigantic! The breakfast and lunch meals I had in the conference rooms were excellent and the servers were very nice since I arrived as they were putting the food up. We got an extended check-out until 1:00pm. When my husband went to check-out, they would NOT give him a $0 balance bill of the room, which we found odd, so we took names and titles of those working the front desk. We stay in about 20 hotels a year and always get the bill balance, never checking out on the remote tv or putting key cards in collection boxes. Two days after we got home, our American Express had a $300 bill from the hotel. After a few calls, we got an apology letter and a credit to our account. They also offered a free one night stay, but my husband refuses to go back. I know new hotels have kinks, but this property had been open for about 11 months, so employees have been trained properly, or we assumed. All in all, I liked this hotel. It is in a great location between the Bellagio and Monte Carlo. The tram in between the two properties is free. The room is spectacular with drapes closing and lights going out at night with the push of one button. We saw the Elvis show inside the hotel and it was pretty good. I'm not a big Elvis fan, but we had time to kill before our red eye flight and the show started at 7:30ish, getting us out early. A friend in our group needed the business center, but refused their service after hearing it was $1 an hour.

Reviews.Title: “More than we could have imagined!”
Reviews.Author: Helper_One
Reviews.Content: Was comped our limo ride, suite stay and all meals during Nov/Dec. Was amazed with the quality of the suite. Clean and tidy and well organized. My husband feel in love with the heated toilet seat. I loved the view...mountain view with the sunrise and the sunset really showing off how beatiful the distant mountains are. The casino was lovely and quite and we didn't experience a lot of children, who we believe shouldn't be in a casino. Machines were plentiful and offered a great variety. All of our meals were at the Aria and each one was a new. unique experience that would not disappoint anyone. We are looking forward to our return in the near future. BTW...the service by everyone in the hotel, restaurants and casio were superior and we couldn't have asked for anything more. Our casino host, Danielle, was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: coso333
Reviews.Content: I was able to check in just after 10 AM. My bags were promptly brought up to my room, along with a bag of ice. The front desk gave a good explanation of how the minibar sensors worked and the bellman described how the electronic room controls worked. I had a good feeling for how the automation in the room functioned as well as knew not to take anything out of the refrigerator to look at it. It was very cool to have the drapes open, lights & music come on upon entering the room for the first time. I found it easy to control lighting, HVAC, window coverings as well as the TV. The individual lights do have switches on them, so you can turn off a light just by walking over to it and switching it off. If you leave it on, you then have to use the automated controls. The public spaces of the hotel are contemporary & well done. The artwork is beautiful. When I was in other parts of the hotel apart from the casino, I did not feel like I was in Las Vegas. It felt more like a contemporary city hotel. I had a hard time rating cleanliness as perfect, as when I arrived in the room, the floor wasn't vacuumed. After notifying housekeeping of this, they had it taken care of within 10 minutes. The bathroom & bedding were very clean, however, which is more important to me than some crumbs on the floor! Other than the minor housekeeping flaw, I found Aria to be an outstanding option for Las Vegas accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine staying anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: jbidder
Reviews.Content: I am now Aria's biggest fan. I'm so glad that I listened to the reviewers on trip advisor and gave this place a chance. Upon arrival, I saw a young lady who used to work at the Riviera a few years back; she's still the nicest reservationist ever - Sheeliya. As stated by other reviewers, it took me a while to get used to the window shades and lights. However, once I got it, I was overjoyed. I also loved the tub and robes in the room. The only issue that I had with this hotel was the expensive food. I was so thirsty that I drank a $4.50 sprite. Coffee and a danish was another $12 or $14 and the buffet was 39.95 and most of the food was cold; not the best. Plus the cashier was Very nasty; she needed someone to give her a lesson or two in customer service. I also loved teh casino, very clean and the machines were not that tight.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL BUT TOO BIG”
Reviews.Author: rika13In
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge no personal service - had to wait in line 45 minutes to register with reservations. Very beautiful and trendy - wait in line for everything, food, drinks, etc. The bars and drinks are excellent - just very busy....

Reviews.Title: “A pain rather than hip.”
Reviews.Author: Patagonia8
Reviews.Content: 1) If you drive, be prepared to walk from the self parking garage carting all of your luggage to the opposite end of this huge hotel in order to check in. 2) Then when you are in your room, be prepared that you cannot turn on your own reading light and changing the TV channels is a totally tedious event (and this was so for my husband who is totally at ease with new technology). EVERYTHING works through a master touch screen controller which exists on one side of the bed so that one person only has control to the lights, heat, television, etc. The most frustrating is the long processing time the controller takes each time you want to change a channel. Another inconvenience is that the Aria has only $15.00 minimum Blackjack tables whereas the Bellagio had many $10.00 minimum tables. This hotel tries to be hip but is a pain. On the brighter side, the food was lovely, reception folks helpful, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Check in time-Extremely DISSATISFYING”
Reviews.Author: 808HAWAII123
Reviews.Content: DO NOT try to check in between the hours of 12 midnight through 6:00am, you'll be screwed! They will charge you for an additional night. If your check in was on Wednesday, their check in time is from 7:00am. They DO NOT have early check ins. I was charged for an additional night which was approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes until their check in time. We just arrived from a long flight with 1 stop over and we even tried to kill 2 hours but my mother in law and I were extremely exhausted from the flight. I paid for the additional night because my mother in law had to lay down and rest. She couldn't wait any longer and I didn't want her to collapse of fatigue. The manager was adamant and would not make an exception for me because he already made an exception for me to check in early at 5:00am. So I paid $100 something more for an hour and 15 minutes!( Note: I met another couple who arrived at the hotel around 2:00am too and they weren't charged for an additional night. The same manager made an exception for them.;) It was just a matter of an hour and 15 minutes more! I've been to other hotels on the strip, Treasure Island, Mirage, Venetian, Encore, MGM, Luxor, and Monte Carlo and have NOT ever been treated the way ARIA treated me. So I WOULD NOT EVER recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and amazing spa - loved it again but room for service improvement”
Reviews.Author: LuvRingo
Reviews.Content: At check-in there were no places for check-in, only check-out (they do have a roped area for people to line up now at the check-in/check-out area). We got in the line and when we got to the window, there was some confusion because I had cancelled a reservation and rebooked at a lower rate through my husband’s players card. It took the girl about 10 minutes to find the correct reservation. We decided to upgrade to a panoramic corner suite for an extra $75 per night and had room 16-049. We weren’t super high and we were only a few floors above the parking structure behind Monte Carlo and a couple roof tops but it didn’t bother us. The room has a half bath near the entrance, a beautiful living room area with a flat screen TV, views of the strip and the front area of Aria from the front window. The side window looked toward MGM Grand. The living room had the normal mini-fridge full of snacks and alcohol. You can set a code on it to keep it locked. There is also an empty mini-fridge that we stocked with water. The bedroom had a king sized bed – and it is the most comfortable bed EVER. We own a Bellagio bed and we’re trying to figure out how we can fit a king sized bed in the guest room so we can get a 2nd king size bed and get the Aria bed  The view was of the Aria pool and there were people out there swimming in the chilly weather! Nice sized flat screen TV on the wall. The bathroom has the toilet with a separate door – biggest surprise being the heated toilet seat. The toilet also had controls for a front or back wash, dry and oscillating. Stand up shower – lots of room with a bench and great water pressure. The vanity was on the corner – so there was a sink and mirror on each side of the corner of the room. Lots of room for my makeup, hair products, etc. There is a deep tub in the other corner of the bathroom that looks out the panoramic windows in that room. View of the Monte Carlo pool area to the side and out toward the strip at the front of the bathroom. There was a small flat screen tv in the bathroom as well. I went to the spa the day we arrived for a 25 minute Vichy Shower with a salt scrub. The therapist was amazing. This was my 2nd Vichy at Aria and I really enjoyed it again. Having smooth, soft skin is the bets way to start a vacation! 2nd day in town, we purchased two day passes to the spa so we could enjoy the amenities. We love the co-ed portions of the spa. The meditation rooms are extremely relaxing (as long as other guests realize these aren’t rooms for chatting). We stayed outside in the therapy infinity pool for over an hour just relaxing and enjoying the hot water and jets. After our time at the spa, I went to the gym to work out – the gym is a top notch facility. 3rd day in town, we both had massages. Hubby had the 50 minute signature massage – he said it was great and he looked pretty relaxed after. I had the 50 minute hand, foot and scalp massage and I loved it! The therapist was awesome. They used a hot oil on my scalp and in my hair…if you ever get this massage – put shampoo in your hair before wetting your hair to get the oil out after the massage. One of my goals of this trip was to purchase a spa robe – I’m so excited they sell them now! I love my robe! We sat in the fireside lounge and watched a little football before heading back to the room. This was our 2nd trip to Aria and we absolutely love the hotel. It’s beautiful and comfortable and is the top spa in our opinion. For the most part, service was good – not as great as our last trip. The one disappointment was the day before we left, housekeeping didn’t replace our shampoo, conditioner and shower gel and they also took our bathrobes and never replaced them. I use the robes whenever I’m in the room so I was annoyed that I wasn’t able to lounge around in the robe.

Reviews.Title: “flawless”
Reviews.Author: jaydelaney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must stay for las vegas, from restaurants to the bars to the casino it was all flawless, the staff were fantastic very very helpful considering it was a 10 minute walk from our hotel to our reception if we ever needed anything teh staff had it there in 5 somehow. the rooms are flawless and i have already ordered one of the beds, the panoramic suites are a must. will be booking with Aria when i hopefully return to Las vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: safetyman65
Reviews.Content: Although i used Tripadvisor before my stay, this is my first review and is an opinion of an average 40 something couple who have just returned from a weeks stay at Aria. Tis was our first time in Vegas. Pro's On arrival to the Hotel, we were advised that as it was my partners birthday, we were upgraded to a 54th floor strip view room, which was fantastic! Complimentary Chocolate covered Strawberries were also delivered to the room on our first day. We found the check in very quick and all staff polite and efficient during our stay and the hotel spotlessly clean throughout. Con's Pretty cold atmosphere in the bars of the hotel and all very very expensive. Tried the Aria Buffet on one occasion and found the food to be very bland, so did not try it again. Overall the hotel was a great base for our first Vegas stay, but ate mainly at Bellagio and Monte Carlo hotels. For fun, good old fashioned vegas, try Bills Gamblin Hall.. Great band playing at night, good priced drinks, great atmosphere and service. We also watched the show KA which was incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Service with an Attitude”
Reviews.Author: Collisionwork
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend at the Aria. We stayed in a corner suite and got a package through SW. We normally stay at the Encore, but wanted to try a new experience. The service is cold, unprofessional and unfriendly. The hotel is large and you're made to feel like one of thousands of guests and it really doesn't matter if you come back again. The staff is trained to say "no" or "I'm sorry there is nothing I can do" to any request. If you have stayed at the Wynn or Encore you will be sorely disappointed...We will never stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Aria Sky Suite--Oh La La!!!”
Reviews.Author: lindz3
Reviews.Content: Loved this suite! 1100 sq feet of gorgeous luxury! Totally private. My husband loved our suite and I believe he was extra fond of it because it was has a very masculine vibe going on. In fact, the whole hotel ooozed manliness. We were greeted by a driver with a stretch limo and taken to a private check in area. The girl behind the desk wasn't too friendly, but who really cares about that (I'm not looking for friendship...all I want is to be checked into our room)! We stayed in 33022 which faced Planet Hollywood and the new Cosmopolitan Hotel (next visit for sure!). Our room rate was not cheap, I believe with tax and resort fee, etc. it was $400.00 The room was exceptionally clean (no bed bugs to be seen and believe me, I checked). The only drawbacks were the lack of good shopping in the hotel and there were not a ton of restaurants within the hotel. The pool was pretty nice. Ample towels. Chairs were comfy. There were not very many servers at the pool, but it was not really "in season" to be at the pool anyhow. The other guests with whom I spoke were very pleased with their rooms too! The spa was nice. I prefer the Encore spa because it has a real "WOW!" factor. We loved the Jules Serano restaurant (Spanish)! REmember there is a nice tram service that will take you all the way to the Bellagio. It runs every 3 minutes or so. Still, my favorite place to stay in Vegas is in a suite at the Wynn, but this hotel is my husband's favorite. Check out my other reviews, we usually stay in 4 and 5 star hotels. This hotel is a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Winning money does make the food taste better.”
Reviews.Author: TCHermosa
Reviews.Content: When your gambling winnings pay for everything and more, it can affect the review. The food tastes better, view a little better, service a little friendlier. But that being said, it was a great place for a great weekend. At check in, there was a long line, although it only took 20 mins. But having friendly cocktail servers serving comped Stellas and Becks in line started everything out nice. Room was great, even though someones gum was stuck on the carpet and they didnt remove it when asked. The casino/restaurants/walkways/citycenter are modern and phenomenal. The floors, the colors/designs were like nothing else I've seen. Small but comfortable sports book, with as good of TV screens as anywhere, paid off handsomely. Food was great everywhere, especially the french cafe with pastries and crepes. Even though the maid removed my fresh raspberry tart(without picking up my fork off the floor---did he/she just eat it??)--so they took my food, but not the old gum off the floor?? Small stuff, I will definitely stay here again, just certainly wouldnt leave valuables/food/cash in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: gurt29
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here I was a bit worried about our stay in the Aria. However these were soon dispelled. Check in was very quick for a Friday evening as we were seen almost straight away. Then we were offered an upgrade to a city view room for an extra $15 a night. We jumped on this offer and were glad of it afterwards as the view was really cool. We had a window on the 20th floor looking out to the leaning apartment blocks, Crystal shopping center, the Monte Carlo plus MGM & New York New York in the distance. The automated lights and curtains were impressive particularly as we set it as our alarm clock for the following day. It still didn't make it easier to get out of that extremely comfortable bed; very welcoming after a tough night! The room is an extensively stocked minibar holding every thing from Belgium chocolates to champagne and a “Romance Kit”. We were warned at the main desk that it was weight sensored and not to touch anything as it would then be charged to the room. The bath incased behind the shower was a decent size while the shower had good pressure. I also liked the toilet behind the frosted door in the bathroom. The hotel itself is pretty big (like most things in Vegas) with 17 restaurants. We ate one night at Sage which was really, really good. Bill came to about $180 for a starter, 2 mains & a desert but the most expensive part were the drinks which probably cost at least half of the bill. Service was great and the food superbly tasty. My boyf made use of the Absinthe offered as a desert option which came with quite a show-well worth it! We didn’t get to use the pool due to the weather so I can’t comment on that, also didn't visit the spa as that cost an extra $30 per day. All in all a great stay-helped by the fact that we won a little on the blackjack tables!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dougj210
Reviews.Content: At McCarren Airport following a 3-night stay at Aria. Loved the hotel. Beautifully designed and executed. My stay got off to a rough start when the requested non-smoking room was not available. I was given a smoking room that had been heavily smoked in. My friends received the same, but their rooms were manageable. My was really nasty. The claimed to have no other rooms, and offered to have the room ionized. But it never happened. So the first night was not the best night I've ever spent in a hotel. But the next day I decided to upgrade to a corner suite - a non-smoking suite - and it was amazing. My impression of the hotel did a 180 immediately. It appears Aria has problems honoring requests for non-smoking rooms. We ate in several restaurants. All excellent. The quality of the food and service was very good. Especially for a hotel of that size. My friends loved the spa. Said it was first class. So all in all, other than the non-smoking room debacle, it was a great stay. And I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Aria is luxurious, fun and exciting!”
Reviews.Author: Mhb7
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Aria Suites which are fabulous - the decor, the amenities, the space - everything was great. I have stayed in many casinos in Las Vegas and what I loved about Aria was that it was fresh, white and very modern - a big contrast from some other places that seem to be decorated so heavily. I ate in several of their restaurants and the food and service was impeccable. One waitress remembered not only my face, but what kind of tea I drank! The fact that it is located in City Center was the best. It gave me access to great shopping, other casinos and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: monsoon34
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas with my sis for her birthday, and stayed at the Aria for 4 nghts - great value for money. We had stayed at the Venetian before, but decided to try Aria this time. Rooms are very nice, modern. Not too big, bathroom nice, modern, though I didnt much care for the glass toilet door. Beds are heavenly like sleeping on a cloud! Staff are all nice an friendly. Pool was beautiful, not too crowded, and plenty of sunbeds. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Aria Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ANZO
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Aria Hotel in Vegas. What a great time! The rooms, service, food, espresso, even the slots were great. Made enough at the slots to pay for our room, which we enjoyed at a slightly reduced rate. Would go again in a minute, and will probably head there again in January. Customer service folks went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. We especially enjoyed having the espresso/bakery near the room/suite elevators. Great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Service- Will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: KRSTucson_Az
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at Aria. I'm a regular visitor to Vegas, about a weekend a month. Always stay at Palazzo or Wynn. I assumed it would be a similar experience here. I encountered the worst service ever upon check in on Friday. At the reception desk I verified the room was a "non-smoking" double. The desk person was fairly friendly, although offered no information other than the only room available in the hotel was on the 11th floor as the property was fully booked, I accepted the room and went upstairs. Upon entering the smoke filled room with ashtrays I realized we were issued a smoking room. I called the check in desk. I was told that was the only room in the hotel that had two double beds and they could not move us. I asked to speak with the general manager , I was on hold a long time, then answered as follows, " our general manager went home as it is getting late and there is no one else to talk with". My response was that it is a very large hotel they certainly should move us to a non smoking room that was reserved a month prior. I was again told that nothing could be done about the room change. In addition, the rooms are small, good design, except the bathroom is a one person at a time ( two sinks in a 4' long vanity?), and the shower and tub are both in one stall. Lots of glitz and glamour, not a comfortable experience overall. A 16 oz bottle of water is $ 8.00. Would never go back. Although there is one bright spot in City Center, had lunch at the Mandarin Oriental, what a great dining experience and well worth the money! I certainly will tell my friends about my weekend at Aria ( don't stay there! ).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and what we expected and then some”
Reviews.Author: jennlh413
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Aria on Sunday 11-14 and stayed for 4 nights. It was awesome from the moment we walked in. We checked in at the invited guest area and at first it was somewhat slow because I don't really think the lady there knew what she was doing. But within about 20 min we were checked in and went to the room on the 52nd floor and the last room on the floor. We got a corner suite and it was outstanding. The living room area looked out at the mountains and the bedroom and bathroom looked out to the strip and Cosmopolitian. All we could say when we walked in was WOW! I am not sure why people would complain about the Aria... come on people... lights do burn out from time to time, batteries do die in the remotes and there sure are not many hotels or resorts in Vegas that have ever had coffee pots in the rooms other than maybe a couple in downtown Vegas!! Vegas costs money, food is not cheap and if you are looking for cheap then either dont go to vegas or stay downtown! I went to the spa and got an awesome massage from a guy named Serge.. wow... awesome. We ate at Lemongrass and it was wonderful...the buffet for breakfast was great too and tons of selections.. the skybox grille was very good too. same with cafe vettro. the casino was nice and very large. the dealers for the most part were very nice and friendly, some of them just had looks on their faces saying that they were bored or something was just not right in their world! the table min were pretty standard for the size of the resort and the beauty... I dont think $10 min for anything is that bad to be honest.... if you are looking for smaller min then go downtown for $3 a hand... We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms but the Casino had no life to it. "Its not your money Laprice"”
Reviews.Author: FunTimes18
Reviews.Content: The moment I stepped foot into this hotel I loved it. The smell was vanillary but I prefered that then old stale cigars and damp carpet smell I found at other casinos/hotels. The casino had no life to it, no one was yelling "yayy or woohoo or laughing" the reason for this I think was because the Aria was taking everyones money. I had much better fun gambling downtown at the Golden Nugget and all the other surrounding casinos. The drink ladies came more often and the dealers were helpful and fun and were more willing to give their employers money away rather than the tight Aria! I loved the rooms, very upscale and plenty of room. I couldnt say a better word about house keeping. Twice a day - once in the day after I had made a mess getting ready for the day activities and then once at night after I got ready for my night out on the strip. The Union Restaurant was the BEST. Excellent service, food to die for and cocktails you couldnt even imagine. I had a berrylicious cocktail, one that bubbled and had dry ice so it also had steam on the surface - very impresive. The price was very expensive, but if you can afford to splash out I would reccomend. The pastry shop was yummy also, splurged out on a couple of pastries while I was there. Scoot City Tours is a must!!!! A great way to see the other side of Las Vegas (residential houses and the desert). So much fun honestly. Premium Outlets is the place to shop - I got all my going out clothes from there. CVS is where I shopped for alcoholic beverages to drink while in my room. LAX, Pure, Haze and XS were great clubs! But by the third night I was tired of the night club scenery, we all ended up in the small bars with live music, karaoke or even the piano bar was good. The Aria hotel was close to everthing and central, I would reccomend this place and would defanitly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never met up to all the hype”
Reviews.Author: acap14
Reviews.Content: We chose the Aria during our recent trip to Vegas for our 12 year anniversary. It was our first time to stay, and definitely our last. We arrived only to discover that the hotel's computer systems were down so they were doing manual check-ins, which meant the line to do so was long. Customer reps in the lobby were advising guests to leave their luggage with the bell desk, explore the strip and come back later. So we did just that..we explored Hoover Dam. Came back about 4 hours later, only to find that the line had gotten longer. So we stayed in line and finally were able to check in and when we did, the customer rep did not offer an apology for the wait or offer anything to us for the inconvenience. Not even a free breakfast voucher at the local cafe. All she did was reiterate that the mini bar in the room was weight-sensored so we would be charged if anything was touched. Done. We then went up to our room and called the bell-desk for our bags. I was on hold for 25 minutes, when a bell-desk associate finally picked up. It took 1 hour to get our backs up to our room. We were tired from the exhausting day, so we climbed in bed to nap for the late evening and we then realized that our pillows had make up on them. It was apparent that none of our sheets had been changed. We felt disgusting. We called house keeping and asked if they could come to change our sheets and they said they would send the floor supervisor right away. We waited 45 minutes and had to call house-keeping again to remind them, and they finally came. They did not apologize for the dirty sheets. They came, replaced them and left. And just as a side note, they do not offer complimentary wi-fi and their water pressure is poor. We will never stay at this hotel again. I think the Aria has all the hype it needs to grab first time go-ers, but the hype is where it ends. They need to learn some lessons on customer service from their fellow long-time hotels like Treasure Island or the Bellagio. Huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “no singing here”
Reviews.Author: anubis10
Reviews.Content: The service is horrible. Nobody knows much of anything. Stayed twice and have returned to Bellagio. Rooms and bed are excellent however.

Reviews.Title: “Scam with Book 3 nights get one free”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinRizzo
Reviews.Content: I went online to book 3 nights at Aria. I purposely did it directly with them because they told me that I will never get any "Players Rewards" credit if I book through a travel site. (Travelocity etc). They were offering a deal of book 3 nights get the 3rd night free. The rate was not only different by the time we showed up, it also around 239.00 a night for the two "paid nights " and only around 139.00 for that third night which was free. They charged me for all three nights anyway and it took several calls to get them to credit the 3rd night. Most people would have not took the time, let alone notice the charge, to pursue the credit due on a credit card. Aria is overrated, too big, too expensive for what it is. I am a loyal MGM resorts customer and I'd stay at any of their properties over this one.

Reviews.Title: “42nd wonder of the world”
Reviews.Author: panwestern
Reviews.Content: awesome, fantastic in my families opinion is the best way to desrcribe this hotel ( complex ) if your into new, modern, and quality style, then this hotel is for you. from our suite ( 2 bedroom city view) to the lobby to the pool area, we were impressed. The layout of the sky suites and the hotel in general is well thought out. I saw it twice from afar during the construction period and the construction, materials used is impressive now that ive finally seen the inside... This place is much nicer then the belagio without all the posers and snobs. The pool area had the vibe and atmosphere of the valley Ho hotel in scottsdale ( best pool scene ever ) yet reminded me off passing the time poolside in miami. My daughter loved the pool and although it was getting to be winter in vegas the shallow nature of the pool kept the water nice and warm. Only one of the pools was open but pool service was attentive despite the limited crowd. Lots of cabanas and ill try that next summer. My wife enjoyed the spa while i enjoyed draft beer and internet poolside and our daughter the water, suprisinglly although the hotel does not seem to cater to children ( no kids meals anywhere, and no discounts for children at buffet, a significant downer ) a number of kids were around and our daughter made friends easilly. Our room was impresive from the moment we walked in, hit the button and the drapes open or close automatically lights come on and dim according to taste. The 2 bedroom suite has 4 tv' s and u walk into the living area, beside which, seperated by a wall is an eating area for 6 and a small island style bar, sink area. with an extra fridge for your own stuff. ( thanks we loved that feature ) behind which was a 2 peice bath. on either end we had a bedroom with an adjoining huge bathroom and walkin closet. Nice!!! The bed was great and just let you sleep, and if u had to much free beer at the tables u got up and jumped in the steam shower to melt away the fuzz, class act! hit the auto drape and watch the vegas skyline while snoozing for a few more minutes. grab the 2 papers that come with the room and sit in your living room and watch the traffic coming up the wide lane highway coming up from the street reminicent of one of those moscow heavy arms or chinese parade squares. The flow of vehicles is something to behold and the coolest is watching the "pez" dispenser taxi cab loading area as the cabs come up a ramp from an unseen parkade... very cool. I have no tips for saving money, as this hotel is similarlly priced to most MGM's, special mention is the lemon grass where we had the best thai meal in years... Room service is an extra 4 bucks, but if u have a share plate in the other restaraunts they nail u an extra 3 bucks... of course vegas portions, so its easier to share and we found oursleves spending less on room service then going downstairs... Pancakes were heavenlly. Of course being vegas they dont have a coffee maker in the room something which is a must in my opinion and seriouslly lacking... What do these people really think that i will gamble a couple of hundred while i have to run downstairs to an buy an overpriced cup of java.... or that a coffee maker in my room will keep me out of the casino??? We found out later we could have requested a coffee maker??? I thought all the staff were very friendlly including the maids who were very serious about keeping you happy, security would actually joke with you and most staff made you feel special. We did have a number of communication problems with the VIP services and i have read on other comments people have compalined about service and i attribute this to growing and opening pains as some of these people are inexperienced... however if given the opportuntiy the staff made it right. The experience of viewing this massive complex from inside and enjoying the "newness" is well worth the money. If u can afford it go with the sky suites and they will limo you to and from the airport from the fleet of 30 + limos owned by the hotel. Sky suites also has a coffee and snack lounge which was free and easy to get coffee from in the morning. The wine and cheese held every night was sparselly attended but a nice touch. Free internet in my suite?? an beer was 7 bucks or 15 bucks for the 24oz cup. Enjoy im sure you'll be impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Haven of Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: JanBerlin
Reviews.Content: Having booked "Aria" for a great rate through travelzoo.com, we were more than satisfied with the stay. In fact, having checked out all the major hotels (except the highest end resorts Mandarin Oriental and Four Seasons), we thought that we booked the best one available. The location right on the strip near "Bellagio" and "Paris, Las Vegas" can't be beat. Our arrival was not hassle-free: no bell staff at hand, check-in took ages because there was a group of three walk-ins in front of us, two lamps in our room not working and in a nightstand we found sports trousers, a key chain and cell phone charger from a previous guest (so much for thorough housekeeping). From then on, we had no problems whatsoever. The resort is thankfully totally stripped down from any kitsch and every area is very tastefully designed. Breakfast buffet (brunch, in fact) was unexpensive and featured the widest variety we have ever seen. We didn't like the fact, that, though staff was present, noone stopped people from cutting the - sometimes quite long - line outside the restaurant. "Julian Serrano" tapas restaurant was outstanding. Best feature, though, was the room: the greatest bed, totally sound insulated (first time we found a room like that in the U. S.), spacious and with a gorgeous Strip view. We would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Aria!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoPokerGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Aria for 3 nights and we would definitely go back! Not only did we get a good price, our room was also extremely comfortable and spacious. We checked in late (around 6:30 pm) and we asked for a non-smoking room, near the elevator, with a city view. The only one available at that time was on the 8th floor – lower than we preferred – but we were told that we could move the next day to a higher floor. Once we got in our room, though, we decided just to stay. We liked the fact that the room was quite close to the elevator and we had a view of the strip and the fountain out front. The room was clean as new, but the outside of the floor-to-ceiling windows were so dirty that we could hardly see through them when the sun was shining! What a shame! We loved the pillows and the bed was extra comfortable. The remote control was convenient sometimes and a bit of a hassle sometimes too. The room safe was great – it’s in the nightstand drawer – very convenient! Also you can just press a button near the room’s door to light up “Privacy” or “Service” message outside. The room was always cleaned well and on time. We ate breakfast in the buffet one morning and it was very good, we had to wait in line a short time to get in, but once in it did not seem crowded at all. Unfortunately the weather was just a little too cold for the pools, but we went anyway and just walked around and enjoyed the beautiful setting. There is an outside bar and a nice hot tub area too. We enjoyed the casino and there was a constant flow of complimentary beverages offered – we always gave a $1 tip per drink. Be sure to ride the free monorail that connects Aria/Crystals to the Bellagio and the Monte Carlo. To board it, walk out of the Aria lobby near the Todd English Pub (which is very good, by the way), go into the Crystals shopping mall and take the elevator to the 4th level. – the boarding platform.
