It’s a fun little ride, but if you’re just going to the Monte Carlo, you’re better off walking through the Aria Casino which connects to the Monte Carlo “Street of Dreams” and food court. Here you will find Starbucks, Sbaaro, McDonalds, Haagan Daz, etc. During our stay, we saw the Cirque de Soleil Viva Elvis show – it was a lot of fun – great music, energy and amazing talent! (look for half-price tickets across the strip and the “Tix 4 Tonite” booth. We bought our half-price tickets a couple of hours before the Thursday night show and still got great seats. Aria offers guests 30% off the show. Bottom line – definitely consider a stay at the Aria – you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably expensive, yes.....horrible, no!”
Reviews.Author: matthewgrant1982
Reviews.Content: Every review I have ever composed starts out the same, allow me to tell you what kind of person I am before I start talking. I am a 27 year-old male (married) who is not that hard to please, but I do enjoy luxury at a reasonable price. Having said that, let's proceed with what you really want to hear. The Aria hotel sits between the Bellagio and the Monte Carlo. During my stay, we chose a standard deluxe room (nothing fancy, but still nice)......just to lay our heads down, since we would spend little time there. Rooms are high tech, very comfortable, and the beds are heavenly! The bathrooms are awesome, I loved the design. Upon check-in, we waited about ten minutes.... which isn't that bad, but we checked in on a Sunday. They brought our bags to our room, the staff was very friendly and very professional. Room service was nice, but pricey in my opinion....keep in mind you are at a 5 diamond resort and it is Vegas pricing. Large selection of places to eat, buffet lines will be long...hang in there! Tram to and from Bellagio and Monte Carlo....just ask for directions to the Tram, it's much easier. Casino is very nice and clean and there is plenty to do. The Aria mysteriously smells like vanilla, but you learn to deal with it. The grounds are beautiful and this place has a great atmosphere....make the best you can out of your Vegas Vacation, we did! There are no worries at this hotel unless you are too hard to please and don't want to spend any money! Relax and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “High class, comfortable, lacks character”
Reviews.Author: mumdadandmeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Aria in Las Vegas for 4 nights with friends to celebrate our 50th birthdays. We have never been to Las Vegas before so were quite overwhelmed at some of the hotels on the strip. We picked the Aria for position - it is not far from the Luxor, New York, New York and Excalibur- and because we had a great deal from our operator in UK. The rooms were very plush with everything controlled form the remote control including the curtains and lights. It is a very new hotel and so everything was very clean and well presented.Lighting was difficult as it was very much 'mood lighting' so not easy when you were getting dressed and wanted to match colours or perform a task. There was no central light at all. The bed was particularly comfortable and we had a great night's sleep. Rooms were well proportioned and we were lucky enough to egt all our rooms together and were upgraded free of charge to a city view room on the 28th floor so the view was quite spectacular. There was a mini bar in the room..be careful they will charge you if you lift the item even if you don't use it. Apparently, you can get a fridge from housekeeping but they ask you not to use the mini bar for your own use. Items within were very expensive so be warned.There was no coffee machine so I was very glad to have taken my travel kettle..as with the rest of the USA it is hard to find a decent cup of tea and the coffee bar in the casino was quite expensive and had nowhere to sit. This was something we noticed a lot here..unless youwere in a restaurant or bar or casino and spending money then you didn't get to just sit and watch this crazy world go by. The bathroom was lovely and very big with a huge tub and nice shower. The floor in the shower was very slippery and quite dangerous so take care.Everywhere beautifully furnished with nice carpets and curtains and plenty of storage space for clothes. An iron and board was supplied along with hairdrier and some toiletries. The casino was quite 'serious' and there did not appear to be a lot of merriment here, in contrast to some we visited for instance the Imperial Hotel. Although this was much older and a little run down the atmosphere was much happier, people seemed friendlier and minimum bets were very much cheaper. Also they did a good line in $1 Michelob bottled beer and Margeritas so we were very happy. Drinks were considerably more expensive at the Aria: my margerita was $14..it was good though. The pool area was beautiful with loads of sun beds and the whole area was a suntrap. We ordered drinks from the waitress round the pool and had a fairly hefty supplement added to our bill unbeknown to us until we went to check out. There is a lovely spa and gym but you have to pay a $30per person per day cover charge to use this. We chose not to because unless you intend to spend the day there it seemed not worth while. The pool area closed quite early too, so no after shop swim if you come back late afternoon/early evening. We went out to breakfast a couple of times but soon realised that the buffet in the hotel at $15 was actually really good value and included as much juice, tea and coffee as you like along with as much as you could eat. We found that the juice certainly increased the price of our breakfast in the restaurant across the road. Beware: breakfast becomes brunch at the weekend and price increases a lot. However, they included snow crab and other delicacies so probably still good value if you like that sort of thing. We noticed that the evening buffet seemed good value as well but unfortunately did not have chance to sample it. On one night they included Maine lobster and unlimited wine in the price. In summary, this was an enormous but lovely, very classy hotel. However if you are looking for a theme or a more boisterous feel then this may not suit you. We were more than satisfied andthey looked after us very well. I did not really see any others that matched it for elegance but did feel it had quite a serious atmosphere. When talking to the staff though i.e. room maid and waitress they all seemed very happy there which is a good sign as far as I can tell. Make sure you take really comfortable shoes..you will walk miles and most places do not really have a dress code so most people dress down even in the poshest hotels.However, anything goes it seems. The roads do not really cater for pedestrians. There are not too many crossing points on them and you often have to go 'up and over' using steps, lifts and escalators to walk over a bridge. We noticed that often the escalators were out of order and felt that anyone with disabilities might have problems getting about in places. Smoking is still allowed in most casinos but we did not notice the smell too much so assume they have good air conditioning systems. Getting about is easy by foot or some hotels have monorails that go between them. They unfortunately do not go for any distance so you have to keep getting off and moving to the next hotel so sometimes easier to just walk. The bus service is quite good value at about$7 for the day or $5 for 2 hours. They get absolutely packed though.There are plentiful cabs but you are not allowed to hail them in the strip apparently.We got a cab to take 6 of us to the Plaza hotel at the far end of the strip from the Aria(about 7 miles) and it cost $47 so you need to decide what will offer you the best value. We loved that you can just wander in and out of the hotels and see what they have tooffer.The new York roller coaster is great fun ($14 for one trip but you can buy a day pass) and there are loads of old fashioned amusements here so the kids would have a great time on these.There are some good restaurants in the Miracle Mile shopping centre across the road and you are also near Mcdonalds, Wendys, Dennys and Subway if you want something cheap and cheerful. Take a plentiful supply of dollar notes for tips and make sure you do a Grand Canyon trip..it really is quite spectacular...though not very safety conscious..there are no railings so mind your footing.We booked our trip through a company called Viator who are on the net. They were very helpful and offered some really good prices. Also they have a UK telephone number and it was really good to be able to speak to them without racking up the phone bill. Unfortunately our trip was cancelled but they managed to get us on a more expensive one and matched the price as well. You will have jet lag for the first couple nights but it's well worth the long flight and the tiredness. You will have a great holiday..I know we all did.

Reviews.Title: “Aria- Ranks Among the Best!”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkieab
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews of the Aria prior to arrival, I was somewhat a little hesitant to stay (we had originally booked the Mirage) but due to a great booking rate, my husband and I decided that it was worth a try! And boy, was it sure worth it! We loved it here! We arrived on a Monday night and had no problems at the check in whatsoever. To be honest, there wasn't even a line up. While checking in, we asked if there was a possibility of an upgrade since we booked a deluxe room. They offered us a corner suite for an extra charge which we happily took as it was at quite a discounted rate. The elevators are quite fast, and do be prepared if you have a corner suite-- it is quite a trek from the elevators, but trust me, it is definitely worth it. We were on the 20th floor, and the view was stunning. The room itself was gorgeous, and quite large. The floor to ceiling windows in the den, the bathroom and the bedroom were breathtaking. We could see NYNY, Paris, The Cosmopolitan, PH, PH Westgate, Ballys, Rio... all from our room. We really felt like we were living the life! There were a few minor inconveniences in the room such as a few burnt out lightbulbs, and we were missing one robe in the room which was odd too. The only thing else I'll comment on in the room is the technology- even being somewhat of a savvy electronic geek did not help me with the room controls at all. It was as if the settings had been programmed wrong, and while trying to do one task, it actually performed tasks not being asked of. It was a bit frustrating, but if you encounter the same issue just press the switches themselves individually and it'll work brilliantly! We had no problems with housekeeping whatsoever. There is a button adjacent to the hotel door that prompts housekeeping for service, which is nicer than those laminated do not disturb signs that are at most other hotels. I did forget to push the service button twice during my stay, but when returning to the room both times I had a voicemail from housekeeping informing me that the room had not been serviced, but at any time they would be more than happy to come up and clean it. The lobby is gorgeous and definitely has that vanilla scent that others have referenced prior, but it is not overwhelming and is a nice break from the other smoky casinos. Casino was large, and was busy with a good vibe during our entire stay. We also enjoyed that this hotel was a refresher from some of the other "typical Las Vegas strip hotels". It definitely has a more modern, upscale and classier feeling to it. We didn't eat too much at the hotel, but we did have an appetizer at Deuce Lounge which was great, and the coffee bar on the far south side of the casino had great breakfast offerings. We also had dinner at Todd English's P.U.B which is adjacent to the hotel and Crystals, and it was fantastic! Just an f.y.i. for you guys who are into this, on Tuesday's they have 5 cent draft night. The location of the hotel is amazing! I recommend wandering around throughout Crystals to find your shortcuts! Both my husband and I loved that we could choose whether to walk north or south on the strip as we particularly enjoy wandering the Strip. After being somewhat of an experienced traveller and having stayed in quite my fair share of nice hotels, this definitely ranks among the top. When I return to Las Vegas, I will definitely be returning to the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, fantastic view, top service”
Reviews.Author: Roel19
Reviews.Content: We visited the Aria for 6 night in the beginning of November. For around 1.2k Dollars we had a corner suite on the 37th floor with a fantastic view both during the day as well as during the night time. Upon arrival we received a room on the 3rd floor which didn't have the view so asked to switch to a higher floor which was no problem at all and was done without us even needing to pass by check-in. They just called us to say that our key cards were updated for the other room and could move when we wanted. The vanilla smell some people are complaining about is not that bad at all. You smell it the first time you enter the hotel, but after one day there you can hardly notice it. The room itself was fantastic. Very large windows, and no problems what so ever with the automated curtains/tv/light... bathroom was very clean and perfectly fitted out. My wife loved the heated toilet seat. The breakfast buffet is very complete.... We have tried the Wynn and Bellagio buffets, but the Aria breakfast buffet is equally good if not better. And to top it off it is very cheap (&§ dollars a person I believe). Location of the hotel is good (very good compared to the Wynn of course) and the walk towards the strip via the Crystals shopping is very pleasant. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Las Vegas. It is a modern version of most other hotels in Vegas, so less tralala, but we love it. Oh, and you also have free internet all over the hotel so we facetimed through the casino to show it to our relatives :-)

Reviews.Title: “Aria - Modern Elegance...”
Reviews.Author: HollyK1
Reviews.Content: Everything extra costs extra, but where doesn't that happen in Vegas. Beautiful hotel, good housekeeping and okay service. Had a problem with the TV remote that was never really fixed, but managed to get around it for our two day stay. Casino floor not too noisy or smelly -- except for intense vanilla odor whenever you got off the elevators. I would recommend Aria if you like very modern architecture and ambiance... Brand new in 2010 and it shows!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janeelis
Reviews.Content: We loved it there. We were first given a room miles and miles from the elevator so we went all the way back to the front desk pulling all our luggage. They changed our room for us but on a much lower floor. It turned out great. The room was very nice. The staff was excellent as well as the food and casino. We would definitely return to the Aria. I wish they wouldn't have a $30 daily rate for the workout room. That's all day, but we just wanted a 30 minute workout so we passed on the charge and got nothing.

Reviews.Title: “New”
Reviews.Author: putter63
Reviews.Content: Great new hotel. Bed is great. Central room remote control that turnson/off lights, air, and tv and also open curtains from location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms - A Little Boring”
Reviews.Author: PablosTravels
Reviews.Content: The Aria has a great rooms and has spent a ton of money to make everything feel just right. Not quite sure how to put my finger on it, but it's almost too perfect. Casino has no energy, the staff and all the guests seem to be moving really slowly. Go to Planet Hollywood on a Friday night and then go the Aria, you'll see what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: KiwiKitten
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here of Aria, I nearly cancelled my reservation. I'm so glad I didn't because we loved it. It's unlike any other hotel in Las Vegas - in a good way! The rooms were beautiful and being woken up by the curtains automatically opening was lots of fun. And the beds are unbelievable - the most comfortable EVER. The air con was very efficient - no smell of smoke whatsoever which was really important to us. We also loved the Jean-Philippe Patisserie - really good crepes and pastries. The negatives: 1. The vanilla scent downstairs. Hated it. 2. Cafe Vettro - absolutely gorgeous setting, but the food was so-so. Try Tableau at the Wynn or Bouchon at the Venetian for a great breakfast in about the same price bracket. 3. The valet was slow - so slow we gave up and went back to self-parking. 4. Internet is $15 a day, but that's pretty standard for Vegas. Overall we loved the Aria and look forward to returning. Tip: ask for a room on floors 25-30 as they have their own elevator (the other elevator services about 20 floors and I''m guessing is slower to arrive)

Reviews.Title: “Not ready for prime time”
Reviews.Author: GinnyGuy
Reviews.Content: Reviews typically focus on little idiocies, like "the coffee tale had a ring on it." That's meaningless to me. Here's my take: gorgeous lobby; it is airy, but not really comparable to the airline hangar that other opine. Service terrible. Lines everywhere, not because of so many guests, but because of inadequate staffing. Room glasses were dirty. I called for more, and they were delivered rattling around in a 30 gallon trash bag. Walked to the lobby, stood in line for 20 minutes before walking over to an unmanned front desk telephone and dialed for a manager. After half hour of waiting on hold, I was told "there are no managers." Indifferent, pretentious staff. If you do mind that, and don't drink out of the glasses, then this is a tech-laden, upscale place, quite a walk to the Strip, that you might enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but expensive.....”
Reviews.Author: MARTINIGURL
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at Aria to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Had a Corner Suite for my husband and I and a double room for my adult children. Had a bit of a rough time checking in. We arrived around 11:00 AM and was told our rooms were not ready yet. I had called a couple of weeks before our arrival to request rooms close together and then requested again when we checked in. We checked our bags and went on our way. Did not get notified until almost 4:00 PM that our rooms were ready. When I went up to the desk to get our keys our rooms were on two seperate floors. I again requested rooms on the same floor and after much pleeding they finally gave us two rooms on the same (low) floor....only to realize once we were on the floor the rooms were literally miles away from each other. Very dissappointed!!! Didnt feel like fighting with the people anymore. The Corner Suite was beautiful!!! But be ready to walk A LOT!!! I think all suites are at the very end of the hallways. LONG WALK!!! The double rooms were very nice as well. I had gotten a pretty good deal thru Southwest Vacations. I saw what the rooms go for regularly and I think they are over priced. Also it appeared that the restaurants were all quite expensive. We ate at 2 of them and did the Sunday Brunch as well. The Buffet was excellent. All in all....I am glad I stayed at Aria, its a georgous hotel, but because of its location (set back from the strip) and the amount of walking you have to do just to get out of there, plus the fact of how expensive everything is there and that they really did not give an effort to give me my rooms on the same floor, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Aria was better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: DBonna
Reviews.Content: We took a shuttle from the airport to Aria. The shuttle drops you off in an underground bay and that's when the magic began. The second we got off the bus we had our own personal bellhop who unloaded our bags and led us to the front desk. As we walked through the property he was like our own personal tour guide. Check in took no time at all and we were allowed to check in even though it was 9am. The room was fabulous! The bed was the best I have ever slept in! We were on the 27th floor with a great view of planet hollywood. I really enjoyed playing with all the gadget controls. There is no coffee maker or fridge but that is usually the case in Vegas so it was no big deal. The casino was well decorated and smelled awesome. Had no problems getting drinks, but I tip well so this usually isn't a problem. The machines were very tight and after the first day we did most of our gambling at the Monte Carlo which is connected to Aria. All the restaurants were expensive but that is also par for upscale Vegas properties so it was expected. The steak and eggs at Cafe Vettro was very good and the food at the buffet was great! Over all we were treated very well here and I can't wait to go back. I will be dreaming about that bed or I may have to just buy one for myself!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Fabulous Rooms”
Reviews.Author: WimmerVictoria
Reviews.Content: Most of the hotels in Las Vegas have themed lobbies, and public areas plus casino. The Aria seemed to lack a theme even though it was very grand and had a varied selection of restaurants. The rooms at this hotel were fabulous. The bed was really comfortable and the bath tub was great. Our room was quite large and quiet and we had a nice view overlooking the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: u34sm3
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at aria. The room was comfortable and clean, I loved the bathroom too - very good shower! The hotel itself was very big, so there was a lot of walking about, but I guess this is the case for most Vegas hotels. As far as location goes, it wasn't ideal.. We seemed to end up at the other end of the strip every day so I would probably stay in that area next time. It is next to crystals but there really isn't much in there. The spa was also very good! I went to the viva Elvis show which was good, but not amazing. The Internet was pretty pricey and they charged me twice for one days use. I checked out on the tv so didn't bother complaining about it.

Reviews.Title: “YES!”
Reviews.Author: jenjujubee
Reviews.Content: Flew in for one night for a friends Birthday! From the minute you walk in, there is an airy aroma...clean, fresh.... Brilliant... Great mood enhancer....rather than smoker smoke hitting you in the face like as freight train as you enter!!! Great use of eclectic designs & use of materials....from, padded chenille fabric walls, to reclaimed wood Enjoyed the Spa @ Aria... The Room was AMAZING! The BED...TO DIE FOR!!! and believe me, we are picky about our beds!!! Great Quality bedding & pillows!!! YAHOO!!!! We stayed on the 35th floor facing the mountains... beautiful. I think it's better than a stripe view! The room was simple yet perfect! Floor to ceiling windows, automatic curtains, great Flat screen, awesome bathroom...big tub! Spacious! Not overdone! Great design! Our friend stayed in the AriaSky Suites...hmmmm. Ok, it's like an apartment! 2 rooms, living room & bedroom, guest bathroom, main bathroom...AMAZING ...really just incredible! COULD JUST MOVE RIGHT IN!!! Booking again for a trade show in June!!! it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “UP THERE WITH THE BEST AND A SPLENDID ADDITION TO THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: bowlio
Reviews.Content: Offered a very reasonable rate for upgrade to a 1200sq ft end of floor suite with 270* panoramic over the strip and Monte Carlo on 24th Floor Red Rock was visible about 8 miles away. The room was immaculate clean well serviced and only lacked the tea and coffee making facilities us Brits love!!! Great pattisserie John Phillipe at the bottom of the bank of lifts in the casino with a bountiful offering of beveridges cakes and goodies and queues that were minimal. A great play is made on the Architecture of the development and as a "property person" this always smacks of failures in other key areas with the architecture masking a host of flaws...however I have to say the whole thing Aria Vdara and Mandarin is incredibly well put together with a huge amount of thought and it definitely has added another tier of brilliance to The Strip and a genuinely different and pleasing option. The retail development Crystals was again well put together but it was limited to an impressive array of top end brands that were lifeless and looked to be struggling. This retail development won't survive and I am sure in the fullness of time will be replaced by something more vibrant. The ARIA location is brilliant two minutes walk to the Bellagio 5 minutes from Paris. New York and 10 minutes from MGM. The pool area is a reasonable size and we were able to find a spot for 2 at most times during the day. Overall its up there with the best.

Reviews.Title: “Sportsbook”
Reviews.Author: vcals
Reviews.Content: Just want to let everyone who is planning to use their sportsbook to ask for a drink ticket when you place your bets. They don't tell you that you get a free drink ticket with your bet because they want you to pay for your drinks. My husband loves to bet on football games, basketball games, horses -- you name it. He sat down with this older man and bought a drink from the waitress. The man asked him what was he doing wasting his money on buying a beer when he could use the free drink tickets. My husband didn't know so he went to ask for one everytime he placed his bet so he drank all day with his drink tickets. They change the color of the tickets every day so if you have some left over from Saturday you can't use them on Sunday. The sportsbook is VERY small so you have to get there early to get a seat. The check in time was long. My husband signed up for their reward card and when he went to register it the man didn't give him his $5.00 free play and didn't give him anything that said what you get for your points. He was very rude. Everyone else at the hotel was nice, especially the cleaning staff. The hotel has a very strong floral scent when you walk in but you get used to it. As far as smoking it's the same compared to the other hotels. The hotel is very far from the strip so you have to do a lot of walking. Nice hotel but probably wouldn't stay there again. Food at the restaurants was very expensive but the buffet was good.

Reviews.Title: “Best yet”
Reviews.Author: Grangett
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bed sky suite with another couple and enjoyed the best hotel we have ever stayed in. Limo pick up from airport and return. Top class attention in sky suite reception and hospitility area with courtesy drinks, refreshments, pastries and fruit together with wine and cheese. Suite very modern with all mod cons and excellant view of Nevada mountains and passing helicopters. Restaurants and bars in complex were fantastic and service first class. Must see the Elvis show set in the hotel theatre itself. Easy links to other strip hotels and well placed to walk in from the strip and attractions. Pools are fantastic and clean and tidy. Used the Spa on final day - out of this world!

Reviews.Title: “Great Sleep”
Reviews.Author: pentref
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a great place to stay, once you navigate the humdrum noise of the casino, its an oasis of tranquility.stayed on the 7th floor. Great beds, could do with tea or coffee making facilities in the room for this quality of hotel it is irksome in the mornings not to have it and seems mean. Never really got to grips with the timing of the electronic curtains, room overlooked the high way and carpark but to be honest most people would not hear the road noise. Buffet breafast very good value, but Sunday brunch breaksfast very steeply priced if you just want something light there was no option there. We where there for the PBR finals and it was reletavely easy traveling to the Thomas and Mack centre with car. We would recomend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a really great time, but...”
Reviews.Author: Mrsjones08
Reviews.Content: Ok you guys I am a TA girl myself I come to TA.com to read reviews on all prespective places to stay during vacation. So I will break it down as easy as possible: Check In: It was busy we arrived by airport shuttle around noon on Thursday October 26, 2010. My husband and I waited maybe 10 minutes before we were helped. Linda was our represenetive. This was our 1st time in Vegas so she was very helpful, explaning where to go & what to do etc. The Aria is huge so Linda provided us with a map, and overview of hotel setup. Easy... Rooms: Very clean, spacious, and modern. room was serviced everyday (we used service button just to make sure), bathroom was cool, double sinks, tub & shower, the water is so hot u get good steam too. Had a great city view. Downside: No in room coffee maker and the line @ the coffee shop is longer than I care to tell ya. O and no newspaper unless you pay for it to be delivered. The little epad that controls the room is easy too, after you get use to it and stop playing with it, NO PROBLEM. It has about a 3 second delay after you select your option of choice. EASY Area of Aria: Ok, Aria is directly in the center of CityCenter between Crystals and the Mandarin Oriental. But you have to walk alot to get out of CityCenter. Be prepared leave your stiletto's for the days you rent a car or take a cab. Food @ Aria: We ate at Cafe Vettro several times it was good but, expensive. For example 2 club sandwiches, crab cake appetizer, 2 waters w/ lime, and a really good hot chocolate about $70 + tip. It is open 24 hours tho. The patisserie was so cute, as well as delicious. We ate @ the breakfast buffett it was great too. Clubs @ Aria: GREAT...try Dueces for a grown & sexy atmosphere. Haze was great too. The R&B artist Ceiara's birthday party was there while we were there it was awesome! Pool: Beautiful, but too chilly to use it during our stay... Business Center: Ok here is where the nickel & diming began for me personally. Aria charges $1 per minute to use the business center w/ a 15 minute minimum. All we needed to do was confirm our seating and check our bags + print 2 boarding passes which takes 2 minutes to do. I think thats kind of excessive. I ended up using the business center @ Planet Hollywood for $5 flat, we were there returning our rental car at the Avis in that hotel. Concierge: No complaints @ all. Check Out: You can checkout by using your folio on the tv but we had prepaid for our hotel in advance so we didnt leave a credit card on file so it was unavailable to us, but I just called the front desk and they checked out for me. Bell desk was called to take care of our luggage, and about 5 minutes later our bags had been taken to the shuttle drop/pick up zone. Easy! I would stay there again, its a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average--I've been in Much Better”
Reviews.Author: Aggies
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed here 3 nights starting Oct 24, 2010. We had an early morning flight and were not able to check in early. That's understandable. The front desk was great. They basically checked us in, then told us they'd call us (on our cell phone) when the room was ready and we could come to a separate marked area of the front desk (marked "Keys Only") to get our keys. About noon, we received the call and went to get our keys. There was no area marked "Keys Only." We had to find someone to ask and were told to stand in line at a single "window" at the end of the counter. When we got to the "window" (there were 4 people ahead of us), they were shocked to hear we were told about the "keys only" sign, because they hadn't received their sign yet. We went to the room. We were the LAST room before the corner suite. That is a long, long hike from the guest elevator. I guess because we had a buy 2 get one night free, we were put at the very end of the "standard" rooms. I would STRONGLY suggest that IF you make a reservation here that you make it perfectly clear that you want to be close to the elevators. I'm telling you, honestly, it's between 1/8 and 1/4 of a mile hike from the elevators to the end of the hallway. The room was AVERAGE at best. Much smaller than any of the other rooms we've been in in Las Vegas. No TV in the bathroom, no place to sit and put on make-up. VERY small bathroom counter space. The room was DUSTY and I mean dust everywhere. We happened to see housekeeping outside and she asked "you just checked in, right? So your room is made up?" I told her it was VERY dusty and she said, "I dusted it, but my vacuum cleaner must throw off dust." Yeah, right. My spouse told her there was a light out in the bathroom. She offered to re-dust the room, but I told her it would do for today. However, it was NOT dusted the next day. Despite a tip, even the ashtray was left dirty the second day. It had been dumped, but not even wiped out. The TV screen had splatter marks on it, the wall had splatter marks on it. Somebody either celebrated with champagne or splattered soda on both. Neither was ever cleaned while we were there. Day 3 was more of the same. This time the ashes from the ashtray were even left, so I know they didn't dust. The light bulb in the bathroom was NEVER fixed. As far as linens go, they are OK. The beds are comfy. The pillows "different" but OK. They do not do any linen changes unless you call housekeeping and ask that your bed linens be changed. I can agree with the "saving water" issue, but other hotels leave a card that you put on the bed if you want your linens changed. Not Aria--you have to call housekeeping and request they change the linens the next day. Towels were changed daily if "you threw them on the floor". I wasn't intimidated by all the electronics in the room. It was easy to understand. However, I also wasn't impressed by it. Give me better housekeeping and I don't care about all the electronics. When we went to use the on-screen check-out, we found out they had "accidentally" billed us for all 3 nights (remember we had a buy 2 get one free). That necessitated a call to the front desk--it took about 10 minutes of on-hold to get through to them. She was very nice and said she'd correct it immediately, which she did. Self-parking is not convenient for hotel guests. It's great for casino visitors, but not guests. It's a very long walk from the parking garage to the guest elevators and a long, long walk to your room especially if you are at the END of the hallway. NOTE: If you travel with medical equipment that must be plugged in--bring an extension cord (at least 9 ft). There are NO plugs that you can get to on the walls. The ONLY plug is on the desk and supposedly for a lap top. We ate at the coffee shop (Cafe Vettro) on the day of arrival--average food, average prices. One morning we stopped for coffee at Roasted Bean on our way to the parking garage. Had coffee and bagel. At Roasted Bean a bagel w/cream cheese (2 containers of cream cheese) is $3.25. The bagel was hot and toasted correctly. Next morning we went to Jean Philippe Patisserie. Coffee and bagel were the same price as Roasted Bean, but the Bagel did not come with cream cheese--I paid $1 for ONE cream cheese packet. The order took about 20 minutes--ridiculous. The bagel was cold, so evidently they forgot about it, they screwed up our order and gave us AND CHARGED us for extra pastry. Don't waste your time on Jean Philippe Patisserie. It is just ridiculous that it can't be run any better than it is. You place your order, pay for it, then step out of line and WAIT for your name to be called. Even if it's JUST COFFEE, you wait to get it. It's close to the guest elevators, so I guess they can get by with doing things like that. But walk half way across the casino floor to Roasted Bean and you'll be much better off. Sorry we won't be staying here again, unless they GIVE us the room for FREE. While all staff that we saw (front desk, housekeeping, servers, etc), were very friendly, the cleanliness, the difficulty of parking and walking to room, and the lack of amenities (extra TV, clean sheets, plugs for medical equipment) make this hotel not the correct one for us.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, customer service needs some adjusting.”
Reviews.Author: allisonlight
Reviews.Content: -Housekeeping was incredible. They did a fabulous job every single day. -The check-in process was extremely long- took about 45 minutes in a line to get through. -Valet service was very very fast and friendly. -I got a little frustrated at The Cafe Vettro (24 hr cafe) To place a to-go order you actually have to be seated by a hostess and wait to place your order with a member of the waitstaff. This was a hassle and took much longer than needed. I thought the point of to-go is to be faster! -Jean Phillipe has awesome pastries, but there is always an extremely long line with no particular order. Staff did not attempt to keep any order at all. Elsa, who works there was particularly rude. -Sounds weird, but the toilet seat in the suites is AMAZING. Heated bidet type. -The breakfast buffet was awesome! -Room service menu was limited.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: kimnmario
Reviews.Content: All the good things people have said about this hotel is true. Truly the best hotel room I have stayed in. Make sure to request a room by the elevator - the hallways are very long on your feet after you have been walking all day. Tip: during check in ask them to include a free buffet. It seems there are always line ups and sometimes feel short staffed is the only thing I could complain about. Great location. All the other popular hotel lobbies pull other tourists into the hotel as a tourist attraction and tend to be very busy. The good thing about the Aria is that it is a hotel with no big attraction (like the Bellagio or Ceasars Palace) for tourists, so you can go out into the hustle and bustle of the strip and return to a relaxing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we have ever stayed at in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: kpt53
Reviews.Content: As this was our 9th visit to Vegas with various hotel stays we thought our choice of Aria might be too soon after their opening. How wrong we were. It was so nice to walk into a vegas Hotel and still see natural light. The Hotel rooms and the public areas are all very spacious, the staff from the checkin to the bell boys are all of 5 star standard. I had great fun with the room remote, wish i had one at home. The ELVIS tribute show had some of the best singing and dancing , but still think Le Reve at Wynn is the Best Vegas Show. Will definately stay there again and again. Viva Las Vegas, Viva Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Bad communication between staff”
Reviews.Author: janexxxxx
Reviews.Content: Just back from a holiday in vegas and stayed at the Aria on first impressions it was lovely and when checking in the member of staff asked what is it a special occasion and i explained that we had just got engaged that very day in which he kindly offered us $150 to spend in the resort which we were delighted with so far so good, had a great few nights until checking out when we had a bill of $148 to our dismay, after explaining the situation to a member of staff they begrudgingly told us that the matter was dealt with and they would speak to the member of staff in question, so low and behold we arrive home to check our credit card and we have been charged £79, i have contacted the hotel on a number of occasions with no avail. So my advise if they offer you anything get it in WRITING!!!!!!!!!!!!!! A dissapointing end to what would have been a great holiday!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ROOM WAS WONDERFUL, FOOD GOOD BUT VERY EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: washashorecapecodma
Reviews.Content: We had what is probably a regular room. Very spacious with a view of the strip. Furniture was nice -bath was divine. Loved the shower and the amenties in bath. All help were friendly and did a very good job. The restaurants were all good. We ate in the steakhouse which was good but soooo expensive. The tapas bar was the best. More reasonably priced. The coffee bar was good but also very expensive. $10 for a coffee and pastry is too much. Both were delicious. The gelato was also excellent. At $5/cup for 2 large scoops it seemed like a bargain. I like the modern style and the air in the casino was not full of smoke from cigarettes as was the MGM casino.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel & Casino EVER!”
Reviews.Author: alizaschrier
Reviews.Content: I just wanted people to know how wonderful the experience I just had. The Hotel is beautiful. The pools are great. All the staff are very helpful. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, Dont expect perfect- Elvis show horrible”
Reviews.Author: chris r
Reviews.Content: First the pro's : Service was excellent for this size resort. Room was clean, food great. Room service best ever. Con's: 30 dollars to use fitness center. mini bar kept at 55 degrees, we called they said take what you want and put it in the fridge next to the mini bar. Lock on mini bar broken room 16-0042. (Corner Suite). Gimmick with the electronic curtains and such, slow to use. A picture or mirror had been removed with the screws still sticking out. Bed was so soft I thought it was a waterbed. Back Ache The Elvis show: Aria you have a problem, beautiful theater, but the show is terrible. I was in complete shock at the horror that is Elvis. Cirque should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with good restaurant and hi-tech room, love it!”
Reviews.Author: zban
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Aria for 2 nights 2 weeks ago (the Halloween week). The hotel room was great, we liked it alot. The room is clean, and then bed was very comfortable, probably because of the fact that it's still new. The view was great too. We had the view facing the west side of the strip on 21st floor. That means we saw Vdara, Rio, Palms etc. The view was very nice at night. We enjoyed it so much. And we also enjoyed the room alot for its hi tech stuff. Upon our first entry, the curtain opened itself, and the music was turned on automatically as a welcome. It was amazing! And there was a control panel next to the bed, the control panel can control every night within the room (including the lights in the bathroom!), the curtains, the TV on/off and channel selection, music channels, etc. So you pretty much can stay in the bed most of your time and just relax. It's definitely a room for honeymoon, vacation and relaxing. We also like the bathroom as it's clean and the light is good, we can make the light softer and stronger with the control panel. So if you want to have a bubble bath with dim light you can do that. If you want to have stronger light when doing make-up, you can do that too. We just love the room. They also provided robes for use. Very very nice. It's also convenient to walk around the City Center as we stayed in Aria. We ate at the Jean Philippe Patisseria, Jillian Serrano, Cafe Vettro and the Buffet at Aria. They are all good food and within Aria. Actually I just ordered take-out from Jillian Serrano and Jean Philippe so we can enjoy the room more. For Cafe Vettro, we dine in there as the restaurant was nicely designed. The pool is very nicely designed. We enjoyed the pool alot too. The water is well heated, not too cold, not too hot. And I don't think the casino floor smell badly like others do in the older hotels. Maybe because it's still new, so it's good that we can enjoy the smell-less casino now when it's still new. I also like the waterfall and the fountain at the entrance of the hotel. They look very nice and very soothing. You gotta check out the galleries along the walk from Aria to Mandarin Oriental. They are nice and no fee to get in. The hotel overall is very beautifully and well designed that we like everything in Aria. We would stay in Aria again when we go to Vegas in the future, and recommend Aria to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel at bargain price”
Reviews.Author: AlunWatkins
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a beautiful new hotel in a good location which you will appreciate more and more over your stay. We paid only £60 / night for the hotel through netflights.com. The car park is accessed from Las Vegas Boulevard and the second floor is where the bridge to the front of the casino is located. The reception area is located at the front of the hotel at the opposite side to the car park bridge and it may be easier to walk along the front pavement past the main Valet Parking to get to it from the self park bridge. The Check-in lines seemed to be slow however the time we were at the check-in desk was quick and efficient. We were allocated a Standard King room on the 17th floor (17260) which was not far from the lifts and faced away from the strip so looked out over the Rio. The room was quite large and tastefully furnished with a comfortable bed and plenty of storage space. The bathroom was very well appointed with large shower alongside the soaking bath. There were glass doors separating the WC, shower/bath and twin sink areas. There was a nice range of soaps, shampoos etc. A good hairdryer and dressing gowns (although no slippers). The room safe was unusually in the bedside drawers. The pool area was much nicer than the photos show with 4 pools and 4 Jacuzzi pools. The landscaping was very nice with plenty of sun beds. There were some nice restaurants in the hotel and at the Crystals Mall next door although we found most to be on the pricy side ($40 each for an entree + extra for sides + $30+ for a bottle of wine) – gone are the days when eating out in the United States was excellent value. Although there are half price meal deals available around town from Tickets4Tonight. The show tickets are also getting more expensive although there are plenty of half price or discounts available at Tickets4Tonight. We saw the Viva Elvis show which was good but not great and we saw the Lion King which again was good. The only issue we had at the hotel was with Housekeeping. On our second day (1st November) housekeeping had not showed up by 6pm so we called to be told they operate 24 hours. I asked to speak to the manager who said she would get someone straight on to it. They arrived about an hour later with some chocolates as an apology and cleaned the room thoroughly. The next day (2nd November) the cleaning was done promptly and thoroughly however the next day (3rd November) the beds were made and towels changed but no cleaning was carried out. I got the impression that they did not have enough staff to complete all rooms and a significant number of rooms were only being serviced where complaints were made. I would recommend that all guests take advantage of Housekeeping’s offer of requesting by phone a specific time to have the room serviced. All in all we would stay again at Aria depending on the price offered.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for you money”
Reviews.Author: jsaby10
Reviews.Content: This a new hotel so no doubt its going to be new, modern and loaded with the latest gadgets in the industry. What you need to do is go down to the casino and sit there for 2-3 hours and gamble, let them know you are gambling and they will comp your stay. We were a group of 8 business travelers and each one of us got our stay comped.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pedroschmidt
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, nice clean rooms. Smaller than the ones at Encore/Wynn, but modern and spacious enough. A would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, but rude employees and slow service”
Reviews.Author: TXtraveler12345
Reviews.Content: This is the second time our group has stayed at this hotel. The first experience I found the staff to be extremely rude and unhelpful but we decided to give it another shot since the location was ok and the rooms were fairly nice. After my second experience, I do not recommend this hotel. I had been shopping earlier in the day and had several bags inside of a big bag sitting on the floor next to the desk. The cleaning service assumed it to be trash and THREW OUT my purchases! When I told the desk, they apologized and refused to do anything further. The bedspread and carpets were stained, the bathroom floor had spots and the windows were filthy. We went down to two different lounges in the lobby. Both nights the servers were extremely rude and we had to go up to the bar to ASK to be served. The room was spacious and the beds extremely comfortable. I enjoyed all the flat screens but there seemed to be an issue with our TV every night...and we had to call and have a technician come up. It took 3 hours and 4 phones calls one evening before anyone showed.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA-clean, modern, new”
Reviews.Author: allisonmw1
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at the Aria for our 6th wedding anniversary. We actually got married at the Venetian in 2004 and have decided to come back to Vegas every year on our anniversary. We usually stay at the Venetian or Palazzo, but decided to try something new. We loved the simple designs and clean look of the Aria. It was not smoky either! The room was very nice and the bed so comfy. I will say that everything is controlled my a remote in the room, which we liked. But if you are not tech savy, you might find it annoying. The Aria is centrally located on the strip, so we didn't feel stuck at one end. Some recommendations: -The Todd English Pub, right next to the Aria, was super fun. If you drink a beer in 7 seconds, its FREE! My husband loved that. -The breakfast buffett at the Aria was good and reasonably priced. -The SPA at the Aria is also very nice. I had a massage and it was wonderful. They also had a great fitness center. -The pastry shop right near the elevators was wonderful. It was always crowded in the mornings for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: ClosetMonkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days for a conference which was being held at another hotel, but we stayed here because it was newer and supposedly nicer. The rooms were very elegant, but so are the ones at most every other hotel on the strip. The gaming was fairly dead most of the week, whereas I could catch a cab to the Ventian or the Palazzo most any time and their casinos were always jumping. It took over an hour to get breakfast in the restaurant due to the long lines, which I suppose is good for their bottom line but was very inconvenient for me, as I had meetings to get ready for. Everything was way overpriced - even for Vegas - and the staff and dealers seemed competent but fairly apathetic. As others have noted, there was no personality at all to this hotel and nothing about it really wowed me the way I expected for such a new facility. I'm giving it a "recommend" rating because there's nothing wrong with it for sure, but I just can't think of a compelling reason for me to go back to the Aria instead of the Venetian, or even the Luxor, both of which seem to have a lot more going on and more personality.

Reviews.Title: “Aria is FABULOUS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ells55
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a stay at the Aria. After reading some of the reviews on here I was a bit nervous - but when we arrived all that anxiousness disappeared. It was fantastic, I do not know what some people want from a hotel - there seems to be a lot of petty nit-picking going on, and I am sorry to say that the majority of this is from US visitors! The hotel is breath-taking from arriving outside, to check-in to the casino to the elevators to the room. We were there for a 60th Birthday celebration, and were allocated a room on the 37th floor with an out of this world view. We are not smokers, but the room was a smoking room, but the view and the room made us forget about that - you can't have everything!!!! Loved that when we walked into the room that that lights came on, the curtains opened and the TV came on with my name on it - very impressive! The view was to die for, I couldn't stop looking out the window - day or night - night was especially wonderful, but the view of the mountains in the morning when the sun hit them was so special. Staff were very friendly and smiled and said hello. We did go to other hotels on the strip for a nosey, but in my opinion, they are all pricey, therefore the Aria is no different. Enjoyed the casino and the waitresses were good at getting drinks, considering the area they have to cover. The bathroom was large and functional, and the clothes space was massive. The bed and pillows were so comfortable and I would give them 6 stars!!! The location of the Aria is great, very central and near the bus (where you can get a pass for $7 for 24 hours or $20 for 3 days) - the bus is a great experience (and saves your poor feet) and as we were there for Halloween, it was great fun too! I cannot fault this hotel and would go back in a heartbeat and would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Bed EVER”
Reviews.Author: ScarfGirl85
Reviews.Content: I visited my boyfriend on his consulting project in Las Vegas, and we stayed at the Aria. As a road warrior, I have stayed in many hotels, and by far, the Aria has the MOST AMAZING BED EVER. It was extremely plush and comfortable, with luxurious bedding and pillows. I cannot remember having a better night's rest. However, the service had something to be desired. We tried calling the front desk, and it rang for at least two minutes before we gave up. The line for check-in/check-out is disorganized and not as efficient as other hotels. The ability to set how you will be woken up via touch screen gadget (e.g. automatic opening of shades, lighting, and music at a specified time) was a nice touch. The location is very central, which was convenient. This is a good hotel for some R&R with a significant other.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LDorey
Reviews.Content: We did the $20 tip trick and got upgraded to the 53rd floor strip view room. The only problem with that our ears would pop going up and down. Loved all the technology, even checked out of the room thru the TV menu. The music piped thru the hotel was great (mix of current and 90’s) did not need my ipod @ the pool. Rooms where good sized.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service at every turn. Need new Management and Customer Service Training”
Reviews.Author: TravelMax51
Reviews.Content: This place is clueless regarding customer service. Video Poker Bar outside sports book was the worst offender. Smart [--] bartenders, unfriendly, and gave you a hard time when using drink vouchers provided by the casino. While gambling several thousand dollars in the sportsbook, only had one cocktail waitress come by in 2 hours. I dont expect to be catered to, but I would like to have more than one beer while watching an entire basketball game. Don't waste your money here, go anywhere else. Ive been to all of the hotels and sportsbooks in vegas and Aria by far has the worst service. Even Ballys was better. At least they appreciate your business. After experiencing Aria, there is no surprise that the citycenter is bleeding cash. Keep treating guests like they do and they will be boarding up the place. If you like being treated like like dirt, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent---- stay in all aspects-------”
Reviews.Author: peacefullduck
Reviews.Content: stayed at this property from [16---20] august----my wife had rooms comped-plus other xtras----i just have to give top praise to security staff--[especially GERRY]i had a misfortune on the floor the first few hrs after we checked in---i tripped over some luggage that was placed in the isle between the slot banks--as i moved from one section to another a piece off the luggage was tipped over as i moved to the centre off the isle down i went to the floor-hitting my face--forehead with one hell off a smack---nose and fore head left with small cuts-----immediately--security[gerry] was at my side--for assiatance--within seconds in house medics were on scene-the next thing i knew parmedics-ambulance arrived----wow-- the attention i recieved was amazing-----i did not go to the hospital-but it was offered to me-------i can not say how thankfull i was for the attention given to me----the staff treated me like royalty-----the next few days were spent enjoying the hotel and all it had to offer-------THANK YOU---GERRY--IN house MEDICS AND YOUR ATTENTION GIVEN TO ME--------stay at this property and be rest assured they have your personal interest at heart-------i highly recommend this property

Reviews.Title: “Everything at the hotel was fantastic from check in to check out.”
Reviews.Author: Slotsmumma
Reviews.Content: Beginning with a very smooth checkin and very friendly staff, we thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. Both the breakfast and dinner buffets were excellent. We enjoyed the playing area so much that we didn't feel the need to go to other casinos. We would return in a heart beat and would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pokernut
Reviews.Content: Arrived yesterday afternoon and everything went perfectly. Check-in was swift and the directions to the room was very easy. We were concerned from previous reviews that we were in for a hike. This was far from the truth as the elevators were very close and our room on the 29th floor (city view) was only 2 rooms away. The room is beautiful, spacious, and nicely appointed. We had no problems with the high tech electronic in the room and we're nno teeny boppers as I'm about to turn 50. The pools are heated (a fact the hotel should advertise) and are awesome. The scenery around them and the service were beyond compare. We usually stay at the Bellagio so that is the standard we are comparing this facility to. The best experience so far, however, was our meal at Jean Georges. The Austrilian lobster tail was to die for. Would we come again? Based on our experience so far, absolutely yes.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in LV”
Reviews.Author: CoralReef
Reviews.Content: Aria is the sixth hotel we’ve stayed at in Las Vegas, and it’s our favorite! We spent 5 nights in a Corner Suite, which we booked 6 months in advance on Aria’s website for $275 per night (plus tax). It was the nicest room we’ve ever had in Las Vegas. The layout was a little odd because of the corner placement, but it was very comfortable and luxurious. What we liked about the room: We loved the high-tech controls, which allow you to change room temperature, lighting, TV, music, and curtains from your TV or from a bedside panel. You can even set the lights to go off/on at a specific time, or in a certain number of minutes. We loved the three large flat-screen TVs with HD programming (one in the bathroom so you can soak in the tub while watching TV). We enjoyed having a second half-bath to use when one of us was in the bathroom. It was great to have drawers in the bathroom to put stuff away instead of having everything out on the counters like most hotel rooms. The shower had a bench to sit on while shaving legs. There were always at least 6 towels, so we never had to ration them. The high-tech toilet with multiple bidet functions took some getting used to (especially the warmed seat), but we liked it, too. The toiletry selection was the most extensive I’ve ever seen: shampoo, conditioner, soap, bath gel, lotion, shaving cream, disposable razor, shower cap, Q-tips, sewing kit, dental kit, and bath salts. It was nice to have a good-sized refrigerator, with icemaker, in addition to the minibar. (No coffeemaker, though.) Every morning, a local newspaper and a NY Times were hung on our doorknob. What we liked about the hotel: Service at Aria was GREAT! By far the best service we’ve had at a Las Vegas hotel. Everyone from the front desk to the housekeepers was trained to greet all guests with a friendly smile. We’ve never had such prompt housekeeping service in a Las Vegas hotel. Aria seems to have a real service culture. When we checked out, the front desk person noticed that we’d been charged for several phone calls that failed to connect, and took them off the bill before I could even mention them. The staff wasn’t just accommodating, they were actually proactive in trying to ensure a good experience. Aria has a great location in the center of the Strip. The walk from our room to the Strip was comparable or shorter than other hotels we’ve stayed at. We had drinks and several meals at the hotel, and all were excellent. The casino is nothing unusual, but nice. The hotel as a whole doesn’t project a unique character, but everything is beautifully decorated and in great condition. What wasn’t perfect: 1. We arrived at 1:00, and there were no lines at the check-in desk, but we did have to wait until 2:30 for our room. We hadn’t booked a view suite, and we didn’t ask for a special view, but the check-in guy volunteered that he was putting us on “a high floor with a nice view”. We got all excited… but his “high floor” turned out to be the 9th floor, with the top of a parking garage taking up half the view. Not a big deal, but I wish he hadn’t raised our expectations. 2. They seemed to be running short on conditioner. The other toiletries were replaced so frequently that at one point we had 6 bottles of bath gel, but we only ever got one little bottle of conditioner. 3. The bed was a big puffy marshmallow that was comfortable for the first five minutes, but provided zero back support, so I woke up sore. It would be great if Aria had the same fabulous beds as MGM. 4. The Aria gym wasn’t as good as you’d expect for the price ($30 per day, or $80 for a three-day pass). It was a standard hotel gym. Aria’s ellipticals were disappointing. They were a good brand (Precor), but they had a front drive, and were much harder on the knees than our rear-driven home machine. One day we went to the next-door Monte Carlo gym, a better value for the price ($19). It was smaller and more crowded, but we didn’t have to wait for equipment, and the True ellipticals were rear-driven. However, the Monte Carlo’s machines didn’t have individual TVs. Overall, Aria’s positives far outweighed the negatives. For the first time, we are planning to go back to the same hotel on our next trip to Las Vegas, if we can get a reasonable room rate. I recommend Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: SFpol
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Aria - this bed was the best I have ever experienced. It was a softer mattress, which I prefer and the pillows were perfect - I think maybe they were memory foam? Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful and the rooms are gorgeous. I love being able to customize all the controls and wish I could have stayed there longer to enjoy everything. Only downsides for me were the weird shower/soaker tub combo - the tile was really slick and its just odd to have that in one enclosed space. And all the glasses in the room were really dirty. But those were both really minor - especially b/c the bed more than made up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel....no heart.”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior2010_10
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this hotel exemplifies all that is wrong with modern Las Vegas. The hotel is so big that even high end customers feel lost in the flow. Technically it is exceptional. Decent food, world class casino, new rooms and a Cirque show. But it lacks heart. The dealers are apathetic, the front desk people seem overworked and short. I was ticked that even though my suite was prepaid by my company the hotel took almost $7000 in authorizations on my credit card durning my 10 day stay, regardless of the fact that I never actually billed anything to my room. The people running the place had no idea what was going on in the area. I hate to know that I probably have a better functional understanding of the area then they do. The bartenders were lackluster and overall I was underwhelmed. The suite was lovely, but I like Vdara more. The bathroom was large and had a nice view of the strip. But at $450 per night, it was overpriced for what you got. The worst thing about the hotel is that it competes with other MGM properties. They poach guests from Mirage and Bellagio, but are not nearly high end enough to take away Wynn loyal patrons. There are better places for the money.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING - Best on the Strip! Definitley 5*”
Reviews.Author: irishkiwi1
Reviews.Content: OMG this place is AMAZING (don't know where the negative reviewers were staying - must have been confused with somewhere else!!) Aria is the newest on the Strip and it looks great. The rooms are HUGE, modern and the bed is the best ever!! We stayed for 8 nights and can't wait to go back there! Check in and check out very quick and efficient and we were offered express check out. It is only 3-4 mins walk from the strip (no different from the Bellagio and Caesars!) The rooms are sooooo much better than Bellagio - more modern and larger! Dble sinks in bathroom and great shower cubicle. Tram great between Aria and Bellagio. Hotel seems smoke free (even though it isn't) I cant wait to go back here...would definitely recommend without hesitation The best place we have ever stayed at and we have travelled the world!!

Reviews.Title: “There can be only one...!”
Reviews.Author: Adam_at_hello
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Las Vegas on a vacation with my wife at the end of October this year, and chose the Aria as our hotel for a few reasons -- Location is central on the strip, it is a new, modern hotel, and it is green certified. As a plus we were able to get an excellent rate through my wife as she is a travel agent and is "in the know". Upon arrival we were more than impressed. The lobby area is amazing beautiful, and the scent of vanilla that gets pumped into the lobby is great (if a little TOO strong). It was so nice to come back to the hotel after a long day sight-seeing and not be inundated with a "theme" as so many of the other hotels have. The room couldn't have been nicer. We were placed on the fourth floor of the hotel, a non-smoking floor, and were pleased with the cleanliness of it. It would have been great to be higher up to have a better view, and our "mountain view" could have been a bit more "mountainous", but that's what you get on the fourth floor. Next time I'll go for the "pool view" option. The room itself had a massive bathroom, double sink and low-flow toilet, as well as walk in shower and tub combo which was more than big enough for two. A nice touch was that after a day of wandering about the room attendants had placed all our toiletries on little "placemats" so as to keep them off the marble tops. Impressive! The bed was great, if a little soft, and the pillows were perfect. We considered purchasing two for our own bedroom back home! Each time the room attendants came and cleaned the room we came home to an absolutely spotless new room! We only sampled the buffet once, for breakfast, and were very impressed. At $14.95/person we thought it to be very reasonable. The pool area was very nice as well, although we just passed through and didn't have a chance to sample the supposed "death ray"...? The concierge staff were great, and they helped us arrange to renew our vows Vegas style. Remember to tip your concierge! We valeted our car, and were happy if not blown away by the service. Again, tip your valets! We aren't gamblers, but it was fun to watch others and walk in and around the various tables. We didn't find the casino too smokey, but it was apparent. Over-all, if we ever go back to the madness of Las Vegas, we will definitely stay here. It's a wonderful little oasis away from the more traditional craziness of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: VanessaSalem
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great food (kinda expensive food) service was awesome and i have nothing bad to say about Aria. We would absolutely go there again!!

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: carcip
Reviews.Content: Just came back from spending a week at Aria. We were very pleased. The hotel is modern and beautiful. Check in went quickly. We had arrived several hours before the official check in time and there were no nonsmoking rooms available. We wanted to settle in right away so we took smoking rooms and they were fine, not smoky at all. The rooms were very comfortable. Housekeeping did a fine job all week. The hi-tech controller was pretty easy to operate and controlled the drapes, tv, lights. I have more trouble working my phone. The conectivity panel for the tv has connections for HDMI, S video, composite, ethernet, USB, and two electric outlets. The in room safe is big enough for a laptop but is fairly shallow. This was possibly the nicest hotel room I had ever stayed in. The hotel is big but we learned our way around within a day. We had a rental car; the location was good for us. Easy access from the highway via Flamingo. The hotel is situated on the Strip (LV Blvd) between Flamingo and Tropicana and we had no problem getting in and out. Currently, construction at the nearby Cosmopolitan has the sidewalk closed off. You can detour across the street via the pedestrian bridge. When leaving Aria headed for north on the Strip, you can also cut through Vdara and Bellagio. No matter what, be prepared to walk. People with mobility issues will have no problems within the hotel itself (other than the fact that the place is huge), but the surrounding complex might be tricky. There are stairs, but also escalators and elevators. The tram is most helpful when going between Bellagio and Monte Carlo. We had breakfast in the buffet almost every day. We liked it. We also went to Bellagio's buffet and Vdara's Silk Road for breakfast, both were very good also. The Todd English pub in Crystals was great for dinner. The Viva Elvis show was better than expected. I had seen bits of it on TV but it was much better live. A real crowd pleaser too, our audience gave it a standing ovation. I would gladly stay here again and would recommend Aria to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “My best trip to Vegas so far!”
Reviews.Author: AngieK_75
Reviews.Content: The first impression when I walked into Aria was WOW! I knew when the City Center complex was being built it would be impressive. We were greeted by staff instantly who guided us into the check in lines. Our room was in the sky suites area and we were directed to the private check in for those rooms. During our stay we found the staff to be very engaging no matter where we were in the hotel. They made eye contact and greeted us most of the time - which you don't see very often in Vegas due to the amount of people around at any given time. Our room in the Sky Suites was luxurious and had amazing views. We were there for a bachelorette party so it was the perfect space to have friends come and spend time before heading out on the town. No detail was forgotten in this room. The heated toilet seat was amazing in the middle of the night and the steam shower was great after a night out dancing. The lounge for the sky suites offered light snacks and evening cocktails and was a comfortable space to relax in between activities. Friends of ours had rooms in the main hotel and they were the best we have encountered in vegas yet. Decorated beautifully, spacious, great views, state of the art technology and our friends have given their accommodations their seal of approval. The swimming pool at Aria was amazing - we were there in July so it's super hot and you spend a lot of time at the pool. It never felt so crowded and there was plenty of staff coming around to look after drinks and keep the pool decks clean. We booked a poolside cabana one day and it was incredible. The poolside cabana's at Aria are the best we have seen and our cabana attendant was great. He took great care of us and by the end of the day we felt like he was an old friend. The restaurants that we dined in at Aria were also exceptional. Julian Serrano served up amazing Tapas. There were so many choices and we were hard pressed to find one that we didn't enjoy. It was a great atmosphere too - and even though the restaurant was busy it was not loud which we definitely appreciated. We also dined at Jean George's steakhouse and the food was exceptional and came out cooked exactly as we wanted it. The lighting was a bit darker than I would have liked it but it still gets a recommend from me for sure. The buffet at Aria is one of the better ones I have seen with many different serving stations, and offers enough variety for all tastes. The food tasted great and it was incredibly clean. Finally Cafe Vetro served up a great breakfast after a night out at the club. Our server was lovely and again spent some time getting to know us and making sure that we were well taken care of. All in all our stay at Aria was the best we have had in Vegas and we all agree that we would recommend this hotel and will stay there again when we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “VEGAS BABY!!”
Reviews.Author: mylittlegrace
Reviews.Content: OMG this hotel was amazing! Check in was mega quick we were very very tired off our 16 hour journey and the staff were right over to assist us with our bags and showed us to check in. We waited around 10 minutes to check in then we were straight up to our rooms to get ready to hit the clubs. We ordered room service a few time which was expensive but worth it when your too hungover to eat out. If your going to Vegas for the clubs make sure you try and sort out guest list into a club each night although club promoters and managers will give anything to a big group of English girls. We got free entry every night into a different clyub such s hardrock, The Wynn ad XS in the Encore. All in all it was amaaaaaaaaazing!! The Aria smelt beautiful all arond the hotel , The shops are great and they have a spa. The pools are great and your up ofr some fun at the weekend make sure you go to the Liquid Pool Partys held next to the pool area. Its like an outdoor club its great. We had to turn the air con ff in the room as we could not sleep. But then as soon s we turned it off we slept like logs. Think they might pump oxygen into the rooms to get you up to go downstairs and gamble, but we werent big gamblers so we never did. breakfast buffet was great- try the eggs benedict if you go it was the best i have ever tasted To sum it up - Definatly Reccomend Aria Definatly reccomend Vegas.Its amazing!! Cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kamitravel
Reviews.Content: This place is in mid strip in the heart of all the action in Vegas. This is a brand new hotel. quite nice and glitzy. This is a full resort with everything. The casino area looked nice with less smoke ! Pool was great. I didn't try the retaurants but the jean philip patisserie was awesome. Rooms are quite high techy. Drapes are pulled and the TV comes on when you enter the room. You can control the lights and the curtain from the TV. You can even check out with your TV. Only downside were the elevators which were far from our room. If you are an elderly, considering the distance of the elevators from the rooms in the end of the hallways , it might be hassle for you. If you are not into high tech stuff, dealing with the room controls might be a pain for you. I loved it and will highly recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Far From a Five Star”
Reviews.Author: KenNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for two nights after spending 11/2 weeks in the National Parks. We booked the hotel in July (got a very good rate on their website for deluxe room). We were so looking forward to spending time in Las Vegas and at the Aria. The weather was bad at Bryce and we decided to come into Vegas a day earlier. We called the Aria Front Desk who at first seemed taken aback that we called them directly and not central reservations number. They then proceeded to say rooms were available but they would be unable to negotiate a rate with us that was anywhere near comparable what we were paying for the two nights already reserved. We decided to just book a room at another hotel and go to the Aria the following day. We checked tripadvisor reviews and booked a room through expedia for the Ballys Hotel. We arrived at Ballys in the late afternoon and checkin was swift and pleasant. Room was large, clean, nonsmoking as requested and on a reasonably high floor. Hotel is not new but well maintained and service is prompt and courteous. They are adjacent to the Paris Hotel. Very centrally located. Bellagio is across the street and Aria is also close by. We had breakfast the next morning and drove to the Aria with plan to just pre checkin and leave our luggage until a room was ready. I was given baggage claim check and told to go to pre-checkin. Lines at checkin are extremely long and SLOW at the Aria. When my turn finally came I was told that she couldn't register us as it was my husbands name only on the reservation ( I booked deluxe room for two and provide both names to reservations agent). She then said okay she would take my information and my husband needed to come back with me with his photo ID when we came back. We went to see the Hoover Dam and as promised the Aria did call in mid afternoon to say the room was ready. We got backt to the Aria close to dinner time. We checked in and called for our bags. Unlike other reviews the bags did come in a very reasonable time. We were WOWED by the beauty of the room and all the modern amenities,electronics,etc. I was taking pictures/videos of the room just to post online. That was when I discovered that the free wifi internet didn't exist and they wanted a daily charge for this. When I booked the room , I particularly was interested in the Aria as it posted a "no resort fee" and when I reserved the room was told that wifi would be included in the room charge. When I went down to the dest to query this I was told that "this won't be consolation to you but like the other Vegas hotels we are going to a resort fee in November". Decided not to make a big deal out of this and went to dinner at Lemongrass. We had an excellent meal (service was also very good) and then went to explore the Vegas strip. We got back to the room very late and that was when we learned a valuable lesson. If sleep is of any concern to you on a vacation before you are smitten by the beauty of a place take the time to check out the bed or whatever is most important to you. The bed is "pillowtop" but were clearly not replaced since the hotel opened. What made it worse was the boxframe it was on was totally shot and needed to be replaced. We struggled to find a spot that we would not sink to the bottom or the middle and finally just slept on the floor. Yes I did just say that and between my husband and myself we have travelled all over the world for business and/or pleasure and never had to do this. My husband went to the front desk in the morning and was told they would need to have housekeeping check out the bed. He said this was unaccesptable. Without any apology or offer of compensation they offered to show him another room with king bed (he requested that they show him a room with two queens thinking that we'd have a better chance of at least one good bed). They said the room with two queens would be an additional $30 charge. We were told to wait outside a room for security to show us the room and "try" the bed.. I think we waited at least 30 minutes or more for security.
