The second room was pretty much the same as the original but the bed was marginally better and for one more night I just wanted to settle in and enjoy the rest of my time in Vegas. I had left the privacy light (everything in this hotel is electronic) on when I left our first room as all our belongings were still in it. We came back to the room to call for a bellhop to move our bags only to find the room ajar and two men in the room switching the mattress. I am still clueless why they didn't offer to do this in the first place. They then looked at the box spring and said maybe they needed to put some plywood between the mattress and boxspring!! I know this can be done but in a 10 month old five star hotel???? We went out to enjoy our last day/evening in Vegas and pretty much spent the rest of our time anywhere but the Aria. Came back at the end of the evening only to find that the bulbs in the lamps by the bed needed to be replaced. Called housekeeping twice before someone came up and then he looked at me and said "did you try everything to see if they worked". Yes the remotes worked and the bulb needed to be replaced. We didn't bother to call for a bellman on checkout and just took our bags to the parking lot ourselves. Checkout was not long but not once was an apology for our inconvenience even expressed by any of the staff. If Vegas is on your list of places to go to please realize that there are so many hotels to choose from that please read reviews carefully before you choose hotel. Look beyond the surface as some of the older hotels in this tight economy may actually be providing better hospitality and services (Ballys did give us a book with several discount coupons). The Aria and City Center are well located and the hotel is beautfiul and modern but they need to make serious changes in how the hotel is managed. We have just gotten back from vacation but do plan on writing also to Aria and MGM management re our experience which I see from other recent reviews is unfortunately not uncommon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BrendaCumbria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a wonderful location for exploring Vegas. The hotel is very modern and the staff go the extra mile to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelerChick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on holiday for 4 days. The rooms are designed for gadget freaks like me, so I loved the automation -- you can flip one switch and turn everything on or off as you enter or leave. I also loved being able to set an alarm that opened the curtains, turned on the TV and the lists. Very cool. We had only one time when the curtains wouldn't open, but a couple of tries later they did. I loved that there was no line up when we checked in -- I absolutely hate when arriving on a long flight and having to stand in line for a long time to check in. For the most part we ate at the buffet when we ate in the hotel, mostly for the selection. Like most buffets, the food is about average, but I did enjoy the fact that there was a huge selection and most of the food was not heavily processed junk. We could get real vegetables, real fruit, etc. There was a small line up (3 minute wait) when we checked out, but we were offered to just leave an e-mail address and have our bill sent to us. We opted out of that, but it was nice that they offered. We didn't get a lot of time to spend by the pool. However, the pool area small compared to some of the more popular casinos. It probably wouldn't have mattered much to us, but it could if you are used to the gigantic areas like at the Luxor. The casino staff were pleasant, but the drink hostesses rarely came by and when they did it was often 30 minutes before they returned with a drink, if they did at all. We tip these ladies well and it still didn't really do us any good. Most of the time I just want water or club soda, but that was hard to come by. The only negative part of our stay was the ODOR near the spa. I can't call it perfume or scent. This smell was gag-inducing horrible, overpowering and rank. Even walking by the hallway to the hallway to the spa was a "hold your breath and walk quickly" experience. This is something that definitely needs to be fixed. I would never book a spa appointment due to the...stink. If we can get a a deal, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel, 1 star service”
Reviews.Author: scottishlass8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria for one week in October with my husband and family. On arriving at the hotel at 10pm after a long journey there was nobody to greet us or help with our baggage. We queued at check-in and were told that there were no non-smoking rooms available and no King bed rooms available so we would have to stay in a smoking room with 2 queen beds and ask to change room the following day. We asked if they could just sort out the room change for us the following day but they said no. So at 9am the next morning we approached reception who said they wouldn't know what rooms were available until later on. My husband complained about the inconvenience of this and at first was getting nowhere but spoke to the supervisor who said that she's put $60 of credit on our room account for the inconvenience. It took a further 2 visits to reception and 2 phone calls until we finally got moved into the correct room at 5pm the following day. This spoilt the first day of our holiday. The concierge gave us the wrong directions to a restaurant we were looking for. It turned out that the $60 credit wasn't added to one of our rooms so we had to request this again as well. On a positive note, the hotel is beautiful and the location is perfect. The rooms are lovely and we've never slept in such a comfy bed and the breakfast buffet is fab and very reasonable during the week. We felt the hotel lacked a bit of atmosphere compared to some of the other major hotels. All in all a great hotel which is totally let down by its customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Ah-mazing hotel, even better price”
Reviews.Author: TheGounz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a week at his hotel and we couldn't have picked a better hotel for the price. There is nothing to can complain about. The hotel is located a bit off the Strip but it is still right in the middle of all the action with just a short walk before being on the Strip. The hotel check-in was quick even though we arrived at a major rush hour. They made sure to add more employees to accomodate as many people as possible. We asked to have the highest floor available and we were given the 17th floor which gave us an incredible city view. The room was far from the elevators but it didn't bother us at all. The rooms are a decent size and the layout is well designed. I had read reviews of people complaining about the electronic room control but we can't complain about that. The bed was incredibly comfortable and it was hard getting out of bed every day. For the food we ordered room service twice and we were pretty surprised by how good the food was. The only other restaurant we tried at the hotel was Cafe Vettro and we enjoyed several meals there for both breakfast and lunch. Overall, we were very pleased and if I had to go there again I would pick this place over others on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Place to be on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: vez_9
Reviews.Content: We had a great week at the Aira. Checkin was no problem. We choose a smoking room which seemed like we were the first to stay in it. The rooms were spacious, beds very comfy and the view was over the pools. Everything is controlled from the touch screen clock beside the bed. We loved the casino. There was a buzz about this casino compared to the others (Maybe cos it's new and everyone was in ours) The dealers seemed more talkative here and drinks come quick. Round the pool things about a bit steep but what do you except from a nice new hotel. Theres a shop just on the strip so you can stock up on water and snacks for the room too. We have stayed at the Bellagio and Planet Hollywood but this is were we would return. Great spot!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place that could be Better.”
Reviews.Author: Chris10573
Reviews.Content: Do not want to complain but want to give people an honest review. Booked about two months in advance. Two rooms for four nights (which were comped prior so they did not cost me anything) but my mom and myself do a good bit of gambling so i am sure we paid for our rooms more than once. Ok arrived at 200 pm , me my wife and my mom and also my 2 year old son, Check in was quick and simple, two king rooms that were non smoking and that were joined, the only thing they could offer us was on the 5th floor. I would have liked to have been higher but didnt complain and took it . Rooms were clean, a good size, and far from elevators, once i got out of elevator on the 5th floor i counted 230 steps from elevator to room. May not sound like much but to do over and over and over it begins to take a toll. I was told that the hotel was suppose to have another bank of elevators, but when the economy tanked, they saved money by eliminating some elevators, could be true, dont know . But my two rooms 5237 and 5239 were a good walk and i dont know how top architects could miss this design flaw. anyway both rooms had minor electronic issues, one room could not get curtains to open, and they other room couldnt get tv to work one day.. Both issues were corrected within one day. Ate at chinese rest. Blossoms which was very very good, everything we ordered was a nice size portion and the quality of the food was excellant. Cafe Verte we ate at also, food was just average. We gave the Buffet a try for lunch. A great variety but a lot of the choices just didnt taste that good. So I would say the buffet was just average. The casino does have a strong smell of vanilla aroma that started to make me a little sick. Room service was very good. Upon check out had 6 bags , called bellman, after 20 min , called back they still didnt come 20 min later was getting to close to my flight time , ended up carrying own bags, waited over 40 mins for bellman and never showed up. With all gambling even though I had 120.00 comp dollars showing on my players card, they said that i could only convert those and use on slot machine and i couldnt use it towards any of the meals that I had charged to my room. I thought this was a bad buisness, Very tight on comps slim to none . I think with some work that the hotel could be a real winner. but they do some real stupid things. like 15.00 a day for internet service. Just when things a going good they do something stupid. anyway if you want any advice I would be glad to help email me at amoco29@optonline.net

Reviews.Title: “difficult check in”
Reviews.Author: travellerVictoria_BC
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Aria from the 23rd for 4 nights. We had pre-booked and paid for was a room with two queen beds. At check in the agent asked us if we wanted a non smoking room, we said we did and then were told that not was available. We were offered a room with one king bed and a cot, we could move to the two queen bed room the next day. We were told that the non smoking option was on availability only, fine. We decided to take the two queen room, smoking. The agent initially made it seem that it was available and the only reason we could not have two queen beds was because we wanted a non smoking room. It seemed to us that we were set up in a way, because the smoking room was not available either. The agent was nice, and professional and I'm sure he was doing as instructed. He asked us if we wanted to speak to a manager and we said yes. He went away and did speak to a woman a little bit away and when he came back a non smoking room with two queen beds was suddenly available. Also, the pool closes at 5pm. All in all we had a good stay. The room was well appointed and quiet and had all the electronic gadgets you could want.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Gamblord
Reviews.Content: Loved the Aria, utterly modern and free from the slightly embarrasing "themes" of the other resorts. Great, super clean, classy and crisp room with ultra comfy bed and lots of gadgets to play with, loved the room control centre although ours seemed to go a bit haywire from time to time but generally its a great feature, and the room also has the fastest Internet I've ever tried, ipod connector is great feature but the room could use some decent speakers. Made up for minor niggles with the wonderful views of the strip and airport. Aria housed the best casino we tried (and we visited most of the big ones) with excellent, cheerfull staff and most importanty a remarkably smoke free, clean environment. Great bars with some really interesting coctails, try the "fire in the hole" to get rid of your hangover! Great restaurants, very nice pool complex but the upgrade to the beach club was a bit too pricey. Arias "Haze" nightlub is simply mind-blowing and has to be visited. All in all we had a super time and didn't wat to leave, we went for 4 days and could probably have spent 2 of those just expolring the Aria. Don't forget to use your Players club card when gaming and you'll get VIP access to Haze among other goodies.

Reviews.Title: “Five star all the way!”
Reviews.Author: northerngirl3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 11 nights from September 19-30, 2010. This was the 9th visit to Las Vegas and absolutely the best ever. We were celebrating my husband's 50th birthday and we treated like royalty at the Aria. Our shuttle dropped us off in the bus lobby and we easily found our way to the front registration desk. The check-in line was only 5 minutes, the best I have ever experienced in Las Vegas the previous 8 times. The check-in process was quickly and efficiently handled, and we found ourselves upgraded to a Cityview on the 29th floor upon arrival in the room (Our package paid only for a regular view). The room was second to none and even though I am 'technology challenged' I had no difficulty in figuring out the electronic control pad for the room. The first night we found two platters of chocolate covered strawberries with cards to welcome us and to wish my husband 'Happy Birthday'. Our 'Aria experience' continued in an incredibly comfortable room, with fabulous room food service without 'delays', impecible daily maid service, wonderful turndown service with chocolates each night, terrific food in the restaurants, lack of smoke in the hotel (didn't realize how great the Aria was for this until we were in other hotels), the Spa very enjoyable, wonderful, helpful staff whenever we found ourselves in need from the conceirge staff, front desk area greeters, security etc., the walk to the strip was quick and easy (better than almost all the high end hotels on the strip), although we were not 'fanatic' Elvis fans we truly enjoyed the show in the hotel. We had the ability to turn the chairs in our room around to view the strip and enjoy a glass of wine to finish the evening taking in the breathtaking view. All in all, this was our favourite Las Vegas hotel and experience...and we would recommend this hotel to anyone who cares where they 'lay their head' at night in Vegas. From the get go we made it clear we were 'not' gamblers and there to enjoy the hotel and the city's many attractions, and were made to feel like 'high rollers' non the less!

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel, my a?!”
Reviews.Author: UsaHank
Reviews.Content: where do I start, upon walking in there is this terrible perfume smell that they use to hide the smoke . asked for non smoking room, given a smoking room. getting a cab or limo is a nightmare walk. the waitress in the city bar brought the wrong drink and tried to steal my money off the table. the bartender in front apparently does not recognize legal tender, had the nerve to ask me for another twenty dollar bill because the one the cashier at the casino gave me wasn't clean enough for him. the rooms are too much, in order to operate the lights and television you better be under 25 years of age. the security is overzealous, asking for room key every 500 feet . the sportsbook closed at night, could not cash winning tickets, even the cashiers refused to cash winning tickets. the table s in the casino were half empty yet the employees treatment of guests was the most ignorant ever displayed in vegas. no comps given , even after taking there money this hotel is a loser, stay away, although the buffet was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a Place”
Reviews.Author: cjg87
Reviews.Content: This place is truly gigantic. It is beautiful in a modern, cold Italian style. The room was good sized and well decorated, and the bath was perhaps the nicest I have ever seen. Room service was excellent. Only restaurant we visited was the coffee shop, and the food was fine but pricey. Same for drinks in the bars. Valet was good. Overall I have nothing to criticize, though it is true that the place is so big that there are some long walks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel but unremarkable all the same”
Reviews.Author: Centauri27
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that we don't travel all that often, let alone stay at 5 star hotels like the Aria. But we couldn't resist the opportunity when we found this very aggressively priced deal on Expedia. Our initial impressions were very favourable: massive courtyard, massive lobby, all decorated tastefully. The hotel looked very modern indeed. Our room was on the 50th floor and sported stunning views of the city and mountains. Our room was modern and high tech--perhaps too much so. It took several minutes to figure out how to turn the lights on--everything was touch control but unfortunately the main control pad was very unresponsive (took me ten minutes to program in the wake-up chime. They really should contact Apple for their touch-screen technology.) So why do I sound somewhat less than enthused? For starters, I thought a 5-star hotel was suppose to pamper you with amenities. This hotel certainly had the amenities but everything was extra cost. Want to dip in their pool? That'll be a $30/day "facility fee" please. Work out in the gym? Same $30 fee. Cool your water in the fridge? There's a bar fridge but it was intentionally designed to offer *no* extra space. They'll deliver you a mini fridge...for an extra fee of course. The room didn't even have a coffee maker--a standard amenity in 2-star hotels. I didn't bother to ask because I knew what the answer would be. Needless to say, we did not bother to pay all these extra fees seeing how we were away from the hotel most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “I would not pay full price and if you have a sensitive nose, don't bother”
Reviews.Author: winnief00
Reviews.Content: Pros: Tram runs from 8 am-4 am- Very convenient!, Guests don't have to pay cover at Haze (before midnight), Comfy bed, modern feel, Great shower and tub, Remote controls everything in the room, free web access, Heated pools, Desserts at buffet are amazing, View is fantastic! Cons: Vanilla scent all over casino floor and lobby smells alright in the beginning but gets annoying by the second day, Not enough cocktail ladies and they take forever to return, Not enough 25 cent slot machine (Mostly penny slots or $1 and higher slots), Not enough creative slot machines that are interactive (I love the Uspin and Sex and the City - very fun when you win), Room fridge has a sensor. If you remove any item, even if you don't eat it, they charge you, Too much technology! Flipping the channels on the tv is annoying since the remote lags a little bit. No fan in the bathroom or air ventilator Table minimum bets are too high for roulette and craps - $15, ouch! There's no late night or 24 hour dining options on casino floor Casino layout is confusing, I wish there was a cashier cage located on both sides of the casino Its a bit of a walk on to the strip - 10 min walk. But its not a horrible walk. $35 fee to use gym - the fee includes access to the spa areas but I think gym should be included Tip: Rent a car at the airport (as little as $40 a day). Its more expensive when you rent outside of airport. Parking is free at all hotel casinos on the strip. Makes checking out the hotels on the strip alot easier, Sign up for MGM player card - its worth it! My friend lost $650 but he got back $50. Its not much of a return but its something.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyGalway
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant hotel - probably the most modern on the strip, with great facilities, an array of restaurants to choose from, and great service. Some of the additional services can be pricey however (e.g. $30 to use the gym for just one day, $1 per minute internet), but overall, it's a great stay. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Total Let Down”
Reviews.Author: sheblee72
Reviews.Content: So happy to be checking out of the Aria tomorrow. My mom & I thought this hotel would be fun, fresh & new, but to our surprise its a piece of crap with bad staff that is still being weeded out. Every day we had a problem: The 1 flat screen is going out, the towels missing from that the bathroom, the comforter funky, scale not working, dirty pillow cases left on the chair, dirty used glasses left in room after cleaning crew left, comp bathroom shower package opened with items missing out, hotel manager unavailable at night, floor supervisor unable to be found it took 40 mins & 4 phone calls to get assistance. This horrible laundry list of BS will for sure keep me & everyone I know away from this crappy place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our room was already occupied by a guy in a wife beater and boxers!!”
Reviews.Author: trvleat
Reviews.Content: Girlfriends and I drove up to aria on Friday night with a reservation for a double room, we called the hotel two times on the way up and were assured that we would have a double room, however upon arrival..none were available because they were completely sold out! So we ended up with a king and a roll away...so three people in the king and one on the rollaway...then the TV didn't work...and we had to call 4x before somone finally fixed it more than an hour later! The manager we spoke with, Brian..promised a double room by the next morning at 10am...so we got up the next morning, had breakfast...then were told...NO double room, and NO record of the verbal exchange with Brian..what?? Finally after some wrangling we were given a room, so we went back and grabbed all our bags and went to the new room...only to be greeted by an undressed guy who promptly offered to party with us, while we stood awkwardly in the hallway w/ all our bags!! Unbelievable!! don't hotels keep track of this stuff?? anways, dragged all our stuff back downstairs...and talked more...and finally were told to go back to our room and they'd call us when one became available...they gave us a 50$ food credit for our trouble..Finally at 5pm...we moved into our double room, got another 50$ food credit and free internet...ONLY after we spent exhaustive time talking to hotel staff who were frankly not that helpful!! wouldn't a high end hotel who makes mistakes like this try to be more helpful? why is it up to us the customer to make these demands? urrgghh!! anways..we still had a fun time despite the hotel room annoyance...

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but flawed”
Reviews.Author: kkhill87
Reviews.Content: IF I could take a star away, I would. The beds were already worn out. The linens were thin polyester-y bumpy and the bathtub drips. The coffee was miles from the room and the lines were long. Too big, too busy. too expensive. Check in and check out were scary. They kept woarning you about a;ll the potential charges should you move things around. The hotel is beautiful, the room was huge, but 3 stars at most.

Reviews.Title: “Great area and great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jbm0022
Reviews.Content: First time to stay at the Aria. The room was comfortable and controlled from a single remote i.e lights, tv, curtain, temp. The hotel was in a great area near everything we wanted to do. Easy in and out for taxis unlike some of the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, but ...”
Reviews.Author: wombat18
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have pointed out, this is an outstanding facility. 4000 rooms, $8.5 billion for the whole complex, average daily room rate of $175, and occupancy levels around 82% - clearly they are doing something right. I booked a standard room and found it to be outstanding - spacious, comfortable, sparkling clean, and with state-of-the-art technology. The bathroom was top-notch - marble surfaces, separate bath and shower, private toilet. Pity they didn't service my room every day - coming back to a dirty toilet and bathroom after a long day of work is a bit dispiriting. But, like others, I had some problems. I, too, booked a non-smoking room and was given a smoking room for my first night. No, I couldn't tell much difference and they offered to swap after the first night, but really why bother asking for my preference. I wonder what they would do if I were allergic to cigarette smoke? Given that it is a casino I suppose there is nothing they can do. The layout of the resort is odd. Having to walk through the casino every time I want to get to my room is odd. Having long, long corridors without much lighting is odd. Having to show my room-key everywhere I go is odd. Not being able to find various restaurants (one of them doesn't even have a sign) is odd. Not being connected to the monorail is odd. Although typical for a Vegas casino, it is really frustrating not having coffee making facilities in your room. It is also frustrating to not be able to have a newspaper delivered outside your door each morning. I'm sorry, but as a business traveler I require those things. And, no, I'm not going to call the bellhop every morning of my stay and order a pot of coffee and newspaper - by the time they get to my room, I'm on my way to my meeting. I don't like being nickel and dimed, so this hotel wasn't as all inclusive as I like my resort stay to be. Having to pay for coffee is poor form. Having to pay for internet is poor form. Having to pay to use the pools is poor. Having to pay to use the gym is poor. Having to pay for a newspaper is poor. I wonder when they will charge to have a shower or watch the TV? All-in-all, I loved this place. But, after being opened 10 months, they should have worked out more of the kinks.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous state-of-the-art new hotel centrally located with terrific restaurants and shopping”
Reviews.Author: motAlamo
Reviews.Content: Aria opened early in 2010 and has the newest of everything, including electronics, shopping, and artwork. Lovely rooms with modern entertainment center controls, electronic window coverings, and a spacious, comfortable bathroom. Excellent bed and bedding. Good choice of restaurants and shopping and spa services. Beautiful pool area with several pools and hot tubs to choose from. Great location in the middle of the Strip at City Center, between Bellagio and Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “kick-a$$ room with awesome view”
Reviews.Author: nole1731
Reviews.Content: If you are on the fence about staying here, and not the type of person who nitpicks everything, this place is awesome. We were there Oct. 15th-18th. ROOMS-We arrived at 11:00 a.m. and room was ready. Room and view were spectacular. We had a corner suite on 29th floor to entertain friends on my 40th. Our friends had regular rooms and they loved it. Central system is a little weird, but if you can figure out how to use hammer and nail, you can figure this out. It really isn't that hard. We shut all the lights off on ourselves a few times, but who really cares, we thought it was kind of funny. Room service was quick and good. Not a great selection though. Very nice and helpful staff. Bathtub in the corner suite is killer. Especially at night. Lets just say it lets the romance blossom. TV 's in the room are great. Never any sound except what we made in our own room. Coming in the hotel- Everyone loved the vanilla smell as you enter (no where near overwhelming). Casino is clean modern and cool. I never really gamble at the big hotels anyway, so couldn't tell you much else (I did not lose at Drai however). Spa and pool are really, really nice. I can see how this place will soon become a classy, fun pool party that is not overtaken by spring break crowd. How do I know this? Because it is a little expensive. But we came to Vegas expecting to spend a little money and this place is worth it. Surrounding area- the hotel could use a little cheaper, quicker shops inside that are closer to the elevators (when hungover in the morning), and maybe a more diverse selection, but we really didn't mind. Everything you need (later in the morning and during the day) is within relatively short distance, and very diverse. I like staying at different hotels everytime I go to Vegas, so I probably would not stay there again if I returned, BUT like I said, only because I want to stay at other hotels I have not stayed at. If I was asked to go and everyone was staying at ARIA, I would still be very happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Gary194724
Reviews.Content: We had read reviews from July and they were not flattening. We had an excellent room, the bed and pillows were the same as we used at home. The casino was spacious with alot of different slots to play. The only negative was, the drink ladies did not always come around. But we had the same problem at some other casino's. Overall we found this trip to very good. We will stay at Aria the next time we come out.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: azmd65
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews and location of convention booked a corner suite. Arrived early. Doorman said don't expect your room to be ready. Front desk a total zoo. All signs said "Check-out only" so I figured I was stuck. Well turns out that I was able at least check in to see if my room was ready. Lobby was nothing special and very loud. Went to grab a quick bite at the cafe before going to my room. After fairly long walk found a line of about 30 people waiting to be seated. I had had enough. Cancelled my room and had a wonderful stay at the nearby Mandarin Oriental. Peaceful, beautiful, 5' walk to Aria casino and other City Center stuff AND same price as suite at Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great location”
Reviews.Author: msgc2010
Reviews.Content: I loved the room, bathroom and location, my only issue is the electronics that operate everything in the room didn't work. The best part was that to get to our room we had to pass the Jean Phillipe pastry shop every day - heaven. We had a very very good rate for this room.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but with annoying quirks.”
Reviews.Author: vepr
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Aria for a week. Nice place, buy has several annoying issues. First the room. It looks sleek, but has a ridiculous and very glitch prone central control unit which controls everything on the room, from lights to tv to curtains. The remote is somewhat slow to respond, but also has some kind of setting to predict what you would want, so when country to turn one one thing for example, some other thing in the room will also turn on or off for no apparent reason. Trying to turn on the lights above the bed, a few times I also ended up with a tv streaming music or opened curtains. I don't know if that was just my malfunctioning unit, but if not, the idiotic automated presets have got to go. Often in the middle of the night, I preferred to go to the bathroom in the dark rather than try to turn anything on. Another annoying feature is the fact that there are no electrical outlets in the room that are in the vicinity of the bed. Which means that if you want to plug in anything like a cell phone or a laptop ( and I had both) you have to leave it across the room by the tv where the two outlets are located. The hotel promised to bring me an extension cord which they keep around just for such complaints but it never arrived. For a hotel attached to a conference center which is hoping to receive business clientele, that does not make sense. Internet is available, but at $15 a day is way overpriced. Options to grab a quick meal are limited, with only one cafe selling very expensive sandwiches and deserts ( which ate very good by the way). The problem is that for breakfast and lunch the lines are ridiculous, since you order one at a time and there are no other quick food options. The sit down restaurants are very good but extremely expensive. In the steak house, a $50 steak requires the side dishes to be purchased separately.delicious, but feels like a rip off. The architecture itself is impressive but rather cold, feeling very un-Vegas. there are not enough check in and out windows and the process takes a while because of thw long lines. Overall, I think it is a nice hotel, but there are better choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “Class and great service”
Reviews.Author: Biz_Professor
Reviews.Content: The front desk is a little slow if you hit it at a busy time. However, we were able to check in at noon since we arrived from the airport early. The hotel was perfect and I had a great time. I did have a bad experience with the iron. It had a hard water stain and it leaked brown water stains on my dress shirt. I called the front desk. Within 20 minutes security game to the room and they cleaned and pressed my shirt within 4 hours. The stain was removed and the shirt was perfect. I love Aria. I was there for business by my wife joined me. Only complaint is that it is pricey and is the hotel food. However, you can get cheaper food down the road. Also, the maritinis and other drinks in the casino are top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, really has the wow factor!”
Reviews.Author: Kara02
Reviews.Content: Booked the Aria as a surprise b-day break for my husband's 30th! Was very nervous as dont usually book things by myself and oh how relieved i was!! The check in was fast and friendly. We were given a fantastic room on the 30th floor, overlooking the strip! My husband was blown away by the room, bathroom and view! Really made the weeks of panic worth while! (and oh, what amazing beds, you just sink into them!!!) I am pregnant and my senses are high, so was a little worried about the vanilla smell others had commented on, this did not bother me at all, in fact the only time i smelt it was in the hallway leading to the pool. The breakfast buffet was good and offered a wide selection! Also a must, ice cream from the cafe - every flavour you could ask for! The pool area is fantastic, with many pools and beds to choose from. Again, was worried about the smokiness of the Casino, but this was not a problem, they also have none smoking tables. My husband managed to have many Free drinks while playing - not quite the same for me only allowed water or orange juice!! The location of the Aria is great, central to the strip. You can walk through The Crystals and it will bring you out opposite Planet Hollywood and right near the Balagio! The romote that controlled everything was just great, felt like kids again, setting an alarm to open the curtains for us every morning was just amazing! Conciege went out of their way to help, we had booked a table at 'off the strip' one night, luckily we mentioned this to them, they informed us that it was some miles away and a taxi would have cost $80 for a round trip!! Gave some great recomendations on other restuarants and even booked 2 for the following nights! If we return to Vegas (which may not be for some time, due to our little arrival), we would definately choose the Aria Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “The seafood buffet was unbelieveable and the service was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: stella51_2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel employees were very knowledgeable and that was a plus in it self. We had a great time at the show. The seafood buffet was fabulous. I never had Alaska crab legs like the ones I had at the buffet nice, sweet and tender. I enjoy the Digital set up right at your finger tips next to the bed. The view from the West side of the Hotel was beauitful with the mountain in the back round what a great view at night. Yes, I will be staying at the Aria on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “extremely slow front desk service, not enough non-smoking rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ophelia89
Reviews.Content: while the hotel is new and hip, it's pluses are outweighed by its issues. I have never seen such a chaotic and slow front desk - I have no idea why it takes them so long to check customers in, and there are no roped lines, so it is every man for themselves in trying to get up to the front desk. They also ran out of non-smoking rooms and all of my colleagues got stinky smoking rooms: it seemed especially inappropriate for a conference for cardiologists. Finally, the fees are obscene - I had to pay $10 to pick up a package that had been sent to me at the hotel. What a ripoff. Finally, my room, although attractive and comfortable, was extremely confusing to navigate with all of the unlabeled light and power buttons, and I was kept up half the night by loud music blaring from somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: JTinGB
Reviews.Content: This place is very very nice! Rooms are huge, clean, luxurious, the beds are phenomenal, and the room is loaded with the latest technology. We ate breakfast there everyday and the food was very good. The pool area is really something to see.... 3 large pools which are very clean and the scenery was nice in more ways than one!! Don't know if we were able to book this for a great price because it is so new, but it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking Vegas excitement, good location”
Reviews.Author: natalia_cim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came for our first wedding anniversary. We wanted to try the Aria because it is one of the newest hotels on the strip. I read up about it on tripadvisor before we went, here are things I read about and experienced first hand: 1. The hotel smells like vanilla when you walk in. A little strong for my taste but better than smoke. 2. Nobody ever came to offer us a drink while we played the slots. We walked next door to the Monte Carlo 3 times over 3 days. They were much more prompt with gaming drink service. 3. They do not have an abundance of 5 cent slots. Better gaming at Monte Carlo if you're not a high roller. I mostly prefer Jacks or Better. 4. The Jean Georges Steakhouse is phenomenal. Easily the best sea bass I've tasted in my life. Very attentive staff. Surprised us with a dessert and wrote "Happy Anniversary" on the plate with chocolate. 5.The plug in the bathroom is located in the most inconvenient place. I don't know who's idea it was to put it there but it is really not smart. You literally have to clear off the entire counter if you're going to plug anything in, or you''ll knock everything on the ground. 6. It's an older crowd. You will not encounter hoards of sloppy college kids here, which is great. But when I come to Vegas I don't mind a little ruckus. We are in our late 20s, it was a little too tame for me. 7. The buffet sucks. Lack of variety, poor presentation, food tasted bad. Spend more and go to the Bellagio buffet, you won't regret it. 8.Great location. The Planet Hollywood shops are really close and will have something for those of us that don't spend thousands on Gucci and Fendi. Only 15 minutes walk to the center of the strip. Lots of close restaurant choices. 9. The decore is very modern. Very cold, not exciting. Minimalist. The entrance leaves something to be desired. It seemed like whoever decorated it was trying to disguise that it is in fact a casino. It was like a really nice convention center everywhere you went. Over all good experience but for the money I'd rather go back and stay at the Palazzo. Their rooms are more lush, twice as big, and the environment is far more exciting. The best part of this hotel is it's location. We're going back to Vegas for New Year's Eve, I just managed to convince my family that staying at the Aria isn't going to make for an exciting weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Service doesn't match beauty of property”
Reviews.Author: DinkyDi61
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, hip property. Guest rooms smell wonderful, have beautiful beds, fabulous technology and lovely amenities. Heaps of storage space. Poor signage. Almost impossible to find your way around. A map of both the hotel and Las Vegas should be offerred when checking in. Should tell you about the monorail between the Monte Carlo, Aria and Bellagio and where to find it. The poor pianist in the piano bar on Saturday night was drowned out by the doof-doof music coming from the casino floor. Horrible uniforms on the staff. Bell hops extremely friendly, knowledgable and helpful. Greeters in the Spa at Aria stuck up and full of themselves . Therapists very good. The man in the salon who provided the Royal Shave for my friend was absolutely bloody fantastic. Ask him about customer service, management of Aria. Why are jack hammers digging up the ground in the porte-cochere? The property is 10 months old... Why is the cappucino machine broken in the breakfast restaurant? Why do I have to stir my tea with a dessert spoon? Why do they not know what a teaspoon is? Why, when I contacted their conierge via email 3 times, over a period of 2 months prior to my visit through their website link did I not get a reply? 'I'm sorry ma'am" doesn't cut it guys. So many questions, so few answers. Fix your problems. You have the potential to be a fabulous property on the strip but you don't get customer service at all. Oh and by the way, it wouldn't kill you to offer free Wi-Fi in your guest rooms. Boo hoo to Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra money for this truly fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cramseysmom
Reviews.Content: We moved to Aria from Planet Hollywood because PH was a bust. Aria is gorgeous, smells like a spa all the time and the rooms are awesome.! I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SeaJohn
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! I have stayed at most of the top Las Vegas hotels, and Aria is one of the best. The check-in was seamless; they even let me check in early around noon and were able to locate me on a reasonable floor with a great view. The staff I ran in to throughout the hotel was friendly and always helpful. The room was spotless, gorgeous, and one of the best (if not the best) on the strip and I just stayed in the standard room. The technology in the room is very cool and everything is controlled through the TV and remotes. The people that complain about the remotes/technology probably couldn’t figure it out. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The casino is a little different and took a day to get used to, but it is still nice and not as smoky as some. The pool is phenomenal and mostly adults….do not miss this. The spa/gym is also a nice treat and quite large. It is a great value at $30 or $80 for a 3 day pass. I would stay at Aria over Bellagio. I think Aria rivals Venetian/Palazzo for amenities…although the location of Aria is by far the best and it has that sparkling new and modern feel to it. Hallways are large, but if you don’t want to walk, request a room near the elevators. The buffet is great and the café is also a nice place to grab a bite. One thing I found is that employees struggle a bit to give you directions out of the hotel. They will send you to Crystals or all around to catch the monorail. If you want to go to Bellagio, even easier is to use the walkway from the north valet, through Vadara, and in to Bellagio (6 minute walk mostly indoors). I also found it much easier to walk to Monte-Carlo if you are heading in that direction. Everything seemed very close staying at Aria vs. some of the other hotels we have stayed at in the past. I would highly recommend staying here if you are willing to spend the money for a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Expensive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travler1976
Reviews.Content: Found this to be a nice new hotel. Modern and expensive. Service was impeccable from the free valet parking, to bellman and front desk. Did have to request on arrival for room to be vaccumed properly and it was handled promply. This is a big hotel and you wil log some miles walking to your room and such. Great ammenities in room, bed and bath are nice. Automated controls of lights and curtains is cool. Get a city view room and open curtains at night for a floor to ceiling window view of the strip, it is great. This hotel is also quiet.,didn't really hear much noise around . My only complaints are the lack of casual resturants in the hotel, Had to stand in line too many times . Breakfast is a problem, consider room service instead. We ate at other hotels simply because there were no lines, you even wait for coffee and pastries. Here is a warning. THE MINI BAR HAS SENSORS IN IT, AND ON TOP AS WELL. IF YOU TAKE AN ITEM OUT OF FRIDGE YOU WILL GET CHARGED FOR THAT ITEM. IF YOU TAKE ANYTHING OFF THE TOP OF THE MINI BAR TO LOOK AT IT YOU WILL BE CHARGED FOR IT WETHER YOU CONSUMED IT OR NOT, BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: barrylisa
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the Aria. Service, location and value for money was great. Rooms were a good size and very modern. Will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: Oscar827
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Aria Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas. We went because we were got 3 night comp for room, 2buffets, and $100 free play. We were able to get cheap airfare from Mpls. so we went. The Hotel was very modern and a very nice place to stay. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were great. It was a standard room on the 19th floor with a nice view. Check-in was easy and quick. We checked in on a Tuesday at 5:30 in the afternoon. Check-out was also easy on Friday. Rooms were like many have said before, very advanced in technology. We are not very advanced, but it was easy. To not touch anything on the frig or it will cost alot extra. They told us that at check-in. The check-in person was very nice. The hotel floors were a little hard at first to navigate, but not bad after you been there for a while. The only place we at the Aria was the dinner buffet. It had good food, but I thought the selection was a little lacking for me. I am not a big buffet person, and I would not have eaten at the buffet if not being free. All the people we had contact with were very friendly and helpful. If you like to have a beverage while playing, they were slow in coming around compared to other casinos we were at. Monte Carlo was better. We played mostly slots and won some and lost some like normal. We had a very good time like always in Vegas. This was our second trip in a two months. We may go again before the end of the year. The Aria was like stated before was nice. Would I pay the extra price to stay at the Aria compared to other places? Probably not, because I would use the extra money it costs on other things. If I could get a deal yes I would. It was an easy place to get to other casinos on that end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “UPSCALE, LOTS OF SPACE, AND HEAVENLY BEDS!”
Reviews.Author: JezebelNM
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and casino, used a promo code so was able to get a rate of $109 a night, would not have paid the normal $360 or so for Fridays and Saturdays etc. The room was great and the beds and pillows were wonderful! Housekeeping could have been better, don't understand why you have to call them if you want linens changed daily, it should be mandatory if you ask me. Even after calling them I checked later in the day when we returned to our room and they had not changed them, they just made the bed. I called again and they sent someone up about an hour later to change them so that was nice. Casino was nice but cocktails were not very available while playing the slots. Nice high ceiling gives a great open air feeling. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Aria, you are my new favourite!!”
Reviews.Author: angie90210
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aria for part 2 of my trip(Wynn was part 1) as i stayed at Bellagio last time and felt it was getting very tired in places and wanted to try something new. So glad i did. Im not a fusspot but i do like my luxury hotels and want surroundings that make me feel good. This did the trick. CHECK IN: First thing you notice is the beautiful vanilla scent wafting through the air, not too overpowering, but gave it a comforting feel . Id love that in my house. Was a busy Saturday morning so as expected room wasnt ready in time. Got a couple pool passes to pass the time and then got my key about 2ish. ROOM: Booked a basic resort room through City and Show (worked out at £140 a night for 2) and was expecting a much smaller area. The room was for me, pretty spacious, lots of floor space, nothing crammed and the large floor to ceiling windows covered the whole back wall. The bathroom was smaller than say Bellagio, Venetian, Wynn but was very modern and spotless. As for the much mentioned controls for the room, i didnt have any problems at all. It is touch screen and very simple ( it has pictures!!) Bed was extremely soft and comfy, slept like a log. HD TV was a nice surprise and plug points for every electrical gadget possible. Was on the 51st floor and had a great view, not strip but Vdara and all the way across to Palms. It was just the lights at night that i wanted, it was so amazing to look out at. CASINO: Im not a gambler so cant comment on machines or tables or the sort, just the feel of the casino area was very different from others. Still busy but not as bright and bustling as the usual. Very dark, but to me suited the feel of the place. The most modern looking and trendy i have been in. FOOD: Had the Buffet at breakfast once only. On a par with the rest. Loved the Jean Phillippe Patisserie section so much, we went there for pastries and crepes the next day. Handy just next to the elevators. Great coffee there also. LOCATION: Ok, so it is situated behind Crystals but when you consider how long it takes to get from your room in most Vegas hotels to the street, then this is absolutely no different. I tried the whole tram nonsense from Bellagio but definitly took longer as you have to walk through the Bellagio spa tower route, up stairs, up more stairs then exit at the far end of Crystals. Depends where you are heading i suppose. I prefered going through Crystals from and exiting at the Planet Hollywood walkway. Much easier and quicker to get to the strip. The only issue i have with location is a personal one. I much prefer the other end of the strip with Venetian, Caesers etc. As you travel up towards the MGM area it gets a bit less touristy and more porn slapper. No big deal really. Overall, i love the Aria and how clean and spacious it is. Upstairs on promenade level is so serene and found the staff to be very friendly and didnt grumble when i paid for my newspaper in dimes. Love that. It has a younger, trendier feel than Bellagio, though not rowdy or wild. Give it a go and judge for yourself, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and best sleeping quality”
Reviews.Author: JAD7752
Reviews.Content: Excellent hight tech hotel located in center of Stip.Quiet beautifull view of surrounding mountains and city view, the hotel provides luxurious accomodation at affordable price.Impeccable service and among one of the best beds I ever slert in. Very satisfied with stay and the quality of bar and restaurant on premises.Excellent and quiet ppol side.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: Naptown2
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice however upon checking into my room I noticed that my room floor was not vacuumed. There was hair everywhere. They were apologetic and sent someone up to clean the room again. Hotel employees were hit or miss. Some were very nice others like, Michael a manager in Cafe Vettro were arrogant and rude. Overall, Aria is just an average hotel however, if you cannot deal with crowds, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Returned still Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: southpamela
Reviews.Content: 2nd time my husband & I have been to the Aria. No negative things to say. Rooms spacious, beds are heavenly, views amazing, staff very polite. We waited until 2:30 pm for room no big deal we expected this being a long weekend. Pools & area are wonderfull. We went to see the viva elvis show music great some moments touching but still my favorite show is the Jersey boys. Loved the service at the casino drinks served quickly while playing. Excellent buffet at the aria also worth to pay all day buffet and go to the P.H. Shopping I love Ross dress for less cross the street from city center. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking room!”
Reviews.Author: kmmartinez21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria recently from October 9-13th. We arrived at about 11am and they told us they didnt have any rooms ready so we checked in our luggage with the concierge and went to explore the city. We arrived back at about 4pm and there was a huge line of people trying to check in. This was the only unpleasant part of our whole trip. Check in took about 1 hour. We ended up getting a Deluxe room on the 11th floor and it was amazing. The view was great and the bed was heaven. Im definitely considering buying one from the Elements store for $2200. We tried room service one day for breakfast and it was delicious and delivered in a timely manner. Other than the check in wait time, this hotel was absolutely amazing. The smell of vanilla that comes through the AC system kind of sticks to you also. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: vita-brevis
Reviews.Content: The new Aria is the best on the strip. Having stayed at a half-dozen or so, including Bellagio and Mirage, I have to say the latest addition pleasantly surprised me. The room is spacious, QUIET, and all wired -- even the curtains move on command. You can set your alarm to have the shades open, a particular TV or radio channel, lights go on, etc just to wake you up. The gadgets aside, the bed was incredibly comfortable, the shower like a spa. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: Morgan109
Reviews.Content: Loved it. I know that there are many beautiful hotels in Vegas but this one manages to keep out the "riff raff". They do this by keeping security at every turn where you have to show your key card to get past. Also it's situated back off the stip with a long enterance so it's a bit walk to get to the sidewalk, which we didn't mind at all. One complaint would be the $15 charge for 24h internet service.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: geo_357
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this trip spur of the moment. The prices for flight and hotel were great. Neither my husband nor myself had ever been to Las Vegas ( hard to imagine since we are in our 60's) We never had any desire to go and said Las Vegas would be the last place to go on a vacation. Just goes to show, never say never. From the moment we landed to the time we left it was a fantastic place to visit. We are not novice travelers either. We lived in England for a year and are seasoned travelers. The Aria was breathtakingly beautiful from the moment you stepped into the lobby . The delicious fragrance that permeates the main floor is intoxicating. I would like to smell that everywhere. We don't gamble AT ALL but it's fun to watch the players. Our room on the 19th floor was perfect and the view stunning, you look out towards the Rio Hotel. The Aria is a little out of the way but who cares, it's fun to explore and walk around given the outdoor temps were in the high 100's . Coming from Washington State it was temperature shock. We went to the Elvis show at the hotel and could have gone to that show every night. We never used any of the services so I am unable to comment of that aspect of the hotel. I will say as previous reviewers have commented on; the remotes in the room are sort of confusing and not user friendly. By the time you figure them out it time to leave. We loved Las Vegas so much we are going back in December. We won't be staying at the Aria but The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. It will be interesting to compare the two. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone but go online and try to get a "special" price. One last comment , the elevators at the Aria might be the fastest in Vegas. Never ever a wait for anything at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over great trip/hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nickle1987
Reviews.Content: Check In: Just came back last night from a 4 night stay at Aria. Overall had a great experience. We arrived around 6pm...check in was about 25 minutes...we asked for a room on the higher floor with a city view...there was none available because of 10 10 10...we go to our room and find that they gave us a room that was occupied by other people...we then went back downstairs to get a new room...the line up was even larger now so I decided to go right over to a counter that was closed and a manager came over to assist me..i told her was happened and she apologized and offered us a free upgrade a panoramic city view corner suite...i dont think we could go to vegas again without getting a suite and city view.. Room: room was amazing!! everything about the room was amazing...bed so comfy...view was awesome we were facing MGM and NYNY and HardRock Cafe...Bathroom was awesome...the technology in the bathroom the toilet had a feature that it sprayed you with water and blow dryed you when you went to the bathoom...nice jacuzzi tub with a city view...everything was just awesome...loved how you could do everything from the tv/computer thingy by the bed...only thing that was kinda gross was there was two half empty bottles of water in the fridge..we didnt complain tho room upgrade was worth it... Extra fees: Local calls cost a 1$ per call which we didnt know about until check out...internet is 15$ for 24 hours per day Restaurants: We only had the buffet once for breakfast...it was really good but the line ups at the toast and eggs and meats counter made your food cold time you got back to your seat...but great selection and great taste just cold but thats what buffets taste like usually...For breakfast we went to Denny's accross the street and Monte Carlo food court...suppers we just went to diff places on strip/other hotels Location: Overall pretty good location...there is a tram to take you to the beligio or Monte Carlo and you can walk through Crystals (mall) to get accross the street to Planet Hollywood we went to Zumanity from Cirque du Sole didnt like it as good as other shows we saw in the past..wouldnt go again..we did a Limo Tour that was pretty cool..first time in a limo..got to tour the strip...went to las vegas sign...pawn shop..and old wedding chappels...well worth $62 /hour...We went to Fremont Street Experience...great time there!!! Mix Bar at Mandalay Bay was amazing very nice view!!!! Coyote Ugly was not too bad but really small/no views ..we had a fun time though...

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford it, it's a real treat.”
Reviews.Author: Susan S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly new and it's got all the bells and whistles. When we entered the room for the first time the curtains opened up themselves. Everything can be controlled with the remote control. The TV, lights, service if you want it, curtains, the list goes on. It was bliss. It's not for people who care about the cost of a hotel, however, if you feel like treating yourself, it's the place to be. Oh, and the beds were like sleeping on a cloud. I am going to be phoning them to get the name of them because I forgot to look.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: billieG1980
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was beautiful. Great location, fantastic rooms and very clean. The rooms are great, and very technologically advanced. The only problem was the front desk customer service. It took numerous calls to have any issue addressed. Considering this hotel is fairly new, I am sure with time they will have their speed of customer service improved. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay for the price.”
Reviews.Author: NurseKK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a week long Vegas vacay. We stayed at the Bellagio before and loved it. Wished we went back there. The hotel had an overwhelming arouma of vanilla/lilac. The beds were not very comfortable. They only offered large fluffy pillows that offered no support. I asked for a different type, however that was all they offered. The bathroom always had this foul odor. I was just not impressed. The crowd was a little older as well. Not a bad thing if this is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a short visit”
Reviews.Author: Assassin8
Reviews.Content: The Aria was very modern and everything was brand new. It was further off the strip than what we would have liked, but we got a great deal on the room rate, so it was worth the risk. We never had to wait on the elevators to get up to our room and our room was cleaned every day and early in the afternoon. The food service was overall pretty good. BUT- the food was very expensive! 7.50 for a glass of grapefruit juice.

Reviews.Title: “ultimate”
Reviews.Author: nareshjain
Reviews.Content: this property is new and with remote controlled curtain and lights. 1-dont touch items placed in the fridge and table unless u want to consume them.we did it and were billed 80$.when we explained they waived off the bill and provided us a other fridge to keep our eatables and medicine. 2-they have the best discotheqe of the city from thursday-sunday.while making reservation request them to put u on the guest list of disco.otherwise u have to pay 30$ pp entrance charge. 3-have your drinks free in the casino in any hotel whether u play or not just sit on the slot machines 24 hrs.dont forget to tip 1$ per drink

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular room, great view, great perks and and great service”
Reviews.Author: CanaDoug
Reviews.Content: We were excited about staying at Aria since it was THE brand new hotel in Vegas. We booked a great deal and upgraded to the Penthouse City View for about $200 more. The upgrade was DEFINITELY WORTH EVERY PENNY! The Penthouse rooms are part of Aria's Sky Suite series rooms and all bookings for Sky Suites automatically mean private stretch limousine transportation from the airport (and back). We were greeted at the airport by a friendly driver who helped fetch our bags and showed us to our limo waiting outside. We asked about a stop between the airport and the hotel for something to eat but the driver was not authorized to do that. After a 10-15 minute ride, we drove through a rolling gate to our private entrance at the hotel and shown to a Sky Suites-only check-in and concierge desk. There, we received our room keys and access to the Sky Suites-only elevators. The concierge then showed us up to our room personally and we were blown away. Beautifully appointed with modern furnishings, fully automated lighting, curtains, entertainment centers including iPod jack inputs...over 1,400 square feet of decadence and luxury. Operating the various room functions actually...FUN...using the touch panel provided in the master bedroom. Turning on and off individual lights, closing inner and/or outer curtains, temperature adjustments...it was all changeable...even putting the "Do Not Disturb" notification at the door could be done from the bed. Shower with steam bath, Toto heated-seat bidet, bubble tub, walk-in closet and of course a television in the bathing area - you know, just in case. Any fears we had that the little people would be allowed into our oasis quickly diminished when we noticed that all entrances to Sky Suites areas were manned by security around the clock. Whew. As an added bonus, we were also given line-jump passes for the very popular buffet restaurant and another restaurant at Casino level...restaurants that regularly had long lineups outside. Considering the cost of to-and-from taxis, time spent lining up at a crowded general check-in and busy restaurants...our upgrade was already paying for itself. It was fantastic walking down at any time in the morning and waving our line-jump card, strolling past the grumbling herd of cattle to expedite our feasting. Even better - free snacks and beverages, including evening wine, were available all day every day for Sky Suites guests. Judging from the outrageous price for in-room beverages and snacks, this alone practically covered the additional upgrade cost for us! Admittedly we were a little piggish with them (okay, a lot piggish) but they were very nice to have. All the Fiji water, Sam Pellegrino, soft drinks, cakes, cookies, fruit etc. etc. etc. you could eat. The casino and hotel property itself is HUGE. That is...it's ENORMOUSLY, GIGANTICALLY huge. There are entire wings of this hotel that, by themselves, probably show impressively on satellite yet we never saw them simply because we had neither the time nor the energy to travel there. Getting from the front door back to the Sky Suites elevators and into our room was an odyssey - one afternoon a briskly-walked (nearly running) return from the front door to fetch forgotten sunglasses clocked in at a staggering 12 minutes...enough time to fly between Washington D.C. and Philadelphia at full cruising speed. If there was a downside, this was it. While there was a tram that ran from Aria to City Center and Bellagio, we wished there was one INSIDE this hotel. Perhaps a full-time fleet of charged Rascals might be in order here. It's almost as if they wanted to create exhausted, hungry and thirsty people and force them to walk through their plush, well-stocked casinos before they got to their rooms. Wait... Some things we wish we'd known beforehand: we brought a laptop with us, but our concierge told us laptops were available to guests if they wanted them. We're not sure if this was a Sky Suites-only perk but we suspect it was. We also wish we'd known about the availability of private cabanas in the pool areas - they looked beautiful, and of course included flat screen TVs (presumably in case sunning and swimming got dull), but it was my understanding they were best pre-booked before arrival. All in all a wonderful, shining addition to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Anahid
Reviews.Content: Rooms are state of the art - everything, down to the curtains, are computerized. There is a "switchboard" sort of computer at the bedside that controls all the room lights, the tv's, even has room-service options. It's awesome. You also have silky robes and fluffy slippers waiting for you in your room. In a word - luxurious! Significantly higher priced than the majority of Vegas rooms, but if you like to feel pampered, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Aria is sophisticated elegance and a pleasure to the senses”
Reviews.Author: cgruchy
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Aria is refined elegance - from the lobby, to the buffet, the restaurants, the pools and especially the rooms. Every staff member I encountered was friendly, professional, and eager to please. Check-in was a breeze on the Friday night of the October long weekend, and check-out on Monday was just as quick. We never had to wait or line up for an elevator. Several banks of elevators for different floors make the trip to and from your room very efficient. The buffet food was very good - the servers work extremely hard to clear your table, and refills of the complementary wine at dinner came promptly. We did not eat in any of the fancy restaurants - we just enjoyed looking at the exquisite decor. There are several bars and clubs to choose from, depending on what mood you are in you can go to a lively bar, a casual sports bar, or the quiet "View Bar" which we preferred after a long day. We had dinner one night at the 24 hour Cafe Vettro - a very comfortable mid-range restaurant with delicious food. We split a salad after seeing a full head of lettuce being delivered to a guest at the next table. The room was very quiet and the bed was one of the most comfortable we have ever slept in. The electronics are fun and efficient, especially when turning in for the night. One click of the button on the headboard shuts off the lights and closes the curtains. The soaps, shampoo, conditioner and lotions are of only moderate quality - you'll get better quality at a Four Seasons or Fairmont. I missed not having a hand held shower. The only complaint we had was that the pools closed too early. Two, including the adult only Liquid Lounge closed at 4 p.m. (we missed out on that one, which I was looking forward to) and the remaining pool closed at 6 p.m. I guess they don't want to pay the staff to keep them running. The reason given was the time of year, even though it was well over 80 degrees each evening. We enjoyed walking through Crystals shopping center on the way to and from the strip. All in all a wonderful long weekend. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality sacrificed for gadgetry.”
Reviews.Author: Clkster
Reviews.Content: Rooms= small Concierge= excellent Service= excellent restaurants,not enough good casual places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Technology is definitely cool, otherwise just a run of the mill Vegas megahotel”
Reviews.Author: JTears
Reviews.Content: I had a two night stay at the Aria for a meeting I attended in the adjacent conference center. I had heard a lot of hype about the Aria, its dramatic architecture, its cutting edge technology, and modern design. Firstly, the technology does not disappoint. It was definitely one of the most technologically sophisticated rooms in which I've had the opportunity to stay. Tons of review have mentioned this fact - the bedside remote that controls everything in the room, which can even tune the TV to the preferred morning news program for your wake-up. I must admit it definitely ups the ante (apologies for the gambling pun) for technology in Vegas hotels. However, technology does not make a four star hotel. Service standards do. That's where Aria, like many of its Vegas siblings, falls short. Yes, there is a very cool button that indicates "Do Not Disturb" vs "Service Room". However, one would think that the "Service Room" button would be tied into a central database which would send the housekeeping crew up when it is lit. I press the "Service Room" button at 8am when I leave for my conference, and when I return at 5pm, my room is not clean. I had to call down. What was the point of the tech if it's not being used? Also, the design is quite unique and modern, but scratch beneath the surface, and you realize the average quality of the products and materials in the room. Bathroom products are clearly marked "Made in China". The W Hotel chain can use Bliss, but the Aria can't manage to get some known name brand? The tub looks cool, but its made of fiberglass. In fact all the fixtures have a plastic feel to them. In fact one can only see that the tech and design is covering up what is really a run of the mill Vegas megahotel. And in all honesty, it probably won't hold up better than any of its siblings along the strip.

Reviews.Title: “a few minor bumps but we enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: luvgetaways
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to admit I was a little apprehensive after reading some reviews but after a few minor bumps, we enjoyed our stay! I did email the hotel a good four days before arrival to mention we were visiting for a special occasion. On the hotel website it said they would respond to every email within 48 hours. I never received a response. Upon arrival I mentioned it to the reception and they apologized and immediately called to have someone follow through on my original request. The same day they had chocolate covered strawberries and coconut macaroons sent to the room. That was nice. I was extremely nervous after all the reviews about the mini bar and how you can't even touch it or move anything without being charged for something even if it was not consumed. That must be a major issue because they even encouraged us at checkin not to touch anything to be on the safe side. I found that really ridiculous because I shouldn't have to be literally afraid to go near something in fear of being charged for it. Luckily there were no issues with that when we checked out. We did have a strange charge to the room which we later found out were the complimentary strawberries they sent to the room. Also not an issue when we checked out they apologized and immediately removed them from our room bill. Wondered what would have happened had we taken advantage of the nice man offering "express check out" had we not asked to talk to a clerk to question the charge to the room...but as I said it wasn't an issue. The only other bad thing I can think of is the Liquid Lounge Pool. I found it almost intimidating the way they stand at the entrance almost like it is some top secret exclusive "for snobby priveleged guests only" type of a place. We walked up and there was a security guard standing there with another gentlemen and all we asked was "is there a charge to get in?" and her response was "I don't know, you'll have to ask this gentlemen" He explained there is no charge to get in but you will be charged $30/person for food and drinks in order to use the pool. To me that's a YES, that was strange and frankly a turnoff. I am a paying guest and I didn't think that was fair to pay to use a pool at my own hotel, but, whatever. On the good side: We loved, loved, loved our room. It was so clean, had the most amazing bed I have ever slept in and an incredible view. Except for construction going on at the new Cosmopotitan opening in December, it was fine. We didn't hear any noise and just overlooked the cranes and so forth. It was still amazing at night! I loved the way you could personalize the room with the touch screen at bedside to open the curtains, turn on the lights and turn on the TV to wake up to. That was awesome and very user friendly. The room was completely cleaned every day, including vacuuming, cleaning the bathroom, changing the linens and refreshing the toiletries daily. I say this because you could tell it was cleaned top to bottom unlike some others that just surface clean. There were plenty of towels and pillows, usually we have to ask for extra of both. I found the employees very friendly and pleasant all over the hotel. Even housekeeping was very friendly and asked if everything is okay and did we need anything when they passed us in the hallway. As others had mentioned, I liked the way you had to show your room key in order to get to the elevators to your room. That made me feel secure. I liked the high speed elevator since we were on the 27th floor. We never waited for an elevator either going up or down, one was there as soon as you pressed the button. The food was amazing, even at the buffet. It was alittle weird at the cashier checkin at the buffet though, you pay and then have to wait to be seated and that was a little bit of a wait even though there were empty seats all over the restaurant you can't just sit wherever you want. Also I should mention there is a outdoor cafe "breeze cafe" which was not open the whole time we were there. That was weird it said "seasonal" but it was 100 degrees and September? Perfect weather to be open! Didn't quite understand that. Drinks at the pool bar were delicious but be prepared to pay top dollar. We paid $50 dollars for two drinks! They were 32 oz drinks but seriously? We also noticed the waitresses were few and far between at times at the casino. We waited quite a while at times for a drink but not a huge deal for us since we aren't big drinkers but it would have been nice not to have to wait a good 15-20 minutes for a drink once we ordered. Overall, it was a wonderful stay and a very nice hotel. Oh, we did smell the "vanilla ish" scent others complained about but I didn't think it was that overbearing. It was on the promenade deck near the hallway leading to the pool area. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is unsure. I would most definitely go back and plan on returning!

Reviews.Title: “High tech hotel”
Reviews.Author: mom2monkeys-13
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel room with all the remote features. Open/close blinds and turn the lights off/on with your tv remote (or even the alarm clock!) Super quiet room. Pricey food/drinks like the rest of the nice hotels on the strip. Great shopping and pools. Only drawback was the $30 charge per day to use the fitness facilities. Never paid the fee so cannot comment on whether it was worth the $30 charge. Fitness classes also available for additional fees. Oh - Wi-Fi was $15.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time with Friends!”
Reviews.Author: txtraveller82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 3 nights (Thur-Sat) in August. This was my first time to Vegas, and I wasn't sure what to expect. I must say, I was very impressed with the amenities and accomodations that Aria has to offer, especially with the price we paid! There was no wait at the check-in or concierge line, and luggage delivery was speedy. We only ate one meal at the hotel, but we chose well...Sirio was casual but still a very nice atmosphere, just what we needed after a day on the strip. I would recommend the Aria for couples who are looking for a Vegas experience without the typical annoyances...our room was completely smoke free and the hallway was always quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave the pool”
Reviews.Author: Heatheren
Reviews.Content: The pool is amazing. It was gorgeous outside, and the pool was lively. Plenty of places to sit. One downfall, the wait staff at the pool was slow. The rooms are almost too high tech. With a little patience you will learn how to turn the lights, and tv on. We were near an elevator, it was noisy all day and night. I think the walls are pretty thin i heard the shower in the the other room, and noise. I would recommend requesting a more desirable room than the standard. We figured since it was a very new hotel this wouldn't be an issue... but it was noisy and it makes it a little less comfortable! The cleaning staff did not change our sheets even when we asked... the rooms could be cleaned more thoroughly throughout your stay. The mini fridge is on a sensor and stuff on top... make sure you are not being charged for extras you did not take! We almost were charged $100 for knocked over stuff on a sensor on the counter.

Reviews.Title: “Most artistic and extravagant hotel to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: sherminbm
Reviews.Content: Best Customer service; great variety in slots and other gambling games; beautiful rooms and gorgeous views!

Reviews.Title: “Check first”
Reviews.Author: DAH51
Reviews.Content: Check first where your room is. There is only 1 ice machine per floor and the elevators are in the middle of the hotel. So if your room is at the west end it will be a long walk. The self park is even further. Between the self and the west rooms you will travel about 3 city blocks. Also find out about the internet fee or the new resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Aria Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcharj105
