Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Aria from Oct. 4 - Oct. 7. Our stay was very nice but there were a few things I had a slight issue with: 1 Our room was very, very far from the elevator. 2. The bath towels were thick but ruff. Soft, plush towels feel much better to body.. 3. Had dinner one night at buffett. Food selection was okay; preparation/taste good. 4. Had breakfast at Cafe Ventro one time. Staff was very nice but food was awful for the price. Although the meal came covered, the food was cold. 5. Charge for internet access. I was truly disturbed by this. Most low end hotels/motels provide this service free of charge. 6. No excitement in the casino which means no winners small or large. People just pumping money into machines of all denominations and shelling out chips at the various table games. 7. High prices at all eateries. 8. Since we had to walk to valet park area, it was just as easy to self park as to valet. Self park was only a short escalator up from valet.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed after 2 weeks in the desert!”
Reviews.Author: WestYorkshire6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 3 days at the end of an energetic road trip taking in San Francisco, Yosemite, most of Utah, Arizona and Colorado staying motels along the way. The Aria was a dream ending, comfortable large rooms with great views and technology. The rooms were cleaned without fuss and all the staff appeared pleased to provide a courteous service. We were a little wary of feeling overwhelmed in Vegas but the location of the Aria made it a fab retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: kobe4mvp
Reviews.Content: wow. This hotel is one of the best! We got the corner suite and it was just amazing. As we walked into the room, the curtains, light, and music started to go on. It was greeting us! There's a remote that controls the whole room. From music, tv channel, curtains, tempurature, its all within one touch of a button. I would definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Aria”
Reviews.Author: ChrisK0110
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Aria. We were celebrating his birthday. Before we left, I spent quite a bit of time reading all the reviews on Trip Advisor. I found this very helpful. When I checked in I had two requests. First I wanted a room close to the elevators and secondly, I wanted a great view. I was informed that if I was given a room facing the Strip and close to the elevators it would be $50 a day more. So, she gave us a room close to the elevators on the backside of the hotel facing the mountains. We were OK with this because it still was a beautiful view. We had a Deluxe King. I didn't feel the room was very spacious, but it was adequate. It was super clean. It was also sound-proof. You could not hear anyone in the hallway or next door to you. You didn't even hear people opening and closing their doors. Enjoyed all the different restaurants in the Aria. It was nice having the tram that took you to the Monte Carlo or the Bellagio. It saved a bit of walking. We liked the casino, but had no luck. We never saw anyone ever being paid a jackpot. We have casinos here at home and at least once during the evening you will see someone winning something and getting paid by the casino. Not at the Aria!! We did enjoy our stay and had alot of fun. I would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Amazing... 5 Stars all the way”
Reviews.Author: ttasinas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from staying 4 nights at the Aria. I have nothing bad to say about the place at all. When we got there we were waiting maybe 5 minutes in line, when another hotel employee walked up and said that he had seen we have been waiting and to follow him over to another part of the front desk area so we could be taken care of right away. The gentlemen that then helped us was super friendly and upgraded us to the 53 floor city view room because we were there for our anniversary. They made us feel special and important which previous reviews it didn't sound like that was the case. The room was clean and beautiful. Not giant, but thats not we had wanted. I fell in love with the shower and huge tub. I also slept perfect every night. The bed and pillows were the best I have ever experienced! Everything in the room is operated with buttons on the walls and a remote, which did take a little getting used to but was not to hard to use at all. House keeping was great and even called our room and left us a message when they had missed cleaning our room one day because we had left our privacy light on while they were on our floor letting us know to just call and they would come. We had good service in every area we went to from the pool, to the casino to the bell desk when we had them watch our bags due to a late flight the day we were leaving. I can not say enough about how kind and helpful everyone was and how beautiful and fresh the hotel was. The location was perfect for us too because we didn't rent a car but were able to walk the whole strip in either direction without a problem. We would recommend the Aria to anyone and when we go back to Vegas odds are, we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas Stay I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: irisheyesPhoenix
Reviews.Content: All of the employees are nice and extremely helpful regardless of the type of questions I had. Check In and Check Out were extremely easy and quick. The rooms are absolutely beautiful and luxurious. I felt like a Queen. This was the first time I've stayed here, although I have played at the casino before, and I will most definately stay here again in the future. I also went to see Viva Elvis, which is a "must-see" for any Elvis/Cirque du Soleil fan.

Reviews.Title: “it was a great experiance!”
Reviews.Author: MlsGuy
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife for our 10 year anniversary. We loved the hotel. The location is in the center of everything. The rooms are awesome. We loved it so much that we are going back in November.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: naveenjohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family for two . Got a free city view upgrade in the heigher floor. The rooms are very good.well kept and cleam. I liked there advance technology rooms Not very difficult to get used to it. The wall to wall curtain opens with remote or you can program to open when you enter the room or time it also. Never seen anything like that before. The staff were also very nice. The location of the hotel very good near to every thing. You can get a free tram ride to near by hotels also. Pool also very nice. Didn't use the Casino so can't anything about it. There buffet was also good but rate is bit over than near by hotels. Overall an excellent hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive place!”
Reviews.Author: NurseLe
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a corner suite. WOW! Room was incredible! Great restaurants. Pool area was very nice also. Favorite time there was at the Spa. Everything I expected and more!

Reviews.Title: “MGM Grand 2.0”
Reviews.Author: TrustySam
Reviews.Content: The good: beautiful, new, spacious hotel, rooms, and casino with a great selection of restaurants - all at a reasonable price. The bad: long walks to the rooms, air conditioning was a little warm, short-staffed maid service. The ugly: $4 coffee, $9 oatmeal. It was fun to stay at the Aria and be able to explore the new casino in town, but the shopping wasn't as good as at Caesar's or Planet Hollywood, the hotel wasn't as posh as the Wynn or the Bellagio, and there wasn't anything like a pirate show or volcano or tigers to see. So while it was interesting to visit this first time, and we got a great deal on the room, I don't know if this is one of those hotels I'd choose to go back to again and again. My favorite's still Caesars. But we had fun! :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great view, but.......”
Reviews.Author: Amsmithy
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 months researching where we would stay in Vegas. Decided on Aria and got a great room deal for a corner suite overlooking the strip. Booked and paid before we left. Arrived on the airport shuttle at hotel around 8:00pm. Dropped off under hotel. No signs, no porter, no idea where the lobby was or how to get there. Followed our nose and made our way upstairs to be told that reception was at the other end of the concourse. Lugged bags through casino to get to reception. Once at reception and checking in, told room we had booked and paid for was not available, would we accept another room and move the next day? This is a common complaint of the Aria based on other reviews. Assistant manager happened along to welcome us to the hotel. Not happy Jan... Ended up in corner suite but with 2 QS beds, Beautiful room, easy to operate controls, quiet and comfortable bed. Did not hear from neighbouring rooms the 4 nights we were their. Breakfast buffet good value, only meal we ate their. Better and cheaper alternatives elsewhere. Casino lacked atmosphere and the slots did not pay that well. Gambled mostly at Monte Carlo. Easy walk there. Mono rail to Bellagio convenient, and you can them walk into Caesers and further up the strip. All in all great hotel, position a little off the strip but lovely rooms. I just wish they would get the check in the room bookings right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but dont use their services or facilities”
Reviews.Author: whitepointer
Reviews.Content: Romms are great but Gym = +$30 per day business centre +$15. These prices are just over the top. get a hotel with free gym. Vegas is very competitive you wont have to look far. Staff are great very friendly and service orientated

Reviews.Title: “Aria Sky Suites were great”
Reviews.Author: chilnviln
Reviews.Content: I loved the amount of technology in the rooms. Never had an issue trying to figure out how to turn a light on or open the shades. The sky suite rooms were clean and plenty spacious. I liked the restaurants that were close by and the pool was fun. Some may say it is a long walk to the strip but I really don't think its any farther than most, especially if you take the tram. They did screw my bill (didn't use the promotional price) which took 45 minutes at check out to get arranged but that was the only blemish of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Great Service, Very Few Cheap Slots”
Reviews.Author: iloveeeetrips
Reviews.Content: I recently took my first trip to Vegas and stayed at Aria. My boyfriend had been to Vegas several times and always stayed at MGM because its a great value and right on the strip, but wanted to try somewhere new. We were excited to try Aria because the rooms are very high tech and you have a little tv screen looking remote to control everything in your room (lights, tv, etc) and we new the hotel was new so it would be fancy and very clean. I felt like the hotel was tailored towards a older crowd. My boyfriend liked the poker room, but the rest of us were looking for cheap penny slots to play for awhile and had a hard time finding any. A lot of them say penny slots, but have a minimum bet of 40 cents or so. So that was kind of a bummer. Also, the waitresses weren't around that much with free drinks. We went to the MGM and played penny slots for hours and hours with all the free drinks we could ask for most of the time when we wanted to play slots. I think if we go back, we'll stay there instead. Aria is very nice and we had a view room which was kind of neat.. you could see the strip out to the side. The only other thing I wasn't crazy about at Aria was that it's a little off of the strip, so its not as easy to get around as the MGM or other hotels. If you're staying at Aria and looking for an affordable snack, I suggest "The Cup" in citycenter. Its right next to the hotel and has good pizza and snacks for much cheaper than inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant/designer chic without the snob element”
Reviews.Author: Love_Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: One of the newest hotels on the Strip, part of the City Center Complex, centrally placed between the Monte Carlo and the Bellagio. Ideal location. Not really a family hotel, better for adult couples or groups. The theme of the hotel isn't as obvious as the others, but plenty of natural elements, bare wood, marble, stone, metal, sculptures and beautiful designer touches. Reception service was great, very efficient. Not a great choice of good eating places, but plenty closeby. The P.U.B. venue tries to be a British/Irish pub but the food menu is misleading and disappointing. It's got a good beer menu though ! Pool area was gorgeous, 3 separate pools and plenty of beds available, but no slides/lazy river for the kids. They also remove towels left on empty beds after 1 hour, which is great. The pool bar is very handy indeed. Nice cocktails, and friendly waitresses. Rooms are very nice, spacious, comfortable beds, plenty of storage space. Nice bathrooms - whirlbath and walk-in shower in our standard room. Be wary of picking up anything from the auto mini-bar or the rack in the room, or you'll get charged ! Handy monorail to other hotels, but just as quick to walk to the Vdara/Bellagio and the other way to the Monte Carlo - study your hotel map carefully, we wandered around for 3 days and discovered shortcuts by chance. I'd definitely come back here again, both with friends or partner, it's a special place, a bit like Bellagio but for the 30-50 age bracket.

Reviews.Title: “Viva la Aria”
Reviews.Author: ladyluck2124
Reviews.Content: Again, after reading many of the reviews on this site with less-than-stellar thoughts and comments, I was slightly nervous to try out the Aria. I'm really not sure why there are all the complaints other than people are just bored and crabby, because this hotel is a smash hit. Check in was swift and painless, although (and my only complaint) the front-desk helper was less than thrilled to welcome us. They should review some customer service policies with them since it is your first experience with the hotel. We trekked to the 15th floor and were overwhelmed with joy when we saw the room. Great views of the pool, Mandalay Bay, Monte Carlo, the mountains, etc. and that was just a deluxe room view. The bed is posh plush, I loved the use of technology for the remote/lights/drapes--no problems here and I would install the closets in our house if we had the room. All around A+. Jean Phillipe Patisserie is a must-try but you will pay $6 for a medium latte. Yowza--but, that's typical Vegas unless you stop by Starbuck's. Cafe Vettro is great for breakfast. I did not eat at any of the restaurants for any other meals but they had great offerings from what we could see. I'd also recommend an off the strip joint, Piero's, for dinner if you're looking for a little calmer charm and traditional Italian. All in all, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!!”
Reviews.Author: soprincess_78
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel from the moment I walked in. It smells really good in the main areas but its not a slap in your face smell. Check in was quick and painless. The hotel is very large so you do have to walk a ways to get to the rooms, but that didnt bother me. The rooms arent huge but big enough. I loved the modern decor. Bed was very soft. I prefer a firmer bed but this bed wasnt uncomfy. The bathroom had a very cool design. You had to walk through the shower to get to the tub. Neat touch. And the toilet was in its only little closet to provide privacy. We did have one minor issue that was cleared up upon check out. I picked something up out of the fridge just to see what it was and put it back. It was charged to our room but all we had to do was say we didnt use it and the charge was removed. There was a sign inside the fridge that warned of things being charged if you removed them but I didnt see it until it was too late. The bars have tasty drinks though they are a little high on the price. But I do plan on going back. We are thinking of another trip in either March or April and plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “AM-A-ZING! When can i go back!”
Reviews.Author: fappa_123
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in las Vegas and both last time and this time I was able to visit the top hotels and without a doubt the aria is in the top 3 if not number 1. It was great for younger travellers with more money. As its was so modern and contemporary but also chic, tasteful and luxurious! I found the room spacious and clean with some very modern features. The only criticism for the room would be the mp3 player which you have to buy an additional cable for. There was a great choice of restaurants and cafes. the buffet was great when there’s lots of people with different tastes for breakfast or lunch. All in all I had an amazing time and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “So you want to live the life at a 5 star...well this is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: hillbillsktown
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews about people who had just visitied this resort we were starting to get a little worried that we had booked this place because all of the reviews read that it was either a hit or a miss. From the moment we arrived, the service was excellent ( kind courteous and a fast check in), the room was beyond incredible and the food was delicious.....however the roulette table not so kind (as expected...it is Vegas after all)!! You would have to be crazy not to stay here! The only minor disappoint was when we went to our ( first) room. As beautiful as it was it was on the third floor overlooking a slab of cement. After a quick call to the front desk (and of course an additional $200 ) we were upgraded to a King Corner Suite overlooking the strip on the 53d floor! Wow! Well worth the money. Book now because to get this kind of 5 star hotel at these prices.......it is only a matter of time before the prices are only going to go up!

Reviews.Title: “Best New Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jjpthe2
Reviews.Content: Very new. Fantastic rooms. ask for a "city View" Terrific beds and bedding. Spacious baths. easy to get to rooms off casino floor. Very good restaurant choices at hotel. 6 great pools, plenty of chairs and service. Only small issue is up-charges for things like internet, gym etc can tack on as much as 60-70.00 per day to an already great value. All in all one of the best hotel experiences I have had in Vegas, and I have stayed at Bellagio, MGM, Paris, Mandalay Bay and Treasure Island

Reviews.Title: “get your butt to Aria”
Reviews.Author: havingfun021
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a couple of places and been in and out of many others in Vegas. Aria is Top Notch. It's new, huge, you never have to leave, cocktail waitress dresses are classy, many places to eat, not crowded, I can not say good enough things about it! The maid service was awesome too! I would HIGHLY recommend staying here even if you can't afford to eat in their restaurants, stay here and walk a short distance to food on a cheaper budget...you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “awesome high end luxury hotel with a few kinks...”
Reviews.Author: wskungfuclub
Reviews.Content: aria is fantastic for what it is--it's a niche hotel. it's a luxurious, adult-catered modern architectural tour de force. the decor is modern and absolutely unbelievable. it's simply a beautiful hotel. yes, it's pricey, but it's one of the newest hotels on the strip on the biggest megaresort (citycenter) on the strip--what'd you expect? we actually got a comp stay at the aria :) so we just took the kids along for a weekend of fun. the aria is not great for kids, but we didn't expect that it would be. it's still an awesome place. the pool is just okay, plenty of room, but pretty standard--nothing exciting. no lazy river or wave pool like the mandalay bay. liquid, the adult pool area wasn't really happening--we got a good view of it from the co-ed jet pool in the hotel spa area which was awesome. the spa is expensive but outstanding. if you're going to stay at aria you might as well splurge and get some massages and spa time. the weekend seafood buffet at the aria in this family's humble opinion is the best in town. the only weird thing was included in the buffet is half a lobster tail and claw--but you can only order ONE. everything is all you can eat EXCEPT for the lobster. LOL i guess that's reasonable because we would've eaten about 5 lobsters each. we also ate at lemongrass, the thai restaurant in the aria which was fantastic. the casino is action-packed and modern. fun place to gamble. the elvis show is not the best cirque show in town but still pretty good and worth seeing. it's a great tribute to the king--not cheesy, no real bad impersonators or anything--and if you're a big elvis fan then it's a must-see. the aria rooms are a bit of a conundrum. the PROS: ultra modern and plush. the bed is absolutely one of the most comfortable hotel beds of all time. ever. seriously. i can't stress this enough. REALLY COMFORTABLE BED. the technology is probably difficult to figure out if you're really old or not tech saavy but we thought it was very cool--one remote controls the entire room from the curtains to the lights to the temperature. there's also a decent size flat screen tv. bathroom is a little small but the adjacent shower/tub combo is great. the provided shampoo is sulfate free (my wife tells me that's outrageously high-end for a hotel to provide). we had a view of the front of the aria--the strip was partially obstructed by the two diagonal citycenter buildings but still great. the CONS: the room itself is kind of small. and for us, the sleep quality wasn't the best--but HOW IS THAT POSSIBLE you ask since their bed is the most comfortable hotel bed ever?! well, in the morning, the hotel room lights up because whilst the automated curtains are really cool to play with, they do a horrendous job of keeping out light! Our family likes our hotel room as dark as possible so we can sleep in. in this regard the aria room failed badly. the top of the curtain pretty much let's a lot of vegas sunshine in. it's just a design flail. they sacrificed function for form. overall the aria is a spectacular hotel if you're in the mood for some ultra modern luxury in sin city. it's really a 4.5 star but it falls just short of the 5 star because of the reasons above. we'd probably go back for a grown-ups only stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Stay”
Reviews.Author: karlab
Reviews.Content: Went with three girlfriends, all age 30, to the Aria for three nights - Friday - Sunday. This was my first time to Vegas, so I was not sure what to expect, especially after seeing some negative reviews of Aria on TA. I was very happy that we chose Aria. Check in was very quick - we requested a double queen room, and were afraid that we were not going to get it since there are so few, and because we were supposed to check in Thursday night, but due to flight delays it ended up being Friday AM. We ended up getting the queen room! After we got in we went to CVS, which is literally right next door to the hotel, to stock up on water, soda, sunscreen, snacks, etc. We saved a lot of money buying these items at CVS (it is open 24 hours). Room - Our room was very nice, it was plenty of space for 4 women. There are two closet areas and a bureau. The double sinks were perfect for getting ready to go out at night. Almost everything in the room is controlled by a remote, which could be frustrating if you don't know how to use it. But there are lights in the room that are controlled by switches. The beds and pillows are amazing, they are sooo confortable. The linens were really nice as well, nice soft towels and sheets. Our room was cleaned every day by 5 pm. We had a problem with the safe one night and they sent an extremely nice engineer to come and fix it for us, at around 2 am! Food - We ate breakfast every morning at the Jean Phillippe Patissierie which had a great selection of coffee drinks, breakfast items and sandwiches. Prices were pretty steep- iced tea for $4.00 and a croissant was $3.95. They did have some coffee drinks that were $6 - $7 which I thought was crazy! They have an amazing yogurt parfait for $7.75, which is expensive but it was soooo worth it. We had a late night snack at Cafe Vettro one night, the food was pretty good and prices weren't too bad, it was about $70.00 for the four of us. Three pools to choose from, all were nice with plenty of chairs, umbrellas and tables. The pool area was clean and well maintained. There is an adults only "Liquid" pool that we didn't check out - I think they charged adminission to it. All in all we had a nice time. The staff were all friendly, and there are plently of places at the Aria to eat a meal or pick up a snack. All in all, I would stay here again and would recommend Aria to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “All steel and glass but no character”
Reviews.Author: Raglan
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at this hotel and found it to be like the Curate's egg, good in parts but bad in others. The Good - The room was not large but well designed and the bathroom was particularly well designed although we found it strange that the double hand basins had no plugs so the for washing/shaving etc. the water continously ran away- not good for water conservation. The main feature of the room is the high tech use of the television and remote for controlling curtains, lighting, air conditioning, etc. The pool area is another good feature, plenty of sunbeds for the three pools and the fountains into the pool and cool mists at the entrance and cafe are welcome in extreme temperatures. The Bad - Why did they build this hotel at the back of the CityCentre development? It is difficult to access The Strip, especially for seniors, The view from our 26th floor "Strip View" room was terrible. The two leaning yellow apartment blocks completely dominates the view and looking downwards is a 30foot wide channel filled with service pipes. We assume that they ran out of money and could not afford to hide the pipework. If you like modern architecture in the minimilistic style then OK but this is not what Las Vegas is about. We expect each hotel on the strip to have its own theme and to demonstrate this even to excess. If ultimately the whole Strip was tranformed as the new City Centre its attraction will be lost and so will thousands of visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Aria - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Rodger-Dodger
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a very modern, very classy hotel set in a great position close to the middle of the strip. I found all the staff I came into contact at the Aria to be very pleasant and helpful, not at all like the comments posted on this board (...if only some of the guests had been the same). Was upgraded to a City View corner suite after a room mix-up and found the room to be excellent, the quality of the fixtures and fittings was top notch. As stated the bed was very luxurious and the technology was cool – right down to the electronic bidet in the loo! Tried the weekend buffet and found the food to be very good quality, would compare to the Bellagio, but not so much choice. Quite a small dining room, no long queues. Pool area was large, with plenty of beds in both full sun and shade. On a negative point – getting in and out of the Aria is a bit of a chore. Found best plan of action was to use the South exit through Monte Carlo to the strip. The exit through Crystals to the walkway to Planet Hollywood and a little known exit from the North Valet through Vdara into the Bellagio. The tram was pretty much useless for Aria. It does seem a fact that Vegas is loosing it’s “themed” hotels and that’s a real shame as it makes Vegas different to any other destination, but the Aria is a great hotel none the less.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but difficult to get to and from the strip”
Reviews.Author: swrCt
Reviews.Content: The Aria is brand new, and supposed to be very hip. It's a sleek, modern hotel with lots of options. The check in service was pleasant, didn't take very long, which is unusual in Vegas. We arrived on Thursday late afternoon so that may have helped. Our room was nice, technology managed everything in the room which my husband had fun playing with daily! When got to our room, there was a coffee cup sitting in the hallway outside our door. We wouldn't have noticed it but it was still there at the end of the next day. We had brought a couple of drinks from the Casino up to the room and the next day, the coffee cup was gone, and replaced with our used drink glasses....which were still there when we checked out on Sunday. Again, not a big thing and it became a bit of a joke between us as to when they would finally be gone!! The complaint I have about Aria is the location. It's location is set way back off the strip in between The Monte Carlo and the new City Center. They don't make it easy to get to the strip, forcing you to go through the City Center Mall every time. It's easier to just go over to the Monte Carlo and take the tram to the Bellagio. You avoid all the construction going on and the pedestrian walkways which are blocked. As usual, Buffet was great, pool area was nice and the spa was terrific, if a bit pricey. Tip: If you book a spa appointment, do it early in the a.m. You get to use the spa and fitness center all day. It has a private pool, overlooking the general pool area and is quite nice. Fully stocked pantry in the spa and the fitness center is great.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced experience!!! Never again.”
Reviews.Author: TexasHotRodMomma
Reviews.Content: Check-in is your typical Vegas (cattle fighting to get to the trough) nightmare! The room was beautiful but we walked a quarter mile to get to it once we were OFF the elevator on our floor. The new machines at the tables mean you won't win. The Cafe is overpriced. SkyBox is wonderful!!! Fish and Chips, yum! Jean Georges was pretty good, but I don't think it was $600 good. The hotel staff is the friendliest I've ever experienced. The spa was nice, but didn't exceed my expectations in any way. The most fun we had during the trip was when we went to freemont to gamble!!

Reviews.Title: “Unreal Experience”
Reviews.Author: nicky1972
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect since this new hotel had mixed reviews, but we were blown away walking in the door. From the decor to the wonderful people who work there, our stay was wonderful. Neutral decor throughout, very clean everywhere. Great placement for the coffee shop for that morning pick me up. All workers were very friendly. Gorgeous cityview room with a view that can't be matched. Comfortable bed, gorgeous bathroom, very cool controls for the lights, curtains, alarm clock, etc. Despite Vegas taking nearly every penny we brought, the stay at Aria made up for it. We didn't try any of the restaurants, opted for Seablue at MGM which was the most expensive meal we have ever eaten and will ever eat and it wasn't anything special. I have nothing to really complain about and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but service leaves room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Mishtress
Reviews.Content: My fiancee, now husband, and I were there Sept 25th to the 29th. The hotel itself was nice enough, clean, fancy features, comfortable, etc... but we had the worst dining experience ever at their 24-hour 'cafe' restaurant downstairs. We even tried it twice to see if the first time was just a fluke. It wasn't! The buffet was good, so we made repeat appearances there. The pool seemed too hot and crowded for us so we skipped it entirely. Their spa was outrageously priced so we also skipped that. The beds, however, were superb. Honestly, I'd go back for the rooms and skip the rest of the hotels 'features'. There's a CVS located downstairs so that's convenient. Also, it's centrally located on the strip and makes it easy to cab anywhere you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Not for us!!!”
Reviews.Author: pabacat
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in Aria! I had received an offer in the mail for 3 nights in a suite and food at select restaurants, drinks at most bars, room service and mini bar. I called the hotel several times to confirm this offer. I was never told a daily limit on meals. However, when we arrived, I was told the offer had a $150 cap per day. Well when drinks average $8 to $10 dollars and meals averaged $50, that didn't go far. I also had 2 for 1 Elvis tickets. When we arrived the Players Club employee told me where to go to purchase the tickets and have them charged to the room. Later in the evening I was approached my a "Host" and told I had to purchase tickets through her to be able to get the 2 for 1. Well of course her tickets were more expensive. Also, I had $350 in free play. The players club put the money on my card. When I got ready to use it, it wouldn't work, so I went back to the players club, and they informed me I had already used it. There is no way!! It was not fun playing in the casino, all the machines are the "new" electronic ones. We never won anything. However, we went down to Mirage and played and it was much better. All the electronics in the room drove us crazy. Shut the curtains and the lights go off. Too many quirks. I would not stay here again, no matter what the offer. I will return to Mirage.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel and casino! Very spacious...”
Reviews.Author: mainetoday
Reviews.Content: Great new hotel and casino! Very spacious and convenient! Buffet had a lot of options. This is a spot for young and old! Would definitely go back again, but the only downfall is the vanilla scented air freshener that they filter thru the building, just really got to us after a while...

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern hotel but quite a walk from the strip”
Reviews.Author: craigmmorq4
Reviews.Content: Check in was quite easy - there was a guy telling people to go to certain lines so there were no mega long queues - got a free upgrade to City View - not really a view as Veer Towers is in the way and Aria is set back from the strip. Hotel had a nice smell in the lobby and corridors - casion wasn't very smoky which was good. Requested a non-smoking room which we got. Room was cleanish - crumbs in the draws off the last guests and hairs in the shower - didnt' bother complaining about that. The in room technology was great so easy to use and great fun - very lazy! The decor and bath were great - very modern and smart. The air con in the room was poor - wouldnt go down - rang reception 3 times and waiting 15 minutes to speak to someone the second time - they must be busy or just don't want to answer the phone! The pools were great, very clean and plenty of sunbeds to choose from. No one was allowed drinks in the near the pool which was good. Only big problem with the hotel is that it's quite a walk to the strip compared to other hotels but wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars”
Reviews.Author: JeromeCosta
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, luxe and high tech. Awesome bathroom... Restaurants, bars are very nice in this hotel. Casino is a good standing one. I will come back without a doubt if i go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: magydoll
Reviews.Content: Everything was superb, can't way to go back. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, modern”
Reviews.Author: DCmetrodogmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria for a business conference. First time in Vegas. PROS: 1. Rooms are modern and feature all necessary amenities plus so many more. The tech system (carefully explained in other reviews) is helpful and fun. The bed is soft as are the pillows. Very comfortable for sleep. 2. The spa is fabulous! I had a wonderful massage. The service was impeccable. I highly recommend you get a spa treatment! 3. Lemongrass restaurant and catering at our conference on-site were very good. CONS 1. Water not readily available at the pool, and towels are only located as you enter. Chairs would benefit from cushions and to make the pool more high-end. I also never saw a waitress for a drink order. Pool=not as good as hotel spa facility. 2. Aria nickle-and-dimes you: internet $15/day, spa/gym $30 day, bowl of fruit at cafe $7 3. The pool closes at 6 and the spa closes at 8. What about those of us who like these activities later in the day? If everything hadn't been paid for by the conference, I might have been more annoyed about the value, etc. That said, Aria seemed a lot nicer than other Vegas hotels I saw while touring around. I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA SKY "SWEETS"-Living like The Jetson's”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights on Labor Day Weekend in a Sky Suites Penthouse Suite. The Sky Suites are a separate part of The Aria which includes round trip airport stretch limousine pick up and drop off by a uniformed driver who was waiting for Us at the baggage claim area when We arrived-very very classy. There is a separate entrance to The Sky Suites and a lounge that serves free sodas, juices, coffee, tea, fruit and cookies. In the morning they have amazing Danish Pastries and at night there is wine and cheese-all free. The check in was simple with no wait and check out took all of 5 minutes-none of the usual Vegas chaos. The room was beautifully decorated-large and very spacious with an amazing view of the strip and We slept very well here. The bathroom was enormous and had an amazing Jacuzzi air bath. The computer controls were easy to use and the sound system was great. We even had a dining room and bar area. Everything was ultra contemoporary and very much like living out a Jetsons fantasy. Todd English's Pub was great (Try The Lobster Sliders-Amazing) and Cafe Vettro is gorgeous and has the most amazing Roast Chicken with Orzo-out of this world good. We really enjoyed the pool area-We liked going the last few hours it was open when it was quiet and less crowded-The Pools and Jacuzzi's are really nice and large. All of The Staff were very nice and low key. There are Security Guards at the entrances to only allow Sky Suites Guests to enter-It is all very exclusive. You get alot for Your money here.

Reviews.Title: “In love with Aria!”
Reviews.Author: SupraChica
Reviews.Content: Beautiful ultra modern hotel and grounds. The one bedroom suite was lush and comfortable. Not a monstrosity that you can actually get to the elevators without getting lost in the casino. They have a tram connecting to Monte Carlo and Bellagio. Couldn't have asked for a better stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent at Aria!”
Reviews.Author: JosephineChien
Reviews.Content: We arrived the hotel at 9:00 in the morning and assumed we were unable to check in so early. However, they have a very good system and pre-checked in and assigned room with a tempory pool access pass so you don't have to waste your time. We got our suite at around noon. The bell boys delivered our baggages within 5 mins after we called. Our corner suite was excellent facing the strip. Rooms are clean and fully equipped. Staffs are friendly and professional. We had a great time at Aria and would highly recommend to our firends.

Reviews.Title: “Aria is Ariaght”
Reviews.Author: JulesInLa
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews that were hit or miss on this place, I was lucky that it was a hit for me. Rooms: very high-tech. When you walk in, the tv turns on with some music, and the curtains open up so you can see the view. Everything is controlled by the tv remote. You can even check up-to-date flight status, adjust all the lights, curtains, etc. all on that remote. If you don't like all this technology, you might get frustrated, but I loved it. The regular rooms are not suites, and are sized as regular rooms, so keep that in mind. It's a decent size, but if you're used to other Vegas hotels and all rooms being suites, you'll think this room is small. Spacious closets, soft bath towels, large flat screen tv. The distance from the elevator to our room was quite a trek, and we weren't even at the end. Bed: wow, what a soft and comfy bed. I believe it was a memory foam pillow top they have on the mattress. I had no problems falling asleep. Bathroom: I heard this hotel is an eco-friendly green hotel. That being said, they have those sinks/faucets that spray the water out in a certain way. After using the sink, I looked around the counter and my clothes and it looked like a had a water fight with myself. It is a dual sink, and maybe I just have a lot of stuff, but there was barely enough counter space for 2 people. The toilet is separated from the rest of the bathroom by a frosted glass door and wall. So technically you can see a silhouette if someone else is in the bathroom with you. The shower head is awesome. To get to the tub, you have to go thru the shower, and I'm not really a fan of that, and that's just a personal preference. The amenities are the standard amenities, however, there was no cotton swabs or cotton balls. Food: I did not eat at any of their establishments. Sportsbook: Not a fan of the setup. No free drinks there either. Casino: the layout is pretty wide. Also, they try to cover up any smoke smell with some sort of light vanilla scent. No theme at this hotel whatsoever so it doesn't feel like you're in Paris, Italy, Egypt, etc.. It is just a clean, modern/contemporary hotel. Parking: I am cheap and won't even take advantage of the Vegas free valet. Self parking used to have ridiculously large spaces when they first opened which was such a waste of space, but now it's normal. They have a handful of low emission/alternative fuel parking spaces available, but unfortunately all but 1 car was legitimately parked there. It takes a while to walk from the parking to the guest elevators, fyi, and you take an outdoor (but covered) ramp to the caisno as well. Pool: 3 pools, and the beach club, Liquid. I didn't have a chance to utilize it but it looked like your standard fare pool. Spa: Didn't use, but I would love to check it out as it did look very nice. Overall: I am glad I tried this hotel, and while not the most exciting, it was modern and I would definitely stay here again at a promotional price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Modern, Clean”
Reviews.Author: DKAP
Reviews.Content: What a great stay. Hotel is very large, spotless, clean, sleek, modern looking. Staff was so nice. Everyone we asked any info from stopped whatever they were doing to help us. At check in you receive a map of center and the process was a breeze. The room set up is one of the best I have seen in awhile. The closets and bathroom areas are in front of room as you walk in, then you walk into the main part of room. Really a good setup. I would go back in a minute. And the slots were the best in town for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Unfriendly Staff, 5 Stars? Not in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: bigred1972
Reviews.Content: Was dropped off at the rear of the resort by the airport transport we booked through our airline, we were not greeted and had to search out a hotel employee. They were not very friendly or helpful. Finding the front desk was a chore and moving throughout the resort was difficult. The front desk was not helpful, we were in Vegas on our 10 year anniversary and was given a room on the 16th floor with a view of the interstate. The rooms were great and the bed was awesome. The Casino was a joke, we did most of our gambling at planet hollywood and the Freemont. This is a 5 Star Resort? not in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Cool Room, Best Night Sleep in a long time”
Reviews.Author: garagedoorinfo
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Aria on business. I got a promo rate from my MGM players club card (I highlt recommend joining their players club. I don't gamble very much but I get great rates and promos at all of the MGM properties). The room was very high tech. The lights, curtains, and A/C were run through an interface on the the television or the alarm clock by the bed. The room was nicely decorated and I have a nice view from my room. The best part was the bed. The be was very comfortable and the Pillows were GREAT! I found out what they were made of and bought a similar one when I got home. A dinner and breakfast buffet were a part of my package. They were both great. They had great selections of food and deserts. The casino was very nice, but their slots/video poker were very stingy. I did not enjoy gambling there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Sleep EVER”
Reviews.Author: TeamLobsinger
Reviews.Content: The hotel was super nice. Very modern, and the rooms were techy. Awesome drinks at every bar in the Casino area. The Elements store on the main level sells everything you may have forgotten at home. Great, friendly staff... and every time we found ourselves needing assistance with something related to our stay, we were rewarded with efficient people giving excellent customer service. The hotel was obviously very well-managed. Additionally, every staff member that we came accross in the hallways of the hotel gave a friendly smile and told us to have a great day. Obviously they've put some effort into ensuring a good customer experience, and having the staff say hello is a great gesture. Aria really is going above and beyond, and it definitely doesn't go unnoticed. We were here for business, and the conference rooms were really nice. Wonderful space for group presentations. I have to give special mention to the beds in the hotel rooms at Aria. I have never slept so well ever in my life. We've stayed at many nice hotels, but the beds/pillows/duvets at Aria astounded us with their luxury. Two thumbs up to Aria!

Reviews.Title: “High Tech Room, Nice Hotel, Very Pricey Restaurants, OK Casino”
Reviews.Author: DES_travels_alot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. The rooms were nice - very high tech. You could control everything in the room (lights, curtains, tv, music) from a touch screen panel by your bed..... couldn't get the remote to work though..... The bathroom was big - large tub and shower, however it had a bit of a moldy smell. Also, the bed was very comfortable, yet the cream colored comforter on the bed had stains on it and looked a bit dirty...... The internet is $15 a day..... No coffee maker in the room. The casino is nice. Not themed at all like some of the other hotels on the strip. The restaurants I visited seemed overly pricey. $20 for a martini. $20 for an appetizer and the main courses went up from there. Expect to spend a lot if you want to sit down to a nice dinner at this hotel. I will say that there is a great pastry and gelato cafe in the casino with reasonable prices. Overall, it was a little overrated though still nice......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience in the corner suite!”
Reviews.Author: fivestartraveler2008
Reviews.Content: This review will help you if you are contemplating a corner suite: If you are not into tech and can't deal with computers or calculators DO NOT STAY HERE!! You will LOVE it or Hate it! I loved it. Prebooked this during a promo at a rediculous rate, about $140 per night. Stayed in a corner suite. Dining room table, 3 flatscreens, sofa. .Fully automated 1000 sq ft 1 1/2 bath delight! Seriously everything is automated. Touch screen controls windows, TV, radio, lights, alarm. It can be programmed to open the shades, dim the lights and turn on your favotire TV show in the AM. Much better than the typical larm clock! the toilet!! OH the toilet. Gross conversation but it did make me google the $1000 Toto Flush for a possible addition in my master bath. Cleans both men and women with heated wather (no need for TP, if you are daring) blow dries you all while sitting on a heated seat! I was a little nervous and worried to try it but my wife and I both agree, pretty impressive and useful! Bathroom was narrow but efficient. Double sinks, full jacuzzi, flt screen. The pics online do it justive. COMPLAINT: The sinks in the master bath were horrible, splashing all over. Very difficult to handle the and contain the back splash due to the narrow and shallow doubel sinks. Small issue but a complaint none the less. Pools are decent. I highly reccomend a cabana off hours when the price drops (Sun to Wed). 42 inch plasma, misters, a stoked bar, Wi Fi and cabana girl. If you are splitting the costs with others absolutely worth it! We were in our cabana watching golf and football on the sofa, posting online bets and lounging in the private patio from 11AM to 6pm. BUY THE PITCHERS of booze and not individual drinks. Much better value. Casino is nice, propety is expansive and worth exploring. We ate breatfast every day at the restaurant by slots. Began with a V, I think vet I cant remember the name but is overlooks the back entereance of the hotel and is HUGE. Phenominal food. Literally ate there 5 mornings and never got sick of it. Best fruit platter, eggs and BREAD!!! Sports book blows compared to the one at Palazzo. Huge screen but not a great feel. The SPA and workout facility are 5 STAR! Make plans to spend time here. Workout room is $30 per day without spa reservatios so book and workout same day. You can utilize all facilities if you are booked same day for a massage. I would book late massages and work out in the AM. You can keep a locker all day and go back and forth as much as you please. Great relaxation and healing rooms to enjoy. TRUST ME take advantage of the spa. Excellent wlittle co ed outdoor relaxing pool overlooking the crazy party pool. Did not venture there, it is small, loud and not a couples place..unless you are single and looking to get after it. If it was a boys trip, we would have been there in a heartbeat. Enjoy the trip and Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price of the hype”
Reviews.Author: HoustonLady66
Reviews.Content: After all the hoopla about this new hotel, I was rather excited when I found out that the seminar I would be attending would be hosted here. I'm glad this stay was not on my dime. We arrived around 9:15 pm; check in was prompt and friendly. Our room was nice but, other than being 'modern' I wouldn't say it was any better than any other hotel room I've seen. The view was horrible (over looking construction and, due to its concave build, our room looked into someone else's). I probably would have accepted this given the seminar's discounted rate, but I also booked nights on either side at full rack rates. The tv did not work. I called and requested service; an hour and a half later, still no one shows. When I called back, I was told that they were super busy and asked if I could wait until the next day. Their description of a "separate shower and bath tub" is somewhat flawed; yes, they are separate, but together. You have to step through the shower to get into the bath tub. If you wanted to take a bath while your husband showered, it is not going to work unless you want to wash your hair at the same time. And because there is very little ventilation around the glass doors to the shower, it had a constant sour smell. It was also slicker than snot and I was always concerned one of us would break our neck in there. You cannot actually use the mini fridge in the room. It is computerized so that if anything moves, you are automatically charged for it. No place to put your own snacks or beverages. There are also no vending machines on the floors or convience marts within the hotel; thank goodness for the CVS at the bottom of the hill. Skip the Viva Elvis show. The sound system is horrible. If you think you are in for a WOW! factor because it is sponsored by Cirque du Soliel, think again. Save your money and buy his records. Spent $25 for a beer and one cocktail in the lobby; the same order at the pool bar (literally just around the corner) was $10 cheaper. Still haven't figured that one out. When you check out, you go to the front desk where you checked in and then have to walk to the complete other side of the hotel to grab a taxi, and this is not a small place. Actually, it is too large and everything is very spread out. There are two saving graces: 1) the beds are to die for; scrumptuous bedding and a mattress that feels as if it were made just for you; and 2) Jean George's Steakhouse. Best steak I've ever had outside of Texas.

Reviews.Title: “Cold but Elegant”
Reviews.Author: ncoco53
Reviews.Content: We drove into self parking, parked then tried to figure out how to find the hotel's front desk. Not to many signs are posted. The walkway from the parking to the inside looks like it is still under construction. The sign showing the way to the hotel was turned around pointing to the other end of the parking lot. After about 15 minutes of walking we found our way to the front desk. We had a friendly person check us in. There were no carts to help us with our bags if you self park. We had to make 3 trips back and forth. You also have to show your room key to get near the elevators going to your room. No room card no entry. Not use to this. The hotel room was nice but in-personal, not warm and inviting. The bed was way to soft for me. Everything worked in our room. We had to take some time to learn how to work it all, lights, TV, clock, drapes, all high tech.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA”
Reviews.Author: Taylo_10
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Las Vegas for the 7th time, and decided to stay at the Aria, we are player club members. The hotel offered their standard room for 3 nights comp, by the end of the trip it was 4 nights comp and an invitation to return for New Years. We both enjoyed our stay at Aria, we were on the 4th floor, I was disappointed at first because I wanted to be higher to enjoy the views of Las Vegas. It all worked out because we were close enough to the elevators and after a long day of walking appreciated getting to our rooms quicker. The rooms are amazing, high tech, clean, and comfortable. I felt they were spacious enough for 2 people. The bed was very soft, so much you didn't want to get out of them. Enjoyed a dinner at Sario's Italian Restaurant, and the buffet and everyday Chills for coffee and muffins, we felt the service was outstanding. The winnings were not big at the machines so I quit after th 2nd day and went shopping, when I could bare the heat. Other than that, would we stay at ARia again, absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Worried about bad reviews, but had a great time”
Reviews.Author: gda141
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay at Aria. I travel to Vegas two to three times a year, and have stayed at many different resorts on the strip. My favorites are Mirage, Mandalay Bay, and Venetian. When we stay in Vegas, our rooms are comped. We decided to stay at Aria since it was new, and wanted to give it a try. After reading many reviews on this site, I was worried about what our stay at Aria would be like. However, we thought the hotel was great, and we enjoyed our stay. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly, professional, and helpful. Check in was fast...no problems. Housekeeping did a good job, room was clean. Bed was very comfortable, loved the layout of the room. We had no problem with the technology in the room at all. The only meal we had at the hotel was the buffet, which was fine. Drink service at the casino was good. Pool area was nice and clean....watch out for the drink nazis at the pool, who won't let you bring your drink in the pool. Other MGM/Mirage resorts allow drinks in the pool.....so not sure why it is different here. Really enjoyed the atmosphere of the casino, but was surprised the casino was a little on the small side. Aria did not have a big slot selction.......and the machines didn't pay out at all. Also, I did not like how almost all of the blackjack tables had automated shufflers. I was also surprised to see the blackjack tables at Aria had higher minimums than the tables at Bellagio. Overall, we liked the hotel, and would stay there again...but it would probably not be our first choice. I would say give it a try...everyone has different tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Mikey1231
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Aria for 3 nights having stayed at Encore for 3 nights earlier in the same trip. Despite being more expensive, Aria cannot compete. Service was slow and slightly inept with numerous breakdowns in communication, poor housekeeping (did not return when told to, didnt replace shampoo etc.). The low point came when our TV stopped working (note the TV is used to control everything in the room - a/c, curtains, lights etc) and despite front desk agreeing to send an engineer up immediatley, no-one came for 3 hrs after constant chasing. The quality of the room was average, but in Las Vegas customers expect something special.

Reviews.Title: “cold and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Hudson_NHJazz
Reviews.Content: Wrote a review of this hotel earlier in the month but forgot to tell everyone that if you take a bus from the airport you will be dropped off at a rear door of the building. No signs to point you in the direction of the front desk...no greeter to take your bags...when you finally find your way to the front desk then someone will ask you if you want help with your bags. At this point we said no...if you can't greet us at the door...no gratuity. Felt like I was breaking into the building or a poor relation that should not be recognized. Hang it up Aria...get with the real people that will spend money...if we like it we tell all our friends. If we don't like it we tell everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Aria”
Reviews.Author: tnuhlj
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of great hotels in Vegas and believe me the Aria is not one of them. From the pretentious / ignorant front desk staff to the terrible house keeping staff ( if they clean your room at all) there is really nothing good to say about this place. Well maybe that it looks pretty. Only stayed there two nights, thank god. On the first day our room wasn't ready for check in until 6:30 as none of the non- smoking rooms had been cleaned. On the second day our room was finally cleaned at 8 PM only after a trip to the front desk to tear a strip off of the so called manager. Don't bother trying to call house keeping they don't answer and the front desk will keep you on hold for at least half an hour before they answer the phone. No coffee in the rooms so you have to purchase your $4.00 a cup morning coffee in the casino. Restaurants offer up mediocre food at ridiculous prices. Beds are a back breaker like sleeping on a marshmallow which slopes to the outside edges, weirdest bed I've ever slept on. The technology in the rooms doesn't work, in our room if you open the curtains the bathroom lights go out. Air conditioning will not keep the room cool was on full blast the whole time we were there and room was still warm. I've stayed at many hotels both more and less expensive than the Aria but have never felt as ripped off as I did at this place. Never again. Avoid Avoid Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Aria Resort & Casino”
Reviews.Author: SamNDonna
Reviews.Content: It looked wonderful and glamorous on the internet Aria site. It opened in December 2009 but has mountains to climb and great distances to travel before it can meet expectations. It does not begin to compare with the majority of strip hotels. Guest services are lacking and housekeeping needs attention. No complimentary coffee in rooms. No refrigerator in rooms. Linens were supposed to be changed daily on our 39th floor; no one told us until a housekeeper asked us about linens. We were here one full week; returned home 09/24. Housekeeping did not clean bathrooms properly (water spots on fixtures and no fresh soaps provided.) Fully automated draperies, lights did not work. Four lights burned out but never got repaired. The automated system was too cumbersome to learn in just a few minutes. Telephone charges on bill - no telephone used; that's what cellphones are for! Check-out? Lines do not move. Credit card machines overwhelmed and died. Staff said they were 99-100% booked. Not prepared. It is a slick, glamorous place but needs to quality control attention. Avoid this resort hotel for at least another year.

Reviews.Title: “City Center Contemporary - Sleek and Cold”
Reviews.Author: Grace1947
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas several times and always stayed at the Bellagio which we love, but we were tempted by the Aria because of the promotions we received. We had watched City Center being built and were curious to see the project as it neared completion. We knew the architects involved in the project by reputation and so booked 3 nights there in September. The Aria exemplifies the best and the worst of modern architecture: the best being the use of computers to design angles and spaces that would have been virtually impossible a few years ago: the worst being the starkness and coldness of the building materials used. The inside of the hotel is imposing and uninviting. The seating in the large lobby consists of granite benches, for example. They may be practical but hardly comfortable. The colors in the hotel are dull. There is very little "life" to many of the spaces. That said, our room was a refuge from the coldness of the lobby. Because the hotel has recently opened, the rooms are immaculate, bedding comfortable, and bathrooms clean. Our room, just a standard king, was spacious and well lit. Our view of the mountains and pool areas was lovely. (The pool areas were our favorite spaces in the hotel. There are several pools, plenty of lounges in sun and shade, and landscaped very nicely.) When you walk into the lobby you will notice an odor, not necessarily bad, but pervasive and a little sweet. I asked about it and was told it was "Vanilla Mist" and was used in all the public spaces to mask the odor of smoke from the casino. At first it seemed a little overwhelming, but we eventually got used to it. However, anyone particularly sensitive to odors and perfumes should avoid this hotel, for sure. We did not eat any meal other than breakfast in the hotel. The buffet (which came with our package) had so many choices you really had to pace yourself. We did see the Cirque du Soleil show featuring the music of Elvis Presley one evening and I would offer one word of advice. There is not a bad seat in the theater so don't worry about getting a seat close to the stage. We were in the third row and actually wished we had been further back. The performance, by the way, was very entertaining - loud but entertaining. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a bargain at a nice, centrally located place to stay, but don't expect the rates to stay low for long. The hotel was crowded with conventioneers and other guests taking advantage of the bargains, but as business picks up, I'm sure the rates will too. The monorail (free) which is just outside the hotel will take you to the Bellagio if you need a "fix" for elegance and old world charm.

Reviews.Title: “Striking architecture but service not 5-star yet”
Reviews.Author: canadianicequeen
Reviews.Content: While the modern architecture and sculptures both inside and out are strikingly beautiful this hotel lacks the charm and high level of service of her sister hotel Bellagio next door. The rooms are ultra modern with keyless entry, single source control for lights, drapes, audo/video and room service but lacked the little niceties like nightly turn-down service that we expect when paying this much per night. The bathroom amenities were 'down-market' in white plastic containers, but the linens - both sheets and towels were well-appointed although the mattress was a tad on the soft side. Room service was surprisingly quick in a hotel with 4000-plus rooms however the bar service on the casino floor was very slow indeed. There wasn't much variety in the slot games compared with a Wynn or Bellagio The location means a bit of a walk from the entrance to the strip although there is a free tram that runs between Monte Carlo and Bellagio. The mall 'Crystals' that is connected to the hotel by a walkway - Tiffany, Versace, Gucci etc. was empty except for a few scattered souls wandering about. We tried one of the restaurants - 'Blossoms' which did have excellent service and although they described themselves as 'classic Chinese' had a very limited menu and limited wine selection. The two entrees with two glasses of wine and a beer and sharing one dessert came to $135. The front desk staff were pleasant enough but seemed a bit disorganized and although we arrived at 11am and they promised that there would be a room ready by 12 - we had to keep checking back with them every hour (their request) and finally got to our room after 3pm. We found the internet access at the business centre a bit pricey at $15.00 minimum for 15 minutes of internet time. Because of the location and because the service levels didn't seem quite 'polished' yet we would not stay there again and will likely return to Bellagio instead.

Reviews.Title: “ROOMS TO WARM FOR COMFORT AND CHECK WAIT TO LONG”
Reviews.Author: JYDV
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a beautiful Hotel but for the price you can stay in less expensive hotel and get rooms that are cooler than these. I love the room with its wonderful spa bath and remote controls for curtains and lights but we could not get the temp low enough. When I checked with the front desk I was told that they are ECO friendly and the temp is controlled by a ECO. I love the green ECO idea but not at my expense and not when I need a good nights sleep. Also, the check in process is a very long wait in line.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: suzy399
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas with some girlfriends for a weekend away with no kids/husbands. Or intent was to relax, enjoy the spa and lie by the pool. I've stayed at several hotels on the strip, and this was by far the nicest. The check in/out was quick and very easy. They were very accomodating by splitting the room fee at the end of our stay 3 ways without a problem. The rooms were super modern and furninishings were beautiful. The bathroom was amazing. Super clean rooms. Housekeeping was on top of things, always clean towels, even when we were only leaving the room for an hour, it was always done by the time we got back. Everything in the room, drapes, tv, lighting was controlled by a touch pad remote control. Only downside to that was that it was connected to the wall, so if you were in bed and wanted the remote to the tv, you had to lean over to change the channel. The pools were fabulous, music was good and there was always a cocktail waitress around. It didn't have the "spring break" feel which was nice, it felt like a nice sophisticated resort. Drinks were pricey, but they are pricey all over the strip unless you are gambling and get them for free. We tried one restaurant called Sirio in the hotel. Great Italian food, on the pricey side, but everything is pricey in Vegas!! Casino was nice, not too smokey. We weren't big gamblers so we didn't spend much time in it however. Overall, a fabulous time, would definitely stay here again and recommend it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't take the heat!”
Reviews.Author: kcbaz
Reviews.Content: We checked in late, were "upgraded" to Aria Sky Suites. The room was lovely but lots of problems. The air conditioning didn't work well, leaving us in 82-degree heat inside the room at night - worse during the day. The "sophisticated" lighting system wouldn't turn off the bathroom lights so we had not one but two engineers in our bedroom at 1:30 am, finally using the handle end of a screwdriver to knock the offending switch into submission. The "fluff & puff" high-end Toto toilet was more of a "hot end," with a seat so overly heated that we couldn't bear to sit on it! The employees in the Sky Suite concierge center were distracted and almost rude. This is a hotel that looks better than it works so will try the Mandarin Oriental next door next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: florabella59
Reviews.Content: Wonderful modern room, great location, friendly staff, terrific spa!

Reviews.Title: “It was a mistake staying at ARIA”
Reviews.Author: BobbbyE
Reviews.Content: On 9/19/10, we checked in to room 172__. My disappointment started with a soaking wet tissue box in the bathroom. Then, as I was about to step into the shower, housekeeping comes in the room and wants to know if I'm checking out. The following morning, I requested the front desk to replace the room filter because it was covered with a THICK, white layer of dust. And to top it off, housekeeping didn't clean my shower/tub enclosure or replace the bath towels. It was a mistake staying at ARIA. But... we were lucky that we only stayed for 2 nights. One good thing to say about Aria: It's a great looking hotel, in between Bellagio and Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “The interior design of this modern hotel complex is worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: forward_cabin
Reviews.Content: On a recent business trip to Vegas my office booked me into the Aria, not sure of what to expect of either Vegas or the hotel being my first time in Sin City. I celebrated my birthday, never good while on hectic business trip so i took the upgrade of $50 and stayed on the 52 floor in a suite. Amazing view of the strip and out past the airport and hills beyond. Hotel standard was very high and being 6 months old everything smelt and looked new. The lighting and curtain were a little to high tec, taking me the entire stay to work out how to light my rooms and keep the curtains open... Only two things that bugged me, was you can't sit in the bed and watch TV as there is only one tv, odd for a suite and the bedside lamp cable is too short and the cleaner moves the lamp in the morning and service men come back at night to reposition everything re plug the cable located behind the fitted wall etc.. 4 days... become a bit tiring... The design of the place is very unusual, not so in your face as many i saw there, restaurants serve suitable food though, i did notice a long queue each morning when i left to do business, not so good if your not an early riser. The gym acess is not included, a nusinsance and closes at 8pm??? what's that about... Otherwise good service location is on the strip if your there to gamble, it's everywhere... you'll be happy at this one...

Reviews.Title: “Really Impressive”
Reviews.Author: CAperson
Reviews.Content: I arrived around midnight , the check-in service was quick and efficient. My room with a view - was excellent. The room was squeaky clean smoke free. The hotel was just beautiful, modern and up to date technology. I have stayed in Las Vegas many times but this was really impressive. Edit - Delete

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: sd_carlsbad_NM
Reviews.Content: I have read reviews on this location and was a little concerned that I might not enjoy the hotel or at least the staff, but that was not the case. Check-in and out were very easy and fast. I got an amazing rate by signing up for their email alerts. The room was the nicest I have stayed in on the strip, including the hotel right next to this one with the big pond (you know which one I am talking about). The only complaint I could have would be the food options. All of the food at this hotel is very expensive, more than I like to spend in Vegas. I travel to Vegas usually two or three times a year and have tried to stay at all of the hotels on the strip. I rank this one at the top and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel in center of strip”
Reviews.Author: Ashburn_Pats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria from August 27-30 and were in room 15-117. Overall, we had a great stay. It's in an ideal location and connected to the Mirage and other MGM properties on that side of the strip via tram (we didn't take the tram). We booked through a SW Vacation package which included airfare and choice of MGM hotel. We picked the "deluxe room" and were facing the Rio and the new Cosmopolitan hotel, currently under construction next door. Here are the highlights: - Hotel location: Well-located next to the Mirage and Bellagio. 24-hour CVS drug store is right next to it to pick up essentials if needed. - Architecture and ambiance: Stunning architecture with tons of water elements all over the property. The lobby is "grand", but like other reviews mentioned, the vanilla-esque smell was overwhelming and distracting. We didn't really care for it. - Check-in: Pretty easy. I had read previous reviews and had set my expectations accordingly about a possible slow check-in, but it was pretty effortless. There was staff to greet us and point us in the right direction and line. - Room: Beautifully appointed. Great details like the scale in the bathroom; the safe in the nightstand which can accommodate two laptops and more; the big bathroom; technology. The dark wood furniture, although very chic, shows some wear already with chipped nightstands. Pillows and beds are incredibly soft and feathery. Not bad if you like it, but if you prefer firmer beds or pillows, this may not work for you. Also, we loved the floor to ceiling windows. We were a bit distracted with the construction air horn blowing every once in a while from the Cosmopolitan (they were doing construction on the pool), but it wasn't so bad that we thought we had to move. - Housekeeping: Did a good job. No complaints. One of the days, it was already 3:30 and they hadn't hit our room yet, but it eventually got done. - Pool: Wait service was good. They have several pools to choose from. Never had an issue finding a chaise, but I got to the pool pretty early in the day (10:30 am). Folks showing up later in the afternoon had a hard time finding a place to settle. - Food: Ate breakfast at the Cafe Vettro, which was very good and very reasonable. Not a buffet, but a menu structured restaurant. Also had snacks (gelato, pastries) at the Patisserie shop on the Casino level. I've been to France several times and the pastries are just like there. Incredible. It was always packed. If it's too crowded, try the quick little "To Go" bar/cafe near the North valet, I think. Grabbed coffee there several times when the Pastry shop was too crowded, even for coffee. They also seem to have nice restaurants on the Viva Las Vegas floor, but we didn't have an opportunity to check any of them out. - Casino: My husband are not huge gamblers, so we played a bit, and had fun. Won and lost some. - Check-out: I sense that they're still trying to figure out the best way to manage this. There was staff available to greet folks checking out and advising folks about express check out if you didn't want to check your room bill (which we did, so we waited in line). It was a little busy, but it usually is at check-out time in large hotels. They were staffed adequately, I think. - Hotel staff: Staff across the board for our stay were very pleasant, nice, and helpful. I'd read otherwise, but did not run into any issues with staff at all. - Internet access: Wifi is pricey ($15 per 24-hour period). We found that we could get it for free the first couple of days we were there, but then as soon as the weekend crowd hit, the hotel added their security and locked down access to paying customers only. Business Center rates are a rip off for any kind of internet access or printing. - MGM-property perk: We purchased tickets to an event at the Mirage from the concierge at the Mirage and were able to bill it to our room at the Aria, which was nice. - Adjacent shopping mall: Architecturally stunning property. Still a little vacant, but has all the standard Vegas stores and still being filled by retail stores. It had been a while (6 years and 3 kids later) since we had been to Las Vegas. We had not heard of the Aria, nor had most of our friends somewhat familiar with Vegas, but we wanted to stay in a 5-star resort. We'd recommend it highly to our friends going there and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “MGM Groug of Hotels should be ashamed of the Aria!”
Reviews.Author: didi014
Reviews.Content: We received an invitation from the Aria & booked for 3 nights incl. our anniversay Jun 23, 2010. The pungent odor in the casino & shopping centre gave me a headache but the worst part was the accommodation. First night asked for "strip view room" & were given a 6th floor room with panoramic view of 8 storey cement parkade! Very nice assist. mgr. moved us into "sky tower suite" on 2nd day. List of deficiencies with suite incl.: bent track on curtains,so no "black-out feature", badly chipped veneer on coffee table & bed nightstand, desk phone didn't work, bedside lamps controls reversed left to right, blood stains on bedspread & bathroom wallpaper, toilet "wash feature" not operational, bedroom broken lamp shade, bathroom broken lamp, dangerous metal corner brackets on base of king bed protruding about 6 inches beyond mattress, wall behind headboard not painted, and most amazing: blank white wall facing bed with wires/cables protuding from hole in centre where tv should be mounted & when reported to staff as possible theft of tv, was told room was built for tv but not scheduled to receive one yet???? All this in a hotel that's just a few months old & cost billions to build! We were offered another move, meant 3rd time packing & unpacking in 3 days but not much point especially as this was now our anniversary day....happy anniversary to us! Wrote a letter to mgmnt on return home months ago, have yet to receive a response! Stayed at NewYork NewYork in Aug. & had email thanking us for our stay & asking if everything was satisfactory within a week. Also stayed at Bellagio, our favorite hotel, this month & had the usual fabulous room & fantastic service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: LuxeGirlNYC
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute decision because we had to spend one night somewhere. I had been very curious about the Aria and this was my chance, so I went for it. Check in was nice and smooth, very quick actually. I booked a deluxe room. I did not book a city view room but I was given a high floor. I was not sure what to expect for a view. My first impression after stepping off the elevator was that it looked like a nice cono building or luxury apartment building. It had a nice feel to it. When we walked in the direction of our room, 32-167, we were pleasantly surprised. The hallway has a panoramic view of the strip! It was outrageous! I thought that was an incredible touch. The room keys don’t work like standard room keys. All you have to do it hold the key up to the round sensor on the door and it opens. There’s no slot to stick it in, which is perfect for me since I always seems to have trouble with those. As soon as you walk in the room for the first time, the drapes open to show you the view. Considering I did not pay extra for a view, I thought my view was great. Immediately in front of us was the Cosmopolitan, so we were able to see the construction. They are making great progress. To our left, we could see the Aria corner suites and the Rio in the distance. To the right we could see Planet Hollywood very clearly and a piece of the Eiffel Tower. The room was beautiful but small. However, for a small room they used the space wisely. I really liked the color scheme and the furniture. It was very contemporary but very plush. The room is very high tech. All of your controls are next to your bed. You basically don’t have to get out of bed to change anything, including the temperature.
