There is even a channel that tells you if flights are on time, which I thought was awesome! The pool at the Aria is nice but not spectacular. I thought it was bit of a walk from the room. They do check for room keys at the entrance to the pool, which is a plus. Beverage service at the pool was not good at all. Nobody serviced our section. It was like we were invisible. Overall, the hotel was very nice. Would I recommend it to someone? Sure. Would I stay there again? Probably not, unless I’m comped.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS MY NEW VEGAS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: crauto1
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical on this place because of some of the reviews. Was a little nervous and overwhelmed when I got out of the cab but within minutes of walking through the glass doors, employees greeted me with smiles and offered any help I needed. Not sure if I was the exception instead of the rule, but we were there for 4 days and 3 nights and everyone there offered help 24/7. Rooms were wonderful and not too techno. Just check it out for a few minutes and it is quite easy to maneuver. Housekeeping was wonderful and I am quite messy while in Vegas because of time shortage. They made everything look great and took great pride in there work! The casino is beautiful and the machines are lots of fun. I won many times and lost many times. It was great! The cocktail waitresses were quick and always had a smile even with many rude customers. The concierge was wonderful and was never too busy to help. Also had a great smile. The front desk was great to check in /check out and answer any questions in between. The whole hotel was the nicest place I have stayed in a long time. Love the location and finally could navigate by the time I left. I can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but won't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: NandM91209
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas for our one year anniversary. We have always stayed at the MGM Grand, but decided to do it up since it was a special occasion. We were able to get discounted rooms due to our player club status. We upgraded to a Deluxe City View room when we arrived. They didn't have any Corner Suites available, which is what we really wanted. The hotel lobby and casino area are beautiful. It has a very artsy feel with sculptures everywhere, very nice to look at. The casino itself was not as big as I thought, but a good size. Table games were never less than $10 for you gamblers, but we didn't expect them to be any lower. When we got to our room the automated lights and window sheers were nice at first. You have total control of the lights and curtains by the touch of the remote. They also have an alarm clock that also controls everything. You can set a wake up or sleep timer and it will adjust the temperature, open the curtains, turn on or off the TV. That is pretty cool. The cool wears off though when you just want to turn on a light. Sometimes simple is better. The bathroom was very nice with a shower and tub. I will post some pictures of this because it is hard to describe the look. The toilet was secluded which was nice for some privacy. The bedroom was nicely decorated. There was a desk with USB ports and plugs. There was a mini bar that was fully stocked, but very pricey. $8 for a bottle of Fuji water. The bed was very comfortable. The view from the room was also pleasant. You cannot really see the strip from the room because the hotel is about 300 years from the strip and there are other buildings that are included in City Center that block the view. We could see Monte Carlo, NY NY, MGM, and Planet Hollywood. The main focus of the view is the middle of City Center where there is a fountain and pretty lights. We did not get room service, but the prices were very high and we did talk with someone that had ordered something and they said it wasn't that good. There is access to a monorail that connects City Center, Vdara, Aria, Monte Carlo and Bellagio. The monorail puts you out at the back of the Bellagio which is a pretty long walk to get back to the strip, but beats walking in the heat. You have access to the mall which has some nice upscale shops and good places to eat. As far as the restaurants in the hotel go there are several high dollar places to eat (see my review on Sirio). The buffet was good, but I heard the Bellagio has a better one. The one thing is we didn't want to eat 5 stars every time we went out. We sometimes wanted something quick so we had to go to the Monte Carlo or across the street to get any type of fast food. Overall, it was a nice trip, but if we had paid full price for the room then we would have been upset. If you are looking for an artsy, high tech place to stay then I would recommend this hotel, if not stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service of any place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: g8trdmd
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas 6 times. I have stayed in Caesars, MGM, Hard Rock, and the Palms. The rooms at Aria are high tech, modern, and well done. However, I went with a group of friends for a bachelor party and we could not book rooms together, and only some us ended up with double beds. When we arrived at the Aria we had to lug out baggage and glof bags in throught the double non automatic doors ourselves as the hotel personnel was no where to be found. This became a common theme for the weekend as times we wanted to leave with our golf clubs the bell/baggage person would tell us to walk around the round about to other side to talk to someone about getting a limo and our golf clubs. I thought I was at a vegas hotel charging me 300 a night. Amenities?? The normal casino .. only one conversation with one bellhop and bags are delivered, large tip is given. The Aria is extremely poorly managed. I average 100-200 per hand for 8-10 hours each day, but if you win money the Aria will not comp you. I would not recommend this place to anyone. There are too many other great places to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable - but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: agrippina17
Reviews.Content: Aria is understated and comfortable, and provides a real contrast to the bright lights of the Strip. We found that the hotel offered a welcome respite from noise and bustle of Vegas - so I would recommend it, on that basis, to people who think the full-on Vegas experience might be just a bit too much. We had the lowest-priced room type but it was still huge, with a bath and a shower, a very comfortable king bed, lots of room to move around and lots of cupboard space. We also thought that the breakfast buffet was excellent value. There were a few things we didn't like. Our room wasn't cleaned on one day, although we had asked for service (housekeeping was thorough on the other days). The remote control for the tv was maddeningly slow to respond. The pools seemed very small to us (although we didn't really have anything to compare them to) and the vanilla perfume which they pump out on all the public floors was really unpleasant and overpowering. Wifi costs $15 per night. They also charge $10 to hold a parcel for a guest - but the concierge didn't mention the fee when I called up to ask about this service. These are small things, and we were happy with the hotel overall - but there is definitely room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: sig
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Aria, at begining of our trip thru Southwest. This is one of the best hotels in Las Vegas we ever stayed. From the rooms to the people who work there, it's in class of its own. Everything in the room is high technology and is easy to master, don't understand people who complain about it. When I will go back to Vegas this the place I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Room cleaning was atrocious”
Reviews.Author: ozracer101
Reviews.Content: This was the newest hotel in Las Vegas and had excellent amenities. The pools were brilliant (AND needed in the Las Vegas heat) and location was perfect. What surprised us was the newer innovation of " automatically deducted pay for what you use". If you so much as moved an item in their room fridge, you were charged for it. Don't bother putting it back because you have been zapped by a sensor in the fridge,. AND the prices of bar items was ridiculously expensive. BE WARNED!! For the price of rooms you wold think the internet may have been provided but at US$15 per 24 hours they get their extras out of you. And the fitness centre was extra. The room cleaners were shocking as we had items like towels that were replaced were actually short changed. ( i am sure we would have been charged for items missing on checkout!! ) Then we found that some drinking glasses were not changed and still had water in them. The bed was the best we have ever slept in and the overall comfort was great. but when you pay the type of nightly fee they ask, you expect to have better room service. We would rather go back to the Belagio next visit.

Reviews.Title: “better than a motel 8”
Reviews.Author: ann22901
Reviews.Content: Immaculate and new. Rooms high tech. Elvis show was great. Room service was very prompt. All staff was polite and professional. No electrical outlets near the beds. Decor very plain. Entire hotel looks and feels like they ran out of money and didn't finish it! Not a single live flower arrangement in the place. Decor is all rocks, stones and marble. The pools were crowded but the cabanas were lovely. Best cabana service in all of Vegas. Jean Phillipe pastry shop is fabulous. Friends and family stayed here because we had an offer we could not refuse. Overall just fine. This is no where near the caliber of the Bellagio (my favorite) or Encore (Wynns). The location really sucks unless you are interested in visiting south end resorts. In the future I won't bother staying anywhere but the Bellagio no matter how good the deal is.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Service From Edmonton Alberta”
Reviews.Author: haileythegolden
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aria from September 10 -15th. We go to Vegas about 3 -4 times a year. We were a little anxious to stay there due to some of the negtative reviews regarding poor service from hotel staff in housekeeping, checkin and maintenance. Because we received the players club promotion of $79 plus 2 free buffets we thought we would give the hotel a try. The moment we arrived to the hotel lobby to checkin at 9:00pm a young lady took us immediately to a checkin person, His name was Keith. An extremely polite and enthusiastic individual. We spoke with him for about 10 minutes exchanging pleasantries. He made every effort to get to know us and told us about he and his wife. We told him that we just had an anniversary and he sent up to our room a wonderful box of Jean Philiippe Chocolates., We also mention to him we wanted to have a late dinner at Lemon Grass so he immediately called the restaruant and reserved a table for us later that evening. He then gave us great directions to our room on the 20th floor with a very nice view of west Las Vegas. Our room was far from the elevators but it was'nt a big deal as you get use to the distance, because you are farther from the center of the hotel you get a better view. I really like the high tech room and the system was very user friendly. For most guys who like TV remotes it is very straight forward. If you are like myself who likes to TV surf alot the batteries do run out. The bad news is our batteries did run out on the TV remote and then you cannot work the system. We called maintenance and they delivered new batteries in about 1 hour. When we arrived at Lemon Grass restaurant the hostess was extremely friendly. The bus person brought us water and tea immediately and then the waiter greeted us. He was very friendly and also personable. A few minutes later another staff person came to our table to make sure we were being served. The price is a little expensive compared to comparable Thai or Vietnamese restaurants of this type of the strip but we enjoyed our meal. We also had breakfast at Cafe Vettro. Again, friendly and efficient staff. The breakfast portions are large and I am glad my wife and I shared a breakfast. The room has a privacy switch and I accidentally push the button in the morning so housekeeping did not clean our room. We we came back to our room at 5:00pm we called housekeeping and a housekeeper came within 10 minutes to clean our room. I had a very nice conservation with her and she told me that the supervisors are changing systems on a regular basis to ensure that hotel guess are receiving the best service possible. She was very thorough and I was happy to tip her. Every time we passed housekeeping staff in the hallway we were always politely greeted. My wife used the pool area and was very satisfied with the facilities. Make sure you always carry your room key because they ask for your key to enter the pool area and room elevators. We thought the casino had a limited variety of machines especially penny, nickel and quarter machines. The minimum bet for the penny machines was actually 30 to 50 cents. We have our favorite machines at other casinos so we just went there to use the slots. My wife went to check on tickets for Viva Elvis but the show was dark that night but was given a a password to get a great discount for KA at the MGM ticket office. We got $150 tickets for $55. They were great seats and the performance was sold our that night. It was very easy to park in the parkade and an easy walk to enter the hotel not like the lots at MGM, Caesars Palace, Mandalay Bay etc. Overall we had a great stay and and had a great experience. I am a frequent traveller and I felt the experience at the Aria was more like a 5 star hotel experience rather that a casino experience like we have had at the MGM Grand and other Vegas Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Yippee!!”
Reviews.Author: MBrack
Reviews.Content: I got a Player's Club deal for $79/night with 2 free buffets. Since they are about $35, I figure we paid $9 for one of the best rooms I've ever stayed in. We were on the 53rd floor with a beautiful mountain view. The decor is elegant and modern, the bed AMAZING and the touch-screen remote by the bed was a lot of fun for a gadget-freak like myself. It was easy to use and you control everything in the room without leaving the bed - amazing! It even told us our door was ajar at one point. The staff were all very, very friendly and helpful. The pool area is really great - five different pools with about 10 lounge chairs to every person there. Of course we were there during the week, so I imagine it's more crowded on the weekends. Cocktail service was great - but the drinks were pricey as usual. We ate one dinner at Cafe Vetro which was really good. I had the steak/salad/drink combo for $31 and it was probably the best meal I had on this trip. We also gorged ourselves at the (free) buffet which was above average, but still a buffet. The crab legs were so salty we couldn't eat them, but everything else was good. Oh - the desserts are really, really good. Really. We also got a dessert crepe, breakfast pastries and coffee at the bakery in the casino and it was all very good too. They gave me the wrong brioche (pear instead of almond) but it was yummy so I didn't mind. We didn't have the time to really explore the other restaurants of shops, but will definitely try to go back and do so.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Fantastic hotel - everything was 5star!”
Reviews.Author: sonya.k
Reviews.Content: i sent my husband here for 2nts in september- he couldnt stop making me jelous on how good the stay was here- the staff were first class from reception to house keeping, the rooms were out of this world, the ipad style gadget was really cool and the bathrooms were magnificiant-the swimming pool area was excellent will come back here !- ..BOOK IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every aspect Hotel/Casino!”
Reviews.Author: mountaineergal78
Reviews.Content: Stayed September 9-11th to celebrate our 11th wedding anniversary. We stayed in a City View room on the 23rd floor. The hotel/casino and rooms are top notch and all of the staff were extremely accommodating and friendly. Very Impressive all around. I would highly recommend a stay and personally my husband and I can hardly wait to pay them another visit very soon! To us, it was definitely 5 star all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Overall it was very nice”
Reviews.Author: svice
Reviews.Content: Our view of the strip on the 25th floor was very nice. The floor to ceiling glass windows were awesome! It was my birthday and that evening we came back to the room to see chocolate dipped strawberries and cookies waiting. Very sweet! Everyone at the hotel was very friendly! The restaurant Juilane Serrano was my favorite! Very good food and the Ginger Pear Mint Julep was yummy! A couple complaints I had about the room is it did not have a safe that was a standard feature which is shocking for Vegas! The state of the art room was nice when things worked propertly. You can only use the remote control to open and close yoru curtains, adjust the air, turn on.off lights, monitor your account etc.... so when it doesnt work you cant do either of these things which happend twice and had to have fixed. The time on the clock was wrong which affect the time on the tv as well. Not so good when you relay on this for a dinner reservation to only realize the time is wrong. Our mini bar was suppose to have a wine bottle opener and when we looked around for it we were charged for a bag of chips we never ate because if anything is moved you are charged. They did take it off our bill but was annoyed I had to explain why the chips may have been moved looking for something that should have been obvious to see but wasnt even there..... The menu by the pool needs serious improvement! The drinks were very good and a great selection but the nearest place to eat is a far walk back into the main casino area so your only option really is the poolside. I sat on the SIDE of the pool with my drink in a plastic cup but was told this was not allowed, however, a group of guys can smoke cigars IN the pool!! Does this make any sense??? The Spa was spectacular! Best money spent all weekend! I would go back just for the spa! They were very friendly and it was very nice and well thought out! The location of this hotel was also great! The tram that takes you to the Bellagio or Monte Carlo was a great idea! S. Vice

Reviews.Title: “sky suite service outstanding”
Reviews.Author: CREST28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a sky suite at the Aria and the service was outstanding. We normally could not afford this kind of suite but they had a special that made the price very reasonable. They pick you up at the airport in a limo and you enter a private check in area and lounge. The service was tremendous and the hotel room was state of the art. They will even lend you a laptop while in the lounge and you get limo service to the airport when you depart.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Aria”
Reviews.Author: PiettaEastRidge_TN
Reviews.Content: We loved the Aria, the location execllent. We will definitely stay here again. Everyone was wonderful in makig sure our request was taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Re-Visited: Feedback since they seem to be reading these reviews...”
Reviews.Author: pulgadelmundo
Reviews.Content: Hey Everyone... Visited Aria again briefly this week...I ran into Elena, the staff who found my purse (last review)...She gave me a hug and shared how she had received total kudos from my review...she deserved it! So since, I know someone from Aria is reading this....Let the feedback begin from the last visit! Everything went well with a couple exceptions (btw thanks for the awesome player's rate and no resort fee)...I will give credit that reception was much better in its organization! Also, someone must of read that the bathroom was poorly planned because you could actually see the electric socket the time! yippie..they moved the kleenex box... Problems: The greeting Valet guys TOTALLY dropped the ball...When I arrived they did not ask me if I needed a bell person and were yelling at each other...It was not THAT busy. It was not the organized service I experienced the last time I arrived. It pissed me off...just because I don't drive an Escalade and am not a hot chick, don't ignore me...I would of tipped you well but now I just right this... New Hotel, but get matience some brown paint...I actually had to change rooms so I saw a couple floors of rooms...The doors need to get cleaned more often and they need some paint..Drunk Vegas people are bouncing off the doors like crazy...or at least that is how it looks with all the nicks I saw...on the plus side...my room was in solid shape once you got past the door... Biggest Off issue: The Buffett...or more specifically the STAFF In my rate special I was comped 2 buffets (worth about $60) which was cool. I invited a local friend and we had dinner...The food itself with a couple exceptions (lamb masala) and the desserts was underwhelming. The bright lighting in the buffett area makes it look like a cheap cafeteria which was unusual...The biggest issue we had was actually the STAFF...not the guys serving the food (they were pleasant) but the SERVERS...My friend even said to me when our server had a bad attutude that she has noticed a couple servers who looked REALLY unhappy to be there...We know it was toward the end of the night but leave your sour expressions at the door...you are almost going home! Cheers....Till My next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: SharonE19
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Aria we were met with excellent service from the doorman to the check in staff. Which was nice after our terrible taxi ordeal. We got the worst taxi driver in history, he was rude, tried to rip us off and the car stunk like he had had been living in it. After this taxi journey we will never use Las Vegas taxi's again!! Anyway I digress! Miguel met us at Aria and was very courteous and helpful and so was Christopher on checkin. We asked for a quiet room and were given a room on the 4th floor with a part pool view but it was very quiet which is what we wanted, the exception was saturday and sunday when noisy neighbours were thrust upon us. Tried to call security but lines engaged. Tried several times to phone, front desk, bell desk etc. After reading the reviews we thought this was typical of the hotel but on checking out we realised the phone we had been trying to use on the desk was broken. Had we tried the phone next to the bed we would have found we could have got through as we used this on the last day for the bell desk. How annoying as we had tried to call room service several times and always got the engaged tone we felt like idiots! Room wasn't clean on entry but after going to front desk and complaining they had someone go clean the room quickly and gave us 2 free breakfast buffets for use anytime during our stay. We had planned to eat at the buffet during our stay so free breakfasts were a great way to check it out. The buffet- A big disappointment. The service was great, the waiter was good fun and kept our drinks full but the buffet didn't have enough stations or choice. We ate at the Mandalay Bay buffet for lunch and found the food excellent but our waitress was very uninterested and curt and didn't replenish our drinks. We are returning to Vegas at x-mas as we will not be going to either of the buffets again. The room- Comfy bed, pillows were best ever, fantastic shower, toiletries very nice especially the shampoo. Some days had hairspray and mouthwash but some days not. Bathroom door handle was broken, they never fixed this but we never complained as we couldn't get through on the broken phone..But you would have thought the cleaners would have reported it in stead of trying to hang it back on broken... MOUTHWASH- after complaining about the room not being cleaned we went to the casino whilst the cleaners were sent back in to clean. Prior to complaining my hubby had opened the mouthwash and had some (just arrived after 15hrs traveling). When we came back to the room he noticed the bottle was full. He took a mouthful and it was water. Mmmmm where was that from?????? Also robes were removed from our room and had to ask for some more. Hubby started leaving a tip again after we got a nice cleaner!! Summary- We would not say this is a 5* hotel, we would rate it a 4*. We have stayed at numerous 4and 5*'s such as MGM 4* and Encore/Wynn 5*. We would stay here again if the rates were more reasonable but current rates they are asking are over priced. We think this hotel is somewhere between MGM and Bellagio. When we return at x-mas we will be staying at the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectation”
Reviews.Author: Bubs404
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Aria at 10:30 pm, check-in was fast, people friendly & professional. Got a killer room facing the strip, dead center of the hotel (a smoking room that had never been smoked in). The room control (HAL) took me all of 5 mins to figure out. Set the alarm with drapes opening & TV on. The hook-up for Ipod etc, on desk side worked well with no issues (bring cables). Pool area super slick (expensive beer thought - what ever), with few kids. All in all, a uber modern hi-end hotel with none of the gaudy trappings of Vegas. People have called it cold & generic, I call it refined & modern. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cmb2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and loved it! The check in was good, and they were friendly! We got our room right away. We got a great rate on our players club so we couldn't not come stay here for a bit. The rooms were very nice. The bathroom was awesome and very specious and they had the best beds I have ever slept on and we have an awesome bed at home), woke up super rested. But there was a couple negivative with the room. It seemed like they did a very quick clean in the rooms just a quick once over. the mirrors were all streaky and the end side table was really dirty. When my boyfriend went to the hall and ask the cleaning lady for a rag to wipe our table she just gave him one she didn't offer to clean it, which I didn't think was awesome. And everything was electonic but we had a hard time closing our blackout blinds we had to keep pressing the buttons over and over to close them. But that was the only negitive that we experinced. The pool was great. They had 3 pools and tonnes of loungers. It was very relaxing and had tonnes of palm trees and plants to make it very tropical. The casino was huge which I really like so we could always find a free slot game that we liked. The location of this hotel was great too. It was right in the middle of the strip, so easy to get everywhere we needed. Over all we loved this hotel and would stay agian in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel--exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Colorado_Rick
Reviews.Content: After reading many negative reviews about the Aria on this site, we were a bit concerned about what we would encounter upon arrival. Our fears were baseless, as we had NO problems whatsoever. Here's some details, both + and -: We encountered no "unfriendly" staff. Everyone we dealt with was pleasant and friendly. Check-in took about 5 minutes max. This was @ 1:00 pm on Monday. Labor Day. Check-out took even less, like 2 minutes. This was very early in the morning however. We had a corner suite, which had a spectacular view, but the sun came in in the late afternoon, requiring us to close the drapes for a couple of hours. The food at the buffet was outstanding, even better than the Wynn's buffet. We had one breakfast and one lunch at the buffet. The pool area was spotless, and the pool towels were clean and fluffy--no old towels. The room was very clean, but not spotless. The carpet & the tile floors needed to be better cleaned in our opinion. Maid service was great, with no problems. If you want your room cleaned early, simply call Housekeeping and request it. Don't forget to leave a tip every day for the maid(s). For whatever reason, we could hear people talking in a neighboring room through the small vents in the bedroom & bathroom. Strange... The living room remote had dead batteries when we arrived, and the technician was there in about 5 minutes after I called to replace the batteries. We had several burned out light bulbs, and the maintenance guy arrived in about 30 minutes to replace them after I called. Yes, the Aria is a BIG hotel, which means LOTS of walking. If you are averse to walking, you may wish to consider staying elsewhere. However, our experience is that most of the "larger" hotels in Vegas require just as much walking, with the Wynn, the Encore, the TI, the Rio, the Mirage, and the Flamingo as examples. If you need to be close to the elevators, request a room close to the elevators. A corner suite is NOT close to the elevators. All the high-tech stuff in the room was fun to play with, but you can't touch the "Master" switch near the door, because if you do, all your settings disappear. At least ours did. The soft bed was fine, but I didn't care for the oversized pillows. I may bring my own next time, or ask if they have some others that aren't so big. There is a shop on the Casino Level called Elements. It contains curios, snacks, drinks and other essential you may have forgotten. It isn't hard to find, as it is on the maps, and listed in the guide in the room. Not cheap like an ABC store, but nicely stocked. Overall, we loved our experience at the Aria. It was like being on a grand luxury ocean liner, with all the amenities. Really no NEED to go elsewhere. We plan to stay there again in the future, as long as we can get a good deal on the room, like we had this time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravlinStarre
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed 9-5 thru 9-9 at the Aria and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay....there was a bit of a 'bump in the road' upon check in, but after chatting with the Customer Service people about what happened they changed our room from the 4th floor to a 20th floor room with an amazing view of the strip & gave us a $50.00 voucher which we used at the pool for a couple drinks....the rooms are very technically advanced & are very comfortable & chic.....the pool area was quite lush & tropical with good service...we would def stay here again when we return to Las Vegas~

Reviews.Title: “Aria vegas”
Reviews.Author: DivaZoe
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, loved Julian Serrano the sangria is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Stay, Stylish Place, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: surfsunsand
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in September, over Memorial Day Weekend, just got back in fact, and I love the Aria:) I am a frequent traveller to Las Vegas and have stayed at many properties on the Strip, all 41/2 star or better and this is the best so far. The front desk staff was friendly and professional, our room was ready upon arrival and there were no long waits to speak to anyone. The computer for the room curtains, tv, music, lights ect is very easy to use. No issues at all with the room keys. The crowd at the hotel was mostly 21 to 45ish, well dressed, and having fun. It was very busy and a lot was going on. I found the service to be excellent, friendly and helpful from everyone at the resort, front desk to room attendants. We had a corner suite, I definately recommend this, it was large and beautiful, great views from all the rooms in the suite, clean, well stocked every day, and cleaned in a timely mannor. Turn down service every night. I was there for 5 days and it was over a weekend and the service was excellent every day. The pools were very nice and we liked the DJ spinning music, awsome touch, the drinks were the same prices as any other high end resort, and strong. The gelato at Sweet Chill was so good, try the turtle gelato, you'll love it. We played Mega Millions and Roulette and were up for both, yay. Although I really did want to win the mega millions jackpot:( I won a few hundred instead.) oh well maybe next time. It is not confusing at all to get around the resort, don't really know how people think it is, they may have problems with direction in the first place. Also I did not think a 2 minute walk to my room at the end of the hall was excessive as I have read on here. Some complain the rooms are far away from the elevators. I guess if you do have issues with walking I can see that, otherwise, it is not long at all. The Valet service is excellent, and very fast. I did not have to wait long at all for the car at anytime. In my opinion the staff go out of the way to make sure you are happy and content with everything. I definately feel that this resort will be hard to top if I do stay anywhere else next visit, I like to try a different place everytime, but I really want to spend some more time at the Aria. I hope your stay is as great as mine was, I definately reccomend this resort and have to friends and family already:)

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm, mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: This hotel took a while for me to warm up to, but once I did, I loved it. At first, not so much. I would have to say that it is quite user-unfriendly overall, and somewhat less welcoming in general that most of the other upscale Vegas hotels I'd stayed at. The newness is a big draw though, as everything is shiny and nice still, and doesn't reek of smoke. The rooms are a bit small, but pleasantly tech-y. I found the City Center where it is housed to be horrid though. Completely sterile and offering absolutely nothing for anyone but millionaires. They were all obviously out of town since the place was totally empty and quiet. I can't imagine how it will stay afloat in this economy or any other really. Do bring a fat wallet to the hotel though because the Aria itself manages to gouge you at every turn. Suntan lotion for $20, wireless for $15? Just accept it and you'll be better off, but make sure you get a good deal on your room, because they will be getting the rest of your money one way or another. At the Aria, I found that if you stay either at the pool or in the spa it is a wonderful experience. Blissful really. Anywhere else though and you are in for a rough ride.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, fun rooms”
Reviews.Author: mmj0ly
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and my husband and I had a lot of fun playing with the controls in the room. Unfortunately, the hotel seemed to be understaffed and we waited in line about 30-40 min. to check in. We also had a problem with the safe and, though we called to the front desk, they forgot to send someone up. We called again and someone showed up about 2 hours later. Overall, though, it is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend and Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: travellingJimb
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying at Aria this past weekend (Labor day weekend) and I was very happy with our stay. I was offered a free room for the weekend by MGM/Mirage marketing so my "value" opinion may be biased, but I would definitely pay to stay at Aria in the future. Check In: Check in was crowded when we arrived at 12:45 on Friday afternoon, but the staff was organized and we waited just a few minutes until we were helped. Our room was ready and were able to check in immediately. Check out was a similar experience; quick and easy. Room: We had a deluxe room (fairly standard room I think) and it was nice and well appointed. The bathroom was a little bit smaller than I would like and the beds were softer than I prefer, but all in all the room was very comfortable. All the rooms have a fancy integrated electronic remote comtrol that controls everything from the lighting and curtains, to the television and music. It was an intersting novelty, but shouldn't be the reason you stay ar Aria. Fortunately, we did not experience any technical malfunctions with the remote. Casino/Common Areas: I really liked the casino area. Not a convoluted mess of tables, not difficult to navigate, amble assortment of games (variety, betting minimums), friendly dealers and pit bosses. All good. I was a little dissapointed at the numebr of auto-shufflers at blackjack tables. I wish they would have more tables with traditional shoe dealing. I also like how the casino has small bar and lounge areas strewn all about. They provided a nice respite from gaming and helped to make one feel as though they weren't in the mist of a throng of people (did that make sense?). Spa: Went to the spa on Sunday for some steam room and relaxation. The spa is set up very well (large steam room, hot tubs, cold tub, outdoor pool, shower, etc) and the staff is increibly helpful. However, the outdoor pool overlooks Liquid, the adult pool/club, and the music from Liquid is lound and somewhat disrupts relaxation time. Also, for $30 the spa is the best deal in town, in my opinion. Buffet: We had a free buffet and went for breakfast on Sat morning. If you're into buffets I'm sure you'll enjoy this one. For me... I would have rather paid for a normal breakfast somewhere else. Pool: Didn't really give the pool much of a chance, but it wasn't my favorite pool. Just didn't seem to have the character of the pool at Mandalay, or Hard Rock. Aside from some minor gripes, I was very impressed with Aria and it has become my 1st choice when visiting Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Shiny and new but needs to work on customer service at reception!”
Reviews.Author: lesrion99
Reviews.Content: Everyone at Aria was extremely friendly & helpful with the exception of the front desk staff (or at least the ones I encountered). My trip to Aria started off on the wrong foot. As part of a conference, the hotel had blocked off a group of rooms at a reduced rate for attendees. When shown the rate upon check-in it was $10 higher an night than what was advertised. When I brought this up to the clerk she rudely asked me why I cared because "it was not that big a difference" and refused to even look into the issue because it "looked like a good rate" to her. After a full day of traveling I gave up on arguing and just turned in. I've noticed this on a lot of other reviews too but when I checked into a "non-smoking" room it had definitely been smoked in recently and over time. I brought it up to the staff so did something to improve it as the smell wasn't so bad the next day. Despite the rocky beginning, the rest of the trip was wonderful. The conference facilities were top notch and I was impressed by not only the food at the conference, but also the attentiveness of the waitstaff (maybe they should be running the front desk, at least they smile!). I'm sure its hard to make tasty food for 1,000+ people but they did a spectacular job at it. My room was spotless and the housekeeping did a wonderful job each day keeping it tidy. The rooms were trendy and modern and I was pleased with my view. All of the room functions are automated so you could, for example, program the shades to open as a wake up call. Very cool. Ate at two of the restraunts - Lemongrass (Thai) and Sage (Contemporary American) and would recommend them both. The service at Sage was particurally nice. Even all of the dealers in the casino were friendly! I didn't have a clue what I was doing so they were kind enough to show me how to lose my money. ;-) No, but seriously they were professional, yet friendly. One more thing that I've come to expect from high end hotels, but still hate, is all of the add on charges -- for example the business center charged $1/minute (yes!) for internet and entrance to the gym was $30/day. After trying to go for a jog in Vegas that may have actually been worth it but I didn't try and find out.

Reviews.Title: “Music to the Eyes”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Weston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I holiday in Las Vegas several times a year, and we stayed for the first time at the Aria in City Center in September. I had read the negative comments in Tripadvisor and so felt some trepidation about staying there, but we were offered a rate of $79 a night, so we booked a room. [Another reason that we decided to stay at the Aria is that, unlike the MGM/Mirage hotels and the Venetian, the Aria does not charge a "resort fee"]. Happily, our entire experience was excellent. Although we arrived at noon, we were immediately given keys to our room (and our wait at the check-in was only five minutes). The room was beautiful and clean and we had a "Strip view" although we had not payed extra money for it. My only negative comment about the room can be that it was smaller than we expected (relative to the size of the rooms at the Venetian or in the Augustus Tower at Caesers), but we were nevertheless very pleased with it. The room was cleaned well every day. We had Sunday brunch at the buffet: the quality of food and the variety, as well as the service, were both wonderful. Again, I can make only one negative comment about the buffet: you have to pay extra for the "champagne", while at all the other buffets at which we have had the champange brunch unlimited champagne is included in the price of the brunch. The hotel is set back a considerable distance from Las Vegas Blvd, which was a "plus" for us because we we happy to have the chance to walk-off some of the calories consumed every day. The pool area was satisfactory but nothing special. An added bonus: because the Aria is relatively close to the airport, we payed about twenty-five dollars less for the round trip taxi ride from the airport than we usually pay. We would stay at the Aria again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property---don't use North Valet parking if you have luggage.”
Reviews.Author: shirleymarsh07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria on Labor Day weekend. It had beautiful rooms/shops/restaraunts. The hi-tech rooms were a nice feature. One piece of advice: There are two drives leading into City Center where Aria is located, Harmon Drive and City Center Drive. I took Harmon Drive from the strip and ended up at the rear of the hotel on the I-15 side at North Valet parking. They valet park your car, but they DO NOT carry your luggage! If you want them to carry your luggage, you must take City Center Drive which leads to the front of the hotel and lobby where there also is valet parking AND luggage service. Didn't know that; when I asked the door man why they don't carry luggage at the North Valet parking, he said that side is for locals mainly-----would've been nice to know ahead of time. I carried my own luggage and nobody got a tip!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel. Great for conference...”
Reviews.Author: whitelex
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Great for conference that I attended. Security was top notch. Rooms were clean and great casino. Lost it all but it went from my hands in style.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: deniseciah
Reviews.Content: had comp room for double queen - confirmed reservation on same day of arrival. upon checkin, they only had king room, had to get 2 rollaways (twin size ea) which took 6 hours for them to deliver to our room. windows were filthy and could not see out of window - very, very dirty. - casino was all high tech machines (3D) no regular slots. all tables were very high, not even any $10.00 tables, no matter what time. even though they had 3 pools, they were all very small and very packed - cabanna's were way overpriced and you never had any regular service. very short staffed in all areas. only can compliment the Skybox restraurant, as it was very reasonably priced and they did accomodate our request to change 1 of the many TV's to a game we preferred. the buffet was very lacking and not much of variety to select from, compared to other buffets in vegas, this one was overpriced for the lack of variety. we will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and new option for the strip”
Reviews.Author: KristinWA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our first trip without the kids in several years and we really enjoyed the adult getaway. The hotel is very nicely done and, having stayed at the Wynn/Encore before, I felt like Aria is a good comparison. We had been upgraded to a Corner Suite, which had a great layout but it was very smokey. After going back and forth with the front desk, they offered to upgrade us to a Sky Suite for $100 a night, which was well worth it. The Sky Suites and Sky Villas have a separate elevator, lounge, and check-in. My husband and I made good use of the free soft drinks and water plus light food throughout the day. The Sky Suites also come with free limo service to the airport and free wifi, which are very nice money savers. The room had a separate bedroom and fantastic bathroom with soaking tub (with jets), great shower, and a very fancy toilet (think heated seat). We went to the buffet for breakfast ($15 pp) and it was actually a better deal than most restaurants. We went to Vdara one morning for breakfast and it was quite pricey. Casino was fun, nice smell (which someone else mentioned) and good layout. My husband played poker a few times and said the room and service were nice. In all, this was a really nice hotel and we had great service throughout. We've been to Vegas with kids before and this was definitely more adult (try Mandalay Bay for kids). There's a tram so it's easy to go to other places and we didn't feel too far away at all. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “ultimate luxury”
Reviews.Author: gypsychicago_IlUSA
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel-we didn't want to leave! The room remote is a little tricky but it controls everything you need. The service is five star. The rooms were huge. I felt it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it at a convention rate, but otherwise...”
Reviews.Author: TexasSnow0001
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights during the last week of August, the convention was at the City Convention Center next door. The cheaper rooms must have all been at the ends of the hallways and you will walk forever to get to them - room rate was $119/night. Vaunted technology worked only when manually operated, as the control panel clock next to the bed was 6-7 hours off and so any automatic wake-sleep settings were useless. Room was generally clean, but I did note a few housekeeping issues-when I first arrived, the maid had just begun to clean. I left my luggage in the room and returned in an hour and the room was put back together. Decor is very modern, almost retro in feel. I'm not a gambling type so can't comment on the casino, but it didn't seem very busy. Restaurants: Sage - fantastic food, great service, worth a trip to the hotel. Julian Serrano's - yummy sandwiches, again great service. Overall, would not recommend mainly because there are so many other options in Las Vegas. Stay there if you can get a good rate and a room within 10 doors of the central elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Aria management listen to your guests. they are telling you what's wrong”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra029
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria and had no problems or complaints - it is a beautiful hotel but based on all the reviews there is no doubt they have problems with housekeeping and their buffet. I can't understand why Aria management are not listening to their guests who have spoken loudly and clearly about service issues. In any other business if clients were publishing complaints on a website where the world is checking it out, management would immediately rectify the issues identified. Aria is being told in no uncertain terms what the problems are and ignoring their guests' genuine complaints can only lead to loss of future business. After all, there is not exactly a shortage of hotel rooms in Vegas. Listen to your guests, they know what they are talking about.

Reviews.Title: “The shiny newness failed to hide the stink within.”
Reviews.Author: wingedcat
Reviews.Content: We had a real odor problem with the rooms at the ARIA. The first room they gave us had a very strong urine smell: think public bathroom at a truckers' rest-stop. The second room reeked of a variety of disinfectants used to hide a similar bathroom odor and this was in a different floor too! The front desk was extremely unhelpful, telling us that our noses was too sensitive and that if we had a problem with vanilla then we should stay at another hotel. She even arranged to get us rooms at the Bellagio at extra cost to us. Umm... trust me, the smell was NOT vanilla. And also, what kind of customer service was this? The next day, after finding a nicer front desk manger, we were able to switch to a third room. Although it was an improvement, there was still a strange, faint chemical smell to the room. The whole experience soured our stay at the ARIA. Although the exteriors are very pretty and modern-- albeit extremely BROWN-- the hotel is very poorly designed. There is only one set of elevators on each floor and confusing branching hallways that lead to dead-ends. If you're unlucky, you can have a very, very long walk to your room. Room numbers are five digits long and easily forgotten after a few drinks. Although it isn't obvious, the ARIA is actually behind the Strip. It's not a bad walk to the casino through City Center, but if you return late at night (it's vegas, who doesn't?), the City Center is locked, which means you have to walk around the City Center in a roundabout way to get back to ARIA. It's very inconvenient. Plus, it's another roundabout walk through the weird branching hallways to your room. The room was compact with high tech buttons everywhere. In fact, I found it a little too high-tech. When I accidentally pushed the wrong button, I shut off the entire room. The lights, tv, and shades shut automatically without any way to cancel it. There is very little counter space in the bathroom and I disliked how the tub was located inside the shower. Our bathroom lock was broken. Also, the beds are too soft. Sleeping in it is like sinking into quicksand. The ARIA casino and shopping area is worth a visit for its shiny, shiny modern newness. Also, if you get a chance, try one of the desserts at the patisserie in the casino. They're very good! But, DON'T bother staying at the hotel. It's not worth the price you're paying.

Reviews.Title: “Wow for Architecture -- Boo for Service”
Reviews.Author: smvhou
Reviews.Content: With such a huge investment in City Center, one can only imagine why zero attention has been paid to service levels. Perhaps that is why just over 60% of the reviews on this website, by former guests, are favorable. Our stay last week was a huge disappointment. While there is not another hotel complex in Las Vegas that can match Aria & City Center for impressive architecture, art & public area WOW factor, there is a decided void in terms of customer service. Electronically controlled drapes in the guest rooms simply does not make up for quality customer service. For 3 days we left requests to have 3 burned out bulbs in the bathroom replaced, but after 3 days they remained burned out. Why would a guest even have to ask to have burned out bulbs replaced? Is that not a function of professional housekeeping? And the air vent in the bathroom had absolutely not been cleaned since it was installed. It was covered in dirt & lint & we got on a chair & cleaned it off, after leaving 2 notes asking for it to be cleaned. Even though the kleenex box in the room was empty on arrival, & the one in the bathroom ran out the first night, & we place both empty boxes on the counter tops, they were never replaced for 3 days. On the 3rd day we finally went to a main in the hallway & asked for kleenex, but (get this) she had "NONE" on her cart. Was that the problem? Did the hotel forget to order kleenex, which meant the maids had none? Over a 3 day period the soap bars were never replaced, nor were the shampoo & other amenities replaced. There were no glasses in the bathroom & only 3 with the ice bucket in the room, & none of the 3 were replaced over the 3 day period. Each evening we washed them out in order to reuse them. And we heard LOTS of customer service complaint from other guests, no matter where we were in the hotel. Ordered 1/2 price appetizers & drinks in a lobby bar/restaurant named Union, during happy hour, & if we had been paying full price for the stuff we got we would have sent it back. Even at 1/2 price the food quality was very inferior. Something is not right at these City Center operations yet. Perhaps the well publicized financial problems are having a negative impact on employee levels, since training seems to be non-existent. Fantastically beautiful facility, & definitely worth a visit to "view" the property, but would we stay there again? Not in the near future, & not until we start reading that things are operating as they should for a facility that is so over-priced as to be insulting ---- "when" the related service levels are non-existent. MGM Mirage has missed the mark on this development, as it specifically relates to professionalism & quality service.

Reviews.Title: “Glam”
Reviews.Author: January28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty nice. It was such a nice distinct scent, its attracting! The room was nice, hi-tech, comfy. I loved the dessert shop that was there! The pools were good, there were a few pools and jacuzzi's. The buffet wasgood, large variety. It was a long walk from the hotel to the strip, compared to other hotels. Most Vegas hotels are like this, but this one is very new.

Reviews.Title: “High Tech, High Comfort and High Prices”
Reviews.Author: paulobster
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed two nights at Aria. First, despite being technologically challenged ourselves, I did not think that the room remote which controls everything from the drapes to the lights was difficult to figure out. The room was large, nicely appointed, clean and very comfortable- perhaps the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in. I know there have been concerns expressed about check in however on a Thursday, we had a minimal wait with friendly professional help- warning us not to touch the stuff in the mini-fridge or on top of the counter as a charge might be generated. Total time including the wait was about twelve minutes with ten stations open at registration. The bathroom was fine although having the toilet separated from the rest of the bathroom by semi-translucent glass is odd. The shower was great with the shower head mounted up high. Security is present checking people for room keys as they enter the guest elevator area. We ate at the buffet which was comped- a good but not great buffet, and had coffee and pasty at the pastry shop near the guest elevators. Prices are generally high across the board. The property connects to both the Monte Carlo and Bellagio via a free tram however we also walked inside from the Monte Carlo to the Aria which was convenient. We found the casino dimly lit although all staff throughout the property were very helpful. The view from our room (50-118) was great. We were especially pleased with the Aria's lost and found department that arranged to return some items we left in the room after checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: SarahsSun
Reviews.Content: I was excited to try the new hotel with its unbelievable technology on the strip. A chance to work and play. I did not like that: I could not get internet access for days after being told multiple times by management and tech support that it would be up in just 1 hour. 2 days later I learned it had been down for 4 days and was not expected to be up until conference left. The only electrical outlets that worked were in the bathroom The iPOD station they advertise never worked The food prices were outrageous - a coffee and two bottles of water for $17. Minimum bids were $15 at the tables. Pathetic views for a Vegas strip hotel (and yes, I upgraded for the city view)... alls I saw was roof top and another building. I did like: Great pools staff was very friendly although not knowledgable. Exceptional Steak house on the 2nd floor. Security at the elevators for safety I think they were going for a high class theme but I was not impressed. I would recommend the Venetian or Belagio instead.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: ehrmanna
Reviews.Content: UGH! Where do I start? Here's a small list of what was wrong: * After receiving 1 years worth of direct mail promotions to come to the hotel, when I called the offers were crazy high. Orbitz was much cheaper. * First time in all my years that I haven't been upgraded during the week. Now, I know this is never a guarantee but it didn't go noticed by me. At least but me on a high floor!! (especially after "courting" me for so long) * The track for the automatic blinds leave a sliver of light the entire length of the window at the top and a little on the side. Having the bed closest to the window, this meant my bed was blanketed in sunlight and that I was up as soon as the sun came up -- no way to block out the light. * Adult only pool had lots of children in it. Staff didn't enforce the policy. * No drinks in or anywhere near the pool. Pool "police" stopped us instantly but failed to kick the kids out. Surely their pee in the pool is more harmful than a little spilled white wine. * No food service pool side during the week -- only 3 pre-prepared sandwiches. Restaurant only open Fri, Sat & Sun. (told this was a new policy) Seriously?!?!? No food at the pool in summer at a "5" star hotel? Crazy. * Hi-tech console in the room was busted. Never really worked the TV and TV screen and gadget monitor weren't synchronized. * Press one wrong button in your room and everything shuts down. * Tried to check out via TV for 20 minutes. Finally called front desk who tried walked me through it. Finally front desk realized my monitor was broken and missing the proper icon. * Housekeeping never came. * Set back pretty far off strip. Construction at night meant we were walking forever just to get home. * Casino dark and dead. I could go on. Its sleek and beautiful but its all style, no substance. You can do so much better in Vegas for better prices.

Reviews.Title: “Apparently spending billions of dollars doesn’t buy you adequate customer service”
Reviews.Author: Manowar007
Reviews.Content: I was excited to book a couple of days at the Aria and see what the fuss was about. Having visited Vegas frequently over the last 15 years I love the chance to visit new casinos and see what the latest and greatest is all about. Did the Aria live upto the hype? Here are the some of the issues I dealt with; 1. Not allowed to check in: My friend was on a flight 2 hours after me and had booked the flight on Orbitz. On calling the Aria they were told that nobody could be added to the room, and Orbitz required a complete cancellation rebooking. My friend emailed me the confirmation so should have been no problem right? Wrong. Despite all common sense they refused to check me in despite me brandishing the email and reservation # from my friend on my iphone. Their apparent reason was that I could be stealing someone’s reservation. Yes, I wrote a random email, had the person’s first and last name and reservation number and decided to do that instead of actually make a booking myself. Regardless of the fact they could have just told me if the person booked in and didn’t recognize me they would throw my stuff out, or even more obvious that they would take my credit card and charge me $500 if it wasn’t legitimate, both common sense solutions that I would have been more than happy to have submitted to. Common sense = FAIL. 2. Room control not functional: I make a generous living working in Wall Street IT so I’m more than comfortable around technology. The room control may have had intuitive controls but the delays and the missing icons made it a nightmare to even control the TV. Next time just give me a remote control (apparently our friends had a remote control but we didn’t). Using slow confusing box to control TV = FAIL 3. Blackout Blinds not blackout: My friend with the bed nearest the blinds was woken up each morning by the bright thin light coming out from the top of the blinds. Blackout Blinds not doing their job = FAIL 4. No Pool signs: Received details on the 3 types of pools the next morning and went to find my friend only to find no signs detailing which was the adult pool, and it took 3 staff before somebody finally pointed me in the right direction. Simple signs = FAIL 5. If its an adult pool, why the screaming kids?: One father boisterously and loudly played with his 3 kids for 2 hours while numerous annoyed glances were exchanged by everyone around the pool and the staff couldn’t have cared less. What’s the point of having an adult pool if you’re going to allow screaming kids to mess around? Screaming kids = FAIL 6. No alcohol in the pool: The staff couldn’t care less about the loud kids, but the moment we slipped into the comfortable water with a plastic cup of wine the pool Gestapo were all over us. ARE YOU KIDDING ME? It’s Vegas! What do you mean I can’t have a drink in the pool? I don’t remember a single pool in Vegas that didn’t allow me to drink in it. Annoying kids but no drinking in pool = EPIC FAIL After staying at the Aria for 2 days we moved to Planet Hollywood, which was more than functional for all our needs for vastly cheaper than the Aria would have been (and with plenty of people drinking in the pool). Suffice to say I won’t be staying at the Aria with all the better options available.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotels on the strip”
Reviews.Author: crimstone
Reviews.Content: Thid was my first trip to Vegas and Aria was promoting deal for $109 per night. Upon arrival, the bell hop took my bags so I don't have to lug they through the hotel. Check was a breeze, only waited in line for ten minutes. My room was ready right away which was a surprise because most rooms aren't ready till 3pm and it was only 11am. The room was very clean and had a great view of the Vegas strip. I called for my bags and they were brought to my room in 5 minutes. The bed was one of the nicest i slept on and had plenty of pillows to spare. Room was very quiet. No issues with housekeeping. The hotel was nicely laid out. Staff was very friendly. Overall, I had a great experience at this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: joeannay
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel...the smell, the location, basically everything... This was the first time my husband I have have stayed in the hotel. When you first walk in, you're greeted with a very soothing sweet fragrance - not smoke like other casinos. It might be because Aria is still new, but still, it's a nice change from other hotels. It's located in the middle of the strip - between Monte Carlo and Bellagio. Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile shops are across the street and uber fancy/expensive stores are located next door in Crystals. The rooms are really nice and very high tech. They have a remote control that controls EVERYTHING - the TV, the lights, the curtains, the alarm...everything... The tv lets you know if the dead bolt is set on the door and if the privacy light (yep - privacy LIGHT - not SIGN) is on. The bed by far is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. The rooms are really clean and comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Aria, Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Rue36
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria for 3 nights. 40 th Birthday treat by my girlfriend. Staff were friendly & helpfull. A new hotel, with good facilites Just what we were looking for chic & stylish. Location was perfect with a free mono rail link availible till 4am linking to the Monte Carlo & Bellagio Hotels. Aria conected to high end shopping mall called Cyrstals along with one of the hottest night clubs in town called Eve owned by Eva Longoria. There is also a Hip & happening night club called Haze in the hotel. The Casino was very modern with lessons for beginers. Which i found very helpful because i won on the roulette table. The hotel has many resturants & bars, including a 24hr resturant & a 24hr Bar. Visited all the other Big hotels, but for me the Aria was by far the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking Service - Poor Design - Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: foodwinetraveler
Reviews.Content: After al I had read about the construction and design of this property I just had to visit. Plenty of glass and chrome but service lacked at every turn - asked for a map to find my room ( not available ), map of property ( why would you want this - just follow the signs ), Wanted to work out in the AM ( cost $30 per person to use the gym !! ), No gift shop to buy sodas ( purchased at $4.50 each in mini bar ). Pools closed at 7 PM. Cab line not near front lobby and not marked (?), TV so high tech that even when I learned how to operate all the screens it still took me 3 or 4 minutes to get to the actual stations. Automatic curtains that had a life of their own ( open and closing when they wanted ? ) Heard they had a tram but no one seemed to know how to find it and of course no map? Paid $20 per night more than the Bellagio quoted - Venetian, Bellagio, Wynn and even Paris are all much better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay & Excellent Rooms and Rates”
Reviews.Author: HoustonCountryMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria with 3 free comped nights having a players card. The service and rooms were execellent. Clean, new rooms even got a extra adjoining room $99 a night for a traveling friend. The rooms are stylish, beds feel great and the rooms are a nice size. Love all the closet space and the sepate shower and tub! The service and stay was great. The comps were good and the staff was plesant. Room service is high, but Vegas room service is always high. You can go to the restaraunt right inside the casino for the same food for a cheaper price. The slots are kinda tight, but I did see some winning. Overall a great hotel to impress and relax at enjoyed the stay and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “The service is not as beautiful as the hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichieCMontreal
Reviews.Content: The Aria is located in the City Center complex in Las Vegas. I was warned about staying at this hotel because it was quite a hike to the strip. I did not find this to be the case as it is quite easy to get where you need to go from the hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful as most new hotels are. The decor is cool and exciting although a bit cold. The rooms are quite nice as well, a little smaller than what you will find in most of the newer hotels in Vegas but still quite acceptable. The in room technology features are way ahead of any hotel I have stayed at in North America, you can access all room functions from your bed side which is a very nice thing to be able to do. I have seen this at a few hotels in Asia and wondered when hoteliers on this side of the Pacific would catch up. The bed was quite comfortable if you like very soft beds. The bathroom was a nice size although still smaller than the Wynn/Encore or Venetian/Palazzo. The shower and bath are separate but combined in one glassed in area similar to how many of the hotel bathrooms are being done in Asia. You can't have 2 people taking a bath and shower simultaneously for that reason. The restaurants are nice but pricey with average food. The crystals complex attached to the hotel is nice but very high end and restaurants are quite expensive with average food. Where this hotel seriously misses is on service. I waited more than 45 minutes to contact the bell desk to get my bags sent up to my room upon my arrival, I finally gave up and called the concierge who got hold of them and got my bags sent up. When the bellman brought my bags up we noticed that the desk lamp was not working and he said that he would send someone to fix it right away. We were in our room for four nights and nobody ever came despite the fact that I called or went down and spoke to the desk 3 other times. On our third day at the hotel we met the maid who apologized for not having made one of our rooms because she was called to do a room on an emergency basis, she said she would do it after lunch. When we returned at 9PM with our 2 young boys it had not been done, again we notified the desk. Last but not least the workers at the hotel seem to be very disinterested as do the supervisors. We had food basically thrown at us at by a staff member at the buffet, I asked to speak with a supervisor and I was basically told by a waitress that the supervisor was too busy to talk and she would tell her what I wanted and then the supervisor would decide if she wanted to take her time to talk to me. By the way make sure to bring your ID to the buffet or they will make you go back and get it if you want to do a room charge. This was the only place in the hotel where I encountered this. Last but not least I was shocked to see only one person working at the ice cream parlour on the mezzanine level where they serve small breakfasts during the breakfast rush. There was a lineup twenty deep being handled by one girl who did the best she could on her own. If this hotel can correct their service issues it would be one of the nicest places to stay in Vegas but if they don't it does not matter how cheaply they sell the rooms it simply is not worth aggravation to save a few bucks because they will get it from you in one way or another.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but there's better out there...”
Reviews.Author: travellingexpat
Reviews.Content: We travel yearly to Las Vegas; this time we decided to try the new Aria: Travelling with our 2 children ages 9 & 11, we had a standard room with 2 queen beds. Very spacious, clean, beautiful room -- from the alarm clock to the curtains opening, you could set it up electronically with your tv. The bathroom was walled with glass, so only 1 person could be in the whole bathroom area at a time -- perfect for couples, not the best set-up travelling with kids. Beds were very comfortable, probably the best hotel beds we've ever had. Since the hotel is shaped in an arc, the elevators are central -- good luck if you have a room at one of the ends, it's a long walk, so beware if you are older or have a lot of luggage (and decline help). Walls in the rooms are THIN. We could hear our neighbor's lively conversation at 3am. We switched rooms and could still hear neighbors, but toughed it out, knowing we would not return to this hotel. Like any other high-end hotel, you overpay for your meals. They are good, but not the best we've had and the lines for all restaurants and bistros were long. Overall, it was an ok stay, but after staying at Bellagio, maybe our expectations were high.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Incredible Design/Architecture. Fun Stay.”
Reviews.Author: eawnyc
Reviews.Content: The City Center complex is amazing and filled with 'high style'. You won't find kitchy Vegas at this complex. We loved our stay at Aria from the welcome at the desk, to the views from our 'Sky Suite' rooms, to the design of the room and the attention to modern comforts, to the choice of restaurants at the complex, to the ability to get from point to point without having to constantly walk through the casino (important if you are traveling with children).

Reviews.Title: “I am hooked on Aria”
Reviews.Author: flyingeaglestarone
Reviews.Content: Over 15 years visiting Las Vegas and staying at different hotels (including Wynn, Bellagio, Paris, Ballys, The Hotel at Mandalay bay, Mirage, Rio and Golden Nugget) it was one of the best experience so far. The room (sky suite) was outstanding and the service from all the employees from the reception at check in to the cocktail waitresses and casino employees, was very polite, kind and constant and even the limo driver who was there waiting for us at 3h00 am in the morning after our flight has been delayed for 5 hours. The only down side was maybe the quality of food and service at the Sirio Italian restaurant which was overpriced and not very edible. Other than that the experience was outstanding and the employees at the pool and cabana service merit our 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “First Come, First Served on Rooms with Double Beds!”
Reviews.Author: Cmos2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, chic, and very modern. We booked our room a month in advance and requested 2 beds in our room (traveling with my Mother). My only real complaint was about the not getting the 2 beds in the room! After reading a review on TripAdvisor about the bed situation, I called to confirm our reservations and to make sure that we would have a room with 2 beds. I was told by the Concierge that they couldn't guarantee a room with 2 beds and it would be based on the number of people checking that day if we would get a room with 2 beds AND she would place us on a "priority list"!?! What the *&#@? That little piece of information is not mentioned anywhere on the site when booking the rooms. We arrived on a Wednesday for our 4 day stay (105 degrees at 10 am), we were waited on by the nicest front desk rep - Jane. She explained the room situation and told us about the roll-away bed (a pillow top - Wahoo!) that would be placed in our room. She was apologetic about the situation, but wasn't offering any discount or comps. A $12 billion dollar hotel built - over 2800 rooms and it only has about 250 double rooms? Unbelievable! The room has all the bells and whistles - a technophobe's dream. After the initial newness wore off of using the remote for just about everything in the room, it became tiresome. I just wanted to close the freaking curtains and turn down air without push a whole lot of buttons! The king size bed was super comfortable (mother and I alternating sleeping on the Pillow Top Roll-a-Way bed! Yeah!). The bathroom well appointed - separate toilet closet, stand alone marble shower and tub -very nice. We had a super view from the 14th floor...beautiful. Hallways are bit long and a nice hike from the elevators. Breakfast: The lines are long at the (Cafe Vettro - serves B, L, D 24/7), but there is another outlet (The Roasted Bean) that serves just pastries and coffee for a quick breakfast. We ate at the Denny's across the street across from the complex. Don't waste your money on the Buffet - it looks like a old high school cafeteria from the 1960s serving similiar fare found in a high school cafeteria - breakfast $16.95. The buffet at the Bellagio is phenomenal and highly recommended - take the tram inside of the hotel complex to get over there (it is the sister property of the Aria). Try Julian Serrano's for the tapas and Chill upstairs for gelato or ice cream (yummy). We heard that the steakhouse upstair is great...pricey...but good. Overall.... This a great place for a getaway weekend (romantic or with your friends or whatever)...it has everything if you don't want to leave the property. This is definitely an adult hotel - we didn't see anything kid friendly about it. $30 per day to use the pool and fitness center - it is worth it! Hey, don't expect 2 beds in a double room...just book a suite! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Classy new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Billyp27
Reviews.Content: Just had a week long stay with wife and 2 teenagers. The hotel is very shiny and classy looking. The check in was fast and easy. Getting to the guestroom elevators was a trek through the casino and were monitored 24hrs by security. The guestroom we had was exactly as advertised, with everything state of the art. The only negative aspect was programming the alarm on the remote control. The bathroom door was a heavy sliding door that would not close. I can see some troubles in the future for maintaining the decor, as there is lots of melamine looking furniture. There needs to be some soundproofing improvements from the sleeping area and the bathroom. I went to the concierge hoping to get some info on renting a car for the day, and within 3 minutes, i had a convertable secured, along with pick up and drop off at the valet! Great job by the very helpful lady at the concierge!! The hotel is awesome, food is even better, casino is very nice looking. I will be returning!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Trip”
Reviews.Author: RStef
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews posted about the problems with cleanliness of rooms, difficulties with technology and poor customer service, I was beginning to doubt my choice of the Aria. However, from the moment my husband and I arrived in baggage claim at the airport we were treated wonderfully! Our package included limo pick up at the airport- the driver was very friendly as well as helpful with our baggage. He directed us to a registration clerk at the Aria who was extremely pleasant and courteous. We were able to upgrade our room to a corner suite for a very reasonable price and it was well worth it! The views were fantastic from every part of the suite! Our room was cleaned without any issues everyday by mid day and turn down service made sure everything was neat and tidy every evening. Food was a bit expensive but honestly it seems most everywhere on the Strip has become that way. Most mornings we ate at Jean Phillipe Patisserie and found that to be filling as well as quite tasty. The pool area was very nice and never crowded while we were there. The music was a bit loud depending on where you sat as the speakers were hidden in the landscaping throughout the pool area. My husband and I had a wonderful time at the Aria and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a more resort like experience in Las Vegas. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating, everything was neat and clean and the modern style was very pleasing. Very much worth the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Plush, beautiful hotel, with great restaurants”
Reviews.Author: 0puns
Reviews.Content: I was offered three comp nights in a corner suite with comp meals at the non fine dining restaurants. We were allowed to check-in at 1 p.m. via the invited guest desk. We were quickly checked in after a 3 minute wait. The regular check in desk also did not appear to be crowded. The corner suite was huge with a marble foyer. The bath amenities were not high quality, but they did include toothpaste, toothbrush, hairspray, and mouthwash. The curtains/lighting remote control took about 5 minutes to master and was very useful. The HD LCD T.V.'s (one in the living room, one in the bedroom) were great and the bed was comfortable. In fact even the couch in the living room was comfortable to sleep on. The corner suite had an honor bar as well as a seperate small refrigerator with an ice maker. The bathroom was incredible as the shower area is huge and has a deluge showerhead. The jet tub is great and there is a small t.v. right above it. The toilet is a trip as well and you'll have fun figuring it out. There are two sinks and the lighting is bright. The buffet was okay, but nowhere near the quality or quantity of the Bellagio. However, their prime rib was succulent and the desserts/gelato bar were great. The thai restaurant Lemongrass was very tasty and seemed to us to be very authentic. The casino was a bit dark, but I thought it was very nice and easy to manuever around. The only negative was that picking your car up from the valet involved a hike almost as far as the parking structure. However, dropping off you car puts you right near registration. Check out was a breeze as it was done through the T.V. in the room. A great stay, and we were just offered the same deal, so we'll be back in December!
