Reviews.Title: “Deep discount makes for affordable luxury at The Aria”
Reviews.Author: Bobbyjl50
Reviews.Content: The deeply discounted cost for our three day stay at the recently opened Aria Hotel and Casino made it a GREAT value! The Aria is located midway on the Strip at the City Center complex. The Deluxe Room was spacious and well appointed with a very comfortable bed (a custom made pillowtop model), a 42" High-def flat screen TV, and floor-to-ceiling window-wall looking west to the mountains beyond I-15. Many restaurants, swimming pools and shops are on-site, as is one of the newest Cirque Du Soleil shows (Elvis). The free valet parking is nice and there is a tram to The Bellagio and Monte Carlo hotels (also free). The Buffett includes Alaskan King Crab legs on its reasonable dinner price. We enjoyed our stay, needless to say!

Reviews.Title: “If it "Was" good before, it isnt now!”
Reviews.Author: MrGMandCEO
Reviews.Content: Ok...were at the Aria right now. We are in a VERY expensive Penthouse Suite, bulbs are burnt out, the jacuzzi tub doesnt work, furnishings are stained, pieces of the decor are broken, chipped or missing pieces, the cordless phone doesnt work, 2 of the 3 remotes have dead batteries, the on screen tv guide doesnt funcition in the living room, the sink doesnt drain well, we were charged nearly $50 for a sandwhich and a desert even though the menu says it should have been 1/2 of that and there was already stuff missing from the "in room Food tray" as soon as we walked into our room, we have ordered the exact same food 3 times and its different each time...different bread, different portions, different everything..we called them about it as soon as we saw it or they would have charged us for the missing food. We have adressed all of this and so far nobody has fixed one thing. So, there you have it, a live review from within the hotel itself. I will actually be surprised of this review even gets posted...hopefully it will.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Experience we have ever had”
Reviews.Author: Buts44
Reviews.Content: Before booking our Sky Suite at Aria, we read many reviews here and they were mixed. We arrived at Las Vegas at 12.30pm and our Limo driver was waiting for us as we came off the plane. Very friendly and as soon as we had our bags promptly drove us to the Hotel. The Sky Suite check in was great with no line or waiting and our room was ready and we went straight up. Room was huge and everything worked (I think some of the problems identified on here with the room technology are related to operator error). We had a 1 Bedroom Sky Suite and arranged for a rollaway for our son. When we got to the room the rollaway was not there so we made a quick call and it was there within 10 minutes. The staff at this hotel thoughout our 4 night stay went above and beyond any hotel I have stayed at before in every sense. Room service dinner at 11pm at night for the 3 of us after going to a show was delivered within 20 minutes. Every time we asked for something it was done straight away. The room was serviced twice a day without fail. All the staff were polite, courteous and new their jobs. We will definately be going back and staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and impressive hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mscanary
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Aria. We took a taxi in from the airport and were dropped off right at the front door. The bellman took our bags and directed us inside. It was Sunday at 2:30 p.m. and we waited less than 5 minutes to get to the counter. The young woman checking us in found our reservations immediately and gave us the non-smoking room we had asked for and it was a Strip/City view which turned out great. We had made the reservation 3 months prior and I checked again 2 weeks before our arrival. I asked for a room close to an elevator and she quickly had us on the 21st floor The whole area smelled of that faint vanilla scent that I had read about. It was a pleasant contrast to other hotel/casinos we have stayed at. We got to our room so quickly we didn't have the "drapes opening and music playing" that was described. But we did the opening ourselves and loved the view. Turned on the tv and there was my name at the top of the screen. My husband who is a non-technical person had the bedside contols figured out in a few minutes. The room and bathroom were absolutely clean. Towels stocked, bath products complete. Our bags arrived quickly. We unpacked still looking for flaws after all the reviews we'd read. We brought along an extension cord which solved any outlet problems although we could have done without it. The bathroom sinks were no problem. I have hand painted talevera sinks in my home that are shallower than these at the Aria so we had no problem with splashing. We liked the shower and had no complaints about water pressure. The bed was super comfortable and we didn't hear any hall or noise from other rooms. The view at night was so beautifiul I didn't close the drapes until I was done reading in bed. The front desk took an imprint of our credit card and we liked the convenience of that. We signed for our meals and ate all but one at the hotel. The Cafe Vettro was our choice for breakfast and got to know some of the waitstaff by name, and they ours. Everyone was courteous and cheerful. We loved American Fish and the Jean Georges steakhouse on the night of our anniversary. We played blackjack every day and enjoyed the fact that we didn't smell smoke, our hair and clothes never smelled smokey, and we were in the casino every day. We found the environmentally friendly store "Elements" and got some incidentals there and also a very nice jogging outfit. We walked a lot checking every restaurant menu and just marveling at the ultra modern architecture and furnishings. At 108 outside we didn't use the pools but they were busy most of the time. We had a great room service breakfast the day we checked out , and used the tv quick check to see our bill. Everything seemed to be in order. We have been coming to Las Vegas for over thirty years and have stayed at several hotels. Aria will now be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Aria Panoramic Corner Suite”
Reviews.Author: peapod33
Reviews.Content: I forgot to add: 1. We were not comped - we booked via Orbitz and got Panoramic Corner Suite Monday - Friday, full car rental and first class seats from Portland to Vegas and trip insurance for about #1350. 2. We didn't get to try valet as we used to live in Vegas and still think of ourselves as "local" - I didn't see or hear any issues anyone had w/ valet - and if we did it again we would have used valet for when we first had our bags. But just to go in & out it was no big walk/deal to use the self-park. 3. Living Room did get a bit warm in afternoon even w/ the A/C cranked - but it was 112 F outside. Still tolerable. 4. No issues w/ lights, hardware, control panel or anything else that other's have had issues with.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing facility -- poor quality control and food”
Reviews.Author: MACF
Reviews.Content: The facility is amazing, but the quality control and majority of the food was so poor I would not come back and would not recommend this place. I would much rather stay at a place that is less fancy and has excellent quality control and food. When I arrived, after a long tiring flight, I learned that the elevators are behind the casino and a long way from registration. Then the room was hard to locate because of the confusing number of interlinking halls and a long way from the elevator lobby. After finally finding my room, the room key did not work and no one would come to help me. After going all the way back to registration, I was initially made to feel that I was incompetent with using the key until they saw they had given me the wrong room number for the keys. When it was time to check-out, I was charged for extra purchases I had not made. Check your bill closely!!! The food was the biggest disappointment. For such a fancy place one expects excellent food, but 4 out of my 5 experiences were terrible. I did get a cream of mushroom soup that was excellent, but that was the only realy good dish. At one restaurant the shrimp was overcooked and mushy and the shell fish was overcooked and rubbery. It was all served on this "foam" that was like an overcooked and disgusting looking egg white omlet. The breakfast was the worst. The hash browns were in cute little balls with the outside overcooked, the inside raw and no seasonings. The eggs were rubbery and the corn beef has was just big sloppy chunks of dry and flavorless meat. There is a fancy bakery that has very artistic food that does not deliver on the taste. The food does not match the fancy facility.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room/Horrible Quality Control”
Reviews.Author: frankbabinder
Reviews.Content: Took more than four hours after checking in at 6:15 p.m. to resolve problem with keys and lock that didn't work. Finally, after three trips to the front desk, and an equal number of visits by security personnel, with no one able to solve the problem, I was given a different room at approximately 10:30 p.m. Next day, after several hours out doing tourist stuff, returned to room by 4:45 p.m. and housekeeping hadn't been there. Needed to shower and start getting ready for dinner, so not enough time by then to have room made up. I requested a fresh set of towels. They were delivered 15 mins. later. 15 mins after that, another knock on the door offering more towels. 15 mins after that, someone else shows up offering to clean the room. At this point I'm feeling like I'm in a Marx Bros. movie. Nothing works as it should. To top everything off, next day at check out, they'd doubled the number of days I'd been there and my bill was totally out of whack. Just a comedy of errors from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: pharcyde23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best on the strip. People were professional and nice. Rooms clean and amazing. We stayed in the corner suite for 5 days.. WELL worth the extra money. we visited the regular rooms and let me tell you the corner suites are the way to go if you cant afford the sky suites. If you are a non smoker you will appreciate the smell of the place. I can still smell the Vanilla. This hotel is very driven by sales so do expect to spend a lot of money..but the best part is..The Monte carlo is a short walk away and prices are cheaper for food and anything in the little shops..fast food restaurants are close also. So if you are tight on cash but want to enjoy what Aria has to offer..plan on eating elsewhere. The walk is no better or worse than any other place on the strip. Tram is close..Riding carts are available complimentary with credit card hold. cant wait to stay again,

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: clancypammy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Aria. Loved the hotel. The room was great, with a city view. The curtains open and the lights turn on when you enter the room. The bathrooms were neat. Seperate shower area with bath. Double sinks. Very nice. The bed was so comfortable. The pillows were great, and they are available for purchase. Flatscreen TV was good. You can view your account and room details on the TV at all times. Loved everything about it.....EXCEPT, the air conditioning did not get as cool as I would have liked. Other than that, it was a great stay. Check in was a breeze. Valet parking was quick and easy. All the staff, from the frontdesk, , to housekeepers, parking attendents, dealers, and waitstaff, were wonderful and very friendly and helpful. Security was also very present. The pool was awesome. It was very nice and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a awsome hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickster13
Reviews.Content: I have to admit after reading some of the reviews on this hotel I was not sure what to expect. My wife wanted to stay at the new hotel in town. We had been to Las Vegas once before staying at the Stardust before it was taken down. This hotel was way more than anything I could have hoped for. At check in there was only three people ahead of me, but the host directed me to the check out line where there was no wait . I was checked in in less than 10 minutes. There is a person at the elevator checking for room keys which I thought was a good thing. There are a lot of people everywhere and knowing that only hotel guest can go up to the rooms was comfotrting. Entering our room the lights come on and the curtains opened to a nice view of the strip. The TV comes on welcoming you by name. There is a remote that controls everything in the room. The remote was very easy to figure out and was a cool touch. The beds are to die for they are the most comfortable beds I have ever slep on. I have a bad back, but felt great every morning. This hotel is huge. The first night I went down to checkout the place and couldn't believe how much there was to it. I was still finding places three days later. It would be a good idea to spend some time when you first get there to plan routes. We ate at the buffet each morning which was a little expensive , but the food was good. There is a sports bar by the casino that has a take out window which I thought was pretty cool. The pools are on the second floor and I didn't have any problems getting a chair. The pool waitress would come around often so getting a drink was not a problem. The sports book area was a great place to watch a game. They have one TV that was huge, and several large screens. The dealers at the gaming tables were great. I'm not an expert on all the games but they would explain the rules and were very friendly. The casino war game was an easy game to understand and the odds (for me) were good. Every staff person we came in contact with was great. The maid service was very good. They would always greet you with a good morning and stand aside to let guest pass. They couldn't have been more friendly. All and all I would highly recommend this hotel. The price is a little high but wll worth it.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay - SkySuites”
Reviews.Author: Mattincbr
Reviews.Content: Second Stay in the Sky Suites at Aria. Both stays were great, love the contemporary style of Aria (I understand others dont), and everything about the stay was excellent. Car service was efficient, check in swift, concierge was helpful in assisting to make choices for dinner reservations - all in all, everything that you could want was delivered in style. I look forward to returning to Aria.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: linda37917
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there for three nights, 8-16-10 thru 8-18-10, and had a great time at the hotel and casino. We were concerned after reading the reviews here, but we had no problems at all. We checked in late at night and it took only about 10 minutes. Our rooms were comped but they upgraded us to a strip view because my birthday was the next day. There was a problem with the TV when we checked in, but we really didn't care that we had to turn on the lights ourself. When we called the desk the next morning, someone was there to fix it within 15 minutes. The only thing about our room that we didn't like was the water pressure in the shower. We were on the 37th floor and the shower was like using a firehose with no way to turn it down, The beds were the most comfortable that I have ever had in a hotel. The only time we ate at the buffet was for breakfast. Everything was good except for the biscuits. They were like a rock and you could not even cut them with a knife. The casino is kind of dark, and some people complain, but we kind of enjoyed it after the heat and bright sunshine of Vegas in august. They have a good variety of machines and they were not as tight as some of the other casinos that we went to.We never had a problem getting something to drink. They came by at least every 30 minutes. We were at MGM for over 3 hours and never got anything to drink. We could not find anyone on the floor there that worked for the casino except the dealers. i would definatley stay at the Aria again. We loved our stay and everyone was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: New_Englander225
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed this hotel. We had to go to Vegas for a wedding and Southwest had a package deal which included round trip airfare and hotel. We chose the Aria because it was a 5 star rated hotel and had fairly decent ratings here on trip advisor. The package included a $100 food credit as well - The room was ready upon arrival - of course that could be because we checked in at 10:00 a.m. on a Friday morning. It was very easy to check in, the staff was friendly, and the room was absolutely beautiful. Very clean (we didn't have maid service for the 4 days we were there so I cannot comment on that). The bed was incredibly comfortable, bathroom spacious, and the touch pad that controlled the room was fairly easy to use. In addition it was very quiet - no hallway noise or noise from other rooms. Both my husband and I appreciated the security in the hotel - you had to show your room pass (like a credit card rather than a key) to access the hotel elevators. We truly appreciated this after visiting some of the hotels that did not have the guest elevator security component - but did have some rowdy guests. The buffet was good. I found it funny that the dinner buffet was almost $10 more per person but the base food choices were exactly the same. The only thing that irked me was that you could not use the gym without paying a fee. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and relatives - I would definitelyl

Reviews.Title: “We were not disappointed in any way. Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: dacollr
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews after I had already booked my room. Some of the reviews had me worried. There were complaints about check in delays, under staffing, and the walk to get anywhere. Well, I experienced no check in delays and the bellman was waiting at our room with our bags when we got to our door. The entire staff was friendly and the room was cleaned promptly and efficiently every day. The bed was hands down the most comfortable I have ever slept on. As far as the long walk, that some complain about, I have been to Vegas several times and I have found that no matter where you stay, you better be ready to do some walking. We didn't even gamble a tremendous amount and the hotel comped us quite well. All we had to do was ask. When I go back, I don't want to stay anywhere but the Aria. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “OK not great stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: powerpuffgirl22
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled the Aria is an overpriced average hotel wtih the service of a Motel 6. This property is Not on the strip, it's behind it ,and you must go through a maze to get to the front enterance. This hotel tries too hard, but doesn't deliver. Staff is nice but not efficient. Waited for 4 hours to check in ridiculous! With so many choices in Vegas don't wast your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip”
Reviews.Author: caraesheppard
Reviews.Content: Aria was an absolutely fantastic hotel. My husband and I stayed there for 4 nights. We were welcomed with suburb service and allowed in our rooms earlier than expected. The hotel is very large, so expect to walk a lot, but it was nothing more than we were used to. The rooms were very sleek and modern. Mostly all electronics were controlled by a remote. The only downfall to the room was the price of the mini-bar/fridge. Items were very high, so we just went and bought our own items for the room. The restaurants were a bit expensive, but seemed normal for Vegas. We payed the same price for food at other hotels. The buffet was very good and reasonable and provided a variety of different foods. The lounges were very modern and sleek and the staff was very willing to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. The pool was not too crowded and very relaxing. The pool bar was excellent. The drinks were expensive, but worth it! We were able to use the business center with no charge. The hotel was about a 5 minute walk off the strip, but it was nice to get away from the hustle and bustle and go back to such a peaceful retreat. Aria was a fantastic hotel and had a lot to offer! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A COOL HIP LAS VEGAS EXPERIENCE WORTH A TRY”
Reviews.Author: Robby7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is futuristic and not for the old. It is definitely young and hip. The rooms are high tech with blinds that open automatically and you can set the ac from your TV.. Super clean rooms and the spa although pricey was stellar with cool amenities. Tthe service level is great. I read the other reviews, and don't believe them. The people that work in the hotel were great and rooms were clean . Easy fast` cheek in on the weekend!! The show VIVA LAS VEGAS is on of the best shows I have seen since LOVE. The location off the strip aw bit but you have a monorail and a bridge to planet Hollywood and the other side of the strip. We ate at Wolfgang Puck Cucinna surprisingly reasonable for Las Vegas and in crystals. One helpful tip. CVS is right in front of the hotel on the strip within a short walk. They have cheap water and and a chase ATM. Overall prepare your self for a different Las Vegas experience. The hotel is worth it and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Need some check ups”
Reviews.Author: malbahari
Reviews.Content: Hotel in General, Very Nice and new. But my room had: lamps not working, electric curtains not working and could not find the safe box in the room...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting and terrible service”
Reviews.Author: oakdruid
Reviews.Content: This place was really gross. I must say this was the most bizarre hotel experience I have had, and I have stayed in one dollar a night places in India. I came back late from the casinos and used the toilet for the first time, and noticed that there were streams of DIARRHEA or VOMIT (I didn't want to get close enough to figure out which) all around the toilet from the previous occupant. It was late and I was tired, so I got up around 8 the next morning to deal with it. I made around a dozen phone calls to the hotel management to deal with this situation, but it took nearly FOUR HOURS to get it resolved. At one point I had gone out of the room and come back, and housekeeping had finally come. They had given me fresh towels but HAD NOT CLEANED THE TOILET. At this point I called the manager (AGAIN) to ask if I could have some bleach to clean it up myself. I did not feel comfortable using the bathroom, so did not get a shower or shave, and had to use a public restroom. I also missed the breakfast I had paid for, though they did cover that. Needless to say this ruined by Las Vegas vacation. They seemed rather unconcerned about it all, and gave me a "special rate" on a future stay which was twice what I paid for the room! I can't believe that a "five star" hotel would have this awful a level of cleanliness and service. The Aria restaurant buffet was actually incredibly good, so I would stay somewhere else, and eat at the buffet here.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a 5 star experience in Sin City!”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Traveller81
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this place, this hotel was gorgeous, amazing finishes and ammenities make this a 5 star hotel. The check in was a little slow but who cares when you have a corner suite over looking both sides of the strip? The room was HUGE and bathrooms truly amazing. The corner suites include free wifi so that came in handy. Pools are great, there are many of them and plenty of sunbeds. We did eat in the Liquid Pool Lounge but paying $50 per sunbed isn't really appealing. You have to basically each spend $50 on food/drink to get the sun bed. Though if you are a pretty young lady you'll get in for free, we were happy with the free sun beds outside! The pool bar was good, pricey but you expect that right near the pool! The shops inside were pretty good, and very well priced, you could get water and red bull in there plus snacks etc. For what we paid it was amazing value and also there is no Resort tax! The restuarants in the hotel were great, we tried the cafe which was delicious, the tapas place was excellent and the patisserie, out of this WORLD. We didnt find it too pricey at all. Yes you have to walk a bit, but really people, its not that far and with all the great food around you its good to get some exercise! We were in the furthest corner and it didnt bother us at all. I can't wait to stay here again one day!

Reviews.Title: “look to spend up while staying here”
Reviews.Author: simonsays1885
Reviews.Content: this hotel was very nice to stay at , clean new and comfy , down falls on this place are its so big that it takes you 5 - 10 min to get from your room to the strip then add you travel time on that . $50 charge for entry to night club inside of hotel and $12 drinks . i also thought it was a little unfair that they charge for the use of the hotel gym since when do you have to pay to use hotel facility's and be charged $30 usd per visit , if you need things printed dont have them done in the hotel the charge around $10 per page they do there best to charge for anything they can , we also got charge $10 for a parcel being dropped off at the business center .. buffet is very nice and is probably the only good value for money place in this hotel other food places are expensive.. all in all its a nice place if you dont have a cash limit , i would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at Aria”
Reviews.Author: sarasota69
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible. Made us wait until 7 pm to check in. We heard it's everyday like that. Poorly designed and hard to go anywhere. Only one guest elevators and your room is a 20 minute walk down a hall. I"m serious. Don't even try to get a taxi. Not only is the taxi line long but, NO Taxi's PERIOD!!! We had to hire a car everywhere. The driver told us that taxi's don't like to go there because it's to much trouble. Don't let them tell you everything is 5 minutes away because it is not. Also, the rooms you see on the Aria site IS NOT what you get. Don't be fooled. You should see what they are calling a suite.. A small cramped room with way to much furniture. Stay at Belligio...trust me you will thank me.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JoeB-2009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aria for our anniversary last week. The hotel itself was beautiful and we did not have any problem with the staff. However, we realized after the first night that the walls for the rooms were paper thin. We were woken up several times in the middle of the night by either the loud people next door to us or by other people in the hallway. Our "neighbors" left after the first night which was great because we didn't want to give up our room with the great city view, but for a 5 star hotel, I would expect better. Other than that, the trip was good. The hotel's restaurants are a little pricey but that was expected. Overall, if you are staying there to party, this place is for you. Otherwise I would steer clear and stay at another hotel like the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “As very regular vegas visitors, who actually are 'high rollers', even with every perk imaginable, positively awful.”
Reviews.Author: pjbirdie
Reviews.Content: We are what some call 'high rollers'. We often stay the very finest properties in las vegas and beyond. I was truly thrilled while awaiting to experience aria. This is where anything remotely possible to say in a positive context begins. From the minute we/you arrive you notice that for a brand new place, it seems oddly old and in need of a renovation. It is dark, but not in a sexy nor soothing way, more like a "I wonder why they built a depressing, bleak and boring casino. Truly, we all could felt the very same thing when we shared our thoughts. Next we were brought to one of their high roller villas, to most it would be simply heaven, IF it was not designed in a 1970's odd circles and sharp angles and tight spaces and dizzying colors and DARK and really can cause a non claustrophobic person to become one. For the sake of keeping this less than the size of a three full page ny times review, I must simply list the rest - it was that bad. The food was so bad, it caused us to laugh. The service was so bad (except for a few shining stars) that we wanted to cry. The overall experience - ONE NIGHT, as we were supposed to stay for a week, was downright horrible enough to prompt me to write this because I feel compelled to save others from this. There is not a redeemable feature for which I can say "well at least... was good", and I am an easy going type who loves to enjoy the food, spa, service of a fine establishment. That is why we left. We were so exhausted (imagine, actually exhausted from the constant problems) that I can only hope that a GM or CEO or someone with terrific stock in this place reads this. We are not looking for any compensation because as players everything is already taken care of. That is my only way to impress that this is genuine. Go anywhere but here. We are lucky to be able to easily leave and find an alternative, I hope this finds the person who works hard all year to have a relaxing holiday to make a better choice - which would be ANY choice but here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this new hotel on The Strip. Great location!! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Oceanbreeze22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new ARIA at The City Center for 3 nights, July 13 - July 16. This hotel is absolutely BEAUTIFUL inside and out. It is located right in the middle of The Strip, between Bellagio and Monte Carlo. The rooms were very nice, and the beds were EXTREMLY COMFORTABLE!!!! We had a really nice 42" flat screen. The room lights, curtains television and room temperature were all controlled by the remote. The bathroom is AWESOME!!. The garden tub and separate shower were located together behind glass doors. For even more privacy, the toilet had it's own stall with a telephone on the wall. A mini bar and refrigerator were in the room; however, since we never use the items in the mini bar or refrigerator, I asked that the items be removed. Unfortunately, they told me that they could not remove the items from the refrigerator so I could use it for my own personal use. (They have to unlock the refrigerator for you upon request). So this was very disappointing because every hotel and and cruise ship I have been on, I have requested this, and there has never been a problem. For a hotel this nice, the check in process could be a lot smoother. There were several guests checking in when we arrived; however, it was very difficult, and quite confusing to see who was being waited on. There were no lines, or ropes that would have made it easier to see who was next in line. Another observation was that the front desk clerks were very unfriendly.... not just one or two, but all of them. None of them greeted the guests with a smile. They all acted like they hated their jobs. I thought it was just me, but I heard other guests commenting on how unfriendly they were as well. The front desk clerks could take some lessons from Aria's security personnel. Every single one of the security personnel I met, was extremely friendly and helpful. Incidentally, the concierge that assisted me was very, very nice as well. One of my favorite spots at this hotel was the pool area. I really enjoyed relaxing out by the pools in the mornings. It is BEAUTIFUL, and the music was great too. I just wish that the pools were open at night, at least until 10 or 11 p.m. I would love to lounge by the pool, in the evening. In summary, I would definitely stay at ARIA again.

Reviews.Title: “Hi Tech Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul_R_Hol
Reviews.Content: We thought the rooms were great. They were spacious, big tv, good view and almost every thing is remote control. In some ways they were a bit too high tech, as we were warned when we checked that if we lifted anything from the fridge or the tray on top that it would automatically be charged to our room! A good point is that they were security at the base of the elevators, stopping anyone going to the rooms that did not have a key. Food and drink were expensive, so we went to local places nearby. We were not sure before we booked if they charged a resort fee, but they do not. The hotel staff were pleasant and even printed off our boarding passes free of charge. Overall we thought we got really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Aria---what a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: tuffer39
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at Aria; I really wanted to like this hotel/casino and thought maybe the "new hotel" bugs would be worked out, but that was not to be our luck. Had reserved 2 queens, and as many have noted, not available upon checkin. OK, no big deal. We arrived early Sat. AM, so we didn't expect to be able to checkin; dropped bags at bell desk and headed out to explore. It is not easy to get to the strip from lobby---lots of ongoing construction on CityCenter property and at Cosmopolitan. Back to Aria about noon and the very nice young lady at invited guest checkin got our room and explained keys, what to expect with room technology, etc. After wandering the 14th floor forever we were able to find room---opened door and it seemed to be great. Beautiful view, spacious, bright. Wait---there's a refrigerator in here with half a loaf of bread and jar of peanut butter on top; oh, and there are 2 half-empty bottles of red wine and dirty wine glasses; and there is a pile of loose change on the nightstand??? Call the front desk and ask if they possible could have checked us into an occupied room? No, the room was checked out of early that morning and when I told the desk clerk of the condition, he said they could get housekeeping there in "a couple of hours" to clean everything out; even though the bed was made, we had no assurance that the sheets had been changed so we opted to say we wanted a different, CLEAN room; put on hold for a long time and he finally came back to say there was a smoking room available. Sorry, not an option so put on hold again and he finally came back on and directed us to a 12th floor room and said our keycard would work when we got there. Wandered around 12th floor and found room...why are all the rooms so far from the elevator banks? Room was clean but definately smaller than original room. Lots of closet and drawer space and we loved the shower/tub setup but not impressed with anything else. Very little counter space in bathroom; beds are not comfortable; chairs are beautiful design but like sitting on a rock! Room technology failed us on 2nd night; lights would not turn off, drapes would not open or close, etc. Front desk sent maintenance man at midnight to "reboot system" which requires unscrewing panel under desk and almost 20 minutes of fiddling with programming and wireless connections---I just wanted to go to sleep! Give me a plain old light-switch anyday! Employees were pleasant but not very efficient; breakfast buffet was excellent food but lousy service; cafe was good food but lousy service; housekeeping replaced bath towels but didn't leave facecloths or handtowels. Noise from other rooms was disconcerting as it seemed to travel through the plumbing and ventilation systems. Guess it just wasn't our trip, but I know the Venetian will remain our hotel of choice! Aria has a long way to go if it wants to play with the big boys!

Reviews.Title: “The crown jewel of the strip for sure.”
Reviews.Author: pittsburghtraverler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Mandalay Bay, Wynn, and Bellagio on business. All great and each has their strong points. Mandalay Bay...best pools. Wynn...sleek elegance. Bellagio...location and very ornate. My wife and I always come home happy. My teenage sons wanted "in on it" and convinced me to forgo our usual east coast beach vacation and head to Vegas as a family! Aria was a couple of months away from completion when we were at Bellagio. I hit their web site in January and made plans to stay at the Aria SkySuites. WOW! I feel bad for anyone who had any issues at all during their visit because ours was five nights and six days of perfection. The Sky Suite came with some "extras", from limo service to private check in and private elevators and I have never been more impressed with service. I felt like a King, with a Queen and two Princes with me! Blows away all of the resorts I have been to. Hands down, no contest! The Suite was unbelievable, the twice daily room cleaning, the amenities, every detail the best. Great lobby with drinks and light snacks. Rented a cabana on a 105 degree day and it was worth every penny. Again, no detail overlooked here. Love Mandalay Bay, Wynn, and Bellagio. But I have no reason to go anywhere as long as Aria "performs" the way they did August 8th thru the 13th! A lifetime of memories for my family...thanks to Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Trip”
Reviews.Author: Guiv37
Reviews.Content: Third time I went to Vegas with a group of 10 friends. Very good hotel, not as luxurious as the wynn and bellagio but very clean and Tech. Beautifull. The liquid Poll party are amazing and nightclub HAZE was awesome....The Shooping mall city center is very good, with very good stores. Louis Vuiton GUcci Prada Porsche and others... I recommend....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerx2IN
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay. We were a bit concerned on the cab ride from the airport to Aria. The cab driver had mostly negative comments on the hotel. However we found none of those to be true. We arrived at 9 AM. Check in had not begun. So we were given a pool pass and directions to the luggage hold area. The person there gave us a map of the hotel and pointed us to CafeVettro for a delicious breakfast. We then headed up to the pool and changed into our suits. We found plenty of lounge chairs both in and out of the sun. The pool area was beautiful. The attendants were constantly removing towels from empty chairs. The waitresses were always available and accommodating. Had a good turkey wrap sandwich and yummy cocktails. At 3:00 we left the pool and headed to check in. At 3:15 we were in our room. Our luggage was delivered in 10 minutes with a bucket of ice. We were given an explanation of the electronics of the room and the safe. Our room was spotless and loved the full wall of glass view. I really liked the vibe of the hotel. Very laid back and not a lot of kids. The Viva Elvis show was fabulous. The live band was just awesome and with the speakers under each seat you actually felt the vibration of the bass. The Jean Philippe Patisserie was excellent. My only negative comment would be on the buffet for dinner. Just did not care for the atmosphere. We did try it again for breakfast and were given a table looking over the pool. The meal was somewhat better. We have stayed at the Bellagio and the Venetian. I would rate the Aria #1, with Venetian #2. We passed thru the Bellatio via the tram from the Aria and it was a madhouse in the Bellagio lobby and garden area. We could not wait to get out of there. Also went across the street to Planet Hollywood shops. What a difference in cleanliness. I commented to my husband that we never saw grimy fingerprints on the Aria glass doors. We were always glad to return to the Aria. Would definitely stay there again and recommend it highly. We also did the Red Rock Canyon tour with a stop at the Spring Mountain Ranch. A very enjoyable day. The night helicopter flight over the strip was great. It took a while to finally get on the helicopter but they apologized for the delay and said it was due to a large family group in front of us. Which I believe as we saw a family of about 20. There were 2 helicopters with 6 passengers each. By the way we got a front seat....so exciting sitting next to the pilot and what a spectacular view. So back to reality...can't wait to visit again next year!

Reviews.Title: “no atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: manc65
Reviews.Content: travelled with 2 kids 16 and 13,very boring hotel,overpriced,internet,fitness centre all not included. this hotel could be anywhere in US,nothing to do with Vegas. drinks and food overpriced. pool is nice to relax but for kids nothing to do. go for this money somewhere else with a really Vegas atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrated”
Reviews.Author: kendrac21
Reviews.Content: Recently, my boy friend and my self stayed 3 nights at the Aria for the Lady Gaga concert. We booked in advance and got a great deal for a corner suite thanks to being on the guest book. Payed slightly more $ then for the lowest room for a 900 sq. ft suite. Trying to find the hotel was very tricky since its tucked away. Arriving on the back side offers "complimentary" valet. For some reason the attendant told us it would be less walking if we drove to the front to self parking. Already frustrated we navigated back to self parking. There are numerous spots saying lower emissions cars only, tow away. I was scared to park in front in fear of the tow away but there was many other suv's and while I hesitated someone stole the spot. In reality anyone can park there. We walked all the way back across the entire hotel to the lobby to see the same attendant that sent us to self parking and we would have walked about 10 feet. Checking in they informed us the room was not ready and the Aria does not have a check in time designated. I enjoyed the casino and my overpriced beer, while the bell desk watched our bags. The room was very nice and clean. However, our room was lacking the "technology" the Aria seems so prided on. Several times we called the front desk to get them to bring up the audio video consul to hook up the laptops and xbox. Someone finally came up at 2 am. Then that morning someone ran into our room yelling "dont be alarmed" took something and ran back out. The location was convenient on the strip. The gaga concert awesome. If I get another big discount I will stay here again since my suite was so nice. Pay full price, I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: descheytypipjo
Reviews.Content: I just got back from spending 3 nights at Aria. From there I spent 3 nights at Palazzo. I much preferred Aria. The room was wonderful. Check-in was fast (about a 5 minute wait). Everyone I encountered was friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Aria - The hotel that blew my mind”
Reviews.Author: Aenmrajask-2
Reviews.Content: The Aria has high-tech amenities, curtains, TV, even bathrooms. The location is great you're smack-dab in the middle of the strip &... Citycenter. Citycenter, yes it is all 1 word, is a complex of 1 no-condo hotel (Aria), 3 other hotels (Mandarin Oriental, Harmon, Veer Towers), 1 super-luxurios Mall (Crystals), and a pure condo building (Vdara). It is architecture heaven in sin-city. Aria also has a promenade w/ a gelato shop, a cirque de solet theater for Viva Elvis which I mentioned in another review. It's great. Back to the list on the promenade: the pool is up there, its very grand indeed buffet is up there: best I've been to. you can go directly to the promenade from your elevator, unless you booked in the sky suites, which I havent been to. All in all the best hotel I've been to.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort”
Reviews.Author: WallaceR
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to go to Vegas for a long time and at the last minute I booked a trip and got a great deal with Aria. It wasn't until after I had booked my stay that I looked at trip advisor and noticed that they seemed to be having problems with service which was backed up upon arrival at the hotel. The girl on reception was bordering on rude, not a great first impression on arrival at this resort. I checked into my room, which had a great view, was clean and spacious. The property is huge and could do with some better signage to help you find your way around but once I spent a few hours wandering around I started to appreciate the beautiful modern building. Despite my reservations about service I found most of the staff to be welcoming and friendly particularly in City Bar and Todd English Pub, where the staff contribute to a great atmosphere, the staff looked like they were having a great time, while offering what can only be described as outstanding service! So much so I would love if job there! I also spent 3 days in Liquid Pool Lounge and 2 out of the 3 days were great, my host Sam, with servers Michael & TJ offered outstanding service. On the day that Sam was off the host was friendly enough but she spent most of the day wandering around complaining and really looked like she didn't want to be there. The food in all the venues was great and being Vegas the resort really comes to life in the evening. Overall I had a great stay and can't wait to go back to Aria.

Reviews.Title: “worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jesfire415
Reviews.Content: stayed at aria hotel, It was a very good hotel. staff was a little slow with check in and taking bag to room. Overall very good and woeth the money

Reviews.Title: “Great addition to Las Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler0813201
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our trip (Aug 10-13) to Las Vegas and spent three nights at Aria. We travel to Las Vegas two to three times a year and have stayed at a number of other hotels throughout the years. This was our first time staying at Aria and were pleasantly surprised by the hotel and accomadations, espescially after reading so many negative reviews. Check in/Check out: No lines for either and both were accomplished in under 5 minutes. (Weekday). Room: Standard Deluxe Room with one kingbed. Fairly small room but decor and electronics are all top of the line. The view from our room was not the greatest as the Aria sits back from the strip and view was somewhat obstructed by nearby City Center buildings. However, we don't spend alot of time in the room so having a spectacular view is not that big of a deal. Room was cleaned well each day at about 2pm and we never had any issues with room cleanliness, key cards, electronics, plumbing, etc. Casino: Good variety of slot machines in different denominations. We personally did not have much luck but did see a 25K win on a 5 dollar machine and a 8K win on a quarter machine. Table games are plentiful and they always had at least a couple of 10 dollar blackjack and Pai Gow tables available so they are not trying to price anyone out of playing (well at least they are comparable as what the other MGM properties are asking for minimum bets). Really enjoyed the layout of the casino floor and overall experience. Restaurants: Jean Georges Steakhouse- Probably the best steak I have ever had. Jean-Paul Philippe Pastry (Patisserie) Shop: Great selection of sandwiches and pastries and good quality. Buffet: Food was alright but did not like the layout of the buffet area. Felt like you were standing in a school cafeteria lunch line. Would walk over to the Bellagio if I was going to do a buffet again. Pool: Nice large area with lots of lounge chairs and palm trees. Did not have any issue obtaining chairs as is usually the case at most strip hotels. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay at Aria again. I am not sure if the large number of negative reviews of Aria are due to people having higher expectations for the hotel because it is new or what. I think Aria is comparable to Bellagio which is where we have been staying on our recent visits. Happy travels...

Reviews.Title: “Casino for Mature Clientele (30+)”
Reviews.Author: M3Princess
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking upon arrival with lots of interesting modern art and waterfalls. It is a gorgeous hotel inside and out. Staff is the friendliest I've ever seen anywhere in Vegas and I've been coming for the last 15 years. Arrived on Tuesday morning from the east coast and early check-in was a breeze. The room was at the very end of the hallway and it was worth the walk - spectacular, very modern with a gorgeous view of the mountains, the strip and Vdara. The king bed was plush and the LCD panel to control all the curtains, lights, etc. was fun to play with. The bathroom was very cool with the sunken tub behind the shower, double sinks, ample lighting. Water pressure in the shower could've been better but hey, we're in a desert. It was peaceful and quiet in our room. I loved it. Have read a lot of complaints about the long hallways in Aria. If you have an aversion to exercise, simply request a room close to an elevator when you check-in. Seems like a no brainer. Casino is very cool, very dark with a plethora of slots and table games. Poker room sucked - everybody was playing over at the Venetian. Don't expect free stuff, coupon books or comps like you get from the downtown casinos. Aria wants your money, plain and simple. No coffee makers in any of the hotel rooms, I'm assuming in all of LV. No Starbucks in Aria, had to go to Starbucks in Monte Carlo next door and it's not open 24-7. Or buy crappy weak coffee from one of the bars in Aria. More than a little irritating and only negative I found. Pools were exquisite with plenty of brand new loungers to choose from, lots of palm trees and shade. Very relaxing. Saw ZERO KIDS, which is a very high thumbs up. You also won't see many hotties here so if you're looking to hook up, it'll be with an old cougar at least twice your age. Got a lot of R&R at the pools every morning after feasting at the buffet, which was quite good. Two omelette stations, great selection of everything. Lots of restaurants to choose from. Sweet Chill has delicious ice lattes. Jean Phillipe was a one-stop shop for pastries, muffins and all the sweets I could ask for. Viva Elvis is the show at Aria by Cirque du Soleil. Pretty good but Phantom of the Opera at the Venetian was twice as good - it depends what you're into. Took the free tram to the Bellagio several times, which was very convenient. Walked through the shops to get to the strip. Bellagio hallways were always packed with people and it was VERY LOUD with noise. Saw some kids and more than a few baby strollers. Lots of maneuvering to get through Bellagio. Bring some worn in walking shoes or flip flops. Made the mistake of buying new shoes for this trip and got some blisters. Got extremely annoyed by the people on the strip handing out porn/lady of the evening business cards on the strip. They'd shove them in your face as you walked by. If I need a hooker, I know where to find them. Stayed half of the trip at Aria and half of the trip at the Golden Nugget downtown. I'll do a separate review for GN but in complete contrast to Aria, Nugget was a madhouse with kids screaming, running up and down the hallway in the casino and outside of our room in the Gold Tower. Searched for 30 minutes at the pool at GN for two lounge chairs (are you kidding me???). No one at the entrance to the pool was checking peoples' room keys...looks like GN is letting people off the street into their pool - nasty! Saw two women with 8 little kids hogging the modern seats next to the jacuzzi. Did not look like they belonged, if you know what I mean. Don't want to SEE or HEAR kids anywhere in LV. This is supposed to be where the adults go on vacation. Will definitely stay at Aria next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing ARIA Experience - Cold and Distant”
Reviews.Author: ckdaddy
Reviews.Content: Aria did not live up to the hype. The rooms were big and roomy, nice bathroom, but the service and design aspects of the resort left a cold and distant feeling with me. Everyone from the front desk, dealers to the wait staff seemed unhappy and distant... therefore the feel of the entire place was just general coldness... There is no flow in the design, it's like the designers got to do whatever they imagined. Not Vegas-like either...! One night when coming back to Aria, we saw the cleaning crew with duct tape and plastic bags on their hands and knees taping the floor. We asked them what they were doing and they said they have to taping off each of the matte granite tiles in order to polish the floor... which they do nightly. I can't believe they have to tape over the matte granite tiles and polish the shiny granite tiles, then go back over and hand clean each matte tile.... if you have been there you know, what a chore and the result of the bad design. Wish they would have thought about the hospitality more than the design and maybe used that money for coffee pots or other amenities for the guests.... Anyway, overall, glad I got to see the place, so I won't do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Danadeon
Reviews.Content: I am usually not so enthusiastic about hotels but this one was the best. My and husband and I went unexpectedly with his job and had a planned trip to Disney World the next week. When we arrived at our Disney resort my first thought was It's no Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, upscale hotel, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Gahan
Reviews.Content: I was planning a trip for my best friend and I to meet up in Vegas. She's worked in the hotel industry, so I knew we had to get a 'decent' hotel in Vegas. I booked us a 2-queen deluxe suite. We got there around 6 pm on a Monday night to check in. The lines were long to check in and after waiting about 20 minutes, it was finally our turn. I had a feeling they were overbooked or something since it had taken so long in line. Turns out they were out of queens and the only thing they had was a king smoking room. UGH! After dealing with the desk clerk, who didn't seem very empowered, and having her check with the manager (who had a line of desk clerks waiting to help their customers too), we were finally able to get a non-smoking king room without the strip view. I'd rather have non-smoking than the strip, so we decided on that room. Fortunately, I didn't mind sharing a bed with my friend, but if it had been almost anyone else in my room, I would've been really annoyed to have to share a bed. When I asked why we didn't get a queen, she said "When you book the room, you're entering your bed preference, but it doesn't guarantee you'll get that bed." We also asked for a discount and they gave us $10 off a night. I was hoping for more, but oh well. The room ended up being on the 5th floor and facing the strip, so the view wasn't quite as bad as I expected. Overall the room was very nice and spacious with plenty of closet space for all our stuff. We ate at the 24-hour restaurant for breakfast every day and it was good. A little pricey, but not bad. Everyone else in the hotel seemed friendly (besides the front desk staff) and I liked how it seemed a little classier than other hotels and it wasn't a bunch of 21 year olds running around either. The location was good. Easy to take the tram over to Bellagio or walk on the strip. We took taxis several times and I liked how they queue the taxis underneath the drop off area, so there was always one waiting, but not clogging up the front of the hotel at the same time. The spa looked really nice too, but we didn't have time to go there.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed with the room”
Reviews.Author: momo711
Reviews.Content: We chose Aria hotel cuz it is a 5 stars hotel. We went down to Las Vegas for my stag party on August long weekend. Minus: - Upon arrival, we were "upgraded" to a room on higher floor. We were disappointed with the room. The room was dirty. I have never encountered such a dirty room for a 5 stars hotel. The floor was dirty with bits and pieces of garbage. We found three pillows with lipstick print, footprint and dirt. The overall impression left us uncomfortable with how clean the bedsheets were. - Called front desk. It took forever to get them on the phone. However, they did follow up on our requests. - The bathroom was small relatively. We stayed at Bellagio last year and we were so impressed with their large bathroom with marble bathtub and large shower hall. When I walked into Aria hotel room, my first impression was "this is it?". - The bed was very soft. It's personal preference I must admit. Plus: - The Aria spa was amazing. We really enjoyed lying on their heat stone beds and all their amenties. - The swimming pool area was large and we could find a quieter area for sun tanning. However, we did not like the loud party music on the Sunday afternoon. I guess some party-goers would enjoy that very much. - The restaurants on main lobby were very good. We loved the sheperd pie at Todd English (it's to die for) and the green curry at Lemongrass. The cafe provided great choices of foods too. - The location was good. We took the connecting train to Bellagio many times. Would I return to the Aria hotel? I think next time I'll get a room at Bellagio but hop over to Aria for their restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is inconvenient at the Aria”
Reviews.Author: DuffyNC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay at the Aria. We usually stay at the Bellagio, but thought we would give this new place a try. Big mistake. Obviously Aria started out to be one sort of hotel and because of the economic downturn, they decided to cut corners wherever they could. Let's start with the elevators. There must have been a whole bank of elevators cut from the final plans. Our room was 125 feet (we measured) from the elevators and we were not even close to the end of the hallway. I am all for exercise, but after a day in the Vegas heat or a night on the town, your room needs to be somewhat closer than a half a football field away. Housekeeping is very sporadic. We would leave the room at 10 am and return at 5 pm to find that the room had not been cleaned. We were shortchanged on towels on two different days. One day the room toilet stopped up and maintenance was called. They showed up over 2 hours later and did not clean up after themselves. Nothing like coming home to a filthy toilet at midnight. The rooms are supposed to be high tech and everything is controlled with a tv remote. This sounds good in theory, but turns out to be a pain when you have to scroll through a menu to turn the lights on or off or to open or shut the curtains. There is construction going on all around the Aria that is nowhere near complete. The constant beep-beep of trucks backing up starts just after dawn. The Aria is located back off the strip and it is difficult to get anywhere from there. During our stay several sidewalks were closed and you would actually have to walk a few blocks north to cross the street to go the the south strip! The Aria never let you know in advance which sidewalks were closed. This is information that could have easily been posted and saved patrons long walks in 110 degree Vegas heat. In fairness, I have to recommend the Aria buffet. It was the only thing at the hotel we liked. The choices are limited compared to other buffets, but everything was of high quality and the desserts were the best I have ever had anywhere in LV. My advice, however, is to avoid the Aria for lodging even if you get a great rate. Trust me, you will be much more comfortable elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Technological, smart, savvy”
Reviews.Author: case02
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, with great room and bathroom. It's a new build and is very technological - the TV controls everything! But once you get used to using the technology it's an excellent and helpful tool. The Buffet is simply fantastic (you must try the Crab legs!) and the casino good. The bars can be a little on the pricey side, but are generally great value. The pool is comfortable and well designed. The Cirque de Soleil Elvis show was exciting and worth a look in. A great place to stay in Vegas, if a little difficult to get to (it's a little off the strip at the top, near MGM Grand).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller22010
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Aria last week. I loved the place. We got upgraded to a view suite. OMG. The suite was amazing roomy and hi-tech. It had controls in every room to open, close drapes, temp control, audio etc. The bathtub and the view from the bathroom was fantastic. The bidet was amazing. The pool very relaxing, the frozen mojito by the pool minty and refreshing. the design, and the decor throughout the hotel was fantastic and the food both at the cafe and the steak restaurant were great. I would definitely go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “great stay w husband & friends”
Reviews.Author: wolfpk3
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive after reading a few of the reviews on this site about the Aria but was going as a part of a group of 5 couples for a friend's 50th birthday. We range in age from 35-50. In short, we had an awesome time. Super clean, ultra modern hotel. spa was fantastic, I had the Thai Clay Wrap and loved it! The spa facilities were superb! We had great service at the front desk at both check in and out and at any other encounter. We also requested and received late checkout as our plane was leaving late afternoon. The guys at the pool were fun and kept our drinks coming. I have absolutely no complaints. This is my 5th or 6th time in vegas and this hotel ranks up there with the best of them.

Reviews.Title: “Equally As Good As The Last Time Here”
Reviews.Author: chatter-box2go
Reviews.Content: I was last here in Las Vegas in April & stayed at the Aria over night. This time in August I stayed 8/4 - 8/8 at this great hotel & had a very good time! Every staff member I came in contact with was friendly & professional & treated me as a valued guest! Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do it once, but then back to the MGM Grand”
Reviews.Author: synergydoc
Reviews.Content: Most frequent Las Vegas visitors seem to have a fallback position -- a place they know will provide reasonable value, comfort, and service (for me, that's the MGM Grand), but we all like to try new stuff. So when Aria offered a terrific deal on a Saturday night stay, and the airfare bargains coincided, it was a no brainer to give it a try. (Normally, a person with a relatively open schedule can avoid the crowded weekends -- why pay three times the price for the same room on a Saturday as a Tuesday?) Found the Self Park without problem, but the problems began with the walk from the Self-Park to the Hotel Lobby (at the opposite end of the property from where the parking lot connects). Dragging even lightweight carry-on bags that far and across so much carpet on the first floor in the July heat was . . . well, a drag. The staff at check-in seemed inexperienced and slow. We had reserved 2 queen beds non-smoking, but the woman who finally waited on us indicated those were all gone -- "bedding and smoking are not guaranteed". Well, okay, but if I'd wanted a King bed, I might have gone to the Trump Tower. She did manage to snag a smoking 2 queen that popped up on the system just before it disappeared. Hint to hoteliers: there's a BIG shortage of 2 bedded rooms in Las Vegas (and elsewhere), and not everyone who travels together wants to sleep together. Places like the Venetian have figured this out and charge more for 2 beds (and we gladly pay), but THEY SELL OUT quickly. Traipsed back to the elevators, dragging luggage on carpet and checked out the room. Pretty cool (see pix) looking -- though of course the actual temp was hot -- with a huge bathroom (double sinks and a huge shower with a large tub oddly placed in the shower enclosure). The glamor level was high, but the substance just didn't seem to be there. Cool electronic remote to control drapes, tv, lights, etc., but one of the reading lights over the bed never would work. Cushy beds, but frankly I've felt better back support on the more ordinary beds at the MGM Grand (and certainly the next night at the Hard Rock Hotel). It took a pretty long time to get the room cooled down adequately, but it did get reasonably cool by the time we went out to eat, etc. For all the glamor in the room's fittings, the toilet paper and tissues were blatantly cheap and crummy. Casino area / lobby / bar areas was really loud -- may be a function of Saturday and lots of people because it's new. Lots of restaurants -- Julian Serrano was a terrific choice. And we heard from a friend who was also not particularly enamored of the Aria that the pool area (which we missed by staying only one night) was its best asset. Would recommend to a friend -- TO TRY as a novelty; once was enough, thanks.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bossyrn
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from the Aria hotel and casino. This hotel is excellent. I had read in other reviews that the check in line was long and the customer service was bad. When we arrived the line was short and everyone was very friendly. My boyfriend and I were upgraded to a corner room suite which is absolutely amazing. The hotel is beautifully decorated and has many modern amenities. There are several restaurants to choose from. I can only comment on Skybox and Cafe Vettro, both have tasty food selections for decent prices. I will say that the service at Cafe Vettro late night is very slow. My only complaint about the hotel is the spa. The customer service at the spa is lacking and my massage was average. Overall I had an excellent stay I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, huge and fancy but...”
Reviews.Author: Preciousbaby
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I got a great deal through our travel agent and went for it. We got to the hotel late, around 10pm and checked in at the desk. This was somewhat time consuming as the hotel was still fairly new people still seemed in training which was understandable. They explained they were nearly fully booked so we had been upgraded. We were pretty excited to get into the room and check things out but unfortunately when we got there it was evident it had not been cleaned at all. Garbage full, bed unmade, soaps all used. We took our stuff downstairs expecting to just be moved. This again took quite a long time. They moved us into a much lower floor and not nearly nice of a room or view. We were pretty disappointed so thought we would ask for our original room to be cleaned while we hit the town. When we came back to the room nearly 3 hours later (tired and sore at this point) the room was in the same condition we left it *ew* Pretty grumpy and tired we went to the desk to ask for something to be done as we were exhausted. They offered to get someone in there to clean it within the next 30 minutes. We were not impressed.... so we pushed for a food credit at the very least so we could go sit down and grab a bite which they grudgingly obliged. 45 minutes later we got to our room to find the cleaning staff finishing... ugh This really put us off. The hotel was gorgeous in general. It was well ventilated which I appreciated as a non-smoker and it was huge and exciting. It is set back a bit deep so felt somewhat far from the strip but a trick is that the Aria is connected to the Monte Carlo so go through that way to get to the street. The room fiasco was most likely a result of the hotel beingclose to brand new so I'm sure normally things would go smooth so I would still recommend it as it is new modern and in a decent spot. Pools were awesome also.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable service and suites !! PERFECT!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bonniej
Reviews.Content: My husband and I do travel, but let me tell you this is a "DO NOT MISS". Do you know what it is like to be a princess and prince? My husband and I do!!!! Aria Sky Suites treated us that way. We are by no means "wealthy", but you would have thought we were. We were picked up at the airport by Limo, chauffer toting all bags though the airport, then whisked off to a private entrance at Aria. It took only a few minutes to check in, no waiting and we were escorted to our suite, 52002. Fabulous view and amenities. I could go on and on about the suite but you will see for yourself. Housekeeping supervisor, Monica came up within 1 hour after we arrived to see if everything was the way we liked it or if we wanted things done differently. PERFECT!! Beds turned down every night with lovely chocolates at bedside, and room cleaned and STRAIGHTENED UP AGAIN! Soft Jazz, (our favorite) playing throughout the suite. Our room was NEVER messy. Batteries ran low on control unit, engineering was up in 10 minutes. Refreshment center filled within 1-2 hours after we took something, never charged for items we did not use but only looked at. Full refrig for our own use. 1 1/2 bathrooms, real lifesaver for us. Spa like Bathroom, whrilpool lovely. Front of the line pass for the buffet and cafe. Great food, you would never think buffet and reasonable too. Lemongrass and Union were delectiable too. Casino had plenty of table games and slots. We played 1 cent slots but the servers were there for our drink orders within 5 minutes after we arrived, and kept the drinks coming. Loose slots too!!!!!! The beds were like heaven, we are used to a hard bed at home per our liking, and these were like memory foam, so we were sure we would wake with a backache but NO, it was the best night's sleep ever. I am missing those beds already. The VIVA ELVIS show was spectacular. I was not an Elvis fan, but I am now. Concierge services were very accommodating plus we received a free upgrade that saved us $120.00. She also hooked us up with last minute tickets for David Copperfield, in a sold out house. The Sky Suite hostess made sure we had coffee, soda, juices, and snacks all day, as well as drinks during Happy Hour. This is a Sky Suite Perk. Room service has our coffee up to our room each morning in 10 minutes when they said 20 minutes. Our boarding passes were taken care of by the suites front desk staff, as well as the flight upgrades we wanted. WHERE CAN YOU GO AND BE PAMPERED FOR AT VERY REASONABLE RATE PER DAY???? This is a little more than regular rooms. The ARIA SKY SUITES. Thank you so much for an awesome vacation, ARIA SKY SUITES. I wish I was still there....... For any other service I missed, you were perfect too!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay with Aria again!”
Reviews.Author: chinatraveler1016
Reviews.Content: The stay at Aria's Sky Suite was well worth my time, money and experience. The room was beautifully designed, it was relaxing and luxurious, just like some of the estate I would design for my clients. The bathrooms were particularly impressive. They were spacious, immaculate and included high quality, all-natural personal care products. The most of all about the suites was the lounge area. I can find coffee, tea, fruits, cookies, juices through out the day, making it very convenient for me. The food at Mastro's Ocean Club was to die for, making it one of the best restaurant on my dining list. Dion our server was very friendly , knowledgeable and professional. If you ever going there, do try the their famous butter cake! The pool was wonderful, we tried out the Liquid Pool, got food and drinks. The food was fantastic and the drinks was not deluded like some of the places I've stayed. Service was great, the surrounding was beautiful and the live DJ was the gem. If you are there on the weekend, do go to the Haze if you like the club scene, enjoy the pole dancing, amazing skill! Very entertaining. Music was awesome, danced until I couldn't stand straight. Overall, I loved the hotel, it's making me liking Vegas so much more!

Reviews.Title: “Big on appearances, short on service”
Reviews.Author: FlamingoJoe
Reviews.Content: I had visited here shortly after it opened and was impressed with the appearance of everything. When I received an offer of $79 for weeknights and $119 for Fri & Sat, plus food comps, I thought I would give them a try. Knowing that MGM is notorious for big properties that don't seem to have enough staff to accommodate their guests' needs (esp at peak times), I went into this expecting shortcomings - and I was right. Check-in (arrived at midnight) was simple. I was not offered any options on the room (view, etc) and really didn't care. I was however offered, since I was using a debit card, to not have any money authorized (charged) for incidentals. I thought this was really fascinating since I stay in approx 30 hotels a year and have never heard this before. It was explained to me that I could opt to have $130 a day (in addition to my room rate) charged to me or I could waive that and not have the ability to charge food, in-room movies or phone calls to my room. (This could be a good option for travelers on a tight budget.) There were very few food options at that time of night and I could not figure out, with all of their signage, brochures and interactive directories, where I could get something to eat at that hour, without asking a concierge. The room was beautiful and very high-tech. I won't go into details on all the features - you can prob get that on their website. The drama of having all of the lights slowly turn on and the curtains open as you first enter the room is very impressive. When the toilet would not stop running, it took close to 10 minutes from dialing the front desk to the time someone actually answered the phone. On Sunday, late afternoon (after peak check-out time) I had to watch let 2 packed elevators go before one came that had room for 1 more person. The buffet was lousy (see review) but Sirio's was excellent. Upon check-out, I wanted to check my bags at the bell desk and leave them until my flight, which was later that night. I walked up to the bell desk and was told I would have to go outside to do this. In 105-degree heat, this was the last thing I wanted to do. I went outside to find approx 10 people on line waiting to do the very same thing. This is really absurd when you're there because you're NOT LEAVING - why would you have to go OUTSIDE and stand there in the Vegas heat, only to come back inside. I really wanted to just grab a cab and go elsewhere to gamble, but I didn't. Most casino staff was very friendly. Hotel staff was friendly but made it clear that it was all going to be done "by the book" and they would not go out of their way to make any accommodations. Just a few more little annoying things: Wifi is not free anywhere in the hotel, use of computers in the business center is expensive, and you cannot just buy stamps, you have to give the clerk your postcards or mail and they can apply metered postage.

Reviews.Title: “Aria is a must stay!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmr74
Reviews.Content: Aria is one of the best hotels on the Las Vegas strip. My wife and I stayed there for five nights from August 1-6. We had a deluxe city view room which had good views of Monte Carlo, the city center, and Planet Hollywood. The bathroom had dual sinks, a shower/bath tub combo, and private toilet closet. If you can splurge a little more, then get the corner suite, it's pretty sweet. The remote system isn't as bad as people make it out to be, just work with it for a few minutes and it will be worth it. The bed is way to soft and we have a temper-pedic so we were ready to get back to our bed. The TV was nice and the his and hers closets were more than enough room for our clothes and shoes. The casino is a little dark but who cares, you are in Vegas and the scent of the hotel/casino is nice. It doesn't have any smoke smell anywhere, which is GOOD. The pools are nice but I'm not a real pool person, especially in August. When it's 106 outside, I'll be in the casino where it's cold. The buffet is pretty good and the service here was good. If you go for breakfast, get an omelette, real good. If you go for lunch, the mongolian beef and orange chicken were as good as it gets. The pizza was good as well. The desserts looked good but I don't really eat them so I can't give you a report on them. Viva Elvis is a must if you are an Elvis fan. The show is 90 minutes and very entertaining and worth every penny. We were in the third row dead center and it was awesome. Check out the Gold Lounge after or before the show, they give out 2-1 drink tickets. The only downfall of Aria was the Deuce Lounge. They are handing out 2-1 drink tickets everywhere in the casino. We accepted the voucher and decided to try it out. Big mistake. We ordered drinks with our 2-1 vouchers and twenty minutes later, still nothing. It was not crowded either, maybe ten other people in the club, big disappointment. So we left after sitting there for almost thirty minutes and no drinks, by the way, the drinks there are expensive, I'd say twenty bucks on average.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: TexasCrapsman
Reviews.Content: We approached Aria with some apprehension due to the number of negative reviews but decided to stay here because of a great offer. We were very pleased with our decision. Check-in was quick and efficient, and we were offered a free upgrade--the whole process from getting in line to having a key was less than five minutes. Hotel is very attractive--it is modern looking, but we did not sense that it was cold or impersonal. The room was very nice--not as large as the Wynn or Encore but plenty of room. Decor was very modern. Room technology was not a problem. We had a spectacular Strip view from our floor to ceiling windows. No noise from outside or from other rooms. The only down side to the room was seating: the two straight back upholstered chairs did not offer the comfort you get at the Wynn properties. Bath was smaller than the Wynn but very adequate. The bath has a separate shower and tub, but they are located in the same compartment. Showering and bathing simultaneously was a problem for a lady concerned about her hair. The water closet is separate, but the separating panels are obscure glass. You don't get the same amount of privacy that you get from a solid wall. The beds were very overrated. Staff was very efficient, helpful, and friendly. Housekeeping service was outstanding. Food service was great. Breakfast in the room was tasty and very quick. Tried the buffet the next morning and thought it was a good value. Had dinner at Jean Georges steakhouse and Blossom (Chinese food). Both were great meals--the equal of any we have had in Vegas. Would highly recommend the property.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service”
Reviews.Author: maxmanChicoCa
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for her birthday to Las Vegas, We decided to chek out the new Aria hotel, check in went great, we got a corner suite with a descent view, overall it was very nice. But during the night while we were trying to sleep, an alrm outside kept going off, well this continued all night. My sink was clogged in our bathroom, and @ 7:00am in the morning, we looked out our window, and there was somebody out on the roof, oh by the way the rooftop was part of our view, then @ 7:30am, the were three window washers hanging right outside our window. I preceded to get up, and I told my wife that since it was her birthday, I was going to go down to Invited guest check in to explain what we went through the night before, as well what happened in the morning. Talked to a nice person, her name was Toney, she apoligze to me, and said for $25.00 they could give us an upgrade, and move our room.
