Once in the room, it was dirty with carpet stains, smudges on the window, and long black hair in the bathroom (mine's brown). It also looked like there were blood stains on the tile, but it turned out to be part of the natural tile- bad choice. The room is a "smart room" where everything is connected to a "central control panel" on the TV, including the lights, alarms, curtains, etc. Another thing they should have explained. There are only 2 outlet on the desk for chargers- not enough for a business traveler. The other 2 are by the front door (not convenient) and in the bathroom. Food was RIDICULOUSLY expensive- I paid $25 for a cheesesteak. There are NO vending machines on the floors, just ice, and there are NO coffemakers in the rooms. Also, internet service is NOT free- $15/day. Not happy. Good luck going to bed early, they flood the windows with spotlights at night- no match for the curtains. My boss also got food poisoning one night. To go anywhere in this hotel is a long haul. Also the decor is cold and modern. The staff are very unfriendly. The service stinks- we went to a hotel restaurant one night and they made us wait to be seated even thought the place was empty. Another annoying thing is that security stops pretty much everyone at the elevator and asks to see your room key. I guess that's good, but annoying when your arms are full of shopping bags. Why don't they just require a key to get on the elevator?? One good thing I discovered was the gift shop downstairs. Way, way in the back is "cheap" food with $3 bottles of water and snacks. Another gold mine is if you go out the doors by the Coffee Bean cafe towards the Mirage (a relatively short walk) there is a food court with Starbucks, Subway, Sbarro, and McD's! Woo-Hoo! I was in heaven. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again. The only positive was the comfy mattress and the quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of what you eat & touch”
Reviews.Author: butterflyga
Reviews.Content: Yes hotel is new ok. service was the worst ever.we were there a week our room was serviced twice & very poorly.I stay at Bellagio once or twice a year never a problem.I only ate at the hotel & that was 2 meals because by then I had food poisoning.My whole vacation was spent in my room mostly in bed. From first day checked in went to room it had not been cleaned at all,called desk waited 15 mins.then put on hold 5 more,sent to new room key did't work,tracked down a maintenance worker he went in room called front desk we sat in hallway no one came I called manager (very young lady was hotel manager ? huh } finally in room bed was made everything else dirty.Rooms are small for vegas calling for service was useless.my husband cleaned.Went to casino top of slot machines filthy where you place your hands.We had to buy more anti-b cloths.they did not have a gift /necessities type store you have to walk to cvs.After 30 hours there I was sick,very sick.Husband called for doctor said they would find one didn't call back.Small water from mini bar was 5.00 I needed a few before he could get medicine & water etc. at cvs.Called front desk after 2 days to get room disinfected.Ha Ha good luck.No one really cared.Husband asked about if people reported illness front desk said no. He asked several workers on his way to cvs & they said yes.I will never stay there again.Ten years going to vegas have never been sick .Oh yeah the food that made me sick was crummy room service food. quality was less than fast food.The chicken looked like mystery meat I wish I had not eaten any.Also the monte carlo is connected & people were pan handling in the food court! Employees were ignoring them.By the way Wi-Fi is not FREE it is 15.00 a day.Enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “Stepping in to a Dream”
Reviews.Author: Elisafernanda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is setting a new bar in Las Vegas. Friendly staff, fairly spacious rooms, and great amenities give the traveler everything they're looking for. There is no need to go beyond the property line with this place. My only real critique would be that the Front Desk staff need to smile more and be friendlier. To read a complete review go here: http://kimodlf.posterous.com/aria-resort-and-casino-las-vegas-stepping-in

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BKPDX
Reviews.Content: We spent the past two nights at the Aria and the best way to describe it is FANTASTIC! I should say that I read a number of negative reviews about the property. People complained about everything from the valet, to buffet, the rude staff and the small rooms. We did not experience any problems. NOTE ON SELF PARKING- The garage could be tricky to find, if you don't know what your looking for. you need to be in the far left lane for the Aria garage and it is the second ramp down. The Experience We arrived at 9:30 am and were able to check-in early (normally it is 3 pm). The front desk staff was friendly accommodating. The whole resort was very clean and the air quality was wonderful. The complex is huge, but there is plenty of signage. The Room Our room, a Deluxe Guestroom, was quite nice. It was silent at night. We were on the 20th floor and had a great view of the Strip. The technology was fun, but make sure that you aren't trying to control the lights manually while your other half is playing with the remote! The bathroom was beautiful and the amenities were nice. You should note that if you desire turndown service it is on request. The walk from the elevator to our room was not too bad. The charge for internet is not listed is the $15 per day. The size for the room was just fine. It wasn't huge, but very comfortable. Your not in Vegas to hang out in your room anyway, right? Dinning The buffet was amazing! We booked a $99 a night room with a $75 food/beverage credit. The F/B credit was nice and covered our breakfast each day and a few extras. The breakfast buffet is $14.95 - not too shabby. Parking We didn't have a problem with it. The self parking was easy to find, just PAY ATTENTION when you pull into the drive you need to be in the FAR left lane for the Aria garage. Overall the Aria was great and we will stay here again. My big advice to people traveling, whether to Aria or not, you have to be nice to the staff to get friendliness in return. Expectations are great, but just because the place is new you shouldn't expect they will give you everything for free. We have traveled to many of the top resorts and hotels in the US and the Aria is right up there with the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iggyhawk
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Aria over the weekend! The rooms are bright and nicely laid out and we found the beds very comfortable. We had a good experience with service -- check-in was quick and easy, loved the electronic controls for the room, and bellman had luggage up to our room within minutes. We have stayed at the Bellagio, Wynn, Mandalay Bay, Hard Rock, Mirage, and Paris and will definitely stay at the Aria in the future. Casino is a good size with friendly dealers.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible-Poor soundproofing-poor service(Staff can be So Rude it is unbelievable). I couldnt wait to leave. There is construction going on starting at 6AM which woke us up. The other side of the hotel has blaring music from the pool. The pool area was not good. The light blares into the room in the early morning through the gap in the curtains. The techno stuff didnt work either. After 2 nights with little sleep We went to The Heavenly Bellagio-Stay there!! Avoid this hotel like the plague. The only reason I would ever go back to Aria are for The Elvis Show, Coffee Place and Todd Englishs Pub which were great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lamrgrays74
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas to celebrate my sisters birthday. It was somewhat of a short notice, so we went online to see what was available. We discovered that there was a new City Center development on the strip. We read about the Aria hotel and found that it had mixed reviews. People complained about the service, the check in/out time etc.. ultimately, we decided to give Aria a try. I can DEFINATELY say that Aria was by far the best hotel experience till date. When we walked in, the service man quickly came to collect our luggage with instruction. When we entered the lobby, we were absolutely floored. The aroma of vanilla flowed throughout the hotel, the staff were so nice and courtious. At the check in, the staff had noticed a line forming, some people started to complain about the wait (all of five minutes) and the staff quickly opened more lines. It took us roughly 10-15 minutes to get situated. When we got to our room on the 35th floor, entering the room was a breeze, just wave the card in front of the sensor and your in! once in the room, the view was breathtaking, the bathroom has a double sink with a shower and bath for two...the bathroom is private behind frost glass. The room was very high tech, we were able to conrol everything in the room inc. phone, drapes and tv from remote control. They had FREE WiFi, Ipod hook up etc. The buffet was amazing!!!!!!!!!!! Lobster people, all you can eat for a reasonable price. They have a tram (space aged) that will take you from Aria to the Bellagio and Ceasars Palace. The pool is relaxing, and the location of the hotel is somewhat in the middle of the strip. What I especially liked is that after a certain time, only hotel guest can go to certain areas of the hotel. The only down side of the hotel is that the gym is an additional cost BUT THATS IT!!!! Aria will definately be my hotel of choice when I go to Vegas. From my family to yours, Aria is the hotel to stay when in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: Carmen2468
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked this trip to get away for a 4 day weekend and relax. We took a shuttle to the hotel which dropped us off underground (not a great first impression). We proceeded to walk (what felt forever) to the check-in where a not-so-happy looking employee graced us with her presence. The check-in was speedy which is good. We got up to our Deluxe City View Room which promises a view of the City Center and Strip...The view we had was BLAH with the exception of the mountains in the horizon. We had a view of the plain Monte Carlo and NY NY (not much of a strip view). I called the front desk who said that it was a view of the City Center and not the strip (check their website b/c it clearly states view of strip). I was not too pleased with that answer. Don't waste your $ on that upgrade. Also, the room layout is odd. Why put a desk in front of the tv? We ate at a small restaurant there and my fiance ordered a steak (which ended up looking like a rinky dink piece of bologne! When I asked a Players Club employee for a chain for the card so I won't lose it she said that they did not give those away b/c it looks "tacky". SNOB!!! We put the sign up for room service who NEVER came!!! Wait I take that back...our last nite at 1am they sure showed up, but I had the privacy sign up. They mentioned something about a glass breaking clean up. Sorry pal, WRONG ROOM! Oh and I forgot to mention that we had to get up at 3:50am to leave. When it came to checking out, we had several charges to the room that we did not partake in such as using the poker chips and the phone. Luckily, they took them all off. On a positive note, the place smelled good and it is very modern and chic. Oh and I loved the bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Best mid-range priced hotel I've found in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TaylorJackson
Reviews.Content: First off, I'll start by saying that, I took a point off for location, only because I'm a location snob. It's set back from the strip a little ways, but you can easily walk anywhere without a problem. It is in a great location - but for location I prefer Paris, Mirage or TI, or anything else that's right on the sidewalk. I booked my room for $130 a night, and it's the best 130 a night room I've found on the strip. I recommend it over TI, Mirage, MGM, Bellagio, Paris, Mandalay Bay and anything else that's comparable to the above. The hotel experience is great - it's brand new. If you're looking for a great view, you might want to check out TI, but Aria is the best overall.

Reviews.Title: “Beds UNBEARABLY soft .....”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuru9
Reviews.Content: Im not sure how to rate this hotel. Everything about it is pretty much awesome. But what rating do you give, when the bed is so soft that you are physically incapable of sleeping in it? When you sit down on the bed, you literally sink in, over 12 inches. Nearly a foot. Its FAR too soft. Laying in it is like a Hammock. I am not kidding. After a few hours you will wake up with a pinched nerve, some sort of dislocated spinal column, or at the very least a cramped neck. I honestly don't know what they were thinking. Vegas has a reputation for overly firm beds. Thankfully that is giving way to the more comfortable beds. But everyone knows that its safer to err on the side of firmness over "too soft". Too soft results in very uncomfortable sleep and is extremely bad for your back. They went way too far on the "comfort" concept for this one. It was so bad that I literally had to flip the bed over onto the hard side and lay on that in order to sleep. Way too firm, but better than a hammock. I called the front desk and they said all beds are the same, so no point in changing rooms. Everything else - totally loved it. So I guess im going with 3 stars :(

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but the service is so...”
Reviews.Author: quintanahoo
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, but the service is so bad it is unreal! Check-in was a mess. Told that room was not available at 3pm.....still not abailable at 5pm! After letting them know that was nuts our room was suddenly available. Huge wet spot on floor when we got in and the room was 80 degrees! We crank the AC and go out for gambling and dinner. Come back and room is still hot. This is where it gets bad! Multiple calls to the front desk all with 10+ minute hold times. Finally at midnight people come to the room to fix it. We are tying to sleep and people are working in our room. It is 3am EST where we have travelled from! Worst service ever! Avoid avoid avoid!

Reviews.Title: “The service I experienced at ARIA was excellent from check in to check out”
Reviews.Author: Andy00Sunderland
Reviews.Content: After reading other travellers reviews I was a bit worried about the service at ARIA and the hotel itself. Those reviews couldnt be further than from what I experienced. Check in was a 10 minute affair with no wait - all check in staff were busy, so they opened up another desk for me and the lady who served me was polite, friendly and very helpful. I had booked at standard double room, but as there were none ready for guests, we were upgraded to a Queen size room at no extra cost. My room at ARIA was fantastic, modern, clean, well designed and with great views over to pool area. A great Queen size bed, double sink bathroom with shower and bath plus a huge flat screen TV and well stocked mini bar. The room was serviced upon request and the auotmated features of the room were excellent - electric curtains, one touch lighting, air con etc. The location of ARIA and the surrounding City Centre complex is in a great location and you have many of the other big name resorts and casinos within walking distance. I liked the location and the design of ARIA best of all, the one thing that let it down slightly was that some of the bars and resturants within the hotel itself were a bit pretentious for my liking, but the buffet at the hotel offered a great selection of worldwide cusine day and night. Overall I found ARIA to be one of the best hotels I have stayed at, with friendly, helpful staff who gave great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience!”
Reviews.Author: LSU_1
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what all the bad reviews are about because we had an excellent experience!! I think we also have pretty high standards at places we stay. We have previously stayed at the Bellagio and thought we'd give Aria a try because of the promotional room rate we received. We will definitely be back. Arrival - Our bags were taken & we were told to call for them when we got to our room Check in - we got there around 3pm and waited behind 1 person (there were at least 10 other lines checking people in as well) Room - got to the room within 10 minutes of checking in, called for our bags and they showed up in literally 5 minutes! Very fast!! The air conditioning couldn't keep up with the hot temps in Las Vegas, but it wasn't HOT! The universal remote for the room turned the lights, curtains on & off and controlled many other things like the TV & A/C. It was very EASY to use and we had NO problems with it. There are controls on the wall & TV if you don't like it. Also, you are able to make programs which allow you to set the room how you want it at different times. Overall, the technology was EXCELLENT!!! The bathroom was a little weird in that the bathtub was behind the shower, but was still fine! The bed was a little soft for our liking, but still very comfy. I didn't care for the selection of the pillows. We never heard any noise while in the room. Housekeeping came each time before we came back to the room at around 4:30 pm and restocked everything. Overall, the room was modern & very nice. Our room was about 100 steps from the elevators, but I could see where it would be very annoying if our room had been further off one of the corridors since there is only 1 bank of elevators. Casino - VERY COLD!!! Yes, it is dark in the casino, but it didn't bother us at all. It's not like you can't see, it's just a different type of lighting. There were plenty of slot machines to play and of course all new. We thought the slots were very loose! There seemed to be lots of tables as well. The cocktail waitresses come around very frequently too. Last but not least, the music playing in the casino was AWESOME!!! Restaurants - the Buffet food was just ok, but the desserts on the buffet were all from Jean-Philippe Patisserie which was nice! We tried Skybox which was expensive and average food. Cafe Vettro wasn't very good in my opinion. We went to Lemongrass which was also just ok. Lastly, we tried the UNION which was very good! I guess the food is lacking here; however, we didn't try any of the fine dining here. We went to other places (CUT at the Palazzo & Koi at Planet Hollywood - which were EXCELLENT). Pool - The pool was nice, not as elegant as the Bellagio. Chek-out - Even though we had to check out at 4am, there were still 2 people open at that time and we had no problems. It is a great facility. It took us about a day to find our way around, but after that we were fine. You did have to do some walking if you wanted to go anywhere else. The Tram was nice to take you to the Bellagio, but then you had to walk more. You could get to the strip through Crystals, which was by far the easiest way to get there. Unfortunately, Crystals shopping was a little too high-end for us. Overall, the Aria was nice and we'd go again.

Reviews.Title: “This property will set a new Standard for Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: MrChad
Reviews.Content: I booked corner Suite on the 27th floor for my 4 night stay at Aria. Arrived on a Tuesday and was met with smiles and an easy check in. Room technology is really cool if your into that kind of stuff. The touch screen panel lets you control all the lighting, powered window curtains, room status, etc. If you prefer you can use the switches or the remote. The Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom gives you two views as it it located in the tip of the Bathroom. Be careful walking around as the windows are not one way. I saw a couple of interesting things during my stay. :) The Casino is rich and elegant and the staff is efficient and friendly. Restaurants, Sports Book are all top notch. Some Restaurants are pricey but if you hook up with a good Casino Host you can get a comp if your play warrants it. The Condos are interesting and fun. I'm not in the market but would enjoy the views and amenities that Vdara and Veer offer if I was. The Tram is fast and connects you with The Monte Carlo at one end and the Bellagio on the other. Very nice and convenient. Right now you can get some good deals at this property due to their desire to fill the Hotel up to get the property more well known. You can get deals here and stay in brand new facilities. Awesome. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: copokefan
Reviews.Content: If your going to Las Vegas for a meeting or a conference, and your company booked at Aria, hug your meeting planner. If your going to Vegas on vacation, and looking for time at the pool, casino, shops, yadda, yadda, yadda....book someplace else. My wife and I stayed at Aria for three nights in June. Leading up to our trip I read every review on the property I could find. Having benefited from the shared knowledge of others, I felt compelled to write a review and share my thoughts on this new property. In my opinion, it is a large conference hotel, designed specifically for that purpose (large meetings, trade shows, multi-state conferences, etc). Unfortunately, this hotel opened at the worst possible time for a new conference facility and is having to reinvent itself somewhat into a hotel that caters to the weekend and leisure travelers. Everything at Aria is set up to deal with large numbers of people; the hallways are wide, the buffet is great, the elevators are fast, and the 4,000 rooms are efficient and clean. FYI - for those of you who have had trouble booking a room with two queens - this makes sense - it's because very few conference travelers would want this. Most people out of town on business, or attending a conference, request a king bed, a desk, and standard room amenities. The beds are silly comfortable. That said, we did not have a bad time at this hotel. Check-in was smooth, our room was comfortable, and the casino gave as much as it took (in the end...it still took). We hung out at the pool one day and it was very nice. My only knock on the pool is no drinks in the water. This must be due to the eco-friendly "green" factor of the hotel. A pool with a pina colada in it is harder to clean and filter and would probably require a less 'green' filtration system. I'm in Vegas, I'll recycle and be a good person when I get home. When it's 110 outside, I want a cold beer and a cool pool. We had no problems with noise. No problems with house-keeping. And, everyone we met was friendly and helpful. Although, I do think the hotel is slightly understaffed - but that's probably more of a sign of the times than a direct reflection on the hotel. Finally, I'm not sure what the standard is to be a true "five star" hotel. Whatever it is, I think Aria misses it by one star. Not because the facilities are not nice (the spa is amazing). But because I think Aria is missing the extras that make staying in an upscale hotel 'upscale'. We had dinner and caught the show at Wynn while we were in town and there is a distinct difference in walking into and around Wynn vs. the Aria. The best way I can describe it is that Wynn has a Private Country Club feel, while Aria is more of a business center with neat stuff. We probably would not stay at Aria again. Not because I hated the hotel or we didn't have a great time.....on vacation I'm just looking for something a little more first class and upscale. More cabanas, coronas and limes, less name-tags and notebooks. Either way. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Disppointing - Not worth to be a 5-star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tomatocrab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights at Aria recently and the experience we both had were terrible and disappointing. 1) Non-smiling front desk staff We thought hospitality is the most important area in hotel management (especially front desk personnel). To our dismay, we were greeted with none during check-in. The staff which assisted us was wearing a glum face, with entirely no smile. 2) Room was absolutely short of basic amenities This was the main reason why we had to say this isn't worth to be rated a 5-star. We were not provided with any toiletries upon check-in. Also, one set of face/hand towels was missing, no bedroom slippers provided and there was only 1 bathrobe. Perhaps an oversight on the housekeeping but this is pretty serious. It just seemed housekeeping did a half-hearted job cleaning up on the previous guest. Although these items were replaced after we made a request for it, but no apologies given whatsoever. 3) Poor Maintenance of room - Faulty Bathtub, Fused Lamp What more disappointing can it get when you can't even enjoy a relaxing bath after a scorching hot day in Las Vegas. We tried to drain the water off but couldn't cause the sinker isn't working. Made a complaint to the front desk in person regarding this and other various stuffs. Still no sign of any apology and met with yet another non-smiling staff. Said the tub would be fixed in an hour. We went out, came back and it was not fixed. We also got a bedside lamp that was fused..... 4) No Coffee-making facility Not sure if we were asking for too much. But don't the hotel provide water flask and complimentary coffee/tea for guests? Even a 2-star hotel provides that. We do notice the room was very well stock-up in non-complimentary food/ beverages. But, who needs to purchase those fancy-looking chocolates, nuts, drinks in the room when the world-class Jean Philippe Patisserie is just down the lobby, right next to the guest elevators. A decent water flask and some complementary food would do the job. Needless to say, with all these imperfections, this would be our first and last time staying with Aria. There are still many short-falls this hotel has compared with the other 5-star in Vegas in terms of casino, buffet etc, but we think these are pretty minor. We really hope the hotel management puts more effort into making this hotel a deserving world-class 5-star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vegaslover99
Reviews.Content: Don't pass up the opportunity to stay at this hotel!! This is by far one of the most impressive hotels in Vegas. It is modern, clean and the staff is so friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautiful! The bed, including the linens and pillows, was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. It is in a great location on the central part of the strip...the only downside is it is quite far back from the strip, so you have about a 5 minute walk to the strip. That would be the only negative thing I would say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NO BIG DEAL...”
Reviews.Author: AmoItalia
Reviews.Content: I received a "special rate" and stayed at Aria about 2 months ago. I took the train over from Bellagio, which was nice. That whole City Center is a bit sad, if you ask me. It's such a reminder of our frail economic times. It's a massive structure conceived when things were booming, but is mostly vacant now. Check in was a nightmare. No specific lines and very few front desk staff. The whole hotel seems understaffed, but again that's clearly a reflection of the times. Yes the room was nice and new, but about what you would expect from a brand new 4star+ hotel in Vegas. There was no wow factor to speak of, and I couldn't help but think that the ammenities were sparce. One last thing that struck me as odd was that never in all of my Las Vegas gambling sprees have I lost so much so quickly. Don't think I'll be returning any time soon...

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RuthyAsheville
Reviews.Content: We loved it there. Please don't listen to bad reviews it was great!!!!! The room was beautiful & the bed was perfect. The view was to die for!!! Our service was excellent and we would stay there in a heartbeat. It was a great location on the Strip. The only down side is that they need a food court for casual dinning when you don't feel like being in a fancy restaurant. We went to other places on the Strip which were all near by for less expensive food & choices.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, Not great”
Reviews.Author: Love2Go80
Reviews.Content: My girfriends and I booked a room at the Aria for a quick vacation. When I booked the room, I was promised two adjoining rooms. When we arrived at the Aria, we were told we were in two adjoining rooms by the young lady that checked us in. When we arrived to our room, they were not adjoining. The four of us then spent the next hour playing musical rooms only to be told in the end that the hotel could not tell which rooms were adjoining. We ended up staying in our original room. With the exception of our bellhop, the staff was not helpful at all with recommending restruants nearby, how to walk to the strip or even how to navigate around the hotel. The hotel itself is gorgeous with AMAZING views. The beds probably the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on. The bathroom is awesome and the linens nice. I really liked the automated features of the room and despite the staff not knowing the hotel they work in, I probably would stay there again. (Or the Bellagio if I can afford it.)

Reviews.Title: “WOW SIMPLY AMAZING LOVED IT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tamsutbadger
Reviews.Content: Well what can i say about this hotel other than WOW, its modern clean and grand well loved it. I was so concerned about the technology and put off from comments on the trip advisor, but i needed not be it was fine. The room was spacious clean well decorated and expertly cleaned as many times as we needed it to be. We had a blocked loo one night and they were up and resolving it within 15 minutes. I have stayed at The Wynn and i would stay at either if i went back really smart hotel, and the buffet is really nice, its a credit to vegas. The beds in this hotel make you want to stay in them all day and night!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Fun”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl614
Reviews.Content: I felt it necessary to inform anyone traveling to Las Vegas, to consider staying at Aria Hotel/Casino. It is a beautiful property with so much to offer and I can’t wait to return. The dining experience at the hotel is phenomenal. However, I found the best bang for my buck at their buffet, which for a minimal price of $20 you can enjoy a full array of sushi, great seafood selections, all sorts of veggies, and an assortment of decadent desserts. I stayed here with my family and several friends in celebration of my birthday and was amazed at how much fun I could have right there on the property. There are several nightclubs and lounges if you want to party like a rockstar. The Chihuly and Cirque du Soleil exhibit are a must see, and there is even a free above ground Tram that will take you to several hotels on the strip for more tours of different hotel properties. My only complaint is that the gym charged $30 per day, but if you felt the urge to workout and can get up before 10am, then take a jog along Las Vegas Blvd. Overall, I rate Aria Hotel/Casino a 10!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: FATW
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Bed was incredibly comfortable. The entire stay was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite! Lousy front desk!”
Reviews.Author: Miandrea
Reviews.Content: When we checked in (noon), we were told that our room would be ready in an hour. Returned to find out that our room wouldn't be ready for a few more hours. When we returned, I was told I had a non-smoking suite....only to find it was so smoky that my eyes burned as soon as I entered - extremely rude front desk...told us that we booked a package deal and that we should be happy that we are even getting a room. If I wanted a non-smoking room, I would have to wait until 9 pm. Returned at 9 (the lady was very nice!) and received a beautiful (non-smoking) suite on the 25th floor. The corner suite was excellent. Great tub and shower! Very spacious. Loved opening the curtains with a touch of a button. Excellent televsion....every channel possible (great for those late nights or just lounging around in the morning). Housekeeping was very good. Loved having a scale in the room too! Pool area was nice. Great facility. Trip was great after the check-in issue! Business centre staff were friendly and helpful! Able to print boarding passes free of charge...something little but appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: Sarac_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Memorial weekend. Aria reminds me of a hotel casino somewhere in the Pacific Rim. The color scheme is dark, and lighting is dim. The rooms are very nice, they are completely 'connected' with Control 4. ( Which we also have in our home.) So, you can control the drapes, TV, check out etc., right from your bedside. The room was well appointed and I would recommend this hotel. Thing is, the feel is a 'high end business hotel', as opposed to feeling like you are staying in Vegas. I feel like I am in Vegas when I stay at the Ventian, Plams, even the Golden Nugget. I knowit is downtown, but it is a gem. Newly renovated, the brand new tower is beautiful. The gym is awesome, it is very large and well appointed. The only on premise restarant at City Center we ate at was Todd English's P.U.B., my husband came home and was in bed for 2 days., sick as a dog. He could not eat a morcel, or even drink water. The only thing that he ate, that I did not, was the shrimp cocktail. We believe the shrimp was the culprit, so I would recommend staying away from the seafood there, although the raw bar presentation is alluring. Order the turkey sandwhich platter for two, it is very good. However, the tomato sald is to die for, if you like tomatoes.....

Reviews.Title: “never wanted to leave”
Reviews.Author: W.O.F.
Reviews.Content: I got a great "summer special" at the Aria, which consisted of a room, 2 free buffets, and $50 in freeplay because I have an MGM players club card. Loved all aspects of the hotel, and the buffet was wonderful. Great beds and quiet hallways. The pool has nice quiet music and mellow people, not like the MGM Grand. Another nice thing was that they let me check in before noon. I will definitely come back if they continue to offer deals to players club members!

Reviews.Title: “ALL WHAT I EXPECTED AND MORE”
Reviews.Author: Lisa4574
Reviews.Content: Aria was the best hotel I had ever stayed. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by a guest service gentleman. He opened our taxi door welcomed us to the hotel then took our luggage and told us that someone would bring them to our room after we checked in. He then directed us to the lobby to check in. As we entered the main lobby we were amazed. the hotel was beautifully designed from the The floors, carpet, and decor. What a magnificent array of artistic work. No waiting in line! Asked for a strip view they upgraded us to a city view NO Charge! Beautiful site view from the the 35th floor in our deluxe room. although, I thought room could have been more roomier. The buffet restaurant was above and beyond. You're going to love the selection and the food tasted GREAT!!!! Jean Phillippe pastries outstanding. Had the chocolate crepe. The pool looked like a tropical paradise. Great location!!!! Across the street alot of bargain shops. Be sure to check out the Tram. It takes you from Aria to Bellagio, Monte Carlo and Crystals for, FREEEE! Casino was a site to see. no luck on slots for me. Loved the security check to enter the elevators to your room. I can't say enough about this place. Must see for yourself. I will return for another visit soon. Our stay Jun 15-18, 2010

Reviews.Title: “Oh My Gosh--absolutely AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: jworm23
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW! This resort is unbelievable! The location is great, centrally located on the Strip between The Bellagio and Monte Carlo. The rooms are fantastic, large and bright with full floor to ceiling windows. The bed was very comfortable and the room itself was spacious, the bathroom was really nice--double sinks, deep soaking tub with seperate shower. The entire room including the lights, curtains, TV, room temperature was controlled by a large touch screen panel, which you can customize to your own personal settings---a little intimidating to program at first but was fun to play with! I stayed at the resort for a large multi-day conference and the conference center and catering was also very good. Didn't have a ton of down time so I didn't get to play in the pool but did sit out in between sessions and it was very nice, large area with several pools. Connected is the new City Centre/Crystals mall which has all the high end stores and shopping you could want. Great restaurants also, ate at Mastro's Ocean Club and the filet was butter knife tender and melt in your mouth delicious! You will NOT be disappointed if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Poor accessability for Handicapped”
Reviews.Author: toniecal
Reviews.Content: Casino new and full of smoke, dark and you have to walk and walk to get anywhere. The rooms small for the two beds choice. Dark hallways going on and on to finally reach your room. The pools are ok but they are only opened till 8pm and by 7 pm are telling you that they are closing. In the desert it is best either real early or late and this is not a choice in this hotel when it comes to the pools. The doors to the handicapped do not fully open and it is not friendly for disable people. Food too expensive and not very good.

Reviews.Title: “An air of beauty and style!”
Reviews.Author: fmlaffs
Reviews.Content: We've stayed for four days in it was just wonderful. It took five minutes to check-in. I called because we had a minor problem with the in-room safe: 5 minutes later somebody was there to fix -it. The rooms our spacious and so is the bathroom. A remote control is all you need to manage all the electronic and electric features. Don't worry: you can also operate them the old fashion way: with the switches on the walls. The pool area is very nice. A must see with the City Complex and adjoining towers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel but will not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: dmartoakville_Canada
Reviews.Content: I was not going to write a review but last night I saw a article on TA about the managers reading the reviews and making changes to Aria. One of the things they are going to change is the buffet and we LOVED the buffet and had eaten at Wynn's buffet the night before and Aria's was so much better. Also no line up to get in and not squashed beside the next table. Great crab legs and everything fresh. The only complaint was they were short of table servers and the older gentleman who was looking after our table was run ragged he had such a big area to cover. This is not a complaint against him he busy the whole time but felt it was very unfair of management not to have sufficient wait staff. He had to take abuse from customers who insisted on immediate service and I felt sorry for him. The night we were there you could have lobster if you paid extra and the lobster was so small it was not worth the time to cook it. Lesson learned...do not bother with the lobster but everything else was so good. The hotel was just beautiful. I am not big on modern design but this hotel was great. We had a comp'd room in a tower suit and it was just so nice. Prior to staying at Aria we were comp'd three nights at the Palazzo so I had a good reference point for comparison. I thought Aria was superior. I just loved the seperate bedroom with the floor to ceiling windows right beside the bed. The bathroom was beautiful and loved the frosted sliding doors to the bathroom. The layout of the bathroom is different from the discription I have read about the regular rooms. The little extras made the experience so much better. A small box of toothpaste and toothbrush, a box with a shaver plus all the usual stuff. The bed was so comfortable we contacted Seally when we got back to Canada to see where we could purchase a mattress like it. Another bonus about the suit was the fridge it the bar area. It had it's own ice making machine so we did not have to go in search of ice....Just loved this hotel room. We thought Crystals was great, it was like walking inside of a actual work of art. I never had a problem walking around with out a place to sit. I always find the walk from Encore to Wynn a long haul and have had to stopp numerous times because if have a problem with my hip. When we arrived there were not a lot of people waiting to be served and there was a host who assisted us to the next available registration clerk so check in was efficient. Our room was not ready and this is the first time in all the years we have been coming to Vegas that we could not get in our room early but this is only a compent not a complaint. After we registered we asked the host if there was someplace we could pick up our room key with out standing in line again and he said we just had to come to him and tell him and he would get us in the next available line. Restraunts.....the 24 hour cafe (can not remember the name) was good for breakfast but were not impressed with lunch or supper. Staff....all the staff with one exception were very friendly and helpful. The man at the players booth was kind of condesending. I had trouble getting my free play to work and it was a long walk from my slot machine back to the players desk to get it fixed and he seemed annoyed with me but everyone has bad days. The players desk was sufficiently staffed and the casino wait staff were excellent and never had to wait for a drink. I was looking for a particular slot machine and asked a staff member and he walked me right to the machine which I thought was great. OK so now I will tell you why I will not return to Aria. I love to play the slots which is why we get our rooms comp'd. I will play for hours on penny machines which are around $3.50 a pull for max bet. I did not like the set up of the slot machines. They do not give you the option of picking the number of line you want to play or how much you want to bet per line. Instead its bet 50 or 100 or 150 ect. I like to be in control of my betting and be able to change the number of line and value of the bet if I feel the machine is to tight or in a winning mode. I really hated this new way of betting and gambling is a big part of my Vegas vacation. I play were i stay so the casino needs to meet my gambling requirements and this casino does not. I did not mind the darkness of the casino and even liked the darkness but gambling experience was not good so I will return to Palazzo for future visits. I also loved the pool area, lots of room and did not seem to have the loud drunken party type of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Haunted Hotel Room Better 2nd Time Around”
Reviews.Author: redheadjokes
Reviews.Content: Here we are 2nd time at Aria this summer, and read LV Sun article. We had to LOL because tho our experience this time is better, it was a bit of a wild time last visit. My mother died this year. I came to Aria end of April to relax. My computer guru husband went to the room computer to close the drapes and turn on the tv. Nothing was working. He called the front desk. They were sending someone up. 5 min later the drapes suddenly close, TV shuts down, lights are all off and we're in total darkness. We are stunned and spooked. Mark calls the front desk to tell them what happened, they said they'd send someone up. Waiting again, Mark tried to change some things on the room controls. Nothing worked. Mark tried the TV remote. Nothing works. Suddenly the drapes fly open, the TV turns on to new age nature music, all the lights come on. Mark calls the front desk to tell them. Same answer. We'll send someone up. We're still waiting when I hear a horse galloping and I'm freaking out a little bit. Took me a minute to realize it was the nature music channel. Suddenly the drapes close, the tv shuts down and we're in darkness again, laughing at ourselves and the situation. Finally there's a knock on the door. A young man with a backpack is there to reset everything. He explains the TV remote often stops working when the computer has been reset. *light dawns* They reset the computer 3xs remotely WITHOUT telling us they were doing it, or what would happen. Now the young man remotely resets computer and remotely resets the remote and leaves. He didn't look like or act like an Aria employee. His arrival and departure was surreal. We're back at Aria again because of a great deal, and this time we experienced what they were going for - as we walked into our room the drapes opened, the TV came on to a Jazz station, and the bed reading lights came up. Ahhh, that's the greeting that's supposed to happen. BTW, our first visit we had an incredible dinner and service at Barmasa Restaurant. That and the pool area are fond memories, and brought us back. Besides, my husband won $4000 this same trip. *chuckle*

Reviews.Title: “great room, that's about it...”
Reviews.Author: rabbit424
Reviews.Content: Chose the Aria because we were traveling with our 9-month old son and needed a suite with space to put him to sleep in. Found a great deal for a corner suite at Aria, and boy was it a great room! We were able to set up my son's pack and play in the half bathroom, so that we didnt need to tiptoe around while he was napping. it's a very large half bath! As far as the room goes, we were on the 14th floor and had an incredible view! Our corner suite overlooked the pool, Monte Carlo and the interior of City Center. We could see Paris, Planet Hollywood, MGM Grand, Monte Carlo, Mandalay Bay and Palms, among other properties. The rooms was nicely appointed. The TVs were big and had lots of HD channels (no HBO thought). The master bath was huge, with a nice whirlpool tub, separate shower and 2 sinks. The view from the bathroom was the best in the suite. The bidet was pretty cool. The bed was cozy and everything seemed clean and modern in style. The room controls, including the curtains, TVs, thermostats and lights, were pretty nifty. Overall, the room was great. On the downside, as cool as the room controls were, it was a pain not to have manual overrides for some of the lights. to turn on only a desk lamp in the living room, you either had to turn on the TV and use the remote control to navigate to room controls and turn it on there, or use the touch-screen controller in the bedroom. The channel guide on the TV was slow, often not displaying the wrong program information, and was unresponsive when we tried changing channels a few times. Other reviews that the halls are long are not understatements... when I was alone, I'd jog through the halls to our suite (at the end of the hall), and it would take 103 long jogging strides, 30-40 seconds of running to get from the elevator. The hotel/casino was beautiful, and not quite as dark as it seemed the first time we walked through on a previous trip. EVERYTHING is overpriced. A coffee that would normally be $3 at starbucks was $7 at their coffee shop. Fortunately we had resort credit with our package, otherwise we wouldnt have purchased anything. We ate at the buffet twice (with our resort credit). Both times the food was pretty much the same, and as vegetarians, had little for us. The sushi was ok. Naan was delicious. Salad bar was small. There were lots of carving stations and seafood entrees that would make it a better value, if we ate them. Overall, not terrible for the price, but I've liked the Rio and Planet Hollywood buffets better. the cookies and other desserts were pretty good. We went to the pool one morning, around 8am, when it was still in the shade of the building. It was nice and quiet, other than music being played. I play blackjack and craps, and my wife and I both play poker. The poker room only had 1 4-8 limit table, only at night. everything else was no-limit, which we dont play. We didnt come back the second night, in favor of monte carlo's poker room. I played a little $10 BJ, and $10 craps, but later went over to MC in favor of $5 craps. One cool thing about the poker room, though, is the Ivey Room, where we saw a few famous poker players in a $150k buy-in game. After we each played for a few days we went over to the players club desk to ask about comps and the woman had such an attitude, basically refusing to check and see if we'd earned a few dollars. She said we should just go to dinner and charge it to our room, and after we checked out, the players club would see about comping the meal. (seriously???) We then went to the poker room and told our story and were given the $9 of comps we earned there as well as a $20 food and beverage voucher to make up for the other lady being nasty to us. When we got up to the room we called the front desk to tell them about how disappointed we were with that woman and they offered $50 food and beverage credit, as well as 2 free spa entries. So, customer service isnt all that bad -- dont let one bad apple ruin the whole bunch. All in all, a pretty good experience. The thing is, unless we're staying at Aria again (which will take a really really sweet deal with resort credit), we probably wont visit again. no reason to walk all the way from the strip, through the overpriced mall, just to get to a bland, overpriced casino. The tram doesnt do much, since it's a longer walk to the back of bellagio or MC to reach the stations, than it is to simply walk straight up the path from the strip. Even though we enjoyed our stay, we'll probably aim for ventian, wynn or bellagio next time we want a luxury hotel. A few notes -- call the valet before you leave the room. if you take your ticket to the north valet, it'll take 20 minutes for them to get your car. Also, it's quicker to walk to monte carlo than to take the tram, which requires a 15 minute walk into Crystals just to access the "aria" station.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Hotel, staff needs more training all the way around.”
Reviews.Author: cksabbie
Reviews.Content: For such a nice hotel, check in experience was horrible, customer service lacked, room service was sketchy, room was poorly designed. Front Desk check in lines were extremely long at our check in time of 3:30pm. Our rooms were not ready we had (3). We came back an hour later and 2 of them still were not ready. Guest assistance woman walking around tried to assist us but could not get anywhere herself with the front desk staff. We finally had to go to Management. Room design was poor, could not find an electrical outlet by the beds to use for my fathers C-PAP machine, had to get extension cord. Can't find what buttons in room operates what lights, drapes squeeked loud when they moved, Confusing layout of entire building when walking in halls. Overall I would not pay any more that 70-100 for a night. Breakfast for 2 eggs and juice came to 80.00.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, fabulous dining, room hot as hell!”
Reviews.Author: lololas
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate to have been able to have access to the Invited Guests check in line or else I would have had to join the sea of people who were waiting in line to check in. Yikes! I don't know if all the flights arrive in Vegas at the same time or do people not know that at ARIA you can check in at any hour as long as they have a room available? Overall, the hotel is absolutely gorgeous--the design, the colors and textures. It was fun to walk around and be impressed by all the work that went into it. Absolutely, stunning! ROOMS The room was clean although there was debris on the floors of the wing not only where we were staying but also on the other floors where friends were staying on, which is why I did not rate cleanliness as excellent. I loved the set up of the shower and tub! I lamented not bringing bubble bath, but the shower gel worked nicely. The low point of our stay would have to be the temperature controls of the room. No matter how much we fiddled with it, the temperature never lowered than to what we requested. And it was very much 100 degree weather outside. We didn't figure this out until late the evening we stayed since we were out of the room all day. It was hot and miserable and made it difficult to sleep. POOL The pool area was comfortable and we enjoyed prompt and attentive cocktail service. FOOD We love food and dining out and the restaurants did not disappoint. Sure, the prices are high, but for the type of property it is ranked in the league of Wynn, Encore, and the Bellagio, what do you expect?? The prices of a food court or Outback? I don't think so! We ate at Julian Serrano for lunch one day (Yum!! Loved the red, white sangria and tried a bunch of dishes-- too many to name *blush*. Save room for the churros with spicy chocolate dipping sauce). For dinner did the tasting at Sirio for dinner (a great value given the portion size and the selection. also great service!!), and had breakfast at Silk Road at Vdara which is a five minute walk from the guest elevators. If you enjoy breakfast taken to the next level, you must check this out! On Sunday they have brunch. The blueberry ricota pancakes were heavenly and I still dream of eating them to this day!! VIVA ELVIS A fun show, not the original style of Cirque du Soliel show heavy on acrobatics, but enjoyable if you can appreciate dance. An energetic cast, the live band, and video footage of Elvis made it a fun night out. Ticket prices are on the higher end of other Cirque shows. As a hotel guest, you get a comp seat upgrade. SERVICE The staff we came in contact with had a pleasant demeanor. From the security stationed by guest elevators, the Concierge desk, Valet, I felt welcomed. Leading up to my visit and reading the reviews I have to say that it is unfortunate that one lapse of service delivered by one person mars the view of all of the staff. You can tell they take pride in what they do and there is genuine hospitality. Based on the experience I had, I would recommend critically sizing up the negative reviews. Some just vent and spew negativity without even indicating went wrong. My experience as a hotel guest at ARIA was a pleasant one and I would consider returning in a heartbeat. To stay or even just to eat!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean, Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: traveler1033_10
Reviews.Content: Amazingly clean. I'm very picky and travel with my own cleaning wipes and there was no need to at this hotel. The rooms are beautiful and very quiet. The pool has a great atmosphere and the casino was not very smokey. The food is pricey and although the buffet is good, the atmosphere reminded us of a cafeteria. The sfaff was wonderful. When we arrived on Sunday of the Memorial Day weekend we were disappointed how crowed the pool was, but our next 4 days were nothing but relaxing and quiet. We had no problems with checking in or out. We would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: nattrig
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice but it does not make up for the fact that the customer service is horrible. They have forgotten that the customer comes first. They also charge $30 a day per person to use the gym so if you're fitness minded...don't go here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kooleagels
Reviews.Content: My mom, me, and my brother went to the Aria for vacation. It is so gorgeous and nice. The rooms will take your breath away. The controls are easy, you can control from the remote and the monitor next to the beds. The goodnight button is awesome, just press the button and the curtains close, the lights go out, and the TV does too AWESOME. The staff is awesome nice and curtious very helpful. Always have your key card because you will need it a lot. The pool is fabulous and cool. Overall the rooms are nice. Don't pain attention to the comments about the rude staff, because they are not rude.

Reviews.Title: “More familiar and more fun second time around”
Reviews.Author: steeldoc
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Aria and it was actually a little easier and more enjoyable this time because ,frankly, we were more familiar with the physical layout of the hotel and surrounding properties. Whether it's by design or happenstance, I tend to get disoriented in some of these large properties. We only stayed for one day at our last visit . This time we were there for four nights . So we became more familiar with the location of the pool, gym, elevators, restaurants, tram, and the other hotels. in other words, i didn't get lost as much ! Also, the Aria doesn't really have a 7-11 type store where you can go and purchase convenience items, but we found a nice ABC store across the street at the Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile Shops. It shot up to about 106 degrees that weekend so we had to stock up on water to keep us hydrated. We found that the Monte Carlo is fairly close and they have some of the smaller denomination slots over there as well as a shopping area and McDonald's and Starbucks. It's always nice to walk through the Conservatory at the Bellagio and it's definitely easier to reach with the tram. One thing I noticed are the large numbers of young adults that dress up and party at these larger hotels on a Saturday night. It seemed that the casino was full of them and I can't believe that they were all staying at the hotel. Some were , probably, but I think most were just hanging out. Anyway, you can expect to see a huge influx of the hipsters on the weekend. I had more success at the tables on this trip as well as finding a good Blackjack machine to play on. Vegas is always good, it's better when you can make some money back ! Good luck .

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and can't wait to go back to the hotel and spa!”
Reviews.Author: LuvRingo
Reviews.Content: We really had a great time at Aria and we thought it was a beautiful hotel. It’s different in style and that’s a good thing. We thought the casino was beautiful – the darker woods and colors were beautiful. We thought the dealers were all friendly. All of the staff we encountered at the hotel was wonderful and very friendly. We will return to Aria in a heartbeat but in the meantime – I have my Aria pillow I bought to bring home to use on my Bellagio mattress. We miss the beds at Aria already - they were sooo comfortable! The pillows were amazing as well which is why I bought one. We did not have any problems finding our way around Aria and Crystals – the tram was very handy and we used it a lot. No problems with a splashing sink as people have complained in other reviews. We thought the touchscreen keypad was very easy to use and it was nice to not get out of bed to open the curtains to take in the view! Check in: Very smooth – no wait in line at 11am on a Wednesday. We were hoping to upgrade to a corner suite but nothing was available as the hotel was sold out Friday night but they had city view for $15 a night. I told the girl no thanks but she did give us a pool view. We got upstairs and the room was still dirty so we went back downstairs. There were people in all of the lines for check-in but we were put in short check-out line (there were people directing traffic at the lines) and we were able to get to a window within a few minutes. The girl apologized and comped our first night stay for the inconvience-we didn’t expect that at all – just a new room would have been fine with us. We had a deluxe room – beautiful view of the mountains. Loved our room, very comfortable and a nice size. I have worked in the service industry for years so a little mix up with the room didn't upset me at all - things happen! The Spa at Aria: AMAZING! I did the Vichy Body Experience and it was awesome. I had a pineapple/sugar body scrub and then the Vichy shower to rinse off. It was very relaxing and the therapist was awesome! All of the staff was very friendly and helpful. My husband got a day pass and came down to take advantage of the spa. We used the co-ed facilities together and split up to enjoy the other facilities. We enjoyed the Ganbanyoku beds – basically large marble surfaces with bamboo pillows (very comfy) and the marble was heated – it was so relaxing. We also liked the Shio Salt Room. You lay in chairs with headphones on and there is a control on the chair so that you can feel the vibrations of the music in the chair. We were in there for a good 30 minutes. After that we went to the 3rd floor infinity pool. It’s a small pool and is very warm. It looks out over Liquid so we watched the chaos that was Liquid and said it was nothing we would be interested in doing. We split up after that and went to sit in the roman style baths and the saunas. We took showers and met in the fire side lounge. This is a lounge in front of the gym (beautiful gym – I should have worked out) with a giant fireplace and very comfy couches to sit and read the newspaper. The gym was a very good size and so nice! I really should have used it! The day before we went to the Spa at Aria, we had massages at Qua – they were very disappointing. I wouldn’t go back to Qua but can’t wait to return to Aria!!! We LOVED the robes at the spa but they don’t sell them. I would have paid at least $100 for one of those robes – so comfortable. We really enjoyed the spa at Aria and my husband suggested we stay an extra day so he could go back to the spa for another day. Restaurants: Had the breakfast buffet one morning and it was so good! The service was fast, there were a lot of choices and the atmosphere was nice. I probably would have tried a dinner buffet if we had the time. Todd English Pub (technically in Crystals) – amazing! We went twice. The lobster rolls were so good – the flavor of the lobster was amazing. My husband had the chicken parm sliders and we split chicken wings – all were great. The 2nd time we went there he had the fish and chips and I had the prime rib from the carvery menu – soooo good! Pick a meat, pick a bread and pick 2 sauces and you build a sandwich at the table with all that yumminess. Dessert was by far the best thing we had our entire trip – a bread pudding with a toffee sauce, salted caramel ice cream (AMAZING) and captain crunch on top. So good! Pools: 3 decent sized pools, one that seemed more geared towards children, 3 hot tubs and then Liquid, the adult only pool. It was very easy to find a chair at the pool after 1pm and the cocktail waitresses were getting around the pool area quickly taking orders. The water felt great. Housekeeping: Everything was great. I left a $5 tip in an envelope each morning when we left the room and the room was always clean by the time we made it back to the room in early afternoon. The first morning after leaving the tip, the housekeeper even left me a note saying thank you and to enjoy our trip. Check out: Checked out at 5am and it was super easy. They still had to comp the one night off the room and that took about 2 minutes and I was out the door. Great service and everyone was friendly. Overall – we loved Aria and can’t wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Aria - Great hotel and great spa”
Reviews.Author: clp8413
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many Vegas hotels, we enjoyed our stay at Aria. The rooms are very modern and the hotel rooms run via touch panel. This was okay until I tried to simply flip a light switch and nothing happened! I would say the only drawback here is the tight fit of the bathroom and the door to the water closet that swings out to hit the person using the adjacent sink. However, with a little "dancing" around each other, you should be able to avoid any mishaps! We very much enjoyed the spa. Although no one there could explain why a couples' massage is $185 pp vs. $150 pp for an individual massage. Angelique was the masseuse that provided my massage and she was fantastic. Please ask for her, as she is a lifelong Las Vegas resident and very knowledgeable about the Strip scene. Fitness enthusiasts will love the new gym which has a great view. Plenty of shops, dining choices and architecture make Aria a gem of a place to stay. The staff was friendly and made sure that we received the resort credit that had been part of our package.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: terryjgardner
Reviews.Content: An excellent experience at this price is the Aria in City Center. The rooms are of the high quality one should expect in a town like Las Vegas where the tourist is King. The rooms greet the guest by name as they boot up when the guest arrives, remote and programmable controls for everything, and guests are remembered by the room from visit to visit. Classify the Aria as "modern" and "technological" as opposed to "swank". The hotel is connected to other hotels on the Strip, there is no need to venturing down to the pavement at all. Several excellent (and high-priced) restaurants are available, as well as some more casual fare. My favorite restaurant in several visits is Lemongrass (Thai), though the fettucini at Sirio was the best I've had in a long time. The casino is excellent; the sound of slot machines is muted by the design of the casino, no Circus-Circus experience here. This is definitely my hotel of choice for my weekly Las Vegas visits.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed at in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: fordphelps
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bedroom Aria Sky Suite and it was amazing. I was blown away when we pulled up the the beautiful hotel, there was staff there to help us and point us in the direction of the check in. After we checked in, the elevator wipped us up the the 37 floor. When we entered the gorgeous room, it greeted us by opening the curtains, fading on the lights, and turning on some music. The bed was EXTREMELY comfortable and probable the best sleep I ever got was in it. The one-touch remote of the room was very helpful because I did not have to get out of bed to turn off the lights in the bathroom, powder room, and living room. The maid service was outstanding and folded all my clothes and put them away for me, even thought I didn't. I called for a roll-away bed the first day and it was up in my room in less then 5 minutes. I have no complaints of anything of the hotel at all, it was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! I had to write a review...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! I had to write a review since I saw a lot of poor reviews. Hotel was amazing....cheap for the quality, restaurants were great, service was good and overall we had a great experience. If you're having second thoughts because of bad reviews, don't! Btw, the breakfast buffet thru the week is GREAT and only $15 (not including drinks though)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Aria - did not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: TriedTestedTrue
Reviews.Content: First time back in Vegas after years and wanted to stay here since its brand new and I have to say, I was not disappointed! When you enter, you are welcomed by a large, open space check in area with bright sky lights and a wonderful hint of vanilla (that I actually miss now that I'm home). The check in was about 10 mins and we walked thru the casino to the guest elevators, proceeded to our room via the speedy elevators. Our room was a King size, non smoking room and it was bright and facing the strip and city centre with a great view to see all the bright lights. The touch pad was so easy to use and you have the option of using regular light switches if you are technically challenged. We didn't hear a sound at night from the other suites and more importantly, even walking thru the casino and throughout the hotel, not once could you smell the smoke! It was amazing. The restaurants are a little more on the upper end, but we are not buffet lovers and so the alternative to eat and dine in peace was great. From the lazy days at the pool, to the pastries and gelato @ JP patiserrie, to Union restaurant, our experience exceeded our expectations and we will most definitely be back again and again. Give ARIA a chance, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: maureenandmark
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews about the terrible check-in process, but figured that since we wouldn't be checking in until around midnight, this wouldn't be a problem. I was wrong--even in the middle of the night, the line was a mess, and the staff seemed overwhelmed. The man who checked us in was pleasant--we did the $20 sandwich trick and he told us we would be upgraded to a city view room and given a $50 room credit. Great. So, we get to our first room, and it is a city view, but it's also a smoking, double-bed city view--we had requested a king non-smoking. It reeked of smoke, and the kicker was that there were still bachelorette party balloons in the room from the last party. My husband called the front desk to complain and was informed that smoking/bed assignments are a REQUEST, not a guarantee and that actual assignments are at the hotel's discretion. Um, thanks, nothing like making your guests feel special. After much negotiation, they finally agreed to move us to a king smoking room (there were no other non-smoking rooms available) So, room 2...(drumroll please)...is a double, smoking, city view room. In other words, the EXACT room they put us in in the first place, just 10 floors down. Once again, my husband called the front desk to complain, was put on hold for 30 minutes, and then was promptly hung up on. Fearful that I'll have to come up with bail for my husband if he goes to the front desk, I instead go down to complain. After waiting in line for another 30 minutes (it's 2:00 a.m. by this point), I finally explain the situation once again and am promised this time that we will at least get a king bed. So, I go up to the new room (Room 3, for those of you keeping count), try the key and...nothing. The room key doesn't work. At this point we're both exhausted and I'm on the verge of tears--I pick up the house phone and call the front desk, who informs us that we need to talk to security. After being on hold waiting for security for 30 minutes...I get hung up on again. I call back and (I'm usually a very nice person, btw) absolutely freak out on the person who answers, who takes it upon herself to call security up to our room. After another 20 minutes of sitting outside the room with all our luggage, the security guard shows up, and we're finally, finally in our hotel room. So...yay. Long story even longer, we were given a $100 room credit for our troubles and they promised to call us the next day to move us to a non-smoking room. We were there for 3 nights. Never got a phone call. After the initial nightmare experience, though, we actually had a wonderful time. We're not big gamblers, so I can't really tell you what the casino was like, but the hotel itself is like nothing else in Vegas--it's beautiful in an understated, elegant way, and the architecture, design, and layout is incredible. We spent 5 hours the first day at the Liquid pool, and it was heaven--amazing service, relaxed atmosphere, and delicious food and drink. It was pricey, but nothing in Vegas comes cheap. We had breakfast one morning at the Jean-Philippe Patisserie (oh my god the Nutella brioche), and a pretty decent late night snack at the 24-hour cafe, but we did most of our eating off-site, so I'm not really qualified to review the restaurants. In all, we got a very good deal with our AmEx card (around $80 a night) so I'm satisfied with our stay there, headaches and all. But, I would caution anyone considering paying full-price for the 5-star experience to stay somewhere else--the Bellagio is comparable and is better situated on the strip. We had a blast in Vegas, and will definitely be coming back, but not to the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “City Center is epic, Aria is riding its coattails”
Reviews.Author: lestarvinmarvin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is splendid because it is new. Everything (especially the bed) felt new and comfortable. The room had a central remote to control everything (such as the curtains) which was a nice touch. The location of the hotel is really perfect. Some people think just because a hotel is on the strip, the location is perfect. But that's for people who haven't stayed at the Wynn/Encore or Mandalay and drove the strip during traffic trying to get to a show on the other side. City Center is at the prime spot of the strip. The stores and restaurants both have inspiring renovations. If you haven't stayed here before, you must give it a try! My only complaint is that self parking and the hotel rooms are so far from each other, and a bit confusing.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT ARIA”
Reviews.Author: Truert
Reviews.Content: service was very poor !! Rooms were not clean till we returned and had to make special request to clean rooms in the evening. Food was expensive however eating at the buffet was $30 for dinner but they had good quality and huge selection of different cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: stan2010d
Reviews.Content: It's my second time in vegas and my first stay at the aria. I booked online with priceline for 125 per night. On arrival at check in I asked if I could be upgraded to the cityview room (normally 25 extra), the gentleman behind the desk Alex decided to upgrade my room for FREE. As I ended my room on the 14th floor, I found the suite to be modern and refined. The bed is the best bed I've ever slept on. The bathroom was large and clean, plus the bath tub was awesome. The electronics systems were okay, but I did not have too much time to play with it, but I found it relatively simple to use. The view of the stip from the room was amazing. Loved the idea of security guards at entrance to the elevators. Also very friendly and helpfull staff. The room was quite and easy to sleep in. I would highly recommend stay at the Aria to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: e_yelverton
Reviews.Content: For a weekend getaway my husband and I decided to stay at Aria for the location on the strip and the expectation of having all that we need available in one hotel. After all this was part of "city center". What we found was a decent room, ok view (upgraded), and overpriced dining facilities. Had better buffets elsewhere for the price. Had better breakfasts elsewhere again for the price. The room service menu choices was poor, overpriced. Be aware there are no familiar "food court" eateries. Not even a STARBUCKS!!! You'll have to leave the "city center" for this. If not, then you're at their mercy. What place doesn't include the cream cheese with the bagel? What place gives you 6 chicken drummets (lollypops) for $12? If gambling and expensive bars and restaurant is what you look for then this is your cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, modern, and techie rooms still a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: Cheapo_From_Berkeley
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights sharing my room with a 30+ year college friend. Rooms are very nice, pretty big, and very high tech. The bed and linens are very, very comfortable. I really enjoyed playing with the TV remote to control all the lighting, curtains, and temp. in the room. You can also do it with the touch screen clock at bed side. Three of the light bulbs in the bathroom where not working (still plenty of light generally) but the maid didn't seem to notice so I called it in and they were fixed when I came back to the room. Also the wireless phone handset didn't seem to work, you could only use it in speaker phone mode (there was a regular phone which worked fine). While not on the Strip, one can take a tram or walk (only about 700ft outside too) to the Bellagio. Their Spa was $30/day and really nice -- good workout equip. plus the usual sauna, steam room, dunking pools, and a "salt" room and a "rock" room for relaxing. I left on a late flight so I actually spent a few hours in the gym working out and the spa area relaxing and reading. The pools are nice but none seem to be deeper than 4 feet at any point. They have/had great rates (occupancy seemed high but Vegas was packed in general and they are not yet very well known nor are they really a Strip location). However, it is only the initial room rate that was low. Everything else is very expensive from $4 coffee at their coffee and pastry shop to about $25 basic breakfast with tax and tip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: kittykatla
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly, and the rooms are really great. We had a sky loft room so I dont know how the regular room are. The pools are family freindly but not too loud and crazy. Very relaxing. The beds are awsome!!!! The only downside is that they have very few quarter slots, there mare lots of dollar and penny though. I would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Give 'em 90%”
Reviews.Author: atineb3
Reviews.Content: The Aria is a pretty new hotel on the Strip, part of a complex called City Center. I had a birthday celebration there with ten friends and all went fairly well. It is a beautiful new place (some of the hotels on the Strip really are showing their age), beautiful rooms, bathrooms, flat screens and wonderful beds. But it is also huge and there were some glitches in terms of registration -- getting the right kinds of room (that is, non-smoking), not having access to rooms during a normal check-in time, cleaning etc. Having said that, the hotel did its best to compensate inconvenience with comps and perks and the like.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best - not the worst”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Pher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria for a conference for work, so the decision about where to stay was made for me and the cost wasn't a factor because it was paid by work. The rooms were nice. Generally functional and felt large. The automation was nice, but several of the lights didn't work and one of the light fixtures in the bathroom was falling out of the ceiling. After a week, I still hadn't mastered the remote control and I'm a techie! My roommate decided that it wasn't worth the effort to try. The staff was remarkably friendly, but we had repeated problems with housekeeping: never replaced the complementary mouthwash, didn't leave any hand towels one day, and didn't vacuum for several days. Ordered a medium-rare hamburger at the cafe and got a piece of charcoal. I didn't have time to wait for a new burger, but the manager did refill by beer at no charge. There's a tram to the Bellagio, but the walk to the tram stop was almost as long as the walk to the Bellagio itself! Overall, a mixed bag. It wasn't unpleasant to stay there, but I would have been upset if I had been paying out of my own pocket. I won't be staying at Aria for my next trip unless they make me a great offer on my room. Even then, I'll probably head to one of the properties at Mandalay Bay or the Wynn/Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Big Hotel--An Architectural and Design Statement Inside and Out”
Reviews.Author: BigBrion
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about some of the reviews concerning service at this fairly new hotel but we found it to be excellent, with a friendly and helpful staff. It may be that due to the size of the hotel, it will just take longer to iron out service glitches. Our room was a beautiful corner suite of modern yet welcoming design chock full of great electronic gadgetry.
