How the heck are we suppose to get all our stuff out of our room and move into the new room? Seriously?! Seriously! I gave them 1 star for the fact that they did finally change us to a room with 2 beds on Saturday. And the other star was for the really nice bed they have. Overall - VERY poor. I'm a professional meeting planner, therefore, have stayed in numerous hotels throughout the U.S. and by far, this is the worst service I've encountered, and I will never return!

Reviews.Title: “WORST customer service I have ever received. Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: tmamajdogg
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have experienced in Vegas. It is beautiful inside, and the rooms are very nice, but the HORRIBLE customer service ruins the trip. I specifically asked for two queen beds upon purchasing the room, and they ensured me this would be fine. However, the front desk would only give me 1 King bed. It took ten minutes of a very nice argument between me and the front desk until the "magically" had 2 queens. I waited in line 20 minutes, yes 20, to even be able to check-in. It was a Friday- they should be prepared for a large group. My bill came back with the wrong charge and every single time I call the front desk I get put on hold for 20 minutes, yes again, 20 minutes. The accounting department is LITERALLY the rudest group of people I have ever spoken to. The people that work here are rude, and it is not that nice of a hotel. There is one late night restaurant, and you have to wait about 30 minutes to sit down, yet there are about 50 open tables. This does not make any sense. They have one small cafe with sandwiches, and every single time we tried to go there (4 different times), they were out of every sandwich they have on the menu- the only serve sandwiches!!!! Seriously? HORRIBLE. ALso, did I mention the servers at both places were horribly rude?! DO NOT STAY here.

Reviews.Title: “They need to figure out a LOT of things”
Reviews.Author: madmadcat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria for 3 nights, with my husband. The impression at the arrival is the one of being in an airport. Large, cold, lobby. Very little help with the bags (that I would have appreciated). The bad service started right away, at check in. Since I was in LV for business I checked in first, and he joined me later. While I was in line waiting for a check in counter to free up (by myself, with one large bag and one carry on), two men went directly in line behind someone who was checking in, bypassing the line and stepping in front of me. The staff person who is supposed to direct people checking in, saw everything and didn't say a word. When the two moved forward to the closest open check in desk I gave an eloquent look at the staff person, who told me "oh, but one will free up right away". I replied that i thought it was his job to make sure stuff like that didn't happen. He shrugged and didn't even apologize. The room is elegant and clean, I wasn't bothered by the glass separating the WC area, but I found that the shower/tub area is too big and uncomfortable. I don't want echo in my shower! The decor is a little impersonal, looking more like an upscale business hotel than a LV hotel. But maybe it was intentional. The room service did a good job with the cleaning, but didn't fill up the ice bucket at turndown, and I find the music they play in the room in the evening is cheesy and not adequate to the class of the hotel (would you believe the collection is called "waiting room?!" I heard better at my dentist's office). Turning it off with the complex in-room control system isn't easy either. It took me a whole song of Kenny G before I figured it out. The options for breakfast are very poor. Unless you go at Cafe Vettri (the service is slow, the food ok, but nothing great), there are only two coffee shops where the lines are unbelievably long. The first day took 40 minutes to get a coffee and a pastry. Did they realize the hotel has 4004 rooms? The second day we went to the pool, thinking that we could get at least a coffee there. The pool is beautiful, nothing to say about that, but the waitress can only serve you drinks. No food nor coffee. For coffee (they don't have milk, so don't try to ask for a latte) or food one can either sit at the Breeze (slow slow service, and only in the shade), or has to go to a special "take out area" behind the Breeze, where two poor waiters try to do their best, but they're totally clueless. Someone has to explain to me why they can't have a food menu at the pool, served right there, like in every other LV hotel. The casino is dark, loud and depressing. There are very few tables and the slots are badly organized. The color schema isn't great and not festive. The lighting is bad, and the music is different in the different areas of the casino, often creating a very disturbing noise. Apparently the management likes Madonna's greatest hits, too. On Sunday we woke up at 6:30 because some loud noises. It sounded like someone was doing some plumbing work in the floor above us. After a late night, it wasn't the most pleasant experience. We found out what the noises were when my husband came out from the bathroom to find two guys washing the window of the room . The noises were due to the window washer platform hitting the building. Of course, the clients weren't notified, and I still wonder why the windows have to be cleaned at 6 am...On a SUNDAY morning....IN VEGAS. We opted for the self check out, to avoid the long lines, and the internet connection was billed twice each day (how does that happen?). Beware of the fact that the way the charges are displayed on the TV makes very difficult to spot stuff like that. A call to the front desk fixed it and we could proceed with the check out. Overall, in LV, for that price, you can find better places. We won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked the Aria!”
Reviews.Author: ratodino
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in late March. I read all the reviews on here before we went, so had a pretty good idea of what to expect. We like technology and we like trying new places when we travel, so Aria fit the bill. We arrived around 4pm on a Saturday. Check in was not terribly busy and they had one woman on duty directing people to different lines to keep things moving. It took maybe 5 minutes to get checked in. Front desk clerk was all business-not one friendly greeting or any chit chat, but she took care of business quickly and efficiently, showed us where to go on a map and we were done. You do walk through part of the casino to get to the room elevators, but that's the norm at a lot of the places we have stayed before. Elevators are grouped by floor number, so there was never a long wait for the elevator to arrive. It was pretty cool when we walked into the room and it did it's little show for us-lights coming on, drapes opening, music playing. We had a mountain view room on floor 36. Not a bad view, but nothing spectacular either. Would have liked more of a strip view, but didn't luck into any upgrade. Our windows were dirty with a lot of spots on the outside glass, but I never really noticed it after the first time that we walked right up to the window to check out the view. I really liked the decor of the room. Lots of chocolate brown and white- modern, but not too much. We had fun with the remote that controls the room. It is very easy to figure out, but I did shut off the bathroom lights a few times on my husband by accident. It is a little slow to respond, so don't hit too many buttons at once. The casino was very nice-LOTS of craps tables which is our favorite game. Also able to find $5 tables quite often which was a nice surprise. Lighting in the casino is low, but I loved the atmosphere. Always seemed very friendly and classy at the same time. Ate at Cafe Vetro and also at the buffet. Service was very good at both places. Buffet was best value for breakfast. Our only complaint about this hotel was the cost of food if you wanted something quick and simple. There really wasn't any place that you could get any type of meal for less than $40 for two. We would walk over to the food court at the Monte Carlo quite often for a quick bite at Subway, etc. It was only about a 5 minute walk through the hotel corridors. If you just need a cup of coffee in the morning, there is a short line at the front candy shop-the line up front in the morning goes on forever, but it's really several lines all going to different areas. You have to look for the coffee line. The pool was just opening the week we were there and we went out and looked at it and walked around the area. It was very nice. Lots of little areas where you could relax, lots of palm trees, and several different hot tubs. All the employees that we saw stopped to say hello and see if we needed anything. I was impressed with the level of service in all areas other than the first lady at the front desk. When it's time to check out, you can do it in your room with the TV remote (not the big master remote). We got all the way to the end, were able to see all room charges (which were all correct) and then we got an error message. So we went to the front desk to check out-very busy, so we waited in line about 15 minutes. When we got to the desk, she said we were already checked out, so not sure what the glitch was in the system, but it was all o.k. Overall, we really liked the hotel. Liked the central location, good service, attractive rooms and casino, etc. Would go back unless something else new catches our eye.

Reviews.Title: “It lacks the personal touch...”
Reviews.Author: Mertuil71
Reviews.Content: The Aria is big, really big and I did not feel like I mattered as a customer. There was absolutely no personal touch to our stay. It was a pleasant enough hotel, but given the price we paid, I expected Nordstrom level service. Our flight was delayed so we called ahead to let the hotel know we were going to arrive late. The person on the phone was very polite, but there was no reason to call ahead. There was a long line when we arrived and instead of the call ahead easing our check in, we had to wait while they found the room we reserved, we were at the window for nearly 15 minutes. The room was nice enough, it was the view we paid for. If you get a strip view room, make sure that you aren't above the lighted fountain, the curtains don't block out the light flashes. The beds are comfortable, the amenities are plush although this is not a room to share with people because the bathroom is only for one person at a time. The brunch buffet is very good, although our waitress was slow to refill coffee and juice. The walk to the strip is not bad, and the proximity to the Cirque shows (including one being at the hotel) was its best selling point.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah475
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a corner suite and I think some of the negative reviews here are a bit exaggerated. The hotel is MODERN - if you don't want modern, stay somewhere else. This is the major theme - lots of glass and sculptural elements - and obviously the place cost a vast amount of money. Are there some kinks, yes, but I think they are minor for the most part. Pros: Rooms are nicely decorated - spacious, very comfortable bed which is ultra soft like a cloud. May not suit someone who likes a firmer mattress. We got free internet and recommend upgrading to a corner suite, it wasn't much more money. Housekeeping came in 2x per day - room was always made up and clean towels. Make sure to turn off the 'privacy' button on the door otherwise they wil not come in. And don't expect them to do it fast, leave them an hour or 2 to do it. We always got turn down service, chocolates and nice music at night. Pool areas are lovely, always space, not loud music and nice pools. Restaurants are pretty good - buffet is good for brunch but the lines can be very long so get there before 10.30 am. On the weekdays they change over to lunch at 11am which is definitely not as good unless you like crablegs. Try Cafe Vettro for all day breakfast and the food was excellent both times we went there. For more expensive food the steakhouse was great, American Fish was 'ok'. Casino is not really that dark - you can see fine so not sure why people are complaining about it. It was quieter than the Bellagio at night, less crowds but still a good atmosphere. There is a safe in the room - use it to put your valuables in - it is never a good idea to leave cash or smaller valuables out in the open in any hotel. The tram that runs to the Motecarlo and the Bellagio is so great - fabulous idea. Those 2 hotels have more fun slot machines and it was nice to try different places. There is also a Starbucks in the Monte Carlo if you want one. There is a CVS close by the Aria to stock up on water etc. Check in was absolutely fine, 15 minutes on a Saturday evening. They were nice and there was a supervisor on the floor monitoring it all - so they are trying to fix the reported issues. There was always a line at the concierge though, not sure why. For check out - you can do it from your room under 'folio' - much easier and faster. Cons: The rooms need to be cleaned more throughly - there was dust on the table tops and on the floor - not a big deal but seems like the housekeeping was maybe a little too fast. However it was still ok. The walls were quite thin, as in most hotels. We could hear our neighbors mostly through the vent system. It wasn't too loud but a little annoying in the middle of the night. There seems to be a problem with the vent systems - 2x a day in the morning and at night a strong smell of cooking came through the vents in our bedroom. It didnt last more than 15 minutes, but was very strange and they need to fix this. The sinks are badly designed, Very pretty but the splashing is ridiculous. Don't wear anything nice while you are washing your hands - you get sprayed. Plus this must be a a nightmare for housekeeping. I know they can't replace 4000 sinks at this point, but seriously, who put those in??? The Hotel is not poorly laid out, but there needs to be more maps around. And the signage is a litte small. Once you get the hang of it, it's quite easy. Yes there is alot of walking but this is vegas people! The Crystals mall, while beautiful is so full of high end stores only high rollers can shop there. Such a shame - they need to get more of a mix of stores like the Venetian. There is no place to buy newspapers, water, etc. They need one of those. Overall we had a great time, dont let the bad reviews put you off. Was it perfect? No but it was a very good experience and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “over charged acounts”
Reviews.Author: sweatpea13
Reviews.Content: Always check your account on TV monitor in your room. We had items from the pool bar charged to our room. We sorted this out whilst there but on our return home I find we have be charged on our Credit Card, the response from the Aria in getting this matter cleared up is extremely poor. It may be a modern state of the art hotel but obviously there is a blip on the system somewhere. No I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Casino vanilla scent is way too strong and caused me to have an allergic reaction!”
Reviews.Author: CH1CK
Reviews.Content: Visually Aria is stunning as it is both modern and beautiful. Plus, the technology in the rooms was bar none. The lights, curtains, room privacy settings, alarm clock and more, could all be controlled via the flat screen TV or by using a bedside touch screen device. Important to note is how thin the walls are in the resort. We could hear our neighbors doing what people do in Vegas. We could also hear people in their rooms as we walked down the hallway. This is a brand new development so I expected higher quality materials and construction. Very disappointing - not to mention we were embarassed for those people. So, I rated the rooms as average even though the technology and interior design were amazing. I will NEVER stay there again. Apparently they were having a problem with a sewage smell wafting from pipes that run under the casino, and instead of fixing the problem at its source they flooded the casino and Crystal’s shopping center with an extremely strong vanilla perfume scent. It was overwhelming to the point where it was unbearable and unpleasant. Unfortunately, I had an allergic reaction to it and ended up having to go to a different casino to gamble and shop. Fortunately, the aforementioned scent, or stench at this point, was not pumped into the resort hallways or rooms. Thank goodness or we would have been forced to change our reservations and stay at a different resort all together. I am disappointed that we cannot return to Aria or Crystal’s unless I want to suffer from severe allergies again because it is a beautiful casino and resort with many amazing restaurants. We ate at Bar Mesa, Sage, and Jullian Serrano. All of which were amazing EXCEPT for the overwhelming vanilla stench forced on patrons while they ate. We wanted give them a fair chance and try out several services before leaving, but eventually we had to leave due to the fact we have to breathe to survive. I have been home for two days and symptoms of my allergies are nearly gone but the disappointment of not being able to enjoy other services provided by Aria will stay with me for a long time as we travel to Las Vegas one to two times a year. We have enjoyed staying at the Bellagio and MGM Signature Towers several times without any allergy issues, or any other issues for that matter. If Aria reformulates their signature scent and lessens the amount they pump into the air then I will visit them again, but if not then I will NEVER set foot in Aria or Crystal’s ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed.. Haze Club was awful”
Reviews.Author: jolie714
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice because the hotel is new but overall I was not impressed. Their choice for decor is not modern and I'm surprised that they chose that scheme. The layout of the hotel is confusing. We were walking around for late night food and couldn't find anything besides the coffee shop in the front of the hotel. The casino floor felt gloomy and depressing. I was the most disappointed with the Haze nightclub. The bouncers were rude and the bartender ripped me off. They all charge customers whatever they want. I paid 4 different prices for the same drinks all night. The layout of the club was bad and the VIP room upstairs was small and narrow. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel for the price and compared to other competitors in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Huge Hotel...with some downsides”
Reviews.Author: westcoastvangirl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other Vegas Hotels....Bellagio, Venetian, Wynn and I would say that the entrance, lobby, restaurants, Crystal Mall, are all very impressive. Check-in was fine. Getting into the room was fine. Pretty cool to be greeted by an automatic opening of the curtains and all the lights being turned on. CONS - why do you charge $30 to use their ipod connector? if you would like to play your ipod in your room while you get ready, bring an A/V cable, otherwise be prepared to pay. - there are no real practical towel racks in the bathroom. And why frosted glass? If you are sharing a room with more than 2 people...it is slightly awkward to say the least. And what is about Vegas hotels with bathrooms without a fan option? LOL - the entertainment system is impressive, but the light switches & technology are a bit difficult to figure out. they should have an "easy start" menu or material...trust me, even we were confused still after 3 days. - housekeeping woke us up at 8:30 am :( however, they did a great job. - Breeze cafe by the pool is sub-par unfortunately PROS - the pool is gorgeous and has a great calm scene. music isn't too loud. - the frozen blended mojitos are to die for! - it isn't "that" far from the strip...maybe a 10 min walk out of the entrance - very easy to grab cabs - convenient pharmacy/grocery store inside the hotel - Tod English PUB & many other graet restaurants - they serve ceasars! - awesome beds...! We were on a girls trip, so we loved the luxury of the hotel and the immense size, however, i do think that the glitches bring it down a notch.

Reviews.Title: “very good, still working out some kinks”
Reviews.Author: db1337
Reviews.Content: Aria is a beautiful hotel and resort. I am not sure how much of a fan I am of City Center, there's a lot of steel and glass and it's set far enough back from the strip that it feels out of place. However, the interior of Aria is really quite nice, and the rooms are also quite nice. Service is pretty good, all of the staff works as fast as they can and as hard as they can to take care of your needs. Beds were very comfortable and I slept very well. I recommend Aria. I think it's a nice place. I am going to list a bunch of minor "rough around the edges" things though, I think they will improve in these areas as the hotel continues to settle into full operations. Minor issues: - sign to the ice machine pointing the wrong way - when the sun hits the hotel, there is a lot of expansion on the outside, creates a loud banging noise every 30-60 minutes - blackout drapes don't close fully - concierge for some reason is not available after a certain time... I tried to make a dinner reservation, calling at 8:30 and was told the concierge was closed for the day... there were still staff at the desk though, during checkin there were no concierge staff available to help at 11:30pm (five star resort in a 24 hour town should have a 24 hour concierge) - rooms are already getting a bit rough around the edges, the hotel's decor has things like a glass centerpiece on a glass tabletop, this gets moved by guests and staff and ends up scratching the tabletops up... small wear issues like this are starting to be apparent that could have been circumvented with a bit of planning - included transportation for the Sky Suites did not show up to pick me up at the airport Other things that I felt were awkward: - the VIP rooms (Sky Suites) don't have immediate access to taxi cabs, but the regular suites do... taxi cabs cannot come into the Sky Suites entrance, so unless you take a limo you can't get to the door, but have to check in at the far end of the hotel, and then truck your stuff all the way over... this makes zero sense, but I guess they are planning to transfer you with their limo (in my case the limo did not show)... even so this is a convenience issue that makes getting around town and back a bit more of a hassle for guests staying in the more expensive suites (makes little sense to do this) - the hotel makes a big deal of how the suites recognize guests the first time and turn everything on and open the blinds for you... well if you check in at night, this means you have to run around turning off TVs and music (in my case three of them), closing blinds, turning off lights... everything is computerized and the controls are laggy, so you press buttons, nothing happens, press again and you cancel the previous action which was just slow - there is a connectivity panel on the TVs allowing you to jack in a music player... trying to do this just resulted in blank screens... built in music selections have no electronic music or hiphop, you're fine if you like rock n roll and such though - hotel left a little greeting note, though I checked in as a "Mr." and was in their system as such, they addressed me as "Ms." ... no big deal, but it kind of defeats the purpose of a "personalized" note The room service food was good, the two restaurants I tried (Blossom and Lemongrass) were adequate but not stellar. Lemongrass is Thai and served bland food (waiter forgot to ask how spicy, we forgot to mention, Thai by default should have some zing). Blossom was better but didn't feel like it was worth the expense of $200 for dinner for two. Basically, Aria is trying, and these rough spots I think will smooth out over time. It's overall a beautiful hotel and staff work hard, and those are the most important things. These details brought to their attention I think will be dealt with. I give Aria two bonus points, one they gave me a good food and beverage credit to make up for the missing airport pickup, and they include internet in the suites. More 5* hotels should do this. It makes sense instead of nickel and dimeing the guests.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: conrad55
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe all the negative reviews! I brought my two daughters for my youngest's 21st bday. We had a FABULOUS time from the moment we arrived at Aria. Our room was ready and waiting for us (arrived around 1 pm), waited maybe 5 minutes in line to check in. We were on the 51st floor overlooking the strip, upgraded to a deluxe city view room. It was absolutely beautiful, everything worked, we had the best housekeeping service, I honestly cannot find one thing to complain about! We enjoyed the pools for 3 days, service was great, every single employee we encountered was friendly and helpful. Don't stay away from Aria.. it's definitely a little bit of paradise... !

Reviews.Title: “Nice But $$$$”
Reviews.Author: Davet22
Reviews.Content: We received Players Club invitation email for May visit; paid $122/night (includes taxes) and received $50 Free Play. Used Bell Trans shared shuttle ($24 round trip for 2), which worked very well. Note: shuttles drop off underneath Aria at its Tour Lobby. That was okay on arrival, however, it took us about 15 minutes to locate again at departure as we received 4 incorrect directions before security dude got us there. BTW, Southwest TSA was jammed around 2 PM. Fortunately add'l agents arrived to allow fairly quick entry. Back to Aria. The room was very nice...technology was neat ! That said, everything's expensive...costs more that our budget allows. We ate at $$ cafes on the Strip and spent our big bucks on Jersey Boys show, which I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very hi-tech, comfortable and stylish”
Reviews.Author: chef082
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aria over the weekend. The hotel is gigantic, new, shiny, and fun. Things I liked: - Touch screen rooms that control everything - Express Check out - Lots of storage for clothing - The Buffet restaurant (probably the best breakfast buffet I have ever had) - Bell man brought ice up with the bags without being asked, very nice touch - Casino was very new Problems: - Air freshener in lobby was very strong - Sleeping pillows touch/rest on the comforter after room is made up (this is not supposed to happen) - 3 pools, each a bit small, very crowded on weekends - Shower/bath combo a bit wierd, but sinks splash everywhere - Internet is $15/day, for a hi-tech hotel, this is behind the times - Walk to room is very very far Somehow this hotel, being as great as it is, is missing something. I can't explain it.. It feels like I am within gigantic masses of concrete over the entire property. This makes it cold. Overall would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful beds”
Reviews.Author: WorldTrvler22
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend stay at the Aria hotel. Pros: 1. It smells amazing in this hotel. Almost good enough to drown out the ever-present cigarette smell on all Vegas casino floors 2. We found the staff incredibly friendly and efficient. They did their best to get one of our rooms available to us before check-in (we arrived early) and were very accomodating. 3. Decent at Jean Philippe and good food at Cafe Vettro 4. The remote control rooms are very cool and the bed was amazingly comfortable (if you like super plush beds). Cons 1. The service we received at P.U.B was very slow. 2 1/2 hours for lunch? The food was decent. 2. The Crystals shopping area was beautiful, but small. Just a handful of very high end stores. For real shopping it is still best to head to Caesars or the outlet mall. Overall I thought our stay here was great. We usually stay at the Venetian, but thought we would give the new place a try. Still like the location of the Venetian better, but would definitely return/recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment re: ARIA”
Reviews.Author: rkotowski
Reviews.Content: Request for room near elevator due to wife’s broken foot boot, 75402082, could not be found during check in; 3230 was a significant walk. The $234 room was small and did not compare to less expensive Palazzo suite. WiFi charge is $15/day; saw a Motel 6 sign on Tropicana offering free WiFi. TV/Room controls malfunctioned for first four days. Valet over 30 minute wait; attendent said ticket “didn’t get put in right.” No soap dish or hand hold in shower. Sink design not convenient. Concierge was great; except for the comment that the Wifi charge was for the convenience of not having to drive to the Motel 6 parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: DeniseEsquire
Reviews.Content: The entire City Center complex is an amazing. The architecture and art alone make it worth the stay. We had a corner suite facing the strip. Floor to ceiling windows on three sides of the living/bath/bedroom/powder room. We found the touch screen controls for the drapes, lights, tv, etc. very easy to use after a few minutes of trial and error. Service was great - we wanted for nothing. In fact, after leaving a drawer-ful of clothes behind, everything was shipped back to me at no charge after a simple phone call. The small decorative details in both the hotel and casino (wall coverings, fixtures, lighting) give Aria a very modern, but warm feeling. The casino was also very upscale and nicely laid out - a bit dark (which I personally like). The only possible shortcoming may have been that our window facing the strip desperately needed a wash (although we did see a team of window washers working all five days). There is also a vanilla scent pumped into the casino which friends loved but I found a little cloying. The patisserie outside the main elevator bank was a fabulous choice for a less expensive breakfast or lunch than Cafe' Vettro (which was also very good - great omelettes). The pool area was average for Vegas but still nice. Several pools to choose from. Don't accidentally order the one-pound hotdog. Cool hotel. Would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay again”
Reviews.Author: jzmes
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 days in Las Vegas at the Aria. Positives: beautiful space, super quiet room, great central location with eay access to Monto Carlo restaurants andtheir fantastic pub with more than 50 draft beers, delux room which had a wonderful view through wall size windows, elaborate technical controls in the room to control temperature, positions of curtains, lights, etc, large tub in bathroom with high pressure water, high quality bed with 6 or so pillows, elegant furnishings, easy electronic checkout, polite room cleaning staff, the hotel itself filled with expensive tile flooring, great air circulation so smoke not smelled from cigarettes or cigars, top of the line pools with extensive landscaping and warm water, pastries in the coffe shop area beautiful and made with quality ingred ents, . Negatives: Crystles Shopping Center (attached to the hotel) pretty much for very high rollers but stores pretty to look at, very nice restaurants though some very expensive, hotel buffet probably 1/2 as nice as the one at Bellagio for the same price, room electronics complicated and it would help to have a clear written guide of how to use them, lack of a good walking map of the hotel (it is a hugh place) in the room (apparently one is available from the concierge but always a line there), inconvenient arrival by shuttle bus from the airport to the poorly lit basement and no clear directions to the registration area, room bed possibly too soft for those who need harder surface for back support. Summary: a fantastic hotel that is very unique and offers a one-of-a kind experience. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay !”
Reviews.Author: myriade_qc
Reviews.Content: I have to say we were a bit nervous after reading the reviews about the Aria. And from the begining to the end of our stay (5 nights overall), nothing could have been better. We asked for an upper room, so they gave us one on the 51 floor. one word : AMAZING . View of the mountains, curtains opening while we first arrived in the room. I mean, we didnt pay an extra or anything for that, it just have been that way everyday. Housekeeping was perfect, they even did the room twice a day without asking. Were a couple in young 30's, techno savy's, we used our computer, wireless was really fast. We definitly enjoyed the touch screen. I can understand thought why some people didnt like that, could easily imagine my mother being lost with all that technology, but for us it was really convenient. Jean-Philippe at the first floor does the best pastrys, perfect for breakfast too. Try the ham and cheese croissant. Didnt think Aria's restaurants was that interesting thought. Theres a lot of choices in Vegas ! Pool area is just great, relaxing, lots of room. We enjoyed the casino as well, trendy, well kept, excellent blackjack tables. We visited around most hotels of the strip and would not go back elsewhere. ARIA is just perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: cheryleb99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 4 days and enjoyed it. We were on the 50th floor and the view of the mountains was great. We were a bit concerned about elevator waits but never waited more than a few seconds and the elevators were unbelievably fast. We thought the bathroom was the nicest we'd seen in a hotel. The shower and tub were particularly comfortable. The tech features were very convenient once we got them figured out (didn't take long). It was nice to wake up in the middle of the night and adjust the temperature without leaving bed. I also liked the electronic control for the sheers and blackout curtains. We were also pleasantly surprised by how quiet it was in the room. We never heard a sound from the hall or adjacent rooms. That was a great feature. The bed was also like sleeping on a cloud. It was comfortable and soft at the same time. We ate dinner at the buffet twice and both thought the food was very good. We were eating low carb though so didn't try the desserts. The meat selections were very well prepared. The trip to the strip was a bit daunting as it was windy while we were there but this was minor and I would definitely stay at the Aria again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place (with a few glitches)”
Reviews.Author: CAGlaser
Reviews.Content: We stayed as invited guests for 3 nights. Had little trouble with the technical attributes of the room, it was easy to figure out after a few tries. The only problem--our bedside lamps wouldn't work, and there was a pot-light bulb burned out in our bathroom, but after a call, both were fixed immediately. The most disappointing thing was the poor design of the bathroom sinks. Both were very deep, but what for? There are NO popups (you can't hold water in them to rinse out your undies) and NO aerators on the faucets, which caused them to be noisy and spray violently all over whenever you put anything under the water stream. Shower head spray is not adjustable--again, a noisy, non-aerated stream from 4 small holes. We did like the bathroom design overall, though. The TV was great! It appears to be a 50" flatscreen with HD. Very, very nice. The room decor was elegant, and the beds were very comfortable. The distance to the Strip was far...but there is a nice tram to the Bellagio, where you could use their automated walkway to get down to the Strip and other nearby casinos. From Aria, it was also an easy walk to the Monte Carlo (where food is cheaper and you can charge it to your Aria room). We liked the casino atmosphere--somewhat dimmer than usual, but very sexy. Machines were good, too. Overall, it's a very, very modern, comtemporary resort, but lacks the sheer elegance of Bellagio or Wynn. We'd stay again, if invited.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service but a decent hotel with flaws”
Reviews.Author: dave9956
Reviews.Content: Sadly, the reviews about service issues at Aria are true. In short, the staff at Aria does not seem to be happy and it shows. The issues started at check-in. We were two hours early. The check-in person said our room wasn't ready and we would have to return after 3 to see if it was. That was it. So we had to return and get back in line and go through the same process. At the Encore, they process your credit card and call you when the room is ready. The marble floors in our suite were dirty and not cleaned during the 3 days we were there (bathroom floor around the toilet was especially bad). The cleaning supervisor walked into our room while the privacy light was on. Not one service employee looked at us and smiled our said hello the entire stay while we walked around. We also suffered some of the glitches. The drapes did not fully close in the bedroom, the bedroom TV remote was dead on arrival, and the bathroom sinks are easy to spray water around (not sure what they were thinking). We were charged for a $8 bottle of water even though we never touched the wet bar. Room quality was very nice and the casino is huge with lots of options for gambling. Pool area is ready well done but once again service was terrible, we were never offered a drink in 45 minutes. Internet access is free, a nice touch. Self-parking is a long walk, so I would recommend dropping off bags or using the valet. The Aria is off the strip a little bit, so be ready to walk a little more than at some of the other resorts. Views from the rooms aren't great since Aria is surrounded by other buildings on all sides (it feels like you are staying in a downtown area). We ate at three places in Aria. The buffet ($28 dinner) was not good, weird mix of foods and low quality. Only the desserts were good. The Cafe Ventra (or something like that) was expensive, but the food was decent. Service was very slow. Finally the gelato place was not good, tasted more like plain ice cream. We did not really like the brown theme in the Aria. It felt corporate and dull and lacked energy compared to places like Bellagio or Encore. We have stayed in all of the major resorts in Las Vegas. For us, Encore, Wynn, Palazzo, and the Bellagio are all much better. For pure service, the Encore and Wynn are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: michydid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 5 nights and we were sorry that we didn't plan to stay more. The hotel is wonderful. It's located in the new City Center which are buildings made of glass and steel. A sight to behold. You feel like you are in Hong Kong. It's all brand new and very high tech looking. Each room in the hotel is equipped through the TV and master board at bedside to control everything in the room remotely. At bedtime, simply press goodnight and everything turns off and the curtains close. It works perfectly. Request a city view and you won't be disappointed. It's also very quiet. There are many restaurants to choose from. Attached to the hotel is Crystals. All the upscale, high end boutiques that you could ask for and additional restaurants. The hotel and casino are modern elegant. There are three heated, lovely pools in a tropical setting. There was an attention to detail throughout the property. We were so glad we chose Aria and would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Jess087
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, i will stay there every time i go to vegas. First of all the beds were unbelievable, crazy comfy (i wanna buy one!)! The location was perfect if you want to be able to walk everywhere, or take a cheap taxi. Everything is so close to the aria but the aria feels like an oasis of calm compared to the craziness of the strip. The room was really nice, had everything you could need, gorgeous view (we were on the 53rd floor), and also very quite, i never once heard anyone else in their rooms. All the restaurants in the hotel were really good, also the Pool Lounge Liquid was really nice, had a excellent time there relaxing on their extra comfy loungers and drinking fancy drinks. We had some friends staying at Caesars and their standard room didnt even compete with the standard room at the Aria, so great value for money as we paid significantly less than they did! I highly recommend anyone to stay here you will not regret it! I cant wait to go back! email me if you have an questions!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: sander10
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 5 nights and it was perfect, starting with the pick up with the limo at the airport. checking in quickly and the 2 bedroom sky suite was beautifull decorated. Good explanation on the thechnology in the room. Swimmingpool nice with good service. Breakfast buffet also perfect almost too much. We had dinner at the steakhouse, meat perfect, service not goot. American fish restaurant food and service very good

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed in the best hotels in Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: Kitalang
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the best hotels in Vegas most are five or four star hotels and by far this Eco friendly hotel is my favorite. The rooms were made with the best technology everything was "wireless" and controlled by a computer easy to use system. The beds were so comfortable I did not want to get out of bed even though I love to play the slots and nothing could keep me from them. The best part is that the slots paid well the restaurants were great we never left the hotel for three days we stayed. The filter system did not make my clothes smell like smoke as it always does when I am at a casino. Use your players club to get room and food comps. We only paid for one night and everything was comped. We will be back to the aria no doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: HornHighYo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night getaway to Aria. First the good. The hotel is very, very nice. Love the design, some very cool restaurants, pool was great. I like that the casino isn't lit up like Walmart, very comfortable atmosphere. And never, ever went thirsty while gambling. I played twice in the 1 o'clock poker tourney, great format and the poker room staff were great. Location on the strip is ideal once you walk from the hotel to the boulevard (access isn't great and it's a long walk). The breakfast buffet was excellent for taste and value. You cannot go wrong for $15! Our room was very nice, love the modern technology. But the in room safe did not work, which became a problem that i will discuss later... Room was fairly clean except for a few drops of a sticky red liquid on the bathroom floor, somebody's spilled daiquiri perhaps? Other than that really enjoyed the room, wouldn't pay to upgrade to strip view again though. Even from the 21st floor the view wasn't great as you are so far back from the strip. Now the bad... I will start by echoing the complaints about check-in. Even at 9 pm the line up was long, no queue set-up and very slow. Check-out was even longer. On our first full day in town we went shopping in the morning. I returned to the room at lunch time to drop off our purchases. I left the bags on a shelf under the desk. My wifes camera and sunglasses were in one of the bags hidden under a skirt she had purchased. When we returned late afternoon the room had been made up and the bag with the camera in it was gone. We tore the room apart trying to find it, no luck. We went to the front desk to report it and were first told to check lost and found. The staff did not seem concerned with our plight at all. I insisted on speaking to someone else so security was called. We waited about twenty minutes for someone to show up. The security officer was nice enough but offered no apology or assurance that anything would be done about it. He said they would investigate and contact us. At check out time we had still not heard back from security. The front desk staff was not concerned and said they would call us if they located the camera. Like that is going to happen!!! I was really surprised with the way the whole situation was treated. We once got stuck in an elevator at Luxor and they fell all over themselves to make it up to us, including comped rooms, meals etc. You should be able to leave your camera in the room in Vegas and not feel like it is at risk of being stolen, or so I thought. The only thing they did was waive the charge on a disposable camera we took out of the mini bar, and that was only at my inisistence. All in all, a great hotel and experience ruined by terrible service. I am curious if we will hear back from the hotel, but I am not holding my breath. I will be sure to update the review if we do.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but slightly overwhelming...”
Reviews.Author: LizzyDripping_10
Reviews.Content: This is a very impressive hotel, but it's sheer size (4,000 rooms) was a little overwhelming. We managed to pick March Madness weekend (our own faults - clueless Europeans!), and the place was heaving day and night. When we checked in, there were long queues at reception and many people were booked out to other hotels. There was then a long trudge through the casino and the crowds to the lifts for the rooms. The public areas are pretty dark night and day. The room itself was very swish, and had great views of the strip. The technology in the room was a bit bamboozling though. We could not open the curtains or switch on the lights various times. Someone came to re-boot the computer in the room, and it did work better after that, but not perfectly. Pretty frustrating. The room rates were great for the level of comfort offered though. Pools were fabulous, but we balked at having to pay 30 Dollars per person per day for the gym facilities, which we would have liked to take advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “ROOMS ARE BEAUTIFUL BUT THE FRONT DESK NEEDS 90% IMPROVEMENT”
Reviews.Author: LIR21
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hoterl at 10 am....a lot of lines...no movement...I don't understand why a person in the front desk needs to go away just to verify reservations and they get tired of walking back and forth. Either the computers are extremely slow or they still don't know what's going on....They need a supervisor. Another thing...they don't smile. A lot of problems could be easily solved if they would smile. Very modern, nicely organized, food looks beautiful. I really liked the fact of someone from security verifying the access to rooms late at night. If your room is facing the strip...the lights from the fountain will not let you sleep.

Reviews.Title: “SKY Suite 2 Bedroom Penthouse Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DunesClipper
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Aria this weekend. Check in went ok but the so called VIP check in was so disappointing. The 2 bedroom penthouse sky suite was so much smaller in person than it looks on the Aria website. The sky suite experience just didn't compare to other premium hotels on the strip. I arrived several hours before my traveling companion and wished the Aria limo service would taken me to the property and brought my friend in four hours later when he arrived. Spent four hours at the airport waiting for him to arrive. Nice staff but for the prices of these suites I will return to Wynn or Encore suites on my nest trip in June.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Stich71
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is beautiful, I've never been treated so poorly by hotel staff. We arrived at the hotel around 10 AM and tried to check in. They didn't have a room available and we were told to return in two hours. We tried again at noon and were told again to try back in an hour or so. The third trip trying to check in we were told that there were no 2-queen bed rooms available and that we would have to take a king bed room. The only problem - we had four people in our party. They said that we could have roll outs. When I told the agent we are paying good money for the room and we had requested the two beds with our reservation she said that it is never a guarentee and there was nothing she could do for us. I explained that we started the check in process at 10 AM and kept being told to come back. She then went on to say she didn't know why we were told to come back over and over as she "would never tell a guest to do that." I asked what the check in time was and she said they don't have a check in time. You can check in when a room is ready. No check in time? I asked to speak with a manager and she picked up the phone and stood there like she was on hold. Then hung up and told me nobody was available to talk to me. She continued to be rude and at one point another agent came up behind her and said something and they both laughed. Not to mention, there was another party at the desk next to us having the SAME problem. This hotel needs to get it together. I HAVE NEVER BEEN TREATED SO POORLY AT A HOTEL EVER! Spend your money at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy, new, designer ... awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Scriber13
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Vegas and our first stay at the Aria. We will definitely return here again! The hotel is gorgeous! It's new, modern, very designer in it's style. If you read a lot of reviews, you'll see people complaining that there is no theme, or that it's just a modern building. That IS the theme - it's called City Center. It's a very nice/fancy building with all the modern amenities you'd expect from the latest Vegas mega-resort. The room was very well done - very high tech too. There's a little 7" control panel by the bed that controls all the lights, curtains, TV, music, etc. You can even set your "do not disturb" from there. The Casino wasn't really any different than the rest - other than it's darker. Most of the casino's try to keep it light and bright so you stay up all night, but this one is more "natural" in that it's dark when it's dark outside. I didn't win anything, but my wife won a few bucks on a slot machine. We don't go to Vegas to gamble though - we go for food and shows. The attached mall is still pretty sparse, but there are a few HIGH end shops. Nothing really we could afford, but fun to window shop. They have a new tram that connects from the Monte Carlo, through Aria, to the Bellagio. We rode over to the Bellagio one night for the buffett there. It's not that easy to access, and you could have probably walked to the Bellagio on the street just as quick/easy. Overall this hotel is very new/modern and very nice. It's upscale. Like I said earlier, the "theme" is "the City" so if you are after an Italian Villa or a Paris escape, don't stay here. But if you like the modern/clean lines of new buildings, check this place out. Oh, one other cool feature - they seem to have a lot of good "green" aspects. The buildings are LEED certified. The shampoo/etc is parabon free and "natural". Overall, that was impressive in a property of this magnitude.

Reviews.Title: “Aria- Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JPTHREE70
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Bellagio,& Venetian at I rate this hotel & casino so much better! The service from the casino staff, restaurant staff & hotel staff could not be faulted. Always finishing conversations with "is there anything else I can do for you today?" The fully automated room worked a treat and I want my house to be like this! A cheap single zero roulette table too boot!Trust me, stay here you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “I hope the management is reading these reviews ...nice place, needs work!!”
Reviews.Author: PennAndUCLAGrad
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 2nd weekend trip to the Aria (from LA). The good: Incredible modern architecture, amazing rooms - including technology i've never seen before. from the touch screen control panel next to the bed, you can control almost everything in the room and your experience (for example, you can set the alarm so that the TV goes on and the blackout shades open at your desired time). The bed is very comfortable, and rooms are spacious. The casino is pretty nice, and restaurants are good. The tram that connects to Vdara & Bellagio is pretty convenient. The pools seem nice, but nothing super amazing (except for Liquid, the daytime "nightclub" which is behind a wall and has a hefty cover). There's a good overall vibe. The bad: In 2 months, the service level has not improved, and the once beautiful immaculate room already is showing some wear (dark wood looks great, but shows everything). It really all starts with check-in, and I echo what all these others have said, it takes forever. They had several un-manned check-in counter slots at peak check-in time on a Saturday, and they seem to not have learned anything from the queing process at other large hotels. They were able to check us in a bit early, which was nice. When we got to our room the linens had a very obvious dirt stain, so I called housekeeping. 5 hours later, after walking around all afternoon and needing a nap, the dirty duvet was still there. 1 1/2 hours later, we had new linens...my entire nap time (naps are important in vegas!) They did provide a $50 incentive for my trouble, which was nice, but the poor turnaround time was inexcusable for a hotel that is putting 5 stars next to its name. Finally, it's Vegas, you WILL feel part of the masses. however, if you're a Bellagio regular looking for that more exclusive experience, despite its decor, nice rooms, and 5 stars, you should stick with your usual.

Reviews.Title: “Still working out kinks”
Reviews.Author: jcctexas
Reviews.Content: Staff is extremely professional, but still working out details of running a top-notch hotel. When we arrived, our 2-bedroom suite was smoky, even though we were on a non-smoking floor. This is not the fault of the staff, however, it took them 9 hours to resolve the situation. And the resolution was that there was nowhere else to put us but back in the same suite, after it had supposedly been fumigated. It still smelled smokey. We were provided with a substantial discount for having to stay in the room. And the staff was extremely apologetic for the problem. However, it shouldn't take 9 hours to figure out how to resolve such an issue. This hotel still isn't sure what it wants to be--an upscale elegant, yet trendy hotel for the rich and famous. Or an upscale party place for the down and sleazy. There was such a WIDE variety of types of guests, even in the SkySuites area. I prefer to find a hotel, or pay extra for being in a specific part of a hotel that fits my age/socio-economic level, especially at the price we were paying. That said, it is a very beautiful, modern-style hotel with the most gorgeous and varied stone I have seen used in a hotel. The pools, restaurants, bars/clubs, spa and casino are beautiful and sophisticated. And the staff, at least in the SkySuites section was extremely friendly and helpful. Hopefully they can iron out the kinks and figure out where they want to fit in the list of upscale resorts in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at Aria!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTraveler00
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I recently had a wonderful stay at Aria Hotel and Casino. I have stayed in almost all of the so called "Top Vegas Strip Hotels" and the experience at Aria far surpassed my accommodations at other resorts. Ill begin with our arrival. We were greeted outside by several very polite and helpful doormen who immediately asked if we needed help with our bags and directed us to the check-in desk. The check-in process was quick, flawless and very informative. Without requesting, the host provided us with a room upgrade which was determined by availability. Several maps of City Center were provided and a very detailed synopsis of the "to dos" at the hotel and Casino were also explained. Upon arriving to our room and opening the door, the curtains automatically opened and the television and lights automatically turned on to greet us. The in-room touch screen controls are wonderful and control everything from the curtains to television to temperature controls. Very high tech and efficient. No issues there. For those that don’t like the technology, everything can be done manually as well. The bed is absolutely wonderful and a true highlight of the room. The decor is very modern and sleek. There are many restaurants in Aria to meet almost any desire and taste. Shortly after check-in we ventured around the resort to find a good lunch. We found the lunch buffet on Promenade Level ($23.95) to be surprisingly affordable compared to other Vegas resorts. I can honestly say this was the best buffet I have ever visited. Once seated, our drink orders where quickly taken and lunch began. Everything from Italian and Mexican cuisine to all you can eat crab legs to a full dessert bar with many ice cream flavors were available. It was delicious. We returned a couple days later for dinner ($36.95). The dinner buffet includes the entire buffet once again as well as a whole Lobster per every 2 people as well as unlimited wine. On top of the wonderful selection, all the food was seasoned very well and tasted great. Several previous reviewers complained about how dark the Casino is presented. I think this overall very "cool" low light presentation is in line with the modern decor of the hotel and fits very very well. There is plenty light in areas where it’s needed such as at all the game tables and slot machines. Great spotlighting on all the tables. There several pools and an adult only pool located on the Promenade level. The three main pools were designed like a beach complete with the Palm trees and all. Truely the nicest outdoor pool oasis ive seen in Vegas. Overall, this experience at Aria Hotel and Casino was by far the best resort experience in Vegas. Far surpassing MGM Grand, Cesar’s, Bellagio, Planet Hollywood and others. My next stay in Vegas will definitely bring my back to Aria for another great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to a bellagio”
Reviews.Author: rclaussen
Reviews.Content: Check in took 45 minutes. We had reserved two rooms for teens with two beds, but got one bed instead. Just no attention to detail and what we had reserved - sort of like they were just making things up when we got here. Ordered late night room service which took 90 minutes to get to the room (double their estimate). Food was simply not edible - looked like someone had taken a plate to the food that had been setting out at the buffet for six hours and loaded up a plate. Totally nasty. Another time, food took two hours to get to the room. When you complain, the operators simply hang up on you. Food at the cafe in the hotel is equally horrid -- cold french fries, soggy sandwiches, etc. The rooms are nice, but the service sucks - probably among the worst I've ever had at hundreds of hotels over the years. I'd never stay here again. MGM should be ashamed of this hotel and service and the food and room service managers should be fired (or better yet, make them eat the crap they are trying to serve to guests).

Reviews.Title: “Aria is a spectacular new hotel. A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: tlkonczal
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Vegas with two girlfriends. Aria is terrific and different from all the other Vegas hotels. So new and modern and beautiful. The rooms are really, really nice. We asked for adjoining rooms so that was great. The casino is nice and not overwhelming. We played Craps the whole time and never walked away a loser so that was nice. We ate at American Fish, Cafe Vettro, Breezes Cafe, and Lemongrass. ALL were fantastic. It's pricey, but so is everything in Vegas. The location is great. Take the tram to Bellagio and walk to Caesars. Check in/out was a little slow, but really nothing to complain about. The doormen and bell servers were very helpful. The pool was great too! Not huge, but just right. The only two hotels I would ever want to stay at in Vegas are Aria and The Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke in your lungs, loud noisy crowds, rude people....this is a vacation?”
Reviews.Author: NoDumbPeople
Reviews.Content: I've never understood why the City Center was ever built. It looks like an average office building in downtown Houston. Anyway, it's no fun. You will cough at the massive smoke everywhere. You will feel like a sardine among throngs of people. You will never have 1 minute of relaxation. And you will lose your money at the end of the day because the blackjack dealer always wins somehow. Instead of going to Aria and regretting every minute, go somewhere else. In fact, go to San Diego, Honolulu, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Portland, Vancouver, San Antonio - anywhere but this town. My rating of Aria Hotel: 1 out of 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “I totally loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Paula7928
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria for 3 nighs while attending a conference in Las Vegas. I arrived about 2pm on a Tuesday afternoon and waited about 15 minutes to check in. The Aria is very classy and upscale and I really liked staying there. I had no problems with the light controls etc. in the beautiful The bed was just a little on the soft side for me but I got used to it. There was always a security guard standing in front of the bank of elevators. You had to show your room card to go past. One thing that is very efficient about Aria that I don't think anyone else has mentioned is how the elevators are configured. There is one bank of elevators for floors 3 - 7, one set for 8 - 15,. etc.) Most of the time I had an elevator to myself going directly to my floor. There were 6 elevators in each set so you never were waiting for an elevator. Previous reviewers have complained about how far Aria is off the strip. It is no farther off the strip than Bellagio where you have to walk around the lake. To walk from my room out to the strip was about a 7 or 8 minute walk. One thing I really enjoyed were the pools. There are 3 very large pools. The one that is farthest from the hotel building is heated like bathwater. And I don't mean lukewarm. It i is warm like bathwater. I ate lunch one day at the buffet, $19.95 on a weekday. The food was good and the staff was helpful. There were plenty of choices. Other people have complained about the cafeteria atmosphere but I think the style of the buffet is what is called the "minimalist" style. The oreo slider dessert was to die for. I do agree with another poster that Arias buffet has the best dessrts. The stafff was very helpful. The concierge printed my boarding pass for me since the business center was closed in the evening. They gave me late checkout til 1pm on Friday when I left. I tried to get late but they were full on Friday night so they could not give me later. I hung out at the pool until it was time to leave for my flight. There are showers in the bathrooms by the pool so if you have a late flight home this helps. Sometimes a person would call in the morning to make sure I receive my wakeup call. Sometimes I did have trouble calling to the front desk and would be on hold. I usually would hang up and just try later or stop at the desk when I was going out. One night when I called for a wakeup call, the operator said " You are at Aria, right" which makes me think they hav onlyo ne operator for Aria and Vdara which is why you wait on hold so long. Other than the buffet and my $3.25 morning coffees (small) from the bakery in the casino I didn't eat in any of the restaurants. I did see somene pay $4.50 for a coke at the pool bar. The waiters were friendly and would always give me a glass of ice for my bottled water. I pad $15 per day for wireless. It worked well, no complaints just a bit pricey. One last thing, I paid $108 on Hotwire and though it was a great deal. I totally loved Aria and canot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Dont' Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: cba33393
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT a luxury hotel and was a huge disappointment. The check-in was a fiasco. Most people's rooms were not avaiable and would not be available for hours. It took 45 minutes of standing in line to check-in. We paid for a "deluxe" room only to get a mediocre room with a view of a huge air conditioning unit with spot lights outside the window. It's about on par with the Gold Strike in Tunica. They don't even have bellmen to help with luggage or if they do none were available to us. They don't ask you at the desk if you need any help. The casino is not very pretty either.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was great”
Reviews.Author: Lillian81
Reviews.Content: I was worried about going to the Aria after some of the reviews. I was suprising my best friend for her 30th bday and didnt want to have a nightmare trip. We arrived, Sat afternoon, waited about 10 min to check in, got to the room, it was beautiful, I didnt find it too techy, we were able to use everything without a struggle. We stayed 4 nights, and on our first night they brought chocolate covered strawberries and macaroons at turn down service, I thought it was a nice touch. And the beds.....OMG like sleeping on clouds! When we checked out I forgot my cell phone at the hotel, in a panic I contact the hotel when I arrived back home in Vancouver, CA and I dealt with Eddie from lost and found who was super helpful and fanastic on arranging gettng it back to me. Thanks Eddie! I look forward to being back in Vegas and enjoying the good times at the Aria

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, not Great”
Reviews.Author: KarenATL
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying at Aria after all the negative reviews, but our stay was perfectly fine. We had booked the hotel with a grand opening special, so the price was right. I would not stay here and pay full price, mainly because it's a bit of a walk to the strip. If you're going to pay premium $$ in Vegas, being on the strip is ideal. We had no problems with check in or check out. The bed was incredibly comfortable! We tried to figure out what the pillows were so we could get some when we got home. The remote feature in our room worked, but I kept forgetting how to turn off the TV, so I would often just manually push the button. The sinks do spray back at you, which was a little annoying, but nothing earth shattering. We ate at Cafe Vettro twice (dinner upon arrival and breakfast). It was fine, but the $7.50 orange juice I got provided a little sticker shock! We also ate at Lemongrass, which was very good. Overall, a fine place to stay, but only really worth it if you have a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation within a vacation - a great reprieve from the sensory overload of the traditional vegas strip hotels/casinos”
Reviews.Author: nms31
Reviews.Content: We went to vegas on a three-night vacation. package from Westjet. My boyfriend had been there a couple of times before and it was my first trip. Vegas isn't a place that i've always dreamed of going so i was hesitant when we booked the trip. We picked Aria because it was new, modern, and was attempting some LEED components. we loved it. the place is beautiful and relaxing, which i found to be nice break from the sensory overload of vegas (we walked the entire strip and aria was in my top hotels, which also included wynn). things we really liked: It has a lot of natural light (which many of the hotels and casinos do not). The pool was relaxing on a hot day - could have been any all-inclusive poolside that i've been to. Some great restaurants including Cafe Vettro (breakfast) Rooms were modern, hi-tech, had great views and were clean Location - right at the centre of the strip Drawbacks if you're on a budget: Minimum bets on the tables were $10 (nothing a trip to Freemont can't fix) Poolside beers were $8 and drinks were $12-$14 Overall, wouldn't think twice about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never been to a 5 star resort with such atrocious service.”
Reviews.Author: Ep65
Reviews.Content: My friend booked us a 2 double beds room, which he reconfirmed 2 weeks before our arrival. When we arrived about 6 pm, the lines were long and I was listening to a lot of arguments from the person in the next line who's been at the check in for more than 15 minutes. it turned out he didn't get the 2 beds he requested and was told to try again the next day. The same thing happened to us and we talked to the young manager who insisted the hotel was fully booked. So, when i asked where my son was supposed to sleep, she said she could give us another room for a discount??? I was speechless, after all who can whip up another room in a fully booked hotel?? She said she'd give us the double beds the next day and she guaranteed it when I pushed for assurance. It took us half an hour checking in at the desk (excluding waiting time). The next day another receptionist swore that the hotel was fully booked again and I couldn't get the double bed which was 'guaranteed to me'. I decided to make more noise and insisted the receptionist call a real manager, this time I insist on someone older who has authority. Within 3 mins the manager managed to find me a room with the double beds.

Reviews.Title: “Over overblown - over priced - Bellagio wantabe”
Reviews.Author: toughbutfair99
Reviews.Content: Debated over whether to take issue with this new hotel, but if they charge the price, they need to produce the value. Stayed there over the worst weekend possible - NCAA 1st & 2nd round. Front desk totally unprepared - 3 stations open & 45 minute line to check-in on Fri. Booked 2 queens got one king. Not cool for 3 people. Desk could care less - said they didn't have many Queens. Duh - everyone that goes to Vegas is a couple??. Room was average - everything was centrally wired thru TV & half didn't work. Had to get maint to close drapes and turn off TV. Casino poorly laid out. Sports Book cramped with no seating for commoners. 'City Center' project is obnoxious & 2/3 unoccupied (both shoppers and stores). Depressing. Looks like it could go broke any day. Maybe impressive if you have somehow missed ever being in a high end mall. All in all, if you have never stayed at Bellagio (or other top Vegas properties), this might pass. And if you can get your room at big discount because they are so disorganized (like we did after numerous trips to the front desk) - OK. Otherwise, don't expect much except to pay alot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: vpplayers
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to Las Vegas in April for 7 nights, 3 nights at The Venetian, 2 nights at The Palms (Salon suite a must see, beautiful bathroom) and 2 nights at Aria. We are video poker (vp) players and our ages are 48 & 54. The Aria hotel was beautiful, clean and we had no issues with the service. Check in took about 10 minutes (invited guest line) and we were the only ones in line. Our offer included, comped rooms for 2-3 nights, $200 free play each and $100 each in food credit (we have our own slot cards). We booked two rooms so that we both could take advantage of our offers, and we were able to get adjoining rooms. We asked at check in if they would upgrade us to one bigger room vs. 2 rooms, but they said they could not do it?? The rooms were nice, but small, especially compared to a Venetian Suite or the Palms Salon Suite. We were glad to have the adjoining rooms, which gave us 2 bathrooms and more space to move around. The bathrooms were nice, but again, smaller than the ones in the other hotels. The electronic pad that controlled everything (lights, curtains, TV, etc.) in the room worked in both rooms and was VERY simple to figure out. The only thing that did not work was the TV remote in our “extra” room, but we were able to use the electronic pad to change the channels. Our rooms were cleaned every day and we had turn down service each night (Hint – make sure your “private” button is turned off when you leave the room, otherwise, I’m assuming your room will not be cleaned). The beds and pillows were the best!!! I travel with my own pillow and this is the first hotel that I left my pillow in my suitcase. We always rent a car and found the main valet to be painless. We never had to wait for more than 5 minutes for our car and we used the valet 4 or 5 times during our stay. The vp odds are not the best, (same as the Venetian) but we did manage to hit quite a few good hands – I turned $100 of my free play into $700 on dollar double double bonus poker vp machine, in about 15 minutes. My boyfriend hit many 4 of a kinds, and many of them being bonus 4 of a kinds. We ate at Lemongrass once and Café Vettro twice. Food and service was good (food not great) at both places. We did not think the prices were too bad, for a five star hotel, but probably would not have had 3 of our main meals there, had we not had the food credits. We did not use the pool because it was cold (60 degrees) and very windy the two days we were there, but the pools looked nice from the view in our room. We visit Vegas 2 times a year and may stay at Aria again, that is if we get the same type of offer. In reading many of the other reviews, it always surprises me that people complain about not having coffee pots in the room, most nice hotels in Vegas do not have coffee pots. That’s just the norm. Also, many hotels have the snacks and stocked refrigerator, but if you move something, you get charged for it, that’s normal practice. I do believe that some people feel the need to complain if everything is not perfect, but really, when does everything goes as planned, all the time!!! Remember folks, you are on vacation, just relax and have fun – sometimes, things happen, but don’t let it ruin your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bzang1
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in vegas and its not even close. Don't believe the negative reviews, first of all check in only took 20 minuets, including standing in line, and this was at 1pm very quick in vegas terms. Got the upgrade to strip view for only $15 a night, well worth it. Get to the room 39th Floor, open the door all the lights turn on, tv, and drapes open to reveal the best view in vegas. you can see both north and south down the strip plus a nice view of the mountains, and at night the view gets even more spectacular. Casino is big enough, but not overly huge, poker room gives the venetian a run for its money as the best in vegas. Had a standard deluxe room not huge but larger than your standard hotel room and the floor to ceiling window that stretches the entire length of room make it fell bigger. The remote control touch pad is easy to use and you can control everything in the room from there. Bed and pillows were out of this world comfortable. They have thier own brand of organic shampoos and lotions and do not replace them everyday due to the cost which is understandable. Pools were large with plenty of room to spread out, which is unusal for a vegas pool. Ate at buffet more than once very good food but its the same every time so limit your trips there, there are about 20 places to eat including the crystals area connected to the hotel. Booked this trip with delta vacations and got 40% off thier normal discount rate and this was booked 4 days before departure they have the best last minute deals of all the travel sites. This hotel is worth the full price, but if you can get it cheaper than the inferior hotels around it don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: devcon30
Reviews.Content: I liked the location of this hotel. We stayed here for 3 days in a 2 queen room. the room was pretty big and the bathroom was awesome. the rooms were clean and the staff was nice with every request. the goodnight button rocked and was a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: b_bo0
Reviews.Content: They have tons to offer at Aria. Lots of pretty women around, gorgeous atmosphere. Great interior and exterior architecture. I don't regret my stay at Aria at all and fully suggest to any young person 20s to 30s+

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, doesn't outpace the rest”
Reviews.Author: PortlandTraveler1969
Reviews.Content: Traveled here through SW Airlines vacation package for the hotel/airfare. The remarkably poor service did not outpace the other things that were nice. I would not recommend this hotel until the service is better, much better. Many things went sideways but it started with a 45 minute wait to check upon arrival. Our party was 3 adults and had reserved a room with two queen beds. After the long wait, we got closer to the front we realized that there was a growing number of upset people ranting about rooms not being available and wrong reservations etc. We became one of them too. They only had a king bed and hotel staff suggested extra pillows and blankets so someone could sleep on the floor. Unbelievably and without any other options, we actually agreed. Oh wait, they had already given them out to other guest so they didn't have any more pillow or blankets to give out!!! We did survive the night and made calls to the front desk all the next day without much results and continued uncaring customer service. I finally called SW Airlines vacation number, at my wits end, and action did occur after that. We got moved but, just little things just kept being annoying. Like my mother forgot her curling iron in the room we were transferred from and an hour later called to see if she could go back and get it. Housekeeping/front desk/bell person no one could go look and ultimately said it was not found in the room. Whatever. Next, we were told that our room keys would transfer and we did not need to get new keys or have them recoded. So off we went, out on the town for a few hours before our big show that we were going to. Get all the way back to the room and yep, key didn't work so, back to the front desk to wait in line behind people checking in. I finally was so upset that I cut to the front, and asked for the key to be fixed immediately. It was like this the entire time we were in the Aria. I heard the same sort of feedback from so many people, I could not believe it. I was very disappointed and will wait a long time, a very long time before I consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - but not as impressed as I hoped to be”
Reviews.Author: bhatnasx
Reviews.Content: I'm an MGM Players Club member & received a decent offer for this hotel on a busy weekend in April ($129/night - not great, but decen for an on-Strip casino hotel. Here's the good: -Rooms were relatively spacious - we had a 2-queen bed room. Beds were comfortable & I appreciated the floor to ceiling windows with an automated curtain to keep the painful morning sun out. -Hotel is well designed - it's a beautiful building & the location is pretty good -There's a free tram that runs to the Bellagio & Monte Carlo is connected within walking distance Here's the bad: -Reserved a non-smoking 2 queen bedded room (this was for a Friday-Monday stay). -Was told check-in would be at 3pm - requested an early check-in as for noon - was told that wouldn't be a problem at all. -Arrived around 1pm at the hotel & was told only rooms available were smoking king rooms - not a huge deal since we did request early check-in. Asked if we could go to the pool area in the meantime & leave luggage with bell stand.
