Front desk agent hesitated, but relented. -Came back at 3pm to check-in to see if the 2 queen bedded non-smoking rooms was available yet - was told it wasn't. Went back to pool, asking they call on cell phone when it was. No call. -Went back at 4pm to see if the room was ready - nope. -Went back at 5pm to see if the room was ready - this time a queen/queen room was available, but only smoking. Really didn't want a smoking room for 3-nights. -Went back at 6pm to see if there was a non-smoking queen queen ready - nope. -Went back at 7pm to see if there was a non-smoking queen queen ready - yep. -Internet charges pretty high -Unlike other hotels that have reasonably priced quick snack/lunch options for a quick bite, this one does not - had to go to Monte Carlo for that. Thought it was pretty poor form to offer check-in at 3pm & not have a room ready for several hours afterwards (and you'd think in a hotel as large as they are with checkout supposedly scheduled for 11am, if I recall correctly, within 8 hours, they'd have the staffing to clean a queen-queen non-smoking room. Also, you'd think with such a large new hotel, they would have designed it with higher ceilings so the smoke doesn't linger as much - but they didn't. Saw the Elvis cirque show (on-site) - it was pretty good. Decent hotel, but given the options that are out there, if you can get a good price elsewhere, I'd go elsewhere - only because of the front desk/check-in experience. Not even an apology or sorry for the inconvenience. I'd recommend the hotel because it's new & trendy, but to a friend, I'd be hesitant & suggest that they not have high expecations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel, definitely worth going to!”
Reviews.Author: GiveItAway
Reviews.Content: Finally go a chance to post a review on my stay at Aria in Jan. Enjoyed my stay although i requested a nice view (asked for upgrades too) and was told that "all the rooms at Aria had a nice view." This was misleading unless you enjoy a a view of the Aria terrace and ongoing construction! Also, our phone didn't work and they never sent someone to fix it after they said that they would. The food at Aria was excellent (Julian Serrano, the buffet, and room service pizza) although it wasn't cheap. It's a nice hotel but it's a good 10 minute walk to the strip even if you go through the mall.

Reviews.Title: “ARIA Elganance and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: StibFlorida
Reviews.Content: ARIA in Vegas Air-e-ah not A-ree-ah, yes I had to learn the pronunciation. I asked the taxi to take me there and this driver from Guatemala took me to the "Rio". He quickly corrected course and splained to me that he was so sorry. I should have figured when he turned off Las Vegas Blvd from Caesars but I thought maybe there was a back door with all the talk about the Aria being so far off the strip. Still only fifteen bucks with tip. Three nights at the ARIA hotel, Tuesday through Thursday April 20-23. The Aria will open new territory in the resort property wars. This place is elegant, classy, unique, and absolutely a modern comfort. I was pensive at first but from our arrival we were impressed. Walking through the casino towards the check in we were greeted with tremendous scale architecture. Soaring ceilings, pillars so ginormous you felt like you were the kids they shrunk in the movie. Earthen tones with properly placed lighting let the casino games become eye-popping sights beckoning to the gamer that resides inside. Mood lighting everywhere but certainly not too dark. The Wynn casinos are full of light as you enter but they too become sedate and muted on the casino floor, a feminine feel where the Aria also presents great lighted spaces on entry but feels more powerful dare I say masculine with its leather and browns after deeper penetration into the heart of the casino. Check in with Jonathon was a snap and were given room 23270. What a wonderful room. We arrived to open the door by slapping the lock with the keycard, entered and the curtains opened to a wonderful view of the Palms, the mountains in the background viewed through floor to ceiling room wide windows. The light came on and the TV came on to a music channel. It was quite and experience. The beds were the most comfy with extra pillows and soft top mattress. A beautiful room that seemed so techie when I first arrived that I was thinking it was over done. After the second day I can report that these amenities are not overdone at all, in fact I am not sure how I can continue to live without these most appreciated of comforts. The curtains opened with the remote so as I awoke in the mornings I just opened them from the bed and viewed those glorious mountains and sights. Lights all controlled by the remote so when in bed you did not have to get back up to turn out the bathroom light (Light also controlled at the switch), TV, TVGuide, temperature, folio, and yes you can check out on that giant flat panel high def television, I guess 50 inches or bigger. The tub was behind the shower, you walked through the shower to get in the tub. Really nice design. I took a hot bath and filled the soaking tub to the very rim, splashed and frolicked in the water with no worry of spill. Wifey showered right beside me and when I left the tub I just showered off on my way out. Very nice bathroom and amenities. If you don't like seeing your peeps naked then you must use this bath in the singular sense and draw the sliding door closed. We relished it as our own private spa in Vegas. Absolutely loved it! The hotel sent a few chocolate covered strawberry's with a birthday card for my wifeys 18262nd day in life, most generous and thoughtful. The service was genuine and professional with all employees I encountered seeming to be happily employed by the MGM empire and the ARIA hotel. The concierge printed our boarding passes free of charge. A great service that Harrah's only offers to its Diamond crowd. Did I mention that points were clicking away at one dollar fifty per point? My experience has been three dollars a point but at ARIA and the Monte Carlo it seemed to be two times points for my stay and slot play. The slot floor is large and offers most every game my heart desired. The play was up and down but I certainly came close to even and I just lost my stake at Caesars Palace in short time. Now I did ask for a comp for the room charges of 120 bucks and they said, "Not at this time." I was surprised because I did play at least my usual and that is good for a few nice comps in Biloxi. May be they were counting my invite, maybe they made a mistake, I don't really care. It was a great stay. The funniest thing I overheard while in the Hotel, some lady complaining that her bathroom scale was not working! Are you kidding me! Maybe she was a contestant on the reality show "Biggest Losers" and was oh so close to winning. There was modern art staged everywhere from sculpture to wall art it was all interesting and beautiful. I also stayed two nights in a Palace Tower premium room in Caesars. I used to love that room and it is nice but spoiled I am by the functionality and beauty of Aria. Fist choice will always be Aria from this stay forward. A beautiful property destined to become the "best" hotel on the strip. Cirque Elvis I have seen all the Cirque du Soleil shows except for "Believe". The Elvis theatre is another very nice feature to this hotel. As it is specific to this show I don't think you can have a bad seat. I had very good seats in section 203. The show is a Vegas spectacular! No impersonators trying to be the King, no this is a celebration of the King and his life and music all wrapped around a special Cirque show treatment. There was every element a great show should have: Theme, Elvis; Music, Hey he is called the King; Costumes, old Vegas with skimpy sequins and BIG hats, superheroes and jail garb; Band, Best band I have heard in years full of brass and percussion; Lighting, wonderful light show; Cirque du Soleil, yes that famous artistic touch in great performances. Full of fun and pizzazz! Much video of the King and his music but the live band covered the music and the vocals were by Elvis for a great feeling. Some songs are sung by a couple different female leads but this also was excellent. The music was perfectly presented to a wonderful show full of the greatest costuming and Circus type acts that it was a audio and visual feast of "Sterling Brunch" proportions! The band was really great. I have never seen a Cirque show that the actors took a curtain call and the audience gave the goods. Yes folks the show ended to a standing ovation, each group introduced and applauded in turn with the band getting a thunderous ovation. The only thing the left out was telling the audience, " Ladies and Gentlemen, Elvis has left the building." This show will be the premiere must see show in Vegas for all the above reasons. If you can only see one show in Vegas then this has to be it. Viva Las Vegas, Baby! Jean Philippe Patisserie Wow this place is addictive, serving a variety of outstanding proper French pastry plus espresso and other assorted dishes. A fine place for an easy breakfast that is memorable. I find myself wishing I had one in the neighborhood. ARIA Buffet. We received two buffets with the offer and Tuesday night we ate the buffet in the Hotel. I was very impressed. King crab legs, while great are always a mistake after the second or third pound. The prime rib on the carving station was so very good I can say it was better than many fine dining restaurants prime rib entree. It was infused with some herb flavor and cooked perfect; after the crab slaughter the prime rib was all I could muster. Yummy. The desert bar was tempting and the crème Brule was very good although small cups caused me to return to consume mass quantities. Chocolate dipped strawberry's that were perfection, no unripe tasteless berries here, each strawberry was bursting fresh full of sweet flavor neatly covered with prime dark chocolate. It was heaven. About thirty dollars a person for the evening meal, always has the crab, Friday and Saturday they were touting Maine lobster on the buffet but I just saw a sign. Lemongrass Lemongrass was a nice lunch for around fifty bucks for two. It is a beautiful restaurant and the food was fresh and well prepared with excellent service. We were very happy with that lunch and the portions were quite large. Two entrees, two appetizers', too much. A great place to eat. I think you must be sensing my theme. We were not inclined to leave ARIA at all. The other casinos we visited seemed less, and whenever we left we always longed to return. Return to the great cocktail service, the great cocktails (Mojito), and the close proximity room that was dreamy and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Ever wondered what its liek to sleep on a cloud?”
Reviews.Author: Allieswans
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at Aria in April. Very central hotel middle of the strip. The room was lovely with an awesome bathroom. The TV, lights, curtains was all controlled by the Remote control, which I thought was an awesome idea. I loved the goodnight buttons next to the bed which turn all the lights and TV off and closes the curtain. No need to get out of bed. The bed is a dream, it was like sleeping on a cloud. The bathroom had a shower and a hug bathtub (big enough to fit two). The pressure on the shower was average but have never found a hotel in the US that has good shower pressure. There was a long walk to get to teh rooms through the casino but I guess this is common in Vegas. Loved the food in the sports bar The downside to this hotel was that when we arrived the tables next to the bed were very dusty. Other issue I had was that housekeeping didn't restock the shampoo and shower gel after we used on day one.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel but aweful service”
Reviews.Author: UBTESTING9
Reviews.Content: ill make this one brief the hotel is lovely the location is central the casino is typical of a nice vegas hotel and so are the restaurants the room itself is very nice / modern - the bed is out of this world confortable by far the highlight of the hotel but my biggest problem with the hotel is the high tech nature of the room (most things work off a central remote control). my controls didnt work when i got to my room hence i had nothig working but bathroom lights - no tv / closed curtains/ no lights/ no nothing. i called front desk - no answer / i called reception - no answer / only room service number worked and they said they would send someone up right away. 20 mins later, still noone - i called again and they said it usually takes 45mins-1 hr for someone to come! wow......... anyway i felt better when 2 of my friends had the same issue with their rooms. i am afraid that things will get worse once the systems age. i prefer most other hotels in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Non-responsive "touch-screen" room controls”
Reviews.Author: 123BW
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend with a group of friends and, for the most part, we thought the hotel was fine. We did not encounter any of the long lines, non-responsive staff issues, etc. that I had read about in previous reviews. HOWEVER, the touch-screen control panel for controlling the lights, TV, air, curtains, etc. in the room was complete garbage... Of the three of us, only one person's system worked without issue. My room controls were either completely non-responsive or kicked in after delays of 3-5+ minutes (no kidding). My one friend (who's system worked) came to my room b/c he did not believe me - and was shocked at how screwed up the system was. Unfortunate, but i will likely not go back because of the rooms. Also - there were no safes in any of the rooms we stayed in...

Reviews.Title: “nice, but wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: mkh1069
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews that other people had left before going on my trip and decided to make the best of it. After booking the transportation to the hotel through expedia, the bus/van picks you up and drives you to ARIA. They take you in the basement of the hotel where all the pick ups for tours are. We got there around 9pm on a Monday and when the van dropped us off there was no one to direct us where to go. Big turnoff! We managed to find our way to the lobby......10 min. later and had a pleasant check in. The rooms are beautiful. We had a mountain view which was nice. You can see the snow on the top of the mountain. The beds are so comfortable. Everyone keeps complaining about the remote that controls the whole room. I didn't see it as a big deal. I didn't even use it the whole time. You can control everything with light switches. Not a big deal. The one problem with the room was the toilet. It didn't flush. I called housekeeping 3 times in order for it to get fixed. That was annoying. The hotel itself is huge. I don't even know if they are done with everything. It is a very confusing hotel and I don't think that I would stay there again with it being so new. Not many people knew what was going on. The pools are nice but nothing amazing. This was my first time in Vegas and I wanted to try the "brand new" hotel. If I were to go to Vegas again I think I would stay at Planet Hollywood which is right across the street from Aria. Overall it is a beautiful and very nice hotel but just not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern, clean, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: IslamoradaBound
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night with my sister for her 40th birthday. We had a double room that had a view of the strip. Room was extremely nice, clean, and comfortable - view was great! Room service twice - was VERY fast - expensive - but then all room service is! Everyone that worked in the hotel was friendly and helpful. Went to the spa for "red carpet" facials - request Joanne M. - she was FABULOUS! We ate at Sirios - italian - nothing to talk about - just ok. Had Gelatos at Jean Phillipes- fabulous! Had lunch at Vetros (not sure of the name) and had their signature salad - very good! All in all - a very nice hotel/casino!

Reviews.Title: “Highest quality food & architecture but hotel & casino didn't wow me”
Reviews.Author: Momadu11
Reviews.Content: This is our 7th time in Vegas. Past hotels were: Wynn, Encore, Palazzo and Venetian. We wanted to try the new City Center and since Aria is the only hotel with a casino, we stayed there for 4 nights. Check In: 45 minutes. Stood in two lines with two different check in staff finally got a non-smoking room (as requested by my reservation). Deluxe City View rooms: Smaller than any other Deluxe room I've ever stayed in. Average decor. The one touch everything turns off/on thing is cool but didn't really need it. Beds and pillows are super comfortable. City view is really a view of the Mandarin Oriental, driveway and the fountain which is pretty weak. It's not worth the upgrade. Casino: Again, great decor. Dealers and wait staff are pleasant. I don't get the ugly brown color of the place though. Nothing special. Food: Fantastic. I visited all the bars around the casino. They were fun and exciting being in the middle of the action. Out of all the restaurants, we only went to Sirio Restorante, Jullian Serrano and Gold Lounge. They were Great. Pools: Ok...average. Lots of chairs and sun. The pool side service is sub-par. One server worked a very large area making it very slow (30 minutes for one beer). Can't take your drink anywhere near the pool. What's the point then? Any other hotel I've stayed at we can take our drink right into the water. The hotel is close to the airport, so loud helicopters are constantly flying over. LIQUID, the outdoor pool lounge/club, was awesome if you don't mind spending money but you're in Vegas, you have to splurge once or twice right? We got a day bed where you have to spend a MINIMUM of $500 on food, beverage and/or merchandise. Not bad. Spa: We had a couples massage. Above average. Ganbanyoku Japanese hot stone beds...kind relaxing until you get tired of lying on hard surface. The Shiu salt room. didn't get it. Balcony pool wasn't filled with water, so didn't get to use it Shopping: Crystals is a masterpiece of architecture with all the best stores. It's HUGE!! But, if you want the same stores and way more shopping options, you can just hop on the tram to Bellagio and the Forum shops at Caesars Palace. Conclusion: It's a nice change but we'd still rather stay at the Venetian, Wynn or Encore. Aria is just another huge child of MGM Mirage taking up way too much space.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Goldens18
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at Aria. We were celebrating a birthday, and the hotel took wonderful care of us. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. We got a wonderful room with a view. The room was clean, modern and the bed was comfortable. The pool area is on the promenade level, so you're not walking through the casino in your bathing suit. There are three pools plus an adults only pool. The water is warm, not freezing. That was a nice surprise. The buffet had a wonderful selection of food. We had brunch on Sat morning, and it was amazing. We will definitely come back to stay at Aria. We had a wonderful weekend at Aria. Thanks, Aria!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: aprkontra
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this hotel... we stay in Vegas at least 6 – 8 times a year, we like to explore different hotels… On our last visit we stayed at the Aria and it was a TURE PLEASURE,,, from the moment we checked in the service was second to none… The rooms are too cool… everything runs off a touch screen computer.. … lock doors, turn on the air conditioning, open the curtains, turn on lights,,, all from your bed… Restaurants: The rates are average but you will not find any fast food or dicount food. but what they do have is quality....high quality… Gaming: its as good as it gets/ the sports book is decent, lots of tables, slots & bars… Overall we had a great time everything was high class… I highly Recommend this Hotel… And we will return....

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience - don't believe the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: bagspacked2travl
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were so skeptical of staying at the Aria after reading the various reviews..... and boy were we glad that we didn't listen. The experience was an incredible one. Check-in wasn't a problem. There isn't a main queue but there were folks working the crowd making sure the lines were forming accordingly (the Bellagio) and several others don't have a single queue line either. The front desk employee (Anthony) was outstanding!!!! Travelling with friends, he made sure we were on the same floor and tried to meet each of our requirements (high floor, non-smoking, various room options / upgrades). Needless to say, it was wonderful. We arrived on a Wednesday around noon time and the room wasn't ready yet but it wasn't a huge deal. We checked our luggage and went to lunch. He called when the rooms were ready. The bags were sent up immediately and the bellman explained the features of the room. When you open the door, the drapes open, music plays, lights go on... it's just like seeing a show with the opening curtain. Again... amazing!!! The room itself was beautiful. I didn't notice any of the issues that prior guests complain of (bathroom sink, difficulty of remote, etc.) The beds are heavenly and if I could have packed it in my suitcase, I would have. I will be ordering the pillows from the room for my house this week. I love the Aria because it is center strip. It only takes 5 minutes to walk to the front of the complex. Really, with fabulous weather and all the good food we eat, it wasn't an issue. Maybe it's an issue for people who don't work out or walk a lot. The staff everywhere we went in the complex were friendly and so nice. Multiple times I was asked if I was enjoying my stay. We had turndown service every night except Friday. I have a feeling that they were sold out but honestly, it was not a big deal (although, I missed the bedside chocolate that night). On my next trip to Vegas, I don't plan on staying anywhere else. It truly was an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, best beds ever, can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: kimbiss
Reviews.Content: Many mixed opinions of Aria on this site, so let me give you an idea of who I am before I rate this. I (32) traveled with my husband (37), another couple (29 & 30) and their brother (34). I've stayed in the Hard Rock, Flamingo, Mandalay Bay, Monte Carlo & Luxor, with the Hard Rock being my favorite of those, Flamingo Go Room a close second. We live in NYC so we often dine out at nice restaurants, that is not the biggest draw for us in LV. We really just like a beautiful room, a nice casino with friendly dealers, and good cocktail service. I LOVED the Aria! Yes, there were some issues with service, which I will detail a bit more, but for me the pros by far outweighed those cons. We had to wait quite a while for check in, but when our turn finally came, I asked if there were any upgrades available. She offered me either a city view for an extra $15 or a corner suite for an extra $50 per night. We went with the suite. Good decision, the suites are really nice. Ours was done in beiges, creams, dark oranges, and browns, with splashes of blues in the artwork. There was a guest bath in the entryway, followed by dining area with mini bar & extra empty fridge, then the living area, the bedroom and the large bathroom. The bathroom in the suites is different from the regular rooms in that the tub is completely separate from the shower. The toilet came with heated seats & a bidet (interesting!). The bedding was amazing and I could tell a huge difference when I slept in my own bed back in NYC after our trip. Not so good, I think I need a new mattress :( I only ate in the Breeze Cafe, Jean Philippe Patisserie, the Buffet, and their coffee shop but I liked all. However, the service at the coffee shop was not very good , the place was empty when we got there and it took us almost 2 hours for sandwiches & burgers, no appetizers. All of the food/drink in the hotel is rather expensive, a latte in the morning is $6, and the sandwiches/burgers are all about $17. The bars were just ok, I liked Bar Moderno the best, followed by City Bar. View Bar is the lobby bar and I didn't really like it. We waited almost a half hour for a drink from the waitress, after waiting about 10 minutes for her to come take our order. Kind of annoying. These were the service issues that I mentioned. The casino was really nice, and I loved the dealers. I thought they were all really nice and talkative and I wasn't bored at all. The drink service was quick and the cocktail waitresses were also really friendly. I didn't find the casino too dark at all, I would rather it a little dark than too bright, like Monte Carlo. Location did leave a little to be desired, unless you take cabs everywhere. Which we did, so we didn't have much problem. But to walk to/from the Aria is super confusing. All-in-all, I really loved it, and can't wait to return. One last thing to note, if you have perfume allergies, the vanilla smell was really strong, and it did get to me at times. But not enough to bother my sinuses.

Reviews.Title: “Value and price are good!! service is subpar !!”
Reviews.Author: hugoboss575
Reviews.Content: As a newer hotel Aria is a very beautiful destination. However after staying at the Palatzo. The Aria service does not compare to the Palatzo. We checked in at 5pm and our room was not even cleaned. At the Palatzo someone took us to our room went over all the amenities of the hotel the Aria seemed disorganized at the checkin. The next day our room did not get cleaned until after 7pm and after two phone calls to the front desk. I will say the Elvis theater was fabulous and the show was outstanding. The Spa at the hotel for $30.00 is a great value and the service there was excellent. The facilities were state of the art at the Spa. The pools and the service were great. The Liquid club is a joke. The doorman are very greety and are looking for handouts. The resturants are very good however everything is alacarte. The steak house was very good however they do not disclose things as the side of sourcream and bacon bits will cost you extra!!! The topping for the steak is extra we don't they just say it!!!

Reviews.Title: “My 9 year old could control the "difficult" electronics...literally”
Reviews.Author: crbell
Reviews.Content: We were planning to stay at the Aria for one night this past weekend and extended our stay for three nights our kids loved it so much. I will admit I was a bit hesitant after reading the unfavorable reviews of this hotel however, there was a part of me that wanted to see for myself. There are quite a few complaints regarding the electronic features of the rooms here. We ALL (kids included ages 9 & 12) could EASILY use the system. I don't understand what was so difficult. There was a large touch screen remove (about 5"x7") with pictures of each feature i.e. TV, Curtains, Lights. Unless someone is severely electronically challenged, you'll manage. Yes, there was about a 30 min wait upon check in and I was told our room was not ready but the desk girl said to come back in a hour and instead of waiting in the long line again, I could go directly to the invited guests desk for check in. Simple & Fast. Our room had a GREAT view, the property was set back from the stip but we liked that, unless your a total lazyass it is not that far. The bathroom was nice (two sinks, made it faster when getting ready) Large bathtub, flat screen TV in the room, comfortable beds. It was also quiet which is important to me since I always get disturbed by noisy people in the middle of the night in Vegas. We were very pleased. The pools were nice & clean the cabanas were not cheap $250 per day, $350 on the weekends. My only complaint with the pools was that Heidi Montag was there and she is nasty. It wasn't like other hotel pools we have been to in Vegas that was full of drunk low lifes. The casino was a little dark but I thought it was classier, it went with the decor/theme. It is more of a contemporary look and it doesn't smell like smoke, most casinos in Vegas do. This casino smells really nice. There is also a lovely gelato/crepe & chocolate store that is to die for they also have the most beautiful deserts and those were only about $6 each. We will be back. I think the bottom line is there will ALWAYS be complainers anywhere you go

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: VegasSusie
Reviews.Content: After booking Aria for 1 night a month before arrival, we were dismayed at the reviews of this hotel. Apparently, they needed to address some issues. We were a bit worried but needn't have been, as our stay went without a hitch. We booked one night at $109, which included a $50 dining credit and $50 free play. Who could resist? The hotel is beautifully appointed and the room -- !! When you wave your room key in front of the sensor, you open the door and the lights come on and the drapes open automatically. You already know that this is going to be quite a different experience. The room was spacious; the bed, --OMG -- it was the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in, hands down! It was hard to leave the bed in the morning but, after all, it is Vegas, baby. Places to go and things to do. The casino was fun, lots of new slots to try. We ate at Lemongrass, which was very good, service excellent. The check-in/out staff was professional and friendly. Whatever problems they were having when the place first opened have obviously been resolved. Would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if your idea of a good time is an office building”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: Seriously? What were they thinking? The entire City Center complex looks like office buildings. Arriving at the Aria is like valeting your car at some corporate office or at the towers in Century City (Los Angeles). It really feels more like where you'd find accountants or lawyers or consultants than a resort. Inside the casino is dark and difficult to navigate. Remember when casinos used to try to trap you in with poor pathways, hard to find exits and no windows? Well Aria is that old school with some nice decor and architecture that feel like the designers cared more about CAD then actually being in the space. Food prices are higher than Manhattan, SF or London. Plenty of super high end food. But even hot dogs are $9. As for access, it's set waaay back from the strip so expect a hike to get to any other property. You also can't cross LV Blvd. anywhere near the hotel. There's also a laughable water feature in front that's maybe 20 feet across. I saw people taking pictures of it and was baffled. I've seen water faucets that were more interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, believe every negative review on here, they are all true.”
Reviews.Author: worldsoul77
Reviews.Content: The service kills this place. I pull in, I have the valet take my car, I then give my baggage to the bellman, I then wait in the checkin line for 30 minutes (1 person ahead of me) and checkin. I then go to my room which takes forever because I had to walk a mile from the elevator to my room. I then call the bellman to bring my luggage, I wait on hold for 30 minutes. They then bring up my baggage 15 minutes later. So total 45 minutes after I dial. I try to turn on my TV with the remote, the remote does not work, so I call the front desk, I wait on hold for 30 minutes. Front desk girl says someone will be by 1 PM (the next day) to fix it (change the batteries). I goto the buffet and I wait in line for 45 minutes, and then wait for the waitress to bring me drinks which took 10 minutes. I goto the cigar lounge / bar and I order a cigar and a cocktail, I wait 15 minutes, the waitress brings my drink and puts my cigar in front of me then tells me sorry I can't smoke it because I am in a non-smoking section! I ask to be moved to the smoking section and she tells me it is now full. I wait for 30 minutes and she then moves me over ONE table so I can smoke it! I goto my room and attempt to shut off the lights, the lights do not shut off, so I try the manual switch a couple more times and nothing happens. I walk away and a minute later the light goes off and I am happy, I lay down and then the light comes back on, I scramble out of bed and hit the light switch again and it does nothing, I check my watch and a minute later the light goes off, then a minute after that the light comes back on, the light turned on and then off for the next 30 minutes (it obviously queued my repeated attempts to turn off the light). The next day rolls around and me and my wife goto pick up the car from the valet which is on the opposite end of the hotel from where you drop off the car, I wait 45 minutes for them to bring me my car. I come back and it is 6PM and I try to turn on the TV with my remote that was to be fixed at 1PM, the remote still does not work. I call the front desk, I wait on hold for 30 minutes, I then cuss out the front desk woman, she puts me on hold for 30 minutes for the manager, I then cuss out her manager, the manager (who was professional and pleasant) finally sends someone up to replace the batteries. I attempt to turn off the hall light again, again it has trouble so I freak out and start pushing every button in the place a gazillion times and also on the main console, the console wigs out and resets (thank god) after it reset things started to respond better. I then eat at Blossoms which was a good experience, good staff and good food. I come back and use the restroom, while I am doing that I can hear my neighbor going #2 in his restroom through the vent, I can also here everything he said as clear as day while talking to his roommates. I then take a shower and notice housekeeping had given me two conditioners and no shampoo. This crap went on and on for the week I was there. Trust me, avoid this place like the plague, believe EVERY negative review you read here, they are all absolutely true most all happened to me. What to do if you get stuck staying there: 1. Do not use the valet, self-parking at this hotel is your best friend. 2. Do not use the bellman. 3. Always call the concierge for everything, never call the front desk or the bellman. 4. There are 4 physical buttons that are not labeled on the bottom of the main control panel next to the bed one of the buttons on the bottom right will reset the system, do that when you first get there so you can avoid an unresponsive system. 5. Expect to wait around 30 minutes for nearly everything (seriously almost everything) you do there. 6. Leave the hotel, only sleep there, you will be happier away from it. Me and my wife had a great time in Vegas except at Aria. 7. Get a room that is close the elevators unless you want to walk what seems like forever to your room. 8. Be aware that the electric socket in the bathroom is behind the tissue holder. Pros: 1. Big Shower and Tub. Very nice. 2. Technology is novel when it works like it is supposed to. 3. The hotel has a nice modern architecture to it if you enjoy that style. 3. Hotel is so terrible that it makes everything else you do in Vegas seem awesome in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for four nights - $139 for weekend...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights - $139 for weekend & $109 for weekdays. At that price we were impressed. Nice pool area and did not feel too crowded. Room was great... The high tech electronics were not an issue as the old fashion way to turn on the lights & tv (light switch & remote) worked just fine. Only down side... Not a whole lot of character.. Nothing that made it memorable..the smell other reviews have mentioned was not an issue... There is a hint of "sulfur" but not overbearing. Check out the English pub - good atmosphere & service.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service”
Reviews.Author: bs0dxi
Reviews.Content: I can't say I wasn't warned about the terrible service at Aria but I decided to take a chance anyway. Having stayed at Aria for 2 nights (April 10 & 11), I can safely say that I won't be back anytime soon. Regardless of how nice and beautiful the property and the suites are, staying at a hotel with such crappy service is not worth the frustration or anger. Management at MGM-Mirage needs to do something and fast. While I was checking in no less than 2 guests asked to have their reservations cancelled and refunded. Apparently Aria had overbooked suites and had to downgrade guests to regular rooms - these people were told to wait for hours and got nowhere. Front desk people were unresponsive. Housekeeping never picked up on my calls - ever. And the sink! Could they have designed a worse sink? Water spills out at you everywhere. The only plus was the suite -beautiful views of PH, MGM, Veer towers.

Reviews.Title: “If you can't program your VCR, don't stay at the Aria”
Reviews.Author: Jeannette007
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was disappointed in this hotel...it does not compare with some others in Vegas. First off....our room and bathroom were small compared with other Vegas premier hotels. The room was an electronic nightmere. Everything except the toilet was controlled by a small unfriendly panel. We entered the room and our shades opened, music came on and my name appeared on the tv welcoming me....then we hit the wrong button and everything closed, lights went off, and we were in the dark...I went into the hallway to get a maid to help us. After 4 days we mastered everything except the tv ....the remote was useless except for the that special button that closed everything that first day. It was a quiet room and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel... worst service ever!”
Reviews.Author: eelzbeth9
Reviews.Content: I work in a hotel so I know how it all works. But the people at the Aria were the worst! Huge attitudes when THEY were the ones that messed up. They booked me in a king room when I needed (and was very specific) that I needed 2 queens. They had nothing to say other than it would be fixed the next day as soon as a room opens up. I had to sleep on the floor, or with my business partner (not acceptable). They wouldnt even give us a roll away bed. I also took 5 plus hours to get extra blankets. Then did the problem get fixed the next day? Nope... I spent 4 nights on the floor. Not so much as an apology from ANYONE! No discount, no sorry, no nothing. And everyday that I went to the desk to ask what the deal was, it took over an hour to get to the front of the line. If you called... forget it, no one ever answers the phone. I saw people wandering the hotel with no rooms because they messed up... one front desk agent even said "you are lucky you even have a room!" The nerve... I was so excited to try a new place close to the strip. But I will never return to the Aria. Great hotel and casino, very nice rooms but why go if they will mess it up and be rude? They have no idea what customer service is or should be.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL STAY !”
Reviews.Author: orchid91
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria for 3 nights from April 5th to the 8th. Check-in was easy enough.. They did not have a double queen room available since we did an early check-in, but the front desk rep Brandie was just superb, she put in a rush request for room cleaning, directed us to a few dining options within Aria to catch a snack meal, and by the time we were fed, our room was ready. When we arrived at our room, a quick telephone call to the bell captain got our bags up to our room within 10 mins. The room was absolutely wonderful.. the beds were comfortable, the room was spacious and it seemed like every detail had been well thought of. Loved the bath-shower walk-through, the dual sinks, the separate toilet, 2 wardrobes and 4 dresser drawers. And the electronic control panel was simple to use and oh so very handy. We especially loved the JP Patisiserie for morning coffee, afternoon tea, and snacks in between.We tried the Cafe Vettro for a quick meal one night and were not impressed. Enjoyed the Viva Elvis show.. a definite must-see ! We were sad to leave at the end of the 3 days, and wished we could have stayed longer.. will defintely be back again at Aria the next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and the Security Miracle”
Reviews.Author: pulgadelmundo
Reviews.Content: I had just come off of two days at Mandalay Bay’s The Hotel and couldn’t bring myself to drive home to LA on a Friday night..Everywhere, even the budget places near the strip, were $100+ and I am a bit of a spa/bed princess. While waiting forever on the player’s club line to book a special from NYNY that included a bit of free play, I stubbled upon a intro offer for Aria. With the Freeplay I was offered, my night was going to be about the same as NYNY once you add their resort fees…I was curious about the new hotel. So let’s get down to what you want to know and what you need to know…please take the time to read the end where I encountered a security miracle when I lost my purse Getting There: Sign for City Center/Aria off Las Vegas BLVD are not that great if you have never been there. Just look for the Mandarin signs but go straight. That is the main valet…BUT if you want something faster, especially if driving a taxi trying to milk your money at night or trying to avoid stuck LV Blvd, ask to be dropped off at their east valet. The complex can seem like a bit of a monster. Also, my local friends says the self park is a circle of hell.. Do yourself a favor..It is Vegas...Valet it! Checking In: Ok…it didn’t take THAT long BUT they really need to get some better organization. They need someone to shepherd people. I picked a line and it was the WRONG ONE…after a bit of watching new people get into the line to the right us, the people in front of me started making jokes about how we really had picked the wrong line. As a service gesture, I would have appreciated the staff at the counter asking us to come over rather then us having to watch people who just walked in get checked in before those who had already been waiting 15-20 minutes. Placing people in a variety of lines is hard when you are a party of one or two… The Room: I loved that the room “welcomes” you.. It is just such a little gesture that starts your stay right. I know some people have complained about it being too techie but I loved it…I had relaxing massage music on during much of my one night stay. I loved that I could change the temp or the curtains. The lights took a little bit but nothing major. My room was on the 18th floor, bright clean and spacious with a mountain view. I asked to be near the elevator as I was a female alone. They do have security checking for room keys at the elevators 24/7. I appreciated the full safe (Regular MBay rooms do not offer this yet which is sooo unsafe, they have a tiny wall safe they doesn’t hope a netbook, let alone a laptop). Mini bar is electronic but has a lock..so lock it if you have kids. If they touch something, you will get charged! That said, my $4 coke was delicious! I loved the built in dressers to cram all your stuff and forget about it. A lot of comments have been made about the unusual bath/shower combo. I liked it overall…great id you need a shave. The bath products were really so-so in quality compared to some 5 stars but I did like the offered a cool mouthwash. FYI Alert Bathroom: The only problem I had with the room was the bathroom electrical socket. I actually had to READ a review on here to find it (behind the Kleenex/bath product caddy in the middle of the sink). I had already told my friend when I called her that that surely a nerdy man who never dried his hair could design a bathroom WITHOUT an electrical plug! It was impossible to even fathom such a design error in a billion dollar property…duh..thanks TP for helping me find the socket... The Casino: This casino is really for the deep pocketed. I was disappointed at the minimum they had on all the penny machines. I don’t mind losing my money to a casino but I would rather lose it 25 cents at a time, If I get to gamble longer, it is a better experience for me! That said, it isn’t a huge casino which is nice and was lucky by winning..thanks BRUCE LEE machine! Food: I love nice places but when I’m on my own, I don’t visit them so much unless it is a top chef’s casual interpretation. At Aria, I ate at their café verti which was bright, airy and spacious on a beautiful sunny day. Very fresh in design. This is a zen treat. You don’t feel stuck in the darker casino. I would have liked some more options on their menu but the calamari was delish and the salad was nice. They have a dinner roll that is made out of pretzel roll that was AMAZING..gotta love artisian breads! While the café was fun, but the BEST was Jean Philippe’s little bit of tastiness in middle of the hotel. He does pastry and chocolates for the Bellagio. Be warned that by afternoon they do sell out of their last salads/sandwiches (which is why I ended up at the café). That night ,before they closed at 12am, I went down to get some dulce de leche brioche and gold flaked cup of mousse which was reasonable, tasty and beautiful. The next morning I went down to get the beautiful salad I had coveted earlier..anytime you can eat well for $15 or under $20 I think that is a good deal. The sweets are under $8 and so special. The place was packed but worth the not very wait…highly organized staff. The Lost PURSE and HONEST STAFF…My trip had been wonderful but I made a classic mistake in Vegas. As I left Aria, I sat to spend some more money since I was ahead. In being so busy looking at my luggage/computer, I played and stupidly left my black purse between two games. I was playing 10 minutes at another machine before I realized my error and was sent into a panic. I started retracing my steps nothing…I saw a staff floor member named Elena and said “I lost my purse” knowing my whole trip was now ruined. I was heartbroken…She said the magic words “Coach and black?”…I was saved. I had just one priceless jackpot! I have worked in customer service for over 10 years and I cannot express how nice it was that Elena had just wonderfully done her job. Yes, I know I was lucky that staff found it. I was also lucky that, Elena was honest staff…I know a lot of people can scoff saying it was an exception to the rule. I am not naïve to know that a my designer purse with money, a digital camera, a wristlet, credit cards and my id could of easily been gone forever. What I can say is this, Elena did her job, both honestly and well…She walked me to security. She didn’t just hand me off or shrug her shoulders or make me feel stupid (yes, I already felt dumb enough). I did tip Elena, I did ask to speak to her boss to express my gratitude an praise…If an honest and well-trained employee is the best recommend for any place, then please take my experience with Elena as the highest compliment to visit Aria’s casino. Sidenote: This week I was at the gocery store. I grabbed a cart and found a woman’s black coach purse…I turned it in and thought about how lucky I was to find it! ART: Last note..If you love art there are plenty of cool installations and the conceriege has a walking tour hand out available. I didn't get to explore more just because of my 24 hour visit. That said, I spotted some Chihuly by the valet pick up! next visit will be for the salt spa room!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Beautifull Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: leslierph
Reviews.Content: Wow - I was impressed with the modern decor in the hotel room and all thru the hotel. We had a regular room and I thought it was quite large. The window was the enire lenghth of one wall, true floor to ceiling windows, top to bottom, left to right, it even turned the corner so you could see to the side also. We were on the 26th floor We had a view of an under construction hotel next door (the Harmon I think?) and we could see a bit of the Rio to the left, and a bit of Planet Hollywood to the right. I loved the entryway with 2 large closets and a granite top in the middle for jewelry etc and 4 large drawers in the middle. The bathroom was also large and the soaking tub was oval and very comfy! We had no problem using the remote panel. Some of the lights could also be turned on/off on the wall (bathroom, entryway, and bedroom switches) The blackout curtains and sheers could also be opened with a wall switch or the remote pad. I told my husband how so many people complained on trip advisor about the blackout drapes letting so much light in the top. We laughed, as you could barely see a thin line of light above the curtains and the light was in no way in our eyes. The room was plenty dark for us anytime of the day. We kept our air on about 62 degrees most of the time, and it was plenty cool for us. Soda in the mini bar was $4 and beers were $6. 2 others in our party had Corner Suites. We saw both rooms. One Corner Suite was on the 53rd floor. It had a 1/2 bath with toilet and sink, round table with 4 chairs, small living area with couch and flat screen tv and large window with remote curtains, bedroom with windows curved around bed on 3 sides and large bathroom with large airjet tub in window with flat screen tv and large shower and get this.. a toilet with heated seats and bidet action (rinse and dry buttons on wall). The other Corner suite was on the 10th floor, and we were surprised by the layout of that room , totally different than the other one. They had a bigger living room, no dinning table and a larger bedroom and a huge L shaped bathroom. Same amount of windows, but the room had views 2 different directions. Both suites had view over Vdara hotel and the 2nd suite could also see out front to Planet Hollywood. The views are not as good as I have had at other vegas hotels. Probably because of the location of Aria within City Center. It is set back a bit off the strip, so you don't get a good view of the strip. Besides that, I thought the location was great. It didn't take very long at all to walk to the strip. Maybe 5 minutes tops as you exit the lobby and walk towards the strip. If you go to the right, you are at CVS and Monte Carlo, and to the left is crystals shopping center, you can either go thru, or on the sidewalk outside continue to Bellagio, or go up and across street to Planet Hollywood. We liked the location. The hotel, while it had numerous restaurants and shops etc. was very easy to navigate. There are 4-5 elevator banks and each bank only went to certain floors. It was a pain to get to our friends room, as they both used different elevators than us, so from our room, we had to go down to casino or promenade level and change elevators to go up to their room. Right next to the lobby was the casino, and the elevators were on the right side of the casino. There were several restaurants and shops around the edge of the casino. The promenade level had the buffett the pool and spa entrance the Viva Elvis show and several more restaurants, bars, and shops. We went to the pool only one day. It was pretty and heated to about 82 degrees which was nice. 3 large pools with plenty of lounge chairs and palm trees. The servers came around often for drinks and food if needed. Cocktails and frozen drinks were about $12-$14 and beers were $7. We did check out the Liquid Lounge, which was just a smaller pool (1/2 size of others) with loud music (DJ) more expensive drinks and food and more plush lounge chairs. They let us in free (2 girls) but said men cost $75 each to enter. We just walked thru to check it out and left. The only advantage I could see is that they let people in the pool with drinks, and the regular pools you could not even get close to pool with your drink. I guess if you were in your 20s it may be fun, I was much too old and got back to regular pool ASAP! I prefer the pools at Mandalay Bay, Mirage, Monte Carlo, and MGM with lazy rivers and wave pools and fountains. Arias pools were a little boring. I guess good for relaxing, only saw 2-3 kids around the pool all day. My daughter was a bit bored. We ate at the buffett for breakfast and for lunch. It was not as large as some other vegas hotels, but most of the selections were good quality. My husband and his father ate at the gourmet buffett that they have on fri and sat nights. It was $35 and included a whole lobster per 2 people brought to your table and unlimited wine (chardonay or merlot) they said it was good. We ate at Cafe Vettro (open 24 hours) for breakfast and it was very good. I preferred it to the buffett. It was probably the most reasonalbe restaurant price wise. We also went to Beso, Eva Longoria's beautifull restaurant. It was very nice and looked like the place to be. We sat near the bar. I had 1 glass of wine, salad, and lobster bisque. It was very good, but with tip costs $45 (just for me) I was glad we went though. We also ate at the P.U.B by Todd English. It was very good and reasonably priced. They had sandwiches and a whole carvery menu where you pick a meat, 2 sauces, and a bread, then put it all together as a sandwich. OUr friends had turkey and brisket and said it was great. There is also a pastry shop (french - jean phillipe patissirie) I'm sure I didn't spell it right, but it had all sorts of rolls and muffins etc and they made fresh crepes and had prob 50 flavors of sorbet and gelato. It was located right by elevators, so easy to take up to room. We went to the Viva Elvis show - awesome. I liked it better than most Cirque shows because it was more normal (costumes and dancing and singing) I also love Elvis, so that helped. My husband even liked it, and he generally hates cirque shows. As far as gambling goes, the slot players in our group never won much and the blackjack (as with most places on the strip on the weekend) were $25 min. My husband did not care for most of the tables having automatic shufflers. Only 2 tables had shoes = and they were $50 and $100 min. I didn't think any of the food/drinks were any more expensive than the other nice strip hotels. We found ourselves walking down to Bills gambling Hall a couple of times to play $5 blackjack and drink $1 frozen margaritas and strawberry daquaris. We also ate lunch at our favorite place , Mon Ami Gabi at the Paris on the outside patio with the Bellagio fountains right across the street. I would definetly stay here again if the price was right. I generally like to stay somewhere different each time though

Reviews.Title: “Not the nicest but definitely up there”
Reviews.Author: wellheynow
Reviews.Content: Aria disclaimer…we were invited by our casino host from the Mirage so we didn’t pay for our room and we came home with more gambling money than we came with which always makes a trip nicer. But with that out of the way here are my thoughts. Check in was efficient when we got to the desk—but both people in front of us asked really involved questions (next time buddy save your bell desk questions for the bell desk). So check in took about 20 minutes but most of it was because of bad luck of standing in the wrong line. When we turned around to leave the 4-5 open lines had grown from 4 people in each to over 8 in each so we timed that well. The room is nice. Never staying there before we didn’t know if the 19th floor was good or not but at check in the woman made it sound nice and said it had “a mountain view”. That’s kind of silly to say because it was actually a view of Vdara and other construction still taking place with just a hint of mountain in the back. I understand “mountain view” sounds preferable to “construction view” but let’s call a spade a spade. Anyway, other than that the room lived up to it’s billing on the web. Nice colors, efficient use of space. Nothing outrageous but nice—especially the comfortable bed and it was quiet (until the construction started early in the morning but again we knew that going in that it was a new place). It was cool when you walked into the room and everything lit up from the automated systems. We thought the remote control unit was fairly easy to use as well. And again it was nice to have so many features at your fingertips. One of the TV stations shows flight info at McCarran which was nice to not have to look up on our pda/computers. Speaking of which—they charge $15/day for internet access which seems a little cheesy. Just about anywhere else first class we travel that’s an amenity and not an expense. Cheap. It was nice in the mornings to not walk have to walk too far to find coffee and pastries. The Jean Philippe pastry shop is great. The brioche was amazing and the coffee good and again it was conveniently located just off the elevators to quickly grab something and head back upstairs. The casino is nice—subdued colors and spacious. It wasn’t crowded during the day but the evenings were fuller. There was a convention going on (broadcasters) which had swelled the numbers some they said. Speaking of they—every employee and dealer we had contact with was very pleasant. I can’t recall a place where every person was pleasant. Crystal—the shopping mall—is definitely a work in progress. Nice attention to detail in the building of it though and hopefully it will take off. You walk through sections of it to get to the tram which takes you to Bellagio or Monte Carlo. We also walked from the hotel to the strip and it was no problem at all—no further than walking from Caesars to the strip for example. But there’s lots of construction going on so you’re walking under cover for some of it. But it’s an easy walk to Bellagio for sure. All and all a fine stay and we’ll be back. But it seems like Bellagio and Mirage have a more solid feel than this place but again it’s early. Give it a try!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing State of the Art Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bocanewlywed
Reviews.Content: I'm a Las Vegas resident, and we, along with three other couples, decided to stay here for a single night for kicks. We got a local discount rate, I think we paid $119 for the room. I'm not a huge fan of the hotel check ins adjacent to the casino, but it was efficient. The staff was friendly. The most impressive feature is the moment you unlock your hotel room door with the the keyless lock, the door opens, and the lights come on and the curtains are immediately pulled back electronically. The room is beautiful, everything is state of the art. There were a couple negatives...the wireless little notepad that controls just about anything and everything in that room, wouldn't let me change the channel on the tv, had to change manually. I also didn't care for the fact that the bath was located in the enclosed shower. It really just got too warm in there. Other than that the hotel is amazing. We ate at Union Restaurant, which was also fantastic. A great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Design Flaw!”
Reviews.Author: crandles60
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong. I think everything about this hotel is beautiful. Very clean and modern. The rooms are nicely appointed. Beds are really comfortable. Too bad I couldn't sleep. The blackout shades let in light all along the top and on the side where the remote stops. This might be a non issue except for the fact that the outside of the building has flood lights that remain on all night long. My room overlooked the front of the hotel. My brother and sister in law were staying in the room across the hall from us and had the same issue, even though their room overlooked the pools so apparently it doesn't matter where you are located. I've never had this problem at a Las Vegas hotel before. Usually it's so dark in the room you can't see day from night. All you see here at Aria is day :-( For that reason only, I don't think I could go back to Aria. I emailed customer service about the problem. We'll see what they have to say.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Las Vegas Blvd. strip”
Reviews.Author: Curious-Monkey
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Las Vegas and the Grand Canyon. While in Las Vegas, I stayed at Aria Resort and Casino. The room I stayed in was very modern, clean and hi-tech. The window curtains are all controlled by computer panels/buttons in the room, as are all the lights and TV. The combined shower/bath tub area had heated floors. The room had very good sound insulation so you wouldn't hear the noise from the city or from the neighbours. The pizza ordered via room service was very tasty and reasonably priced for hotel standards. Staff were all very professional. Valet parking was free (excluding tips for the guys who work there). The only con was that when I wanted to use the in-room safety deposit box, I called the front desk and they informed me that it would take 45 minutes for someone to come set it up for me BUT I needed to be there as well. This didn't work very well because I had a show to catch. It would have been nice for the safe to be pre-set for use upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Looks pretty, HORRIBLE service.”
Reviews.Author: DJSteve4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria for the first time, as we wanted to try out the new city center. What a mistake. While the hotel and casino are very pretty, that is where the experience ends. The entire staff with the exception of the one bellman who tried to make things right was horrible. We waited 30 minutes to check in at 1030pm. Once we go to the counter, they wanted to authorize an additional $130 a day in addition to our elevated room rates. We stated we were not going to allow this, and they said they would make an exception, and only authorize $130 for the length of our stay...they lied. They ended up over authorizing and we had over $700 of our spending money tied up in this disaster. All they did was offer a line pass at the buffet..lame. When we then got to our 6th floor room, with a great view of the valet lane, nothing worked, the room was 80 degrees, we couldn't get the lights on, the drapes open, or the TV on. In the bathroom, there was still garbage from the previous guest. Nasty. We tried calling the front desk...the phone rang and rang...no answer. Called the bellman to get our bags, they told us it would be 30 minutes, wasting more our time. Finally when our bags got to our room, we lost it. The poor bellman had to deal with all our issues. He moved us to a 16th floor room, and gave us a $100 food credit. We thought, ok, this helps. Boy were we wrong. We got dressed and left the hotel for the night. Went to the valet to get our car, there were tons of people standing around complaining how they had been waiting for over 20 minutes to get their vehicles AT 1 AM!! We we told by the attendant that our wait would be similar. We ended up taking cabs for the night, costing us over $50. Next day we went to the pool. Bad idea. Tried to get into a poolside restaurant with empty tables, we were told it was a 30 minute wait. We were too hungry and figured we could get food from the waitress at the pool. After sitting in our lounge chairs for over 30 minutes the waitress came by, telling us she would be right back. Another 30 minutes go by she finally took our order. 30 minutes later our drinks arrive, she told us that our food would be right out. Guess what? It took another 30 minutes to get the food out, keep in mind this is prepackaged food not chef prepared. 1.5 hours from sitting down to get our order. When it arrived we told them we weren't paying for it. She said she would get a manager. The pool manager at this hotel needs to be FIRED. She took the food from us (which we didn't touch) and offered simply not to charge us. She did not apologize or offer anything to make up for the lack of service and time wasted on our vacation. She made excuses how staff had called in and that the hotel was doing great business etc. She said we were lying and that she was timing us and it didn't take an hour and a half to get our order. The ten people around us who were also waiting for orders assured her it did. I have never experienced such cruddy service at a high end resort. The $100 the bellman comped use did not make up for the experience we had here. Keep in mind also this property has no choices for quick food, only sit down restaurants or over priced bakery areas. I will never return to an MGM property, and I feel obligated to let everyone I know going to vegas via facebook, twitter, and blogs not to stay at Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Love this new casino, but not the food choices”
Reviews.Author: love2travel805
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a weekend getway with friends. It is a nice looking new casino, and the location is great for going to see other casinos. Our room is excellent, the bathroom is huge, and we liked their high tech features in the room. The service we received all around the casino was also excellent. However, we were disappointed with their food choices. The restaurants are all way over priced. We liked to eat well on these trips, so we stopped by all the restaurants to see what's on the menu, and found all the restaurants are over priced. We did go to their $30 dinner buffet, but were disappointed with the quality and selection. We also went to their Spanish restaurant, and were disappointed with the portions. A friend and I shared a Pella, and after we cleaned out the dish, we could still eat more. And we ordered tapas before the main dish. So, we had to keep go to other casinos to eat our meals. Since food is always a big part of our vegas getaway, we would not stay here again because of the lack of decent meal choices. But other than that, we really liked this new casino.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE, LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: DELGADO10
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was a bit hesitant after reading all of the bad reviews, but I had already made the reservations. I was so pleasantly surprised, it was beautiful! The moment you walk into the ARIA you are impressed with the architecture, so modern and sleek. The rooms are incredible, and the touch pad everybody talks about, it's not hard to operate, very simple. Staff was very nice and polite, we even saw the American Idol contestants who were staying there for the weekend. We saw the Elvis Live show which was great. You will not be disappointed, we were'nt. Can't wait to go back!!! This was out first time in Vegas by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Aria going to stay here again? NO!”
Reviews.Author: soniktemple
Reviews.Content: Long lines, long waits, no answer at front desk, no relief! We stayed here and at first from outside we arrived at some futuristic venue with beautiful facades great ambiance and lighting, until we got to the check in line! There were about 6 separate lines each with 10 people waiting. Just what I wanted to do after a 4 hour drive and that line isn't moving fast, I have no idea what these people are doing but they probably got into the same situation I did. Unfortunately they said they didn't have the 2 queen beds available that I had booked online. Now I know the catch, book on their website for the good deal but then you can't rate them on Expedia, Orbitz, hotels.com travelocity etc if you book it with them at a higher price. Then we had some punks next door playing rap music in some other language at 4am. and I mean it was like you can hear everything because the glass in the bathroom resonates with every noise next door. Changing rooms turned into an ordeal and to save you the long story I'll just say, we eventually got another room but they never changed the key so we couldn't get in and when calling the front desk we were put on hold for 30 minutes I know because I watched a whole sitcom and used the restroom while I waited. Though the room itself is state of the art, the service SUCKS! They might have an excuse like "oh it's a big XXXX convention this weekend" - since when has Vegas ever been dull on the weekends? Come on get with the program! Do you think I just had one bad experience? Well my coworker wanted to check out this new scene in Vegas, yeah they gave him the same runaround, "no queen beds just a king" for his family and then when he called the front desk no answer whatsoever. So I would wait at least a year maybe more before the economy picks up and they can hire more staff to work in this massive hotel - or something.

Reviews.Title: “A disaster ... but has potential!”
Reviews.Author: Aeh_One
Reviews.Content: This new hotel will be a gem one day ... but my experience was a disaster! Avoid at all costs until the kinks are worked out. The check-in process was a nearly all day affair! Upon arriving at the hotel, we had to wait over 30 minutes while the significantly under-staffed (but very professional and very nice staff) checked in hundreds of guests. After a long walk with our heavy luggage, we arrived at our first (of 3) rooms. The high-tech room system was not functioning - we weren't able to open the blackout shades or operate anything electrical in the room so hotel management secured a move to the room next door. After a nearly 30 minute wait (and 3 phone calls to the front desk), security showed up with our new room keys. After settling in - it was clear that this room didn't work either. The high-tech room control device malfunctioned here too. This time, the shades stayed open, we couldn't turn off the lights, and the TV couldn't be operated. Another call to the front desk manager (Jennifer) and she offered to send engineering and due to the ~60 minute wait time we decided to spend our time by the pool (that experience is detailed below). After two room software re-sets, it was determined that we would need to be moved again. Again, another 45 minute wait (and 2 phone calls to the front desk) before the bell man showed up to escort us to our room on the other side of the hotel. This room worked (except for the slow drain in the shower which caused water to overflow onto the beautiful bathroom floor). The bellman didn't bring our new room keys (as was promised by the front staff) - so on our way out for the evening, we stopped by the front desk to pick up a new set of room keys. They were still swamped! Not even a manager was available to get us keys without waiting in yet another 30 minute line. We gave up and just went out for the evening. The pool area, while beautiful and spacious, was not a good experience either. It took 1 hour and 30 minutes before we were served our first pina coloda. We flagged down the attendant, who confessed that only 2 people were assigned to the hundreds of pooside guests. We were offered the opportunity to stand in line at the bar for a cocktail - but were adivsed that the wait time was expected to be at least 30 minutes. Did I mention that this was on Friday afternoon? How would they be able to handle weekend guests? To be fair - the hotel did credit us a one-night stay and a $100 food/beverage credit. There's really nothing more they could have offered, but even a free room and $100 of drinking was NOT worth this much hassle! We literally lost nearly one day of R&R. We won't be back until they get their staffing and technology issues cleared up. Once they do, Aria will be a fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay. Great Room. Very Modern & High Tech”
Reviews.Author: TheVegasGuy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my stay 4/8-4/12 Thurs-Sun. Hotel: Like some other reviews said. It is a bit darker than other Hotels. The Casino has a dim look to it. Wasn't a very big Casino compared to Mandalay Bay or Belagio but still was nice and clean. It did have a bit of a cigarette odor down at the Casino. Plenty of High Stakes gaming, as well, as lower and more affordable games to enjoy. I booked a Deluxe 2 queen bed room, non smoking, but was forced into a smoking section, only room with 2 queen beds available, but was given a free city view room at no extra charge. Later was able to move to a non smoking room, EXTREMELY better smelling room/hall ways. Room: I was amazed upon first entry, Lights turned on, curtains opened, T.V turned on Welcoming the Guest and with such a nice view its hard to not be impressed. The touchscreen remote for the entire room was a lot easier than people reviewed it. Had HUGE buttons indicating what you want to control. TV, TEMPERATURE, MUSIC, LIGHTS, Bathroom or Room, SERVICE and CURTAINS If you own an ipod or are under 30 yrs. old (I'm 22) it will take less than 15 min to be fully comfortable and wishing you had one at home. Nice bathroom, nice shower head with a full body tub to soak in. The bed was the absolute most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. So many pillows and great sleep. Only thing for an ipod, make sure to bring your USB charger and audio plug to plug into the control panel. Amenities: The Spa was excellent! got 2 all day passes (6am - 8pm) for me and my girl friend for $60 a great price for Vegas. You can visit it at any time within those hours. Had a full gym to use, but never touched it. Looked very nice though. The Co-ed sections were also a pretty nice touch. And the only Co-ed spa in Vegas. Had a Co-ed Japanese hearted rock thing that was amazingly comfortable, and also had a relaxation room to sit and be calm. Very nice. The Co-ed patio swimming pool was over looking Liquid, the Adult swimming pool section when I went it was $20 men Free Woman. The pool it self was a little of a let down. I am used to to Mandalay Bays pool, and nothing else compares. But the Aria had about 2 or 3 pools, each was only 3 1/2 feet deep. No real "swimming" could be done. Also very large Jacuzzis. Night club: Only went to Haze got free passes for entrance and about a 30 min wait. The sound system was incredible with great bass but was rather small and some one cramped, and this was the second Friday of April, I can only imagine in Summer or Holiday. But was a cool place to go to for free with a great vibe and cool atmosphere. Also saw Mel B. Scary Spice from the Spice Girls there at the DJ booth. Over all it had at young persons vibe to the hotel. I can see why the older generations might not like the touch screens and fancy high tech rooms. I recommend the Hotel to all. Very nice and fresh look to it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: funtimesinvegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights for a girls weekend. Like others, I was a bit hesitant after reading the reviews, but I'm so glad we decided to stay anyway. We were checked in fast, great housekeeping, clean rooms, and super nice pools! Don't be scared off by the reviews!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: justus_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel two weeks in advance and then I made the mistake of reading the reviews on here. We came really close to cancelling the reservations after reading so many negative comments but decided to keep them and form our own opinions. I just cannot believe all the negativity that people expressed about this hotel. We totally loved our stay here. I'll start with the parking. The exit off Las Vegas Blvd. is clearly marked "Aria". Once you exit, there are signs that say valet parking and self-parking. Couldn't be any clearer. We parked in the self-parking and it is quite a journey to the check-in desk. There were four couples ahead of us and the check-in took about 15 mins. People were asking lots of questions and the clerks were very patient and explained everything. We went to our room and it was immaculate. It was a little warm but I used the remote control and changed temp. from 77 to 72. As everyone said, when you walk in the drapes open, the lights come on and the TV has your name on the screen. Our technical ability is average and we had no trouble at all controlling the TV, lights, temperature, and drapes with the remote. Also, if you don't want to use the remote, there are manual switches everywhere. The bed and pillows were awesome...so soft and comfortable. Others complained about the light that came in at the top of the drapes. There is a very small amount but I just can't see how this could annoy anyone. I probably wouldn't have even thought about it if I had not read about in on here. Also, I experienced no water splashing in the bathroom sinks as others mentioned.. We left the next morning around 10am to go shopping and when we came back about 4 hrs. later, the room had been cleaned and was spotless. Left again later and when we returned, the bed was turned down and chocolates were left on the night stand beside the bed. We did not eat at any of the restaurants here so I can't comment on them. Didn't have any luck in the casino but I can't see how anyone could have a problem with the darkness or the smell. Just barely noticed the smell when we first walked in and i thought the darkness was comparable to most other casinos. Also, saw the Viva Elvis show. This was 90 non-stop minutes of great entertainment. Would love to see this show again. I will definitely stay here again. It is just an awesome hotel and there was really nothing I didn't like about it.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: Little_R72
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Aria for our first 5 nights on a recent trip to Vegas, we had then booked to stay at Trump for the other 6 nights of our holiday. We went to Vegas last year and had stayed at Trump but were both keen to try somewhere different and somewhere on the strip. We got a good deal online at Aria so decided to book it and see what it was like. We arrived at about 11pm and check in was really quick. The walk from the elevator to our room was slightly annoying as it was quite a distance however the room itself was lovely and the bed was very comfortable. Its a very modern hotel and the in-room technology was impressive although I agree with other comments about it being difficult to work out how to actually turn on and off the lights. My only problem with the room was the location of the plug socket which my boyfriend ended up finding behind the tray of toilettries on the bathroom sink.....this was a very bad design idea!! The hotel staff were helpful, however any time we tried to phone down to front desk there was always a long wait to speak to someone. The location of the hotel is perfect, right in the middle of the strip and its so easy to get to everything else from there. The pool area was really nice, 3 big pools with loads of sunbeds and the staff are very attentive. They also have Liquid Pool which we didnt ever go to but every day I would get a "Ladies Pass" for it. The casino is massive but we didn't really spend much time there. We went to the buffet one night for dinner and thought it was really good value for money. The food was great and there was plenty of choice. We also went to Aria's nightclub "Haze" but had been given passes so didn't have to pay to get in which was a bonus for my boyfriend as guys were paying $40 just to get in?! The club wasn't as fantastic as I thought it might be but I enjoyed my night there, drinks were pretty much the same price as other clubs and it was around $20 for 2. Our check out which was on a Monday morning was problem free and there was no queue so was really quick. I liked Aria, its trendy, modern and we had a lot of fun. I think I preferred it to our stay at Trump just because there is so much to do at Aria. However there are definitely a few teething problems that need ironing out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms, great location, very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: missie22
