Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new Aria hotel on our most recent trip to Vegas and it is a fantastic hotel. Location It's perfectly placed on the Strip as it is about halfway up so you can get to enjoy the whole of the strip - it also has its own mono rail linking to the Monte Carlo and Bellagio for those who can't face the walk. If you do want to walk, the hotel is set back from the Strip so you just have to walk down to the main road. Rooms The rooms are fantastic too, with floor to ceiling windows - you need to ask though if you want a strip view and its a few dollars extra, otherwise you get a Mountain view...ie the back of the hotel ! The room is state of the art...and almost a bit too much as everything is controlled electronically and from a control panel...the curtains are electronic, the lighting system is electronic..which is fine, until you jump out of bed in the middle of the night and just want to turn the light on quickly for the loo but you have to figure out the electronic system to do it. The hi def TV is amazing but I couldn't figure out how to attach my Ipod to the entertainment system. The bed was super comfy and quite high so it feels really special, but as usual there were too many things on the bed such as cushions and a thick topper...I'm just a simple duvet girl ! The bathroom was lovely, but weirdly the bath is inside the shower cubicle and the rain shower wasn't as powerful as I would have liked. Also..the sinks didn't have plugs, whichy is a bit annoying if you want to wash your face as you have to leave the tap running..which can't be good for the old eco credentials ! all in all, its a really plush amazing room..and best of all, fantastically sound proofed unlike other Vegas hotels I have stayed in. Casino Is really stylish and doesn't have a particular theme, which is quite nice - we had a great couple of nights gaming and I particularly liked the lighting which for me was just right. Restaurants. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants per se...we did try and get a super late night snack - at about 3am and were disapointed that the only place was the main restaurant which was a bit more formal than we wanted - at least that is what one of the gaming managers said...We just wanted to grab a burger or a tuna melt and a cup of tea to take to bed. The menu was bit fancier than that and the waitress looked down her nose at us a bit when we asked whether we could get the food packaged up to take to bed and they didnt have any disposable cups to take the tea to bed..so I just took the mug..she looked down her nose at that too ! At the end of the day...the place is lovely, but it doesnt matter if you have a million pounds or 100 pounds, when its 3 am in the morning and you've had a few beers, you don't want fancy food..you want a burger and fries!! We didn't go to the pool as it was too cold, but if the rest of the hotel is anything to go by,,,it will be fantastic ! Definately reccomend this place ...but be prepared to be foxed by the electronic room devices !

Reviews.Title: “Bad reviews are written by the super picky...Aria Is Great!”
Reviews.Author: dmt19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria April 4 - 7th for a short getaway. From the start I would agree that it is strange that the first impression if you are arriving via shuttle is the underground parking lot where you get dropped off. If you arrive by limo or taxi they take you to the front entrance. Strange but nothing worth really complaining about. Checking in was simple and quick, we asked for the highest floor possible and were given the 51st! Rooms are great and the tech rooms were easy to figure out...however if you keep touching every option over and over again it will slow down to think and try and catch up....typical computer.....again...nothing worth complaining about. Service was great everywhere we went.....everyone was willing to answer questions and have fun....always asking where we were from and having great conversations. Nothing bad to say about staff! Cleaning of our room was done everyday without fail or issue. Restaurants are pricey but we expected that....bars are the same....about $11 for a highball drink....but there are MANY other places in Vegas to drink for cheaper so......not worth complaining about.....we knew that going in. Casino is dark....but that's what makes it different and in fact I like it better than a bright casino at 3 in the morning.....its quite relaxing actually. Location is great....I do not understand how anyone says it's a 20 minute walk to the strip? it's like 2 or three minutes! If you go to Vegas and don't like to walk your pretty much screwed. AGAIN the location is perfect....right in the heart of it all. I cannot understand some of the bad reviews I have read before I went......forget them all......ARIA is the next great Vegas hotel. I would definitely go back again. Unless your picky about stupid things like the color of the carpet in your room, the smell of the hotel or that you have to walk......you"ll have a good time. I RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “A new Las Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravel1099
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Las Vegas where we stayed at the Aria. My husband and I have traveled to Vegas on numerous occasions and stayed at the Monte Carlo and MGM. After reading about the new City Center, we decided to book a reservation at the Aria. Upon arrival, we had a very good experience checking in. The reservation clerk was very professional and experienced and there was little wait at the check-in counter. Our room was on a higher floor with a wonderful view of the strip. Everything was very comfortable in the room with no outside noise at all. This is most likely the most sound-proof room that I have ever stayed in. We had no problems with the remotes even with our limited technological ability. As for location, there is a short 5 minute or less walk to Las Vegas Boulevard with sidewalks and an escalator. There is also a tram available to the MonteCarlo and Bellagio. When in Vegas, we always prefer to walk - that is what it is all about!!!!! The restaurants at Aria are all up-scale and were not busy during the time that we visitied. We preferred to go to other buffets and to the food court at the Monte Carlo. If I had a family traveling, it would be difficult to find reasonable priced food at the Aria. I understand their thinking as it is the one up-scale MGM/Mirage property. Also, remember that the Players Club for the casino includes all MGM/Mirage properties - 9 or 10 in all. The pools are beautiful - 3 pools and 3 hot tubs. Hours are advertised as 9-6, however, we were told that they close at 5 when the pool is not busy. Hours need to be more flexible. Doors opened at 9 AM sharp. We arrived a few minutes early and were turned away. I would also think that in the summer, many would want to relax at the pool with a cocktail after 5 or 6 PM. If arriving and departing by airport shuttle, be prepared for a less than expected experience. Taxis and limos are permitted at the front entrance to the hotel, however, shuttle busses are sent to the very sterile basement through a tunnel. To get to the reservation desk, one must then travel up two sets of escalators and through the entire casino with suitcase in tow. When we went to depart via shuttle, we had a difficult time finding the basement entrance and had to approach 3 hotel employees before someone could help us. Everything in the hotel is designed with atmosphere in mind. Someone missed the first and last impression when they thought the shuttle entrance! We loaded the shuttle by the restaurant supply trucks!!! Hopefully, the hotel will reconsider this option. It makes the guest feel like a second-class guest. All in all, I would return to the Aria. It was a pleasant get-away.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bouchra85
Reviews.Content: its the most beautiful hotel i v stayed in,the view from the room is amazing and the architecture of the hotel is just wonderful..very nice restaurant with great food,little bit pricy but worth it! we enjoyed our stay and we definetly staying there next time

Reviews.Title: “Modern Scandinavians who love luxury.”
Reviews.Author: Dindin98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria during the last two weeks of March, and had a wonderful time. My husband gave this trip to himself as his 50th Bday present, and as a Christmas gift to our three grown Children(early 20's). He also suprised my parents who live in the US with this trip also. They haven't been on a vacation in years, and also haven't seen their grandkids for 10 yrs because of my fathers illness, not being allowed to travel to europe (NO FLYING). So, we arrived at 7pm on Monday, and were checked in within 15mnts. Given great rooms that were so modern and comfortable we never wanted to get out of bed! I can understand that most people would think it's kinda pricey, but we come from the most expensive country for daily living in the world, and price wise for all ammenities seemed normal to us. When my parents arrived on Tuesday, they couldn't wait to see their grandkids, and start gambling. We gave them their spending money, the whole trip was on us, and we had a great time while they were with us. They loved the hotel, unfortunately they were given a smoking room, as the hotel was booked up, but there was NO SMELL of smoke at all! They thought the rooms and especially the bathroom was soo luxurious, that they are planning to redesign parts of their home in the same modern design as Aria. Housekeeping was emmaculate as well as service. The valet parking work hard, so tip them well, we did. The kids used the spa and the pools, and said they were top of the line, as was the casino. I loved the fact that although people smoked, you couldn't smell it or that the smoke lingered on your clothes. The scent they have going thru the air is one of Vanilla and spices. All in all, this hotel is worth getting the 5 star rating if it can get it, but yes, you do have to have some money or saved some money to enjoy this hotel, but if you do, I gaurantee it's worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Everything ARIA promised and more.”
Reviews.Author: JohnBuffalo_NY
Reviews.Content: Prior to our trip I was a bit concerned, having read a number of negative reviews. My worry proved quite unnecesary. We checked in in under 10 minutes. The bellman gave us a thorough introduction to the electronic features of our state of the art room. The unique alarm clock wakes guests up by opening the curtains, turning on all lights, activating the TV and changing the temperature. A slot supervisor sought out our favorite games. The buffet was fabulous and reasonable priced. The concierge saved us a special trip to the airport for boarding passes when a technical snafu prohibited us for obtaining them on-line. The view from the 30th. floor was spectacular. I can not honestly think of a single weakness in the services provided and would be happy to reserve at the ARIA in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive...!”
Reviews.Author: rencren14104
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my stay at Aria. I'd seen the hotel under construction during my last trip in October 2009 and was curious as to how it would turn out. The hotel lives up to the hype! The room was great, the bed very, very comfortable and the electronics all worked. I spent quite a bit of time (and money) in the casino. It was spacious, well layed out. The waitresses were nice, efficient and good looking!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and lacking upscale service”
Reviews.Author: tahoetom
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to the Aria, which looks great, but that's where it ends.My reservation was botched....a sad discovery after standing in line for quite awhile at check-in.The staff seemed green and not particularly helpful. I was told that they were at "102% occupancy" and that I got the last available room..............hmmmmmmm. The room smelled awful...like stale cigarettes and beer at a fraternity house on Sunday morning.There was no way to make tea or coffee in the room, which I find annoying, as I regularly get up before 6:00 AM. For $300/night this was unacceptable. Food and drink seemed crazy expensive. I grew up in NYC, so I know what expensive is... The $32.00 hamburger did it for me. The pastry shoppe was actually quite good: the breakfast quiche and coffee were excellent. Cold food from room service...not good. If you want to work out in the gym, that's another $30.00/day. The room did have a terrific view and it was quiet. On the plus side, this was the best hotel bed I've slept on in over 20 years of traveling. Overall....some good, some bad....which is OK for less than $200.00/night , but not at these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Visit but don't stay”
Reviews.Author: MrWonderfulToronto
Reviews.Content: We felt terribly isolated. Right in the middle of a cement jungle at it's worst. The casino is very dark and lacks a theme. None of the resturants offer ablecloth service in the name of envirowackoism. I'm not paying $350 for dinner for 2 without all the trimmings. Wortha visit just to see how $8,000,000,000 can be mis-spent.

Reviews.Title: “An $8.5 billion dollar waste of money! Avoid at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: HPBunny
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago, my husband and I had the worst experience at any hotel we have ever stayed at. Check in went fairly smooth (under on hour!), considering the amount of guests checking in and only about 4 employees working the front desk. Upon checking into our room, we decided to go check out the casino and get something to eat. Much to our surprise, when we returned to our room, we noticed someone had been in it. And shockingly enough, $200 in cash was missing! Now mind you, this cash wasn't just sitting out in the open…someone would have to have been looking for it. The room had been made up prior to our check in and the room had not yet been turned down so there was no reason what so ever for ANYONE to have been in our room. Aside from the missing money an ashtray had been emptied so we knew someone had been in the room. After getting the run around for a half hour at the front desk, my husband finally gave up trying to actually talk to someone in person, returned to our room and call the front desk. After sitting on hold for twenty minutes, he was told someone would be up shortly to take our statement. Apparently, their idea or shortly and mine aren't the same! After waiting 45 minutes, the "report writer" for the hotel showed up. Which is odd considering we here told by the front desk that security would be coming. And YES...there is a safe hidden somewhere in the room(sort of like playing hide and seek)...which was discovered on the 3rd day we were there! Because God forbid the secret location would be mentioned at check in or better yet, by the "security/report writer" that had taken our report! Having been a police officer for fifteen years, my husband was more qualified to take that statement then the person who was sent to our room. After being giving the standard reply of, "We will look into it and let you know", he left the room…never to be heard from again! I would like to say I'm surprised by that, but sadly, the customer service we received at this hotel couldn't have been worse. From that point on we left the privacy light on, so as not to have anyone in our room. Of course, I have come to realize that the privacy light is merely a suggestion to housekeeping. Since regardless of it being on or not, there was always someone in our room. In fact, on our last day there, the privacy light was on and housekeeping still came barging in, while still in our room packing. Since this happened on our first night at the hotel, we never ate at the restaurants and avoided their casino...they already made $200 off of us, why spend more?! After waiting two weeks for "someone to get back to us", I send an email to the "customer service" (using that term very loosly!) dept. Oddly enough, I received a reply email saying that they didn't have any way of contacting me about the report, which was why we hadn't heard back. Yet the response from them wasn't a reply to my original email, rather a new email sent to my other email address. Which is odd considering they had "no way of contacting me", yet could send me an email to an address that they apparently didn't have?! So the long and short of it...we are out $200, since they are "still looking into it". Chalk it up to an expensive learning experience...not like they wouldn't have gotten that money either in the casino or at a restaurant, but I would have liked to get some enjoyment out of spending my hard earned money! The only decent employees working there are the ones who depend on tips and understand the meaning of customer service, such as the cocktail waitresses and the bell men. Such a waste to have spent the money to build this hotel and then drive paying customers away by terrible customer service. Despite the awful experiences we received at Aria, we had a wonderful trip and will be returning to Las Vegas for many more vacation. However, we will never stay at Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about noisy pool areas & concierge lounge”
Reviews.Author: linlees
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 1 bed aria sky suite - rooms were very nice , especially the luxurious bathroom. Pool music is VERY loud at all 3 pools - although we like to hear music it was way to loud to be able to read or relax and no quieter areas at all. The communal area of the spa is outside - a small pool deck with 5 sunbeds - this overlooks the liquid lounge! If you visit the spa for a serene tranquil treament you will be amazed that this deck overlooks the liquid lounge and the thumping music is all you can hear - very bad planning! "Liquid loud Spa". we have stayed at Palazzo previously & their concierge lounge/ free drinks etc is really worth the extra cost. Aria's sky suites lounge for only sky suite guests is an open plan reception area ( not a proper lounge) with wine in the evening & cheese/choc strawberries - no cocktails. During the day there are granola bars & cookies ( no alcohol) and very littel else offered. Not worth the extra if you are expecting a typical concierge lounge with good drinks & appetisers.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay without housekeeping problems.”
Reviews.Author: fanfong
Reviews.Content: Just came back. The trip was totally awesome. Was checked in promptly upon arrival. We got a corner suite at the top floor. Amazing views. The room spans the front/back of the hotel so you get views of the strip in the bedroom as well as views of west Vegas/Palms from the living room. Huge bathroom with a jacuzzi tub overlooking the strip, floor to ceiling windows everywhere. Didn't have any problems with room service. Nightly turndown and morning makeup of rooms were all on time. Furnishing were great and the bed was very comfortable (though a bit hot). The casino itself was fine. Dark but had lots of interesting architecture pieces, especially on the Promenade level. A trick I learned is to use the north Valet area where it's not busy and MUCH closer to the guestrooms. It's a long hike from self park/main valet. The Crystals shopping center was a let down though, wasn't very impressed with what looked like a big indoor mall. Anyways, would definitely recommend. Won about $150 in an hour of blackjack so can't complain. Jean Phillipe crepes/chocolates for breakfast is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Willolot
Reviews.Content: This is the centerpiece of a complex thta cost more than $8bn to build. Not worth it. Our room charge at the corporate rate was pretty cheap, but everythign esle about the hotel was really expensive. The restaurants we tried were good, especially the Thai restaurant. The buffet price is much more at weekends, making it hard to get a decent breakfast without paying what you think you would for lunch or dinner. The in room technology is "cool" and I found it worked, but it was hard for my wife to understand how to make the lights and curtains work. Despite the glitzy outside, the inside of the hotel is very brown, almost back to the seventies. The spa does not have a good mixed area, so my wife and I could not enjoy sitting in a hot tub together. Next time I will stay at The Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again...better experience than others.”
Reviews.Author: KAS09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria this past weekend(Easter Weekend) for 2 nights. I was nervous too, after reading the reviews on here, but decided to book a room here, just because it is in the City Center and this is where a lot of the action is right now on the Strip. Check in: Checked in early friday at 11am. Staff at check in was polite, and there was a small line at the main check in desk, so they moved us over the VIP check in and waited no more than 2 minutes and received a room even though we were waay early. There is some kinda scent that is pumped thru the ventilation system on the main floor that is such a nice change to the normal old cigarettes smell in most Vegas hotel lobbies and casinos..You had to show your room key to get to elevators to go to rooms, so at least they were on top of that securty detail. Room: we were on the 20th floor and got a pool view room with 2 queen beds... the walk from the elevator was FAR.. really far... they should have considered to banks of elevators when designing this place. The room was clean (except for a few spots on carpet). Nicely appointed, good size, good closet space. The remote control system is way too gimicky, and even though ours was working fine, could not figure out how to simply turn off TV. Bathroom was clean as well. No issues with water pressure. Didn't find marble slippery. Service staff was friendly, always greeted you when you saw them in hallway. Soap in room was really harsh and drying. Casino- didn't gamble much but it is dark.. way dark. Pool- didnt go, cuz it was windy and cold, but sure saw people down there.. Restaurants- Julian Serrano- even for a tapas restaurant, the portions seemed really, really small for the price. Not worth it in my opinion, and the Sangria was lacking flavor. The Buffet- could have used more selection for hot food. The Indian and Mexican food was not up to par. Had the usual crab legs and shrimp and carved meat thing going on. Desserts were good. There are better buffets on the strip. Cafe Vettro- open 24 hours, good after you are done clubbing, food pretty decent, slightly overpriced. Nitelife- Haze. The latest club to open on the Strip. Waaaay to young for my taste and not alot of dancing space...if you want to waste your money to do bottle service, then it may be ok for you. Drinks like most other Vegas hotspots are overpriced. Got comp admission. Gold- lounge on promenade level, no cover. Door staff and bartenders were actually friendly at this place. Better music than Haze. Was not packed at all, but there are supposed to have grand opening this week. All other lounges/ bars seemed kinda empty to me. Eve at Beso is right outside hotel door, didn't go in but crowd seemed older than at Haze. Didnt experience any of the difficulties that others had, so I would stay here again and recommed it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: EpGray
Reviews.Content: From the minute we entered the Aria for a three night stay, the customer service was exceptional. We were upgraded to a Sky View Suite for $400 less than our original room reservation. The Sky View Suite was the height of luxury. The Suite was clean, comfortable, and gorgeous. The room service and laundry services were flawless and prompt. The in-room panel is somewhat annoying but not impossible to figure out. The Sky View Suites have their own entrance and reception desk. There is a refreshment area with complimentary coffee, light breakfast items, and open bar until midnight. Dined at Julian Serranos and Sage. Food was great at Serranos but the location left something to be desired. Located in the reception lobby the restaurant suffers from the loud club remix music blaring from the casino floor. Sage was a quieter experience with great service. A highlight was the Absinthe (recently legalized) expert. I don't know where they found this guy but he was very well versed in the history of Absinthe and the selection they were offering. The casino is darker than most but well layed out with many unique bars/ located around the casino floor. We went to the Deuce Lounge a few times to take a break from blackjack and people watch. The service was terrific. Be warned that there are no late night dining options at Aria so plan on eating before 11pm. My husband and I have stayed at the Mandalay Bay for our last four Vegas trips and the experience at Aria was much better than any we have had at Mandalay Bay. For such an enormous hotel, the staff at Aria went above and beyond to make us feel that the quality of our stay was important to them. Aria is our new hotel of choice in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't worth it. More form than function.”
Reviews.Author: Odajennys
Reviews.Content: In Summation: One night, 40 wait for check in time on Friday night at 9 pm, severely understaffed. Ridiculous remote control system which didn't work, 1.5 lag time for the controls (lights, tv, curtains), called 3 times to front desk (40 min wait each time). Got through to the front desk at 12:30 am, they sent out someone to fix the controller at 3 am (poor guy), he fixed it after 30 minutes of rebooting the system. The bathroom toiletries were minimal, no outlet for the hair dryer, and the shower water pressure was nonexistent, the marble floors inside the shower, which also included the bathtub, was extremely slippery-it's a lawsuit waiting to happen. I would rather spend the 150 bucks at another hotel, preferably the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience”
Reviews.Author: coralville1512
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out. Room service at 6:00pm after leaving room at 11:am. American fish Restraunt, Manager severe nose problem. Not gay friendly. Could and would never send or refer anyone to this hell hole.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoLove2travel
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that touts itself as having "the most advanced guestroom technology in the world", perhaps the rooms could have blackout blinds that actually work. The touch pad interface in the rooms seems very cool at first, until you try to use it. I am in the computer industry and found it difficult to use and at times unresponsive. The service was poor - many times when calling the front desk or housekeeping, no one answered the phone. Housekeeping stunk - did not replace face towels, left wine in our glasses from the night before, did not replace some toiletries we used. I know this all sounds negative but we did not care for the "modern" design of the property or citycenter as a whole. We found the casino to be quite dark and overall, it felt cold and unwelcoming. We did not "get" the whole modern look of citycenter. That was a disappointment as I own MGM stock. Food at restaurants in the property were ridiculously overpriced. Perhaps they need to realise that when they reduce the price of the rooms, they will attract other people besides upper class americans so perhaps they could also reduce the price of the food?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrvlDn
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the comments about the ARIA in Tripadvisor, I was a bit reluctant to stay at this hotel. What a pleasant surprise! There was, at most, a fifteen minute wait for check-in (Tuesdays are probably not as busy as other days) where we received an upgrade special that was really a deal; the luggage was brought to the room promptly; and the housekeeping services were great. I only used the concierge services a few times, but each instance was handled with courtesy, promptness and friendliness. Dinner at Julian Serrano (Spanish) was excellent with tasty tapas and a really fine mixed paella. My wife and I had a wonderful time at the ARIA and would highly recommend this hotel to others. I'm not one to give high scores to hotels, but this hotel deserved the high scores I have given it.

Reviews.Title: “See for yourself, Aria is amazing”
Reviews.Author: emmegib
Reviews.Content: After booking my trip back in January, I started reading the reviews on here. The more I read, the more nervous I got. In fact, I even considered switching hotels about a month before I left. But I am so glad that I decided to stay. The Aria is beautiful, and the staff is so friendly. When we first checked in, which was around 7 pm, so it was pretty quick, they didn't have any of the rooms we requested available (2 queen beds) so I immediately expressed my dissapointment and asked what they could do. We were offered a $50 food and beverage credit. But not even a miniute later, she suddenly found a 2 queen bed room. AND, she let us keep the credit. The room was beautiful, we had a few of the mountains, which was nice. I thought the control panel was extremely easy to use. I could understand how some guests may find that difficult, but I thought it was fun, and it was the first thing I ran over to when we walked in. I couldn't wait to start playing with all the features. The hotel is massive, and even after staying there 5 days, we still got confused when trying to get to different places. The hotel is connected to the Monte Carlo and getting there is pretty easy. So is the Tram to the Bellagio. We went to the Viva Elvis show, which was amazing. His music is so iconic, that I think any one from any generation would like it. It's so colorful and bright, and its Cirque du Soleil performers were incredible. It's a must and I'm so glad we got to see it. The dining options at the Aria are a little too refined for our tastes. Everything was very upscale, but very expensive. There weren't a lot of options for people who just wanted normal food. I asked an employee why the Aria doesn't have any sort of food court, and we were told that Aria is going for a 5 star, 5 diamond rating, which is obvious. We decided to go to the Jean Georges Steakhouse. I had the 8 oz Filet Mignon, and my friend had the 10 oz strip steak. We each ordered a side, no appetizers, no drinks and no dessert and our bill was $100. So, it's kind of expensive, but worth the splurge, plus it helped that we had the $50 credit. All in all, the Aria is amazing. I felt that I needed to write this review because I cannot believe the things that other reviewers were complaning about. Don't believe what you read. The staff was so friendly, everyone is so nice and we never had a problem with housekeeping. See for yourself, it's pretty incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Cool calm style”
Reviews.Author: kdcde
Reviews.Content: Unique from all of the other Casino Hotels. Zen like compared to all of the other over the top places. Great service. Good buffet. Enjoyed the spa. Room electonics were great, just like operating a DVD menu. The restaurants wanted big money for what could have been better food but I don't think that that is too different from the other strip hotels. Be ready for alot of walking..again not to different from all of the other giant strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room-Expensive eats”
Reviews.Author: NorcalSacramento_CA
Reviews.Content: When entering your room - the drapes open, lights go on, music starts and the TV welcomes you by name. Everthing is by remote control. (you can do it manual once you figure out that is easier.)The spacious room is well designed and superbly furnished. The matteress and pillows are the best. Most of the bars & some restaurants are on the casino level, and the Promenade level has the high end eateries and the Theater. Saw the Viva Elvis show and it was very good. (only about three quarters full). The restaurants are way overpriced. I am ready to pay more than normal, but except for the Cafe & Buffet it's over the top even for Vegas. To leave the casino on foot is a real challenge. Just to get across the street (Planet Hollywood) you take a Tram that ends up at the Bellagio and then walk about a half mile to the street, the other option is about a six block walk outside around the whole city center and over Las Vegas Blvd. Overall the hotel is beautiful and large. I still like the Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, or Mirage better.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Aria do not waste your time or money terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Marlenegoesbyebye
Reviews.Content: Left on March 26, 2010 - March 30th went to Vegas for some r an r...here are my comments service needs an extreme makeover it is an 8 billion dollar hotel guess they can"t afford proffesional staff,,,, Hotel is impressive upon arrival however no bellboys to greet us downstairs upon leaving shuttle in south garage you are on your own. Get up to front desk mess of over 200 hundred people waiting in a crowd to check in NO Definite lines or line system..waited over 40 minutes to check in it was a mess rude counter person trying to make lines total confusion. This was a Friday afternoon total mess,, tons of people complaining at front desk for service...everyone is angry at the wait times staff just ignoring your comments Finally check in no one brings us up to room we are left on our own to find elevators this place is giant ...SIGNAGE VERY HARD we had to keep asking where are the elevators,,,difficult to read very dark casinos that smell like vanilla to mask smoking smell. and to get you to gamble more . Get up to our room on 52nd floor view is spectacular, room is nicely decorated NOTHING WORKS. the tv will not turn on with remote, the curtains keep opening and closing, and the lights only work in one section ..WE keep calling front desk to ask for help we even ask the maid she has no idea says to keep calling front desk... no one answers wait forever no one answers the phone we call another department who says we have to call front desk right now we are annoyed and tired from flying so we decide to deal with it lator ...after calling more than 20x the line ups at the front desk never end no service ,so we call food and beverage who locate the team who repairs the electronics a guy comes up after waiting for him over 30 minutes to say the batteries are dead in the remote, I ask how come no one checked this before we got there he says there is a team but they do not have time to do everything ... than he says we have to reset the room which takes an additional 30 minutes it finally works but our morning is shot waiting for the repair .. we miss breakfast because breakfast ends at 11am so we find a cheap spot to eat. During the night while we were sleeping the curtains open an close a few times without us touching anything some electronice malfunction...than we go down to the pool...the pool is very nice there are three of them with hot tubs all around .We order two drinks pay waitress with a $50 travelers check she disappears we wait over an hour than have to go the bar to find her...they say at the bar "o she did not come back an tell you we do not accept the checks,,, you have to pay cash here our cashes are not set up for that" so we get our check back pay cash....exhausting again no service and again no communication to staff to let weary travelers know anything. I panic thinking maybe waitress thought it was a big tip??? Our next adventure was eating at the buffet which promised a lobster each it is only one split between you it was dried out and the food was ok not great the desserts are great but for $40. you can do better on the strip.We told the waitress she said we had to tell the manager about the dried out lobster he told us he would tell the cook it is called pass the buck in that hotel NO ONE TAKES RESPONIBILITY FOR ANYTHING THERE...I go to the casino all I wanted while playing was a bottle of water the waitress told me she does not serve in that section no one ever came to offer anything so I left for greener pastures which was Planet Hollywood better at service...always being served drinks It is a huge hotel they need to fix tons of things like service , heres a good story three guests told me they booked three months in advance only to find out when they got there hotel overbooked so one of the guests had to sleep on the floor , finally after two days they switched their rooms after freaking out at the front desk ...it was computer glitch another story was from another guest she enters the room to find an inch of dust and a dirty sock left on the floor she called front desk no one came up to clean it up either she was left to do it she will never return either...everyone that I ran into complained about the same thing NO Service anywhere So pick another hotel like Bellagio or Wynn encore is a better bet ,,this place needs a management shakeup and will close if it does not improve fast ,,people want service not issues when they travel. Anyways we go back upstairs to get dressed and walk around BRING COMFORTABLE SHOES LIKE RUNNING SHOES SNEAKERS PLIMPSOLES Las Vegas is huge... We go to ticketsrless to find out bout the shows and food we buy a half price ticket to Treasure Island buffet...food is ok not great but we are so hungrey anything would be good. Price was $25 pp we got tickets from the ticketsrless place it saves you some money... We decide on a few shows we went to see Peep show do not bother it was crap Holly Madison cannot act or dance or even sing for beans she only exposes herself once and it is the most boring show I have ever seen..I actually feel sorry for her she should of stayed with Hefner as he would of supported her better than this will..It is in Planet Hollywood main strip ..however this place after the show is amazing tons of fun lots of action busy.. I liked the energy in the place and they had to close down some of the machines to change them for the new cards coming ,the management were very nice to me they gave me a card with $15 on it for my inconvience. I went back a few times there, I really liked the ambiance,,, and the restaurants in the Mall were very good especially the Italian one, they also serve cheap breakfasts there for $5.99 ..great job Planet Hollywood !!!!now you have to get a world class show in there and you will be winning hands down Holly Madison is not world class sad but true!!! Holly what did you do with the money your mom gave you for acting lessons??? Next show Zumanities from the Cirque de soleil bravo Guy Laliberte great show very entertaining and tons of fun the cast was amazing very entertaining professional I give it 5 stars loved it and the music dancing tons of fun very sexual but fun...in New York New York great place to gamble too lots of fun and the music was great. Very energetic place No I did not win anything but still had fun and it looks like NY... I recommend this hotel to anyone. wanting that experiance. The Bellagio is my favorite so far the restuarant we went to was Olives main floor,,, it was wonderful we sat at the bar the food is delicious the bar tender that served us was Chris he was great fun and professional. He Knows his wines and food and recommended what we ate ..very impressed great service and go there it was about 35 per person and it was worth it if you want good food with wonderful bistro ambiance this is the place !!!! Do not eat at Wendys for breakfast no matter how desperate you are it was awful the eggs were runny and the biscuits were not done properly and the service was slow Dennys was ok but the waiter dropped the toast on his hands and got angry when I asked for another order, he raised his voice and said " O comeon it only touched my hands it did not hit the floor " this was on the main strip across from New York,,, he was a bit rude and the breakfast was not that great... The breakfast place in Planet Hollywood in the Mall section was very good and reasonable so go there for your food everyone does that knows it.. water is cheap at 7/11 2 bottles for $2 that is a great deal when hotels are selling them at $4 each you need to drink it is very dry there you get dehydrated we took the public bus called the duece to the old section which is very charming take the express instead called the ACE IT IS REALLY FAST and direct and cheap get a pass like we got. we also ate at the RAINFOREST cafe in the MGM Grand what an experiance it was great food fun place and I felt like I was kid again at Disney land it is a nice hotel too. I will be writting my comments to them about the AWFUL ARIA and they are the managers of that place it was shame because we saved up for this holiday and were greatly disappointed at having to complain no one wants to waste their time with issues all you want is great time without problems . it is called a holiday for a reason right? Anyways if I ever go back it will be either the Bellagio or Wynn ,,,,,,,sorry folks for the bad review however I was not the only guest who thought like that most of them that I spoke to at the pool had the same opinion of the no service at the Aria....

Reviews.Title: “Aria was like a dream....”
Reviews.Author: MrsKrys
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent,so I was watching this hotel for over a year and a half because I wanted to see its architecture and beauty for myself. I had never been to Vegas before and I could NOT wait to stay at this hotel. I chose the Aria, because of its overall beauty, and its location (City Centre) I stayed at the Aria January 8th-12th, this was a VERY popular time, for there was eight conventions in town. When we arrived the absolute beauty of the outside of the hotel is just magnificent all those angles and glass. It was so cool to watch the monorail pass by. The first thing I noticed when I walked into the Aria was the smell, it smells so delicious, its like chocolate and vanilla (or just really sweet--mmmmmm). Once we got to the lobby there where a few line ups, but there was a coordinator who showed us to a short line. Well the front desk attendants where very pleasant and welcoming, and apologize for the delay for we had come on one of the craziest weekends with all the conventions. I was then informed our suite with 2 queens was not available until 4:00pm. Well I had called and requested an early checkin because we were there at 10:00am. So I asked her if we could just get any room for now, just so my friend and I could freshen up. She said no problem. So I gave her my cell number and asked her if she could contact me when our room was ready, because we were going to go check out the strip for the first time, and get lunch. She assured me this would not be a problem. So we get to the room, and it is very futuristic, everything is electronic. When you walk in the curtains open, television turns on, and you are welcomed into the room with a delightful voice. It was very cool to play with everything, and try and figure out the remote. A somewhat funny even occurred when I was showering, all of a sudden all the lights in the bathroom turned off. So I stayed calm opened the shower door and like magic the lights turned on.(I guess the 3 light switches all do different things--I found out later that we were suppose to get a guest service rep help us to our rooms, and show us how all the switches and electronic remote worked-NO IMPRESSED-Make sure you get shown how to use these). It was about noon when we left the room. We hit the casino for a bit, very nice. The Aria has a shopping centre in it, it is VERY high end, but still worth a walk through, because there are so many unique objects. Once we made it outside we noticed that walking out to the main strip was a good ten minute walk. I have to say my favorite part of the outside of the Aria is the massive triangle over hang (its hard to explain my in my pictures) thats made of glass and is just amazing, and a waterfall wall. I also want people to know that there are different rooms available, and each room category (modern to extravagant) are separated by different elevators and different doors. You cant get to an elevator without the appropriate key. I did like this very much, the security of knowing that there was a big security man standing by each elevator. When we hadn't heard anything by 6:00 we decided to head back to the hotel. When we went to the front desk to check if our room was ready they told us that there was never a room put on hold for us. So by this time I was getting frustrated. Once I explained the situation, they did eventually get us our room(30 mins), but it still wasn't the one I requested. The poker rooms were great, and kept small, but scattered. Sports bar was very nice, and theirs a delicious bistro before it. Very large amount of Slots, alot of blackJack, overall my favorite casino out of most. The waitresses were very prompt at serving you. Theres also a nice coffee, sweet shop near the casino, and some very nice restaurants. All the lounges were very laid back, and classic. Overall I would definitely stay in the Aria again, because it is in a great location on the strip, very upscale/ unique, great casino, lots of shopping available, rooms are fantastic ( love the futuristic feel) and the absolute beauty of the architecture of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “for the beautiful people”
Reviews.Author: candeux
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from our latest trip to Vegas. With so many hotel options to now choose from on the Strip, and not having received a special invite from Aria, we still decided to check out the new kid on the block in the massive City Center (which is what $8.5 billion on 67 acres gets you - a LOT of new hotels/casinos/shopping). We're both architects and were very curious at the lure of the starchitect cachet of Aria and its immediate surroundings. The Strip is visually stimulating and Aria is no exception. The room technology is impressive as other reviews have stated. Little expense seems to have been spared and a lot of attention to detail paid. Congrats to the design team. However, from our point of view, we can't give it our full approval. Appreciative as we are to the aesthetic, It's just not us - this hotel is geared towards VERY image conscious, young, 20-something. "beautiful" people who see nothing wrong with having it literally all hang out at the Buffet (yes, the young blonde loudly insisted her sheer cover-up was sufficient - the management & diners disagreed). There were all ages, races, shapes and sizes to the guests but the sweet young things were definitely front and center. The service, although very polite and nice enough, was definitely spotty. Thankfully we didn't have any major issues w/ our room except ever-present sporatic housecleaning. And the times that I did call down to the front desk, well, it was faster to go speak to them in person than wait on the line. With that said, it's not all bad . . . Pros: -GREAT bed (it can be yours for @ $2500) -lovely Spa & Salon (the staff here were the most pleasant in the hotel - even if a prerequisite for the Salon staff includes a tattoo or piercing) -casino is not THAT big (and the machines & tables were friendly!!!) -Buffet has wonderful selection for food -great public art (although there's generations of people who don't know what a typewriter eraser is) -easy walk/connection to Bellagio thru Vdara But there are the Cons: -the sickeningly sweet smell that tries to cover the smoke (smells like the same scent that's used in the Venetian) -poor service: hopefully these are just growing pains that they must improve to keep those 4000+ rooms filled -poor design: I'm disgusted that it took me way too long to find the outlet in the bathroom to plug in the hair dryer - moving the tray AND tissue box each time was absolutely ridiculous - THAT is not smart or well-designed - form still follows function! -if you have a Strip view room, the lights around the entry fountain manage to peek in through the edges of the blackout blinds -misc. "bugs": after the elevator stopped unexpectedly, had to convince myself that consciously I knew it could not freefall - but there were other elevators out of order and it's only been open for 3 months -what is it going to feel like in mid-August with all that glass? we could already feel the heat gain off the reflections in late-March. LEED is a crock. We're not 20-somethings. We appreciate the good life and this just missed the mark for us on so many levels. We'll easily go back to the Bellagio or Venetian or Four Seasons next time.

Reviews.Title: “Doubt I Will Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Worldguy79
Reviews.Content: I accepted an invitation from Aria for 3 nights in a suite and stayed there March 28-31. I arrived at 4 PM and was told my suite was not ready, check back in 1-2 hours. Came back in 1.5 hours and was able to get checked in. They told me I had been given a corner suite. Upon arrival to the room, was very surprised at how small it was compared to other Vegas suites I have stayed in. The windows were filthy which really destroyed the view of the construction going on outside on the other buildings in City Center. The electronics are great when they are working, which in my case was off and on. At one point the lights went off and the drapes closed for no apparent reason. The TV locked up and it required 2 calls and a 5 hour wait to get it re-booted and up and running again. Don't even bother to try to get maid service. I was there 3 days and the room was serviced once, and that was only I after I called to request it. City Center....10,000 rooms, 2 maids!! Whoever designed the bathrooms must have been drunk. The water from the sinks splashes all over the place, you, the floor, the mirror, etc. There is little surface area at the sinks to place anything. The casino is average by Vegas standards, win some, lose some. The drink service is good. The jackpot service is good, if you are so lucky.......I was. I did not get much opportunity to try the restaurants, but strongly recommend Lemongrass. Good food and not too expensive. Don't bother with the buffet for dinner.....$60.00 for 2 for dinner, and no better than Circus Circus!!! Absurd!! The breakfast buffet was good, but still $35.00 for 2. Patisserie is good for s snack and coffee, but also very expensive. All in all, I guess bigger is not always better, and I doubt I would ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: sbhudson
Reviews.Content: I'm truly surprised by all of the negative reviews. My husband and I travel to Vegas often so have experienced many of the hotels on the strip. Prior to our visit to Aria last month, Mirage and Mandalay Bay were our fav's. Aria has, by far, become our new favorite. So much so that we are returning in April for another stay. My husband surprised me with this trip and we were arriving from different cities...he arrived at about 7:30 am and was promptly given a room. The rooms are so modern and decorated so well! It is a fully electronic room...from the curtains, to the lights, to the TV. Very cool! Although, I must say, it was a little difficult to figure out the remote and how everything worked...and I consider myself to be good with technology. When my husband entered the room for the first time there was a nice surprise...don't want to spill the beans because it makes you feel like you're getting some special treatment or something. When I arrived at the hotel and entered the lobby I was blown away by how GOOD it smelled. Whatever scent they have running thru there is phenomenal...something like a vanilla/citrus mix. The casino was HUGE but easy enough to get around. I LOVE the decor of the casino/hotel. No theme...just new and modern...kind of refreshing. My husband spends most of the time in the casino while I spend most of mine at the pool. So...when picking out hotels I tend to go to pick those with the nicest pools. ARIA did NOT disappoint. They have three pools, plenty of chairs (although it was March so not full) and the wait staff are constantly coming thru. Lots of palm trees, plants, etc. Also, someone mentioned lack of security. We only stayed for one night and on two different occassions, on our floor, we saw security going into two rooms. Not sure if that was coincidence or not but wanted to notate it. We only ate one of the restaurants; Jean Georges (not sure if I'm spelling that right) and it was DELISH!!! My husband and I split the porterhouse and it was probably the best steak I've ever had...second best was at STACK in Mandalay Bay. Someone also mentioned that there is not a sundries shop...there is. It's in the shop (which does look like a clothing store) at the bottom of escalators leading up to the pool...around the corner for the bakery/dessert shop. Anyway, I think that about covers it. I would definitely recommend this hotel...I didn't experience ANY of the problems of previous reviews. Give Aria a shot!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: lawplanet
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in early March. When you arrive at the hotel, the bellman open the doors to the cab for you and welcome you. As soon as you get in, you will notice big line ups to check in. I don't mind waiting, but each guest took at least 10-15 mins at each counter it seemed. We requested a upper floor suite and they put us in floor 31 at the end, which was great, it was quiet. cons of this hotel: Make sure you put your privacy sign on! there has been many times where at random times, house keeping will knock on your door (even at 11:30 pm. yes 11:30) to see if you needed service, if you don't answer, they will open the door! House keeping in this hotel is terrible. (they do a good job of cleaning, but there are times where we came back at 5:00pm to change for our dinner and the room still haven't been cleaned yet. to reach the guest elevators, you have to walk through the casino floors. The hotel it self faces the strip, but its a good 5 min walk to the strip from front door. Pros: very very nice hotel, -Tram connects you to bellagio. -technology is awesome - very big walk in showers with sit down spots as well. I still recommend this hotel to friends, but wish they would do better on house keeping.

Reviews.Title: “Eat at the buffet but don't stay”
Reviews.Author: hpcody
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas about 2 -3 times per year and have stayed at many different hotels. We were excited to try the newest luxury hotel, Aria, but were disappointed overall with our stay. The building is very beautiful with lots to look at. The rooms had a great initial appearance, but that's when the problems started. First, there was rotten food in the unlocked mini bar that was obviously there for some time. We called to have it removed but no one ever showed. We really wanted to order room service which is much easier to do if they include a menu in the room. We called to request a menu which they said they would send right up, but no menu ever showed up. We figured we could at least put some drinks on ice and relax without room service only to find after a long walk to the ice machine, there was no ice, the machine was broken. We reported this problem but as you can probably guess, no one showed to fix the ice machine. Do you sense a trend? On another topic, the remote control option to open curtains, turn on lights, manage music and other entertainment had great potential but unfortunately, the software was painfully slow. Hit a button and wait became the norm. We recommend you pray you hit the right button and don't hit it more than once because bad things happen. The check in process was somewhat disorganized. We could see they were trying but more work needs to be done. We had two couple in front of us and it still took 30 minutes to get checked in. The clerk was slow and should have asked for more information about us prior to searching for our reservation. She attempted to use our name which was very slow. We finally offered a confirmation number which moved the process along. The rooms were quiet and the beds were very comfortable. The food was a bright spot. The dessert shop had great options for a reasonable price. The coffee was great! The buffet was OUTSTANDING!. The choices and quality were far better than any buffet that we have ever been to. You must have brunch there. Overall this place could be great with improved service and attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Too many kinks to ironed out. Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous094
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the rooms look great but the service was absolutely non-existent. I had a security problem in the hallway outside my room and was unable to reach ANYONE on the phone for 45 minutes. One morning, I had to step over two drunks who were passed out in the hall outside my room. I was told there are no security cameras in the halls. The electronics in the rooms (everything is computerized) didn't work. I discovered my front door did not lock - after 2 days! Don't expect any amenities either. No sundries shop in the hotel. Coffee isn't available before 6:00 a.m. (although alcohol is 24/7). I was so unimpressed, I can't find the words. I was there to attend a wedding and they should be ashamed of the "suite - and I use the term loosely" that they gave the bride and groom. It was awful - on the roof with a view of building services. If you really want to stay here, give it a year. They don't know what they're doing yet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, poorly trained desk staff! Walk through the property, but don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: mzkris10
Reviews.Content: The facility itself is absolutely stunning! It is as if you are living in a piece of art. Everywhere you look you are surrounded by beautiful things. The valet, conceierge, restaurant staffs and housekeeping staffs were fantastic. The front desk staff was inept. Upon arrival they could not locate our reservations. We had (2) rooms with (3) adult women in each room. When they found our reservations, they informed us they only had rooms with (1) king size bed per room and no rollaway beds available. This was obviously not okay. After much discussion, they miraculously found rooms with (2) beds per room. Throughout our stay we had to deal with them frequently because at one point they checked us out of one of our rooms a day early. Upon departure, we had pre-paid for our stay, yet they had us owing for misc. charges we never made. Bottom line, we had to spend way too much time dealing with their ineptness for this to be considered a vacation. Now that I've seen the property, I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Frustration couldn't stop the party”
Reviews.Author: CSIguy
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I just got back from a near legendary bachelor party. I chose the Aria for our group largely because it was brand new and that it would likely draw a good crowd. Some of my gambles paid off, while others added to my daily hangover. We chose to stay here for four nights, so I can honestly say that these issues were not isolated, so without further ado... The technology is sweet, but also a nightmare. You can control the entire room on one touch pad remote. Cool until you actually NEED to use it. Most of this is because the touch remote is unresponsive making TV useless. The lights weren't labeled well, so you have to push every button or deal with the touch pad. On a positive note, you could set the alarm to open your curtains and dim the lights. Not cool when pranksters set if for 5am and have ESPN and lights turn on. Arg. $30 gym fee. Needed to do a quickie workout, but found out at the spa there was a fee. I am not paying for a 30 minute jog on an elliptical. After a long wait, I got the manager to comp this for me and a few friends. Casino is so so. Aside from getting my rear kicked on every table, the casino was small and not well planned. It took us a very long time to figure our where anything was located. You cannot see easily because it is very dark and the ceilings are low. Therefore, you need a GPS to find the sports book, poker rooms, cashier, and a quick bite. Positive note, cocktail waitresses were very friendly. If you are staying, I would immediately learn the floor plan and city center layout. This will save you TONS of wasted time and energy. Pool is nothing special. Everything about the Aria is a scam to milk your wallet, and the pool is no exception. Some pools are very exclusive and Aria guests don't get preference. Many private cabanas that are surrounding the pool area rent for $1000. If your making Kanye $$ then this would be BA. The pool definitely caters to the rock star crowd and was pretty boring. Monte Carlo pool was rocking though, saw tons of people having fun. I know this because the Aria tram access is overlooking the MC. Music and food everywhere and a good balance of amenities. Aria failed on making it classy AND fun. Perks... not for me. We were there during March Madness and the hotel was booked solid. Because of this, I'm guessing they payed little attention to non-VIPs. Room service, not great. I didn't test this extensively, but when I needed towels on the fly we waited an hour. I also had a question for the front desk and could never get someone to answer. Called about 5 times or 10 minutes. They wouldn't provide us with basic requests, ie-cups for the room. Most service staffers were extremely friendly though. 50% have been laid off since the open, so I'm guessing they are highly motivated. Bathroom was pretty nice. Not good for a group of friends since the shower and toilet are only separated by glass. Created a few uncomfortable moments. Shower leaks all over the outside marble and the water flow is weak. Took us 5 min to locate the sink outlet, which was hidden behind a marble kleenex box. "Towels are kinda scratchy!" Never visited the clubs at Aria, but the word is that Haze is a pretty happening club. Tough to get in and I'm guessing they want guys to drop $1000 for a 2 bottle minimum table. Keys had problems. Like most hotel keys, there are easy to demagnetize. This caused many of us to make the 10 mile walk from room to front desk. Once one key is remagnetized, the others are invalid. This was very annoying. Check-in and check-out can take a long time depending on when you show up. I didn't have this problem, but mid-day arrivals were 15 people deep. All in all, it was a good stay due to the novelty of the casino/hotel. One and done for me, and I would recommend this to anyone who is new to Vegas. I have stayed elsewhere and recognize the many faults at Aria. If you are familiar with SPG hotels, I would compare this to the Aloft. It is trendy and clean like a W Hotel but has the attention to details and value of an Aloft. Hope this is helpful! PS. Can't leave this out. I've been to almost all of the big name casinos and I will give the Aria one closing complement... the women that were converging on this casino and hotel were amazing! Hottest women in Vegas on this survey. Most were passing through to clubs, or other venues. Around midnight, it was an amazing to see. Oh yeah, and I gambled with Mike Tice, previous Vikings coach. Cool guy.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL SERVICE EVER!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NeneCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I have never experienced such bad service. I've gotten better service staying at a motel. Room reservations were messed up. I was given 1 queen bed for a family traveling with 2 young kids. I was then told that they would send up 2 rollaway beds at no charge. Waited several hours for beds to arrive then was told that they ran out of rollaway beds. Needless to say rest of the family had to sleep on the floor all weekend =(. Once we got into our room TV did not work. Had to wait several for that also for someone to come in a repair problem. Oh, by the way everytime we called front desk we were put on hold for long periods of time and then call would be dropped. As for the next day when we came back to our room our keys would not work. Had to ask housekeeping that was down the hall to let us in. For such a new hotel you would think service would be outstanding.... I would never stay here again nor would I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with a great staff! Most high tech room in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: brittany2325
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria last week for five nights. It was phenominal. After reading some of the reviews I was a little nervous but we had a GREAT time. The hotel is obviously brand new. The decorations and architecture is beautiful. Prices for food, buffets, and drinks are similar to all other locations on the strip in Vegas. We also had a 75.00 credit with a promo code we used so that got us free ice cream, drinks, and part of a meal. The room is very high tech with a touch screen that controls everything. It is very neat...we enjoyed just playing with all the controls. The bathroom is very large with double sinks which was great since we had many people in our room. We were a younger crowd, and enjoyed this hotel. People of all ages seem to stay at this hotel, however it was mostly middle aged people, as it is too expensive for most Spring Breakers. The staff is very accomodating. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay as great as possible. We had a problem with our bathroom door handle and the toilet flushing on its own. They came up immediately to fix these problems. We also accidentally broke the toilet lid trying to figure out the problem ourself, and they never charged us for it. Very nice!! The pool area is Gorgeous with three pools and 3 hot tubs. There is also a luxury pool called Liquid, but it was not open yet and I'm assuming it will cost more. Only bad thing is that the website makes it appear the wireless internet is included with your stay but it actually costs 15.00 a day. Overall, loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Curiosity killed the cat”
Reviews.Author: FrankieWI
Reviews.Content: The reviews really sum things up. Lots of kinks to work out. For the money, there are better options. Service is the standout problem here. From dirty carpet in room, unstocked mini bar, lack of complete toiletries in room and room service being completely off (with no attempt to make things right) you do (and should ) expect more for your money. That being said, its beautiful to look at. Yes, it is dark but thats okay. (The filthy windows requiring that you keep sheers closed, however is NOT okay). Oh, and you can hear your neighbors through the walls when you are in the bathroom--nice touch. The salon is a must. So wouldn't really recommend it with so many better options. Once they teach the staff that they are in the hospitality industry in a competitive market it may improve. But maybe just consider this one if you are in your 20's and never been to Vegas before.

Reviews.Title: “A few bugs to work out”
Reviews.Author: Seajax
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aria for 2 nights with colleagues. We took a shuttle from the airport since 5 of us arrived on the same flight. For some reason the shuttle dropped us off in the basement and it took us a good 10 minutes of walking to find the front desk. I was impressed when I walked in the room and the curtains opened and the music and lights came on. It was very clean and spacious. As previous posters have already written, the room has a touchpad control for the TV, curtains, temperature, lights, alarm and music. There are 2 closets with robes, plenty of drawers to hold clothes, including a drawer in the bathroom to hold toilettries. The bed was incredibly comfortable and I never heard a sound from the other rooms except when I was in the bathroom. Except for one of us that had the connecting doors to another room, none of us heard a peep from our neighbors. The bathroom is tiled along the floor and walls, so there was an echo which is probably why I heard sounds from my neighbor only in the bathroom. The bathroom had a big shower and a huge soaking tub...very luxurious! However, there are a few bugs that the Aria needs to work out. Out of our group, I heard the following complaints from my colleagues: -2 TVs weren't working. -2 people set their alarms on the touchpad to wake up and it didn't work -About 4-5 of us couldn't get the internet to work in our rooms. Apparently not all of the cell phone towers are hooked up yet from what one of us was told by the staff. -1 person was put in a smoking room even when he requested non-smoking, and had to wait 1/2 hour on hold to be moved. Then the bell hops showed up 45 minutes early from their scheduled time to move him and he wasn't ready. -All of us experienced long hold times when calling the front desk. I gave up after 10 minutes and went to a colleague's room to use their internet. Luckily I was never charged since I was never able to hook up. -Almost all of us had trouble with our cell phone coverage in our rooms. Although it was neat having the touchpad, it didn't quite work right. I was watching TV late one night and selected "lights off" and the lights AND the TV shut off. Then it took a good few minutes to get the TV back on. I hit something else with the lights, and the curtains opened up! This happened a few times when turning off the lights. I learned to just go through every light on the menu and turn them off one by one. The Aria is a bit away from the strip, but there is a back way that you can take a skywalk over to the Bellagio. You will still have to walk through the Bellagio to get through the strip, but the Bellagio is beautiful, so I didn't mind. However, for those that want to be right in the action, this might be a little bit of an issue. The rooms were very spacious and quiet with extremely comfortable beds. I believe the hotel "officially" opens next week with higher rates. Although the little issues weren't a big deal during my stay, if I was paying the prices they will soon be commanding, I wouldn't be a very happy guest. The Aria needs to get more staff to answer the phones and fix the few little technology glitches and it will be top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn333
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Aria March 6 -8. We really enjoyed the hotel; it is very nice, modern and well-kept. Check-in went very smoothly, and we were able to check in at 10:30am without any issue. The rooms are beautiful. We were at the furthest end of the hall away from the elevators, and it wasn't far to walk, unlike other reviewers compaints on this. Didn't like their casino's, as we plan penny slots and although there are lots of them, you must bet between 40 cents and 4 dollars minimum on them. Because of this, we went to other casinos for the little gambling we did. Their breakfast buffet was delicious; lots of choices, lots of food in the serving trays. Not sure how it would be for dinner, but definitely worth the weekday price for breakfast. Pools and hot tub were open, although we didn't use them. Overall, a great stay with no complaints! Booked online with Expedia...$940 incl. taxes for both of us, including flights from Edmonton, Alberta and 2 nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Havingagoodtime67
Reviews.Content: Not sure what all the bad reveiws are about. We stayed their March 20-24, 2010 and had the best time ever. There was 5 of us and we had 3 rooms. We did not have one complaint. It is a very luxurious hotel! The rooms were absolutely beautiful! The beds are so comfy! The pool area was big and real suave! We are going back and staying longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “On the strip but off the strip...”
Reviews.Author: undathesea
Reviews.Content: The property is very nice. Every bit of 4.5 stars. I actually really enjoyed my three night stay. It is dark, as other have reported, but this appeals to the gambler in me. I do not feel comfortable (or even really enjoy) gambling at bright, airy places like the Wynn, Venetian, Mandalay Bay, etc. I prefer places like Mirage, Aria, and somewhat MGM. The room was fantastic. The bed was extremely comfortable and the view I had, although there was another building between the Aria and the strip, was nice as well. The furniture is very contemporary and, again, dark in the room. White comforter and light colored carpeting. A nice contrast if you that's your thing. The in-room safe was a bit hard to find... and it was eventually found after about 15 minutes of searching and re-searching. It is in the night stand drawer. The dealers in Aria were really friendly... as was the rest of the staff. I very much enjoyed playing craps there and spent about 12-15 hours playing craps all night with them. They had several $25 tables and so that was my main game for the trip. I am a dice setter and not once did the dealers talk to me about setting the dice and were really chatty in between rolls (I tip a lot as well). The pit as well as the dealers were extremely outgoing for me. The poker room has a lot of locals and very good players. It is nice and the seats are very comfortable. I noted that there were no drink holders on the tables nor did they have a drink rail for your drinks. The drinks simply go right on the table on a bev-nap. Don't sit at a game unless you're comfortable with making moves on players and having them make moves back at you. I had a spa service at the Aria with Ramese (spelling may be wrong). She gave a wonderful deep-tissue, classic massage in very comfortable surroundings. She came over from the Bellagio where she had worked since it opened. The facilities are very nice and the coed, outdoor area features a wading pool that overlooks the adult pool area. An interesting sight to behold at 4pm. There is limited seating outside on the deck and if you dare to go out, make sure you take a bathing suit with you and be prepared to either sit in the wading pool or to layout on the stone walk. I prefer Canyon Ranch's aquavana to the amenities at the Aria spa, but the massage was every bit as good as those at CR. I would recommend. The downside to the property is what is lacking at most higher-end strip properties... a quick stop food court (the Venetian has mastered the art of offering great food options for anything from quick and on the go to a five star sit down dinner). There is an overrun coffee shop in the morning... But that seemed to be it and I avoided food at the Aria for this reason alone. Most of the dining seems to be out of the way of the gambling and I only found my options when I intentionally went looking for them. Another downside to this property is the distance that it is setback off the strip. There's really no upside to it. It's about a 30 minute walk to Paris (roughly) due to the winding manner in which you have to walk. I made the walk several times over the trip and I got used to it, but I never enjoyed it. Especially after a few margaritas. For gamblers that don't plan to leave the resort, I'd say it's a pretty good destination. Especially if you can get used to the limiting food options and make the most of it. I know they have a sports book bar/pub that's probably very usable for some quick eats, but during March Madness it was hard to even get close to the place it was so overrun with people... so no good review of it. I do recommend Aria and I do plan to return and stay there. But, I can definitely understand why it's not everyone's cup-o-tea.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: ScreamingHD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 30th wedding anniversary last week and the Aria ruined it. The first room they put us in had a pair of dirty mans boxer shorts and a half eaten candy bar. Then the maid moved us to the room across the hall but no one changed our key cards so we could not get back in the room. It took hours to get the key cards changed. No one at the hotel even wised us a happy anniversary the entire time we were there. The front desk told us to eat our special dinner at another hotel. The two meals we had at the Aria were both very bad. Cold food poor service and raw hambuger. There is no place to eat late after 10 pm. We had to eat at the strips fat burger to get a quick cheap meal at 11 pm. The location is poor also. To far off main strip. Long walk just to get to the main road. The only nice people working at the hotel are the valets.

Reviews.Title: “Aria was much better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: brownboy1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3/14 until 3/18 and came away very impressed. We got to check in early (around 11 am) and only had to be in the check in line for 15 minutes. Suggestion if you're checking in early to have the luggage with you. We had the bell service gathered our luggage as soon as we arrived. Tried to call the service number as soon as we got to the room but no answer after 15 minutes. Not a big deal as we used that opportunity to explore the hotel. We came back to the room around 3 pm and called the service line and got our luggage within 10 minutes plus the bellman brought in some ice and explained to us all the function of the buttons/remote etc. Speaking of the remote, it is not that difficult to figure out if you have some tech skills. If you can't figure it out they also have manual switch overrides for all the lightings and tv (42" 1080p LCD - with all HD channels!). Love the "keyless" entry! We have the mountain view which was not bad at all. I agree that the drape didn't have the total "blackout" effect but the bedding were awesome! One note to those who uses any electronic sleep aid (CPAP etc. - I use one) to remember to bring with you an extension cord (at least a 6') because there isn't a plugin close by the bed (it's right behind the mattress). My wife and I really liked the vanilla scent as you enter the hotel lobby area (kind of remind you that you are "home" after lots of walking during the day). The overall ambiance throughout the hotel was very nice - it is purposely decorated ultra modern with very nice modern and fine arts. The "wall of water" outside the front entrance is a good photo op spot plus the sound is very soothing. The casino is a litle dark compare to most casinos on the strip but the lightings are in the proper places. We didn't gamble much as our purpose really was for relaxation and to go see shows. The pool area is very nice and the only thing is I wish that for the hotel to have more waiter/waitresses around the pool area. Security was excellent on the elevator shafts. We had lunch at the buffet right before we left. The prices are about the same for all 3 meals comepare to others on the strip. (PH and Paris had the best buffet IMO though). Viva Elvis is a must see!! we had orchestra level seat and it was well worth it! We were granted a late check out. The process only took 5 minutes. Concierge was very helpful with any questions that we had. Turndown service at night is wonderful also! This was our 5th trip to Vegas and we've stayed in 5 different places. I really liked Aria because it's uniqueness compare to other hotels that we've stayed. I will definitely recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Technology for Technology’s Sake”
Reviews.Author: Retailwonderer
Reviews.Content: The Aria makes a big deal about the innovative technology in its rooms. I guess it’s kind of fun, but anytime you need to read a manual to figure out how to set your alarm clock or change the TV channel, it’s just too much work. I also wonder what will happen as some of it starts to get old.
