If you can overlook or enjoy the technology, here’s what else you will find: -Check-In took over 25 minutes. 5 to 10 minutes to check in each guest, even though everyone I saw was pre-registered and already in the computer system. It appeared to be a combination of slow employees, slow computers, and the Aria trying to make it a fun “event”. There was also a lot of time spent showing people maps of all the hotel’s shops and services, which I think was really an up-selling attempt. -Check-Out was also slow. (What a surprise.) Seemed to be the same issues. Unlike most hotels, no one asked me how my stay was. -There is no in-room coffee at this hotel. I cannot remember the last time I was at a nice hotel (or even a cheap motel for that matter) which did not have in-room coffee. When I called the front desk to see if perhaps it was just missing from my room, they told me about all the places in the hotel where I could buy a cup of coffee, including room service for a total cost of $9. Rip off. -The bathroom faucets are a joke. Again, form over function. There is no way to run the water without splashing yourself and everything sitting around your sink. The rest of the bathroom is a bit strange, but functional. -There is a fitness center as part of the spa. Unlike most hotels, there is no option available to just go in and work out for free or a nominal cost. Even if all you want to do is run 3 miles on a treadmill and lift a few weights, you have to purchase a $30 spa day pass. No thanks. - Like most Las Vegas hotels, you must walk through their smokey casino to get anywhere. -On the positive side, the convention facilities were excellent and the meeting food, drink, and service were very good.

Reviews.Title: “No elegance or service”
Reviews.Author: jandol
Reviews.Content: Tried this new Aria in Las Vegas, was very dissapointed.......the line ups to register were at least 15 to 20 minutes. When we arrived at our room, it was not vacuumed, popcorn on the floor, no stationery in the drawer to write on just envelopes, the light on the desk did not work. After complaining (waiting in line again), we were moved to another room. The casino is very dark, everything is brown and orange.... the music in the casino was extremely loud and noisy - Rapp music, etc. this went on from the early morning to late night. At the restuarant the menu has almost nothing for vegetarian, we requested a vegeterian pizza and had to send it back as it was not cooked in the middle and was covered in garlic (just chopped up ). The whole place is extremely bland - we felt like we were in a shopping mall on the way to the pool - where we had to leave once again for the loud music. This certainly is not the standard we were expecting of this calibre of hotel. On check out we had to wait in line, once again for a taxi - there were about 25 people in front of us with no taxi cabs in site. We ended up sharing a limo with people anxious to get to the airport for their flight. So if you want an elegant stay in Las Vegas with excellent service try the Bellagio - can't beat it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “High high-tech and marshmallow bedding!”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer1966
Reviews.Content: During my two nights at Aria, I was consumed in sheer luxury and high-tech innovation. The hotel property is absolutely massive. Despite an awe-inspiring use of glass in the construction of Aria, it is quite dark once you venture into the belly of the resort. There is no sense of any real character, but it is without doubt an architectural marvel and doesn't fail to impress as a building. For me, it is overwhelming, but I'm sure it is sheer heaven for avid gamblers. The rooms are outstanding. Very plush and well appointed. The bed and pillows are the softest, most comfortable I have EVER slept on. The room is totally "wired" with a state-of-the-art system that allows you to control everything from curtains and lighting to TV or check-out via a single, easy to use remote control. Waking up to my choice of curtains opening to reveal the sunrise and the gentle introduction of light from my bedside lamp is unique and thoroughly indulgent. Affordable even for the most frugal of corporate travel budgets, though I imagine the rates will change as the economy improves. If you get a chance to stay while rates are reasonable I highly recommend it. Even when the rates do increase, it's well worth experiencing. The bathrooms have all the mod-cons and are VERY lovely. The pool area is exquisite and a must-see, even if just to walk around or have a drink/meal in the fresh air. Last but by no means least, the staff at Aria are simply superb. As a woman traveling on business it's not always comfortable to have a drink alone at the bar. The bar tenders engage you in conversation to put you at ease while you sip a night cap. Everyone from security, maids/cleaning staff, concierge, bellboys, doormen and room service personnel were incredibly pleasant, friendly and keen to make their guests' stay as enjoyable as possible. I was very late arriving and check-in seemed very slow, but check-out was very speedy and I only went to the desk because they charged me twice for Internet access, which they rectified immediately. I had access to my bill at all times thanks to the TV/high-tech system in the room, so Express Check-out would have been a convenient option had I not needed human intervention.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience...”
Reviews.Author: Crazy8s_MIA
Reviews.Content: I must say, i've been following the reviews on Aria since about 1 month after its grand opening in Dec. My friends and I wanted a great 5 star hotel and that's what we got. I've read some reviews where ppl arrived on friday and had to wait almost on hour to check in!...I arrived on Friday as well and it took about 15-20 minutes TOTAL (we arrived just before 7pm). We booked rooms with double beds and they claimed there were no queen rooms availalbe...minor inconvenience...but with every hotel review i read (yes, including other 5 star hotels) there was always somebody who didn't get the exact room they requested...it happens to alot of ppl at every hotel on the strip. Anyway, the hotel is nice and classy...not too dark (i can definitely see everything, see where i'm going, and see my room number thank you). As for the room, it was fabulous...and NO it wasn't small for a 5 star hotel lmao. IF you're comparing the room size to Encore or Palazzo, then yes...it is smaller. But if you're comparing to Wynn or Bellagio, well..ummm...it's the same size...ppl get over it. I loved the technology in the room. I read that some ppl had trouble with this (i don't see why), but if you can read and have fingers, you can figure how to use the all-in-one remote...it's not hard ppl...and i'm not tech savvy at all. If you figure you can get up and open your own curtains w/o that darn remote, then by all means...but don't complain. If you don't like using the remote to change the tv channels, then use the other standard tv remote that's provided...but don't complain when there are other options for you to choose from. Oh yeah, the hotel is NOT too far back from the strip...where do ppl come up with these things. It took all of 3 minutes to walk from the hotel to the strip.And the walk thru the casino to the elevators...omg i can't believe ppl complained about this too!! You walk thru part of the casino to get to the elevators...this is not a new concept exclusively at the Aria lol. As for the maid service, we didn't have a problem at all. No money was stolen (even though we left the money for housekeeping we had to label it before they would take their tip). We turned on the service light and when we came back towards the evening it was clean. We didn't request service expecting it to be done within 1-2 hours. Our room was cleaned every day...not one problem. With that, the only complaint i did have with the hotel is the buffet. We went for dinner and immediately left. Yes, a waste of $90 (30/person). That food was not up to par with a 5 star hotel. I've had better food at Emerald Coast (miami) and even Golden Corral lol. But with hundreds of other options on the strip, this won't be an issue the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: gpbdolphin
Reviews.Content: I've never rated a hotel before, but the service at the Aria was so bad I could not get over it. I had booked this room for months and was looking forward to spending a great time there, unfortunately it ruined the majority of our weekend. It all started when we checked in on Friday night, the wait was a horrible experience. It took at least 40 minutes to check in. Guests were requesting a manager, and it wasn't until 20 minutes later that front desk decided to call the manager. Saturday we requested house keeping service before leaving to go to lunch and when we came back the room was still a mess and the tip we left was gone! I called to complain and they apologized and said they would send someone up and tell the manager. No one came up until we called again. They finally came by when the turn down service came by. My boyfriend and I decided to leave and have a nice dinner, which was the only pleasant thing at the Aria. Of course that had to get ruined when we went gambling. One of the waitresses came around calling beverages. So I asked her for a drink. I repeated myself twice because she looked at me as if she didn't know what I was saying. I finally asked, you did say beverages right. She got an attitude and said "didn't you just hear me say beverages?" I was livid! And not only that my boyfriend tried to order a drink and she walked away. Sunday when we were leaving we called the bell hop desk, it took them an hour and three phone calls later for them to finally tell me that the request was never put in. The whole experience was horrible. Oh and by the way complaining to management was no help either. All they said was sorry and nothing else. It was useless talking to them. Do not bother staying here. It's not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great. Expected more from 5 star resort.”
Reviews.Author: TrvlrRob
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at multiple 5 star properties in Las Vegas and the Aria is one that I would most likely not return to unless something really changes in the next 4 days (currently staying). We checked in and were told we received a complimentary upgrade in the Suite Tower. While there are a few good perks staying in this 'exclusive' tower, we were highly disappointed to enter our room to find out it was a typical room that wreaked of cigarette smoke. On top of this it was a handicapped equipped room with no bath tub. The only place to hang a towel in this room is on the handicap rails right over the toilet, no where even close to the shower. As I have called for a different room I get the same response, "we'll see what we can do by one pm". At that point if nothing changes I will ask to speak with a manager to try and get this taken care of. To be quite honest at this point, we would love to be downgraded to a normal room. At this point I would return to the Encore any day. THAT is a true 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Check out the art, stay someplace else....”
Reviews.Author: PVDFan1974
Reviews.Content: Prior to this trip, I've stayed at Signature, Wynn, and Encore, and I must say that Aria is by far the worst of the bunch. I get that it is geared toward a younger clientele with a modern aesthetic, but as a 36 yr old (who is not an enemy of minimalism) I just found Aria to look and feel cheap. Make that C-H-E-A-P. One very specific complaint: the floor to ceiling window of the room with the view for which I paid extra was FILTHY. So dirty that I kept the shears closed. Having said all that a few positives: in-room WI-FI is the fastest, most reliable connection on the strip. However, bring a network cable if you think you'll need one...you have to pay for the one in the room as part of $30 "technology package." Other positives : the buffet is excellent and compares quite favorably with Wynn. Also Julian Serrano is awesome. Those highlights aside, all in all, I cannot recommend Aria as there are so many other nicer places to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints.”
Reviews.Author: BOC2010
Reviews.Content: No issues with the Aria, would definitely go back. Don't be intimidated by any of the negative reviews. Friendly staff and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Aria - If you want luxury stay at the Bellagio, Venetian, The Four Seasons, THE Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Carlito_NY
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Aria this past weekend and I have to say that the experience was less than desirable. The Check in and Check out process was a nightmare and it was very difficult to find someone who had any good information or reliable knowledge of the property and what the property had to offer. I originally booked 2 rooms and requested 2 double beds for each room and upon arrival I was told that there were no rooms with double beds available in the entire hotel. After 10 minutes at the front desk the woman who helped me found a room with queen beds but told me that the other room was a king bed. I was then told that I could call up for a roll away bed. Once we got to the room, I called to request a rollaway bed and was told that it was not available. At that point, I then had to request a 3rd room for my group. I ended up booking another room which cost us money that was not originally planned for. I can’t help but think that a rollaway bed was not provided so that I may book another room. Another problem that I had was whenever I called the Front Desk, Bell Desk, Concierge, Operator there was an exceptionally long wait and hold time. Once I was connected to the bell desk to have my bags sent up (after 10 minutes on hold) it took almost 30 minutes to get the bags after the person on the line said it would be 10 minutes. We went to the spa and had 12 noon massage appointments – the masseuse was 30 minutes late and the massage did not start until 12:30pm…this made our time spent in the relaxation room less than relaxing. The Aria billed itself as a luxury hotel with luxury amenities but the service that we received was less than luxurious. This hotel could take a page out of the book of the Four Seasons, or the Venetian for that matter. Rooms were actually cool though...

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service ever, never stay here.”
Reviews.Author: enga49
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I never write a review for anything, but this hotel left such a bad taste in my mouth that I had to write something. First off this was a birthday trip, so never plan a birthday trip around Aria or even Vdara for that matter. Booked two rooms, well ahead of time, with TWO queens. When we got there, they said they had overbooked their hotel, and this happened to a bunch of other people who arrived at the same time. They said they would offer us two rooms with ONE king bed. We asked for a roll away, and they said they didn't have any left. What kind of brand new hotel doesn't have a sufficient amount of roll aways? Especially a vegas hotel. We said we obviously can't function with ONE BED cuz we planned to have 4 people in the room. We asked for an upgrade because it was their fault for overbooking, instead the receptionist just straight up said NO. without giving us a reason. I even told them it was my BIRTHDAY, which it really was, and she said "I'm sorry, but no." It didn't help either that the receptionist was giving us attitude the whole way, even though we were calm and understanding of the situation. Their staff seemed to lack any type of professionalism or courtesy. we ended up just taking one room there, and the other people went to vdara, which from what I heard was just as bad. they gave them a "suite" but it was a regular sized room, which was smaller than our NORMAL Aria room, but cost 50 dollars MORE. on top of that, their front desk put them on hold for 40 minutes at 4am in the morning. what is so urgent that the front desk has to put you on hold for 40 minutes? TERRIBLE customer service. Usually vegas hotels treat you well and take care of their customers, but at Aria and Vdara we definately felt like SECOND CLASS CITIZENS. Id rather stay at Planet Hollywood. Cheaper, same sized rooms, and the staff treats you kindly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for Fun and Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: JeGeo
Reviews.Content: The bad reviews are overdone. We stayed at the Aria for 3 days over the March Madness weekend. The beds were incredibly comfortable and we slept extremely well. Otherwise we spent little time in the room - it's Vegas. No complaints about the room; we managed the high tech controls with a little practice. The last night we set the "wakeup" to have the blackout curtains open and the TV come on to wake us up. We found all staff to be friendly! It was as if they were told to be friendly as part of their training. Breakfast buffet was excellent, though a little slow with the service. Yes, the casino is a bit dark, and it was packed with people over the March Madness weekend, as was all of Vegas, but we had fun despite the crowds. The server based video reel slots took some getting used to, but were fun once we played around with them a bit. Switching games on the fly was interesting, which is an option you can select. We also enjoyed some time at the pool each day, but it did get very crowded by around 1:30 p.m. We took in a couple of shows but not the Elvis show at the Aria. We walked through Crystals and felt most businesses were for the very well off. The architecture is all very modern, with a lot of shiny metal and glass. It was OK, but we prefer more of a theme. We would stay at the Aria again, and hope they continue to offer some good promotions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: initiator92
Reviews.Content: I can't speak for anyone else, but I thought this hotel was excellent. It is completely modern and very classy. The room was spectacular. It was very high tech. Practically everything can be controlled from the remote and/or TV. The mini-bar was like a mini 7-Eleven. It had the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on in a hotel. I'm a frequent business traveler and I've stayed in a lot of hotels. This is by far the best. I would agree with what a few others have said that there is a slight walk from the parking garage to the hotel lobby and rooms. To me, though, this is a minor convenience. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Six of us stayed with a range of ages from 25 to 75, will not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: DPHDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: Arrival in shuttle underground parking garage, no assistance or directions on how to get to main lobby. A very long walk to the entrance and check-in. Staff very friendly, beds very comfortable. Aria breakfast buffet very good with a good selection. Nice big windows, too dirty to see out. Bathroom look very modern, but water splattered out of the sinks no matter how low you turned it on. Walk into shower and then bath - connected. If you took a bath, had to remove towel because the water from the shower got everything wet. To warm up the water in the shower, had to stand in bathtub, or if you stood outside the glass door, the floor would then get wet when you opened the door. If anyone pushed the button in the room that said "goodnight", it turned off everything in the room including the bathroom lights, which was bad when someone was actually taking their shower. Shower floor seemed very slick. Casino very cold and very few people gambling in their casino.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Aria”
Reviews.Author: mommacl
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights 3/16-3/19 2010 with my daughter (21) and her boyfriend (25) we had adjoining rooms on the 16th floor. We all loved the hotel. The check in was fast and easy. We did the express check out, which I would recommend. When we left there was a long line of people checking out. The techie room was cool. Watch TV, open your curtains...all at the touch of your bedside control panel, which also was your wake up call, clock etc. The bathroom was stunning! Loved the bath / shower arrangement. We ate at Lemongrass, a casual Thai restaurant, the food was excellent. We also ate at Cafe Vettro, also casual, this is a 24 hr. restaurant , you can get breakfast, lunch or diner 24/7. All of our food was very good. All and all we would go back to the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever in Vegas -- You can do Better!!”
Reviews.Author: bjamboli
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful and brand new. Rooms are nice. Restaurants OK. Service is horrible. My room safe malfunctioned 4 days in a row, and only on the 4th time did management offer any cure for the problem. Of course, the problem was the safe which they finally changed on the last night of our stay. To add insult to injury, the next to last day even though we had the service room light on all day and were out of the room all day, when we returned to the room at 6:00 pm to shower and get ready for dinner and the rest of the evening our room had not been serviced. We were out of all toiletries. After waiting so far for 45 minutes, room service still has not brought toiletries so we still can't prepare for dinner and the evening. Also, the pool service is terrible. When you try to call the front desk to try to get something resolved, be prepared to stay on hold at least 15 minutes. We stayed March 16 - March 21, 2010. I will never stay here again, and would not recommend this hotel to anyone. In my opinion the hotel is cold and impersonal. Worst hotel we have ever stayed at any resort location around the world because of service issues. James B Dallas, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: LoJoMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Seems to me that many negative reviews I read on here are from people who feel they deserve special treatment for some reason. I learned early in life, people who act like they have money, have nothing but an over rated opinion of themselves. That being said on with the review. We visit Vegas on average 2-3 times per year. Have stayed at most of the strip hotels including THEHotel, Ceasars, Bellagio and so on. We had a great stay, check in was fine, room little smaller than expected but very nice. High tech stuff was kinda cool and the bed was outstanding. Service was very friendly, restaurants on the expensive side but food quality was very good. Can't wait to go back whens it warmer, pool area looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged/Service Bad”
Reviews.Author: flafishers
Reviews.Content: Me, my mother and daughter stayed at Aria. We hauled our luggage from the parking structure to the lobby. This is a long walk so, if you are handicapped beware. We finally got checked in, and went to our DIRTY room! It still had kids toys in it. We waitted in the hall for an hour before a bell boy brought us a key and moved our luggage to a clean room. Suppose to be an upgrade.. Same room just a few floors up. THEN, we check out and on our Visa we have charges for days we were not at the hotel. They still have not fixed the charges as of yet. We will report this to Visa and the States Attorney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic modernistic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaneFtWorthTexas
Reviews.Content: Briefly walked through Aria in January after it opened in December 2009 and was impressed enough to make reservation for March. The design, sleekness, and convenience are great. Good food/bars/casino with excellent rooms very fashionably detailed. High-tech electronics, comfortable bedding. Security going to elevators was well handled. I would definitely return. Shopping is still limited but great potential.

Reviews.Title: “MANY MORE PRO'S THAN CON'S AND WOULD STAY AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: MILLYDM
Reviews.Content: Like most people have said, I was reluctant about arriving here due to the mixed reviews. I was in a group of men over for a Vegas trip and we are a mix of ages and job types, yet we all pretty much agreed on everything and so I will summarise on here. First impressions are wow - we arrived by limo bus and were dropped at the door and had our luggage taken from the bus to the door. Took 20 minutes to check in and get keys to the rooms and all as booked and no surprises. This could have been better had there been a host in the foyer directing guests to a window as they became free (this is what happens in most other Strip Casino/Hotels) as opposed to take pot luck and pick a queue and hope...we got the lucky queue that was fast!!!! If the Aria reads this - take one person from the friont or back taxi areas and make them a foyer host - I guarantee your feedback will positively rocket!! Next impressions are that brown is everywhere and that the casino is the worst lit on the strip. Carper is so soft but beware electric shocks....not joking.....touch the wall before you press the lift button - best tip I can give!!! The rooms are very plush and clean and as everyone has said the mattresses - wow - best ever!! Servicing of the rooms was very late for us two days - after 5pm and we had vacated at about 9am to return at 4.30pm for a nap to find not done. Lager from the in room fridge is the same price as the bars and cheaper than ordered up room service!! Shower is great as well and we had an adjoining room and there was no noise from next door at all. Has to be a five star rated hotel that appears to have ironed out the opening glitches and if the check in was better manned and the rooms cleaned earlier - then would be a 100% review for me - as it is it gets 95% from me. Hope this helps. Some random ietms about Vegas now (some are especially for UK visitors): Eat at the Outback by the Casino Royale - you will get a superb steak at a great price. If wanting to see the Hoover Dam - visit the shop directly across the Strip opposite the end of the road to the Aria as they give the best price in town by about $10 a head (we asked on the coach and all had booked via different places). Do the Gun Shop and fire some guns! Amazing experience and also a $5 vocuher in the brochures in the back of cabs. Take some photos in the gun arcades as well - they will oblige if you ask. Go to the Old Vegas end of the Strip at Freemont Street and see the covered roof show and the open air free shows every 30 minutes at night - great to watch! Get a players card from every casino Chain you visit (MGM is most of them..) as you will get discounts on foods - especially the buffets. Cheapest price for casino used cards is $1.30 a pack plus tax ($3 for 2 packs inclusive) that we could find anywhere and is in most gift shops - some charge $2 a pack plus tax though. Sapphires was over priced and way too busy to enjoy - be warned! Take loads of $1 bills as they are very useful for tipping and smoothing the way.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: atbell21
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about booking a hotel at Aria considering some of the reviews I read. Overall I would say the experience was not bad. I stayed at Aria from March 3-March 7. We decided to use a shuttle bus to arrive at the hotel being that we got a really good deal. Upon arrival at the hotel the shuttle bus driver informed us that we could not be dropped off at the front door as there was no room for a shuttle bus to enter. We were dropped off in a lower parking garage and told that we would have to go up a set of stairs, through the casino to the front desk. Being that this is a 5 star hotel, you would expect there to be bellboys to carry your luggage up. My friend and I was stuck with dragging four bags through the casino it took us about 10 minutes to get to the front desk. Once we arrived at the front desk the lady told us being that the trip was prepaid that we would have to put a credit card on file just incase we decided to make any daily purchases she also added that because it was a debit card they would charge $130 a day! Luckily my friend has worked as a manager at several hotels and was able to get past these requirements. From there everything was perfect! Our room was ready and we were even asked if we wanted to be closer the the elevators! Of course we did. We even called the front desk when my friend left her toothbrush and within 5 minutes we had two complimentry hygiene kits! The view although not a strip view was amazing and I enjoyed waking up to a view of the rio, and mountains everyday. Enjoyed all the updated technology. I would definitely stay at the Aria again. Good: Technology, Location, Entertainment, Food Bad: Shower/Tub setup weird, no plugs near the bed

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: lovevegasalways
Reviews.Content: Wife and I visit Vegas 2 to 3 times a year and have stayed in 5 different hotels but stay mostly at the MGM Grand. Offered comped rooms with perks at Aria. Pros - everything is new, staff is eager to help, good beds, cocktail service is good, liked the casino, players club attentive and helpful, mono-rail convenient. Hall ways very quiet no sound from late night noise. Cons - Technology in rooms is hit and miss, security safe too small, TV check out did not work. Restaurants - Thi food was good, portions were adequate good for the price. Service a little disorganized. Cafe Vettro and The Buffet all overpriced and the food was cold and had no taste. Service again confused. Barmasa was overpirced, small portioned, no taste and decor was uncomfortable. Service was friendly. Baggage storage at checkout was inconvenient but bellman was very professional. Overall nice and new but restaurants except for one are pricey and quality of food lacking. Casino slots are focused on pennys or dollars with very few quarter slots. Need more vidio poker. If you like glass and steel this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and classy, but things could be better.”
Reviews.Author: hvtrillo
Reviews.Content: Asked for room with view upon check-in, but didn't want to pay $75 extra for the 3 nights - was given what was supposed to be a really nice room facing the Strip. Spotlight from fountain out front hit our window, so had to close blackout curtains to sleep. Was given a handicap room without telling us. No place to put toiletries in bathroom, so had to pull chair into bathroom to put them on. Received a very watered-down martini at City Bar; better one the next night at Bar Moderno, but husband had to go find server to order, Restaurants are very $$$$ in hotel, and food is very gourmet - I'd prefer some well-prepared basics. Breakfast cafe was very nice. Ocean Club restaurant in adjacent Crystals shopping mall was excellent and really nice atmosphere. The 3 pools are beautiful and very spacious. Exercise room is not free. Verizon cell phones would not work in casino or restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and contemporary”
Reviews.Author: VicGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aria the first weekend in March. It was an easy check in, maybe 10 minutes or so. The front desk staff were very helpful. They asked if it was necessary for us to be near the elevators and it wasn't so we didn't mind that we had a bit of a walk to our room. We were on the 24th floor with a city view. Beautiful room. It was large and had a nice layout. The in-room technology was easy enough to use. The automatic curtains were our most favorite feature. The hotel smelled great, a nice calm vanilla scent. We ate at just one of the restaurants and it was extremely expensive...but we already new that. We visited the pool area once, had a nice hot tub. Overall our experience was very enjoyable at the Aria, but we would most likely stay at a different hotel next time...just to try something different.

Reviews.Title: “A good time at Aria”
Reviews.Author: gregcs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I take 1-2 trips a year to Vegas to relax. We are both in our 30's and enjoy fine dining / hanging out. We are not casino people - might play $100 max. Our favorite hotel the last few years has been THEhotel. Aria looked promising with all of its modern features so we switched this year. We booked a corner suite. This is primarily why I rated the hotel 4*. The floor plan for the corner suite shows windows in the bathroom and advertises incredible views. Our bathroom was in the interior, so no window. Also it appears that the standard corner suites all have an off-strip/parking lot type view. You need to pony up lots more $$$'s for a city view or panoramic. Never had that issue at THEhotel, a corner suite there has always come with a good view, I suspect this is location - Aria is surrounded by lots of tall buildings and I suspect very few rooms have an actual good view. I was tempted to give 5* because of service. I went to plug my iPod into the high tech system. Plugs available on the TV, but no way to access them. When I called and asked I was told there should be a connection panel, but it was removed from our room for maintenance. They instantly upgraded us to a 1 bedroom Aria Sky Suite with a working connection panel without us asking. This is a more private area of the hotel, about the same size room, but so much better. Pool view was much nicer, bathroom was amazing, space is utilized much better than the corner suite we saw. Internet access in the Sky Suites is apparently free. Incidentally for all the high tech I was unimpressed the with the connectivity. I couldn't get my laptop to talk to their HDMI port and I didn't have a VGA cable with me. I did plug in the iPod, but it only played in the one room - I would have thought everything was connected room to room. The suite did have very decent speakers below the TV, but every 30 minutes or so it would reset and forget the iPod was there. Very strange, these high tech toys seem like they weren't researched well or they went too far down to the lowest bidder. We have never had a chance to do a Vegas pool, but took the opportunity to check out the Bellagio pools while eating a Panini for lunch. Nice, but later we went to the Aria pool for an hour. The pool was definitely heated - if outside temps were 5 degrees higher I'm sure we would have tried it. Others seemed to be having fun, we used the hot tub instead. Aria's pools are large and look like they will be a good time in the busier season. Again on the tech, I think their IT systems aren't all there. We were told we'd get a $75 credit on check in (discount code), this didn't show on our bill. This easily could have been because our room was switched. I didn't complain because we made several drink / water purchases that didn't show up on the bill either, but unfortunately our large salon bill did show up :-(. I think we broke even and I wasn't going to complain about $75 anyway after the great upgrade. In the future we will choose either Aria or THEhotel based purely on price, but the price comparison will be a standard THEhotel V Suite versus an upgraded Aria Corner Suite. No sense in having all those windows if you don't have anything to see out of them!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: sd28
Reviews.Content: Aria is a beautiful hotel. If you want a retreat from the craziness of Vegas but stay within reach of everything this is a wonderfully situated hotel. The artwork that is in and around the City Centre complex speaks volumes. You can obtain a map tour guide at the concierge desk. This hotel complex offers tourists that are more interested in something more cultural than the usual Elvis and Lindsay Lohan spottings.The spa is massive and not to be missed. The restos are amazing..Julian Serrano offers wonderful tapas -traditional and contemporary. Their intent of building a city within a city is captured well. If you've been to Vegas several times..you may just appreciate fresh approach. A tram connects to Bellagio for tired feet. Rooms are LEED certified..everything is at a touch of a remote. This is by far our favourite hotel. This is our third visit to Vegas and we've stayed at Bellagio and Mandalay Bay. Well worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: rorothedog
Reviews.Content: The Aria is like the Titanic of Vegas hotels - a grand behemoth that is being managed straight into a service nightmare of an iceberg. It took over 30 minutes to check in. Calling the front desk takes over 5 minutes of being on hold. The concierges do not know the area - and need to Google simple questions like "how far is this (famous restaurant) from here?" There was no HOT water on Saturday morning. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “loved aria”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyTheresa
Reviews.Content: in february i spent 5 nights at aria with my parents and sister to celebrate my sisters 50th birthday. i was nervous about reading so many negative reviews and was hoping the kinks were worked out before we arrived. they were and it was a great experience. they upgraded us to a strip view because it was my sisters birthday. our first two basic rooms were to far from the elevator but we requested something closer and got it. there was a minor problem with the new rooms but it was quickly fixed. the hotel was beautiful and it cracks me up that so many people say it's to "brown". it's different and not as colorful as wynn but still beautiful. do people want all the hotels and casinos to look the same? i've read that some people were unhappy with the buffet. i'm not a buffet person but really loved theirs. we had dinner there twice and breakfast twice. we stayed at encore last year and i liked the buffet at aria better. it was about $26 for dinner and $19 for breakfast during the week. you couldn't beat it. everything was fresh and delicious. the restuarants were too pricy for my taste and we only had a lite dinner at one of them on our first night. i'm not into spending a lot of money on food and am not into fine dining. as with any of the newer hotels you're going to do a lot of walking because they are huge. we had no problems with valet in fact i was very surprised at how quickly they got us our car. i've read good and bad about the beds. my mother couldn't sleep because the mattress was to soft. i thought it was ok but not as wonderful as some people wrote. check in and out was a little slow but we were there at off times so it wasn't bad. i really loved the aria and would love to go back. vdara might be a nice place to check out if u wanted something a little more quiet and away from the casino. i enjoyed walking around and seeing all the artwork and beauty. i'd definetly go back. i was disappointed that there was no free internet access anywhere in the hotel and i think they charged $15 a day for it. that should definetly be included.

Reviews.Title: “curb appeal does not equal quality”
Reviews.Author: rtjwebster
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Aria for nine days (five days business, fours days personal) I would be hard pressed to recommend this hotel to anyone that has enjoyed the quality of the Bellagio, Wynn, or any Four Seasons location. Day one started with finding a pair of mens underwear in our bed.YUCK! The linens had not been changed from the prior guest. A closer inspection of the sheets revealed makeup ,and I won't go into anymore detail there. Upon reporting this to the houskeeping staff and requesting a new set of linens, we were told that a manager would be right up to speak with us. That never happened. I left a note stating my displeasure. Upon returning about five hours later, we found that while the bed was made, the same linens were still there! The floor had not been vacuumed, and there was dust and hair on the bathroom floor. Now I'm not talking about a white glove treatment here, this was just unacceptable cleaning. Another call to the front desk this time resulted in a $100.00 credit to be used in their restaurants, an apology, and a supervisor to our room. While a very nice gesture, considering that my total bill at the Aria last week exceeded 1,500.00 for just the room, they probably should have done better. I let it go and appreciated that fact that room was spotless when we returned. Some other items, the urban technology in the room with the HVAC, lighting, and curtains controlled via your TV remote or the bedside touchscreen needs some fine tuning. Technology is great when it works...and a real pain when it doesn't. The bathroom sinks have a tendency to splash water regardless of the volume, so don't brush your teeth after you're dressed or you get soaked. And if you're looking for the nice room darkening curtains that you may have had next door at the Bellagio, you will be dissapointed. With three months under their belt since opening, we expected that the bugs would be worked out and the staff would have been weeded out to retain only the best. While we received some great service at the View Bar located off the main lobby, most of the servers and staff in the other bars and restaurants could do with some basic customer satisfaction courses. All told, be sure to take a walk through Aria and Crystals to be awed at the truly amazing architecture, but get your room next door or at the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “..Hotel smelled like sewage”
Reviews.Author: mango17
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at Aria and were extremely disappointed. Visually this hotel is impressive however it does feel like your pulling up to an airport. checking in is a nightmare. There is no velvet rope to assure an organized line with people just scrambling to find a shorter line. The front desk is quite unimpressive with an odd sculpture THE WATERFALL outside of the valet is beautiful and should have also been behind the front desk instead there are office windows with an ugly view of nothing behind them. NOW the smell on the casino stinks of sewage masked by an awful vanilla smell they have pumping through the entire casino and lobby. The SMELL outside the valet was so AWFUL on wed, evening March 8th we couldn't even wait outside. TRULY DISGUSTING. We smelled it faintly the rest of our stay.JUST GROSS. The casino is quite dark which did not bother me so much as the stupid layout which is a series of pockets of machines. PENNY MACHINE after PENNY MACHINE after penny. I think i saw only ten 3 coin quarter machines in the entire place. The walk to the valet when checking out is absurd. SO be prepared to LUG YOUR LUGGAGE all the way to the back of the casino far away from the front desk. THE BEST PART OF THE HOTEL IS THE BEDS. Absolutely hands down the most comfortable beds and pillows ever AND THE HIGH TECH FEATURES IN THE ROOM WERE GREAT. The bathroom was beautiful but the water pressure is AWFUL with a stupid shower head that trickles out combined with a gorgeous tub with no jacuzzi jets in it. (what a waste). Such a high tech room but be prepared to search for a power outlet to charge your cell phone there none by the bedstand and it was hidden behind the kleenex box in the bathroom and one by the front door. It was kinda ridiculous. Overall i would not stay here again the smell of the casino was nauseating and just too cold and sterile for my taste. WE come to vegas to get away from that city feel so the whole idea of a City Center is just plain dumb. We love the Bellagio the best atleast we feel pampered there and the pool cant be beat

Reviews.Title: “Stunning....but short staffed”
Reviews.Author: MikeandDeon
Reviews.Content: Spent a week (Mar8-12) at Aria for my wife's birthday. Like most of the other hotels there, this place is such eye candy, but Aria stands out a bit. If you modern decor, stay here! I read tons of reviews before coming and almost bailed out but thought "what the heck, it's new and it looks awesome" and it does!!! So like other reviews, i'll break it down into sections. And remember.....these are the opinions of my wife and I, so make a decision solely based on what we thought. Casino: Like all the others... I was expecting it to be super dark like the reviews say but, it's like most casinos, just maybe a tad bit darker. No luck on the slots for us. Restaurants: Blossom!!!! Dinner here was the best Chinese food we've ever had. All the others looked awesome, but we couldn't afford a meal per day at this hotel. Pricey ($80-up for two, definitely) Blossom was $180 for the two of us. Lol. Spa: Wife enjoyed a 50min Swedish massage. She loved the other amenities the spa had to offer too! The pool was open too! Room: Average size, but cozy. Enjoyed the tech side of it. And there are about 6 plugs, not sure what reviewers are talking about there not being any plugs. Not by the bed so bring an extension cord if you need something close. Also, there are buttons on the walls for lights and curtains, and a regular remote for the tv to control the whole room. So if you don't like the bedside touchscreen remote, you dont have to use it. I loved the alarm, it turns on the lights, tv, and opens the curtains for you.....no loud buzzing. Lol! Atmosphere: Young and CEOish. Everybody looks at you like, "I wonder what kind of work is he into" or "Who is he." I wear sunglasses and a hat a lot so I got the "is he a celebrity" look all the time...Lol! We left on a Thursday night and it was JUMPIN! We heard that the weekend is crowded for Haze, the nightclub!! So, would we come back, yes, but after we stay at some of the other 5star hotels. (We were Vegas Virgins prior to this trip) If you have stayed at the other 5 stars and want to try this one, do it! It's nice! We will return on the weekend next time so we can club a lil bit! Had a few housekeeping issues (short staffed) but they were resolved, thanks to Dana and Alex (Management), ask for them if you have ANY issues, TRUST ME, they will take care of you!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and $20 trick works!”
Reviews.Author: Marisa6180
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria Feb. 22 thru Feb. 26th. Check in took a long time but that was because the person in front of us. We did the $20 sandwich trick and was upgraded to a strip view on the top floor--the 54th. Beautiful view! The room was great. Loved the technology. Never even had to get out of bed to do things! Only downside--there were some ants in our bathroom. The casino was empty in the morning but was packed at night. I fell in with the new "Sex and the city" game. It wins lots of money too! Tip: Bring COMFORTABLE shoes. We had to go to the Adidas outlet because my feet were killing me. Huge hotel. But it makes up for all the calories I was probably taking in. The only place we ate at the hotel was the Sky Box sports grill. They have a "to go" desk so we would bring it up to the room. Nachos were very good. Bed was very comfortable. Hubby loved it! We hated the pillows. They are the kind where you put your head down and it sinks into it. We like firmer pillows. Don't be worried...it was very nice. Staff was wonderfully nice! Would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “very nice great bed”
Reviews.Author: Bugaginga
Reviews.Content: the hotel is great. the decor is modern. it is very nice. no better than a lot of places here. it is a great hotel but not as nice as palazzo. that being said i would stay here again. many restaurants, the spa is good. highlight is the co-ed hot tub outside with an awesome view of the mountains. location is good but a pain to get to the strip, you have to walk a bit to get to tte strip, through the mall about a ten minute walk which is nice. room is good. bed is GREAT. the remote works everything. that was cool. gets some getting used to but very easy to use. many great restaurants. pricey but all good. buffet is average. casino is huge and dark but in a good way. worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy suites , Pricey, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: yoshiboy700
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel and casino in the city center of Las vegas. Compared to the rest of the hotels, this is forsure one of the gems of the city. The rooms are perfect for two, but if you have more you might need a double room ( Double the price ). You wont regret it though as it is very roomy and the beds are super comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Let down...”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel5791
Reviews.Content: We stayed at "ARIA" because we received a great offer. First half of trip we stayed at "Paris" and shouldn't have switched. The "ARIA" is verrry brown, much too dark, both casino, hotel hallways and the rooms. They say that they have twice a day housekeeping. One day they didn't come at all. We had to go to the front desk around midnight to talk to the manager and get some results. Room was straighten then. We will not go back to "ARIA".

Reviews.Title: “To Sum it Up - Aria is OK”
Reviews.Author: mnbowers
Reviews.Content: Prior to heading out for this trip with my wife, father in law and sister in law I read the TripAdvisor reviews extensively. Quite frankly I almost changed my reservation multiple times but ultimately decided to give the property the benefit of the doubt. We stayed in the city view 2 bedroom penthouse suite and here is my take, for what it is worth... Te Property - The City Center / Aria facilities are both enormous and impressive. You can spend quite a bit of time just wandering around the facility and taking in the architecture and art work. However, the layout is such that it takes some effort to figure out how to get off the property and to anywhere else. A casino is a casino so I won't say much about it other than it is quite dark. The Service - Everyone we interacted with was both friendly and helpful. The limo drivers, attendants, sky suite personnel, housekeeping and security were all great. We had zero problem with check in and our room was ready when we arrived at about 2pm on a Thursday. The Room - We were underwhelmed with the room. While the decor was both modern and tasteful the suite seemed smaller than the 2000 square feet advertised. This could however just be how it was laid out as it wasn't really an open floor plan. The automated controls were interesting and worked just fine in all the rooms. The TV in one of our bedrooms and the bathroom did not work and our bathtub also had some challenges. In addition, the carpenters missed some spots while painting the walls. These are little things but things you would not find in true 5 star hotels. The bed is as magnificent as others have said, you will want to take one home with you. The Restaurants - I can only comment on 2 of the restaurants - Sirio and the Buffet. My wife and I had dinner at Sirio and it was excellent. The service was attentive but not annoying and the food was superb. We shared the Gnocchi, she had the lamb and I had the Osso Bucco and they were all worth getting again. We only ate breakfast at the buffet and it is marginal. However, the morning buffet people watching is entertaining! If Aria is trying to position itself as a 5 star hotel, in my mind right now, it fails to do so. I did not find Aria to be a good value for the money and cannot recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Highly automated room, nice furnishings, but could use a dusting”
Reviews.Author: FKS
Reviews.Content: Most everything in the room is computer controlled, from the lights, to the curtains, and the privacy and service room signs. The details in the hotel are very modern and upscale for a Vegas hotel. The standard room we were in was a bit of a walk from the elevator core (exercise is always good) Good: 1. Courteous and friendly staff 2. Fast room service 3. HD tv 4. Lights, curtains and a/c can be controlled without leaving the bed 5. No need to struggle through traffic to get to the hotel 6. Three large pools (although only two were open) 7. Parking spots were handicapped-size (unecessarily though, wasting space) Bad: 1. Furnishings need to be dusted 2. Tub drainplug was broken, and two lights were dead 3. Pillows were too soft 4. Curtains did not completely darken the room 5. TV was right above the desk, making it very painful to watch tv and use your computer at the same time 6. No power outlets near the bed if you want to use your computer 7. Shower and tub arrangement is weird 8. Internet access is not free (it's 2010, get with the program)

Reviews.Title: “Only thing 5 star about this hotel was the price”
Reviews.Author: Kim-Chris
Reviews.Content: I booked a Sky Suite as a suprise for my brother, as we were celebrating his 21st birthday. I researched many hotels, and was very excited to stay at the Aria. Complimentary limo service was provided and our limo driver was very nice. We booked our room as a special, but it was still over $500 per night (not including tax). We went up to our room to discover we were put into a smoking room even though we booked (and requested) a non-smoking room. I went down to the front desk to have our room moved, we were offered a down-graded room at the same $500+ price. I declined the downgrade and we sucked up the smoking room. We had clearly put 3 adults on the reservation and were given a room with just a king bed. I went down to ask about moving to a room with two bedrooms (we booked a one bedroom) and were told it would be an additional $400 per night, even though it wasn't that much of a difference online. We declined, however they did send up a rollaway bed. My brother is 6'5", so the rollaway was a little small for him, but he made do. That evening we went to go to bed around 1am and the light in the bathroom would not go off. The doors to the bathroom were frosted glass, so the light was pretty bright in the bedroom. We, again, called down to the front desk and after over half an hour someone from engineering finally came up. It took another 30 minutes to shut the light off. The next morning we had breakfast at the buffet, which was excellent and I highly recommend it. I realized I had forgotten my camera and went back up to the room. It was around 9:30am and housekeeping was servicing our room, which was fine, I just needed to pick up my camera quickly. We returned to our room 11 hours later (at around 9pm) to find our door was left OPEN all day!!! Thankfully nothing was missing from our room, but never the less, it was left open all day. I called down to the front desk again, the girl was very apologetic, but that was about it. We had planned to spend the remaining 3 days of our stay at the hotel, but after all of that, we decided to check out as scheduled and move to another hotel. It's a shame, because the room was beautiful and the location was perfect. Upon checkout we were told we received a $75 resort credit for one of the problems we had, but no one made us aware of the credit. I asked if she could apply the credit to our room, and she said no. I am the general manager of a 100-room 3-star hotel and I have a high tolerance for simple/honest mistakes. Not one point did a manager offer to speak to us or do anything to make it up to us. They wouldn't even apply the $75 resort credit against our room charge, when I told them that we had paid cash for our breakfast at the hotel the morning before! I was beyond disappointed with my experience and have had better service at $69 "budget hotels".

Reviews.Title: “Great all round experience”
Reviews.Author: TaverAlberta
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a place. Stayed in the sky towers, so did not have to deal with the lines that existed at the main hotel lobby, or the ones we witnessed at the Belagio. Guests do not have to leave the property - although we did, but had most of our fun in the hotel. I would rate the spa an 8 out of 10, but had very good massage. Dined at 5 different restaurants within Aria. I was apprehensive heading down to Aria, after reading some past reviews, but decided to stick with my reservation. I will go back to Aria and City Center. Much better than I thought it would be.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: scs327
Reviews.Content: After all the bad reviews I was worried about the reservations we had made at Aria, but our trip was absolutely wonderful. The room was clean and comfortable. The bed was soooo nice. The room technology was not hard to figure out at all, and we had no problems with it malfunctioning. Our room was available when we got there, and the woman at the front desk gave us free passes to the nightclub HAZE. Everyone who worked there that we came in contact with was friendly and accommodating. The decor was modern but still natural, and unlike any other hotel in Vegas. In fact I can't think of a single complaint. We will stay here the next time we go to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: nancymommydearest
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews before booking, but I was offered 139.00 on Saturday, and 109.00 on the other nights, so why not! Upon arriving, the hotel was very full due to the Nascar race, so we had to be put on the smoking floor. I asked for some compensation, and we recieved 50 free play and 50 credit for food. I was very happy with that. We were upgraded to a bigger room and it was very nice and comfortable. Lots of space in the room and the bathroom, and a beautiful view of the mountains. The hall smelled smokey, but not the room, so we didn't move the next 2 nights. The restaurant help was not good at all...they need to work on that! And the food took FOREVER to arrive. We had a late night meal and then made the mistake of going back for breakfast, and the same thing! VERY expensive meals and our friends had wine to the tune of $20.00 per glass! My family was staying at the Monte Carlo, so we walked over there and had a GREAT breakfast twice at the Cafe for about half the price! The security was very good, my husband ran back to the room while the cleaning person was there, and they made sure it was his room with the key. They also won't let you upstairs or into the pool area without a key which is nice. The spa and ammenities are amazing. We paid $30 to work-out, but that included use of the spa and it had ALOT to offer. We spent 4 hours in there and enjoyed it very much. The pool is the spa area is wonderful! All in all, like any new place, they have some issues to work out, but the rooms are great and they are so willing to upgrade and compensate to make people happy. Just skip their restaurants unless you are a high roller and can afford it!!

Reviews.Title: “5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: jjtwo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, our corner suite was fantastic with wonderful amenities. Service from top to bottom was impeccable. Great dinner at Lemongrass. Can't wait to go back - wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was fine but...”
Reviews.Author: jocko999
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, we found the shower floor very sippery, there wasn only one hand hold but it was for the bath not the shower

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Issues”
Reviews.Author: easton1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love modern architecture, but the Aria lacks joy and lasting appeal. Our room was nice but not fabulous. My guess is that the dark browns that dominate the decor will get dated very quickly. We found that Aria had a number of customer service issues. Our room didn’t have a TV remote control. The staff took a very long to deliver the remote and more than one call from us. Unraveling a problem getting my husband authorization to charge to the room took longer than needed. From the Aria staff, we received three different, conflicting, and erroneous directions to the Dollar-Rent-A-Car booth in the hotel. When we arrived in the room, two of the lights had burnt-out bulbs. Probalby the worst problem was the delay in housekeeping services. On one day, our room hadn’t received housekeeping service as of 5:30pm. We called to request it for our room. At about 7:30pm that night, as we walked down the hall, we noticed that most of rooms’ light called for service. It was our impression that these rooms had the received housekeeping service yet. The electronic pad that controls the lights, TV, blinds, is cool but it's very bright and makes it hard to sleep. While most of the operations on the pad worked, some functions didn’t (or maybe it was operator error on our part but we don't think so...) Also, the blinds did start to close by the remote but they would get jammed so to close them, you still had to get up and help them along to close them. Overall, for us, this hotel was a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Visitors - nothing really negative, but not sure if we would go again...”
Reviews.Author: socaltravelerss
Reviews.Content: I think one of the problems with most reviews on this site is that few people offer a baseline as to what type of people they are and what their expectations are. Since I have never done a review I figured this was a good one to start with. My wife and I live in Southern California and frequent Vegas about 9 - 12 times a year. I am in my early 30's and my wife in her late 20's. We are standard middle to upper income people. We come to Vegas to drink, play slots, enjoy a good meal, and occasionally go to a club, and go to the pools in the summer, and often times we bring friends. We are not high rollers by any means, but have not paid for a hotel room in over 4 years in Vegas and often our free rooms include free money for gambling and food credits - GET PLAYERS CARDS AT EVERY CASINO YOU VISIT - IT PAYS OFF!!! Anyway, if you are this type of person, here is my review. First things first, if you are driving in, the only way to get to the valet is off of the strip, and don't make the mistake of trying to come in from behind off of Frank Sinatra Drive, there isn't an entrance...oh and don't make the mistake of entering off of Harmon from the strip, that takes you to the ULTRA CONFUSING back valet, a mile form the real entrance. So expect delays on the strip just getting to Valet. Aria is massive and is way back off the strip. Check in - we came in at midnight on a Friday - no rhyme or reason to the lines, kind of find your way to the front and hopefully you'll get lucky in a fast line. Front desk was cool enough and helped us promptly. Then he directed us to the elevators - if you ever got the idea they try and get you into the casino, you literally have to take your bags (if you don't use the bellman) and walk everything through the middle of the casino which was kind of weird, and unlike every other casino. By the way, we don't use a bellman as anyone who goes to vegas knows it can be forever to get your bags. Room: we had the standard room. very nice. bathroom had a separate toilet, a tub and a shower that were in the same enclosure but separate from each other...the only downside was a small sink area, it is dual sinks, but not much room to put anything. Opposite the shower was two full closets and 5 large drawers with a counter above them...ample room for clothes for a 3 day stay. nice bedding, the HD TV had many many channels and the HD actually is in HD...unlike other hotel (ahhem Hard Rock, Mandalay Bay that have HD TVs but no HD)...the cool part of the room is that everything is controlled by a touch screen remote next to the bed, our worked fine all weekend and was convenient to use while lying in bed to open and close drapes, turn lights on and off, operate the TV and the Thermostat. Casino: Modern Chic is how I would describe it - but no real theme or soul that I could figure out...forget about "loose slots" and "luck at the table" - every casino has the same slots and table games, and any seasoned vegas person know it is all luck. the bars were cool we got a drink at a few, and all of them offered some sort of vantage point to overlook the casino action. We enjoyed ourselves, cocktail waitresses were quick, but overall it didn't do much for us. We kind of like the vibe at a Mandalay Bay of Hard Rock or New York New York better - I can't describe the difference other than to say there is a better theme and atmosphere at those casinos. Buffett - we thought it was awesome, very nice place, food was extremely fresh, even the sushi was top notch, they also had king crab legs which I asked the lady to steam for me and she did! The waitress there could not have been any faster to fill our drinks and remove old plates...it was a little pricey though at 27.95 on Sunday night Misc - there is a tram to Bellagio that takes a bit of a hike to get to. Long waits at the valet line on Saturday mid day and Monday morning when we left - the valet guys have to run a mile to get to cars and it seems they are way understaffed for this. Don't really consider walking to another hotel in nice clothes, it is a hike, but just take a cab, no big deal. One funny thing, we came back to our hotel room saturday night and there was a foldout cot in our room - now obviously this would concern some people, but we are pretty easy going and they apologized and had somebody there to remove it in a few minutes. Over all, it was a very nice place, the casino seemed a little small and had no real theme that we could put our hands on. Crowd seemed to be our age and fairly high end fashionistas. The place is huge and you can't quickly get anywhere fast...as a frame of reference, to walk to the nearest casino across the street (Planet Hollywood) took about 20 minutes. If we get free rooms again we would probably go back, but we would go to Mandalay Bay or Hard Rock if given the choice. Random comment about the trip - we ended up a Paris one night, and there is a new Amazing Race slot machine that was a ton of fun. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and unique!”
Reviews.Author: looking4sun09
Reviews.Content: If you are someone that uptight and complains about everything than you might agree with the other comments on here but I have stayed in MANY hotels across US and Canada and this one was flawless! I will start with the staff because they were exceptional. Everytime we passed a staff member in the hallway they were VERY warm and friendly. It actually surprised me at first because most other hotel staff will smile or say hello but don't actually go out of their way to be this friendly. Just wanted to point this out because it really stood out for us and was one of those "little things" that really made a difference in our overall impression of this place. Also the buffet staff (not so much the cashier though) were so friendly and helpful. Always on top of clearing the plates, refilling our coffee or getting us more juice. It was the kind of service you always hope for but don't always get. By the way, the breakfast buffet was fantastic! Prices were about the same that you'd find at any other nice hotel in Vegas. And for the good quality of food that there was, we certainly didn't feel it was too high. As for the room. I loved it. We had a great view of the strip. The light/blinds controller is really not hard to use. Not sure what others are complaining about. Seriously it's very user friendly. I am by no means a technology geek and I figured it out in less than 30seconds. My 13 year old figured it out in even less time than that. :) Personally I had no issue with the shower/bath area combo. The tub was large and the shower pressure was good. Sure it's a different idea but not at all a bad one. The sliding door to the restroom is heavy and I can imagine someone getting their fingers caught in there. Ouch! Might need a rubber bumper to prevent that from happening. Almost happened to me so I wanted to mention that in case management reads this. The beds were large and comfy! The "wake up" setting on the controller was great as was the "goodnight" setting. Also, the room was peaceful and quiet at night. Not sure what the other person meant about "wind" noise because we didn't hear any at all. Pool wasn't open yet which was disappointing since we had asked about that when making the reservation and they told us it was definitely open. I guess that would be my only complaint. Overall, an excellent place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “WORDS CANNOT EXPRESS”
Reviews.Author: karleena
Reviews.Content: Believe nothing negative in this review. There are people in this world that cannot find anything positive. This is an 8 billion dollar establishment. Now come on guys how bad can it be. The negative reviews are from people that for the most part are miserable with life. The place is so totally awesome I find it hard to put into words. The rooms are to die for. Upon entering the sheers automatically open . The drapes follow. Music plays. You wake up to the same. The decor is gorgeous. The bedding is so fabulous I inquired about purchasing the same thing for home. It is the most elegant plush place on earth. The staff is most accomodating. My brother from Beverly Hills is a very famous architect and designer who has been published in Architectural Digest numerous times. He was impressed.............. Getting the pic yet. Please believe nothing you read, go and enjoy and while you are smiling think of me. I told you so........ Karleen in Nebraska

Reviews.Title: “ARIA disappointing overall”
Reviews.Author: sfiver
Reviews.Content: The biggest disapointment is the closed off, tucked-away location. Amazing that it sits right on the Las Vegas Strip. If you enjoy a walk, be prepared with comfortable walking shoes. The place was built to keep you from straying. It is not tourist friendly. It is more of a piece of structural art than anything practical. The rooms are small. Other than the bed, which is wonderful, be prepared to learn all the technolgical aspects of the so-called "room of the future." The bedside touch screen control system might fascinate you for a moment until you realize it regulates almost everything. Lighting, TV, drapes, housekeeping, etc. The bathroom is also small, but interesting. The tub/shower combination is exactly that. A large shower that opens to an oval soaking tub. You can litterally sit on the side of the filled tub allowing the shower spray to hit your back; nice touch. But, most of us spend a minimum bathing. The double sinks are so close together - it would have been easier to put a large single sink - more practical. The water closet is walled off with frosted glass and door, and has a telephone next to the throne. In fact, three phones adorn the room. The 42" HDTV is great. Above the 20th floor is where you'll get any views. The floor to ceiling windows allow ample sunlight as most of the hotel faces east or west. The worst part of the "room experience" and the major reason I'd never return: the furniture (other than the bed) is so very uncomfortable. No sofa or love seat. Armless, cushioned benches is the easiest explanation. And, is standard in all rooms other than the suites per the housekeeping operator. Kudo's to the quick elevator service. I never waited longer than a minute. The casino is very, very dark and unwelcoming. It snakes around inside the curving structure and I literally got lost. The table minimums start at $25, although the penny slots are abundant. The main hotel restaurant is Cafe Vettro. Customer service excellent. Limited menu is extremely overpriced. Hamburger $18, coffee $5, etc. Okay, okay... the Aria is not Motel 6. Customer service is good, far from excellent, however. The regular rates are in the $200 per night range. Join their "Players Club" before making any reservations - I think you can do it online. I secured a $140 rate for a weekend (Fri/Sat) stay. Even at that - it is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I did not listen to the reviews here on Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: Mateo303
Reviews.Content: I started getting concerned about my upcoming reservation at the Aria after the negative reviews started pouring in on this site. We hesitantly decided to stick to our plan since we had gotten a really good rate. All that I can say is that our experience was wonderful and largely met or exceeded our expectations. First off, the decor of the hotel is very contemporary. If you do not like that sort of thing you will probably be disappointed with this hotel. I'm surprised to see so many people comparing the Aria to the Bellagio and other "classic" looking hotels on the strip. The Aria really is unique and has a style all its own. It was refreshing to us it that it is not a theme hotel trying to emulate another style from somewhere else in the world. We were granted an early check in and they took the time to help us find a room high in the building with a view that we were happy with. In all of my travels I have found it to be very rare that they actually give you a choice of rooms/views while checking in. We did not experience any chaos at the front desk as described by others. Our room was incredible and we loved the automation. By far the biggest highlight was the incredible bed that, after returning home, inspired us to begin shopping around to try and find something comparable for home. Our dinner at Sage was a highlight of our trip. Most notable was the Absinthe after dinner. They bring out a cart of multiple types of Absinthe and then go into great detail about the history and various ways you can prepare it. Heads were turning as they poured flaming absinthe into my glass in the finale of what was a wonderful presentation. I will agree that the staff is a bit "green". They do not carry themselves with the sophistication and professionalism I would expect from a hotel of this caliber. Although the service really was never bad, many just seemed awkward, lacking confidence, and overwhelmed. During check in while discussing the details about Sage the desk person began talking in vast detail about where to get a good hamburger. Although not really "bad service" it just seemed a bit odd. We did have one glitch with the automation in our room however we called the desk and it was all resolved upon returning after lunch. Overall, if you love classic elegance like at the Bellagio than this may not be the perfect hotel for you. If you like contemporary architecture and design than I suspect you will have an amazing time and love this hotel as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “IT 'S DIFFERENT !”
Reviews.Author: smitty62
Reviews.Content: We went to vegas for a getaway and booked the Aria for a change and definitely got that. This hotel is alot different then the others. Not really a "theme" hotel, like the Paris or Bellagio. Felt cold and dark with all the concrete and dark wood. If you're in to contemporary or modern architecture it's o.k. More fun for us at other places, just because of the atmosphere. Check in is definitely a problem. We checked in late because of our flight, no line but the lady that I dealt with was very rude and inconsiderate, we of course, asked for an upgrade and she wanted a ridiculous charge to move up to the 12th floor. We went to our room on the 3rd. floor and it over looked the roof and all the plumbing on it. Went back down to check in, spoke to another lady , very nice and helpful, she gave us a room on the 51st. floor - 4 rooms from elevator, no problems. Not sure if it's the check in process or the people working. Rooms are as every other review, great. House keeping even stopped by our room 20 min. after we got in and asked if all was o.k. Didn't eat at Aria, very pricey. Morning cup of coffee - $ 3.95. All in all a very nice place but for normal middle class people that go to vegas to gamble a bit and have a good time, probably more fun to go and stay at Ceasers, Paris, or other.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Awesome Aria”
Reviews.Author: gafferroche
Reviews.Content: Having read many bad reviews before staying at Aria I had considered changing hotels, but I am glad I didn't. My 5-day Aria experience was fantastic, and I would say Aria is the best strip hotel I have stayed in. The checkin process was flawless, the room was amazing with the most comfortable bed & pillows I have ever experienced, the restaurants and food were superb (buffet was particularly good), staff were very friendly and helpful, my room design & hotel decor, artwork, and overall attention to detail in design and architecture were amazing. The floor to ceiling windows in the room and corridors give amazing views. The keypad technology in the room may be daunting at first but after a minute or two you will easy master it to control the Lights/TV/Curtains/Aircon/Music etc . The casino itself is quite large, well layed out and easy to Navigate. It's not that far to walk to the strip, just cut through Crystals and take the elvators/escalators. The pool area is very nice with 3 pools, spas, cabanas, and lots of mature trees and vegetation, only one of the pools is currently open and it is heated. Security were strict at all times about showing a room key before allowing you get to the elevators. Elevators are dedicated for 8/9 floors with 8 elevators for each section, which means you never wait any longer than a few seconds for one. The Viva Elvis show was good, but on the night I went was only half full so the balcony section was closed and people were put up front instead. It's more of a singing & dancing type of show compared to the normal Cirque acrobatic spectaculars we are used to, but there are some acrobatics involved, and the way they've integrated Elvis singing into the show with the band and performers is truly wonderful, and technically brilliant. If you have any doubts I would just put them aside and stay at Aria, you probably wont be disappointed. I certainly wasn't

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL - DON'T MISS IT”
Reviews.Author: DixieGirlCalgary_AB
Reviews.Content: People just like to whine and complain. The service was great, the staff exceptionally friendly. The electronics of the room doesn't need rocket science to figure out. The room was clean clean, every day we had a turn down service and they left chocolates. No coffee pot in these casino hotels is the norm, never got one at any of Caesars, Mirage or Tropicana (now thats a dump). The casino was paying on the slots, to the point I had to stay up all night one night. Bed was great, bathroom water pressure was good and even used the bath and it took no time to fill. Some people just love to complain and pretend to be some sort of bigshot. My room was a comp and the service was not downgraded because of that fact either. Totally loved it and would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Unorganized, overbilled,”
Reviews.Author: liquidworldvideo
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel Achitecture, Check In unorganized, Hotel needs to designate someone to organize the check in process so there are no line cutting arguments rooms are beautiful and comfortable, electric curtains and lights, but we were charged for items not purchased, and billed for tips on services not received, If you want to park close to the elevator you better be driving an electric car or low emmission vehicle, or you will be parking on the far side of the garage, checkout process was very bad, we were promised hotel credits for the restaurant and cafe, and our account was overcharged and credited so many times it took us hours to figure out what we paid. The only way i would reccommend this Hotel is with time, they are not yet organized but in time it will be.

Reviews.Title: “Almost the Borgata of the West”
Reviews.Author: 4bizandfun
Reviews.Content: Overall our ARIA experience was quite positive. It might have been stellar but for some bewildering items of note, some of which have already been mentioned. Essentially be aware of the following: The roads on property are confusing. The front desk staff is young and unseasoned. It is a very long walk from a set back hotel to the strip. The buffet is incredibly over valued ($34.99) and pales in comparison to the Bellagio or Borgata (if you have been there).
