If you walk into almost any other casino on the strip the impression is that they were all designed by the same guy. Large brightly patterened carpets with bright lights, and old style finishing regardless of the hotel theme. Aria's casino is the opposite. A little darker and more modern. Plenty of choice on the gaming with lots of different minimums to suit whatever you like. I loved the poker room... the dealers were professional, and their was a festive atmosphere at the tables. I never waited for a seat. We don't play slots, so I can't comment on the quality or winning frequency. We never had to wait for a seat at any of the gaming tables either. Dealers were all friendly and helpful. Wish there was a Starbucks onsite, but you can get to one in under 5 minutes in the connection to the Monte Carlo. The Jean Phillipe Patisserie on site serves coffee, and breakfast items as well as great sandwiches at lunch. We ate at Cafe Vettro for breakfast and enjoyed it. Had dinner at Sirio onsite which was excellent - great Italian in a beautiful room. Had the breakfast buffet on our last morning - plenty of choice and good value (14.95 each). I thought the location on the Strip was fantastic. Very centrally located. Quick walk through Crystals (the attached mall) gets you to the strip in under 5 minutes. We used the tram to Bellagio a couple of times as well - very convenient. Walked to the fashion show mall across from Wynn.... Took about 30 minutes at a very leisurely pace. All in all it's a good location - easy to get almost anywhere by foot or cab. Lastly the rooms: Very well laid out, adequate size, and super comfortable bedding. Loved the electronic control of everything in the room. Thought the remote was intuitive and easy to use. We had a probem with our tv handheld remote. Called the front desk, and it was fixed by the time we got back to our room (a few hours later). All in all, I disagree with the negative reviews, and am not sure what people were expecting or were complaining about. I think this is definitely a 5 star resort given the amenities, the high quality dining, top brand shopping (LV, Prada, Paul Smith, Tom Ford, Tiffanys etc...), decent service, and luxurious accommodations. I would recommend this resort to anyone. My wife and I had a fantastic time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Stay...”
Reviews.Author: LillyKitty1972
Reviews.Content: First off this hotel is brand new and shiney with all the bells and whistles and that in and of itself makes it appealing. However, it definitely lacks the charm/vintage feel of other Las Vegas casino hotels. So, if you are looking for a traditional vegas feel place this is probably not for you as it has a very modern chic big city feel. We arrived at 6pm on a Monday and check in was was very fast. I noticed that throughout the day this hotel seemed to have much shorter check in lines than the other hotes. First we were given a room with a terrible view on the 3rd floor right next to the elevator and overlooking the 3rd floor roof with total view of the hotel spotlights secured to the roof. We asked to changed and got a much nicer room on the 21st floor. We did not face the strip but view was still pretty decent. One cool thing was they can activate the room change without having to go downstairs to get a new key card. When we got to the room the bedside phone didn't work and we only had one robe. We called down and they came right up with a robe. Engineering knocked at 12:45am! to fix the phone. We were in bed so we didn't answer the door. Complained the next day and got comped a $55 breakfast for the inconvenience was in our minds was adequate. The service at the cafe was wonderful. Waitress was very attentive and friendly and full of smiles. The room was very nice and the sunken tub was fabulous after a long day of walking. The bed however was so soft I found it hard to sleep in. It was comfy at first but way too soft for anyone with any aches and pains. You really sink in on this one. I did not sleep well the entire week and that would be enough for me not to stay here again. The entire room is activated by the key pad on the bedside table. We are pretty tech savvy people but found using this to work the TV to be quite the pain. They do give you a regular remote thought to to use if you feel like it so I am really just whining here. The location of the hotel on the strip is decent however, it is a very long walk to get to the street. You cannot cross the street at this hotel you have to walk about a quarter mile in either direction to get to a crosswalk or overhead bridge. We found this to be a bit annoying. Would have preferred to just walk out and on to the street. The spa was great. For $30 you get a nice selection of sauna, outdoor heated pool, jacuzzis etc to use. Would highly recommend the spa. There are no additional fees at this hotel (i.e. resort fees other hotels charge). We did not gamble much at the Aria but it got pretty busy in the evenings. Other times of the day it is dead. We got such a great deal at the hotel that we decided to try it. i don't think we would stay here again though. We would probably try one of the other hotels before coming back to this one. Overall I give the hotel a grade of B. If you get a good deal you might want to try it.

Reviews.Title: “I had a fantastic stay at the Aria.”
Reviews.Author: BigTexasOil
Reviews.Content: Like most here, I had almost second guessed my decision to stay at the Aria due to some of the earlier reviews. This being our first stay in Vegas, I wanted it to be something to remember for my wife and I and it was certainly that. We stayed from Feb. 8 through Feb. 11. They were able to check us in early that day (around 10am) and it was quick and easy. The front desk hostess was very helpful on room selection and explained everything, I was very comfortable walking away knowing exactly how to get to the room elevators to valet and self parking and the various other useful points of interest. We stayed in a corner suite on the 11th floor (promo code AR15RC75) and the view was great. I could see everything from Planet Hollywood, MGM, Monte Carlo, to the mountains. The room technology for the lights, curtains, tv, etc. was very easy to use and had no hiccups at all. The food was very good and the room service was excellent. It was a bit pricey but I was vacationing and what I didn't spend on food I was going to spend at the tables anyway so I didn't mind. The only con we experienced was the minibar. When we arrived it was missing a few items and it did show up on our account, but was quickly resolved with a visit to the front desk. The staff was always pleasant throughout the whole resort from the valet, front desk, dealers, elevator security, housekeeping, room service, etc. They were always welcoming and genuine. We do intend on returning soon and will plan on staying at the Aria again when the weather gets a bit warmer so we can take advantage of the pools.

Reviews.Title: “The best place I have ever stayed!!”
Reviews.Author: momongo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days at the Aria and it was EXCELLENT!!! Every staff person we came in contact with was very helpful and courteous. The concierge was very helpful and got us great tickets to shows. Rooms are beautiful and clean and the technology fun!!! When word gets out about the Aria, its gonna be hard to get a room there!

Reviews.Title: “This place is AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: sox04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from Feb 5th through the 8th and had an amazing time. I was so worried about staying here after reading all the bad reviews, we even tried to change hotels at the last minute. So glad we didn't, this new hotel/casino has to be seen to be believed. Check in was extremely fast, no problems. Room was ready upon arrival and we upgraded to a strip view for $15 a night. Worth every penny. The room was the nicest I have ever been in. The remote that everyone complains about worked perfectly and it was the coolest thing ever. We ate breakfast at the cafe Vettro 2 days and it was spectacular (yummy eggs benedict). Our waitress Esther was awesome, she actually had our cream warmed up for our coffee before she brought it to us, it made the coffee so creamy and smooth, we loved it. The place was spotless, people were constantly cleaning and shining everything and all the artwork everywhere was so interesting. There is nothing to complain about as far as I am concerned. The casino was HUGE and they had all kinds of fun machines to play. The tram to Bellagio and Monte Carlo was quite convenient and nice. All in all, a super place to stay and we will be returning as soon as we make some more money!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Vegas, as long as you don't need white tigers or fake cityscapes to make you happy...”
Reviews.Author: cubbiesx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aria hotel for three nights late January into February and absolutely loved it. I've been to Vegas a few times before, have stayed at the Luxor, New York New York, MGM Grand, and Bellagio and Aria is probably my favorite of all of them. Why? Well a few things come to mind...First it's more of a low key place. Some may say this is a downer but not for me. I like going out to see shows and have a crazy time as much as the next guy, but it's kind of nice to come back to a hotel that's just plain comfortable and classy. Second, the casino is easily my favorite in all of Vegas already. For some of the same reasons...not all crazy with people going berserk everywhere. Maybe it was a fluke, but my time in the Aria casino was fun and people seemed to be actually enjoying themselves...not being either depressed from losing or obnoxious. Again, your experience at the hotel may vary. Third, the rooms are great. Big standard rooms with an entire wall being a floor to ceiling window. I was even in the back facing a construction site and didn't really mind it. Room tech is cool and not really that hard to use. I can see my parents having a problem with it but anyone who uses an ipod should be able to handle it easily. One downer: the ipod connection in the entertainment area requires some weird wire that you probably don't have, or didn't think to bring. However the "connectivity console" or whatever it's called is pretty cool. Two USB connections for charging a camera or iphone or whatever. Some power outlets also and even a video input if you want to use the HDTV for something. Internet is about $15/day which is a downer but I suppose it's not too bad. I guess the hotel is on the expensive side (my room was comped so can't comment on that)...the restaurants are pretty high end. I've heard the tapas restaurant is very good. I personally only ate at the buffet for lunch and at Jean Phillippe for morning pastry and sandwiches. Both great and both reasonably priced as far as I'm concerned. I should point out that I'm from NYC where everything is "expensive" compared to most areas. I've also heard that there are great deals on room at the Aria if you look around. Vegas is dead these days and the Aria in particular seems pretty slow. Summing it up: Great hotel, slightly expensive. I suppose if it's your first time in Vegas you should go ahead and stay at the Bellagio or one of the more themed hotels to have that experience. Others that just want a good quality high end hotel in Vegas should seriously consider Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, solid 4 star resort”
Reviews.Author: bran99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 1 night last week due to a great rate. Its a very nice hotel. Drink service was good. The room was very nice, well appointed. Pros: Room rate, drink service, room comfort Cons: Casino is a little odd, decent game selection but it was just odd. Staff: The check in person was not very bright, I asked her what resturants were still open(it was about 10pm on a friday night when we checked in) and she had no idea and wasnt able to find out) . Then we asked the slot club person when check out was as our chick in lady didnt tell us, and she told us 11am, then in the morning I called to double check, and they told us it was 12. Nothing major but just odd that everyone didnt know the basics. Food: Only ate at Cafe Vetio(sp?) as we had to use a food credit asap. We got the buffalo wings( maybe the worst wings i have ever had in my life, just terrible). My wife and I both had burgers, they were good, but definitly overpriced at about 20 bucks for a cheeseburger. Overall: This is not the Wynn or Encore, but it is price accordingly. They seem to agree they are a 4 star hotel and as long as they dont pretend they are 5 star this place will be a good addition to vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: chef31
Reviews.Content: Short cab ride from the airport, just $15.00 (plus tip). Had to wait with about 30 people in line to check in. It was slow with only six desk clerks working until a seventh arrived to check us in. Service was pleasant and very thorough. Elevators are located midway through the 3+ acre casino but are monitored by security. Getting an elevator was never a problem since each cluster of eight is dedicated to 5 or 6 floors only. The hallways on the floors are extremely long and often had a very loud and annoying buzz/squeal coming from the utility room. Upon first entering a guestroom, the lights and TV come on automatically and the drapes draw open. The room itself is super-high-tech meets architect-on-steriods. The space is beautiful and artfully decorated. However, there is no electric receptacle near the nightstand. This presents a problem for anyone who wants to charge their cell phone overnight while keeping it close by. It is an even bigger problem for people like me who need a place to plug in a c-pap machine for sleeping. I tried moving the mattresses only to find that the lamp cord disappears behind a wood panel behind the nightstand. Eventually the front desk sent up two engineers who moved the nightstand (with safe inside) to gain access to an opening in the paneling which led to a receptacle. For the duration of our stay the nightstand remained about six inches from the wall so I could unplug without help when leaving. The engineers replaced some CFL light bulbs and had to have the TV rebooted. It takes a while to get familiar with the electronic controls. They are not intuitive enough for me and could be greatly improved upon. The bedding was super comfortable and the room was very quiet. There is no shampoo shelf in the shower and no aerator in the sink faucet which means the water comes out in a hard stream and splashes everywhere. Dinner at the Buffet was excellent except for an alarm of some kind with strobe lights and a loud recorded voice kept going off. Our daughter's room was not serviced at all one day. We've stayed at the Hilton, Paris and Wynn in the past. Will probably not stay at Aria again. I've checked the "not recommended" box with this qualifier - If you enjoy ultra-modern technology and don't mind spending some time learning controls and art is more important to you than comfort, you'll like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great property . . . some service issues to resolve”
Reviews.Author: jthreedAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel/casino. It is hip and modern and like nothing else on the strip. The architecture and art is gorgeous. The casino is darker than others on the strip but it works for this property. We stayed in a Sky Suite with a mountain view. Beautiful room with wonderful finishes. They provided limo transportation to and from the airport. We entered through the entrance for Sky Suites/Villas which is separate from main entrance. There is a nice lounge area and beverages and light snacks available near Sky Suite check in. Our complaints are only service related. They tout two daily housekeeping and we were lucky to get once daily housekeeping. The bedside lamps didn't work nor did the tv in the bathroom. Small complaints but the small things are what set some properties apart. We requested housekeeping several times and sometimes we got it and sometimes not. We requested the lamps and tv be fixed and we got one lamp to work. The concierge was not helpful. I called several times requesting recommendations for restaurants or shows and I knew as much as he did. The most frustrating thing was our limo from the hotel to the airport. The driver was 15 minutes late so we sat and watched while guest after guest was shuttled away from the resort while we waited . . . your reservation or "first come first serve" don't apply - its all about your "assigned driver". We were grateful we didn't miss our plane. Our only other complaint and it is more of a comment is that there are virtually no quick eateries. It would be nice to see MGM add something a little more mainstream for a quick or easy bite to eat at Aria or Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but dumb”
Reviews.Author: rjuliansf
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in a city view room. Good news: great architecture and art, beautifully appointed room with great linens, big king mattress, and luxurious bathroom. Bad news: with 4,004 rooms, this hotel is just too big. Also the floorplan forces you to walk through the casino to get anywhere on the main level. If you are sensitive to fragrances, YOU MUST AVOID this hotel. The HVAC system blows all central heat and air through a scented oil system. It works fine to keep down the cigarette and cigar smell on the main floor, but each room smells like the perfume counter at Macy's. You cannot turn off the scent in the individual rooms - it is centrally piped. Also, all the dining, spa, and entertainment options in the hotel are really expensive. Dinner in any of the restaurants will run a minimum of $50 per person, even if you don't drink alcohol. If you're going to spend some real money on a Vegas hotel, stay across the street at the serenely beautiful new Mandarin Oriental which does not have a casino and is just as nicely appointed.

Reviews.Title: “amazing room, great hotel (a little too trendy, though)”
Reviews.Author: cmhman
Reviews.Content: was a bit nervous about this hotel after reading reviews, but it seems to have turned a corner and has worked out most bugs. Check in was simple. Sat. afternoon...we had to wait behind one person. After two minutes we were at the desk and had our keys after about a minute. To the room: absolutely amazing. Had a view of the strip (Planet Hollywood hotel) from the 16th floor, but didn't pay for it. Large, spacious room. Most comfortable bed ever. Large 42" LCD tv. Large shower and bathroom. Windows were dirty (as mentioned on other reviews). Remote controlling temp, curtains and tv was great. One of the best room experiences I have ever had. The hotel staff was friendly but not nice enough. The hotel as a whole seemed pretentious and too formal. The restaurants and shops are very formal and remind me of a museum of modern art. Maybe I am not used to this type of luxury, but it was more of a modern, stuffy luxury compared to what I saw in the elegant luxury of the Venetian, Bellagio, Pallazzo. Location on the strp is great and the ability to walk to the connected Monte Carlo and take the tram from Crystals (upscale shops next door) to the Bellagio was very convenient. The construction going on next door (we were closest to the construction on the north end) was somewhat annoying if you are a light sleeper. I doubt you would have any problems if you were on the south end of the hotel. Valets and bellman were very friendly. This hotel was great and lived up to the hype and we were lucky enough not to encounter any major problem.

Reviews.Title: “Fears be gone!”
Reviews.Author: Bali_teman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aria just 3 weeks after it opened. I must admit I was a little worried after reading some reviews, but was pleasantly surprised (and greatly relieved) when these turned out to be either fixed teething problems or maybe just people that wont ever be happy. Our room was great, I could not have asked for another thing, apart from the shower, I dont like to get my hair wet and the shower head was high and fairly fixed, there was however a decent shower cap that sorted this. The matress was super comfortable, and the room quite spacious. The bedside remote control via touch screen was super easy to navigate (even husband could manage it). The staff were all attentive and knowledgable abou the property and all venues on the site as well as getting some good info on Vegas as well. Top place will definately stay again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: d2sargento
Reviews.Content: Way over-hyped. Way over-priced. Way to big. No signs to find anything. Looks like a modern airport. Very cold atmosphere. Lousy sports-book. Terrible buffet. (and way over-priced). Smokey Casino. Dark-Dead lighting. What a waste of money. Go to New York if you want this Metal and Glass atmosphere. Stay at Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “If you like gadgets, You'll love it!”
Reviews.Author: Ili_from_Miami
Reviews.Content: We arrived Thursday, January 28th we took the 4 pm flight and got there at 6:45, we took a taxi and it was a $25 cab ride and very convenient and glad I didn't pay for transfer!. The negative... Don't drop your luggage with the porter when you arrive to the hotel. The porter lied to us and told us that if left the luggage with him, it would be in my room by the time we got to the room by the time we finished checking in. NOT TRUE! Back to this later! The GOOD... When I was reading the experience of previous guests, I was a little nervous because there were comments of how long it would take to be checked in. They must have worked out the quirks because check in was painless and person that took care of us was very good. That's when I found out I had to call to request the luggage when I got to the room to request the luggage and that it would take 15 - 20 minutes. I requested a room in the high floor regardless of view. The gave us Room 23288, on the 23rd floor. The only thing I didn't think of was the size of the window. There is NO false advertising. the windws are from ceiling to floor, but very small. In the previews of the room, the windows appear huge, but ours were not even 1/8 in width. With that said, I want to let you know that EVERYTHING in the room is state of the art. The Bed is one of the best mattresses I've slept in. The pillows HEAVENLY! You control the room controls on the TV, on the Alarm clock and by the panels on the walls. No keys, just wave the key and it opens. Security is superb, as you approach the guest elevators, there is always someone there and you must show your key. The TV, FLATscreen with many, many pixles because the crispness of the picture was incredible. I thought our tv at home was good, it's mediocre if you compare it to this on. The bathroom is spacious with his and hers sinks, a separate "toilet" room, and the shower was behind the same wall with a tub. You may wonder why I did not give the resort all 5s: Rate Hotel - Extremely large and front of it is not directly on the strip. You need to go around and go through a "walk" to get to the sidewalk and then to reach the elevators to get to the rooms. Location is good, it's next to the Monte Carlo. But just like with the Belagio, to get to the rooms you have to walk, walk, walk and walk some more. The value was good for everything you get, but the pool is not yet finished. You had to use the pool of the Monte Carlo. Value 4.5 I have to say that we spent a wonderful anniversary weekend! The only other complaint, that is really not a complaint is that I ordered chocolate covered strawberries and anothe crunchy package to be delivered or if possible to be in the room when we arrived. It didn't happen, but it was not charged either. A GREAT experience, I forgot my diamond earings on the nightstand, they were left untouched. Would I recommend you do that, NO, but it was refreshing to see that there are honest and descent people around!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: anp604
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel last weekend! it was an amazing experience from the fine dining to the arichetural detail and beauty. this hotel is amazing and a must see! the rooms were cleana nd beautiful and very roomy! i would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone and i dont think i could stay anywhere else after staying here! great location on the strip within walking distance to Bellagio, Caesars, Planet Hollywood, MGM......loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: Frangos777
Reviews.Content: Absolutely stunning hotel, best on the strip by far. State of the art rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved”
Reviews.Author: cancunfav
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Las Vegas for a Birthday Party Jan 16th to Jan 20. We booked at the beginning of December and received a GREAT deal. Reading the reviews up to our time of travel I was a bit disappointed. But I must say the negative reviews were WRONG! This Hotel was amazing. From the moment we arrived the staff was wonderful, it took all of 20 minutes to check in and about 5 minuted to check out. The rooms were so comfortable, we had a great view of the Vdara, the Bellagio, as well as the Palms. The water pressure was very low. I was disappointed that there were no vending machines on the floors which kind of forced you to drink the over priced items in the mini bar. The casino was nice and never over crowded. The Spa was fantastic. The only thing that I did not like was the 24hr. Cafe, there was not a wide menu selection and we paid $52 for 2 burgers and 2 orders of fries. Never again! lol I would definitely visit the Aria again and I recommend that you do to.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mike_51382
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom Penthouse and couldn't have asked for more. The staff was attentive and the rooms were amazing-- couldn't have asked for more. The decor throughout the hotel was upscale and never ceased to amaze us, especially the giant wall of water at the front entrance. We only at the buffett and it was great and reasonably priced. I have to say, I thought about changing our reservation after reading the reviews however, I can't tell you happy I am that I didn't. It was an amazing experience from start to finish. Great job Aria!!

Reviews.Title: “Not much good to say...from experienced Las Vegas visitors”
Reviews.Author: Colleen44
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at Aria. It was probably the oddest experience we've had in our many trips to Vegas. We felt it was a very boring hotel. We did enjoy the king bed and pillows and slept very well. The electronics, in my opinion, are a huge waste of money for the hotel. TV remote wouldn't work. Impossible to move the channels around with the large remote on the bedside. Couldn't check out through the TV. Our room wasn't cleaned the second day even after the "service" light was on for hours while we were gone. Promised to bring us towels and amenities at 7 a.m. the next morning. Didn't happen. No soda machines on the floors, they want you to buy the $4 mini-bar Cokes. The modern architecture was too much chaos. Lot of wasted space. Casino slot machines were tight for us. The smoke alarm went off the second day every 15 minutes or so from 9:00 a.m. for about an hour. There were knocking sounds outside our window. The buffet didn't have any Mexican food, or much American food, when we were there. The soups, seafood and Chinese rice were cold. The location, we felt, was set too far back from the strip. We felt almost as if we were off the strip and out of the "loop". We'll be going back to Mandalay Bay and TheHotel. This hotel decor and size is too impersonable. Usually, we hardly have any complaints, but we expected more from this hotel. The valet staff, slot attendants and cocktail waitresses were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Service overcomes the Glitches”
Reviews.Author: vsop_10
Reviews.Content: I received an email offer from Aria, so I booked 1 nite to overlap my 3 nites I already had at Bally's....Two days prior to departure, I called to confirm my reservation at Aria, I was told the reservation was cancelled!!!! They re-instated my reservation and gave me additional perks ($75 food and $75 free play.....up from $50 and $50 from the email offer).... check in at the hotel can be a bit of a gamble as you kinda pick a check in line to stand in as opposed to standing in a queu and going to the next available agent.....check in was quick...very friendly...the room was available at 10 AM....The elevators are a short walk away...I think there are 4 groups of elevators...each group goes to a certain range of floors....The casino is a bit dark, but if youv'e been to The Mirage lately, you'll know what dark means... The GOOD: -the place is new, clean...glass and steel....modern form and furnishings.. -the room furnishings are top shelf...very comfortable bed and pillows...hi tech controls....HDTV...satellite radio...touch screen control panel at the bedside... -spacious bathroom, separate toilet room...combo soaking tub and shower room.....double vanity....nice bathrobes - the bufffet is tops IMHO...having lamb chops for breakfast is a first for me....prepared med. rare...roast duck and prime rib (med. rare also), leg of lamb....raw oysters, peeled shrimp, split crab legs (chilled)...gourmet deserts (no pies or cakes) for lunch....the selections are surprisingly limited, considering the size of the property, buy the quality is excellent... The BAD: - the color scheme...BROWN hues....seem contrary to the modern look of the place.. - hi tech stuff did not always work... - the entrance is setback a ways from LV Blvd...think Bally's entrance... - the dinner buffet is a tad overpriced ($30) considering the selection is basically the same as lunch....go 15-20 minutes prior to the dinner change over and save $10.... There were some glitches, but the customer service protocol made up for any inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “can you say BEAUTIFUL......”
Reviews.Author: phoenixdeb
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of bad reviews here, I almost cancelled our reservations opting for a hotel we knew we liked (Wynn or Pallazo) but we got such a good room rate from the MGM corp. as a grand opening gift that we decided to chance it. I AM SO GLAD WE DID!!!! Aria wasnt just a hotel...it was an experience. I am a designer and I was mesmerized by the designs and textures of the hotel and the entire City Center. Very tastefully done, from the lobby to the casino to the rooms, I was so very impressed with "the look" of everything. The service was excellent....employees in every area were smiling, helpful and friendly. Check in went smooth, no lines, room was what we asked for and clean, clean CLEAN!!!!! We recieved room service every day-the trick is to put on the "service" light as you walk out the door. Its a switch located at the door, looks like a light switch. There is also a "privacy" switch beside it...flick that if you dont want to be disturbed. Shopping within the hotel was great, not so impressed with Crystals, tho....too empty.....the casino is gorgeous and not as dark as what others say it is. Its no darker than any other casino in town. The restaurants were pricey but they had good food. We liked the buffet the best for good food at a good value. The coffee and chocolate bistro just off the casino/lobby area is a must....great coffee and good food. Self parking is easy, we entered from the strip and it was well marked.... but a bit of a walk from the lot to the hotel...be prepared for that. We liked the tram to Bellagio and from there walking is easy over to Ceasars. Its also not too far to walk across the street to MGM/New york-New york. We saw the ELVIS show and it was a MUST SEE. It has been tweeked alot since its first showing and it is now ready for prime time!! Great music, great sound system...truly a great entertainment package. I was sad when the show ended...I wanted another hour of it...cant ever get enough of Elvis!!! Aria is a beautiful hotel and at such good prices right now, I would say "Go FOR IT" while it is reasonably priced...you wont be disappointed....we sure enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay inspired me to spend my time writing this bad review”
Reviews.Author: Upintheairtexas
Reviews.Content: A Hyatt hotel is far supieror to this- but this hotel is all pretty on the outside and average or worse on the inside. This hotel, while modern, is riddled with gadgets that make it hard to even turn on a light. The TV is really really difficult to enjoy because of the controls. The rooms are small-ish rooms, the size of any standard decent hotel. For the money, stay at the Venetian and have a real experience. Or The Hotel at Mandalay even though that's a walk to get to the rest of the strip. OR why not save a bunch of money and stay at the hardrock, MGM, Mirage, etc. Get my drift? Don't bother with this hotel. They wanted 30 more bucks just to work out in their gym, as if I didn't pay enough for my simply-sized hotel room and the football-long fields of walking to get to the room. Oh, and if you get a non city view, and you are an ATT mobile customer, don't expect your phone to work, either.

Reviews.Title: “Aria - AMAZING.. but not without some hiccups”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravelar
Reviews.Content: We checked into our Deluxe City View room and were upgraded. Not sure why so didn't say anything. The checkin took forever.. so the other comments about this are accurate. There were only 4 people infront of us in the line as well! Get directions to the lifts.. but they were wrong. We were upgraded to the Sky Suites and the lifts were in a different area. We eventually found them, got to our room (yep CORRIDORS ARE LOONGGGG) and couldn't get it. This is not unusual as this happens to us at many hotels. The maid came over and told us that someone checked in earlier. Mmmmmmm. The person in our room came to the door as we were trying to get in - she had the same name as me and our credit card was on her room! In the end, after waiting around in the hallway we got a room.. certainly not the one we booked or paid for but up in the Sky Suite area and if you have the money - spend it! THESE ROOMS ARE ABSOLUTELY OUT OF THIS WORLD! They decided tokeep us there after the muck up of our check in and our credit card. Thank you Aria. The room had a gorgeous lounge area, kitchen, dining area, 2 bathrooms, spa bath and the most gorgeous bed/pillows. I think the bed was a little too soft but only a minor detail. The hotel was gorgeous. The art, the finishing detail was all top notch. There are definitely hiccups with a new hotel. I think Wynn rooms are gorgeous and the service was sooo much better but the location of Aria is much much better. The staff uniforms are drab. I thought that a new hotel would dress there staff in funkier outfits, but the casino staff match the carpet. The security team have oversized maroon jackets - that need resizing, and the check in girls are in a very drab blue. Would I stay again? Yes in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Almost fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: Bourgeois_Yuppie
Reviews.Content: Aria is a beautiful hotel in a great location, I just didn't think they quite delivered what they promised. First the good: rooms were spacious, clean and well-furnished. The maid services was great; the maids came by 2x per day - once to clean early in the day then again for turndown service in the evening. The bathrooms were really nice, with a separate water closet and a glass-enclosed bath/shower combo that was really very nice. The lobby, casino, and decor were fantastic. The pastry shop at the bottom of the elevators was fantastic. It's in the middle of the strip, convenient to Planet Hollywood, the Bellagio, Paris, etc. My boyfriend used the gym/spa and said it was well worth the $30 he paid to get in. Now for the not so good: They have two valet locations, but I found it odd that I had to wait 10-15 minutes for my car when I was the only person at the valet. There is no Starbucks in the resort, but there is one closeby in the walkway to Monte Carlo. The computerized controls were touchy; sometimes I didn't know if touching a button would turn lights on or off; sometimes I'd hit a button and some of the lights would go on while others would go off. And the bathroom could have used more towel bars -- there's nowhere to put your face towels around the vanity, and you have to hang your bath towels outside the shower/bath combo enclosure. None of these issues is a dealbreaker though. If these had been my biggest problems, I would have loved this hotel. Now the bad: the wireless internet cost $15/day, which is not my complaint. I logged on and had the $15 added to my room bill, but the internet stopped working after an hour. I called the internet helpdesk number, which was a inside call according to the guest services booklet and thus should have been free of charge. When I told the helpdesk guy that the internet wasn't working, his response was "yeah, that's been happening". I asked him if there was an ETA to fix it and he said "no, it's just something we have to live with". Seriously, there isn't a business in the world where that's an acceptable response from the helpdesk; I got the impression they weren't even working to resolve the problem. I asked if he could refund my $15 and he told me to call the front desk. So fine. I checked my portfolio to see if this was necessary (I thought that since this appeared to be a common, widespread problem maybe the hotel wasn't charging for internet that day) only to find that not only had they charged the $15, they had charged it TWICE. Yes, I was charged for 24 hours of internet (that didn't work) twice within an hour. And they had tacked on $1 for the call to the helpdesk. The lady at the front desk removed all the charges for me after arguing for a couple minutes about whether or not the helpdesk call should have been free. She also had no idea when the internet would be working. We also were unable to get our curtains open for the last two days, whether we used the GUI next to the bed, the TV, or the buttons on the wall to try to open them. At one point when I tried to open them, the whole room shut down while the computer system was "reloading", so we had to sit there in the dark for five minutes until it came back up. If they could get those internet issues worked out, fix their billing glitches, and get their computerized controls to work more intuitively and without shutting down, it would be a great hotel. But for the money, I'd rather get a room at a place that has their act more together.

Reviews.Title: “Aria is the best of the strip. Go with confidence.”
Reviews.Author: Sebas_montreal
Reviews.Content: Room ares very comfortable. The casino is really great with fast service for cocktails. Check-in and check-out wheres fast. I've saw Guy Laliberte from "Cirque du soleil" he was playing slot machine BlackJack!!! Go with confidence, you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Service puts a damper on this beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: salsamari
Reviews.Content: I was at Aria hotel for a conference over the dates of Jan 19-22, 2010. Beautiful, contemorary and unique. CHECK-IN PROCESS- Took forever! Although I did not wait very long in line, the process just took to long. Just when you are done, they present you with this HUGE overwhelming map and give you a few minute presentation on how to get around the hotel. After a long trip from the east coast, I just wanted to get to my room. ROOMS- Good part- Beautiful room and fabulous sense of arrival. When you walk in, the lights magically turn on, mood music turns on and the curtians open. Its seriously amazing. Makes you want to act like a child and jump on the bed. Ahhh, the Bed. It was seriously the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in... makes getting up that much harder. ROOMS- Bad part- Everything in the room is controlled by a panel. Tv, air, service, LIGHTS, curtains, temperature, music, you name it. Imagine you wake up in th emiddle of the night to use the bathroom.. only to remember that you have to figure out where to turn the light on in the panel near your bed.... or when youve had too much to drink and cant figure out how to turn the hallway lights out without turning the whole lights out. Also, there were MAJOR malfuctions with the lights.. whenver you turned on the lights, the curtains woudl open. I contacted ENGINEERING many times about it, and they said that they would send someone up. Never happend. CALLS FROM THE ROOM- VERY IMPORTANT- me and a colleague of mine and mysterious local call charges added to our final bill I asked them to be removed at checkout and they did not give me any trouble. Made me wonder if this is a common problem and makes me wonder if this this happens frequently when people just dont pay attention to the bill. HALLWAYS- this hotel is MASSIVE. Im pretty sure its the largest (or one of) hotels on the strip. The elevators are located in 1 area. If you have a room at the far end of the hall (which I did), please pack your walking shoes!! I timed that it took me appx 10 minutes to walk from the elevator to my room. YOu'd think that they would do a better job of designing the hotel SECURITY- AWESOME!! They always asked for your keys when walking to the elevators. They were also very helpful with assisting with my random questions about things to do, restaurants, etc. RESTAURANTS- The Buffet is adequite, nothing special but reasonably priced. The Tapas restaurant (forgot the name) next to the front desk, has the BESSSSSSSTTT SANGRIA! I suggest getting the pitcher.. Trust me, its worth it. The Deuce lounge is a very nice spot to hang out with some friends for some drinks. The manager even made us reservations at a restaurant nearby for dinner... but it took us 30 minutes to get our bill.... VERY frustrating when we were 1 of 3 people in there. Overall, the hotel was beautiful; service needs some serious attention. Hopefully, a few months, they will get the hang of it and be a force to be reckoned with... in the meantime, you are better off splurging your $$ at the Bellagio, where the service is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “HANDS DOWN PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: phillysiteseer
Reviews.Content: listen up all of you that are reading these negative reviews. dont worry this place is banging unbelievable from a to z i recently went there for a four night five day get a way i booked two months before my trip after reading all the negative reviews a was getting nervous and even called to switch my casino but my wife convinced me to stay with aria all i can say is thank god i kept it food bars night life shopping everything was perfect the rooms are wonderful they clean your room twice a day and all employees are extra nice 1 complaint make sure you have comfortable shoes the property is huge and you will do alot of walking

Reviews.Title: “i would give it a couple more months..”
Reviews.Author: ryancass
Reviews.Content: Stayed from January 10th to 12th. I was trying to change hotel before we arrived as I read some horrible reviews on this site. As we were so close to departure, we could not make any changes so decided to give Aria a fair shot and not expect much. Upon check in, I was pleasantly surprised by the lobby... saw reviews that the lobby reeked of smoke but found it very pleasant (smelt of vanilla). We went to check in, with only 2 people ahead of us. I had read reviews of the long wait with reception and they ARE TRUE. Only 2 people ahead of us but took over half an hour to check in. Other guests would come from behind the line to speak with the reception about problems they were having. Some guests were given key cards for rooms already occupied, Some guests reservations were not pulling up, etc. Management was hovering behind the front desk agents, but not assisting them. It was very odd. Sink or swim maybe? We had no problem with our reservation but no one at front desk was smiling, happy, or wishing us a pleasant stay. I even tried to make a joke to cut the tension but not even a smirk from our agent. You could tell that they had been hearing complaints all day (all week even!) and were too happy to be there. Walking into the Casino, you could smell that smoke that others had commented about, but that is with any casino in vegas with smoking permitted. This hotel is absolutely beautiful and very modern. We arrived in our room to a "stripview" facing mgm and planet hollywood. Someone commented on a loud noise in the room due to the wind??.. didn't experience that at all and wonder if they had the fan on without knowing it. Quite rooms- very high tech with the lighting, shades, tv, music. You could even control your privacy door setting with the click of a button on the tv :) I could see if your not used to these modern features, it could be quite frustrating, but we had no problems and had fun playing around with this. Some people complained about the $15/day internet fee. I think this is reasonable as many travelers won't need the internet while in vegas and those that need it, should pay a little more. Another note- its $15 for 24 hours... so if you get it at 4pm - you have it till 4pm the next day. That's less than 60 cents and hour- i think that a great deal in an expensive city like vegas. Beds are AWESOME! almost toooo soft. The main issue at this hotel is the service. As with our experience at check in, calling the front desk from our room was another challenge. The line would just ring and ring until you were put on a hold. I held for about twenty minutes before the line was answered, just to ask for a late check out. Luckily it was worth it, they gave us a late check out of 230pm. I went to check out on the final day and saw the line. I said forget it and left our keys at the elevator drop box. We didn't dine at any of the restaurants but did walk around and checked them out on our last day. The look of them is spectacular- every little corner of the hotel has some visual art, blown glass, contemporary designs, etc. #1 suggestion: use the spa facilities for $30/day. You have access to the fitness centre (all new equipment), indoor dip pools, sauna, steam room, salt room, heated stones, and shower/makeup area. There is also a heated outdoor infinity pool, not too big but great views of the mountains while sitting outside... so relaxing. Free products like shampoo, body lotions, razors, etc for use. Also free refreshments and fruit while you are in the spa. The outdoor pool is closed-- but could be because of the winter season (or it's not completed yet). Overall- we were very happy with the Aria. I would definitely pass on that the service is not good, with the exception of the spa staff. Give this hotel about 3-6 months and hopefully the reception staff will catch up & be happy to be working in this amazing hotel. I would return on another trip, but may give other hotels a try first.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: TBJB
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, the most comfortable bed & pillows I have ever slept on. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The casino was a good place to play, relax and feel pampered. Waitressess were right there offering drinks,you did not feel as if you were imposing on them. From the buffet to the cafe - the food was good, the service was good, room service was quick with the hot coffee. It is nice to be treated well by friendly staff who seem to care how your doing. Aria is a nice change to the strip. The Elvis show was a nice tribute to the king. We were fortunate to have a corner suite looking out on the strip, opened our curtains and watched the rain and had the best nap ever.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Mass Improvements!”
Reviews.Author: Ram88
Reviews.Content: I was looking to go to Vegas for my birthday, 1-8-10, and booked the trip from 1-7-10 to 1-11-10. I originally booked an American Ailrline Vacation package that included the flight and the Aria Hotel. Well two days later, I received a call that they could not get me in the Aria. I really, really, really, really, wanted to stay at Aria, so I called direct and the rate was $399.00 a night. Although, more than I wanted to pay, I was willing since it was new, on the strip, and a great way to celebrate my birthday. Tons of problems at this highly advertised as a great 5 star hotel. My airport shuttle to the Aria would not allow me to be dropped off at the front, had to enter in the underground garage in the back of the hotel. The front seemed to take forever to get there, and once at the reservation desk, there was a line of people. Also, found out it was the Electronic Show Convention weekend, so it was busier than normal. It took 45 minutes to get to the desk and check in. Once checked in, I was informed that the non-smoking rooms were not cleaned or available yet, and it was around 5:00 pm. So I was offered a smoking room, in which only opened for 2 weeks, there shouldn't be any smoke smell, and given 50 off for two nights only. Hello, I'm staying 4 nights, what about those nights? She said that was the best she could do.?? As I approached the elevators, the "guard" was very rude to ask for my room key. I can understand making sure guests have a key, but his approach was very unpleasant. There was no nightly turn down or cleaning service as was told in the advertisement. One day, I went to get ice, and the door handle came off. I had to wait outside my room for maintenance, which was 30 minutes, b/c the housekeepers couldn't let me in. Well, the door lock was broke that I had to move rooms. So got another $100.00 off my bill for the inconvenience. I was told that my boarding pass could be printed if I call down to the front desk, and then they told me no, so I had to go down and request it. Last day as I checked out, I noticed my bill was incorrect-they added some mini bar items, THAT I DID NOT HAVE. So, as I left my room, I left my luggage, received a correct receipt, and they had checked me out, so my card was no longer useful, so I had to wait for SECURITY to open my door to get my luggage in which I missed my shuttle to the airport and ended up taking a taxi. I know it is new, but still how can you represent yourself as a 5 star hotel and so many mishappens on 1 stay? I did have a spa day and that was great! The room technology is great, the cleanliness and attention to detail was awful, and the front desk help still needs some help, as well as other personnell in the hotel. Very disappointed, and made for a bad birthday weekend with lots of money on a room that didn't make sense paying 399.00 a night, even with all the discounts. I would have preferred an even more discount, due to my disappointment, but mgmt., would not help me. Will NEVER go back to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class all the way......”
Reviews.Author: WildCommonwealthBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and were very impressed. State of the art electronics in your room. We had a beautiful view of the snow capped mountains.Bathroom was exceptional. We ate at Lemongrass for Thai food and again we weren't disappointed. I think this is a must try because of its' newness on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Too much for to little”
Reviews.Author: tbone5058
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a work of art but the service is not what it should be for the rate they charge and if you want a view not like the Mirage they want $50.00 bucks per night. I have stayed up and down the strip and never had a view like the one they gave me ( Mountain View) Yeah right !!!!! Since when does mountains look like the building next door. Poor poor view from the 20th floor for the money. Mirage has much much better views. The casino makes you feel like you are in a cave.very very dark. And save your money when it comes to playing the slots they are not paying at all but paying for all the high dollar fixtures in the hotel. Went out to the South point Hotel of Las Vegas blvd off the strip to win some money because the ARIA is not paying at all. I Have been coming to Las Vegas for more then 20 years and never have I played slots like these that don't give up anything and if they do pay you a little they turn right back around within seconds and take it back. If you want your dollars to go a long way go somewhere else to play slots. For me I will stay anywhere but this new high dollar rip off.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel needs new day Cleaning staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1funtravler
Reviews.Content: Arriving a day early our hotel for the next night was unavailable to accomodate us so we toured the Aria, checked the rates and were happy with the immediate check-in and hospitality shown as well as the good weekday last minute rate. Quick, smooth check-in and upon entering our room we were pleasantly suprised at the first impression. Usually stay at the Encore and many of our favorite features there were available- black out shades, electronic lights (automatic here), soaking tub, large shower, comfy soft bed and extra lounging area. After a few moments our unpleasent discoveries appeared: 1. Multiple hairs in the soaking tub and shower area 2. Filthy windows overlooking our 'roof garden below' and a few city lights- looks as if a bird lives directly above our room- gross! and then the worst discovery of all...3. A partial piece of Condom in our BED!!!! I placed an immediate call to the front desk (took almost 10 minutes to even get through and they were NOT busy when we were just there). They offered to set us up in a new room or send up housekeeping 'immediately' to change the bedding. We picked the second option. I always travel with Clorox wipes and we had disinfected everything else already and started settling in so this was easier of us. The front desk also offered to take off $50 from our room for that nights stay- on check out we did have to remind them of this but it was taken care of in the end. About 15 minutes later a housekeeper arrived with fresh towels- no bed linens. I told her what was the problem and she returned immediately with a new set of linens. Quick, efficient and clean our room was returned to us in a better state and we enjoyed the rest of our short one night stay. Location is central for this hotel, poker room in the casino was a plus, casual to fine dining available as well although we only tried the pastries at the chocolate shop and the Cafe for a quick dinner salad (reasonable at only $13-$16 but nothing exceptional). Walking distance, or tram if you prefer, to Bellagio, and a CVS is conveniently located just below the hotel on the strip if you need anything you may have forgotten. Overall the hotel is quite 'brown' and a bit dark compared to some hotels on the strip but the public areas seem to be kept clean and the modern style is enjoyable. Staff in the casino area was friendly as well as the men who monitor the elevators to only allow guests in the room areas. Music is pumped throughout the hotel and in some spots a bit loud, including the elevators and hallways. Outside there are taxis available next to the water inspired decor including a wall of cascading water on the outer wall of the hotel, nice fountain in the center and an amazing collection of canoes (yes, the boat) that are all tied together and set as an artwork piece that is quite a sight and hovers above the entrance area. Overall we would possibly consider staying again but would certainly have a member of the staff accompany us to our room on check-in to assure us of the cleanliness we expect. A few more months and they may work out the kinks but until then don't expect it to go completely smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in felt like five star...”
Reviews.Author: TW66
Reviews.Content: Check-in was really fast and felt as a 5 star experience. Rooms are very modern, but maybe not so cosy. And they are more like rooms you expect in a Business Hotel in for example New York. But the beds are to die for, I have never slept in a more comfortable bed. The Casino is rather dark, and when we stayed at Aria it was really crowded, so we ended up playing at Monte Carlo instead.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations - must visit!”
Reviews.Author: nulles
Reviews.Content: spent 2 nights at Sky Suites. Room was very elegant, bedding A++. Bathroom soaking tub was most relaxing. Heated toilets a real treat. Service was efficient and responsive. love the high tech touch screens. curtains open when you enter the room - spectacular view. concierge level beverages and service met 5 star service axpectations. the chocolates bedside are luscious. Plan to make this hotel my new retreat while in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Choki_Mann
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aria Hotel & Casino New Year’s Eve thru Jan. 4th,deluxe room city view, it is an architectural masterpiece but not a five star hotel The rooms are fresh and spacious with floor to ceiling windows, dark hard wood furniture, ample closet & drawer space, a well laid out master bath, excellent Phillips 46” LCD and oh…..that King-size bed, it’s almost too good to share. The check-in area resembles an old bank countertop, about a dozen tightly spaced stations with staff still learning how to use the computer. I wondered why there were so many agent/customer ‘discussions’ taking place on the check-in line, apparently Aria felt it was necessary to pre-charge $150 per day on your credit card if you say you may have a notion to use room service during your stay…..ouch! Bell hops? I think I saw 2 or 3 in my 25 minutes in the lobby, yeah for like 150-200 people …ouch! Aria sits easily 2 blocks off the Strip to the southbound side of Las Vegas Blvd. You have to walk 2 blocks out then another 2 blocks to make it across the pedestrian walkway because you cannot cross at the end of the entrance to CityCenter (stairs, escalators, elevators included). To access the departing taxi queue you must first walk over 200 feet north inside the hotel lobby to the entrance then again 200 feet south outside on the walkway- add a ride down to the sub-level for valet car service…. ouch! The restaurants are not really family oriented which is a shame because it seems that CityCenter has attracted more of the larger family groups than most upscale properties on the strip even if they were mostly browsing. People staying at the hotel seem to frequent the pastry shop near the elevators serving light sandwiches and muffins. leaving the upscale Asian and Italian restaurants empty during dinner hours. The Hi-end Crystals Mall served more use as a shortcut to L.V. Blvd. with the biggest crowds gathering at the water and ice displays. Yes Aria has a lot of work to do, no the room was not perfect, yes the call-girls patrolling the casino are looser than their slots and what’s up with that “Goodnight/Lockdown” button on the light switch? Downgrade it to a 4 Star hotel, get rid of the mini-bar icebox, the rip-off 45 second “touch-it you own it tray” and finally fix the taxi/valet situation and maybe Aria &CityCenter won’t end up a ghost town.

Reviews.Title: “good place but check in is a mess. will be worthy 5 star rating after a few months”
Reviews.Author: T_Blake
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Aria over MLK weekend. came in on a Saturday night with 3 other guys. waited to check in for a hour. once we got to the front of the desk. was told that there were no more double queen rooms available ( they are a mostly King bed rooms in hotel) and since we got our room package through Southwest, there were no gaurantees on our room. after some back in forth with the manager we had to sleep in a king/w rollaway for one night. even though the view was amazing wasn't too happy. the next day we called in the morning to move, they told us it will be ready at 12, came back to the desk at 1 and was told they had no record of move. we were very pissed, after some back and forth again, the Manager this time promised us it would be ready at 4:30 and gave us $100 room credit.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but too many issues...will not be staying there again.”
Reviews.Author: Tuckersmommy1971
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive about this stay after reading all of the poor reviews. In fact, I even emailed their guest services department. I received a cookie cutter email response. This was not our first time in Vegas so I had a pretty good idea what I wanted in a "five star" hotel. This was not it. It is very beautiful. I have no complaints about the decor since that is highly subjective. It is dark but hardly the only dark casino on the strip so that wasn't an issue for me. Check in was fairly uneventful. A hotel employee directed us to the VIP line for quick service (we were not VIP's) and it went off smoothly. We did have trouble finding the hotel desk from the airport shuttle drop off and better signage could probably help with that. The room was small but just fine. The technology aspect was interesting but in some respects just make basic tasks more difficult. Of course, the batteries went out in our remote-just another annoyance. It is the first hotel that didn't ask us if we wanted to upgrade. Interesting. The bed is the most comfortable hotel bed EVER! Our issues involved the bathroom toilet which backed up 4 of the 5 days we were there. We did nothing that should have backed this thing up. The first time I called the front desk someone answered farily quickly and sent someone up right away (within 20 min.) to fix it but it was very early in the morning. From that point on it was downhill. I could never reach anyone at the front desk and discovered that no other "floor" employees even carry radio's so they can't help either. I took to leaving notes on the counter for Housekeeping in hopes that they would take care of it somehow. Day 3 I went to the front desk. We got back very late and they hadn't even been there. I was furious. They do not seem to care if you complain. Never were we offered any compensation for our time or trouble. It was just odd. Housekeeping was totally inconsistent. I do not understand why they do not have a "to do in every room" list. One day we had 1 washcloth. The next day I left a note and we received more. They emptied the ice bucket on one of the five days but that's it. They took glasses but didn't replace them or they left them sitting dirty. It made no sense to me. They actually took the hotel shampoo and soap amenities from our shower and set them all back up on the bathroom counter. Who does that? Overall, I found the staff to be pleasant but that wasn't enough to make up for all the little issues we had the whole stay. The location of the hotel is fantastic! The food is expensive even by Vegas standards. For the most part, we ate at other locations. The sports bar was okay but that's it. The cafe was the same. $7.50 for a glass of orange juice was a bit over the top for us. At least it tasted good. In my opinion, if this hotel doesn't improve dramatically - they will never make it. I would rate it a 3 star at best. It has a long way to go. On a side note, our last trip to Vegas we stayed at the MGM Signature - the rooms, staff, etc. were fantastic! The downside was the LONG walk to the strip. However, all things considered.....Aria could take a lesson from them. They know exactly what they're doing.

Reviews.Title: “Welcom The NEW Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ashlightner
Reviews.Content: Having only been open just over a week when we stayed at the Aria we did think we may come across a few teething problems, however how wrong we were, everything in this resort was perfect and definately first class plus. This resort and the City Centre complex have heralded a new way forward for Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Bugs/Temper Expectations”
Reviews.Author: honest0112
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Penthouse one-bedroom suite in the Sky Suites. Tough review to write because many of my issues will be worked out with time but JEEZE!!! First room still under construction/assembly so we were moved. Second room the sheer drapes won't open, five calls over a 24 hour period with no repair, finally repaired but now the black out drapes won't close, maintenance guys rushing from room to room looking like they are about to go postal, just comical really. Loved the call at 8:00 AM noting that our privacy light was on and wondering if a technician could come fix our bathroom lights....UGHHHH!!!! (no idea what is wrong with them) Right now the "cutting edge technology" is "bleeding edge" and it is painful! This is a huge hotel, lots of great aspects to it, but don't think that they have targeted high end luxury segment (i.e., Wynn/Encore, Four Seasons, even Palazzo)...they have aimed much broader...need to appeal to all segments given it's size. So the result is a large, new MGM...not a large, new Wynn or even Bellagio. Still, some good dining (tried Sage, American Fish and Sirio), a pretty good Cirque show (Elvis), some amazing architecture, and a staff that seems to be trying...just really overwhelmed and ill-equipped to deliver a predictable level of service. Finally, the rooms are very contemporary...going for the New York loft look and feel. This is not bad, just a little too contemporary for my liking, at least on a regular basis. Fit and finish is not what you would find at the Wynn/Encore, Four Seasons, Palazzo and even the Bellagio. With that said, many will appreciate the style and the technology features of the rooms should be a plus once they get the many issues worked out. Right now they are more annoyance than anything!

Reviews.Title: “So so hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike-lcf
Reviews.Content: I booked here for a last minute business trip on the recommendation of my company's travel agent, as this was the "new" hotel in town. The hotel is visually beautiful and still has that "new hotel smell." The interior decor is tastefully but unorignally done. However, its at best a 3 star hotel. Its not on par with the other high end hotels in Las Vegas. If I got a super good deal I might consider going back, but otherwise I will pass in the future. Positives: The employees working in the self park are very friendly. The workers at the craps and blackjack tables are friendly. The staff at the elevators is friendly. Elevators do not take long. Pretty interesting art gallery within the City Center (just outside the main lobby). Negatives: The front desk staff is indifferent and unhelpful, and overall they appear to be materially understaffed. The rooms are on the darker side (intentionally designed that way), so if you want to read or work at the desk you will need to use the desk lamp. Unfortunately, my desk lamp did not work. I called down within two minutes of checking in to my room. The front desk person said "we'll send someone right up." About an hour I called down again and got the response that "engineering" was very busy and my request was "in the queue." I asked what this meant and could he give me at least an estimate of how long it would take -- the unhelpful employee said no, he was unable to do that. I asked if it would be longer than 20 minutes, he said I don't know. I asked if I could just come down there and pick up a replacement desk lamp. He said no, engineering has to do that and they have several "orders" ahead of you. 30 minutes later I called down again and got the same response. I asked that a manager or supervisor call me. Each time I called the front desk there was a long wait. The front desk person assured me he would. No one ever called or came by. Finally another hour later a repair guy came, and had no idea what the problem was. He spent 20 minutes trying to "fix" the lamp by taking it apart and the panel under the table (where the wires are located) apart. Finally he gave up and agreed I needed a new lamp and left. It took another 30 minutes to get the replacement. The repair guy was nice enough, but this whole episode should have been resolved in 10 minutes when I requested they bring up a new lamp. And the manager never called. The whole episode wasted about 3 hours of my Friday evening in Las Vegas. When I checked out, no one asked to follow up on the problem. I also have a pet peeve about hotels that over charge for mediocre internet access. This is supposed to be a hotel that claims to be technologically advanced. They charge $15 per day for wireless access that goes in and out. My sprint wireless card was twice as fast, so I ended using that instead. Also, they have the usual touch screen panel by the bed, but it doesn't really do anything other than look neat and give you the time. The television menu has a "listen" feature to allow you to listen to music, but it doesn't work. Instead you have to go to the "watch" television channels option and select a music station. Not a big deal, but this is a brand new hotel and some thought should have been put into the menu design of this supposedly advanced hotel. One other thing I found to be pretty amazing. Their business center is only open until 4 pm. So if you need any business support after 4 pm (send a fax, print a document, etc.) you are on your own. Finally, I recommend you avoid the "Coffee Beanery" downstairs by the parking elevators. A small cup of regular coffee is $4, and it is lukewarm, even at 7:30 am, when it should have been hot and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern Hotel. (but nothing exceptional)”
Reviews.Author: wallyQ
Reviews.Content: Nice new hotel in Vegas, but lacks the wow. Nice Spacious Rooms. Comfortable Bed. Big and soft. Modern and wonderful bathrooms. The rooms are tastefully done and has a nice look, but it seems to feel like just any other city and lacks the Vegas Wow factor. Service was poor. Things were just slow and problems with the room was never fixed. Hotel casino is a bit dark, something you have to get used to coming and going to and from your room. The Lobby and reception area was nice. Bright, Refreshing and Welcoming. The Waterfalls was a nice and tranquil space in the middle of the strip. All in all, the hotel is nice but just feels normal. Nothing exceptional you'd come to expect from the City Center.

Reviews.Title: “New and good”
Reviews.Author: i_marchak
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Aria in a month the hotel was opened. I was impressed with technology used in the hotel 's room and all over the hotel . It still needs some improvement, but it understandable- such a costly project requires time to make everything work. Restaurants are unbelievable , espessialy "American fish" and Jean George Steakhouse. Casino is very big and convinient. Poker Room of 24th tables is probably one the best in Vegas. All workers are very helpfull and friendly. Especialy, I would like to mentioned poker room manager AURIMAS BIELIAUSKAS , who was helping me to resolve even small problems wich occured during the play in the poker room . Drink and food service was also very prompt . I can recomend Aria hotel for stay , dinning and play. Looking forward to be back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rimen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Aria for 3 nights. We booked through Continental and got a good deal on air + hotel combo. We've both been to Vegas several times and have stayed at various hotels. Im going to start w/ the negatives b/c there are only a few: 1. If you're looking for a warm/romantic room/hotel, this isnt the place for you. The hotel, while nice, is modern and doesn't have that romantic feel to it. 2. Check-out was a slight pain b/c we were checking out at 5 am and the self-checkout on the tv did not work and there was quite a large line at the front desk with only a few employees checking people out. 3. The casino is rather dark. Now on to the positives: 1. PERFECT location. This hotel is located in the city center, right in the middle of the action and the strip. Further, you can cut through the city center mall and take the bridge across to the other side (Planet Hollywood) where we ended up going out at night. Also, there is a free tram running from Monte Carlo to the Bellagio with a stop at the hotel. This was perfect b/c we didn't have to walk outside in the cold at night and it was much quicker. Further, we had friends staying at Monte Carlo and we were able to walk inside from our hotel to theirs and they connected in the middle. 2. Rooms. While not as big as some of the other hotels (Venetian/Wynn), our king room was a plenty big for 2 people. We fell in love with the technologically advanced room. When we walked in, the curtains and sheers opened and the tv turned on with a personalized welcome message. The innovation and technology provided in the room definitely made it a better experience. The housekeeping staff came to our room 2x a day which was nice b/c we always had clean towels and new amenities. We ordered room service one late night, and I was suprised as to how fast the food came up, within 15 minutes of us calling. 3. Staff: we had a quick check-in, and in fact the employee at the front desk upgraded us to a higher floor with a better view. We had trouble with the safe in our room, but security came and handled the issue quickly. All in all, the staff was friendly and very attentive. 4. Restaurants: unfortunately, we didn't really eat at the hotel that much so I can't really comment. However, we did have lunch at the restaurant near the front desk which served tapas. The food was, but the portions were small as it was a tapas restaurant. 5. Spa: what a relaxing experience. My husband and I both made spa appointments. We were allowed access to the spa area all day. We went a little earlier to enjoy some of the other amenities in the spa, such as: a heated pool, jacuzzis, and various relaxation rooms. Further, we were provided with plush robes and slippers. There were bathing facilities and several amenities to get ready at the spa. We were both very satisfied with our treatments and the staff at the spa. Overall, we really enjoyed our time at Aria and would definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the other reviews scare you”
Reviews.Author: Happy2travel8
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel on Jan 14th and kept an open mind after reading most of the reviews. Upon arriving to the hotel we were greeted by Ray who opened our door and asked us if we needed any help with our luggage and we declined. He then advised us as to where to go to check in. As you enter, I noticed that there was a little confusion as to where to go but, we figured it out. When we were prompted to the next available person we were greeted by Ryan G. He helped us at check in with making sure the roll a bed was in our room as well as up grading us to a city view room. He was so helpful and friendly I was quite impressed how easy it was to do so. When we went to our room we were greeted with a pleasant surprise of the room. The lights came on automatically, the curtains were opening and all you can see was the strip. After checking out the room we realized that our toilet didn't work. I immediately called maintenance and they assured me that somebody would be there to fix it. So we went to check out the room and we quickly went by to say Thank you to Ryan for the fabulous view room and we mentioned that the toilet didn't work and told him that we already called but he then put in another request and assured us that somebody would be there to fix it. After exploring the strip for about an hour, we went back up to the room and checked the toilet and it didn't work still. So, we went back down to see Ryan and advised him that the toilet was still not working. He doubled checked and assured us that somebody was there and he offered to move us to another room. We declined and just advised him that all we wanted was a toilet that worked. He assured us that it would be done. After the second time of informing that our toilet was broken we had no other issues with our room. I have to say, room was big with comfortable beds, service was great, the casino had some great slot machines, and the drinks were great and fast. I went with my daughter (first time to vegas), my sister, niece (first time to Vegas) and a friend (first time in Vegas) and they had a great experience at this hotel. The Lemongrass restaurant was OK. It wasn't spectacular for the prices you paid and service was just alright. For what we paid I would've expected better service and portions.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy, sleek and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MrsKerr03
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned about my choice of hotel after reading the many negative reviews posted about the Aria. While some of the complaints were valid, overall I found my experience at the Aria to be a pleasant one. Great first impression! As we pulled up the bell hop was there to take our bags and point us in the direction of check in. Check in was a pain in the butt as many others have reported. We waited in line for at least 20 minutes and this was in the VIP/Invited guests check in. We were assigned a corner suite on the 7th floor. Amazing! This suite is perfect for romance. Check out the posted pictures. Most impressive was the floor to ceiling windows, the separate whirlpool tub for two and the fully stocked mini bar with a second empty mini fridge for your own beverages and snacks. Our bags arrived within 10 minutes of calling for them, no wait, no problems. The hubby liked the in room technology and gadgetry. Even the toilets were high tech with heated seats and built in bidet! The room would have been perfect if we had a higher floor but none was available due to the holiday weekend. Noise was not a problem at all. We heard NOTHING! That may have been because we were on the corner but our room was a quiet cocoon. The room had a contemporary look yet was still cozy and warm. Think W or Westin hotels. If your style is more traditional, a la Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons, this is not the hotel for you. Housekeeping was on point, no complaints there. They respected the privacy sign and kept the towels fresh and the room clean. We used in room dining twice. Service was lightning fast both times (less than a 30 minute wait) the food was tasty and the servers were pleasant. The City Center tram made it easy to get around between the Bellagio and the Monte Carlo. We did check out Haze on a Saturday night. Be forewarned no special consideration for hotel guests, general admission line with everyone else, club just so-so. Also, the Aria buffet wasn't as bad as others have said. We went around 11am as it transitioned from breakfast to lunch. For around $15 a person choices included made to order omelettes, carving stations with lamb chops, prime rib and venison, sweet, succulent king crab legs and more. I ran out of room before I could try everything I wanted. Check out was much easier than check in; no wait and finished in about 5 minutes. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel but not 5 stars ( yet )”
Reviews.Author: flyme123
Reviews.Content: OK, this is a little long, but I hope to give as objective and truthfull review as possible. My GF and I stayed here Jan 15-18. First, They are listening! They now have a few emplyees directing people into checkin lines. I think it could go a little faster, but it was not the worst I have seen. There were 3 people in line in front of me and it took about 20 min before I was at the counter. Yes the place is Brown. it works for them. If you dont like brown don't come here.
